GEN	1	3	God-FX1	#20		4	" << Let there be light,"""
GEN	1	3	Narr_01: Genesis	#19		5	" and there was light. {4} God saw that the light was good, and he separated the light from the darkness."
GEN	1	5	Narr_01: Genesis	#19		6	" {5} God called the light ""day,"" and the darkness he called ""night."" And there was evening, and there was morning--the first day. {6} And God said,"
GEN	1	6	God-FX1	#20		7	 << Let there be an expanse between the waters to separate water from water.>>
GEN	1	7	Narr_01: Genesis	#19		8	 {7} Thus God made the firmament and divided the waters which were under the firmament from the waters which were above the firmament; and it was so.
GEN	1	8	Narr_01: Genesis	#19		9	" {8} And God called the firmament Heaven. So the evening and the morning were the second day. {9} Then God said,"
GEN	1	9	God-FX1	#20		10	" << Let the waters under the heavens be gathered together into one place, and let the dry land appear.>>"
GEN	1	9	Narr_01: Genesis	#19		11	 and it was so. 
GEN	1	10	Narr_01: Genesis	#19		12	" {10} And God called the dry land Earth, and the gathering together of the waters He called Seas. And God saw that it was good. {11} Then God said,"

GEN	1	11	Narr_01: Genesis	#19		14	 and it was so. 
GEN	1	12	Narr_01: Genesis	#19		15	" {12} And the earth brought forth grass, the herb that yields sed according to its kind, and the tree that yields fruit, whose seed is in itself according to its kind."

GEN	1	14	God-FX1	#20		17	" << Let there be lights in the firmament of the heavens to divide the day from the night, and let them be for signs and seasons, and for days and years,"
GEN	1	15	God-FX1	#20		18	 {15} and let them be for lights in the firmament of the heavens to give light on the earth.>>
GEN	1	15	Narr_01: Genesis	#19		19	 and it was so. {16} Then God made two great lights: the greater light to rule the day and the lesser light to rule the night. He made the stars also.
GEN	1	17	Narr_01: Genesis	#19		20	" {17} God set them in the firmament of the heavens to give light on the earth, {18} to rule over the day and over the night, and to divide the light from the darkness."

GEN	1	20	God-FX1	#20		22	" << Let the waters abound with an abundance of living creatures, and let the birds fly above the earth across the face of the firmament of the heavens.>>"
GEN	1	21	Narr_01: Genesis	#19		23	" {21} So God created great sea creatures and every living thing that moves, with which the waters abounded, and every winged bird according to its kind."
GEN	1	21	Narr_01: Genesis	#19		24	" And God saw that it was good. {22} And God blessed them saying,"
GEN	1	22	God-FX1	#20		25	" << Be fruitful and multiply, and fill the waters in the seas, and let birds multiply on the earth.>>"
GEN	1	23	Narr_01: Genesis	#19		26	" {23} So the evening and the morning were the fifth day. {24} Then God said,"
GEN	1	24	God-FX1	#20		27	" << Let the earth bring forth the living creature according to it's kind: cattle and creeping thing and beast of the earth, each according to its kind.>>"
GEN	1	24	Narr_01: Genesis	#19		28	" and it was so. {25} And God made the beast of the earth according to its kind, cattle according to its kind, and everything that creeps on the earth acccording to its kind."
GEN	1	25	Narr_01: Genesis	#19		29	" And God saw that it was good. {26} Then God said,"
GEN	1	26	God-FX1	#20		30	" << Let Us make man in Our image, according to Our likeness;"
GEN	1	26	God-FX1	#20		31	" let them have dominion over the fish of the sea, over the birds of the air, over the cattle, and over all the earth and over every creeping thing that creeps on the earth.>>"
GEN	1	27	Narr_01: Genesis	#19		32	 {27} So God created man in His own image; in the image of God He created him; male and female He created them.
GEN	1	28	Narr_01: Genesis	#19		33	" {28} Then God blessed them and God said to them,"

GEN	2	4	Narr_01: Genesis	#19		44	 {4} This is the account of the heavens and the earth when they were created. When the Lord God made the earth and the heavens--
GEN	2	5	Narr_01: Genesis	#19		45	" {5} and no shrub of the field had yet appeared on the earth and no plant of the field had yet sprung up, for the Lord God had not sent rain on the earth and there was no man to work the ground,"
GEN	2	6	Narr_01: Genesis	#19		46	 {6} but streams came up from the earth and watered the whole surface of the ground--
GEN	2	7	Narr_01: Genesis	#19		47	" {7} the Lord God formed the man from the dust of the ground and breathed into his nostrils the breath of life, and the man became a living being."
GEN	2	8	Narr_01: Genesis	#19		48	" {8} Now the Lord God had planted a garden in the east, in Eden; and there he put the man he had formed."
GEN	2	9	Narr_01: Genesis	#19		49	 {9} And the Lord God made all kinds of trees grow out of the ground--trees that were pleasing to the eye and good for food.

GEN	2	10	Narr_01: Genesis	#19		51	 {10} A river watering the garden flowed from Eden; from there it was separated into four headwaters.
GEN	2	11	Narr_01: Genesis	#19		52	" {11} The name of the first is the Pishon; it winds through the entire land of Havilah, where there is gold."
GEN	2	12	Narr_01: Genesis	#19		53	 {12} (The gold of that land is good; aromatic resin and onyx are also there.)
GEN	2	13	Narr_01: Genesis	#19		54	 {13} The name of the second river is the Gihon; it winds through the entire land of Cush.
GEN	2	14	Narr_01: Genesis	#19		55	 {14} The name of the third river is the Tigris; it runs along the east side of Asshur. And the fourth river is the Euphrates.
GEN	2	15	Narr_01: Genesis	#19		56	" {15} The Lord God took the man and put him in the Garden of Eden to work it and take care of it. {16} And the Lord God commanded the man,"

GEN	2	17	God-FX1	#20		58	" {17} but you must not eat from the tree of the knowledge of good and evil, for when you eat of it you will surely die.>>"
GEN	2	18	Narr_01: Genesis	#19		59	 {18} The Lord God said
GEN	2	18	God-FX1	#20		60	 << It is not good for the man to be alone. I will make a helper suitable for him.>>
GEN	2	19	Narr_01: Genesis	#19		61	 {19} Now the Lord God had formed out of the ground all the beasts of the field and all the birds of the air.
GEN	2	19	Narr_01: Genesis	#19		62	" He brought them to the man to see what he would name them; and whatever the man called each living creature, that was its name."
GEN	2	20	Narr_01: Genesis	#19		63	" {20} So the man gave names to all the livestock, the birds of the air and all the beasts of the field. But for Adam no suitable helper was found."
GEN	2	21	Narr_01: Genesis	#19		64	 {21} So the Lord God caused the man to fall into a deep sleep.
GEN	2	21	Narr_01: Genesis	#19		65	" While he was sleeping, he took one of the man's ribs and closed up the place with flesh."
GEN	2	22	Narr_01: Genesis	#19		66	" {22} Then the Lord God made a woman from the rib he had taken out of the man, and he brought her to the man. {23} The man said,"
GEN	2	23	Adam	#07		67	" << This is now bone of my bones and flesh of my flesh; she shall be called 'woman,' for she was taken out of man.>>"
GEN	2	24	Narr_01: Genesis	#19		68	" {24} For this reason a man will leave his father and mother and be united to his wife, and they will become one flesh."

EXO	1	<<	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2223	EXODUS *~*EXODUS 1
EXO	1	1	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2224	" {1} These are the names of the sons of Israel who went to Egypt with Jacob, each with his family:"

EXO	1	5	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2228	 {5} The descendants of Jacob numbered seventy in all;
EXO	1	6	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2229	 {6} Joseph was already in Egypt.
EXO	1	6	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2230	" Now Joseph and all his brothers and all that generation died, {7} but the Israelites were fruitful and multiplied greatly and became exceedingly numerous, so that the land was filled with them."
EXO	1	8	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2231	" {8} Then a new king, who did not know about Joseph, came to power in Egypt. {9} He said to his people,"
EXO	1	9	Pharoah #3	#17		2232	" << Look, the Israelites have become much too numerous for us."
EXO	1	10	Pharoah #3	#17		2233	" {10} Come, we must deal shrewdly with them or they will become even more numerous and, if war breaks out, will join our enemies, fight against us and leave the country.>>"
EXO	1	11	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2234	" {11} So they put slave masters over them to oppress them with forced labor, and they built Pithom and Rameses as store cities for Pharaoh."
EXO	1	12	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2235	" {12} But the more they were oppressed, the more they multiplied and spread; so the Egyptians came to dread the Israelites and {13} worked them ruthlessly."
EXO	1	14	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2236	 {14} They made their lives bitter with hard labor in brick and mortar and with all kinds of work in the fields; in all their hard labor the Egyptians used them ruthlessly.
EXO	1	15	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2237	" {15} The king of Egypt said to the Hebrew midwives, whose names were Shiphrah and Puah, and he said,"
EXO	1	16	Pharoah #3	#17		2238	" {16} << When you help the Hebrew women in childbirth and observe them on the delivery stool, if it is a boy, kill him; but if it is a girl, let her live.>>"
EXO	1	17	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2239	" {17} The midwives, however, feared God and did not do what the king of Egypt had told them to do; they let the boys live."
EXO	1	18	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2240	" {18} Then the king of Egypt summoned the midwives and asked them,"
EXO	1	18	Pharoah #3	#17		2241	 << Why have you done this? Why have you let the boys live?>>
EXO	1	19	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2242	" {19} The midwives answered Pharaoh,"
EXO	1	19	Midwife	#24		2243	 << Hebrew women are not like Egyptian women; they are vigorous and give birth before the midwives arrive.>>
EXO	1	20	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2244	 {20} So God was kind to the midwives and the people increased and became even more numerous.
EXO	1	21	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2245	" {21} And because the midwives feared God, he gave them families of their own."
EXO	1	22	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2246	 {22} Then Pharaoh gave this order to all his people:
EXO	1	22	Pharoah #3	#17		2247	" << Every boy that is born you must throw into the Nile, but let every girl live.>> *~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
EXO	2	<<	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2248	EXODUS 2
EXO	2	1	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2249	" {1} Now a man of the house of Levi married a Levite woman, {2} and she became pregnant and gave birth to a son."
EXO	2	2	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2250	" When she saw that he was a fine child, she hid him for three months. {3} But when she could hide him no longer, she got a papyrus basket for him and coated it with tar and pitch."
EXO	2	3	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2251	 Then she placed the child in it and put it among the reeds along the bank of the Nile.
EXO	2	4	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2252	 {4} His sister stood at a distance to see what would happen to him.
EXO	2	5	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2253	" {5} Then Pharaoh's daughter went down to the Nile to bathe, and her attendants were walking along the river bank. She saw the basket among the reeds and sent her slave girl to get it."
EXO	2	6	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2254	" {6} She opened it and saw the baby. He was crying, and she felt sorry for him and said,"
EXO	2	6	Princess	#25		2255	 << This is one of the Hebrew babies.>>
EXO	2	7	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2256	" {7} Then his sister asked Pharaoh's daughter,"

EXO	2	8	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2258	" {8} And Pharaoh's daughter said to her,"
EXO	2	8	Princess	#25		2259	" << Yes, go.>>"
EXO	2	8	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2260	" And the girl went and got the baby's mother. {9} Pharaoh's daughter said to her,"

EXO	2	9	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2262	 So the woman took the baby and nursed him.
EXO	2	10	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2263	" {10} When the child grew older, she took him to Pharaoh's daughter and he became her son. She named him Moses, saying,"
EXO	2	10	Princess	#25		2264	 << I drew him out of the water.>>
EXO	2	11	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2265	" {11} One day, after Moses had grown up, he went out to where his own people were and watched them at their hard labor. He saw an Egyptian beating a Hebrew, one of his own people."
EXO	2	12	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2266	" {12} Glancing this way and that and seeing no one, he killed the Egyptian and hid him in the sand."
EXO	2	13	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2267	" {13} The next day he went out and saw two Hebrews fighting. He asked the one in the wrong,"
EXO	2	13	Moses	#01		2268	 << Why are you hitting your fellow Hebrew?>>
EXO	2	14	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2269	" {14} The man said,"
EXO	2	14	Man	#14		2270	 << Who made you ruler and judge over us? Are you thinking of killing me as you killed the Egyptian?>>
EXO	2	14	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2271	" Then Moses was afraid and thought,"
EXO	2	14	Moses	#01		2272	 << What I did must have become known.>>
EXO	2	15	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2273	" {15} When Pharaoh heard of this, he tried to kill Moses, but Moses fled from Pharaoh and went to live in Midian, where he sat down by a well."
EXO	2	16	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2274	" {16} Now a priest of Midian had seven daughters, and they came to draw water and fill the troughs to water their father's flock."
EXO	2	17	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2275	" {17} Some shepherds came along and drove them away, but Moses got up and came to their rescue and watered their flock."
EXO	2	18	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2276	" {18} When the girls returned to Reuel their father, he asked them,"
EXO	2	18	Jethro/Reuel	#02		2277	 << Why have you returned so early today?>>
EXO	2	19	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2278	" {19} They said,"
EXO	2	19	Daughter	#23		2279	 << An Egyptian rescued us from the shepherds. He even drew water for us and watered the flock.>>
EXO	2	20	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2280	" {20} So he said to his daughters,"
EXO	2	20	Jethro/Reuel	#02		2281	 << And where is he? Why did you leave him? Invite him to have something to eat.>>
EXO	2	21	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2282	" {21} Moses agreed to stay with the man, who gave his daughter Zipporah to Moses in marriage."
EXO	2	22	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2283	" {22} Zipporah gave birth to a son, and Moses named him Gershom, saying,"
EXO	2	22	Moses	#01		2284	 << I have become an alien in a foreign land.>>
EXO	2	23	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2285	" {23} During that long period, the king of Egypt died. The Israelites groaned in their slavery and cried out, and their cry for help because of their slavery went up to God."
EXO	2	24	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2286	" {24} God heard their groaning and he remembered his covenant with Abraham, with Isaac and with Jacob."
EXO	2	25	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2287	 {25} So God looked on the Israelites and was concerned about them.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*

EXO	5	6	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2395	 {6} That same day Pharaoh gave this order to the slave drivers and foremen in charge of the people:
EXO	5	7	Pharoah #3	#17		2396	 {7} << You are no longer to supply the people with straw for making bricks; let them go and gather their own straw.
EXO	5	8	Pharoah #3	#17		2397	 {8} But require them to make the same number of bricks as before; don't reduce the quota.
EXO	5	8	Pharoah #3	#17		2398	" They are lazy; that is why they are crying out, 'Let us go and sacrifice to our God.'"
EXO	5	9	Pharoah #3	#17		2399	 {9} Make the work harder for the men so that they keep working and pay no attention to lies.>>
EXO	5	10	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2400	" {10} Then the slave drivers and the foremen went out and said to the people,"
EXO	5	10	Slave Driver	#04		2401	 << This is what Pharaoh says: 'I will not give you any more straw.
EXO	5	11	Slave Driver	#04		2402	" {11} Go and get your own straw wherever you can find it, but your work will not be reduced at all.>>"
EXO	5	12	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2403	" {12} So the people scattered all over Egypt to gather stubble to use for straw. {13} The slave drivers kept pressing them, saying,"

EXO	9	25	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2565	 {25} Throughout Egypt hail struck everything in the fields--both men and animals; it beat down everything growing in the fields and stripped every tree.
EXO	9	26	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2566	" {26} The only place it did not hail was the land of Goshen, where the Israelites were. {27} Then Pharaoh summoned Moses and Aaron. He said to them,"

EXO	9	28	Pharoah #3	#17		2568	" {28} Pray to the Lord, for we have had enough thunder and hail. I will let you go; you don't have to stay any longer.>>"
EXO	9	29	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2569	" {29} Moses replied,"

EXO	9	30	Moses	#01		2572	 {30} But I know that you and your officials still do not fear the Lord God.>>
EXO	9	31	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2573	" {31} (The flax and barley were destroyed, since the barley had headed and the flax was in bloom."
EXO	9	32	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2574	" {32} The wheat and spelt, however, were not destroyed, because they ripen later.)"
EXO	9	33	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2575	" {33} Then Moses left Pharaoh and went out of the city. He spread out his hands toward the Lord; the thunder and hail stopped, and the rain no longer poured down on the land."

EXO	10	13	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2601	" {13} So Moses stretched out his staff over Egypt, and the Lord made an east wind blow across the land all that day and all that night. By morning the wind had brought the locusts;"
EXO	10	14	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2602	" {14} they invaded all Egypt and settled down in every area of the country in great numbers. Never before had there been such a plague of locusts, nor will there ever be again."
EXO	10	15	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2603	 {15} They covered all the ground until it was black. They devoured all that was left after the hail--everything growing in the fields and the fruit on the trees.

EXO	12	4	God-FX1	#20		2639	" {4} If any household is too small for a whole lamb, they must share one with their nearest neighbor, having taken into account the number of people there are."

EXO	12	5	God-FX1	#20		2641	" {5} The animals you choose must be year-old males without defect, and you may take them from the sheep or the goats."

EXO	13	17	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2718	" {17} When Pharaoh let the people go, God did not lead them on the road through the Philistine country, though that was shorter. For God said,"

EXO	13	18	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2720	 {18} So God led the people around by the desert road toward the Red Sea. The Israelites went up out of Egypt armed for battle.
EXO	13	19	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2721	" {19} Moses took the bones of Joseph with him because Joseph had made the sons of Israel swear an oath. He had said,"

EXO	14	3	God-FX1	#20		2729	" {3} Pharaoh will think, 'The Israelites are wandering around the land in confusion, hemmed in by the desert.'"
EXO	14	4	God-FX1	#20		2730	" {4} And I will harden Pharaoh's heart, and he will pursue them. But I will gain glory for myself through Pharaoh and all his army, and the Egyptians will know that I am the Lord.>>"
EXO	14	4	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2731	" So the Israelites did this. {5} When the king of Egypt was told, << The people have fled!>> Pharaoh and his officials changed their minds about them and said,"
EXO	14	5	Official	#15		2732	 << What have we done? We have let the Israelites go and have lost their services!>>
EXO	14	6	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2733	 {6} So he had his chariot made ready and took his army with him.
EXO	14	7	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2734	" {7} He took six hundred of the best chariots, along with all the other chariots of Egypt, with officers over all of them."
EXO	14	8	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2735	" {8} The Lord hardened the heart of Pharaoh king of Egypt, so that he pursued the Israelites, who were marching out boldly."
EXO	14	9	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2736	" {9} The Egyptians--all Pharaoh's horses and chariots, horsemen and troops--pursued the Israelites and overtook them as they camped by the sea near Pi Hahiroth, opposite Baal Zephon."
EXO	14	10	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2737	" {10} As Pharaoh approached, the Israelites looked up, and there were the Egyptians, marching after them. They were terrified and cried out to the Lord. {11} They said to Moses,"
EXO	14	11	Israelite	#14		2738	 << Was it because there were no graves in Egypt that you brought us to the desert to die?
EXO	14	11	Israelite	#14		2739	 What have you done to us by bringing us out of Egypt?
EXO	14	12	Israelite	#14		2740	" {12} Didn't we say to you in Egypt, 'Leave us alone; let us serve the Egyptians'?"
EXO	14	12	Israelite	#14		2741	 It would have been better for us to serve the Egyptians than to die in the desert!>>
EXO	14	13	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2742	" {13} Moses answered the people,"
EXO	14	13	Moses	#01		2743	 << Do not be afraid. Stand firm and you will see the deliverance the Lord will bring you today. The Egyptians you see today you will never see again.
EXO	14	14	Moses	#01		2744	 {14} The Lord will fight for you; you need only to be still.>>
EXO	14	15	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2745	" {15} Then the Lord said to Moses,"
EXO	14	15	God-FX1	#20		2746	 << Why are you crying out to me? Tell the Israelites to move on.
EXO	14	16	God-FX1	#20		2747	 {16} Raise your staff and stretch out your hand over the sea to divide the water so that the Israelites can go through the sea on dry ground.
EXO	14	17	God-FX1	#20		2748	" {17} I will harden the hearts of the Egyptians so that they will go in after them. And I will gain glory through Pharaoh and all his army, through his chariots and his horsemen."
EXO	14	18	God-FX1	#20		2749	" {18} The Egyptians will know that I am the Lord when I gain glory through Pharaoh, his chariots and his horsemen.>>"
EXO	14	19	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2750	" {19} Then the angel of God, who had been traveling in front of Israel's army, withdrew and went behind them."
EXO	14	19	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2751	" The pillar of cloud also moved from in front and stood behind them, {20} coming between the armies of Egypt and Israel."
EXO	14	20	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2752	 Throughout the night the cloud brought darkness to the one side and light to the other side; so neither went near the other all night long.
EXO	14	21	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2753	" {21} Then Moses stretched out his hand over the sea, and all that night the Lord drove the sea back with a strong east wind and turned it into dry land. The waters were divided,"
EXO	14	22	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2754	" {22} and the Israelites went through the sea on dry ground, with a wall of water on their right and on their left."
EXO	14	23	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2755	" {23} The Egyptians pursued them, and all Pharaoh's horses and chariots and horsemen followed them into the sea."
EXO	14	24	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2756	 {24} During the last watch of the night the Lord looked down from the pillar of fire and cloud at the Egyptian army and threw it into confusion.
EXO	14	25	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2757	" {25} He made the wheels of their chariots come off so that they had difficulty driving. And the Egyptians said,"
EXO	14	25	Egyptian	#21		2758	 << Let's get away from the Israelites! The Lord is fighting for them against Egypt.>>
EXO	14	26	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2759	" {26} Then the Lord said to Moses,"
EXO	14	26	God-FX1	#20		2760	 << Stretch out your hand over the sea so that the waters may flow back over the Egyptians and their chariots and horsemen.>>
EXO	14	27	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2761	" {27} Moses stretched out his hand over the sea, and at daybreak the sea went back to its place. The Egyptians were fleeing toward it, and the Lord swept them into the sea."
EXO	14	28	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2762	 {28} The water flowed back and covered the chariots and horsemen--the entire army of Pharaoh that had followed the Israelites into the sea. Not one of them survived.
EXO	14	29	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2763	" {29} But the Israelites went through the sea on dry ground, with a wall of water on their right and on their left."
EXO	14	30	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2764	" {30} That day the Lord saved Israel from the hands of the Egyptians, and Israel saw the Egyptians lying dead on the shore."
EXO	14	31	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2765	" {31} And when the Israelites saw the great power the Lord displayed against the Egyptians, the people feared the Lord and put their trust in him and in Moses his servant.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
EXO	15	<<	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2766	EXODUS 15

EXO	18	14	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2901	" {14} When his father-in-law saw all that Moses was doing for the people, he said,"
EXO	18	14	Jethro/Reuel	#02		2902	" << What is this you are doing for the people? Why do you alone sit as judge, while all these people stand around you from morning till evening?>>"
EXO	18	15	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2903	" {15} Moses answered him,"
EXO	18	15	Moses	#01		2904	 << Because the people come to me to seek God's will.
EXO	18	16	Moses	#01		2905	" {16} Whenever they have a dispute it is brought to me, and I decide between the parties and inform them of God's decrees and laws.>>"
EXO	18	17	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2906	" {17} Moses' father-in-law replied,"
EXO	18	17	Jethro/Reuel	#02		2907	 << What you are doing is not good.
EXO	18	18	Jethro/Reuel	#02		2908	 {18} You and these people who come to you will only wear yourselves out. The work is too heavy for you; you cannot handle it alone.
EXO	18	19	Jethro/Reuel	#02		2909	" {19} Listen now to me and I will give you some advice, and may God be with you. You must be the people's representative before God and bring their disputes to him."
EXO	18	20	Jethro/Reuel	#02		2910	" {20} Teach them the decrees and laws, and show them the way to live and the duties they are to perform.>>"
EXO	18	21	Jethro/Reuel	#02		2911	" {21} But select capable men from all the people--men who fear God, trustworthy men who hate dishonest gain--and appoint them as officials over thousands, hundreds, fifties and tens."
EXO	18	22	Jethro/Reuel	#02		2912	" {22} Have them serve as judges for the people at all times, but have them bring every difficult case to you;"
EXO	18	22	Jethro/Reuel	#02		2913	" the simple cases they can decide themselves. That will make your load lighter, because they will share it with you."
EXO	18	23	Jethro/Reuel	#02		2914	" {23} If you do this and God so commands, you will be able to stand the strain, and all these people will go home satisfied.>>"
EXO	18	24	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2915	 {24} Moses listened to his father-in-law and did everything he said.
EXO	18	25	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2916	" {25} He chose capable men from all Israel and made them leaders of the people, officials over thousands, hundreds, fifties and tens."
EXO	18	26	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2917	" {26} They served as judges for the people at all times. The difficult cases they brought to Moses, but the simple ones they decided themselves."
EXO	18	27	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2918	" {27} Then Moses sent his father-in-law on his way, and Jethro returned to his own country.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"

EXO	19	13	God-FX1	#20		2937	" Whether man or animal, he shall not be permitted to live.' Only when the ram's horn sounds a long blast may they go up to the mountain.>>"
EXO	19	14	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2938	" {14} After Moses had gone down the mountain to the people, he consecrated them, and they washed their clothes. {15} Then he said to the people,"
EXO	19	15	Moses	#01		2939	 << Prepare yourselves for the third day. Abstain from sexual relations.>>
EXO	19	16	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2940	" {16} On the morning of the third day there was thunder and lightning, with a thick cloud over the mountain, and a very loud trumpet blast. Everyone in the camp trembled."
EXO	19	17	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2941	" {17} Then Moses led the people out of the camp to meet with God, and they stood at the foot of the mountain."
EXO	19	18	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2942	" {18} Mount Sinai was covered with smoke, because the Lord descended on it in fire."
EXO	19	18	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2943	" The smoke billowed up from it like smoke from a furnace, the whole mountain trembled violently, {19} and the sound of the trumpet grew louder and louder."

EXO	19	20	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2945	" {20} The Lord descended to the top of Mount Sinai and called Moses to the top of the mountain. So Moses went up {21} and the Lord said to him,"

EXO	19	22	God-FX1	#20		2947	" {22} Even the priests, who approach the Lord, must consecrate themselves, or the Lord will break out against them.>>"

EXO	19	25	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2952	 {25} So Moses went down to the people and told them.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*

EXO	20	6	God-FX1	#20		2959	 {6} but showing love to a thousand generations of those who love me and keep my commandments.

EXO	20	8	God-FX1	#20		2961	" {8} ""Remember the Sabbath day by keeping it holy. {9} Six days you shall labor and do all your work, {10} but the seventh day is a Sabbath to the Lord your God."
EXO	20	10	God-FX1	#20		2962	" On it you shall not do any work, neither you, nor your son or daughter, nor your manservant or maidservant, nor your animals, nor the alien within your gates."

EXO	20	18	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2968	" {18} When the people saw the thunder and lightning and heard the trumpet and saw the mountain in smoke, they trembled with fear. They stayed at a distance {19} and said to Moses,"

EXO	20	21	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2972	" {21} The people remained at a distance, while Moses approached the thick darkness where God was. {22} Then the Lord said to Moses,"

EXO	21	<<	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2979	EXODUS 21
EXO	21	1	God-FX1	#20		2980	 {1} << These are the laws you are to set before them:>>
EXO	21	2	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2981	" {2} If you buy a Hebrew servant, he is to serve you for six years. But in the seventh year, he shall go free, without paying anything."
EXO	21	3	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2982	" {3} If he comes alone, he is to go free alone; but if he has a wife when he comes, she is to go with him."
EXO	21	4	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2983	" {4} If his master gives him a wife and she bears him sons or daughters, the woman and her children shall belong to her master, and only the man shall go free."
EXO	21	5	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2984	" {5} ""But if the servant declares, 'I love my master and my wife and children and do not want to go free,' {6} then his master must take him before the judges."
EXO	21	6	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2985	 He shall take him to the door or the doorpost and pierce his ear with an awl. Then he will be his servant for life.
EXO	21	7	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2986	" {7} ""If a man sells his daughter as a servant, she is not to go free as menservants do."
EXO	21	8	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2987	" {8} If she does not please the master who has selected her for himself, he must let her be redeemed. He has no right to sell her to foreigners, because he has broken faith with her."
EXO	21	9	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2988	" {9} If he selects her for his son, he must grant her the rights of a daughter."
EXO	21	10	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2989	" {10} If he marries another woman, he must not deprive the first one of her food, clothing and marital rights."
EXO	21	11	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2990	" {11} If he does not provide her with these three things, she is to go free, without any payment of money."
EXO	21	12	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2991	" {12} ""Anyone who strikes a man and kills him shall surely be put to death."
EXO	21	13	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2992	" {13} However, if he does not do it intentionally, but God lets it happen, he is to flee to a place I will designate."
EXO	21	14	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2993	" {14} But if a man schemes and kills another man deliberately, take him away from my altar and put him to death."
EXO	21	15	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2994	" {15} ""Anyone who attacks his father or his mother must be put to death."
EXO	21	16	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2995	" {16} ""Anyone who kidnaps another and either sells him or still has him when he is caught must be put to death."
EXO	21	17	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2996	" {17} ""Anyone who curses his father or mother must be put to death."
EXO	21	18	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2997	" {18} If men quarrel and one hits the other with a stone or with his fist and he does not die but is confined to bed, "
EXO	21	19	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2998	 {19} the one who struck the blow will not be held responsible if the other gets up and walks around outside with his staff;
EXO	21	19	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		2999	" however, he must pay the injured man for the loss of his time and see that he is completely healed."
EXO	21	20	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3000	" {20} If a man beats his male or female slave with a rod and the slave dies as a direct result, he must be punished,"
EXO	21	21	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3001	" {21} but he is not to be punished if the slave gets up after a day or two, since the slave is his property."
EXO	21	22	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3002	" {22} ""If men who are fighting hit a pregnant woman and she gives birth prematurely but there is no serious injury, the offender must be fined whatever the woman's husband demands and the court allows."
EXO	21	23	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3003	" {23} But if there is serious injury, you are to take life for life, {24} eye for eye, tooth for tooth, hand for hand, foot for foot, {25} burn for burn, wound for wound, bruise for bruise."
EXO	21	26	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3004	" {26} ""If a man hits a manservant or maidservant in the eye and destroys it, he must let the servant go free to compensate for the eye."
EXO	21	27	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3005	" {27} And if he knocks out the tooth of a manservant or maidservant, he must let the servant go free to compensate for the tooth."
EXO	21	28	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3006	" {28} ""If a bull gores a man or a woman to death, the bull must be stoned to death, and its meat must not be eaten. But the owner of the bull will not be held responsible."
EXO	21	29	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3007	" {29} If, however, the bull has had the habit of goring and the owner has been warned but has not kept it penned up and it kills a man or woman, the bull must be stoned and the owner also must be put to death."
EXO	21	30	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3008	" {30} However, if payment is demanded of him, he may redeem his life by paying whatever is demanded."
EXO	21	31	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3009	 {31} This law also applies if the bull gores a son or daughter.
EXO	21	32	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3010	" {32} If the bull gores a male or female slave, the owner must pay thirty shekels of silver to the master of the slave, and the bull must be stoned."
EXO	21	33	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3011	" {33} If a man uncovers a pit or digs one and fails to cover it and an ox or a donkey falls into it, {34} the owner of the pit must pay for the loss;"
EXO	21	34	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3012	" he must pay its owner, and the dead animal will be his."
EXO	21	35	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3013	" {35} If a man's bull injures the bull of another and it dies, they are to sell the live one and divide both the money and the dead animal equally."
EXO	21	36	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3014	" {36} However, if it was known that the bull had the habit of goring, yet the owner did not keep it penned up, the owner must pay, animal for animal, and the dead animal will be his.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
EXO	22	<<	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3015	EXODUS 22
EXO	22	1	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3016	" {1} If a man steals an ox or a sheep and slaughters it or sells it, he must pay back five head of cattle for the ox and four sheep for the sheep."
EXO	22	2	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3017	" {2} ""If a thief is caught breaking in and is struck so that he dies, the defender is not guilty of bloodshed;"
EXO	22	3	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3018	" {3} but if it happens after sunrise, he is guilty of bloodshed. ""A thief must certainly make restitution, but if he has nothing, he must be sold to pay for his theft."
EXO	22	4	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3019	" {4} ""If the stolen animal is found alive in his possession--whether ox or donkey or sheep--he must pay back double."
EXO	22	5	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3020	" {5} ""If a man grazes his livestock in a field or vineyard and lets them stray and they graze in another man's field, he must make restitution from the best of his own field or vineyard."
EXO	22	6	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3021	" {6} ""If a fire breaks out and spreads into thornbushes so that it burns shocks of grain or standing grain or the whole field, the one who started the fire must make restitution."
EXO	22	7	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3022	" {7} ""If a man gives his neighbor silver or goods for safekeeping and they are stolen from the neighbor's house, the thief, if he is caught, must pay back double."
EXO	22	8	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3023	" {8} But if the thief is not found, the owner of the house must appear before the judges to determine whether he has laid his hands on the other man's property."
EXO	22	9	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3024	" {9} In all cases of illegal possession of an ox, a donkey, a sheep, a garment, or any other lost property about which somebody says, 'This is mine,' both parties are to bring their cases before the judges."
EXO	22	9	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3025	 The one whom the judges declare guilty must pay back double to his neighbor.
EXO	22	10	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3026	" {10} ""If a man gives a donkey, an ox, a sheep or any other animal to his neighbor for safekeeping and it dies or is injured or is taken away while no one is looking,"
EXO	22	11	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3027	 {11} the issue between them will be settled by the taking of an oath before the Lord that the neighbor did not lay hands on the other person's property. 
EXO	22	11	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3028	" The owner is to accept this, and no restitution is required. {12} But if the animal was stolen from the neighbor, he must make restitution to the owner."
EXO	22	13	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3029	" {13} If it was torn to pieces by a wild animal, he shall bring in the remains as evidence and he will not be required to pay for the torn animal."
EXO	22	14	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3030	" {14} If a man borrows an animal from his neighbor and it is injured or dies while the owner is not present, he must make restitution."
EXO	22	15	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3031	" {15} But if the owner is with the animal, the borrower will not have to pay. If the animal was hired, the money paid for the hire covers the loss."
EXO	22	16	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3032	" {16} If a man seduces a virgin who is not pledged to be married and sleeps with her, he must pay the bride-price, and she shall be his wife."
EXO	22	17	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3033	" {17} If her father absolutely refuses to give her to him, he must still pay the bride-price for virgins."
EXO	22	18	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3034	" {18} ""Do not allow a sorceress to live. {19} ""Anyone who has sexual relations with an animal must be put to death."
EXO	22	20	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3035	" {20} ""Whoever sacrifices to any god other than the Lord must be destroyed."
EXO	22	21	God-FX1	#20		3036	" {21} << Do not mistreat an alien or oppress him, for you were aliens in Egypt."
EXO	22	22	God-FX1	#20		3037	" {22} ""Do not take advantage of a widow or an orphan. {23} If you do and they cry out to me, I will certainly hear their cry."
EXO	22	24	God-FX1	#20		3038	" {24} My anger will be aroused, and I will kill you with the sword; your wives will become widows and your children fatherless."
EXO	22	25	God-FX1	#20		3039	" {25} ""If you lend money to one of my people among you who is needy, do not be like a moneylender; charge him no interest."
EXO	22	26	God-FX1	#20		3040	" {26} If you take your neighbor's cloak as a pledge, return it to him by sunset, {27} because his cloak is the only covering he has for his body."
EXO	22	27	God-FX1	#20		3041	" What else will he sleep in? When he cries out to me, I will hear, for I am compassionate.>>"
EXO	22	28	God-FX1	#20		3042	" {28} ""Do not blaspheme God or curse the ruler of your people."
EXO	22	29	God-FX1	#20		3043	" {29} ""Do not hold back offerings from your granaries or your vats. ""You must give me the firstborn of your sons."
EXO	22	30	God-FX1	#20		3044	" {30} Do the same with your cattle and your sheep. Let them stay with their mothers for seven days, but give them to me on the eighth day."
EXO	22	31	God-FX1	#20		3045	" {31} ""You are to be my holy people. So do not eat the meat of an animal torn by wild beasts: throw it to the dogs.>> *~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
EXO	23	<<	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3046	EXODUS 23
EXO	23	1	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3047	" {1} ""Do not spread false reports. Do not help a wicked man by being a malicious witness."
EXO	23	2	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3048	" {2} ""Do not follow the crowd in doing wrong."
EXO	23	2	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3049	" When you give testimony in a lawsuit, do not pervert justice by siding with the crowd, {3} and do not show favoritism to a poor man in his lawsuit."
EXO	23	4	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3050	" {4} ""If you come across your enemy's ox or donkey wandering off, be sure to take it back to him."
EXO	23	5	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3051	" {5} If you see the donkey of someone who hates you fallen down under its load, do not leave it there; be sure you help him with it."
EXO	23	6	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3052	" {6} ""Do not deny justice to your poor people in their lawsuits."
EXO	23	7	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3053	" {7} Have nothing to do with a false charge and do not put an innocent or honest person to death, for I will not acquit the guilty."
EXO	23	8	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3054	" {8} ""Do not accept a bribe, for a bribe blinds those who see and twists the words of the righteous."
EXO	23	9	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3055	" {9} Do not oppress an alien; you yourselves know how it feels to be aliens, because you were aliens in Egypt."
EXO	23	10	God-FX1	#20		3056	" {10} << For six years you are to sow your fields and harvest the crops, {11} but during the seventh year let the land lie unplowed and unused."
EXO	23	11	God-FX1	#20		3057	" Then the poor amoung your people may get food from it, and the wild animals may eat what they leave. Do the same with your vineyard and your olive groove."
EXO	23	12	God-FX1	#20		3058	" {12} ""Six days do your work, but on the seventh day do not work, so that your ox and your donkey may rest and the slave born in your household, and the alien as well, may be refreshed.>>"
EXO	23	13	God-FX1	#20		3059	 {13} << Be careful to do everything I have said to you. Do not invoke the names of other gods; do not let them be heard on your lips.
EXO	23	14	God-FX1	#20		3060	" {14} ""Three times a year you are to celebrate a festival to me."
EXO	23	15	God-FX1	#20		3061	" {15} ""Celebrate the Feast of Unleavened Bread; for seven days eat bread made without yeast, as I commanded you."
EXO	23	15	God-FX1	#20		3062	" Do this at the appointed time in the month of Abib, for in that month you came out of Egypt. ""No one is to appear before me empty-handed."
EXO	23	16	God-FX1	#20		3063	" {16} ""Celebrate the Feast of Harvest with the firstfruits of the crops you sow in your field."
EXO	23	16	God-FX1	#20		3064	" ""Celebrate the Feast of Ingathering at the end of the year, when you gather in your crops from the field.>>"
EXO	23	17	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3065	" {17} ""Three times a year all the men are to appear before the Sovereign Lord."
EXO	23	18	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3066	" {18} ""Do not offer the blood of a sacrifice to me along with anything containing yeast. ""The fat of my festival offerings must not be kept until morning."
EXO	23	19	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3067	" {19} ""Bring the best of the firstfruits of your soil to the house of the Lord your God. ""Do not cook a young goat in its mother's milk."
EXO	23	20	God-FX1	#20		3068	" {20} << See, I am sending an angel ahead of you to guard you along the way and to bring you to the place I have prepared."
EXO	23	21	God-FX1	#20		3069	" {21} Pay attention to him and listen to what he says. Do not rebel against him; he will not forgive your rebellion, since my Name is in him."
EXO	23	22	God-FX1	#20		3070	" {22} If you listen carefully to what he says and do all that I say, I will be an enemy to your enemies and will oppose those who oppose you."
EXO	23	23	God-FX1	#20		3071	" {23} My angel will go ahead of you and bring you into the land of the Amorites, Hittites, Perizzites, Canaanites, Hivites and Jebusites, and I will wipe them out."
EXO	23	24	God-FX1	#20		3072	 {24} Do not bow down before their gods or worship them or follow their practices. You must demolish them and break their sacred stones to pieces.
EXO	23	25	God-FX1	#20		3073	" {25} Worship the Lord your God, and his blessing will be on your food and water."
EXO	23	25	God-FX1	#20		3074	" I will take away sickness from among you, {26} and none will miscarry or be barren in your land. I will give you a full life span."
EXO	23	27	God-FX1	#20		3075	" {27} ""I will send my terror ahead of you and throw into confusion every nation you encounter. I will make all your enemies turn their backs and run.>>"
EXO	23	28	God-FX1	#20		3076	" {28} I will send the hornet ahead of you to drive the Hivites, Canaanites and Hittites out of your way."
EXO	23	29	God-FX1	#20		3077	" {29} But I will not drive them out in a single year, because the land would become desolate and the wild animals too numerous for you."
EXO	23	30	God-FX1	#20		3078	" {30} Little by little I will drive them out before you, until you have increased enough to take possession of the land."
EXO	23	31	God-FX1	#20		3079	" {31} ""I will establish your borders from the Red Sea to the Sea of the Philistines, and from the desert to the River."
EXO	23	31	God-FX1	#20		3080	 I will hand over to you the people who live in the land and you will drive them out before you.
EXO	23	32	God-FX1	#20		3081	 {32} Do not make a covenant with them or with their gods.
EXO	23	33	God-FX1	#20		3082	" {33} Do not let them live in your land, or they will cause you to sin against me, because the worship of their gods will certainly be a snare to you.>> *~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"

EXO	26	<<	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3146	EXODUS 26
EXO	26	1	God-FX1	#20		3147	" {1} ""Make the tabernacle with ten curtains of finely twisted linen and blue, purple and scarlet yarn, with cherubim worked into them by a skilled craftsman."
EXO	26	2	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3148	 {2} All the curtains are to be the same size--twenty-eight cubits long and four cubits wide.
EXO	26	3	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3149	" {3} Join five of the curtains together, and do the same with the other five."
EXO	26	4	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3150	" {4} Make loops of blue material along the edge of the end curtain in one set, and do the same with the end curtain in the other set."
EXO	26	5	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3151	" {5} Make fifty loops on one curtain and fifty loops on the end curtain of the other set, with the loops opposite each other."
EXO	26	6	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3152	 {6} Then make fifty gold clasps and use them to fasten the curtains together so that the tabernacle is a unit.
EXO	26	7	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3153	" {7} ""Make curtains of goat hair for the tent over the tabernacle--eleven altogether."

EXO	26	9	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3155	 {9} Join five of the curtains together into one set and the other six into another set. Fold the sixth curtain double at the front of the tent.
EXO	26	10	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3156	 {10} Make fifty loops along the edge of the end curtain in one set and also along the edge of the end curtain in the other set.
EXO	26	11	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3157	 {11} Then make fifty bronze clasps and put them in the loops to fasten the tent together as a unit.
EXO	26	12	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3158	" {12} As for the additional length of the tent curtains, the half curtain that is left over is to hang down at the rear of the tabernacle."
EXO	26	13	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3159	 {13} The tent curtains will be a cubit longer on both sides; what is left will hang over the sides of the tabernacle so as to cover it.

EXO	26	18	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3163	" {18} Make twenty frames for the south side of the tabernacle {19} and make forty silver bases to go under them--two bases for each frame, one under each projection."
EXO	26	20	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3164	" {20} For the other side, the north side of the tabernacle make twenty frames {21} and forty silver bases--two under each frame."
EXO	26	22	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3165	" {22} Make six frames for the far end, that is, the west end of the tabernacle, {23} and make two frames for the corners at the far end."
EXO	26	24	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3166	" {24} At these two corners they must be double from the bottom all the way to the top, and fitted into a single ring; both shall be like that."
EXO	26	25	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3167	 {25} So there will be eight frames and sixteen silver bases--two under each frame.
EXO	26	26	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3168	" {26} ""Also make crossbars of acacia wood:"
EXO	26	26	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3169	" five for the frames on one side of the tabernacle, {27} five for those on the other side, and five for the frames on the west, at the far end of the tabernacle."

EXO	26	29	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3171	 {29} Overlay the frames with gold and make gold rings to hold the crossbars. Also overlay the crossbars with gold.
EXO	26	30	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3172	" {30} ""Set up the tabernacle according to the plan shown you on the mountain."

EXO	26	35	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3177	" {35} Place the table outside the curtain on the north side of the tabernacle, and put the lampstand opposite it on the south side."

EXO	27	15	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3196	" {15} Curtains fifteen cubits long are to be on the other side, with three posts and three bases."
EXO	27	16	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3197	" {16} For the entrance to the courtyard, provide a curtain twenty cubits long, of blue, purple and scarlet yarn and finely twisted linen--the work of an embroiderer--with four posts and four bases."

EXO	27	18	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3199	" {18} The courtyard shall be a hundred cubits long and fifty cubits wide, with curtains of finely twisted linen five cubits high, and with bronze bases."
EXO	27	19	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3200	" {19} All the other articles used in the service of the tabernacle, whatever their function, including all the tent pegs for it and those for the courtyard, are to be of bronze."
EXO	27	20	God-FX1	#20		3201	" {20} ""Command the Israelites to bring you clear oil of pressed olives for the light so that the lamps may be kept burning."
EXO	27	21	God-FX1	#20		3202	" {21} In the Tent of Meeting, outside the curtain that is in front of the Testimony, Aaron and his sons are to keep the lamps burning before the Lord from evening till morning."
EXO	27	21	God-FX1	#20		3203	" This is to be a lasting ordinance among the Israelites for the generations to come.""*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
EXO	28	<<	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3204	EXODUS 28

EXO	28	6	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3211	" {6} ""Make the ephod of gold, and of blue, purple and scarlet yarn, and of finely twisted linen--the work of a skilled craftsman."
EXO	28	7	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3212	" {7} It is to have two shoulder pieces attached to two of its corners, so it can be fastened."
EXO	28	8	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3213	" {8} Its skillfully woven waistband is to be like it--of one piece with the ephod and made with gold, and with blue, purple and scarlet yarn, and with finely twisted linen."
EXO	28	9	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3214	" {9} ""Take two onyx stones and engrave on them the names of the sons of Israel"
EXO	28	10	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3215	 {10} in the order of their birth--six names on one stone and the remaining six on the other.
EXO	28	11	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3216	 {11} Engrave the names of the sons of Israel on the two stones the way a gem cutter engraves a seal. Then mount the stones in gold filigree settings
EXO	28	12	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3217	 {12} and fasten them on the shoulder pieces of the ephod as memorial stones for the sons of Israel. Aaron is to bear the names on his shoulders as a memorial before the Lord.
EXO	28	13	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3218	 {13} Make gold filigree settings
EXO	28	14	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3219	" {14} and two braided chains of pure gold, like a rope, and attach the chains to the settings."
EXO	28	15	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3220	" {15} ""Fashion a breastpiece for making decisions--the work of a skilled craftsman. Make it like the ephod: of gold, and of blue, purple and scarlet yarn, and of finely twisted linen."
EXO	28	16	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3221	 {16} It is to be square--a span long and a span wide--and folded double.
EXO	28	17	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3222	" {17} Then mount four rows of precious stones on it. In the first row there shall be a ruby, a topaz and a beryl;"
EXO	28	18	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3223	" {18} in the second row a turquoise, a sapphire and an emerald;"
EXO	28	19	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3224	" {19} in the third row a jacinth, an agate and an amethyst;"
EXO	28	20	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3225	" {20} in the fourth row a chrysolite, an onyx and a jasper. Mount them in gold filigree settings."
EXO	28	21	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3226	" {21} There are to be twelve stones, one for each of the names of the sons of Israel, each engraved like a seal with the name of one of the twelve tribes."
EXO	28	22	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3227	" {22} ""For the breastpiece make braided chains of pure gold, like a rope. {23} Make two gold rings for it and fasten them to two corners of the breastpiece."
EXO	28	24	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3228	 {24} Fasten the two gold chains to the rings at the corners of the breastpiece.
EXO	28	25	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3229	" {25} Fasten the other ends of the chains to the two settings, attaching them to the shoulder pieces of the ephod at the front."
EXO	28	26	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3230	 {26} Make two gold rings and attach them to the other two corners of the breastpiece on the inside edge next to the ephod.
EXO	28	27	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3231	" {27} Make two more gold rings and attach them to the bottom of the shoulder pieces on the front of the ephod, close to the seam just above the waistband of the ephod."
EXO	28	28	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3232	" {28} The rings of the breastpiece are to be tied to the rings of the ephod with blue cord, connecting it to the waistband, so that the breastpiece will not swing out from the ephod."
EXO	28	29	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3233	" {29} ""Whenever Aaron enters the Holy Place, he will bear the names of the sons of Israel over his heart on the breastpiece of decision as a continuing memorial before the Lord."
EXO	28	30	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3234	" {30} Also put the Urim and the Thummim in the breastpiece, so they may be over Aaron's heart whenever he enters the presence of the Lord."
EXO	28	30	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3235	 Thus Aaron will always bear the means of making decisions for the Israelites over his heart before the Lord.
EXO	28	31	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3236	" {31} Make the robe of the ephod entirely of blue cloth, {32} with an opening for the head in its center."
EXO	28	32	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3237	" There shall be a woven edge like a collar around this opening, so that it will not tear."
EXO	28	33	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3238	" {33} Make pomegranates of blue, purple and scarlet yarn around the hem of the robe, with gold bells between them."
EXO	28	34	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3239	 {34} The gold bells and the pomegranates are to alternate around the hem of the robe.
EXO	28	35	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3240	" {35} Aaron must wear it when he ministers. The sound of the bells will be heard when he enters the Holy Place before the Lord and when he comes out, so that he will not die."
EXO	28	36	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3241	 {36} Make a plate of pure gold and engrave on it as on a seal: holy to the Lord. {37} Fasten a blue cord to it to attach it to the turban; it is to be on the front of the turban.
EXO	28	38	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3242	" {38} It will be on Aaron's forehead, and he will bear the guilt involved in the sacred gifts the Israelites consecrate, whatever their gifts may be."
EXO	28	38	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3243	 It will be on Aaron's forehead continually so that they will be acceptable to the Lord.
EXO	28	39	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3244	" {39} ""Weave the tunic of fine linen and make the turban of fine linen. The sash is to be the work of an embroiderer."
EXO	28	40	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3245	" {40} Make tunics, sashes and headbands for Aaron's sons, to give them dignity and honor."
EXO	28	41	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3246	" {41} After you put these clothes on your brother Aaron and his sons, anoint and ordain them. Consecrate them so they may serve me as priests."
EXO	28	42	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3247	" {42} ""Make linen undergarments as a covering for the body, reaching from the waist to the thigh."
EXO	28	43	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3248	" {43} Aaron and his sons must wear them whenever they enter the Tent of Meeting or approach the altar to minister in the Holy Place, so that they will not incur guilt and die."
EXO	28	43	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3249	 This is to be a lasting ordinance for Aaron and his descendants.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
EXO	29	<<	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3250	EXODUS 29

EXO	29	17	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3266	" {17} Cut the ram into pieces and wash the inner parts and the legs, putting them with the head and the other pieces."
EXO	29	18	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3267	" {18} Then burn the entire ram on the altar. It is a burnt offering to the Lord, a pleasing aroma, an offering made to the Lord by fire."
EXO	29	19	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3268	" {19} Take the other ram, and Aaron and his sons shall lay their hands on its head."

EXO	29	21	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3271	 {21} And take some of the blood on the altar and some of the anointing oil and sprinkle it on Aaron and his garments and on his sons and their garments.
EXO	29	21	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3272	 Then he and his sons and their garments will be consecrated.
EXO	29	22	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3273	" {22} ""Take from this ram the fat, the fat tail, the fat around the inner parts, the covering of the liver, both kidneys with the fat around them, and the right thigh. (This is the ram for the ordination.)"
EXO	29	23	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3274	" {23} From the basket of bread made without yeast, which is before the Lord, take a loaf, and a cake made with oil, and a wafer."

EXO	29	25	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3276	" {25} Then take them from their hands and burn them on the altar along with the burnt offering for a pleasing aroma to the Lord, an offering made to the Lord by fire."
EXO	29	26	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3277	" {26} After you take the breast of the ram for Aaron's ordination, wave it before the Lord as a wave offering, and it will be your share."
EXO	29	27	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3278	" {27} ""Consecrate those parts of the ordination ram that belong to Aaron and his sons: the breast that was waved and the thigh that was presented."
EXO	29	28	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3279	 {28} This is always to be the regular share from the Israelites for Aaron and his sons. It is the contribution the Israelites are to make to the Lord from their fellowship offerings.

EXO	29	30	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3281	 {30} The son who succeeds him as priest and comes to the Tent of Meeting to minister in the Holy Place is to wear them seven days.
EXO	29	31	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3282	" {31} ""Take the ram for the ordination and cook the meat in a sacred place."

EXO	29	33	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3284	" {33} They are to eat these offerings by which atonement was made for their ordination and consecration. But no one else may eat them, because they are sacred."
EXO	29	34	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3285	" {34} And if any of the meat of the ordination ram or any bread is left over till morning, burn it up. It must not be eaten, because it is sacred."

EXO	32	<<	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3358	EXODUS 32
EXO	32	1	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3359	" {1} When the people saw that Moses was so long in coming down from the mountain, they gathered around Aaron and said,"
EXO	32	1	Israelite	#14		3360	" << Come, make us gods who will go before us. As for this fellow Moses who brought us up out of Egypt, we don't know what has happened to him.>>"
EXO	32	2	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3361	" {2} Aaron answered them,"
EXO	32	2	Aaron	#05		3362	" << Take off the gold earrings that your wives, your sons and your daughters are wearing, and bring them to me.>>"
EXO	32	3	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3363	 {3} So all the people took off their earrings and brought them to Aaron.
EXO	32	4	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3364	" {4} He took what they handed him and made it into an idol cast in the shape of a calf, fashioning it with a tool. Then they said,"
EXO	32	4	Israelite	#11		3365	" << These are your gods, O Israel, who brought you up out of Egypt.>>"
EXO	32	5	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3366	" {5} When Aaron saw this, he built an altar in front of the calf and announced,"

EXO	32	6	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3368	 {6} So the next day the people rose early and sacrificed burnt offerings and presented fellowship offerings.

EXO	32	8	God-FX1	#20		3373	" They have bowed down to it and sacrificed to it and have said, 'These are your gods, O Israel, who brought you up out of Egypt.'"

EXO	32	11	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3376	 {11} But Moses sought the favor of the Lord his God.
EXO	32	11	Moses	#01		3377	" << O Lord, why should your anger burn against your people, whom you brought out of Egypt with great power and a mighty hand?"
EXO	32	12	Moses	#01		3378	" {12} Why should the Egyptians say, 'It was with evil intent that he brought them out, to kill them in the mountains and to wipe them off the face of the earth'?"
EXO	32	12	Moses	#01		3379	 Turn from your fierce anger; relent and do not bring disaster on your people.

EXO	32	13	Moses	#01		3381	" 'I will make your descendants as numerous as the stars in the sky and I will give your descendants all this land I promised them, and it will be their inheritance forever.'>>"
EXO	32	14	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3382	 {14} Then the Lord relented and did not bring on his people the disaster he had threatened.
EXO	32	15	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3383	" {15} Moses turned and went down the mountain with the two tablets of the Testimony in his hands. They were inscribed on both sides, front and back."
EXO	32	16	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3384	" {16} The tablets were the work of God; the writing was the writing of God, engraved on the tablets."
EXO	32	17	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3385	" {17} When Joshua heard the noise of the people shouting, he said to Moses,"

EXO	32	19	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3389	" {19} When Moses approached the camp and saw the calf and the dancing, his anger burned and he threw the tablets out of his hands, breaking them to pieces at the foot of the mountain."

EXO	36	<<	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3532	EXODUS 36
EXO	36	1	Moses	#01		3533	" {1} << So Bezalel, Oholiab and every skilled person to whom the Lord has given skill and ability to know how to carry out all the work of constructing the sanctuary are to do the work just as the Lord has commanded.>>"
EXO	36	2	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3534	 {2} Then Moses summoned Bezalel and Oholiab and every skilled person to whom the Lord had given ability and who was willing to come and do the work.
EXO	36	3	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3535	 {3} They received from Moses all the offerings the Israelites had brought to carry out the work of constructing the sanctuary.
EXO	36	3	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3536	 And the people continued to bring freewill offerings morning after morning.
EXO	36	4	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3537	" {4} So all the skilled craftsmen who were doing all the work on the sanctuary left their work {5} and said to Moses,"
EXO	36	5	Craftsmen	#12		3538	 << The people are bringing more than enough for doing the work the Lord commanded to be done.>>
EXO	36	6	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3539	 {6} Then Moses gave an order and they sent this word throughout the camp:
EXO	36	6	Moses	#01		3540	 << No man or woman is to make anything else as an offering for the sanctuary.>>
EXO	36	6	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3541	" And so the people were restrained from bringing more, {7} because what they already had was more than enough to do all the work."
EXO	36	8	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3542	" {8} All the skilled men among the workmen made the tabernacle with ten curtains of finely twisted linen and blue, purple and scarlet yarn, with cherubim worked into them by a skilled craftsman."
EXO	36	9	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3543	 {9} All the curtains were the same size--twenty-eight cubits long and four cubits wide.
EXO	36	10	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3544	 {10} They joined five of the curtains together and did the same with the other five.
EXO	36	11	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3545	" {11} Then they made loops of blue material along the edge of the end curtain in one set, and the same was done with the end curtain in the other set."
EXO	36	12	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3546	" {12} They also made fifty loops on one curtain and fifty loops on the end curtain of the other set, with the loops opposite each other."
EXO	36	13	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3547	 {13} Then they made fifty gold clasps and used them to fasten the two sets of curtains together so that the tabernacle was a unit.
EXO	36	14	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3548	 {14} They made curtains of goat hair for the tent over the tabernacle--eleven all together.
EXO	36	15	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3549	 {15} All eleven curtains were the same size--thirty cubits long and four cubits wide.
EXO	36	16	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3550	 {16} They joined five of the curtains into one set and the other six into another set.
EXO	36	17	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3551	 {17} Then they made fifty loops along the edge of the end curtain in one set and also along the edge of the end curtain in the other set.
EXO	36	18	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3552	 {18} They made fifty bronze clasps to fasten the tent together as a unit.
EXO	36	19	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3553	" {19} Then they made for the tent a covering of ram skins dyed red, and over that a covering of hides of sea cows."
EXO	36	20	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3554	 {20} They made upright frames of acacia wood for the tabernacle.
EXO	36	21	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3555	" {21} Each frame was ten cubits long and a cubit and a half wide, {22} with two projections set parallel to each other. They made all the frames of the tabernacle in this way."
EXO	36	23	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3556	" {23} They made twenty frames for the south side of the tabernacle {24} and made forty silver bases to go under them--two bases for each frame, one under each projection."
EXO	36	25	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3557	" {25} For the other side, the north side of the tabernacle, they made twenty frames {26} and forty silver bases--two under each frame."
EXO	36	27	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3558	" {27} They made six frames for the far end, that is, the west end of the tabernacle, {28} and two frames were made for the corners of the tabernacle at the far end."
EXO	36	29	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3559	 {29} At these two corners the frames were double from the bottom all the way to the top and fitted into a single ring; both were made alike.
EXO	36	30	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3560	 {30} So there were eight frames and sixteen silver bases--two under each frame.
EXO	36	31	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3561	 {31} They also made crossbars of acacia wood:
EXO	36	31	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3562	" five for the frames on one side of the tabernacle, {32} five for those on the other side, and five for the frames on the west, at the far end of the tabernacle."
EXO	36	33	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3563	 {33} They made the center crossbar so that it extended from end to end at the middle of the frames.
EXO	36	34	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3564	 {34} They overlaid the frames with gold and made gold rings to hold the crossbars. They also overlaid the crossbars with gold.
EXO	36	35	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3565	" {35} They made the curtain of blue, purple and scarlet yarn and finely twisted linen, with cherubim worked into it by a skilled craftsman."
EXO	36	36	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3566	 {36} They made four posts of acacia wood for it and overlaid them with gold. They made gold hooks for them and cast their four silver bases.
EXO	36	37	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3567	" {37} For the entrance to the tent they made a curtain of blue, purple and scarlet yarn and finely twisted linen--the work of an embroiderer;"
EXO	36	38	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3568	 {38} and they made five posts with hooks for them. They overlaid the tops of the posts and their bands with gold and made their five bases of bronze.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
EXO	37	<<	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3569	EXODUS 37
EXO	37	1	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3570	" {1} Bezalel made the ark of acacia wood--two and a half cubits long, a cubit and a half wide, and a cubit and a half high."
EXO	37	2	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3571	" {2} He overlaid it with pure gold, both inside and out, and made a gold molding around it."
EXO	37	3	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3572	" {3} He cast four gold rings for it and fastened them to its four feet, with two rings on one side and two rings on the other."
EXO	37	4	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3573	 {4} Then he made poles of acacia wood and overlaid them with gold. {5} And he inserted the poles into the rings on the sides of the ark to carry it.
EXO	37	6	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3574	 {6} He made the atonement cover of pure gold--two and a half cubits long and a cubit and a half wide.
EXO	37	7	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3575	 {7} Then he made two cherubim out of hammered gold at the ends of the cover.
EXO	37	8	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3576	 {8} He made one cherub on one end and the second cherub on the other; at the two ends he made them of one piece with the cover.
EXO	37	9	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3577	" {9} The cherubim had their wings spread upward, overshadowing the cover with them. The cherubim faced each other, looking toward the cover."
EXO	37	10	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3578	" {10} They made the table of acacia wood--two cubits long, a cubit wide, and a cubit and a half high."
EXO	37	11	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3579	 {11} Then they overlaid it with pure gold and made a gold molding around it.
EXO	37	12	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3580	 {12} They also made around it a rim a handbreadth wide and put a gold molding on the rim.
EXO	37	13	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3581	" {13} They cast four gold rings for the table and fastened them to the four corners, where the four legs were."
EXO	37	14	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3582	 {14} The rings were put close to the rim to hold the poles used in carrying the table.
EXO	37	15	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3583	 {15} The poles for carrying the table were made of acacia wood and were overlaid with gold.
EXO	37	16	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3584	 {16} And they made from pure gold the articles for the table--its plates and dishes and bowls and its pitchers for the pouring out of drink offerings.
EXO	37	17	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3585	" {17} They made the lampstand of pure gold and hammered it out, base and shaft; its flowerlike cups, buds and blossoms were of one piece with it."
EXO	37	18	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3586	 {18} Six branches extended from the sides of the lampstand--three on one side and three on the other.
EXO	37	19	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3587	" {19} Three cups shaped like almond flowers with buds and blossoms were on one branch, three on the next branch and the same for all six branches extending from the lampstand."
EXO	37	20	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3588	 {20} And on the lampstand were four cups shaped like almond flowers with buds and blossoms.
EXO	37	21	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3589	" {21} One bud was under the first pair of branches extending from the lampstand, a second bud under the second pair, and a third bud under the third pair--six branches in all."
EXO	37	22	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3590	" {22} The buds and the branches were all of one piece with the lampstand, hammered out of pure gold."
EXO	37	23	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3591	" {23} They made its seven lamps, as well as its wick trimmers and trays, of pure gold."
EXO	37	24	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3592	 {24} They made the lampstand and all its accessories from one talent of pure gold.
EXO	37	25	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3593	" {25} They made the altar of incense out of acacia wood. It was square, a cubit long and a cubit wide, and two cubits high--its horns of one piece with it."
EXO	37	26	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3594	" {26} They overlaid the top and all the sides and the horns with pure gold, and made a gold molding around it."
EXO	37	27	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3595	 {27} They made two gold rings below the molding--two on opposite sides--to hold the poles used to carry it.
EXO	37	28	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3596	 {28} They made the poles of acacia wood and overlaid them with gold.
EXO	37	29	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3597	" {29} They also made the sacred anointing oil and the pure, fragrant incense--the work of a perfumer.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"

EXO	38	19	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3618	" Their hooks and bands were silver, and their tops were overlaid with silver. {20} All the tent pegs of the tabernacle and of the surrounding courtyard were bronze."
EXO	38	21	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3619	" {21} These are the amounts of the materials used for the tabernacle, the tabernacle of the Testimony, which were recorded at Moses' command by the Levites under the direction of Ithamar son of Aaron, the priest."
EXO	38	22	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3620	" {22} (Bezalel son of Uri, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah, made everything the Lord commanded Moses;"
EXO	38	23	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3621	" {23} with him was Oholiab son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan--a craftsman and designer, and an embroiderer in blue, purple and scarlet yarn and fine linen.)"
EXO	38	24	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3622	" {24} The total amount of the gold from the wave offering used for all the work on the sanctuary was talents and 730 shekels, according to the sanctuary shekel."
EXO	38	25	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3623	" {25} The silver obtained from those of the community who were counted in the census was 100 talents and 1,775 shekels, according to the sanctuary shekel--"
EXO	38	26	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3624	" {26} one beka per person, that is, half a shekel, according to the sanctuary shekel, from everyone who had crossed over to those counted, twenty years old or more, a total of 603,550 men."
EXO	38	27	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3625	" {27} The 100 talents of silver were used to cast the bases for the sanctuary and for the curtain--100 bases from the 100 talents, one talent for each base."
EXO	38	28	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3626	" {28} They used the 1,775 shekels to make the hooks for the posts, to overlay the tops of the posts, and to make their bands."
EXO	38	29	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3627	" {29} The bronze from the wave offering was 70 talents and 2,400 shekels."
EXO	38	30	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3628	" {30} They used it to make the bases for the entrance to the Tent of Meeting, the bronze altar with its bronze grating and all its utensils,"

EXO	39	<<	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3630	EXODUS 39
EXO	39	1	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3631	" {1} From the blue, purple and scarlet yarn they made woven garments for ministering in the sanctuary. They also made sacred garments for Aaron, as the Lord commanded Moses."
EXO	39	2	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3632	" {2} They made the ephod of gold, and of blue, purple and scarlet yarn, and of finely twisted linen."
EXO	39	3	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3633	" {3} They hammered out thin sheets of gold and cut strands to be worked into the blue, purple and scarlet yarn and fine linen--the work of a skilled craftsman."
EXO	39	4	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3634	" {4} They made shoulder pieces for the ephod, which were attached to two of its corners, so it could be fastened."
EXO	39	5	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3635	" {5} Its skillfully woven waistband was like it--of one piece with the ephod and made with gold, and with blue, purple and scarlet yarn, and with finely twisted linen, as the Lord commanded Moses."
EXO	39	6	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3636	 {6} They mounted the onyx stones in gold filigree settings and engraved them like a seal with the names of the sons of Israel.
EXO	39	7	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3637	" {7} Then they fastened them on the shoulder pieces of the ephod as memorial stones for the sons of Israel, as the Lord commanded Moses."
EXO	39	8	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3638	" {8} They fashioned the breastpiece--the work of a skilled craftsman. They made it like the ephod: of gold, and of blue, purple and scarlet yarn, and of finely twisted linen."
EXO	39	9	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3639	 {9} It was square--a span long and a span wide--and folded double.
EXO	39	10	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3640	" {10} Then they mounted four rows of precious stones on it. In the first row there was a ruby, a topaz and a beryl;"
EXO	39	11	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3641	" {11} in the second row a turquoise, a sapphire and an emerald;"
EXO	39	12	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3642	" {12} in the third row a jacinth, an agate and an amethyst;"
EXO	39	13	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3643	" {13} in the fourth row a chrysolite, an onyx and a jasper. They were mounted in gold filigree settings."
EXO	39	14	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3644	" {14} There were twelve stones, one for each of the names of the sons of Israel, each engraved like a seal with the name of one of the twelve tribes."
EXO	39	15	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3645	" {15} For the breastpiece they made braided chains of pure gold, like a rope."
EXO	39	16	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3646	" {16} They made two gold filigree settings and two gold rings, and fastened the rings to two of the corners of the breastpiece."
EXO	39	17	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3647	 {17} They fastened the two gold chains to the rings at the corners of the breastpiece.
EXO	39	18	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3648	" {18} They fastened the other ends of the chains to the two settings, attaching them to the shoulder pieces of the ephod at the front."
EXO	39	19	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3649	 {19} They made two gold rings and attached them to the other two corners of the breastpiece on the inside edge next to the ephod.
EXO	39	20	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3650	" {20} Then they made two more gold rings and attached them to the bottom of the shoulder pieces on the front of the ephod, close to the seam just above the waistband of the ephod."
EXO	39	21	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3651	" {21} They tied the rings of the breastpiece to the rings of the ephod with blue cord, connecting it to the waistband so that the breastpiece would not swing out from the ephod--as the Lord commanded Moses."
EXO	39	22	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3652	 {22} They made the robe of the ephod entirely of blue cloth--the work of a weaver--
EXO	39	23	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3653	" {23} with an opening in the center of the robe like the opening of a collar, and a band around this opening, so that it would not tear."
EXO	39	24	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3654	" {24} They made pomegranates of blue, purple and scarlet yarn and finely twisted linen around the hem of the robe."
EXO	39	25	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3655	 {25} And they made bells of pure gold and attached them around the hem between the pomegranates.
EXO	39	26	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3656	" {26} The bells and pomegranates alternated around the hem of the robe to be worn for ministering, as the Lord commanded Moses."
EXO	39	27	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3657	" {27} For Aaron and his sons, they made tunics of fine linen--the work of a weaver-- {28} and the turban of fine linen, the linen headbands and the undergarments of finely twisted linen."
EXO	39	29	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3658	" {29} The sash was of finely twisted linen and blue, purple and scarlet yarn--the work of an embroiderer--as the Lord commanded Moses."
EXO	39	30	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3659	" {30} They made the plate, the sacred diadem, out of pure gold and engraved on it, like an inscription on a seal: holy to the Lord."
EXO	39	31	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3660	" {31} Then they fastened a blue cord to it to attach it to the turban, as the Lord commanded Moses."
EXO	39	32	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3661	" {32} So all the work on the tabernacle, the Tent of Meeting, was completed. The Israelites did everything just as the Lord commanded Moses."
EXO	39	33	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3662	" {33} Then they brought the tabernacle to Moses: the tent and all its furnishings, its clasps, frames, crossbars, posts and bases;"
EXO	39	34	Narr_02: Exodus	#19		3663	" {34} the covering of ram skins dyed red, the covering of hides of sea cows and the shielding curtain;"
