LEV	8	2	God-FX1	#20		3909	" {2} << Bring Aaron and his sons, their garments, the anointing oil, the bull for the sin offering, the two rams and the basket containing bread made without yeast."
LEV	8	3	God-FX1	#20		3910	 {3} Gather the entire assembly at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting.>>
LEV	8	4	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		3911	" {4} Moses did as the Lord commanded him, and the assembly gathered at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting."
LEV	8	5	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		3912	" {5} Moses said to the assembly,"
LEV	8	5	Moses	#01		3913	 << This is what the Lord has commanded to be done.>>
LEV	8	6	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		3914	 {6} Then Moses brought Aaron and his sons forward and washed them with water.
LEV	8	7	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		3915	" {7} He put the tunic on Aaron, tied the sash around him, clothed him with the robe and put the ephod on him."
LEV	8	7	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		3916	 He also tied the ephod to him by its skillfully woven waistband; so it was fastened on him.
LEV	8	8	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		3917	 {8} He placed the breastpiece on him and put the Urim and Thummim in the breastpiece.
LEV	8	9	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		3918	" {9} Then he placed the turban on Aaron's head and set the gold plate, the sacred diadem, on the front of it, as the Lord commanded Moses."
LEV	8	10	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		3919	" {10} Then Moses took the anointing oil and anointed the tabernacle and everything in it, and so consecrated them."
LEV	8	11	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		3920	" {11} He sprinkled some of the oil on the altar seven times, anointing the altar and all its utensils and the basin with its stand, to consecrate them."
LEV	8	12	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		3921	 {12} He poured some of the anointing oil on Aaron's head and anointed him to consecrate him.
LEV	8	13	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		3922	" {13} Then he brought Aaron's sons forward, put tunics on them, tied sashes around them and put headbands on them, as the Lord commanded Moses."
LEV	8	14	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		3923	" {14} He then presented the bull for the sin offering, and Aaron and his sons laid their hands on its head."
LEV	8	15	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		3924	" {15} Moses slaughtered the bull and took some of the blood, and with his finger he put it on all the horns of the altar to purify the altar."
LEV	8	15	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		3925	 He poured out the rest of the blood at the base of the altar. So he consecrated it to make atonement for it.
LEV	8	16	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		3926	" {16} Moses also took all the fat around the inner parts, the covering of the liver, and both kidneys and their fat, and burned it on the altar."
LEV	8	17	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		3927	" {17} But the bull with its hide and its flesh and its offal he burned up outside the camp, as the Lord commanded Moses."
LEV	8	18	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		3928	" {18} He then presented the ram for the burnt offering, and Aaron and his sons laid their hands on its head."
LEV	8	19	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		3929	 {19} Then Moses slaughtered the ram and sprinkled the blood against the altar on all sides.
LEV	8	20	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		3930	" {20} He cut the ram into pieces and burned the head, the pieces and the fat."
LEV	8	21	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		3931	" {21} He washed the inner parts and the legs with water and burned the whole ram on the altar as a burnt offering, a pleasing aroma, an offering made to the Lord by fire, as the Lord commanded Moses."
LEV	8	22	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		3932	" {22} He then presented the other ram, the ram for the ordination, and Aaron and his sons laid their hands on its head."
LEV	8	23	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		3933	" {23} Moses slaughtered the ram and took some of its blood and put it on the lobe of Aaron's right ear, on the thumb of his right hand and on the big toe of his right foot."
LEV	8	24	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		3934	" {24} Moses also brought Aaron's sons forward and put some of the blood on the lobes of their right ears, on the thumbs of their right hands and on the big toes of their right feet."
LEV	8	24	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		3935	 Then he sprinkled blood against the altar on all sides.
LEV	8	25	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		3936	" {25} He took the fat, the fat tail, all the fat around the inner parts, the covering of the liver, both kidneys and their fat and the right thigh."
LEV	8	26	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		3937	" {26} Then from the basket of bread made without yeast, which was before the Lord, he took a cake of bread, and one made with oil, and a wafer;"
LEV	8	26	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		3938	 he put these on the fat portions and on the right thigh. {27} He put all these in the hands of Aaron and his sons and waved them before the Lord as a wave offering.
LEV	8	28	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		3939	" {28} Then Moses took them from their hands and burned them on the altar on top of the burnt offering as an ordination offering, a pleasing aroma, an offering made to the Lord by fire."
LEV	8	29	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		3940	" {29} He also took the breast--Moses' share of the ordination ram--and waved it before the Lord as a wave offering, as the Lord commanded Moses."
LEV	8	30	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		3941	 {30} Then Moses took some of the anointing oil and some of the blood from the altar and sprinkled them on Aaron and his garments and on his sons and their garments.
LEV	8	30	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		3942	" So he consecrated Aaron and his garments and his sons and their garments. {31} Moses then said to Aaron and his sons,"
LEV	8	31	Moses	#01		3943	" << Cook the meat at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting and eat it there with the bread from the basket of ordination offerings, as I commanded, saying, 'Aaron and his sons are to eat it.'"
LEV	8	32	Moses	#01		3944	 {32} Then burn up the rest of the meat and the bread.
LEV	8	33	Moses	#01		3945	" {33} Do not leave the entrance to the Tent of Meeting for seven days, until the days of your ordination are completed, for your ordination will last seven days."
LEV	8	34	Moses	#01		3946	 {34} What has been done today was commanded by the Lord to make atonement for you.
LEV	8	35	Moses	#01		3947	" {35} You must stay at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting day and night for seven days and do what the Lord requires, so you will not die; for that is what I have been commanded.>>"
LEV	8	36	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		3948	 {36} So Aaron and his sons did everything the Lord commanded through Moses.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
LEV	9	<<	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		3949	LEVITICUS 9
LEV	9	1	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		3950	" {1} On the eighth day Moses summoned Aaron and his sons and the elders of Israel. {2} He said to Aaron,"
LEV	9	2	Moses	#01		3951	" << Take a bull calf for your sin offering and a ram for your burnt offering, both without defect, and present them before the Lord."
LEV	9	3	Moses	#01		3952	" {3} Then say to the Israelites: 'Take a male goat for a sin offering, a calf and a lamb--both a year old and without defect--for a burnt offering,"
LEV	9	4	Moses	#01		3953	" {4} and an ox and a ram for a fellowship offering to sacrifice before the Lord, together with a grain offering mixed with oil. For today the Lord will appear to you.'>>"
LEV	9	5	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		3954	" {5} They took the things Moses commanded to the front of the Tent of Meeting, and the entire assembly came near and stood before the Lord. {6} Then Moses said,"
LEV	9	6	Moses	#01		3955	" << This is what the Lord has commanded you to do, so that the glory of the Lord may appear to you.>>"
LEV	9	7	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		3956	" {7} Moses said to Aaron,"
LEV	9	7	Moses	#01		3957	 << Come to the altar and sacrifice your sin offering and your burnt offering and make atonement for yourself and the people;
LEV	9	7	Moses	#01		3958	" sacrifice the offering that is for the people and make atonement for them, as the Lord has commanded.>>"
LEV	9	8	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		3959	 {8} So Aaron came to the altar and slaughtered the calf as a sin offering for himself.
LEV	9	9	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		3960	" {9} His sons brought the blood to him, and he dipped his finger into the blood and put it on the horns of the altar; the rest of the blood he poured out at the base of the altar."
LEV	9	10	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		3961	" {10} On the altar he burned the fat, the kidneys and the covering of the liver from the sin offering, as the Lord commanded Moses;"
LEV	9	11	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		3962	 {11} the flesh and the hide he burned up outside the camp.
LEV	9	12	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		3963	" {12} Then he slaughtered the burnt offering. His sons handed him the blood, and he sprinkled it against the altar on all sides."
LEV	9	13	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		3964	" {13} They handed him the burnt offering piece by piece, including the head, and he burned them on the altar."
LEV	9	14	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		3965	 {14} He washed the inner parts and the legs and burned them on top of the burnt offering on the altar.
LEV	9	15	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		3966	 {15} Aaron then brought the offering that was for the people. He took the goat for the people's sin offering and slaughtered it and offered it for a sin offering as he did with the first one.
LEV	9	16	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		3967	 {16} He brought the burnt offering and offered it in the prescribed way.
LEV	9	17	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		3968	" {17} He also brought the grain offering, took a handful of it and burned it on the altar in addition to the morning's burnt offering."
LEV	9	18	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		3969	" {18} He slaughtered the ox and the ram as the fellowship offering for the people. His sons handed him the blood, and he sprinkled it against the altar on all sides."
LEV	9	19	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		3970	" {19} But the fat portions of the ox and the ram--the fat tail, the layer of fat, the kidneys and the covering of the liver--"
LEV	9	20	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		3971	" {20} these they laid on the breasts, and then Aaron burned the fat on the altar."
LEV	9	21	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		3972	" {21} Aaron waved the breasts and the right thigh before the Lord as a wave offering, as Moses commanded."
LEV	9	22	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		3973	" {22} Then Aaron lifted his hands toward the people and blessed them. And having sacrificed the sin offering, the burnt offering and the fellowship offering, he stepped down."
LEV	9	23	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		3974	" {23} Moses and Aaron then went into the Tent of Meeting. When they came out, they blessed the people; and the glory of the Lord appeared to all the people."
LEV	9	24	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		3975	 {24} Fire came out from the presence of the Lord and consumed the burnt offering and the fat portions on the altar.
LEV	9	24	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		3976	" And when all the people saw it, they shouted for joy and fell facedown.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
LEV	10	<<	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		3977	LEVITICUS 10
LEV	10	1	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		3978	" {1} Aaron's sons Nadab and Abihu took their censers, put fire in them and added incense; and they offered unauthorized fire before the Lord, contrary to his command."
LEV	10	2	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		3979	" {2} So fire came out from the presence of the Lord and consumed them, and they died before the Lord. {3} Moses then said to Aaron,"
LEV	10	3	Moses	#01		3980	" << This is what the Lord spoke of when he said: "" 'Among those who approach me I will show myself holy; in the sight of all the people I will be honored.'>>"
LEV	10	3	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		3981	" Aaron remained silent. {4} Moses summoned Mishael and Elzaphan, sons of Aaron's uncle Uzziel, and said to them,"
LEV	10	4	Moses	#01		3982	" << Come here; carry your cousins outside the camp, away from the front of the sanctuary.>>"
LEV	10	5	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		3983	" {5} So they came and carried them, still in their tunics, outside the camp, as Moses ordered. {6} Then Moses said to Aaron and his sons Eleazar and Ithamar,"
LEV	10	6	Moses	#01		3984	" << Do not let your hair become unkempt, and do not tear your clothes, or you will die and the Lord will be angry with the whole community."
LEV	10	6	Moses	#01		3985	" But your relatives, all the house of Israel, may mourn for those the Lord has destroyed by fire."
LEV	10	7	Moses	#01		3986	" {7} Do not leave the entrance to the Tent of Meeting or you will die, because the Lord's anointing oil is on you.>>"
LEV	10	7	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		3987	" So they did as Moses said. {8} Then the Lord said to Aaron,"
LEV	10	9	God-FX1	#20		3988	" {9} << You and your sons are not to drink wine or other fermented drink whenever you go into the Tent of Meeting, or you will die."
LEV	10	9	God-FX1	#20		3989	 This is a lasting ordinance for the generations to come.
LEV	10	10	God-FX1	#20		3990	" {10} You must distinguish between the holy and the common, between the unclean and the clean, {11} and you must must teach the Israelites all the decrees the Lord has given them through Moses.>>"
LEV	10	12	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		3991	" {12} Moses said to Aaron and his remaining sons, Eleazar and Ithamar,"
LEV	10	12	Moses	#01		3992	" << Take the grain offering left over from the offerings made to the Lord by fire and eat it prepared without yeast beside the altar, for it is most holy."
LEV	10	13	Moses	#01		3993	" {13} Eat it in a holy place, because it is your share and your sons' share of the offerings made to the Lord by fire; for so I have been commanded."
LEV	10	14	Moses	#01		3994	 {14} But you and your sons and your daughters may eat the breast that was waved and the thigh that was presented.
LEV	10	14	Moses	#01		3995	 Eat them in a ceremonially clean place; they have been given to you and your children as your share of the Israelites' fellowship offerings.
LEV	10	15	Moses	#01		3996	" {15} The thigh that was presented and the breast that was waved must be brought with the fat portions of the offerings made by fire, to be waved before the Lord as a wave offering."
LEV	10	15	Moses	#01		3997	" This will be the regular share for you and your children, as the Lord has commanded.>>"
LEV	10	16	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		3998	" {16} When Moses inquired about the goat of the sin offering and found that it had been burned up, he was angry with Eleazar and Ithamar, Aaron's remaining sons, and asked,"
LEV	10	17	Moses	#01		3999	 {17} << Why didn't you eat the sin offering in the sanctuary area?
LEV	10	17	Moses	#01		4000	 It is most holy; it was given to you to take away the guilt of the community by making atonement for them before the Lord.
LEV	10	18	Moses	#01		4001	" {18} Since its blood was not taken into the Holy Place, you should have eaten the goat in the sanctuary area, as I commanded.>>"
LEV	10	19	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4002	" {19} Aaron replied to Moses,"
LEV	10	19	Aaron	#05		4003	" << Today they sacrificed their sin offering and their burnt offering before the Lord, but such things as this have happened to me."
LEV	10	19	Aaron	#05		4004	 Would the Lord have been pleased if I had eaten the sin offering today?>>
LEV	10	20	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4005	" {20} When Moses heard this, he was satisfied.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
LEV	11	<<	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4006	LEVITICUS 11
LEV	11	1	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4007	" {1} The Lord said to Moses and Aaron,"
LEV	11	2	God-FX1	#20		4008	" {2} ""Say to the Israelites: ' Of all the animals that live on land these are the ones you may eat:"
LEV	11	3	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4009	 {3} You may eat any animal that has a split hoof completely divided and that chews the cud.
LEV	11	4	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4010	" {4} "" ' There are some that only chew the cud or only have a split hoof, but you must not eat them."
LEV	11	4	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4011	" The camel, though it chews the cud, does not have a split hoof; it is ceremonially unclean for you."
LEV	11	5	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4012	" {5} The coney, though it chews the cud, does not have a split hoof; it is unclean for you."
LEV	11	6	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4013	" {6} The rabbit, though it chews the cud, does not have a split hoof; it is unclean for you."
LEV	11	7	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4014	" {7} And the pig, though it has a split hoof completely divided, does not chew the cud; it is unclean for you."
LEV	11	8	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4015	 {8} You must not eat their meat or touch their carcasses; they are unclean for you.
LEV	11	9	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4016	" {9} "" 'Of all the creatures living in the water of the seas and the streams, you may eat any that have fins and scales."
LEV	11	10	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4017	 {10} But all creatures in the seas or streams that do not have fins and scales--whether among all the swarming things or among all the other living creatures in the water--you are to detest.
LEV	11	11	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4018	" {11} And since you are to detest them, you must not eat their meat and you must detest their carcasses."
LEV	11	12	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4019	 {12} Anything living in the water that does not have fins and scales is to be detestable to you.
LEV	11	13	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4020	" {13} "" 'These are the birds you are to detest and not eat because they are detestable: the eagle, the vulture, the black vulture,"
LEV	11	14	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4021	" {14} the red kite, any kind of black kite, {15} any kind of raven,"
LEV	11	16	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4022	" {16} the horned owl, the screech owl, the gull, any kind of hawk,"
LEV	11	17	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4023	" {17} the little owl, the cormorant, the great owl, {18} the white owl, the desert owl, the osprey,"
LEV	11	19	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4024	" {19} the stork, any kind of heron, the hoopoe and the bat."
LEV	11	20	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4025	" {20} "" 'All flying insects that walk on all fours are to be detestable to you."
LEV	11	21	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4026	" {21} There are, however, some winged creatures that walk on all fours that you may eat: those that have jointed legs for hopping on the ground."
LEV	11	22	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4027	" {22} Of these you may eat any kind of locust, katydid, cricket or grasshopper."
LEV	11	23	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4028	 {23} But all other winged creatures that have four legs you are to detest.
LEV	11	24	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4029	" {24} "" 'You will make yourselves unclean by these; whoever touches their carcasses will be unclean till evening."
LEV	11	25	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4030	" {25} Whoever picks up one of their carcasses must wash his clothes, and he will be unclean till evening."
LEV	11	26	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4031	" {26} "" 'Every animal that has a split hoof not completely divided or that does not chew the cud is unclean for you; whoever touches the carcass of any of them will be unclean."
LEV	11	27	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4032	" {27} Of all the animals that walk on all fours, those that walk on their paws are unclean for you; whoever touches their carcasses will be unclean till evening."
LEV	11	28	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4033	" {28} Anyone who picks up their carcasses must wash his clothes, and he will be unclean till evening. They are unclean for you."
LEV	11	29	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4034	" {29} "" 'Of the animals that move about on the ground, these are unclean for you: the weasel, weasel, the rat, any kind of great lizard,"
LEV	11	30	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4035	" {30} the gecko, the monitor lizard, the wall lizard, the skink and the chameleon."
LEV	11	31	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4036	" {31} Of all those that move along the ground, these are unclean for you. Whoever touches them when they are dead will be unclean till evening."
LEV	11	32	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4037	" {32} When one of them dies and falls on something, that article, whatever its use, will be unclean, whether it is made of wood, cloth, hide or sackcloth."
LEV	11	32	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4038	" Put it in water; it will be unclean till evening, and then it will be clean."
LEV	11	33	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4039	" {33} If one of them falls into a clay pot, everything in it will be unclean, and you must break the pot."
LEV	11	34	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4040	" {34} Any food that could be eaten but has water on it from such a pot is unclean, and any liquid that could be drunk from it is unclean."
LEV	11	35	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4041	" {35} Anything that one of their carcasses falls on becomes unclean; an oven or cooking pot must be broken up. They are unclean, and you are to regard them as unclean."
LEV	11	36	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4042	" {36} A spring, however, or a cistern for collecting water remains clean, but anyone who touches one of these carcasses is unclean."
LEV	11	37	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4043	" {37} If a carcass falls on any seeds that are to be planted, they remain clean."
LEV	11	38	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4044	" {38} But if water has been put on the seed and a carcass falls on it, it is unclean for you."
LEV	11	39	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4045	" {39} "" 'If an animal that you are allowed to eat dies, anyone who touches the carcass will be unclean till evening."
LEV	11	40	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4046	" {40} Anyone who eats some of the carcass must wash his clothes, and he will be unclean till evening."
LEV	11	40	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4047	" Anyone who picks up the carcass must wash his clothes, and he will be unclean till evening."
LEV	11	41	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4048	" {41} "" 'Every creature that moves about on the ground is detestable; it is not to be eaten."
LEV	11	42	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4049	" {42} You are not to eat any creature that moves about on the ground, whether it moves on its belly or walks on all fours or on many feet; it is detestable."
LEV	11	43	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4050	 {43} Do not defile yourselves by any of these creatures. Do not make yourselves unclean by means of them or be made unclean by them.
LEV	11	44	God-FX1	#20		4051	" {44} I am the Lord your God; consecrate yourselves and be holy, because I am holy. Do not make yourselves unclean by any creature that moves about on the ground."
LEV	11	45	God-FX1	#20		4052	" {45} I am the Lord who brought you up out of Egypt to be your God; therefore be holy, because I am holy."
LEV	11	46	God-FX1	#20		4053	" {46} "" 'These are the regulations concerning animals, birds, every living thing that moves in the water and every creature that moves about on the ground."
LEV	11	47	God-FX1	#20		4054	" {47} You must distinguish between the unclean and the clean, between living creatures that may be eaten and those that may not be eaten.' ""*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
LEV	12	<<	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4055	LEVITICUS 12
LEV	12	1	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4056	" {1} The Lord said to Moses,"
LEV	12	2	God-FX1	#20		4057	" {2} ""Say to the Israelites: 'A woman who becomes pregnant and gives birth to a son will be ceremonially unclean for seven days, just as she is unclean during her monthly period."
LEV	12	3	Moses	#01		4058	 {3} On the eighth day the boy is to be circumcised.
LEV	12	4	Moses	#01		4059	 {4} Then the woman must wait thirty-three days to be purified from her bleeding. She must not touch anything sacred or go to the sanctuary until the days of her purification are over.
LEV	12	5	Moses	#01		4060	" {5} If she gives birth to a daughter, for two weeks the woman will be unclean, as during her period. Then she must wait sixty-six days to be purified from her bleeding."
LEV	12	6	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4061	" {6} "" ' When the days of her purification for a son or daughter are over, she is to bring to the priest at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting a year-old lamb for a burnt offering and a young pigeon or a dove for a sin offering."
LEV	12	7	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4062	" {7} He shall offer them before the Lord to make atonement for her, and then she will be ceremonially clean from her flow of blood."
LEV	12	7	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4063	 These are the regulations for the woman who gives birth to a boy or a girl.
LEV	12	8	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4064	" {8} If she cannot afford a lamb, she is to bring two doves or two young pigeons, one for a burnt offering and the other for a sin offering."
LEV	12	8	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4065	" In this way the priest will make atonement for her, and she will be clean.'>> *~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
LEV	13	<<	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4066	LEVITICUS 13
LEV	13	1	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4067	" {1} The Lord said to Moses and Aaron,"
LEV	13	2	God-FX1	#20		4068	" {2} "" ' When anyone has a swelling or a rash or a bright spot on his skin that may become an infectious skin disease, he must be brought to Aaron the priest or to one of his sons who is a priest."
LEV	13	3	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4069	" {3} The priest is to examine the sore on his skin, and if the hair in the sore has turned white and the sore appears to be more than skin deep, it is an infectious skin disease."
LEV	13	3	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4070	" When the priest examines him, he shall pronounce him ceremonially unclean."
LEV	13	4	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4071	" {4} If the spot on his skin is white but does not appear to be more than skin deep and the hair in it has not turned white, the priest is to put the infected person in isolation for seven days."
LEV	13	5	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4072	" {5} On the seventh day the priest is to examine him, and if he sees that the sore is unchanged and has not spread in the skin, he is to keep him in isolation another seven days."
LEV	13	6	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4073	" {6} On the seventh day the priest is to examine him again, and if the sore has faded and has not spread in the skin, the priest shall pronounce him clean; it is only a rash."
LEV	13	6	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4074	" The man must wash his clothes, and he will be clean."
LEV	13	7	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4075	" {7} But if the rash does spread in his skin after he has shown himself to the priest to be pronounced clean, he must appear before the priest again."
LEV	13	8	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4076	" {8} The priest is to examine him, and if the rash has spread in the skin, he shall pronounce him unclean; it is an infectious disease."
LEV	13	9	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4077	" {9} "" When anyone has an infectious skin disease, he must be brought to the priest. {10} The priest is to examine him."
LEV	13	10	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4078	" If there is a white swelling in the skin that has turned the hair white and if there is raw flesh in the swelling, {11} it is a chronic skin disease and the priest shall pronounce him unclean."
LEV	13	11	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4079	" He is not to put him in isolation, because he is already unclean."
LEV	13	12	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4080	" {12} ""If the disease breaks out all over his skin and, so far as the priest can see, it covers all the skin of the infected person from head to foot, {13} the priest is to examine him."
LEV	13	13	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4081	" If the disease has covered his whole body, he shall pronounce that person clean. Since it has all turned white, he is clean."
LEV	13	14	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4082	" {14} But whenever raw flesh appears on him, he will be unclean."
LEV	13	15	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4083	" {15} When the priest sees the raw flesh, he shall pronounce him unclean. The raw flesh is unclean; he has an infectious disease."
LEV	13	16	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4084	" {16} Should the raw flesh change and turn white, he must go to the priest."
LEV	13	17	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4085	" {17} The priest is to examine him, and if the sores have turned white, the priest shall pronounce the infected person clean; then he will be clean."
LEV	13	18	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4086	" {18} "" When someone has a boil on his skin and it heals, {19} and in the place where the boil was, a white swelling or reddish-white spot appears, he must present himself to the priest."
LEV	13	20	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4087	" {20} The priest is to examine it, and if it appears to be more than skin deep and the hair in it has turned white, the priest shall pronounce him unclean."
LEV	13	20	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4088	 It is an infectious skin disease that has broken out where the boil was.
LEV	13	21	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4089	" {21} But if, when the priest examines it, there is no white hair in it and it is not more than skin deep and has faded, then the priest is to put him in isolation for seven days."
LEV	13	22	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4090	" {22} If it is spreading in the skin, the priest shall pronounce him unclean; it is infectious."
LEV	13	23	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4091	" {23} But if the spot is unchanged and has not spread, it is only a scar from the boil, and the priest shall pronounce him clean."
LEV	13	24	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4092	" {24} "" When someone has a burn on his skin and a reddish-white or white spot appears in the raw flesh of the burn, {25} the priest is to examine the spot."
LEV	13	25	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4093	" If the hair in it has turned white, and it appears to be more than skin deep, it is an infectious disease that has broken out in the burn."
LEV	13	25	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4094	 The priest shall pronounce him unclean; it is an infectious skin disease.
LEV	13	26	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4095	" {26} But if the priest examines it and there is no white hair in the spot and if it is not more than skin deep and has faded, then the priest is to put him in isolation for seven days."
LEV	13	27	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4096	" {27} On the seventh day the priest is to examine him, and if it is spreading in the skin, the priest shall pronounce him unclean; it is an infectious skin disease."
LEV	13	28	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4097	" {28} If, however, the spot is unchanged and has not spread in the skin but has faded, it is a swelling from the burn, and the priest shall pronounce him clean; it is only a scar from the burn."
LEV	13	29	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4098	" {29} ""If a man or woman has a sore on the head or on the chin, {30} the priest is to examine the sore."
LEV	13	30	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4099	" If it appears to be more than skin deep and the hair in it is yellow and thin, the priest shall pronounce that person unclean; it is an itch, an infectious disease of the head or chin."
LEV	13	31	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4100	" {31} But if, when the priest examines this kind of sore, it does not seem to be more than skin deep and there is no black hair in it, then the priest is to put the infected person in isolation for seven days."
LEV	13	32	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4101	 {32} On the seventh day the priest is to examine the sore.
LEV	13	32	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4102	" If the itch has not spread and there is no yellow hair in it and it does not appear to be more than skin deep, {33} he must be shaved except for the diseased area, and the priest is to keep him in isolation another seven days."
LEV	13	34	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4103	" {34} On the seventh day the priest is to examine the itch, and if it has not spread in the skin and appears to be no more than skin deep, the priest shall pronounce him clean. He must wash his clothes, and he will be clean."
LEV	13	35	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4104	" {35} But if the itch does spread in the skin after he is pronounced clean, {36} the priest is to examine him."
LEV	13	36	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4105	" If the itch has spread in the skin, the priest does not need to look for yellow hair; the person is unclean."
LEV	13	37	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4106	" {37} If, however, in his judgment it is unchanged and black hair has grown in it, the itch is healed. He is clean, and the priest shall pronounce him clean."
LEV	13	38	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4107	" {38} "" When a man or woman has white spots on the skin, {39} the priest is to examine them."
LEV	13	39	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4108	" If the spots are dull white, it is a harmless rash that has broken out on the skin; that person is clean."
LEV	13	40	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4109	" {40} "" When a man has lost his hair and is bald, he is clean."
LEV	13	41	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4110	" {41} If he has lost his hair from the front of his scalp and has a bald forehead, he is clean."
LEV	13	42	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4111	" {42} But if he has a reddish-white sore on his bald head or forehead, it is an infectious disease breaking out on his head or forehead. {43} The priest is to examine him."
LEV	13	43	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4112	" If the swollen sore on his head or forehead is reddish-white like an infectious skin disease, {44} the man is diseased and is unclean."
LEV	13	44	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4113	 The priest shall pronounce him unclean because of the sore on his head.
LEV	13	45	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4114	" {45} ""The person with such an infectious disease must wear torn clothes, let his hair be unkempt, cover the lower part of his face and cry out, 'Unclean! Unclean!'"
LEV	13	46	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4115	 {46} As long as he has the infection he remains unclean. He must live alone; he must live outside the camp.
LEV	13	47	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4116	" {47} ""If any clothing is contaminated with mildew--any woolen or linen clothing, {48} any woven or knitted material of linen or wool, any leather or anything made of leather--"
LEV	13	49	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4117	" {49} and if the contamination in the clothing, or leather, or woven or knitted material, or any leather article, is greenish or reddish, it is a spreading mildew and must be shown to the priest."
LEV	13	50	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4118	 {50} The priest is to examine the mildew and isolate the affected article for seven days. {51} On the seventh day he is to examine it. 
LEV	13	51	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4119	" If the mildew has spread in the clothing, or the woven or knitted material, or the leather, whatever its use, it is a destructive mildew; the article is unclean."
LEV	13	52	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4120	" {52} He must burn up the clothing, or the woven or knitted material of wool or linen, or any leather article that has the contamination in it, because the mildew is destructive; the article must be burned up."
LEV	13	53	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4121	" {53} ""But if, when the priest examines it, the mildew has not spread in the clothing, or the woven or knitted material, or the leather article, {54} he shall order that the contaminated article be washed."
LEV	13	54	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4122	 Then he is to isolate it for another seven days.
LEV	13	55	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4123	" {55} After the affected article has been washed, the priest is to examine it, and if the mildew has not changed its appearance, even though it has not spread, it is unclean."
LEV	13	55	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4124	" Burn it with fire, whether the mildew has affected one side or the other."
LEV	13	56	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4125	" {56} If, when the priest examines it, the mildew has faded after the article has been washed, he is to tear the contaminated part out of the clothing, or the leather, or the woven or knitted material."
LEV	13	57	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4126	" {57} But if it reappears in the clothing, or in the woven or knitted material, or in the leather article, it is spreading, and whatever has the mildew must be burned with fire."
LEV	13	58	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4127	" {58} The clothing, or the woven or knitted material, or any leather article that has been washed and is rid of the mildew, must be washed again, and it will be clean."""
LEV	13	59	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4128	" {59} These are the regulations concerning contamination by mildew in woolen or linen clothing, woven or knitted material, or any leather article, for pronouncing them clean or unclean.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
LEV	14	<<	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4129	LEVITICUS 14
LEV	14	1	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4130	" {1} The Lord said to Moses,"
LEV	14	2	God-FX1	#20		4131	" {2} ""These are the regulations for the diseased person at the time of his ceremonial cleansing, when he is brought to the priest:"
LEV	14	3	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4132	 {3} The priest is to go outside the camp and examine him.
LEV	14	3	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4133	" If the person has been healed of his infectious skin disease, {4} the priest shall order that two live clean birds and some cedar wood, scarlet yarn and hyssop be brought for the one to be cleansed."
LEV	14	5	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4134	 {5} Then the priest shall order that one of the birds be killed over fresh water in a clay pot.
LEV	14	6	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4135	" {6} He is then to take the live bird and dip it, together with the cedar wood, the scarlet yarn and the hyssop, into the blood of the bird that was killed over the fresh water."
LEV	14	7	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4136	 {7} Seven times he shall sprinkle the one to be cleansed of the infectious disease and pronounce him clean. Then he is to release the live bird in the open fields.
LEV	14	8	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4137	" {8} "" 'The person to be cleansed must wash his clothes, shave off all his hair and bathe with water; then he will be ceremonially clean."
LEV	14	8	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4138	" After this he may come into the camp, but he must stay outside his tent for seven days."
LEV	14	9	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4139	" {9} On the seventh day he must shave off all his hair; he must shave his head, his beard, his eyebrows and the rest of his hair."
LEV	14	9	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4140	" He must wash his clothes and bathe himself with water, and he will be clean."
LEV	14	10	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4141	" {10} ""On the eighth day he must bring two male lambs and one ewe lamb a year old, each without defect, along with three-tenths of an ephah of fine flour mixed with oil for a grain offering, and one log of oil."
LEV	14	11	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4142	 {11} The priest who pronounces him clean shall present both the one to be cleansed and his offerings before the Lord at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting.
LEV	14	12	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4143	" {12} ""Then the priest is to take one of the male lambs and offer it as a guilt offering, along with the log of oil; he shall wave them before the Lord as a wave offering."
LEV	14	13	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4144	" {13} He is to slaughter the lamb in the holy place where the sin offering and the burnt offering are slaughtered. Like the sin offering, the guilt offering belongs to the priest; it is most holy."
LEV	14	14	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4145	" {14} The priest is to take some of the blood of the guilt offering and put it on the lobe of the right ear of the one to be cleansed, on the thumb of his right hand and on the big toe of his right foot."
LEV	14	15	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4146	" {15} The priest shall then take some of the log of oil, pour it in the palm of his own left hand, {16} dip his right forefinger into the oil in his palm, and with his finger sprinkle some of it before the Lord seven times."
LEV	14	17	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4147	" {17} The priest is to put some of the oil remaining in his palm on the lobe of the right ear of the one to be cleansed, on the thumb of his right hand and on the big toe of his right foot, on top of the blood of the guilt offering."
LEV	14	18	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4148	 {18} The rest of the oil in his palm the priest shall put on the head of the one to be cleansed and make atonement for him before the Lord.
LEV	14	19	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4149	" {19} ""Then the priest is to sacrifice the sin offering and make atonement for the one to be cleansed from his uncleanness."
LEV	14	19	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4150	" After that, the priest shall slaughter the burnt offering {20} and offer it on the altar, together with the grain offering, and make atonement for him, and he will be clean."
LEV	14	21	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4151	" {21} ""If, however, he is poor and cannot afford these, he must take one male lamb as a guilt offering to be waved to make atonement for him, together with a tenth of an ephah of fine flour mixed with oil for a grain offering, a log of oil."
LEV	14	22	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4152	" {22} Also two doves or two young pigeons, whichever he can afford. One shall be for a sin offering and the other for a burnt offering."
LEV	14	23	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4153	" {23} ""On the eighth day he must bring them for his cleansing to the priest at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting, before the Lord."
LEV	14	24	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4154	" {24} The priest is to take the lamb for the guilt offering, together with the log of oil, and wave them before the Lord as a wave offering."
LEV	14	25	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4155	" {25} He shall slaughter the lamb for the guilt offering and take some of its blood and put it on the lobe of the right ear of the one to be cleansed, on the thumb of his right hand and on the big toe of his right foot."
LEV	14	26	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4156	" {26} The priest is to pour some of the oil into the palm of his own left hand, {27} and with his right forefinger sprinkle some of the oil from his palm seven times before the Lord."
LEV	14	28	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4157	" {28} Some of the oil in his palm he is to put on the same places he put the blood of the guilt offering--on the lobe of the right ear of the one to be cleansed, on the thumb of his right hand and on the big toe of his right foot."
LEV	14	29	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4158	" {29} The rest of the oil in his palm the priest shall put on the head of the one to be cleansed, to make atonement for him before the Lord."
LEV	14	30	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4159	" {30} Then he shall sacrifice the doves or the young pigeons, whichever the person can afford, {31} one as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering, together with the grain offering."
LEV	14	31	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4160	 In this way the priest will make atonement before the Lord on behalf of the one to be cleansed.
LEV	14	32	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4161	" {32} These are the regulations for anyone who has an infectious skin disease and who cannot afford the regular offerings for his cleansing. {33} The Lord said to Moses and Aaron,"
LEV	14	34	God-FX1	#20		4162	" {34} "" When you enter the land of Canaan, which I am giving you as your possession, and I put a spreading mildew in a house in that land, {35} the owner of the house must go and tell the priest,"
LEV	14	35	Man	#03		4163	 I have seen something that looks like mildew in my house.'
LEV	14	36	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4164	" {36} The priest is to order the house to be emptied before he goes in to examine the mildew, so that nothing in the house will be pronounced unclean."
LEV	14	36	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4165	 After this the priest is to go in and inspect the house. {37} He is to examine the mildew on the walls.
LEV	14	37	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4166	" If it has greenish or reddish depressions that appear to be deeper than the surface of the wall, {38} the priest shall go out the doorway of the house and close it up for seven days."
LEV	14	39	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4167	 {39} On the seventh day the priest shall return to inspect the house.
LEV	14	39	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4168	" If the mildew has spread on the walls, {40} he is to order that the contaminated stones be torn out and thrown into an unclean place outside the town."
LEV	14	41	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4169	 {41} He must have all the inside walls of the house scraped and the material that is scraped off dumped into an unclean place outside the town.
LEV	14	42	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4170	 {42} Then they are to take other stones to replace these and take new clay and plaster the house.
LEV	14	43	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4171	" {43} ""If the mildew reappears in the house after the stones have been torn out and the house scraped and plastered, {44} the priest is to go and examine it."
LEV	14	44	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4172	" If the mildew has spread in the house, it is a destructive mildew; the house is unclean."
LEV	14	45	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4173	" {45} It must be torn down--its stones, timbers and all the plaster--and taken out of the town to an unclean place."
LEV	14	46	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4174	" {46} ""Anyone who goes into the house while it is closed up will be unclean till evening. {47} Anyone who sleeps or eats in the house must wash his clothes."
LEV	14	48	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4175	" {48} ""But if the priest comes to examine it and the mildew has not spread after the house has been plastered, he shall pronounce the house clean, because the mildew is gone."
LEV	14	49	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4176	" {49} To purify the house he is to take two birds and some cedar wood, scarlet yarn and hyssop. {50} He shall kill one of the birds over fresh water in a clay pot."
LEV	14	51	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4177	" {51} Then he is to take the cedar wood, the hyssop, the scarlet yarn and the live bird, dip them into the blood of the dead bird and the fresh water, and sprinkle the house seven times."
LEV	14	52	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4178	" {52} He shall purify the house with the bird's blood, the fresh water, the live bird, the cedar wood, the hyssop and the scarlet yarn."
LEV	14	53	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4179	" {53} Then he is to release the live bird in the open fields outside the town. In this way he will make atonement for the house, and it will be clean."""
LEV	14	54	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4180	" {54} These are the regulations for any infectious skin disease, for an itch, {55} for mildew in clothing or in a house, {56} and for a swelling, a rash or a bright spot, {57} to determine when something is clean or unclean."
LEV	14	57	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4181	 These are the regulations for infectious skin diseases and mildew.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
LEV	15	<<	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4182	LEVITICUS 15
LEV	15	1	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4183	" {1} The Lord said to Moses and Aaron,"
LEV	15	2	God-FX1	#20		4184	" {2} ""Speak to the Israelites and say to them: When any man has a bodily discharge, the dischare is unclean."
LEV	15	3	God-FX1	#20		4185	" {3} Whether it continues flowing from his body or is blocked, it will make him unclean. This is how his discharge will bring about uncleanness:"
LEV	15	4	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4186	" {4} "" 'Any bed the man with a discharge lies on will be unclean, and anything he sits on will be unclean."
LEV	15	5	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4187	" {5} Anyone who touches his bed must wash his clothes and bathe with water, and he will be unclean till evening."
LEV	15	6	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4188	" {6} Whoever sits on anything that the man with a discharge sat on must wash his clothes and bathe with water, and he will be unclean till evening."
LEV	15	7	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4189	" {7} "" ' Whoever touches the man who has a discharge must wash his clothes and bathe with water, and he will be unclean till evening."
LEV	15	8	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4190	" {8} "" 'If the man with the discharge spits on someone who is clean, that person must wash his clothes and bathe with water, and he will be unclean till evening."
LEV	15	9	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4191	" {9} Everything the man sits on when riding will be unclean, {10} and whoever touches any of the things that were under him will be unclean until evening;"
LEV	15	10	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4192	" whoever picks up those things must wash his clothes and bathe with water, and he will be unclean till evening."
LEV	15	11	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4193	" {11} "" 'Anyone the man with a discharge touches without rinsing his hands with water must wash his clothes and bathe with water, and he will be unclean till evening."
LEV	15	12	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4194	" {12} "" 'A clay pot that the man touches must be broken, and any wooden article is to be rinsed with water."
LEV	15	13	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4195	" {13} "" ' When a man is cleansed from his discharge, he is to count off seven days for his ceremonial cleansing; he must wash his clothes and bathe himself with fresh water, and he will be clean."
LEV	15	14	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4196	" {14} "" 'On the eighth day he must take two doves or two young pigeons and come before the Lord to the entrance to the Tent of Meeting and give them to the priest."
LEV	15	15	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4197	" {15} "" 'The priest is to sacrifice them, the one for a sin offering and the other for a burnt offering. In this way he will make atonement before the Lord for the man because of his discharge."
LEV	15	16	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4198	" {16} "" ' When a man has an emission of semen, he must bathe his whole body with water, and he will be unclean till evening."
LEV	15	17	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4199	" {17} Any clothing or leather that has semen on it must be washed with water, and it will be unclean till evening."
LEV	15	18	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4200	" {18} When a man lies with a woman and there is an emission of semen, both must bathe with water, and they will be unclean till evening."
LEV	15	19	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4201	" {19} "" ' When a woman has her regular flow of blood, the impurity of her monthly period will last seven days, and anyone who touches her will be unclean till evening."
LEV	15	20	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4202	" {20} "" 'Anything she lies on during her period will be unclean, and anything she sits on will be unclean."
LEV	15	21	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4203	" {21} Whoever touches her bed must wash his clothes and bathe with water, and he will be unclean till evening."
LEV	15	22	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4204	" {22} Whoever touches anything she sits on must wash his clothes and bathe with water, and he will be unclean till evening."
LEV	15	23	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4205	" {23} Whether it is the bed or anything she was sitting on, when anyone touches it, he will be unclean till evening."
LEV	15	24	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4206	" {24} "" 'If a man lies with her and her monthly flow touches him, he will be unclean for seven days; any bed he lies on will be unclean."
LEV	15	25	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4207	" {25} "" ' When a woman has a discharge of blood for many days at a time other than her monthly period or has a discharge that continues beyond her period, she will be unclean as long as she has the discharge, just as in the days of her period."
LEV	15	26	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4208	" {26} Any bed she lies on while her discharge continues will be unclean, as is her bed during her monthly period, and anything she sits on will be unclean, as during her period."
LEV	15	27	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4209	" {27} Whoever touches them will be unclean; he must wash his clothes and bathe with water, and he will be unclean till evening."
LEV	15	28	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4210	" {28} "" 'When she is cleansed from her discharge, she must count off seven days, and after that she will be ceremonially clean."
LEV	15	29	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4211	 {29} On the eighth day she must take two doves or two young pigeons and bring them to the priest at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting.
LEV	15	30	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4212	 {30} The priest is to sacrifice one for a sin offering and the other for a burnt offering. In this way he will make atonement for her before the Lord for the uncleanness of her discharge.
LEV	15	31	God-FX1	#20		4213	" {31} "" 'You must keep the Israelites separate from things that make them unclean, so they will not die in their uncleanness for defiling my dwelling place, which is among them."""
LEV	15	32	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4214	" {32} These are the regulations for a man with a discharge, for anyone made unclean by an emission of semen,"
LEV	15	33	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4215	" {33} for a woman in her monthly period, for a man or a woman with a discharge, and for a man who lies with a woman who is ceremonially unclean.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
LEV	16	<<	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4216	LEVITICUS 16
LEV	16	1	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4217	 {1} The Lord spoke to Moses after the death of the two sons of Aaron who died when they approached the Lord.
LEV	16	2	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4218	 {2} The Lord said to Moses:
LEV	16	2	God-FX1	#20		4219	" << Tell your brother Aaron not to come whenever he chooses into the Most Holy Place behind the curtain in front of the atonement cover on the ark, or else he will die."
LEV	16	2	God-FX1	#20		4220	" For I appear in the cloud over the atonement cover. {3} ""This is how Aaron is to enter the sanctuary area: with a young bull for a sin offering and a ram for a burnt offering."
LEV	16	4	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4221	" {4} He is to put on the sacred linen tunic, with linen undergarments next to his body; he is to tie the linen sash around him and put on the linen turban."
LEV	16	4	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4222	 These are sacred garments; so he must bathe himself with water before he puts them on.
LEV	16	5	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4223	 {5} From the Israelite community he is to take two male goats for a sin offering and a ram for a burnt offering.
LEV	16	6	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4224	" {6} ""Aaron is to offer the bull for his own sin offering to make atonement for himself and his household."
LEV	16	7	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4225	 {7} Then he is to take the two goats and present them before the Lord at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting.
LEV	16	8	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4226	 {8} He is to cast lots for the two goats--one lot for the Lord and the other for the scapegoat. {9} Aaron shall bring the goat whose lot falls to the Lord and sacrifice it for a sin offering.
LEV	16	10	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4227	 {10} But the goat chosen by lot as the scapegoat shall be presented alive before the Lord to be used for making atonement by sending it into the desert as a scapegoat.
LEV	16	11	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4228	" {11} ""Aaron shall bring the bull for his own sin offering to make atonement for himself and his household, and he is to slaughter the bull for his own sin offering."
LEV	16	12	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4229	 {12} He is to take a censer full of burning coals from the altar before the Lord and two handfuls of finely ground fragrant incense and take them behind the curtain.
LEV	16	13	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4230	" {13} He is to put the incense on the fire before the Lord, and the smoke of the incense will conceal the atonement cover above the Testimony, so that he will not die."
LEV	16	14	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4231	 {14} He is to take some of the bull's blood and with his finger sprinkle it on the front of the atonement cover.
LEV	16	14	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4232	 Then he shall sprinkle some of it with his finger seven times before the atonement cover.
LEV	16	15	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4233	" {15} ""He shall then slaughter the goat for the sin offering for the people and take its blood behind the curtain and do with it as he did with the bull's blood:"
LEV	16	15	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4234	 He shall sprinkle it on the atonement cover and in front of it.
LEV	16	16	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4235	" {16} In this way he will make atonement for the Most Holy Place because of the uncleanness and rebellion of the Israelites, whatever their sins have been."
LEV	16	16	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4236	" He is to do the same for the Tent of Meeting, which is among them in the midst of their uncleanness."
LEV	16	17	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4237	" {17} No one is to be in the Tent of Meeting from the time Aaron goes in to make atonement in the Most Holy Place until he comes out, having made atonement for himself, his household and the whole community of Israel."
LEV	16	18	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4238	" {18} ""Then he shall come out to the altar that is before the Lord and make atonement for it."
LEV	16	18	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4239	 He shall take some of the bull's blood and some of the goat's blood and put it on all the horns of the altar.
LEV	16	19	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4240	 {19} He shall sprinkle some of the blood on it with his finger seven times to cleanse it and to consecrate it from the uncleanness of the Israelites.
LEV	16	20	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4241	" {20} "" When Aaron has finished making atonement for the Most Holy Place, the Tent of Meeting and the altar, he shall bring forward the live goat."
LEV	16	21	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4242	 {21} He is to lay both hands on the head of the live goat and confess over it all the wickedness and rebellion of the Israelites--all their sins--and put them on the goat's head.
LEV	16	21	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4243	 He shall send the goat away into the desert in the care of a man appointed for the task.
LEV	16	22	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4244	 {22} The goat will carry on itself all their sins to a solitary place; and the man shall release it in the desert.
LEV	16	23	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4245	" {23} ""Then Aaron is to go into the Tent of Meeting and take off the linen garments he put on before he entered the Most Holy Place, and he is to leave them there."
LEV	16	24	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4246	 {24} He shall bathe himself with water in a holy place and put on his regular garments.
LEV	16	24	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4247	" Then he shall come out and sacrifice the burnt offering for himself and the burnt offering for the people, to make atonement for himself and for the people."
LEV	16	25	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4248	 {25} He shall also burn the fat of the sin offering on the altar.
LEV	16	26	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4249	" {26} ""The man who releases the goat as a scapegoat must wash his clothes and bathe himself with water; afterward he may come into the camp."
LEV	16	27	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4250	" {27} The bull and the goat for the sin offerings, whose blood was brought into the Most Holy Place to make atonement, must be taken outside the camp."
LEV	16	27	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4251	" Their hides, flesh and offal are to be burned up."
LEV	16	28	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4252	 {28} The man who burns them must wash his clothes and bathe himself with water; afterward he may come into the camp.
LEV	16	29	God-FX1	#20		4253	" {29} ""This is to be a lasting ordinance for you: On the tenth day of the seventh month you must deny yourselves and not do any work--whether native-born or an alien living among you."
LEV	16	30	God-FX1	#20		4254	" {30} For on this day atonement will be made for you, to cleanse you. Then, before the Lord, you will be clean from all your sins."
LEV	16	31	God-FX1	#20		4255	" {31} It is a sabbath of rest, and you must deny yourselves; it is a lasting ordinance."
LEV	16	32	God-FX1	#20		4256	 {32} The priest who is anointed and ordained to succeed his father as high priest is to make atonement.
LEV	16	32	God-FX1	#20		4257	" He is to put on the sacred linen garments {33} and make atonement for the Most Holy Place, for the Tent of Meeting and the altar, and for the priests and all the people of the community."
LEV	16	34	God-FX1	#20		4258	" {34} ""This is to be a lasting ordinance for you: Atonement is to be made once a year for all the sins of the Israelites."""
LEV	16	34	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4259	" And it was done, as the Lord commanded Moses.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
LEV	17	<<	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4260	LEVITICUS 17
LEV	17	1	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4261	" {1} The Lord said to Moses,"
LEV	17	2	God-FX1	#20		4262	" {2} ""Speak to Aaron and his sons and to all the Israelites and say to them: This is what the Lord has commanded:"
LEV	17	3	Moses	#01		4263	" {3} Any Israelite who sacrifices an ox, a lamb or a goat in the camp or outside of it {4} instead of bringing it to the entrance to the Tent of Meeting to present it as an offering to the Lord in front of the tabernacle of the Lord--that man shall be con"
LEV	17	4	Moses	#01		4264	 He has shed blood and must be cut off from his people.
LEV	17	5	Moses	#01		4265	 {5} This is so the Israelites will bring to the Lord the sacrifices they are now making in the open fields.
LEV	17	5	Moses	#01		4266	" They must bring them to the priest, that is, to the Lord, at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting and sacrifice them as fellowship offerings."
LEV	17	6	Moses	#01		4267	 {6} The priest is to sprinkle the blood against the altar of the Lord at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting and burn the fat as an aroma pleasing to the Lord.
LEV	17	7	God-FX1	#20		4268	 {7} They must no longer offer any of their sacrifices to the goat idols to whom they prostitute themselves. This is to be a lasting ordinance for them and for the generations to come.'
LEV	17	8	God-FX1	#20		4269	" {8} ""Say to them: Any Israelite or any alien living among them who offers a burnt offering or sacrifice {9} and does not bring it to the entrance to the Tent of Meeting to sacrifice it to the Lord--that man must be cut off from his people."
LEV	17	10	God-FX1	#20		4270	" {10} "" 'Any Israelite or any alien living among them who eats any blood--I will set my face against that person who eats blood and will cut him off from his people."
LEV	17	11	God-FX1	#20		4271	" {11} For the life of a creature is in the blood, and I have given it to you to make atonement for yourselves on the altar; it is the blood that makes atonement for one's life."
LEV	17	12	God-FX1	#20		4272	" {12} Therefore I say to the Israelites, ""None of you may eat blood, nor may an alien living among you eat blood."""
LEV	17	13	God-FX1	#20		4273	" {13} "" 'Any Israelite or any alien living among you who hunts any animal or bird that may be eaten must drain out the blood and cover it with earth, {14} because the life of every creature is its blood."
LEV	17	14	God-FX1	#20		4274	" That is why I have said to the Israelites, ""You must not eat the blood of any creature, because the life of every creature is its blood; anyone who eats it must be cut off."
LEV	17	15	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4275	" {15} "" 'Anyone, whether native-born or alien, who eats anything found dead or torn by wild animals must wash his clothes and bathe with water, and he will be ceremonially unclean till evening; then he will be clean."
LEV	17	16	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4276	" {16} But if he does not wash his clothes and bathe himself, he will be held responsible.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
LEV	18	<<	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4277	LEVITICUS 18

LEV	18	4	God-FX1	#20		4281	 {4} You must obey my laws and be careful to follow my decrees. I am the Lord your God.

LEV	18	6	God-FX1	#20		4283	" {6} "" 'No one is to approach any close relative to have sexual relations. I am the Lord."

LEV	18	8	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4285	" {8} "" 'Do not have sexual relations with your father's wife; that would dishonor your father."

LEV	18	20	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4298	" {20} "" 'Do not have sexual relations with your neighbor's wife and defile yourself with her."
LEV	18	21	God-FX1	#20		4299	" {21} "" 'Do not give any of your children to be sacrificed to Molech, for you must not profane the name of your God. I am the Lord."""
LEV	18	22	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4300	" {22} "" 'Do not lie with a man as one lies with a woman; that is detestable."
LEV	18	23	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4301	" {23} "" 'Do not have sexual relations with an animal and defile yourself with it. A woman must not present herself to an animal to have sexual relations with it; that is a perversion."
LEV	18	24	God-FX1	#20		4302	" {24} "" 'Do not defile yourselves in any of these ways, because this is how the nations that I am going to drive out before you became defiled."
LEV	18	25	God-FX1	#20		4303	" {25} Even the land was defiled; so I punished it for its sin, and the land vomited out its inhabitants. {26} But you must keep my decrees and my laws."
LEV	18	26	God-FX1	#20		4304	" The native-born and the aliens living among you must not do any of these detestable things, {27} for all these things were done by the people who lived in the land before you, and the land became defiled."
LEV	18	28	God-FX1	#20		4305	" {28} And if you defile the land, it will vomit you out as it vomited out the nations that were before you."

LEV	19	21	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4329	" {21} The man, however, must bring a ram to the entrance to the Tent of Meeting for a guilt offering to the Lord."
LEV	19	22	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4330	" {22} With the ram of the guilt offering the priest is to make atonement for him before the Lord for the sin he has committed, and his sin will be forgiven."
LEV	19	23	God-FX1	#20		4331	" {23} "" ' When you enter the land and plant any kind of fruit tree, regard its fruit as forbidden. For three years you are to consider it forbidden; it must not be eaten."
LEV	19	24	God-FX1	#20		4332	" {24} In the fourth year all its fruit will be holy, an offering of praise to the Lord."
LEV	19	25	God-FX1	#20		4333	 {25} But in the fifth year you may eat its fruit. In this way your harvest will be increased. I am the Lord your God.

LEV	20	19	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4366	" {19} "" 'Do not have sexual relations with the sister of either your mother or your father, for that would dishonor a close relative; both of you would be held responsible."

LEV	20	24	God-FX1	#20		4371	" {24} But I said to you, ""You will possess their land; I will give it to you as an inheritance, a land flowing with milk and honey."" I am the Lord your God, who has set you apart from the nations."

LEV	20	26	God-FX1	#20		4374	" {26} You are to be holy to me because I, the Lord, am holy, and I have set you apart from the nations to be my own."

LEV	21	23	God-FX1	#20		4398	" {23} yet because of his defect, he must not go near the curtain or approach the altar, and so desecrate my sanctuary. I am the Lord, who makes them holy.' """

LEV	22	<<	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4400	LEVITICUS 22
LEV	22	1	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4401	" {1} The Lord said to Moses,"
LEV	22	2	God-FX1	#20		4402	" {2} ""Tell Aaron and his sons to treat with respect the sacred offerings the Israelites consecrate to me, so they will not profane my holy name. I am the Lord. {3} ""Say to them:"
LEV	22	3	God-FX1	#20		4403	" 'For the generations to come, if any of your descendants is ceremonially unclean and yet comes near the sacred offerings that the Israelites consecrate to the Lord, that person must be cut off from my presence. I am the Lord."
LEV	22	4	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4404	" {4} "" 'If a descendant of Aaron has an infectious skin disease or a bodily discharge, he may not eat the sacred offerings until he is cleansed."
LEV	22	4	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4405	" He will also be unclean if he touches something defiled by a corpse or by anyone who has an emission of semen,"
LEV	22	5	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4406	" {5} or if he touches any crawling thing that makes him unclean, or any person who makes him unclean, whatever the uncleanness may be."
LEV	22	6	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4407	 {6} The one who touches any such thing will be unclean till evening. He must not eat any of the sacred offerings unless he has bathed himself with water.
LEV	22	7	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4408	" {7} When the sun goes down, he will be clean, and after that he may eat the sacred offerings, for they are his food."
LEV	22	8	God-FX1	#20		4409	" {8} He must not eat anything found dead or torn by wild animals, and so become unclean through it. I am the Lord."
LEV	22	9	God-FX1	#20		4410	" {9} "" 'The priests are to keep my requirements so that they do not become guilty and die for treating them with contempt. I am the Lord, who makes them holy."
LEV	22	10	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4411	" {10} "" 'No one outside a priest's family may eat the sacred offering, nor may the guest of a priest or his hired worker eat it."
LEV	22	11	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4412	" {11} But if a priest buys a slave with money, or if a slave is born in his household, that slave may eat his food."
LEV	22	12	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4413	" {12} If a priest's daughter marries anyone other than a priest, she may not eat any of the sacred contributions."
LEV	22	13	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4414	" {13} But if a priest's daughter becomes a widow or is divorced, yet has no children, and she returns to live in her father's house as in her youth, she may eat of her father's food."
LEV	22	13	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4415	" No unauthorized person, however, may eat any of it."
LEV	22	14	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4416	" {14} "" 'If anyone eats a sacred offering by mistake, he must make restitution to the priest for the offering and add a fifth of the value to it."
LEV	22	15	God-FX1	#20		4417	 {15} The priests must not desecrate the sacred offerings the Israelites present to the Lord {16} by allowing them to eat the sacred offerings and so bring upon them guilt requiring payment. 
LEV	22	16	God-FX1	#20		4418	" I am the Lord, who makes them holy.' """
LEV	22	17	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4419	" {17} The Lord said to Moses,"
LEV	22	18	God-FX1	#20		4420	" {18} ""Speak to Aaron and his sons and to all the Israelites and say to them:"
LEV	22	18	God-FX1	#20		4421	" If any of you--either an Israelite or an alien living in Israel --presents a gift for a burnt offering to the Lord, either to fulfill a vow or as a freewill offering, "
LEV	22	19	God-FX1	#20		4422	" {19} you must present a male without defect from the cattle, sheep or goats in order that it may be accepted on your behalf."
LEV	22	20	Moses	#01		4423	" {20} Do not bring anything with a defect, because it will not be accepted on your behalf."
LEV	22	21	Moses	#01		4424	" {21} When anyone brings from the herd or flock a fellowship offering to the Lord to fulfill a special vow or as a freewill offering, it must be without defect or blemish to be acceptable."
LEV	22	22	Moses	#01		4425	" {22} Do not offer to the Lord the blind, the injured or the maimed, or anything with warts or festering or running sores."
LEV	22	22	Moses	#01		4426	 Do not place any of these on the altar as an offering made to the Lord by fire.
LEV	22	23	Moses	#01		4427	" {23} You may, however, present as a freewill offering an ox or a sheep that is deformed or stunted, but it will not be accepted in fulfillment of a vow."
LEV	22	24	Moses	#01		4428	" {24} You must not offer to the Lord an animal whose testicles are bruised, crushed, torn or cut."
LEV	22	24	Moses	#01		4429	" You must not do this in your own land, {25} and you must not accept such animals from the hand of a foreigner and offer them as the food of your God."
LEV	22	25	Moses	#01		4430	" They will not be accepted on your behalf, because they are deformed and have defects.' """
LEV	22	26	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4431	" {26} The Lord said to Moses,"
LEV	22	27	God-FX1	#20		4432	" {27} "" When a calf, a lamb or a goat is born, it is to remain with its mother for seven days. From the eighth day on, it will be acceptable as an offering made to the Lord by fire."
LEV	22	28	God-FX1	#20		4433	 {28} Do not slaughter a cow or a sheep and its young on the same day.
LEV	22	29	God-FX1	#20		4434	" {29} "" When you sacrifice a thank offering to the Lord, sacrifice it in such a way that it will be accepted on your behalf."
LEV	22	30	God-FX1	#20		4435	" {30} It must be eaten that same day; leave none of it till morning. I am the Lord. {31} ""Keep my commands and follow them. I am the Lord."
LEV	22	32	God-FX1	#20		4436	 {32} Do not profane my holy name. I must be acknowledged as holy by the Israelites.
