LEV	25	<<	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4507	LEVITICUS 25
LEV	25	1	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4508	" {1} The Lord said to Moses on Mount Sinai,"
LEV	25	2	God-FX1	#20		4509	" {2} ""Speak to the Israelites and say to them: 'When you enter the land I am going to give you, the land itself must observe a sabbath to the Lord."
LEV	25	3	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4510	" {3} For six years sow your fields, and for six years prune your vineyards and gather their crops."
LEV	25	4	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4511	" {4} But in the seventh year the land is to have a sabbath of rest, a sabbath to the Lord. Do not sow your fields or prune your vineyards."
LEV	25	5	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4512	 {5} Do not reap what grows of itself or harvest the grapes of your untended vines. The land is to have a year of rest.
LEV	25	6	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4513	 {6} Whatever the land yields during the sabbath year will be food for you--
LEV	25	6	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4514	" for yourself, your manservant and maidservant, and the hired worker and temporary resident who live among you, {7} as well as for your livestock and the wild animals in your land."
LEV	25	7	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4515	 Whatever the land produces may be eaten.
LEV	25	8	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4516	 {8} Count off seven sabbaths of years--seven times seven years--so that the seven sabbaths of years amount to a period of forty-nine years.
LEV	25	9	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4517	 {9} Then have the trumpet sounded everywhere on the tenth day of the seventh month; on the Day of Atonement sound the trumpet throughout your land.
LEV	25	10	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4518	 {10} Consecrate the fiftieth year and proclaim liberty throughout the land to all its inhabitants.
LEV	25	10	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4519	 It shall be a jubilee for you; each one of you is to return to his family property and each to his own clan.
LEV	25	11	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4520	 {11} The fiftieth year shall be a jubilee for you; do not sow and do not reap what grows of itself or harvest the untended vines.
LEV	25	12	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4521	 {12} For it is a jubilee and is to be holy for you; eat only what is taken directly from the fields.
LEV	25	13	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4522	" {13} "" 'In this Year of Jubilee everyone is to return to his own property."
LEV	25	14	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4523	" {14} "" 'If you sell land to one of your countrymen or buy any from him, do not take advantage of each other."
LEV	25	15	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4524	 {15} You are to buy from your countryman on the basis of the number of years since the Jubilee. And he is to sell to you on the basis of the number of years left for harvesting crops.
LEV	25	16	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4525	" {16} When the years are many, you are to increase the price, and when the years are few, you are to decrease the price, because what he is really selling you is the number of crops."
LEV	25	17	God-FX1	#20		4526	" {17} Do not take advantage of each other, but fear your God. I am the Lord your God."
LEV	25	18	God-FX1	#20		4527	" {18} Follow my decrees and be careful to obey my laws, and you will live safely in the land."
LEV	25	19	God-FX1	#20		4528	" {19} Then the land will yield its fruit, and you will eat your fill and live there in safety."
LEV	25	20	God-FX1	#20		4529	" {20} You may ask, "" What will we eat in the seventh year if we do not plant or harvest our crops?"""
LEV	25	21	God-FX1	#20		4530	 {21} I will send you such a blessing in the sixth year that the land will yield enough for three years.
LEV	25	22	God-FX1	#20		4531	" {22} While you plant during the eighth year, you will eat from the old crop and will continue to eat from it until the harvest of the ninth year comes in."
LEV	25	23	God-FX1	#20		4532	" {23} "" 'The land must not be sold permanently, because the land is mine and you are but aliens and my tenants."
LEV	25	24	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4533	" {24} Throughout the country that you hold as a possession, you must provide for the redemption of the land."
LEV	25	25	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4534	" {25} "" ' If one of your countrymen becomes poor and sells some of his property, his nearest relative is to come and redeem what his countryman has sold."
LEV	25	26	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4535	" {26} If, however, a man has no one to redeem it for him but he himself prospers and acquires sufficient means to redeem it,"
LEV	25	27	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4536	 {27} let him determine the value for the years since he sold it and refund the balance to the man to whom he sold it; he can then go back to his own property.
LEV	25	28	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4537	" {28} But if he does not acquire the means to repay him, what he sold will remain in the possession of the buyer until the Year of Jubilee."
LEV	25	28	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4538	" It will be returned in the Jubilee, and he can then go back to his property."
LEV	25	29	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4539	" {29} "" 'If a man sells a house in a walled city, he retains the right of redemption a full year after its sale. During that time he may redeem it."
LEV	25	30	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4540	" {30} If it is not redeemed before a full year has passed, the house in the walled city shall belong permanently to the buyer and his descendants. It is not to be returned in the Jubilee."
LEV	25	31	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4541	" {31} But houses in villages without walls around them are to be considered as open country. They can be redeemed, and they are to be returned in the Jubilee."
LEV	25	32	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4542	" {32} "" 'The Levites always have the right to redeem their houses in the Levitical towns, which they possess."
LEV	25	33	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4543	" {33} If one of the Levites exercises his right of redemption, then the house that was sold in a city they possess shall be released in the Jubilee. "
LEV	25	33	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4544	 For the houses in the cities of the Levites are their possession among the people of Israel.
LEV	25	34	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4545	 {34} But the pastureland belonging to their towns must not be sold; it is their permanent possession.
LEV	25	35	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4546	" {35} "" 'If one of your countrymen becomes poor and is unable to support himself among you, help him as you would an alien or a temporary resident, so he can continue to live among you."
LEV	25	36	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4547	" {36} Do not take interest of any kind from him, but fear your God, so that your countryman may continue to live among you."
LEV	25	37	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4548	 {37} You must not lend him money at interest or sell him food at a profit.
LEV	25	38	God-FX1	#20		4549	" {38} I am the Lord your God, who brought you out of Egypt to give you the land of Canaan and to be your God."
LEV	25	39	God-FX1	#20		4550	" {39} "" 'If one of your countrymen becomes poor among you and sells himself to you, do not make him work as a slave."
LEV	25	40	God-FX1	#20		4551	 {40} He is to be treated as a hired worker or a temporary resident among you; he is to work for you until the Year of Jubilee.
LEV	25	41	God-FX1	#20		4552	" {41} Then he and his children are to be released, and he will go back to his own clan and to the property of his forefathers."
LEV	25	42	God-FX1	#20		4553	" {42} Because the Israelites are my servants, whom I brought out of Egypt, they must not be sold as slaves. {43} Do not rule over them ruthlessly, but fear your God."
LEV	25	44	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4554	" {44} "" 'Your male and female slaves are to come from the nations around you; from them you may buy slaves."
LEV	25	45	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4555	" {45} You may also buy some of the temporary residents living among you and members of their clans born in your country, and they will become your property."
LEV	25	46	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4556	" {46} You can will them to your children as inherited property and can make them slaves for life, but you must not rule over your fellow Israelites ruthlessly."
LEV	25	47	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4557	" {47} "" 'If an alien or a temporary resident among you becomes rich and one of your countrymen becomes poor and sells himself to the alien living among you or to a member of the alien's clan, "
LEV	25	48	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4558	 {48} he retains the right of redemption after he has sold himself. One of his relatives may redeem him: 
LEV	25	49	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4559	" {49} An uncle or a cousin or any blood relative in his clan may redeem him. Or if he prospers, he may redeem himself."
LEV	25	50	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4560	 {50} He and his buyer are to count the time from the year he sold himself up to the Year of Jubilee.
LEV	25	50	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4561	 The price for his release is to be based on the rate paid to a hired man for that number of years.
LEV	25	51	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4562	" {51} If many years remain, he must pay for his redemption a larger share of the price paid for him."
LEV	25	52	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4563	" {52} If only a few years remain until the Year of Jubilee, he is to compute that and pay for his redemption accordingly."
LEV	25	53	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4564	 {53} He is to be treated as a man hired from year to year; you must see to it that his owner does not rule over him ruthlessly.
LEV	25	54	God-FX1	#20		4565	" {54} "" 'Even if he is not redeemed in any of these ways, he and his children are to be released in the Year of Jubilee, {55} for the Israelites belong to me as servants."
LEV	25	55	God-FX1	#20		4566	" They are my servants, whom I brought out of Egypt. I am the Lord your God.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
LEV	26	<<	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4567	LEVITICUS 26
LEV	26	1	God-FX1	#20		4568	" {1} "" 'Do not make idols or set up an image or a sacred stone for yourselves, and do not place a carved stone in your land to bow down before it. I am the Lord your God."
LEV	26	2	God-FX1	#20		4569	" {2} "" 'Observe my Sabbaths and have reverence for my sanctuary. I am the Lord."
LEV	26	3	God-FX1	#20		4570	" {3} "" 'If you follow my decrees and are careful to obey my commands, {4} I will send you rain in its season, and the ground will yield its crops and the trees of the field their fruit."
LEV	26	5	God-FX1	#20		4571	" {5} Your threshing will continue until grape harvest and the grape harvest will continue until planting, and you will eat all the food you want and live in safety in your land."
LEV	26	6	God-FX1	#20		4572	" {6} "" 'I will grant peace in the land, and you will lie down and no one will make you afraid. I will remove savage beasts from the land, and the sword will not pass through your country."
LEV	26	7	God-FX1	#20		4573	" {7} You will pursue your enemies, and they will fall by the sword before you."
LEV	26	8	God-FX1	#20		4574	" {8} Five of you will chase a hundred, and a hundred of you will chase ten thousand, and your enemies will fall by the sword before you."
LEV	26	9	God-FX1	#20		4575	" {9} "" 'I will look on you with favor and make you fruitful and increase your numbers, and I will keep my covenant with you."
LEV	26	10	God-FX1	#20		4576	 {10} You will still be eating last year's harvest when you will have to move it out to make room for the new.
LEV	26	11	God-FX1	#20		4577	" {11} I will put my dwelling place among you, and I will not abhor you. {12} I will walk among you and be your God, and you will be my people."
LEV	26	13	God-FX1	#20		4578	" {13} I am the Lord your God, who brought you out of Egypt so that you would no longer be slaves to the Egyptians; I broke the bars of your yoke and enabled you to walk with heads held high."
LEV	26	14	God-FX1	#20		4579	" {14} "" 'But if you will not listen to me and carry out all these commands, {15} and if you reject my decrees and abhor my laws and fail to carry out all my commands and so violate my covenant, {16} then I will do this to you:"
LEV	26	16	God-FX1	#20		4580	" I will bring upon you sudden terror, wasting diseases and fever that will destroy your sight and drain away your life. You will plant seed in vain, because your enemies will eat it."
LEV	26	17	God-FX1	#20		4581	" {17} I will set my face against you so that you will be defeated by your enemies; those who hate you will rule over you, and you will flee even when no one is pursuing you."
LEV	26	18	God-FX1	#20		4582	" {18} "" 'If after all this you will not listen to me, I will punish you for your sins seven times over."
LEV	26	19	God-FX1	#20		4583	 {19} I will break down your stubborn pride and make the sky above you like iron and the ground beneath you like bronze.
LEV	26	20	God-FX1	#20		4584	" {20} Your strength will be spent in vain, because your soil will not yield its crops, nor will the trees of the land yield their fruit."
LEV	26	21	God-FX1	#20		4585	" {21} "" 'If you remain hostile toward me and refuse to listen to me, I will multiply your afflictions seven times over, as your sins deserve."
LEV	26	22	God-FX1	#20		4586	" {22} I will send wild animals against you, and they will rob you of your children, destroy your cattle and make you so few in number that your roads will be deserted."
LEV	26	23	God-FX1	#20		4587	" {23} "" 'If in spite of these things you do not accept my correction but continue to be hostile toward me, {24} I myself will be hostile toward you and will afflict you for your sins seven times over."
LEV	26	25	God-FX1	#20		4588	" {25} And I will bring the sword upon you to avenge the breaking of the covenant. When you withdraw into your cities, I will send a plague among you, and you will be given into enemy hands."
LEV	26	26	God-FX1	#20		4589	" {26} When I cut off your supply of bread, ten women will be able to bake your bread in one oven, and they will dole out the bread by weight. You will eat, but you will not be satisfied."
LEV	26	27	God-FX1	#20		4590	" {27} "" 'If in spite of this you still do not listen to me but continue to be hostile toward me, {28} then in my anger I will be hostile toward you, and I myself will punish you for your sins seven times over."
LEV	26	29	God-FX1	#20		4591	 {29} You will eat the flesh of your sons and the flesh of your daughters.
LEV	26	30	God-FX1	#20		4592	" {30} I will destroy your high places, cut down your incense altars and pile your dead bodies on the lifeless forms of your idols, and I will abhor you."
LEV	26	31	God-FX1	#20		4593	" {31} I will turn your cities into ruins and lay waste your sanctuaries, and I will take no delight in the pleasing aroma of your offerings."
LEV	26	32	God-FX1	#20		4594	" {32} I will lay waste the land, so that your enemies who live there will be appalled."
LEV	26	33	God-FX1	#20		4595	" {33} I will scatter you among the nations and will draw out my sword and pursue you. Your land will be laid waste, and your cities will lie in ruins."
LEV	26	34	God-FX1	#20		4596	 {34} Then the land will enjoy its sabbath years all the time that it lies desolate and you are in the country of your enemies; then the land will rest and enjoy its sabbaths.
LEV	26	35	God-FX1	#20		4597	" {35} All the time that it lies desolate, the land will have the rest it did not have during the sabbaths you lived in it."
LEV	26	36	God-FX1	#20		4598	" {36} "" 'As for those of you who are left, I will make their hearts so fearful in the lands of their enemies that the sound of a windblown leaf will put them to flight."
LEV	26	36	God-FX1	#20		4599	" They will run as though fleeing from the sword, and they will fall, even though no one is pursuing them."
LEV	26	37	God-FX1	#20		4600	" {37} They will stumble over one another as though fleeing from the sword, even though no one is pursuing them. So you will not be able to stand before your enemies."
LEV	26	38	God-FX1	#20		4601	 {38} You will perish among the nations; the land of your enemies will devour you.
LEV	26	39	God-FX1	#20		4602	 {39} Those of you who are left will waste away in the lands of their enemies because of their sins; also because of their fathers' sins they will waste away.
LEV	26	40	God-FX1	#20		4603	" {40} "" 'But if they will confess their sins and the sins of their fathers--their treachery against me and their hostility toward me, {41} which made me hostile toward them so that I sent them into the land of their enemies--"
LEV	26	41	God-FX1	#20		4604	" then when their uncircumcised hearts are humbled and they pay for their sin, {42} I will remember my covenant with Jacob and my covenant with Isaac and my covenant with Abraham, and I will remember the land."
LEV	26	43	God-FX1	#20		4605	 {43} For the land will be deserted by them and will enjoy its sabbaths while it lies desolate without them. They will pay for their sins because they rejected my laws and abhorred my decrees.
LEV	26	44	God-FX1	#20		4606	" {44} Yet in spite of this, when they are in the land of their enemies, I will not reject them or abhor them so as to destroy them completely, breaking my covenant with them. I am the Lord their God."
LEV	26	45	God-FX1	#20		4607	" {45} But for their sake I will remember the covenant with their ancestors whom I brought out of Egypt in the sight of the nations to be their God. I am the Lord.'"""
LEV	26	46	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4608	" {46} These are the decrees, the laws and the regulations that the Lord established on Mount Sinai between himself and the Israelites through Moses. *~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
LEV	27	<<	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4609	LEVITICUS 27
LEV	27	1	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4610	" {1} The Lord said to Moses,"
LEV	27	2	God-FX1	#20		4611	" {2} ""Speak to the Israelites and say to them:"
LEV	27	2	God-FX1	#20		4612	" If anyone makes a special vow to dedicate persons to the Lord by giving equivalent values, {3} set the value of a male between the ages of twenty and sixty at fifty shekels of silver, according to the sanctuary shekel;"
LEV	27	4	God-FX1	#20		4613	" {4} and if it is a female, set her value at thirty shekels."
LEV	27	5	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4614	" {5} If it is a person between the ages of five and twenty, set the value of a male at twenty shekels and of a female at ten shekels."
LEV	27	6	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4615	" {6} If it is a person between one month and five years, set the value of a male at five shekels of silver and that of a female at three shekels of silver."
LEV	27	7	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4616	" {7} If it is a person sixty years old or more, set the value of a male at fifteen shekels and of a female at ten shekels."
LEV	27	8	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4617	" {8} If anyone making the vow is too poor to pay the specified amount, he is to present the person to the priest, who will set the value for him according to what the man making the vow can afford."
LEV	27	9	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4618	" {9} "" 'If what he vowed is an animal that is acceptable as an offering to the Lord, such an animal given to the Lord becomes holy."
LEV	27	10	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4619	" {10} He must not exchange it or substitute a good one for a bad one, or a bad one for a good one; if he should substitute one animal for another, both it and the substitute become holy."
LEV	27	11	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4620	" {11} If what he vowed is a ceremonially unclean animal--one that is not acceptable as an offering to the Lord--the animal must be presented to the priest, {12} who will judge its quality as good or bad."
LEV	27	12	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4621	" Whatever value the priest then sets, that is what it will be. {13} If the owner wishes to redeem the animal, he must add a fifth to its value."
LEV	27	14	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4622	" {14} "" 'If a man dedicates his house as something holy to the Lord, the priest will judge its quality as good or bad. Whatever value the priest then sets, so it will remain."
LEV	27	15	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4623	" {15} If the man who dedicates his house redeems it, he must add a fifth to its value, and the house will again become his."
LEV	27	16	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4624	" {16} "" 'If a man dedicates to the Lord part of his family land, its value is to be set according to the amount of seed required for it--fifty shekels of silver to a homer of barley seed."
LEV	27	17	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4625	" {17} If he dedicates his field during the Year of Jubilee, the value that has been set remains."
LEV	27	18	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4626	" {18} But if he dedicates his field after the Jubilee, the priest will determine the value according to the number of years that remain until the next Year of Jubilee, and its set value will be reduced."
LEV	27	19	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4627	" {19} If the man who dedicates the field wishes to redeem it, he must add a fifth to its value, and the field will again become his."
LEV	27	20	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4628	" {20} If, however, he does not redeem the field, or if he has sold it to someone else, it can never be redeemed."
LEV	27	21	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4629	" {21} When the field is released in the Jubilee, it will become holy, like a field devoted to the Lord; it will become the property of the priests."
LEV	27	22	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4630	" {22} "" 'If a man dedicates to the Lord a field he has bought, which is not part of his family land, {23} the priest will determine its value up to the Year of Jubilee, and the man must pay its value on that day as something holy to the Lord."
LEV	27	24	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4631	" {24} In the Year of Jubilee the field will revert to the person from whom he bought it, the one whose land it was."
LEV	27	25	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4632	" {25} Every value is to be set according to the sanctuary shekel, twenty gerahs to the shekel."
LEV	27	26	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4633	" {26} "" 'No one, however, may dedicate the firstborn of an animal, since the firstborn already belongs to the Lord; whether a cow or a sheep, it is the Lord's."
LEV	27	27	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4634	" {27} If it is one of the unclean animals, he may buy it back at its set value, adding a fifth of the value to it. If he does not redeem it, it is to be sold at its set value."
LEV	27	28	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4635	" {28} "" ' But nothing that a man owns and devotes to the Lord--whether man or animal or family land--may be sold or redeemed; everything so devoted is most holy to the Lord."
LEV	27	29	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4636	" {29} "" ' No person devoted to destruction may be ransomed; he must be put to death."
LEV	27	30	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4637	" {30} A tithe of everything from the land, whether grain from the soil or fruit from the trees, belongs to the Lord; it is holy to the Lord."
LEV	27	31	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4638	" {31} If a man redeems any of his tithe, he must add a fifth of the value to it."
LEV	27	32	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4639	 {32} The entire tithe of the herd and flock--every tenth animal that passes under the shepherd's rod--will be holy to the Lord.
LEV	27	33	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4640	" {33} He must not pick out the good from the bad or make any substitution. If he does make a substitution, both the animal and its substitute become holy and cannot be redeemed."
LEV	27	34	Narr_03: Leviticus	#19		4641	 {34}These are the commands the Lord gave Moses on Mount Sinai for the Israelites.*~**~*||||| + 5 SECs |||||*~*

NUM	1	46	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4688	" {46} The total number was 603,550."
NUM	1	47	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4689	" {47} The families of the tribe of Levi, however, were not counted along with the others. {48} The Lord had said to Moses:"

NUM	1	50	God-FX1	#20		4691	" {50} Instead, appoint the Levites to be in charge of the tabernacle of the Testimony--over all its furnishings and everything belonging to it."
NUM	1	50	God-FX1	#20		4692	 They are to carry the tabernacle and all its furnishings; they are to take care of it and encamp around it.
NUM	1	51	God-FX1	#20		4693	" {51} Whenever the tabernacle is to move, the Levites are to take it down, and whenever the tabernacle is to be set up, the Levites shall do it."
NUM	1	51	God-FX1	#20		4694	 Anyone else who goes near it shall be put to death.
NUM	1	52	God-FX1	#20		4695	" {52} The Israelites are to set up their tents by divisions, each man in his own camp under his own standard."
NUM	1	53	God-FX1	#20		4696	" {53} The Levites, however, are to set up their tents around the tabernacle of the Testimony so that wrath will not fall on the Israelite community."
NUM	1	53	Moses	#01		4697	" The Levites are to be responsible for the care of the tabernacle of the Testimony."""
NUM	1	54	God-FX1	#20		4698	 {54} The Israelites did all this just as the Lord commanded Moses.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*

NUM	2	26	Aaron	#05		4719	" {26} His division numbers 62,700."
NUM	2	27	Aaron	#05		4720	" {27} The tribe of Asher will camp next to them. The leader of the people of Asher is Pagiel son of Ocran. {28} His division numbers 41,500."
NUM	2	29	Aaron	#05		4721	" {29} The tribe of Naphtali will be next. The leader of the people of Naphtali is Ahira son of Enan. {30} His division numbers 53,400."
NUM	2	31	Aaron	#05		4722	" {31} All the men assigned to the camp of Dan number 157,600. They will set out last, under their standards."
NUM	2	32	Moses	#01		4723	" {32} These are the Israelites, counted according to their families. All those in the camps, by their divisions, number 603,550."
NUM	2	33	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4724	" {33} The Levites, however, were not counted along with the other Israelites, as the Lord commanded Moses."
NUM	2	34	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4725	 {34} So the Israelites did everything the Lord commanded Moses.
NUM	2	34	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4726	" That is the way they encamped under their standards, and that is the way they set out, each with his clan and family.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
NUM	3	<<	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4727	NUMBERS 3
NUM	3	1	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4728	 {1} This is the account of the family of Aaron and Moses at the time the Lord talked with Moses on Mount Sinai.
NUM	3	2	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4729	" {2} The names of the sons of Aaron were Nadab the firstborn and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar."
NUM	3	3	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4730	" {3} Those were the names of Aaron's sons, the anointed priests, who were ordained to serve as priests."
NUM	3	4	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4731	" {4} Nadab and Abihu, however, fell dead before the Lord when they made an offering with unauthorized fire before him in the Desert of Sinai."
NUM	3	4	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4732	 They had no sons; so only Eleazar and Ithamar served as priests during the lifetime of their father Aaron.
NUM	3	5	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4733	" {5} The Lord said to Moses,"
NUM	3	6	God-FX1	#20		4734	" {6} ""Bring the tribe of Levi and present them to Aaron the priest to assist him."
NUM	3	7	God-FX1	#20		4735	 {7} They are to perform duties for him and for the whole community at the Tent of Meeting by doing the work of the tabernacle.
NUM	3	8	God-FX1	#20		4736	" {8} They are to take care of all the furnishings of the Tent of Meeting, fulfilling the obligations of the Israelites by doing the work of the tabernacle."

NUM	3	10	God-FX1	#20		4738	" {10} Appoint Aaron and his sons to serve as priests; anyone else who approaches the sanctuary must be put to death."""
NUM	3	11	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4739	" {11} The Lord also said to Moses,"
NUM	3	12	God-FX1	#20		4740	" {12} ""I have taken the Levites from among the Israelites in place of the first male offspring of every Israelite woman. The Levites are mine, {13} for all the firstborn are mine."
NUM	3	13	God-FX1	#20		4741	" When I struck down all the firstborn in Egypt, I set apart for myself every firstborn in Israel, whether man or animal. They are to be mine. I am the Lord."""
NUM	3	14	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4742	" {14} The Lord said to Moses in the Desert of Sinai,"

NUM	3	20	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4748	" {20} The Merarite clans: Mahli and Mushi. These were the Levite clans, according to their families."
NUM	3	21	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4749	 {21} To Gershon belonged the clans of the Libnites and Shimeites; these were the Gershonite clans.
NUM	3	22	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4750	" {22} The number of all the males a month old or more who were counted was 7,500."
NUM	3	23	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4751	" {23} The Gershonite clans were to camp on the west, behind the tabernacle."
NUM	3	24	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4752	 {24} The leader of the families of the Gershonites was Eliasaph son of Lael.
NUM	3	25	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4753	" {25} At the Tent of Meeting the Gershonites were responsible for the care of the tabernacle and tent, its coverings,"

NUM	3	27	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4755	" {27} To Kohath belonged the clans of the Amramites, Izharites, Hebronites and and Uzzielites; these were the Kohathite clans."
NUM	3	28	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4756	" {28} The number of all the males a month old or more was 8,600. The Kohathites were responsible for the care of the sanctuary."

NUM	3	31	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4759	" {31} They were responsible for the care of the ark, the table, the lampstand, the altars, the articles of the sanctuary used in ministering, the curtain, and everything related to their use."

NUM	3	33	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4761	 {33} To Merari belonged the clans of the Mahlites and the Mushites; these were the Merarite clans.
NUM	3	34	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4762	" {34} The number of all the males a month old or more who were counted was 6,200."
NUM	3	35	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4763	 {35} The leader of the families of the Merarite clans was Zuriel son of Abihail; they were to camp on the north side of the tabernacle.
NUM	3	36	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4764	" {36} The Merarites were appointed to take care of the frames of the tabernacle, its crossbars, posts, bases, all its equipment, and everything related to their use,"

NUM	3	38	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4767	 They were responsible for the care of the sanctuary on behalf of the Israelites. Anyone else who approached the sanctuary was to be put to death.
NUM	3	39	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4768	" {39} The total number of Levites counted at the Lord's command by Moses and Aaron according to their clans, including every male a month old or more, was 22,000."

NUM	5	<<	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4828	NUMBERS 5
NUM	5	1	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4829	" {1} The Lord said to Moses,"
NUM	5	2	God-FX1	#20		4830	" {2} ""Command the Israelites to send away from the camp anyone who has an infectious skin disease or a discharge of any kind, or who is ceremonially unclean because of a dead body."
NUM	5	3	God-FX1	#20		4831	" {3} Send away male and female alike; send them outside the camp so they will not defile their camp, where I dwell among them."""
NUM	5	4	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4832	" {4} The Israelites did this; they sent them outside the camp. They did just as the Lord had instructed Moses. {5} The Lord said to Moses,"
NUM	5	6	God-FX1	#20		4833	" {6} ""Say to the Israelites: ' When a man or woman wrongs another in any way and so is unfaithful to the Lord, that person is guilty {7} and must confess the sin he has committed."
NUM	5	7	God-FX1	#20		4834	" He must make full restitution for his wrong, add one fifth to it and give it all to the person he has wronged."
NUM	5	8	God-FX1	#20		4835	" {8} But if that person has no close relative to whom restitution can be made for the wrong, the restitution belongs to the Lord and must be given to the priest, along with the ram with which atonement is made for him."
NUM	5	9	God-FX1	#20		4836	" {9} All the sacred contributions the Israelites bring to a priest will belong to him. {10} Each man's sacred gifts are his own, but what he gives to the priest will belong to the priest.' """
NUM	5	11	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4837	" {11} Then the Lord said to Moses,"
NUM	5	12	God-FX1	#20		4838	" {12} ""Speak to the Israelites and say to them:"
NUM	5	12	God-FX1	#20		4839	" If a man's wife goes astray and is unfaithful to him {13} by sleeping with another man,"
NUM	5	13	God-FX1	#20		4840	" and this is hidden from her husband and her impurity is undetected (since there is no witness against her and she has not been caught in the act),"
NUM	5	14	God-FX1	#20		4841	 {14} and if feelings of jealousy come over her husband and he suspects his wife and she is impure--or if he is jealous and suspects her even though she is not impure--
NUM	5	15	Moses	#01		4842	 {15} then he is to take his wife to the priest. He must also take an offering of a tenth of an ephah of barley flour on her behalf.
NUM	5	15	Moses	#01		4843	" He must not pour oil on it or put incense on it, because it is a grain offering for jealousy, a reminder offering to draw attention to guilt."
NUM	5	16	Moses	#01		4844	" {16} "" 'The priest shall bring her and have her stand before the Lord. {17} Then he shall take some holy water in a clay jar and put some dust from the tabernacle floor into the water."
NUM	5	18	Moses	#01		4845	" {18} After the priest has had the woman stand before the Lord, he shall loosen her hair and place in her hands the reminder offering, the grain offering for jealousy, while he himself holds the bitter water that brings a curse."
NUM	5	19	Moses	#01		4846	" {19} Then the priest shall put the woman under oath and say to her,"
NUM	5	19	Priest	#02		4847	" << If no other man has slept with you and you have not gone astray and become impure while married to your husband, may this bitter water that brings a curse not harm you."
NUM	5	20	Priest	#02		4848	" {20} But if you have gone astray while married to your husband and you have defiled yourself by sleeping with a man other than your husband""--"
NUM	5	21	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4849	 {21} here the priest is to put the woman under this curse of the oath--
NUM	5	21	Priest	#02		4850	 << May the Lord cause your people to curse and denounce you when he causes your thigh to waste away and your abdomen to swell.
NUM	5	22	Priest	#02		4851	 {22} May this water that brings a curse enter your body so that your abdomen swells and your thigh wastes away.
NUM	5	22	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4852	" "" 'Then the woman is to say,"
NUM	5	22	Woman	#25		4853	" ""Amen. So be it."""
NUM	5	23	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4854	" {23} "" 'The priest is to write these curses on a scroll and then wash them off into the bitter water."
NUM	5	24	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4855	" {24} He shall have the woman drink the bitter water that brings a curse, and this water will enter her and cause bitter suffering."
NUM	5	25	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4856	" {25} The priest is to take from her hands the grain offering for jealousy, wave it before the Lord and bring it to the altar."
NUM	5	26	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4857	" {26} The priest is then to take a handful of the grain offering as a memorial offering and burn it on the altar; after that, he is to have the woman drink the water."
NUM	5	27	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4858	" {27} If she has defiled herself and been unfaithful to her husband, then when she is made to drink the water that brings a curse, it will go into her and cause bitter suffering;"
NUM	5	27	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4859	" her abdomen will swell and her thigh waste away, and she will become accursed among her people."
NUM	5	28	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4860	" {28} If, however, the woman has not defiled herself and is free from impurity, she will be cleared of guilt and will be able to have children."
NUM	5	29	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4861	" {29} ö 'This, then, is the law of jealousy when a woman goes astray and defiles herself while married to her husband, {30} or when feelings of jealousy come over a man because he suspects his wife."
NUM	5	30	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4862	 The priest is to have her stand before the Lord and is to apply this entire law to her.
NUM	5	31	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4863	" {31} The husband will be innocent of any wrongdoing, but the woman will bear the consequences of her sin.' ""*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
NUM	6	<<	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4864	NUMBERS 6
NUM	6	1	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4865	" {1} The Lord said to Moses,"
NUM	6	2	God-FX1	#20		4866	" {2} ""Speak to the Israelites and say to them: 'If a man or woman wants to make a special vow, a vow of separation to the Lord as a Nazirite,"
NUM	6	3	God-FX1	#20		4867	 {3} he must abstain from wine and other fermented drink and must not drink vinegar made from wine or from other fermented drink.
NUM	6	3	God-FX1	#20		4868	 He must not drink grape juice or eat grapes or raisins.
NUM	6	4	God-FX1	#20		4869	" {4} As long as he is a Nazirite, he must not eat anything that comes from the grapevine, not even the seeds or skins."
NUM	6	5	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4870	 {5} ö 'During the entire period of his vow of separation no razor may be used on his head.
NUM	6	5	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4871	 He must be holy until the period of his separation to the Lord is over; he must let the hair of his head grow long.
NUM	6	6	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4872	 {6} Throughout the period of his separation to the Lord he must not go near a dead body.
NUM	6	7	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4873	" {7} Even if his own father or mother or brother or sister dies, he must not make himself ceremonially unclean on account of them, because the symbol of his separation to God is on his head."
NUM	6	8	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4874	 {8} Throughout the period of his separation he is consecrated to the Lord.
NUM	6	9	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4875	" {9} ô 'If someone dies suddenly in his presence, thus defiling the hair he has dedicated, he must shave his head on the day of his cleansing--the seventh day."
NUM	6	10	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4876	 {10} Then on the eighth day he must bring two doves or two young pigeons to the priest at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting.
NUM	6	11	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4877	 {11} The priest is to offer one as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering to make atonement for him because he sinned by being in the presence of the dead body.
NUM	6	11	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4878	 That same day he is to consecrate his head. {12} He must dedicate himself to the Lord for the period of his separation and must bring a year-old male lamb as a guilt offering.
NUM	6	12	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4879	" The previous days do not count, because he became defiled during his separation."
NUM	6	13	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4880	 {13} ö 'Now this is the law for the Nazirite when the period of his separation is over. He is to be brought to the entrance to the Tent of Meeting.
NUM	6	14	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4881	 {14} There he is to present his offerings to the Lord:
NUM	6	14	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4882	" a year-old male lamb without defect for a burnt offering, a year-old ewe lamb without defect for a sin offering, a ram without defect for a fellowship offering,"
NUM	6	15	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4883	" {15} together with their grain offerings and drink offerings, and a basket of bread made without yeast--cakes made of fine flour mixed with oil, and wafers spread with oil."
NUM	6	16	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4884	 {16} ö 'The priest is to present them before the Lord and make the sin offering and the burnt offering.
NUM	6	17	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4885	" {17} He is to present the basket of unleavened bread and is to sacrifice the ram as a fellowship offering to the Lord, together with its grain offering and drink offering."
NUM	6	18	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4886	" {18} ö 'Then at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting, the Nazirite must shave off the hair that he dedicated."
NUM	6	18	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4887	 He is to take the hair and put it in the fire that is under the sacrifice of the fellowship offering.
NUM	6	19	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4888	" {19} ô 'After the Nazirite has shaved off the hair of his dedication, the priest is to place in his hands a boiled shoulder of the ram, and a cake and a wafer from the basket, both made without yeast."
NUM	6	20	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4889	" {20} The priest shall then wave them before the Lord as a wave offering; they are holy and belong to the priest, together with the breast that was waved and the thigh that was presented."
NUM	6	20	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4890	" After that, the Nazirite may drink wine."
NUM	6	21	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4891	" {21} ö 'This is the law of the Nazirite who vows his offering to the Lord in accordance with his separation, in addition to whatever else he can afford."
NUM	6	21	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		4892	" He must fulfill the vow he has made, according to the law of the Nazirite.' """

NUM	9	<<	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5031	NUMBERS 9
NUM	9	1	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5032	" {1} The Lord spoke to Moses in the Desert of Sinai in the first month of the second year after they came out of Egypt. He said,"
NUM	9	2	God-FX1	#20		5033	" {2} ""Have the Israelites celebrate the Passover at the appointed time."
NUM	9	3	God-FX1	#20		5034	" {3} Celebrate it at the appointed time, at twilight on the fourteenth day of this month, in accordance with all its rules and regulations."""
NUM	9	4	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5035	" {4} So Moses told the Israelites to celebrate the Passover, {5} and they did so in the Desert of Sinai at twilight on the fourteenth day of the first month."
NUM	9	5	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5036	 The Israelites did everything just as the Lord commanded Moses.
NUM	9	6	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5037	 {6} But some of them could not celebrate the Passover on that day because they were ceremonially unclean on account of a dead body.
NUM	9	6	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5038	" So they came to Moses and Aaron that same day {7} and said to Moses,"
NUM	9	7	Israelite	#08		5039	" << We have become unclean because of a dead body, but why should we be kept from presenting the Lord's offering with the other Israelites at the appointed time?>>"
NUM	9	8	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5040	" {8} Moses answered them,"
NUM	9	8	Moses	#01		5041	 << Wait until I find out what the Lord commands concerning you.>>
NUM	9	9	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5042	" {9} Then the Lord said to Moses,"
NUM	9	10	God-FX1	#20		5043	" {10} ""Tell the Israelites: ' When any of you or your descendants are unclean because of a dead body or are away on a journey, they may still celebrate the Lord's Passover."
NUM	9	11	God-FX1	#20		5044	" {11} They are to celebrate it on the fourteenth day of the second month at twilight. They are to eat the lamb, together with unleavened bread and bitter herbs."
NUM	9	12	God-FX1	#20		5045	" {12} They must not leave any of it till morning or break any of its bones. When they celebrate the Passover, they must follow all the regulations."
NUM	9	13	God-FX1	#20		5046	" {13} But if a man who is ceremonially clean and not on a journey fails to celebrate the Passover, that person must be cut off from his people because he did not present the Lord's offering at the appointed time."
NUM	9	13	God-FX1	#20		5047	 That man will bear the consequences of his sin.
NUM	9	14	God-FX1	#20		5048	 {14} ö 'An alien living among you who wants to celebrate the Lord's Passover must do so in accordance with its rules and regulations.
NUM	9	14	God-FX1	#20		5049	" You must have the same regulations for the alien and the native-born.'"""
NUM	9	15	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5050	" {15} On the day the tabernacle, the Tent of the Testimony, was set up, the cloud covered it. From evening till morning the cloud above the tabernacle looked like fire."
NUM	9	16	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5051	" {16} That is how it continued to be; the cloud covered it, and at night it looked like fire."
NUM	9	17	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5052	" {17} Whenever the cloud lifted from above the Tent, the Israelites set out; wherever the cloud settled, the Israelites encamped."
NUM	9	18	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5053	" {18} At the Lord's command the Israelites set out, and at his command they encamped. As long as the cloud stayed over the tabernacle, they remained in camp."
NUM	9	19	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5054	" {19} When the cloud remained over the tabernacle a long time, the Israelites obeyed the Lord's order and did not set out."
NUM	9	20	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5055	" {20} Sometimes the cloud was over the tabernacle only a few days; at the Lord's command they would encamp, and then at his command they would set out."
NUM	9	21	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5056	" {21} Sometimes the cloud stayed only from evening till morning, and when it lifted in the morning, they set out. Whether by day or by night, whenever the cloud lifted, they set out."
NUM	9	22	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5057	" {22} Whether the cloud stayed over the tabernacle for two days or a month or a year, the Israelites would remain in camp and not set out; but when it lifted, they would set out."
NUM	9	23	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5058	" {23} At the Lord's command they encamped, and at the Lord's command they set out. They obeyed the Lord's order, in accordance with his command through Moses.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
NUM	10	<<	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5059	NUMBERS 10
NUM	10	1	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5060	 {1} The Lord said to Moses:
NUM	10	2	God-FX1	#20		5061	" {2} ""Make two trumpets of hammered silver, and use them for calling the community together and for having the camps set out."
NUM	10	3	God-FX1	#20		5062	" {3} When both are sounded, the whole community is to assemble before you at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting."
NUM	10	4	God-FX1	#20		5063	" {4} If only one is sounded, the leaders--the heads of the clans of Israel --are to assemble before you."
NUM	10	5	God-FX1	#20		5064	" {5} When a trumpet blast is sounded, the tribes camping on the east are to set out."
NUM	10	6	God-FX1	#20		5065	" {6} At the sounding of a second blast, the camps on the south are to set out. The blast will be the signal for setting out."
NUM	10	7	God-FX1	#20		5066	" {7} To gather the assembly, blow the trumpets, but not with the same signal."
NUM	10	8	God-FX1	#20		5067	" {8} ""The sons of Aaron, the priests, are to blow the trumpets. This is to be a lasting ordinance for you and the generations to come."
NUM	10	9	God-FX1	#20		5068	" {9} When you go into battle in your own land against an enemy who is oppressing you, sound a blast on the trumpets."
NUM	10	9	God-FX1	#20		5069	 Then you will be remembered by the Lord your God and rescued from your enemies.
NUM	10	10	God-FX1	#20		5070	 {10} Also at your times of rejoicing--your appointed feasts and New Moon festivals--you are to sound the trumpets over your burnt offerings and fellowship offerings.
NUM	10	10	God-FX1	#20		5071	 They will be a memorial for you before your God. I am the Lord your God.

NUM	13	28	Man #2	#11		5202	" {28} But the people who live there are powerful, and the cities are fortified and very large. We even saw descendants of Anak there."

NUM	13	33	Man	#14		5212	" {33} We saw the Nephilim there (the descendants of Anak come from the Nephilim). We seemed like grasshoppers in our own eyes, and we looked the same to them.>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
NUM	14	<<	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5213	NUMBERS 14
NUM	14	1	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5214	 {1} That night all the people of the community raised their voices and wept aloud.
NUM	14	2	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5215	" {2} All the Israelites grumbled against Moses and Aaron, and the whole assembly said to them,"
NUM	14	2	Israelite	#15		5216	 << If only we had died in Egypt! Or in this desert!
NUM	14	3	Israelite	#15		5217	 {3} Why is the Lord bringing us to this land only to let us fall by the sword?

NUM	17	9	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5385	" {9} Then Moses brought out all the staffs from the Lord's presence to all the Israelites. They looked at them, and each man took his own staff."
NUM	17	10	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5386	" {10} The Lord said to Moses,"
NUM	17	10	God-FX1	#20		5387	" << Put back Aaron's staff in front of the Testimony, to be kept as a sign to the rebellious. This will put an end to their grumbling against me, so that they will not die.>>"
NUM	17	11	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5388	" {11} Moses did just as the Lord commanded him. {12} The Israelites said to Moses,"
NUM	17	12	Israelite	#16		5389	" << We will die! We are lost, we are all lost!"
NUM	17	13	Israelite	#16		5390	 {13} Anyone who even comes near the tabernacle of the Lord will die. Are we all going to die?>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
NUM	18	<<	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5391	NUMBERS 18
NUM	18	1	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5392	" {1} The Lord said to Aaron,"
NUM	18	1	God-FX1	#20		5393	" << You, your sons and your father's family are to bear the responsibility for offenses against the sanctuary, and you and your sons alone are to bear the responsibility for offenses against the priesthood."
NUM	18	2	God-FX1	#20		5394	 {2} Bring your fellow Levites from your ancestral tribe to join you and assist you when you and your sons minister before the Tent of the Testimony.
NUM	18	3	God-FX1	#20		5395	" {3} They are to be responsible to you and are to perform all the duties of the Tent, but they must not go near the furnishings of the sanctuary or the altar, or both they and you will die."
NUM	18	4	God-FX1	#20		5396	 {4} They are to join you and be responsible for the care of the Tent of Meeting--all the work at the Tent--and no one else may come near where you are.
NUM	18	5	God-FX1	#20		5397	" {5} << You are to be responsible for the care of the sanctuary and the altar, so that wrath will not fall on the Israelites again."
NUM	18	6	God-FX1	#20		5398	" {6} I myself have selected your fellow Levites from among the Israelites as a gift to you, dedicated to the Lord to do the work at the Tent of Meeting."
NUM	18	7	God-FX1	#20		5399	 {7} But only you and your sons may serve as priests in connection with everything at the altar and inside the curtain.
NUM	18	7	God-FX1	#20		5400	 I am giving you the service of the priesthood as a gift. Anyone else who comes near the sanctuary must be put to death.>>
NUM	18	8	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5401	" {8} Then the Lord said to Aaron,"
NUM	18	8	God-FX1	#20		5402	 << I myself have put you in charge of the offerings presented to me; all the holy offerings the Israelites give me I give to you and your sons as your portion and regular share.
NUM	18	9	God-FX1	#20		5403	 {9} You are to have the part of the most holy offerings that is kept from the fire.
NUM	18	9	God-FX1	#20		5404	" From all the gifts they bring me as most holy offerings, whether grain or sin or guilt offerings, that part belongs to you and your sons."
NUM	18	10	God-FX1	#20		5405	 {10} Eat it as something most holy; every male shall eat it. You must regard it as holy.
NUM	18	11	God-FX1	#20		5406	 {11} öThis also is yours: whatever is set aside from the gifts of all the wave offerings of the Israelites.
NUM	18	11	God-FX1	#20		5407	 I give this to you and your sons and daughters as your regular share. Everyone in your household who is ceremonially clean may eat it.
NUM	18	12	God-FX1	#20		5408	 {12} öI give you all the finest olive oil and all the finest new wine and grain they give the Lord as the firstfruits of their harvest.
NUM	18	13	God-FX1	#20		5409	 {13} All the land's firstfruits that they bring to the Lord will be yours. Everyone in your household who is ceremonially clean may eat it.
NUM	18	14	God-FX1	#20		5410	 {14} << Everything in Israel that is devoted to the Lord is yours.
NUM	18	15	God-FX1	#20		5411	" {15} The first offspring of every womb, both man and animal, that is offered to the Lord is yours. But you must redeem every firstborn son and every firstborn male of unclean animals."
NUM	18	16	God-FX1	#20		5412	" {16} When they are a month old, you must redeem them at the redemption price set at five shekels of silver, according to the sanctuary shekel, which weighs twenty gerahs."
NUM	18	17	God-FX1	#20		5413	" {17} öBut you must not redeem the firstborn of an ox, a sheep or a goat; they are holy."
NUM	18	17	God-FX1	#20		5414	" Sprinkle their blood on the altar and burn their fat as an offering made by fire, an aroma pleasing to the Lord."
NUM	18	18	God-FX1	#20		5415	" {18} Their meat is to be yours, just as the breast of the wave offering and the right thigh are yours."
NUM	18	19	God-FX1	#20		5416	 {19} Whatever is set aside from the holy offerings the Israelites present to the Lord I give to you and your sons and daughters as your regular share.
NUM	18	19	God-FX1	#20		5417	 It is an everlasting covenant of salt before the Lord for both you and your offspring.>>
NUM	18	20	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5418	" {20} The Lord said to Aaron,"
NUM	18	20	God-FX1	#20		5419	" << You will have no inheritance in their land, nor will you have any share among them; I am your share and your inheritance among the Israelites."
NUM	18	21	God-FX1	#20		5420	 {21} öI give to the Levites all the tithes in Israel as their inheritance in return for the work they do while serving at the Tent of Meeting.
NUM	18	22	God-FX1	#20		5421	" {22} From now on the Israelites must not go near the Tent of Meeting, or they will bear the consequences of their sin and will die."
NUM	18	23	God-FX1	#20		5422	 {23} It is the Levites who are to do the work at the Tent of Meeting and bear the responsibility for offenses against it.
NUM	18	23	God-FX1	#20		5423	 This is a lasting ordinance for the generations to come. They will receive no inheritance among the Israelites.
NUM	18	24	God-FX1	#20		5424	" {24} Instead, I give to the Levites as their inheritance the tithes that the Israelites present as an offering to the Lord."
NUM	18	24	God-FX1	#20		5425	 That is why I said concerning them: 'They will have no inheritance among the Israelites.' >>
NUM	18	25	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5426	" {25} The Lord said to Moses,"
NUM	18	26	God-FX1	#20		5427	" {26} ""Speak to the Levites and say to them: ' When you receive from the Israelites the tithe I give you as your inheritance, you must present a tenth of that tithe as the Lord's offering."
NUM	18	27	Moses	#01		5428	 {27} Your offering will be reckoned to you as grain from the threshing floor or juice from the winepress.
NUM	18	28	Moses	#01		5429	 {28} In this way you also will present an offering to the Lord from all the tithes you receive from the Israelites.
NUM	18	28	Moses	#01		5430	 From these tithes you must give the Lord's portion to Aaron the priest.
NUM	18	29	Moses	#01		5431	 {29} You must present as the Lord's portion the best and holiest part of everything given to you.'
NUM	18	30	Moses	#01		5432	" {30} ôSay to the Levites: ' When you present the best part, it will be reckoned to you as the product of the threshing floor or the winepress."
NUM	18	31	Moses	#01		5433	" {31} You and your households may eat the rest of it anywhere, for it is your wages for your work at the Tent of Meeting."
NUM	18	32	Moses	#01		5434	" {32} By presenting the best part of it you will not be guilty in this matter; then you will not defile the holy offerings of the Israelites, and you will not die.' ""*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
NUM	19	<<	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5435	NUMBERS 19
NUM	19	1	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5436	 {1} The Lord said to Moses and Aaron:
NUM	19	2	God-FX1	#20		5437	" {2} ""This is a requirement of the law that the Lord has commanded: Tell the Israelites to bring you a red heifer without defect or blemish and that has never been under a yoke."
NUM	19	3	God-FX1	#20		5438	 {3} Give it to Eleazar the priest; it is to be taken outside the camp and slaughtered in his presence.
NUM	19	4	God-FX1	#20		5439	 {4} Then Eleazar the priest is to take some of its blood on his finger and sprinkle it seven times toward the front of the Tent of Meeting.
NUM	19	5	God-FX1	#20		5440	" {5} While he watches, the heifer is to be burned--its hide, flesh, blood and offal."
NUM	19	6	God-FX1	#20		5441	" {6} The priest is to take some cedar wood, hyssop and scarlet wool and throw them onto the burning heifer."
NUM	19	7	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5442	" {7} After that, the priest must wash his clothes and bathe himself with water. He may then come into the camp, but he will be ceremonially unclean till evening."
NUM	19	8	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5443	" {8} The man who burns it must also wash his clothes and bathe with water, and he too will be unclean till evening."
NUM	19	9	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5444	 {9} öA man who is clean shall gather up the ashes of the heifer and put them in a ceremonially clean place outside the camp.
NUM	19	9	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5445	 They shall be kept by the Israelite community for use in the water of cleansing; it is for purification from sin.
NUM	19	10	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5446	" {10} The man who gathers up the ashes of the heifer must also wash his clothes, and he too will be unclean till evening."
NUM	19	10	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5447	 This will be a lasting ordinance both for the Israelites and for the aliens living among them.
NUM	19	11	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5448	" {11} "" Whoever touches the dead body of anyone will be unclean for seven days."
NUM	19	12	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5449	 {12} He must purify himself with the water on the third day and on the seventh day; then he will be clean.
NUM	19	12	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5450	" But if he does not purify himself on the third and seventh days, he will not be clean."
NUM	19	13	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5451	 {13} Whoever touches the dead body of anyone and fails to purify himself defiles the Lord's tabernacle.
NUM	19	13	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5452	" That person must be cut off from Israel. Because the water of cleansing has not been sprinkled on him, he is unclean; his uncleanness remains on him."
NUM	19	14	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5453	 {14} öThis is the law that applies when a person dies in a tent:
NUM	19	14	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5454	" Anyone who enters the tent and anyone who is in it will be unclean for seven days, {15} and every open container without a lid fastened on it will be unclean."
NUM	19	16	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5455	" {16} öAnyone out in the open who touches someone who has been killed with a sword or someone who has died a natural death, or anyone who touches a human bone or a grave, will be unclean for seven days."
NUM	19	17	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5456	" {17} ""For the unclean person, put some ashes from the burned purification offering into a jar and pour fresh water over them."
NUM	19	18	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5457	" {18} Then a man who is ceremonially clean is to take some hyssop, dip it in the water and sprinkle the tent and all the furnishings and the people who were there."
NUM	19	18	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5458	 He must also sprinkle anyone who has touched a human bone or a grave or someone who has been killed or someone who has died a natural death.
NUM	19	19	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5459	" {19} The man who is clean is to sprinkle the unclean person on the third and seventh days, and on the seventh day he is to purify him."
NUM	19	19	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5460	" The person being cleansed must wash his clothes and bathe with water, and that evening he will be clean."
NUM	19	20	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5461	" {20} But if a person who is unclean does not purify himself, he must be cut off from the community, because he has defiled the sanctuary of the Lord."
NUM	19	20	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5462	" The water of cleansing has not been sprinkled on him, and he is unclean."
NUM	19	21	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5463	 {21} This is a lasting ordinance for them.
NUM	19	21	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5464	" ""The man who sprinkles the water of cleansing must also wash his clothes, and anyone who touches the water of cleansing will be unclean till evening."
NUM	19	22	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5465	" {22} Anything that an unclean person touches becomes unclean, and anyone who touches it becomes unclean till evening.""*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"

NUM	21	3	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5508	 {3} The Lord listened to Israel's plea and gave the Canaanites over to them. They completely destroyed them and their towns; so the place was named Hormah.
NUM	21	4	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5509	" {4} They traveled from Mount Hor along the route to the Red Sea, to go around Edom. But the people grew impatient on the way."

NUM	21	6	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5512	" {6} Then the Lord sent venomous snakes among them; they bit the people and many Israelites died. {7} The people came to Moses and said,"
NUM	21	7	Israelite	#05		5513	 << We sinned when we spoke against the Lord and against you. Pray that the Lord will take the snakes away from us.>>

NUM	21	8	God-FX1	#20		5515	 << Make a snake and put it up on a pole; anyone who is bitten can look at it and live.>>
NUM	21	9	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5516	" {9} So Moses made a bronze snake and put it up on a pole. Then when anyone was bitten by a snake and looked at the bronze snake, he lived."
NUM	21	10	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5517	 {10} The Israelites moved on and camped at Oboth.

NUM	21	14	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5523	" << Waheb in Suphah and the ravines, the Arnon {15} and the slopes of the ravines that lead to the site of Ar and lie along the border of Moab.>>"

NUM	21	17	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5527	" Sing about it, {18} about the well that the princes dug, that the nobles of the people sank-- the nobles with scepters and staffs.>>"

NUM	21	24	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5536	" {24} Israel, however, put him to the sword and took over his land from the Arnon to the Jabbok, but only as far as the Ammonites, because their border was fortified."
NUM	21	25	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5537	" {25} Israel captured all the cities of the Amorites and occupied them, including Heshbon and all its surrounding settlements."
NUM	21	26	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5538	" {26} Heshbon was the city of Sihon king of the Amorites, who had fought against the former king of Moab and had taken from him all his land as far as the Arnon."
NUM	21	27	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5539	 {27} That is why the poets say: << Come to Heshbon and let it be rebuilt; let Sihon's city be restored.
NUM	21	28	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5540	" {28} öFire went out from Heshbon, a blaze from the city of Sihon. It consumed Ar of Moab, the citizens of Arnon's heights."

NUM	21	29	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5542	 He has given up his sons as fugitives and his daughters as captives to Sihon king of the Amorites.

NUM	21	32	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5546	" {32} After Moses had sent spies to Jazer, the Israelites captured its surrounding settlements and drove out the Amorites who were there."
NUM	21	33	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5547	" {33} Then they turned and went up along the road toward Bashan, and Og king of Bashan and his whole army marched out to meet them in battle at Edrei."
NUM	21	34	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5548	" {34} The Lord said to Moses,"
NUM	21	34	God-FX1	#20		5549	" << Do not be afraid of him, for I have handed him over to you, with his whole army and his land. Do to him what you did to Sihon king of the Amorites, who reigned in Heshbon.>>"
NUM	21	35	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5550	" {35} So they struck him down, together with his sons and his whole army, leaving them no survivors. And they took possession of his land.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
NUM	22	<<	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5551	NUMBERS 22
NUM	22	1	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5552	 {1} Then the Israelites traveled to the plains of Moab and camped along the Jordan across from Jericho.
NUM	22	2	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5553	" {2} Now Balak son of Zippor saw all that Israel had done to the Amorites, {3} and Moab was terrified because there were so many people."
NUM	22	3	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5554	" Indeed, Moab was filled with dread because of the Israelites. {4} The Moabites said to the elders of Midian,"
NUM	22	4	Moabite	#16		5555	" << This horde is going to lick up everything around us, as an ox licks up the grass of the field.>>"
NUM	22	4	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5556	" So Balak son of Zippor, who was king of Moab at that time, {5} sent messengers to summon Balaam son of Beor who was at Pethor, near the River, in his native land. Balak said:"
NUM	22	5	Balak	#09		5557	 << A people has come out of Egypt; they cover the face of the land and have settled next to me.
NUM	22	6	Balak	#09		5558	" {6} Now come and put a curse on these people, because they are too powerful for me."
NUM	22	6	Balak	#09		5559	 Perhaps then I will be able to defeat them and drive them out of the country.
NUM	22	6	Balak	#09		5560	" For I know that those you bless are blessed, and those you curse are cursed.>>"
NUM	22	7	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5561	" {7} The elders of Moab and Midian left, taking with them the fee for divination. When they came to Balaam, they told him what Balak had said. {8} Balaam said to them,"
NUM	22	8	Balaam	#15		5562	" << Spend the night here, and I will bring you back the answer the Lord gives me.>>"
NUM	22	8	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5563	" So the Moabite princes stayed with him. {9} God came to Balaam and asked,"
NUM	22	9	God-FX1	#20		5564	 << Who are these men with you?>>
NUM	22	10	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5565	" {10} Balaam said to God,"
NUM	22	10	Balaam	#15		5566	" << Balak son of Zippor, king of Moab, sent me this message:"
NUM	22	11	Balaam	#15		5567	 {11} 'A people that has come out of Egypt covers the face of the land.
NUM	22	11	Balaam	#15		5568	" Now come and put a curse on them for me. Perhaps then I will be able to fight them and drive them away.' """
NUM	22	12	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5569	" {12} But God said to Balaam,"
NUM	22	12	God-FX1	#20		5570	" << Do not go with them. You must not put a curse on on those people, because they are blessed.>>"
NUM	22	13	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5571	" {13} The next morning Balaam got up and said to Balak's princes,"
NUM	22	13	Balaam	#15		5572	" << Go back to your own country, for the Lord has refused to let me go with you.>>"
NUM	22	14	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5573	" {14} So the Moabite princes returned to Balak and said,"
NUM	22	14	Prince #1	#07		5574	 << Balaam refused to come with us.>>
NUM	22	15	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5575	" {15} Then Balak sent other princes, more numerous and more distinguished than the first. {16} They came to Balaam and said:"
NUM	22	16	Prince #2	#14		5576	 << This is what Balak son of Zippor says:
NUM	22	16	Prince #2	#14		5577	" Do not let anything keep you from coming to me, {17} because I will reward you handsomely and do whatever you say."
NUM	22	17	Prince #2	#14		5578	 Come and put a curse on these people for me.>>
NUM	22	18	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5579	" {18} But Balaam answered them,"
NUM	22	18	Balaam	#15		5580	" << Even if Balak gave me his palace filled with silver and gold, I could not do anything great or small to go beyond the command of the Lord my God."
NUM	22	19	Balaam	#15		5581	" {19} Now stay here tonight as the others did, and I will find out what else the Lord will tell me.>>"
NUM	22	20	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5582	" {20} That night God came to Balaam and said,"
NUM	22	20	God-FX1	#20		5583	" << Since these men have have come to summon you, go with them, but do only what I tell you.>>"
NUM	22	21	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5584	" {21} Balaam got up in the morning, saddled his donkey and went with the princes of Moab."
NUM	22	22	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5585	" {22} But God was very angry when he went, and the angel of the Lord stood in the road to oppose him. Balaam was riding on his donkey, and his two servants were with him."
NUM	22	23	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5586	" {23} When the donkey saw the angel of the Lord standing in the road with a drawn sword in his hand, she turned off the road into a field. Balaam beat her to get her back on the road."
NUM	22	24	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5587	" {24} Then the angel of the Lord stood in a narrow path between two vineyards, with walls on both sides."
NUM	22	25	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5588	" {25} When the donkey saw the angel of the Lord, she pressed close to the wall, crushing Balaam's foot against it. So he beat her again."
NUM	22	26	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5589	" {26} Then the angel of the Lord moved on ahead and stood in a narrow place where there was no room to turn, either to the right or to the left."
NUM	22	27	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5590	" {27} When the donkey saw the angel of the Lord, she lay down under Balaam, and he was angry and beat her with his staff."
NUM	22	28	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5591	" {28} Then the Lord opened the donkey's mouth, and she said to Balaam,"
NUM	22	28	Donkey (female)	#24		5592	 << What have I done to you to make you beat me these three times?>>
NUM	22	29	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5593	" {29} Balaam answered the donkey,"
NUM	22	29	Balaam	#15		5594	" << You have made a fool of me! If I had a sword in my hand, I would kill you right now.>>"
NUM	22	30	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5595	" {30} The donkey said to Balaam,"
NUM	22	30	Donkey (female)	#24		5596	" << Am I not your own donkey, which you have always ridden, to this day? Have I been in the habit of doing this to you?>>"
NUM	22	30	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5597	" Balaam answered,"
NUM	22	30	Balaam	#15		5598	 << No.>>
NUM	22	31	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5599	" {31} Then the Lord opened Balaam's eyes, and he saw the angel of the Lord standing in the road with his sword drawn. So he bowed low and fell facedown."
NUM	22	32	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5600	" {32} The angel of the Lord asked him,"
NUM	22	32	Angel-FX1	#10		5601	 << Why have you beaten your donkey these three times? I have come here to oppose you because your path is a reckless one before me.
NUM	22	33	Angel-FX1	#10		5602	" {33} The donkey saw me and turned away from me these three times. If she had not turned away, I would certainly have killed you by now, but I would have spared her.>>"
NUM	22	34	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5603	" {34} Balaam said to the angel of the Lord,"
NUM	22	34	Balaam	#15		5604	" << I have sinned. I did not realize you were standing in the road to oppose me. Now if you are displeased, I will go back.>>"
NUM	22	35	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5605	 {35} The angel of the Lord said to Balaam
NUM	22	35	Angel-FX1	#10		5606	" << Go with the men, but speak only what I tell you.>>"
NUM	22	35	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5607	 So Balaam went with the princes of Balak.
NUM	22	36	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5608	" {36} When Balak heard that Balaam was coming, he went out to meet him at the Moabite town on the Arnon border, at the edge of his territory. {37} Balak said to Balaam,"
NUM	22	37	Balak	#09		5609	 << Did I not send you an urgent summons? Why didn't you come to me? Am I really not able to reward you?>>
NUM	22	38	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5610	" {38} Balaam replied,"
NUM	22	38	Balaam	#15		5611	" << Well, I have come to you now, but can I say just anything? I must speak only what God puts in my mouth.>>"
NUM	22	39	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5612	" {39} Then Balaam went with Balak to Kiriath Huzoth. {40} Balak sacrificed cattle and sheep, and gave some to Balaam and the princes who were with him."

NUM	26	10	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5732	" {10} The earth opened its mouth and swallowed them along with Korah, whose followers died when the fire devoured the 250 men. And they served as a warning sign."

NUM	26	62	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5796	" {62} All the male Levites a month old or more numbered 23,000. They were not counted along with the other Israelites because they received no inheritance among them."

NUM	27	8	God-FX1	#20		5811	" {8} ôSay to the Israelites, 'If a man dies and leaves no son, turn his inheritance over to his daughter."
NUM	27	9	God-FX1	#20		5812	" {9} If he has no daughter, give his inheritance to his brothers. {10} If he has no brothers, give his inheritance to his father's brothers."
NUM	27	11	God-FX1	#20		5813	" {11} If his father had no brothers, give his inheritance to the nearest relative in his clan, that he may possess it."
NUM	27	11	God-FX1	#20		5814	" This is to be a legal requirement for the Israelites, as the Lord commanded Moses.'>>"

NUM	28	9	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5837	" {9} ô 'On the Sabbath day, make an offering of two lambs a year old without defect, together with its drink offering and a grain offering of two-tenths of an ephah of fine flour mixed with oil."

NUM	28	14	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5842	" {14} With each bull there is to be a drink offering of half a hin of wine; with the ram, a third of a hin; and with each lamb, a quarter of a hin."
NUM	28	14	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5843	 This is the monthly burnt offering to be made at each new moon during the year.
NUM	28	15	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5844	" {15} Besides the regular burnt offering with its drink offering, one male goat is to be presented to the Lord as a sin offering."

NUM	28	17	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5846	 {17} On the fifteenth day of this month there is to be a festival; for seven days eat bread made without yeast.

NUM	30	<<	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5897	NUMBERS 30
NUM	30	1	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5898	 {1} Moses said to the heads of the tribes of Israel:
NUM	30	1	Moses	#01		5899	 << This is what the Lord commands:
NUM	30	2	Moses	#01		5900	" {2} When a man makes a vow to the Lord or takes an oath to obligate himself by a pledge, he must not break his word but must do everything he said."
NUM	30	3	Moses	#01		5901	" {3} "" When a young woman still living in her father's house makes a vow to the Lord or obligates herself by a pledge,"
NUM	30	4	Moses	#01		5902	" {4} and her father hears about her vow or pledge but says nothing to her, then all her vows and every pledge by which she obligated herself will stand."
NUM	30	5	Moses	#01		5903	" {5} But if her father forbids her when he hears about it, none of her vows or the pledges by which she obligated herself will stand; the Lord will release her because her father has forbidden her."
NUM	30	6	Moses	#01		5904	" {6} ö If she marries after she makes a vow or after her lips utter a rash promise by which she obligates herself {7} and her husband hears about it but says nothing to her, then her vows or the pledges by which she obligated herself will stand."
NUM	30	8	Moses	#01		5905	" {8} But if her husband forbids her when he hears about it, he nullifies the vow that obligates her or the rash promise by which she obligates herself, and the Lord will release her."
NUM	30	9	Moses	#01		5906	 {9} öAny vow or obligation taken by a widow or divorced woman will bebinding binding on her.
NUM	30	10	Moses	#01		5907	" {10} öIf a woman living with her husband makes a vow or obligates herself by a pledge under oath {11} and her husband hears about it but says nothing to her and does not forbid her, then all her vows or the pledges by which she obligated herself will sta"
NUM	30	12	Moses	#01		5908	" {12} But if her husband nullifies them when he hears about them, then none of the vows or pledges that came from her lips will stand. Her husband has nullified them, and the Lord will release her."
NUM	30	13	Moses	#01		5909	 {13} Her husband may confirm or nullify any vow she makes or any sworn pledge to deny herself.
NUM	30	14	Moses	#01		5910	" {14} But if her husband says nothing to her about it from day to day, then he confirms all her vows or the pledges binding on her. He confirms them by saying nothing to her when he hears about them."
NUM	30	15	Moses	#01		5911	" {15} If, however, he nullifies them some time after he hears about them, then he is responsible for her guilt.>>"
NUM	30	16	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5912	" {16} These are the regulations the Lord gave Moses concerning relationships between a man and his wife, and between a father and his young daughter still living in his house.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
NUM	31	<<	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5913	NUMBERS 31
NUM	31	1	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5914	" {1} The Lord said to Moses,"
NUM	31	2	God-FX1	#20		5915	" {2} << Take vengeance on the Midianites for the Israelites. After that, you will be gathered to your people.>>"
NUM	31	3	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5916	" {3} So Moses said to the people,"

NUM	31	4	Moses	#01		5918	 {4} Send into battle a thousand men from each of the tribes of Israel.>>
NUM	31	5	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5919	" {5} So twelve thousand men armed for battle, a thousand from each tribe, were supplied from the clans of Israel."
NUM	31	6	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5920	" {6} Moses sent them into battle, a thousand from each tribe, along with Phinehas son of Eleazar, the priest, who took with him articles from the sanctuary and the trumpets for signaling."
NUM	31	7	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5921	" {7} They fought against Midian, as the Lord commanded Moses, and killed every man."
NUM	31	8	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5922	" {8} Among their victims were Evi, Rekem, Zur, Hur and Reba--the five kings of Midian. They also killed Balaam son of Beor with the sword."
NUM	31	9	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5923	" {9} The Israelites captured the Midianite women and children and took all the Midianite herds, flocks and goods as plunder."
NUM	31	10	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5924	" {10} They burned all the towns where the Midianites had settled, as well as all their camps."
NUM	31	11	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5925	" {11} They took all the plunder and spoils, including the people and animals,"
NUM	31	12	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5926	" {12} and brought the captives, spoils and plunder to Moses and Eleazar the priest and the Israelite assembly at their camp on the plains of Moab, by the Jordan across from Jericho."
NUM	31	13	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5927	" {13} Moses, Eleazar the priest and all the leaders of the community went to meet them outside the camp."
NUM	31	14	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5928	 {14} Moses was angry with the officers of the army--the commanders of thousands and commanders of hundreds--who returned from the battle.
NUM	31	15	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5929	" {15} Moses asked them,"
NUM	31	15	Moses	#01		5930	" << Have you allowed all the women to live?"""
NUM	31	16	Moses	#01		5931	" {16} They were the ones who followed Balaam's advice and were the means of turning the Israelites away from the Lord in what happened at Peor, so that a plague struck the Lord's people."
NUM	31	17	Moses	#01		5932	" {17} Now kill all the boys. And kill every woman who has slept with a man, {18} but save for yourselves every girl who has never slept with a man."
NUM	31	19	Moses	#01		5933	 {19} öAll of you who have killed anyone or touched anyone who was killed must stay outside the camp seven days. On the third and seventh days you must purify yourselves and your captives.
NUM	31	20	Moses	#01		5934	" {20} Purify every garment as well as everything made of leather, goat hair or wood.>>"
NUM	31	21	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5935	" {21} Then Eleazar the priest said to the soldiers who had gone into battle,"
NUM	31	21	Eleazar	#02		5936	 << This is the requirement of the law that the Lord gave Moses:
NUM	31	22	Eleazar	#02		5937	" {22} Gold, silver, bronze, iron, tin, lead {23} and anything else that can withstand fire must be put through the fire, and then it will be clean."
NUM	31	23	Eleazar	#02		5938	 But it must also be purified with the water of cleansing. And whatever cannot withstand fire must be put through that water.
NUM	31	24	Eleazar	#02		5939	" {24} On the seventh day wash your clothes and you will be clean. Then you may come into the camp."""
NUM	31	25	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5940	" {25} The Lord said to Moses,"
NUM	31	26	God-FX1	#20		5941	 {26} << You and Eleazar the priest and the family heads of the community are to count all the people and animals that were captured.
NUM	31	27	God-FX1	#20		5942	 {27} Divide the spoils between the soldiers who took part in the battle and the rest of the community.
NUM	31	28	God-FX1	#20		5943	" {28} From the soldiers who fought in the battle, set apart as tribute for the Lord one out of every five hundred, whether persons, cattle, donkeys, sheep or goats."
NUM	31	29	God-FX1	#20		5944	 {29} Take this tribute from their half share and give it to Eleazar the priest as the Lord's part.
NUM	31	30	God-FX1	#20		5945	" {30} From the Israelites' half, select one out of every fifty, whether persons, cattle, donkeys, sheep, goats or other animals."
NUM	31	30	God-FX1	#20		5946	" Give them to the Levites, who are responsible for the care of the Lord's tabernacle.>>"
NUM	31	31	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5947	 {31} So Moses and Eleazar the priest did as the Lord commanded Moses.
NUM	31	32	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5948	" {32} The plunder remaining from the spoils that the soldiers took was 675,000 sheep, {33} 72,000 cattle, {34} 61,000 donkeys {35} and 32,000 women who had never slept with a man."

NUM	31	42	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		5954	" {42} The half belonging to the Israelites, which Moses set apart from that of the fighting men--{43} the community's half--was 337,500 sheep, {44} 36,000 cattle, {45} 30,500 donkeys {46} and 16,000 people."
