NUM	33	<<	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		6014	NUMBERS 33
NUM	33	1	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		6015	 {1} Here are the stages in the journey of the Israelites when they came out of Egypt by divisions under the leadership of Moses and Aaron.
NUM	33	2	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		6016	 {2} At the Lord's command Moses recorded the stages in their journey. This is their journey by stages:
NUM	33	3	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		6017	" {3} The Israelites set out from Rameses on the fifteenth day of the first month, the day after the Passover."
NUM	33	3	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		6018	" They marched out boldly in full view of all the Egyptians, {4} who were burying all their firstborn, whom the Lord had struck down among them; for the Lord had brought judgment on their gods."
NUM	33	5	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		6019	 {5} The Israelites left Rameses and camped at Succoth.
NUM	33	6	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		6020	" {6} They left Succoth and camped at Etham, on the edge of the desert."
NUM	33	7	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		6021	" {7} They left Etham, turned back to Pi Hahiroth, to the east of Baal Zephon, and camped near Migdol."
NUM	33	8	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		6022	" {8} They left Pi Hahiroth and passed through the sea into the desert, and when they had traveled for three days in the Desert of Etham, they camped at Marah."
NUM	33	9	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		6023	" {9} They left Marah and went to Elim, where there were twelve springs and seventy palmtrees, and they camped there."
NUM	33	10	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		6024	 {10} They left Elim and camped by the Red Sea. {11} They left the Red Sea and camped in the Desert of Sin.
NUM	33	12	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		6025	 {12} They left the Desert of Sin and camped at Dophkah. {13} They left Dophkah and camped at Alush.
NUM	33	14	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		6026	" {14} They left Alush and camped at Rephidim, where there was no water for the people to drink."
NUM	33	15	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		6027	 {15} They left Rephidim and camped in the Desert of Sinai. {16} They left the Desert of Sinai and camped at Kibroth Hattaavah.
NUM	33	17	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		6028	 {17} They left Kibroth Hattaavah and camped at Hazeroth.
NUM	33	18	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		6029	 {18} They left Hazeroth and camped at Rithmah. {19} They left Rithmah and camped at Rimmon Perez.

NUM	33	28	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		6034	 {28} They left Terah and camped at Mithcah. {29} They left Mithcah and camped at Hashmonah.
NUM	33	30	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		6035	 {30} They left Hashmonah and camped at Moseroth. {31} They left Moseroth and camped at Bene Jaakan.
NUM	33	32	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		6036	 {32} They left Bene Jaakan and camped at Hor Haggidgad. {33} They left Hor Haggidgad and camped at Jotbathah.
NUM	33	34	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		6037	 {34} They left Jotbathah and camped at Abronah. {35} They left Abronah and camped at Ezion Geber.
NUM	33	36	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		6038	" {36} They left Ezion Geber and camped at Kadesh, in the Desert of Zin. {37} They left Kadesh and camped at Mount Hor, on the border of Edom."
NUM	33	38	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		6039	" {38} At the Lord's command Aaron the priest went up Mount Hor, where he died on the first day of the fifth month of the fortieth year after the Israelites came out of Egypt."
NUM	33	39	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		6040	 {39} Aaron was a hundred and twenty-three years old when he died on Mount Hor.
NUM	33	40	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		6041	" {40} The Canaanite king of Arad, who lived in the Negev of Canaan, heard that the Israelites were coming."
NUM	33	41	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		6042	 {41} They left Mount Hor and camped at Zalmonah. {42} They left Zalmonah and camped at Punon.
NUM	33	43	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		6043	" {43} They left Punon and camped at Oboth. {44} They left Oboth and camped at Iye Abarim, on the border of Moab."
NUM	33	45	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		6044	 {45} They left Iyim and camped at Dibon Gad. {46} They left Dibon Gad and camped at Almon Diblathaim.
NUM	33	47	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		6045	" {47} They left Almon Diblathaim and camped in the mountains of Abarim, near Nebo."
NUM	33	48	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		6046	 {48} They left the mountains of Abarim and camped on the plains of Moab by the Jordan across from Jericho.
NUM	33	49	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		6047	 {49} There on the plains of Moab they camped along the Jordan from Beth Jeshimoth to Abel Shittim.
NUM	33	50	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		6048	" {50} On the plains of Moab by the Jordan across from Jericho the Lord said to Moses,"
NUM	33	51	God-FX1	#20		6049	" {51} << Speak to the Israelites and say to them: 'When you cross the Jordan into Canaan, {52} drive out all the inhabitants of the land before you."
NUM	33	52	God-FX1	#20		6050	" Destroy all their carved images and their cast idols, and demolish all their high places."
NUM	33	53	God-FX1	#20		6051	" {53} Take possession of the land and settle in it, for I have given you the land to possess."
NUM	33	54	God-FX1	#20		6052	" {54} Distribute the land by lot, according to your clans. To a larger group give a larger inheritance, and to a smaller group a smaller one."
NUM	33	54	God-FX1	#20		6053	 Whatever falls to them by lot will be theirs. Distribute it according to your ancestral tribes.
NUM	33	55	God-FX1	#20		6054	" {55} ö 'But if you do not drive out the inhabitants of the land, those you allow to remain will become barbs in your eyes and thorns in your sides."
NUM	33	55	God-FX1	#20		6055	 They will give you trouble in the land where you will live.
NUM	33	56	God-FX1	#20		6056	 {56} And then I will do to you what I plan to do to them.' >>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
NUM	34	<<	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		6057	NUMBERS 34
NUM	34	1	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		6058	" {1} The Lord said to Moses,"
NUM	34	2	God-FX1	#20		6059	" {2} << Command the Israelites and say to them: 'When you enter Canaan, the land that will be allotted to you as an inheritance will have these boundaries:"
NUM	34	3	God-FX1	#20		6060	 {3} ö 'Your southern side will include some of the Desert of Zin along the border of Edom.
NUM	34	3	God-FX1	#20		6061	" On the east, your southern boundary will start from the end of the Salt Sea, {4} cross south of Scorpion Pass, continue on to Zin and go south of Kadesh Barnea."
NUM	34	4	God-FX1	#20		6062	" Then it will go to Hazar Addar and over to Azmon, {5} where it will turn, join the Wadi of Egypt and end at the Sea."
NUM	34	6	God-FX1	#20		6063	" {6} "" 'Your western boundary will be the coast of the Great Sea. This will be your boundary on the west."
NUM	34	7	God-FX1	#20		6064	" {7} ö 'For your northern boundary, run a line from the Great Sea to Mount Hor {8} and from Mount Hor to Lebo Hamath."
NUM	34	8	God-FX1	#20		6065	" Then the boundary will go to Zedad, {9} continue to Ziphron and end at Hazar Enan. This will be your boundary on the north."
NUM	34	10	God-FX1	#20		6066	" {10} ö 'For your eastern boundary, run a line from Hazar Enan to Shepham."
NUM	34	11	God-FX1	#20		6067	 {11} The boundary will go down from Shepham to Riblah on the east side of Ain and continue along the slopes east of the Sea of Kinnereth.
NUM	34	12	God-FX1	#20		6068	" {12} Then the boundary will go down along the Jordan and end at the Salt Sea. ö 'This will be your land, with its boundaries on every side.' >>"

NUM	35	<<	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		6086	NUMBERS 35
NUM	35	1	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		6087	" {1} On the plains of Moab by the Jordan across from Jericho, the Lord said to Moses,"
NUM	35	2	God-FX1	#20		6088	 {2} <<Command the Israelites to give the Levites towns to live in from the inheritance the Israelites will possess. And give them pasturelands around the towns.
NUM	35	3	God-FX1	#20		6089	" {3} Then they will havetowns to live in and pasturelands for their cattle, flocks and all their other livestock."
NUM	35	4	God-FX1	#20		6090	 {4} öThe pasturelands around the towns that you give the Levites will extend out fifteen hundred feet from the town wall.
NUM	35	5	God-FX1	#20		6091	" {5} Outside the town, measure three thousand feet on the east side, three thousand on the south side, three thousand on the west and three thousand on the north, with the town in the center."
NUM	35	5	God-FX1	#20		6092	 They will have this area as pastureland for the towns.
NUM	35	6	God-FX1	#20		6093	" {6} ôSix of the towns you give the Levites will be cities of refuge, to which a person who has killed someone may flee. In addition, give them forty-two other towns."
NUM	35	7	God-FX1	#20		6094	" {7} In all you must give the Levites forty-eight towns, together with their pasturelands."
NUM	35	8	God-FX1	#20		6095	 {8} The towns you give the Levites from the land the Israelites possess are to be given in proportion to the inheritance of each tribe:
NUM	35	8	God-FX1	#20		6096	" Take many towns from a tribe that has many, but few from one that has few."""
NUM	35	9	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		6097	 {9} Then the Lord said to Moses:
NUM	35	10	God-FX1	#20		6098	" {10} ""Speak to the Israelites and say to them:"
NUM	35	10	God-FX1	#20		6099	" When you cross the Jordan into Canaan, {11} select some towns to be your cities of refuge, to which a person who has killed someone accidentally may flee."
NUM	35	12	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		6100	" {12} They will be places of refuge from the avenger, so that a person accused of murder may not die before he stands trial before the assembly."
NUM	35	13	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		6101	 {13} These six towns you give will be your cities of refuge.
NUM	35	14	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		6102	 {14} Give three on this side of the Jordan and three in Canaan as cities of refuge.
NUM	35	15	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		6103	" {15} These six towns will be a place of refuge for Israelites, aliens and any other people living among them, so that anyone who has killed another accidentally can flee there."
NUM	35	16	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		6104	" {16} ö 'If a man strikes someone with an iron object so that he dies, he is a murderer; the murderer shall be put to death."
NUM	35	17	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		6105	" {17} Or if anyone has a stone in his hand that could kill, and he strikes someone so that he dies, he is a murderer; the murderer shall be put to death."
NUM	35	18	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		6106	" {18} Or if anyone has a wooden object in his hand that could kill, and he hits someone so that he dies, he is a murderer; the murderer shall be put to death."
NUM	35	19	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		6107	" {19} The avenger of blood shall put the murderer to death; when he meets him, he shall put him to death."
NUM	35	20	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		6108	" {20} If anyone with malice aforethought shoves another or throws something at him intentionally so that he dies,"
NUM	35	20	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		6109	" {21} or if in hostility he hits him with his fist so that he dies, that person shall be put to death; he is a murderer."
NUM	35	21	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		6110	 The avenger of blood shall put the murderer to death when he meets him.
NUM	35	22	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		6111	 {22} ô 'But if without hostility someone suddenly shoves another or throws something at him unintentionally
NUM	35	23	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		6112	" {23} or, without seeing him, drops a stone on him that could kill him, and he dies, then since he was not his enemy and he did not intend to harm him,"
NUM	35	24	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		6113	 {24} the assembly must judge between him and the avenger of blood according to these regulations.
NUM	35	25	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		6114	 {25} The assembly must protect the one accused of murder from the avenger of blood and send him back to the city of refuge to which he fled.
NUM	35	25	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		6115	" He must stay there until the death of the high priest, who was anointed with the holy oil."
NUM	35	26	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		6116	" {26} ö 'But if the accused ever goes outside the limits of the city of refuge to which he has fled {27} and the avenger of blood finds him outside the city, the avenger of blood may kill the accused without being guilty of murder."
NUM	35	28	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		6117	 {28} The accused must stay in his city of refuge until the death of the high priest; only after the death of the high priest may he return to his own property.
NUM	35	29	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		6118	" {29} 'These are to be legal requirements for you throughout the generations to come, wherever you live."
NUM	35	30	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		6119	" {30} "" 'Anyone who kills a person is to be put to death as a murderer only on the testimony of witnesses. But no one is to be put to death on the testimony of only one witness."
NUM	35	31	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		6120	" {31} ô 'Do not accept a ransom for the life of a murderer, who deserves to die. He must surely be put to death."
NUM	35	32	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		6121	 {32} ö 'Do not accept a ransom for anyonewho has fled to a city of refuge and so allow him to go back and live on his own land before the death of the high priest.
NUM	35	33	God-FX1	#20		6122	" {33} "" ' Do not pollute the land where you are. Bloodshed pollutes the land, and atonement cannot be made for the land on which blood has been shed, except by the blood of the one who shed it."
NUM	35	34	God-FX1	#20		6123	" {34} Do not defile the land where you live and where I dwell, for I, the Lord, dwell among the Israelites.' >>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"

NUM	36	2	Elder	#11		6126	" << When the Lord commanded my lord to give the land as an inheritance to the Israelites by lot, he ordered you to give the inheritance of our brother Zelophehad to his daughters."
NUM	36	3	Elder	#11		6127	 {3} Now suppose they marry men from other Israelite tribes;
NUM	36	3	Elder	#11		6128	 then their inheritance will be taken from our ancestral inheritance and added to that of the tribe they marry into.
NUM	36	3	Elder	#11		6129	 And so part of the inheritance allotted to us will be taken away.
NUM	36	4	Elder	#11		6130	" {4} When the Year of Jubilee for the Israelites comes, their inheritance will be added to that of the tribe into which they marry,"
NUM	36	4	Elder	#11		6131	 and their property will be taken from the tribal inheritance of our forefathers.
NUM	36	5	Narr_04: Numbers	#19		6132	 {5} Then at the Lord's command Moses gave this order to the Israelites:
NUM	36	5	Moses	#01		6133	 << What the tribe of the descendants of Joseph is saying is right.
NUM	36	6	Moses	#01		6134	 {6} This is what the Lord commands for Zelophehad's daughters: They may marry anyone they please as long as they marry within the tribal clan of their father.
NUM	36	7	Moses	#01		6135	" {7} No inheritance in Israel is to pass from tribe to tribe, for every Israelite shall keep the tribal land inherited from his forefathers."
NUM	36	8	Moses	#01		6136	" {8} Every daughter who inherits land in any Israelite tribe must marry someone in her father's tribal clan, so that every Israelite will possess the inheritance of his fathers."
NUM	36	9	Moses	#01		6137	" {9} No inheritance may pass from tribe to tribe, for each Israelite tribe is to keep the land it inherits."""

DEU	2	21	Narr_05: Deuteronomy	#19		6222	" {21} They were a people strong and numerous, and as tall as the Anakites. The Lord destroyed them from before the Ammonites, who drove them out and settled in their place."
DEU	2	22	Narr_05: Deuteronomy	#19		6223	" {22} The Lord had done the same for the descendants of Esau, who lived in Seir, when he destroyed the Horites from before them. They drove them out and have lived in their place to this day."

DEU	4	6	Nation	#16		6282	 << Surely this great nation is a wise and understanding people.>>
DEU	4	7	Moses	#01		6283	 {7} What other nation is so great as to have their gods near them the way the Lord our God is near us whenever we pray to him?
DEU	4	8	Moses	#01		6284	 {8} And what other nation is so great as to have such righteous decrees and laws as this body of laws I am setting before you today?
DEU	4	9	Moses	#01		6285	" {9} Only be careful, and watch yourselves closely so that you do not forget the things your eyes have seen or let them slip from your heart as long as you live."
DEU	4	9	Moses	#01		6286	 Teach them to your children and to their children after them.
DEU	4	10	Moses	#01		6287	" {10} Remember the day you stood before the Lord your God at Horeb, when he said to me,"
DEU	4	10	God-FX1	#20		6288	 << Assemble the people before me to hear my words so that they may learn to revere me as long as they live in the land and may teach them to their children.>>
DEU	4	11	Moses	#01		6289	" {11} You came near and stood at the foot of the mountain while it blazed with fire to the very heavens, with black clouds and deep darkness."
DEU	4	12	Moses	#01		6290	 {12} Then the Lord spoke to you out of the fire. You heard the sound of words but saw no form; there was only a voice.
DEU	4	13	Moses	#01		6291	" {13} He declared to you his covenant, the Ten Commandments, which he commanded you to follow and then wrote them on two stone tablets."
DEU	4	14	Moses	#01		6292	 {14} And the Lord directed me at that time to teach you the decrees and laws you are to follow in the land that you are crossing the Jordan to possess.
DEU	4	15	Moses	#01		6293	 {15} You saw no form of any kind the day the Lord spoke to you at Horeb out of the fire.
DEU	4	15	Moses	#01		6294	" Therefore watch yourselves very carefully, {16} so that you do not become corrupt and make for yourselves an idol, an image of any shape, whether formed like a man or a woman,"
DEU	4	17	Moses	#01		6295	" {17} or like any animal on earth or any bird that flies in the air, {18} or like any creature that moves along the ground or any fish in the waters below."
DEU	4	19	Moses	#01		6296	" {19} And when you look up to the sky and see the sun, the moon and the stars--all the heavenly array--do not be enticed into bowing down to them and worshiping things the Lord your God has apportioned to all the nations under heaven."
DEU	4	20	Moses	#01		6297	" {20} But as for you, the Lord took you and brought you out of the iron-smelting furnace, out of Egypt, to be the people of his inheritance, as you now are."
DEU	4	21	Moses	#01		6298	" {21} The Lord was angry with me because of you, and he solemnly swore that I would not cross the Jordan and enter the good land the Lord your God is giving you as your inheritance."
DEU	4	22	Moses	#01		6299	 {22} I will die in this land; I will not cross the Jordan; but you are about to cross over and take possession of that good land.
DEU	4	23	Moses	#01		6300	 {23} Be careful not to forget the covenant of the Lord your God that he made with you; do not make for yourselves an idol in the form of anything the Lord your God has forbidden.
DEU	4	24	Moses	#01		6301	" {24} For the Lord your God is a consuming fire, a jealous God."
DEU	4	25	Moses	#01		6302	 {25} After you have had children and grandchildren and have lived in the land a long time--
DEU	4	25	Moses	#01		6303	" if you then become corrupt and make any kind of idol, doing evil in the eyes of the Lord your God and provoking him to anger,"
DEU	4	26	Moses	#01		6304	 {26} I call heaven and earth as witnesses against you this day that you will quickly perish from the land that you are crossing the Jordan to possess.
DEU	4	26	Moses	#01		6305	 You will not live there long but will certainly be destroyed.
DEU	4	27	Moses	#01		6306	" {27} The Lord will scatter you among the peoples, and only a few of you will survive among the nations to which the Lord will drive you."
DEU	4	28	Moses	#01		6307	" {28} There you will worship man-made gods of wood and stone, which cannot see or hear or eat or smell."
DEU	4	29	Moses	#01		6308	" {29} But if from there you seek the Lord your God, you will find him if you look for him with all your heart and with all your soul."
DEU	4	30	Moses	#01		6309	" {30} When you are in distress and all these things have happened to you, then in later days you will return to the Lord your God and obey him."
DEU	4	31	Moses	#01		6310	" {31} For the Lord your God is a merciful God; he will not abandon or destroy you or forget the covenant with your forefathers, which he confirmed to them by oath."
DEU	4	32	Moses	#01		6311	" {32} Ask now about the former days, long before your time, from the day God created man on the earth; ask from one end of the heavens to the other."
DEU	4	32	Moses	#01		6312	" Has anything so great as this ever happened, or has anything like it ever been heard of?"
DEU	4	33	Moses	#01		6313	" {33} Has any other people heard the voice of God speaking out of fire, as you have, and lived?"
DEU	4	34	Moses	#01		6314	" {34} Has any god ever tried to take for himself one nation out of another nation, by testings, by miraculous signs and wonders, "
DEU	4	34	Moses	#01		6315	" by war, by a mighty hand and an outstretched arm, or by great and awesome deeds, like all the things the Lord your God did for you in Egypt before your very eyes?"
DEU	4	35	Moses	#01		6316	 {35} You were shown these things so that you might know that the Lord is God; besides him there is no other.
DEU	4	36	Moses	#01		6317	" {36} From heaven he made you hear his voice to discipline you. On earth he showed you his great fire, and you heard his words from out of the fire."
DEU	4	37	Moses	#01		6318	" {37} Because he loved your forefathers and chose their descendants after them, he brought you out of Egypt by his Presence and his great strength,"
DEU	4	38	Moses	#01		6319	" {38} to drive out before you nations greater and stronger than you and to bring you into their land to give it to you for your inheritance, as it is today."
DEU	4	39	Moses	#01		6320	 {39} Acknowledge and take to heart this day that the Lord is God in heaven above and on the earth below. There is no other.
DEU	4	40	Moses	#01		6321	" {40} Keep his decrees and commands, which I am giving you today, so that it may go well with you and your children after you and that you may live long in the land the Lord your God gives you for all time."
DEU	4	41	Narr_05: Deuteronomy	#19		6322	" {41} Then Moses set aside three cities east of the Jordan, {42} to which anyone who had killed a person could flee if he had unintentionally killed his neighbor without malice aforethought."

DEU	5	14	God-FX1	#20		6344	" On it you shall not do any work, neither you, nor your son or daughter, nor your manservant or maidservant, nor your ox, your donkey or any of your animals, nor the alien within your gates, so that your manservant and maidservant may rest, as you do."
DEU	5	15	God-FX1	#20		6345	 {15} Remember that you were slaves in Egypt and that the Lord your God brought you out of there with a mighty hand and an outstretched arm.

DEU	5	23	Moses	#01		6353	" {23} When you heard the voice out of the darkness, while the mountain was ablaze with fire, all the leading men of your tribes and your elders came to me. {24} And you said,"

DEU	5	24	Israelite	#15		6355	 Today we have seen that a man can live even if God speaks with him.
DEU	5	25	Israelite	#15		6356	" {25} But now, why should we die? This great fire will consume us, and we will die if we hear the voice of the Lord our God any longer."
DEU	5	26	Israelite	#15		6357	" {26} For what mortal man has ever heard the voice of the living God speaking out of fire, as we have, and survived?"
DEU	5	27	Israelite	#15		6358	 {27} Go near and listen to all that the Lord our God says. Then tell us whatever the Lord our God tells you. We will listen and obey.>>

DEU	5	29	God-FX1	#20		6361	" {29} Oh, that their hearts would be inclined to fear me and keep all my commands always, so that it might go well with them and their children forever!"

DEU	5	33	Moses	#01		6365	" {33} Walk in all the way that the Lord your God has commanded you, so that you may live and prosper and prolong your days in the land that you will possess. *~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
DEU	6	<<	Narr_05: Deuteronomy	#19		6366	DEUTERONOMY 6
DEU	6	1	Moses	#01		6367	" {1} These are the commands, decrees and laws the Lord your God directed me to teach you to observe in the land that you are crossing the Jordan to possess,"
DEU	6	2	Moses	#01		6368	" {2} so that you, your children and their children after them may fear the Lord your God as long as you live by keeping all his decrees and commands that I give you, and so that you may enjoy long life."
DEU	6	3	Moses	#01		6369	" {3} Hear, O Israel, and be careful to obey so that it may go well with you and that you may increase greatly in a land flowing with milk and honey, just as the Lord, the God of your fathers, promised you."
DEU	6	4	Moses	#01		6370	" {4} Hear, O Israel: The Lord our God, the Lord is one. {5} Love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your strength."
DEU	6	6	Moses	#01		6371	 {6} These commandments that I give you today are to be upon your hearts.
DEU	6	7	Moses	#01		6372	" {7} Impress them on your children. Talk about them when you sit at home and when you walk along the road, when you lie down and when you get up."
DEU	6	8	Moses	#01		6373	 {8} Tie them as symbols on your hands and bind them on your foreheads. {9} Write them on the doorframes of your houses and on your gates.
DEU	6	10	Moses	#01		6374	" {10} When the Lord your God brings you into the land he swore to your fathers, to Abraham, Isaac and Jacob, to give you--a land with large, flourishing cities you did not build,"
DEU	6	11	Moses	#01		6375	" {11} houses filled with all kinds of good things you did not provide, wells you did not dig, and vineyards and olive groves you did not plant--"
DEU	6	11	Moses	#01		6376	" then when you eat and are satisfied, {12} be careful that you do not forget the Lord, who brought you out of Egypt, out of the land of slavery."
DEU	6	13	Moses	#01		6377	" {13} Fear the Lord your God, serve him only and take your oaths in his name."
DEU	6	14	Moses	#01		6378	" {14} Do not follow other gods, the gods of the peoples around you;"
DEU	6	15	Moses	#01		6379	" {15} for the Lord your God, who is among you, is a jealous God and his anger will burn against you, and he will destroy you from the face of the land."
DEU	6	16	Moses	#01		6380	 {16} Do not test the Lord your God as you did at Massah. {17} Be sure to keep the commands of the Lord your God and the stipulations and decrees he has given you.
DEU	6	18	Moses	#01		6381	" {18} Do what is right and good in the Lord's sight, so that it may go well with you and you may go in and take over the good land that the Lord promised on oath to your forefathers, {19} thrusting out all your enemies before you, as the Lord said."
DEU	6	20	Moses	#01		6382	" {20} In the future, when your son asks you, << What is the meaning of the stipulations, decrees and laws the Lord our God has commanded you?>> {21} tell him:"
DEU	6	21	Moses	#01		6383	" << We were slaves of Pharaoh in Egypt, but the Lord brought us out of Egypt with a mighty hand."
DEU	6	22	Moses	#01		6384	 {22} Before our eyes the Lord sent miraculous signs and wonders--great and terrible--upon Egypt and Pharaoh and his whole household.
DEU	6	23	Moses	#01		6385	 {23} But he brought us out from there to bring us in and give us the land that he promised on oath to our forefathers.
DEU	6	24	Moses	#01		6386	" {24} The Lord commanded us to obey all these decrees and to fear the Lord our God, so that we might always prosper and be kept alive, as is the case today."
DEU	6	25	Moses	#01		6387	" {25} And if we are careful to obey all this law before the Lord our God, as he has commanded us, that will be our righteousness.>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
DEU	7	<<	Narr_05: Deuteronomy	#19		6388	DEUTERONOMY 7
DEU	7	1	Moses	#01		6389	 {1} When the Lord your God brings you into the land you are entering to possess and drives out before you many nations--
DEU	7	1	Moses	#01		6390	" the Hittites, Girgashites, Amorites, Canaanites, Perizzites, Hivites and Jebusites, seven nations larger and stronger than you--"
DEU	7	2	Moses	#01		6391	" {2} and when the Lord your God has delivered them over to you and you have defeated them, then you must destroy them totally."
DEU	7	2	Moses	#01		6392	" Make no treaty with them, and show them no mercy. {3} Do not intermarry with them."
DEU	7	3	Moses	#01		6393	" Do not give your daughters to their sons or take their daughters for your sons,"
DEU	7	4	Moses	#01		6394	" {4} for they will turn your sons away from following me to serve other gods, and the Lord's anger will burn against you and will quickly destroy you."
DEU	7	5	Moses	#01		6395	" {5} This is what you are to do to them: Break down their altars, smash their sacred stones, cut down their Asherah poles and burn their idols in the fire."
DEU	7	6	Moses	#01		6396	" {6} For you are a people holy to the Lord your God. The Lord your God has chosen you out of all the peoples on the face of the earth to be his people, his treasured possession."
DEU	7	7	Moses	#01		6397	" {7} The Lord did not set his affection on you and choose you because you were more numerous than other peoples, for you were the fewest of all peoples."
DEU	7	8	Moses	#01		6398	" {8} But it was because the Lord loved you and kept the oath he swore to your forefathers that he brought you out with a mighty hand and redeemed you from the land of slavery, from the power of Pharaoh king of Egypt."
DEU	7	9	Moses	#01		6399	" {9} Know therefore that the Lord your God is God; he is the faithful God, keeping his covenant of love to a thousand generations of those who love him and keep his commands."
DEU	7	10	Moses	#01		6400	 {10} But those who hate him he will repay to their face by destruction; he will not be slow to repay to their face those who hate him.
DEU	7	11	Moses	#01		6401	" {11} Therefore, take care to follow the commands, decrees and laws I give you today."
DEU	7	12	Moses	#01		6402	" {12} If you pay attention to these laws and are careful to follow them, then the Lord your God will keep his covenant of love with you, as he swore to your forefathers."
DEU	7	13	Moses	#01		6403	 {13} He will love you and bless you and increase your numbers.
DEU	7	13	Moses	#01		6404	" He will bless the fruit of your womb, the crops of your land--your grain, new wine and oil--the calves of your herds and the lambs of your flocks in the land that he swore to your forefathers to give you."
DEU	7	14	Moses	#01		6405	" {14} You will be blessed more than any other people; none of your men or women will be childless, nor any of your livestock without young."
DEU	7	15	Moses	#01		6406	" {15} The Lord will keep you free from every disease. He will not inflict on you the horrible diseases you knew in Egypt, but he will inflict them on all who hate you."
DEU	7	16	Moses	#01		6407	 {16} You must destroy all the peoples the Lord your God gives over to you.
DEU	7	16	Moses	#01		6408	" Do not look on them with pity and do not serve their gods, for that will be a snare to you. {17} You may say to yourselves,"
DEU	7	17	Man	#14		6409	 << These nations are stronger than we are. How can we drive them out?>>
DEU	7	18	Moses	#01		6410	 {18} But do not be afraid of them; remember well what the Lord your God did to Pharaoh and to all Egypt.
DEU	7	19	Moses	#01		6411	" {19} You saw with your own eyes the great trials, the miraculous signs and wonders, the mighty hand and outstretched arm, with which the Lord your God brought you out."
DEU	7	19	Moses	#01		6412	 The Lord your God will do the same to all the peoples you now fear.
DEU	7	20	Moses	#01		6413	" {20} Moreover, the Lord your God will send the hornet among them until even the survivors who hide from you have perished."
DEU	7	21	Moses	#01		6414	" {21} Do not be terrified by them, for the Lord your God, who is among you, is a great and awesome God."
DEU	7	22	Moses	#01		6415	" {22} The Lord your God will drive out those nations before you, little by little. You will not be allowed to eliminate them all at once, or the wild animals will multiply around you."
DEU	7	23	Moses	#01		6416	" {23} But the Lord your God will deliver them over to you, throwing them into great confusion until they are destroyed."
DEU	7	24	Moses	#01		6417	" {24} He will give their kings into your hand, and you will wipe out their names from under heaven. No one will be able to stand up against you; you will destroy them."
DEU	7	25	Moses	#01		6418	 {25} The images of their gods you are to burn in the fire.
DEU	7	25	Moses	#01		6419	" Do not covet the silver and gold on them, and do not take it for yourselves, or you will be ensnared by it, for it is detestable to the Lord your God."
DEU	7	26	Moses	#01		6420	" {26} Do not bring a detestable thing into your house or you, like it, will be set apart for destruction. Utterly abhor and detest it, for it is set apart for destruction. *~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
DEU	8	<<	Narr_05: Deuteronomy	#19		6421	DEUTERONOMY 8

DEU	8	2	Moses	#01		6423	" {2} Remember how the Lord your God led you all the way in the desert these forty years, to humble you and to test you in order to know what was in your heart, whether or not you would keep his commands."

DEU	8	3	Moses	#01		6425	 to teach you that man does not live on bread alone but on every word that comes from the mouth of the Lord.
DEU	8	4	Moses	#01		6426	 {4} Your clothes did not wear out and your feet did not swell during these forty years.
DEU	8	5	Moses	#01		6427	" {5} Know then in your heart that as a man disciplines his son, so the Lord your God disciplines you."

DEU	8	7	Moses	#01		6429	" {7} For the Lord your God is bringing you into a good land--a land with streams and pools of water, with springs flowing in the valleys and hills;"

DEU	8	9	Moses	#01		6431	 {9} a land where bread will not be scarce and you will lack nothing; a land where the rocks are iron and you can dig copper out of the hills.
DEU	8	10	Moses	#01		6432	" {10} When you have eaten and are satisfied, praise the Lord your God for the good land he has given you."
DEU	8	11	Moses	#01		6433	" {11} Be careful that you do not forget the Lord your God, failing to observe his commands, his laws and his decrees that I am giving you this day."

DEU	8	15	Moses	#01		6437	" {15} He led you through the vast and dreadful desert, that thirsty and waterless land, with its venomous snakes and scorpions. He brought you water out of hard rock."

DEU	8	17	Israelite	#15		6439	 << My power and the strength of my hands have produced this wealth for me.>>
DEU	8	18	Moses	#01		6440	" {18} But remember the Lord your God, for it is he who gives you the ability to produce wealth, and so confirms his covenant, which he swore to your forefathers, as it is today."
DEU	8	19	Moses	#01		6441	" {19} If you ever forget the Lord your God and follow other gods and worship and bow down to them, I testify against you today that you will surely be destroyed."

DEU	9	2	Moses	#01		6445	 {2} The people are strong and tall--Anakites! You know about them and have heard it said:

DEU	9	6	Moses	#01		6454	" {6} Understand, then, that it is not because of your righteousness that the Lord your God is giving you this good land to possess, for you are a stiff-necked people."

DEU	9	10	Moses	#01		6460	" {10} The Lord gave me two stone tablets inscribed by the finger of God. On them were all the commandments the Lord proclaimed to you on the mountain out of the fire, on the day of the assembly."

DEU	9	13	Moses	#01		6464	" {13} And the Lord said to me,"

DEU	9	14	God-FX1	#20		6466	" {14} Let me alone, so that I may destroy them and blot out their name from under heaven. And I will make you into a nation stronger and more numerous than they.>>"
DEU	9	15	Moses	#01		6467	 {15} So I turned and went down from the mountain while it was ablaze with fire. And the two tablets of the covenant were in my hands.

DEU	9	17	Moses	#01		6470	" {17} So I took the two tablets and threw them out of my hands, breaking them to pieces before your eyes."

DEU	9	21	Moses	#01		6475	" {21} Also I took that sinful thing of yours, the calf you had made, and burned it in the fire."
DEU	9	21	Moses	#01		6476	 Then I crushed it and ground it to powder as fine as dust and threw the dust into a stream that flowed down the mountain.
DEU	9	22	Moses	#01		6477	" {22} You also made the Lord angry at Taberah, at Massah and at Kibroth Hattaavah."

DEU	9	26	Moses	#01		6482	" {26} I prayed to the Lord and said, ôO Sovereign Lord, do not destroy your people, your own inheritance that you redeemed by your great power and brought out of Egypt with a mighty hand."

DEU	10	17	Moses	#01		6504	" {17} For the Lord your God is God of gods and Lord of lords, the great God, mighty and awesome, who shows no partiality and accepts no bribes."
DEU	10	18	Moses	#01		6505	" {18} He defends the cause of the fatherless and the widow, and loves the alien, giving him food and clothing."

DEU	10	21	Moses	#01		6508	" {21} He is your praise; he is your God, who performed for you those great and awesome wonders you saw with your own eyes."
DEU	10	22	Moses	#01		6509	" {22} Your forefathers who went down into Egypt were seventy in all, and now the Lord your God has made you as numerous as the stars in the sky. *~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
DEU	11	<<	Narr_05: Deuteronomy	#19		6510	DEUTERONOMY 11
DEU	11	1	Moses	#01		6511	" {1} Love the Lord your God and keep his requirements, his decrees, his laws and his commands always."
DEU	11	2	Moses	#01		6512	" {2} Remember today that your children were not the ones who saw and experienced the discipline of the Lord your God: his majesty, his mighty hand, his outstretched arm;"
DEU	11	3	Moses	#01		6513	" {3} the signs he performed and the things he did in the heart of Egypt, both to Pharaoh king of Egypt and to his whole country;"
DEU	11	4	Moses	#01		6514	" {4} what he did to the Egyptian army, to its horses and chariots, how he overwhelmed them with the waters of the Red Sea as they were pursuing you, and how the Lord brought lasting ruin on them."
DEU	11	5	Moses	#01		6515	" {5} It was not your children who saw what he did for you in the desert until you arrived at this place, {6} and what he did to Dathan and Abiram, sons of Eliab the Reubenite, "
DEU	11	6	Moses	#01		6516	" when the earth opened its mouth right in the middle of all Israel and swallowed them up with their households, their tents and every living thing that belonged to them."
DEU	11	7	Moses	#01		6517	 {7} But it was your own eyes that saw all these great things the Lord has done.
DEU	11	8	Moses	#01		6518	" {8} Observe therefore all the commands I am giving you today, so that you may have the strength to go in and take over the land that you are crossing the Jordan to possess,"
DEU	11	9	Moses	#01		6519	" {9} and so that you may live long in the land that the Lord swore to your forefathers to give to them and their descendants, a land flowing with milk and honey."
DEU	11	10	Moses	#01		6520	" {10} The land you are entering to take over is not like the land of Egypt, from which you have come, where you planted your seed and irrigated it by foot as in a vegetable garden."
DEU	11	11	Moses	#01		6521	 {11} But the land you are crossing the Jordan to take possession of is a land of mountains and valleys that drinks rain from heaven.
DEU	11	12	Moses	#01		6522	 {12} It is a land the Lord your God cares for; the eyes of the Lord your God are continually on it from the beginning of the year to its end.
DEU	11	13	Moses	#01		6523	 {13} So if you faithfully obey the commands I am giving you today--to love the Lord your God and to serve him with all your heart and with all your soul--
DEU	11	14	Moses	#01		6524	" {14} then I will send rain on your land in its season, both autumn and spring rains, so that you may gather in your grain, new wine and oil."
DEU	11	15	Moses	#01		6525	" {15} I will provide grass in the fields for your cattle, and you will eat and be satisfied."
DEU	11	16	Moses	#01		6526	" {16} Be careful, or you will be enticed to turn away and worship other gods and bow down to them."
DEU	11	17	Moses	#01		6527	" {17} Then the Lord's anger will burn against you, and he will shut the heavens so that it will not rain and the ground will yield no produce, and you will soon perish from the good land the Lord is giving you."
DEU	11	18	Moses	#01		6528	 {18} Fix these words of mine in your hearts and minds; tie them as symbols on your hands and bind them on your foreheads.
DEU	11	19	Moses	#01		6529	" {19} Teach them to your children, talking about them when you sit at home and when you walk along the road, when you lie down and when you get up."
DEU	11	20	Moses	#01		6530	" {20} Write them on the doorframes of your houses and on your gates,"
DEU	11	21	Moses	#01		6531	" {21} so that your days and the days of your children may be many in the land that the Lord swore to give your forefathers, as many as the days that the heavens are above the earth."
DEU	11	22	Moses	#01		6532	" {22} If you carefully observe all these commands I am giving you to follow--to love the Lord your God, to walk in all his ways and to hold fast to him--"
DEU	11	23	Moses	#01		6533	" {23} then the Lord will drive out all these nations before you, and you will dispossess nations larger and stronger than you."
DEU	11	24	Moses	#01		6534	" {24} Every place where you set your foot will be yours: Your territory will extend from the desert to Lebanon, and from the Euphrates River to the western sea."
DEU	11	25	Moses	#01		6535	" {25} No man will be able to stand against you. The Lord your God, as he promised you, will put the terror and fear of you on the whole land, wherever you go."
DEU	11	26	Moses	#01		6536	" {26} See, I am setting before you today a blessing and a curse--"
DEU	11	27	Moses	#01		6537	 {27} the blessing if you obey the commands of the Lord your God that I am giving you today;
DEU	11	28	Moses	#01		6538	" {28} the curse if you disobey the commands of the Lord your God and turn from the way that I command you today by following other gods, which you have not known."
DEU	11	29	Moses	#01		6539	" {29} When the Lord your God has brought you into the land you are entering to possess, you are to proclaim on Mount Gerizim the blessings, and on Mount Ebal the curses."
DEU	11	30	Moses	#01		6540	" {30} As you know, these mountains are across the Jordan, west of the road, toward the setting sun, near the great trees of Moreh, in the territory of those Canaanites living in the Arabah in the vicinity of Gilgal."
DEU	11	31	Moses	#01		6541	 {31} You are about to cross the Jordan to enter and take possession of the land the Lord your God is giving you.
DEU	11	31	Moses	#01		6542	" When you have taken it over and are living there, {32} be sure that you obey all the decrees and laws I am setting before you today.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
DEU	12	<<	Narr_05: Deuteronomy	#19		6543	DEUTERONOMY 12
DEU	12	1	Moses	#01		6544	" {1} These are the decrees and laws you must be careful to follow in the land that the Lord, the God of your fathers, has given you to possess--as long as you live in the land."
DEU	12	2	Moses	#01		6545	 {2} Destroy completely all the places on the high mountains and on the hills and under every spreading tree where the nations you are dispossessing worship their gods.
DEU	12	3	Moses	#01		6546	" {3} Break down their altars, smash their sacred stones and burn their Asherah poles in the fire; cut down the idols of their gods and wipe out their names from those places."
DEU	12	4	Moses	#01		6547	 {4} You must not worship the Lord your God in their way.
DEU	12	5	Moses	#01		6548	 {5} But you are to seek the place the Lord your God will choose from among all your tribes to put his Name there for his dwelling. To that place you must go;
DEU	12	6	Moses	#01		6549	" {6} there bring your burnt offerings and sacrifices, your tithes and special gifts, what you have vowed to give and your freewill offerings, and the firstborn of your herds and flocks."
DEU	12	7	Moses	#01		6550	" {7} There, in the presence of the Lord your God, you and your families shall eat and shall rejoice in everything you have put your hand to, because the Lord your God has blessed you."
DEU	12	8	Moses	#01		6551	" {8} You are not to do as we do here today, everyone as he sees fit, {9} since you have not yet reached the resting place and the inheritance the Lord your God is giving you."
DEU	12	10	Moses	#01		6552	" {10} But you will cross the Jordan and settle in the land the Lord your God is giving you as an inheritance, and he will give you rest from all your enemies around you so that you will live in safety."
DEU	12	11	Moses	#01		6553	 {11} Then to the place the Lord your God will choose as a dwelling for his Name--there you are to bring everything I command you:
DEU	12	11	Moses	#01		6554	" your burnt offerings and sacrifices, your tithes and special gifts, and all the choice possessions you have vowed to the Lord."
DEU	12	12	Moses	#01		6555	" {12} And there rejoice before the Lord your God, you, your sons and daughters, your menservants and maidservants, and the Levites from your towns, who have no allotment or inheritance of their own."
DEU	12	13	Moses	#01		6556	 {13} Be careful not to sacrifice your burnt offerings anywhere you please.
DEU	12	14	Moses	#01		6557	" {14} Offer them only at the place the Lord will choose in one of your tribes, and there observe everything I command you."
DEU	12	15	Moses	#01		6558	" {15} Nevertheless, you may slaughter your animals in any of your towns and eat as much of the meat as you want, as if it were gazelle or deer, according to the blessing the Lord your God gives you."
DEU	12	15	Moses	#01		6559	 Both the ceremonially unclean and the clean may eat it.
DEU	12	16	Moses	#01		6560	 {16} But you must not eat the blood; pour it out on the ground like water.
DEU	12	17	Moses	#01		6561	" {17} You must not eat in your own towns the tithe of your grain and new wine and oil, or the firstborn of your herds and flocks, or whatever you have vowed to give, or your freewill offerings or special gifts."
DEU	12	18	Moses	#01		6562	" {18} Instead, you are to eat them in the presence of the Lord your God at the place the Lord your God will choose--"
DEU	12	18	Moses	#01		6563	" you, your sons and daughters, your menservants and maidservants, and the Levites from your towns--"
DEU	12	18	Moses	#01		6564	 and you are to rejoice before the Lord your God in everything you put your hand to.
DEU	12	19	Moses	#01		6565	" {19} Be careful not to neglect the Levites as long as you live in your land. {20} When the Lord your God has enlarged your territory as he promised you, and you crave meat and say,"
DEU	12	20	Israelite	#12		6566	" << I would like some meat,>>"
DEU	12	20	Moses	#01		6567	 then you may eat as much of it as you want.
DEU	12	21	Moses	#01		6568	" {21} If the place where the Lord your God chooses to put his Name is too far away from you, you may slaughter animals from the herds and flocks the Lord has given you, as I have commanded you,"
DEU	12	21	Moses	#01		6569	 and in your own towns you may eat as much of them as you want.
DEU	12	22	Moses	#01		6570	 {22} Eat them as you would gazelle or deer. Both the ceremonially unclean and the clean may eat.
DEU	12	23	Moses	#01		6571	" {23} But be sure you do not eat the blood, because the blood is the life, and you must not eat the life with the meat."
DEU	12	24	Moses	#01		6572	 {24} You must not eat the blood; pour it out on the ground like water.
DEU	12	25	Moses	#01		6573	" {25} Do not eat it, so that it may go well with you and your children after you, because you will be doing what is right in the eyes of the Lord."
DEU	12	26	Moses	#01		6574	" {26} But take your consecrated things and whatever you have vowed to give, and go to the place the Lord will choose."
DEU	12	27	Moses	#01		6575	" {27} Present your burnt offerings on the altar of the Lord your God, both the meat and the blood."
DEU	12	27	Moses	#01		6576	" The blood of your sacrifices must be poured beside the altar of the Lord your God, but you may eat the meat."
DEU	12	28	Moses	#01		6577	" {28} Be careful to obey all these regulations I am giving you, so that it may always go well with you and your children after you, because you will be doing what is good and right in the eyes of the Lord your God."
DEU	12	29	Moses	#01		6578	 {29} The Lord your God will cut off before you the nations you are about to invade and dispossess.
DEU	12	29	Moses	#01		6579	" But when you have driven them out and settled in their land, {30} and after they have been destroyed before you, be careful not to be ensnared by inquiring about their gods, saying,"
DEU	12	30	Man (wicked)	#14		6580	 << How do these nations serve their gods? We will do the same.>>
DEU	12	31	Moses	#01		6581	" {31} You must not worship the Lord your God in their way, because in worshiping their gods, they do all kinds of detestable things the Lord hates."
DEU	12	31	Moses	#01		6582	 They even burn their sons and daughters in the fire as sacrifices to their gods.
DEU	12	32	Moses	#01		6583	 {32} See that you do all I command you; do not add to it or take away from it. *~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*

DEU	14	<<	Narr_05: Deuteronomy	#19		6610	DEUTERONOMY 14
DEU	14	1	Moses	#01		6611	" {1} You are the children of the Lord your God. Do not cut yourselves or shave the front of your heads for the dead, {2} for you are a people holy to the Lord your God."
DEU	14	2	Moses	#01		6612	" Out of all the peoples on the face of the earth, the Lord has chosen you to be his treasured possession. {3} Do not eat any detestable thing."
DEU	14	4	Moses	#01		6613	" {4} These are the animals you may eat: the ox, the sheep, the goat,"
DEU	14	5	Moses	#01		6614	" {5} the deer, the gazelle, the roe deer, the wild goat,"
DEU	14	5	Moses	#01		6615	" the ibex, the antelope and the mountain sheep."
DEU	14	6	Moses	#01		6616	 {6} You may eat any animal that has a split hoof divided in two and that chews the cud.
DEU	14	7	Moses	#01		6617	" {7} However, of those that chew the cud or that have a split hoof completely divided you may not eat the camel, the rabbit or the coney."
DEU	14	7	Moses	#01		6618	" Although they chew the cud, they do not have a split hoof; they are ceremonially unclean for you."
DEU	14	8	Moses	#01		6619	" {8} The pig is also unclean; although it has a split hoof, it does not chew the cud. You are not to eat their meat or touch their carcasses."
DEU	14	9	Moses	#01		6620	" {9} Of all the creatures living in the water, you may eat any that has fins and scales. {10} But anything that does not have fins and scales you may not eat; for you it is unclean."
DEU	14	11	Moses	#01		6621	" {11} You may eat any clean bird. {12} But these you may not eat: the eagle, the vulture, the black vulture,"
DEU	14	13	Moses	#01		6622	" {13} the red kite, the black kite, any kind of falcon, {14} any kind of raven,"
DEU	14	15	Moses	#01		6623	" {15} the horned owl, the screech owl, the gull, any kind of hawk,"
DEU	14	16	Moses	#01		6624	" {16} the little owl, the great owl, the white owl,"
DEU	14	17	Moses	#01		6625	" {17} the desert owl, the osprey, the cormorant,"
DEU	14	18	Moses	#01		6626	" {18} the stork, any kind of heron, the hoopoe and the bat."
DEU	14	19	Moses	#01		6627	 {19} All flying insects that swarm are unclean to you; do not eat them. {20} But any winged creature that is clean you may eat.
DEU	14	21	Moses	#01		6628	" {21} Do not eat anything you find already dead. You may give it to an alien living in any of your towns, and he may eat it, or you may sell it to a foreigner."
DEU	14	21	Moses	#01		6629	 But you are a people holy to the Lord your God. Do not cook a young goat in its mother's milk.
DEU	14	22	Moses	#01		6630	 {22} Be sure to set aside a tenth of all that your fields produce each year.
DEU	14	23	Moses	#01		6631	" {23} Eat the tithe of your grain, new wine and oil, and the firstborn of your herds and flocks in the presence of the Lord your God at the place he will choose as a dwelling for his Name, so that you may learn to revere the Lord your God always."
DEU	14	24	Moses	#01		6632	" {24} But if that place is too distant and you have been blessed by the Lord your God and cannot carry your tithe (because the place where the Lord will choose to put his Name is so far away) ,"
DEU	14	25	Moses	#01		6633	" {25} then exchange your tithe for silver, and take the silver with you and go to the place the Lord your God will choose."
DEU	14	26	Moses	#01		6634	" {26} Use the silver to buy whatever you like: cattle, sheep, wine or other fermented drink, or anything you wish."
DEU	14	26	Moses	#01		6635	 Then you and your household shall eat there in the presence of the Lord your God and rejoice.
DEU	14	27	Moses	#01		6636	" {27} And do not neglect the Levites living in your towns, for they have no allotment or inheritance of their own."
DEU	14	28	Moses	#01		6637	" {28} At the end of every three years, bring all the tithes of that year's produce and store it in your towns,"
DEU	14	29	Moses	#01		6638	" {29} so that the Levites (who have no allotment or inheritance of their own) and the aliens, the fatherless and the widows who live in your towns may come and eat and be satisfied,"
DEU	14	29	Moses	#01		6639	 and so that the Lord your God may bless you in all the work of your hands*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
DEU	15	<<	Narr_05: Deuteronomy	#19		6640	DEUTERONOMY 15
DEU	15	1	Moses	#01		6641	 {1} At the end of every seven years you must cancel debts.
DEU	15	2	Moses	#01		6642	 {2} This is how it is to be done: Every creditor shall cancel the loan he has made to his fellow Israelite.
DEU	15	2	Moses	#01		6643	" He shall not require payment from his fellow Israelite or brother, because the Lord's time for canceling debts has been proclaimed."
DEU	15	3	Moses	#01		6644	" {3} You may require payment from a foreigner, but you must cancel any debt your brother owes you."
DEU	15	4	Moses	#01		6645	" {4} However, there should be no poor among you, for in the land the Lord your God is giving you to possess as your inheritance, he will richly bless you,"
DEU	15	5	Moses	#01		6646	 {5} if only you fully obey the Lord your God and are careful to follow all these commands I am giving you today.
DEU	15	6	Moses	#01		6647	" {6} For the Lord your God will bless you as he has promised, and you will lend to many nations but will borrow from none. You will rule over many nations but none will rule over you."
DEU	15	7	Moses	#01		6648	" {7} If there is a poor man among your brothers in any of the towns of the land that the Lord your God is giving you, do not be hardhearted or tightfisted toward your poor brother."
DEU	15	8	Moses	#01		6649	 {8} Rather be openhanded and freely lend him whatever he needs. {9} Be careful not to harbor this wicked thought:
DEU	15	9	Israelite	#02		6650	" << The seventh year, the year for canceling debts, is near,>>"
DEU	15	9	Moses	#01		6651	" so that you do not show ill will toward your needy brother and give him nothing. He may then appeal to the Lord against you, and you will be found guilty of sin."
DEU	15	10	Moses	#01		6652	 {10} Give generously to him and do so without a grudging heart; then because of this the Lord your God will bless you in all your work and in everything you put your hand to.
DEU	15	11	Moses	#01		6653	 {11} There will always be poor people in the land. Therefore I command you to be openhanded toward your brothers and toward the poor and needy in your land.
DEU	15	12	Moses	#01		6654	" {12} If a fellow Hebrew, a man or a woman, sells himself to you and serves you six years, in the seventh year you must let him go free."
DEU	15	13	Moses	#01		6655	" {13} And when you release him, do not send him away empty-handed."
DEU	15	14	Moses	#01		6656	" {14} Supply him liberally from your flock, your threshing floor and your winepress. Give to him as the Lord your God has blessed you."
DEU	15	15	Moses	#01		6657	" {15} Remember that you were slaves in Egypt and the Lord your God redeemed you. That is why I give you this command today. {16} But if your servant says to you,"
DEU	15	16	Servant	#16		6658	" << I do not want to leave you, >>"
DEU	15	16	Moses	#01		6659	" because he loves you and your family and is well off with you, {17} then take an awl and push it through his ear lobe into the door, and he will become your servant for life."
DEU	15	18	Moses	#01		6660	 {18} Do the same for your maidservant.
DEU	15	18	Moses	#01		6661	" Do not consider it a hardship to set your servant free, because his service to you these six years has been worth twice as much as that of a hired hand."
DEU	15	18	Moses	#01		6662	 And the Lord your God will bless you in everything you do.
DEU	15	19	Moses	#01		6663	" {19} Set apart for the Lord your God every firstborn male of your herds and flocks. Do not put the firstborn of your oxen to work, and do not shear the firstborn of your sheep."
DEU	15	20	Moses	#01		6664	 {20} Each year you and your family are to eat them in the presence of the Lord your God at the place he will choose.
DEU	15	21	Moses	#01		6665	" {21} If an animal has a defect, is lame or blind, or has any serious flaw, you must not sacrifice it to the Lord your God."
DEU	15	22	Moses	#01		6666	" {22} You are to eat it in your own towns. Both the ceremonially unclean and the clean may eat it, as if it were gazelle or deer."
DEU	15	23	Moses	#01		6667	 {23} But you must not eat the blood; pour it out on the ground like water. *~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
DEU	16	<<	Narr_05: Deuteronomy	#19		6668	DEUTERONOMY 16
DEU	16	1	Moses	#01		6669	" {1} Observe the month of Abib and celebrate the Passover of the Lord your God, because in the month of Abib he brought you out of Egypt by night."
DEU	16	2	Moses	#01		6670	 {2} Sacrifice as the Passover to the Lord your God an animal from your flock or herd at the place the Lord will choose as a dwelling for his Name.
DEU	16	3	Moses	#01		6671	" {3} Do not eat it with bread made with yeast, but for seven days eat unleavened bread, the bread of affliction, because you left Egypt in haste--"
DEU	16	3	Moses	#01		6672	 so that all the days of your life you may remember the time of your departure from Egypt.
DEU	16	4	Moses	#01		6673	 {4} Let no yeast be found in your possession in all your land for seven days. Do not let any of the meat you sacrifice on the evening of the first day remain until morning.
DEU	16	5	Moses	#01		6674	 {5} You must not sacrifice the Passover in any town the Lord your God gives you {6} except in the place he will choose as a dwelling for his Name.
DEU	16	6	Moses	#01		6675	" There you must sacrifice the Passover in the evening, when the sun goes down, on the anniversary of your departure from Egypt."
DEU	16	7	Moses	#01		6676	 {7} Roast it and eat it at the place the Lord your God will choose. Then in the morning return to your tents.
DEU	16	8	Moses	#01		6677	 {8} For six days eat unleavened bread and on the seventh day hold an assembly to the Lord your God and do no work.
DEU	16	9	Moses	#01		6678	 {9} Count off seven weeks from the time you begin to put the sickle to the standing grain.
DEU	16	10	Moses	#01		6679	 {10} Then celebrate the Feast of Weeks to the Lord your God by giving a freewill offering in proportion to the blessings the Lord your God has given you.
DEU	16	11	Moses	#01		6680	 {11} And rejoice before the Lord your God at the place he will choose as a dwelling for his Name--

DEU	16	13	Moses	#01		6683	 {13} Celebrate the Feast of Tabernacles for seven days after you have gathered the produce of your threshing floor and your winepress.
DEU	16	14	Moses	#01		6684	" {14} Be joyful at your Feast--you, your sons and daughters, your menservants and maidservants, and the Levites, the aliens, the fatherless and the widows who live in your towns."

DEU	16	15	Moses	#01		6686	" For the Lord your God will bless you in all your harvest and in all the work of your hands, and your joy will be complete."
DEU	16	16	Moses	#01		6687	" {16} Three times a year all your men must appear before the Lord your God at the place he will choose: at the Feast of Unleavened Bread, the Feast of Weeks and the Feast of Tabernacles."
DEU	16	16	Moses	#01		6688	 No man should appear before the Lord empty-handed: {17} Each of you must bring a gift in proportion to the way the Lord your God has blessed you.
DEU	16	18	Moses	#01		6689	" {18} Appoint judges and officials for each of your tribes in every town the Lord your God is giving you, and they shall judge the people fairly."
DEU	16	19	Moses	#01		6690	" {19} Do not pervert justice or show partiality. Do not accept a bribe, for a bribe blinds the eyes of the wise and twists the words of the righteous."
DEU	16	20	Moses	#01		6691	" {20} Follow justice and justice alone, so that you may live and possess the land the Lord your God is giving you."
DEU	16	21	Moses	#01		6692	" {21} Do not set up any wooden Asherah pole beside the altar you build to the Lord your God, {22} and do not erect a sacred stone, for these the Lord your God hates.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
DEU	17	<<	Narr_05: Deuteronomy	#19		6693	DEUTERONOMY 17
DEU	17	1	Moses	#01		6694	" {1} Do not sacrifice to the Lord your God an ox or a sheep that has any defect or flaw in it, for that would be detestable to him."
DEU	17	2	Moses	#01		6695	" {2} If a man or woman living among you in one of the towns the Lord gives you is found doing evil in the eyes of the Lord your God in violation of his covenant,"
DEU	17	3	Moses	#01		6696	" {3} and contrary to my command has worshiped other gods, bowing down to them or to the sun or the moon or the stars of the sky,"
DEU	17	4	Moses	#01		6697	" {4} and this has been brought to your attention, then you must investigate it thoroughly."
DEU	17	4	Moses	#01		6698	" If it is true and it has been proved that this detestable thing has been done in Israel, {5} take the man or woman who has done this evil deed to your city gate and stone that person to death."
DEU	17	6	Moses	#01		6699	" {6} On the testimony of two or three witnesses a man shall be put to death, but no one shall be put to death on the testimony of only one witness."
DEU	17	7	Moses	#01		6700	" {7} The hands of the witnesses must be the first in putting him to death, and then the hands of all the people. You must purge the evil from among you."
DEU	17	8	Moses	#01		6701	" {8} If cases come before your courts that are too difficult for you to judge--whether bloodshed, lawsuits or assaults--take them to the place the Lord your God will choose."
DEU	17	9	Moses	#01		6702	" {9} Go to the priests, who are Levites, and to the judge who is in office at that time. Inquire of them and they will give you the verdict."
DEU	17	10	Moses	#01		6703	 {10} You must act according to the decisions they give you at the place the Lord will choose. Be careful to do everything they direct you to do.
DEU	17	11	Moses	#01		6704	" {11} Act according to the law they teach you and the decisions they give you. Do not turn aside from what they tell you, to the right or to the left."
DEU	17	12	Moses	#01		6705	 {12} The man who shows contempt for the judge or for the priest who stands ministering there to the Lord your God must be put to death. You must purge the evil from Israel.
DEU	17	13	Moses	#01		6706	" {13} All the people will hear and be afraid, and will not be contemptuous again."
DEU	17	14	Moses	#01		6707	" {14} When you enter the land the Lord your God is giving you and have taken possession of it and settled in it, and you say,"
DEU	17	14	Israelite	#08		6708	" << Let us set a king over us like all the nations around us,>>"
DEU	17	15	Moses	#01		6709	" {15} be sure to appoint over you the king the Lord your God chooses. He must be from among your own brothers. Do not place a foreigner over you, one who is not a brother Israelite."
DEU	17	16	Moses	#01		6710	" {16} The king, moreover, must not acquire great numbers of horses for himself or make the people return to Egypt to get more of them, for the Lord has told you,"
DEU	17	16	God-FX1	#20		6711	 << You are not to go back that way again.>>
DEU	17	17	Moses	#01		6712	" {17} He must not take many wives, or his heart will be led astray. He must not accumulate large amounts of silver and gold."
DEU	17	18	Moses	#01		6713	" {18} When he takes the throne of his kingdom, he is to write for himself on a scroll a copy of this law, taken from that of the priests, who are Levites."
DEU	17	19	Moses	#01		6714	" {19} It is to be with him, and he is to read it all the days of his life so that he may learn to revere the Lord his God and follow carefully all the words of this law and these decrees"
DEU	17	20	Moses	#01		6715	 {20} and not consider himself better than his brothers and turn from the law to the right or to the left. Then he and his descendants will reign a long time over his kingdom in Israel . *~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
DEU	18	<<	Narr_05: Deuteronomy	#19		6716	DEUTERONOMY 18
DEU	18	1	Moses	#01		6717	" {1} The priests, who are Levites--indeed the whole tribe of Levi--are to have no allotment or inheritance with Israel."
DEU	18	1	Moses	#01		6718	" They shall live on the offerings made to the Lord by fire, for that is their inheritance."
DEU	18	2	Moses	#01		6719	" {2} They shall have no inheritance among their brothers; the Lord is their inheritance, as he promised them."
DEU	18	3	Moses	#01		6720	" {3} This is the share due the priests from the people who sacrifice a bull or a sheep: the shoulder, the jowls and the inner parts."
DEU	18	4	Moses	#01		6721	" {4} You are to give them the firstfruits of your grain, new wine and oil, and the first wool from the shearing of your sheep."
DEU	18	5	Moses	#01		6722	 {5} For the Lord your God has chosen them and their descendants out of all your tribes to stand and minister in the Lord's name always.
DEU	18	6	Moses	#01		6723	" {6} If a Levite moves from one of your towns anywhere in Israel where he is living, and comes in all earnestness to the place the Lord will choose,"

DEU	18	8	Moses	#01		6725	" {8} He is to share equally in their benefits, even though he has received money from the sale of family possessions."
DEU	18	9	Moses	#01		6726	" {9} When you enter the land the Lord your God is giving you, do not learn to imitate the detestable ways of the nations there."

DEU	18	12	Moses	#01		6729	" {12} Anyone who does these things is detestable to the Lord, and because of these detestable practices the Lord your God will drive out those nations before you."
DEU	18	13	Moses	#01		6730	 {13} You must be blameless before the Lord your God.
DEU	18	14	Moses	#01		6731	" {14} The nations you will dispossess listen to those who practice sorcery or divination. But as for you, the Lord your God has not permitted you to do so."
DEU	18	15	Moses	#01		6732	 {15} The Lord your God will raise up for you a prophet like me from among your own brothers. You must listen to him.
DEU	18	16	Moses	#01		6733	" {16} For this is what you asked of the Lord your God at Horeb on the day of the assembly when you said,"
DEU	18	16	Israelite	#14		6734	" << Let us not hear the voice of the Lord our God nor see this great fire anymore, or we will die.>>"

DEU	18	19	God-FX1	#20		6737	" {19} If anyone does not listen to my words that the prophet speaks in my name, I myself will call him to account."
DEU	18	20	God-FX1	#20		6738	" {20} But a prophet who presumes to speak in my name anything I have not commanded him to say, or a prophet who speaks in the name of other gods, must be put to death.ö"
DEU	18	21	Moses	#01		6739	" {21} You may say to yourselves,"
DEU	18	21	Israelite	#11		6740	 << How can we know when a message has not been spoken by the Lord?>>
DEU	18	22	Moses	#01		6741	" {22} If what a prophet proclaims in the name of the Lord does not take place or come true, that is a message the Lord has not spoken."
DEU	18	22	Moses	#01		6742	 That prophet has spoken presumptuously. Do not be afraid of him.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
DEU	19	<<	Narr_05: Deuteronomy	#19		6743	DEUTERONOMY 19
DEU	19	1	Moses	#01		6744	" {1} When the Lord your God has destroyed the nations whose land he is giving you, and when you have driven them out and settled in their towns and houses,"
DEU	19	2	Moses	#01		6745	 {2} then set aside for yourselves three cities centrally located in the land the Lord your God is giving you to possess.
DEU	19	3	Moses	#01		6746	" {3} Build roads to them and divide into three parts the land the Lord your God is giving you as an inheritance, so that anyone who kills a man may flee there."
DEU	19	4	Moses	#01		6747	" {4} This is the rule concerning the man who kills another and flees there to save his life--one who kills his neighbor unintentionally, without malice aforethought."
DEU	19	5	Moses	#01		6748	" {5} For instance, a man may go into the forest with his neighbor to cut wood, and as he swings his ax to fell a tree, the head may fly off and hit his neighbor and kill him."
DEU	19	5	Moses	#01		6749	 That man may flee to one of these cities and save his life.
DEU	19	6	Moses	#01		6750	" {6} Otherwise, the avenger of blood might pursue him in a rage, overtake him if the distance is too great, and kill him even though he is not deserving of death, since he did it to his neighbor without malice aforethought."
DEU	19	7	Moses	#01		6751	 {7} This is why I command you to set aside for yourselves three cities.
DEU	19	8	Moses	#01		6752	" {8} If the Lord your God enlarges your territory, as he promised on oath to your forefathers,"
DEU	19	8	Moses	#01		6753	" and gives you the whole land he promised them, {9} because you carefully follow all these laws I command you today-- to love the Lord your God and to walk always in his ways--"
DEU	19	9	Moses	#01		6754	 then you are to set aside three more cities.
DEU	19	10	Moses	#01		6755	" {10} Do this so that innocent blood will not be shed in your land, which the Lord your God is giving you as your inheritance, and so that you will not be guilty of bloodshed."
DEU	19	11	Moses	#01		6756	" {11} But if a man hates his neighbor and lies in wait for him, assaults and kills him, and then flees to one of these cities,"
DEU	19	12	Moses	#01		6757	" {12} the elders of his town shall send for him, bring him back from the city, and hand him over to the avenger of blood to die."
DEU	19	13	Moses	#01		6758	" {13} Show him no pity. You must purge from Israel the guilt of shedding innocent blood, so that it may go well with you."
DEU	19	14	Moses	#01		6759	 {14} Do not move your neighbor's boundary stone set up by your predecessors in the inheritance you receive in the land the Lord your God is giving you to possess.
DEU	19	15	Moses	#01		6760	 {15} One witness is not enough to convict a man accused of any crime or offense he may have committed. A matter must be established by the testimony of two or three witnesses.
DEU	19	16	Moses	#01		6761	" {16} If a malicious witness takes the stand to accuse a man of a crime, {17} the two men involved in the dispute must stand in the presence of the Lord before the priests and the judges who are in office at the time."
DEU	19	18	Moses	#01		6762	" {18} The judges must make a thorough investigation, and if the witness proves to be a liar, giving false testimony against his brother, {19} then do to him as he intended to do to his brother."
DEU	19	19	Moses	#01		6763	 You must purge the evil from among you.
DEU	19	20	Moses	#01		6764	" {20} The rest of the people will hear of this and be afraid, and never again will such an evil thing be done among you."
DEU	19	21	Moses	#01		6765	" {21} Show no pity: life for life, eye for eye, tooth for tooth, hand for hand, foot for foot. *~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"

DEU	20	4	Priest	#02		6771	 {4} For the Lord your God is the one who goes with you to fight for you against your enemies to give you victory.>>

DEU	20	9	Moses	#01		6782	" {9} When the officers have finished speaking to the army, they shall appoint commanders over it."
DEU	20	10	Moses	#01		6783	" {10} When you march up to attack a city, make its people an offer of peace. {11} If they accept and open their gates, all the people in it shall be subject to forced labor and shall work for you."

DEU	20	14	Moses	#01		6787	 And you may use the plunder the Lord your God gives you from your enemies.
DEU	20	15	Moses	#01		6788	 {15} This is how you are to treat all the cities that are at a distance from you and do not belong to the nations nearby.
DEU	20	16	Moses	#01		6789	" {16} However, in the cities of the nations the Lord your God is giving you as an inheritance, do not leave alive anything that breathes."
DEU	20	17	Moses	#01		6790	" {17} Completely destroy them--the Hittites, Amorites, Canaanites, Perizzites, Hivites and Jebusites--as the Lord your God has commanded you."
DEU	20	18	Moses	#01		6791	" {18} Otherwise, they will teach you to follow all the detestable things they do in worshiping their gods, and you will sin against the Lord your God."
DEU	20	19	Moses	#01		6792	" {19} When you lay siege to a city for a long time, fighting against it to capture it, do not destroy its trees by putting an ax to them, because you can eat their fruit."
DEU	20	19	Moses	#01		6793	" Do not cut them down. Are the trees of the field people, that you should besiege them?"
DEU	20	20	Moses	#01		6794	" {20} However, you may cut down trees that you know are not fruit trees and use them to build siege works until the city at war with you falls. *~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
DEU	21	<<	Narr_05: Deuteronomy	#19		6795	DEUTERONOMY 21
DEU	21	1	Moses	#01		6796	" {1} If a man is found slain, lying in a field in the land the Lord your God is giving you to possess, and it is not known who killed him,"
DEU	21	2	Moses	#01		6797	 {2} your elders and judges shall go out and measure the distance from the body to the neighboring towns.
DEU	21	3	Moses	#01		6798	 {3} Then the elders of the town nearest the body shall take a heifer that has never been worked and has never worn a yoke.
DEU	21	4	Moses	#01		6799	 {4} The elders of that city shall lead her down to a valley that has not been plowed or planted and where there is a flowing stream. There in the valley they are to break the heifer's neck.
DEU	21	5	Moses	#01		6800	" {5} The priests, the sons of Levi, shall step forward, for the Lord your God has chosen them to minister and to pronounce blessings in the name of the Lord and to decide all cases of dispute and assault."
