DEU	21	8	Moses	#01		6804	" {9} And the bloodshed will be atoned for. So you will purge from yourselves the guilt of shedding innocent blood, since you have done what is right in the eyes of the Lord."
DEU	21	10	Moses	#01		6805	" {10} When you go to war against your enemies and the Lord your God delivers them into your hands and you take captives,"
DEU	21	11	Moses	#01		6806	" {11} if you notice among the captives a beautiful woman and are attracted to her, you may take her as your wife."
DEU	21	12	Moses	#01		6807	" {12} Bring her into your home and have her shave her head, trim her nails {13} and put aside the clothes she was wearing when captured."
DEU	21	13	Moses	#01		6808	" After she has lived in your house and mourned her father and mother for a full month, then you may go to her and be her husband and she shall be your wife."
DEU	21	14	Moses	#01		6809	" {14} If you are not pleased with her, let her go wherever she wishes. You must not sell her or treat her as a slave, since you have dishonored her."
DEU	21	15	Moses	#01		6810	" {15} If a man has two wives, and he loves one but not the other, and both bear him sons but the firstborn is the son of the wife he does not love,"
DEU	21	16	Moses	#01		6811	" {16} when he wills his property to his sons, he must not give the rights of the firstborn to the son of the wife he loves in preference to his actual firstborn, the son of the wife he does not love."
DEU	21	17	Moses	#01		6812	 {17} He must acknowledge the son of his unloved wife as the firstborn by giving him a double share of all he has. That son is the first sign of his father's strength. The right of the firstborn belongs to him.
DEU	21	18	Moses	#01		6813	" {18} If a man has a stubborn and rebellious son who does not obey his father and mother and will not listen to them when they discipline him,"
DEU	21	19	Moses	#01		6814	" {19} his father and mother shall take hold of him and bring him to the elders at the gate of his town. {20} They shall say to the elders,"
DEU	21	20	Man	#06		6815	 << This son of ours is stubborn and rebellious. He will not obey us. He is a profligate and a drunkard.>>
DEU	21	21	Moses	#01		6816	 {21} Then all the men of his town shall stone him to death. You must purge the evil from among you. All Israel will hear of it and be afraid.
DEU	21	22	Moses	#01		6817	" {22} If a man guilty of a capital offense is put to death and his body is hung on a tree, {23} you must not leave his body on the tree overnight."
DEU	21	23	Moses	#01		6818	" Be sure to bury him that same day, because anyone who is hung on a tree is under God's curse. You must not desecrate the land the Lord your God is giving you as an inheritance.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
DEU	22	<<	Narr_05: Deuteronomy	#19		6819	DEUTERONOMY 22
DEU	22	1	Moses	#01		6820	" {1} If you see your brother's ox or sheep straying, do not ignore it but be sure to take it back to him."
DEU	22	2	Moses	#01		6821	" {2} If the brother does not live near you or if you do not know who he is, take it home with you and keep it until he comes looking for it. Then give it back to him."
DEU	22	3	Moses	#01		6822	 {3} Do the same if you find your brother's donkey or his cloak or anything he loses. Do not ignore it.
DEU	22	4	Moses	#01		6823	" {4} If you see your brother's donkey or his ox fallen on the road, do not ignore it. Help him get it to its feet."
DEU	22	5	Moses	#01		6824	" {5} A woman must not wear men's clothing, nor a man wear women's clothing, for the Lord your God detests anyone who does this."
DEU	22	6	Moses	#01		6825	" {6} If you come across a bird's nest beside the road, either in a tree or on the ground, and the mother is sitting on the young or on the eggs, do not take the mother with the young."
DEU	22	7	Moses	#01		6826	" {7} You may take the young, but be sure to let the mother go, so that it may go well with you and you may have a long life."
DEU	22	8	Moses	#01		6827	" {8} When you build a new house, make a parapet around your roof so that you may not bring the guilt of bloodshed on your house if someone falls from the roof."
DEU	22	9	Moses	#01		6828	" {9} Do not plant two kinds of seed in your vineyard; if you do, not only the crops you plant but also the fruit of the vineyard will be defiled."
DEU	22	10	Moses	#01		6829	 {10} Do not plow with an ox and a donkey yoked together. {11} Do not wear clothes of wool and linen woven together. {12} Make tassels on the four corners of the cloak you wear.
DEU	22	13	Moses	#01		6830	" {13} If a man takes a wife and, after lying with her, dislikes her {14} and slanders her and gives her a bad name, saying,"
DEU	22	14	Man	#09		6831	" << I married this woman, but when I approached her, I did not find proof of her virginity,>>"
DEU	22	15	Moses	#01		6832	" {15} then the girl's father and mother shall bring proof that she was a virgin to the town elders at the gate. {16} The girl's father will say to the elders,"
DEU	22	16	Father	#15		6833	" << I gave my daughter in marriage to this man, but he dislikes her."
DEU	22	17	Father	#15		6834	" {17} Now he has slandered her and said, 'I did not find your daughter to be a virgin. ' But here is the proof of my daughter's virginity.>>"
DEU	22	17	Moses	#01		6835	" Then her parents shall display the cloth before the elders of the town, {18} and the elders shall take the man and punish him."
DEU	22	19	Moses	#01		6836	" {19} They shall fine him a hundred shekels of silver and give them to the girl's father, because this man has given an Israelite virgin a bad name."
DEU	22	19	Moses	#01		6837	 She shall continue to be his wife; he must not divorce her as long as he lives.
DEU	22	20	Moses	#01		6838	" {20} If, however, the charge is true and no proof of the girl's virginity can be found, {21} she shall be brought to the door of her father's house and there the men of her town shall stone her to death."
DEU	22	21	Moses	#01		6839	 She has done a disgraceful thing in Israel by being promiscuous while still in her father's house. You must purge the evil from among you.
DEU	22	22	Moses	#01		6840	" {22} If a man is found sleeping with another man's wife, both the man who slept with her and the woman must die. You must purge the evil from Israel ."
DEU	22	23	Moses	#01		6841	" {23} If a man happens to meet in a town a virgin pledged to be married and he sleeps with her, {24} you shall take both of them to the gate of that town and stone them to death--"
DEU	22	24	Moses	#01		6842	" the girl because she was in a town and did not scream for help, and the man because he violated another man's wife. You must purge the evil from among you."
DEU	22	25	Moses	#01		6843	" {25} But if out in the country a man happens to meet a girl pledged to be married and rapes her, only the man who has done this shall die."
DEU	22	26	Moses	#01		6844	 {26} Do nothing to the girl; she has committed no sin deserving death.
DEU	22	26	Moses	#01		6845	" This case is like that of someone who attacks and murders his neighbor, {27} for the man found the girl out in the country, and though the betrothed girl screamed, there was no one to rescue her."
DEU	22	28	Moses	#01		6846	" {28} If a man happens to meet a virgin who is not pledged to be married and rapes her and they are discovered, {29} he shall pay the girl's father fifty shekels of silver."
DEU	22	29	Moses	#01		6847	" He must marry the girl, for he has violated her. He can never divorce her as long as he lives."
DEU	22	30	Moses	#01		6848	 {30} A man is not to marry his father's wife; he must not dishonor his father's bed. *~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
DEU	23	<<	Narr_05: Deuteronomy	#19		6849	DEUTERONOMY 23
DEU	23	1	Moses	#01		6850	 {1} No one who has been emasculated by crushing or cutting may enter the assembly of the Lord.
DEU	23	2	Moses	#01		6851	" {2} No one born of a forbidden marriage nor any of his descendants may enter the assembly of the Lord, even down to the tenth generation."
DEU	23	3	Moses	#01		6852	" {3} No Ammonite or Moabite or any of his descendants may enter the assembly of the Lord, even down to the tenth generation."
DEU	23	4	Moses	#01		6853	" {4} For they did not come to meet you with bread and water on your way when you came out of Egypt, and they hired Balaam son of Beor from Pethor in Aram Naharaim to pronounce a curse on you."
DEU	23	5	Moses	#01		6854	" {5} However, the Lord your God would not listen to Balaam but turned the curse into a blessing for you, because the Lord your God loves you."
DEU	23	6	Moses	#01		6855	 {6} Do not seek a treaty of friendship with them as long as you live.
DEU	23	7	Moses	#01		6856	" {7} Do not abhor an Edomite, for he is your brother. Do not abhor an Egyptian, because you lived as an alien in his country."
DEU	23	8	Moses	#01		6857	 {8} The third generation of children born to them may enter the assembly of the Lord.
DEU	23	9	Moses	#01		6858	" {9} When you are encamped against your enemies, keep away from everything impure."
DEU	23	10	Moses	#01		6859	" {10} If one of your men is unclean because of a nocturnal emission, he is to go outside the camp and stay there."
DEU	23	11	Moses	#01		6860	" {11} But as evening approaches he is to wash himself, and at sunset he may return to the camp."
DEU	23	12	Moses	#01		6861	 {12} Designate a place outside the camp where you can go to relieve yourself.
DEU	23	13	Moses	#01		6862	" {13} As part of your equipment have something to dig with, and when you relieve yourself, dig a hole and cover up your excrement."
DEU	23	14	Moses	#01		6863	 {14} For the Lord your God moves about in your camp to protect you and to deliver your enemies to you.
DEU	23	14	Moses	#01		6864	" Your camp must be holy, so that he will not see among you anything indecent and turn away from you."
DEU	23	15	Moses	#01		6865	" {15} If a slave has taken refuge with you, do not hand him over to his master."
DEU	23	16	Moses	#01		6866	 {16} Let him live among you wherever he likes and in whatever town he chooses. Do not oppress him.
DEU	23	17	Moses	#01		6867	 {17} No Israelite man or woman is to become a shrine prostitute.
DEU	23	18	Moses	#01		6868	" {18} You must not bring the earnings of a female prostitute or of a male prostitute into the house of the Lord your God to pay any vow, because the Lord your God detests them both."
DEU	23	19	Moses	#01		6869	" {19} Do not charge your brother interest, whether on money or food or anything else that may earn interest."
DEU	23	20	Moses	#01		6870	" {20} You may charge a foreigner interest, but not a brother Israelite, so that the Lord your God may bless you in everything you put your hand to in the land you are entering to possess."
DEU	23	21	Moses	#01		6871	" {21} If you make a vow to the Lord your God, do not be slow to pay it, for the Lord your God will certainly demand it of you and you will be guilty of sin."
DEU	23	22	Moses	#01		6872	" {22} But if you refrain from making a vow, you will not be guilty."
DEU	23	23	Moses	#01		6873	" {23} Whatever your lips utter you must be sure to do, because you made your vow freely to the Lord your God with your own mouth."
DEU	23	24	Moses	#01		6874	" {24} If you enter your neighbor's vineyard, you may eat all the grapes you want, but do not put any in your basket."
DEU	23	25	Moses	#01		6875	" {25} If you enter your neighbor's grainfield, you may pick kernels with your hands, but you must not put a sickle to his standing grain. *~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
DEU	24	<<	Narr_05: Deuteronomy	#19		6876	DEUTERONOMY 24
DEU	24	1	Moses	#01		6877	" {1} If a man marries a woman who becomes displeasing to him because he finds something indecent about her, and he writes her a certificate of divorce, gives it to her and sends her from his house,"
DEU	24	2	Moses	#01		6878	" {2} and if after she leaves his house she becomes the wife of another man,"
DEU	24	3	Moses	#01		6879	" {3} and her second husband dislikes her and writes her a certificate of divorce, gives it to her and sends her from his house, or if he dies,"
DEU	24	4	Moses	#01		6880	" {4} then her first husband, who divorced her, is not allowed to marry her again after she has been defiled. That would be detestable in the eyes of the Lord."
DEU	24	4	Moses	#01		6881	 Do not bring sin upon the land the Lord your God is giving you as an inheritance.
DEU	24	5	Moses	#01		6882	" {5} If a man has recently married, he must not be sent to war or have any other duty laid on him. For one year he is to be free to stay at home and bring happiness to the wife he has married."
DEU	24	6	Moses	#01		6883	" {6} Do not take a pair of millstones--not even the upper one--as security for a debt, because that would be taking a man's livelihood as security."
DEU	24	7	Moses	#01		6884	" {7} If a man is caught kidnapping one of his brother Israelites and treats him as a slave or sells him, the kidnapper must die. You must purge the evil from among you."
DEU	24	8	Moses	#01		6885	" {8} In cases of leprous diseases be very careful to do exactly as the priests, who are Levites, instruct you. You must follow carefully what I have commanded them."
DEU	24	9	Moses	#01		6886	 {9} Remember what the Lord your God did to Miriam along the way after you came out of Egypt.
DEU	24	10	Moses	#01		6887	" {10} When you make a loan of any kind to your neighbor, do not go into his house to get what he is offering as a pledge."
DEU	24	11	Moses	#01		6888	 {11} Stay outside and let the man to whom you are making the loan bring the pledge out to you.
DEU	24	12	Moses	#01		6889	" {12} If the man is poor, do not go to sleep with his pledge in your possession."
DEU	24	13	Moses	#01		6890	" {13} Return his cloak to him by sunset so that he may sleep in it. Then he will thank you, and it will be regarded as a righteous act in the sight of the Lord your God."
DEU	24	14	Moses	#01		6891	" {14} Do not take advantage of a hired man who is poor and needy, whether he is a brother Israelite or an alien living in one of your towns."
DEU	24	15	Moses	#01		6892	" {15} Pay him his wages each day before sunset, because he is poor and is counting on it. Otherwise he may cry to the Lord against you, and you will be guilty of sin."
DEU	24	16	Moses	#01		6893	" {16} Fathers shall not be put to death for their children, nor children put to death for their fathers; each is to die for his own sin."
DEU	24	17	Moses	#01		6894	" {17} Do not deprive the alien or the fatherless of justice, or take the cloak of the widow as a pledge."
DEU	24	18	Moses	#01		6895	 {18} Remember that you were slaves in Egypt and the Lord your God redeemed you from there. That is why I command you to do this.
DEU	24	19	Moses	#01		6896	" {19} When you are harvesting in your field and you overlook a sheaf, do not go back to get it."
DEU	24	19	Moses	#01		6897	" Leave it for the alien, the fatherless and the widow, so that the Lord your God may bless you in all the work of your hands."
DEU	24	20	Moses	#01		6898	" {20} When you beat the olives from your trees, do not go over the branches a second time. Leave what remains for the alien, the fatherless and the widow."
DEU	24	21	Moses	#01		6899	" {21} When you harvest the grapes in your vineyard, do not go over the vines again. Leave what remains for the alien, the fatherless and the widow."
DEU	24	22	Moses	#01		6900	 {22} Remember that you were slaves in Egypt. That is why I command you to do this. *~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*

DEU	28	<<	Narr_05: Deuteronomy	#19		6999	DEUTERONOMY 28
DEU	28	1	Moses	#01		7000	" {1} If you fully obey the Lord your God and carefully follow all his commands I give you today, the Lord your God will set you high above all the nations on earth."
DEU	28	2	Moses	#01		7001	 {2} All these blessings will come upon you and accompany you if you obey the Lord your God:
DEU	28	3	Moses	#01		7002	 {3} You will be blessed in the city and blessed in the country.
DEU	28	4	Moses	#01		7003	" {4} The fruit of your womb will be blessed, and the crops of your land and the young of your livestock--the calves of your herds and the lambs of your flocks."
DEU	28	5	Moses	#01		7004	 {5} Your basket and your kneading trough will be blessed. {6} You will be blessed when you come in and blessed when you go out.
DEU	28	7	Moses	#01		7005	 {7} The Lord will grant that the enemies who rise up against you will be defeated before you. They will come at you from one direction but flee from you in seven.
DEU	28	8	Moses	#01		7006	 {8} The Lord will send a blessing on your barns and on everything you put your hand to. The Lord your God will bless you in the land he is giving you.
DEU	28	9	Moses	#01		7007	" {9} The Lord will establish you as his holy people, as he promised you on oath, if you keep the commands of the Lord your God and walk in his ways."
DEU	28	10	Moses	#01		7008	" {10} Then all the peoples on earth will see that you are called by the name of the Lord, and they will fear you."
DEU	28	11	Moses	#01		7009	" {11} The Lord will grant you abundant prosperity--in the fruit of your womb, the young of your livestock and the crops of your ground--in the land he swore to your forefathers to give you."
DEU	28	12	Moses	#01		7010	" {12} The Lord will open the heavens, the storehouse of his bounty, to send rain on your land in season and to bless all the work of your hands."
DEU	28	12	Moses	#01		7011	" You will lend to many nations but will borrow from none. {13} The Lord will make you the head, not the tail."
DEU	28	13	Moses	#01		7012	" If you pay attention to the commands of the Lord your God that I give you this day and carefully follow them, you will always be at the top, never at the bottom."
DEU	28	14	Moses	#01		7013	" {14} Do not turn aside from any of the commands I give you today, to the right or to the left, following other gods and serving them."
DEU	28	15	Moses	#01		7014	" {15} However, if you do not obey the Lord your God and do not carefully follow all his commands and decrees I am giving you today, all these curses will come upon you and overtake you:"
DEU	28	16	Moses	#01		7015	 {16} You will be cursed in the city and cursed in the country. {17} Your basket and your kneading trough will be cursed.
DEU	28	18	Moses	#01		7016	" {18} The fruit of your womb will be cursed, and the crops of your land, and the calves of your herds and the lambs of your flocks."
DEU	28	19	Moses	#01		7017	 {19} You will be cursed when you come in and cursed when you go out.
DEU	28	20	Moses	#01		7018	" {20} The Lord will send on you curses, confusion and rebuke in everything you put your hand to, until you are destroyed and come to sudden ruin because of the evil you have done in forsaking him."
DEU	28	21	Moses	#01		7019	 {21} The Lord will plague you with diseases until he has destroyed you from the land you are entering to possess.
DEU	28	22	Moses	#01		7020	" {22} The Lord will strike you with wasting disease, with fever and inflammation, with scorching heat and drought, with blight and mildew, which will plague you until you perish."
DEU	28	23	Moses	#01		7021	" {23} The sky over your head will be bronze, the ground beneath you iron."
DEU	28	24	Moses	#01		7022	 {24} The Lord will turn the rain of your country into dust and powder; it will come down from the skies until you are destroyed.
DEU	28	25	Moses	#01		7023	 {25} The Lord will cause you to be defeated before your enemies.
DEU	28	25	Moses	#01		7024	" You will come at them from one direction but flee from them in seven, and you will become a thing of horror to all the kingdoms on earth."
DEU	28	26	Moses	#01		7025	" {26} Your carcasses will be food for all the birds of the air and the beasts of the earth, and there will be no one to frighten them away."
DEU	28	27	Moses	#01		7026	" {27} The Lord will afflict you with the boils of Egypt and with tumors, festering sores and the itch, from which you cannot be cured."
DEU	28	28	Moses	#01		7027	" {28} The Lord will afflict you with madness, blindness and confusion of mind."
DEU	28	29	Moses	#01		7028	" {29} At midday you will grope about like a blind man in the dark. You will be unsuccessful in everything you do; day after day you will be oppressed and robbed, with no one to rescue you."
DEU	28	30	Moses	#01		7029	" {30} You will be pledged to be married to a woman, but another will take her and ravish her."
DEU	28	30	Moses	#01		7030	" You will build a house, but you will not live in it. You will plant a vineyard, but you will not even begin to enjoy its fruit."
DEU	28	31	Moses	#01		7031	" {31} Your ox will be slaughtered before your eyes, but you will eat none of it."
DEU	28	31	Moses	#01		7032	" Your donkey will be forcibly taken from you and will not be returned. Your sheep will be given to your enemies, and no one will rescue them."
DEU	28	32	Moses	#01		7033	" {32} Your sons and daughters will be given to another nation, and you will wear out your eyes watching for them day after day, powerless to lift a hand."
DEU	28	33	Moses	#01		7034	" {33} A people that you do not know will eat what your land and labor produce, and you will have nothing but cruel oppression all your days."
DEU	28	34	Moses	#01		7035	 {34} The sights you see will drive you mad.
DEU	28	35	Moses	#01		7036	" {35} The Lord will afflict your knees and legs with painful boils that cannot be cured, spreading from the soles of your feet to the top of your head."
DEU	28	36	Moses	#01		7037	" {36} The Lord will drive you and the king you set over you to a nation unknown to you or your fathers. There you will worship other gods, gods of wood and stone."
DEU	28	37	Moses	#01		7038	 {37} You will become a thing of horror and an object of scorn and ridicule to all the nations where the Lord will drive you.
DEU	28	38	Moses	#01		7039	" {38} You will sow much seed in the field but you will harvest little, because locusts will devour it."
DEU	28	39	Moses	#01		7040	" {39} You will plant vineyards and cultivate them but you will not drink the wine or gather the grapes, because worms will eat them."
DEU	28	40	Moses	#01		7041	" {40} You will have olive trees throughout your country but you will not use the oil, because the olives will drop off."
DEU	28	41	Moses	#01		7042	" {41} You will have sons and daughters but you will not keep them, because they will go into captivity."
DEU	28	42	Moses	#01		7043	 {42} Swarms of locusts will take over all your trees and the crops of your land.
DEU	28	43	Moses	#01		7044	" {43} The alien who lives among you will rise above you higher and higher, but you will sink lower and lower."
DEU	28	44	Moses	#01		7045	" {44} He will lend to you, but you will not lend to him. He will be the head, but you will be the tail."
DEU	28	45	Moses	#01		7046	 {45} All these curses will come upon you.
DEU	28	45	Moses	#01		7047	" They will pursue you and overtake you until you are destroyed, because you did not obey the Lord your God and observe the commands and decrees he gave you."
DEU	28	46	Moses	#01		7048	 {46} They will be a sign and a wonder to you and your descendants forever.
DEU	28	47	Moses	#01		7049	" {47} Because you did not serve the Lord your God joyfully and gladly in the time of prosperity, {48} therefore in hunger and thirst, in nakedness and dire poverty, you will serve the enemies the Lord sends against you."
DEU	28	48	Moses	#01		7050	 He will put an iron yoke on your neck until he has destroyed you.
DEU	28	49	Moses	#01		7051	" {49} The Lord will bring a nation against you from far away, from the ends of the earth, like an eagle swooping down, a nation whose language you will not understand,"
DEU	28	50	Moses	#01		7052	 {50} a fierce-looking nation without respect for the old or pity for the young.
DEU	28	51	Moses	#01		7053	 {51} They will devour the young of your livestock and the crops of your land until you are destroyed.
DEU	28	51	Moses	#01		7054	" They will leave you no grain, new wine or oil, nor any calves of your herds or lambs of your flocks until you are ruined."
DEU	28	52	Moses	#01		7055	 {52} They will lay siege to all the cities throughout your land until the high fortified walls in which you trust fall down.
DEU	28	52	Moses	#01		7056	 They will besiege all the cities throughout the land the Lord your God is giving you.
DEU	28	53	Moses	#01		7057	" {53} Because of the suffering that your enemy will inflict on you during the siege, you will eat the fruit of the womb, the flesh of the sons and daughters the Lord your God has given you."
DEU	28	54	Moses	#01		7058	" {54} Even the most gentle and sensitive man among you will have no compassion on his own brother or the wife he loves or his surviving children,"
DEU	28	55	Moses	#01		7059	 {55} and he will not give to one of them any of the flesh of his children that he is eating.
DEU	28	55	Moses	#01		7060	 It will be all he has left because of the suffering your enemy will inflict on you during the siege of all your cities.
DEU	28	56	Moses	#01		7061	 {56} The most gentle and sensitive woman among you--so sensitive and gentle that she would not venture to touch the ground with the sole of her foot--
DEU	28	56	Moses	#01		7062	 will begrudge the husband she loves and her own son or daughter {57} the afterbirth from her womb and the children she bears.
DEU	28	57	Moses	#01		7063	 For she intends to eat them secretly during the siege and in the distress that your enemy will inflict on you in your cities.
DEU	28	58	Moses	#01		7064	" {58} If you do not carefully follow all the words of this law, which are written in this book, and do not revere this glorious and awesome name--the Lord your God--"
DEU	28	59	Moses	#01		7065	" {59} the Lord will send fearful plagues on you and your descendants, harsh and prolonged disasters, and severe and lingering illnesses."
DEU	28	60	Moses	#01		7066	" {60} He will bring upon you all the diseases of Egypt that you dreaded, and they will cling to you."
DEU	28	61	Moses	#01		7067	" {61} The Lord will also bring on you every kind of sickness and disaster not recorded in this Book of the Law, until you are destroyed."
DEU	28	62	Moses	#01		7068	" {62} You who were as numerous as the stars in the sky will be left but few in number, because you did not obey the Lord your God."
DEU	28	63	Moses	#01		7069	" {63} Just as it pleased the Lord to make you prosper and increase in number, so it will please him to ruin and destroy you. You will be uprooted from the land you are entering to possess."
DEU	28	64	Moses	#01		7070	" {64} Then the Lord will scatter you among all nations, from one end of the earth to the other."
DEU	28	64	Moses	#01		7071	" There you will worship other gods--gods of wood and stone, which neither you nor your fathers have known."
DEU	28	65	Moses	#01		7072	" {65} Among those nations you will find no repose, no resting place for the sole of your foot."
DEU	28	65	Moses	#01		7073	" There the Lord will give you an anxious mind, eyes weary with longing, and a despairing heart."
DEU	28	66	Moses	#01		7074	" {66} You will live in constant suspense, filled with dread both night and day, never sure of your life."
DEU	28	67	Moses	#01		7075	" {67} In the morning you will say,"
DEU	28	67	Israelite	#14		7076	 << If only it were evening!>>
DEU	28	67	Moses	#01		7077	" and in the evening,"
DEU	28	67	Israelite	#14		7078	 << If only it were morning!>>
DEU	28	67	Moses	#01		7079	 --because of the terror that will fill your hearts and the sights that your eyes will see.
DEU	28	68	Moses	#01		7080	 {68} The Lord will send you back in ships to Egypt on a journey I said you should never make again.
DEU	28	68	Moses	#01		7081	" There you will offer yourselves for sale to your enemies as male and female slaves, but no one will buy you. *~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"

DEU	29	2	Moses	#01		7085	" Your eyes have seen all that the Lord did in Egypt to Pharaoh, to all his officials and to all his land."

DEU	29	4	Moses	#01		7087	 {4} But to this day the Lord has not given you a mind that understands or eyes that see or ears that hear.

DEU	29	6	God-FX1	#20		7089	 {6} You ate no bread and drank no wine or other fermented drink. I did this so that you might know that I am the Lord your God.

DEU	29	19	Man	#04		7103	" << I will be safe, even though I persist in going my own way.>>"
DEU	29	19	Moses	#01		7104	 This will bring disaster on the watered land as well as the dry.

DEU	29	22	Moses	#01		7108	 {22} Your children who follow you in later generations and foreigners who come from distant lands will see the calamities that have fallen on the land and the diseases with which the Lord has afflicted it.
DEU	29	23	Moses	#01		7109	" {23} The whole land will be a burning waste of salt and sulfur--nothing planted, nothing sprouting, no vegetation growing on it."

DEU	29	25	Moses	#01		7112	 {25} And the answer will be:

DEU	29	26	Man	#09		7114	" {26} They went off and worshiped other gods and bowed down to them, gods they did not know, gods he had not given them."

DEU	32	<<	Narr_05: Deuteronomy	#19		7182	DEUTERONOMY 32
DEU	32	1	Moses	#01		7183	" {1} Listen, O heavens, and I will speak; hear, O earth, the words of my mouth."
DEU	32	2	Moses	#01		7184	" {2} Let my teaching fall like rain and my words descend like dew, like showers on new grass, like abundant rain on tender plants."
DEU	32	3	Moses	#01		7185	" {3} I will proclaim the name of the Lord. Oh, praise the greatness of our God!"
DEU	32	4	Moses	#01		7186	" {4} He is the Rock, his works are perfect, and all his ways are just. A faithful God who does no wrong, upright and just is he."
DEU	32	5	Moses	#01		7187	" {5} They have acted corruptly toward him; to their shame they are no longer his children, but a warped and crooked generation."
DEU	32	6	Moses	#01		7188	" {6} Is this the way you repay the Lord, O foolish and unwise people? Is he not your Father, your Creator, who made you and formed you?"
DEU	32	7	Moses	#01		7189	" {7} Remember the days of old; consider the generations long past. Ask your father and he will tell you, your elders, and they will explain to you."
DEU	32	8	Moses	#01		7190	" {8} When the Most High gave the nations their inheritance, when he divided all mankind, he set up boundaries for the peoples according to the number of the sons of Israel."
DEU	32	9	Moses	#01		7191	" {9} For the Lord's portion is his people, Jacob his allotted inheritance."
DEU	32	10	Moses	#01		7192	" {10} In a desert land he found him, in a barren and howling waste. He shielded him and cared for him; he guarded him as the apple of his eye,"
DEU	32	11	Moses	#01		7193	" {11} like an eagle that stirs up its nest and hovers over its young, that spreads its wings to catch them and carries them on its pinions."
DEU	32	12	Moses	#01		7194	 {12} The Lord alone led him; no foreign god was with him.
DEU	32	13	Moses	#01		7195	 {13} He made him ride on the heights of the land and fed him with the fruit of the fields.
DEU	32	13	Moses	#01		7196	" He nourished him with honey from the rock, and with oil from the flinty crag,"
DEU	32	14	Moses	#01		7197	" {14} with curds and milk from herd and flock and with fattened lambs and goats, with choice rams of Bashan and the finest kernels of wheat."
DEU	32	14	Moses	#01		7198	 You drank the foaming blood of the grape.
DEU	32	15	Moses	#01		7199	" {15} Jeshurun grew fat and kicked; filled with food, he became heavy and sleek. He abandoned the God who made him and rejected the Rock his Savior."
DEU	32	16	Moses	#01		7200	 {16} They made him jealous with their foreign gods and angered him with their detestable idols.
DEU	32	17	Moses	#01		7201	" {17} They sacrificed to demons, which are not God-- gods they had not known, gods that recently appeared, gods your fathers did not fear."
DEU	32	18	Moses	#01		7202	" {18} You deserted the Rock, who fathered you; you forgot the God who gave you birth."
DEU	32	19	Moses	#01		7203	 {19} The Lord saw this and rejected them because he was angered by his sons and daughters.
DEU	32	20	God-FX1	#20		7204	" {20} ""I will hide my face from them, and see what their end will be; for they are a perverse generation, children who are unfaithful."
DEU	32	21	God-FX1	#20		7205	 {21} They made me jealous by what is no god and angered me with their worthless idols.
DEU	32	21	God-FX1	#20		7206	 I will make them envious by those who are not a people; I will make them angry by a nation that has no understanding.
DEU	32	22	God-FX1	#20		7207	" {22} For a fire has been kindled by my wrath, one that burns to the realm of death below."
DEU	32	22	God-FX1	#20		7208	 It will devour the earth and its harvests and set afire the foundations of the mountains.
DEU	32	23	God-FX1	#20		7209	 {23} öI will heap calamities upon them and spend my arrows against them.
DEU	32	24	God-FX1	#20		7210	" {24} I will send wasting famine against them, consuming pestilence and deadly plague;"
DEU	32	24	God-FX1	#20		7211	" I will send against them the fangs of wild beasts, the venom of vipers that glide in the dust.ö"
DEU	32	25	God-FX1	#20		7212	" {25} In the street the sword will make them childless; in their homes terror will reign. Young men and young women will perish, infants and gray-haired men."
DEU	32	26	God-FX1	#20		7213	" {26} I said I would scatter them and blot out their memory from mankind,"
DEU	32	27	God-FX1	#20		7214	" {27} but I dreaded the taunt of the enemy, lest the adversary misunderstand and say, 'Our hand has triumphed; the Lord has not done all this. '"
DEU	32	28	Moses	#01		7215	" {28} They are a nation without sense, there is no discernment in them. {29} If only they were wise and would understand this and discern what their end will be!"
DEU	32	30	Moses	#01		7216	" {30} How could one man chase a thousand, or two put ten thousand to flight, unless their Rock had sold them, unless the Lord had given them up?"
DEU	32	31	Moses	#01		7217	" {31} For their rock is not like our Rock, as even our enemies concede."
DEU	32	32	Moses	#01		7218	" {32} Their vine comes from the vine of Sodom and from the fields of Gomorrah. Their grapes are filled with poison, and their clusters with bitterness."
DEU	32	33	Moses	#01		7219	" {33} Their wine is the venom of serpents, the deadly poison of cobras."
DEU	32	34	God-FX1	#20		7220	 {34} öHave I not kept this in reserve and sealed it in my vaults?
DEU	32	35	God-FX1	#20		7221	 {35} It is mine to avenge; I will repay. In due time their foot will slip; their day of disaster is near and their doom rushes upon them.ö
DEU	32	36	Moses	#01		7222	" {36} The Lord will judge his people and have compassion on his servants when he sees their strength is gone and no one is left, slave or free. {37} He will say:"
DEU	32	37	God-FX1	#20		7223	" öNow where are their gods, the rock they took refuge in, {38} the gods who ate the fat of their sacrifices and drank the wine of their drink offerings?"
DEU	32	38	God-FX1	#20		7224	 Let them rise up to help you! Let them give you shelter!
DEU	32	39	God-FX1	#20		7225	" {39} ôSee now that I myself am He! There is no god besides me. I put to death and I bring to life, I have wounded and I will heal, and no one can deliver out of my hand."
DEU	32	40	God-FX1	#20		7226	 {40} I lift my hand to heaven and declare:
DEU	32	40	God-FX1	#20		7227	" As surely as I live forever, {41} when I sharpen my flashing sword and my hand grasps it in judgment, I will take vengeance on my adversaries and repay those who hate me."

JOS	2	15	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7340	" {15} So she let them down by a rope through the window, for the house she lived in was part of the city wall. {16} Now she had said to them,"

JOS	2	18	Israelite	#04		7344	" and unless you have brought your father and mother, your brothers and all your family into your house."
JOS	2	19	Israelite	#04		7345	" {19} If anyone goes outside your house into the street, his blood will be on his own head; we will not be responsible."
JOS	2	19	Israelite	#04		7346	" As for anyone who is in the house with you, his blood will be on our head if a hand is laid on him."
JOS	2	20	Israelite	#04		7347	" {20} But if you tell what we are doing, we will be released from the oath you made us swear.>>"
JOS	2	21	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7348	" {21} She replied,"
JOS	2	21	Rehab (female)	#23		7349	 << Agreed. Let it be as you say.>>
JOS	2	21	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7350	 So she sent them away and they departed. And she tied the scarlet cord in the window.
JOS	2	22	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7351	" {22} When they left, they went into the hills and stayed there three days, until the pursuers had searched all along the road and returned without finding them."
JOS	2	23	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7352	" {23} Then the two men started back. They went down out of the hills, forded the river and came to Joshua son of Nun and told him everything that had happened to them."

JOS	3	<<	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7355	JOSHUA 3

JOS	7	12	God-FX1	#20		7495	 I will not be with you anymore unless you destroy whatever among you is devoted to destruction.

JOS	7	21	Achan	#14		7509	" {21} When I saw in the plunder a beautiful robe from Babylonia, two hundred shekels of silver and a wedge of gold weighing fifty shekels, I coveted them and took them."
JOS	7	21	Achan	#14		7510	" They are hidden in the ground inside my tent, with the silver underneath.>>"
JOS	7	22	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7511	" {22} So Joshua sent messengers, and they ran to the tent, and there it was, hidden in his tent, with the silver underneath."

JOS	7	24	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7513	" {24} Then Joshua, together with all Israel, took Achan son of Zerah, the silver, the robe, the gold wedge,"

JOS	7	25	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7516	" Then all Israel stoned him, and after they had stoned the rest, they burned them."
JOS	7	26	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7517	" {26} Over Achan they heaped up a large pile of rocks, which remains to this day."
JOS	7	26	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7518	 Then the Lord turned from his fierce anger. Therefore that place has been called the Valley of Achor ever since. *~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
JOS	8	<<	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7519	JOSHUA 8
JOS	8	1	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7520	" {1} Then the Lord said to Joshua,"

JOS	8	1	God-FX1	#20		7522	" For I have delivered into your hands the king of Ai, his people, his city and his land."
JOS	8	2	God-FX1	#20		7523	" {2} You shall do to Ai and its king as you did to Jericho and its king, except that you may carry off their plunder and livestock for yourselves. Set an ambush behind the city.>>"
JOS	8	3	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7524	 {3} So Joshua and the whole army moved out to attack Ai. He chose thirty thousand of his best fighting men and sent them out at night {4} with these orders:
JOS	8	4	Joshua	#13		7525	 << Listen carefully. You are to set an ambush behind the city. Don't go very far from it. All of you be on the alert.
JOS	8	5	Joshua	#13		7526	" {5} I and all those with me will advance on the city, and when the men come out against us, as they did before, we will flee from them."
JOS	8	6	Joshua	#13		7527	" {6} They will pursue us until we have lured them away from the city, for they will say, 'They are running away from us as they did before.Æ"
JOS	8	6	Joshua	#13		7528	" So when we flee from them, {7} you are to rise up from ambush and take the city. The Lord your God will give it into your hand."
JOS	8	8	Joshua	#13		7529	" {8} When you have taken the city, set it on fire. Do what the Lord has commanded. See to it; you have my orders.>>"
JOS	8	9	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7530	" {9} Then Joshua sent them off, and they went to the place of ambush and lay in wait between Bethel and Ai, to the west of Ai --but Joshua spent that night with the people."
JOS	8	10	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7531	" {10} Early the next morning Joshua mustered his men, and he and the leaders of Israel marched before them to Ai."
JOS	8	11	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7532	" {11} The entire force that was with him marched up and approached the city and arrived in front of it. They set up camp north of Ai, with the valley between them and the city."
JOS	8	12	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7533	" {12} Joshua had taken about five thousand men and set them in ambush between Bethel and Ai, to the west of the city."
JOS	8	13	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7534	 {13} They had the soldiers take up their positions--all those in the camp to the north of the city and the ambush to the west of it. That night Joshua went into the valley.
JOS	8	14	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7535	" {14} When the king of Ai saw this, he and all the men of the city hurried out early in the morning to meet Israel in battle at a certain place overlooking the Arabah."
JOS	8	14	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7536	 But he did not know that an ambush had been set against him behind the city.
JOS	8	15	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7537	" {15} Joshua and all Israel let themselves be driven back before them, and they fled toward the desert."
JOS	8	16	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7538	" {16} All the men of Ai were called to pursue them, and they pursued Joshua and were lured away from the city."
JOS	8	17	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7539	" {17} Not a man remained in Ai or Bethel who did not go after Israel. They left the city open and went in pursuit of Israel. {18} Then the Lord said to Joshua,"
JOS	8	18	God-FX1	#20		7540	" << Hold out toward Ai the javelin that is in your hand, for into your hand I will deliver the city.>>"
JOS	8	18	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7541	" So Joshua held out his javelin toward Ai. {19} As soon as he did this, the men in the ambush rose quickly from their position and rushed forward."
JOS	8	19	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7542	 They entered the city and captured it and quickly set it on fire.
JOS	8	20	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7543	" {20} The men of Ai looked back and saw the smoke of the city rising against the sky, but they had no chance to escape in any direction, for the Israelites who had been fleeing toward the desert had turned back against their pursuers."
JOS	8	21	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7544	" {21} For when Joshua and all Israel saw that the ambush had taken the city and that smoke was going up from the city, they turned around and attacked the men of Ai."
JOS	8	22	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7545	" {22} The men of the ambush also came out of the city against them, so that they were caught in the middle, with Israelites on both sides. "
JOS	8	22	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7546	" Israel cut them down, leaving them neither survivors nor fugitives. {23} But they took the king of Ai alive and brought him to Joshua."
JOS	8	24	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7547	" {24} When Israel had finished killing all the men of Ai in the fields and in the desert where they had chased them, and when every one of them had been put to the sword, all the Israelites returned to Ai and killed those who were in it."
JOS	8	25	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7548	 {25} Twelve thousand men and women fell that day--all the people of Ai. {26} For Joshua did not draw back the hand that held out his javelin until he had destroyed all who lived in Ai.
JOS	8	27	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7549	" {27} But Israel did carry off for themselves the livestock and plunder of this city, as the Lord had instructed Joshua."
JOS	8	28	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7550	" {28} So Joshua burned Ai and made it a permanent heap of ruins, a desolate place to this day."
JOS	8	29	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7551	 {29} He hung the king of Ai on a tree and left him there until evening.
JOS	8	29	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7552	" At sunset, Joshua ordered them to take his body from the tree and throw it down at the entrance of the city gate. And they raised a large pile of rocks over it, which remains to this day."
JOS	8	30	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7553	" {30} Then Joshua built on Mount Ebal an altar to the Lord, the God of Israel, {31} as Moses the servant of the Lord had commanded the Israelites."
JOS	8	31	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7554	" He built it according to what is written in the Book of the Law of Moses--an altar of uncut stones, on which no iron tool had been used."
JOS	8	31	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7555	 On it they offered to the Lord burnt offerings and sacrificed fellowship offerings.
JOS	8	32	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7556	" {32} There, in the presence of the Israelites, Joshua copied on stones the law of Moses, which he had written."
JOS	8	33	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7557	" {33} All Israel, aliens and citizens alike, with their elders, officials and judges, were standing on both sides of the ark of the covenant of the Lord, facing those who carried it--the priests, who were Levites."
JOS	8	33	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7558	" Half of the people stood in front of Mount Gerizim and half of them in front of Mount Ebal, as Moses the servant of the Lord had formerly commanded when he gave instructions to bless the people of Israel."
JOS	8	34	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7559	" {34} Afterward, Joshua read all the words of the law--the blessings and the curses--just as it is written in the Book of the Law."
JOS	8	35	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7560	" {35} There was not a word of all that Moses had commanded that Joshua did not read to the whole assembly of Israel, including the women and children, and the aliens who lived among them.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"

JOS	9	5	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7568	 {5} The men put worn and patched sandals on their feet and wore old clothes. All the bread of their food supply was dry and moldy.

JOS	10	1	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7609	 and that the people of Gibeon had made a treaty of peace with Israel and were living near them.
JOS	10	2	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7610	" {2} He and his people were very much alarmed at this, because Gibeon was an important city, like one of the royal cities; it was larger than Ai, and all its men were good fighters."
JOS	10	3	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7611	" {3} So Adoni-Zedek king of Jerusalem appealed to Hoham king of Hebron, Piram king of Jarmuth, Japhia king of Lachish and Debir king of Eglon. He said,"

JOS	10	10	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7620	" {10} The Lord threw them into confusion before Israel, who defeated them in a great victory at Gibeon."
JOS	10	10	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7621	 Israel pursued them along the road going up to Beth Horon and cut them down all the way to Azekah and Makkedah.
JOS	10	11	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7622	" {11} As they fled before Israel on the road down from Beth Horon to Azekah, the Lord hurled large hailstones down on them from the sky,"
JOS	10	11	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7623	 and more of them died from the hailstones than were killed by the swords of the Israelites.
JOS	10	12	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7624	" {12} On the day the Lord gave the Amorites over to Israel, Joshua said to the Lord in the presence of Israel :"
JOS	10	12	Joshua	#13		7625	" << O sun, stand still over Gibeon, O moon, over the Valley of Aijalon.>>"
JOS	10	13	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7626	" {13} So the sun stood still, and the moon stopped, till the nation avenged itself on its enemies, as it is written in the Book of Jashar."
JOS	10	13	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7627	 The sun stopped in the middle of the sky and delayed going down about a full day.
JOS	10	14	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7628	" {14} There has never been a day like it before or since, a day when the Lord listened to a man. Surely the Lord was fighting for Israel!"
JOS	10	15	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7629	 {15} Then Joshua returned with all Israel to the camp at Gilgal.
JOS	10	16	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7630	 {16} Now the five kings had fled and hidden in the cave at Makkedah. {17} Joshua was told:
JOS	10	17	Soldier	#03		7631	 << The five kings have been found hiding in the caves at Makkedah.>>
JOS	10	18	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7632	" {18} He said,"
JOS	10	18	Joshua	#13		7633	" << Roll large rocks up to the mouth of the cave, and post some men there to guard it."
JOS	10	19	Joshua	#13		7634	" {19} But don't stop! Pursue your enemies, attack them from the rear and don't let them reach their cities, for the Lord your God has given them into your hand.>>"
JOS	10	20	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7635	 {20} So Joshua and the Israelites destroyed them completely--almost to a man--but the few who were left reached their fortified cities.
JOS	10	21	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7636	" {21} The whole army then returned safely to Joshua in the camp at Makkedah, and no one uttered a word against the Israelites. {22} Joshua said,"
JOS	10	22	Joshua	#13		7637	 << Open the mouth of the cave and bring those five kings out to me.>>
JOS	10	23	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7638	" {23} So they brought the five kings out of the cave--the kings of Jerusalem, Hebron, Jarmuth, Lachish and Eglon."
JOS	10	24	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7639	" {24} When they had brought these kings to Joshua, he summoned all the men of Israel and said to the army commanders who had come with him,"

JOS	10	24	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7641	" So they came forward and placed their feet on their necks. {25} Joshua said to them,"
JOS	10	25	Joshua	#13		7642	 << Do not be afraid; do not be discouraged. Be strong and courageous. This is what the Lord will do to all the enemies you are going to fight.>>
JOS	10	26	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7643	" {26} Then Joshua struck and killed the kings and hung them on five trees, and they were left hanging on the trees until evening."
JOS	10	27	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7644	 {27} At sunset Joshua gave the order and they took them down from the trees and threw them into the cave where they had been hiding.
JOS	10	27	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7645	" At the mouth of the cave they placed large rocks, which are there to this day."
JOS	10	28	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7646	 {28} That day Joshua took Makkedah. He put the city and its king to the sword and totally destroyed everyone in it.
JOS	10	28	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7647	 He left no survivors. And he did to the king of Makkedah as he had done to the king of Jericho.
JOS	10	29	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7648	 {29} Then Joshua and all Israel with him moved on from Makkedah to Libnah and attacked it.
JOS	10	30	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7649	 {30} The Lord also gave that city and its king into Israel's hand. The city and everyone in it Joshua put to the sword.
JOS	10	30	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7650	 He left no survivors there. And he did to its king as he had done to the king of Jericho.
JOS	10	31	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7651	 {31} Then Joshua and all Israel with him moved on from Libnah to Lachish ; he took up positions against it and attacked it.
JOS	10	32	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7652	" {32} The Lord handed Lachish over to Israel, and Joshua took it on the second day. The city and everyone in it he put to the sword, just as he had done to Libnah."
JOS	10	33	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7653	" {33} Meanwhile, Horam king of Gezer had come up to help Lachish, but Joshua defeated him and his army--until no survivors were left."
JOS	10	34	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7654	 {34} Then Joshua and all Israel with him moved on from Lachish to Eglon ; they took up positions against it and attacked it.
JOS	10	35	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7655	" {35} They captured it that same day and put it to the sword and totally destroyed everyone in it, just as they had done to Lachish."
JOS	10	36	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7656	 {36} Then Joshua and all Israel with him went up from Eglon to Hebron and attacked it.
JOS	10	37	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7657	" {37} They took the city and put it to the sword, together with its king, its villages and everyone in it."
JOS	10	37	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7658	" They left no survivors. Just as at Eglon, they totally destroyed it and everyone in it."
JOS	10	38	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7659	 {38} Then Joshua and all Israel with him turned around and attacked Debir.
JOS	10	39	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7660	" {39} They took the city, its king and its villages, and put them to the sword. Everyone in it they totally destroyed."
JOS	10	39	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7661	 They left no survivors. They did to Debir and its king as they had done to Libnah and its king and to Hebron.
JOS	10	40	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7662	" {40} So Joshua subdued the whole region, including the hill country, the Negev, the western foothills and the mountain slopes, together with all their kings."
JOS	10	40	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7663	" He left no survivors. He totally destroyed all who breathed, just as the Lord, the God of Israel, had commanded."
JOS	10	41	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7664	 {41} Joshua subdued them from Kadesh Barnea to Gaza and from the whole region of Goshen to Gibeon.
JOS	10	42	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7665	" {42} All these kings and their lands Joshua conquered in one campaign, because the Lord, the God of Israel, fought for Israel."
JOS	10	43	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7666	 {43} Then Joshua returned with all Israel to the camp at Gilgal.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*

JOS	11	2	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7669	" {2} and to the northern kings who were in the mountains, in the Arabah south of Kinnereth, in the western foothills and in Naphoth Dor on the west;"
JOS	11	3	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7670	" {3} to the Canaanites in the east and west; to the Amorites, Hittites, Perizzites and Jebusites in the hill country; and to the Hivites below Hermon in the region of Mizpah."
JOS	11	4	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7671	" {4} They came out with all their troops and a large number of horses and chariots--a huge army, as numerous as the sand on the seashore."
JOS	11	5	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7672	" {5} All these kings joined forces and made camp together at the Waters of Merom, to fight against Israel. {6} The Lord said to Joshua,"
JOS	11	6	God-FX1	#20		7673	" << Do not be afraid of them, because by this time tomorrow I will hand all of them over to Israel, slain. You are to hamstring their horses and burn their chariots.>>"
JOS	11	7	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7674	" {7} So Joshua and his whole army came against them suddenly at the Waters of Merom and attacked them, {8} and the Lord gave them into the hand of Israel."
JOS	11	8	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7675	" They defeated them and pursued them all the way to Greater Sidon, to Misrephoth Maim, and to the Valley of Mizpah on the east, until no survivors were left."
JOS	11	9	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7676	 {9} Joshua did to them as the Lord had directed: He hamstrung their horses and burned their chariots.
JOS	11	10	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7677	 {10} At that time Joshua turned back and captured Hazor and put its king to the sword. (Hazor had been the head of all these kingdoms.)
JOS	11	11	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7678	" {11} Everyone in it they put to the sword. They totally destroyed them, not sparing anything that breathed, and he burned up Hazor itself."
JOS	11	12	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7679	" {12} Joshua took all these royal cities and their kings and put them to the sword. He totally destroyed them, as Moses the servant of the Lord had commanded."
JOS	11	13	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7680	" {13} Yet Israel did not burn any of the cities built on their mounds--except Hazor, which Joshua burned."
JOS	11	14	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7681	" {14} The Israelites carried off for themselves all the plunder and livestock of these cities,"
JOS	11	14	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7682	" but all the people they put to the sword until they completely destroyed them, not sparing anyone that breathed."
JOS	11	15	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7683	" {15} As the Lord commanded his servant Moses, so Moses commanded Joshua, and Joshua did it; he left nothing undone of all that the Lord commanded Moses."
JOS	11	16	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7684	" {16} So Joshua took this entire land: the hill country, all the Negev, the whole region of Goshen, the western foothills, the Arabah and the mountains of Israel with their foothills,"
JOS	11	17	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7685	" {17} from Mount Halak, which rises toward Seir, to Baal Gad in the Valley of Lebanon below Mount Hermon."
JOS	11	17	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7686	" He captured all their kings and struck them down, putting them to death. {18} Joshua waged war against all these kings for a long time."
JOS	11	19	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7687	" {19} Except for the Hivites living in Gibeon, not one city made a treaty of peace with the Israelites, who took them all in battle."
JOS	11	20	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7688	" {20} For it was the Lord himself who hardened their hearts to wage war against Israel, so that he might destroy them totally, exterminating them without mercy, as the Lord had commanded Moses."
JOS	11	21	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7689	 {21} At that time Joshua went and destroyed the Anakites from the hill country:
JOS	11	21	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7690	" from Hebron, Debir and Anab, from all the hill country of Judah, and from all the hill country of Israel. Joshua totally destroyed them and their towns."
JOS	11	22	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7691	" {22} No Anakites were left in Israelite territory; only in Gaza, Gath and Ashdod did any survive."
JOS	11	23	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7692	" {23} So Joshua took the entire land, just as the Lord had directed Moses, and he gave it as an inheritance to Israel according to their tribal divisions. Then the land had rest from war.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"

JOS	14	7	Caleb	#17		7773	 And I brought him back a report according to my convictions.
JOS	14	8	Caleb	#17		7774	 {8} But my brothers who went up with me made the hearts of the people melt with fear.
JOS	14	8	Caleb	#17		7775	" I, however, followed the Lord my God wholeheartedly."

JOS	14	10	Caleb	#17		7778	" {10} Now then, just as the Lord promised, he has kept me alive for forty-five years since the time he said this to Moses, while Israel moved about in the desert."
JOS	14	10	Caleb	#17		7779	" So here I am today, eighty-five years old!"
JOS	14	11	Caleb	#17		7780	 {11} I am still as strong today as the day Moses sent me out; I'm just as vigorous to go out to battle now as I was then.
JOS	14	12	Caleb	#17		7781	 {12} Now give me this hill country that the Lord promised me that day.
JOS	14	12	Caleb	#17		7782	" You yourself heard then that the Anakites were there and their cities were large and fortified, but, the Lord helping me, I will drive them out just as he said.>>"

JOS	15	63	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7860	" {63} Judah could not dislodge the Jebusites, who were living in Jerusalem ; to this day the Jebusites live there with the people of Judah.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"

JOS	18	<<	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7909	JOSHUA 18

JOS	18	4	Joshua	#13		7914	" I will send them out to make a survey of the land and to write a description of it, according to the inheritance of each. Then they will return to me."
JOS	18	5	Joshua	#13		7915	 {5} You are to divide the land into seven parts. Judah is to remain in its territory on the south and the house of Joseph in its territory on the north.
JOS	18	6	Joshua	#13		7916	" {6} After you have written descriptions of the seven parts of the land, bring them here to me and I will cast lots for you in the presence of the Lord our God."

JOS	18	9	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		7922	" {9} So the men left and went through the land. They wrote its description on a scroll, town by town, in seven parts, and returned to Joshua in the camp at Shiloh."

JOS	20	<<	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		8009	JOSHUA 20
JOS	20	1	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		8010	 {1} Then the Lord said to Joshua:
JOS	20	2	God-FX1	#20		8011	" {2} << Tell the Israelites to designate the cities of refuge, as I instructed you through Moses,"
JOS	20	3	God-FX1	#20		8012	 {3} so that anyone who kills a person accidentally and unintentionally may flee there and find protection from the avenger of blood.
JOS	20	4	God-FX1	#20		8013	" {4} ôWhen he flees to one of these cities, he is to stand in the entrance of the city gate and state his case before the elders of that city."
JOS	20	4	God-FX1	#20		8014	 Then they are to admit him into their city and give him a place to live with them.
JOS	20	5	God-FX1	#20		8015	" {5} If the avenger of blood pursues him, they must not surrender the one accused, because he killed his neighbor unintentionally and without malice aforethought."
JOS	20	6	God-FX1	#20		8016	 {6} He is to stay in that city until he has stood trial before the assembly and until the death of the high priest who is serving at that time.
JOS	20	6	God-FX1	#20		8017	 Then he may go back to his own home in the town from which he fled.>>
JOS	20	7	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		8018	" {7} So they set apart Kedesh in Galilee in the hill country of Naphtali, Shechem in the hill country of Ephraim, and Kiriath Arba (that is, Hebron ) in the hill country of Judah."

JOS	20	9	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		8021	 {9} Any of the Israelites or any alien living among them who killed someone accidentally could flee to these designated cities and not be killed by the avenger of blood prior to standing trial before the assembly. *~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
JOS	21	<<	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		8022	JOSHUA 21
JOS	21	1	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		8023	" {1} Now the family heads of the Levites approached Eleazar the priest, Joshua son of Nun, and the heads of the other tribal families of Israel {2} at Shiloh in Canaan and said to them,"
JOS	21	2	Levite	#15		8024	" << The Lord commanded through Moses that you give us towns to live in, with pasturelands for our livestock.>>"
JOS	21	3	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		8025	" {3} So, as the Lord had commanded, the Israelites gave the Levites the following towns and pasturelands out of their own inheritance:"
JOS	21	4	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		8026	" {4} The first lot came out for the Kohathites, clan by clan."
JOS	21	4	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		8027	" The Levites who were descendants of Aaron the priest were allotted thirteen towns from the tribes of Judah, Simeon and Benjamin."
JOS	21	5	Joshua	#13		8028	" {5} The rest of Kohath's descendants were allotted ten towns from the clans of the tribes of Ephraim, Dan and half of Manasseh."
JOS	21	6	Joshua	#13		8029	" {6} The descendants of Gershon were allotted thirteen towns from the clans of the tribes of Issachar, Asher, Naphtali and the half-tribe of Manasseh in Bashan."

JOS	23	5	Joshua	#13		8124	" {5} The Lord your God himself will drive them out of your way. He will push them out before you, and you will take possession of their land, as the Lord your God promised you."

JOS	23	7	Joshua	#13		8126	 {7} Do not associate with these nations that remain among you; do not invoke the names of their gods or swear by them. You must not serve them or bow down to them.

JOS	23	9	Joshua	#13		8128	 {9} <<The Lord has driven out before you great and powerful nations; to this day no one has been able to withstand you.
JOS	23	10	Joshua	#13		8129	" {10} One of you routs a thousand, because the Lord your God fights for you, just as he promised. {11} So be very careful to love the Lord your God."

JOS	23	13	Joshua	#13		8132	" Instead, they will become snares and traps for you, whips on your backs and thorns in your eyes, until you perish from this good land, which the Lord your God has given you."

JOS	23	15	Joshua	#13		8135	" {15} But just as every good promise of the Lord your God has come true, so the Lord will bring on you all the evil he has threatened, until he has destroyed you from this good land he has given you."

JOS	24	<<	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		8137	JOSHUA 24

JOS	24	2	Joshua	#13		8140	" << This is what the Lord, the God of Israel, says:"
JOS	24	2	God-FX1	#20		8141	" Æ Long ago your forefathers, including Terah the father of Abraham and Nahor, lived beyond the River and worshiped other gods."

JOS	24	3	God-FX1	#20		8143	" I gave him Isaac, {4} and to Isaac I gave Jacob and Esau. I assigned the hill country of Seir to Esau, but Jacob and his sons went down to Egypt."
JOS	24	5	God-FX1	#20		8144	" {5} ô æThen I sent Moses and Aaron, and I afflicted the Egyptians by what I did there, and I brought you out."
JOS	24	6	God-FX1	#20		8145	" {6} When I brought your fathers out of Egypt, you came to the sea, and the Egyptians pursued them with chariots and horsemen as far as the Red Sea."
JOS	24	7	God-FX1	#20		8146	" {7} But they cried to the Lord for help, and he put darkness between you and the Egyptians; he brought the sea over them and covered them."
JOS	24	7	God-FX1	#20		8147	 You saw with your own eyes what I did to the Egyptians. Then you lived in the desert for a long time.

JOS	24	8	God-FX1	#20		8149	" They fought against you, but I gave them into your hands. I destroyed them from before you, and you took possession of their land."

JOS	24	13	God-FX1	#20		8157	 and you live in them and eat from vineyards and olive groves that you did not plant.Æ
JOS	24	14	Joshua	#13		8158	" {14} << Now fear the Lord and serve him with all faithfulness. Throw away the gods your forefathers worshiped beyond the River and in Egypt, and serve the Lord."
JOS	24	15	Joshua	#13		8159	" {15} But if serving the Lord seems undesirable to you, then choose for yourselves this day whom you will serve, whether the gods your forefathers served beyond the River, or the gods of the Amorites, in whose land you are living."
JOS	24	15	Joshua	#13		8160	" But as for me and my household, we will serve the Lord.>>"
JOS	24	16	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		8161	" {16} Then the people answered,"

JOS	24	19	Joshua	#13		8167	 << You are not able to serve the Lord. He is a holy God; he is a jealous God. He will not forgive your rebellion and your sins.

JOS	24	30	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		8184	" {30} And they buried him in the land of his inheritance, at Timnath Serah in the hill country of Ephraim, north of Mount Gaash."
JOS	24	31	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		8185	 {31} Israel served the Lord throughout the lifetime of Joshua and of the elders who outlived him and who had experienced everything the Lord had done for Israel.
JOS	24	32	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		8186	" {32} And Joseph's bones, which the Israelites had brought up from Egypt, were buried at Shechem in the tract of land that Jacob bought for a hundred pieces of silver from the sons of Hamor, the father of Shechem."
JOS	24	32	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		8187	 This became the inheritance of Joseph's descendants.
JOS	24	33	Narr_06: Joshua	#09		8188	" {33} And Eleazar son of Aaron died and was buried at Gibeah, which had been allotted to his son Phinehas in the hill country of Ephraim.*~**~*||||| + 5 SECs |||||*~*"
JUD	1	<<	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8189	JUDGES*~*JUDGES 1
JUD	1	1	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8190	" {1} After the death of Joshua, the Israelites asked the Lord,"
JUD	1	1	Israelite	#04		8191	 << Who will be the first to go up and fight for us against the Canaanites?>>
JUD	1	2	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8192	" {2} The Lord answered,"
JUD	1	2	God-FX1	#20		8193	 << Judah is to go; I have given the land into their hands.>>
JUD	1	3	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8194	" {3} Then the men of Judah said to the Simeonites their brothers,"
JUD	1	3	Soldier	#03		8195	" << Come up with us into the territory allotted to us, to fight against the Canaanites. We in turn will go with you into yours.>>"
JUD	1	3	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8196	 So the Simeonites went with them.
JUD	1	4	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8197	" {4} When Judah attacked, the Lord gave the Canaanites and Perizzites into their hands and they struck down ten thousand men at Bezek."
JUD	1	5	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8198	" {5} It was there that they found Adoni-Bezek and fought against him, putting to rout the Canaanites and Perizzites."
JUD	1	6	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8199	" {6} Adoni-Bezek fled, but they chased him and caught him, and cut off his thumbs and big toes. {7} Then Adoni-Bezek said,"
JUD	1	7	Adoni-Bezek	#15		8200	 << Seventy kings with their thumbs and big toes cut off have picked up scraps under my table. Now God has paid me back for what I did to them.>>
JUD	1	7	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8201	" They brought him to Jerusalem , and he died there. {8} The men of Judah attacked Jerusalem also and took it. They put the city to the sword and set it on fire."
JUD	1	9	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8202	" {9} After that, the men of Judah went down to fight against the Canaanites living in the hill country, the Negev and the western foothills."
JUD	1	10	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8203	" {10} They advanced against the Canaanites living in Hebron (formerly called Kiriath Arba ) and defeated Sheshai , Ahiman and Talmai."
JUD	1	11	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8204	" {11} From there they advanced against the people living in Debir (formerly called Kiriath Sepher ). {12} And Caleb said,"
JUD	1	12	Caleb	#17		8205	 << I will give my daughter Acsah in marriage to the man who attacks and captures Kiriath Sepher .>>
JUD	1	13	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8206	" {13} Othniel son of Kenaz , Caleb's younger brother, took it; so Caleb gave his daughter Acsah to him in marriage."
JUD	1	14	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8207	" {14} One day when she came to Othniel , she urged him to ask her father for a field. When she got off her donkey, Caleb asked her,"
JUD	1	14	Caleb	#17		8208	 << What can I do for you?>>
JUD	1	15	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8209	" {15} She replied,"
JUD	1	15	Acsah (female)	#23		8210	" << Do me a special favor. Since you have given me land in the Negev , give me also springs of water.>>"
JUD	1	15	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8211	 Then Caleb gave her the upper and lower springs.
JUD	1	16	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8212	" {16} The descendants of Moses' father-in-law, the Kenite , went up from the City of Palms with the men of Judah to live among the people of the Desert of Judah in the Negev near Arad."
JUD	1	17	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8213	" {17} Then the men of Judah went with the Simeonites their brothers and attacked the Canaanites living in Zephath , and they totally destroyed the city. Therefore it was called Hormah."
JUD	1	18	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8214	" {18} The men of Judah also took Gaza , Ashkelon and Ekron --each city with its territory."
JUD	1	19	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8215	" {19} The Lord was with the men of Judah. They took possession of the hill country, but they were unable to drive the people from the plains, because they had iron chariots."
JUD	1	20	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8216	" {20} As Moses had promised, Hebron was given to Caleb, who drove from it the three sons of Anak."
JUD	1	21	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8217	" {21} The Benjamites, however, failed to dislodge the Jebusites, who were living in Jerusalem ; to this day the Jebusites live there with the Benjamites."
JUD	1	22	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8218	" {22} Now the house of Joseph attacked Bethel , and the Lord was with them."
JUD	1	23	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8219	" {23} When they sent sent men to spy out Bethel (formerly called Luz), {24} the spies saw a man coming out of the city and they said to him,"
JUD	1	24	Israelite	#12		8220	 << Show us how to get into the city and we will see that you are treated well.>>
JUD	1	25	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8221	" {25} So he showed them, and they put the city to the sword but spared the man and his whole family."
JUD	1	26	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8222	" {26} He then went to the land of the Hittites, where he built a city and called it Luz, which is its name to this day."
JUD	1	27	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8223	" {27} But Manasseh did not drive out the people of Beth Shan or Taanach or Dor or Ibleam or Megiddo and their surrounding settlements, for the Canaanites were determined to live in that land."
JUD	1	28	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8224	" {28} When Israel became strong, they pressed the Canaanites into forced labor but never drove them out completely."
JUD	1	29	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8225	" {29} Nor did Ephraim drive out the Canaanites living in Gezer , but the Canaanites continued to live there among them."
JUD	1	30	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8226	" {30} Neither did Zebulun drive out the Canaanites living in Kitron or Nahalol , who remained among them; but they did subject them to forced labor."
JUD	1	31	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8227	" {31} Nor did Asher drive out those living in Acco or Sidon or Ahlab or Aczib or Helbah or Aphek or Rehob ,"
JUD	1	32	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8228	 {32} and because of this the people of Asher lived among the Canaanite inhabitants of the land.
JUD	1	33	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8229	 {33} Neither did Naphtali drive out those living in Beth Shemesh or Beth Anath;
JUD	1	33	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8230	" but the Naphtalites too lived among the Canaanite inhabitants of the land, and those living in Beth Shemesh and Beth Anath became forced laborers for them."
JUD	1	34	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8231	" {34} The Amorites confined the Danites to the hill country, not allowing them to come down into the plain."
JUD	1	35	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8232	" {35} And the Amorites were determined also to hold out in Mount Heres , Aijalon and Shaalbim , but when the power of the house of Joseph increased, they too were pressed into forced labor."

JUD	2	<<	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8234	JUDGES 2
JUD	2	1	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8235	" {1} The angel of the Lord went up from Gilgal to Bokim and said,"

JUD	2	1	Angel-FX1	#10		8237	" I said, 'I will never break my covenant with you, {2} and you shall not make a covenant with the people of this land, but you shall break down their altars.'"
JUD	2	2	Angel-FX1	#10		8238	 Yet you have disobeyed me. Why have you done this?
JUD	2	3	Angel-FX1	#10		8239	 {3} Now therefore I tell you that I will not drive them out before you; they will be thorns in your sides and their gods will be a snare to you.>>
JUD	2	4	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8240	" {4} When the angel of the Lord had spoken these things to all the Israelites, the people wept aloud, {5} and they called that place Bokim. There they offered sacrifices to the Lord."
JUD	2	6	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8241	" {6} After Joshua had dismissed the Israelites, they went to take possession of the land, each to his own inheritance."
JUD	2	7	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8242	 {7} The people served the Lord throughout the lifetime of Joshua and of the elders who outlived him and who had seen all the great things the Lord had done for Israel.
JUD	2	8	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8243	" {8} Joshua son of Nun, the servant of the Lord, died at the age of a hundred and ten."
JUD	2	9	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8244	" {9} And they buried him in the land of his inheritance, at Timnath Heres in the hill country of Ephraim , north of Mount Gaash."
JUD	2	10	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8245	" {10} After that whole generation had been gathered to their fathers, another generation grew up, who knew neither the Lord nor what he had done for Israel."
JUD	2	11	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8246	 {11} Then the Israelites did evil in the eyes of the Lord and served the Baals.
JUD	2	12	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8247	" {12} They forsook the Lord, the God of their fathers, who had brought them out of Egypt."
JUD	2	12	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8248	 They followed and worshiped various gods of the peoples around them. They provoked the Lord to anger {13} because they forsook him and served Baal and the Ashtoreths.
JUD	2	14	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8249	" {14} In his anger against Israel the Lord handed them over to raiders who plundered them. He sold them to their enemies all around, whom they were no longer able to resist."
JUD	2	15	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8250	" {15} Whenever Israel went out to fight, the hand of the Lord was against them to defeat them, just as he had sworn to them. They were in great distress."
JUD	2	16	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8251	" {16} Then the Lord raised up judges, who saved them out of the hands of these raiders."
JUD	2	17	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8252	 {17} Yet they would not listen to their judges but prostituted themselves to other gods and worshiped them.
JUD	2	17	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8253	" Unlike their fathers, they quickly turned from the way in which their fathers had walked, the way of obedience to the Lord's commands."
JUD	2	18	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8254	" {18} Whenever the Lord raised up a judge for them, he was with the judge and saved them out of the hands of their enemies as long as the judge lived;"
JUD	2	18	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8255	 for the Lord had compassion on them as they groaned under those who oppressed and afflicted them.
JUD	2	19	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8256	" {19} But when the judge died, the people returned to ways even more corrupt than those of their fathers, following other gods and serving and worshiping them."
JUD	2	19	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8257	" They refused to give up their evil practices and stubborn ways. {20} Therefore the Lord was very angry with Israel and said,"
JUD	2	20	God-FX1	#20		8258	" << Because this nation has violated the covenant that I laid down for their forefathers and has not listened to me,"
JUD	2	21	God-FX1	#20		8259	 {21} I will no longer drive out before them any of the nations Joshua left when he died.
JUD	2	22	God-FX1	#20		8260	 {22} I will use them to test Israel and see whether they will keep the way of the Lord and walk in it as their forefathers did.>>

JUD	3	19	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8284	" The king said,"

JUD	3	19	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8286	" And all his attendants left him. {20} Ehud then approached him while he was sitting alone in the upper room of his summer palace and said,"
JUD	3	20	Ehud	#05		8287	 << I have a message from God for you.>>
JUD	3	20	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8288	" As the king rose from his seat, {21} Ehud reached with his left hand, drew the sword from his right thigh and plunged it into the king's belly."
JUD	3	22	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8289	" {22} Even the handle sank in after the blade, which came out his back. Ehud did not pull the sword out, and the fat closed in over it."
JUD	3	23	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8290	 {23} Then Ehud went out to the porch; he shut the doors of the upper room behind him and locked them.
JUD	3	24	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8291	" {24} After he had gone, the servants came and found the doors of the upper room locked. They said,"
JUD	3	24	Servant	#18		8292	 << He must be relieving himself in the inner room of the house.>>
JUD	3	25	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8293	" {25} They waited to the point of embarrassment, but when he did not open the doors of the room, they took a key and unlocked them. There they saw their lord fallen to the floor, dead."
JUD	3	26	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8294	" {26} While they waited, Ehud got away. He passed by the idols and escaped to Seirah."
JUD	3	27	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8295	" {27} When he arrived there, he blew a trumpet in the hill country of Ephraim , and the Israelites went down with him from the hills, with him leading them."
JUD	3	28	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8296	" {28} He ordered,"

JUD	3	28	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8298	" So they followed him down and, taking possession of the fords of the Jordan that led to Moab , they allowed no one to cross over."
JUD	3	29	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8299	" {29} At that time they struck down about ten thousand Moabites, all vigorous and strong; not a man escaped."
JUD	3	30	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8300	" {30} That day Moab was made subject to Israel , and the land had peace for eighty years."

JUD	4	3	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8305	" {3} Because he had nine hundred iron chariots and had cruelly oppressed the Israelites for twenty years, they cried to the Lord for help."
JUD	4	4	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8306	" {4} Deborah, a prophetess, the wife of Lappidoth , was leading Israel at that time."
JUD	4	5	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8307	" {5} She held court under the Palm of Deborah between Ramah and Bethel in the hill country of Ephraim , and the Israelites came to her to have their disputes decided."

JUD	4	7	Deborah (female)	#22		8310	" {7} I will lure Sisera , the commander of Jabin's army, with his chariots and his troops to the Kishon River and give him into your hands.' >>"

JUD	4	9	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8313	" {9} Deborah said,"
JUD	4	9	Deborah (female)	#22		8314	" << Very well, I will go with you. But because of the way you are going about this, the honor will not be yours, for the Lord will hand Sisera over to a woman.>>"
JUD	4	9	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8315	" So Deborah went with Barak to Kedesh , {10} where he summoned Zebulun and Naphtali. Ten thousand men followed him, and Deborah also went with him."
JUD	4	11	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8316	" {11} Now Heber the Kenite had left the other Kenites, the descendants of Hobab, Moses' brother-in-law, and pitched his tent by the great tree in Zaanannim near Kedesh."
JUD	4	12	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8317	" {12} They told Sisera, << Barak son of Abinoam has gone up to Mount Tabor.>>"
JUD	4	13	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8318	" {13} So Sisera gathered together his nine hundred iron chariots and all the men with him, from Harosheth Haggoyim to the Kishon River. {14} Then Deborah said to Barak,"

JUD	4	14	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8320	" So Barak went down Mount Tabor , followed by ten thousand men."
