JUD	4	16	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8322	 {16} But Barak pursued the chariots and army as far as Harosheth Haggoyim. All the troops of Sisera fell by the sword; not a man was left.
JUD	4	17	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8323	" {17} Sisera, however, fled on foot to the tent of Jael, the wife of Heber the Kenite, because there were friendly relations between Jabin king of Hazor and the clan of Heber the Kenite."
JUD	4	18	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8324	" {18} Jael went out to meet Sisera and said to him,"
JUD	4	18	Jael (female)	#25		8325	" << Come, my lord, come right in. Don't be afraid.>>"
JUD	4	18	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8326	" So he entered her tent, and she put a covering over him. {19} He said,"
JUD	4	19	Sisera	#11		8327	 << I'm thirsty. Please give me some water.>>
JUD	4	19	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8328	" She opened a skin of milk, gave him a drink, and covered him up. {20} He told her,"
JUD	4	20	Sisera	#11		8329	" << Stand in the doorway of the tent. If someone comes by and asks you, 'Is anyone here?' say 'No!' >>"
JUD	4	21	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8330	" {21} But Jael, Heber's wife, picked up a tent peg and a hammer and went quietly to him while he lay fast asleep, exhausted."
JUD	4	21	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8331	" She drove the peg through his temple into the ground, and he died."
JUD	4	22	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8332	" {22} Barak came by in pursuit of Sisera , and Jael went out to meet him."
JUD	4	22	Jael (female)	#25		8333	 << Come. I will show you the man you're looking for.>>
JUD	4	22	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8334	" So he went in with her, and there lay Sisera with the tent peg through his temple--dead."
JUD	4	23	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8335	" {23} On that day God subdued Jabin , the Canaanite king, before the Israelites."
JUD	4	24	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8336	" {24} And the hand of the Israelites grew stronger and stronger against Jabin , the Canaanite king, until they destroyed him.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
JUD	5	<<	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8337	JUDGES 5
JUD	5	1	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8338	 {1} On that day Deborah and Barak son of Abinoam sang this song:
JUD	5	2	Deborah (female)	#22		8339	" {2} << When the princes in Israel take the lead, when the people willingly offer themselves-- praise the Lord!"
JUD	5	3	Deborah (female)	#22		8340	" {3} << Hear this, you kings! Listen, you rulers! I will sing to the Lord, I will sing; I will make music to the Lord, the God of Israel."
JUD	5	4	Barak	#13		8341	" {4} << O Lord, when you went out from Seir, when you marched from the land of Edom, the earth shook, the heavens poured, the clouds poured down water."
JUD	5	5	Barak	#13		8342	" {5} The mountains quaked before the Lord, the One of Sinai , before the Lord, the God of Israel."
JUD	5	6	Deborah (female)	#22		8343	" {6} << In the days of Shamgar son of Anath , in the days of Jael , the roads were abandoned; travelers took to winding paths."
JUD	5	7	Deborah (female)	#22		8344	" {7} Village life in Israel ceased, ceased until I, Deborah, arose, arose a mother in Israel."
JUD	5	8	Deborah (female)	#22		8345	" {8} When they chose new gods, war came to the city gates, and not a shield or spear was seen among forty thousand in Israel."
JUD	5	9	Deborah (female)	#22		8346	" {9} My heart is with Israel's princes, with the willing volunteers among the people. Praise the Lord!"
JUD	5	10	Deborah (female)	#22		8347	" {10} << You who ride on white donkeys, sitting on your saddle blankets, and you who walk along the road, consider {11} the voice of the singers at the watering places."
JUD	5	11	Deborah (female)	#22		8348	" They recite the righteous acts of the Lord, the righteous acts of his warriors in Israel. <<Then the people of the Lord went down to the city gates."

JUD	8	21	King Zebah	#17		8519	" << Come, do it yourself. 'As is the man, so is his strength.'>>"
JUD	8	21	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8520	" So Gideon stepped forward and killed them, and took the ornaments off their camels' necks. {22} The Israelites said to Gideon,"
JUD	8	22	Israelite	#03		8521	" << Rule over us--you, your son and your grandson--because you have saved us out of the hand of Midian.>>"
JUD	8	23	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8522	" {23} But Gideon told them,"
JUD	8	23	Gideon	#08		8523	" << I will not rule over you, nor will my son rule over you. The Lord will rule over you."
JUD	8	24	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8524	" {24} And he said,"
JUD	8	24	Gideon	#08		8525	" << I do have one request, that each of you give me an earring from your share of the plunder.>>"
JUD	8	24	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8526	" (It was the custom of the Ishmaelites to wear gold earrings.) {25} They answered,"
JUD	8	25	Israelite	#16		8527	 << We'll be glad to give them.>>
JUD	8	25	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8528	" So they spread out a garment, and each man threw a ring from his plunder onto it."
JUD	8	26	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8529	" {26} The weight of the gold rings he asked for came to seventeen hundred shekels,"
JUD	8	26	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8530	" not counting the ornaments, the pendants and the purple garments worn by the kings of Midian or the chains that were on their camels' necks."
JUD	8	27	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8531	" {27} Gideon made the gold into an ephod , which he placed in Ophrah , his town."
JUD	8	27	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8532	" All Israel prostituted themselves by worshiping it there, and it became a snare to Gideon and his family."
JUD	8	28	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8533	" {28} Thus Midian was subdued before the Israelites and did not raise its head again. During Gideon's lifetime, the land enjoyed peace forty years."
JUD	8	29	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8534	" {29} Jerub-Baal son of Joash went back home to live. {30} He had seventy sons of his own, for he had many wives."
JUD	8	31	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8535	" {31} His concubine, who lived in Shechem, also bore him a son, whom he named Abimelech."
JUD	8	32	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8536	 {32} Gideon son of Joash died at a good old age and was buried in the tomb of his father Joash in Ophrah of the Abiezrites.
JUD	8	33	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8537	 {33} No sooner had Gideon died than the Israelites again prostituted themselves to the Baals.
JUD	8	33	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8538	" They set up Baal-Berith as their god {34} and did not remember the Lord their God, who had rescued them from the hands of all their enemies on every side."
JUD	8	35	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8539	" {35} They also failed to show kindness to the family of Jerub-Baal (that is, Gideon ) for all the good things he had done for them.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"

JUD	9	3	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8543	" {3} When the brothers repeated all this to the citizens of Shechem, they were inclined to follow Abimelech , for they said,"

JUD	9	6	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8547	 {6} Then all the citizens of Shechem and Beth Millo gathered beside the great tree at the pillar in Shechem to crown Abimelech king.

JUD	9	8	Jotham	#12		8550	" {8} One day the trees went out to anoint a king for themselves. They said to the olive tree, 'Be our king.'"
JUD	9	9	Jotham	#12		8551	" {9} << But the olive tree answered, 'Should I give up my oil, by which both gods and men are honored, to hold sway over the trees?'"
JUD	9	10	Jotham	#12		8552	" {10} << Next, the trees said to the fig tree, 'Come and be our king.'"
JUD	9	11	Jotham	#12		8553	" {11} << But the fig tree replied, 'Should I give up my fruit, so good and sweet, to hold sway over the trees?'"
JUD	9	12	Jotham	#12		8554	" {12} << Then the trees said to the vine, 'Come and be our king.'"
JUD	9	13	Jotham	#12		8555	" {13} << But the vine answered, 'Should I give up my wine, which cheers both gods and men, to hold sway over the trees?'"
JUD	9	14	Jotham	#12		8556	" {14} << Finally all the trees said to the thornbush, 'Come and be our king.'"
JUD	9	15	Jotham	#12		8557	" {15} << The thornbush said to the trees, 'If you really want to anoint me king over you, come and take refuge in my shade;"

JUD	9	25	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8569	" {25} In opposition to him these citizens of Shechem set men on the hilltops to ambush and rob everyone who passed by, and this was reported to Abimelech."

JUD	9	34	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8581	 {34} So Abimelech and all his troops set out by night and took up concealed positions near Shechem in four companies.
JUD	9	35	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8582	 {35} Now Gaal son of Ebed had gone out and was standing at the entrance to the city gate just as Abimelech and his soldiers came out from their hiding place.

JUD	9	41	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8593	" {41} Abimelech stayed in Arumah , and Zebul drove Gaal and his brothers out of Shechem."

JUD	9	44	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8596	 {44} Abimelech and the companies with him rushed forward to a position at the entrance to the city gate. Then two companies rushed upon those in the fields and struck them down.
JUD	9	45	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8597	 {45} All that day Abimelech pressed his attack against the city until he had captured it and killed its people. Then he destroyed the city and scattered salt over it.

JUD	11	17	Messenger	#03		8663	" They sent also to the king of Moab , and he refused. So Israel stayed at Kadesh."

JUD	11	28	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8677	" {28} The king of Ammon , however, paid no attention to the message Jephthah sent him."

JUD	11	29	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8679	" He crossed Gilead and Manasseh, passed through Mizpah of Gilead, and from there he advanced against the Ammonites."
JUD	11	30	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8680	 {30} And Jephthah made a vow to the Lord:
JUD	11	30	Jephthah	#07		8681	" << If you give the Ammonites into my hands,"
JUD	11	31	Jephthah	#07		8682	" {31} whatever comes out of the door of my house to meet me when I return in triumph from the Ammonites will be the Lord's, and I will sacrifice it as a burnt offering.>>"
JUD	11	32	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8683	" {32} Then Jephthah went over to fight the Ammonites, and the Lord gave them into his hands."
JUD	11	33	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8684	" {33} He devastated twenty towns from Aroer to the vicinity of Minnith , as far as Abel Keramim. Thus Israel subdued Ammon."
JUD	11	34	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8685	" {34} When Jephthah returned to his home in Mizpah , who should come out to meet him but his daughter, dancing to the sound of tambourines!"
JUD	11	34	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8686	" She was an only child. Except for her he had neither son nor daughter. {35} When he saw her, he tore his clothes and cried,"
JUD	11	35	Jephthah	#07		8687	" << Oh! My daughter! You have made me miserable and wretched, because I have made a vow to the Lord that I cannot break.>>"
JUD	11	36	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8688	" {36} She replied,"
JUD	11	36	Daughter	#25		8689	" << My father, you have given your word to the Lord. Do to me just as you promised, now that the Lord has avenged you of your enemies, the Ammonites."
JUD	11	37	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8690	" {37} Then she said,"
JUD	11	37	Daughter	#25		8691	" But grant me this one request. Give me two months to roam the hills and weep with my friends, because I will never marry.>>"
JUD	11	38	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8692	" {38} He said,"
JUD	11	38	Jephthah	#07		8693	" << You may go,>>"
JUD	11	38	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8694	 And he let her go for two months. She and the girls went into the hills and wept because she would never marry.
JUD	11	39	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8695	" {39} After the two months, she returned to her father and he did to her as he had vowed. And she was a virgin."
JUD	11	39	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8696	 From this comes the Israelite custom {40} that each year the young women of Israel go out for four days to commemorate the daughter of Jephthah the Gileadite.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*

JUD	15	18	Samson	#06		8848	 << You have given your servant this great victory. Must I now die of thirst and fall into the hands of the uncircumcised?>>
JUD	15	19	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8849	" {19} Then God opened up the hollow place in Lehi Lehi , and water came out of it."
JUD	15	19	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8850	" When Samson drank, his strength returned and he revived. So the spring was called En Hakkore , and it it is still there in Lehi."

JUD	16	<<	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8852	JUDGES 16

JUD	16	7	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8866	" {7} Samson answered her,"
JUD	16	7	Samson	#06		8867	" << If anyone ties me with seven fresh thongs that have not been dried, I'll become as weak as any other man.>>"
JUD	16	8	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8868	" {8} Then the rulers of the Philistines brought her seven fresh thongs that had not been dried, and she tied him with them."
JUD	16	9	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8869	" {9} With men hidden in the room, she called to him,"
JUD	16	9	Delilah (female)	#23		8870	" << Samson, the Philistines are upon you!>>"
JUD	16	9	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8871	 But he snapped the thongs as easily as a piece of string snaps when it comes close to a flame. So the secret of his strength was not discovered.
JUD	16	10	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8872	" {10} Then Delilah said to Samson,"
JUD	16	10	Delilah (female)	#23		8873	" << You have made a fool of me; you lied to me. Come now, tell me how you can be tied.>>"
JUD	16	11	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8874	" {11} He said,"
JUD	16	11	Samson	#06		8875	" << If anyone ties me securely with new ropes that have never been used, I'll become as weak as any other man.>>"
JUD	16	12	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8876	" {12} So Delilah took new ropes and tied him with them. Then, with men hidden in the room, she called to him,"
JUD	16	12	Delilah (female)	#23		8877	" << Samson, the Philistines are upon you!>>"
JUD	16	12	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8878	" But he snapped the ropes off his arms as if they were threads. {13} Delilah then said to Samson,"
JUD	16	13	Delilah (female)	#23		8879	" << Until now, you have been making a fool of me and lying to me. Tell me how you can be tied.>>"
JUD	16	13	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8880	" He replied,"
JUD	16	13	Samson	#06		8881	" << If you weave the seven braids of my head into the fabric on the loom and tighten it with the pin, I'll become as weak as any other man.>>"
JUD	16	14	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8882	" {14} So while he was sleeping, Delilah took the seven braids of his head, wove them into the fabric and tightened it with the pin. Again she called to him,"
JUD	16	14	Delilah (female)	#23		8883	" << Samson, the Philistines are upon you!>>"
JUD	16	14	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8884	" He awoke from his sleep and pulled up the pin and the loom, with the fabric. {15} Then she said to him,"
JUD	16	15	Delilah (female)	#23		8885	" << How can you say, 'I love you,' when you won't confide in me?"
JUD	16	15	Delilah (female)	#23		8886	 This is the third time you have made a fool of me and haven't told me the secret of your great strength.>>
JUD	16	16	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8887	" {16} With such nagging she prodded him day after day until he was tired to death. {17} So he told her everything. He said,"
JUD	16	17	Samson	#06		8888	" << No razor has ever been used on my head, because I have been a Nazirite set apart to God since birth."
JUD	16	17	Samson	#06		8889	" If my head were shaved, my strength would leave me, and I would become as weak as any other man.>>"
JUD	16	18	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8890	" {18} When Delilah saw that he had told her everything, she sent word to the rulers of the Philistines,"
JUD	16	18	Delilah (female)	#23		8891	 << Come back once more; he has told me everything.>>
JUD	16	18	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8892	 So the rulers of the Philistines returned with the silver in their hands.
JUD	16	19	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8893	" {19} Having put him to sleep on her lap, she called a man to shave off the seven braids of his hair, and so began to subdue him."
JUD	16	19	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8894	" And his strength left him. {20} Then she called,"
JUD	16	20	Delilah (female)	#23		8895	" << Samson, the Philistines are upon you!>>"
JUD	16	20	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8896	" He awoke from his sleep and thought,"
JUD	16	20	Samson	#06		8897	 << I'll go out as before and shake myself free.>>
JUD	16	20	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8898	 But he did not know that the Lord had left him.
JUD	16	21	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8899	" {21} Then the Philistines seized him, gouged out his eyes and took him down to Gaza. Binding him with bronze shackles, they set him to grinding in the prison."
JUD	16	22	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8900	 {22} But the hair on his head began to grow again after it had been shaved.
JUD	16	23	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8901	" {23} Now the rulers of the Philistines assembled to offer a great sacrifice to Dagon their god and to celebrate, saying,"
JUD	16	23	Philistine Ruler	#03		8902	" << Our god has delivered Samson, our enemy, into our hands.>>"
JUD	16	24	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8903	" {24} When the people saw him, they praised their god, saying,"
JUD	16	24	Philistine	#08		8904	" << Our god has delivered our enemy into our hands, the one who laid waste our land and multiplied our slain.>>"
JUD	16	25	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8905	" {25} While they were in high spirits, they shouted,"
JUD	16	25	Philistine	#08		8906	 << Bring out Samson to entertain us.>>
JUD	16	25	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8907	" So they called Samson out of the prison, and he performed for them. When they stood him among the pillars, {26} Samson said to the servant who held his hand,"
JUD	16	26	Samson	#06		8908	" << Put me where I can feel the pillars that support the temple, so that I may lean against them.>>"
JUD	16	27	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8909	 {27} Now the temple was crowded with men and women;
JUD	16	27	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8910	" all the rulers of the Philistines were there, and on the roof were about three thousand men and women watching Samson perform."
JUD	16	28	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8911	" {28} Then Samson prayed to the Lord,"
JUD	16	28	Samson	#06		8912	" << O Sovereign Lord, remember me. O God, please strengthen me just once more, and let me with one blow get revenge on the Philistines for my two eyes.>>"
JUD	16	29	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8913	 {29} Then Samson reached toward the two central pillars on which the temple stood.
JUD	16	29	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8914	" Bracing himself against them, his right hand on the one and his left hand on the other, {30} Samson said,"
JUD	16	30	Samson	#06		8915	 << Let me die with the Philistines!>>
JUD	16	30	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8916	" Then he pushed with all his might, and down came the temple on the rulers and all the people in it. Thus he killed many more when he died than while he lived."
JUD	16	31	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8917	 {31} Then his brothers and his father's whole family went down to get him.
JUD	16	31	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8918	 They brought him back and buried him between Zorah and Eshtaol in the tomb of Manoah his father. He had led Israel twenty years.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*

JUD	17	5	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8928	" {5} Now this man Micah had a shrine, and he made an ephod and some idols and installed one of his sons as his priest."

JUD	18	2	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8945	" The men entered the hill country of Ephraim and came to the house of Micah, where they spent the night."

JUD	18	7	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8954	" {7} So the five men left and came to Laish, where they saw that the people were living in safety, like the Sidonians, unsuspecting and secure."
JUD	18	7	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8955	" And since their land lacked nothing, they were prosperous. Also, they lived a long way from the Sidonians and had no relationship with anyone else."
JUD	18	8	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8956	" {8} When they returned to Zorah and Eshtaol , their brothers asked them,"

JUD	18	20	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8975	" {20} Then the priest was glad. He took the ephod , the other household gods and the carved image and went along with the people."

JUD	18	26	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8985	" {26} So the Danites went their way, and Micah, seeing that they were too strong for him, turned around and went back home."

JUD	18	27	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8987	 They attacked them with the sword and burned down their city.
JUD	18	28	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8988	 {28} There was no one to rescue them because they lived a long way from Sidon and had no relationship with anyone else.
JUD	18	28	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8989	 The city was in a valley near Beth Rehob. The Danites rebuilt the city and settled there.
JUD	18	29	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8990	" {29} They named it Dan after their forefather Dan, who was born to Israel --though the city used to be called Laish."

JUD	19	<<	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8993	JUDGES 19
JUD	19	1	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8994	 {1} In those days Israel had no king. Now a Levite who lived in a remote area in the hill country of Ephraim took a concubine from Bethlehem in Judah.
JUD	19	2	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8995	" {2} But she was unfaithful to him. She left him and went back to her father's house in Bethlehem, Judah."
JUD	19	2	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8996	" After she had been there four months, {3} her husband went to her to persuade her to return. He had with him his servant and two donkeys."
JUD	19	3	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8997	" She took him into her father's house, and when her father saw him, he gladly welcomed him."
JUD	19	4	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8998	" {4} His father-in-law, the girl's father, prevailed upon him to stay; so he remained with him three days, eating and drinking, and sleeping there."
JUD	19	5	Narr_07: Judges	#09		8999	" {5} On the fourth day they got up early and he prepared to leave, but the girl's father said to his son-in-law,"
JUD	19	5	Father in Law	#16		9000	 << Refresh yourself with something to eat; then you can go.>>
JUD	19	6	Narr_07: Judges	#09		9001	" {6} So the two of them sat down to eat and drink together. Afterward the girl's father said,"
JUD	19	6	Father in Law	#16		9002	 << Please stay tonight and enjoy yourself.>>
JUD	19	7	Narr_07: Judges	#09		9003	" {7} And when the man got up to go, his father-in-law persuaded him, so he stayed there that night."
JUD	19	8	Narr_07: Judges	#09		9004	" {8} On the morning of the fifth day, when he rose to go, the girl's father said,"
JUD	19	8	Father in Law	#16		9005	 << Refresh yourself. Wait till afternoon!>>
JUD	19	8	Narr_07: Judges	#09		9006	" So the two of them ate together. {9} Then when the man, with his concubine and his servant, got up to leave, his father-in-law, the girl's father, said,"
JUD	19	9	Father in Law	#16		9007	" << Now look, it's almost evening. Spend the night here; the day is nearly over."
JUD	19	9	Father in Law	#16		9008	 Stay and enjoy yourself. Early tomorrow morning you can get up and be on your way home.>>
JUD	19	10	Narr_07: Judges	#09		9009	" {10} But, unwilling to stay another night, the man left and went toward Jebus (that is, Jerusalem), with his two saddled donkeys and his concubine."
JUD	19	11	Narr_07: Judges	#09		9010	" {11} When they were near Jebus and the day was almost gone, the servant said to his master,"
JUD	19	11	Servant	#18		9011	" << Come, let's stop at this city of the Jebusites and spend the night.>>"
JUD	19	12	Narr_07: Judges	#09		9012	" {12} His master replied,"
JUD	19	12	Levite	#14		9013	" << No. We won't go into an alien city, whose people are not Israelites. We will go on to Gibeah.>>"
JUD	19	13	Narr_07: Judges	#09		9014	" {13} He added,"
JUD	19	13	Levite	#14		9015	" <<Come, let's try to reach Gibeah or Ramah and spend the night in one of those places.>>"
JUD	19	14	Narr_07: Judges	#09		9016	" {14} So they went on, and the sun set as they neared Gibeah in Benjamin."
JUD	19	15	Narr_07: Judges	#09		9017	" {15} There they stopped to spend the night. They went and sat in the city square, but no one took them into his home for the night."
JUD	19	16	Narr_07: Judges	#09		9018	" {16} That evening an old man from the hill country of Ephraim , who was living in Gibeah (the men of the place were Benjamites), came in from his work in the fields."
JUD	19	17	Narr_07: Judges	#09		9019	" {17} When he looked and saw the traveler in the city square, the old man asked,"
JUD	19	17	Man (old)	#05		9020	 << Where are you going? Where did you come from?>>
JUD	19	18	Narr_07: Judges	#09		9021	" {18} He answered,"
JUD	19	18	Levite	#14		9022	 << We are on our way from Bethlehem in Judah to a remote area in the hill country of Ephraim where I live.
JUD	19	18	Levite	#14		9023	 I have been to Bethlehem in Judah and now I am going to the house of the Lord. No one has taken me into his house.
JUD	19	19	Levite	#14		9024	" {19} We have both straw and fodder for our donkeys and bread and wine for ourselves your servants--me, your maidservant, and the young man with us."
JUD	19	19	Levite	#14		9025	 We don't need anything.>>
JUD	19	20	Narr_07: Judges	#09		9026	" {20} The old man said,"
JUD	19	20	Man (old)	#05		9027	 << You are welcome at my house. Let me supply whatever you need.
JUD	19	20	Man (old)	#05		9028	 Only don't spend the night in the square.>>
JUD	19	21	Narr_07: Judges	#09		9029	" {21} So he took him into his house and fed his donkeys. After they had washed their feet, they had something to eat and drink."
JUD	19	22	Narr_07: Judges	#09		9030	" {22} While they were enjoying themselves, some of the wicked men of the city surrounded the house. Pounding on the door, they shouted to the old man who owned the house,"
JUD	19	22	Benjamite	#12		9031	 << Bring out the man who came to your house so we can have sex with him.>>
JUD	19	23	Narr_07: Judges	#09		9032	" {23} The owner of the house went outside and said to them,"
JUD	19	23	Man (old)	#05		9033	" << No, my friends, don't be so vile. Since this man is my guest, don't do this disgraceful thing."
JUD	19	24	Man (old)	#05		9034	" {24} Look, here is my virgin daughter, and his concubine. I will bring them out to you now, and you can use them and do to them whatever you wish."
JUD	19	24	Man (old)	#05		9035	" But to this man, don't do such a disgraceful thing.>>"
JUD	19	25	Narr_07: Judges	#09		9036	 {25} But the men would not listen to him.
JUD	19	25	Narr_07: Judges	#09		9037	" So the man took his concubine and sent her outside to them, and they raped her and abused her throughout the night, and at dawn they let her go."
JUD	19	26	Narr_07: Judges	#09		9038	" {26} At daybreak the woman went back to the house where her master was staying, fell down at the door and lay there until daylight."
JUD	19	27	Narr_07: Judges	#09		9039	" {27} When her master got up in the morning and opened the door of the house and stepped out to continue on his way, there lay his concubine, fallen in the doorway of the house, with her hands on the threshold."
JUD	19	28	Narr_07: Judges	#09		9040	" {28} He said to her,"
JUD	19	28	Levite	#14		9041	 << Get up; let's go.>>
JUD	19	28	Narr_07: Judges	#09		9042	 But there was no answer. Then the man put her on his donkey and set out for home.
JUD	19	29	Narr_07: Judges	#09		9043	" {29} When he reached home, he took a knife and cut up his concubine, limb by limb, into twelve parts and sent them into all the areas of Israel."
JUD	19	30	Narr_07: Judges	#09		9044	" {30} Everyone who saw it said,"
JUD	19	30	Israelite	#15		9045	" << Such a thing has never been seen or done, not since the day the Israelites came up out of Egypt."
JUD	19	30	Israelite	#15		9046	 Think about it! Consider it! Tell us what to do!>> *~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*

RUT	2	14	Narr_08: Ruth	#24		9224	" {14} At mealtime Boaz said to her,"
RUT	2	14	Boaz	#07		9225	 << Come over here. Have some bread and dip it in the wine vinegar.>>
RUT	2	14	Narr_08: Ruth	#24		9226	" When she sat down with the harvesters, he offered her some roasted grain. She ate all she wanted and had some left over."
RUT	2	15	Narr_08: Ruth	#24		9227	" {15} As she got up to glean, Boaz gave orders to his men,"
RUT	2	15	Boaz	#07		9228	" << Even if she gathers among the sheaves, don't embarrass her."
RUT	2	16	Boaz	#07		9229	" {16} Rather, pull out some stalks for her from the bundles and leave them for her to pick up, and don't rebuke her.>>"
RUT	2	17	Narr_08: Ruth	#24		9230	" {17} So Ruth gleaned in the field until evening. Then she threshed the barley she had gathered, and it amounted to about an ephah."
RUT	2	18	Narr_08: Ruth	#24		9231	" {18} She carried it back to town, and her mother-in-law saw how much she had gathered."
RUT	2	18	Narr_08: Ruth	#24		9232	" Ruth also brought out and gave her what she had left over after she had eaten enough. {19} Her mother-in-law asked her,"
RUT	2	19	Naomi (female)	#22		9233	 << Where did you glean today? Where did you work? Blessed be the man who took notice of you!>>
RUT	2	19	Narr_08: Ruth	#24		9234	" Then Ruth told her mother-in-law about the one at whose place she had been working. She said,"
RUT	2	19	Ruth (female)	#23		9235	 << The name of the man I worked with today is Boaz.>>
RUT	2	20	Narr_08: Ruth	#24		9236	" {20} Naomi said,"
RUT	2	20	Naomi (female)	#22		9237	 << The Lord bless him! He has not stopped showing his kindness to the living and the dead.
RUT	2	20	Narr_08: Ruth	#24		9238	" She added,"
RUT	2	20	Naomi (female)	#22		9239	 << That man is our close relative; he is one of our kinsman-redeemers.>>
RUT	2	21	Narr_08: Ruth	#24		9240	" {21} Then Ruth the Moabitess said,"
RUT	2	21	Ruth (female)	#23		9241	" << He even said to me, 'Stay with my workers until they finish harvesting all my grain.'>>"
RUT	2	22	Narr_08: Ruth	#24		9242	" {22} Naomi said to Ruth her daughter-in-law,"
RUT	2	22	Naomi (female)	#22		9243	" << It will be good for you, my daughter, to go with his girls, because in someone else's field you might be harmed.>>"
RUT	2	23	Narr_08: Ruth	#24		9244	 {23} So Ruth stayed close to the servant girls of Boaz to glean until the barley and wheat harvests were finished. And she lived with her mother-in-law.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
RUT	3	<<	Narr_08: Ruth	#24		9245	RUTH 3

RUT	3	14	Narr_08: Ruth	#24		9270	" {14} So she lay at his feet until morning, but got up before anyone could be recognized; and he said,"

RUT	3	15	Narr_08: Ruth	#24		9272	" {15} He also said,"

RUT	4	<<	Narr_08: Ruth	#24		9281	RUTH 4

RUT	4	4	Boaz	#07		9289	" If you will redeem it, do so. But if you will not, tell me, so I will know. For no one has the right to do it except you, and I am next in line.>>"

RUT	4	6	Kinsman-Redeemer	#03		9296	 You redeem it yourself. I cannot do it.>>

RUT	4	11	Narr_08: Ruth	#24		9304	" {11} Then the elders and all those at the gate said,"

1SM	1	<<	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9323	1 SAMUEL*~*1 SAMUEL 1
1SM	1	1	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9324	" {1} There was a certain man from Ramathaim, a Zuphite from the hill country of Ephraim, whose name was Elkanah son of Jeroham,"
1SM	1	1	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9325	" the son of Elihu, the son of Tohu, the son of Zuph, an Ephraimite."
1SM	1	2	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9326	" {2} He had two wives; one was called Hannah and the other Peninnah. Peninnah had children, but Hannah had none."
1SM	1	3	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9327	" {3} Year after year this man went up from his town to worship and sacrifice to the Lord Almighty at Shiloh, where Hophni and Phinehas, the two sons of Eli, were priests of the Lord."
1SM	1	4	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9328	" {4} Whenever the day came for Elkanah to sacrifice, he would give portions of the meat to his wife Peninnah and to all her sons and daughters."
1SM	1	5	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9329	" {5} But to Hannah he gave a double portion because he loved her, and the Lord had closed her womb."
1SM	1	6	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9330	" {6} And because the Lord had closed her womb, her rival kept provoking her in order to irritate her."
1SM	1	7	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9331	" {7} This went on year after year. Whenever Hannah went up to the house of the Lord, her rival provoked her till she wept and would not eat."
1SM	1	8	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9332	" {8} Elkanah her husband would say to her,"
1SM	1	8	Elkanah	#10		9333	" << Hannah, why are you weeping? Why don't you eat? Why are you downhearted? Don't I mean more to you than ten sons?>>"
1SM	1	9	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9334	" {9} Once when they had finished eating and drinking in Shiloh, Hannah stood up. Now Eli the priest was sitting on a chair by the doorpost of the Lord's temple."
1SM	1	10	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9335	" {10} In bitterness of soul Hannah wept much and prayed to the Lord. {11} And she made a vow, saying,"
1SM	1	11	Hannah (female)	#23		9336	" << O Lord Almighty, if you will only look upon your servant's misery and remember me, and not forget your servant but give her a son,"
1SM	1	11	Hannah (female)	#23		9337	" then I will give him to the Lord for all the days of his life, and no razor will ever be used on his head.>>"
1SM	1	12	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9338	" {12} As she kept on praying to the Lord, Eli observed her mouth."
1SM	1	13	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9339	" {13} Hannah was praying in her heart, and her lips were moving but her voice was not heard. Eli thought she was drunk {14} and said to her,"
1SM	1	14	Eli (very old)	#02		9340	 << How long will you keep on getting drunk? Get rid of your wine.>>
1SM	1	15	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9341	" {15} Hannah replied,"
1SM	1	15	Hannah (female)	#23		9342	" << Not so, my lord. I am a woman who is deeply troubled. I have not been drinking wine or beer; I was pouring out my soul to the Lord."
1SM	1	16	Hannah (female)	#23		9343	 {16} Do not take your servant for a wicked woman; I have been praying here out of my great anguish and grief.>>
1SM	1	17	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9344	" {17} Eli answered,"
1SM	1	17	Eli (very old)	#02		9345	" << Go in peace, and may the God of Israel grant you what you have asked of him.>>"
1SM	1	18	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9346	" {18} She said,"
1SM	1	18	Hannah (female)	#23		9347	 << May your servant find favor in your eyes.>>
1SM	1	18	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9348	" Then she went her way and ate something, and her face was no longer downcast."
1SM	1	19	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9349	 {19} Early the next morning they arose and worshiped before the Lord and then went back to their home at Ramah.
1SM	1	19	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9350	" Elkanah lay with Hannah his wife, and the Lord remembered her."
1SM	1	20	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9351	" {20} So in the course of time Hannah conceived and gave birth to a son. She named him Samuel, saying,"
1SM	1	20	Hannah (female)	#23		9352	 << Because I asked the Lord for him.>>
1SM	1	21	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9353	" {21} When the man Elkanah went up with all his family to offer the annual sacrifice to the Lord and to fulfill his vow, {22} Hannah did not go. She said to her husband,"
1SM	1	22	Hannah (female)	#23		9354	" << After the boy is weaned, I will take him and present him before the Lord, and he will live there always.>>"
1SM	1	23	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9355	" {23} Elkanah her husband told her,"

1SM	1	23	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9357	 Elkanah her husband told her. So the woman stayed at home and nursed her son until she had weaned him.
1SM	1	24	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9358	" {24} After he was weaned, she took the boy with her, young as he was, along with a three-year-old bull, an ephah of flour and a skin of wine, and brought him to the house of the Lord at Shiloh."
1SM	1	25	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9359	" {25} When they had slaughtered the bull, they brought the boy to Eli, {26} and she said to him,"

1SM	1	28	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9363	 And he worshiped the Lord there.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
1SM	2	<<	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9364	1 SAMUEL 2
1SM	2	1	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9365	 {1} Then Hannah prayed and said:
1SM	2	1	Hannah (female)	#23		9366	 << My heart rejoices in the Lord; in the Lord my horn is lifted high.
1SM	2	1	Hannah (female)	#23		9367	" My mouth boasts over my enemies, for I delight in your deliverance."
1SM	2	2	Hannah (female)	#23		9368	 {2} << There is no one holy like the Lord; there is no one besides you; there is no Rock like our God.
1SM	2	3	Hannah (female)	#23		9369	" {3} << Do not keep talking so proudly or let your mouth speak such arrogance, for the Lord is a God who knows, and by him deeds are weighed. <<"
1SM	2	4	Hannah (female)	#23		9370	" {4} The bows of the warriors are broken, but those who stumbled are armed with strength."
1SM	2	5	Hannah (female)	#23		9371	" {5} Those who were full hire themselves out for food, but those who were hungry hunger no more."
1SM	2	5	Hannah (female)	#23		9372	" She who was barren has borne seven children, but she who has had many sons pines away."
1SM	2	6	Hannah (female)	#23		9373	 {6} << The Lord brings death and makes alive; he brings down to the grave and raises up.
1SM	2	7	Hannah (female)	#23		9374	 {7} The Lord sends poverty and wealth; he humbles and he exalts.
1SM	2	8	Hannah (female)	#23		9375	 {8} He raises the poor from the dust and lifts the needy from the ash heap; he seats them with princes and has them inherit a throne of honor.
1SM	2	8	Hannah (female)	#23		9376	 << For the foundations of the earth are the Lord's; upon them he has set the world.
1SM	2	9	Hannah (female)	#23		9377	" {9} He will guard the feet of his saints, but the wicked will be silenced in darkness. << It is not by strength that one prevails;"
1SM	2	10	Hannah (female)	#23		9378	 {10} those who oppose the Lord will be shattered. He will thunder against them from heaven; the Lord will judge the ends of the earth.
1SM	2	10	Hannah (female)	#23		9379	 << He will give strength to his king and exalt the horn of his anointed.>>
1SM	2	11	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9380	" {11} Then Elkanah went home to Ramah, but the boy ministered before the Lord under Eli the priest. {12} Eli's sons were wicked men; they had no regard for the Lord."
1SM	2	13	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9381	" {13} Now it was the practice of the priests with the people that whenever anyone offered a sacrifice and while the meat was being boiled, the servant of the priest would come with a three-pronged fork in his hand."
1SM	2	14	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9382	" {14} He would plunge it into the pan or kettle or caldron or pot, and the priest would take for himself whatever the fork brought up."
1SM	2	14	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9383	 This is how they treated all the Israelites who came to Shiloh.
1SM	2	15	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9384	" {15} But even before the fat was burned, the servant of the priest would come and say to the man who was sacrificing,"
1SM	2	15	Servant	#14		9385	" << Give the priest some meat to roast; he won't accept boiled meat from you, but only raw.>>"
1SM	2	16	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9386	" {16} If the man said to him,"
1SM	2	16	Man	#12		9387	" << Let the fat be burned up first, and then take whatever you want,<<"
1SM	2	16	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9388	" the servant would then answer,"
1SM	2	16	Servant	#14		9389	" << No, hand it over now; if you don't, I'll take it by force.>>"
1SM	2	17	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9390	" {17} This sin of the young men was very great in the Lord's sight, for they were treating the Lord's offering with contempt."
1SM	2	18	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9391	 {18} But Samuel was ministering before the Lord--a boy wearing a linen ephod.
1SM	2	19	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9392	 {19} Each year his mother made him a little robe and took it to him when she went up with her husband to offer the annual sacrifice.
1SM	2	20	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9393	" {20} Eli would bless Elkanah and his wife, saying,"
1SM	2	20	Eli (very old)	#02		9394	 << May the Lord give you children by this woman to take the place of the one she prayed for and gave to the Lord.>>
1SM	2	20	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9395	 Then they would go home.
1SM	2	21	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9396	" {21} And the Lord was gracious to Hannah ; she conceived and gave birth to three sons and two daughters. Meanwhile, the boy Samuel grew up in the presence of the Lord."
1SM	2	22	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9397	" {22} Now Eli, who was very old, heard about everything his sons were doing to all Israel and how they slept with the women who served at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting."
1SM	2	23	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9398	" {23} So he said to them,"
1SM	2	23	Eli (very old)	#02		9399	 << Why do you do such things? I hear from all the people about these wicked deeds of yours.
1SM	2	24	Eli (very old)	#02		9400	" {24} No, my sons; it is not a good report that I hear spreading among the Lord's people."
1SM	2	25	Eli (very old)	#02		9401	" {25} If a man sins against another man, God may mediate for him; but if a man sins against the Lord, who will intercede for him?>>"
1SM	2	25	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9402	" His sons, however, did not listen to their father's rebuke, for it was the Lord's will to put them to death."
1SM	2	26	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9403	 {26} And the boy Samuel continued to grow in stature and in favor with the Lord and with men.
1SM	2	27	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9404	" {27} Now a man of God came to Eli and said to him,"
1SM	2	27	Man of God-FX1	#09		9405	 << This is what the Lord says: 'Did I not clearly reveal myself to your father's house when they were in Egypt under Pharaoh?
1SM	2	28	Man of God-FX1	#09		9406	" {28} I chose your father out of all the tribes of Israel to be my priest, to go up to my altar, to burn incense, and to wear an ephod in my presence."
1SM	2	28	Man of God-FX1	#09		9407	 I also gave your father's house all the offerings made with fire by the Israelites.
1SM	2	29	Man of God-FX1	#09		9408	 {29} Why do you scorn my sacrifice and offering that I prescribed for my dwelling?
1SM	2	29	Man of God-FX1	#09		9409	 Why do you honor your sons more than me by fattening yourselves on the choice parts of every offering made by my people Israel? '
1SM	2	30	Man of God-FX1	#09		9410	" {30} << Therefore the Lord, the God of Israel, declares: 'I promised that your house and your father's house would minister before me forever.'"
1SM	2	30	Man of God-FX1	#09		9411	" But now the Lord declares: 'Far be it from me! Those who honor me I will honor, but those who despise me will be disdained."
1SM	2	31	Man of God-FX1	#09		9412	" {31} The time is coming when I will cut short your strength and the strength of your father's house, so that there will not be an old man in your family line"
1SM	2	32	Man of God-FX1	#09		9413	" {32} and you will see distress in my dwelling. Although good will be done to Israel, in your family line there will never be an old man."
1SM	2	33	Man of God-FX1	#09		9414	" {33} Every one of you that I do not cut off from my altar will be spared only to blind your eyes with tears and to grieve your heart, and all your descendants will die in the prime of life."
1SM	2	34	Man of God-FX1	#09		9415	" {34}.<< 'And what happens to your two sons, Hophni and Phinehas, will be a sign to you--they will both die on the same day."

1SM	2	35	Man of God-FX1	#09		9417	" I will firmly establish his house, and he will minister before my anointed one always."
1SM	2	36	Man of God-FX1	#09		9418	" {36} Then everyone left in your family line will come and bow down before him for a piece of silver and a crust of bread and plead, << Appoint me to some priestly office so I can have food to eat.>>'>> *~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"

1SM	6	12	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9545	" {12} Then the cows went straight up toward Beth Shemesh, keeping on the road and lowing all the way; they did not turn to the right or to the left."
1SM	6	12	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9546	 The rulers of the Philistines followed them as far as the border of Beth Shemesh.
1SM	6	13	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9547	" {13} Now the people of Beth Shemesh were harvesting their wheat in the valley, and when they looked up and saw the ark, they rejoiced at the sight."
1SM	6	14	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9548	" {14} The cart came to the field of Joshua of Beth Shemesh, and there it stopped beside a large rock."

1SM	6	15	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9550	" {15} The Levites took down the ark of the Lord, together with the chest containing the gold objects, and placed them on the large rock."

1SM	6	16	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9552	 {16} The five rulers of the Philistines saw all this and then returned that same day to Ekron.
1SM	6	17	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9553	" {17} These are the gold tumors the Philistines sent as a guilt offering to the Lord--one each for Ashdod, Gaza, Ashkelon, Gath and Ekron."
1SM	6	18	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9554	 {18} And the number of the gold rats was according to the number of Philistine towns belonging to the five rulers--the fortified towns with their country villages.
1SM	6	18	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9555	" The large rock, on which they set the ark of the Lord, is a witness to this day in the field of Joshua of Beth Shemesh."
1SM	6	19	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9556	" {19} But God struck down some of the men of Beth Shemesh, putting seventy of them to death because they had looked into the ark of the Lord."

1SM	7	<<	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9561	1 SAMUEL 7

1SM	7	6	Man	#09		9569	 << We have sinned against the Lord.>>
1SM	7	6	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9570	 And Samuel was leader of Israel at Mizpah.
1SM	7	7	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9571	" {7} When the Philistines heard that Israel had assembled at Mizpah, the rulers of the Philistines came up to attack them."
1SM	7	7	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9572	" And when the Israelites heard of it, they were afraid because of the Philistines."
1SM	7	8	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9573	" {8} They said to Samuel,"
1SM	7	8	Israelite	#17		9574	" << Do not stop crying out to the Lord our God for us, that he may rescue us from the hand of the Philistines.>>"
1SM	7	9	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9575	" {9} Then Samuel took a suckling lamb and offered it up as a whole burnt offering to the Lord. He cried out to the Lord on Israel's behalf, and the Lord answered him."
1SM	7	10	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9576	" {10} While Samuel was sacrificing the burnt offering, the Philistines drew near to engage Israel in battle."
1SM	7	10	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9577	 But that day the Lord thundered with loud thunder against the Philistines and threw them into such a panic that they were routed before the Israelites.
1SM	7	11	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9578	" {11} The men of Israel rushed out of Mizpah and pursued the Philistines, slaughtering them along the way to a point below Beth Car."
1SM	7	12	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9579	" {12} Then Samuel took a stone and set it up between Mizpah and Shen. He named it Ebenezer, , saying,"
1SM	7	12	Samuel	#15		9580	 << Thus far has the Lord helped us.>>
1SM	7	13	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9581	" {13} So the Philistines were subdued and did not invade Israelite territory again. Throughout Samuel's lifetime, the hand of the Lord was against the Philistines."
1SM	7	14	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9582	" {14} The towns from Ekron to Gath that the Philistines had captured from Israel were restored to her, and Israel delivered the neighboring territory from the power of the Philistines."
1SM	7	14	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9583	 And there was peace between Israel and the Amorites.
1SM	7	15	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9584	 {15} Samuel continued as judge over Israel all the days of his life.
1SM	7	16	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9585	" {16} From year to year he went on a circuit from Bethel to Gilgal to Mizpah, judging Israel in all those places."
1SM	7	17	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9586	" {17} But he always went back to Ramah, where his home was, and there he also judged Israel. And he built an altar there to the Lord.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"

1SM	12	<<	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9744	1 SAMUEL 12
1SM	12	1	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9745	" {1} Samuel said to all Israel,"
1SM	12	1	Samuel	#15		9746	 << I have listened to everything you said to me and have set a king over you.
1SM	12	2	Samuel	#15		9747	" {2} Now you have a king as your leader. As for me, I am old and gray, and my sons are here with you. I have been your leader from my youth until this day."
1SM	12	3	Samuel	#15		9748	 {3} Here I stand. Testify against me in the presence of the Lord and his anointed.
1SM	12	3	Samuel	#15		9749	 Whose ox have I taken? Whose donkey have I taken? Whom have I cheated? Whom have I oppressed?
1SM	12	3	Samuel	#15		9750	" From whose hand have I accepted a bribe to make me shut my eyes? If I have done any of these, I will make it right.>>"
1SM	12	4	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9751	" {4} They replied,"
1SM	12	4	Israelite	#17		9752	 << You have not cheated or oppressed us. You have not taken anything from anyone's hand.>>
1SM	12	5	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9753	" {5} Samuel said to them,"

1SM	12	5	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9755	" They said,"
1SM	12	5	Israelite	#18		9756	 << He is witness.>>
1SM	12	6	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9757	" {6} Then Samuel said to the people,"
1SM	12	6	Samuel	#15		9758	 It is the Lord who appointed Moses and Aaron and brought your forefathers up out of Egypt.
1SM	12	7	Samuel	#15		9759	" {7} Now then, stand here, because I am going to confront you with evidence before the Lord as to all the righteous acts performed by the Lord for you and your fathers."
1SM	12	8	Samuel	#15		9760	" {8} << After Jacob entered Egypt, they cried to the Lord for help, and the Lord sent Moses and Aaron, who brought your forefathers out of Egypt and settled them in this place."
1SM	12	9	Samuel	#15		9761	 {9} << But they forgot the Lord their God;
1SM	12	9	Samuel	#15		9762	" so he sold them into the hand of Sisera, the commander of the army of Hazor, and into the hands of the Philistines and the king of Moab, who fought against them."
1SM	12	10	Samuel	#15		9763	" {10} They cried out to the Lord and said, 'We have sinned; we have forsaken the Lord and served the Baals and the Ashtoreths."
1SM	12	10	Samuel	#15		9764	" But now deliver us from the hands of our enemies, and we will serve you.'"
1SM	12	11	Samuel	#15		9765	" {11} Then the Lord sent Jerub-Baal, Barak, Jephthah and Samuel, and he delivered you from the hands of your enemies on every side, so that you lived securely."
1SM	12	12	Samuel	#15		9766	" {12} << But when you saw that Nahash king of the Ammonites was moving against you, you said to me, 'No, we want a king to rule over us'--even though the Lord your God was your king."
1SM	12	13	Samuel	#15		9767	" {13} Now here is the king you have chosen, the one you asked for; see, the Lord has set a king over you."
1SM	12	14	Samuel	#15		9768	" {14} If you fear the Lord and serve and obey him and do not rebel against his commands, and if both you and the king who reigns over you follow the Lord your God--good!"
1SM	12	15	Samuel	#15		9769	" {15} But if you do not obey the Lord, and if you rebel against his commands, his hand will be against you, as it was against your fathers."
1SM	12	16	Samuel	#15		9770	" {16} << Now then, stand still and see this great thing the Lord is about to do before your eyes!"
1SM	12	17	Samuel	#15		9771	 {17} Is it not wheat harvest now? I will call upon the Lord to send thunder and rain.
1SM	12	17	Samuel	#15		9772	 And you will realize what an evil thing you did in the eyes of the Lord when you asked for a king.>>
1SM	12	18	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9773	" {18} Then Samuel called upon the Lord, and that same day the Lord sent thunder and rain. So all the people stood in awe of the Lord and of Samuel. {19} The people all said to Samuel,"
1SM	12	19	Israelite	#11		9774	" << Pray to the Lord your God for your servants so that we will not die, for we have added to all our other sins the evil of asking for a king.>>"
1SM	12	20	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9775	" {20} Samuel replied,"
1SM	12	20	Samuel	#15		9776	" << Do not be afraid. You have done all this evil; yet do not turn away from the Lord, but serve the Lord with all your heart."
1SM	12	21	Samuel	#15		9777	" {21} Do not turn away after useless idols. They can do you no good, nor can they rescue you, because they are useless."
1SM	12	22	Samuel	#15		9778	" {22} For the sake of his great name the Lord will not reject his people, because the Lord was pleased to make you his own."
1SM	12	23	Samuel	#15		9779	" {23} As for me, far be it from me that I should sin against the Lord by failing to pray for you. And I will teach you the way that is good and right."
1SM	12	24	Samuel	#15		9780	 {24} But be sure to fear the Lord and serve him faithfully with all your heart; consider what great things he has done for you.
1SM	12	25	Samuel	#15		9781	" {25} Yet if you persist in doing evil, both you and your king will be swept away.>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
1SM	13	<<	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9782	1 SAMUEL 13

1SM	13	2	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9785	" two thousand were with him at Micmash and in the hill country of Bethel, and a thousand were with Jonathan at Gibeah in Benjamin. The rest of the men he sent back to their homes."
1SM	13	3	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9786	" {3} Jonathan attacked the Philistine outpost at Geba, and the Philistines heard about it. Then Saul had the trumpet blown throughout the land and said,"
1SM	13	3	Saul	#13		9787	 << Let the Hebrews hear!>>
1SM	13	4	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9788	" {4} So all Israel heard the news: << Saul has attacked the Philistine outpost, and now Israel has become a stench to the Philistines.>> And the people were summoned to join Saul at Gilgal."
1SM	13	5	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9789	" {5} The Philistines assembled to fight Israel, with three thousand chariots, six thousand charioteers, and soldiers as numerous as the sand on the seashore."
1SM	13	5	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9790	" They went up and camped at Micmash, east of Beth Aven."
1SM	13	6	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9791	" {6} When the men of Israel saw that their situation was critical and that their army was hard pressed, they hid in caves and thickets, among the rocks, and in pits and cisterns."
1SM	13	7	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9792	" {7} Some Hebrews even crossed the Jordan to the land of Gad and Gilead. Saul remained at Gilgal, and all the troops with him were quaking with fear."
1SM	13	8	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9793	" {8} He waited seven days, the time set by Samuel; but Samuel did not come to Gilgal, and Saul's men began to scatter."

1SM	13	14	Samuel	#15		9805	 {14} But now your kingdom will not endure;
1SM	13	14	Samuel	#15		9806	" the Lord has sought out a man after his own heart and appointed him leader of his people, because you have not kept the Lord's command.>>"
1SM	13	15	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9807	" {15} Then Samuel left Gilgal and went up to Gibeah in Benjamin, and Saul counted the men who were with him. They numbered about six hundred."
1SM	13	16	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9808	" {16} Saul and his son Jonathan and the men with them were staying in Gibeah in Benjamin, while the Philistines camped at Micmash."
1SM	13	17	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9809	 {17} Raiding parties went out from the Philistine camp in three detachments.
1SM	13	17	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9810	" One turned toward Ophrah in the vicinity of Shual, {18} another toward Beth Horon, and the third toward the borderland overlooking the Valley of Zeboim facing the desert."
1SM	13	19	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9811	" {19} Not a blacksmith could be found in the whole land of Israel, because the Philistines had said,"
1SM	13	19	Philistine	#04		9812	 << Otherwise the Hebrews will make swords or spears!>>
1SM	13	20	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9813	" {20} So all Israel went down to the Philistines to have their plowshares, mattocks, axes and sickles sharpened."
1SM	13	21	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9814	" {21} The price was two thirds of a shekel for sharpening plowshares and mattocks, and a third of a shekel for sharpening forks and axes and for repointing goads."
1SM	13	22	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9815	 {22} So on the day of the battle not a soldier with Saul and Jonathan had a sword or spear in his hand; only Saul and his son Jonathan had them.
1SM	13	23	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9816	 {23} Now a detachment of Philistines had gone out to the pass at Micmash.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*

1SM	14	1	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9820	 But he did not tell his father. {2} Saul was staying on the outskirts of Gibeah under a pomegranate tree in Migron.

1SM	14	4	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9823	" {4} On each side of the pass that Jonathan intended to cross to reach the Philistine outpost was a cliff; one was called Bozez, and the other Seneh."

1SM	14	14	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9840	 {14} In that first attack Jonathan and his armor-bearer killed some twenty men in an area of about half an acre.
1SM	14	15	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9841	" {15} Then panic struck the whole army--those in the camp and field, and those in the outposts and raiding parties--and the ground shook. It was a panic sent by God."
1SM	14	16	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9842	" {16} Saul's lookouts at Gibeah of Benjamin saw the army melting away in all directions. {17} Then Saul said to the men who were with him,"

1SM	14	17	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9844	" When they did, it was Jonathan and his armor-bearer who were not there. {18} Saul said to Ahijah,"

1SM	14	18	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9846	" (At that time it was with the Israelites.) {19} While Saul was talking to the priest, the tumult in the Philistine camp increased more and more. So Saul said to the priest,"

1SM	14	20	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9848	" {20} Then Saul and all his men assembled and went to the battle. They found the Philistines in total confusion, striking each other with their swords."
1SM	14	21	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9849	 {21} Those Hebrews who had previously been with the Philistines and had gone up with them to their camp went over to the Israelites who were with Saul and Jonathan.
1SM	14	22	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9850	" {22} When all the Israelites who had hidden in the hill country of Ephraim heard that the Philistines were on the run, they joined the battle in hot pursuit."
1SM	14	23	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9851	" {23} So the Lord rescued Israel that day, and the battle moved on beyond Beth Aven."
1SM	14	24	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9852	" {24} Now the men of Israel were in distress that day, because Saul had bound the people under an oath, saying,"
1SM	14	24	Saul	#13		9853	" << Cursed be any man who eats food before evening comes, before I have avenged myself myself on my enemies!>>"
1SM	14	24	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9854	" So none of the troops tasted food. {25} The entire army entered the woods, and there was honey on the ground."
1SM	14	26	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9855	" {26} When they went into the woods, they saw the honey oozing out, yet no one put his hand to his mouth, because they feared the oath."
1SM	14	27	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9856	" {27} But Jonathan had not heard that his father had bound the people with the oath, so he reached out the end of the staff that was in his hand and dipped it into the honeycomb."
1SM	14	27	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9857	" He raised his hand to his mouth, and his eyes brightened. {28} Then one of the soldiers told him,"
1SM	14	28	Soldier	#14		9858	" << Your father bound the army under a strict oath, saying, 'Cursed be any man who eats food today!' That is why the men are faint.>>"
1SM	14	29	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9859	" {29} Jonathan said,"
1SM	14	29	Jonathan	#09		9860	 << My father has made trouble for the country. See how my eyes brightened when I tasted a little of this honey.
1SM	14	30	Jonathan	#09		9861	 {30} How much better it would have been if the men had eaten today some of the plunder they took from their enemies.
1SM	14	30	Jonathan	#09		9862	 Would not the slaughter of the Philistines have been even greater?>>
1SM	14	31	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9863	" {31} That day, after the Israelites had struck down the Philistines from Micmash to Aijalon, they were exhausted."
1SM	14	32	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9864	" {32} They pounced on the plunder and, taking sheep, cattle and calves, they butchered them on the ground and ate them, together with the blood."
1SM	14	33	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9865	" {33} Then someone said to Saul,"
1SM	14	33	Soldier	#03		9866	" << Look, the men are sinning against the Lord by eating meat that has blood in it.>>"
1SM	14	33	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9867	" He said,"
1SM	14	33	Saul	#13		9868	 << You have broken faith. Roll a large stone over here at once.

1SM	14	34	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9872	 So everyone brought his ox that night and slaughtered it there.
1SM	14	35	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9873	" {35} Then Saul built an altar to the Lord; it was the first time he had done this. {36} Saul said,"
1SM	14	36	Saul	#13		9874	" << Let us go down after the Philistines by night and plunder them till dawn, and let us not leave one of them alive.>>"

1SM	14	37	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9881	" But God did not answer him that day. {38} Saul therefore said,"

1SM	14	39	Saul	#13		9883	" {39} As surely as the Lord who rescues Israel lives, even if it lies with my son Jonathan, he must die.>>"
1SM	14	39	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9884	" But not one of the men said a word. {40} Saul then said to all the Israelites,"

1SM	14	41	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9890	" And Jonathan and Saul were taken by lot, and the men were cleared. {42} Saul said,"

1SM	14	45	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9898	" {45} But the men said to Saul,"
1SM	14	45	Soldier	#06		9899	 << Should Jonathan die--he who has brought about this great deliverance in Israel? Never!
1SM	14	45	Soldier	#06		9900	" As surely as the Lord lives, not a hair of his head will fall to the ground, for he did this today with God's help.>>"
1SM	14	45	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9901	" So the men rescued Jonathan, and he was not put to death. {46} Then Saul stopped pursuing the Philistines, and they withdrew to their own land."
1SM	14	47	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9902	" {47} After Saul had assumed rule over Israel, he fought against their enemies on every side: Moab, the Ammonites, Edom, the kings of Zobah, and the Philistines."
1SM	14	47	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9903	" Wherever he turned, he inflicted punishment on them."
1SM	14	48	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9904	" {48} He fought valiantly and defeated the Amalekites, delivering Israel from the hands of those who had plundered them."
1SM	14	49	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9905	" {49} Saul's sons were Jonathan, Ishvi and Malki-Shua. The name of his older daughter was Merab, and that of the younger was Michal."
1SM	14	50	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9906	" {50} His wife's name was Ahinoam daughter of Ahimaaz. The name of the commander of Saul's army was Abner son of Ner, and Ner was Saul's uncle."
1SM	14	51	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9907	 {51} Saul's father Kish and Abner's father Ner were sons of Abiel.
1SM	14	52	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9908	" {52} All the days of Saul there was bitter war with the Philistines, and whenever Saul saw a mighty or brave man, he took him into his service.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
1SM	15	<<	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9909	1 SAMUEL 15
1SM	15	1	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9910	" {1} Samuel said to Saul,"
1SM	15	1	Samuel	#15		9911	 << I am the one the Lord sent to anoint you king over his people Israel ; so listen now to the message from the Lord.
1SM	15	2	Samuel	#15		9912	 {2} This is what the Lord Almighty says: 'I will punish the Amalekites for what they did to Israel when they waylaid them as they came up from Egypt.
1SM	15	3	Samuel	#15		9913	" {3} Now go, attack the Amalekites and totally destroy everything that belongs to them."
1SM	15	3	Samuel	#15		9914	" Do not spare them; put to death men and women, children and infants, cattle and sheep, camels and donkeys.Æ>>"
1SM	15	4	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9915	 {4} So Saul summoned the men and mustered them at Telaim --two hundred thousand foot soldiers and ten thousand men from Judah.
1SM	15	5	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9916	" {5} Saul went to the city of Amalek and set an ambush in the ravine. {6} Then he said to the Kenites,"
1SM	15	6	Saul	#13		9917	" << Go away, leave the Amalekites so that I do not destroy you along with them; for you showed kindness to all the Israelites when they came up out of Egypt.>>"
1SM	15	6	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9918	" So the Kenites moved away from the Amalekites. {7} Then Saul attacked the Amalekites all the way from Havilah to Shur, to the east of Egypt."
1SM	15	8	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9919	" {8} He took Agag king of the Amalekites alive, and all his people he totally destroyed with the sword."
1SM	15	9	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9920	" {9} But Saul and the army spared Agag and the best of the sheep and cattle, the fat calves and lambs--everything that was good."

1SM	15	10	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9922	 {10} Then the word of the Lord came to Samuel:

1SM	15	11	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9924	" Samuel was troubled, and he cried out to the Lord all that night. {12} Early in the morning Samuel got up and went to meet Saul, but he was told,"

1SM	15	13	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9926	" {13} When Samuel reached him, Saul said,"

1SM	15	16	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9932	" {16} Samuel said to saul,"

1SM	15	16	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9934	" Saul replied,"

1SM	15	17	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9936	" {17} Samuel said,"
1SM	15	17	Samuel	#15		9937	" << Although you were once small in your own eyes, did you not become the head of the tribes of Israel? The Lord anointed you king over Israel."
1SM	15	18	Samuel	#15		9938	" {18} And he sent you on a mission, saying, 'Go and completely destroy those wicked people, the Amalekites; make war on them until you have wiped them out.'"
1SM	15	19	Samuel	#15		9939	 {19} Why did you not obey the Lord? Why did you pounce on the plunder and do evil in the eyes of the Lord?>>
1SM	15	20	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9940	" {20} Saul said,"
1SM	15	20	Saul	#13		9941	 << But I did obey the Lord. I went on the mission the Lord assigned me. I completely destroyed the Amalekites and brought back Agag their king.
1SM	15	21	Saul	#13		9942	" {21} The soldiers took sheep and cattle from the plunder, the best of what was devoted to God, in order to sacrifice them to the Lord your God at Gilgal.>>"
1SM	15	22	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9943	" {22} But Samuel replied,"
1SM	15	22	Samuel	#15		9944	 << Does the Lord delight in burnt offerings and sacrifices as much as in obeying the voice of the Lord?
1SM	15	22	Samuel	#15		9945	" To obey is better than sacrifice, and to heed is better than the fat of rams."
1SM	15	23	Samuel	#15		9946	" {23} For rebellion is like the sin of divination, and arrogance like the evil of idolatry. Because you have rejected the word of the Lord, he has rejected you as king.>>"
1SM	15	24	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9947	" {24} Then Saul said to Samuel,"
1SM	15	24	Saul	#13		9948	 << I have sinned. I violated the Lord's command and your instructions. I was afraid of the people and so I gave in to them.
1SM	15	25	Saul	#13		9949	" {25} Now I beg you, forgive my sin and come back with me, so that I may worship the Lord.>>"
1SM	15	26	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9950	" {26} But Samuel said to him,"

1SM	15	27	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		9952	" {27} As Samuel turned to leave, Saul caught hold of the hem of his robe, and it tore. {28} Samuel said to him,"

1SM	15	29	Samuel	#15		9954	" {29} He who is the Glory of Israel does not lie or change his mind; for he is not a man, that he should change his mind.>>"

1SM	17	20	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10036	" He reached the camp as the army was going out to its battle positions, shouting the war cry."

1SM	17	37	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10065	" {37} Then David added,"

1SM	17	39	David	#07		10071	" << I cannot go in these, because I am not used to them."

1SM	17	40	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10073	" {40} Then he took his staff in his hand, chose five smooth stones from the stream, put them in the pouch of his shepherd's bag and, with his sling in his hand, approached the Philistine."
1SM	17	41	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10074	" {41} Meanwhile, the Philistine, with his shield bearer in front of him, kept coming closer to David."

1SM	17	45	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10080	" {45} David said to the Philistine,"
1SM	17	45	David	#07		10081	" << You come against me with sword and spear and javelin, but I come against you in the name of the Lord Almighty, the God of the armies of Israel, whom you have defied."
1SM	17	46	David	#07		10082	" {46} This day the Lord will hand you over to me, and I'll strike you down and cut off your head."

1SM	17	47	David	#07		10084	" {47} All those gathered here will know that it is not by sword or spear that the Lord saves; for the battle is the Lord's, and he will give all of you into our hands.>>"
1SM	17	48	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10085	" {48} As the Philistine moved closer to attack him, David ran quickly toward the battle line to meet him."
1SM	17	49	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10086	" {49} Reaching into his bag and taking out a stone, he slung it and struck the Philistine on the forehead. The stone sank into his forehead, and he fell facedown on the ground."
1SM	17	50	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10087	 {50} So David triumphed over the Philistine with a sling and a stone; without a sword in his hand he struck down the Philistine and killed him.
1SM	17	51	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10088	 {51} David ran and stood over him. He took hold of the Philistine's sword and drew it from the scabbard.
1SM	17	51	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10089	" After he killed him, he cut off his head with the sword. When the Philistines saw that their hero was dead, they turned and ran."
1SM	17	52	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10090	 {52} Then the men of Israel and Judah surged forward with a shout and pursued the Philistines to the entrance of Gath and to the gates of Ekron.
1SM	17	52	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10091	 Their dead were strewn along the Shaaraim road to Gath and Ekron.
1SM	17	53	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10092	" {53} When the Israelites returned from chasing the Philistines, they plundered their camp."
1SM	17	54	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10093	" {54} David took the Philistine's head and brought it to Jerusalem, and he put the Philistine's weapons in his own tent."
1SM	17	55	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10094	" {55} As Saul watched David going out to meet the Philistine, he said to Abner, commander of the army,"
1SM	17	55	Saul	#13		10095	" << Abner, whose son is that young man?>>"
1SM	17	55	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10096	" Abner replied,"
1SM	17	55	Abner	#06		10097	" << As surely as you live, O king, I don't know.>>"
1SM	17	56	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10098	" {56} The king said,"
1SM	17	56	Saul	#13		10099	 << Find out whose son this young man is.>>
1SM	17	57	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10100	" {57} As soon as David returned from killing the Philistine, Abner took him and brought him before Saul, with David still holding the Philistine's head."
1SM	17	58	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10101	" {58} Saul asked him,"

1SM	18	2	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10107	 {2} From that day Saul kept David with him and did not let him return to his father's house. {3} And Jonathan made a covenant with David because he loved him as himself.
1SM	18	4	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10108	" {4} Jonathan took off the robe he was wearing and gave it to David, along with his tunic, and even his sword, his bow and his belt."
1SM	18	5	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10109	" {5} Whatever Saul sent him to do, David did it so successfully that Saul gave him a high rank in the army. This pleased all the people, and Saul's officers as well."
1SM	18	6	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10110	" {6} When the men were returning home after David had killed the Philistine, the women came out from all the towns of Israel to meet King Saul with singing and dancing, with joyful songs and with tambourines and lutes."

1SM	18	13	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10120	" {13} So he sent David away from him and gave him command over a thousand men, and David led the troops in their campaigns."
1SM	18	14	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10121	" {14} In everything he did he had great success, because the Lord was with him. {15} When Saul saw how successful he was, he was afraid of him."

1SM	18	19	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10128	" {19} So when the time came for Merab, Saul's daughter, to be given to David, she was given in marriage to Adriel of Meholah."

1SM	18	21	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10131	" So Saul said to David,"

1SM	18	25	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10139	 Saul's plan was to have David fall by the hands of the Philistines.
1SM	18	26	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10140	" {26} When the attendants told David these things, he was pleased to become the king's son-in-law. So before the allotted time elapsed, {27} David and his men went out and killed two hundred Philistines."
1SM	18	27	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10141	 He brought their foreskins and presented the full number to the king so that he might become the king's son-in-law. Then Saul gave him his daughter Michal in marriage.

1SM	20	20	Jonathan	#09		10217	" {20} I will shoot three arrows to the side of it, as though I were shooting at a target."
1SM	20	21	Jonathan	#09		10218	" {21} Then I will send a boy and say, 'Go, find the arrows.'"
1SM	20	21	Jonathan	#09		10219	" If I say to him, 'Look, the arrows are on this side of you; bring them here,' then come, because, as surely as the Lord lives, you are safe; there is no danger."
1SM	20	22	Jonathan	#09		10220	" {22} But if I say to the boy, 'Look, the arrows are beyond you,' then you must go, because the Lord has sent you away."
1SM	20	23	Jonathan	#09		10221	" {23} And about the matter you and I discussed--remember, the Lord is witness between you and me forever.>>"
1SM	20	24	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10222	" {24} So David hid in the field, and when the New Moon festival came, the king sat down to eat."

1SM	20	26	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10224	" {26} Saul said nothing that day, for he thought,"

1SM	20	27	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10226	" {27} But the next day, the second day of the month, David's place was empty again. Then Saul said to his son Jonathan,"

1SM	20	29	Jonathan	#09		10231	" If I have found favor in your eyes, let me get away to see my brothers.' That is why he has not come to the king's table.>>"
1SM	20	30	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10232	" {30} Saul's anger flared up at Jonathan and he said to him,"

1SM	20	32	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10237	" {32} Jonathan asked his father,"
1SM	20	32	Jonathan	#09		10238	 << Why should he be put to death? What has he done?>>
1SM	20	33	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10239	 {33} But Saul hurled his spear at him to kill him. Then Jonathan knew that his father intended to kill David.
1SM	20	34	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10240	" {34} Jonathan got up from the table in fierce anger; on that second day of the month he did not eat, because he was grieved at his father's shameful treatment of David."
1SM	20	35	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10241	" {35} In the morning Jonathan went out to the field for his meeting with David. He had a small boy with him, {36} and he said to the boy,"

1SM	20	36	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10243	" As the boy ran, he shot an arrow beyond him."
1SM	20	37	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10244	" {37} When the boy came to the place where Jonathan's arrow had fallen, Jonathan called out after him,"

1SM	20	38	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10246	" {38} Then he shouted,"

1SM	20	38	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10248	 The boy picked up the arrow and returned to his master. {39} (The boy knew nothing of all this; only Jonathan and David knew.)
1SM	20	40	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10249	" {40} Then Jonathan gave his weapons to the boy and said,"

1SM	20	41	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10251	" {41} After the boy had gone, David got up from the south side of the stone and bowed down before Jonathan three times, with his face to the ground."

1SM	21	<<	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10255	1 SAMUEL 21

1SM	21	5	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10265	" {5} David replied,"
1SM	21	5	David	#07		10266	" << Indeed women have been kept from us, as usual whenever I set out. The men's things are holy even on missions that are not holy. How much more so today!>>"
1SM	21	6	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10267	" {6} So the priest gave him the consecrated bread, since there was no bread there except the bread of the Presence that had been removed from before the Lord and replaced by hot bread on the day it was taken away."

1SM	21	13	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10280	" {13} So he pretended to be insane in their presence; and while he was in their hands he acted like a madman, making marks on the doors of the gate and letting saliva run down his beard."

1SM	25	18	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10428	" {18} Abigail lost no time. She took two hundred loaves of bread, two skins of wine, five dressed sheep, five seahs of roasted grain, a hundred cakes of raisins and two hundred cakes of pressed figs, and loaded them on donkeys."

1SM	25	23	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10435	" {23} When Abigail saw David, she quickly got off her donkey and bowed down before David with her face to the ground. {24} She fell at his feet and said:"
1SM	25	24	Abigail (female)	#24		10436	" << My lord, let the blame be on me alone. Please let your servant speak to you; hear what your servant has to say."
1SM	25	25	Abigail (female)	#24		10437	" {25} May my lord pay no attention to that wicked man Nabal. He is just like his name--his name is Fool, and folly goes with him."
1SM	25	25	Abigail (female)	#24		10438	" But as for me, your servant, I did not see the men my master sent."
1SM	25	26	Abigail (female)	#24		10439	" {26} Now since the Lord has kept you, my master, from bloodshed and from avenging yourself with your own hands,"
1SM	25	26	Abigail (female)	#24		10440	" as surely as the Lord lives and as you live, may your enemies and all who intend to harm my master be like Nabal."
1SM	25	27	Abigail (female)	#24		10441	" {27} And let this gift, which your servant has brought to my master, be given to the men who follow you."
1SM	25	28	Abigail (female)	#24		10442	" {28} Please forgive your servant's offense, for the Lord will certainly make a lasting dynasty for my master, because he fights the Lord's battles."
1SM	25	28	Abigail (female)	#24		10443	 Let no wrongdoing be found in you as long as you live.
1SM	25	29	Abigail (female)	#24		10444	" {29} Even though someone is pursuing you to take your life, the life of my master will be bound securely in the bundle of the living by the Lord your God."
1SM	25	29	Abigail (female)	#24		10445	 But the lives of your enemies he will hurl away as from the pocket of a sling.
1SM	25	30	Abigail (female)	#24		10446	" {30} When the Lord has done for my master every good thing he promised concerning him and has appointed him leader over Israel,"
1SM	25	31	Abigail (female)	#24		10447	 {31} my master will not have on his conscience the staggering burden of needless bloodshed or of having avenged himself.
1SM	25	31	Abigail (female)	#24		10448	" And when the Lord has brought my master success, remember your servant.>>"
1SM	25	32	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10449	" {32} David said to Abigail,"
1SM	25	32	David	#07		10450	" << Praise be to the Lord, the God of Israel, who has sent you today to meet me."
1SM	25	33	David	#07		10451	 {33} May you be blessed for your good judgment and for keeping me from bloodshed this day and from avenging myself with my own hands.
1SM	25	34	David	#07		10452	" {34} Otherwise, as surely as the Lord, the God of Israel, lives, who has kept me from harming you, if you had not come quickly to meet me, not one male belonging to Nabal would have been left alive by daybreak.>>"
1SM	25	35	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10453	" {35} Then David accepted from her hand what she had brought him and said,"
1SM	25	35	David	#07		10454	 << Go home in peace. I have heard your words and granted your request.>>
1SM	25	36	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10455	" {36} When Abigail went to Nabal, he was in the house holding a banquet like that of a king. He was in high spirits and very drunk. So she told him nothing until daybreak."
1SM	25	37	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10456	" {37} Then in the morning, when Nabal was sober, his wife told him all these things, and his heart failed him and he became like a stone."
1SM	25	38	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10457	" {38} About ten days later, the Lord struck Nabal and he died. {39} When David heard that Nabal was dead, he said,"
1SM	25	39	David	#07		10458	" << Praise be to the Lord, who has upheld my cause against Nabal for treating me with contempt."
1SM	25	39	David	#07		10459	 He has kept his servant from doing wrong and has brought Nabal's wrongdoing down on his own head.>>
1SM	25	39	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10460	" Then David sent word to Abigail, asking her to become his wife. {40} His servants went to Carmel and said to Abigail,"
1SM	25	40	Servant	#12		10461	 << David has sent us to you to take you to become his wife.>>
1SM	25	41	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10462	" {41} She bowed down with her face to the ground and said,"
1SM	25	41	Abigail (female)	#24		10463	" << Here is your maidservant, ready to serve you and wash the feet of my master's servants.>>"
1SM	25	42	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10464	" {42} Abigail quickly got on a donkey and, attended by her five maids, went with David's messengers and became his wife."
1SM	25	43	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10465	" {43} David had also married Ahinoam of Jezreel, and they both were his wives."
