1SM	29	7	Achish	#17		10612	 {7} Turn back and go in peace; do nothing to displease the Philistine rulers.>>
1SM	29	8	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10613	" {8} David asked,"

1SM	29	9	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10615	" {9} Achish answered,"
1SM	29	9	Achish	#17		10616	 << I know that you have been as pleasing in my eyes as an angel of God;
1SM	29	9	Achish	#17		10617	" nevertheless, the Philistine commanders have said, 'He must not go up with us into battle.'"
1SM	29	10	Achish	#17		10618	" {10} Now get up early, along with your master's servants who have come with you, and leave in the morning as soon as it is light.>>"
1SM	29	11	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10619	" {11} So David and his men got up early in the morning to go back to the land of the Philistines, and the Philistines went up to Jezreel.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
1SM	30	<<	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10620	1 SAMUEL 30
1SM	30	1	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10621	 {1} David and his men reached Ziklag on the third day. Now the Amalekites had raided the Negev and Ziklag.
1SM	30	1	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10622	" They had attacked Ziklag and burned it, {2} and had taken captive the women and all who were in it, both young and old."
1SM	30	2	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10623	" They killed none of them, but carried them off as they went on their way."
1SM	30	3	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10624	" {3} When David and his men came to Ziklag, they found it destroyed by fire and their wives and sons and daughters taken captive."
1SM	30	4	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10625	" {4} So David and his men wept aloud until they had no strength left to weep. {5} David's two wives had been captured--Ahinoam of Jezreel and Abigail, the widow of Nabal of Carmel."
1SM	30	6	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10626	 {6} David was greatly distressed because the men were talking of stoning him; each one was bitter in spirit because of his sons and daughters. But David found strength in the Lord his God.
1SM	30	7	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10627	" {7} Then David said to Abiathar the priest, the son of Ahimelech,"

1SM	30	9	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10633	" {9} David and the six hundred men with him came to the Besor Ravine, where some stayed behind, {10} for two hundred men were too exhausted to cross the ravine."
1SM	30	10	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10634	 But David and four hundred men continued the pursuit. {11} They found an Egyptian in a field and brought him to David.
1SM	30	11	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10635	 They gave him water to drink and food to eat-- {12} part of a cake of pressed figs and two cakes of raisins.
1SM	30	12	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10636	" He ate and was revived, for he had not eaten any food or drunk any water for three days and three nights. {13} David asked him,"

1SM	30	14	Egyptian	#21		10640	 {14} We raided the Negev of the Kerethites and the territory belonging to Judah and the Negev of Caleb. And we burned Ziklag. >>
1SM	30	15	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10641	" {15} David asked him,"

1SM	30	16	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10645	" {16} He led David down, and there they were, scattered over the countryside, eating, drinking and reveling because of the great amount of plunder they had taken from the land of the Philistines and from Judah."
1SM	30	17	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10646	" {17} David fought them from dusk until the evening of the next day, and none of them got away, except four hundred young men who rode off on camels and fled."
1SM	30	18	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10647	" {18} David recovered everything the Amalekites had taken, including his two wives."
1SM	30	19	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10648	" {19} Nothing was missing: young or old, boy or girl, plunder or anything else they had taken. David brought everything back."
1SM	30	20	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10649	" {20} He took all the flocks and herds, and his men drove them ahead of the other livestock, saying,"
1SM	30	20	Man	#04		10650	 << This is David's plunder.>>
1SM	30	21	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10651	 {21} Then David came to the two hundred men who had been too exhausted to follow him and who were left behind at the Besor Ravine.
1SM	30	21	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10652	" They came out to meet David and the people with him. As David and his men approached, he greeted them. {22} But all the evil men and troublemakers among David's followers said,"
1SM	30	22	Man	#14		10653	" << Because they did not go out with us, we will not share with them the plunder we recovered."
1SM	30	22	Man	#14		10654	" However, each man may take his wife and children and go.>>"
1SM	30	23	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10655	" {23} David replied,"
1SM	30	23	David	#07		10656	" << No, my brothers, you must not do that with what the Lord has given us. He has protected us and handed over to us the forces that came against us."
1SM	30	24	David	#07		10657	 {24} Who will listen to what you say? The share of the man who stayed with the supplies is to be the same as that of him who went down to the battle. All will share alike.>>
1SM	30	25	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10658	 {25} David made this a statute and ordinance for Israel from that day to this.
1SM	30	26	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10659	" {26} When David arrived in Ziklag, he sent some of the plunder to the elders of Judah, who were his friends, saying,"

1SM	31	<<	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10666	1 SAMUEL 31

1SM	31	5	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10672	" {5} When the armor-bearer saw that Saul was dead, he too fell on his sword and died with him."

1SM	31	7	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10674	" {7} When the Israelites along the valley and those across the Jordan saw that the Israelite army had fled and that Saul and his sons had died, they abandoned their towns and fled."
1SM	31	7	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10675	" And the Philistines came and occupied them. {8} The next day, when the Philistines came to strip the dead, they found Saul and his three sons fallen on Mount Gilboa."
1SM	31	9	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10676	" {9} They cut off his head and stripped off his armor, and they sent messengers throughout the land of the Philistines to proclaim the news in the temple of their idols and among their people."

1SM	31	11	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10678	" {11} When the people of Jabesh Gilead heard of what the Philistines had done to Saul, {12} all their valiant men journeyed through the night to Beth Shan."
1SM	31	12	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10679	" They took down the bodies of Saul and his sons from the wall of Beth Shan and went to Jabesh, where they burned them."
1SM	31	13	Narr_09: 1_Samuel	#01		10680	" {13} Then they took their bones and buried them under a tamarisk tree at Jabesh, and they fasted seven days.*~**~*||||| + 5 SECs |||||*~*"

2SM	1	17	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10712	" {17} David took up this lament concerning Saul and his son Jonathan, {18} and ordered that the men of Judah be taught this lament of the bow (it is written in the Book of Jashar):"
2SM	1	19	David	#07		10713	" {19} << Your glory, O Israel, lies slain on your heights. How the mighty have fallen!"
2SM	1	20	David	#07		10714	" {20} <<Tell it not in Gath, proclaim it not in the streets of Ashkelon, lest the daughters of the Philistines be glad, lest the daughters of the uncircumcised rejoice."

2SM	1	21	David	#07		10716	" For there the shield of the mighty was defiled, the shield of Saul--no longer rubbed with oil."
2SM	1	22	David	#07		10717	" {22} From the blood of the slain, from the flesh of the mighty, the bow of Jonathan did not turn back, the sword of Saul did not return unsatisfied."
2SM	1	23	David	#07		10718	" {23} << Saul and Jonathan-- in life they were loved and gracious, and in death they were not parted. They were swifter than eagles, they were stronger than lions. <<"

2SM	1	26	David	#07		10721	" {26} I grieve for you, Jonathan my brother; you were very dear to me. Your love for me was wonderful, more wonderful than that of women. <<"
2SM	1	27	David	#07		10722	 {27} How the mighty have fallen! The weapons of war have perished!>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
2SM	2	<<	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10723	2 SAMUEL 2

2SM	2	7	David	#07		10739	" {7} Now then, be strong and brave, for Saul your master is dead, and the house of Judah has anointed me king over them.>>"
2SM	2	8	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10740	" {8} Meanwhile, Abner son of Ner, the commander of Saul's army, had taken Ish-Bosheth son of Saul and brought him over to Mahanaim."

2SM	2	10	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10742	" {10} Ish-Bosheth son of Saul was forty years old when he became king over Israel, and he reigned two years. The house of Judah, however, followed David."
2SM	2	11	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10743	 {11} The length of time David was king in Hebron over the house of Judah was seven years and six months.
2SM	2	12	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10744	" {12} Abner son of Ner, together with the men of Ish-Bosheth son of Saul, left Mahanaim and went to Gibeon."
2SM	2	13	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10745	 {13} Joab son of Zeruiah and David's men went out and met them at the pool of Gibeon.
2SM	2	13	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10746	" One group sat down on one side of the pool and one group on the other side. {14} Then Abner said to Joab,"
2SM	2	14	Abner	#06		10747	 << Let's have some of the young men get up and fight hand to hand in front of us.>>
2SM	2	14	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10748	" Joab said,"
2SM	2	14	Joab	#08		10749	" << All right, let them do it.>>"
2SM	2	15	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10750	" {15} So they stood up and were counted off--twelve men for Benjamin and Ish-Bosheth son of Saul, and twelve for David."
2SM	2	16	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10751	" {16} Then each man grabbed his opponent by the head and thrust his dagger into his opponent's side, and they fell down together. So that place in Gibeon was called Helkath Hazzurim."
2SM	2	17	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10752	" {17} The battle that day was very fierce, and Abner and the men of Israel were defeated by David's men."
2SM	2	18	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10753	" {18} The three sons of Zeruiah were there: Joab, Abishai and Asahel. Now Asahel was as fleet-footed as a wild gazelle."
2SM	2	19	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10754	" {19} He chased Abner, turning neither to the right nor to the left as he pursued him. {20} Abner looked behind him and asked,"
2SM	2	20	Abner	#06		10755	" << Is that you, Asahel?>>"
2SM	2	20	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10756	" He answered,"
2SM	2	20	Asahel	#12		10757	 << It is.>>
2SM	2	21	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10758	" {21} Then Abner said to him,"
2SM	2	21	Abner	#06		10759	 << Turn aside to the right or to the left; take on one of the young men and strip him of his weapons.>>
2SM	2	21	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10760	" But Asahel would not stop chasing him. {22} Again Abner warned Asahel,"
2SM	2	22	Abner	#06		10761	 << Stop chasing me! Why should I strike you down? How could I look your brother Joab in the face?>>
2SM	2	23	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10762	" {23} But Asahel refused to give up the pursuit; so Abner thrust the butt of his spear into Asahel's stomach, and the spear came out through his back."
2SM	2	23	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10763	 He fell there and died on the spot. And every man stopped when he came to the place where Asahel had fallen and died.
2SM	2	24	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10764	" {24} But Joab and Abishai pursued Abner, and as the sun was setting, they came to the hill of Ammah, near Giah on the way to the wasteland of Gibeon."
2SM	2	25	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10765	" {25} Then the men of Benjamin rallied behind Abner. They formed themselves into a group and took their stand on top of a hill. {26} Abner called out to Joab,"
2SM	2	26	Abner	#06		10766	 << Must the sword devour forever? Don't you realize that this will end in bitterness?
2SM	2	26	Abner	#06		10767	 How long before you order your men to stop pursuing pursuing their brothers?>>
2SM	2	27	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10768	" {27} Joab answered,"
2SM	2	27	Joab	#08		10769	" << As surely as God lives, if you had not spoken, the men would have continued the pursuit of their brothers until morning.>>"
2SM	2	28	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10770	" {28} So Joab blew the trumpet, and all the men came to a halt; they no longer pursued Israel, nor did they fight anymore."
2SM	2	29	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10771	" {29} All that night Abner and his men marched through the Arabah. They crossed the Jordan, continued through the whole Bithron and came to Mahanaim."
2SM	2	30	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10772	" {30} Then Joab returned from pursuing Abner and assembled all his men. Besides Asahel, nineteen of David's men were found missing."
2SM	2	31	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10773	 {31} But David's men had killed three hundred and sixty Benjamites who were with Abner.
2SM	2	32	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10774	 {32} They took Asahel and buried him in his father's tomb at Bethlehem. Then Joab and his men marched all night and arrived at Hebron by daybreak.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
2SM	3	<<	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10775	2 SAMUEL 3
2SM	3	1	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10776	" {1} The war between the house of Saul and the house of David lasted a long time. David grew stronger and stronger, while the house of Saul grew weaker and weaker."
2SM	3	2	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10777	 {2} Sons were born to David in Hebron: His firstborn was Amnon the son of Ahinoam of Jezreel;
2SM	3	3	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10778	" {3} his second, Kileab the son of Abigail the widow of Nabal of Carmel; the third, Absalom the son of Maacah daughter of Talmai king of Geshur;"
2SM	3	4	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10779	" {4} the fourth, Adonijah the son of Haggith; the fifth, Shephatiah the son of Abital;"
2SM	3	5	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10780	" {5} and the sixth, Ithream the son of David's wife Eglah. These were born to David in Hebron."
2SM	3	6	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10781	" {6} During the war between the house of Saul and the house of David, Abner had been strengthening his own position in the house of Saul."
2SM	3	7	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10782	" {7} Now Saul had had a concubine named Rizpah daughter of Aiah. And Ish-Bosheth said to Abner,"
2SM	3	7	Ish-Bosheth	#14		10783	 << Why did you sleep with my father's concubine?>>
2SM	3	8	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10784	" {8} Abner was very angry because of what Ish-Bosheth said and he answered,"
2SM	3	8	Abner	#06		10785	 << Am I a dog's head--on Judah's side? This very day I am loyal to the house of your father Saul and to his family and friends.
2SM	3	8	Abner	#06		10786	 I haven't handed you over to David. Yet now you accuse me of an offense involving this woman!
2SM	3	9	Abner	#06		10787	" {9} May God deal with Abner, be it ever so severely, if I do not do for David what the Lord promised him on oath"
2SM	3	10	Abner	#06		10788	 {10} and transfer the kingdom from the house of Saul and establish David's throne over Israel and Judah from Dan to Beersheba.>>
2SM	3	11	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10789	" {11} Ish-Bosheth did not dare to say another word to Abner, because he was afraid of him. {12} Then Abner sent messengers on his behalf to say to David,"
2SM	3	12	Joab	#08		10790	 << Whose land is it?
2SM	3	12	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10791	 he asked.
2SM	3	12	Joab	#08		10792	" Make an agreement with me, and I will help you bring all Israel over to you.>>"
2SM	3	13	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10793	" {13} David said,"
2SM	3	13	David	#07		10794	 << Good. I will make an agreement with you. But I demand one thing of you:
2SM	3	13	David	#07		10795	 Do not come into my presence unless you bring Michal daughter of Saul when you come to see me.>>
2SM	3	14	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10796	" {14} Then David sent messengers to Ish-Bosheth son of Saul, demanding,"
2SM	3	14	David	#07		10797	" << Give me my wife Michal, whom I betrothed to myself for the price of a hundred Philistine foreskins.>>"
2SM	3	15	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10798	 {15} So Ish-Bosheth gave orders and had her taken away from her husband Paltiel son of Laish.
2SM	3	16	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10799	" {16} Her husband, however, went with her, weeping behind her all the way to Bahurim. Then Abner said to him,"
2SM	3	16	Abner	#06		10800	 << Go back home!>>
2SM	3	16	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10801	" So he went back. {17} Abner conferred with the elders of Israel and said,"
2SM	3	17	Abner	#06		10802	 << For some time you have wanted to make David your king.
2SM	3	18	Abner	#06		10803	" {18} Now do it! For the Lord promised David,"
2SM	3	18	Abner	#06		10804	 By my servant David I will rescue my people Israel from the hand of the Philistines and from the hand of all their enemies.'>>
2SM	3	19	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10805	 {19} Abner also spoke to the Benjamites in person. Then he went to Hebron to tell David everything that Israel and the whole house of Benjamin wanted to do.
2SM	3	20	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10806	" {20} When Abner, who had twenty men with him, came to David at Hebron, David prepared a feast for him and his men. {21} Then Abner said to David,"
2SM	3	21	Abner	#06		10807	" << Let me go at once and assemble all Israel for my lord the king, so that they may make a compact with you, and that you may rule over all that your heart desires.>>"
2SM	3	21	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10808	" So David sent Abner away, and he went in peace."
2SM	3	22	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10809	 {22} Just then David's men and Joab returned from a raid and brought with them a great deal of plunder.
2SM	3	22	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10810	" But Abner was no longer with David in Hebron, because David had sent him away, and he had gone in peace."
2SM	3	23	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10811	" {23} When Joab and all the soldiers with him arrived, he was told,"
2SM	3	23	Man	#02		10812	 <<Abner son of Ner came to the king and he has sent him away and he went in peace.>>
2SM	3	24	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10813	" {24} So Joab went to the king and said,"
2SM	3	24	Joab	#08		10814	" << What have you done? Look, Abner came to you. Why did you let him go? Now he is gone!"
2SM	3	25	Joab	#08		10815	 {25} You know Abner son of Ner;
2SM	3	25	Joab	#08		10816	 he came to deceive you and observe your movements and find out everything you are doing.>>
2SM	3	26	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10817	" {26} Joab then left David and sent messengers after Abner, and they brought him back from the well of Sirah. But David did not know it."
2SM	3	27	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10818	" {27} Now when Abner returned to Hebron, Joab took him aside into the gateway, as though to speak with him privately."
2SM	3	27	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10819	" And there, to avenge the blood of his brother Asahel, Joab stabbed him in the stomach, and he died."
2SM	3	28	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10820	" {28} Later, when David heard about this, he said,"
2SM	3	28	David	#07		10821	 << I and my kingdom are forever innocent before the Lord concerning the blood of Abner son of Ner.
2SM	3	29	David	#07		10822	 {29} May his blood fall upon the head of Joab and upon all his father's house!
2SM	3	29	David	#07		10823	 May Joab's house never be without someone who has a running sore or leprosy or who leans on a crutch or who falls by the sword or who lacks food.>>
2SM	3	30	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10824	 {30} (Joab and his brother Abishai murdered Abner because he had killed their brother Asahel in the battle at Gibeon.)
2SM	3	31	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10825	" {31} Then David said to Joab and all the people with him,"
2SM	3	31	David	#07		10826	 << Tear your clothes and put on sackcloth and walk in mourning in front of Abner.>>
2SM	3	31	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10827	" King David himself walked behind the bier. {32} They buried Abner in Hebron, and the king wept aloud at Abner's tomb. All the people wept also."
2SM	3	33	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10828	 {33} The king sang this lament for Abner:
2SM	3	33	David	#07		10829	 << Should Abner have died as the lawless die?
2SM	3	34	David	#07		10830	" {34} Your hands were not bound, your feet were not fettered. You fell as one falls before wicked men.>>"
2SM	3	34	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10831	" And all the people wept over him again. {35} Then they all came and urged David to eat something while it was still day; but David took an oath, saying,"
2SM	3	35	David	#07		10832	" << May God deal with me, be it ever so severely, if I taste bread or anything else before the sun sets!>>"
2SM	3	36	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10833	" {36} All the people took note and were pleased; indeed, everything the king did pleased them."
2SM	3	37	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10834	" {37} So on that day all the people and all Israel knew that the king had no part in the murder of Abner son of Ner. {38} Then the king said to his men,"
2SM	3	38	David	#07		10835	 << Do you not realize that a prince and a great man has fallen in Israel this day?
2SM	3	39	David	#07		10836	" {39} And today, though I am the anointed king, I am weak, and these sons of Zeruiah are too strong for me. May the Lord repay the evildoer according to his evil deeds!>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"

2SM	4	6	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10845	" {6} They went into the inner part of the house as if to get some wheat, and they stabbed him in the stomach. Then Recab and his brother Baanah slipped away."

2SM	4	10	David	#07		10851	" {10} when a man told me, 'Saul is dead,' and thought he was bringing good news, I seized him and put him to death in Ziklag. That was the reward I gave him for his news!"

2SM	6	11	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10902	" {11} The ark of the Lord remained in the house of Obed-Edom the Gittite for three months, and the Lord blessed him and his entire household. {12} Now King David was told,"

2SM	6	16	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10908	" And when she saw King David leaping and dancing before the Lord, she despised him in her heart."
2SM	6	17	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10909	" {17} They brought the ark of the Lord and set it in its place inside the tent that David had pitched for it, and David sacrificed burnt offerings and fellowship offerings before the Lord."
2SM	6	18	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10910	" {18} After he had finished sacrificing the burnt offerings and fellowship offerings, he blessed the people in the name of the Lord Almighty."
2SM	6	19	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10911	" {19} Then he gave a loaf of bread, a cake of dates and a cake of raisins to each person in the whole crowd of Israelites, both men and women. And all the people went to their homes."
2SM	6	20	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10912	" {20} When David returned home to bless his household, Michal daughter of Saul came out to meet him and said,"
2SM	6	20	Michal (David's wife)	#25		10913	" << How the king of Israel has distinguished himself today, disrobing in the sight of the slave girls of his servants as any vulgar fellow would!>>"
2SM	6	21	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10914	" {21} David said to Michal,"
2SM	6	21	David	#07		10915	" << It was before the Lord, who chose me rather than your father or anyone from his house when he appointed me ruler over the Lord's people Israel --I will celebrate before the Lord."
2SM	6	22	David	#07		10916	" {22} I will become even more undignified than this, and I will be humiliated in my own eyes. But by these slave girls you spoke of, I will be held in honor.>>"
2SM	6	23	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10917	 {23} And Michal daughter of Saul had no children to the day of her death.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
2SM	7	<<	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10918	2 SAMUEL 7
2SM	7	1	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10919	" {1} After the king was settled in his palace and the Lord had given him rest from all his enemies around him, {2} he said to Nathan the prophet,"
2SM	7	2	David	#07		10920	" << Here I am, living in a palace of cedar, while the ark of God remains in a tent.>>"
2SM	7	3	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10921	" {3} Nathan replied to the king,"
2SM	7	3	Nathan	#06		10922	" << Whatever you have in mind, go ahead and do it, for the Lord is with you.>>"
2SM	7	4	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10923	" {4} That night the word of the Lord came to Nathan, saying:"
2SM	7	5	God-FX1	#20		10924	" {5} << Go and tell my servant David, 'This is what the Lord says: Are you the one to build me a house to dwell in?"
2SM	7	6	God-FX1	#20		10925	 {6} I have not dwelt in a house from the day I brought the Israelites up out of Egypt to this day. I have been moving from place to place with a tent as my dwelling.
2SM	7	7	God-FX1	#20		10926	" {7} Wherever I have moved with all the Israelites, did I ever say to any of their rulers whom I commanded to shepherd my people Israel, << Why have you not built me a house of cedar?>> '"
2SM	7	8	God-FX1	#20		10927	" {8} << Now then, tell my servant David, 'This is what the Lord Almighty says: I took you from the pasture and from following the flock to be ruler over my people Israel."
2SM	7	9	God-FX1	#20		10928	" {9} I have been with you wherever you have gone, and I have cut off all your enemies from before you. Now I will make your name great, like the names of the greatest men of the earth."
2SM	7	10	God-FX1	#20		10929	 {10} And I will provide a place for my people Israel and will plant them so that they can have a home of their own and no longer be disturbed.
2SM	7	10	God-FX1	#20		10930	" Wicked people will not oppress them anymore, as they did at the beginning"
2SM	7	11	God-FX1	#20		10931	 {11} and have done ever since the time I appointed leaders over my people Israel.
2SM	7	11	God-FX1	#20		10932	 I will also give you rest from all your enemies. << 'The Lord declares to you that the Lord himself will establish a house for you:
2SM	7	12	God-FX1	#20		10933	" {12} When your days are over and you rest with your fathers, I will raise up your offspring to succeed you, who will come from your own body, and I will establish his kingdom."
2SM	7	13	God-FX1	#20		10934	" {13} He is the one who will build a house for my Name, and I will establish the throne of his kingdom forever."
2SM	7	14	God-FX1	#20		10935	" {14} I will be his father, and he will be my son. When he does wrong, I will punish him with the rod of men, with floggings inflicted by men."
2SM	7	15	God-FX1	#20		10936	" {15} But my love will never be taken away from him, as I took it away from Saul, whom I removed from before you."
2SM	7	16	God-FX1	#20		10937	 {16} Your house and your kingdom will endure forever before me; your throne will be established forever.'>>
2SM	7	17	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10938	 {17} Nathan reported to David all the words of this entire revelation.
2SM	7	18	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10939	" {18} Then King David went in and sat before the Lord, and he said:"
2SM	7	18	David	#07		10940	" << Who am I, O Sovereign Lord, and what is my family, that you have brought me this far?"
2SM	7	19	David	#07		10941	" {19} And as if this were not enough in your sight, O Sovereign Lord, you have also spoken about the future of the house of your servant."
2SM	7	19	David	#07		10942	" Is this your usual way of dealing with man, O Sovereign Lord? <<"
2SM	7	20	David	#07		10943	" {20} What more can David say to you? For you know your servant, O Sovereign Lord."
2SM	7	21	David	#07		10944	" {21} For the sake of your word and according to your will, you have done this great thing and made it known to your servant."
2SM	7	22	David	#07		10945	" {22} << How great you are, O Sovereign Lord! There is no one like you, and there is no God but you, as we have heard with our own ears."
2SM	7	23	David	#07		10946	" {23} And who is like your people Israel --the one nation on earth that God went out to redeem as a people for himself, and to make a name for himself,"
2SM	7	23	David	#07		10947	" and to perform great and awesome wonders by driving out nations and their gods from before your people, whom you redeemed from Egypt?"
2SM	7	24	David	#07		10948	" {24} You have established your people Israel as your very own forever, and you, O Lord, have become their God."
2SM	7	25	David	#07		10949	" {25} And now, Lord God, keep forever the promise you have made concerning your servant and his house."
2SM	7	25	David	#07		10950	" Do as you promised, {26} so that your name will be great forever."
2SM	7	26	David	#07		10951	" Then men will say, 'The Lord Almighty is God over Israel!' And the house of your servant David will be established before you."
2SM	7	27	David	#07		10952	" {27} << O Lord Almighty, God of Israel, you have revealed this to your servant, saying, 'I will build a house for you.'"
2SM	7	27	David	#07		10953	 So your servant has found courage to offer you this prayer.
2SM	7	28	David	#07		10954	" {28} O Sovereign Lord, you are God! Your words are trustworthy, and you have promised these good things to your servant."
2SM	7	29	David	#07		10955	" {29} Now be pleased to bless the house of your servant, that it may continue forever in your sight;"
2SM	7	29	David	#07		10956	" for you, O Sovereign Lord, have spoken, and with your blessing the house of your servant will be blessed forever.>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
2SM	8	<<	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10957	2 SAMUEL 8
2SM	8	1	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10958	" {1} In the course of time, David defeated the Philistines and subdued them, and he took Metheg Ammah from the control of the Philistines."
2SM	8	2	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10959	 {2} David also defeated the Moabites. He made them lie down on the ground and measured them off with a length of cord.
2SM	8	2	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10960	" Every two lengths of them were put to death, and the third length was allowed to live. So the Moabites became subject to David and brought tribute."
2SM	8	3	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10961	" {3} Moreover, David fought Hadadezer son of Rehob, king of Zobah, when he went to restore his control along the Euphrates River."
2SM	8	4	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10962	" {4} David captured a thousand of his chariots, seven thousand charioteers and twenty thousand foot soldiers. He hamstrung all but a hundred of the chariot horses."
2SM	8	5	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10963	" {5} When the Arameans of Damascus came to help Hadadezer king of Zobah, David struck down twenty-two thousand of them."
2SM	8	6	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10964	" {6} He put garrisons in the Aramean kingdom of Damascus, and the Arameans became subject to him and brought tribute."
2SM	8	7	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10965	 {7} The Lord gave David victory wherever he went. David took the gold shields that belonged to the officers of Hadadezer and brought them to Jerusalem.
2SM	8	8	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10966	" {8} From Tebah and Berothai, towns that belonged to Hadadezer, King David took a great quantity of bronze."
2SM	8	9	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10967	" {9} When Tou king of Hamath heard that David had defeated the entire army of Hadadezer,"
2SM	8	10	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10968	" {10} he sent his son Joram to King David to greet him and congratulate him on his victory in battle over Hadadezer, who had been at war with Tou."
2SM	8	10	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10969	 Joram brought with him articles of silver and gold and bronze.
2SM	8	11	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10970	" {11} King David dedicated these articles to the Lord, as he had done with the silver and gold from all the nations he had subdued:"
2SM	8	12	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10971	" {12} Edom and Moab, the Ammonites and the Philistines, and Amalek. He also dedicated the plunder taken from Hadadezer son of Rehob, king of Zobah."
2SM	8	13	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10972	 {13} And David became famous after he returned from striking down eighteen thousand Edomites in the Valley of Salt.
2SM	8	14	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10973	" {14} He put garrisons throughout Edom, and all the Edomites became subject to David. The Lord gave David victory wherever he went."
2SM	8	15	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10974	" {15} David reigned over all Israel, doing what was just and right for all his people."
2SM	8	16	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10975	 {16} Joab son of Zeruiah was over the army; Jehoshaphat son of Ahilud was recorder;
2SM	8	17	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10976	 {17} Zadok son of Ahitub and Ahimelech son of Abiathar were priests; Seraiah was secretary;
2SM	8	18	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		10977	 {18} Benaiah son of Jehoiada was over the Kerethites and Pelethites; and David's sons were royal advisers.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*

2SM	9	10	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11006	" (Now Ziba had fifteen sons and twenty servants.) {11} Then Ziba said to the king,"

2SM	9	11	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11008	 So Mephibosheth ate at David's table like one of the king's sons.
2SM	9	12	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11009	" {12} Mephibosheth had a young son named Mica, and all the members of Ziba's household were servants of Mephibosheth."
2SM	9	13	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11010	" {13} And Mephibosheth lived in Jerusalem, because he always ate at the king's table, and he was crippled in both feet.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
2SM	10	<<	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11011	2 SAMUEL 10
2SM	10	1	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11012	" {1} In the course of time, the king of the Ammonites died, and his son Hanun succeeded him as king. {2} David thought,"
2SM	10	2	David	#07		11013	" << I will show kindness to Hanun son of Nahash, just as his father showed kindness to me.>>"
2SM	10	2	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11014	" So David sent a delegation to express his sympathy to Hanun concerning his father. When David's men came to the land of the Ammonites, {3} the Ammonite nobles said to Hanun their lord,"
2SM	10	3	Noble	#18		11015	 << Do you think David is honoring your father by sending men to you to express sympathy?
2SM	10	3	Noble	#18		11016	 Hasn't David sent them to you to explore the city and spy it out and overthrow it?>>
2SM	10	4	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11017	" {4} So Hanun seized David's men, shaved off half of each man's beard, cut off their garments in the middle at the buttocks, and sent them away."
2SM	10	5	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11018	" {5} When David was told about this, he sent messengers to meet the men, for they were greatly humiliated. The king said,"
2SM	10	5	David	#07		11019	" << Stay at Jericho till your beards have grown, and then come back.>>"
2SM	10	6	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11020	" {6} When the Ammonites realized that they had become a stench in David's nostrils, they hired twenty thousand Aramean foot soldiers from Beth Rehob and Zobah,"
2SM	10	6	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11021	" as well as the king of Maacah with a thousand men, and also twelve thousand men from Tob."
2SM	10	7	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11022	" {7} On hearing this, David sent Joab out with the entire army of fighting men."
2SM	10	8	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11023	" {8} The Ammonites came out and drew up in battle formation at the entrance to their city gate, while the Arameans of Zobah and Rehob and the men of Tob and Maacah were by themselves in the open country."
2SM	10	9	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11024	 {9} Joab saw that there were battle lines in front of him and behind him; so he selected some of the best troops in Israel and deployed them against the Arameans.
2SM	10	10	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11025	" {10} He put the rest of the men under the command of Abishai his brother and deployed them against the Ammonites. {11} Joab said,"
2SM	10	11	Joab	#08		11026	" << If the Arameans are too strong for me, then you are to come to my rescue;"
2SM	10	11	Joab	#08		11027	" but if the Ammonites are too strong for you, then I will come to rescue you."
2SM	10	12	Joab	#08		11028	 {12} Be strong and let us fight bravely for our people and the cities of our God. The Lord will do what is good in his sight.>>
2SM	10	13	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11029	" {13} Then Joab and the troops with him advanced to fight the Arameans, and they fled before him."
2SM	10	14	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11030	" {14} When the Ammonites saw that the Arameans were fleeing, they fled before Abishai and went inside the city. So Joab returned from fighting the Ammonites and came to Jerusalem."
2SM	10	15	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11031	" {15} After the Arameans saw that they had been routed by Israel, they regrouped."
2SM	10	16	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11032	" {16} Hadadezer had Arameans brought from beyond the River; they went to Helam, with Shobach the commander of Hadadezer's army leading them."
2SM	10	17	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11033	" {17} When David was told of this, he gathered all Israel, crossed the Jordan and went to Helam. The Arameans formed their battle lines to meet David and fought against him."
2SM	10	18	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11034	" {18} But they fled before Israel, and David killed seven hundred of their charioteers and forty thousand of their foot soldiers."
2SM	10	18	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11035	" He also struck down Shobach the commander of their army, and he died there."
2SM	10	19	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11036	" {19} When all the kings who were vassals of Hadadezer saw that they had been defeated by Israel, they made peace with the Israelites and became subject to them."
2SM	10	19	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11037	 So the Arameans were afraid to help the Ammonites anymore.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
2SM	11	<<	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11038	2 SAMUEL 11
2SM	11	1	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11039	" {1} In the spring, at the time when kings go off to war, David sent Joab out with the king's men and the whole Israelite army."
2SM	11	1	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11040	 They destroyed the Ammonites and besieged Rabbah. But David remained in Jerusalem.
2SM	11	2	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11041	 {2} One evening David got up from his bed and walked around on the roof of the palace.
2SM	11	2	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11042	" From the roof he saw a woman bathing. The woman was very beautiful, {3} and David sent someone to find out about her. The man said,"
2SM	11	3	Man	#09		11043	" << Isn't this Bathsheba, the daughter of Eliam and the wife of Uriah the Hittite?>>"
2SM	11	4	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11044	" {4} Then David sent messengers to get her. She came to him, and he slept with her. (She had purified herself from her uncleanness.) Then she went back home."
2SM	11	5	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11045	" {5} The woman conceived and sent word to David, saying,"

2SM	11	13	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11062	" {13} At David's invitation, he ate and drank with him, and David made him drunk."
2SM	11	13	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11063	 But in the evening Uriah went out to sleep on his mat among his master's servants; he did not go home.
2SM	11	14	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11064	" {14} In the morning David wrote a letter to Joab and sent it with Uriah. {15} In it he wrote,"
2SM	11	15	David	#07		11065	 << Put Uriah in the front line where the fighting is fiercest. Then withdraw from him so he will be struck down and die.>>
2SM	11	16	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11066	" {16} So while Joab had the city under siege, he put Uriah at a place where he knew the strongest defenders were."
2SM	11	17	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11067	" {17} When the men of the city came out and fought against Joab, some of the men in David's army fell; moreover, Uriah the Hittite was dead."
2SM	11	18	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11068	 {18} Joab sent David a full account of the battle. {19} He instructed the messenger:
2SM	11	19	Joab	#08		11069	" << When you have finished giving the king this account of the battle, {20} the king's anger may flare up, and he may ask you, 'Why did you get so close to the city to fight?"
2SM	11	20	Joab	#08		11070	 Didn't you know they would shoot arrows from the wall?
2SM	11	21	Joab	#08		11071	" {21} Who killed Abimelech son of Jerub-Besheth? Didn't a woman throw an upper millstone on him from the wall, so that he died in Thebez?"
2SM	11	21	Joab	#08		11072	" Why did you get so close to the wall?' If he asks you this, then say to him, 'Also, your servant Uriah the Hittite is dead.'>>"
2SM	11	22	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11073	" {22} The messenger set out, and when he arrived he told David everything Joab had sent him to say. {23} The messenger said to David,"
2SM	11	23	Messenger	#04		11074	" << The men overpowered us and came out against us in the open, but we drove them back to the entrance to the city gate."
2SM	11	24	Messenger	#04		11075	" {24} Then the archers shot arrows at your servants from the wall, and some of the king's men died."
2SM	11	24	Messenger	#04		11076	" Moreover, your servant Uriah the Hittite is dead.>>"
2SM	11	25	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11077	" {25} David told the messenger,"
2SM	11	25	David	#07		11078	 << Say this to Joab: 'Don't let this upset you; the sword devours one as well as another. Press the attack against the city and destroy it.' Say this to encourage Joab.
2SM	11	26	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11079	" {26} When Uriah's wife heard that her husband was dead, she mourned for him."
2SM	11	27	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11080	" {27} After the time of mourning was over, David had her brought to his house, and she became his wife and bore him a son. But the thing David had done displeased the Lord.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
2SM	12	<<	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11081	2 SAMUEL 12
2SM	12	1	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11082	" {1} The Lord sent Nathan to David. When he came to him, he said,"
2SM	12	1	Nathan	#06		11083	" << There were two men in a certain town, one rich and the other poor."
2SM	12	2	Nathan	#06		11084	" {2} The rich man had a very large number of sheep and cattle, {3} but the poor man had nothing except one little ewe lamb he had bought."
2SM	12	3	Nathan	#06		11085	" He raised it, and it grew up with him and his children."
2SM	12	3	Nathan	#06		11086	" It shared his food, drank from his cup and even slept in his arms. It was like a daughter to him. <<"
2SM	12	4	Nathan	#06		11087	" {4} Now a traveler came to the rich man, but the rich man refrained from taking one of his own sheep or cattle to prepare a meal for the traveler who had come to him."
2SM	12	4	Nathan	#06		11088	" Instead, he took the ewe lamb that belonged to the poor man and prepared it for the one who had come to him.>>"
2SM	12	5	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11089	" {5} David burned with anger against the man and said to Nathan,"
2SM	12	5	David	#07		11090	" << As surely as the Lord lives, the man who did this deserves to die!"
2SM	12	6	David	#07		11091	" {6} He must pay for that lamb four times over, because he did such a thing and had no pity.>>"
2SM	12	7	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11092	" {7} Then Nathan said to David,"
2SM	12	7	Nathan	#06		11093	" << You are the man! This is what the Lord, the God of Israel, says:"
2SM	12	7	Nathan	#06		11094	 'I anointed you king over Israel and I delivered you from the hand of Saul.
2SM	12	7	Nathan	#06		11095	" I gave your master's house to you, and your master's wives into your arms."
2SM	12	8	Nathan	#06		11096	" {8} I gave you the house of Israel and Judah. And if all this had been too little, I would have given you even more."
2SM	12	9	Nathan	#06		11097	 {9} Why did you despise the word of the Lord by doing what is evil in his eyes?
2SM	12	9	Nathan	#06		11098	 You struck down Uriah the Hittite with the sword and took his wife to be your own. You killed him with the sword of the Ammonites.
2SM	12	10	Nathan	#06		11099	" {10} Now, therefore, the sword will never depart from your house, because you despised me and took the wife of Uriah the Hittite to be your own.'"
2SM	12	11	Nathan	#06		11100	 {11} This is what the Lord says: 'Out of your own household I am going to bring calamity upon you.
2SM	12	11	Nathan	#06		11101	" Before your very eyes I will take your wives and give them to one who is close to you, and he will lie with your wives in broad daylight."
2SM	12	12	Nathan	#06		11102	" {12} You did it in secret, but I will do this thing in broad daylight before all Israel."
2SM	12	13	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11103	" {13} Then David said to Nathan,"
2SM	12	13	David	#07		11104	 << I have sinned against the Lord.>>
2SM	12	13	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11105	" Nathan replied,"
2SM	12	13	Nathan	#06		11106	 << The Lord has taken away your sin. You are not going to die.
2SM	12	14	Nathan	#06		11107	" {14} But because by doing this you have made the enemies of the Lord show utter contempt, the son born to you will die.>>"
2SM	12	15	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11108	" {15} After Nathan had gone home, the Lord struck the child that Uriah's wife had borne to David, and he became ill."
2SM	12	16	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11109	 {16} David pleaded with God for the child. He fasted and went into his house and spent the nights lying on the ground.
2SM	12	17	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11110	" {17} The elders of his household stood beside him to get him up from the ground, but he refused, and he would not eat any food with them."
2SM	12	18	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11111	" {18} On the seventh day the child died. David's servants were afraid to tell him that the child was dead, for they thought,"
2SM	12	18	Servant	#09		11112	" << While the child was still living, we spoke to David but he would not listen to us."
2SM	12	18	Servant	#09		11113	 How can we tell him the child is dead? He may do something desperate.>>
2SM	12	19	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11114	" {19} David noticed that his servants were whispering among themselves and he realized the child was dead. He asked,"
2SM	12	19	David	#07		11115	 << Is the child dead?>>
2SM	12	19	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11116	" They replied,"
2SM	12	19	Servant	#09		11117	" << Yes, he is dead.>>"
2SM	12	20	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11118	" {20} Then David got up from the ground. After he had washed, put on lotions and changed his clothes, he went into the house of the Lord and worshiped."
2SM	12	20	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11119	" Then he went to his own house, and at his request they served him food, and he ate. {21} His servants asked him,"
2SM	12	21	Servant	#09		11120	" << Why are you acting this way? While the child was alive, you fasted and wept, but now that the child is dead, you get up and eat!>>"
2SM	12	22	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11121	" {22} He answered,"
2SM	12	22	David	#07		11122	" << While the child was still alive, I fasted and wept. I thought, 'Who knows? The Lord may be gracious to me and let the child live.'"
2SM	12	23	David	#07		11123	" {23} But now that he is dead, why should I fast? Can I bring him back again? I will go to him, but he will not return to me.>>"
2SM	12	24	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11124	" {24} Then David comforted his wife Bathsheba, and he went to her and lay with her. She gave birth to a son, and they named him Solomon."
2SM	12	24	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11125	" The Lord loved him; {25} and because the Lord loved him, he sent word through Nathan the prophet to name him Jedidiah."
2SM	12	26	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11126	" {26} Meanwhile Joab fought against Rabbah of the Ammonites and captured the royal citadel. {27} Joab then sent messengers to David, saying,"
2SM	12	27	Joab	#08		11127	 << I have fought against Rabbah and taken its water supply.
2SM	12	28	Joab	#08		11128	" {28} Now muster the rest of the troops and besiege the city and capture it. Otherwise I will take the city, and it will be named after me.>>"
2SM	12	29	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11129	" {29} So David mustered the entire army and went to Rabbah, and attacked and captured it."
2SM	12	30	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11130	" {30} He took the crown from the head of their king--its weight was a talent of gold, and it was set with precious stones--and it was placed on David's head."
2SM	12	30	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11131	" He took a great quantity of plunder from the city {31} and brought out the people who were there, consigning them to labor with saws and with iron picks and axes, and he made them work at brickmaking."
2SM	12	31	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11132	 He did this to all the Ammonite towns. Then David and his entire army returned to Jerusalem.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*

2SM	13	2	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11135	" {2} Amnon became frustrated to the point of illness on account of his sister Tamar, for she was a virgin, and it seemed impossible for him to do anything to her."
2SM	13	3	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11136	" {3} Now Amnon had a friend named Jonadab son of Shimeah, David's brother. Jonadab was a very shrewd man. {4} He asked Amnon,"
2SM	13	4	Jonadab	#14		11137	" << Why do you, the king's son, look so haggard morning after morning? Won't you tell me?>>"
2SM	13	4	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11138	" Amnon said to him,"

2SM	13	8	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11148	" {8} So Tamar went to the house of her brother Amnon, who was lying down. She took some dough, kneaded it, made the bread in his sight and baked it."

2SM	13	10	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11153	" And Tamar took the bread she had prepared and brought it to her brother Amnon in his bedroom. {11} But when she took it to him to eat, he grabbed her and said,"

2SM	13	12	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11155	" {12} She said to him,"
2SM	13	12	Tamar (young female)	#25		11156	" << Don't my brother, don't force me."
2SM	13	12	Tamar (young female)	#25		11157	 Such a thing should not be done in Israel! Don't do this wicked thing.
2SM	13	13	Tamar (young female)	#25		11158	 {13} What about me? Where could I get rid of my disgrace?
2SM	13	13	Tamar (young female)	#25		11159	 And what about you? You would be like one of the wicked fools in Israel.
2SM	13	13	Tamar (young female)	#25		11160	 Please speak to the king; he will not keep me from being married to you.>>
2SM	13	14	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11161	" {14} But he refused to listen to her, and since he was stronger than she, he raped her."
2SM	13	15	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11162	" {15} Then Amnon hated her with intense hatred. In fact, he hated her more than he had loved her. Amnon said to her,"
2SM	13	15	Amnon (son of David)	#18		11163	 << Get up and get out!>>
2SM	13	16	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11164	" {16} She said to him,"

2SM	13	16	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11166	" But he refused to listen to her. {17} He called his personal servant and said,"
2SM	13	17	Amnon (son of David)	#18		11167	 << Get this woman out of here and bolt the door after her.>>
2SM	13	18	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11168	" {18} So his servant put her out and bolted the door after her. She was wearing a richly ornamented robe, for this was the kind of garment the virgin daughters of the king wore."
2SM	13	19	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11169	" {19} Tamar put ashes on her head and tore the ornamented robe she was wearing. She put her hand on her head and went away, weeping aloud as she went."
2SM	13	20	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11170	" {20} Her brother Absalom said to her,"
2SM	13	20	Absalom (son of David)	#10		11171	" << Has that Amnon, your brother, been with you? Be quiet now, my sister; he is your brother. Don't take this thing to heart.>>"
2SM	13	20	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11172	" And Tamar lived in her brother Absalom's house, a desolate woman. {21} When King David heard all this, he was furious."
2SM	13	22	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11173	" {22} Absalom never said a word to Amnon, either good or bad; he hated Amnon because he had disgraced his sister Tamar."
2SM	13	23	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11174	" {23} Two years later, when Absalom's sheepshearers were at Baal Hazor near the border of Ephraim, he invited all the king's sons to come there."
2SM	13	24	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11175	" {24} Absalom went to the king and said,"

2SM	13	25	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11179	" Although Absalom urged him, he still refused to go, but gave him his blessing. {26} Then Absalom said,"

2SM	13	26	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11181	" The king asked him,"

2SM	13	27	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11183	" {27} But Absalom urged him, so he sent with him Amnon and the rest of the king's sons. {28} Absalom ordered his men,"

2SM	13	28	Absalom (son of David)	#10		11185	 Don't be afraid. Have not I given you this order? Be strong and brave.>>
2SM	13	29	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11186	" {29} So Absalom's men did to Amnon what Absalom had ordered. Then all the king's sons got up, mounted their mules and fled. {30} While they were on their way, the report came to David:"
2SM	13	30	Man	#09		11187	 << Absalom has struck down all the king's sons; not one of them is left.>>
2SM	13	31	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11188	" {31} The king stood up, tore his clothes and lay down on the ground; and all his servants stood by with their clothes torn. {32} But Jonadab son of Shimeah, David's brother, said,"
2SM	13	32	Jonadab	#14		11189	 << My lord should not think that they killed all the princes; only Amnon is dead.
2SM	13	32	Jonadab	#14		11190	 This has been Absalom's expressed intention ever since the day Amnon raped his sister Tamar.
2SM	13	33	Jonadab	#14		11191	 {33} My lord the king should not be concerned about the report that all the king's sons are dead. Only Amnon is dead.>>
2SM	13	34	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11192	" {34} Meanwhile, Absalom had fled. Now the man standing watch looked up and saw many people on the road west of him, coming down the side of the hill."
2SM	13	34	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11193	" The watchman went and told the king, << I see men in the direction of Horonaim, on the side of the hill.>>"
2SM	13	35	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11194	" {35} Jonadab said to the king,"
2SM	13	35	Jonadab	#14		11195	" << See, the king's sons are here; it has happened just as your servant said.>>"
2SM	13	36	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11196	" {36} As he finished speaking, the king's sons came in, wailing loudly. The king, too, and all his servants wept very bitterly."
2SM	13	37	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11197	" {37} Absalom fled and went to Talmai son of Ammihud, the king of Geshur. But King David mourned for his son every day."
2SM	13	38	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11198	" {38} After Absalom fled and went to Geshur, he stayed there three years."
2SM	13	39	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11199	" {39} And the spirit of the king longed to go to Absalom, for he was consoled concerning Amnon's death.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
2SM	14	<<	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11200	2 SAMUEL 14

2SM	14	2	Joab	#08		11202	" << Pretend you are in mourning. Dress in mourning clothes, and don't use any cosmetic lotions."

2SM	14	3	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11205	" And Joab put the words in her mouth. {4} When the woman from Tekoa went to the king, she fell with her face to the ground to pay him honor, and she said,"

2SM	14	11	David	#07		11225	" << As surely as the Lord lives, not one hair of your son's head will fall to the ground.>>"
2SM	14	12	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11226	" {12} Then the woman said,"
2SM	14	12	Woman	#22		11227	 << Let your servant speak a word to my lord the king.>>

2SM	14	13	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11230	" {13} The woman said,"
2SM	14	13	Woman	#22		11231	 << Why then have you devised a thing like this against the people of God?
2SM	14	13	Woman	#22		11232	" When the king says this, does he not convict himself, for the king has not brought back his banished son?"
2SM	14	14	Woman	#22		11233	" {14} Like water spilled on the ground, which cannot be recovered, so we must die."
2SM	14	14	Woman	#22		11234	" But God does not take away life; instead, he devises ways so that a banished person may not remain estranged from him."
2SM	14	15	Woman	#22		11235	 {15} And now I have come to say this to my lord the king because the people have made me afraid.
2SM	14	15	Woman	#22		11236	" Your servant thought, 'I will speak to the king; perhaps he will do what his servant asks."
2SM	14	16	Woman	#22		11237	 {16} Perhaps the king will agree to deliver his servant from the hand of the man who is trying to cut off both me and my son from the inheritance God gave us.'
2SM	14	17	Woman	#22		11238	" {17} And now your servant says, 'May the word of my lord the king bring me rest, for my lord the king is like an angel of God in discerning good and evil."

2SM	14	18	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11240	" {18} Then the king said to the woman,"
2SM	14	18	David	#07		11241	 << Do not keep from me the answer to what I am going to ask you.>>

2SM	14	20	Woman	#22		11250	 My lord has wisdom like that of an angel of God--he knows everything that happens in the land.>>
2SM	14	21	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11251	" {21} The king said to Joab,"

2SM	14	23	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11255	" {23} Then Joab went to Geshur and brought Absalom back to Jerusalem. {24} But the king said,"
2SM	14	24	David	#07		11256	 << He must go to his own house; he must not see my face.>>
2SM	14	24	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11257	 So Absalom went to his own house and did not see the face of the king.
2SM	14	25	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11258	 {25} In all Israel there was not a man so highly praised for his handsome appearance as Absalom. From the top of his head to the sole of his foot there was no blemish in him.
2SM	14	26	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11259	" {26} Whenever he cut the hair of his head--he used to cut his hair from time to time when it became too heavy for him--he would weigh it, and its weight was two hundred shekels by the royal standard."
2SM	14	27	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11260	" {27} Three sons and a daughter were born to Absalom. The daughter's name was Tamar, and she became a beautiful woman."
2SM	14	28	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11261	 {28} Absalom lived two years in Jerusalem without seeing the king's face.
2SM	14	29	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11262	" {29} Then Absalom sent for Joab in order to send him to the king, but Joab refused to come to him. So he sent a second time, but he refused to come."
2SM	14	30	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11263	" {30} Then he said to his servants,"
2SM	14	30	Absalom (son of David)	#10		11264	" << Look, Joab's field is next to mine, and he has barley there. Go and set it on fire.>>"
2SM	14	30	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11265	" So Absalom's servants set the field on fire. {31} Then Joab did go to Absalom's house and he said to him,"
2SM	14	31	Joab	#08		11266	 << Why have your servants set my field on fire?>>
2SM	14	32	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11267	" {32} Absalom said to Joab,"
2SM	14	32	Absalom (son of David)	#10		11268	" << Look, I sent word to you and said, 'Come here so I can send you to the king to ask,"
2SM	14	32	Absalom (son of David)	#10		11269	 << Why have I come from Geshur? It would be better for me if I were still there!>> '
2SM	14	32	Absalom (son of David)	#10		11270	" Now then, I want to see the king's face, and if I am guilty of anything, let him put me to death.>>"
2SM	14	33	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11271	 {33} So Joab went to the king and told him this.
2SM	14	33	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11272	" Then the king summoned Absalom, and he came in and bowed down with his face to the ground before the king. And the king kissed Absalom.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
2SM	15	<<	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11273	2 SAMUEL 15
2SM	15	1	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11274	" {1} In the course of time, Absalom provided himself with a chariot and horses and with fifty men to run ahead of him."
2SM	15	2	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11275	" {2} He would get up early and stand by the side of the road leading to the city gate. Whenever anyone came with a complaint to be placed before the king for a decision, Absalom would call out to him,"
2SM	15	2	Absalom (son of David)	#10		11276	 << What town are you from?>>
2SM	15	2	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11277	" He would answer,"
2SM	15	2	Man	#09		11278	 << Your servant is from one of the tribes of Israel.>>
2SM	15	3	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11279	" {3} Then Absalom would say to him,"
2SM	15	3	Absalom (son of David)	#10		11280	" << Look, your claims are valid and proper, but there is no representative of the king to hear you.>>"
2SM	15	4	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11281	" {4} And Absalom would add,"
2SM	15	4	Absalom (son of David)	#10		11282	 << If only I were appointed judge in the land!
2SM	15	4	Absalom (son of David)	#10		11283	 Then everyone who has a complaint or case could come to me and I would see that he gets justice.>>
2SM	15	5	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11284	" {5} Also, whenever anyone approached him to bow down before him, Absalom would reach out his hand, take hold of him and kiss him."
2SM	15	6	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11285	" {6} Absalom behaved in this way toward all the Israelites who came to the king asking for justice, and so he stole the hearts of the men of Israel."
2SM	15	7	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11286	" {7} At the end of four years, Absalom said to the king,"
2SM	15	7	Absalom (son of David)	#10		11287	 << Let me go to Hebron and fulfill a vow I made to the Lord.
2SM	15	8	Absalom (son of David)	#10		11288	" {8} While your servant was living at Geshur in Aram, I made this vow: 'If the Lord takes me back to Jerusalem, I will worship the Lord in Hebron.'>>"
2SM	15	9	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11289	" {9} The king said to him,"
2SM	15	9	David	#07		11290	 << Go in peace.>>
2SM	15	9	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11291	" So he went to Hebron. {10} Then Absalom sent secret messengers throughout the tribes of Israel to say,"
2SM	15	10	Absalom (son of David)	#10		11292	" << As soon as you hear the sound of the trumpets, then say, 'Absalom is king in Hebron.'>>"
2SM	15	11	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11293	" {11} Two hundred men from Jerusalem had accompanied Absalom. They had been invited as guests and went quite innocently, knowing nothing about the matter."
2SM	15	12	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11294	" {12} While Absalom was offering sacrifices, he also sent for Ahithophel the Gilonite, David's counselor, to come from Giloh, his hometown."
2SM	15	12	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11295	" And so the conspiracy gained strength, and Absalom's following kept on increasing."
2SM	15	13	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11296	" {13} A messenger came and told David,"
2SM	15	13	Messenger	#14		11297	 << The hearts of the men of Israel are with Absalom.>>
2SM	15	14	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11298	" {14} Then David said to all his officials who were with him in Jerusalem,"
2SM	15	14	David	#07		11299	" << Come! We must flee, or none of us will escape from Absalom."
2SM	15	14	David	#07		11300	" We must leave immediately, or he will move quickly to overtake us and bring ruin upon us and put the city to the sword.>>"
2SM	15	15	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11301	" {15} The king's officials answered him,"
2SM	15	15	Official	#15		11302	 << Your servants are ready to do whatever our lord the king chooses.>>
2SM	15	16	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11303	" {16} The king set out, with his entire household following him; but he left ten concubines to take care of the palace."
2SM	15	17	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11304	" {17} So the king set out, with all the people following him, and they halted at a place some distance away."
2SM	15	18	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11305	" {18} All his men marched past him, along with all the Kerethites and Pelethites; and all the six hundred Gittites who had accompanied him from Gath marched before the king."
2SM	15	19	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11306	" {19} The king said to Ittai the Gittite,"
2SM	15	19	David	#07		11307	" << Why should you come along with us? Go back and stay with King Absalom. You are a foreigner, an exile from your homeland."
2SM	15	20	David	#07		11308	" {20} You came only yesterday. And today shall I make you wander about with us, when I do not know where I am going?"
2SM	15	20	David	#07		11309	" Go back, and take your countrymen. May kindness and faithfulness be with you.>>"
2SM	15	21	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11310	" {21} But Ittai replied to the king,"
2SM	15	21	Ittai (foreigner)	#21		11311	" << As surely as the Lord lives, and as my lord the king lives, wherever my lord the king may be, whether it means life or death, there will your servant be.>>"
2SM	15	22	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11312	" {22} David said to Ittai,"
2SM	15	22	David	#07		11313	" << Go ahead, march on.>>"
2SM	15	22	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11314	 So Ittai the Gittite marched on with all his men and the families that were with him.
2SM	15	23	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11315	" {23} The whole countryside wept aloud as all the people passed by. The king also crossed the Kidron Valley, and all the people moved on toward the desert."
2SM	15	24	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11316	" {24} Zadok was there, too, and all the Levites who were with him were carrying the ark of the covenant of God."
2SM	15	24	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11317	" They set down the ark of God, and Abiathar offered sacrifices until all the people had finished leaving the city. {25} Then the king said to Zadok,"
2SM	15	25	David	#07		11318	" << Take the ark of God back into the city. If I find favor in the Lord's eyes, he will bring me back and let me see it and his dwelling place again."
2SM	15	26	David	#07		11319	" {26} But if he says, 'I am not pleased with you,' then I am ready; let him do to me whatever seems good to him.>>"
2SM	15	27	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11320	" {27} The king also said to Zadok the priest,"
2SM	15	27	David	#07		11321	" << Aren't you a seer? Go back to the city in peace, with your son Ahimaaz and Jonathan son of Abiathar. You and Abiathar take your two sons with you."
2SM	15	28	David	#07		11322	 {28} I will wait at the fords in the desert until word comes from you to inform me.>>
2SM	15	29	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11323	 {29} So Zadok and Abiathar took the ark of God back to Jerusalem and stayed there.
2SM	15	30	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11324	" {30} But David continued up the Mount of Olives, weeping as he went; his head was covered and he was barefoot. All the people with him covered their heads too and were weeping as they went up."
2SM	15	31	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11325	" {31} Now David had been told,"
2SM	15	31	Man	#04		11326	 << Ahithophel is among the conspirators with Absalom.>>
2SM	15	31	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11327	" So David prayed,"
2SM	15	31	David	#07		11328	" << O Lord, turn Ahithophel's counsel into foolishness.>>"
2SM	15	32	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11329	" {32} When David arrived at the summit, where people used to worship God, Hushai the Arkite was there to meet him, his robe torn and dust on his head. {33} David said to him,"
2SM	15	33	David	#07		11330	" << If you go with me, you will be a burden to me."
2SM	15	34	David	#07		11331	" {34} But if you return to the city and say to Absalom, 'I will be your servant, O king;"
2SM	15	34	David	#07		11332	" I was your father's servant in the past, but now I will be your servant,' then you can help me by frustrating Ahithophel's advice."
2SM	15	35	David	#07		11333	 {35} Won't the priests Zadok and Abiathar be there with you? Tell them anything you hear in the king's palace.
2SM	15	36	David	#07		11334	" {36} Their two sons, Ahimaaz son of Zadok and Jonathan son of Abiathar, are there with them. Send them to me with anything you hear.>>"
2SM	15	37	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11335	 {37} So David's friend Hushai arrived at Jerusalem as Absalom was entering the city.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*

2SM	16	13	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11363	" {13} So David and his men continued along the road while Shimei was going along the hillside opposite him, cursing as he went and throwing stones at him and showering him with dirt."
2SM	16	14	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11364	 {14} The king and all the people with him arrived at their destination exhausted. And there he refreshed himself.
2SM	16	15	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11365	" {15} Meanwhile, Absalom and all the men of Israel came to Jerusalem, and Ahithophel was with him."

2SM	16	22	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11378	" {22} So they pitched a tent for Absalom on the roof, and he lay with his father's concubines in the sight of all Israel."
2SM	16	23	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11379	 {23} Now in those days the advice Ahithophel gave was like that of one who inquires of God. That was how both David and Absalom regarded all of Ahithophel's advice.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
2SM	17	<<	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11380	2 SAMUEL 17

2SM	17	2	Ahithophel	#08		11384	" I would strike him with terror, and then all the people with him will flee. *~*I would strike down only the king {3} and bring all the people back to you."

2SM	17	4	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11386	" {4} This plan seemed good to Absalom and to all the elders of Israel. {5} But Absalom said,"

2SM	17	7	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11390	" {7} Hushai replied to Absalom,"
2SM	17	7	Hushai	#15		11391	 << The advice Ahithophel has given is not good this time.
2SM	17	8	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11392	" {8} He continued saying,"
2SM	17	8	Hushai	#15		11393	" << You know your father and his men; they are fighters, and as fierce as a wild bear robbed of her cubs."
2SM	17	8	Hushai	#15		11394	" Besides, your father is an experienced fighter; he will not spend the night with the troops."
2SM	17	9	Hushai	#15		11395	" {9} Even now, he is hidden in a cave or some other place."
2SM	17	9	Hushai	#15		11396	" If he should attack your troops first, whoever hears about it will say, 'There has been a slaughter among the troops who follow Absalom.'"
2SM	17	10	Hushai	#15		11397	" {10} Then even the bravest soldier, whose heart is like the heart of a lion, will melt with fear, for all Israel knows that your father is a fighter and that those with him are brave."
2SM	17	11	Hushai	#15		11398	" {11} So I advise you: Let all Israel, from Dan to Beersheba --as numerous as the sand on the seashore--be gathered to you, with you yourself leading them into battle."
2SM	17	12	Hushai	#15		11399	" {12} Then we will attack him wherever he may be found, and we will fall on him as dew settles on the ground. Neither he nor any of his men will be left alive."
2SM	17	13	Hushai	#15		11400	" {13} If he withdraws into a city, then all Israel will bring ropes to that city, and we will drag it down to the valley until not even a piece of it can be found.>>"
2SM	17	14	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11401	" {14} Absalom and all the men of Israel said,"
2SM	17	14	Absalom (son of David)	#10		11402	 << The advice of Hushai the Arkite is better than that of Ahithophel.>>
2SM	17	14	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11403	" For the Lord had determined to frustrate the good advice of Ahithophel in order to bring disaster on Absalom. {15} Hushai told Zadok and Abiathar, the priests,"
2SM	17	15	Hushai	#15		11404	" << Ahithophel has advised Absalom and the elders of Israel to do such and such, but I have advised them to do so and so."
2SM	17	16	Hushai	#15		11405	" {16} Now send a message immediately and tell David, 'Do not spend the night at the fords in the desert;"
2SM	17	16	Hushai	#15		11406	" cross over without fail, or the king and all the people with him will be swallowed up.'>>"
2SM	17	17	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11407	" {17} Jonathan and Ahimaaz were staying at En Rogel. A servant girl was to go and inform them, and they were to go and tell King David, for they could not risk being seen entering the city."
2SM	17	18	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11408	" {18} But a young man saw them and told Absalom. So the two of them left quickly and went to the house of a man in Bahurim. He had a well in his courtyard, and they climbed down into it."
2SM	17	19	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11409	 {19} His wife took a covering and spread it out over the opening of the well and scattered grain over it. No one knew anything about it.
2SM	17	20	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11410	" {20} When Absalom's men came to the woman at the house, they asked,"
2SM	17	20	Man	#16		11411	 << Where are Ahimaaz and Jonathan?>>
2SM	17	20	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11412	" The woman answered them,"
2SM	17	20	Woman	#24		11413	 << They crossed over the brook.>>
2SM	17	20	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11414	" The men searched but found no one, so they returned to Jerusalem."
2SM	17	21	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11415	" {21} After the men had gone, the two climbed out of the well and went to inform King David. They said to him,"
2SM	17	21	Ahimaaz	#18		11416	 << Set out and cross the river at once; Ahithophel has advised such and such against you.>>
2SM	17	22	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11417	" {22} So David and all the people with him set out and crossed the Jordan. By daybreak, no one was left who had not crossed the Jordan."
2SM	17	23	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11418	" {23} When Ahithophel saw that his advice had not been followed, he saddled his donkey and set out for his house in his hometown."
2SM	17	23	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11419	 He put his house in order and then hanged himself. So he died and was buried in his father's tomb.
2SM	17	24	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11420	" {24} David went to Mahanaim, and Absalom crossed the Jordan with all the men of Israel. {25} Absalom had appointed Amasa over the army in place of Joab."
2SM	17	25	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11421	" Amasa was the son of a man named Jether, an Israelite who had married Abigail, the daughter of Nahash and sister of Zeruiah the mother of Joab."
2SM	17	26	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11422	 {26} The Israelites and Absalom camped in the land of Gilead.
2SM	17	27	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11423	" {27} When David came to Mahanaim, Shobi son of Nahash from Rabbah of the Ammonites,"
2SM	17	27	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11424	" and Makir son of Ammiel from Lo Debar, and Barzillai the Gileadite from Rogelim"

2SM	17	29	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11426	" {29} honey and curds, sheep, and cheese from cows' milk for David and his people to eat. For they said,"
2SM	17	29	Shobi	#03		11427	 << The people have become hungry and tired and thirsty in the desert.>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
2SM	18	<<	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11428	2 SAMUEL 18
2SM	18	1	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11429	 {1} David mustered the men who were with him and appointed over them commanders of thousands and commanders of hundreds.
2SM	18	2	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11430	" {2} David sent the troops out--a third under the command of Joab, a third under Joab's brother Abishai son of Zeruiah, and a third under Ittai the Gittite. The king told the troops,"

2SM	18	3	Soldier	#06		11433	" << You must not go out; if we are forced to flee, they won't care about us."
2SM	18	3	Soldier	#06		11434	" Even if half of us die, they won't care; but you are worth ten thousand of us."
2SM	18	3	Soldier	#06		11435	 It would be better now for you to give us support from the city.>>
2SM	18	4	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11436	" {4} The king answered,"
2SM	18	4	David	#07		11437	 << I will do whatever seems best to you.>>
2SM	18	4	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11438	 So the king stood beside the gate while all the men marched out in units of hundreds and of thousands.
2SM	18	5	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11439	" {5} The king commanded Joab, Abishai and Ittai,"
2SM	18	5	David	#07		11440	 << Be gentle with the young man Absalom for my sake.>>
2SM	18	5	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11441	 And all the troops heard the king giving orders concerning Absalom to each of the commanders.
2SM	18	6	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11442	" {6} The army marched into the field to fight Israel, and the battle took place in the forest of Ephraim."
2SM	18	7	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11443	" {7} There the army of Israel was defeated by David's men, and the casualties that day were great--twenty thousand men."
2SM	18	8	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11444	" {8} The battle spread out over the whole countryside, and the forest claimed more lives that day than the sword."
2SM	18	9	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11445	 {9} Now Absalom happened to meet David's men.
2SM	18	9	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11446	" He was riding his mule, and as the mule went under the thick branches of a large oak, Absalom's head got caught in the tree. He was left hanging in midair, while the mule he was riding kept on going."
2SM	18	10	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11447	" {10} When one of the men saw this, he told Joab,"
2SM	18	10	Man	#14		11448	 << I just saw Absalom hanging in an oak tree.>>
2SM	18	11	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11449	" {11} Joab said to the man who had told him this,"
2SM	18	11	Joab	#08		11450	 << What! You saw him? Why didn't you strike him to the ground right there?
2SM	18	11	Joab	#08		11451	 Then I would have had to give you ten shekels of silver and a warrior's belt.>>
2SM	18	12	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11452	" {12} But the man replied,"
2SM	18	12	Man	#14		11453	" << Even if a thousand shekels were weighed out into my hands, I would not lift my hand against the king's son."
2SM	18	12	Man	#14		11454	" In our hearing the king commanded you and Abishai and Ittai, 'Protect the young man Absalom for my sake.'"
2SM	18	13	Man	#14		11455	 {13} And if I had put my life in jeopardy--and nothing is hidden from the king--you would have kept your distance from me.>>
2SM	18	14	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11456	" {14} Joab said,"
2SM	18	14	Joab	#08		11457	 << I'm not going to wait like this for you.>>

2SM	18	15	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11459	" {15} And ten of Joab's armor-bearers surrounded Absalom, struck him and killed him."
2SM	18	16	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11460	" {16} Then Joab sounded the trumpet, and the troops stopped pursuing Israel, for Joab halted them."
2SM	18	17	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11461	" {17} They took Absalom, threw him into a big pit in the forest and piled up a large heap of rocks over him. Meanwhile, all the Israelites fled to their homes."

2SM	18	18	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11464	" He named the pillar after himself, and it is called Absalom's Monument to this day. {19} Now Ahimaaz son of Zadok said,"

2SM	18	21	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11469	" {21} Then Joab said to a Cushite,"

2SM	20	21	Woman	#24		11634	 << His head will be thrown to you from the wall.>>
2SM	20	22	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11635	" {22} Then the woman went to all the people with her wise advice, and they cut off the head of Sheba son of Bicri and threw it to Joab."
2SM	20	22	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11636	" So he sounded the trumpet, and his men dispersed from the city, each returning to his home. And Joab went back to the king in Jerusalem."
2SM	20	23	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11637	 {23} Joab was over Israel's entire army; Benaiah son of Jehoiada was over the Kerethites and Pelethites;
2SM	20	24	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11638	 {24} Adoniram was in charge of forced labor; Jehoshaphat son of Ahilud was recorder;
2SM	20	25	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11639	 {25} Sheva was secretary; Zadok and Abiathar were priests; {26} and Ira the Jairite was David's priest.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
2SM	21	<<	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11640	2 SAMUEL 21
2SM	21	1	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11641	" {1} During the reign of David, there was a famine for three successive years; so David sought the face of the Lord. The Lord said,"
2SM	21	1	God-FX1	#20		11642	 << It is on account of Saul and his blood-stained house; it is because he put the Gibeonites to death.>>
2SM	21	2	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11643	 {2} The king summoned the Gibeonites and spoke to them.
2SM	21	2	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11644	 (Now the Gibeonites were not a part of Israel but were survivors of the Amorites;
2SM	21	2	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11645	" the Israelites had sworn to spare them, but Saul in his zeal for Israel and Judah had tried to annihilate them.)"
2SM	21	3	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11646	" {3} David asked the Gibeonites,"
2SM	21	3	David	#07		11647	 << What shall I do for you? How shall I make amends so that you will bless the Lord's inheritance?>>
2SM	21	4	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11648	" {4} The Gibeonites answered him,"
2SM	21	4	Gibeonite	#21		11649	" << We have no right to demand silver or gold from Saul or his family, nor do we have the right to put anyone in Israel to death.>>"
2SM	21	4	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11650	" David asked,"
2SM	21	4	David	#07		11651	 << What do you want me to do for you?>>
