2SM	21	6	Gibeonite	#21		11654	 {6} let seven of his male descendants be given to us to be killed and exposed before the Lord at Gibeah of Saul--the Lord's chosen one.>>
2SM	21	6	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11655	" So the king said,"
2SM	21	6	David	#07		11656	 << I will give them to you.>>
2SM	21	7	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11657	" {7} The king spared Mephibosheth son of Jonathan, the son of Saul, because of the oath before the Lord between David and Jonathan son of Saul."
2SM	21	8	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11658	" {8} But the king took Armoni and Mephibosheth, the two sons of Aiah's daughter Rizpah, whom she had borne to Saul,"
2SM	21	8	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11659	" together with the five sons of Saul's daughter Merab, whom she had borne to Adriel son of Barzillai the Meholathite."
2SM	21	9	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11660	" {9} He handed them over to the Gibeonites, who killed and exposed them on a hill before the Lord."
2SM	21	9	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11661	" All seven of them fell together; they were put to death during the first days of the harvest, just as the barley harvest was beginning."
2SM	21	10	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11662	 {10} Rizpah daughter of Aiah took sackcloth and spread it out for herself on a rock.
2SM	21	10	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11663	" From the beginning of the harvest till the rain poured down from the heavens on the bodies, she did not let the birds of the air touch them by day or the wild animals by night."
2SM	21	11	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11664	" {11} When David was told what Aiah's daughter Rizpah, Saul's concubine, had done, {12} he went and took the bones of Saul and his son Jonathan from the citizens of Jabesh Gilead."
2SM	21	12	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11665	" (They had taken them secretly from the public square at Beth Shan, where the Philistines had hung them after they struck Saul down on Gilboa.)"
2SM	21	13	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11666	" {13} David brought the bones of Saul and his son Jonathan from there, and the bones of those who had been killed and exposed were gathered up."
2SM	21	14	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11667	" {14} They buried the bones of Saul and his son Jonathan in the tomb of Saul's father Kish, at Zela in Benjamin, and did everything the king commanded."
2SM	21	14	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11668	" After that, God answered prayer in behalf of the land."
2SM	21	15	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11669	" {15} Once again there was a battle between the Philistines and Israel. David went down with his men to fight against the Philistines, and he became exhausted."
2SM	21	16	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11670	" {16} And Ishbi-Benob, one of the descendants of Rapha, whose bronze spearhead weighed three hundred shekels and who was armed with a new sword, said he would kill David."
2SM	21	17	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11671	" {17} But Abishai son of Zeruiah came to David's rescue; he struck the Philistine down and killed him. Then David's men swore to him, saying,"
2SM	21	17	Soldier	#09		11672	" << Never again will you go out with us to battle, so that the lamp of Israel will not be extinguished.>>"
2SM	21	18	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11673	" {18} In the course of time, there was another battle with the Philistines, at Gob. At that time Sibbecai the Hushathite killed Saph, one of the descendants of Rapha."
2SM	21	19	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11674	" {19} In another battle with the Philistines at Gob, Elhanan son of Jaare-Oregim the Bethlehemite killed Goliath the Gittite, who had a spear with a shaft like a weaver's rod."
2SM	21	20	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11675	" {20} In still another battle, which took place at Gath, there was a huge man with six fingers on each hand and six toes on each foot--twenty-four in all. He also was descended from Rapha."
2SM	21	21	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11676	" {21} When he taunted Israel, Jonathan son of Shimeah, David's brother, killed him."
2SM	21	22	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11677	" {22} These four were descendants of Rapha in Gath, and they fell at the hands of David and his men.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
2SM	22	<<	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11678	2 SAMUEL 22
2SM	22	1	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11679	 {1} David sang to the Lord the words of this song when the Lord delivered him from the hand of all his enemies and from the hand of Saul. {2} He said:
2SM	22	2	David	#07		11680	" << The Lord is my rock, my fortress and my deliverer; {3} my God is my rock, in whom I take refuge, my shield and the horn of my salvation."
2SM	22	3	David	#07		11681	" He is my stronghold, my refuge and my savior-- from violent men you save me. {4} I call to the Lord, who is worthy of praise, and I am saved from my enemies."
2SM	22	5	David	#07		11682	 {5} << The waves of death swirled about me; the torrents of destruction overwhelmed me. {6} The cords of the grave coiled around me; the snares of death confronted me.
2SM	22	7	David	#07		11683	 {7} In my distress I called to the Lord; I called out to my God. From his temple he heard my voice; my cry came to his ears.
2SM	22	8	David	#07		11684	" {8} << The earth trembled and quaked, the foundations of the heavens shook; they trembled because he was angry."
2SM	22	9	David	#07		11685	" {9} Smoke rose from his nostrils; consuming fire came from his mouth, burning coals blazed out of it."
2SM	22	10	David	#07		11686	 {10} He parted the heavens and came down; dark clouds were under his feet. {11} He mounted the cherubim and flew; he soared on the wings of the wind.
2SM	22	12	David	#07		11687	 {12} He made darkness his canopy around him-- the dark rain clouds of the sky.
2SM	22	13	David	#07		11688	 {13} Out of the brightness of his presence bolts of lightning blazed forth. {14} The Lord thundered from heaven; the voice of the Most High resounded.
2SM	22	15	David	#07		11689	" {15} He shot arrows and scattered the enemies, bolts of lightning and routed them."
2SM	22	16	David	#07		11690	" {16} The valleys of the sea were exposed and the foundations of the earth laid bare at the rebuke of the Lord, at the blast of breath from his nostrils."
2SM	22	17	David	#07		11691	 {17} << He reached down from on high and took hold of me; he drew me out of deep waters.
2SM	22	18	David	#07		11692	" {18} He rescued me from my powerful enemy, from my foes, who were too strong for me."
2SM	22	19	David	#07		11693	" {19} They confronted me in the day of my disaster, but the Lord was my support."
2SM	22	20	David	#07		11694	 {20} He brought me out into a spacious place; he rescued me because he delighted in me.
2SM	22	21	David	#07		11695	 {21} << The Lord has dealt with me according to my righteousness; according to the cleanness of my hands he has rewarded me.
2SM	22	22	David	#07		11696	 {22} For I have kept the ways of the Lord; I have not done evil by turning from my God. {23} All his laws are before me; I have not turned away from his decrees.
2SM	22	24	David	#07		11697	" {24} I have been blameless before him and have kept myself from sin. {25} The Lord has rewarded me according to my righteousness, according to my cleanness in his sight."
2SM	22	26	David	#07		11698	" {26} << To the faithful you show yourself faithful, to the blameless you show yourself blameless, {27} to the pure you show yourself pure, but to the crooked you show yourself shrewd."
2SM	22	28	David	#07		11699	" {28} You save the humble, but your eyes are on the haughty to bring them low. {29} You are my lamp, O Lord; the Lord turns my darkness into light."
2SM	22	30	David	#07		11700	 {30} With your help I can advance against a troop; with my God I can scale a wall.
2SM	22	31	David	#07		11701	" {31} << As for God, his way is perfect; the word of the Lord is flawless. He is a shield for all who take refuge in him."
2SM	22	32	David	#07		11702	 {32} For who is God besides the Lord? And who is the Rock except our God? {33} It is God who arms me with strength and makes my way perfect.
2SM	22	34	David	#07		11703	 {34} He makes my feet like the feet of a deer; he enables me to stand on the heights. {35} He trains my hands for battle; my arms can bend a bow of bronze.
2SM	22	36	David	#07		11704	" {36} You give me your shield of victory; you stoop down to make me great. {37} You broaden the path beneath me, so that my ankles do not turn."
2SM	22	38	David	#07		11705	" {38} << I pursued my enemies and crushed them; I did not turn back till they were destroyed. {39} I crushed them completely, and they could not rise; they fell beneath my feet."
2SM	22	40	David	#07		11706	" {40} You armed me with strength for battle; you made my adversaries bow at my feet. {41} You made my enemies turn their backs in flight, and I destroyed my foes."
2SM	22	42	David	#07		11707	" {42} They cried for help, but there was no one to save them-- to the Lord, but he did not answer."
2SM	22	43	David	#07		11708	 {43} I beat them as fine as the dust of the earth; I pounded and trampled them like mud in the streets.
2SM	22	44	David	#07		11709	 {44} << You have delivered me from the attacks of my people; you have preserved me as the head of nations.
2SM	22	44	David	#07		11710	" People I did not know are subject to me, {45} and foreigners come cringing to me; as soon as they hear me, they obey me."
2SM	22	46	David	#07		11711	 {46} They all lose heart; they come trembling from their strongholds.
2SM	22	47	David	#07		11712	" {47} << The Lord lives! Praise be to my Rock! Exalted be God, the Rock, my Savior!"
2SM	22	48	David	#07		11713	" {48} He is the God who avenges me, who puts the nations under me, {49} who sets me free from my enemies. You exalted me above my foes; from violent men you rescued me."
2SM	22	50	David	#07		11714	" {50} Therefore I will praise you, O Lord, among the nations; I will sing praises to your name."
2SM	22	51	David	#07		11715	" {51} He gives his king great victories; he shows unfailing kindness to his anointed, to David and his descendants forever.>> *~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
2SM	23	<<	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11716	2 SAMUEL 23
2SM	23	1	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11717	" {1} These are the last words of David: the oracle of David, son of Jesse, the oracle of the man exalted by the Most High, the man anointed by the God of Jacob, Israel's singer of songs:"
2SM	23	2	David	#07		11718	 {2} << The Spirit of the Lord spoke through me; his word was on my tongue.
2SM	23	3	David	#07		11719	" {3} The God of Israel spoke, the Rock of Israel said to me: 'When one rules over men in righteousness, when he rules in the fear of God,"
2SM	23	4	David	#07		11720	" {4} he is like the light of morning at sunrise on a cloudless morning, like the brightness after rain that brings the grass from the earth.' <<"
2SM	23	5	David	#07		11721	" {5} Is not my house right with God? Has he not made with me an everlasting covenant, arranged and secured in every part?"
2SM	23	5	David	#07		11722	 Will he not bring to fruition my salvation and grant me my every desire?
2SM	23	6	David	#07		11723	" {6} But evil men are all to be cast aside like thorns, which are not gathered with the hand."
2SM	23	7	David	#07		11724	 {7} Whoever touches thorns uses a tool of iron or the shaft of a spear; they are burned up where they lie.>>
2SM	23	8	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11725	" {8} These are the names of David's mighty men: Josheb-Basshebeth, a Tahkemonite, was chief of the Three; he raised his spear against eight hundred men, whom he killed in one encounter."
2SM	23	9	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11726	" {9} Next to him was Eleazar son of Dodai the Ahohite. As one of the three mighty men, he was with David when they taunted the Philistines gathered at Pas Dammim for battle."
2SM	23	9	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11727	" Then the men of Israel retreated, {10} but he stood his ground and struck down the Philistines till his hand grew tired and froze to the sword."

2SM	23	11	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11729	" {11} Next to him was Shammah son of Agee the Hararite. When the Philistines banded together at a place where there was a field full of lentils, Israel's troops fled from them."
2SM	23	12	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11730	" {12} But Shammah took his stand in the middle of the field. He defended it and struck the Philistines down, and the Lord brought about a great victory."
2SM	23	13	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11731	" {13} During harvest time, three of the thirty chief men came down to David at the cave of Adullam, while a band of Philistines was encamped in the Valley of Rephaim."
2SM	23	14	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11732	" {14} At that time David was in the stronghold, and the Philistine garrison was at Bethlehem. {15} David longed for water and said,"
2SM	23	15	David	#07		11733	" << Oh, that someone would get me a drink of water from the well near the gate of Bethlehem!>>"
2SM	23	16	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11734	" {16} So the three mighty men broke through the Philistine lines, drew water from the well near the gate of Bethlehem and carried it back to David."
2SM	23	16	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11735	" But he refused to drink it; instead, he poured it out before the Lord {17} and said,"
2SM	23	17	David	#07		11736	" << Far be it from me, O Lord, to do this! Is it not the blood of men who went at the risk of their lives?>>"
2SM	23	17	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11737	 And David would not drink it. Such were the exploits of the three mighty men.
2SM	23	18	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11738	" {18} Abishai the brother of Joab son of Zeruiah was chief of the Three. He raised his spear against three hundred men, whom he killed, and so he became as famous as the Three."
2SM	23	19	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11739	" {19} Was he not held in greater honor than the Three? He became their commander, even though he was not included among them."
2SM	23	20	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11740	" {20} Benaiah son of Jehoiada was a valiant fighter from Kabzeel, who performed great exploits."
2SM	23	20	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11741	 He struck down two of Moab's best men. He also went down into a pit on a snowy day and killed a lion.
2SM	23	21	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11742	" {21} And he struck down a huge Egyptian. Although the Egyptian had a spear in his hand, Benaiah went against him with a club."
2SM	23	21	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11743	 He snatched the spear from the Egyptian's hand and killed him with his own spear.
2SM	23	22	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11744	 {22} Such were the exploits of Benaiah son of Jehoiada; he too was as famous as the three mighty men.
2SM	23	23	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11745	" {23} He was held in greater honor than any of the Thirty, but he was not included among the Three. And David put him in charge of his bodyguard."
2SM	23	24	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11746	" {24} Among the Thirty were: Asahel the brother of Joab, Elhanan son of Dodo from Bethlehem,"

2SM	24	<<	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11761	2 SAMUEL 24
2SM	24	1	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11762	" {1} Again the anger of the Lord burned against Israel, and he incited David against them, saying,"
2SM	24	1	God-FX1	#20		11763	 << Go and take a census of Israel and Judah.>>
2SM	24	2	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11764	" {2} So the king said to Joab and the army commanders with him,"
2SM	24	2	David	#07		11765	" << Go throughout the tribes of Israel from Dan to Beersheba and enroll the fighting men, so that I may know how many there are.>>"
2SM	24	3	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11766	" {3} But Joab replied to the king,"
2SM	24	3	Joab	#08		11767	" << May the Lord your God multiply the troops a hundred times over, and may the eyes of my lord the king see it."
2SM	24	3	Joab	#08		11768	 But why does my lord the king want to do such a thing?>>
2SM	24	4	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11769	" {4} The king's word, however, overruled Joab and the army commanders; so they left the presence of the king to enroll the fighting men of Israel."
2SM	24	5	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11770	" {5} After crossing the Jordan, they camped near Aroer, south of the town in the gorge, and then went through Gad and on to Jazer."
2SM	24	6	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11771	" {6} They went to Gilead and the region of Tahtim Hodshi, and on to Dan Jaan and around toward Sidon."
2SM	24	7	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11772	" {7} Then they went toward the fortress of Tyre and all the towns of the Hivites and Canaanites. Finally, they went on to Beersheba in the Negev of Judah."
2SM	24	8	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11773	" {8} After they had gone through the entire land, they came back to Jerusalem at the end of nine months and twenty days."
2SM	24	9	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11774	" {9} Joab reported the number of the fighting men to the king: In Israel there were eight hundred thousand able-bodied men who could handle a sword, and in Judah five hundred thousand."
2SM	24	10	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11775	" {10} David was conscience-stricken after he had counted the fighting men, and he said to the Lord,"
2SM	24	10	David	#07		11776	" << I have sinned greatly in what I have done. Now, O Lord, I beg you, take away the guilt of your servant. I have done a very foolish thing.>>"
2SM	24	11	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11777	" {11} Before David got up the next morning, the word of the Lord had come to Gad the prophet, David's seer:"
2SM	24	12	God-FX1	#20		11778	" {12} << Go and tell David, 'This is what the Lord says: I am giving you three options. Choose one of them for me to carry out against you.'>>"
2SM	24	13	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11779	" {13} So Gad went to David and said to him,"
2SM	24	13	Gad	#18		11780	 << Shall there come upon you three years of famine in your land?
2SM	24	13	Gad	#18		11781	 Or three months of fleeing from your enemies while they pursue you?
2SM	24	13	Gad	#18		11782	 Or three days of plague in your land?
2SM	24	13	Gad	#18		11783	" Now then, think it over and decide how I should answer the one who sent me.>>"
2SM	24	14	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11784	" {14} David said to Gad,"
2SM	24	14	David	#07		11785	" << I am in deep distress. Let us fall into the hands of the Lord, for his mercy is great; but do not let me fall into the hands of men.>>"
2SM	24	15	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11786	" {15} So the Lord sent a plague on Israel from that morning until the end of the time designated, and seventy thousand of the people from Dan to Beersheba died."
2SM	24	16	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11787	" {16} When the angel stretched out his hand to destroy Jerusalem, the Lord was grieved because of the calamity and said to the angel who was afflicting the people,"
2SM	24	16	God-FX1	#20		11788	 << Enough! Withdraw your hand.>>
2SM	24	16	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11789	" The angel of the Lord was then at the threshing floor of Araunah the Jebusite. {17} When David saw the angel who was striking down the people, he said to the Lord,"
2SM	24	17	David	#07		11790	 << I am the one who has sinned and done wrong. These are but sheep. What have they done? Let your hand fall upon me and my family.>>
2SM	24	18	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11791	" {18} On that day Gad went to David and said to him,"

2SM	24	19	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11793	" {19} So David went up, as the Lord had commanded through Gad."
2SM	24	20	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11794	" {20} When Araunah looked and saw the king and his men coming toward him, he went out and bowed down before the king with his face to the ground. {21} Araunah said,"
2SM	24	21	Araunah	#15		11795	 << Why has my lord the king come to his servant?>>
2SM	24	21	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11796	" David answered,"
2SM	24	21	David	#07		11797	" To buy your threshing floor, so I can build an altar to the Lord, that the plague on the people may be stopped.>>"
2SM	24	22	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11798	" {22} Araunah said to David,"
2SM	24	22	Araunah	#15		11799	 << Let my lord the king take whatever pleases him and offer it up.
2SM	24	22	Araunah	#15		11800	" Here are oxen for the burnt offering, and here are threshing sledges and ox yokes for the wood."
2SM	24	23	Araunah	#15		11801	" {23} O king, Araunah gives all this to the king."
2SM	24	23	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11802	" Araunah also said to him,"
2SM	24	23	Araunah	#15		11803	 << May the Lord your God accept you.>>
2SM	24	24	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11804	" {24} But the king replied to Araunah,"
2SM	24	24	David	#07		11805	" << No, I insist on paying you for it. I will not sacrifice to the Lord my God burnt offerings that cost me nothing.>>"
2SM	24	24	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11806	 So David bought the threshing floor and the the oxen and paid fifty shekels of silver for them.
2SM	24	25	Narr_10: 2_Samuel	#01		11807	 {25} David built an altar to the Lord there and sacrificed burnt offerings and fellowship offerings.

1KI	2	34	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		11957	" {34} So Benaiah son of Jehoiada went up and struck down Joab and killed him, and he was buried on his own land in the desert."

1KI	2	38	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		11961	" {38} Shimei answered the king,"
1KI	2	38	Shimei	#17		11962	 <<What you say is good. Your servant will do as my lord the king has said.>>
1KI	2	38	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		11963	" And Shimei stayed in Jerusalem for a long time. {39} But three years later, two of Shimei's slaves ran off to Achish son of Maacah, king of Gath, and Shimei was told,"
1KI	2	39	Man	#03		11964	 <<Your slaves are in Gath.>>
1KI	2	40	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		11965	" {40} At this, he saddled his donkey and went to Achish at Gath in search of his slaves. So Shimei went away and brought the slaves back from Gath."
1KI	2	41	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		11966	" {41} When Solomon was told that Shimei had gone from Jerusalem to Gath and had returned, {42} the king summoned Shimei and said to him,"
1KI	2	42	Solomon	#10		11967	" <<Did I not make you swear by the Lord and warn you, 'On the day you leave to go anywhere else, you can be sure you will die'?"
1KI	2	42	Solomon	#10		11968	" At that time you said to me, 'What you say is good. I will obey.'"
1KI	2	43	Solomon	#10		11969	 {43} Why then did you not keep your oath to the Lord and obey the command I gave you?>>
1KI	2	44	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		11970	" {44} The king also said to Shimei,"
1KI	2	44	Solomon	#10		11971	 <<You know in your heart all the wrong you did to my father David. Now the Lord will repay you for your wrongdoing.
1KI	2	45	Solomon	#10		11972	" {45} But King Solomon will be blessed, and David's throne will remain secure before the Lord forever.>>"
1KI	2	46	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		11973	" {46} Then the king gave the order to Benaiah son of Jehoiada, and he went out and struck Shimei down and killed him."
1KI	2	46	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		11974	 The kingdom was now firmly established in Solomon's hands.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
1KI	3	<<	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		11975	1 KINGS 3

1KI	3	1	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		11977	" He brought her to the City of David until he finished building his palace and the temple of the Lord, and the wall around Jerusalem."
1KI	3	2	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		11978	" {2} The people, however, were still sacrificing at the high places, because a temple had not yet been built for the Name of the Lord."
1KI	3	3	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		11979	" {3} Solomon showed his love for the Lord by walking according to the statutes of his father David, except that he offered sacrifices and burned incense on the high places."
1KI	3	4	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		11980	" {4} The king went to Gibeon to offer sacrifices, for that was the most important high place, and Solomon offered a thousand burnt offerings on that altar."
1KI	3	5	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		11981	" {5} At Gibeon the Lord appeared to Solomon during the night in a dream, and God said,"
1KI	3	5	God-FX1	#20		11982	 <<Ask for whatever you want me to give you.>>
1KI	3	6	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		11983	" {6} Solomon answered,"
1KI	3	6	Solomon	#10		11984	" <<You have shown great kindness to your servant, my father David, because he was faithful to you and righteous and upright in heart."
1KI	3	6	Solomon	#10		11985	 You have continued this great kindness to him and have given him a son to sit on his throne this very day.
1KI	3	7	Solomon	#10		11986	" {7} Now, O Lord my God, you have made your servant king in place of my father David."
1KI	3	7	Solomon	#10		11987	 But I am only a little child and do not know how to carry out my duties.
1KI	3	8	Solomon	#10		11988	" {8} Your servant is here among the people you have chosen, a great people, too numerous to count or number."
1KI	3	9	Solomon	#10		11989	 {9} So give your servant a discerning heart to govern your people and to distinguish between right and wrong.
1KI	3	9	Solomon	#10		11990	 For who is able to govern this great people of yours?>>
1KI	3	10	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		11991	" {10} The Lord was pleased that Solomon had asked for this. {11} So God said to him,"
1KI	3	11	God-FX1	#20		11992	" <<Since you have asked for this and not for long life or wealth for yourself, nor have asked for the death of your enemies but for discernment in administering justice, {12} I will do what you have asked."
1KI	3	12	God-FX1	#20		11993	" I will give you a wise and discerning heart, so that there will never have been anyone like you, nor will there ever be."
1KI	3	13	God-FX1	#20		11994	" {13} Moreover, I will give you what you have not asked for--both riches and honor--so that in your lifetime you will have no equal among kings."
1KI	3	14	God-FX1	#20		11995	" {14} And if you walk in my ways and obey my statutes and commands as David your father did, I will give you a long life.>>"
1KI	3	15	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		11996	" {15} Then Solomon awoke--and he realized it had been a dream. He returned to Jerusalem, stood before the ark of the Lord's covenant and sacrificed burnt offerings and fellowship offerings."
1KI	3	15	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		11997	" Then he gave a feast for all his court. {16} Now two prostitutes came to the king and stood before him. {17} One of them said,"
1KI	3	17	Woman #1	#23		11998	" <<My lord, this woman and I live in the same house. I had a baby while she was there with me."
1KI	3	18	Woman #1	#23		11999	" {18} The third day after my child was born, this woman also had a baby."
1KI	3	18	Woman #1	#23		12000	 We were alone; there was no one in the house but the two of us.
1KI	3	19	Woman #1	#23		12001	 {19} << During the night this woman's son died because she lay on him.
1KI	3	20	Woman #1	#23		12002	 {20} So she got up in the middle of the night and took my son from my side while I your servant was asleep.
1KI	3	20	Woman #1	#23		12003	 She put him by her breast and put her dead son by my breast.
1KI	3	21	Woman #1	#23		12004	" {21} The next morning, I got up to nurse my son--and he was dead!"
1KI	3	21	Woman #1	#23		12005	" But when I looked at him closely in the morning light, I saw that it wasn't the son I had borne.>>"
1KI	3	22	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12006	" {22} The other woman said,"
1KI	3	22	Woman #2	#22		12007	 <<No! The living one is my son; the dead one is yours.>>
1KI	3	22	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12008	" But the first one insisted,"
1KI	3	22	Woman #1	#23		12009	 <<No! The dead one is yours; the living one is mine.>>
1KI	3	22	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12010	" And so they argued before the king. {23} The king said,"
1KI	3	23	Solomon	#10		12011	" <<This one says, 'My son is alive and your son is dead,' while that one says, 'No! Your son is dead and mine is alive.'<<"
1KI	3	24	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12012	" {24} Then the king said,"
1KI	3	24	Solomon	#10		12013	 <<Bring me a sword.>>
1KI	3	24	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12014	 So they brought a sword for the king. {25} He then gave an order:
1KI	3	25	Solomon	#10		12015	 <<Cut the living child in two and give half to one and half to the other.>>
1KI	3	26	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12016	" {26} The woman whose son was alive was filled with compassion for her son and said to the king,"
1KI	3	26	Woman #1	#23		12017	" <<Please, my lord, give her the living baby! Don't kill him!>>"
1KI	3	26	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12018	" The other woman said,"
1KI	3	26	Woman #2	#22		12019	 <<Neither I nor you shall have him. Cut him in two!>>
1KI	3	27	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12020	 {27} Then the king gave his ruling:
1KI	3	27	Solomon	#10		12021	 <<Give the living baby to the first woman. Do not kill him; she is his mother.>>
1KI	3	28	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12022	" {28} When all Israel heard the verdict the king had given, they held the king in awe, because they saw that he had wisdom from God to administer justice.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"

1KI	4	20	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12045	" {20} The people of Judah and Israel were as numerous as the sand on the seashore; they ate, they drank and they were happy."
1KI	4	21	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12046	" {21} And Solomon ruled over all the kingdoms from the River to the land of the Philistines, as far as the border of Egypt. These countries brought tribute and were Solomon's subjects all his life."
1KI	4	22	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12047	" {22} Solomon's daily provisions were thirty cors of fine flour and sixty cors of meal,"
1KI	4	23	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12048	" {23} ten head of stall-fed cattle, twenty of pasture-fed cattle and a hundred sheep and goats,"
1KI	4	23	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12049	" as well as deer, gazelles, roebucks and choice fowl."
1KI	4	24	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12050	" {24} For he ruled over all the kingdoms west of the River, from Tiphsah to Gaza, and had peace on all sides."
1KI	4	25	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12051	" {25} During Solomon's lifetime Judah and Israel, from Dan to Beersheba, lived in safety, each man under his own vine and fig tree."
1KI	4	26	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12052	" {26} Solomon had four thousand stalls for chariot horses, and twelve thousand horses."
1KI	4	27	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12053	" {27} The district officers, each in his month, supplied provisions for King Solomon and all who came to the king's table. They saw to it that nothing was lacking."
1KI	4	28	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12054	 {28} They also brought to the proper place their quotas of barley and straw for the chariot horses and the other horses.
1KI	4	29	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12055	" {29} God gave Solomon wisdom and very great insight, and a breadth of understanding as measureless as the sand on the seashore."
1KI	4	30	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12056	" {30} Solomon's wisdom was greater than the wisdom of all the men of the East, and greater than all the wisdom of Egypt."
1KI	4	31	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12057	" {31} He was wiser than any other man, including Ethan the Ezrahite --wiser than Heman, Calcol and Darda, the sons of Mahol. And his fame spread to all the surrounding nations."
1KI	4	32	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12058	 {32} He spoke three thousand proverbs and his songs numbered a thousand and five.
1KI	4	33	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12059	" {33} He described plant life, from the cedar of Lebanon to the hyssop that grows out of walls. He also taught about animals and birds, reptiles and fish."
1KI	4	34	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12060	" {34} Men of all nations came to listen to Solomon's wisdom, sent by all the kings of the world, who had heard of his wisdom.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
1KI	5	<<	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12061	1 KINGS 5
1KI	5	1	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12062	" {1} When Hiram king of Tyre heard that Solomon had been anointed king to succeed his father David, he sent his envoys to Solomon, because he had always been on friendly terms with David."
1KI	5	2	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12063	 {2} Solomon sent back this message to Hiram:
1KI	5	3	Solomon	#10		12064	" {3} << You know that because of the wars waged against my father David from all sides, he could not build a temple for the Name of the Lord his God until the Lord put his enemies under his feet."
1KI	5	4	Solomon	#10		12065	" {4} But now the Lord my God has given me rest on every side, and there is no adversary or disaster."
1KI	5	5	Solomon	#10		12066	" {5} I intend, therefore, to build a temple for the Name of the Lord my God, as the Lord told my father David, when he said,"

1KI	5	10	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12076	" {10} In this way Hiram kept Solomon supplied with all the cedar and pine logs he wanted,"

1KI	5	12	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12079	" {12} The Lord gave Solomon wisdom, just as he had promised him. There were peaceful relations between Hiram and Solomon, and the two of them made a treaty."
1KI	5	13	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12080	 {13} King Solomon conscripted laborers from all Israel --thirty thousand men.
1KI	5	14	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12081	" {14} He sent them off to Lebanon in shifts of ten thousand a month, so that they spent one month in Lebanon and two months at home. Adoniram was in charge of the forced labor."
1KI	5	15	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12082	" {15} Solomon had seventy thousand carriers and eighty thousand stonecutters in the hills, {16} as well as thirty-three hundred foremen who supervised the project and directed the workmen."
1KI	5	17	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12083	 {17} At the king's command they removed from the quarry large blocks of quality stone to provide a foundation of dressed stone for the temple.
1KI	5	18	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12084	 {18} The craftsmen of Solomon and Hiram and the men of Gebal cut and prepared the timber and stone for the building of the temple.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
1KI	6	<<	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12085	1 KINGS 6
1KI	6	1	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12086	" {1} In the four hundred and eightieth year after the Israelites had come out of Egypt,"
1KI	6	1	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12087	" in the fourth year of Solomon's reign over Israel, in the month of Ziv, the second month, he began to build the temple of the Lord."
1KI	6	2	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12088	" {2} The temple that King Solomon built for the Lord was sixty cubits long, twenty wide and thirty high."
1KI	6	3	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12089	" {3} The portico at the front of the main hall of the temple extended the width of the temple, that is twenty cubits, and projected ten cubits from the front of the temple."
1KI	6	4	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12090	 {4} He made narrow clerestory windows in the temple.
1KI	6	5	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12091	" {5} Against the walls of the main hall and inner sanctuary he built a structure around the building, in which there were side rooms."
1KI	6	6	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12092	" {6} The lowest floor was five cubits wide, the middle floor six cubits and the third floor seven."
1KI	6	6	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12093	 He made offset ledges around the outside of the temple so that nothing would be inserted into the temple walls.
1KI	6	7	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12094	" {7} In building the temple, only blocks dressed at the quarry were used, and no hammer, chisel or any other iron tool was heard at the temple site while it was being built."
1KI	6	8	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12095	 {8} The entrance to the lowest floor was on the south side of the temple; a stairway led up to the middle level and from there to the third.
1KI	6	9	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12096	" {9} So he built the temple and completed it, roofing it with beams and cedar planks."
1KI	6	10	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12097	" {10} And he built the side rooms all along the temple. The height of each was five cubits, and they were attached to the temple by beams of cedar."
1KI	6	11	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12098	 {11} The word of the Lord came to Solomon:
1KI	6	12	God-FX1	#20		12099	" {12} << As for this temple you are building, if you follow my decrees, carry out my regulations and keep all my commands and obey them, I will fulfill through you the promise I gave to David your father."
1KI	6	13	God-FX1	#20		12100	 {13} And I will live among the Israelites and will not abandon my people Israel.>>
1KI	6	14	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12101	 {14} So Solomon built the temple and completed it.
1KI	6	15	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12102	" {15} He lined its interior walls with cedar boards, paneling them from the floor of the temple to the ceiling, and covered the floor of the temple with planks of pine."
1KI	6	16	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12103	" {16} He partitioned off twenty cubits at the rear of the temple with cedar boards from floor to ceiling to form within the temple an inner sanctuary, the Most Holy Place."
1KI	6	17	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12104	 {17} The main hall in front of this room was forty cubits long.
1KI	6	18	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12105	" {18} The inside of the temple was cedar, carved with gourds and open flowers. Everything was cedar; no stone was to be seen."
1KI	6	19	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12106	 {19} He prepared the inner sanctuary within the temple to set the ark of the covenant of the Lord there.
1KI	6	20	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12107	" {20} The inner sanctuary was twenty cubits long, twenty wide and twenty high. He overlaid the inside with pure gold, and he also overlaid the altar of cedar."
1KI	6	21	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12108	" {21} Solomon covered the inside of the temple with pure gold, and he extended gold chains across the front of the inner sanctuary, which was overlaid with gold."
1KI	6	22	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12109	 {22} So he overlaid the whole interior with gold. He also overlaid with gold the altar that belonged to the inner sanctuary.
1KI	6	23	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12110	" {23} In the inner sanctuary he made a pair of cherubim of olive wood, each ten cubits high."
1KI	6	24	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12111	" {24} One wing of the first cherub was five cubits long, and the other wing five cubits--ten cubits from wing tip to wing tip."
1KI	6	25	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12112	" {25} The second cherub also measured ten cubits, for the two cherubim were identical in size and shape."
1KI	6	26	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12113	 {26} The height of each cherub was ten cubits.
1KI	6	27	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12114	" {27} He placed the cherubim inside the innermost room of the temple, with their wings spread out."
1KI	6	27	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12115	" The wing of one cherub touched one wall, while the wing of the other touched the other wall, and their wings touched each other in the middle of the room."
1KI	6	28	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12116	 {28} He overlaid the cherubim with gold.
1KI	6	29	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12117	" {29} On the walls all around the temple, in both the inner and outer rooms, he carved cherubim, palm trees and open flowers."
1KI	6	30	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12118	 {30} He also covered the floors of both the inner and outer rooms of the temple with gold.
1KI	6	31	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12119	 {31} For the entrance of the inner sanctuary he made doors of olive wood with five-sided jambs.
1KI	6	32	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12120	" {32} And on the two olive wood doors he carved cherubim, palm trees and open flowers, and overlaid the cherubim and palm trees with beaten gold."
1KI	6	33	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12121	 {33} In the same way he made four-sided jambs of olive wood for the entrance to the main hall.
1KI	6	34	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12122	" {34} He also made two pine doors, each having two leaves that turned in sockets."
1KI	6	35	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12123	" {35} He carved cherubim, palm trees and open flowers on them and overlaid them with gold hammered evenly over the carvings."
1KI	6	36	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12124	 {36} And he built the inner courtyard of three courses of dressed stone and one course of trimmed cedar beams.
1KI	6	37	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12125	" {37} The foundation of the temple of the Lord was laid in the fourth year, in the month of Ziv."
1KI	6	38	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12126	" {38} In the eleventh year in the month of Bul, the eighth month, the temple was finished in all its details according to its specifications. He had spent seven years building it.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
1KI	7	<<	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12127	1 KINGS 7
1KI	7	1	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12128	" {1} It took Solomon thirteen years, however, to complete the construction of his palace."
1KI	7	2	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12129	" {2} He built the Palace of the Forest of Lebanon a hundred cubits long, fifty wide and thirty high, with four rows of cedar columns supporting trimmed cedar beams."
1KI	7	3	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12130	" {3} It was roofed with cedar above the beams that rested on the columns--forty-five beams, fifteen to a row."
1KI	7	4	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12131	" {4} Its windows were placed high in sets of three, facing each other."
1KI	7	5	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12132	" {5} All the doorways had rectangular frames; they were in the front part in sets of three, facing each other."
1KI	7	6	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12133	" {6} He made a colonnade fifty cubits long and thirty wide. In front of it was a portico, and in front of that were pillars and an overhanging roof."
1KI	7	7	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12134	" {7} He built the throne hall, the Hall of Justice, where he was to judge, and he covered it with cedar from floor to ceiling."
1KI	7	8	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12135	" {8} And the palace in which he was to live, set farther back, was similar in design. Solomon also made a palace like this hall for Pharaoh's daughter, whom he had married."
1KI	7	9	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12136	" {9} All these structures, from the outside to the great courtyard and from foundation to eaves, were made of blocks of high-grade stone cut to size and trimmed with a saw on their inner and outer faces."
1KI	7	10	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12137	" {10} The foundations were laid with large stones of good quality, some measuring ten cubits and some eight."
1KI	7	11	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12138	" {11} Above were high-grade stones, cut to size, and cedar beams."
1KI	7	12	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12139	" {12} The great courtyard was surrounded by a wall of three courses of dressed stone and one course of trimmed cedar beams, as was the inner courtyard of the temple of the Lord with its portico."
1KI	7	13	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12140	" {13} King Solomon sent to Tyre and brought Huram, {14} whose mother was a widow from the tribe of Naphtali and whose father was a man of Tyre and a craftsman in bronze."
1KI	7	14	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12141	 Huram was highly skilled and experienced in all kinds of bronze work. He came to King Solomon and did all the work assigned to him.
1KI	7	15	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12142	" {15} He cast two bronze pillars, each eighteen cubits high and twelve cubits around, by line."
1KI	7	16	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12143	 {16} He also made two capitals of cast bronze to set on the tops of the pillars; each capital was five cubits high.
1KI	7	17	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12144	" {17} A network of interwoven chains festooned the capitals on top of the pillars, seven for each capital."
1KI	7	18	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12145	 {18} He made pomegranates in two rows encircling each network to decorate the capitals on top of the pillars. He did the same for each capital.
1KI	7	19	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12146	" {19} The capitals on top of the pillars in the portico were in the shape of lilies, four cubits high."
1KI	7	20	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12147	" {20} On the capitals of both pillars, above the bowl-shaped part next to the network, were the two hundred pomegranates in rows all around."
1KI	7	21	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12148	 {21} He erected the pillars at the portico of the temple. The pillar to the south he named Jakin and the one to the north Boaz.
1KI	7	22	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12149	 {22} The capitals on top were in the shape of lilies. And so the work on the pillars was completed.
1KI	7	23	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12150	" {23} He made the Sea of cast metal, circular in shape, measuring ten cubits from rim to rim and five cubits high. It took a line of thirty cubits to measure around it."
1KI	7	24	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12151	" {24} Below the rim, gourds encircled it--ten to a cubit. The gourds were cast in two rows in one piece with the Sea."
1KI	7	25	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12152	" {25} The Sea stood on twelve bulls, three facing north, three facing west, three facing south and three facing east."
1KI	7	25	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12153	" The Sea rested on top of them, and their hindquarters were toward the center."
1KI	7	26	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12154	" {26} It was a handbreadth in thickness, and its rim was like the rim of a cup, like a lily blossom. It held two thousand baths."
1KI	7	27	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12155	" {27} He also made ten movable stands of bronze; each was four cubits long, four wide and three high."
1KI	7	28	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12156	 {28} This is how the stands were made: They had side panels attached to uprights.
1KI	7	29	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12157	" {29} On the panels between the uprights were lions, bulls and cherubim --and on the uprights as well. Above and below the lions and bulls were wreaths of hammered work."
1KI	7	30	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12158	" {30} Each stand had four bronze wheels with bronze axles, and each had a basin resting on four supports, cast with wreaths on each side."
1KI	7	31	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12159	 {31} On the inside of the stand there was an opening that had a circular frame one cubit deep.
1KI	7	31	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12160	" This opening was round, and with its basework it measured a cubit and a half. Around its opening there was engraving. The panels of the stands were square, not round."
1KI	7	32	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12161	" {32} The four wheels were under the panels, and the axles of the wheels were attached to the stand. The diameter of each wheel was a cubit and a half."
1KI	7	33	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12162	" {33} The wheels were made like chariot wheels; the axles, rims, spokes and hubs were all of cast metal."
1KI	7	34	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12163	" {34} Each stand had four handles, one on each corner, projecting from the stand."
1KI	7	35	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12164	 {35} At the top of the stand there was a circular band half a cubit deep. The supports and panels were attached to the top of the stand.
1KI	7	36	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12165	" {36} He engraved cherubim, lions and palm trees on the surfaces of the supports and on the panels, in every available space, with wreaths all around."
1KI	7	37	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12166	 {37} This is the way he made the ten stands. They were all cast in the same molds and were identical in size and shape.
1KI	7	38	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12167	" {38} He then made ten bronze basins, each holding forty baths and measuring four cubits across, one basin to go on each of the ten stands."
1KI	7	39	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12168	" {39} He placed five of the stands on the south side of the temple and five on the north. He placed the Sea on the south side, at the southeast corner of the temple."
1KI	7	40	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12169	 {40} He also made the basins and shovels and sprinkling bowls. So Huram finished all the work he had undertaken for King Solomon in the temple of the Lord:
1KI	7	41	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12170	 {41} the two pillars; the two bowl-shaped capitals on top of the pillars; the two sets of network decorating the two bowl-shaped capitals on top of the pillars;
1KI	7	42	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12171	" {42} the four hundred pomegranates for the two sets of network (two rows of pomegranates for each network, decorating the bowl-shaped capitals on top of the pillars);"
1KI	7	43	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12172	 {43} the ten stands with their ten basins; {44} the Sea and the twelve bulls under it;
1KI	7	45	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12173	" {45} the pots, shovels and sprinkling bowls. All these objects that Huram made for King Solomon for the temple of the Lord were of burnished bronze."
1KI	7	46	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12174	 {46} The king had them cast in clay molds in the plain of the Jordan between Succoth and Zarethan.
1KI	7	47	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12175	" {47} Solomon left all these things unweighed, because there were so many; the weight of the bronze was not determined."
1KI	7	48	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12176	 {48} Solomon also made all the furnishings that were in the Lord's temple: the golden altar; the golden table on which was the bread of the Presence;
1KI	7	49	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12177	" {49} the lampstands of pure gold (five on the right and five on the left, in front of the inner sanctuary); the gold floral work and lamps and tongs;"
1KI	7	50	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12178	" {50} the pure gold basins, wick trimmers, sprinkling bowls, dishes and censers;"
1KI	7	50	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12179	" and the gold sockets for the doors of the innermost room, the Most Holy Place, and also for the doors of the main hall of the temple."
1KI	7	51	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12180	" {51} When all the work King Solomon had done for the temple of the Lord was finished, he brought in the things his father David had dedicated--"
1KI	7	51	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12181	 the silver and gold and the furnishings--and he placed them in the treasuries of the Lord's temple.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
1KI	8	<<	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12182	1 KINGS 8
1KI	8	1	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12183	" {1} Then King Solomon summoned into his presence at Jerusalem the elders of Israel, all the heads of the tribes and the chiefs of the Israelite families, to bring up the ark of the Lord's covenant from Zion, the City of David."
1KI	8	2	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12184	" {2} All the men of Israel came together to King Solomon at the time of the festival in the month of Ethanim, the seventh month."
1KI	8	3	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12185	" {3} When all the elders of Israel had arrived, the priests took up the ark, {4} and they brought up the ark of the Lord and the Tent of Meeting and all the sacred furnishings in it."
1KI	8	4	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12186	" The priests and Levites carried them up, {5} and King Solomon and the entire assembly of Israel that had gathered about him were before the ark, sacrificing so many sheep and cattle that they could not be recorded or counted."
1KI	8	6	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12187	" {6} The priests then brought the ark of the Lord's covenant to its place in the inner sanctuary of the temple, the Most Holy Place, and put it beneath the wings of the cherubim."
1KI	8	7	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12188	 {7} The cherubim spread their wings over the place of the ark and overshadowed the ark and its carrying poles.
1KI	8	8	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12189	" {8} These poles were so long that their ends could be seen from the Holy Place in front of the inner sanctuary, but not from outside the Holy Place; and they are still there today."
1KI	8	9	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12190	" {9} There was nothing in the ark except the two stone tablets that Moses had placed in it at Horeb, where the Lord made a covenant with the Israelites after they came out of Egypt."
1KI	8	10	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12191	" {10} When the priests withdrew from the Holy Place, the cloud filled the temple of the Lord."
1KI	8	11	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12192	" {11} And the priests could not perform their service because of the cloud, for the glory of the Lord filled his temple. {12} Then Solomon said,"
1KI	8	12	Solomon	#10		12193	 <<The Lord has said that he would dwell in a dark cloud;
1KI	8	13	Solomon	#10		12194	" {13} I have indeed built a magnificent temple for you, a place for you to dwell forever.>>"
1KI	8	14	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12195	" {14} While the whole assembly of Israel was standing there, the king turned around and blessed them. {15} Then he said:"
1KI	8	15	Solomon	#10		12196	" << Praise be to the Lord, the God of Israel, who with his own hand has fulfilled what he promised with his own mouth to my father David. For he said,"
1KI	8	16	Solomon	#10		12197	" {16} 'Since the day I brought my people Israel out of Egypt, I have not chosen a city in any tribe of Israel to have a temple built for my Name to be there, but I have chosen David to rule my people Israel.' <<"
1KI	8	17	Solomon	#10		12198	" {17} My father David had it in his heart to build a temple for the Name of the Lord, the God of Israel."
1KI	8	18	Solomon	#10		12199	" {18} But the Lord said to my father David, 'Because it was in your heart to build a temple for my Name, you did well to have this in your heart."
1KI	8	19	Solomon	#10		12200	" {19} Nevertheless, you are not the one to build the temple, but your son, who is your own flesh and blood--he is the one who will build the temple for my Name.' <<"
1KI	8	20	Solomon	#10		12201	 {20} The Lord has kept the promise he made:
1KI	8	20	Solomon	#10		12202	" I have succeeded David my father and now I sit on the throne of Israel, just as the Lord promised, and I have built the temple for the Name of the Lord, the God of Israel."
1KI	8	21	Solomon	#10		12203	" {21} I have provided a place there for the ark, in which is the covenant of the Lord that he made with our fathers when he brought them out of Egypt.>>"
1KI	8	22	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12204	" {22} Then Solomon stood before the altar of the Lord in front of the whole assembly of Israel, spread out his hands toward heaven {23} and said:"
1KI	8	23	Solomon	#10		12205	" <<O Lord, God of Israel, there is no God like you in heaven above or on earth below--you who keep your covenant of love with your servants who continue wholeheartedly in your way."
1KI	8	24	Solomon	#10		12206	 {24} You have kept your promise to your servant David my father; with your mouth you have promised and with your hand you have fulfilled it--as it is today.
1KI	8	25	Solomon	#10		12207	" {25} <<Now Lord, God of Israel, keep for your servant David my father the promises you made to him when you said,"
1KI	8	25	Solomon	#10		12208	" You shall never fail to have a man to sit before me on the throne of Israel, if only your sons are careful in all they do to walk before me as you have done.'"
1KI	8	26	Solomon	#10		12209	" {26} And now, O God of Israel, let your word that you promised your servant David my father come true."
1KI	8	27	Solomon	#10		12210	" {27} <<But will God really dwell on earth? The heavens, even the highest heaven, cannot contain you. How much less this temple I have built!"
1KI	8	28	Solomon	#10		12211	" {28} Yet give attention to your servant's prayer and his plea for mercy, O Lord my God. Hear the cry and the prayer that your servant is praying in your presence this day."
1KI	8	29	Solomon	#10		12212	" {29} May your eyes be open toward this temple night and day, this place of which you said, 'My Name shall be there,' so that you will hear the prayer your servant prays toward this place."
1KI	8	30	Solomon	#10		12213	" {30} Hear the supplication of your servant and of your people Israel when they pray toward this place. Hear from heaven, your dwelling place, and when you hear, forgive."
1KI	8	31	Solomon	#10		12214	" {31} << When a man wrongs his neighbor and is required to take an oath and he comes and swears the oath before your altar in this temple, {32} then hear from heaven and act."
1KI	8	32	Solomon	#10		12215	" Judge between your servants, condemning the guilty and bringing down on his own head what he has done. Declare the innocent not guilty, and so establish his innocence. <<"
1KI	8	33	Solomon	#10		12216	" {33} When your people Israel have been defeated by an enemy because they have sinned against you, and when they turn back to you and confess your name, praying and making supplication to you in this temple,"
1KI	8	34	Solomon	#10		12217	 {34} then hear from heaven and forgive the sin of your people Israel and bring them back to the land you gave to their fathers.
1KI	8	35	Solomon	#10		12218	" {35} << When the heavens are shut up and there is no rain because your people have sinned against you,"
1KI	8	35	Solomon	#10		12219	" and when they pray toward this place and confess your name and turn from their sin because you have afflicted them,"
1KI	8	36	Solomon	#10		12220	" {36} then hear from heaven and forgive the sin of your servants, your people Israel. Teach them the right way to live, and send rain on the land you gave your people for an inheritance."
1KI	8	37	Solomon	#10		12221	" {37} << When famine or plague comes to the land, or blight or mildew, locusts or grasshoppers, or when an enemy besieges them in any of their cities, whatever disaster or disease may come,"
1KI	8	38	Solomon	#10		12222	" {38} and when a prayer or plea is made by any of your people Israel --each one aware of the afflictions of his own heart, and spreading out his hands toward this temple--"
1KI	8	39	Solomon	#10		12223	" {39} then hear from heaven, your dwelling place."
1KI	8	39	Solomon	#10		12224	" Forgive and act; deal with each man according to all he does, since you know his heart (for you alone know the hearts of all men),"
1KI	8	40	Solomon	#10		12225	 {40} so that they will fear you all the time they live in the land you gave our fathers.
1KI	8	41	Solomon	#10		12226	 {41} << As for the foreigner who does not belong to your people Israel but has come from a distant land because of your name--
1KI	8	42	Solomon	#10		12227	" {42} for men will hear of your great name and your mighty hand and your outstretched arm--when he comes and prays toward this temple,"
1KI	8	43	Solomon	#10		12228	" {43} then hear from heaven, your dwelling place, and do whatever the foreigner asks of you, so that all the peoples of the earth may know your name and fear you, as do your own people Israel, and may know that this house I have built bears your Name."
1KI	8	44	Solomon	#10		12229	" {44} << When your people go to war against their enemies, wherever you send them, and when they pray to the Lord toward the city you have chosen and the temple I have built for your Name,"
1KI	8	45	Solomon	#10		12230	" {45} then hear from heaven their prayer and their plea, and uphold their cause."
1KI	8	46	Solomon	#10		12231	" {46} << When they sin against you--for there is no one who does not sin--and you become angry with them and give them over to the enemy, who takes them captive to his own land, far away or near;"
1KI	8	47	Solomon	#10		12232	" {47} and if they have a change of heart in the land where they are held captive,"
1KI	8	47	Solomon	#10		12233	" and repent and plead with you in the land of their conquerors and say, 'We have sinned, we have done wrong, we have acted wickedly';"
1KI	8	48	Solomon	#10		12234	" {48} and if they turn back to you with all their heart and soul in the land of their enemies who took them captive,"
1KI	8	48	Solomon	#10		12235	" and pray to you toward the land you gave their fathers, toward the city you have chosen and the temple I have built for your Name;"
1KI	8	49	Solomon	#10		12236	" {49} then from heaven, your dwelling place, hear their prayer and their plea, and uphold their cause."
1KI	8	50	Solomon	#10		12237	" {50} And forgive your people, who have sinned against you; forgive all the offenses they have committed against you, and cause their conquerors to show them mercy;"
1KI	8	51	Solomon	#10		12238	" {51} for they are your people and your inheritance, whom you brought out of Egypt, out of that iron-smelting furnace."
1KI	8	52	Solomon	#10		12239	" {52} << May your eyes be open to your servant's plea and to the plea of your people Israel, and may you listen to them whenever they cry out to you."
1KI	8	53	Solomon	#10		12240	" {53} For you singled them out from all the nations of the world to be your own inheritance, just as you declared through your servant Moses when you, O Sovereign Lord, brought our fathers out of Egypt.>>"
1KI	8	54	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12241	" {54} When Solomon had finished all these prayers and supplications to the Lord, he rose from before the altar of the Lord, where he had been kneeling with his hands spread out toward heaven."
1KI	8	55	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12242	" {55} He stood and blessed the whole assembly of Israel in a loud voice, saying:"
1KI	8	56	Solomon	#10		12243	" {56} << Praise be to the Lord, who has given rest to his people Israel just as he promised. Not one word has failed of all the good promises he gave through his servant Moses."
1KI	8	57	Solomon	#10		12244	 {57} May the Lord our God be with us as he was with our fathers; may he never leave us nor forsake us.
1KI	8	58	Solomon	#10		12245	" {58} May he turn our hearts to him, to walk in all his ways and to keep the commands, decrees and regulations he gave our fathers."
1KI	8	59	Solomon	#10		12246	" {59} And may these words of mine, which I have prayed before the Lord, be near to the Lord our God day and night,"
1KI	8	59	Solomon	#10		12247	" that he may uphold the cause of his servant and the cause of his people Israel according to each day's need,"
1KI	8	60	Solomon	#10		12248	 {60} so that all the peoples of the earth may know that the Lord is God and that there is no other.
1KI	8	61	Solomon	#10		12249	" {61} But your hearts must be fully committed to the Lord our God, to live by his decrees and obey his commands, as at this time.>>"
1KI	8	62	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12250	 {62} Then the king and all Israel with him offered sacrifices before the Lord.
1KI	8	63	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12251	 {63} Solomon offered a sacrifice of fellowship offerings to the Lord: twenty-two thousand cattle and a hundred and twenty thousand sheep and goats.
1KI	8	63	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12252	 So the king and all the Israelites dedicated the temple of the Lord.
1KI	8	64	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12253	" {64} On that same day the king consecrated the middle part of the courtyard in front of the temple of the Lord,"
1KI	8	64	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12254	" and there he offered burnt offerings, grain offerings and the fat of the fellowship offerings,"
1KI	8	64	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12255	" because the bronze altar before the Lord was too small to hold the burnt offerings, the grain offerings and the fat of the fellowship offerings."
1KI	8	65	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12256	" {65} So Solomon observed the festival at that time, and all Israel with him--a vast assembly, people from Lebo Hamath to the Wadi of Egypt."
1KI	8	65	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12257	" They celebrated it before the Lord our God for seven days and seven days more, fourteen days in all."
1KI	8	66	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12258	 {66} On the following day he sent the people away.
1KI	8	66	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12259	" They blessed the king and then went home, joyful and glad in heart for all the good things the Lord had done for his servant David and his people Israel.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
1KI	9	<<	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12260	1 KINGS 9
1KI	9	1	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12261	" {1} When Solomon had finished building the temple of the Lord and the royal palace, and had achieved all he had desired to do,"
1KI	9	2	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12262	" {2} the Lord appeared to him a second time, as he had appeared to him at Gibeon. {3} The Lord said to him:"
1KI	9	3	God-FX1	#20		12263	 << I have heard the prayer and plea you have made before me;
1KI	9	3	God-FX1	#20		12264	" I have consecrated this temple, which you have built, by putting my Name there forever. My eyes and my heart will always be there."
1KI	9	4	God-FX1	#20		12265	" {4} << As for you, if you walk before me in integrity of heart and uprightness, as David your father did, and do all I command and observe my decrees and laws,"
1KI	9	5	God-FX1	#20		12266	" {5} I will establish your royal throne over Israel forever, as I promised David your father when I said, 'You shall never fail to have a man on the throne of Israel.'"
1KI	9	6	God-FX1	#20		12267	" {6} << But if you or your sons turn away from me and do not observe the commands and decrees I have given you and go off to serve other gods and worship them,"
1KI	9	7	God-FX1	#20		12268	 {7} then I will cut off Israel from the land I have given them and will reject this temple I have consecrated for my Name.
1KI	9	7	God-FX1	#20		12269	 Israel will then become a byword and an object of ridicule among all peoples.
1KI	9	8	God-FX1	#20		12270	" {8} And though this temple is now imposing, all who pass by will be appalled and will scoff and say, 'Why has the Lord done such a thing to this land and to this temple?'"
1KI	9	9	God-FX1	#20		12271	" {9} People will answer, ' Because they have forsaken the Lord their God, who brought their fathers out of Egypt, and have embraced other gods, worshiping and serving them--"
1KI	9	9	God-FX1	#20		12272	 that is why the Lord brought all this disaster on them.'>>
1KI	9	10	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12273	" {10} At the end of twenty years, during which Solomon built these two buildings--the temple of the Lord and the royal palace--"
1KI	9	11	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12274	" {11} King Solomon gave twenty towns in Galilee to Hiram king of Tyre, because Hiram had supplied him with all the cedar and pine and gold he wanted."
1KI	9	12	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12275	" {12} But when Hiram went from Tyre to see the towns that Solomon had given him, he was not pleased with them. {13} He asked,"
1KI	9	13	Hiram	#01		12276	" << What kind of towns are these you have given me, my brother?>>"
1KI	9	13	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12277	" And he called them the Land of Cabul, a name they have to this day. {14} Now Hiram had sent to the king 120 talents of gold."
1KI	9	15	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12278	" {15} Here is the account of the forced labor King Solomon conscripted to build the Lord's temple, his own palace, the supporting terraces, the wall of Jerusalem, and Hazor, Megiddo and Gezer."
1KI	9	16	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12279	 {16} (Pharaoh king of Egypt had attacked and captured Gezer. He had set it on fire.
1KI	9	16	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12280	" He killed its Canaanite inhabitants and then gave it as a wedding gift to his daughter, Solomon's wife. {17} And Solomon rebuilt Gezer.)"
1KI	9	17	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12281	" He built up Lower Beth Horon, {18} Baalath, and Tadmor in the desert, within his land,"
1KI	9	19	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12282	" {19} as well as all his store cities and the towns for his chariots and for his horses--whatever he desired to build in Jerusalem, in Lebanon and throughout all the territory he ruled."
1KI	9	20	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12283	" {20} All the people left from the Amorites, Hittites, Perizzites, Hivites and Jebusites (these peoples were not Israelites),"
1KI	9	21	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12284	" {21} that is, their descendants remaining in the land, whom the Israelites could not exterminate--these Solomon conscripted for his slave labor force, as it is to this day."
1KI	9	22	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12285	 {22} But Solomon did not make slaves of any of the Israelites;
1KI	9	22	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12286	" they were his fighting men, his government officials, his officers, his captains, and the commanders of his chariots and charioteers."
1KI	9	23	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12287	 {23} They were also the chief officials in charge of Solomon's projects--550 officials supervising the men who did the work.
1KI	9	24	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12288	" {24} After Pharaoh's daughter had come up from the City of David to the palace Solomon had built for her, he constructed the supporting terraces."
1KI	9	25	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12289	" {25} Three times a year Solomon sacrificed burnt offerings and fellowship offerings on the altar he had built for the Lord, burning incense before the Lord along with them, and so fulfilled the temple obligations."
1KI	9	26	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12290	" {26} King Solomon also built ships at Ezion Geber, which is near Elath in Edom, on the shore of the Red Sea."
1KI	9	27	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12291	 {27} And Hiram sent his men--sailors who knew the sea--to serve in the fleet with Solomon's men.
1KI	9	28	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12292	" {28} They sailed to Ophir and brought back 420 talents of gold, which they delivered to King Solomon.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
1KI	10	<<	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12293	1 KINGS 10
1KI	10	1	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12294	" {1} When the queen of Sheba heard about the fame of Solomon and his relation to the name of the Lord, she came to test him with hard questions."
1KI	10	2	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12295	" {2} Arriving at Jerusalem with a very great caravan--with camels carrying spices, large quantities of gold, and precious stones--she came to Solomon and talked with him about all that she had on her mind."
1KI	10	3	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12296	 {3} Solomon answered all her questions; nothing was too hard for the king to explain to her.
1KI	10	4	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12297	" {4} When the queen of Sheba saw all the wisdom of Solomon and the palace he had built,"
1KI	10	5	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12298	" {5} the food on his table, the seating of his officials, the attending servants in their robes, his cupbearers, and the burnt offerings he made at the temple of the Lord, she was overwhelmed."
1KI	10	6	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12299	" {6} She said to the king,"
1KI	10	6	Queen	#23		12300	 <<The report I heard in my own country about your achievements and your wisdom is true.
1KI	10	7	Queen	#23		12301	" {7} But I did not believe these things until I came and saw with my own eyes. Indeed, not even half was told me; in wisdom and wealth you have far exceeded the report I heard."
1KI	10	8	Queen	#23		12302	" {8} How happy your men must be! How happy your officials, who continually stand before you and hear your wisdom!"
1KI	10	9	Queen	#23		12303	" {9} Praise be to the Lord your God, who has delighted in you and placed you on the throne of Israel."
1KI	10	9	Queen	#23		12304	" Because of the Lord's eternal love for Israel, he has made you king, to maintain justice and righteousness.>>"
1KI	10	10	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12305	" {10} And she gave the king 120 talents of gold, large quantities of spices, and precious stones."
1KI	10	10	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12306	 Never again were so many spices brought in as those the queen of Sheba gave to King Solomon.
1KI	10	11	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12307	 {11} (Hiram's ships brought gold from Ophir; and from there they brought great cargoes of almugwood and precious stones.
1KI	10	12	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12308	" {12} The king used the almugwood to make supports for the temple of the Lord and for the royal palace, and to make harps and lyres for the musicians."
1KI	10	12	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12309	 So much almugwood has never been imported or seen since that day.
1KI	10	13	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12310	" {13} King Solomon gave the queen of Sheba all she desired and asked for, besides what he had given her out of his royal bounty."
1KI	10	13	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12311	 Then she left and returned with her servants to her own country.
1KI	10	14	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12312	" {14} The weight of the gold that Solomon received yearly was 666 talents, {15} not including the revenues from merchants and traders and from all the Arabian kings and the governors of the land."
1KI	10	16	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12313	 {16} King Solomon made two hundred large shields of hammered gold; six hundred bekas of gold went into each shield.
1KI	10	17	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12314	" {17} He also made three hundred small shields of hammered gold, with three minas of gold in each shield. The king put them in the Palace of the Forest of Lebanon."
1KI	10	18	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12315	 {18} Then the king made a great throne inlaid with ivory and overlaid with fine gold.
1KI	10	19	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12316	" {19} The throne had six steps, and its back had a rounded top. On both sides of the seat were armrests, with a lion standing beside each of them."
1KI	10	20	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12317	" {20} Twelve lions stood on the six steps, one at either end of each step. Nothing like it had ever been made for any other kingdom."
1KI	10	21	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12318	" {21} All King Solomon's goblets were gold, and all the household articles in the Palace of the Forest of Lebanon were pure gold."
1KI	10	21	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12319	" Nothing was made of silver, because silver was considered of little value in Solomon's days."
1KI	10	22	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12320	" {22} The king had a fleet of trading ships at sea along with the ships of Hiram. Once every three years it returned, carrying gold, silver and ivory, and apes and baboons."
1KI	10	23	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12321	 {23} King Solomon was greater in riches and wisdom than all the other kings of the earth.
1KI	10	24	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12322	 {24} The whole world sought audience with Solomon to hear the wisdom God had put in his heart.
1KI	10	25	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12323	" {25} Year after year, everyone who came brought a gift--articles of silver and gold, robes, weapons and spices, and horses and mules."
1KI	10	26	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12324	" {26} Solomon accumulated chariots and horses; he had fourteen hundred chariots and twelve thousand horses, which he kept in the chariot cities and also with him in Jerusalem."
1KI	10	27	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12325	" {27} The king made silver as common in Jerusalem as stones, and cedar as plentiful as sycamore-fig trees in the foothills."
1KI	10	28	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12326	 {28} Solomon's horses were imported from Egypt and from Kue --the royal merchants purchased them from Kue.
1KI	10	29	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12327	" {29} They imported a chariot from Egypt for six hundred shekels of silver, and a horse for a hundred and fifty."
1KI	10	29	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12328	 They also exported them to all the kings of the Hittites and of the Arameans.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*

1KI	11	2	God-FX1	#20		12332	" <<You must not intermarry with them, because they will surely turn your hearts after their gods.>>"
1KI	11	2	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12333	" Nevertheless, Solomon held fast to them in love. {3} He had seven hundred wives of royal birth and three hundred concubines, and his wives led him astray."
1KI	11	4	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12334	" {4} As Solomon grew old, his wives turned his heart after other gods, and his heart was not fully devoted to the Lord his God, as the heart of David his father had been."
1KI	11	5	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12335	" {5} He followed Ashtoreth the goddess of the Sidonians, and Molech the detestable god of the Ammonites."
1KI	11	6	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12336	" {6} So Solomon did evil in the eyes of the Lord; he did not follow the Lord completely, as David his father had done."
1KI	11	7	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12337	" {7} On a hill east of Jerusalem, Solomon built a high place for Chemosh the detestable god of Moab, and for Molech the detestable god of the Ammonites."
1KI	11	8	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12338	" {8} He did the same for all his foreign wives, who burned incense and offered sacrifices to their gods."
1KI	11	9	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12339	" {9} The Lord became angry with Solomon because his heart had turned away from the Lord, the God of Israel, who had appeared to him twice."
1KI	11	10	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12340	" {10} Although he had forbidden Solomon to follow other gods, Solomon did not keep the Lord's command. {11} So the Lord said to Solomon,"
1KI	11	11	God-FX1	#20		12341	" << Since this is your attitude and you have not kept my covenant and my decrees, which I commanded you, I will most certainly tear the kingdom away from you and give it to one of your subordinates."
1KI	11	12	God-FX1	#20		12342	" {12} Nevertheless, for the sake of David your father, I will not do it during your lifetime. I will tear it out of the hand of your son."
1KI	11	13	God-FX1	#20		12343	" {13} Yet I will not tear the whole kingdom from him, but will give him one tribe for the sake of David my servant and for the sake of Jerusalem, which I have chosen.>>"
1KI	11	14	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12344	" {14} Then the Lord raised up against Solomon an adversary, Hadad the Edomite, from the royal line of Edom."
1KI	11	15	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12345	" {15} Earlier when David was fighting with Edom, Joab the commander of the army, who had gone up to bury the dead, had struck down all the men in Edom."
1KI	11	16	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12346	" {16} Joab and all the Israelites stayed there for six months, until they had destroyed all the men in Edom."
1KI	11	17	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12347	" {17} But Hadad, still only a boy, fled to Egypt with some Edomite officials who had served his father. {18} They set out from Midian and went to Paran."
1KI	11	18	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12348	" Then taking men from Paran with them, they went to Egypt, to Pharaoh king of Egypt, who gave Hadad a house and land and provided him with food."
1KI	11	19	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12349	" {19} Pharaoh was so pleased with Hadad that he gave him a sister of his own wife, Queen Tahpenes, in marriage."
1KI	11	20	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12350	" {20} The sister of Tahpenes bore him a son named Genubath, whom Tahpenes brought up in the royal palace. There Genubath lived with Pharaoh's own children."
1KI	11	21	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12351	" {21} While he was in Egypt, Hadad heard that David rested with his fathers and that Joab the commander of the army was also dead. Then Hadad said to Pharaoh,"
