1KI	11	22	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12353	" {22} Pharoah asked,"
1KI	11	22	Pharoah #3	#17		12354	 << What have you lacked here that you want to go back to your own country?>>
1KI	11	22	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12355	" Hadad replied,"
1KI	11	22	Hadad	#09		12356	" << Nothing, but do let me go!"
1KI	11	23	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12357	" {23} And God raised up against Solomon another adversary, Rezon son of Eliada, who had fled from his master, Hadadezer king of Zobah."
1KI	11	24	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12358	" {24} He gathered men around him and became the leader of a band of rebels when David destroyed the forces of Zobah; the rebels went to Damascus, where they settled and took control."
1KI	11	25	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12359	" {25} Rezon was Israel's adversary as long as Solomon lived, adding to the trouble caused by Hadad. So Rezon ruled in Aram and was hostile toward Israel."
1KI	11	26	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12360	" {26} Also, Jeroboam son of Nebat rebelled against the king. He was one of Solomon's officials, an Ephraimite from Zeredah, and his mother was a widow named Zeruah."
1KI	11	27	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12361	 {27} Here is the account of how he rebelled against the king: Solomon had built the supporting terraces and had filled in the gap in the wall of the city of David his father.
1KI	11	28	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12362	" {28} Now Jeroboam was a man of standing, and when Solomon saw how well the young man did his work, he put him in charge of the whole labor force of the house of Joseph."
1KI	11	29	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12363	" {29} About that time Jeroboam was going out of Jerusalem, and Ahijah the prophet of Shiloh met him on the way, wearing a new cloak."
1KI	11	29	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12364	" The two of them were alone out in the country, {30} and Ahijah took hold of the new cloak he was wearing and tore it into twelve pieces. {31} Then he said to Jeroboam,"
1KI	11	31	Prophet: Ahijah	#02		12365	" << Take ten pieces for yourself, for this is what the Lord, the God of Israel, says: 'See, I am going to tear the kingdom out of Solomon's hand and give you ten tribes."
1KI	11	32	Prophet: Ahijah	#02		12366	" {32} But for the sake of my servant David and the city of Jerusalem, which I have chosen out of all the tribes of Israel, he will have one tribe."
1KI	11	33	Prophet: Ahijah	#02		12367	" {33} I will do this because they have forsaken me and worshiped Ashtoreth the goddess of the Sidonians, Chemosh the god of the Moabites, and Molech the god of the Ammonites,"
1KI	11	33	Prophet: Ahijah	#02		12368	" and have not walked in my ways, nor done what is right in my eyes, nor kept my statutes and laws as David, Solomon's father, did."
1KI	11	34	Prophet: Ahijah	#02		12369	 {34} << 'But I will not take the whole kingdom out of Solomon's hand;
1KI	11	34	Prophet: Ahijah	#02		12370	" I have made him ruler all the days of his life for the sake of David my servant, whom I chose and who observed my commands and statutes."
1KI	11	35	Prophet: Ahijah	#02		12371	 {35} I will take the kingdom from his son's hands and give you ten tribes.
1KI	11	36	Prophet: Ahijah	#02		12372	" {36} I will give one tribe to his son so that David my servant may always have a lamp before me in Jerusalem, the city where I chose to put my Name."
1KI	11	37	Prophet: Ahijah	#02		12373	" {37} However, as for you, I will take you, and you will rule over all that your heart desires; you will be king over Israel."
1KI	11	38	Prophet: Ahijah	#02		12374	" {38} If you do whatever I command you and walk in my ways and do what is right in my eyes by keeping my statutes and commands, as David my servant did, I will be with you."
1KI	11	38	Prophet: Ahijah	#02		12375	 I will build you a dynasty as enduring as the one I built for David and will give Israel to you.
1KI	11	39	Prophet: Ahijah	#02		12376	" {39} I will humble David's descendants because of this, but not forever.'>>"
1KI	11	40	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12377	" {40} Solomon tried to kill Jeroboam, but Jeroboam fled to Egypt, to Shishak the king, and stayed there until Solomon's death."
1KI	11	41	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12378	 {41} As for the other events of Solomon's reign--all he did and the wisdom he displayed--are they not written in the book of the annals of Solomon?
1KI	11	42	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12379	 {42} Solomon reigned in Jerusalem over all Israel forty years.
1KI	11	43	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12380	 {43} Then he rested with his fathers and was buried in the city of David his father. And Rehoboam his son succeeded him as king.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
1KI	12	<<	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12381	1 KINGS 12
1KI	12	1	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12382	" {1} Rehoboam went to Shechem, for all the Israelites had gone there to make him king."
1KI	12	2	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12383	" {2} When Jeroboam son of Nebat heard this (he was still in Egypt, where he had fled from King Solomon), he returned from Egypt."
1KI	12	3	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12384	" {3} So they sent for Jeroboam, and he and the whole assembly of Israel went to Rehoboam and said to him:"
1KI	12	4	Jereboam	#06		12385	" {4} <<Your father put a heavy yoke on us, but now lighten the harsh labor and the heavy yoke he put on us, and we will serve you.>>"
1KI	12	5	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12386	" {5} Rehoboam answered,"
1KI	12	5	King Rehoboam	#04		12387	 << Go away for three days and then come back to me.>>
1KI	12	5	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12388	" So the people went away. {6} Then King Rehoboam consulted the elders who had served his father Solomon during his lifetime. He asked,"
1KI	12	6	King Rehoboam	#04		12389	 << How would you advise me to answer these people?>>
1KI	12	7	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12390	" {7} They replied,"
1KI	12	7	Elder	#05		12391	" << If today you will be a servant to these people and serve them and give them a favorable answer, they will always be your servants.>>"
1KI	12	8	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12392	" {8} But Rehoboam rejected the advice the elders gave him and consulted the young men who had grown up with him and were serving him. {9} He asked them,"
1KI	12	9	King Rehoboam	#04		12393	" << What is your advice? How should we answer these people who say to me, 'Lighten the yoke your father put on us'?>>"
1KI	12	10	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12394	" {10} The young men who had grown up with him replied,"
1KI	12	10	Man (young)	#18		12395	" << Tell these people who have said to you, 'Your father put a heavy yoke on us, but make our yoke lighter'--tell them, 'My little finger is thicker than my father's waist."
1KI	12	11	Man (young)	#18		12396	 {11} My father laid on you a heavy yoke; I will make it even heavier. My father scourged you with whips; I will scourge you with scorpions.'<<
1KI	12	12	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12397	" {12} Three days later Jeroboam and all the people returned to Rehoboam, as the king had said,"
1KI	12	12	King Rehoboam	#04		12398	 << Come back to me in three days.>>
1KI	12	13	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12399	" {13} The king answered the people harshly. Rejecting the advice given him by the elders, {14} he followed the advice of the young men and said,"
1KI	12	14	King Rehoboam	#04		12400	 << My father made your yoke heavy; I will make it even heavier. My father scourged you with whips; I will scourge you with scorpions.>>
1KI	12	15	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12401	" {15} So the king did not listen to the people, for this turn of events was from the Lord, to fulfill the word the Lord had spoken to Jeroboam son of Nebat through Ahijah the Shilonite."
1KI	12	16	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12402	" {16} When all Israel saw that the king refused to listen to them, they answered the king:"
1KI	12	16	Jereboam	#06		12403	" << What share do we have in David, what part in Jesse's son? To your tents, O Israel! Look after your own house, O David!>>"
1KI	12	16	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12404	" So the Israelites went home. {17} But as for the Israelites who were living in the towns of Judah, Rehoboam still ruled over them."
1KI	12	18	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12405	" {18} King Rehoboam sent out Adoniram, who was in charge of forced labor, but all Israel stoned him to death."
1KI	12	18	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12406	" King Rehoboam, however, managed to get into his chariot and escape to Jerusalem. {19} So Israel has been in rebellion against the house of David to this day."
1KI	12	20	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12407	" {20} When all the Israelites heard that Jeroboam had returned, they sent and called him to the assembly and made him king over all Israel."
1KI	12	20	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12408	 Only the tribe of Judah remained loyal to the house of David.
1KI	12	21	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12409	" {21} When Rehoboam arrived in Jerusalem, he mustered the whole house of Judah and the tribe of Benjamin--a hundred and eighty thousand fighting men--"
1KI	12	21	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12410	 to make war against the house of Israel and to regain the kingdom for Rehoboam son of Solomon.
1KI	12	22	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12411	 {22} But this word of God came to Shemaiah the man of God:
1KI	12	23	God-FX1	#20		12412	" {23} << Say to Rehoboam son of Solomon king of Judah, to the whole house of Judah and Benjamin, and to the rest of the people,"
1KI	12	24	God-FX1	#20		12413	" {24} 'This is what the Lord says: Do not go up to fight against your brothers, the Israelites. Go home, every one of you, for this is my doing.'>"
1KI	12	24	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12414	" So they obeyed the word of the Lord and went home again, as the Lord had ordered."
1KI	12	25	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12415	" {25} Then Jeroboam fortified Shechem in the hill country of Ephraim and lived there. From there he went out and built up Peniel. {26} Jeroboam thought to himself,"
1KI	12	26	Jereboam	#06		12416	 << The kingdom will now likely revert to the house of David.
1KI	12	27	Jereboam	#06		12417	" {27} If these people go up to offer sacrifices at the temple of the Lord in Jerusalem, they will again give their allegiance to their lord, Rehoboam king of Judah."
1KI	12	27	Jereboam	#06		12418	 They will kill me and return to King Rehoboam.>>
1KI	12	28	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12419	" {28} After seeking advice, the king made two golden calves. He said to the people,"
1KI	12	28	King Rehoboam	#04		12420	" << It is too much for you to go up to Jerusalem. Here are your gods, O Israel, who brought you up out of Egypt.>>"
1KI	12	29	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12421	" {29} One he set up in Bethel, and the other in Dan. {30} And this thing became a sin; the people went even as far as Dan to worship the one there."
1KI	12	31	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12422	" {31} Jeroboam built shrines on high places and appointed priests from all sorts of people, even though they were not Levites."
1KI	12	32	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12423	" {32} He instituted a festival on the fifteenth day of the eighth month, like the festival held in Judah, and offered sacrifices on the altar."
1KI	12	32	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12424	" This he did in Bethel, sacrificing to the calves he had made. And at Bethel he also installed priests at the high places he had made."
1KI	12	33	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12425	" {33} On the fifteenth day of the eighth month, a month of his own choosing, he offered sacrifices on the altar he had built at Bethel."
1KI	12	33	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12426	 So he instituted the festival for the Israelites and went up to the altar to make offerings.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
1KI	13	<<	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12427	1 KINGS 13
1KI	13	1	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12428	" {1} By the word of the Lord a man of God came from Judah to Bethel, as Jeroboam was standing by the altar to make an offering. {2} He cried out against the altar by the word of the Lord:"
1KI	13	2	Man of God-FX1	#09		12429	" << O altar, altar! This is what the Lord says: 'A son named Josiah will be born to the house of David."
1KI	13	2	Man of God-FX1	#09		12430	" On you he will sacrifice the priests of the high places who now make offerings here, and human bones will be burned on you.'<<"

1KI	13	3	Man of God-FX1	#09		12432	 << This is the sign the Lord has declared: The altar will be split apart and the ashes on it will be poured out.>>
1KI	13	4	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12433	" {4} When King Jeroboam heard what the man of God cried out against the altar at Bethel, he stretched out his hand from the altar and said,"
1KI	13	4	Jereboam	#06		12434	 << Seize him!>>
1KI	13	4	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12435	" But the hand he stretched out toward the man shriveled up, so that he could not pull it back."
1KI	13	5	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12436	" {5} Also, the altar was split apart and its ashes poured out according to the sign given by the man of God by the word of the Lord. {6} Then the king said to the man of God,"
1KI	13	6	Jereboam	#06		12437	 << Intercede with the Lord your God and pray for me that my hand may be restored.>>
1KI	13	6	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12438	" So the man of God interceded with the Lord, and the king's hand was restored and became as it was before. {7} The king said to the man of God,"
1KI	13	7	Jereboam	#06		12439	" << Come home with me and have something to eat, and I will give you a gift.>>"
1KI	13	8	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12440	" {8} But the man of God answered the king,"
1KI	13	8	Man of God-FX1	#09		12441	" << Even if you were to give me half your possessions, I would not go with you, nor would I eat bread or drink water here."
1KI	13	9	Man of God-FX1	#09		12442	 {9} For I was commanded by the word of the Lord: 'You must not eat bread or drink water or return by the way you came.'<<
1KI	13	10	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12443	 {10} So he took another road and did not return by the way he had come to Bethel.
1KI	13	11	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12444	" {11} Now there was a certain old prophet living in Bethel, whose sons came and told him all that the man of God had done there that day."
1KI	13	11	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12445	" They also told their father what he had said to the king. {12} Their father asked them,"
1KI	13	12	Prophet (deceitful & old)	#15		12446	 << Which way did he go?>>
1KI	13	12	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12447	" And his sons showed him which road the man of God from Judah had taken. {13} So he said to his sons,"
1KI	13	13	Prophet (deceitful & old)	#15		12448	 << Saddle the donkey for me.>>
1KI	13	13	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12449	" And when they had saddled the donkey for him, he mounted it {14} and rode after the man of God. He found him sitting under an oak tree and asked,"
1KI	13	14	Prophet (deceitful & old)	#15		12450	 << Are you the man of God who came from Judah?>>
1KI	13	14	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12451	" He replied,"
1KI	13	14	Man of God-FX1	#09		12452	" << I am,>>"
1KI	13	15	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12453	" {15} So the prophet said to him,"
1KI	13	15	Prophet (deceitful & old)	#15		12454	 << Come home with me and eat.>>
1KI	13	16	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12455	" {16} The man of God said,"
1KI	13	16	Man of God-FX1	#09		12456	" << I cannot turn back and go with you, nor can I eat bread or drink water with you in this place."
1KI	13	17	Man of God-FX1	#09		12457	 {17} I have been told by the word of the Lord: 'You must not eat bread or drink water there or return by the way you came.'>>
1KI	13	18	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12458	" {18} The old prophet answered,"
1KI	13	18	Prophet (deceitful & old)	#15		12459	" << I too am a prophet, as you are. And an angel said to me by the word of the Lord:"
1KI	13	18	Prophet (deceitful & old)	#15		12460	 Bring him back with you to your house so that he may eat bread and drink water.'>>
1KI	13	18	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12461	 (But he was lying to him.)
1KI	13	19	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12462	 {19} So the man of God returned with him and ate and drank in his house.
1KI	13	20	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12463	" {20} While they were sitting at the table, the word of the Lord came to the old prophet who had brought him back. {21} He cried out to the man of God who had come from Judah,"
1KI	13	21	Prophet (deceitful & old)	#15		12464	 << This is what the Lord says: 'You have defied the word of the Lord and have not kept the command the Lord your God gave you.
1KI	13	22	Prophet (deceitful & old)	#15		12465	 {22} You came back and ate bread and drank water in the place where he told you not to eat or drink.
1KI	13	22	Prophet (deceitful & old)	#15		12466	 Therefore your body will not be buried in the tomb of your fathers.'>>
1KI	13	23	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12467	" {23} When the man of God had finished eating and drinking, the prophet who had brought him back saddled his donkey for him."
1KI	13	24	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12468	" {24} As he went on his way, a lion met him on the road and killed him, and his body was thrown down on the road, with both the donkey and the lion standing beside it."
1KI	13	25	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12469	" {25} Some people who passed by saw the body thrown down there, with the lion standing beside the body, and they went and reported it in the city where the old prophet lived."
1KI	13	26	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12470	" {26} When the prophet who had brought him back from his journey heard of it, he said,"
1KI	13	26	Prophet (deceitful & old)	#15		12471	 << It is the man of God who defied the word of the Lord.
1KI	13	26	Prophet (deceitful & old)	#15		12472	" The Lord has given him over to the lion, which has mauled him and killed him, as the word of the Lord had warned him.>>"
1KI	13	27	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12473	" {27} The prophet said to his sons,"
1KI	13	27	Prophet (deceitful & old)	#15		12474	" << Saddle the donkey for me,>>"
1KI	13	27	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12475	 and they did so. 
1KI	13	28	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12476	" {28} Then he went out and found the body thrown down on the road, with the donkey and the lion standing beside it. The lion had neither eaten the body nor mauled the donkey."
1KI	13	29	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12477	" {29} So the prophet picked up the body of the man of God, laid it on the donkey, and brought it back to his own city to mourn for him and bury him."
1KI	13	30	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12478	" {30} Then he laid the body in his own tomb, and they mourned over him and said,"
1KI	13	30	Man in Crowd	#16		12479	" << Oh, my brother!>>"
1KI	13	31	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12480	" {31} After burying him, he said to his sons,"
1KI	13	31	Prophet (deceitful & old)	#15		12481	" << When I die, bury me in the grave where the man of God is buried; lay my bones beside his bones."
1KI	13	32	Prophet (deceitful & old)	#15		12482	 {32} For the message he declared by the word of the Lord against the altar in Bethel and against all the shrines on the high places in the towns of Samaria will certainly come true.>>
1KI	13	33	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12483	" {33} Even after this, Jeroboam did not change his evil ways, but once more appointed priests for the high places from all sorts of people."
1KI	13	33	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12484	 Anyone who wanted to become a priest he consecrated for the high places.
1KI	13	34	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12485	 {34} This was the sin of the house of Jeroboam that led to its downfall and to its destruction from the face of the earth.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
1KI	14	<<	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12486	1 KINGS 14
1KI	14	1	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12487	" {1} At that time Abijah son of Jeroboam became ill, {2} and Jeroboam said to his wife,"
1KI	14	2	Jereboam	#06		12488	" << Go, disguise yourself, so you won't be recognized as the wife of Jeroboam."
1KI	14	2	Jereboam	#06		12489	 Then go to Shiloh. Ahijah the prophet is there--the one who told me I would be king over this people.
1KI	14	3	Jereboam	#06		12490	" {3} Take ten loaves of bread with you, some cakes and a jar of honey, and go to him. He will tell you what will happen to the boy.>>"
1KI	14	4	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12491	" {4} So Jeroboam's wife did what he said and went to Ahijah's house in Shiloh. Now Ahijah could not see; his sight was gone because of his age. {5} But the Lord had told Ahijah,"
1KI	14	5	God-FX1	#20		12492	" <<Jeroboam's wife is coming to ask you about her son, for he is ill, and you are to give her such and such an answer. When she arrives, she will pretend to be someone else.>>"
1KI	14	6	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12493	" {6} So when Ahijah heard the sound of her footsteps at the door, he said,"
1KI	14	6	Prophet: Ahijah	#02		12494	" << Come in, wife of Jeroboam. Why this pretense? I have been sent to you with bad news."
1KI	14	7	Prophet: Ahijah	#02		12495	" {7} Go, tell Jeroboam that this is what the Lord, the God of Israel, says:"
1KI	14	7	Prophet: Ahijah	#02		12496	 I raised you up from among the people and made you a leader over my people Israel.
1KI	14	8	Prophet: Ahijah	#02		12497	" {8} I tore the kingdom away from the house of David and gave it to you,"
1KI	14	8	Prophet: Ahijah	#02		12498	" but you have not been like my servant David, who kept my commands and followed me with all his heart, doing only what was right in my eyes."
1KI	14	9	Prophet: Ahijah	#02		12499	 {9} You have done more evil than all who lived before you.
1KI	14	9	Prophet: Ahijah	#02		12500	" You have made for yourself other gods, idols made of metal; you have provoked me to anger and thrust me behind your back."
1KI	14	10	Prophet: Ahijah	#02		12501	" {10} << 'Because of this, I am going to bring disaster on the house of Jeroboam."
1KI	14	10	Prophet: Ahijah	#02		12502	 I will cut off from Jeroboam every last male in Israel --slave or free.
1KI	14	10	Prophet: Ahijah	#02		12503	" I will burn up the house of Jeroboam as one burns dung, until it is all gone."
1KI	14	11	Prophet: Ahijah	#02		12504	" {11} Dogs will eat those belonging to Jeroboam who die in the city, and the birds of the air will feed on those who die in the country."
1KI	14	11	Prophet: Ahijah	#02		12505	 The Lord has spoken!'
1KI	14	12	Prophet: Ahijah	#02		12506	" {12} << As for you, go back home. When you set foot in your city, the boy will die."
1KI	14	13	Prophet: Ahijah	#02		12507	 {13} All Israel will mourn for him and bury him.
1KI	14	13	Prophet: Ahijah	#02		12508	" He is the only one belonging to Jeroboam who will be buried, because he is the only one in the house of Jeroboam in whom the Lord, the God of Israel, has found anything good."
1KI	14	14	Prophet: Ahijah	#02		12509	" {14} << The Lord will raise up for himself a king over Israel who will cut off the family of Jeroboam. This is the day! What? Yes, even now."
1KI	14	15	Prophet: Ahijah	#02		12510	" {15} And the Lord will strike Israel, so that it will be like a reed swaying in the water."
1KI	14	15	Prophet: Ahijah	#02		12511	" He will uproot Israel from this good land that he gave to their forefathers and scatter them beyond the River, because they provoked the Lord to anger by making Asherah poles."
1KI	14	16	Prophet: Ahijah	#02		12512	 {16} And he will give Israel up because of the sins Jeroboam has committed and has caused Israel to commit.>>
1KI	14	17	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12513	" {17} Then Jeroboam's wife got up and left and went to Tirzah. As soon as she stepped over the threshold of the house, the boy died."
1KI	14	18	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12514	" {18} They buried him, and all Israel mourned for him, as the Lord had said through his servant the prophet Ahijah."
1KI	14	19	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12515	" {19} The other events of Jeroboam's reign, his wars and how he ruled, are written in the book of the annals of the kings of Israel."
1KI	14	20	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12516	 {20} He reigned for twenty-two years and then rested with his fathers. And Nadab his son succeeded him as king.
1KI	14	21	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12517	 {21} Rehoboam son of Solomon was king in Judah.
1KI	14	21	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12518	" He was forty-one years old when he became king, and he reigned seventeen years in Jerusalem, the city the Lord had chosen out of all the tribes of Israel in which to put his Name."
1KI	14	21	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12519	 His mother's name was Naamah; she was an Ammonite.
1KI	14	22	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12520	 {22} Judah did evil in the eyes of the Lord. By the sins they committed they stirred up his jealous anger more than their fathers had done.
1KI	14	23	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12521	" {23} They also set up for themselves high places, sacred stones and Asherah poles on every high hill and under every spreading tree."
1KI	14	24	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12522	 {24} There were even male shrine prostitutes in the land; the people engaged in all the detestable practices of the nations the Lord had driven out before the Israelites.
1KI	14	25	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12523	" {25} In the fifth year of King Rehoboam, Shishak king of Egypt attacked Jerusalem."
1KI	14	26	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12524	" {26} He carried off the treasures of the temple of the Lord and the treasures of the royal palace. He took everything, including all the gold shields Solomon had made."
1KI	14	27	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12525	 {27} So King Rehoboam made bronze shields to replace them and assigned these to the commanders of the guard on duty at the entrance to the royal palace.
1KI	14	28	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12526	" {28} Whenever the king went to the Lord's temple, the guards bore the shields, and afterward they returned them to the guardroom."
1KI	14	29	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12527	" {29} As for the other events of Rehoboam's reign, and all he did, are they not written in the book of the annals of the kings of Judah?"
1KI	14	30	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12528	 {30} There was continual warfare between Rehoboam and Jeroboam.
1KI	14	31	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12529	 {31} And Rehoboam rested with his fathers and was buried with them in the City of David.
1KI	14	31	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12530	 His mother's name was Naamah; she was an Ammonite. And Abijah his son succeeded him as king.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
1KI	15	<<	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12531	1 KINGS 15
1KI	15	1	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12532	" {1} In the eighteenth year of the reign of Jeroboam son of Nebat, Abijah became king of Judah."
1KI	15	2	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12533	 {2} He reigned in Jerusalem three years. His mother's name was Maacah daughter of Abishalom.
1KI	15	3	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12534	" {3} He committed all the sins his father had done before him; his heart was not fully devoted to the Lord his God, as the heart of David his forefather had been."
1KI	15	4	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12535	" {4} Nevertheless, for David's sake the Lord his God gave him a lamp in Jerusalem by raising up a son to succeed him and by making Jerusalem strong."
1KI	15	5	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12536	 {5} For David had done what was right in the eyes of the Lord and had not failed to keep any of the Lord's commands all the days of his life--except in the case of Uriah the Hittite.
1KI	15	6	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12537	 {6} There was war between Rehoboam and Jeroboam throughout Abijah's lifetime.
1KI	15	7	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12538	" {7} As for the other events of Abijah's reign, and all he did, are they not written in the book of the annals of the kings of Judah? There was war between Abijah and Jeroboam."
1KI	15	8	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12539	 {8} And Abijah rested with his fathers and was buried in the City of David. And Asa his son succeeded him as king.
1KI	15	9	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12540	" {9} In the twentieth year of Jeroboam king of Israel, Asa became king of Judah, {10} and he reigned in Jerusalem forty-one years."
1KI	15	10	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12541	" His grandmother's name was Maacah daughter of Abishalom. {11} Asa did what was right in the eyes of the Lord, as his father David had done."
1KI	15	12	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12542	 {12} He expelled the male shrine prostitutes from the land and got rid of all the idols his fathers had made.
1KI	15	13	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12543	" {13} He even deposed his grandmother Maacah from her position as queen mother, because she had made a repulsive Asherah pole."
1KI	15	13	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12544	" Asa cut the pole down and burned it in the Kidron Valley. {14} Although he did not remove the high places, Asa's heart was fully committed to the Lord all his life."
1KI	15	15	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12545	 {15} He brought into the temple of the Lord the silver and gold and the articles that he and his father had dedicated.
1KI	15	16	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12546	 {16} There was war between Asa and Baasha king of Israel throughout their reigns.
1KI	15	17	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12547	 {17} Baasha king of Israel went up against Judah and fortified Ramah to prevent anyone from leaving or entering the territory of Asa king of Judah.
1KI	15	18	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12548	 {18} Asa then took all the silver and gold that was left in the treasuries of the Lord's temple and of his own palace.
1KI	15	18	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12549	" He entrusted it to his officials and sent them to Ben-Hadad son of Tabrimmon, the son of Hezion, the king of Aram, who was ruling in Damascus. He said,"
1KI	15	19	King Asa	#03		12550	 {19} << Let there be a treaty between me and you as there was between my father and your father.
1KI	15	19	King Asa	#03		12551	" See, I am sending you a gift of silver and gold. Now break your treaty with Baasha king of Israel so he will withdraw from me.>>"
1KI	15	20	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12552	 {20} Ben-Hadad agreed with King Asa and sent the commanders of his forces against the towns of Israel.
1KI	15	20	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12553	" He conquered Ijon, Dan, Abel Beth Maacah and all Kinnereth in addition to Naphtali."
1KI	15	21	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12554	" {21} When Baasha heard this, he stopped building Ramah and withdrew to Tirzah."
1KI	15	22	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12555	 {22} Then King Asa issued an order to all Judah--no one was exempt--and they carried away from Ramah the stones and timber Baasha had been using there.
1KI	15	22	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12556	" With them King Asa built up Geba in Benjamin, and also Mizpah."
1KI	15	23	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12557	" {23} As for all the other events of Asa's reign, all his achievements, all he did and the cities he built, are they not written in the book of the annals of the kings of Judah?"
1KI	15	23	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12558	" In his old age, however, his feet became diseased."
1KI	15	24	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12559	 {24} Then Asa rested with his fathers and was buried with them in the city of his father David. And Jehoshaphat his son succeeded him as king.
1KI	15	25	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12560	" {25} Nadab son of Jeroboam became king of Israel in the second year of Asa king of Judah, and he reigned over Israel two years."
1KI	15	26	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12561	" {26} He did evil in the eyes of the Lord, walking in the ways of his father and in his sin, which he had caused Israel to commit."
1KI	15	27	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12562	" {27} Baasha son of Ahijah of the house of Issachar plotted against him, and he struck him down at Gibbethon, a Philistine town, while Nadab and all Israel were besieging it."
1KI	15	28	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12563	 {28} Baasha killed Nadab in the third year of Asa king of Judah and succeeded him as king.
1KI	15	29	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12564	" {29} As soon as he began to reign, he killed Jeroboam's whole family."
1KI	15	29	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12565	" He did not leave Jeroboam anyone that breathed, but destroyed them all, according to the word of the Lord given through his servant Ahijah the Shilonite --"
1KI	15	30	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12566	" {30} because of the sins Jeroboam had committed and had caused Israel to commit, and because he provoked the Lord, the God of Israel, to anger."
1KI	15	31	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12567	" {31} As for the other events of Nadab's reign, and all he did, are they not written in the book of the annals of the kings of Israel?"
1KI	15	32	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12568	 {32} There was war between Asa and Baasha king of Israel throughout their reigns.
1KI	15	33	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12569	" {33} In the third year of Asa king of Judah, Baasha son of Ahijah became king of all Israel in Tirzah, and he reigned twenty-four years."
1KI	15	34	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12570	" {34} He did evil in the eyes of the Lord, walking in the ways of Jeroboam and in his sin, which he had caused Israel to commit.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"

1KI	16	3	God-FX1	#20		12575	" {3} So I am about to consume Baasha and his house, and I will make your house like that of Jeroboam son of Nebat."

1KI	16	10	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12584	" {10} Zimri came in, struck him down and killed him in the twenty-seventh year of Asa king of Judah. Then he succeeded him as king."
1KI	16	11	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12585	" {11} As soon as he began to reign and was seated on the throne, he killed off Baasha's whole family. He did not spare a single male, whether relative or friend."
1KI	16	12	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12586	" {12} So Zimri destroyed the whole family of Baasha, in accordance with the word of the Lord spoken against Baasha through the prophet Jehu --"
1KI	16	13	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12587	" {13} because of all the sins Baasha and his son Elah had committed and had caused Israel to commit, so that they provoked the Lord, the God of Israel, to anger by their worthless idols."
1KI	16	14	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12588	" {14} As for the other events of Elah's reign, and all he did, are they not written in the book of the annals of the kings of Israel?"
1KI	16	15	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12589	" {15} In the twenty-seventh year of Asa king of Judah, Zimri reigned in Tirzah seven days. The army was encamped near Gibbethon, a Philistine town."
1KI	16	16	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12590	" {16} When the Israelites in the camp heard that Zimri had plotted against the king and murdered him, they proclaimed Omri, the commander of the army, king over Israel that very day there in the camp."
1KI	16	17	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12591	 {17} Then Omri and all the Israelites with him withdrew from Gibbethon and laid siege to Tirzah.
1KI	16	18	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12592	" {18} When Zimri saw that the city was taken, he went into the citadel of the royal palace and set the palace on fire around him."
1KI	16	18	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12593	" So he died, {19} because of the sins he had committed, doing evil in the eyes of the Lord and walking in the ways of Jeroboam and in the sin he had committed and had caused Israel to commit."
1KI	16	20	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12594	" {20} As for the other events of Zimri's reign, and the rebellion he carried out, are they not written in the book of the annals of the kings of Israel?"
1KI	16	21	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12595	" {21} Then the people of Israel were split into two factions; half supported Tibni son of Ginath for king, and the other half supported Omri."
1KI	16	22	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12596	 {22} But Omri's followers proved stronger than those of Tibni son of Ginath. So Tibni died and Omri became king.
1KI	16	23	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12597	" {23} In the thirty-first year of Asa king of Judah, Omri became king of Israel, and he reigned twelve years, six of them in Tirzah."
1KI	16	24	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12598	" {24} He bought the hill of Samaria from Shemer for two talents of silver and built a city on the hill, calling it Samaria, after Shemer, the name of the former owner of the hill."
1KI	16	25	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12599	 {25} But Omri did evil in the eyes of the Lord and sinned more than all those before him.
1KI	16	26	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12600	" {26} He walked in all the ways of Jeroboam son of Nebat and in his sin, which he had caused Israel to commit, so that they provoked the Lord, the God of Israel, to anger by their worthless idols."
1KI	16	27	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12601	" {27} As for the other events of Omri's reign, what he did and the things he achieved, are they not written in the book of the annals of the kings of Israel?"
1KI	16	28	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12602	 {28} Omri rested with his fathers and was buried in Samaria. And Ahab his son succeeded him as king.
1KI	16	29	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12603	" {29} In the thirty-eighth year of Asa king of Judah, Ahab son of Omri became king of Israel, and he reigned in Samaria over Israel twenty-two years."
1KI	16	30	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12604	 {30} Ahab son of Omri did more evil in the eyes of the Lord than any of those before him.
1KI	16	31	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12605	" {31} He not only considered it trivial to commit the sins of Jeroboam son of Nebat, but he also married Jezebel daughter of Ethbaal king of the Sidonians, and began to serve Baal and worship him."
1KI	16	32	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12606	 {32} He set up an altar for Baal in the temple of Baal that he built in Samaria.
1KI	16	33	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12607	" {33} Ahab also made an Asherah pole and did more to provoke the Lord, the God of Israel, to anger than did all the kings of Israel before him."
1KI	16	34	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12608	" {34} In Ahab's time, Hiel of Bethel rebuilt Jericho."
1KI	16	34	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12609	" He laid its foundations at the cost of his firstborn son Abiram,"
1KI	16	34	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12610	" and he set up its gates at the cost of his youngest son Segub, in accordance with the word of the Lord spoken by Joshua son of Nun.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
1KI	17	<<	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12611	1 KINGS 17
1KI	17	1	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12612	" {1} Now Elijah the Tishbite, from Tishbe in Gilead, said to Ahab,"
1KI	17	1	Elijah	#13		12613	" << As the Lord, the God of Israel, lives, whom I serve, there will be neither dew nor rain in the next few years except at my word.>>"
1KI	17	2	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12614	 {2} Then the word of the Lord came to Elijah:
1KI	17	3	God-FX1	#20		12615	" {3} << Leave here, turn eastward and hide in the Kerith Ravine, east of the Jordan."
1KI	17	4	God-FX1	#20		12616	" {4} You will drink from the brook, and I have ordered the ravens to feed you there.>>"
1KI	17	5	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12617	" {5} So he did what the Lord had told him. He went to the Kerith Ravine, east of the Jordan, and stayed there."
1KI	17	6	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12618	" {6} The ravens brought him bread and meat in the morning and bread and meat in the evening, and he drank from the brook."
1KI	17	7	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12619	 {7} Some time later the brook dried up because there had been no rain in the land. {8} Then the word of the Lord came to him:
1KI	17	9	God-FX1	#20		12620	 {9} << Go at once to Zarephath of Sidon and stay there. I have commanded a widow in that place to supply you with food.>>
1KI	17	10	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12621	" {10} So he went to Zarephath. When he came to the town gate, a widow was there gathering sticks. He called to her and asked,"
1KI	17	10	Elijah	#13		12622	 << Would you bring me a little water in a jar so I may have a drink?>>
1KI	17	11	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12623	" {11} As she was going to get it, he called,"
1KI	17	11	Elijah	#13		12624	" <<And bring me, please, a piece of bread.>>"
1KI	17	12	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12625	" {12} She replied,"
1KI	17	12	Widow	#24		12626	" << As surely as the Lord your God lives, I don't have any bread--only a handful of flour in a jar and a little oil in a jug."
1KI	17	12	Widow	#24		12627	" I am gathering a few sticks to take home and make a meal for myself and my son, that we may eat it -- and die.>>"
1KI	17	13	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12628	" {13} Elijah said to her,"
1KI	17	13	Elijah	#13		12629	 << Don't be afraid. Go home and do as you have said.
1KI	17	13	Elijah	#13		12630	" But first make a small cake of bread for me from what you have and bring it to me, and then make something for yourself and your son."
1KI	17	14	Elijah	#13		12631	" {14} For this is what the Lord, the God of Israel, says:"
1KI	17	14	Elijah	#13		12632	 The jar of flour will not be used up and the jug of oil will not run dry until the day the Lord gives rain on the land.'>>
1KI	17	15	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12633	 {15} She went away and did as Elijah had told her. So there was food every day for Elijah and for the woman and her family.
1KI	17	16	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12634	" {16} For the jar of flour was not used up and the jug of oil did not run dry, in keeping with the word of the Lord spoken by Elijah."
1KI	17	17	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12635	" {17} Some time later the son of the woman who owned the house became ill. He grew worse and worse, and finally stopped breathing. {18} She said to Elijah,"
1KI	17	18	Widow	#24		12636	" << What do you have against me, man of God? Did you come to remind me of my sin and kill my son?>>"
1KI	17	19	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12637	" {19} Elijah replied,"
1KI	17	19	Elijah	#13		12638	" << Give me your son,>>"
1KI	17	19	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12639	" He took him from her arms, carried him to the upper room where he was staying, and laid him on his bed. {20} Then he cried out to the Lord,"
1KI	17	20	Elijah	#13		12640	" << O Lord my God, have you brought tragedy also upon this widow I am staying with, by causing her son to die?>>"
1KI	17	21	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12641	" {21} Then he stretched himself out on the boy three times and cried to the Lord,"
1KI	17	21	Elijah	#13		12642	" << O Lord my God, let this boy's life return to him!>>"
1KI	17	22	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12643	" {22} The Lord heard Elijah's cry, and the boy's life returned to him, and he lived."
1KI	17	23	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12644	" {23} Elijah picked up the child and carried him down from the room into the house. He gave him to his mother and said,"

1KI	17	24	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12646	" {24} Then the woman said to Elijah,"

1KI	18	2	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12652	" Now the famine was severe in Samaria, {3} and Ahab had summoned Obadiah, who was in charge of his palace. (Obadiah was a devout believer in the Lord."

1KI	18	6	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12656	" {6} So they divided the land they were to cover, Ahab going in one direction and Obadiah in another."

1KI	18	11	Obadiah	#17		12665	" {11} But now you tell me to go to my master and say, 'Elijah is here.'"

1KI	18	12	Obadiah	#17		12667	" If I go and tell Ahab and he doesn't find you, he will kill me. Yet I your servant have worshiped the Lord since my youth."
1KI	18	13	Obadiah	#17		12668	" {13} Haven't you heard, my lord, what I did while Jezebel was killing the prophets of the Lord?"
1KI	18	13	Obadiah	#17		12669	" I hid a hundred of the Lord's prophets in two caves, fifty in each, and supplied them with food and water."
1KI	18	14	Obadiah	#17		12670	" {14} And now you tell me to go to my master and say, 'Elijah is here.' He will kill me!>>"

1KI	18	16	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12673	" {16} So Obadiah went to meet Ahab and told him, and Ahab went to meet Elijah."
1KI	18	17	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12674	" {17} When he saw Elijah, he said to him,"

1KI	18	18	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12676	" {18} Elijah replied,"
1KI	18	18	Elijah	#13		12677	" I have not made trouble for Israel, but you and your father's family have. You have abandoned the Lord's commands and have followed the Baals."
1KI	18	19	Elijah	#13		12678	 {19} Now summon the people from all over Israel to meet me on Mount Carmel.
1KI	18	19	Elijah	#13		12679	" And bring the four hundred and fifty prophets of Baal and the four hundred prophets of Asherah, who eat at Jezebel's table.>>"
1KI	18	20	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12680	" {20} So Ahab sent word throughout all Israel and assembled the prophets on Mount Carmel. {21} Elijah went before the people and said,"

1KI	18	21	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12682	" But the people said nothing. {22} Then Elijah said to them,"
1KI	18	22	Elijah	#13		12683	" << I am the only one of the Lord's prophets left, but Baal has four hundred and fifty prophets."
1KI	18	23	Elijah	#13		12684	 {23} Get two bulls for us.
1KI	18	23	Elijah	#13		12685	" Let them choose one for themselves, and let them cut it into pieces and put it on the wood but not set fire to it."
1KI	18	23	Elijah	#13		12686	 I will prepare the other bull and put it on the wood but not set fire to it.
1KI	18	24	Elijah	#13		12687	" {24} Then you call on the name of your god, and I will call on the name of the Lord."
1KI	18	24	Elijah	#13		12688	 The god who answers by fire--he is God.>>
1KI	18	24	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12689	" Then all the people said,"
1KI	18	24	Man in Crowd	#12		12690	 << What you say is good.>>
1KI	18	25	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12691	" {25} Elijah said to the prophets of Baal,"
1KI	18	25	Elijah	#13		12692	" << Choose one of the bulls and prepare it first, since there are so many of you."
1KI	18	25	Elijah	#13		12693	" Call on the name of your god, but do not light the fire.>>"
1KI	18	26	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12694	" {26} So they took the bull given them and prepared it. Then they called on the name of Baal from morning till noon. They shouted,"
1KI	18	26	Man in Crowd	#15		12695	" << O Baal, answer us!>>"
1KI	18	26	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12696	" But there was no response; no one answered. And they danced around the altar they had made. {27} At noon Elijah began to taunt them. He said,"
1KI	18	27	Elijah	#13		12697	" << Shout louder! Surely he is a god! Perhaps he is deep in thought, or busy, or traveling. Maybe he is sleeping and must be awakened.>>"
1KI	18	28	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12698	" {28} So they shouted louder and slashed themselves with swords and spears, as was their custom, until their blood flowed."
1KI	18	29	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12699	" {29} Midday passed, and they continued their frantic prophesying until the time for the evening sacrifice. But there was no response, no one answered, no one paid attention."
1KI	18	30	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12700	" {30} Then Elijah said to all the people,"
1KI	18	30	Elijah	#13		12701	 << Come here to me.>>
1KI	18	30	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12702	" They came to him, and he repaired the altar of the Lord, which was in ruins."
1KI	18	31	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12703	" {31} Elijah took twelve stones, one for each of the tribes descended from Jacob, to whom the word of the Lord had come, saying,"

1KI	18	32	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12705	" {32} With the stones he built an altar in the name of the Lord, and he dug a trench around it large enough to hold two seahs of seed."
1KI	18	33	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12706	" {33} He arranged the wood, cut the bull into pieces and laid it on the wood. Then he said to them,"

1KI	18	33	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12708	" {34} Then he said,"
1KI	18	34	Elijah	#13		12709	" ""Do it a second time."""
1KI	18	34	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12710	" So they did it a second time. Then he said,"
1KI	18	34	Elijah	#13		12711	" << Do it a third time,>>"
1KI	18	34	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12712	" and they did it the third time. {35} The water ran down around the altar and even filled the trench. {36} At the time of sacrifice, the prophet Elijah stepped forward and prayed:"
1KI	18	36	Elijah	#13		12713	" << O Lord, God of Abraham, Isaac and Israel, let it be known today that you are God in Israel and that I am your servant and have done all these things at your command."
1KI	18	37	Elijah	#13		12714	" {37} Answer me, O Lord, answer me, so these people will know that you, O Lord, are God, and that you are turning their hearts back again.>>"
1KI	18	38	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12715	" {38} Then the fire of the Lord fell and burned up the sacrifice, the wood, the stones and the soil, and also licked up the water in the trench."
1KI	18	39	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12716	" {39} When all the people saw this, they fell prostrate and cried,"

1KI	18	40	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12718	" {40} Then Elijah commanded them,"
1KI	18	40	Elijah	#13		12719	 << Seize the prophets of Baal. Don't let anyone get away!>>
1KI	18	40	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12720	" They seized them, and Elijah had them brought down to the Kishon Valley and slaughtered there. {41} And Elijah said to Ahab,"
1KI	18	41	Elijah	#13		12721	" << Go, eat and drink, for there is the sound of a heavy rain.>>"
1KI	18	42	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12722	" {42} So Ahab went off to eat and drink, but Elijah climbed to the top of Carmel, bent down to the ground and put his face between his knees."
1KI	18	43	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12723	" {43} He told his servant,"
1KI	18	43	Elijah	#13		12724	" << Go and look toward the sea,>>"

1KI	18	43	Servant	#18		12726	" << There is nothing there,>>"
1KI	18	43	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12727	" Seven times Elijah said,"
1KI	18	43	Elijah	#13		12728	 << Go back.>>
1KI	18	44	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12729	" {44} The seventh time the servant reported,"
1KI	18	44	Servant	#18		12730	 <<A cloud as small as a man's hand is rising from the sea.>>
1KI	18	44	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12731	" So Elijah said,"
1KI	18	44	Elijah	#13		12732	" << Go and tell Ahab, 'Hitch up your chariot and go down before the rain stops you.'<<"
1KI	18	45	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12733	" {45} Meanwhile, the sky grew black with clouds, the wind rose, a heavy rain came on and Ahab rode off to Jezreel."
1KI	18	46	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12734	" {46} The power of the Lord came upon Elijah and, tucking his cloak into his belt, he ran ahead of Ahab all the way to Jezreel.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
1KI	19	<<	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12735	1 KINGS 19

1KI	19	3	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12738	" {3} Elijah was afraid and ran for his life. When he came to Beersheba in Judah, he left his servant there, {4} while he himself went a day's journey into the desert."
1KI	19	4	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12739	" He came to a broom tree, sat down under it and prayed that he might die. He said,"

1KI	19	6	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12743	" {6} He looked around, and there by his head was a cake of bread baked over hot coals, and a jar of water. He ate and drank and then lay down again."

1KI	19	8	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12746	" {8} So he got up and ate and drank. Strengthened by that food, he traveled forty days and forty nights until he reached Horeb, the mountain of God."

1KI	20	21	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12820	" {21} The king of Israel advanced and overpowered the horses and chariots and inflicted heavy losses on the Arameans. {22} Afterward, the prophet came to the king of Israel and said,"

1KI	20	25	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12828	 He agreed with them and acted accordingly. {26} The next spring Ben-Hadad mustered the Arameans and went up to Aphek to fight against Israel.

1KI	21	20	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12902	" {20} Ahab said to Elijah,"

1KI	21	21	Elijah	#13		12906	 {21} 'I am going to bring disaster on you. I will consume your descendants and cut off from Ahab every last male in Israel --slave or free.
1KI	21	22	Elijah	#13		12907	" {22} I will make your house like that of Jeroboam son of Nebat and that of Baasha son of Ahijah, because you have provoked me to anger and have caused Israel to sin.'"
1KI	21	23	Elijah	#13		12908	 {23} << And also concerning Jezebel the Lord says: 'Dogs will devour Jezebel by the wall of Jezreel.'
1KI	21	24	Elijah	#13		12909	" {24} << Dogs will eat those belonging to Ahab who die in the city, and the birds of the air will feed on those who die in the country.>>"
1KI	21	25	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12910	" {25} (There was never a man like Ahab, who sold himself to do evil in the eyes of the Lord, urged on by Jezebel his wife."

1KI	22	38	Narr_11: 1_Kings	#11		12992	" {38} They washed the chariot at a pool in Samaria (where the prostitutes bathed), and the dogs licked up his blood, as the word of the Lord had declared."

2KI	2	11	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13080	" {11} As they were walking along and talking together, suddenly a chariot of fire and horses of fire appeared and separated the two of them, and Elijah went up to heaven in a whirlwind."

2KI	2	14	Elisha	#02		13086	" << Where now is the Lord, the God of Elijah?>>"
2KI	2	14	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13087	" When he struck the water, it divided to the right and to the left, and he crossed over. {15} The company of the prophets from Jericho, who were watching, said,"
2KI	2	15	Man in Crowd	#16		13088	 << The spirit of Elijah is resting on Elisha.>>
2KI	2	15	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13089	" And they went to meet him and bowed to the ground before him. {16} They said,"
2KI	2	16	Man	#03		13090	" << Look, we your servants have fifty able men."
2KI	2	16	Man	#03		13091	 Let them go and look for your master.
2KI	2	16	Man	#03		13092	 Perhaps the Spirit of the Lord has picked him up and set him down on some mountain or in some valley.>>
2KI	2	16	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13093	" Elisha replied,"
2KI	2	16	Elisha	#02		13094	" <<No, do not send them.>>"
2KI	2	17	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13095	" {17} But they persisted until he was too ashamed to refuse. So he said,"
2KI	2	17	Elisha	#02		13096	 <<Send them.>>
2KI	2	17	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13097	" And they sent fifty men, who searched for three days but did not find him. {18} When they returned to Elisha, who was staying in Jericho, he said to them,"
2KI	2	18	Elisha	#02		13098	 << Didn't I tell you not to go?>>
2KI	2	19	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13099	" {19} The men of the city said to Elisha,"
2KI	2	19	Man	#15		13100	" <<Look, our lord, this town is well situated, as you can see, but the water is bad and the land is unproductive.>>"
2KI	2	20	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13101	" {20} He said,"
2KI	2	20	Elisha	#02		13102	" << Bring me a new bowl, and put salt in it.>>"
2KI	2	20	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13103	" So they brought it to him. {21} Then he went out to the spring and threw the salt into it, saying,"
2KI	2	21	Elisha	#02		13104	 << This is what the Lord says: 'I have healed this water. Never again will it cause death or make the land unproductive.'>>
2KI	2	22	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13105	" {22} And the water has remained wholesome to this day, according to the word Elisha had spoken."
2KI	2	23	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13106	" {23} From there Elisha went up to Bethel. As he was walking along the road, some youths came out of the town and jeered at him. They said,"
2KI	2	23	Youth	#18		13107	" << Go on up, you baldhead! Go on up, you baldhead!>>"
2KI	2	24	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13108	" {24} He turned around, looked at them and called down a curse on them in the name of the Lord. Then two bears came out of the woods and mauled forty-two of the youths."
2KI	2	25	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13109	 {25} And he went on to Mount Carmel and from there returned to Samaria.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
2KI	3	<<	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13110	2 KINGS 3
2KI	3	1	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13111	" {1} Joram son of Ahab became king of Israel in Samaria in the eighteenth year of Jehoshaphat king of Judah, and he reigned twelve years."
2KI	3	2	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13112	" {2} He did evil in the eyes of the Lord, but not as his father and mother had done. He got rid of the sacred stone of Baal that his father had made."
2KI	3	3	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13113	" {3} Nevertheless he clung to the sins of Jeroboam son of Nebat, which he had caused Israel to commit; he did not turn away from them."
2KI	3	4	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13114	" {4} Now Mesha king of Moab raised sheep, and he had to supply the king of Israel with a hundred thousand lambs and with the wool of a hundred thousand rams."
2KI	3	5	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13115	" {5} But after Ahab died, the king of Moab rebelled against the king of Israel. {6} So at that time King Joram set out from Samaria and mobilized all Israel."
2KI	3	7	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13116	 {7} He also sent this message to Jehoshaphat king of Judah:
2KI	3	7	King Joram	#09		13117	 << The king of Moab has rebelled against me. Will you go with me to fight against Moab?>>
2KI	3	7	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13118	" He replied,"
2KI	3	7	Jehoshaphat	#07		13119	" << I will go with you. I am as you are, my people as your people, my horses as your horses.>>"
2KI	3	7	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13120	" {8} He asked,"
2KI	3	8	King Joram	#09		13121	 << By what route shall we attack?>>
2KI	3	8	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13122	" He answered,"
2KI	3	8	Jehoshaphat	#07		13123	" << Through the Desert of Edom,>>"
2KI	3	9	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13124	 {9} So the king of Israel set out with the king of Judah and the king of Edom.
2KI	3	9	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13125	" After a roundabout march of seven days, the army had no more water for themselves or for the animals with them. {10} The King of Israel exclaimed,"
2KI	3	10	King Joram	#09		13126	 What!! Has the Lord called us three kings together only to hand us over to Moab?>>
2KI	3	11	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13127	" {11} But Jehoshaphat asked,"
2KI	3	11	Jehoshaphat	#07		13128	" << Is there no prophet of the Lord here, that we may inquire of the Lord through him?>>"
2KI	3	11	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13129	" An officer of the king of Israel answered,"
2KI	3	11	Officer	#08		13130	 << Elisha son of Shaphat is here. He used to pour water on the hands of Elijah.>>
2KI	3	12	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13131	" {12} Jehoshaphat said,"
2KI	3	12	Jehoshaphat	#07		13132	 << The word of the Lord is with him.>>
2KI	3	12	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13133	" So the king of Israel and Jehoshaphat and the king of Edom went down to him. {13} Elisha said to the king of Israel,"
2KI	3	13	Elisha	#02		13134	 << What do we have to do with each other? Go to the prophets of your father and the prophets of your mother.>>
2KI	3	13	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13135	" The king of Israel answered,"
2KI	3	13	King Joram	#09		13136	" << No, because it was the Lord who called us three kings together to hand us over to Moab.>>"
2KI	3	14	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13137	" {14} Elisha said,"
2KI	3	14	Elisha	#02		13138	" << As surely as the Lord Almighty lives, whom I serve, if I did not have respect for the presence of Jehoshaphat king of Judah, I would not look at you or even notice you."
2KI	3	15	Elisha	#02		13139	 {15} But now bring me a harpist.>>
2KI	3	15	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13140	" While the harpist was playing, the hand of the Lord came upon Elisha {16} and he said,"
2KI	3	16	Elisha	#02		13141	 << This is what the Lord says: Make this valley full of ditches.
2KI	3	17	Elisha	#02		13142	" {17} For this is what the Lord says: You will see neither wind nor rain, yet this valley will be filled with water, and you, your cattle and your other animals will drink."
2KI	3	18	Elisha	#02		13143	 {18} This is an easy thing in the eyes of the Lord; he will also hand Moab over to you.
2KI	3	19	Elisha	#02		13144	 {19} You will overthrow every fortified city and every major town.
2KI	3	19	Elisha	#02		13145	" You will cut down every good tree, stop up all the springs, and ruin every good field with stones.>>"
2KI	3	20	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13146	" {20} The next morning, about the time for offering the sacrifice, there it was--water flowing from the direction of Edom! And the land was filled with water."
2KI	3	21	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13147	" {21} Now all the Moabites had heard that the kings had come to fight against them; so every man, young and old, who could bear arms was called up and stationed on the border."
2KI	3	22	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13148	" {22} When they got up early in the morning, the sun was shining on the water. To the Moabites across the way, the water looked red--like blood. {23} They said,"
2KI	3	23	Moabite	#21		13149	" << That's blood! Those kings must have fought and slaughtered each other. Now to the plunder, Moab!>>"
2KI	3	24	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13150	" {24} But when the Moabites came to the camp of Israel, the Israelites rose up and fought them until they fled. And the Israelites invaded the land and slaughtered the Moabites."
2KI	3	25	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13151	" {25} They destroyed the towns, and each man threw a stone on every good field until it was covered."
2KI	3	25	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13152	" They stopped up all the springs and cut down every good tree. Only Kir Hareseth was left with its stones in place, but men armed with slings surrounded it and attacked it as well."
2KI	3	26	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13153	" {26} When the king of Moab saw that the battle had gone against him, he took with him seven hundred swordsmen to break through to the king of Edom, but they failed."
2KI	3	27	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13154	" {27} Then he took his firstborn son, who was to succeed him as king, and offered him as a sacrifice on the city wall."
2KI	3	27	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13155	 The fury against Israel was great; they withdrew and returned to their own land.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
2KI	4	<<	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13156	2 KINGS 4
2KI	4	1	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13157	" {1} The wife of a man from the company of the prophets cried out to Elisha,"

2KI	4	1	Widow	#23		13159	 But now his creditor is coming to take my two boys as his slaves.>>
2KI	4	2	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13160	" {2} Elisha replied to her,"

2KI	4	2	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13162	" She said,"
2KI	4	2	Widow	#23		13163	" << Your servant has nothing there at all, except a little oil.>>"
2KI	4	3	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13164	" {3} Elisha said,"
2KI	4	3	Elisha	#02		13165	 << Go around and ask all your neighbors for empty jars. Don't ask for just a few.
2KI	4	4	Elisha	#02		13166	" {4} Then go inside and shut the door behind you and your sons. Pour oil into all the jars, and as each is filled, put it to one side.>>"
2KI	4	5	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13167	" {5} She left him and afterward shut the door behind her and her sons. They brought the jars to her and she kept pouring. {6} When all the jars were full, she said to her son,"
2KI	4	6	Widow	#23		13168	 << Bring me another one.>>
2KI	4	6	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13169	" But he replied,"
2KI	4	6	Elisha	#02		13170	 << There is not a jar left.>>
2KI	4	6	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13171	" Then the oil stopped flowing. {7} She went and told the man of God, and he said,"
2KI	4	7	Elisha	#02		13172	" << Go, sell the oil and pay your debts. You and your sons can live on what is left.>>"
2KI	4	8	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13173	" {8} One day Elisha went to Shunem. And a well-to-do woman was there, who urged him to stay for a meal. So whenever he came by, he stopped there to eat. {9} She said to her husband,"
2KI	4	9	Shunammite Woman	#24		13174	 << I know that this man who often comes our way is a holy man of God.
2KI	4	10	Shunammite Woman	#24		13175	" {10} Let's make a small room on the roof and put in it a bed and a table, a chair and a lamp for him."
2KI	4	10	Shunammite Woman	#24		13176	 Then he can stay there whenever he comes to us.>>
2KI	4	11	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13177	" {11} One day when Elisha came, he went up to his room and lay down there. {12} He said to his servant Gehazi,"
2KI	4	12	Elisha	#02		13178	 << Call the Shunammite.>>
2KI	4	12	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13179	" So he called her, and she stood before him. {13} Elisha said to him,"
2KI	4	13	Elisha	#02		13180	" << Tell her, 'You have gone to all this trouble for us."
2KI	4	13	Elisha	#02		13181	 Now what can be done for you? Can we speak on your behalf to the king or the commander of the army?'>>
2KI	4	13	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13182	" She replied,"
2KI	4	13	Shunammite Woman	#24		13183	 << I have a home among my own people.>>
2KI	4	14	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13184	" {14} Elisha asked,"
2KI	4	14	Elisha	#02		13185	 << What can be done for her?>>
2KI	4	14	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13186	" Gehazi said,"
2KI	4	14	Gehazi	#14		13187	" << Well, she has no son and her husband is old.>>"
2KI	4	15	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13188	" {15} Then Elisha said,"
2KI	4	15	Elisha	#02		13189	 << Call her.>>
2KI	4	15	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13190	" So he called her, and she stood in the doorway. {16} Elisha said,"
2KI	4	16	Elisha	#02		13191	" << About this time next year, you will hold a son in your arms.>>"
2KI	4	16	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13192	" She objected,"
2KI	4	16	Shunammite Woman	#24		13193	" << No, my lord. Don't mislead your servant, O man of God!>>"
2KI	4	17	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13194	" {17} But the woman became pregnant, and the next year about that same time she gave birth to a son, just as Elisha had told her."
2KI	4	18	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13195	" {18} The child grew, and one day he went out to his father, who was with the reapers. {19} He said to his father,"
2KI	4	19	Boy	#21		13196	 << My head! My head!>>
2KI	4	19	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13197	" His father told a servant,"
2KI	4	19	Father	#01		13198	 << Carry him to his mother.>>
2KI	4	20	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13199	" {20} After the servant had lifted him up and carried him to his mother, the boy sat on her lap until noon, and then he died."
2KI	4	21	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13200	" {21} She went up and laid him on the bed of the man of God, then shut the door and went out. {22} She called her husband and said,"
2KI	4	22	Shunammite Woman	#24		13201	 << Please send me one of the servants and a donkey so I can go to the man of God quickly and return.>>
2KI	4	23	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13202	" {23} He asked,"
2KI	4	23	Father	#01		13203	 << Why go to him today? It's not the New Moon or the Sabbath.>>
2KI	4	23	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13204	" She said,"
2KI	4	23	Shunammite Woman	#24		13205	" << It's all right,>>"
2KI	4	24	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13206	" {24} She saddled the donkey and said to her servant,"
2KI	4	24	Shunammite Woman	#24		13207	 << Lead on; don't slow down for me unless I tell you.>>
2KI	4	25	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13208	" {25} So she set out and came to the man of God at Mount Carmel. When he saw her in the distance, the man of God said to his servant Gehazi,"

2KI	4	26	Elisha	#02		13210	" {26} Run to meet her and ask her, 'Are you all right? Is your husband all right? Is your child all right?'>>"
2KI	4	26	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13211	" She replied,"
2KI	4	26	Shunammite Woman	#24		13212	" << Everything is all right,>>"
2KI	4	27	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13213	" {27} When she reached the man of God at the mountain, she took hold of his feet. Gehazi came over to push her away, but the man of God said,"
2KI	4	27	Elisha	#02		13214	" << Leave her alone! She is in bitter distress, but the Lord has hidden it from me and has not told me why.>>"
2KI	4	28	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13215	" {28} She said,"
2KI	4	28	Shunammite Woman	#24		13216	" << Did I ask you for a son, my lord? Didn't I tell you, 'Don't raise my hopes'?>>"

2KI	4	29	Elisha	#02		13219	" If you meet anyone, do not greet him, and if anyone greets you, do not answer. Lay my staff on the boy's face.>>"
2KI	4	30	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13220	" {30} But the child's mother said,"
2KI	4	30	Shunammite Woman	#24		13221	" << As surely as the Lord lives and as you live, I will not leave you.>>"
2KI	4	30	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13222	" So he got up and followed her. {31} Gehazi went on ahead and laid the staff on the boy's face, but there was no sound or response. So Gehazi went back to meet Elisha and told him,"
2KI	4	31	Gehazi	#14		13223	 << The boy has not awakened.>>
2KI	4	32	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13224	" {32} When Elisha reached the house, there was the boy lying dead on his couch."
2KI	4	33	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13225	" {33} He went in, shut the door on the two of them and prayed to the Lord."
2KI	4	34	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13226	" {34} Then he got on the bed and lay upon the boy, mouth to mouth, eyes to eyes, hands to hands. As he stretched himself out upon him, the boy's body grew warm."
2KI	4	35	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13227	 {35} Elisha turned away and walked back and forth in the room and then got on the bed and stretched out upon him once more. The boy sneezed seven times and opened his eyes.
2KI	4	36	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13228	" {36} Elisha summoned Gehazi and said,"
2KI	4	36	Elisha	#02		13229	 << Call the Shunammite.>>
2KI	4	36	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13230	" And he did. When she came, he said,"
2KI	4	36	Elisha	#02		13231	 << Take your son.>>
2KI	4	37	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13232	" {37} She came in, fell at his feet and bowed to the ground. Then she took her son and went out."
2KI	4	38	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13233	" {38} Elisha returned to Gilgal and there was a famine in that region. While the company of the prophets was meeting with him, he said to his servant,"
2KI	4	38	Elisha	#02		13234	 << Put on the large pot and cook some stew for these men.>>
2KI	4	39	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13235	 {39} One of them went out into the fields to gather herbs and found a wild vine. He gathered some of its gourds and filled the fold of his cloak.
2KI	4	39	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13236	" When he returned, he cut them up into the pot of stew, though no one knew what they were. {40} The stew was poured out for the men, but as they began to eat it, they cried out,"
2KI	4	40	Man	#12		13237	" << O man of God, there is death in the pot!>>"
2KI	4	40	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13238	" And they could not eat it. {41} Elisha said,"
2KI	4	41	Elisha	#02		13239	 << Get some flour.>>
2KI	4	41	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13240	" He put it into the pot and said,"
2KI	4	41	Elisha	#02		13241	 << Serve it to the people to eat.>>
2KI	4	41	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13242	 And there was nothing harmful in the pot.
2KI	4	42	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13243	" {42} A man came from Baal Shalishah, bringing the man of God twenty loaves of barley bread baked from the first ripe grain, along with some heads of new grain. Elisha said,"
2KI	4	42	Elisha	#02		13244	" << Give it to the people to eat,>>"
2KI	4	43	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13245	" {43} His servant asked,"
2KI	4	43	Gehazi	#14		13246	 <<How can I set this before a hundred men?>>
2KI	4	43	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13247	" But Elisha answered,"
2KI	4	43	Elisha	#02		13248	 << Give it to the people to eat. For this is what the Lord says: 'They will eat and have some left over.'>>
2KI	4	44	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13249	" {44} Then he set it before them, and they ate and had some left over, according to the word of the Lord.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
2KI	5	<<	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13250	2 KINGS 5
2KI	5	1	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13251	 {1} Now Naaman was commander of the army of the king of Aram.
2KI	5	1	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13252	" He was a great man in the sight of his master and highly regarded, because through him the Lord had given victory to Aram. He was a valiant soldier, but he had leprosy."
2KI	5	2	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13253	" {2} Now bands from Aram had gone out and had taken captive a young girl from Israel, and she served Naaman's wife. {3} She said to her mistress,"
2KI	5	3	Servant girl	#25		13254	 << If only my master would see the prophet who is in Samaria! He would cure him of his leprosy.>>
2KI	5	4	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13255	" {4} Naaman went to his master and told him what the girl from Israel had said. {5} The King of Aram replied,"
2KI	5	5	King of Aram	#17		13256	" << By all means, go, I will send a letter to the king of Israel."
2KI	5	5	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13257	" So Naaman left, taking with him ten talents of silver, six thousand shekels of gold and ten sets of clothing. {6} The letter that he took to the king of Israel read:"
2KI	5	6	King of Aram	#17		13258	 << With this letter I am sending my servant Naaman to you so that you may cure him of his leprosy.>>
2KI	5	7	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13259	" {7} As soon as the king of Israel read the letter, he tore his robes and said,"
2KI	5	7	King Joram	#09		13260	 << Am I God? Can I kill and bring back to life?
2KI	5	7	King Joram	#09		13261	 Why does this fellow send someone to me to be cured of his leprosy?
2KI	5	7	King Joram	#09		13262	 See how he is trying to pick a quarrel with me!>>
2KI	5	8	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13263	" {8} When Elisha the man of God heard that the king of Israel had torn his robes, he sent him this message:"
2KI	5	8	Elisha	#02		13264	 << Why have you torn your robes? Have the man come to me and he will know that there is a prophet in Israel
2KI	5	9	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13265	" {9} So Naaman went with his horses and chariots and stopped at the door of Elisha's house. {10} Elisha sent a messenger to say to him,"
2KI	5	10	Gehazi	#14		13266	" << Go, wash yourself seven times in the Jordan, and your flesh will be restored and you will be cleansed.>>"
2KI	5	11	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13267	" {11} But Naaman went away angry and said,"
2KI	5	11	Naaman	#07		13268	" << I thought that he would surely come out to me and stand and call on the name of the Lord his God, wave his hand over the spot and cure me of my leprosy."
2KI	5	12	Naaman	#07		13269	" {12} Are not Abana and Pharpar, the rivers of Damascus, better than any of the waters of Israel? Couldn't I wash in them and be cleansed?>>"
2KI	5	12	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13270	" So he turned and went off in a rage. {13} Naaman's servants went to him and said,"
2KI	5	13	Servant	#16		13271	" << My father, if the prophet had told you to do some great thing, would you not have done it?"
2KI	5	13	Servant	#16		13272	" How much more, then, when he tells you, 'Wash and be cleansed'!>>"
2KI	5	14	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13273	" {14} So he went down and dipped himself in the Jordan seven times, as the man of God had told him, and his flesh was restored and became clean like that of a young boy."
2KI	5	15	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13274	" {15} Then Naaman and all his attendants went back to the man of God. He stood before him and said,"

2KI	5	16	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13277	" {16} The prophet answered,"

2KI	5	16	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13279	" And even though Naaman urged him, he refused. {17} Naaman said,"
2KI	5	17	Naaman	#07		13280	" << If you will not, please let me, your servant, be given as much earth as a pair of mules can carry,"

2KI	5	21	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13290	" {21} So Gehazi hurried after Naaman. When Naaman saw him running toward him, he got down from the chariot to meet him. He asked,"

2KI	5	23	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13296	" {23} Naaman said,"

2KI	5	24	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13300	" {24} When Gehazi came to the hill, he took the things from the servants and put them away in the house. He sent the men away and they left."

2KI	7	5	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13396	" {5} At dusk they got up and went to the camp of the Arameans. When they reached the edge of the camp, not a man was there,"

2KI	7	8	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13400	" {8} The men who had leprosy reached the edge of the camp and entered one of the tents. They ate and drank, and carried away silver, gold and clothes, and went off and hid them."

2KI	7	9	Leper #1	#07		13403	" If we wait until daylight, punishment will overtake us. Let's go at once and report this to the royal palace.>>"
2KI	7	10	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13404	" {10} So they went and called out to the city gatekeepers and told them,"

2KI	7	10	Leper #2	#05		13406	" not a sound of anyone--only tethered horses and donkeys, and the tents left just as they were.>>"
2KI	7	11	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13407	" {11} The gatekeepers shouted the news, and it was reported within the palace. {12} The king got up in the night and said to his officers,"

2KI	8	<<	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13428	2 KINGS 8

2KI	8	7	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13439	" {7} Elisha went to Damascus, and Ben-Hadad king of Aram was ill. When the king was told,"

2KI	8	9	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13443	" {9} Hazael went to meet Elisha, taking with him as a gift forty camel-loads of all the finest wares of Damascus. He went in and stood before him, and said,"

2KI	8	10	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13445	" {10} Elisha answered,"
2KI	8	10	Elisha	#02		13446	" << Go and say to him, 'You will certainly recover'; but the Lord has revealed to me that he will in fact die.>>"
2KI	8	11	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13447	" {11} He stared at him with a fixed gaze until Hazael felt ashamed. Then the man of God began to weep. {12} Hazael asked,"
2KI	8	12	Hazael	#13		13448	 << Why is my lord weeping?>>
2KI	8	12	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13449	" He answered,"
2KI	8	12	Elisha	#02		13450	 << Because I know the harm you will do to the Israelites.

2KI	8	13	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13452	" {13} Hazael said,"
2KI	8	13	Hazael	#13		13453	" << How could your servant, a mere dog, accomplish such a feat?>>"

2KI	8	15	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13460	" {15} But the next day he took a thick cloth, soaked it in water and spread it over the king's face, so that he died. Then Hazael succeeded him as king."
2KI	8	16	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13461	" {16} In the fifth year of Joram son of Ahab king of Israel, when Jehoshaphat was king of Judah, Jehoram son of Jehoshaphat began his reign as king of Judah."
2KI	8	17	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13462	" {17} He was thirty-two years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem eight years."
2KI	8	18	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13463	" {18} He walked in the ways of the kings of Israel, as the house of Ahab had done, for he married a daughter of Ahab. He did evil in the eyes of the Lord."
2KI	8	19	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13464	" {19} Nevertheless, for the sake of his servant David, the Lord was not willing to destroy Judah. He had promised to maintain a lamp for David and his descendants forever."
2KI	8	20	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13465	" {20} In the time of Jehoram, Edom rebelled against Judah and set up its own king."
2KI	8	21	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13466	" {21} So Jehoram went to Zair with all his chariots. The Edomites surrounded him and his chariot commanders, but he rose up and broke through by night; his army, however, fled back home."
2KI	8	22	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13467	 {22} To this day Edom has been in rebellion against Judah. Libnah revolted at the same time.
2KI	8	23	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13468	" {23} As for the other events of Jehoram's reign, and all he did, are they not written in the book of the annals of the kings of Judah?"

2KI	8	26	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13471	" {26} Ahaziah was twenty-two years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem one year. His mother's name was Athaliah, a granddaughter of Omri king of Israel."
2KI	8	27	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13472	" {27} He walked in the ways of the house of Ahab and did evil in the eyes of the Lord, as the house of Ahab had done, for he was related by marriage to Ahab's family."

2KI	10	24	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13613	 {24} So they went in to make sacrifices and burnt offerings. Now Jehu had posted eighty men outside with this warning:
2KI	10	24	Jehu	#06		13614	" << If one of you lets any of the men I am placing in your hands escape, it will be your life for his life.>>"
2KI	10	25	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13615	" {25} As soon as Jehu had finished making the burnt offering, he ordered the guards and officers:"
