2KI	10	25	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13617	 So they cut them down with the sword. The guards and officers threw the bodies out and then entered the inner shrine of the temple of Baal.
2KI	10	26	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13618	 {26} They brought the sacred stone out of the temple of Baal and burned it.
2KI	10	27	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13619	" {27} They demolished the sacred stone of Baal and tore down the temple of Baal, and people have used it for a latrine to this day."
2KI	10	28	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13620	 {28} So Jehu destroyed Baal worship in Israel.
2KI	10	29	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13621	" {29} However, he did not turn away from the sins of Jeroboam son of Nebat, which he had caused Israel to commit--the worship of the golden calves at Bethel and Dan."
2KI	10	30	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13622	" {30} The Lord said to Jehu,"
2KI	10	30	God-FX1	#20		13623	" << Because you have done well in accomplishing what is right in my eyes and have done to the house of Ahab all I had in mind to do, your descendants will sit on the throne of Israel to the fourth generation.>>"
2KI	10	31	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13624	" {31} Yet Jehu was not careful to keep the law of the Lord, the God of Israel, with all his heart. He did not turn away from the sins of Jeroboam, which he had caused Israel to commit."
2KI	10	32	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13625	 {32} In those days the Lord began to reduce the size of Israel.
2KI	10	32	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13626	" Hazael overpowered the Israelites throughout their territory {33} east of the Jordan in all the land of Gilead (the region of Gad, Reuben and Manasseh ),"
2KI	10	33	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13627	 from Aroer by the Arnon Gorge through Gilead to Bashan.
2KI	10	34	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13628	" {34} As for the other events of Jehu's reign, all he did, and all his achievements, are they not written in the book of the annals of the kings of Israel?"
2KI	10	35	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13629	 {35} Jehu rested with his fathers and was buried in Samaria. And Jehoahaz his son succeeded him as king.
2KI	10	36	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13630	 {36} The time that Jehu reigned over Israel in Samaria was twenty-eight years.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
2KI	11	<<	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13631	2 KINGS 11
2KI	11	1	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13632	" {1} When Athaliah the mother of Ahaziah saw that her son was dead, she proceeded to destroy the whole royal family."
2KI	11	2	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13633	" {2} But Jehosheba, the daughter of King Jehoram and sister of Ahaziah, took Joash son of Ahaziah and stole him away from among the royal princes, who were about to be murdered."
2KI	11	2	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13634	 She put him and his nurse in a bedroom to hide him from Athaliah; so he was not killed.
2KI	11	3	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13635	 {3} He remained hidden with his nurse at the temple of the Lord for six years while Athaliah ruled the land.
2KI	11	4	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13636	" {4} In the seventh year Jehoiada sent for the commanders of units of a hundred, the Carites and the guards and had them brought to him at the temple of the Lord."
2KI	11	4	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13637	" He made a covenant with them and put them under oath at the temple of the Lord. Then he showed them the king's son. {5} He commanded them, saying,"

2KI	11	6	Priest: Jehoiada	#01		13639	" {6} a third at the Sur Gate, and a third at the gate behind the guard, who take turns guarding the temple--"
2KI	11	7	Priest: Jehoiada	#01		13640	 {7} and you who are in the other two companies that normally go off Sabbath duty are all to guard the temple for the king.
2KI	11	8	Priest: Jehoiada	#01		13641	" {8} Station yourselves around the king, each man with his weapon in his hand."
2KI	11	8	Priest: Jehoiada	#01		13642	 Anyone who approaches your ranks must be put to death. Stay close to the king wherever he goes.>>
2KI	11	9	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13643	 {9} The commanders of units of a hundred did just as Jehoiada the priest ordered.
2KI	11	9	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13644	 Each one took his men--those who were going on duty on the Sabbath and those who were going off duty--and came to Jehoiada the priest.
2KI	11	10	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13645	 {10} Then he gave the commanders the spears and shields that had belonged to King David and that were in the temple of the Lord.
2KI	11	11	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13646	" {11} The guards, each with his weapon in his hand, stationed themselves around the king--near the altar and the temple, from the south side to the north side of the temple."
2KI	11	12	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13647	 {12} Jehoiada brought out the king's son and put the crown on him; he presented him with a copy of the covenant and proclaimed him king.
2KI	11	12	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13648	" They anointed him, and the people clapped their hands and shouted,"
2KI	11	12	Man in Crowd	#16		13649	 << Long live the king!>>
2KI	11	13	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13650	" {13} When Athaliah heard the noise made by the guards and the people, she went to the people at the temple of the Lord."
2KI	11	14	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13651	" {14} She looked and there was the king, standing by the pillar, as the custom was."
2KI	11	14	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13652	" The officers and the trumpeters were beside the king, and all the people of the land were rejoicing and blowing trumpets. Then Athaliah tore her robes and called out,"
2KI	11	14	Athaliah (female)	#24		13653	 <<Treason! Treason!>>
2KI	11	15	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13654	" {15} Jehoiada the priest ordered the commanders of units of a hundred, who were in charge of the troops:"
2KI	11	15	Priest: Jehoiada	#01		13655	 << Bring her out between the ranks and put to the sword anyone who follows her.>>
2KI	11	15	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13656	" For the priest had said,"
2KI	11	15	Priest: Jehoiada	#01		13657	 << She must not be put to death in the temple of the Lord.>>
2KI	11	16	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13658	" {16} So they seized her as she reached the place where the horses enter the palace grounds, and there she was put to death."
2KI	11	17	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13659	 {17} Jehoiada then made a covenant between the Lord and the king and people that they would be the Lord's people. He also made a covenant between the king and the people.
2KI	11	18	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13660	 {18} All the people of the land went to the temple of Baal and tore it down.
2KI	11	18	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13661	 They smashed the altars and idols to pieces and killed Mattan the priest of Baal in front of the altars. Then Jehoiada the priest posted guards at the temple of the Lord.
2KI	11	19	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13662	" {19} He took with him the commanders of hundreds, the Carites, the guards and all the people of the land,"
2KI	11	19	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13663	" and together they brought the king down from the temple of the Lord and went into the palace, entering by way of the gate of the guards."
2KI	11	19	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13664	" The king then took his place on the royal throne. {20} All the people of the land rejoiced. And the city was quiet, because Athaliah had been slain with the sword at the palace."
2KI	11	21	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13665	 {21} Joash was seven years old when he began to reign.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
2KI	12	<<	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13666	2 KINGS 12
2KI	12	1	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13667	" {1} In the seventh year of Jehu, Joash became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem forty years. His mother's name was Zibiah; she was from Beersheba."
2KI	12	2	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13668	 {2} Joash did what was right in the eyes of the Lord all the years Jehoiada the priest instructed him.
2KI	12	3	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13669	" {3} The high places, however, were not removed; the people continued to offer sacrifices and burn incense there. {4} Joash said to the priests,"
2KI	12	4	King Joash	#12		13670	 << Collect all the money that is brought as sacred offerings to the temple of the Lord--
2KI	12	4	King Joash	#12		13671	" the money collected in the census, the money received from personal vows and the money brought voluntarily to the temple."
2KI	12	5	King Joash	#12		13672	" {5} Let every priest receive the money from one of the treasurers, and let it be used to repair whatever damage is found in the temple.>>"
2KI	12	6	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13673	" {6} But by the twenty-third year of King Joash the priests still had not repaired the temple. {7} Therefore King Joash summoned Jehoiada the priest and the other priests and asked them,"
2KI	12	7	King Joash	#12		13674	 << Why aren't you repairing the damage done to the temple?
2KI	12	7	King Joash	#12		13675	" Take no more money from your treasurers, but hand it over for repairing the temple.>>"
2KI	12	8	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13676	 {8} The priests agreed that they would not collect any more money from the people and that they would not repair the temple themselves.
2KI	12	9	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13677	" {9} Jehoiada the priest took a chest and bored a hole in its lid. He placed it beside the altar, on the right side as one enters the temple of the Lord."
2KI	12	9	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13678	 The priests who guarded the entrance put into the chest all the money that was brought to the temple of the Lord.
2KI	12	10	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13679	" {10} Whenever they saw that there was a large amount of money in the chest, the royal secretary and the high priest came, counted the money that had been brought into the temple of the Lord and put it into bags."
2KI	12	11	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13680	" {11} When the amount had been determined, they gave the money to the men appointed to supervise the work on the temple."
2KI	12	11	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13681	" With it they paid those who worked on the temple of the Lord--the carpenters and builders, {12} the masons and stonecutters."
2KI	12	12	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13682	" They purchased timber and dressed stone for the repair of the temple of the Lord, and met all the other expenses of restoring the temple."
2KI	12	13	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13683	" {13} The money brought into the temple was not spent for making silver basins, wick trimmers, sprinkling bowls, trumpets or any other articles of gold or silver for the temple of the Lord;"
2KI	12	14	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13684	" {14} it was paid to the workmen, who used it to repair the temple."
2KI	12	15	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13685	" {15} They did not require an accounting from those to whom they gave the money to pay the workers, because they acted with complete honesty."
2KI	12	16	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13686	 {16} The money from the guilt offerings and sin offerings was not brought into the temple of the Lord; it belonged to the priests.
2KI	12	17	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13687	 {17} About this time Hazael king of Aram went up and attacked Gath and captured it. Then he turned to attack Jerusalem.
2KI	12	18	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13688	 {18} But Joash king of Judah took all the sacred objects dedicated by his fathers--
2KI	12	18	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13689	" Jehoshaphat, Jehoram and Ahaziah, the kings of Judah--"
2KI	12	18	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13690	" and the gifts he himself had dedicated and all the gold found in the treasuries of the temple of the Lord and of the royal palace, and he sent them to Hazael king of Aram, who then withdrew from Jerusalem."
2KI	12	19	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13691	" {19} As for the other events of the reign of Joash, and all he did, are they not written in the book of the annals of the kings of Judah?"
2KI	12	20	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13692	" {20} His officials conspired against him and assassinated him at Beth Millo, on the road down to Silla."
2KI	12	21	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13693	 {21} The officials who murdered him were Jozabad son of Shimeath and Jehozabad son of Shomer.
2KI	12	21	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13694	 He died and was buried with his fathers in the City of David. And Amaziah his son succeeded him as king.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
2KI	13	<<	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13695	2 KINGS 13
2KI	13	1	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13696	" {1} In the twenty-third year of Joash son of Ahaziah king of Judah, Jehoahaz son of Jehu became king of Israel in Samaria, and he reigned seventeen years."
2KI	13	2	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13697	" {2} He did evil in the eyes of the Lord by following the sins of Jeroboam son of Nebat, which he had caused Israel to commit, and he did not turn away from them."
2KI	13	3	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13698	" {3} So the Lord's anger burned against Israel, and for a long time he kept them under the power of Hazael king of Aram and Ben-Hadad his son."
2KI	13	4	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13699	" {4} Then Jehoahaz sought the Lord's favor, and the Lord listened to him, for he saw how severely the king of Aram was oppressing Israel."
2KI	13	5	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13700	" {5} The Lord provided a deliverer for Israel, and they escaped from the power of Aram. So the Israelites lived in their own homes as they had before."
2KI	13	6	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13701	" {6} But they did not turn away from the sins of the house of Jeroboam, which he had caused Israel to commit; they continued in them. Also, the Asherah pole remained standing in Samaria."
2KI	13	7	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13702	" {7} Nothing had been left of the army of Jehoahaz except fifty horsemen, ten chariots and ten thousand foot soldiers, for the king of Aram had destroyed the rest and made them like the dust at threshing time."
2KI	13	8	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13703	" {8} As for the other events of the reign of Jehoahaz, all he did and his achievements, are they not written in the book of the annals of the kings of Israel?"

2KI	13	12	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13707	" {12} As for the other events of the reign of Jehoash, all he did and his achievements, including his war against Amaziah king of Judah, are they not written in the book of the annals of the kings of Israel?"

2KI	13	14	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13709	" {14} Now Elisha was suffering from the illness from which he died. Jehoash king of Israel went down to see him and wept over him. He cried,"
2KI	13	14	King Jehoash	#14		13710	 <<My father! My father! The chariots and horsemen of Israel!>>
2KI	13	15	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13711	" {15} Elisha said,"
2KI	13	15	Elisha (old)	#02		13712	" << Get a bow and some arrows,>>"
2KI	13	16	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13713	" and he did so. {16} He said to the king of Israel,"

2KI	13	16	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13715	" When he had taken it, Elisha put his hands on the king's hands. {17} He said,"

2KI	13	17	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13717	" and he opened it. Elisha said,"

2KI	13	17	Elisha (old)	#02		13720	" << The Lord's arrow of victory, the arrow of victory over Aram! You will completely destroy the Arameans at Aphek."
2KI	13	18	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13721	" {18} Then he said,"
2KI	13	18	Elisha (old)	#02		13722	" << Take the arrows,>>"

2KI	13	18	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13725	 He struck it three times and stopped.
2KI	13	19	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13726	" {19} The man of God was angry with him and said,"
2KI	13	19	Elisha (old)	#02		13727	 << You should have struck the ground five or six times; then you would have defeated Aram and completely destroyed it.
2KI	13	19	Elisha (old)	#02		13728	 But now you will defeat it only three times.>>
2KI	13	20	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13729	 {20} Elisha died and was buried. Now Moabite raiders used to enter the country every spring.
2KI	13	21	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13730	" {21} Once while some Israelites were burying a man, suddenly they saw a band of raiders; so they threw the man's body into Elisha's tomb."
2KI	13	21	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13731	" When the body touched Elisha's bones, the man came to life and stood up on his feet."
2KI	13	22	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13732	 {22} Hazael king of Aram oppressed Israel throughout the reign of Jehoahaz.
2KI	13	23	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13733	" {23} But the Lord was gracious to them and had compassion and showed concern for them because of his covenant with Abraham, Isaac and Jacob."
2KI	13	23	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13734	" To this day he has been unwilling to destroy them or banish them from his presence. {24} Hazael king of Aram died, and Ben-Hadad his son succeeded him as king."
2KI	13	25	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13735	 {25} Then Jehoash son of Jehoahaz recaptured from Ben-Hadad son of Hazael the towns he had taken in battle from his father Jehoahaz.

2KI	14	<<	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13737	2 KINGS 14
2KI	14	1	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13738	" {1} In the second year of Jehoash son of Jehoahaz king of Israel, Amaziah son of Joash king of Judah began to reign."
2KI	14	2	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13739	" {2} He was twenty-five years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem twenty-nine years. His mother's name was Jehoaddin; she was from Jerusalem."
2KI	14	3	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13740	" {3} He did what was right in the eyes of the Lord, but not as his father David had done. In everything he followed the example of his father Joash."
2KI	14	4	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13741	" {4} The high places, however, were not removed; the people continued to offer sacrifices and burn incense there."
2KI	14	5	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13742	" {5} After the kingdom was firmly in his grasp, he executed the officials who had murdered his father the king."
2KI	14	6	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13743	" {6} Yet he did not put the sons of the assassins to death, in accordance with what is written in the Book of the Law of Moses where the Lord commanded:"
2KI	14	6	God-FX1	#20		13744	" << Fathers shall not be put to death for their children, nor children put to death for their fathers; each is to die for his own sins.>>"
2KI	14	7	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13745	" {7} He was the one who defeated ten thousand Edomites in the Valley of Salt and captured Sela in battle, calling it Joktheel, the name it has to this day."
2KI	14	8	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13746	" {8} Then Amaziah sent messengers to Jehoash son of Jehoahaz, the son of Jehu, king of Israel, with the challenge:"
2KI	14	8	King Amaziah	#08		13747	" << Come, meet me face to face.>>"
2KI	14	9	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13748	 {9} But Jehoash king of Israel replied to Amaziah king of Judah:
2KI	14	9	King Jehoash	#14		13749	" << A thistle in Lebanon sent a message to a cedar in Lebanon, 'Give your daughter to my son in marriage.' Then a wild beast in Lebanon came along and trampled the thistle underfoot."
2KI	14	10	King Jehoash	#14		13750	" {10} You have indeed defeated Edom and now you are arrogant. Glory in your victory, but stay at home! Why ask for trouble and cause your own downfall and that of Judah also?>>"
2KI	14	11	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13751	" {11} Amaziah, however, would not listen, so Jehoash king of Israel attacked. He and Amaziah king of Judah faced each other at Beth Shemesh in Judah."
2KI	14	12	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13752	" {12} Judah was routed by Israel, and every man fled to his home."
2KI	14	13	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13753	" {13} Jehoash king of Israel captured Amaziah king of Judah, the son of Joash, the son of Ahaziah, at Beth Shemesh."
2KI	14	13	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13754	 Then Jehoash went to Jerusalem and broke down the wall of Jerusalem from the Ephraim Gate to the Corner Gate--a section about six hundred feet long.
2KI	14	14	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13755	 {14} He took all the gold and silver and all the articles found in the temple of the Lord and in the treasuries of the royal palace. He also took hostages and returned to Samaria.
2KI	14	15	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13756	" {15} As for the other events of the reign of Jehoash, what he did and his achievements, including his war against Amaziah king of Judah, are they not written in the book of the annals of the kings of Israel?"
2KI	14	16	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13757	 {16} Jehoash rested with his fathers and was buried in Samaria with the kings of Israel. And Jeroboam his son succeeded him as king.
2KI	14	17	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13758	 {17} Amaziah son of Joash king of Judah lived for fifteen years after the death of Jehoash son of Jehoahaz king of Israel.
2KI	14	18	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13759	" {18} As for the other events of Amaziah's reign, are they not written in the book of the annals of the kings of Judah?"
2KI	14	19	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13760	" {19} They conspired against him in Jerusalem, and he fled to Lachish, but they sent men after him to Lachish and killed him there."
2KI	14	20	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13761	" {20} He was brought back by horse and was buried in Jerusalem with his fathers, in the City of David."
2KI	14	21	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13762	" {21} Then all the people of Judah took Azariah, who was sixteen years old, and made him king in place of his father Amaziah."
2KI	14	22	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13763	 {22} He was the one who rebuilt Elath and restored it to Judah after Amaziah rested with his fathers.
2KI	14	23	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13764	" {23} In the fifteenth year of Amaziah son of Joash king of Judah, Jeroboam son of Jehoash king of Israel became king in Samaria, and he reigned forty-one years."
2KI	14	24	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13765	" {24} He did evil in the eyes of the Lord and did not turn away from any of the sins of Jeroboam son of Nebat, which he had caused Israel to commit."
2KI	14	25	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13766	" {25} He was the one who restored the boundaries of Israel from Lebo Hamath to the Sea of the Arabah, in accordance with the word of the Lord, the God of Israel,"
2KI	14	25	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13767	" spoken through his servant Jonah son of Amittai, the prophet from Gath Hepher."
2KI	14	26	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13768	" {26} The Lord had seen how bitterly everyone in Israel, whether slave or free, was suffering; there was no one to help them."
2KI	14	27	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13769	" {27} And since the Lord had not said he would blot out the name of Israel from under heaven, he saved them by the hand of Jeroboam son of Jehoash."
2KI	14	28	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13770	" {28} As for the other events of Jeroboam's reign, all he did, and his military achievements, including how he recovered for Israel both Damascus and Hamath, which had belonged to Yaudi,"
2KI	14	28	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13771	 are they not written in the book of the annals of the kings of Israel?
2KI	14	29	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13772	" {29} Jeroboam rested with his fathers, the kings of Israel. And Zechariah his son succeeded him as king.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
2KI	15	<<	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13773	2 KINGS 15
2KI	15	1	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13774	" {1} In the twenty-seventh year of Jeroboam king of Israel, Azariah son of Amaziah king of Judah began to reign."
2KI	15	2	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13775	" {2} He was sixteen years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem fifty-two years. His mother's name was Jecoliah; she was from Jerusalem."
2KI	15	3	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13776	" {3} He did what was right in the eyes of the Lord, just as his father Amaziah had done."
2KI	15	4	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13777	" {4} The high places, however, were not removed; the people continued to offer sacrifices and burn incense there."
2KI	15	5	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13778	" {5} The Lord afflicted the king with leprosy until the day he died, and he lived in a separate house. Jotham the king's son had charge of the palace and governed the people of the land."
2KI	15	6	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13779	" {6} As for the other events of Azariah's reign, and all he did, are they not written in the book of the annals of the kings of Judah?"
2KI	15	7	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13780	 {7} Azariah rested with his fathers and was buried near them in the City of David. And Jotham his son succeeded him as king.
2KI	15	8	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13781	" {8} In the thirty-eighth year of Azariah king of Judah, Zechariah son of Jeroboam became king of Israel in Samaria, and he reigned six months."
2KI	15	9	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13782	" {9} He did evil in the eyes of the Lord, as his fathers had done. He did not turn away from the sins of Jeroboam son of Nebat, which he had caused Israel to commit."
2KI	15	10	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13783	" {10} Shallum son of Jabesh conspired against Zechariah. He attacked him in front of the people, assassinated him and succeeded him as king."
2KI	15	11	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13784	 {11} The other events of Zechariah's reign are written in the book of the annals of the kings of Israel.
2KI	15	12	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13785	 {12} So the word of the Lord spoken to Jehu was fulfilled:
2KI	15	12	God-FX1	#20		13786	 << Your descendants will sit on the throne of Israel to the fourth generation.>>
2KI	15	13	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13787	" à {13} Shallum son of Jabesh became king in the thirty-ninth year of Uzziah king of Judah, and he reigned in Samaria one month."
2KI	15	14	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13788	" {14} Then Menahem son of Gadi went from Tirzah up to Samaria. He attacked Shallum son of Jabesh in Samaria, assassinated him and succeeded him as king."
2KI	15	15	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13789	" {15} The other events of Shallum's reign, and the conspiracy he led, are written in the book of the annals of the kings of Israel."
2KI	15	16	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13790	" {16} At that time Menahem, starting out from Tirzah, attacked Tiphsah and everyone in the city and its vicinity, because they refused to open their gates."
2KI	15	16	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13791	 He sacked Tiphsah and ripped open all the pregnant women.
2KI	15	17	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13792	" {17} In the thirty-ninth year of Azariah king of Judah, Menahem son of Gadi became king of Israel, and he reigned in Samaria ten years."
2KI	15	18	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13793	" {18} He did evil in the eyes of the Lord. During his entire reign he did not turn away from the sins of Jeroboam son of Nebat, which he had caused Israel to commit."
2KI	15	19	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13794	" {19} Then Pul king of Assyria invaded the land, and Menahem gave him a thousand talents of silver to gain his support and strengthen his own hold on the kingdom."
2KI	15	20	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13795	 {20} Menahem exacted this money from Israel. Every wealthy man had to contribute fifty shekels of silver to be given to the king of Assyria.
2KI	15	20	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13796	 So the king of Assyria withdrew and stayed in the land no longer.
2KI	15	21	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13797	" {21} As for the other events of Menahem's reign, and all he did, are they not written in the book of the annals of the kings of Israel?"
2KI	15	22	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13798	 {22} Menahem rested with his fathers. And Pekahiah his son succeeded him as king.
2KI	15	23	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13799	" {23} In the fiftieth year of Azariah king of Judah, Pekahiah son of Menahem became king of Israel in Samaria, and he reigned two years."
2KI	15	24	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13800	" {24} Pekahiah did evil in the eyes of the Lord. He did not turn away from the sins of Jeroboam son of Nebat, which he had caused Israel to commit."
2KI	15	25	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13801	" {25} One of his chief officers, Pekah son of Remaliah, conspired against him."
2KI	15	25	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13802	" Taking fifty men of Gilead with him, he assassinated Pekahiah, along with Argob and Arieh, in the citadel of the royal palace at Samaria."
2KI	15	25	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13803	" So Pekah killed Pekahiah and succeeded him as king. {26} The other events of Pekahiah's reign, and all he did, are written in the book of the annals of the kings of Israel."
2KI	15	27	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13804	" {27} In the fifty-second year of Azariah king of Judah, Pekah son of Remaliah became king of Israel in Samaria, and he reigned twenty years."
2KI	15	28	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13805	" {28} He did evil in the eyes of the Lord. He did not turn away from the sins of Jeroboam son of Nebat, which he had caused Israel to commit."
2KI	15	29	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13806	" {29} In the time of Pekah king of Israel,"
2KI	15	29	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13807	" Tiglath-Pileser king of Assyria came and took Ijon,"
2KI	15	29	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13808	" Abel Beth Maacah, Janoah, Kedesh and Hazor."
2KI	15	29	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13809	" He took Gilead and Galilee, including all the land of Naphtali, and deported the people to Assyria."
2KI	15	30	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13810	 {30} Then Hoshea son of Elah conspired against Pekah son of Remaliah.
2KI	15	30	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13811	" He attacked and assassinated him, and then succeeded him as king in the twentieth year of Jotham son of Uzziah."
2KI	15	31	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13812	" {31} As for the other events of Pekah's reign, and all he did, are they not written in the book of the annals of the kings of Israel?"
2KI	15	32	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13813	" {32} In the second year of Pekah son of Remaliah king of Israel, Jotham son of Uzziah king of Judah began to reign."
2KI	15	33	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13814	" {33} He was twenty-five years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem sixteen years. His mother's name was Jerusha daughter of Zadok."
2KI	15	34	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13815	" {34} He did what was right in the eyes of the Lord, just as his father Uzziah had done."
2KI	15	35	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13816	" {35} The high places, however, were not removed; the people continued to offer sacrifices and burn incense there. Jotham rebuilt the Upper Gate of the temple of the Lord."
2KI	15	36	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13817	" {36} As for the other events of Jotham's reign, and what he did, are they not written in the book of the annals of the kings of Judah?"
2KI	15	37	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13818	 {37} (In those days the Lord began to send Rezin king of Aram and Pekah son of Remaliah against Judah.)
2KI	15	38	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13819	" {38} Jotham rested with his fathers and was buried with them in the City of David, the city of his father. And Ahaz his son succeeded him as king.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
2KI	16	<<	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13820	2 KINGS 16
2KI	16	1	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13821	" {1} In the seventeenth year of Pekah son of Remaliah, Ahaz son of Jotham king of Judah began to reign."
2KI	16	2	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13822	" {2} Ahaz was twenty years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem sixteen years. Unlike David his father, he did not do what was right in the eyes of the Lord his God."
2KI	16	3	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13823	" {3} He walked in the ways of the kings of Israel and even sacrificed his son in the fire, following the detestable ways of the nations the Lord had driven out before the Israelites."
2KI	16	4	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13824	" {4} He offered sacrifices and burned incense at the high places, on the hilltops and under every spreading tree."
2KI	16	5	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13825	" {5} Then Rezin king of Aram and Pekah son of Remaliah king of Israel marched up to fight against Jerusalem and besieged Ahaz, but they could not overpower him."
2KI	16	6	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13826	" {6} At that time, Rezin king of Aram recovered Elath for Aram by driving out the men of Judah. Edomites then moved into Elath and have lived there to this day."
2KI	16	7	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13827	" {7} Ahaz sent messengers to say to Tiglath-Pileser king of Assyria,"
2KI	16	7	King Ahaz	#15		13828	" << I am your servant and vassal. Come up and save me out of the hand of the king of Aram and of the king of Israel, who are attacking me.>>"
2KI	16	8	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13829	 {8} And Ahaz took the silver and gold found in the temple of the Lord and in the treasuries of the royal palace and sent it as a gift to the king of Assyria.
2KI	16	9	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13830	 {9} The king of Assyria complied by attacking Damascus and capturing it. He deported its inhabitants to Kir and put Rezin to death.
2KI	16	10	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13831	 {10} Then King Ahaz went to Damascus to meet Tiglath-Pileser king of Assyria.
2KI	16	10	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13832	" He saw an altar in Damascus and sent to Uriah the priest a sketch of the altar, with detailed plans for its construction."
2KI	16	11	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13833	 {11} So Uriah the priest built an altar in accordance with all the plans that King Ahaz had sent from Damascus and finished it before King Ahaz returned.
2KI	16	12	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13834	" {12} When the king came back from Damascus and saw the altar, he approached it and presented offerings on it."
2KI	16	13	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13835	" {13} He offered up his burnt offering and grain offering, poured out his drink offering, and sprinkled the blood of his fellowship offerings on the altar."
2KI	16	14	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13836	 {14} The bronze altar that stood before the Lord he brought from the front of the temple--from between the new altar and the temple of the Lord--and put it on the north side of the new altar.
2KI	16	15	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13837	 {15} King Ahaz then gave these orders to Uriah the priest:
2KI	16	15	King Ahaz	#15		13838	" << On the large new altar, offer the morning burnt offering and the evening grain offering,"
2KI	16	15	King Ahaz	#15		13839	" the king's burnt offering and his grain offering,"
2KI	16	15	King Ahaz	#15		13840	" and the burnt offering of all the people of the land, and their grain offering and their drink offering."
2KI	16	15	King Ahaz	#15		13841	 Sprinkle on the altar all the blood of the burnt offerings and sacrifices.
2KI	16	15	King Ahaz	#15		13842	 But I will use the bronze altar for seeking guidance.>>
2KI	16	16	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13843	 {16} And Uriah the priest did just as King Ahaz had ordered.
2KI	16	17	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13844	 {17} King Ahaz took away the side panels and removed the basins from the movable stands. He removed the Sea from the bronze bulls that supported it and set it on a stone base.
2KI	16	18	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13845	" {18} He took away the Sabbath canopy that had been built at the temple and removed the royal entryway outside the temple of the Lord, in deference to the king of Assyria."
2KI	16	19	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13846	" {19} As for the other events of the reign of Ahaz, and what he did, are they not written in the book of the annals of the kings of Judah?"
2KI	16	20	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13847	 {20} Ahaz rested with his fathers and was buried with them in the City of David. And Hezekiah his son succeeded him as king.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
2KI	17	<<	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13848	2 KINGS 17
2KI	17	1	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13849	" {1} In the twelfth year of Ahaz king of Judah, Hoshea son of Elah became king of Israel in Samaria, and he reigned nine years."
2KI	17	2	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13850	" {2} He did evil in the eyes of the Lord, but not like the kings of Israel who preceded him."
2KI	17	3	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13851	" {3} Shalmaneser king of Assyria came up to attack Hoshea, who had been Shalmaneser's vassal and had paid him tribute."
2KI	17	4	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13852	" {4} But the king of Assyria discovered that Hoshea was a traitor,"
2KI	17	4	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13853	" for he had sent envoys to So, king of Egypt, and he no longer paid tribute to the king of Assyria, as he had done year by year."
2KI	17	4	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13854	 Therefore Shalmaneser seized him and put him in prison.
2KI	17	5	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13855	" {5} The king of Assyria invaded the entire land, marched against Samaria and laid siege to it for three years."
2KI	17	6	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13856	" {6} In the ninth year of Hoshea, the king of Assyria captured Samaria and deported the Israelites to Assyria."
2KI	17	6	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13857	" He settled them in Halah, in Gozan on the Habor River and in the towns of the Medes."
2KI	17	7	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13858	" {7} All this took place because the Israelites had sinned against the Lord their God, who had brought them up out of Egypt from under the power of Pharaoh king of Egypt."
2KI	17	7	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13859	" They worshiped other gods {8} and followed the practices of the nations the Lord had driven out before them, as well as the practices that the kings of Israel had introduced."
2KI	17	9	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13860	 {9} The Israelites secretly did things against the Lord their God that were not right. From watchtower to fortified city they built themselves high places in all their towns.
2KI	17	10	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13861	 {10} They set up sacred stones and Asherah poles on every high hill and under every spreading tree.
2KI	17	11	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13862	" {11} At every high place they burned incense, as the nations whom the Lord had driven out before them had done. They did wicked things that provoked the Lord to anger."
2KI	17	12	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13863	" {12} They worshiped idols, though the Lord had said,"
2KI	17	12	God-FX1	#20		13864	 << You shall not do this.>>
2KI	17	13	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13865	 {13} The Lord warned Israel and Judah through all his prophets and seers:
2KI	17	13	Prophet	#01		13866	 << Turn from your evil ways.
2KI	17	13	Prophet	#01		13867	" Observe my commands and decrees, in accordance with the entire Law that I commanded your fathers to obey and that I delivered to you through my servants the prophets.>>"
2KI	17	14	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13868	" {14} But they would not listen and were as stiff-necked as their fathers, who did not trust in the Lord their God."
2KI	17	15	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13869	 {15} They rejected his decrees and the covenant he had made with their fathers and the warnings he had given them.
2KI	17	15	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13870	 They followed worthless idols and themselves became worthless.
2KI	17	15	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13871	" They imitated the nations around them although the Lord had ordered them, << Do not do as they do,>> and they did the things the Lord had forbidden them to do."
2KI	17	16	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13872	" {16} They forsook all the commands of the Lord their God and made for themselves two idols cast in the shape of calves, and an Asherah pole."
2KI	17	16	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13873	" They bowed down to all the starry hosts, and they worshiped Baal."
2KI	17	17	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13874	" {17} They sacrificed their sons and daughters in the fire. They practiced divination and sorcery and sold themselves to do evil in the eyes of the Lord, provoking him to anger."
2KI	17	18	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13875	 {18} So the Lord was very angry with Israel and removed them from his presence.
2KI	17	18	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13876	" Only the tribe of Judah was left, {19} and even Judah did not keep the commands of the Lord their God. They followed the practices Israel had introduced."
2KI	17	20	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13877	" {20} Therefore the Lord rejected all the people of Israel; he afflicted them and gave them into the hands of plunderers, until he thrust them from his presence."
2KI	17	21	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13878	" {21} When he tore Israel away from the house of David, they made Jeroboam son of Nebat their king."
2KI	17	21	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13879	 Jeroboam enticed Israel away from following the Lord and caused them to commit a great sin.
2KI	17	22	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13880	" {22} The Israelites persisted in all the sins of Jeroboam and did not turn away from them {23} until the Lord removed them from his presence, as he had warned through all his servants the prophets."
2KI	17	23	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13881	" So the people of Israel were taken from their homeland into exile in Assyria, and they are still there."
2KI	17	24	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13882	" {24} The king of Assyria brought people from Babylon, Cuthah, Avva,"
2KI	17	24	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13883	 Hamath and Sepharvaim and settled them in the towns of Samaria to replace the Israelites. They took over Samaria and lived in its towns.
2KI	17	25	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13884	" {25} When they first lived there, they did not worship the Lord; so he sent lions among them and they killed some of the people. {26} It was reported to the king of Assyria:"
2KI	17	26	Man	#16		13885	 << The people you deported and resettled in the towns of Samaria do not know what the god of that country requires.
2KI	17	26	Man	#16		13886	" He has sent lions among them, which are killing them off, because the people do not know what he requires.>> {27} Then the king of Assyria gave this order:"
2KI	17	27	King of Assyria	#17		13887	 << Have one of the priests you took captive from Samaria go back to live there and teach the people what the god of the land requires.>>
2KI	17	28	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13888	 {28} So one of the priests who had been exiled from Samaria came to live in Bethel and taught them how to worship the Lord.
2KI	17	29	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13889	" {29} Nevertheless, each national group made its own gods in the several towns where they settled, and set them up in the shrines the people of Samaria had made at the high places."
2KI	17	30	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13890	" {30} The men from Babylon made Succoth Benoth, the men from Cuthah made Nergal, and the men from Hamath made Ashima;"
2KI	17	31	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13891	" {31} the Avvites made Nibhaz and Tartak, and the Sepharvites burned their children in the fire as sacrifices to Adrammelech and Anammelech, the gods of Sepharvaim."
2KI	17	32	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13892	" {32} They worshiped the Lord, but they also appointed all sorts of their own people to officiate for them as priests in the shrines at the high places."
2KI	17	33	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13893	" {33} They worshiped the Lord, but they also served their own gods in accordance with the customs of the nations from which they had been brought."
2KI	17	34	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13894	 {34} To this day they persist in their former practices.
2KI	17	34	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13895	" They neither worship the Lord nor adhere to the decrees and ordinances, the laws and commands that the Lord gave the descendants of Jacob, whom he named Israel."
2KI	17	35	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13896	" {35} When the Lord made a covenant with the Israelites, he commanded them:"
2KI	17	35	God-FX1	#20		13897	" << Do not worship any other gods or bow down to them, serve them or sacrifice to them."
2KI	17	36	God-FX1	#20		13898	" {36} But the Lord, who brought you up out of Egypt with mighty power and outstretched arm, is the one you must worship. To him you shall bow down and to him offer sacrifices."
2KI	17	37	God-FX1	#20		13899	" {37} You must always be careful to keep the decrees and ordinances, the laws and commands he wrote for you. Do not worship other gods."
2KI	17	38	God-FX1	#20		13900	" {38} Do not forget the covenant I have made with you, and do not worship other gods."
2KI	17	39	God-FX1	#20		13901	" {39} Rather, worship the Lord your God; it is he who will deliver you from the hand of all your enemies.>>"
2KI	17	40	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13902	" {40} They would not listen, however, but persisted in their former practices."
2KI	17	41	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13903	" {41} Even while these people were worshiping the Lord, they were serving their idols."
2KI	17	41	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13904	 To this day their children and grandchildren continue to do as their fathers did.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
2KI	18	<<	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13905	2 KINGS 18
2KI	18	1	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13906	" {1} In the third year of Hoshea son of Elah king of Israel, Hezekiah son of Ahaz king of Judah began to reign."
2KI	18	2	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13907	" {2} He was twenty-five years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem twenty-nine years. His mother's name was Abijah daughter of Zechariah."
2KI	18	3	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13908	" {3} He did what was right in the eyes of the Lord, just as his father David had done. {4} He removed the high places, smashed the sacred stones and cut down the Asherah poles."
2KI	18	4	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13909	" He broke into pieces the bronze snake Moses had made, for up to that time the Israelites had been burning incense to it."
2KI	18	4	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13910	 (It was called Nehushtan.)
2KI	18	5	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13911	" {5} Hezekiah trusted in the Lord, the God of Israel. There was no one like him among all the kings of Judah, either before him or after him."
2KI	18	6	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13912	 {6} He held fast to the Lord and did not cease to follow him; he kept the commands the Lord had given Moses.
2KI	18	7	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13913	 {7} And the Lord was with him; he was successful in whatever he undertook. He rebelled against the king of Assyria and did not serve him.
2KI	18	8	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13914	" {8} From watchtower to fortified city, he defeated the Philistines, as far as Gaza and its territory."
2KI	18	9	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13915	" {9} In King Hezekiah's fourth year, which was the seventh year of Hoshea son of Elah king of Israel, Shalmaneser king of Assyria marched against Samaria and laid siege to it."
2KI	18	10	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13916	" {10} At the end of three years the Assyrians took it. So Samaria was captured in Hezekiah's sixth year, which was the ninth year of Hoshea king of Israel."
2KI	18	11	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13917	" {11} The king of Assyria deported Israel to Assyria and settled them in Halah, in Gozan on the Habor River and in towns of the Medes."
2KI	18	12	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13918	" {12} This happened because they had not obeyed the Lord their God, but had violated his covenant--all that Moses the servant of the Lord commanded."
2KI	18	12	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13919	 They neither listened to the commands nor carried them out.
2KI	18	13	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13920	" {13} In the fourteenth year of King Hezekiah's reign, Sennacherib king of Assyria attacked all the fortified cities of Judah and captured them."
2KI	18	14	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13921	 {14} So Hezekiah king of Judah sent this message to the king of Assyria at Lachish:
2KI	18	14	King Hezekiah	#10		13922	" << I have done wrong. Withdraw from me, and I will pay whatever you demand of me.>>"
2KI	18	14	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13923	 The king of Assyria exacted from Hezekiah king of Judah three hundred talents of silver and thirty talents of gold.
2KI	18	15	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13924	 {15} So Hezekiah gave him all the silver that was found in the temple of the Lord and in the treasuries of the royal palace.
2KI	18	16	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13925	" {16} At this time Hezekiah king of Judah stripped off the gold with which he had covered the doors and doorposts of the temple of the Lord, and gave it to the king of Assyria."
2KI	18	17	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13926	" {17} The king of Assyria sent his supreme commander, his chief officer and his field commander with a large army, from Lachish to King Hezekiah at Jerusalem."
2KI	18	17	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13927	" They came up to Jerusalem and stopped at the aqueduct of the Upper Pool, on the road to the Washerman's Field."
2KI	18	18	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13928	" {18} They called for the king; and Eliakim son of Hilkiah the palace administrator, Shebna the secretary, and Joah son of Asaph the recorder went out to them."
2KI	18	19	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13929	" {19} The field commander said to them,"
2KI	18	19	Commander	#13		13930	" << Tell Hezekiah: << 'This is what the great king, the king of Assyria, says:"
2KI	18	19	Commander	#13		13931	 On what are you basing this confidence of yours?
2KI	18	20	Commander	#13		13932	 {20} You say you have strategy and military strength--but you speak only empty words.
2KI	18	20	Commander	#13		13933	" On whom are you depending, that you rebel against me?"
2KI	18	21	Commander	#13		13934	" {21} Look now, you are depending on Egypt, that splintered reed of a staff, which pierces a man's hand and wounds him if he leans on it!"
2KI	18	21	Commander	#13		13935	 Such is Pharaoh king of Egypt to all who depend on him.
2KI	18	22	Commander	#13		13936	" {22} And if you say to me, << We are depending on the Lord our God>> --"
2KI	18	22	Commander	#13		13937	" isn't he the one whose high places and altars Hezekiah removed, saying to Judah and Jerusalem, << You must worship before this altar in Jerusalem >>?"
2KI	18	23	Commander	#13		13938	" {23} << 'Come now, make a bargain with my master, the king of Assyria:"
2KI	18	23	Commander	#13		13939	 I will give you two thousand horses--if you can put riders on them!
2KI	18	24	Commander	#13		13940	" {24} How can you repulse one officer of the least of my master's officials, even though you are depending on Egypt for chariots and horsemen?"
2KI	18	25	Commander	#13		13941	" {25} Furthermore, have I come to attack and destroy this place without word from the Lord?"
2KI	18	25	Commander	#13		13942	 The Lord himself told me to march against this country and destroy it.'>>
2KI	18	26	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13943	" {26} Then Eliakim son of Hilkiah, and Shebna and Joah said to the field commander,"
2KI	18	26	Shebna the secretary	#04		13944	" << Please speak to your servants in Aramaic, since we understand it."
2KI	18	26	Shebna the secretary	#04		13945	 Don't speak to us in Hebrew in the hearing of the people on the wall.>>
2KI	18	27	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13946	" {27} But the commander replied,"
2KI	18	27	Commander	#13		13947	" << Was it only to your master and you that my master sent me to say these things, and not to the men sitting on the wall--who, like you, will have to eat their own filth and drink their own urine?>>"
2KI	18	28	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13948	 {28} Then the commander stood and called out in Hebrew:
2KI	18	28	Commander	#13		13949	" << Hear the word of the great king, the king of Assyria!"
2KI	18	29	Commander	#13		13950	 {29} This is what the king says: Do not let Hezekiah deceive you. He cannot deliver you from my hand.
2KI	18	30	Commander	#13		13951	" {30} Do not let Hezekiah persuade you to trust in the Lord when he says, 'The Lord will surely deliver us; this city will not be given into the hand of the king of Assyria.'"
2KI	18	31	Commander	#13		13952	 {31} << Do not listen to Hezekiah. This is what the king of Assyria says: Make peace with me and come out to me.
2KI	18	31	Commander	#13		13953	" Then every one of you will eat from his own vine and fig tree and drink water from his own cistern,"
2KI	18	32	Commander	#13		13954	" {32} until I come and take you to a land like your own, a land of grain and new wine, a land of bread and vineyards, a land of olive trees and honey."
2KI	18	32	Commander	#13		13955	" Choose life and not death! << Do not listen to Hezekiah, for he is misleading you when he says, 'The Lord will deliver us.'"
2KI	18	33	Commander	#13		13956	 {33} Has the god of any nation ever delivered his land from the hand of the king of Assyria?
2KI	18	34	Commander	#13		13957	 {34} Where are the gods of Hamath and Arpad?
2KI	18	34	Commander	#13		13958	" Where are the gods of Sepharvaim, Hena and Ivvah? Have they rescued Samaria from my hand?"
2KI	18	35	Commander	#13		13959	 {35} Who of all the gods of these countries has been able to save his land from me? How then can the Lord deliver Jerusalem from my hand?>>
2KI	18	36	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13960	" {36} But the people remained silent and said nothing in reply, because the king had commanded,"
2KI	18	36	King Hezekiah	#10		13961	 << Do not answer him.>>
2KI	18	37	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13962	" {37} Then Eliakim son of Hilkiah the palace administrator, Shebna the secretary and Joah son of Asaph the recorder went to Hezekiah, with their clothes torn, and told him what the field commander had said.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
2KI	19	<<	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13963	2 KINGS 19
2KI	19	1	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13964	" {1} When King Hezekiah heard this, he tore his clothes and put on sackcloth and went into the temple of the Lord."
2KI	19	2	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13965	" {2} He sent Eliakim the palace administrator, Shebna the secretary and the leading priests, all wearing sackcloth, to the prophet Isaiah son of Amoz. {3} They told him,"
2KI	19	3	Shebna the secretary	#04		13966	" << This is what Hezekiah says: This day is a day of distress and rebuke and disgrace, as when children come to the point of birth and there is no strength to deliver them."

2KI	19	4	Shebna the secretary	#04		13969	 Therefore pray for the remnant that still survives.>>
2KI	19	5	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13970	" {5} When King Hezekiah's officials came to Isaiah, {6} Isaiah said to them,"
2KI	19	6	Isaiah	#01		13971	" << Tell your master, 'This is what the Lord says:"
2KI	19	6	Isaiah	#01		13972	 Do not be afraid of what you have heard--those words with which the underlings of the king of Assyria have blasphemed me.
2KI	19	7	Isaiah	#01		13973	" {7} Listen! I am going to put such a spirit in him that when he hears a certain report, he will return to his own country, and there I will have him cut down with the sword.'<<"
2KI	19	8	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13974	" {8} When the field commander heard that the king of Assyria had left Lachish, he withdrew and found the king fighting against Libnah."
2KI	19	9	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13975	" {9} Now Sennacherib received a report, saying:"
2KI	19	9	Messenger	#03		13976	" << Tirhakah, the Cushite king of Egypt, is marching out to fight against you.>>"
2KI	19	9	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13977	 So he again sent messengers to Hezekiah with this word:
2KI	19	10	Commander	#13		13978	" {10} << Say to Hezekiah king of Judah: Do not let the god you depend on deceive you when he says, 'Jerusalem will not be handed over to the king of Assyria.'"
2KI	19	11	Commander	#13		13979	" {11} Surely you have heard what the kings of Assyria have done to all the countries, destroying them completely. And will you be delivered?"
2KI	19	12	Commander	#13		13980	 {12} Did the gods of the nations that were destroyed by my forefathers deliver them:
2KI	19	12	Commander	#13		13981	" the gods of Gozan, Haran, Rezeph and the people of Eden who were in Tel Assar?"
2KI	19	13	Commander	#13		13982	" {13} Where is the king of Hamath, the king of Arpad, the king of the city of Sepharvaim, or of Hena or Ivvah?>>"
2KI	19	14	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13983	 {14} Hezekiah received the letter from the messengers and read it. Then he went up to the temple of the Lord and spread it out before the Lord. {15} And Hezekiah prayed to the Lord:
2KI	19	15	King Hezekiah	#10		13984	" << O Lord, God of Israel, enthroned between the cherubim, you alone are God over all the kingdoms of the earth."
2KI	19	15	King Hezekiah	#10		13985	 You have made heaven and earth.
2KI	19	16	King Hezekiah	#10		13986	" {16} Give ear, O Lord, and hear; open your eyes, O Lord, and see; listen to the words Sennacherib has sent to insult the living God."
2KI	19	17	King Hezekiah	#10		13987	" {17} << It is true, O Lord, that the Assyrian kings have laid waste these nations and their lands."
2KI	19	18	King Hezekiah	#10		13988	" {18} They have thrown their gods into the fire and destroyed them, for they were not gods but only wood and stone, fashioned by men's hands."
2KI	19	19	King Hezekiah	#10		13989	" {19} Now, O Lord our God, deliver us from his hand, so that all kingdoms on earth may know that you alone, O Lord, are God.>>"
2KI	19	20	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		13990	 {20} Then Isaiah son of Amoz sent a message to Hezekiah:
2KI	19	20	Isaiah	#01		13991	" << This is what the Lord, the God of Israel, says: I have heard your prayer concerning Sennacherib king of Assyria."
2KI	19	21	Isaiah	#01		13992	 {21} This is the word that the Lord has spoken against him:
2KI	19	21	Isaiah	#01		13993	 << 'The Virgin Daughter of Zion despises you and mocks you. The Daughter of Jerusalem tosses her head as you flee.
2KI	19	22	Isaiah	#01		13994	 {22} Who is it you have insulted and blasphemed?
2KI	19	22	Isaiah	#01		13995	 Against whom have you raised your voice and lifted your eyes in pride? Against the Holy One of Israel!
2KI	19	23	Isaiah	#01		13996	 {23} By your messengers you have heaped insults on the Lord.
2KI	19	23	Isaiah	#01		13997	" And you have said, << With my many chariots I have ascended the heights of the mountains, the utmost heights of Lebanon."
2KI	19	23	Isaiah	#01		13998	" I have cut down its tallest cedars, the choicest of its pines."
2KI	19	23	Isaiah	#01		13999	" I have reached its remotest parts, the finest of its forests."
2KI	19	24	Isaiah	#01		14000	 {24} I have dug wells in foreign lands and drunk the water there.
2KI	19	24	Isaiah	#01		14001	 With the soles of my feet I have dried up all the streams of Egypt.>>
2KI	19	25	Isaiah	#01		14002	 {25} << 'Have you not heard? Long ago I ordained it.
2KI	19	25	Isaiah	#01		14003	" In days of old I planned it; now I have brought it to pass, that you have turned fortified cities into piles of stone."
2KI	19	26	Isaiah	#01		14004	" {26} Their people, drained of power, are dismayed and put to shame."
2KI	19	26	Isaiah	#01		14005	" They are like plants in the field, like tender green shoots, like grass sprouting on the roof, scorched before it grows up."
2KI	19	27	Isaiah	#01		14006	 {27} << 'But I know where you stay and when you come and go and how you rage against me.
2KI	19	28	Isaiah	#01		14007	" {28} Because you rage against me and your insolence has reached my ears, I will put my hook in your nose and my bit in your mouth, and I will make you return by the way you came.'"
2KI	19	29	Isaiah	#01		14008	" {29} << This will be the sign for you, O Hezekiah: << This year you will eat what grows by itself, and the second year what springs from that."
2KI	19	29	Isaiah	#01		14009	" But in the third year sow and reap, plant vineyards and eat their fruit."
2KI	19	30	Isaiah	#01		14010	 {30} Once more a remnant of the house of Judah will take root below and bear fruit above.
2KI	19	31	Isaiah	#01		14011	" {31} For out of Jerusalem will come a remnant, and out of Mount Zion a band of survivors. The zeal of the Lord Almighty will accomplish this."
2KI	19	32	Isaiah	#01		14012	 {32} << Therefore this is what the Lord says concerning the king of Assyria:
2KI	19	32	Isaiah	#01		14013	 << He will not enter this city or shoot an arrow here. He will not come before it with shield or build a siege ramp against it.
2KI	19	33	Isaiah	#01		14014	" {33} By the way that he came he will return; he will not enter this city, declares the Lord."
2KI	19	34	Isaiah	#01		14015	" {34} I will defend this city and save it, for my sake and for the sake of David my servant.>>"
2KI	19	35	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14016	 {35} That night the angel of the Lord went out and put to death a hundred and eighty-five thousand men in the Assyrian camp.
2KI	19	35	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14017	 When the people got up the next morning--there were all the dead bodies!
2KI	19	36	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14018	 {36} So Sennacherib king of Assyria broke camp and withdrew. He returned to Nineveh and stayed there.
2KI	19	37	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14019	" {37} One day, while he was worshiping in the temple of his god Nisroch,"
2KI	19	37	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14020	" his sons Adrammelech and Sharezer cut him down with the sword,"
2KI	19	37	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14021	 and they escaped to the land of Ararat. And Esarhaddon his son succeeded him as king.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
2KI	20	<<	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14022	2 KINGS 20

2KI	20	11	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14042	" {11} Then the prophet Isaiah called upon the Lord, and the Lord made the shadow go back the ten steps it had gone down on the stairway of Ahaz."
2KI	20	12	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14043	" {12} At that time Merodach-Baladan son of Baladan king of Babylon sent Hezekiah letters and a gift, because he had heard of Hezekiah's illness."
2KI	20	13	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14044	" {13} Hezekiah received the messengers and showed them all that was in his storehouses--the silver, the gold, the spices and the fine oil--his armory and everything found among his treasures."
2KI	20	13	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14045	" There was nothing in his palace or in all his kingdom that Hezekiah did not show them. {14} Then Isaiah the prophet went to King Hezekiah and asked,"

2KI	20	14	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14047	" Hezekiah replied,"
2KI	20	14	King Hezekiah	#10		14048	 << From a distant land. They came from Babylon.>>
2KI	20	15	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14049	" {15} The prophet asked,"

2KI	20	15	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14051	" Hezekiah said,"
2KI	20	15	King Hezekiah	#10		14052	 << They saw everything in my palace. There is nothing among my treasures that I did not show them.>>
2KI	20	16	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14053	" {16} Then Isaiah said to Hezekiah,"

2KI	20	18	Isaiah	#01		14056	" {18} And some of your descendants, your own flesh and blood, that will be born to you, will be taken away, and they will become eunuchs in the palace of the king of Babylon.>>"
2KI	20	19	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14057	" {19} Hezekiah replied,"

2KI	20	19	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14059	" He said,"
2KI	20	19	King Hezekiah	#10		14060	 Will there not be peace and security in my lifetime?>>
2KI	20	20	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14061	" {20} As for the other events of Hezekiah's reign, all his achievements and how he made the pool and the tunnel by which he brought water into the city,"

2KI	20	21	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14063	 {21} Hezekiah rested with his fathers. And Manasseh his son succeeded him as king.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
2KI	21	<<	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14064	2 KINGS 21
2KI	21	1	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14065	" {1} Manasseh was twelve years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem fifty-five years. His mother's name was Hephzibah."
2KI	21	2	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14066	" {2} He did evil in the eyes of the Lord, following the detestable practices of the nations the Lord had driven out before the Israelites."
2KI	21	3	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14067	" {3} He rebuilt the high places his father Hezekiah had destroyed; he also erected altars to Baal and made an Asherah pole, as Ahab king of Israel had done."
2KI	21	3	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14068	" He bowed down to all the starry hosts and worshiped them. {4} He built altars in the temple of the Lord, of which the Lord had said,"
2KI	21	4	God-FX1	#20		14069	 << In Jerusalem I will put my Name.>>
2KI	21	5	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14070	" {5} In both courts of the temple of the Lord, he built altars to all the starry hosts."
2KI	21	6	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14071	" {6} He sacrificed his own son in the fire, practiced sorcery and divination, and consulted mediums and spiritists. He did much evil in the eyes of the Lord, provoking him to anger."
2KI	21	7	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14072	" {7} He took the carved Asherah pole he had made and put it in the temple, of which the Lord had said to David and to his son Solomon,"
2KI	21	7	God-FX1	#20		14073	" << In this temple and in Jerusalem, which I have chosen out of all the tribes of Israel, I will put my Name forever."
2KI	21	8	God-FX1	#20		14074	" {8} I will not again make the feet of the Israelites wander from the land I gave their forefathers, if only they will be careful to do everything I commanded them and will keep the whole Law that my servant Moses gave them.>>"
2KI	21	9	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14075	" {9} But the people did not listen. Manasseh led them astray, so that they did more evil than the nations the Lord had destroyed before the Israelites."
2KI	21	10	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14076	 {10} The Lord said through his servants the prophets:
2KI	21	11	Prophet	#15		14077	 {11} << Manasseh king of Judah has committed these detestable sins.
2KI	21	11	Prophet	#15		14078	 He has done more evil than the Amorites who preceded him and has led Judah into sin with his idols.
2KI	21	12	Prophet	#15		14079	" {12} Therefore this is what the Lord, the God of Israel, says:"
2KI	21	12	Prophet	#15		14080	 I am going to bring such disaster on Jerusalem and Judah that the ears of everyone who hears of it will tingle.
2KI	21	13	Prophet	#15		14081	 {13} I will stretch out over Jerusalem the measuring line used against Samaria and the plumb line used against the house of Ahab.
2KI	21	13	Prophet	#15		14082	" I will wipe out Jerusalem as one wipes a dish, wiping it and turning it upside down."
2KI	21	14	Prophet	#15		14083	 {14} I will forsake the remnant of my inheritance and hand them over to their enemies.
2KI	21	14	Prophet	#15		14084	" They will be looted and plundered by all their foes, {15} because they have done evil in my eyes and have provoked me to anger from the day their forefathers came out of Egypt until this day.>>"
2KI	21	16	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14085	" {16} Moreover, Manasseh also shed so much innocent blood that he filled Jerusalem from end to end--besides the sin that he had caused Judah to commit, so that they did evil in the eyes of the Lord."
2KI	21	17	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14086	" {17} As for the other events of Manasseh's reign, and all he did, including the sin he committed, are they not written in the book of the annals of the kings of Judah?"
2KI	21	18	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14087	" {18} Manasseh rested with his fathers and was buried in his palace garden, the garden of Uzza. And Amon his son succeeded him as king."
2KI	21	19	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14088	" {19} Amon was twenty-two years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem two years."
2KI	21	19	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14089	 His mother's name was Meshullemeth daughter of Haruz; she was from Jotbah.
2KI	21	20	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14090	" {20} He did evil in the eyes of the Lord, as his father Manasseh had done."
2KI	21	21	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14091	" {21} He walked in all the ways of his father; he worshiped the idols his father had worshiped, and bowed down to them."
2KI	21	22	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14092	" {22} He forsook the Lord, the God of his fathers, and did not walk in the way of the Lord."
2KI	21	23	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14093	 {23} Amon's officials conspired against him and assassinated the king in his palace.
2KI	21	24	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14094	" {24} Then the people of the land killed all who had plotted against King Amon, and they made Josiah his son king in his place."
2KI	21	25	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14095	" {25} As for the other events of Amon's reign, and what he did, are they not written in the book of the annals of the kings of Judah?"
2KI	21	26	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14096	 {26} He was buried in his grave in the garden of Uzza. And Josiah his son succeeded him as king.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
2KI	22	<<	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14097	2 KINGS 22
2KI	22	1	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14098	" {1} Josiah was eight years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem thirty-one years."
2KI	22	1	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14099	 His mother's name was Jedidah daughter of Adaiah; she was from Bozkath.
2KI	22	2	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14100	" {2} He did what was right in the eyes of the Lord and walked in all the ways of his father David, not turning aside to the right or to the left."
2KI	22	3	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14101	" {3} In the eighteenth year of his reign, King Josiah sent the secretary, Shaphan son of Azaliah, the son of Meshullam, to the temple of the Lord. He said:"
2KI	22	4	King Josiah	#09		14102	" {4} << Go up to Hilkiah the high priest and have him get ready the money that has been brought into the temple of the Lord, which the doorkeepers have collected from the people."

2KI	22	8	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14107	" {8} Hilkiah the high priest said to Shaphan the secretary,"

2KI	22	10	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14111	" {10} Then Shaphan the secretary informed the king,"

2KI	22	10	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14113	" And Shaphan read from it in the presence of the king. {11} When the king heard the words of the Book of the Law, he tore his robes."
2KI	22	12	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14114	" {12} He gave these orders to Hilkiah the priest, Ahikam son of Shaphan, Acbor son of Micaiah, Shaphan the secretary and Asaiah the king's attendant:"

2KI	22	13	King Josiah	#09		14116	 Great is the Lord's anger that burns against us because our fathers have not obeyed the words of this book;
2KI	22	13	King Josiah	#09		14117	 they have not acted in accordance with all that is written there concerning us.>>
2KI	22	14	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14118	" {14} Hilkiah the priest, Ahikam, Acbor, Shaphan and Asaiah went to speak to the prophetess Huldah,"

2KI	22	15	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14121	" {15} She said to them,"

2KI	22	16	Prophetess: Huldah (female)	#22		14124	" I am going to bring disaster on this place and its people, according to everything written in the book the king of Judah has read."
2KI	22	17	Prophetess: Huldah (female)	#22		14125	" {17} Because they have forsaken me and burned incense to other gods and provoked me to anger by all the idols their hands have made, my anger will burn against this place and will not be quenched.'"
2KI	22	18	Prophetess: Huldah (female)	#22		14126	" {18} Tell the king of Judah, who sent you to inquire of the Lord, 'This is what the Lord, the God of Israel, says concerning the words you heard:"
2KI	22	19	Prophetess: Huldah (female)	#22		14127	" {19} Because your heart was responsive and you humbled yourself before the Lord when you heard what I have spoken against this place and its people, that they would become accursed and laid waste,"
2KI	22	19	Prophetess: Huldah (female)	#22		14128	" and because you tore your robes and wept in my presence, I have heard you, declares the Lord."
2KI	22	20	Prophetess: Huldah (female)	#22		14129	" {20} Therefore I will gather you to your fathers, and you will be buried in peace. Your eyes will not see all the disaster I am going to bring on this place.'<<"
2KI	22	20	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14130	 So they took her answer back to the king.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
2KI	23	<<	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14131	2 KINGS 23
2KI	23	1	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14132	 {1} Then the king called together all the elders of Judah and Jerusalem.
2KI	23	2	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14133	" {2} He went up to the temple of the Lord with the men of Judah, the people of Jerusalem, the priests and the prophets--all the people from the least to the greatest."
2KI	23	2	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14134	" He read in their hearing all the words of the Book of the Covenant, which had been found in the temple of the Lord."
2KI	23	3	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14135	 {3} The king stood by the pillar and renewed the covenant in the presence of the Lord--
2KI	23	3	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14136	" to follow the Lord and keep his commands, regulations and decrees with all his heart and all his soul, thus confirming the words of the covenant written in this book."
2KI	23	3	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14137	 Then all the people pledged themselves to the covenant.
2KI	23	4	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14138	" {4} The king ordered Hilkiah the high priest, the priests next in rank and the doorkeepers to remove from the temple of the Lord all the articles made for Baal and Asherah and all the starry hosts."
2KI	23	4	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14139	 He burned them outside Jerusalem in the fields of the Kidron Valley and took the ashes to Bethel.
2KI	23	5	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14140	 {5} He did away with the pagan priests appointed by the kings of Judah to burn incense on the high places of the towns of Judah and on those around Jerusalem --
2KI	23	5	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14141	" those who burned incense to Baal, to the sun and moon, to the constellations and to all the starry hosts."
2KI	23	6	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14142	 {6} He took the Asherah pole from the temple of the Lord to the Kidron Valley outside Jerusalem and burned it there.
2KI	23	6	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14143	 He ground it to powder and scattered the dust over the graves of the common people.
2KI	23	7	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14144	" {7} He also tore down the quarters of the male shrine prostitutes, which were in the temple of the Lord and where women did weaving for Asherah."
2KI	23	8	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14145	" {8} Josiah brought all the priests from the towns of Judah and desecrated the high places, from Geba to Beersheba, where the priests had burned incense."
2KI	23	8	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14146	" He broke down the shrines at the gates--at the entrance to the Gate of Joshua, the city governor, which is on the left of the city gate."
2KI	23	9	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14147	" {9} Although the priests of the high places did not serve at the altar of the Lord in Jerusalem, they ate unleavened bread with their fellow priests."
2KI	23	10	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14148	" {10} He desecrated Topheth, which was in the Valley of Ben Hinnom, so no one could use it to sacrifice his son or daughter in the fire to Molech."
2KI	23	11	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14149	 {11} He removed from the entrance to the temple of the Lord the horses that the kings of Judah had dedicated to the sun.
2KI	23	11	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14150	 They were in the court near the room of an official named Nathan-Melech. Josiah then burned the chariots dedicated to the sun.
2KI	23	12	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14151	" {12} He pulled down the altars the kings of Judah had erected on the roof near the upper room of Ahaz, and the altars Manasseh had built in the two courts of the temple of the Lord."
2KI	23	12	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14152	" He removed them from there, smashed them to pieces and threw the rubble into the Kidron Valley."
2KI	23	13	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14153	 {13} The king also desecrated the high places that were east of Jerusalem on the south of the Hill of Corruption--
2KI	23	13	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14154	" the ones Solomon king of Israel had built for Ashtoreth the vile goddess of the Sidonians, for Chemosh the vile god of Moab, and for Molech the detestable god of the people of Ammon."
2KI	23	14	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14155	 {14} Josiah smashed the sacred stones and cut down the Asherah poles and covered the sites with human bones.
2KI	23	15	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14156	" {15} Even the altar at Bethel, the high place made by Jeroboam son of Nebat, who had caused Israel to sin--even that altar and high place he demolished."
2KI	23	15	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14157	" He burned the high place and ground it to powder, and burned the Asherah pole also."
2KI	23	16	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14158	" {16} Then Josiah looked around, and when he saw the tombs that were there on the hillside, he had the bones removed from them and burned on the altar to defile it,"
2KI	23	16	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14159	 in accordance with the word of the Lord proclaimed by the man of God who foretold these things.
2KI	23	17	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14160	" {17} The king asked,"
2KI	23	17	King Josiah	#09		14161	 << What is that tombstone I see?>>
2KI	23	17	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14162	" The men of the city said,"
2KI	23	17	Man	#04		14163	 << It marks the tomb of the man of God who came from Judah and pronounced against the altar of Bethel the very things you have done to it.>>
2KI	23	18	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14164	" {18} He said,"
2KI	23	18	King Josiah	#09		14165	 << Leave it alone. Don't let anyone disturb his bones.>>
2KI	23	18	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14166	 So they spared his bones and those of the prophet who had come from Samaria.
2KI	23	19	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14167	" {19} Just as he had done at Bethel, Josiah removed and defiled all the shrines at the high places that the kings of Israel had built in the towns of Samaria that had provoked the Lord to anger."
2KI	23	20	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14168	 {20} Josiah slaughtered all the priests of those high places on the altars and burned human bones on them. Then he went back to Jerusalem.
2KI	23	21	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14169	 {21} The king gave this order to all the people:
2KI	23	21	King Josiah	#09		14170	" << Celebrate the Passover to the Lord your God, as it is written in this Book of the Covenant.>>"
2KI	23	22	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14171	" {22} Not since the days of the judges who led Israel, nor throughout the days of the kings of Israel and the kings of Judah, had any such Passover been observed."
2KI	23	23	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14172	" {23} But in the eighteenth year of King Josiah, this Passover was celebrated to the Lord in Jerusalem."
2KI	23	24	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14173	" {24} Furthermore, Josiah got rid of the mediums and spiritists, the household gods, the idols and all the other detestable things seen in Judah and Jerusalem."
2KI	23	24	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14174	 This he did to fulfill the requirements of the law written in the book that Hilkiah the priest had discovered in the temple of the Lord.
2KI	23	25	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14175	" {25} Neither before nor after Josiah was there a king like him who turned to the Lord as he did--with all his heart and with all his soul and with all his strength, in accordance with all the Law of Moses."
2KI	23	26	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14176	" {26} Nevertheless, the Lord did not turn away from the heat of his fierce anger, which burned against Judah because of all that Manasseh had done to provoke him to anger."
2KI	23	27	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14177	" {27} So the Lord said,"
2KI	23	27	God-FX1	#20		14178	" << I will remove Judah also from my presence as I removed Israel, and I will reject Jerusalem, the city I chose, and this temple, about which I said, 'There shall my Name be.'>>"
2KI	23	28	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14179	" {28} As for the other events of Josiah's reign, and all he did, are they not written in the book of the annals of the kings of Judah?"
2KI	23	29	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14180	" {29} While Josiah was king, Pharaoh Neco king of Egypt went up to the Euphrates River to help the king of Assyria."
2KI	23	29	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14181	" King Josiah marched out to meet him in battle, but Neco faced him and killed him at Megiddo."
2KI	23	30	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14182	 {30} Josiah's servants brought his body in a chariot from Megiddo to Jerusalem and buried him in his own tomb.
2KI	23	30	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14183	 And the people of the land took Jehoahaz son of Josiah and anointed him and made him king in place of his father.
2KI	23	31	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14184	" {31} Jehoahaz was twenty-three years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem three months."
2KI	23	31	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14185	 His mother's name was Hamutal daughter of Jeremiah; she was from Libnah.
2KI	23	32	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14186	" {32} He did evil in the eyes of the Lord, just as his fathers had done."
2KI	23	33	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14187	" {33} Pharaoh Neco put him in chains at Riblah in the land of Hamath so that he might not reign in Jerusalem, and he imposed on Judah a levy of a hundred talents of silver and a talent of gold."
2KI	23	34	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14188	 {34} Pharaoh Neco made Eliakim son of Josiah king in place of his father Josiah and changed Eliakim's name to Jehoiakim.
2KI	23	34	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14189	" But he took Jehoahaz and carried him off to Egypt, and there he died."
2KI	23	35	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14190	 {35} Jehoiakim paid Pharaoh Neco the silver and gold he demanded.
2KI	23	35	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14191	" In order to do so, he taxed the land and exacted the silver and gold from the people of the land according to their assessments."
2KI	23	36	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14192	" {36} Jehoiakim was twenty-five years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem eleven years."
2KI	23	36	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14193	 His mother's name was Zebidah daughter of Pedaiah; she was from Rumah.
2KI	23	37	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14194	" {37} And he did evil in the eyes of the Lord, just as his fathers had done.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
2KI	24	<<	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14195	2 KINGS 24
2KI	24	1	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14196	" {1} During Jehoiakim's reign, Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon invaded the land, and Jehoiakim became his vassal for three years."
