2KI	24	2	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14198	" {2} The Lord sent Babylonian, Aramean, Moabite and Ammonite raiders against him."
2KI	24	2	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14199	" He sent them to destroy Judah, in accordance with the word of the Lord proclaimed by his servants the prophets."
2KI	24	3	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14200	" {3} Surely these things happened to Judah according to the Lord's command, in order to remove them from his presence because of the sins of Manasseh and all he had done,"
2KI	24	4	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14201	" {4} including the shedding of innocent blood. For he had filled Jerusalem with innocent blood, and the Lord was not willing to forgive."
2KI	24	5	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14202	" {5} As for the other events of Jehoiakim's reign, and all he did, are they not written in the book of the annals of the kings of Judah?"

2KI	24	7	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14204	" {7} The king of Egypt did not march out from his own country again, because the king of Babylon had taken all his territory, from the Wadi of Egypt to the Euphrates River."
2KI	24	8	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14205	" {8} Jehoiachin was eighteen years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem three months. His mother's name was Nehushta daughter of Elnathan; she was from Jerusalem."
2KI	24	9	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14206	" {9} He did evil in the eyes of the Lord, just as his father had done."
2KI	24	10	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14207	" {10} At that time the officers of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon advanced on Jerusalem and laid siege to it, {11} and Nebuchadnezzar himself came up to the city while his officers were besieging it."
2KI	24	12	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14208	" {12} Jehoiachin king of Judah, his mother, his attendants, his nobles and his officials all surrendered to him."
2KI	24	12	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14209	" In the eighth year of the reign of the king of Babylon, he took Jehoiachin prisoner."
2KI	24	13	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14210	" {13} As the Lord had declared, Nebuchadnezzar removed all the treasures from the temple of the Lord and from the royal palace,"
2KI	24	13	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14211	 and took away all the gold articles that Solomon king of Israel had made for the temple of the Lord.
2KI	24	14	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14212	" {14} He carried into exile all Jerusalem: all the officers and fighting men, and all the craftsmen and artisans--a total of ten thousand. Only the poorest people of the land were left."
2KI	24	15	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14213	" {15} Nebuchadnezzar took Jehoiachin captive to Babylon. He also took from Jerusalem to Babylon the king's mother, his wives, his officials and the leading men of the land."
2KI	24	16	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14214	" {16} The king of Babylon also deported to Babylon the entire force of seven thousand fighting men, strong and fit for war, and a thousand craftsmen and artisans."
2KI	24	17	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14215	" {17} He made Mattaniah, Jehoiachin's uncle, king in his place and changed his name to Zedekiah."
2KI	24	18	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14216	" {18} Zedekiah was twenty-one years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem eleven years. His mother's name was Hamutal daughter of Jeremiah; she was from Libnah."
2KI	24	19	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14217	" {19} He did evil in the eyes of the Lord, just as Jehoiakim had done."
2KI	24	20	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14218	" {20} It was because of the Lord's anger that all this happened to Jerusalem and Judah, and in the end he thrust them from his presence."
2KI	24	20	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14219	 Now Zedekiah rebelled against the king of Babylon.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
2KI	25	<<	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14220	2 KINGS 25
2KI	25	1	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14221	" {1} So in the ninth year of Zedekiah's reign, on the tenth day of the tenth month, Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon marched against Jerusalem with his whole army."
2KI	25	1	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14222	 He encamped outside the city and built siege works all around it. {2} The city was kept under siege until the eleventh year of King Zedekiah.
2KI	25	3	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14223	 {3} By the ninth day of the fourth month the famine in the city had become so severe that there was no food for the people to eat.
2KI	25	4	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14224	" {4} Then the city wall was broken through, and the whole army fled at night through the gate between the two walls near the king's garden, though the Babylonians were surrounding the city."
2KI	25	4	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14225	" They fled toward the Arabah, {5} but the Babylonian army pursued the king and overtook him in the plains of Jericho."
2KI	25	5	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14226	" All his soldiers were separated from him and scattered, {6} and he was captured. He was taken to the king of Babylon at Riblah, where sentence was pronounced on him."
2KI	25	7	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14227	" {7} They killed the sons of Zedekiah before his eyes. Then they put out his eyes, bound him with bronze shackles and took him to Babylon."
2KI	25	8	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14228	" {8} On the seventh day of the fifth month, in the nineteenth year of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, Nebuzaradan commander of the imperial guard, an official of the king of Babylon, came to Jerusalem."
2KI	25	9	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14229	" {9} He set fire to the temple of the Lord, the royal palace and all the houses of Jerusalem. Every important building he burned down."
2KI	25	10	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14230	" {10} The whole Babylonian army, under the commander of the imperial guard, broke down the walls around Jerusalem."
2KI	25	11	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14231	" {11} Nebuzaradan the commander of the guard carried into exile the people who remained in the city, along with the rest of the populace and those who had gone over to the king of Babylon."
2KI	25	12	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14232	 {12} But the commander left behind some of the poorest people of the land to work the vineyards and fields.
2KI	25	13	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14233	" {13} The Babylonians broke up the bronze pillars, the movable stands and the bronze Sea that were at the temple of the Lord and they carried the bronze to Babylon."
2KI	25	14	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14234	" {14} They also took away the pots, shovels, wick trimmers, dishes and all the bronze articles used in the temple service."
2KI	25	15	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14235	 {15} The commander of the imperial guard took away the censers and sprinkling bowls--all that were made of pure gold or silver.
2KI	25	16	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14236	" {16} The bronze from the two pillars, the Sea and the movable stands, which Solomon had made for the temple of the Lord, was more than could be weighed."
2KI	25	17	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14237	 {17} Each pillar was twenty-seven feet high. The bronze capital on top of one pillar was four and a half feet high and was decorated with a network and pomegranates of bronze all around.
2KI	25	17	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14238	" The other pillar, with its network, was similar."
2KI	25	18	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14239	" {18} The commander of the guard took as prisoners Seraiah the chief priest, Zephaniah the priest next in rank and the three doorkeepers."
2KI	25	19	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14240	" {19} Of those still in the city, he took the officer in charge of the fighting men and five royal advisers."
2KI	25	19	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14241	 He also took the secretary who was chief officer in charge of conscripting the people of the land and sixty of his men who were found in the city.
2KI	25	20	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14242	 {20} Nebuzaradan the commander took them all and brought them to the king of Babylon at Riblah.
2KI	25	21	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14243	" {21} There at Riblah, in the land of Hamath, the king had them executed. So Judah went into captivity, away from her land."
2KI	25	22	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14244	" {22} Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon appointed Gedaliah son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan, to be over the people he had left behind in Judah."
2KI	25	23	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14245	" {23} When all the army officers and their men heard that the king of Babylon had appointed Gedaliah as governor, they came to Gedaliah at Mizpah, namely--"
2KI	25	23	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14246	" Ishmael son of Nethaniah, Johanan son of Kareah, Seraiah son of Tanhumeth the Netophathite, Jaazaniah the son of the Maacathite, and their men."
2KI	25	24	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14247	" {24} Gedaliah took an oath to reassure them and their men. He said,"
2KI	25	24	Gedaliah	#02		14248	" << Do not be afraid of the Babylonian officials. Settle down in the land and serve the king of Babylon, and it will go well with you.>>"
2KI	25	25	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14249	" {25} In the seventh month, however, Ishmael son of Nethaniah, the son of Elishama, who was of royal blood, came with ten men and assassinated Gedaliah and also the men of Judah and the Babylonians who were with him at Mizpah."
2KI	25	26	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14250	" {26} At this, all the people from the least to the greatest, together with the army officers, fled to Egypt for fear of the Babylonians."
2KI	25	27	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14251	" {27} In the thirty-seventh year of the exile of Jehoiachin king of Judah, in the year Evil-Merodach became king of Babylon, he released Jehoiachin from prison on the twenty-seventh day of the twelfth month."
2KI	25	28	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14252	 {28} He spoke kindly to him and gave him a seat of honor higher than those of the other kings who were with him in Babylon.
2KI	25	29	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14253	 {29} So Jehoiachin put aside his prison clothes and for the rest of his life ate regularly at the king's table.
2KI	25	30	Narr_12: 2_Kings	#11		14254	 {30} Day by day the king gave Jehoiachin a regular allowance as long as he lived. *~**~*||||| + 5 SECs |||||*~*
1CH	1	<<	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14255	1 CHRONICLES*~*1 CHRONICLES 1
1CH	1	1	Geneology	#01		14256	" {1} Adam, Seth, Enosh, {2} Kenan, Mahalalel, Jared,"
1CH	1	3	Geneology	#01		14257	" {3} Enoch, Methuselah, Lamech, Noah."

1CH	1	7	Geneology	#01		14261	" {7} The sons of Javan: Elishah, Tarshish, the Kittim and the Rodanim."
1CH	1	8	Geneology	#01		14262	" {8} The sons of Ham: Cush, Mizraim, Put and Canaan."
1CH	1	9	Geneology	#01		14263	" {9} The sons of Cush: Seba, Havilah, Sabta, Raamah and Sabteca."
1CH	1	9	Geneology	#01		14264	 The sons of Raamah: Sheba and Dedan.
1CH	1	10	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14265	" {10} Cush was the father of Nimrod, who grew to be a mighty warrior on earth."
1CH	1	11	Geneology	#01		14266	" {11} Mizraim was the father of the Ludites, Anamites, Lehabites, Naphtuhites,"
1CH	1	12	Geneology	#01		14267	" {12} Pathrusites, Casluhites (from whom the Philistines came) and Caphtorites."
1CH	1	13	Geneology	#01		14268	" {13} Canaan was the father of Sidon his firstborn, and of the Hittites,"
1CH	1	14	Geneology	#01		14269	" {14} Jebusites, Amorites, Girgashites, {15} Hivites, Arkites, Sinites,"
1CH	1	16	Geneology	#01		14270	" {16} Arvadites, Zemarites and Hamathites."
1CH	1	17	Geneology	#01		14271	" {17} The sons of Shem: Elam, Asshur, Arphaxad, Lud and Aram."
1CH	1	17	Geneology	#01		14272	" The sons of Aram: Uz, Hul, Gether and Meshech."
1CH	1	18	Geneology	#01		14273	" {18} Arphaxad was the father of Shelah, and Shelah the father of Eber."
1CH	1	19	Geneology	#01		14274	" {19} Two sons were born to Eber: One was named Peleg, because in his time the earth was divided; his brother was named Joktan."
1CH	1	20	Geneology	#01		14275	" {20} Joktan was the father of Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, Jerah,"
1CH	1	21	Geneology	#01		14276	" {21} Hadoram, Uzal, Diklah, {22} Obal, Abimael, Sheba,"
1CH	1	23	Geneology	#01		14277	" {23} Ophir, Havilah and Jobab. All these were sons of Joktan."
1CH	1	24	Geneology	#01		14278	" {24} Shem, Arphaxad, Shelah, {25} Eber, Peleg, Reu,"
1CH	1	26	Geneology	#01		14279	" {26} Serug, Nahor, Terah {27} and Abram (that is, Abraham)."
1CH	1	28	Geneology	#01		14280	 {28} The sons of Abraham: Isaac and Ishmael.
1CH	1	29	Geneology	#01		14281	" {29} These were their descendants: Nebaioth the firstborn of Ishmael, Kedar, Adbeel, Mibsam,"
1CH	1	30	Geneology	#01		14282	" {30} Mishma, Dumah, Massa, Hadad, Tema,"
1CH	1	31	Geneology	#01		14283	" {31} Jetur, Naphish and Kedemah. These were the sons of Ishmael."
1CH	1	32	Geneology	#01		14284	" {32} The sons born to Keturah, Abraham's concubine: Zimran, Jokshan, Medan, Midian, Ishbak and Shuah."
1CH	1	32	Geneology	#01		14285	 The sons of Jokshan: Sheba and Dedan.
1CH	1	33	Geneology	#01		14286	" {33} The sons of Midian: Ephah, Epher, Hanoch, Abida and Eldaah. All these were descendants of Keturah."
1CH	1	34	Geneology	#01		14287	 {34} Abraham was the father of Isaac. The sons of Isaac: Esau and Israel.
1CH	1	35	Geneology	#01		14288	" {35} The sons of Esau: Eliphaz, Reuel, Jeush, Jalam and Korah."
1CH	1	36	Geneology	#01		14289	" {36} The sons of Eliphaz: Teman, Omar, Zepho, Gatam and Kenaz; by Timna: Amalek."

1CH	1	40	Geneology	#01		14294	 The sons of Zibeon: Aiah and Anah.
1CH	1	41	Geneology	#01		14295	" {41} The son of Anah: Dishon. The sons of Dishon: Hemdan, Eshban, Ithran and Keran."
1CH	1	42	Geneology	#01		14296	" {42} The sons of Ezer: Bilhan, Zaavan and Akan."
1CH	1	42	Geneology	#01		14297	 The sons of Dishan: Uz and Aran.
1CH	1	43	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14298	" {43} These were the kings who reigned in Edom before any Israelite king reigned: Bela son of Beor, whose city was named Dinhabah."
1CH	1	44	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14299	" {44} When Bela died, Jobab son of Zerah from Bozrah succeeded him as king."
1CH	1	45	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14300	" {45} When Jobab died, Husham from the land of the Temanites succeeded him as king."
1CH	1	46	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14301	" {46} When Husham died, Hadad son of Bedad, who defeated Midian in the country of Moab, succeeded him as king. His city was named Avith."
1CH	1	47	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14302	" {47} When Hadad died, Samlah from Masrekah succeeded him as king."
1CH	1	48	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14303	" {48} When Samlah died, Shaul from Rehoboth on the river succeeded him as king."
1CH	1	49	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14304	" {49} When Shaul died, Baal-Hanan son of Acbor succeeded him as king."
1CH	1	50	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14305	" {50} When Baal-Hanan died, Hadad succeeded him as king."
1CH	1	50	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14306	" His city was named Pau, and his wife's name was Mehetabel daughter of Matred, the daughter of Me-Zahab."
1CH	1	51	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14307	" {51} Hadad also died. The chiefs of Edom were: Timna, Alvah, Jetheth,"

1CH	2	1	Geneology	#01		14312	" {1} These were the sons of Israel: Reuben, Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, Zebulun,"
1CH	2	2	Geneology	#01		14313	" {2} Dan, Joseph, Benjamin, Naphtali, Gad and Asher."
1CH	2	3	Geneology	#01		14314	" {3} The sons of Judah: Er, Onan and Shelah. These three were born to him by a Canaanite woman, the daughter of Shua."
1CH	2	3	Geneology	#01		14315	" Er, Judah's firstborn, was wicked in the Lord's sight; so the Lord put him to death."
1CH	2	4	Geneology	#01		14316	" {4} Tamar, Judah's daughter-in-law, bore him Perez and Zerah. Judah had five sons in all."
1CH	2	5	Geneology	#01		14317	 {5} The sons of Perez: Hezron and Hamul.
1CH	2	6	Geneology	#01		14318	" {6} The sons of Zerah: Zimri, Ethan, Heman, Calcol and Darda --five in all."
1CH	2	7	Geneology	#01		14319	" {7} The son of Carmi: Achar, who brought trouble on Israel by violating the ban on taking devoted things."
1CH	2	8	Geneology	#01		14320	 {8} The son of Ethan: Azariah.
1CH	2	9	Geneology	#01		14321	" {9} The sons born to Hezron were: Jerahmeel, Ram and Caleb."
1CH	2	10	Geneology	#01		14322	" {10} Ram was the father of Amminadab, and Amminadab the father of Nahshon, the leader of the people of Judah."
1CH	2	11	Geneology	#01		14323	" {11} Nahshon was the father of Salmon, Salmon the father of Boaz,"
1CH	2	12	Geneology	#01		14324	 {12} Boaz the father of Obed and Obed the father of Jesse.
1CH	2	13	Geneology	#01		14325	" {13} Jesse was the father of Eliab his firstborn; the second son was Abinadab, the third Shimea,"
1CH	2	14	Geneology	#01		14326	" {14} the fourth Nethanel, the fifth Raddai, {15} the sixth Ozem and the seventh David."
1CH	2	16	Geneology	#01		14327	" {16} Their sisters were Zeruiah and Abigail. Zeruiah's three sons were Abishai, Joab and Asahel."
1CH	2	17	Geneology	#01		14328	" {17} Abigail was the mother of Amasa, whose father was Jether the Ishmaelite."
1CH	2	18	Geneology	#01		14329	" {18} Caleb son of Hezron had children by his wife Azubah (and by Jerioth ). These were her sons: Jesher, Shobab and Ardon."
1CH	2	19	Geneology	#01		14330	" {19} When Azubah died, Caleb married Ephrath, who bore him Hur."
1CH	2	20	Geneology	#01		14331	" {20} Hur was the father of Uri, and Uri the father of Bezalel."
1CH	2	21	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14332	" {21} Later, Hezron lay with the daughter of Makir the father of Gilead (he had married her when he was sixty years old), and she bore him Segub."
1CH	2	22	Geneology	#01		14333	" {22} Segub was the father of Jair, who controlled twenty-three towns in Gilead."
1CH	2	23	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14334	" {23} (But Geshur and Aram captured Havvoth Jair, as well as Kenath with its surrounding settlements--sixty towns.)"
1CH	2	23	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14335	 All these were descendants of Makir the father of Gilead.
1CH	2	24	Geneology	#01		14336	" {24} After Hezron died in Caleb Ephrathah, Abijah the wife of Hezron bore him Ashhur the father of Tekoa."
1CH	2	25	Geneology	#01		14337	" {25} The sons of Jerahmeel the firstborn of Hezron: Ram his firstborn, Bunah, Oren, Ozem and Ahijah."
1CH	2	26	Geneology	#01		14338	" {26} Jerahmeel had another wife, whose name was Atarah; she was the mother of Onam."
1CH	2	27	Geneology	#01		14339	" {27} The sons of Ram the firstborn of Jerahmeel: Maaz, Jamin and Eker."
1CH	2	28	Geneology	#01		14340	 {28} The sons of Onam: Shammai and Jada. The sons of Shammai: Nadab and Abishur.
1CH	2	29	Geneology	#01		14341	" {29} Abishur's wife was named Abihail, who bore him Ahban and Molid."
1CH	2	30	Geneology	#01		14342	 {30} The sons of Nadab: Seled and Appaim. Seled died without children.
1CH	2	31	Geneology	#01		14343	" {31} The son of Appaim: Ishi, who was the father of Sheshan. Sheshan was the father of Ahlai."
1CH	2	32	Geneology	#01		14344	" {32} The sons of Jada, Shammai's brother: Jether and Jonathan. Jether died without children."
1CH	2	33	Geneology	#01		14345	 {33} The sons of Jonathan: Peleth and Zaza. These were the descendants of Jerahmeel.
1CH	2	34	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14346	 {34} Sheshan had no sons--only daughters. He had an Egyptian servant named Jarha.
1CH	2	35	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14347	" {35} Sheshan gave his daughter in marriage to his servant Jarha, and she bore him Attai."
1CH	2	36	Geneology	#01		14348	" {36} Attai was the father of Nathan, Nathan the father of Zabad,"
1CH	2	37	Geneology	#01		14349	" {37} Zabad the father of Ephlal, Ephlal the father of Obed,"
1CH	2	38	Geneology	#01		14350	" {38} Obed the father of Jehu, Jehu the father of Azariah,"
1CH	2	39	Geneology	#01		14351	" {39} Azariah the father of Helez, Helez the father of Eleasah,"
1CH	2	40	Geneology	#01		14352	" {40} Eleasah the father of Sismai, Sismai the father of Shallum,"
1CH	2	41	Geneology	#01		14353	" {41} Shallum the father of Jekamiah, and Jekamiah the father of Elishama."
1CH	2	42	Geneology	#01		14354	" {42} The sons of Caleb the brother of Jerahmeel: Mesha his firstborn, who was the father of Ziph, and his son Mareshah, who was the father of Hebron."

1CH	2	45	Geneology	#01		14357	" {45} The son of Shammai was Maon, and Maon was the father of Beth Zur."
1CH	2	46	Geneology	#01		14358	" {46} Caleb's concubine Ephah was the mother of Haran, Moza and Gazez. Haran was the father of Gazez."
1CH	2	47	Geneology	#01		14359	" {47} The sons of Jahdai: Regem, Jotham, Geshan, Pelet, Ephah and Shaaph."
1CH	2	48	Geneology	#01		14360	 {48} Caleb's concubine Maacah was the mother of Sheber and Tirhanah.
1CH	2	49	Geneology	#01		14361	 {49} She also gave birth to Shaaph the father of Madmannah and to Sheva the father of Macbenah and Gibea. Caleb's daughter was Acsah.
1CH	2	50	Geneology	#01		14362	" {50} These were the descendants of Caleb. The sons of Hur the firstborn of Ephrathah: Shobal the father of Kiriath Jearim,"
1CH	2	51	Geneology	#01		14363	" {51} Salma the father of Bethlehem, and Hareph the father of Beth Gader."
1CH	2	52	Geneology	#01		14364	" {52} The descendants of Shobal the father of Kiriath Jearim were: Haroeh, half the Manahathites,"
1CH	2	53	Geneology	#01		14365	" {53} and the clans of Kiriath Jearim: the Ithrites, Puthites, Shumathites and Mishraites."
1CH	2	53	Geneology	#01		14366	 From these descended the Zorathites and Eshtaolites.
1CH	2	54	Geneology	#01		14367	" {54} The descendants of Salma: Bethlehem, the Netophathites, Atroth Beth Joab, half the Manahathites, the Zorites,"
1CH	2	55	Geneology	#01		14368	" {55} and the clans of scribes who lived at Jabez: the Tirathites, Shimeathites and Sucathites."
1CH	2	55	Geneology	#01		14369	" These are the Kenites who came from Hammath, the father of the house of Recab.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"

1CH	4	<<	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14399	1 CHRONICLES 4
1CH	4	1	Geneology	#01		14400	" {1} The descendants of Judah: Perez, Hezron, Carmi, Hur and Shobal."
1CH	4	2	Geneology	#01		14401	" {2} Reaiah son of Shobal was the father of Jahath, and Jahath the father of Ahumai and Lahad. These were the clans of the Zorathites."
1CH	4	3	Geneology	#01		14402	" {3} These were the sons of Etam: Jezreel, Ishma and Idbash. Their sister was named Hazzelelponi."
1CH	4	4	Geneology	#01		14403	" {4} Penuel was the father of Gedor, and Ezer the father of Hushah."
1CH	4	4	Geneology	#01		14404	" These were the descendants of Hur, the firstborn of Ephrathah and father of Bethlehem."
1CH	4	5	Geneology	#01		14405	" {5} Ashhur the father of Tekoa had two wives, Helah and Naarah."
1CH	4	6	Geneology	#01		14406	" {6} Naarah bore him Ahuzzam, Hepher, Temeni and Haahashtari. These were the descendants of Naarah."
1CH	4	7	Geneology	#01		14407	" {7} The sons of Helah: Zereth, Zohar, Ethnan,"
1CH	4	8	Geneology	#01		14408	" {8} and Koz, who was the father of Anub and Hazzobebah and of the clans of Aharhel son of Harum."
1CH	4	9	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14409	" {9} Jabez was more honorable than his brothers. His mother had named him Jabez, saying,"
1CH	4	9	Mother of Jabez	#22		14410	 << I gave birth to him in pain.>>
1CH	4	10	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14411	" {10} Jabez cried out to the God of Israel,"
1CH	4	10	Jabez	#03		14412	" << Oh, that you would bless me and enlarge my territory! Let your hand be with me, and keep me from harm so that I will be free from pain.>>"
1CH	4	10	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14413	 And God granted his request.
1CH	4	11	Geneology	#01		14414	" {11} Kelub, Shuhah's brother, was the father of Mehir, who was the father of Eshton."
1CH	4	12	Geneology	#01		14415	" {12} Eshton was the father of Beth Rapha, Paseah and Tehinnah the father of Ir Nahash. These were the men of Recah."
1CH	4	13	Geneology	#01		14416	 {13} The sons of Kenaz: Othniel and Seraiah. The sons of Othniel: Hathath and Meonothai.
1CH	4	14	Geneology	#01		14417	" {14} Meonothai was the father of Ophrah. Seraiah was the father of Joab, the father of Ge Harashim. It was called this because its people were craftsmen."
1CH	4	15	Geneology	#01		14418	" {15} The sons of Caleb son of Jephunneh: Iru, Elah and Naam. The son of Elah: Kenaz."
1CH	4	16	Geneology	#01		14419	" {16} The sons of Jehallelel: Ziph, Ziphah, Tiria and Asarel."
1CH	4	17	Geneology	#01		14420	" {17} The sons of Ezrah: Jether, Mered, Epher and Jalon."
1CH	4	17	Geneology	#01		14421	" One of Mered's wives gave birth to Miriam, Shammai and Ishbah the father father of Eshtemoa."
1CH	4	18	Geneology	#01		14422	" {18} (His Judean wife gave birth to Jered the father of Gedor, Heber the father of Soco, and Jekuthiel the father of Zanoah.)"
1CH	4	18	Geneology	#01		14423	" These were the children of Pharaoh's daughter Bithiah, whom Mered had married."
1CH	4	19	Geneology	#01		14424	" {19} The sons of Hodiah's wife, the sister of Naham: the father of Keilah the Garmite, and Eshtemoa the Maacathite."
1CH	4	20	Geneology	#01		14425	" {20} The sons of Shimon: Amnon, Rinnah, Ben-Hanan and Tilon."
1CH	4	20	Geneology	#01		14426	 The descendants of Ishi: Zoheth and Ben-Zoheth.
1CH	4	21	Geneology	#01		14427	" {21} The sons of Shelah son of Judah: Er the father of Lecah, Laadah the father of Mareshah and the clans of the linen workers at Beth Ashbea,"
1CH	4	22	Geneology	#01		14428	" {22} Jokim, the men of Cozeba, and Joash and Saraph, who ruled in Moab and Jashubi Lehem."
1CH	4	22	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14429	 (These records are from ancient times.)
1CH	4	23	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14430	 {23} They were the potters who lived at Netaim and Gederah; they stayed there and worked for the king.
1CH	4	24	Geneology	#01		14431	" {24} The descendants of Simeon: Nemuel, Jamin, Jarib, Zerah and Shaul;"
1CH	4	25	Geneology	#01		14432	" {25} Shallum was Shaul's son, Mibsam his son and Mishma his son."
1CH	4	26	Geneology	#01		14433	" {26} The descendants of Mishma: Hammuel his son, Zaccur his son and Shimei his son."
1CH	4	27	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14434	" {27} Shimei had sixteen sons and six daughters, but his brothers did not have many children; so their entire clan did not become as numerous as the people of Judah."
1CH	4	28	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14435	" {28} They lived in Beersheba, Moladah, Hazar Shual,"
1CH	4	29	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14436	" {29} Bilhah, Ezem, Tolad,"
1CH	4	30	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14437	" {30} Bethuel, Hormah, Ziklag,"
1CH	4	31	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14438	" {31} Beth Marcaboth, Hazar Susim, Beth Biri and Shaaraim. These were their towns until the reign of David."
1CH	4	32	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14439	" {32} Their surrounding villages were Etam, Ain, Rimmon, Token and Ashan --five towns--"
1CH	4	33	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14440	 {33} and all the villages around these towns as far as Baalath. These were their settlements. And they kept a genealogical record.
1CH	4	34	Geneology	#01		14441	" {34} Meshobab, Jamlech, Joshah son of Amaziah,"
1CH	4	35	Geneology	#01		14442	" {35} Joel, Jehu son of Joshibiah, the son of Seraiah, the son of Asiel,"
1CH	4	36	Geneology	#01		14443	" {36} also Elioenai, Jaakobah, Jeshohaiah,"
1CH	4	36	Geneology	#01		14444	" Asaiah, Adiel, Jesimiel, Benaiah,"
1CH	4	37	Geneology	#01		14445	" {37} and Ziza son of Shiphi, the son of Allon, the son of Jedaiah, the son of Shimri, the son of Shemaiah."
1CH	4	38	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14446	 {38} The men listed above by name were leaders of their clans.
1CH	4	38	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14447	" Their families increased greatly, {39} and they went to the outskirts of Gedor to the east of the valley in search of pasture for their flocks."
1CH	4	40	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14448	" {40} They found rich, good pasture, and the land was spacious, peaceful and quiet. Some Hamites had lived there formerly."
1CH	4	41	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14449	 {41} The men whose names were listed came in the days of Hezekiah king of Judah.
1CH	4	41	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14450	" They attacked the Hamites in their dwellings and also the Meunites who were there and completely destroyed them, as is evident to this day."
1CH	4	41	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14451	" Then they settled in their place, because there was pasture for their flocks."
1CH	4	42	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14452	" {42} And five hundred of these Simeonites, led by Pelatiah, Neariah, Rephaiah and Uzziel, the sons of Ishi, invaded the hill country of Seir."
1CH	4	43	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14453	" {43} They killed the remaining Amalekites who had escaped, and they have lived there to this day.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
1CH	5	<<	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14454	1 CHRONICLES 5
1CH	5	1	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14455	" {1} The sons of Reuben the firstborn of Israel (he was the firstborn, but when he defiled his father's marriage bed, his rights as firstborn were given to the sons of Joseph son of Israel;"
1CH	5	1	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14456	" so he could not be listed in the genealogical record in accordance with his birthright,"
1CH	5	2	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14457	" {2} and though Judah was the strongest of his brothers and a ruler came from him, the rights of the firstborn belonged to Joseph)--"
1CH	5	3	Geneology	#01		14458	" {3} The sons of Reuben the firstborn of Israel: Hanoch, Pallu, Hezron and Carmi."
1CH	5	4	Geneology	#01		14459	" {4} The descendants of Joel: Shemaiah his son, Gog his son, Shimei his son,"
1CH	5	5	Geneology	#01		14460	" {5} Micah his son, Reaiah his son, Baal his son,"
1CH	5	6	Geneology	#01		14461	" {6} and Beerah his son, whom Tiglath-Pileser king of Assyria took into exile. Beerah was a leader of the Reubenites."
1CH	5	7	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14462	" {7} Their relatives by clans, listed according to their genealogical records: Jeiel the chief, Zechariah,"
1CH	5	8	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14463	" {8} and Bela son of Azaz, the son of Shema, the son of Joel."
1CH	5	8	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14464	 They settled in the area from Aroer to Nebo and Baal Meon.
1CH	5	9	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14465	" {9} To the east they occupied the land up to the edge of the desert that extends to the Euphrates River, because their livestock had increased in Gilead."
1CH	5	10	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14466	" {10} During Saul's reign they waged war against the Hagrites, who were defeated at their hands; they occupied the dwellings of the Hagrites throughout the entire region east of Gilead."
1CH	5	11	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14467	" {11} The Gadites lived next to them in Bashan, as far as Salecah:"
1CH	5	12	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14468	" {12} Joel was the chief, Shapham the second, then Janai and Shaphat, in Bashan."
1CH	5	13	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14469	" {13} Their relatives, by families, were: Michael, Meshullam, Sheba, Jorai, Jacan, Zia and Eber --seven in all."
1CH	5	14	Geneology	#01		14470	" {14} These were the sons of Abihail son of Huri, the son of Jaroah, the son of Gilead,"
1CH	5	14	Geneology	#01		14471	" the son of Michael, the son of Jeshishai, the son of Jahdo, the son of Buz."
1CH	5	15	Geneology	#01		14472	" {15} Ahi son of Abdiel, the son of Guni, was head of their family."
1CH	5	16	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14473	" {16} The Gadites lived in Gilead, in Bashan and its outlying villages, and on all the pasturelands of Sharon as far as they extended."
1CH	5	17	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14474	 {17} All these were entered in the genealogical records during the reigns of Jotham king of Judah and Jeroboam king of Israel.
1CH	5	18	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14475	" {18} The Reubenites, the Gadites and the half-tribe of Manasseh had 44,760 men ready for military service--"
1CH	5	18	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14476	" able-bodied men who could handle shield and sword, who could use a bow, and who were trained for battle."
1CH	5	19	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14477	" {19} They waged war against the Hagrites, Jetur, Naphish and Nodab."
1CH	5	20	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14478	" {20} They were helped in fighting them, and God handed the Hagrites and all their allies over to them, because they cried out to him during the battle."
1CH	5	20	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14479	" He answered their prayers, because they trusted in him."
1CH	5	21	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14480	" {21} They seized the livestock of the Hagrites--fifty thousand camels, two hundred fifty thousand sheep and two thousand donkeys."
1CH	5	21	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14481	" They also took one hundred thousand people captive, {22} and many others fell slain, because the battle was God's. And they occupied the land until the exile."
1CH	5	23	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14482	" {23} The people of the half-tribe of Manasseh were numerous; they settled in the land from Bashan to Baal Hermon, that is, to Senir (Mount Hermon )."
1CH	5	24	Geneology	#01		14483	" {24} These were the heads of their families: Epher, Ishi, Eliel, Azriel,"
1CH	5	24	Geneology	#01		14484	" Jeremiah, Hodaviah and Jahdiel."
1CH	5	24	Geneology	#01		14485	" They were brave warriors, famous men, and heads of their families."
1CH	5	25	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14486	" {25} But they were unfaithful to the God of their fathers and prostituted themselves to the gods of the peoples of the land, whom God had destroyed before them."
1CH	5	26	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14487	" {26} So the God of Israel stirred up the spirit of Pul king of Assyria (that is, Tiglath-Pileser king of Assyria), who took the Reubenites, the Gadites and the half-tribe of Manasseh into exile."
1CH	5	26	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14488	" He took them to Halah, Habor, Hara and the river of Gozan, where they are to this day.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"

1CH	6	54	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14547	" {54} These were the locations of their settlements allotted as their territory (they were assigned to the descendants of Aaron who were from the Kohathite clan, because the first lot was for them):"
1CH	6	55	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14548	 {55} They were given Hebron in Judah with its surrounding pasturelands.
1CH	6	56	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14549	 {56} But the fields and villages around the city were given to Caleb son of Jephunneh.
1CH	6	57	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14550	" {57} So the descendants of Aaron were given Hebron (a city of refuge), and Libnah, Jattir, Eshtemoa,"
1CH	6	58	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14551	" {58} Hilen, Debir,"
1CH	6	59	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14552	" {59} Ashan, Juttah and Beth Shemesh, together with their pasturelands."
1CH	6	60	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14553	" {60} And from the tribe of Benjamin they were given Gibeon, Geba, Alemeth and Anathoth, together with their pasturelands."
1CH	6	60	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14554	" These towns, which were distributed among the Kohathite clans, were thirteen in all."
1CH	6	61	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14555	 {61} The rest of Kohath's descendants were allotted ten towns from the clans of half the tribe of Manasseh.
1CH	6	62	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14556	" {62} The descendants of Gershon, clan by clan, were allotted thirteen towns from the tribes of Issachar, Asher and Naphtali, and from the part of the tribe of Manasseh that is in Bashan."
1CH	6	63	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14557	" {63} The descendants of Merari, clan by clan, were allotted twelve towns from the tribes of Reuben, Gad and Zebulun."
1CH	6	64	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14558	 {64} So the Israelites gave the Levites these towns and their pasturelands.
1CH	6	65	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14559	" {65} From the tribes of Judah, Simeon and Benjamin they allotted the previously named towns."
1CH	6	66	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14560	 {66} Some of the Kohathite clans were given as their territory towns from the tribe of Ephraim.
1CH	6	67	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14561	" {67} In the hill country of Ephraim they were given Shechem (a city of refuge), and Gezer,"
1CH	6	68	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14562	" {68} Jokmeam, Beth Horon,"
1CH	6	69	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14563	" {69} Aijalon and Gath Rimmon, together with their pasturelands."
1CH	6	70	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14564	" {70} And from half the tribe of Manasseh the Israelites gave Aner and Bileam, together with their pasturelands, to the rest of the Kohathite clans."
1CH	6	71	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14565	" {71} The Gershonites received the following: From the clan of the half-tribe of Manasseh they received Golan in Bashan and also Ashtaroth, together with their pasturelands;"

1CH	7	14	Geneology	#01		14598	 {14} The descendants of Manasseh: Asriel was his descendant through his Aramean concubine. She gave birth to Makir the father of Gilead.
1CH	7	15	Geneology	#01		14599	" {15} Makir took a wife from among the Huppites and Shuppites. His sister's name was Maacah. Another descendant was named Zelophehad, who had only daughters."
1CH	7	16	Geneology	#01		14600	" {16} Makir's wife Maacah gave birth to a son and named him Peresh. His brother was named Sheresh, and his sons were Ulam and Rakem."
1CH	7	17	Geneology	#01		14601	" {17} The son of Ulam: Bedan. These were the sons of Gilead son of Makir, the son of Manasseh."
1CH	7	18	Geneology	#01		14602	" {18} His sister Hammoleketh gave birth to Ishhod, Abiezer and Mahlah."
1CH	7	19	Geneology	#01		14603	" {19} The sons of Shemida were: Ahian, Shechem, Likhi and Aniam."
1CH	7	20	Geneology	#01		14604	" {20} The descendants of Ephraim: Shuthelah, Bered his son, Tahath his son, Eleadah his son, Tahath his son,"
1CH	7	21	Geneology	#01		14605	" {21} Zabad his son and Shuthelah his son. Ezer and Elead were killed by the native-born men of Gath, when they went down to seize their livestock."
1CH	7	22	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14606	" {22} Their father Ephraim mourned for them many days, and his relatives came to comfort him."
1CH	7	23	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14607	" {23} Then he lay with his wife again, and she became pregnant and gave birth to a son. He named him Beriah, because there had been misfortune in his family."
1CH	7	24	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14608	" {24} His daughter was Sheerah, who built Lower and Upper Beth Horon as well as Uzzen Sheerah."

1CH	7	27	Geneology	#01		14611	 {27} Nun his son and Joshua his son.

1CH	7	28	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14613	 and Shechem and its villages all the way to Ayyah and its villages.

1CH	9	1	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14670	 {1} All Israel was listed in the genealogies recorded in the book of the kings of Israel. The people of Judah were taken captive to Babylon because of their unfaithfulness.
1CH	9	2	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14671	" {2} Now the first to resettle on their own property in their own towns were some Israelites, priests, Levites and temple servants."
1CH	9	3	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14672	" {3} Those from Judah, from Benjamin, and from Ephraim and Manasseh who lived in Jerusalem were:"
1CH	9	4	Geneology	#01		14673	" {4} Uthai son of Ammihud, the son of Omri, the son of Imri, the son of Bani, a descendant of Perez son of Judah."

1CH	9	6	Geneology	#01		14675	 {6} Of the Zerahites: Jeuel. The people from Judah numbered 690.
1CH	9	7	Geneology	#01		14676	" {7} Of the Benjamites: Sallu son of Meshullam, the son of Hodaviah, the son of Hassenuah;"
1CH	9	8	Geneology	#01		14677	" {8} Ibneiah son of Jeroham; Elah son of Uzzi, the son of Micri;"
1CH	9	8	Geneology	#01		14678	" and Meshullam son of Shephatiah, the son of Reuel, the son of Ibnijah."
1CH	9	9	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14679	" {9} The people from Benjamin, as listed in their genealogy, numbered 956. All these men were heads of their families."
1CH	9	10	Geneology	#01		14680	 {10} Of the priests: Jedaiah; Jehoiarib; Jakin;
1CH	9	11	Geneology	#01		14681	" {11} Azariah son of Hilkiah, the son of Meshullam, the son of Zadok,"
1CH	9	11	Geneology	#01		14682	" the son of Meraioth, the son of Ahitub, the official in charge of the house of God;"
1CH	9	12	Geneology	#01		14683	" {12} Adaiah son of Jeroham, the son of Pashhur, the son of Malkijah;"
1CH	9	12	Geneology	#01		14684	" and Maasai son of Adiel, the son of Jahzerah, the son of Meshullam,"
1CH	9	12	Geneology	#01		14685	" the son of Meshillemith, the son of Immer."
1CH	9	13	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14686	" {13} The priests, who were heads of families, numbered 1,760. They were able men, responsible for ministering in the house of God."
1CH	9	14	Geneology	#01		14687	" {14} Of the Levites: Shemaiah son of Hasshub, the son of Azrikam, the son of Hashabiah, a Merarite;"
1CH	9	15	Geneology	#01		14688	" {15} Bakbakkar, Heresh, Galal and Mattaniah son of Mica, the son of Zicri, the son of Asaph;"
1CH	9	16	Geneology	#01		14689	" {16} Obadiah son of Shemaiah, the son of Galal, the son of Jeduthun;"
1CH	9	16	Geneology	#01		14690	" and Berekiah son of Asa, the son of Elkanah, who lived in the villages of the Netophathites."
1CH	9	17	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14691	" {17} The gatekeepers: Shallum, Akkub, Talmon, Ahiman and their brothers, Shallum their chief"
1CH	9	18	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14692	" {18} being stationed at the King's Gate on the east, up to the present time. These were the gatekeepers belonging to the camp of the Levites."
1CH	9	19	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14693	" {19} Shallum son of Kore, the son of Ebiasaph, the son of Korah, and his fellow gatekeepers from his family (the Korahites)"
1CH	9	19	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14694	 were responsible for guarding the thresholds of the Tent just as their fathers had been responsible for guarding the entrance to the dwelling of the Lord.
1CH	9	20	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14695	" {20} In earlier times Phinehas son of Eleazar was in charge of the gatekeepers, and the Lord was with him."
1CH	9	21	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14696	 {21} Zechariah son of Meshelemiah was the gatekeeper at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting.
1CH	9	22	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14697	" {22} Altogether, those chosen to be gatekeepers at the thresholds numbered 212."
1CH	9	22	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14698	 They were registered by genealogy in their villages. The gatekeepers had been assigned to their positions of trust by David and Samuel the seer.
1CH	9	23	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14699	 {23} They and their descendants were in charge of guarding the the gates of the house of the Lord--the house called the Tent.
1CH	9	24	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14700	" {24} The gatekeepers were on the four sides: east, west, north and south."
1CH	9	25	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14701	 {25} Their brothers in their villages had to come from time to time and share their duties for seven-day periods.
1CH	9	26	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14702	" {26} But the four principal gatekeepers, who were Levites, were entrusted with the responsibility for the rooms and treasuries in the house of God."
1CH	9	27	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14703	" {27} They would spend the night stationed around the house of God, because they had to guard it; and they had charge of the key for opening it each morning."
1CH	9	28	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14704	 {28} Some of them were in charge of the articles used in the temple service; they counted them when they were brought in and when they were taken out.
1CH	9	29	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14705	" {29} Others were assigned to take care of the furnishings and all the other articles of the sanctuary, as well as the flour and wine, and the oil, incense and spices."
1CH	9	30	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14706	 {30} But some of the priests took care of mixing the spices.
1CH	9	31	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14707	" {31} A Levite named Mattithiah, the firstborn son of Shallum the Korahite, was entrusted with the responsibility for baking the offering bread."
1CH	9	32	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14708	 {32} Some of their Kohathite brothers were in charge of preparing for every Sabbath the bread set out on the table.
1CH	9	33	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14709	" {33} Those who were musicians, heads of Levite families, stayed in the rooms of the temple and were exempt from other duties because they were responsible for the work day and night."
1CH	9	34	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14710	" {34} All these were heads of Levite families, chiefs as listed in their genealogy, and they lived in Jerusalem."
1CH	9	35	Geneology	#01		14711	" {35} Jeiel the father of Gibeon lived in Gibeon. His wife's name was Maacah,"
1CH	9	36	Geneology	#01		14712	" {36} and his firstborn son was Abdon, followed by Zur, Kish, Baal, Ner, Nadab,"
1CH	9	37	Geneology	#01		14713	" {37} Gedor, Ahio, Zechariah and Mikloth."
1CH	9	38	Geneology	#01		14714	 {38} Mikloth was the father of Shimeam. They too lived near their relatives in Jerusalem.
1CH	9	39	Geneology	#01		14715	" {39} Ner was the father of Kish, Kish the father of Saul,"
1CH	9	39	Geneology	#01		14716	" and Saul the father of Jonathan, Malki-Shua, Abinadab and Esh-Baal."
1CH	9	40	Geneology	#01		14717	" {40} The son of Jonathan: Merib-Baal, who was the father of Micah."
1CH	9	41	Geneology	#01		14718	" {41} The sons of Micah: Pithon, Melech, Tahrea and Ahaz."
1CH	9	42	Geneology	#01		14719	" {42} Ahaz was the father of Jadah, Jadah was the father of Alemeth, Azmaveth and Zimri,"
1CH	9	42	Geneology	#01		14720	 and Zimri was the father of Moza.
1CH	9	43	Geneology	#01		14721	" {43} Moza was the father of Binea; Rephaiah was his son, Eleasah his son and Azel his son."
1CH	9	44	Geneology	#01		14722	" {44} Azel had six sons, and these were their names: Azrikam, Bokeru, Ishmael,"
1CH	9	44	Geneology	#01		14723	" Sheariah, Obadiah and Hanan. These were the sons of Azel.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
1CH	10	<<	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14724	1 CHRONICLES 10
1CH	10	1	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14725	" {1} Now the Philistines fought against Israel; the Israelites fled before them, and many fell slain on Mount Gilboa."
1CH	10	2	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14726	" {2} The Philistines pressed hard after Saul and his sons, and they killed his sons Jonathan, Abinadab and Malki-Shua."
1CH	10	3	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14727	" {3} The fighting grew fierce around Saul, and when the archers overtook him, they wounded him. {4} Saul said to his armor-bearer,"
1CH	10	4	Saul	#13		14728	" << Draw your sword and run me through, or these uncircumcised fellows will come and abuse me.>>"
1CH	10	4	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14729	" But his armor-bearer was terrified and would not do it; so Saul took his own sword and fell on it. {5} When the armor-bearer saw that Saul was dead, he too fell on his sword and died."
1CH	10	6	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14730	" {6} So Saul and his three sons died, and all his house died together."
1CH	10	7	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14731	" {7} When all the Israelites in the valley saw that the army had fled and that Saul and his sons had died, they abandoned their towns and fled. And the Philistines came and occupied them."
1CH	10	8	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14732	" {8} The next day, when the Philistines came to strip the dead, they found Saul and his sons fallen on Mount Gilboa."
1CH	10	9	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14733	" {9} They stripped him and took his head and his armor, and sent messengers throughout the land of the Philistines to proclaim the news among their idols and their people."
1CH	10	10	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14734	 {10} They put his armor in the temple of their gods and hung up his head in the temple of Dagon.
1CH	10	11	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14735	" {11} When all the inhabitants of Jabesh Gilead heard of everything the Philistines had done to Saul, {12} all their valiant men went and took the bodies of Saul and his sons and brought them to Jabesh."
1CH	10	12	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14736	" Then they buried their bones under the great tree in Jabesh, and they fasted seven days."
1CH	10	13	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14737	" {13} Saul died because he was unfaithful to the Lord; he did not keep the word of the Lord and even consulted a medium for guidance, {14} and did not inquire of the Lord."
1CH	10	14	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14738	 So the Lord put him to death and turned the kingdom over to David son of Jesse.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
1CH	11	<<	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14739	1 CHRONICLES 11
1CH	11	1	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14740	" {1} All Israel came together to David at Hebron and said,"
1CH	11	1	Israelite	#15		14741	 << We are your own flesh and blood.
1CH	11	2	Israelite	#15		14742	" {2} In the past, even while Saul was king, you were the one who led Israel on their military campaigns."
1CH	11	2	Israelite	#15		14743	" And the Lord your God said to you, 'You will shepherd my people Israel, and you will become their ruler.'>>"
1CH	11	3	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14744	" {3} When all the elders of Israel had come to King David at Hebron, he made a compact with them at Hebron before the Lord, and they anointed David king over Israel, as the Lord had promised through Samuel."
1CH	11	4	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14745	" {4} David and all the Israelites marched to Jerusalem, that is, Jebus. The Jebusites who lived there {5} said to David,"
1CH	11	5	Jebusite	#14		14746	 << You will not get in here.>>
1CH	11	5	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14747	" Nevertheless, David captured the fortress of Zion, the City of David. {6} David had said,"
1CH	11	6	David	#07		14748	 << Whoever leads the attack on the Jebusites will become commander-in-chief.>>
1CH	11	6	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14749	" Joab son of Zeruiah went up first, and so he received the command. {7} David then took up residence in the fortress, and so it was called the City of David."
1CH	11	8	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14750	" {8} He built up the city around it, from the supporting terraces to the surrounding wall, while Joab restored the rest of the city."
1CH	11	9	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14751	" {9} And David became more and more powerful, because the Lord Almighty was with him."
1CH	11	10	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14752	" {10} These were the chiefs of David's mighty men--they, together with all Israel, gave his kingship strong support to extend it over the whole land, as the Lord had promised--"
1CH	11	11	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14753	" {11} this is the list of David's mighty men: Jashobeam, a Hacmonite, was chief of the officers; he raised his spear against three hundred men, whom he killed in one encounter."
1CH	11	12	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14754	" {12} Next to him was Eleazar son of Dodai the Ahohite, one of the three mighty men."
1CH	11	13	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14755	" {13} He was with David at Pas Dammim when the Philistines gathered there for battle. At a place where there was a field full of barley, the troops fled from the Philistines."
1CH	11	14	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14756	" {14} But they took their stand in the middle of the field. They defended it and struck the Philistines down, and the Lord brought about a great victory."
1CH	11	15	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14757	" {15} Three of the thirty chiefs came down to David to the rock at the cave of Adullam, while a band of Philistines was encamped in the Valley of Rephaim."
1CH	11	16	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14758	" {16} At that time David was in the stronghold, and the Philistine garrison was at Bethlehem. {17} David longed for water and said,"
1CH	11	17	David	#07		14759	" << Oh, that someone would get me a drink of water from the well near the gate of Bethlehem!>>"
1CH	11	18	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14760	" {18} So the Three broke through the Philistine lines, drew water from the well near the gate of Bethlehem and carried it back to David."
1CH	11	18	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14761	" But he refused to drink it; instead, he poured it out before the Lord. {19} He said,"
1CH	11	19	David	#07		14762	 << God forbid that I should do this! Should I drink the blood of these men who went at the risk of their lives?>>
1CH	11	19	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14763	" Because they risked their lives to bring it back, David would not drink it. Such were the exploits of the three mighty men."
1CH	11	20	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14764	" {20} Abishai the brother of Joab was chief of the Three. He raised his spear against three hundred men, whom he killed, and so he became as famous as the Three."
1CH	11	21	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14765	" {21} He was doubly honored above the Three and became their commander, even though he was not included among them."
1CH	11	22	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14766	" {22} Benaiah son of Jehoiada was a valiant fighter from Kabzeel, who performed great exploits. He struck down two of Moab's best men."
1CH	11	22	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14767	 He also went down into a pit on a snowy day and killed a lion.
1CH	11	23	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14768	" {23} And he struck down an Egyptian who was seven and a half feet tall. Although the Egyptian had a spear like a weaver's rod in his hand, Benaiah went against him with a club."
1CH	11	23	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14769	 He snatched the spear from the Egyptian's hand and killed him with his own spear.
1CH	11	24	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14770	 {24} Such were the exploits of Benaiah son of Jehoiada; he too was as famous as the three mighty men.
1CH	11	25	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14771	" {25} He was held in greater honor than any of the Thirty, but he was not included among the Three. And David put him in charge of his bodyguard."

1CH	12	18	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14814	" {18} Then the Spirit came upon Amasai, chief of the Thirty, and he said:"

1CH	12	22	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14823	" {22} Day after day men came to help David, until he had a great army, like the army of God."

1CH	12	37	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14834	" {37} and from east of the Jordan, men of Reuben, Gad and the half-tribe of Manasseh, armed with every type of weapon--120,000."
1CH	12	38	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14835	 {38} All these were fighting men who volunteered to serve in the ranks.
1CH	12	38	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14836	 They came to Hebron fully determined to make David king over all Israel. All the rest of the Israelites were also of one mind to make David king.
1CH	12	39	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14837	" {39} The men spent three days there with David, eating and drinking, for their families had supplied provisions for them."
1CH	12	40	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14838	" {40} Also, their neighbors from as far away as Issachar, Zebulun and Naphtali came bringing food on donkeys, camels, mules and oxen."
1CH	12	40	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14839	" There were plentiful supplies of flour, fig cakes, raisin cakes, wine, oil, cattle and sheep, for there was joy in Israel.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
1CH	13	<<	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14840	1 CHRONICLES 13
1CH	13	1	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14841	" {1} David conferred with each of his officers, the commanders of thousands and commanders of hundreds. {2} He then said to the whole assembly of Israel,"
1CH	13	2	David	#07		14842	" << If it seems good to you and if it is the will of the Lord our God, let us send word far and wide to the rest of our brothers throughout the territories of Israel,"
1CH	13	2	David	#07		14843	" and also to the priests and Levites who are with them in their towns and pasturelands, to come and join us."
1CH	13	3	David	#07		14844	" {3} Let us bring the ark of our God back to us, for we did not inquire of it during the reign of Saul.>>"
1CH	13	4	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14845	" {4} The whole assembly agreed to do this, because it seemed right to all the people."
1CH	13	5	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14846	" {5} So David assembled all the Israelites, from the Shihor River in Egypt to Lebo Hamath, to bring the ark of God from Kiriath Jearim."
1CH	13	6	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14847	" {6} David and all the Israelites with him went to Baalah of Judah (Kiriath Jearim) to bring up from there the ark of God the Lord, who is enthroned between the cherubim--the ark that is called by the Name."
1CH	13	7	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14848	" {7} They moved the ark of God from Abinadab's house on a new cart, with Uzzah and Ahio guiding it."
1CH	13	8	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14849	" {8} David and all the Israelites were celebrating with all their might before God, with songs and with harps, lyres, tambourines, cymbals and trumpets."
1CH	13	9	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14850	" {9} When they came to the threshing floor of Kidon, Uzzah reached out his hand to steady the ark, because the oxen stumbled."
1CH	13	10	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14851	" {10} The Lord's anger burned against Uzzah, and he struck him down because he had put his hand on the ark. So he died there before God."
1CH	13	11	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14852	" {11} Then David was angry because the Lord's wrath had broken out against Uzzah, and to this day that place is called Perez Uzzah. {12} David was afraid of God that day and asked,"
1CH	13	12	David	#07		14853	 << How can I ever bring the ark of God to me?>>
1CH	13	13	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14854	" {13} He did not take the ark to be with him in the City of David. Instead, he took it aside to the house of Obed-Edom the Gittite."
1CH	13	14	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14855	" {14} The ark of God remained with the family of Obed-Edom in his house for three months, and the Lord blessed his household and everything he had.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"

1CH	14	2	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14858	 {2} And David knew that the Lord had established him as king over Israel and that his Kingdom had been highly exaulted for the sake of his people Israel.
1CH	14	3	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14859	 {3} In Jerusalem David took more wives and became the father of more sons and daughters.

1CH	14	8	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14864	" {8} When the Philistines heard that David had been anointed king over all Israel, they went up in full force to search for him, but David heard about it and went out to meet them."
1CH	14	9	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14865	 {9} Now the Philistines had come and raided the Valley of Rephaim; {10} so David inquired of God:
1CH	14	10	David	#07		14866	 << Shall I go and attack the Philistines? Will you hand them over to me?>>
1CH	14	10	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14867	" The Lord answered him,"
1CH	14	10	God-FX1	#20		14868	" << Go, I will hand them over to you.>>"
1CH	14	11	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14869	" {11} So David and his men went up to Baal Perazim, and there he defeated them. He said,"
1CH	14	11	David	#07		14870	" << As waters break out, God has broken out against my enemies by my hand.>>"
1CH	14	11	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14871	" So that place was called Baal Perazim. {12} The Philistines had abandoned their gods there, and David gave orders to burn them in the fire."
1CH	14	13	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14872	" {13} Once more the Philistines raided the valley; {14} so David inquired of God again, and God answered him,"
1CH	14	14	God-FX1	#20		14873	" << Do not go straight up, but circle around them and attack them in front of the balsam trees."
1CH	14	15	God-FX1	#20		14874	" {15} As soon as you hear the sound of marching in the tops of the balsam trees, move out to battle, because that will mean God has gone out in front of you to strike the Philistine army.>>"
1CH	14	16	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14875	" {16} So David did as God commanded him, and they struck down the Philistine army, all the way from Gibeon to Gezer."
1CH	14	17	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14876	" {17} So David's fame spread throughout every land, and the Lord made all the nations fear him.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
1CH	15	<<	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14877	1 CHRONICLES 15
1CH	15	1	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14878	" {1} After David had constructed buildings for himself in the City of David, he prepared a place for the ark of God and pitched a tent for it. {2} Then David said,"
1CH	15	2	David	#07		14879	" << No one but the Levites may carry the ark of God, because the Lord chose them to carry the ark of the Lord and to minister before him forever.>>"
1CH	15	3	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14880	 {3} David assembled all Israel in Jerusalem to bring up the ark of the Lord to the place he had prepared for it. {4} He called together the descendants of Aaron and the Levites:
1CH	15	5	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14881	" {5} From the descendants of Kohath, Uriel the leader and 120 relatives;"

1CH	15	11	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14887	" {11} Then David summoned Zadok and Abiathar the priests, and Uriel, Asaiah, Joel, Shemaiah, Eliel and Amminadab the Levites. {12} He said to them,"
1CH	15	12	David	#07		14888	 << You are the heads of the Levitical families;
1CH	15	12	David	#07		14889	" you and your fellow Levites are to consecrate yourselves and bring up the ark of the Lord, the God of Israel, to the place I have prepared for it."
1CH	15	13	David	#07		14890	" {13} It was because you, the Levites, did not bring it up the first time that the Lord our God broke out in anger against us."
1CH	15	13	David	#07		14891	 We did not inquire of him about how to do it in the prescribed way.>>
1CH	15	14	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14892	" {14} So the priests and Levites consecrated themselves in order to bring up the ark of the Lord, the God of Israel."

1CH	15	16	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14894	" {16} David told the leaders of the Levites to appoint their brothers as singers to sing joyful songs, accompanied by musical instruments: lyres, harps and cymbals."

1CH	15	22	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14906	 {22} Kenaniah the head Levite was in charge of the singing; that was his responsibility because he was skillful at it.

1CH	15	25	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14911	" {25} So David and the elders of Israel and the commanders of units of a thousand went to bring up the ark of the covenant of the Lord from the house of Obed-Edom, with rejoicing."
1CH	15	26	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14912	" {26} Because God had helped the Levites who were carrying the ark of the covenant of the Lord, seven bulls and seven rams were sacrificed."
1CH	15	27	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14913	" {27} Now David was clothed in a robe of fine linen, as were all the Levites who were carrying the ark, and as were the singers, and Kenaniah, who was in charge of the singing of the choirs."

1CH	16	14	David	#07		14931	 {14} He is the Lord our God; his judgments are in all the earth.
1CH	16	15	David	#07		14932	" {15} He remembers his covenant forever, the word he commanded, for a thousand generations, {16} the covenant he made with Abraham, the oath he swore to Isaac."

1CH	16	19	David	#07		14935	" {19} When they were but few in number, few indeed, and strangers in it, {20} they wandered from nation to nation, from one kingdom to another."

1CH	16	22	God-FX1	#20		14937	 {22} << Do not touch my anointed ones; do my prophets no harm.>>
1CH	16	23	David	#07		14938	" {23} Sing to the Lord, all the earth; proclaim his salvation day after day. {24} Declare his glory among the nations, his marvelous deeds among all peoples."
1CH	16	25	David	#07		14939	" {25} For great is the Lord and most worthy of praise; he is to be feared above all gods. {26} For all the gods of the nations are idols, but the Lord made the heavens."
1CH	16	27	David	#07		14940	 {27} Splendor and majesty are before him; strength and joy in his dwelling place.
1CH	16	28	David	#07		14941	" {28} Ascribe to the Lord, O families of nations, {29} ascribe to the Lord glory and strength, ascribe to the Lord the glory due his name."

1CH	16	30	David	#07		14943	" {30} Tremble before him, all the earth! The world is firmly established; it cannot be moved."
1CH	16	31	David	#07		14944	" {31} Let the heavens rejoice, let the earth be glad; let them say among the nations, << The Lord reigns!>>"
1CH	16	32	David	#07		14945	" {32} Let the sea resound, and all that is in it; let the fields be jubilant, and everything in them!"
1CH	16	33	David	#07		14946	" {33} Then the trees of the forest will sing, they will sing for joy before the Lord, for he comes to judge the earth. {34} Give thanks to the Lord, for he is good; his love endures forever."
1CH	16	35	David	#07		14947	" {35} Cry out, << Save us, O God our Savior; gather us and deliver us from the nations, that we may give thanks to your holy name, that we may glory in your praise.>>"
1CH	16	36	David	#07		14948	" {36} Praise be to the Lord, the God of Israel, from everlasting to everlasting."
1CH	16	36	Man in Crowd	#18		14949	 << AMEN PRAISE THE LORD>>
1CH	16	36	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14950	 said all the people.

1CH	17	<<	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14958	1 CHRONICLES 17
1CH	17	1	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14959	" {1} After David was settled in his palace, he said to Nathan the prophet,"
1CH	17	1	David	#07		14960	" << Here I am, living in a palace of cedar, while the ark of the covenant of the Lord is under a tent.>>"
1CH	17	2	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14961	" {2} Nathan replied to David,"
1CH	17	2	Nathan	#06		14962	" << Whatever you have in mind, do it, for God is with you.>>"
1CH	17	3	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14963	" {3} That night the word of God came to Nathan, saying:"
1CH	17	4	God-FX1	#20		14964	" {4} << Go and tell my servant David, 'This is what the Lord says: You are not the one to build me a house to dwell in."
1CH	17	5	God-FX1	#20		14965	" {5} I have not dwelt in a house from the day I brought Israel up out of Egypt to this day. I have moved from one tent site to another, from one dwelling place to another."
1CH	17	6	God-FX1	#20		14966	" {6} Wherever I have moved with all the Israelites, did I ever say to any of their leaders whom I commanded to shepherd my people, << Why have you not built me a house of cedar?>> '"
1CH	17	7	God-FX1	#20		14967	" {7} << Now then, tell my servant David, 'This is what the Lord Almighty says: I took you from the pasture and from following the flock, to be ruler over my people Israel."
1CH	17	8	God-FX1	#20		14968	" {8} I have been with you wherever you have gone, and I have cut off all your enemies from before you. Now I will make your name like the names of the greatest men of the earth."
1CH	17	9	God-FX1	#20		14969	 {9} And I will provide a place for my people Israel and will plant them so that they can have a home of their own and no longer be disturbed.
1CH	17	9	God-FX1	#20		14970	" Wicked people will not oppress them anymore, as they did at the beginning {10} and have done ever since the time I appointed leaders over my people Israel."
1CH	17	10	God-FX1	#20		14971	 I will also subdue all your enemies. << 'I declare to you that the Lord will build a house for you:

1CH	17	13	God-FX1	#20		14974	" {13} I will be his father, and he will be my son. I will never take my love away from him, as I took it away from your predecessor."
1CH	17	14	God-FX1	#20		14975	 {14} I will set him over my house and my kingdom forever; his throne will be established forever.'>>
1CH	17	15	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14976	" {15} Nathan reported to David all the words of this entire revelation. {16} Then King David went in and sat before the Lord, and he said:"
1CH	17	16	David	#07		14977	" << Who am I, O Lord God, and what is my family, that you have brought me this far?"
1CH	17	17	David	#07		14978	" {17} And as if this were not enough in your sight, O God, you have spoken about the future of the house of your servant."
1CH	17	17	David	#07		14979	" You have looked on me as though I were the most exalted of men, O Lord God."
1CH	17	18	David	#07		14980	" {18} << What more can David say to you for honoring your servant? For you know your servant, O Lord."
1CH	17	19	David	#07		14981	" {19} For the sake of your servant and according to your will, you have done this great thing and made known all these great promises."
1CH	17	20	David	#07		14982	" {20} << There is no one like you, O Lord, and there is no God but you, as we have heard with our own ears."
1CH	17	21	David	#07		14983	" {21} And who is like your people Israel --the one nation on earth whose God went out to redeem a people for himself,"
1CH	17	21	David	#07		14984	" and to make a name for yourself, and to perform great and awesome wonders by driving out nations from before your people, whom you redeemed from Egypt?"
1CH	17	22	David	#07		14985	" {22} You made your people Israel your very own forever, and you, O Lord, have become their God."
1CH	17	23	David	#07		14986	" {23} << And now, Lord, let the promise you have made concerning your servant and his house be established forever."
1CH	17	23	David	#07		14987	" Do as you promised, {24} so that it will be established and that your name will be great forever."
1CH	17	24	David	#07		14988	" Then men will say, 'The Lord Almighty, the God over Israel, is Israel's God!' And the house of your servant David will be established before you."
1CH	17	25	David	#07		14989	" {25} << You, my God, have revealed to your servant that you will build a house for him. So your servant has found courage to pray to you."
1CH	17	26	David	#07		14990	" {26} O Lord, you are God! You have promised these good things to your servant."
1CH	17	27	David	#07		14991	" {27} Now you have been pleased to bless the house of your servant, that it may continue forever in your sight; for you, O Lord, have blessed it, and it will be blessed forever.>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
1CH	18	<<	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14992	1 CHRONICLES 18
1CH	18	1	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14993	" {1} In the course of time, David defeated the Philistines and subdued them, and he took Gath and its surrounding villages from the control of the Philistines."
1CH	18	2	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14994	" {2} David also defeated the Moabites, and they became subject to him and brought tribute."
1CH	18	3	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14995	" {3} Moreover, David fought Hadadezer king of Zobah, as far as Hamath, when he went to establish his control along the Euphrates River."
1CH	18	4	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14996	" {4} David captured a thousand of his chariots, seven thousand charioteers and twenty thousand foot soldiers. He hamstrung all but a hundred of the chariot horses."
1CH	18	5	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14997	" {5} When the Arameans of Damascus came to help Hadadezer king of Zobah, David struck down twenty-two thousand of them."
1CH	18	6	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14998	" {6} He put garrisons in the Aramean kingdom of Damascus, and the Arameans became subject to him and brought tribute. The Lord gave David victory everywhere he went."
1CH	18	7	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		14999	 {7} David took the gold shields carried by the officers of Hadadezer and brought them to Jerusalem.
1CH	18	8	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15000	" {8} From Tebah and Cun, towns that belonged to Hadadezer, David took a great quantity of bronze, which Solomon used to make the bronze Sea, the pillars and various bronze articles."
1CH	18	9	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15001	" {9} When Tou king of Hamath heard that David had defeated the entire army of Hadadezer king of Zobah,"
1CH	18	10	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15002	" {10} he sent his son Hadoram to King David to greet him and congratulate him on his victory in battle over Hadadezer, who had been at war with Tou."
1CH	18	10	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15003	 Hadoram brought all kinds of articles of gold and silver and bronze.
1CH	18	11	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15004	" {11} King David dedicated these articles to the Lord, as he had done with the silver and gold he had taken from all these nations:"
1CH	18	11	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15005	" Edom and Moab, the Ammonites and the Philistines, and Amalek."
1CH	18	12	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15006	 {12} Abishai son of Zeruiah struck down eighteen thousand Edomites in the Valley of Salt.
1CH	18	13	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15007	" {13} He put garrisons in Edom, and all the Edomites became subject to David. The Lord gave David victory everywhere he went."
1CH	18	14	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15008	" {14} David reigned over all Israel, doing what was just and right for all his people."
1CH	18	15	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15009	 {15} Joab son of Zeruiah was over the army; Jehoshaphat son of Ahilud was recorder;
1CH	18	16	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15010	 {16} Zadok son of Ahitub and Ahimelech son of Abiathar were priests; Shavsha was secretary;
1CH	18	17	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15011	 {17} Benaiah son of Jehoiada was over the Kerethites and Pelethites; and David's sons were chief officials at the king's side.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
1CH	19	<<	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15012	1 CHRONICLES 19
1CH	19	1	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15013	" {1} In the course of time, Nahash king of the Ammonites died, and his son succeeded him as king. {2} David thought,"
1CH	19	2	David	#07		15014	" << I will show kindness to Hanun son of Nahash, because his father showed kindness to me.>>"
1CH	19	2	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15015	 So David sent a delegation to express his sympathy to Hanun concerning his father.
1CH	19	2	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15016	" When David's men came to Hanun in the land of the Ammonites to express sympathy to him, {3} the Ammonite nobles said to Hanun,"
1CH	19	3	Noble	#17		15017	 << Do you think David is honoring your father by sending men to you to express sympathy?
1CH	19	3	Noble	#17		15018	 Haven't his men come to you to explore and spy out the country and overthrow it?>>
1CH	19	4	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15019	" {4} So Hanun seized David's men, shaved them, cut off their garments in the middle at the buttocks, and sent them away."
1CH	19	5	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15020	" {5} When someone came and told David about the men, he sent messengers to meet them, for they were greatly humiliated. The king said,"
1CH	19	5	David	#07		15021	" << Stay at Jericho till your beards have grown, and then come back.>>"
1CH	19	6	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15022	" {6} When the Ammonites realized that they had become a stench in David's nostrils, Hanun and the Ammonites sent a thousand talents of silver to hire chariots and charioteers from Aram Naharaim, Aram Maacah and Zobah."
1CH	19	7	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15023	" {7} They hired thirty-two thousand chariots and charioteers, as well as the king of Maacah with his troops, who came and camped near Medeba, while the Ammonites were mustered from their towns and moved out for battle."
1CH	19	8	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15024	" {8} On hearing this, David sent Joab out with the entire army of fighting men."
1CH	19	9	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15025	" {9} The Ammonites came out and drew up in battle formation at the entrance to their city, while the kings who had come were by themselves in the open country."
1CH	19	10	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15026	 {10} Joab saw that there were battle lines in front of him and behind him; so he selected some of the best troops in Israel and deployed them against the Arameans.
1CH	19	11	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15027	" {11} He put the rest of the men under the command of Abishai his brother, and they were deployed against the Ammonites. {12} Joab said,"
1CH	19	12	Joab	#08		15028	" << If the Arameans are too strong for me, then you are to rescue me;"
1CH	19	12	Joab	#08		15029	" but if the Ammonites are too strong for you, then I will rescue you."
1CH	19	13	Joab	#08		15030	 {13} Be strong and let us fight bravely for our people and the cities of our God.
1CH	19	13	Joab	#08		15031	 The Lord will do what is good in his sight.>>
1CH	19	14	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15032	" {14} Then Joab and the troops with him advanced to fight the Arameans, and they fled before him."
1CH	19	15	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15033	" {15} When the Ammonites saw that the Arameans were fleeing, they too fled before his brother Abishai and went inside the city. So Joab went back to Jerusalem."
1CH	19	16	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15034	" {16} After the Arameans saw that they had been routed by Israel, they sent messengers and had Arameans brought from beyond the River, with Shophach the commander of Hadadezer's army leading them."
1CH	19	17	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15035	" {17} When David was told of this, he gathered all Israel and crossed the Jordan; he advanced against them and formed his battle lines opposite them."
1CH	19	17	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15036	" David formed his lines to meet the Arameans in battle, and they fought against him."
1CH	19	18	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15037	" {18} But they fled before Israel, and David killed seven thousand of their charioteers and forty thousand of their foot soldiers. He also killed Shophach the commander of their army."
1CH	19	19	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15038	" {19} When the vassals of Hadadezer saw that they had been defeated by Israel, they made peace with David and became subject to him."
1CH	19	19	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15039	 So the Arameans were not willing to help the Ammonites anymore.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
1CH	20	<<	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15040	1 CHRONICLES 20
1CH	20	1	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15041	" {1} In the spring, at the time when kings go off to war, Joab led out the armed forces."
1CH	20	1	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15042	" He laid waste the land of the Ammonites and went to Rabbah and besieged it, but David remained in Jerusalem. Joab attacked Rabbah and left it in ruins."
1CH	20	2	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15043	" {2} David took the crown from the head of their king--its weight was found to be a talent of gold, and it was set with precious stones--and it was placed on David's head."
1CH	20	2	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15044	" He took a great quantity of plunder from the city {3} and brought out the people who were there, consigning them to labor with saws and with iron picks and axes."
1CH	20	3	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15045	 David did this to all the Ammonite towns. Then David and his entire army returned to Jerusalem.
1CH	20	4	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15046	" {4} In the course of time, war broke out with the Philistines, at Gezer."
1CH	20	4	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15047	" At that time Sibbecai the Hushathite killed Sippai, one of the descendants of the Rephaites, and the Philistines were subjugated."

1CH	20	6	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15049	" {6} In still another battle, which took place at Gath, there was a huge man with six fingers on each hand and six toes on each foot--twenty-four in all. He also was descended from Rapha."
