1CH	21	<<	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15052	1 CHRONICLES 21
1CH	21	1	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15053	" {1} Satan rose up against Israel and incited David to take a census of Israel. {2} So David said to Joab and the commanders of the troops,"
1CH	21	2	David	#07		15054	 << Go and count the Israelites from Beersheba to Dan. Then report back to me so that I may know how many there are.>>
1CH	21	3	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15055	" {3} But Joab replied,"
1CH	21	3	Joab	#08		15056	 << May the Lord multiply his troops a hundred times over.
1CH	21	3	Joab	#08		15057	" My lord the king, are they not all my lord's subjects?"
1CH	21	3	Joab	#08		15058	 Why does my lord want to do this? Why should he bring guilt on Israel?>>
1CH	21	4	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15059	" {4} The king's word, however, overruled Joab; so Joab left and went throughout Israel and then came back to Jerusalem."
1CH	21	5	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15060	 {5} Joab reported the number of the fighting men to David:
1CH	21	5	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15061	" In all Israel there were one million one hundred thousand men who could handle a sword, including four hundred and seventy thousand in Judah."
1CH	21	6	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15062	" {6} But Joab did not include Levi and Benjamin in the numbering, because the king's command was repulsive to him."
1CH	21	7	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15063	" {7} This command was also evil in the sight of God; so he punished Israel. {8} Then David said to God,"
1CH	21	8	David	#07		15064	" << I have sinned greatly by doing this. Now, I beg you, take away the guilt of your servant. I have done a very foolish thing.>>"
1CH	21	9	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15065	" {9} The Lord said to Gad, David's seer,"
1CH	21	10	God-FX1	#20		15066	" {10} << Go and tell David, 'This is what the Lord says: I am giving you three options. Choose one of them for me to carry out against you.'<<"
1CH	21	11	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15067	" {11} So Gad went to David and said to him,"
1CH	21	11	Gad	#18		15068	" << This is what the Lord says: 'Take your choice: {12} three years of famine,"
1CH	21	12	Gad	#18		15069	" three months of being swept away before your enemies, with their swords overtaking you,"
1CH	21	12	Gad	#18		15070	" or three days of the sword of the Lord--days of plague in the land, with the angel of the Lord ravaging every part of Israel.'"
1CH	21	12	Gad	#18		15071	" Now then, decide how I should answer the one who sent me.>>"
1CH	21	13	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15072	" {13} David said to Gad,"
1CH	21	13	David	#07		15073	" << I am in deep distress. Let me fall into the hands of the Lord, for his mercy is very great; but do not let me fall into the hands of men.>>"
1CH	21	14	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15074	" {14} So the Lord sent a plague on Israel, and seventy thousand men of Israel fell dead."
1CH	21	15	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15075	" {15} And God sent an angel to destroy Jerusalem. But as the angel was doing so, the Lord saw it and was grieved because of the calamity and said to the angel who was destroying the people,"
1CH	21	15	God-FX1	#20		15076	 << Enough! Withdraw your hand.>>
1CH	21	15	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15077	 The angel of the Lord was then standing at the threshing floor of Araunah the Jebusite.
1CH	21	16	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15078	" {16} David looked up and saw the angel of the Lord standing between heaven and earth, with a drawn sword in his hand extended over Jerusalem."
1CH	21	16	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15079	" Then David and the elders, clothed in sackcloth, fell facedown. {17} David said to God,"
1CH	21	17	David	#07		15080	 << Was it not I who ordered the fighting men to be counted? I am the one who has sinned and done wrong.
1CH	21	17	David	#07		15081	 These are but sheep. What have they done?
1CH	21	17	David	#07		15082	" O Lord my God, let your hand fall upon me and my family, but do not let this plague remain on your people.>>"
1CH	21	18	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15083	 {18} Then the angel of the Lord ordered Gad to tell David to go up and build an altar to the Lord on the threshing floor of Araunah the Jebusite.
1CH	21	19	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15084	 {19} So David went up in obedience to the word that Gad had spoken in the name of the Lord.
1CH	21	20	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15085	" {20} While Araunah was threshing wheat, he turned and saw the angel; his four sons who were with him hid themselves."
1CH	21	21	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15086	" {21} Then David approached, and when Araunah looked and saw him, he left the threshing floor and bowed down before David with his face to the ground. {22} David said to him,"
1CH	21	22	David	#07		15087	" << Let me have the site of your threshing floor so I can build an altar to the Lord, that the plague on the people may be stopped. Sell it to me at the full price.>>"
1CH	21	23	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15088	" {23} Araunah said to David,"
1CH	21	23	Araunah	#15		15089	 << Take it! Let my lord the king do whatever pleases him.
1CH	21	23	Araunah	#15		15090	" Look, I will give the oxen for the burnt offerings, the threshing sledges for the wood, and the wheat for the grain offering."
1CH	21	23	Araunah	#15		15091	 I will give all this.>>
1CH	21	24	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15092	" {24} But King David replied to Araunah,"
1CH	21	24	David	#07		15093	" << No, I insist on paying the full price. I will not take for the Lord what is yours, or sacrifice a burnt offering that costs me nothing.>>"
1CH	21	25	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15094	 {25} So David paid Araunah six hundred shekels of gold for the site.
1CH	21	26	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15095	 {26} David built an altar to the Lord there and sacrificed burnt offerings and fellowship offerings.
1CH	21	26	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15096	" He called on the Lord, and the Lord answered him with fire from heaven on the altar of burnt offering."
1CH	21	27	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15097	" {27} Then the Lord spoke to the angel, and he put his sword back into its sheath."
1CH	21	28	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15098	" {28} At that time, when David saw that the Lord had answered him on the threshing floor of Araunah the Jebusite, he offered sacrifices there."
1CH	21	29	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15099	" {29} The tabernacle of the Lord, which Moses had made in the desert, and the altar of burnt offering were at that time on the high place at Gibeon."
1CH	21	30	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15100	" {30} But David could not go before it to inquire of God, because he was afraid of the sword of the angel of the Lord.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
1CH	22	<<	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15101	1 CHRONICLES 22
1CH	22	1	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15102	" {1} Then David said,"
1CH	22	1	David	#07		15103	" << The house of the Lord God is to be here, and also the altar of burnt offering for Israel.>>"
1CH	22	2	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15104	" {2} So David gave orders to assemble the aliens living in Israel, and from among them he appointed stonecutters to prepare dressed stone for building the house of God."
1CH	22	3	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15105	" {3} He provided a large amount of iron to make nails for the doors of the gateways and for the fittings, and more bronze than could be weighed."
1CH	22	4	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15106	" {4} He also provided more cedar logs than could be counted, for the Sidonians and Tyrians had brought large numbers of them to David. {5} David said,"
1CH	22	5	David	#07		15107	" << My son Solomon is young and inexperienced,"
1CH	22	5	David	#07		15108	 and the house to be built for the Lord should be of great magnificence and fame and splendor in the sight of all the nations.
1CH	22	5	David	#07		15109	 Therefore I will make preparations for it.>>
1CH	22	5	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15110	 So David made extensive preparations before his death.
1CH	22	6	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15111	" {6} Then he called for his son Solomon and charged him to build a house for the Lord, the God of Israel. {7} David said to Solomon:"
1CH	22	7	David	#07		15112	" << My son, I had it in my heart to build a house for the Name of the Lord my God."
1CH	22	8	David	#07		15113	 {8} But this word of the Lord came to me: 'You have shed much blood and have fought many wars.
1CH	22	8	David	#07		15114	" You are not to build a house for my Name, because you have shed much blood on the earth in my sight."
1CH	22	9	David	#07		15115	" {9} But you will have a son who will be a man of peace and rest, and I will give him rest from all his enemies on every side."
1CH	22	9	David	#07		15116	" His name will be Solomon, and I will grant Israel peace and quiet during his reign."
1CH	22	10	David	#07		15117	" {10} He is the one who will build a house for my Name. He will be my son, and I will be his father. And I will establish the throne of his kingdom over Israel forever.'"
1CH	22	11	David	#07		15118	" {11} << Now, my son, the Lord be with you, and may you have success and build the house of the Lord your God, as he said you would."
1CH	22	12	David	#07		15119	" {12} May the Lord give you discretion and understanding when he puts you in command over Israel, so that you may keep the law of the Lord your God."
1CH	22	13	David	#07		15120	 {13} Then you will have success if you are careful to observe the decrees and laws that the Lord gave Moses for Israel. Be strong and courageous. Do not be afraid or discouraged.
1CH	22	14	David	#07		15121	" {14} << I have taken great pains to provide for the temple of the Lord a hundred thousand talents of gold,"
1CH	22	14	David	#07		15122	" a million talents of silver, quantities of bronze and iron too great to be weighed, and wood and stone. And you may add to them."
1CH	22	15	David	#07		15123	" {15} You have many workmen: stonecutters, masons and carpenters, as well as men skilled in every kind of work {16} in gold and silver, bronze and iron--craftsmen beyond number."
1CH	22	16	David	#07		15124	" Now begin the work, and the Lord be with you.>>"
1CH	22	17	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15125	" {17} Then David ordered all the leaders of Israel to help his son Solomon. He said to them,"
1CH	22	18	David	#07		15126	 {18} << Is not the Lord your God with you? And has he not granted you rest on every side?
1CH	22	18	David	#07		15127	" For he has handed the inhabitants of the land over to me, and the land is subject to the Lord and to his people."
1CH	22	19	David	#07		15128	 {19} Now devote your heart and soul to seeking the Lord your God.
1CH	22	19	David	#07		15129	" Begin to build the sanctuary of the Lord God, so that you may bring the ark of the covenant of the Lord and the sacred articles belonging to God into the temple that will be built for the Name of the Lord.>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
1CH	23	<<	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15130	1 CHRONICLES 23
1CH	23	1	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15131	" {1} When David was old and full of years, he made his son Solomon king over Israel. {2} He also gathered together all the leaders of Israel, as well as the priests and Levites."
1CH	23	3	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15132	" {3} The Levites thirty years old or more were counted, and the total number of men was thirty-eight thousand. {4} David said,"

1CH	23	6	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15135	" {6} David divided the Levites into groups corresponding to the sons of Levi: Gershon, Kohath and Merari."

1CH	23	10	Geneology	#01		15139	" {10} And the sons of Shimei: Jahath, Ziza, Jeush and Beriah. These were the sons of Shimei --four in all."
1CH	23	11	Geneology	#01		15140	" {11} Jahath was the first and Ziza the second, but Jeush and Beriah did not have many sons; so they were counted as one family with one assignment."
1CH	23	12	Geneology	#01		15141	" {12} The sons of Kohath: Amram, Izhar, Hebron and Uzziel --four in all."
1CH	23	13	Geneology	#01		15142	" {13} The sons of Amram: Aaron and Moses. Aaron was set apart, he and his descendants forever, to consecrate the most holy things,"
1CH	23	13	Geneology	#01		15143	" to offer sacrifices before the Lord, to minister before him and to pronounce blessings in his name forever."
1CH	23	14	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15144	 {14} The sons of Moses the man of God were counted as part of the tribe of Levi.
1CH	23	15	Geneology	#01		15145	 {15} The sons of Moses: Gershom and Eliezer. {16} The descendants of Gershom: Shubael was the first.
1CH	23	17	Geneology	#01		15146	" {17} The descendants of Eliezer: Rehabiah was the first. Eliezer had no other sons, but the sons of Rehabiah were very numerous."
1CH	23	18	Geneology	#01		15147	 {18} The sons of Izhar: Shelomith was the first.
1CH	23	19	Geneology	#01		15148	" {19} The sons of Hebron: Jeriah the first, Amariah the second, Jahaziel the third and Jekameam the fourth."
1CH	23	20	Geneology	#01		15149	 {20} The sons of Uzziel: Micah the first and Isshiah the second.
1CH	23	21	Geneology	#01		15150	 {21} The sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi. The sons of Mahli: Eleazar and Kish.
1CH	23	22	Geneology	#01		15151	" {22} Eleazar died without having sons: he had only daughters. Their cousins, the sons of Kish, married them."
1CH	23	23	Geneology	#01		15152	" {23} The sons of Mushi: Mahli, Eder and Jerimoth --three in all."
1CH	23	24	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15153	 {24} These were the descendants of Levi by their families--the heads of families as they were registered according to the number of names of the individuals from twenty years old or more who served in the temple of the Lord.
1CH	23	25	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15154	" {25} For David had said,"
1CH	23	25	David	#07		15155	" << Since the Lord, the God of Israel, has granted rest to his people and has come to dwell in Jerusalem forever,"
1CH	23	26	David	#07		15156	 {26} the Levites no longer need to carry the tabernacle or any of the articles used in its service.>>
1CH	23	27	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15157	" {27} According to the last instructions of David, the Levites were counted from those twenty years old or more."
1CH	23	28	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15158	 {28} The duty of the Levites was to help Aaron's descendants in the service of the temple of the Lord:
1CH	23	28	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15159	" to be in charge of the courtyards, the side rooms, the purification of all sacred things and the performance of other duties at the house of God."
1CH	23	29	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15160	" {29} They were in charge of the bread set out on the table, the flour for the grain offerings, the unleavened wafers, the baking and the mixing, and all measurements of quantity and size."
1CH	23	30	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15161	 {30} They were also to stand every morning to thank and praise the Lord. They were to do the same in the evening
1CH	23	31	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15162	 {31} and whenever burnt offerings were presented to the Lord on Sabbaths and at New Moon festivals and at appointed feasts.
1CH	23	31	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15163	 They were to serve before the Lord regularly in the proper number and in the way prescribed for them.
1CH	23	32	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15164	" {32} And so the Levites carried out their responsibilities for the Tent of Meeting, for the Holy Place and, under their brothers the descendants of Aaron, for the service of the temple of the Lord.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
1CH	24	<<	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15165	1 CHRONICLES 24
1CH	24	1	Geneology	#01		15166	" {1} These were the divisions of the sons of Aaron: The sons of Aaron were Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar."
1CH	24	2	Geneology	#01		15167	" {2} But Nadab and Abihu died before their father did, and they had no sons; so Eleazar and Ithamar served as the priests."
1CH	24	3	Geneology	#01		15168	" {3} With the help of Zadok a descendant of Eleazar and Ahimelech a descendant of Ithamar, David separated them into divisions for their appointed order of ministering."
1CH	24	4	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15169	" {4} A larger number of leaders were found among Eleazar's descendants than among Ithamar's, and they were divided accordingly:"
1CH	24	4	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15170	 sixteen heads of families from Eleazar's descendants and eight heads of families from Ithamar's descendants.
1CH	24	5	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15171	" {5} They divided them impartially by drawing lots, for there were officials of the sanctuary and officials of God among the descendants of both Eleazar and Ithamar."
1CH	24	6	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15172	" {6} The scribe Shemaiah son of Nethanel, a Levite, recorded their names in the presence of the king and of the officials:"
1CH	24	6	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15173	" Zadok the priest, Ahimelech son of Abiathar and the heads of families of the priests and of the Levites--one family being taken from Eleazar and then one from Ithamar."

1CH	24	18	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15185	 {18} the twenty-third to Delaiah and the twenty-fourth to Maaziah.
1CH	24	19	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15186	" {19} This was their appointed order of ministering when they entered the temple of the Lord, according to the regulations prescribed for them by their forefather Aaron, as the Lord, the God of Israel, had commanded him."
1CH	24	20	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15187	 {20} As for the rest of the descendants of Levi: from the sons of Amram: Shubael; from the sons of Shubael: Jehdeiah.
1CH	24	21	Geneology	#01		15188	" {21} As for Rehabiah, from his sons: Isshiah was the first."
1CH	24	22	Geneology	#01		15189	 {22} From the Izharites: Shelomoth; from the sons of Shelomoth: Jahath.
1CH	24	23	Geneology	#01		15190	" {23} The sons of Hebron: Jeriah the first, Amariah the second, Jahaziel the third and Jekameam the fourth."
1CH	24	24	Geneology	#01		15191	 {24} The son of Uzziel: Micah; from the sons of Micah: Shamir.
1CH	24	25	Geneology	#01		15192	 {25} The brother of Micah: Isshiah; from the sons of Isshiah: Zechariah.
1CH	24	26	Geneology	#01		15193	 {26} The sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi. The son of Jaaziah: Beno.
1CH	24	27	Geneology	#01		15194	" {27} The sons of Merari: from Jaaziah: Beno, Shoham, Zaccur and Ibri."
1CH	24	28	Geneology	#01		15195	" {28} From Mahli: Eleazar, who had no sons."
1CH	24	29	Geneology	#01		15196	 {29} From Kish: the son of Kish: Jerahmeel.
1CH	24	30	Geneology	#01		15197	" {30} And the sons of Mushi: Mahli, Eder and Jerimoth. These were the Levites, according to their families."
1CH	24	31	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15198	" {31} They also cast lots, just as their brothers the descendants of Aaron did, in the presence of King David and of Zadok, Ahimelech, and the heads of families of the priests and of the Levites."
1CH	24	31	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15199	 The families of the oldest brother were treated the same as those of the youngest.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
1CH	25	<<	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15200	1 CHRONICLES 25
1CH	25	1	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15201	" {1} David, together with the commanders of the army, set apart some of the sons of Asaph, Heman and Jeduthun for the ministry of prophesying, accompanied by harps, lyres and cymbals."
1CH	25	1	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15202	 Here is the list of the men who performed this service:
1CH	25	2	Geneology	#01		15203	" {2} From the sons of Asaph: Zaccur, Joseph, Nethaniah and Asarelah."
1CH	25	2	Geneology	#01		15204	" The sons of Asaph were under the supervision of Asaph, who prophesied under the king's supervision."
1CH	25	3	Geneology	#01		15205	" {3} As for Jeduthun, from his sons: Gedaliah, Zeri, Jeshaiah,"
1CH	25	3	Geneology	#01		15206	" Shimei, Hashabiah and Mattithiah,"
1CH	25	3	Geneology	#01		15207	" six in all, under the supervision of their father Jeduthun, who prophesied, using the harp in thanking and praising the Lord."

1CH	25	5	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15213	 {5} All these were sons of Heman the king's seer. They were given him through the promises of God to exalt him. God gave Heman fourteen sons and three daughters.

1CH	26	12	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15244	" {12} These divisions of the gatekeepers, through their chief men, had duties for ministering in the temple of the Lord, just as their relatives had."
1CH	26	13	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15245	" {13} Lots were cast for each gate, according to their families, young and old alike."
1CH	26	14	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15246	" {14} The lot for the East Gate fell to Shelemiah. Then lots were cast for his son Zechariah, a wise counselor, and the lot for the North Gate fell to him."
1CH	26	15	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15247	" {15} The lot for the South Gate fell to Obed-Edom, and the lot for the storehouse fell to his sons."
1CH	26	16	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15248	 {16} The lots for the West Gate and the Shalleketh Gate on the upper road fell to Shuppim and Hosah. Guard was alongside of guard:
1CH	26	17	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15249	" {17} There were six Levites a day on the east, four a day on the north, four a day on the south and two at a time at the storehouse."
1CH	26	18	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15250	" {18} As for the court to the west, there were four at the road and two at the court itself."
1CH	26	19	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15251	 {19} These were the divisions of the gatekeepers who were descendants of Korah and Merari.
1CH	26	20	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15252	 {20} Their fellow Levites were in charge of the treasuries of the house of God and the treasuries for the dedicated things.
1CH	26	21	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15253	" {21} The descendants of Ladan, who were Gershonites through Ladan and who were heads of families belonging to Ladan the Gershonite, were Jehieli,"
1CH	26	22	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15254	" {22} the sons of Jehieli, Zetham and his brother Joel. They were in charge of the treasuries of the temple of the Lord."
1CH	26	23	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15255	" {23} From the Amramites, the Izharites, the Hebronites and the Uzzielites:"
1CH	26	24	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15256	" {24} Shubael, a descendant of Gershom son of Moses, was the officer in charge of the treasuries."
1CH	26	25	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15257	" {25} His relatives through Eliezer: Rehabiah his son, Jeshaiah his son, Joram his son, Zicri his son and Shelomith his son."

1CH	26	26	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15259	" by the heads of families who were the commanders of thousands and commanders of hundreds, and by the other army commanders."
1CH	26	27	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15260	 {27} Some of the plunder taken in battle they dedicated for the repair of the temple of the Lord.
1CH	26	28	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15261	" {28} And everything dedicated by Samuel the seer and by Saul son of Kish,"
1CH	26	28	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15262	" Abner son of Ner and Joab son of Zeruiah, and all the other dedicated things were in the care of Shelomith and his relatives."
1CH	26	29	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15263	" {29} From the Izharites: Kenaniah and his sons were assigned duties away from the temple, as officials and judges over Israel."
1CH	26	30	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15264	 {30} From the Hebronites: Hashabiah and his relatives--seventeen hundred able men--were responsible in Israel west of the Jordan for all the work of the Lord and for the king's service.
1CH	26	31	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15265	" {31} As for the Hebronites, Jeriah was their chief according to the genealogical records of their families."
1CH	26	31	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15266	" In the fortieth year of David's reign a search was made in the records, and capable men among the Hebronites were found at Jazer in Gilead."
1CH	26	32	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15267	" {32} Jeriah had twenty-seven hundred relatives, who were able men and heads of families,"
1CH	26	32	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15268	" and King David put them in charge of the Reubenites, the Gadites and the half-tribe of Manasseh for every matter pertaining to God and for the affairs of the king.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
1CH	27	<<	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15269	1 CHRONICLES 27
1CH	27	1	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15270	" {1} This is the list of the Israelites--heads of families, commanders of thousands and commanders of hundreds, and their officers,"
1CH	27	1	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15271	" who served the king in all that concerned the army divisions that were on duty month by month throughout the year. Each division consisted of 24,000 men."
1CH	27	2	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15272	" {2} In charge of the first division, for the first month, was Jashobeam son of Zabdiel. There were 24,000 men in his division."
1CH	27	3	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15273	 {3} He was a descendant of Perez and chief of all the army officers for the first month.
1CH	27	4	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15274	" {4} In charge of the division for the second month was Dodai the Ahohite; Mikloth was the leader of his division. There were 24,000 men in his division."
1CH	27	5	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15275	" {5} The third army commander, for the third month, was Benaiah son of Jehoiada the priest. He was chief and there were 24,000 men in his division."
1CH	27	6	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15276	 {6} This was the Benaiah who was a mighty man among the Thirty and was over the Thirty. His son Ammizabad was in charge of his division.
1CH	27	7	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15277	" {7} The fourth, for the fourth month, was Asahel the brother of Joab; his son Zebadiah was his successor. There were 24,000 men in his division."
1CH	27	8	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15278	" {8} The fifth, for the fifth month, was the commander Shamhuth the Izrahite. There were 24,000 men in his division."

1CH	27	16	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15286	 {16} The officers over the tribes of Israel: over the Reubenites: Eliezer son of Zicri;
1CH	27	16	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15287	 over the Simeonites: Shephatiah son of Maacah;

1CH	27	22	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15299	 These were the officers over the tribes of Israel.
1CH	27	23	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15300	" {23} David did not take the number of the men twenty years old or less, because the Lord had promised to make Israel as numerous as the stars in the sky."
1CH	27	24	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15301	" {24} Joab son of Zeruiah began to count the men but did not finish. Wrath came on Israel on account of this numbering, and the number was not entered in the book of the annals of King David."
1CH	27	25	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15302	 {25} Azmaveth son of Adiel was in charge of the royal storehouses.
1CH	27	25	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15303	" Jonathan son of Uzziah was in charge of the storehouses in the outlying districts, in the towns, the villages and the watchtowers."
1CH	27	26	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15304	 {26} Ezri son of Kelub was in charge of the field workers who farmed the land.
1CH	27	27	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15305	 {27} Shimei the Ramathite was in charge of the vineyards.
1CH	27	27	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15306	 Zabdi the Shiphmite was in charge of the produce of the vineyards for the wine vats.
1CH	27	28	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15307	 {28} Baal-Hanan the Gederite was in charge of the olive and sycamore-fig trees in the western foothills.
1CH	27	28	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15308	 Joash was in charge of the supplies of olive oil.
1CH	27	29	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15309	 {29} Shitrai the Sharonite was in charge of the herds grazing in Sharon.
1CH	27	29	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15310	 Shaphat son of Adlai was in charge of the herds in the valleys.
1CH	27	30	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15311	 {30} Obil the Ishmaelite was in charge of the camels.
1CH	27	30	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15312	 Jehdeiah the Meronothite was in charge of the donkeys.
1CH	27	31	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15313	 {31} Jaziz the Hagrite was in charge of the flocks. All these were the officials in charge of King David's property.
1CH	27	32	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15314	" {32} Jonathan, David's uncle, was a counselor, a man of insight and a scribe."
1CH	27	32	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15315	 Jehiel son of Hacmoni took care of the king's sons.
1CH	27	33	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15316	 {33} Ahithophel was the king's counselor. Hushai the Arkite was the king's friend.
1CH	27	34	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15317	 {34} Ahithophel was succeeded by Jehoiada son of Benaiah and by Abiathar.
1CH	27	34	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15318	 Joab was the commander of the royal army.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
1CH	28	<<	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15319	1 CHRONICLES 28
1CH	28	1	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15320	 {1} David summoned all the officials of Israel to assemble at Jerusalem:
1CH	28	1	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15321	" the officers over the tribes, the commanders of the divisions in the service of the king, the commanders of thousands and commanders of hundreds,"
1CH	28	1	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15322	" and the officials in charge of all the property and livestock belonging to the king and his sons, together with the palace officials, the mighty men and all the brave warriors."
1CH	28	2	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15323	 {2} King David rose to his feet and said:
1CH	28	2	David	#07		15324	" << Listen to me, my brothers and my people."
1CH	28	2	David	#07		15325	" I had it in my heart to build a house as a place of rest for the ark of the covenant of the Lord, for the footstool of our God, and I made plans to build it."
1CH	28	3	David	#07		15326	" {3} But God said to me, 'You are not to build a house for my Name, because you are a warrior and have shed blood.'"
1CH	28	4	David	#07		15327	" {4} << Yet the Lord, the God of Israel, chose me from my whole family to be king over Israel forever."
1CH	28	4	David	#07		15328	" He chose Judah as leader, and from the house of Judah he chose my family, and from my father's sons he was pleased to make me king over all Israel."
1CH	28	5	David	#07		15329	 {5} Of all my sons--and the Lord has given me many--he has chosen my son Solomon to sit on the throne of the kingdom of the Lord over Israel.
1CH	28	6	David	#07		15330	" {6} He said to me: 'Solomon your son is the one who will build my house and my courts, for I have chosen him to be my son, and I will be his father."
1CH	28	7	David	#07		15331	" {7} I will establish his kingdom forever if he is unswerving in carrying out my commands and laws, as is being done at this time.'"
1CH	28	8	David	#07		15332	" {8} << So now I charge you in the sight of all Israel and of the assembly of the Lord, and in the hearing of our God:"
1CH	28	8	David	#07		15333	" Be careful to follow all the commands of the Lord your God, that you may possess this good land and pass it on as an inheritance to your descendants forever."
1CH	28	9	David	#07		15334	" {9} << And you, my son Solomon, acknowledge the God of your father, and serve him with wholehearted devotion and with a willing mind, "
1CH	28	9	David	#07		15335	" for the Lord searches every heart and understands every motive behind the thoughts. If you seek him, he will be found by you; but if you forsake him, he will reject you forever."
1CH	28	10	David	#07		15336	" {10} Consider now, for the Lord has chosen you to build a temple as a sanctuary. Be strong and do the work.>>"
1CH	28	11	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15337	" {11} Then David gave his son Solomon the plans for the portico of the temple, its buildings, its storerooms, its upper parts, its inner rooms and the place of atonement."
1CH	28	12	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15338	" {12} He gave him the plans of all that the Spirit had put in his mind for the courts of the temple of the Lord and all the surrounding rooms,"
1CH	28	12	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15339	 for the treasuries of the temple of God and for the treasuries for the dedicated things.
1CH	28	13	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15340	" {13} He gave him instructions for the divisions of the priests and Levites, and for all the work of serving in the temple of the Lord, as well as for all the articles to be used in its service."
1CH	28	14	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15341	" {14} He designated the weight of gold for all the gold articles to be used in various kinds of service, and the weight of silver for all the silver articles to be used in various kinds of service:"
1CH	28	15	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15342	" {15} the weight of gold for the gold lampstands and their lamps, with the weight for each lampstand and its lamps;"
1CH	28	15	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15343	" and the weight of silver for each silver lampstand and its lamps, according to the use of each lampstand;"
1CH	28	16	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15344	 {16} the weight of gold for each table for consecrated bread; the weight of silver for the silver tables;
1CH	28	17	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15345	" {17} the weight of pure gold for the forks, sprinkling bowls and pitchers; the weight of gold for each gold dish; the weight of silver for each silver dish;"
1CH	28	18	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15346	 {18} and the weight of the refined gold for the altar of incense.
1CH	28	18	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15347	" He also gave him the plan for the chariot, that is, the cherubim of gold that spread their wings and shelter the ark of the covenant of the Lord. {19} David said,"
1CH	28	19	David	#07		15348	" << All this. I have in writing from the hand of the Lord upon me, and he gave me understanding in all the details of the plan.>>"
1CH	28	20	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15349	" {20} David also said to Solomon his son,"
1CH	28	20	David	#07		15350	" << Be strong and courageous, and do the work. Do not be afraid or discouraged, for the Lord God, my God, is with you."
1CH	28	20	David	#07		15351	 He will not fail you or forsake you until all the work for the service of the temple of the Lord is finished.
1CH	28	21	David	#07		15352	" {21} The divisions of the priests and Levites are ready for all the work on the temple of God, and every willing man skilled in any craft will help you in all the work."
1CH	28	21	David	#07		15353	 The officials and all the people will obey your every command.>> *~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
1CH	29	<<	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15354	1 CHRONICLES 29
1CH	29	1	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15355	 {1} Then King David said to the whole assembly:
1CH	29	1	David	#07		15356	" << My son Solomon, the one whom God has chosen, is young and inexperienced. The task is great, because this palatial structure is not for man but for the Lord God."
1CH	29	2	David	#07		15357	" {2} With all my resources I have provided for the temple of my God--gold for the gold work, silver for the silver, bronze for the bronze, iron for the iron and wood for the wood,"
1CH	29	2	David	#07		15358	" as well as onyx for the settings, turquoise, stones of various colors, and all kinds of fine stone and marble--all of these in large quantities."
1CH	29	3	David	#07		15359	" {3} Besides, in my devotion to the temple of my God I now give my personal treasures of gold and silver for the temple of my God, over and above everything I have provided for this holy temple:"
1CH	29	4	David	#07		15360	" {4} three thousand talents of gold (gold of Ophir ) and seven thousand talents of refined silver, for the overlaying of the walls of the buildings,"
1CH	29	5	David	#07		15361	" {5} for the gold work and the silver work, and for all the work to be done by the craftsmen. Now, who is willing to consecrate himself today to the Lord?>>"
1CH	29	6	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15362	" {6} Then the leaders of families, the officers of the tribes of Israel, the commanders of thousands and commanders of hundreds, and the officials in charge of the king's work gave willingly."
1CH	29	7	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15363	" {7} They gave toward the work on the temple of God five thousand talents and ten thousand darics of gold, ten thousand talents of silver, eighteen thousand talents of bronze and a hundred thousand talents of iron."
1CH	29	8	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15364	 {8} Any who had precious stones gave them to the treasury of the temple of the Lord in the custody of Jehiel the Gershonite.
1CH	29	9	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15365	" {9} The people rejoiced at the willing response of their leaders, for they had given freely and wholeheartedly to the Lord. David the king also rejoiced greatly."
1CH	29	10	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15366	" {10} David praised the Lord in the presence of the whole assembly, saying,"
1CH	29	10	David	#07		15367	" << Praise be to you, O Lord, God of our father Israel, from everlasting to everlasting."
1CH	29	11	David	#07		15368	" {11} Yours, O Lord, is the greatness and the power and the glory and the majesty and the splendor, for everything in heaven and earth is yours."
1CH	29	11	David	#07		15369	" Yours, O Lord, is the kingdom; you are exalted as head over all."
1CH	29	12	David	#07		15370	 {12} Wealth and honor come from you; you are the ruler of all things. In your hands are strength and power to exalt and give strength to all.
1CH	29	13	David	#07		15371	" {13} Now, our God, we give you thanks, and praise your glorious name."
1CH	29	14	David	#07		15372	" {14} << But who am I, and who are my people, that we should be able to give as generously as this? Everything comes from you, and we have given you only what comes from your hand."
1CH	29	15	David	#07		15373	" {15} We are aliens and strangers in your sight, as were all our forefathers. Our days on earth are like a shadow, without hope."
1CH	29	16	David	#07		15374	" {16} O Lord our God, as for all this abundance that we have provided for building you a temple for your Holy Name, it comes from your hand, and all of it belongs to you."
1CH	29	17	David	#07		15375	" {17} I know, my God, that you test the heart and are pleased with integrity. All these things have I given willingly and with honest intent."
1CH	29	17	David	#07		15376	 And now I have seen with joy how willingly your people who are here have given to you.
1CH	29	18	David	#07		15377	" {18} O Lord, God of our fathers Abraham, Isaac and Israel, keep this desire in the hearts of your people forever, and keep their hearts loyal to you."
1CH	29	19	David	#07		15378	" {19} And give my son Solomon the wholehearted devotion to keep your commands, requirements and decrees and to do everything to build the palatial structure for which I have provided.>>"
1CH	29	20	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15379	" {20} Then David said to the whole assembly,"
1CH	29	20	David	#07		15380	 << Praise the Lord your God.>>
1CH	29	20	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15381	" So they all praised the Lord, the God of their fathers; they bowed low and fell prostrate before the Lord and the king."
1CH	29	21	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15382	 {21} The next day they made sacrifices to the Lord and presented burnt offerings to him:
1CH	29	21	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15383	" a thousand bulls, a thousand rams and a thousand male lambs, together with their drink offerings, and other sacrifices in abundance for all Israel."
1CH	29	22	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15384	 {22} They ate and drank with great joy in the presence of the Lord that day.
1CH	29	22	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15385	" Then they acknowledged Solomon son of David as king a second time, anointing him before the Lord to be ruler and Zadok to be priest."
1CH	29	23	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15386	 {23} So Solomon sat on the throne of the Lord as king in place of his father David. He prospered and all Israel obeyed him.
1CH	29	24	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15387	" {24} All the officers and mighty men, as well as all of King David's sons, pledged their submission to King Solomon."
1CH	29	25	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15388	 {25} The Lord highly exalted Solomon in the sight of all Israel and bestowed on him royal splendor such as no king over Israel ever had before.
1CH	29	26	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15389	 {26} David son of Jesse was king over all Israel. {27} He ruled over Israel forty years--seven in Hebron and thirty-three in Jerusalem.
1CH	29	28	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15390	" {28} He died at a good old age, having enjoyed long life, wealth and honor. His son Solomon succeeded him as king."
1CH	29	29	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15391	" {29} As for the events of King David's reign, from beginning to end,"
1CH	29	29	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15392	" they are written in the records of Samuel the seer, the records of Nathan the prophet and the records of Gad the seer,"
1CH	29	30	Narr_13: 1_Chronicles	#05		15393	" {30} together with the details of his reign and power, and the circumstances that surrounded him and Israel and the kingdoms of all the other lands. *~**~*||||| + 5 SECs |||||*~*"

2CH	1	5	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15399	" {5} But the bronze altar that Bezalel son of Uri, the son of Hur, had made was in Gibeon in front of the tabernacle of the Lord; so Solomon and the assembly inquired of him there."
2CH	1	6	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15400	" {6} Solomon went up to the bronze altar before the Lord in the Tent of Meeting and offered a thousand burnt offerings on it. {7} That night God appeared to Solomon and said to him,"
2CH	1	7	God-FX1	#20		15401	 << Ask for whatever you want me to give you.>>
2CH	1	8	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15402	" {8} Solomon answered God,"
2CH	1	8	Solomon	#10		15403	 << You have shown great kindness to David my father and have made me king in his place.
2CH	1	9	Solomon	#10		15404	" {9} Now, Lord God, let your promise to my father David be confirmed, for you have made me king over a people who are as numerous as the dust of the earth."
2CH	1	10	Solomon	#10		15405	" {10} Give me wisdom and knowledge, that I may lead this people, for who is able to govern this great people of yours?>>"
2CH	1	11	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15406	" {11} God said to Solomon,"
2CH	1	11	God-FX1	#20		15407	" << Since this is your heart's desire and you have not asked for wealth, riches or honor, nor for the death of your enemies,"
2CH	1	11	God-FX1	#20		15408	" and since you have not asked for a long life but for wisdom and knowledge to govern my people over whom I have made you king,"
2CH	1	12	God-FX1	#20		15409	" {12} therefore wisdom and knowledge will be given you. And I will also give you wealth, riches and honor, such as no king who was before you ever had and none after you will have.>>"
2CH	1	13	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15410	" {13} Then Solomon went to Jerusalem from the high place at Gibeon, from before the Tent of Meeting. And he reigned over Israel."
2CH	1	14	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15411	" {14} Solomon accumulated chariots and horses; he had fourteen hundred chariots and twelve thousand horses, which he kept in the chariot cities and also with him in Jerusalem."
2CH	1	15	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15412	" {15} The king made silver and gold as common in Jerusalem as stones, and cedar as plentiful as sycamore-fig trees in the foothills."
2CH	1	16	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15413	 {16} Solomon's horses were imported from Egypt and from Kue --the royal merchants purchased them from Kue.
2CH	1	17	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15414	" {17} They imported a chariot from Egypt for six hundred shekels of silver, and a horse for a hundred and fifty."
2CH	1	17	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15415	 They also exported them to all the kings of the Hittites and of the Arameans.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
2CH	2	<<	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15416	2 CHRONICLES 2
2CH	2	1	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15417	 {1} Solomon gave orders to build a temple for the Name of the Lord and a royal palace for himself.
2CH	2	2	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15418	 {2} He conscripted seventy thousand men as carriers and eighty thousand as stonecutters in the hills and thirty-six hundred as foremen over them.
2CH	2	3	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15419	 {3} Solomon sent this message to Hiram king of Tyre:
2CH	2	3	Solomon	#10		15420	 << Send me cedar logs as you did for my father David when you sent him cedar to build a palace to live in.
2CH	2	4	Solomon	#10		15421	" {4} Now I am about to build a temple for the Name of the Lord my God and to dedicate it to him for burning fragrant incense before him, for setting out the consecrated bread regularly,"
2CH	2	4	Solomon	#10		15422	 and for making burnt offerings every morning and evening and on Sabbaths and New Moons and at the appointed feasts of the Lord our God. This is a lasting ordinance for Israel.
2CH	2	5	Solomon	#10		15423	" {5} << The temple I am going to build will be great, because our God is greater than all other gods."
2CH	2	6	Solomon	#10		15424	" {6} But who is able to build a temple for him, since the heavens, even the highest heavens, cannot contain him?"
2CH	2	6	Solomon	#10		15425	" Who then am I to build a temple for him, except as a place to burn sacrifices before him?"
2CH	2	7	Solomon	#10		15426	" {7} << Send me, therefore, a man skilled to work in gold and silver, bronze and iron, and in purple, crimson and blue yarn,"
2CH	2	7	Solomon	#10		15427	" and experienced in the art of engraving, to work in Judah and Jerusalem with my skilled craftsmen, whom my father David provided."
2CH	2	8	Solomon	#10		15428	" {8} << Send me also cedar, pine and algum logs from Lebanon, for I know that your men are skilled in cutting timber there."
2CH	2	8	Solomon	#10		15429	" My men will work with yours {9} to provide me with plenty of lumber, because the temple I build must be large and magnificent."
2CH	2	10	Solomon	#10		15430	" {10} I will give your servants, the woodsmen who cut the timber, twenty thousand cors of ground wheat, twenty thousand cors of barley, twenty thousand baths of wine and twenty thousand baths of olive oil.>>"
2CH	2	11	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15431	 {11} Hiram king of Tyre replied by letter to Solomon:
2CH	2	11	Hiram	#01		15432	" << Because the Lord loves his people, he has made you their king.>>"

2CH	2	12	Hiram	#01		15435	" He has given King David a wise son, endowed with intelligence and discernment, who will build a temple for the Lord and a palace for himself."
2CH	2	13	Hiram	#01		15436	" {13} << I am sending you Huram-Abi, a man of great skill, {14} whose mother was from Dan and whose father was from Tyre."
2CH	2	14	Hiram	#01		15437	" He is trained to work in gold and silver, bronze and iron, stone and wood, and with purple and blue and crimson yarn and fine linen."
2CH	2	14	Hiram	#01		15438	 He is experienced in all kinds of engraving and can execute any design given to him.
2CH	2	14	Hiram	#01		15439	" He will work with your craftsmen and with those of my lord, David your father."

2CH	2	17	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15443	" {17} Solomon took a census of all the aliens who were in Israel, after the census his father David had taken; and they were found to be 153,600."
2CH	2	18	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15444	" {18} He assigned 70,000 of them to be carriers and 80,000 to be stonecutters in the hills, with 3,600 foremen over them to keep the people working.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
2CH	3	<<	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15445	2 CHRONICLES 3
2CH	3	1	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15446	" {1} Then Solomon began to build the temple of the Lord in Jerusalem on Mount Moriah, where the Lord had appeared to his father David."
2CH	3	1	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15447	" It was on the threshing floor of Araunah the Jebusite, the place provided by David."
2CH	3	2	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15448	 {2} He began building on the second day of the second month in the fourth year of his reign.
2CH	3	3	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15449	 {3} The foundation Solomon laid for building the temple of God was sixty cubits long and twenty cubits wide (using the cubit of the old standard).
2CH	3	4	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15450	 {4} The portico at the front of the temple was twenty cubits long across the width of the building and twenty cubits high. He overlaid the inside with pure gold.
2CH	3	5	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15451	 {5} He paneled the main hall with pine and covered it with fine gold and decorated it with palm tree and chain designs.
2CH	3	6	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15452	 {6} He adorned the temple with precious stones. And the gold he used was gold of Parvaim.
2CH	3	7	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15453	" {7} He overlaid the ceiling beams, doorframes, walls and doors of the temple with gold, and he carved cherubim on the walls."
2CH	3	8	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15454	" {8} He built the Most Holy Place, its length corresponding to the width of the temple--twenty cubits long and twenty cubits wide."
2CH	3	8	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15455	 He overlaid the inside with six hundred talents of fine gold. {9} The gold nails weighed fifty shekels. He also overlaid the upper parts with gold.
2CH	3	10	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15456	 {10} In the Most Holy Place he made a pair of sculptured cherubim and overlaid them with gold. {11} The total wingspan of the cherubim was twenty cubits.
2CH	3	11	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15457	" One wing of the first cherub was five cubits long and touched the temple wall, while its other wing, also five cubits long, touched the wing of the other cherub."
2CH	3	12	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15458	" {12} Similarly one wing of the second cherub was five cubits long and touched the other temple wall, and its other wing, also five cubits long, touched the wing of the first cherub."
2CH	3	13	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15459	" {13} The wings of these cherubim extended twenty cubits. They stood on their feet, facing the main hall."
2CH	3	14	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15460	" {14} He made the curtain of blue, purple and crimson yarn and fine linen, with cherubim worked into it."
2CH	3	15	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15461	" {15} In the front of the temple he made two pillars, which together were thirty-five cubits long, each with a capital on top measuring five cubits."
2CH	3	16	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15462	 {16} He made interwoven chains and put them on top of the pillars. He also made a hundred pomegranates and attached them to the chains.
2CH	3	17	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15463	" {17} He erected the pillars in the front of the temple, one to the south and one to the north. The one to the south he named Jakin and the one to the north Boaz.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
2CH	4	<<	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15464	2 CHRONICLES 4
2CH	4	1	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15465	" {1} He made a bronze altar twenty cubits long, twenty cubits wide and ten cubits high."
2CH	4	2	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15466	" {2} He made the Sea of cast metal, circular in shape, measuring ten cubits from rim to rim and five cubits high. It took a line of thirty cubits to measure around it."
2CH	4	3	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15467	" {3} Below the rim, figures of bulls encircled it--ten to a cubit. The bulls were cast in two rows in one piece with the Sea."
2CH	4	4	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15468	" {4} The Sea stood on twelve bulls, three facing north, three facing west, three facing south and three facing east."
2CH	4	4	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15469	" The Sea rested on top of them, and their hindquarters were toward the center."
2CH	4	5	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15470	" {5} It was a handbreadth in thickness, and its rim was like the rim of a cup, like a lily blossom. It held three thousand baths."
2CH	4	6	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15471	 {6} He then made ten basins for washing and placed five on the south side and five on the north.
2CH	4	6	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15472	" In them the things to be used for the burnt offerings were rinsed, but the Sea was to be used by the priests for washing."
2CH	4	7	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15473	" {7} He made ten gold lampstands according to the specifications for them and placed them in the temple, five on the south side and five on the north."
2CH	4	8	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15474	" {8} He made ten tables and placed them in the temple, five on the south side and five on the north. He also made a hundred gold sprinkling bowls."
2CH	4	9	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15475	" {9} He made the courtyard of the priests, and the large court and the doors for the court, and overlaid the doors with bronze."
2CH	4	10	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15476	" {10} He placed the Sea on the south side, at the southeast corner."
2CH	4	11	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15477	 {11} He also made the pots and shovels and sprinkling bowls. So Huram finished the work he had undertaken for King Solomon in the temple of God:
2CH	4	12	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15478	 {12} the two pillars; the two bowl-shaped capitals on top of the pillars; the two sets of network decorating the two bowl-shaped capitals on top of the pillars;
2CH	4	13	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15479	" {13} the four hundred pomegranates for the two sets of network (two rows of pomegranates for each network, decorating the bowl-shaped capitals on top of the pillars);"
2CH	4	14	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15480	 {14} the stands with their basins; {15} the Sea and the twelve bulls under it;
2CH	4	16	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15481	" {16} the pots, shovels, meat forks and all related articles. All the objects that Huram-Abi made for King Solomon for the temple of the Lord were of polished bronze."
2CH	4	17	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15482	 {17} The king had them cast in clay molds in the plain of the Jordan between Succoth and Zarethan.
2CH	4	18	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15483	 {18} All these things that Solomon made amounted to so much that the weight of the bronze was not determined.
2CH	4	19	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15484	 {19} Solomon also made all the furnishings that were in God's temple: the golden altar; the tables on which was the bread of the Presence;
2CH	4	20	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15485	" {20} the lampstands of pure gold with their lamps, to burn in front of the inner sanctuary as prescribed; {21} the gold floral work and lamps and tongs (they were solid gold);"
2CH	4	22	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15486	" {22} the pure gold wick trimmers, sprinkling bowls, dishes and censers; and the gold doors of the temple: the inner doors to the Most Holy Place and the doors of the main hall.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
2CH	5	<<	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15487	2 CHRONICLES 5
2CH	5	1	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15488	" {1} When all the work Solomon had done for the temple of the Lord was finished, he brought in the things his father David had dedicated--"
2CH	5	1	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15489	 the silver and gold and all the furnishings--and he placed them in the treasuries of God's temple.
2CH	5	2	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15490	" {2} Then Solomon summoned to Jerusalem the elders of Israel, all the heads of the tribes and the chiefs of the Israelite families, to bring up the ark of the Lord's covenant from Zion, the City of David."
2CH	5	3	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15491	 {3} And all the men of Israel came together to the king at the time of the festival in the seventh month.
2CH	5	4	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15492	" {4} When all the elders of Israel had arrived, the Levites took up the ark, {5} and they brought up the ark and the Tent of Meeting and all the sacred furnishings in it."
2CH	5	5	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15493	" The priests, who were Levites, carried them up;"
2CH	5	6	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15494	" {6} and King Solomon and the entire assembly of Israel that had gathered about him were before the ark, sacrificing so many sheep and cattle that they could not be recorded or counted."
2CH	5	7	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15495	" {7} The priests then brought the ark of the Lord's covenant to its place in the inner sanctuary of the temple, the Most Holy Place, and put it beneath the wings of the cherubim."
2CH	5	8	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15496	 {8} The cherubim spread their wings over the place of the ark and covered the ark and its carrying poles.
2CH	5	9	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15497	" {9} These poles were so long that their ends, extending from the ark, could be seen from in front of the inner sanctuary, but not from outside the Holy Place; and they are still there today."
2CH	5	10	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15498	" {10} There was nothing in the ark except the two tablets that Moses had placed in it at Horeb, where the Lord made a covenant with the Israelites after they came out of Egypt."
2CH	5	11	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15499	" {11} The priests then withdrew from the Holy Place. All the priests who were there had consecrated themselves, regardless of their divisions."
2CH	5	12	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15500	" {12} All the Levites who were musicians--Asaph, Heman, Jeduthun and their sons and relatives--stood on the east side of the altar, dressed in fine linen and playing cymbals, harps and lyres."
2CH	5	12	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15501	 They were accompanied by 120 priests sounding trumpets.
2CH	5	13	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15502	" {13} The trumpeters and singers joined in unison, as with one voice, to give praise and thanks to the Lord."
2CH	5	13	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15503	" Accompanied by trumpets, cymbals and other instruments, they raised their voices in praise to the Lord and sang:"
2CH	5	13	Man in Crowd	#16		15504	 <<He is good; his love endures forever.>>
2CH	5	13	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15505	" Then the temple of the Lord was filled with a cloud,"
2CH	5	14	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15506	" {14} and the priests could not perform their service because of the cloud, for the glory of the Lord filled the temple of God.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
2CH	6	<<	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15507	2 CHRONICLES 6
2CH	6	1	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15508	" {1} Then Solomon said,"
2CH	6	1	Solomon	#10		15509	" << The Lord has said that he would dwell in a dark cloud; {2} I have built a magnificent temple for you, a place for you to dwell forever.>>"
2CH	6	3	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15510	" {3} While the whole assembly of Israel was standing there, the king turned around and blessed them. {4} Then he said:"
2CH	6	4	Solomon	#10		15511	" << Praise be to the Lord, the God of Israel, who with his hands has fulfilled what he promised with his mouth to my father David."
2CH	6	5	Solomon	#10		15512	" {5} For he said, 'Since the day I brought my people out of Egypt, I have not chosen a city in any tribe of Israel to have a temple built for my Name to be there, nor have I chosen anyone to be the leader over my people Israel."
2CH	6	6	Solomon	#10		15513	" {6} But now I have chosen Jerusalem for my Name to be there, and I have chosen David to rule my people Israel.'"
2CH	6	7	Solomon	#10		15514	" {7} << My father David had it in his heart to build a temple for the Name of the Lord, the God of Israel."
2CH	6	8	Solomon	#10		15515	" {8} But the Lord said to my father David, 'Because it was in your heart to build a temple for my Name, you did well to have this in your heart."
2CH	6	9	Solomon	#10		15516	" {9} Nevertheless, you are not the one to build the temple, but your son, who is your own flesh and blood--he is the one who will build the temple for my Name.'"
2CH	6	10	Solomon	#10		15517	 {10} << The Lord has kept the promise he made.
2CH	6	10	Solomon	#10		15518	" I have succeeded David my father and now I sit on the throne of Israel, just as the Lord promised, and I have built the temple for the Name of the Lord, the God of Israel."
2CH	6	11	Solomon	#10		15519	" {11} There I have placed the ark, in which is the covenant of the Lord that he made with the people of Israel.>>"
2CH	6	12	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15520	 {12} Then Solomon stood before the altar of the Lord in front of the whole assembly of Israel and spread out his hands.
2CH	6	13	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15521	" {13} Now he had made a bronze platform, five cubits long, five cubits wide and three cubits high, and had placed it in the center of the outer court."
2CH	6	13	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15522	 He stood on the platform and then knelt down before the whole assembly of Israel and spread out his hands toward heaven. {14} He said:
2CH	6	14	Solomon	#10		15523	" << O Lord, God of Israel, there is no God like you in heaven or on earth--you who keep your covenant of love with your servants who continue wholeheartedly in your way."
2CH	6	15	Solomon	#10		15524	 {15} You have kept your promise to your servant David my father; with your mouth you have promised and with your hand you have fulfilled it--as it is today.
2CH	6	16	Solomon	#10		15525	" {16} << Now Lord, God of Israel, keep for your servant David my father the promises you made to him when you said,"
2CH	6	16	Solomon	#10		15526	" You shall never fail to have a man to sit before me on the throne of Israel, if only your sons are careful in all they do to walk before me according to my law, as you have done.'"
2CH	6	17	Solomon	#10		15527	" {17} And now, O Lord, God of Israel, let your word that you promised your servant David come true."
2CH	6	18	Solomon	#10		15528	" {18} << But will God really dwell on earth with men? The heavens, even the highest heavens, cannot contain you. How much less this temple I have built!"
2CH	6	19	Solomon	#10		15529	" {19} Yet give attention to your servant's prayer and his plea for mercy, O Lord my God. Hear the cry and the prayer that your servant is praying in your presence."
2CH	6	20	Solomon	#10		15530	" {20} May your eyes be open toward this temple day and night, this place of which you said you would put your Name there. May you hear the prayer your servant prays toward this place."
2CH	6	21	Solomon	#10		15531	" {21} Hear the supplications of your servant and of your people Israel when they pray toward this place. Hear from heaven, your dwelling place; and when you hear, forgive."
2CH	6	22	Solomon	#10		15532	" {22} << When a man wrongs his neighbor and is required to take an oath and he comes and swears the oath before your altar in this temple,"
2CH	6	23	Solomon	#10		15533	" {23} then hear from heaven and act. Judge between your servants, repaying the guilty by bringing down on his own head what he has done."
2CH	6	23	Solomon	#10		15534	 Declare the innocent not guilty and so establish his innocence.
2CH	6	24	Solomon	#10		15535	" {24} << When your people Israel have been defeated by an enemy because they have sinned against you and when they turn back and confess your name, praying and making supplication before you in this temple,"
2CH	6	25	Solomon	#10		15536	 {25} then hear from heaven and forgive the sin of your people Israel and bring them back to the land you gave to them and their fathers.
2CH	6	26	Solomon	#10		15537	" {26} << When the heavens are shut up and there is no rain because your people have sinned against you,"
2CH	6	26	Solomon	#10		15538	" and when they pray toward this place and confess your name and turn from their sin because you have afflicted them,"
2CH	6	27	Solomon	#10		15539	" {27} then hear from heaven and forgive the sin of your servants, your people Israel."
2CH	6	27	Solomon	#10		15540	" Teach them the right way to live, and send rain on the land you gave your people for an inheritance."
2CH	6	28	Solomon	#10		15541	" {28} << When famine or plague comes to the land, or blight or mildew, locusts or grasshoppers, or when enemies besiege them in any of their cities, whatever disaster or disease may come,"
2CH	6	29	Solomon	#10		15542	" {29} and when a prayer or plea is made by any of your people Israel --each one aware of his afflictions and pains, and spreading out his hands toward this temple--"
2CH	6	30	Solomon	#10		15543	" {30} then hear from heaven, your dwelling place."
2CH	6	30	Solomon	#10		15544	" Forgive, and deal with each man according to all he does, since you know his heart (for you alone know the hearts of men),"
2CH	6	31	Solomon	#10		15545	 {31} so that they will fear you and walk in your ways all the time they live in the land you gave our fathers.
2CH	6	32	Solomon	#10		15546	" {32} << As for the foreigner who does not belong to your people Israel but has come from a distant land because of your great name and your mighty hand and your outstretched arm-- when he comes and prays toward this temple,"
2CH	6	33	Solomon	#10		15547	" {33} then hear from heaven, your dwelling place, and do whatever the foreigner asks of you, so that all the peoples of the earth may know your name and fear you, as do your own people Israel, and may know that this house I have built bears your Name."
2CH	6	34	Solomon	#10		15548	" {34} << When your people go to war against their enemies, wherever you send them, and when they pray to you toward this city you have chosen and the temple I have built for your Name,"
2CH	6	35	Solomon	#10		15549	" {35} then hear from heaven their prayer and their plea, and uphold their cause."
2CH	6	36	Solomon	#10		15550	" {36} << When they sin against you--for there is no one who does not sin--and you become angry with them and give them over to the enemy, who takes them captive to a land far away or near;"
2CH	6	37	Solomon	#10		15551	" {37} and if they have a change of heart in the land where they are held captive, and repent and plead with you in the land of their captivity and say, 'We have sinned, we have done wrong and acted wickedly';"
2CH	6	38	Solomon	#10		15552	" {38} and if they turn back to you with all their heart and soul in the land of their captivity where they were taken,"
2CH	6	38	Solomon	#10		15553	" and pray toward the land you gave their fathers, toward the city you have chosen and toward the temple I have built for your Name;"
2CH	6	39	Solomon	#10		15554	" {39} then from heaven, your dwelling place, hear their prayer and their pleas, and uphold their cause. And forgive your people, who have sinned against you."
2CH	6	40	Solomon	#10		15555	" {40} << Now, my God, may your eyes be open and your ears attentive to the prayers offered in this place."
2CH	6	41	Solomon	#10		15556	" {41} << Now arise, O Lord God, and come to your resting place, you and the ark of your might."
2CH	6	41	Solomon	#10		15557	" May your priests, O Lord God, be clothed with salvation, may your saints rejoice in your goodness."
2CH	6	42	Solomon	#10		15558	" {42} O Lord God, do not reject your anointed one. Remember the great love promised to David your servant.>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"

2CH	7	3	Man in Crowd	#16		15563	 << He is good; his love endures forever.>>
2CH	7	4	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15564	 {4} Then the king and all the people offered sacrifices before the Lord.
2CH	7	5	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15565	 {5} And King Solomon offered a sacrifice of twenty-two thousand head of cattle and a hundred and twenty thousand sheep and goats.
2CH	7	5	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15566	 So the king and all the people dedicated the temple of God.
2CH	7	6	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15567	" {6} The priests took their positions, as did the Levites with the Lord's musical instruments, which King David had made for praising the Lord and which were used when he gave thanks, saying, << His love endures forever.>>"

2CH	7	7	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15570	" and there he offered burnt offerings and the fat of the fellowship offerings, because the bronze altar he had made could not hold the burnt offerings, the grain offerings and the fat portions."
2CH	7	8	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15571	" {8} So Solomon observed the festival at that time for seven days, and all Israel with him--a vast assembly, people from Lebo Hamath to the Wadi of Egypt."
2CH	7	9	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15572	" {9} On the eighth day they held an assembly, for they had celebrated the dedication of the altar for seven days and the festival for seven days more."
2CH	7	10	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15573	" {10} On the twenty-third day of the seventh month he sent the people to their homes, joyful and glad in heart for the good things the Lord had done for David and Solomon and for his people Israel."
2CH	7	11	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15574	" {11} When Solomon had finished the temple of the Lord and the royal palace, and had succeeded in carrying out all he had in mind to do in the temple of the Lord and in his own palace, {12} the Lord appeared to him at night and said:"
2CH	7	12	God-FX1	#20		15575	 << I have heard your prayer and have chosen this place for myself as a temple for sacrifices.

2CH	7	14	God-FX1	#20		15577	" {14} if my people, who are called by my name, will humble themselves and pray and seek my face and turn from their wicked ways, then will I hear from heaven and will forgive their sin and will heal their land."
2CH	7	15	God-FX1	#20		15578	 {15} Now my eyes will be open and my ears attentive to the prayers offered in this place.
2CH	7	16	God-FX1	#20		15579	 {16} I have chosen and consecrated this temple so that my Name may be there forever. My eyes and my heart will always be there.
2CH	7	17	God-FX1	#20		15580	" {17} << As for you, if you walk before me as David your father did, and do all I command, and observe my decrees and laws,"

2CH	7	19	God-FX1	#20		15582	" {19} << But if you turn away and forsake the decrees and commands I have given you and go off to serve other gods and worship them,"
2CH	7	20	God-FX1	#20		15583	" {20} then I will uproot Israel from my land, which I have given them, and will reject this temple I have consecrated for my Name."
2CH	7	20	God-FX1	#20		15584	 I will make it a byword and an object of ridicule among all peoples.
2CH	7	21	God-FX1	#20		15585	" {21} And though this temple is now so imposing, all who pass by will be appalled and say, 'Why has the Lord done such a thing to this land and to this temple?'"
2CH	7	22	God-FX1	#20		15586	" {22} People will answer, 'Because they have forsaken the Lord, the God of their fathers, who brought them out of Egypt, and have embraced other gods, worshiping and serving them--"
