2CH	8	1	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15589	" {1} At the end of twenty years, during which Solomon built the temple of the Lord and his own palace, {2} Solomon rebuilt the villages that Hiram had given him, and settled Israelites in them."
2CH	8	3	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15590	 {3} Solomon then went to Hamath Zobah and captured it. {4} He also built up Tadmor in the desert and all the store cities he had built in Hamath.
2CH	8	5	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15591	" {5} He rebuilt Upper Beth Horon and Lower Beth Horon as fortified cities, with walls and with gates and bars,"
2CH	8	6	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15592	" {6} as well as Baalath and all his store cities, and all the cities for his chariots and for his horses--whatever he desired to build in Jerusalem, in Lebanon and throughout all the territory he ruled."
2CH	8	7	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15593	" {7} All the people left from the Hittites, Amorites, Perizzites, Hivites and Jebusites (these peoples were not Israelites),"
2CH	8	8	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15594	" {8} that is, their descendants remaining in the land, whom the Israelites had not destroyed--these Solomon conscripted for his slave labor force, as it is to this day."
2CH	8	9	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15595	" {9} But Solomon did not make slaves of the Israelites for his work; they were his fighting men, commanders of his captains, and commanders of his chariots and charioteers."
2CH	8	10	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15596	 {10} They were also King Solomon's chief officials--two hundred and fifty officials supervising the men.
2CH	8	11	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15597	" {11} Solomon brought Pharaoh's daughter up from the City of David to the palace he had built for her, for he said,"
2CH	8	11	Solomon	#10		15598	" << My wife must not live in the palace of David king of Israel, because the places the ark of the Lord has entered are holy.>>"
2CH	8	12	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15599	" {12} On the altar of the Lord that he had built in front of the portico, Solomon sacrificed burnt offerings to the Lord,"
2CH	8	13	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15600	" {13} according to the daily requirement for offerings commanded by Moses for Sabbaths, New Moons and the three annual feasts--the Feast of Unleavened Bread, the Feast of Weeks and the Feast of Tabernacles."
2CH	8	14	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15601	" {14} In keeping with the ordinance of his father David, he appointed the divisions of the priests for their duties, and the Levites to lead the praise and to assist the priests according to each day's requirement."
2CH	8	14	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15602	" He also appointed the gatekeepers by divisions for the various gates, because this was what David the man of God had ordered."
2CH	8	15	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15603	" {15} They did not deviate from the king's commands to the priests or to the Levites in any matter, including that of the treasuries."
2CH	8	16	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15604	" {16} All Solomon's work was carried out, from the day the foundation of the temple of the Lord was laid until its completion. So the temple of the Lord was finished."
2CH	8	17	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15605	" {17} Then Solomon went to Ezion Geber and Elath on the coast of Edom. {18} And Hiram sent him ships commanded by his own officers, men who knew the sea."
2CH	8	18	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15606	" These, with Solomon's men, sailed to Ophir and brought back four hundred and fifty talents of gold, which they delivered to King Solomon.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
2CH	9	<<	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15607	2 CHRONICLES 9
2CH	9	1	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15608	" {1} When the queen of Sheba heard of Solomon's fame, she came to Jerusalem to test him with hard questions."
2CH	9	1	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15609	" Arriving with a very great caravan--with camels carrying spices, large quantities of gold, and precious stones--she came to Solomon and talked with him about all she had on her mind."
2CH	9	2	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15610	 {2} Solomon answered all her questions; nothing was too hard for him to explain to her.
2CH	9	3	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15611	" {3} When the queen of Sheba saw the wisdom of Solomon, as well as the palace he had built,"
2CH	9	4	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15612	" {4} the food on his table, the seating of his officials, the attending servants in their robes, the cupbearers in their robes and the burnt offerings he made at the temple of the Lord, she was overwhelmed."
2CH	9	5	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15613	" {5} She said to the king,"
2CH	9	5	Queen	#23		15614	 << The report I heard in my own country about your achievements and your wisdom is true.
2CH	9	6	Queen	#23		15615	 {6} But I did not believe what they said until I came and saw with my own eyes.
2CH	9	6	Queen	#23		15616	" Indeed, not even half the greatness of your wisdom was told me; you have far exceeded the report I heard."
2CH	9	7	Queen	#23		15617	" {7} How happy your men must be! How happy your officials, who continually stand before you and hear your wisdom!"
2CH	9	8	Queen	#23		15618	" {8} Praise be to the Lord your God, who has delighted in you and placed you on his throne as king to rule for the Lord your God."
2CH	9	8	Queen	#23		15619	" Because of the love of your God for Israel and his desire to uphold them forever, he has made you king over them, to maintain justice and righteousness.>>"
2CH	9	9	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15620	" {9} Then she gave the king 120 talents of gold, large quantities of spices, and precious stones. There had never been such spices as those the queen of Sheba gave to King Solomon."
2CH	9	10	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15621	 {10} (The men of Hiram and the men of Solomon brought gold from Ophir; they also brought algumwood and precious stones.
2CH	9	11	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15622	" {11} The king used the algumwood to make steps for the temple of the Lord and for the royal palace, and to make harps and lyres for the musicians. Nothing like them had ever been seen in Judah.)"
2CH	9	12	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15623	 {12} King Solomon gave the queen of Sheba all she desired and asked for; he gave her more than she had brought to him. Then she left and returned with her servants to her own country.
2CH	9	13	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15624	" {13} The weight of the gold that Solomon received yearly was 666 talents, {14} not including the revenues brought in by merchants and traders."
2CH	9	14	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15625	 Also all the kings of Arabia and the governors of the land brought gold and silver to Solomon.
2CH	9	15	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15626	 {15} King Solomon made two hundred large shields of hammered gold; six hundred bekas of hammered gold went into each shield.
2CH	9	16	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15627	" {16} He also made three hundred small shields of hammered gold, with three hundred bekas of gold in each shield. The king put them in the Palace of the Forest of Lebanon."
2CH	9	17	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15628	 {17} Then the king made a great throne inlaid with ivory and overlaid with pure gold.
2CH	9	18	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15629	" {18} The throne had six steps, and a footstool of gold was attached to it. On both sides of the seat were armrests, with a lion standing beside each of them."
2CH	9	19	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15630	" {19} Twelve lions stood on the six steps, one at either end of each step. Nothing like it had ever been made for any other kingdom."
2CH	9	20	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15631	" {20} All King Solomon's goblets were gold, and all the household articles in the Palace of the Forest of Lebanon were pure gold."
2CH	9	20	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15632	" Nothing was made of silver, because silver was considered of little value in Solomon's day."
2CH	9	21	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15633	" {21} The king had a fleet of trading ships manned by Hiram's men. Once every three years it returned, carrying gold, silver and ivory, and apes and baboons."
2CH	9	22	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15634	 {22} King Solomon was greater in riches and wisdom than all the other kings of the earth.
2CH	9	23	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15635	 {23} All the kings of the earth sought audience with Solomon to hear the wisdom God had put in his heart.
2CH	9	24	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15636	" {24} Year after year, everyone who came brought a gift--articles of silver and gold, and robes, weapons and spices, and horses and mules."
2CH	9	25	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15637	" {25} Solomon had four thousand stalls for horses and chariots, and twelve thousand horses, which he kept in the chariot cities and also with him in Jerusalem."
2CH	9	26	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15638	" {26} He ruled over all the kings from the River to the land of the Philistines, as far as the border of Egypt."
2CH	9	27	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15639	" {27} The king made silver as common in Jerusalem as stones, and cedar as plentiful as sycamore-fig trees in the foothills."
2CH	9	28	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15640	 {28} Solomon's horses were imported from Egypt and from all other countries.
2CH	9	29	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15641	" {29} As for the other events of Solomon's reign, from beginning to end,"
2CH	9	29	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15642	" are they not written in the records of Nathan the prophet, in the prophecy of Ahijah the Shilonite and in the visions of Iddo the seer concerning Jeroboam son of Nebat?"
2CH	9	30	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15643	 {30} Solomon reigned in Jerusalem over all Israel forty years.
2CH	9	31	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15644	 {31} Then he rested with his fathers and was buried in the city of David his father. And Rehoboam his son succeeded him as king.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
2CH	10	<<	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15645	2 CHRONICLES 10
2CH	10	1	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15646	" {1} Rehoboam went to Shechem, for all the Israelites had gone there to make him king."
2CH	10	2	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15647	" {2} When Jeroboam son of Nebat heard this (he was in Egypt, where he had fled from King Solomon), he returned from Egypt."
2CH	10	3	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15648	" {3} So they sent for Jeroboam, and he and all Israel went to Rehoboam and said to him:"
2CH	10	4	Jereboam	#06		15649	" {4} << Your father put a heavy yoke on us, but now lighten the harsh labor and the heavy yoke he put on us, and we will serve you.>>"
2CH	10	5	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15650	" {5} Rehoboam answered,"
2CH	10	5	King Rehoboam	#04		15651	 << Come back to me in three days.>>
2CH	10	5	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15652	 So the people went away.
2CH	10	6	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15653	" {6} Then King Rehoboam consulted the elders who had served his father Solomon during his lifetime. He asked,"
2CH	10	6	King Rehoboam	#04		15654	 << How would you advise me to answer these people?>>
2CH	10	7	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15655	" {7} They replied,"
2CH	10	7	Elder	#01		15656	" << If you will be kind to these people and please them and give them a favorable answer, they will always be your servants.>>"
2CH	10	8	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15657	" {8} But Rehoboam rejected the advice the elders gave him and consulted the young men who had grown up with him and were serving him. {9} He asked them,"
2CH	10	9	King Rehoboam	#04		15658	" << What is your advice? How should we answer these people who say to me, 'Lighten the yoke your father put on us'?>>"
2CH	10	10	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15659	" {10} The young men who had grown up with him replied,"
2CH	10	10	Man (young)	#18		15660	" << Tell the people who have said to you, 'Your father put a heavy yoke on us, but make our yoke lighter'--tell them, 'My little finger is thicker than my father's waist."
2CH	10	11	Man (young)	#18		15661	 {11} My father laid on you a heavy yoke; I will make it even heavier. My father scourged you with whips; I will scourge you with scorpions.'>>
2CH	10	12	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15662	" {12} Three days later Jeroboam and all the people returned to Rehoboam, as the king had said, << come back to me in three days.>>"
2CH	10	13	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15663	" {13} The king answered them harshly. Rejecting the advice of the elders, {14} he followed the advice of the young men and said,"
2CH	10	14	King Rehoboam	#04		15664	 << My father made your yoke heavy; I will make it it even heavier. My father scourged you with whips; I will scourge you with scorpions.>>
2CH	10	15	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15665	" {15} So the king did not listen to the people, for this turn of events was from God, to fulfill the word the Lord had spoken to Jeroboam son of Nebat through Ahijah the Shilonite."
2CH	10	16	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15666	" {16} When all Israel saw that the king refused to listen to them, they answered the king:"
2CH	10	16	Jereboam	#06		15667	" << What share do we have in David, what part in Jesse's son? To your tents, O Israel! Look after your own house, O David!>>"
2CH	10	16	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15668	" So all the Israelites went home. {17} But as for the Israelites who were living in the towns of Judah, Rehoboam still ruled over them."
2CH	10	18	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15669	" {18} King Rehoboam sent out Adoniram, who was in charge of forced labor, but the Israelites stoned him to death."
2CH	10	18	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15670	" King Rehoboam, however, managed to get into his chariot and escape to Jerusalem."
2CH	10	19	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15671	 {19} So Israel has been in rebellion against the house of David to this day.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
2CH	11	<<	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15672	2 CHRONICLES 11
2CH	11	1	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15673	" {1} When Rehoboam arrived in Jerusalem, he mustered the house of Judah and Benjamin--a hundred and eighty thousand fighting men--to make war against Israel and to regain the kingdom for Rehoboam."
2CH	11	2	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15674	 {2} But this word of the Lord came to Shemaiah the man of God:
2CH	11	3	Prophet: Shemaiah	#15		15675	" {3} << Say to Rehoboam son of Solomon king of Judah and to all the Israelites in Judah and Benjamin,"
2CH	11	4	Prophet: Shemaiah	#15		15676	" {4} 'This is what the Lord says: Do not go up to fight against your brothers. Go home, every one of you, for this is my doing.'>>"
2CH	11	4	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15677	 So they obeyed the words of the Lord and turned back from marching against Jeroboam.
2CH	11	5	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15678	 {5} Rehoboam lived in Jerusalem and built up towns for defense in Judah:

2CH	11	11	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15682	" {11} He strengthened their defenses and put commanders in them, with supplies of food, olive oil and wine."
2CH	11	12	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15683	" {12} He put shields and spears in all the cities, and made them very strong. So Judah and Benjamin were his."
2CH	11	13	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15684	 {13} The priests and Levites from all their districts throughout Israel sided with him.
2CH	11	14	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15685	" {14} The Levites even abandoned their pasturelands and property, and came to Judah and Jerusalem because Jeroboam and his sons had rejected them as priests of the Lord."
2CH	11	15	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15686	 {15} And he appointed his own priests for the high places and for the goat and calf idols he had made.
2CH	11	16	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15687	" {16} Those from every tribe of Israel who set their hearts on seeking the Lord, the God of Israel, followed the Levites to Jerusalem to offer sacrifices to the Lord, the God of their fathers."
2CH	11	17	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15688	" {17} They strengthened the kingdom of Judah and supported Rehoboam son of Solomon three years, walking in the ways of David and Solomon during this time."
2CH	11	18	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15689	" {18} Rehoboam married Mahalath, who was the daughter of David's son Jerimoth and of Abihail, the daughter of Jesse's son Eliab."
2CH	11	19	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15690	" {19} She bore him sons: Jeush, Shemariah and Zaham."
2CH	11	20	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15691	" {20} Then he married Maacah daughter of Absalom, who bore him Abijah, Attai, Ziza and Shelomith."
2CH	11	21	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15692	" {21} Rehoboam loved Maacah daughter of Absalom more than any of his other wives and concubines. In all, he had eighteen wives and sixty concubines, twenty-eight sons and sixty daughters."
2CH	11	22	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15693	" {22} Rehoboam appointed Abijah son of Maacah to be the chief prince among his brothers, in order to make him king."
2CH	11	23	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15694	" {23} He acted wisely, dispersing some of his sons throughout the districts of Judah and Benjamin, and to all the fortified cities."
2CH	11	23	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15695	 He gave them abundant provisions and took many wives for them.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
2CH	12	<<	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15696	2 CHRONICLES 12
2CH	12	1	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15697	" {1} After Rehoboam's position as king was established and he had become strong, he and all Israel with him abandoned the law of the Lord."
2CH	12	2	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15698	" {2} Because they had been unfaithful to the Lord, Shishak king of Egypt attacked Jerusalem in the fifth year of King Rehoboam."
2CH	12	3	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15699	" {3} With twelve hundred chariots and sixty thousand horsemen and the innumerable troops of Libyans, Sukkites and Cushites that came with him from Egypt,"
2CH	12	4	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15700	 {4} he captured the fortified cities of Judah and came as far as Jerusalem.
2CH	12	5	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15701	" {5} Then the prophet Shemaiah came to Rehoboam and to the leaders of Judah who had assembled in Jerusalem for fear of Shishak, and he said to them,"
2CH	12	5	Prophet: Shemaiah	#15		15702	" << This is what the Lord says, 'You have abandoned me; therefore, I now abandon you to Shishak.'>>"
2CH	12	6	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15703	" {6} The leaders of Israel and the king humbled themselves and said,"
2CH	12	6	Man in Crowd	#17		15704	 << The Lord is Just.>>
2CH	12	7	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15705	" {7} When the Lord saw that they humbled themselves, this word of the Lord came to Shemaiah:"
2CH	12	7	God-FX1	#20		15706	" << Since they have humbled themselves, I will not destroy them but will soon give them deliverance. My wrath will not be poured out on Jerusalem through Shishak."
2CH	12	8	God-FX1	#20		15707	" {8} They will, however, become subject to him, so that they may learn the difference between serving me and serving the kings of other lands.>>"
2CH	12	9	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15708	" {9} When Shishak king of Egypt attacked Jerusalem, he carried off the treasures of the temple of the Lord and the treasures of the royal palace."
2CH	12	9	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15709	" He took everything, including the gold shields Solomon had made."
2CH	12	10	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15710	 {10} So King Rehoboam made bronze shields to replace them and assigned these to the commanders of the guard on duty at the entrance to the royal palace.
2CH	12	11	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15711	" {11} Whenever the king went to the Lord's temple, the guards went with him, bearing the shields, and afterward they returned them to the guardroom."
2CH	12	12	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15712	" {12} Because Rehoboam humbled himself, the Lord's anger turned from him, and he was not totally destroyed. Indeed, there was some good in Judah."
2CH	12	13	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15713	 {13} King Rehoboam established himself firmly in Jerusalem and continued as king.
2CH	12	13	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15714	" He was forty-one years old when he became king, and he reigned seventeen years in Jerusalem, the city the Lord had chosen out of all the tribes of Israel in which to put his Name."
2CH	12	13	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15715	 His mother's name was Naamah; she was an Ammonite.
2CH	12	14	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15716	 {14} He did evil because he had not set his heart on seeking the Lord.
2CH	12	15	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15717	" {15} As for the events of Rehoboam's reign, from beginning to end, are they not written in the records of Shemaiah the prophet and of Iddo the seer that deal with genealogies?"
2CH	12	15	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15718	 There was continual warfare between Rehoboam and Jeroboam.
2CH	12	16	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15719	 {16} Rehoboam rested with his fathers and was buried in the City of David. And Abijah his son succeeded him as king.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
2CH	13	<<	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15720	2 CHRONICLES 13
2CH	13	1	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15721	" {1} In the eighteenth year of the reign of Jeroboam, Abijah became king of Judah, {2} and he reigned in Jerusalem three years."
2CH	13	2	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15722	" His mother's name was Maacah, a daughter of Uriel of Gibeah. There was war between Abijah and Jeroboam."
2CH	13	3	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15723	" {3} Abijah went into battle with a force of four hundred thousand able fighting men, and Jeroboam drew up a battle line against him with eight hundred thousand able troops."
2CH	13	4	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15724	" {4} Abijah stood on Mount Zemaraim, in the hill country of Ephraim, and said,"
2CH	13	4	Abijah	#02		15725	" << Jeroboam and all Israel, listen to me!"
2CH	13	5	Abijah	#02		15726	" {5} Don't you know that the Lord, the God of Israel, has given the kingship of Israel to David and his descendants forever by a covenant of salt?"
2CH	13	6	Abijah	#02		15727	" {6} Yet Jeroboam son of Nebat, an official of Solomon son of David, rebelled against his master."
2CH	13	7	Abijah	#02		15728	 {7} Some worthless scoundrels gathered around him and opposed Rehoboam son of Solomon when he was young and indecisive and not strong enough to resist them.
2CH	13	8	Abijah	#02		15729	" {8} << And now you plan to resist the kingdom of the Lord, which is in the hands of David's descendants."
2CH	13	8	Abijah	#02		15730	 You are indeed a vast army and have with you the golden calves that Jeroboam made to be your gods.
2CH	13	9	Abijah	#02		15731	" {9} But didn't you drive out the priests of the Lord, the sons of Aaron, and the Levites, and make priests of your own as the peoples of other lands do?"
2CH	13	9	Abijah	#02		15732	 Whoever comes to consecrate himself with a young bull and seven rams may become a priest of what are not gods.
2CH	13	10	Abijah	#02		15733	" {10} << As for us, the Lord is our God, and we have not forsaken him. The priests who serve the Lord are sons of Aaron, and the Levites assist them."
2CH	13	11	Abijah	#02		15734	 {11} Every morning and evening they present burnt offerings and fragrant incense to the Lord.
2CH	13	11	Abijah	#02		15735	 They set out the bread on the ceremonially clean table and light the lamps on the gold lampstand every evening.
2CH	13	11	Abijah	#02		15736	 We are observing the requirements of the Lord our God. But you have forsaken him.
2CH	13	12	Abijah	#02		15737	 {12} God is with us; he is our leader. His priests with their trumpets will sound the battle cry against you.
2CH	13	12	Abijah	#02		15738	" Men of Israel, do not fight against the Lord, the God of your fathers, for you will not succeed.>>"
2CH	13	13	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15739	" {13} Now Jeroboam had sent troops around to the rear, so that while he was in front of Judah the ambush was behind them."
2CH	13	14	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15740	 {14} Judah turned and saw that they were being attacked at both front and rear. Then they cried out to the Lord.
2CH	13	15	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15741	" {15} The priests blew their trumpets and the men of Judah raised the battle cry. At the sound of their battle cry, God routed Jeroboam and all Israel before Abijah and Judah."
2CH	13	16	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15742	" {16} The Israelites fled before Judah, and God delivered them into their hands."
2CH	13	17	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15743	" {17} Abijah and his men inflicted heavy losses on them, so that there were five hundred thousand casualties among Israel's able men."
2CH	13	18	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15744	" {18} The men of Israel were subdued on that occasion, and the men of Judah were victorious because they relied on the Lord, the God of their fathers."
2CH	13	19	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15745	" {19} Abijah pursued Jeroboam and took from him the towns of Bethel, Jeshanah and Ephron, with their surrounding villages."
2CH	13	20	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15746	 {20} Jeroboam did not regain power during the time of Abijah. And the Lord struck him down and he died.
2CH	13	21	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15747	 {21} But Abijah grew in strength. He married fourteen wives and had twenty-two sons and sixteen daughters.
2CH	13	22	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15748	" {22} The other events of Abijah's reign, what he did and what he said, are written in the annotations of the prophet Iddo.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
2CH	14	<<	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15749	2 CHRONICLES 14
2CH	14	1	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15750	" {1} And Abijah rested with his fathers and was buried in the City of David. Asa his son succeeded him as king, and in his days the country was at peace for ten years."
2CH	14	2	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15751	" {2} Asa did what was good and right in the eyes of the Lord his God. {3} He removed the foreign altars and the high places, smashed the sacred stones and cut down the Asherah poles."
2CH	14	4	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15752	" {4} He commanded Judah to seek the Lord, the God of their fathers, and to obey his laws and commands."
2CH	14	5	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15753	" {5} He removed the high places and incense altars in every town in Judah, and the kingdom was at peace under him."
2CH	14	6	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15754	" {6} He built up the fortified cities of Judah, since the land was at peace. No one was at war with him during those years, for the Lord gave him rest. {7} He said to Judah,"
2CH	14	7	King Asa	#03		15755	" << Let us build up these towns, and put walls around them, with towers, gates and bars."
2CH	14	7	King Asa	#03		15756	" The land is still ours, because we have sought the Lord our God;"
2CH	14	7	King Asa	#03		15757	 we sought him and he has given us rest on every side.>>
2CH	14	7	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15758	 So they built and prospered.
2CH	14	8	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15759	" {8} Asa had an army of three hundred thousand men from Judah, equipped with large shields and with spears,"
2CH	14	8	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15760	" and two hundred and eighty thousand from Benjamin, armed with small shields and with bows. All these were brave fighting men."
2CH	14	9	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15761	" {9} Zerah the Cushite marched out against them with a vast army and three hundred chariots, and came as far as Mareshah."
2CH	14	10	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15762	" {10} Asa went out to meet him, and they took up battle positions in the Valley of Zephathah near Mareshah. {11} Then Asa called to the Lord his God and said,"
2CH	14	11	King Asa	#03		15763	" << Lord, there is no one like you to help the powerless against the mighty."
2CH	14	11	King Asa	#03		15764	" Help us, O Lord our God, for we rely on you, and in your name we have come against this vast army."
2CH	14	11	King Asa	#03		15765	" O Lord, you are our God; do not let man prevail against you.>>"
2CH	14	12	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15766	" {12} The Lord struck down the Cushites before Asa and Judah. The Cushites fled, {13} and Asa and his army pursued them as far as Gerar."
2CH	14	13	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15767	 Such a great number of Cushites fell that they could not recover; they were crushed before the Lord and his forces. The men of Judah carried off a large amount of plunder.
2CH	14	14	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15768	" {14} They destroyed all the villages around Gerar, for the terror of the Lord had fallen upon them. They plundered all these villages, since there was much booty there."
2CH	14	15	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15769	 {15} They also attacked the camps of the herdsmen and carried off droves of sheep and goats and camels. Then they returned to Jerusalem.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
2CH	15	<<	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15770	2 CHRONICLES 15
2CH	15	1	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15771	" {1} The Spirit of God came upon Azariah son of Oded. {2} He went out to meet Asa and said to him,"
2CH	15	2	Azariah	#16		15772	" << Listen to me, Asa and all Judah and Benjamin."
2CH	15	2	Azariah	#16		15773	 The Lord is with you when you are with him.
2CH	15	2	Azariah	#16		15774	" If you seek him, he will be found by you, but if you forsake him, he will forsake you."
2CH	15	3	Azariah	#16		15775	" {3} For a long time Israel was without the true God, without a priest to teach and without the law."
2CH	15	4	Azariah	#16		15776	" {4} But in their distress they turned to the Lord, the God of Israel, and sought him, and he was found by them."
2CH	15	5	Azariah	#16		15777	" {5} In those days it was not safe to travel about, for all the inhabitants of the lands were in great turmoil."
2CH	15	6	Azariah	#16		15778	" {6} One nation was being crushed by another and one city by another, because God was troubling them with every kind of distress."
2CH	15	7	Azariah	#16		15779	" {7} But as for you, be strong and do not give up, for your work will be rewarded.>>"
2CH	15	8	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15780	" {8} When Asa heard these words and the prophecy of Azariah son of Oded the prophet, he took courage."
2CH	15	8	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15781	 He removed the detestable idols from the whole land of Judah and Benjamin and from the towns he had captured in the hills of Ephraim.
2CH	15	8	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15782	 He repaired the altar of the Lord that was in front of the portico of the Lord's temple.
2CH	15	9	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15783	" {9} Then he assembled all Judah and Benjamin and the people from Ephraim, Manasseh and Simeon who had settled among them, "
2CH	15	9	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15784	 for large numbers had come over to him from Israel when they saw that the Lord his God was with him.
2CH	15	10	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15785	 {10} They assembled at Jerusalem in the third month of the fifteenth year of Asa's reign.
2CH	15	11	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15786	 {11} At that time they sacrificed to the Lord seven hundred head of cattle and seven thousand sheep and goats from the plunder they had brought back.
2CH	15	12	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15787	" {12} They entered into a covenant to seek the Lord, the God of their fathers, with all their heart and soul."
2CH	15	13	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15788	" {13} All who would not seek the Lord, the God of Israel, were to be put to death, whether small or great, man or woman."
2CH	15	14	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15789	" {14} They took an oath to the Lord with loud acclamation, with shouting and with trumpets and horns."
2CH	15	15	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15790	" {15} All Judah rejoiced about the oath because they had sworn it wholeheartedly. They sought God eagerly, and he was found by them. So the Lord gave them rest on every side."
2CH	15	16	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15791	" {16} King Asa also deposed his grandmother Maacah from her position as queen mother, because she had made a repulsive Asherah pole."
2CH	15	16	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15792	" Asa cut the pole down, broke it up and burned it in the Kidron Valley."
2CH	15	17	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15793	" {17} Although he did not remove the high places from Israel, Asa's heart was fully committed to the Lord all his life."
2CH	15	18	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15794	 {18} He brought into the temple of God the silver and gold and the articles that he and his father had dedicated.
2CH	15	19	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15795	 {19} There was no more war until the thirty-fifth year of Asa's reign.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
2CH	16	<<	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15796	2 CHRONICLES 16
2CH	16	1	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15797	 {1} In the thirty-sixth year of Asa's reign Baasha king of Israel went up against Judah and fortified Ramah to prevent anyone from leaving or entering the territory of Asa king of Judah.
2CH	16	2	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15798	" {2} Asa then took the silver and gold out of the treasuries of the Lord's temple and of his own palace and sent it to Ben-Hadad king of Aram, who was ruling in Damascus. He said,"
2CH	16	3	King Asa	#03		15799	" {3} << Let there be a treaty between me and you, as there was between my father and your father."
2CH	16	3	King Asa	#03		15800	" See, I am sending you silver and gold. Now break your treaty with Baasha king of Israel so he will withdraw from me.>>"
2CH	16	4	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15801	" {4} Ben-Hadad agreed with King Asa and sent the commanders of his forces against the towns of Israel. They conquered Ijon, Dan, Abel Maim and all the store cities of Naphtali."
2CH	16	5	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15802	" {5} When Baasha heard this, he stopped building Ramah and abandoned his work."
2CH	16	6	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15803	" {6} Then King Asa brought all the men of Judah, and they carried away from Ramah the stones and timber Baasha had been using. With them he built up Geba and Mizpah."
2CH	16	7	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15804	 {7} At that time Hanani the seer came to Asa king of Judah and said to him:
2CH	16	7	Prophet: Hanani	#01		15805	" << Because you relied on the king of Aram and not on the Lord your God, the army of the king of Aram has escaped from your hand."
2CH	16	8	Prophet: Hanani	#01		15806	 {8} Were not the Cushites and Libyans a mighty army with great numbers of chariots and horsemen?
2CH	16	8	Prophet: Hanani	#01		15807	" Yet when you relied on the Lord, he delivered them into your hand."
2CH	16	9	Prophet: Hanani	#01		15808	 {9} For the eyes of the Lord range throughout the earth to strengthen those whose hearts are fully committed to him.
2CH	16	9	Prophet: Hanani	#01		15809	" You have done a foolish thing, and from now on you will be at war.>>"
2CH	16	10	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15810	 {10} Asa was angry with the seer because of this; he was so enraged that he put him in prison. At the same time Asa brutally oppressed some of the people.
2CH	16	11	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15811	" {11} The events of Asa's reign, from beginning to end, are written in the book of the kings of Judah and Israel."
2CH	16	12	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15812	 {12} In the thirty-ninth year of his reign Asa was afflicted with a disease in his feet.
2CH	16	12	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15813	" Though his disease was severe, even in his illness he did not seek help from the Lord, but only from the physicians."
2CH	16	13	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15814	 {13} Then in the forty-first year of his reign Asa died and rested with his fathers.
2CH	16	14	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15815	 {14} They buried him in the tomb that he had cut out for himself in the City of David.
2CH	16	14	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15816	" They laid him on a bier covered with spices and various blended perfumes, and they made a huge fire in his honor.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
2CH	17	<<	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15817	2 CHRONICLES 17
2CH	17	1	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15818	 {1} Jehoshaphat his son succeeded him as king and strengthened himself against Israel.
2CH	17	2	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15819	 {2} He stationed troops in all the fortified cities of Judah and put garrisons in Judah and in the towns of Ephraim that his father Asa had captured.
2CH	17	3	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15820	 {3} The Lord was with Jehoshaphat because in his early years he walked in the ways his father David had followed.
2CH	17	3	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15821	 He did not consult the Baals {4} but sought the God of his father and followed his commands rather than the practices of Israel.
2CH	17	5	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15822	" {5} The Lord established the kingdom under his control; and all Judah brought gifts to Jehoshaphat, so that he had great wealth and honor."
2CH	17	6	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15823	" {6} His heart was devoted to the ways of the Lord; furthermore, he removed the high places and the Asherah poles from Judah."
2CH	17	7	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15824	" {7} In the third year of his reign he sent his officials Ben-Hail, Obadiah, Zechariah, Nethanel and Micaiah to teach in the towns of Judah."
2CH	17	8	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15825	" {8} With them were certain Levites--Shemaiah, Nethaniah, Zebadiah,"
2CH	17	8	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15826	" Asahel, Shemiramoth, Jehonathan,"
2CH	17	8	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15827	" Adonijah, Tobijah and Tob-Adonijah --"

2CH	17	9	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15829	" {9} They taught throughout Judah, taking with them the Book of the Law of the Lord; they went around to all the towns of Judah and taught the people."
2CH	17	10	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15830	" {10} The fear of the Lord fell on all the kingdoms of the lands surrounding Judah, so that they did not make war with Jehoshaphat."
2CH	17	11	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15831	" {11} Some Philistines brought Jehoshaphat gifts and silver as tribute, and the Arabs brought him flocks: seven thousand seven hundred rams and seven thousand seven hundred goats."
2CH	17	12	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15832	 {12} Jehoshaphat became more and more powerful; he built forts and store cities in Judah {13} and had large supplies in the towns of Judah. He also kept experienced fighting men in Jerusalem.
2CH	17	14	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15833	" {14} Their enrollment by families was as follows: From Judah, commanders of units of 1,000: Adnah the commander, with 300,000 fighting men;"
2CH	17	15	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15834	" {15} next, Jehohanan the commander, with 280,000; next,"
2CH	17	16	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15835	" {16} Amasiah son of Zicri, who volunteered himself for the service of the Lord, with 200,000."
2CH	17	17	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15836	" {17} From Benjamin: Eliada, a valiant soldier, with 200,000 men armed with bows and shields;"
2CH	17	18	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15837	" {18} next, Jehozabad, with 180,000 men armed for battle."
2CH	17	19	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15838	" {19} These were the men who served the king, besides those he stationed in the fortified cities throughout Judah.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"

2CH	18	1	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15840	" {1} Now Jehoshaphat had great wealth and honor, and he allied himself with Ahab by marriage."
2CH	18	2	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15841	 {2} Some years later he went down to visit Ahab in Samaria. Ahab slaughtered many sheep and cattle for him and the people with him and urged him to attack Ramoth Gilead.
2CH	18	3	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15842	" {3} Ahab king of Israel asked Jehoshaphat king of Judah,"

2CH	18	3	Jehoshaphat	#07		15845	" << I am as you are, and my people as your people; we will join you in the war.>>"
2CH	18	4	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15846	" {4} But Jehoshaphat also said to the king of Israel,"
2CH	18	4	Jehoshaphat	#07		15847	 << First seek the counsel of the Lord.>>
2CH	18	5	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15848	" {5} So the king of Israel brought together the prophets--four hundred men--and asked them,"
2CH	18	5	Ahab	#14		15849	" << Shall we go to war against Ramoth Gilead, or shall I refrain?>>"
2CH	18	5	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15850	" they answered,"
2CH	18	5	Man in Crowd	#18		15851	" << Go, for God will give it into the king's hand,>>"
2CH	18	6	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15852	" {6} But Jehoshapaht asked,"
2CH	18	6	Jehoshaphat	#07		15853	 << Is there not a prophet of the Lord here whom we can inquire of?>>
2CH	18	7	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15854	" {7} The king of Israel answered Jehoshaphat,"

2CH	18	7	Ahab	#14		15856	" but I hate him because he never prophesies anything good about me, but always bad."
2CH	18	7	Ahab	#14		15857	 He is Micaiah son of Imlah.>>
2CH	18	7	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15858	" Jehoshaphat replied,"
2CH	18	7	Jehoshaphat	#07		15859	" << The king should not say that,>>"
2CH	18	8	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15860	" {8} So the king of Israel called one of his officials and said,"
2CH	18	8	Ahab	#14		15861	 << Bring Micaiah son of Imlah at once.>>
2CH	18	9	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15862	" {9} Dressed in their royal robes, the king of Israel and Jehoshaphat king of Judah were sitting on their thrones at the threshing floor by the entrance to the gate of Samaria, "
2CH	18	9	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15863	 with all the prophets prophesying before them.
2CH	18	10	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15864	" {10} Now Zedekiah son of Kenaanah had made iron horns, and he declared,"
2CH	18	10	Prophet (false)	#15		15865	 << This is what the Lord says: 'With these you will gore the Arameans until they are destroyed.'>>
2CH	18	11	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15866	" {11} All the other prophets were prophesying the same thing. They said,"
2CH	18	11	Man in Crowd	#18		15867	" << Attack Ramoth Gilead and be victorious, for the Lord will give it into the king's hand.>>"
2CH	18	12	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15868	" {12} The messenger who had gone to summon Micaiah said to him,"
2CH	18	12	Messenger	#04		15869	" << Look, as one man the other prophets are predicting success for the king. Let your word agree with theirs, and speak favorably.>>"
2CH	18	13	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15870	" {13} But Micaiah said,"
2CH	18	13	Micaiah	#06		15871	" << As surely as the Lord lives, I can tell him only what my God says.>>"
2CH	18	14	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15872	" {14} When he arrived, the king asked him,"
2CH	18	14	Ahab	#14		15873	" <<Micaiah, shall we go to war against Ramoth Gilead, or shall I refrain?>>"
2CH	18	14	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15874	" he answered,"
2CH	18	14	Micaiah	#06		15875	" << Attack and be victorious, for they will be given into your hand.>>"
2CH	18	15	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15876	" {15} The king said to him,"
2CH	18	15	Ahab	#14		15877	 << How many times must I make you swear to tell me nothing but the truth in the name of the Lord?>>
2CH	18	16	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15878	" {16} Then Micaiah answered,"
2CH	18	16	Micaiah	#06		15879	 << I saw all Israel scattered on the hills like sheep without a shepherd.
2CH	18	16	Micaiah	#06		15880	" And the Lord said, 'These people have no master. Let each one go go home in peace.'>>"
2CH	18	17	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15881	" {17} The king of Israel said to Jehoshaphat,"
2CH	18	17	Ahab	#14		15882	" << Didn't I tell you that he never prophesies anything good about me, but only bad?>>"
2CH	18	18	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15883	" {18} Micaiah continued,"
2CH	18	18	Micaiah	#06		15884	 << Therefore hear the word of the Lord:
2CH	18	18	Micaiah	#06		15885	 I saw the Lord sitting on his throne with all the host of heaven standing on his right and on his left.
2CH	18	19	Micaiah	#06		15886	" {19} And the Lord said, 'Who will lure Ahab king of Israel into attacking Ramoth Gilead and going to his death there?'"
2CH	18	19	Micaiah	#06		15887	" << One suggested this, and another that."
2CH	18	20	Micaiah	#06		15888	" {20} Finally, a spirit came forward, stood before the Lord and said, 'I will lure him.'"
2CH	18	20	Micaiah	#06		15889	 << 'By what means?' the Lord asked.
2CH	18	21	Micaiah	#06		15890	" {21} << 'I will go and be a lying spirit in the mouths of all his prophets,' he said."
2CH	18	21	Micaiah	#06		15891	" << 'You will succeed in luring him,' said the Lord. 'Go and do it.'"
2CH	18	22	Micaiah	#06		15892	 {22} << So now the Lord has put a lying spirit in the mouths of these prophets of yours.
2CH	18	22	Micaiah	#06		15893	 The Lord has decreed disaster for you.>>
2CH	18	23	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15894	" {23} Then Zedekiah son of Kenaanah went up and slapped Micaiah in the face. He asked,"
2CH	18	23	Prophet (false)	#15		15895	 << Which way did the spirit from the Lord go when he went from me to speak to you?>>
2CH	18	24	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15896	" {24} Micaiah replied,"
2CH	18	24	Micaiah	#06		15897	 << You will find out on the day you go to hide in an inner room.>>
2CH	18	25	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15898	" {25} The king of Israel then ordered,"
2CH	18	25	Ahab	#14		15899	" << Take Micaiah and send him back to Amon the ruler of the city and to Joash the king's son, {26} and say, 'This is what the king says:"
2CH	18	26	Ahab	#14		15900	 Put this fellow in prison and give him nothing but bread and water until I return safely.'>>
2CH	18	27	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15901	" {27} Micaiah declared,"
2CH	18	27	Micaiah	#06		15902	" << If you ever return safely, the Lord has not spoken through me."
2CH	18	27	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15903	" Then he said,"
2CH	18	27	Micaiah	#06		15904	" Mark my words, all you people!>>"
2CH	18	28	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15905	" {28} So the king of Israel and Jehoshaphat king of Judah went up to Ramoth Gilead. {29} The king of Israel said to Jehoshaphat,"
2CH	18	29	Ahab	#14		15906	" << I will enter the battle in disguise, but you wear your royal robes.>>"
2CH	18	29	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15907	" So the king of Israel disguised himself and went into battle. {30} Now the king of Aram had ordered his chariot commanders,"
2CH	18	30	King of Syria	#17		15908	" << Do not fight with anyone, small or great, except the king of Israel.>>"
2CH	18	31	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15909	" {31} When the chariot commanders saw Jehoshaphat, they thought,"
2CH	18	31	Commander	#13		15910	 << This is the king of Israel.>>
2CH	18	31	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15911	" So they turned to attack him, but Jehoshaphat cried out, and the Lord helped him. "
2CH	18	31	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15912	" God drew them away from him, {32} for when the chariot commanders saw that he was not the king of Israel, they stopped pursuing him."
2CH	18	33	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15913	" {33} But someone drew his bow at random and hit the king of Israel between the sections of his armor. The king told the chariot driver,"
2CH	18	33	Ahab	#14		15914	 << Wheel around and get me out of the fighting. I've been wounded.>>
2CH	18	34	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15915	" {34} All day long the battle raged, and the king of Israel propped himself up in his chariot facing the Arameans until evening. Then at sunset he died.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
2CH	19	<<	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15916	2 CHRONICLES 19
2CH	19	1	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15917	" {1} When Jehoshaphat king of Judah returned safely to his palace in Jerusalem, {2} Jehu the seer, the son of Hanani, went out to meet him and said to the king,"
2CH	19	2	Jehu the Seer	#09		15918	" << Should you help the wicked and love those who hate the Lord? Because of this, the wrath of the Lord is upon you."
2CH	19	3	Jehu the Seer	#09		15919	" {3} There is, however, some good in you, for you have rid the land of the Asherah poles and have set your heart on seeking God.>>"
2CH	19	4	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15920	" {4} Jehoshaphat lived in Jerusalem, and he went out again among the people from Beersheba to the hill country of Ephraim and turned them back to the Lord, the God of their fathers."
2CH	19	5	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15921	" {5} He appointed judges in the land, in each of the fortified cities of Judah. {6} He told them,"
2CH	19	6	Jehoshaphat	#07		15922	" << Consider carefully what you do, because you are not judging for man but for the Lord, who is with you whenever you give a verdict."
2CH	19	7	Jehoshaphat	#07		15923	" {7} Now let the fear of the Lord be upon you. Judge carefully, for with the Lord our God there is no injustice or partiality or bribery.>>"
2CH	19	8	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15924	" {8} In Jerusalem also, Jehoshaphat appointed some of the Levites, priests and heads of Israelite families to administer the law of the Lord and to settle disputes. And they lived in Jerusalem."

2CH	19	9	Jehoshaphat	#07		15926	 <<You must serve faithfully and wholeheartedly in the fear of the Lord.
2CH	19	10	Jehoshaphat	#07		15927	 {10} In every case that comes before you from your fellow countrymen who live in the cities--
2CH	19	10	Jehoshaphat	#07		15928	" whether bloodshed or other concerns of the law, commands, decrees or ordinances--"
2CH	19	10	Jehoshaphat	#07		15929	 you are to warn them not to sin against the Lord;
2CH	19	10	Jehoshaphat	#07		15930	" otherwise his wrath will come on you and your brothers. Do this, and you will not sin."
2CH	19	11	Jehoshaphat	#07		15931	" {11} << Amariah the chief priest will be over you in any matter concerning the Lord,"
2CH	19	11	Jehoshaphat	#07		15932	" and Zebadiah son of Ishmael, the leader of the tribe of Judah, will be over you in any matter concerning the king,"
2CH	19	11	Jehoshaphat	#07		15933	" and the Levites will serve as officials before you. Act with courage, and may the Lord be with those who do well.>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
2CH	20	<<	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15934	2 CHRONICLES 20
2CH	20	1	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15935	" {1} After this, the Moabites and Ammonites with some of the Meunites came to make war on Jehoshaphat. {2} Some men came and told Jehoshaphat,"
2CH	20	2	Man	#04		15936	" << A vast army is coming against you from Edom, from the other side of the Sea. It is already in Hazazon Tamar >>"
2CH	20	2	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15937	" (that is, En Gedi ). {3} Alarmed, Jehoshaphat resolved to inquire of the Lord, and he proclaimed a fast for all Judah."
2CH	20	4	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15938	" {4} The people of Judah came together to seek help from the Lord; indeed, they came from every town in Judah to seek him."
2CH	20	5	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15939	 {5} Then Jehoshaphat stood up in the assembly of Judah and Jerusalem at the temple of the Lord in the front of the new courtyard {6} and said:
2CH	20	6	Jehoshaphat	#07		15940	" << O Lord, God of our fathers, are you not the God who is in heaven?"
2CH	20	6	Jehoshaphat	#07		15941	" You rule over all the kingdoms of the nations. Power and might are in your hand, and no one can withstand you."
2CH	20	7	Jehoshaphat	#07		15942	" {7} O our God, did you not drive out the inhabitants of this land before your people Israel and give it forever to the descendants of Abraham your friend?"
2CH	20	8	Jehoshaphat	#07		15943	" {8} They have lived in it and have built in it a sanctuary for your Name, saying,"
2CH	20	9	Jehoshaphat	#07		15944	" {9} 'If calamity comes upon us, whether the sword of judgment, or plague or famine,"
2CH	20	9	Jehoshaphat	#07		15945	" we will stand in your presence before this temple that bears your Name and will cry out to you in our distress, and you will hear us and save us.'"
2CH	20	10	Jehoshaphat	#07		15946	" {10} << But now here are men from Ammon, Moab and Mount Seir, whose territory you would not allow Israel to invade when they came from Egypt;"
2CH	20	10	Jehoshaphat	#07		15947	 so they turned away from them and did not destroy them.
2CH	20	11	Jehoshaphat	#07		15948	 {11} See how they are repaying us by coming to drive us out of the possession you gave us as an inheritance.
2CH	20	12	Jehoshaphat	#07		15949	" {12} O our God, will you not judge them? For we have no power to face this vast army that is attacking us."
2CH	20	12	Jehoshaphat	#07		15950	" We do not know what to do, but our eyes are upon you.>>"
2CH	20	13	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15951	" {13} All the men of Judah, with their wives and children and little ones, stood there before the Lord."
2CH	20	14	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15952	" {14} Then the Spirit of the Lord came upon Jahaziel son of Zechariah, the son of Benaiah,"
2CH	20	14	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15953	" the son of Jeiel, the son of Mattaniah, a Levite and descendant of Asaph, as he stood in the assembly. {15} He said:"
2CH	20	15	Jahaziel	#10		15954	" << Listen, King Jehoshaphat and all who live in Judah and Jerusalem!"
2CH	20	15	Jahaziel	#10		15955	 This is what the Lord says to you: 'Do not be afraid or discouraged because of this vast army.
2CH	20	15	Jahaziel	#10		15956	" For the battle is not yours, but God's."
2CH	20	16	Jahaziel	#10		15957	 {16} Tomorrow march down against them.
2CH	20	16	Jahaziel	#10		15958	" They will be climbing up by the Pass of Ziz, and you will find them at the end of the gorge in the Desert of Jeruel."
2CH	20	17	Jahaziel	#10		15959	 {17} You will not have to fight this battle.
2CH	20	17	Jahaziel	#10		15960	" Take up your positions; stand firm and see the deliverance the Lord will give you, O Judah and Jerusalem."
2CH	20	17	Jahaziel	#10		15961	 Do not be afraid; do not be discouraged.
2CH	20	17	Jahaziel	#10		15962	" Go out to face them tomorrow, and the Lord will be with you.'<<"
2CH	20	18	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15963	" {18} Jehoshaphat bowed with his face to the ground, and all the people of Judah and Jerusalem fell down in worship before the Lord."
2CH	20	19	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15964	" {19} Then some Levites from the Kohathites and Korahites stood up and praised the Lord, the God of Israel, with very loud voice."
2CH	20	20	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15965	" {20} Early in the morning they left for the Desert of Tekoa. As they set out, Jehoshaphat stood and said,"
2CH	20	20	Jehoshaphat	#07		15966	" << Listen to me, Judah and people of Jerusalem!"
2CH	20	20	Jehoshaphat	#07		15967	 Have faith in the Lord your God and you will be upheld;
2CH	20	20	Jehoshaphat	#07		15968	 have faith in his prophets and you will be successful.>>
2CH	20	21	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15969	" {21} After consulting the people, Jehoshaphat appointed men to sing to the Lord and to praise him for the splendor of his holiness as they went out at the head of the army, saying:"
2CH	20	21	Man in Crowd	#18		15970	" << Give thanks to the Lord, for his love endures forever.>>"
2CH	20	22	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15971	" {22} As they began to sing and praise, the Lord set ambushes against the men of Ammon and Moab and Mount Seir who were invading Judah, and they were defeated."
2CH	20	23	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15972	 {23} The men of Ammon and Moab rose up against the men from Mount Seir to destroy and annihilate them.
2CH	20	23	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15973	" After they finished slaughtering the men from Seir, they helped to destroy one another."
2CH	20	24	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15974	" {24} When the men of Judah came to the place that overlooks the desert and looked toward the vast army, they saw only dead bodies lying on the ground; no one had escaped."
2CH	20	25	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15975	" {25} So Jehoshaphat and his men went to carry off their plunder, and they found among them a great amount of equipment and clothing and also articles of value--more than they could take away."
2CH	20	25	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15976	 There was so much plunder that it took three days to collect it.
2CH	20	26	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15977	" {26} On the fourth day they assembled in the Valley of Beracah, where they praised the Lord. This is why it is called the Valley of Beracah to this day."
2CH	20	27	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15978	" {27} Then, led by Jehoshaphat, all the men of Judah and Jerusalem returned joyfully to Jerusalem, for the Lord had given them cause to rejoice over their enemies."
2CH	20	28	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15979	 {28} They entered Jerusalem and went to the temple of the Lord with harps and lutes and trumpets.
2CH	20	29	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15980	 {29} The fear of God came upon all the kingdoms of the countries when they heard how the Lord had fought against the enemies of Israel.
2CH	20	30	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15981	" {30} And the kingdom of Jehoshaphat was at peace, for his God had given him rest on every side."
2CH	20	31	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15982	" {31} So Jehoshaphat reigned over Judah. He was thirty-five years old when he became king of Judah, and he reigned in Jerusalem twenty-five years."
2CH	20	31	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15983	 His mother's name was Azubah daughter of Shilhi.
2CH	20	32	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15984	 {32} He walked in the ways of his father Asa and did not stray from them; he did what was right in the eyes of the Lord.
2CH	20	33	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15985	" {33} The high places, however, were not removed, and the people still had not set their hearts on the God of their fathers."
2CH	20	34	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15986	" {34} The other events of Jehoshaphat's reign, from beginning to end, are written in the annals of Jehu son of Hanani, which are recorded in the book of the kings of Israel."
2CH	20	35	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15987	" {35} Later, Jehoshaphat king of Judah made an alliance with Ahaziah king of Israel, who was guilty of wickedness."
2CH	20	36	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15988	" {36} He agreed with him to construct a fleet of trading ships. After these were built at Ezion Geber,"
2CH	20	37	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15989	" {37} Eliezer son of Dodavahu of Mareshah prophesied against Jehoshaphat, saying,"

2CH	20	37	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		15991	 The ships were wrecked and were not able to set sail to trade.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*

2CH	21	15	Elijah	#13		16012	" {15} You yourself will be very ill with a lingering disease of the bowels, until the disease causes your bowels to come out.'<<"
2CH	21	16	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16013	 {16} The Lord aroused against Jehoram the hostility of the Philistines and of the Arabs who lived near the Cushites.

2CH	23	12	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16059	" {12} When Athaliah heard the noise of the people running and cheering the king, she went to them at the temple of the Lord."
2CH	23	13	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16060	" {13} She looked, and there was the king, standing by his pillar at the entrance."
2CH	23	13	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16061	" The officers and the trumpeters were beside the king, and all the people of the land were rejoicing and blowing trumpets, and singers with musical instruments were leading the praises."

2CH	23	15	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16068	" {15} So they seized her as she reached the entrance of the Horse Gate on the palace grounds, and there they put her to death."
2CH	23	16	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16069	 {16} Jehoiada then made a covenant that he and the people and the king would be the Lord's people.
2CH	23	17	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16070	 {17} All the people went to the temple of Baal and tore it down. They smashed the altars and idols and killed Mattan the priest of Baal in front of the altars.
2CH	23	18	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16071	" {18} Then Jehoiada placed the oversight of the temple of the Lord in the hands of the priests, who were Levites,"
2CH	23	18	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16072	" to whom David had made assignments in the temple, to present the burnt offerings of the Lord as written in the Law of Moses, with rejoicing and singing, as David had ordered."
2CH	23	19	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16073	 {19} He also stationed doorkeepers at the gates of the Lord's temple so that no one who was in any way unclean might enter.
2CH	23	20	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16074	" {20} He took with him the commanders of hundreds, the nobles, the rulers of the people and all the people of the land and brought the king down from the temple of the Lord."

2CH	24	<<	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16077	2 CHRONICLES 24
2CH	24	1	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16078	" {1} Joash was seven years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem forty years. His mother's name was Zibiah; she was from Beersheba."
2CH	24	2	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16079	" {2} Joash did what was right in the eyes of the Lord all the years of Jehoiada the priest. {3} Jehoiada chose two wives for him, and he had sons and daughters."
2CH	24	4	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16080	" {4} Some time later Joash decided to restore the temple of the Lord. {5} He called together the priests and Levites and said to them,"
2CH	24	5	King Joash	#12		16081	" << Go to the towns of Judah and collect the money due annually from all Israel, to repair the temple of your God. Do it now.>>"
2CH	24	5	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16082	" But the Levites did not act at once. {6} Therefore the king summoned Jehoiada the chief priest and said to him,"
2CH	24	6	King Joash	#12		16083	 << Why haven't you required the Levites to bring in from Judah and Jerusalem the tax imposed by Moses the servant of the Lord and by the assembly of Israel for the Tent of the Testimony?>>
2CH	24	7	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16084	 {7} Now the sons of that wicked woman Athaliah had broken into the temple of God and had used even its sacred objects for the Baals.
2CH	24	8	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16085	" {8} At the king's command, a chest was made and placed outside, at the gate of the temple of the Lord."
2CH	24	9	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16086	 {9} A proclamation was then issued in Judah and Jerusalem that they should bring to the Lord the tax that Moses the servant of God had required of Israel in the desert.
2CH	24	10	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16087	" {10} All the officials and all the people brought their contributions gladly, dropping them into the chest until it was full."
2CH	24	11	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16088	" {11} Whenever the chest was brought in by the Levites to the king's officials and they saw that there was a large amount of money,"
2CH	24	11	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16089	 the royal secretary and the officer of the chief priest would come and empty the chest and carry it back to its place.
2CH	24	11	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16090	 They did this regularly and collected a great amount of money.
2CH	24	12	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16091	 {12} The king and Jehoiada gave it to the men who carried out the work required for the temple of the Lord.
2CH	24	12	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16092	" They hired masons and carpenters to restore the Lord's temple, and also workers in iron and bronze to repair the temple."
2CH	24	13	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16093	" {13} The men in charge of the work were diligent, and the repairs progressed under them. They rebuilt the temple of God according to its original design and reinforced it."
2CH	24	14	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16094	" {14} When they had finished, they brought the rest of the money to the king and Jehoiada, and with it were made articles for the Lord's temple:"
2CH	24	14	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16095	" articles for the service and for the burnt offerings, and also dishes and other objects of gold and silver."
2CH	24	14	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16096	" As long as Jehoiada lived, burnt offerings were presented continually in the temple of the Lord."
2CH	24	15	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16097	" {15} Now Jehoiada was old and full of years, and he died at the age of a hundred and thirty."
2CH	24	16	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16098	" {16} He was buried with the kings in the City of David, because of the good he had done in Israel for God and his temple."
2CH	24	17	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16099	" {17} After the death of Jehoiada, the officials of Judah came and paid homage to the king, and he listened to them."
2CH	24	18	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16100	" {18} They abandoned the temple of the Lord, the God of their fathers, and worshiped Asherah poles and idols. Because of their guilt, God's anger came upon Judah and Jerusalem."
2CH	24	19	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16101	" {19} Although the Lord sent prophets to the people to bring them back to him, and though they testified against them, they would not listen."
2CH	24	20	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16102	" {20} Then the Spirit of God came upon Zechariah son of Jehoiada the priest. He stood before the people and said,"
2CH	24	20	Zechariah (son of Jehoiada)	#06		16103	 << This is what God says: 'Why do you disobey the Lord's commands?
2CH	24	20	Zechariah (son of Jehoiada)	#06		16104	" You will not prosper. Because you have forsaken the Lord, he has forsaken you.'>>"
2CH	24	21	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16105	" {21} But they plotted against him, and by order of the king they stoned him to death in the courtyard of the Lord's temple."
2CH	24	22	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16106	" {22} King Joash did not remember the kindness Zechariah's father Jehoiada had shown him but killed his son, who said as he lay dying,"
2CH	24	22	Zechariah (son of Jehoiada)	#06		16107	 << May the Lord see this and call you to account.>>
2CH	24	23	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16108	" {23} At the turn of the year, the army of Aram marched against Joash; it invaded Judah and Jerusalem and killed all the leaders of the people."
2CH	24	23	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16109	 They sent all the plunder to their king in Damascus.
2CH	24	24	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16110	" {24} Although the Aramean army had come with only a few men, the Lord delivered into their hands a much larger army."
2CH	24	24	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16111	" Because Judah had forsaken the Lord, the God of their fathers, judgment was executed on Joash."
2CH	24	25	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16112	" {25} When the Arameans withdrew, they left Joash severely wounded. His officials conspired against him for murdering the son of Jehoiada the priest, and they killed him in his bed."
2CH	24	25	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16113	" So he died and was buried in the City of David, but not in the tombs of the kings."
2CH	24	26	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16114	" {26} Those who conspired against him were Zabad, son of Shimeath an Ammonite woman, and Jehozabad, son of Shimrith a Moabite woman."
2CH	24	27	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16115	" {27} The account of his sons, the many prophecies about him, and the record of the restoration of the temple of God are written in the annotations on the book of the kings."
2CH	24	27	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16116	 And Amaziah his son succeeded him as king.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
2CH	25	<<	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16117	2 CHRONICLES 25
2CH	25	1	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16118	" {1} Amaziah was twenty-five years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem twenty-nine years. His mother's name was Jehoaddin; she was from Jerusalem."
2CH	25	2	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16119	" {2} He did what was right in the eyes of the Lord, but not wholeheartedly. {3} After the kingdom was firmly in his control, he executed the officials who had murdered his father the king."
2CH	25	4	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16120	" {4} Yet he did not put their sons to death, but acted in accordance with what is written in the Law, in the Book of Moses, where the Lord commanded:"
2CH	25	4	God-FX1	#20		16121	" << Fathers shall not be put to death for their children, nor children put to death for their fathers; each is to die for his own sins.>>"
2CH	25	5	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16122	 {5} Amaziah called the people of Judah together and assigned them according to their families to commanders of thousands and commanders of hundreds for all Judah and Benjamin.
2CH	25	5	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16123	" He then mustered those twenty years old or more and found that there were three hundred thousand men ready for military service, able to handle the spear and shield."
2CH	25	6	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16124	" {6} He also hired a hundred thousand fighting men from Israel for a hundred talents of silver. {7} But a man of God came to him and said,"
2CH	25	7	Man of God-FX1	#09		16125	" << O king, these troops from Israel must not march with you, for the Lord is not with Israel --not with any of the people of Ephraim."
2CH	25	8	Man of God-FX1	#09		16126	" {8} Even if you go and fight courageously in battle, God will overthrow you before the enemy, for God has the power to help or to overthrow.>>"
2CH	25	9	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16127	" {9} Amaziah asked the man of God,"
2CH	25	9	King Amaziah	#08		16128	 << But what about the hundred talents I paid for these Israelite troops?>>
2CH	25	9	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16129	" The man of God replied,"
2CH	25	9	Man of God-FX1	#09		16130	 << The Lord can give you much more than that.>>
2CH	25	10	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16131	 {10} So Amaziah dismissed the troops who had come to him from Ephraim and sent them home. They were furious with Judah and left for home in a great rage.
2CH	25	11	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16132	" {11} Amaziah then marshaled his strength and led his army to the Valley of Salt, where he killed ten thousand men of Seir."
2CH	25	12	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16133	" {12} The army of Judah also captured ten thousand men alive, took them to the top of a cliff and threw them down so that all were dashed to pieces."
2CH	25	13	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16134	 {13} Meanwhile the troops that Amaziah had sent back and had not allowed to take part in the war raided Judean towns from Samaria to Beth Horon.
2CH	25	13	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16135	 They killed three thousand people and carried off great quantities of plunder.
2CH	25	14	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16136	" {14} When Amaziah returned from slaughtering the Edomites, he brought back the gods of the people of Seir. He set them up as his own gods, bowed down to them and burned sacrifices to them."
2CH	25	15	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16137	" {15} The anger of the Lord burned against Amaziah, and he sent a prophet to him, who said,"
2CH	25	15	Prophet	#03		16138	" << Why do you consult this people's gods, which could not save their own people from your hand?>>"
2CH	25	16	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16139	" {16} While he was still speaking, the king said to him,"
2CH	25	16	King Joash	#12		16140	 << Have we appointed you an adviser to the king? Stop! Why be struck down?>>
2CH	25	16	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16141	" So the prophet stopped but said,"
2CH	25	16	Prophet	#03		16142	" << I know that God has determined to destroy you, because you have done this and have not listened to my counsel.>>"
2CH	25	17	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16143	" {17} After Amaziah king of Judah consulted his advisers, he sent this challenge to Jehoash son of Jehoahaz, the son of Jehu, king of Israel:"
2CH	25	17	King Amaziah	#08		16144	" << Come, meet me face to face.>>"
2CH	25	18	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16145	 {18} But Jehoash king of Israel replied to Amaziah king of Judah:
2CH	25	18	King Jehoash	#14		16146	" << A thistle in Lebanon sent a message to a cedar in Lebanon, 'Give your daughter to my son in marriage.'"
2CH	25	18	King Jehoash	#14		16147	 Then a wild beast in Lebanon came along and trampled the thistle underfoot.
2CH	25	19	King Jehoash	#14		16148	" {19} You say to yourself that you have defeated Edom, and now you are arrogant and proud."
2CH	25	19	King Jehoash	#14		16149	 But stay at home! Why ask for trouble and cause your own downfall and that of Judah also?>>
2CH	25	20	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16150	" {20} Amaziah, however, would not listen, for God so worked that he might hand them over to Jehoash, because they sought the gods of Edom."
2CH	25	21	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16151	 {21} So Jehoash king of Israel attacked. He and Amaziah king of Judah faced each other at Beth Shemesh in Judah.
2CH	25	22	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16152	" {22} Judah was routed by Israel, and every man fled to his home."
2CH	25	23	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16153	" {23} Jehoash king of Israel captured Amaziah king of Judah, the son of Joash, the son of Ahaziah, at Beth Shemesh."
2CH	25	23	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16154	 Then Jehoash brought him to Jerusalem and broke down the wall of Jerusalem from the Ephraim Gate to the Corner Gate--a section about six hundred feet long.
2CH	25	24	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16155	" {24} He took all the gold and silver and all the articles found in the temple of God that had been in the care of Obed-Edom, together with the palace treasures and the hostages, and returned to Samaria."
2CH	25	25	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16156	 {25} Amaziah son of Joash king of Judah lived for fifteen years after the death of Jehoash son of Jehoahaz king of Israel.
2CH	25	26	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16157	" {26} As for the other events of Amaziah's reign, from beginning to end, are they not written in the book of the kings of Judah and Israel?"
2CH	25	27	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16158	" {27} From the time that Amaziah turned away from following the Lord, they conspired against him in Jerusalem and he fled to Lachish, but they sent men after him to Lachish and killed him there."
2CH	25	28	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16159	 {28} He was brought back by horse and was buried with his fathers in the City of Judah.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
2CH	26	<<	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16160	2 CHRONICLES 26
2CH	26	1	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16161	" {1} Then all the people of Judah took Uzziah, who was sixteen years old, and made him king in place of his father Amaziah."
2CH	26	2	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16162	 {2} He was the one who rebuilt Elath and restored it to Judah after Amaziah rested with his fathers.
2CH	26	3	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16163	" {3} Uzziah was sixteen years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem fifty-two years. His mother's name was Jecoliah; she was from Jerusalem."
2CH	26	4	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16164	" {4} He did what was right in the eyes of the Lord, just as his father Amaziah had done."
2CH	26	5	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16165	" {5} He sought God during the days of Zechariah, who instructed him in the fear of God. As long as he sought the Lord, God gave him success."
2CH	26	6	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16166	" {6} He went to war against the Philistines and broke down the walls of Gath, Jabneh and Ashdod. He then rebuilt towns near Ashdod and elsewhere among the Philistines."
2CH	26	7	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16167	 {7} God helped him against the Philistines and against the Arabs who lived in Gur Baal and against the Meunites.
2CH	26	8	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16168	" {8} The Ammonites brought tribute to Uzziah, and his fame spread as far as the border of Egypt, because he had become very powerful."
2CH	26	9	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16169	" {9} Uzziah built towers in Jerusalem at the Corner Gate, at the Valley Gate and at the angle of the wall, and he fortified them."
2CH	26	10	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16170	" {10} He also built towers in the desert and dug many cisterns, because he had much livestock in the foothills and in the plain."
2CH	26	10	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16171	" He had people working his fields and vineyards in the hills and in the fertile lands, for he loved the soil."
2CH	26	11	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16172	" {11} Uzziah had a well-trained army, ready to go out by divisions according to their numbers as mustered by Jeiel the secretary and Maaseiah the officer under the direction of Hananiah, one of the royal officials."
2CH	26	12	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16173	" {12} The total number of family leaders over the fighting men was 2,600."
2CH	26	13	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16174	" {13} Under their command was an army of 307,500 men trained for war, a powerful force to support the king against his enemies."
2CH	26	14	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16175	" {14} Uzziah provided shields, spears, helmets, coats of armor, bows and slingstones for the entire army."
2CH	26	15	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16176	 {15} In Jerusalem he made machines designed by skillful men for use on the towers and on the corner defenses to shoot arrows and hurl large stones.
2CH	26	15	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16177	" His fame spread far and wide, for he was greatly helped until he became powerful."
2CH	26	16	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16178	" {16} But after Uzziah became powerful, his pride led to his downfall. He was unfaithful to the Lord his God, and entered the temple of the Lord to burn incense on the altar of incense."
2CH	26	17	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16179	" {17} Azariah the priest with eighty other courageous priests of the Lord followed him in. {18} They confronted him and said,"
2CH	26	18	Azariah	#16		16180	" << It is not right for you, Uzziah, to burn incense to the Lord."
2CH	26	18	Azariah	#16		16181	" That is for the priests, the descendants of Aaron, who have been consecrated to burn incense."
2CH	26	18	Azariah	#16		16182	" Leave the sanctuary, for you have been unfaithful; and you will not be honored by the Lord God.>>"
2CH	26	19	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16183	" {19} Uzziah, who had a censer in his hand ready to burn incense, became angry."
2CH	26	19	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16184	" While he was raging at the priests in their presence before the incense altar in the Lord's temple, leprosy broke out on his forehead."
2CH	26	20	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16185	" {20} When Azariah the chief priest and all the other priests looked at him, they saw that he had leprosy on his forehead, so they hurried him out."
2CH	26	20	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16186	" Indeed, he himself was eager to leave, because the Lord had afflicted him."
2CH	26	21	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16187	" {21} King Uzziah had leprosy until the day he died. He lived in a separate house --leprous, and excluded from the temple of the Lord."
2CH	26	21	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16188	 Jotham his son had charge of the palace and governed the people of the land.
2CH	26	22	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16189	" {22} The other events of Uzziah's reign, from beginning to end, are recorded by the prophet Isaiah son of Amoz."
2CH	26	23	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16190	" {23} Uzziah rested with his fathers and was buried near them in a field for burial that belonged to the kings, for people said,"
2CH	26	23	Man	#09		16191	 << He had leprosy.>>
2CH	26	23	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16192	 And Jotham his son succeeded him as king.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
2CH	27	<<	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16193	2 CHRONICLES 27

2CH	27	5	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16199	" {5} Jotham made war on the king of the Ammonites and conquered them. That year the Ammonites paid him a hundred talents of silver, ten thousand cors of wheat and ten thousand cors of barley."
