2CH	28	<<	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16205	2 CHRONICLES 28
2CH	28	1	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16206	" {1} Ahaz was twenty years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem sixteen years. Unlike David his father, he did not do what was right in the eyes of the Lord."
2CH	28	2	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16207	 {2} He walked in the ways of the kings of Israel and also made cast idols for worshiping the Baals.
2CH	28	3	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16208	" {3} He burned sacrifices in the Valley of Ben Hinnom and sacrificed his sons in the fire, following the detestable ways of the nations the Lord had driven out before the Israelites."
2CH	28	4	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16209	" {4} He offered sacrifices and burned incense at the high places, on the hilltops and under every spreading tree."
2CH	28	5	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16210	 {5} Therefore the Lord his God handed him over to the king of Aram. The Arameans defeated him and took many of his people as prisoners and brought them to Damascus.
2CH	28	5	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16211	" He was also given into the hands of the king of Israel, who inflicted heavy casualties on him."
2CH	28	6	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16212	" {6} In one day Pekah son of Remaliah killed a hundred and twenty thousand soldiers in Judah--because Judah had forsaken the Lord, the God of their fathers."
2CH	28	7	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16213	" {7} Zicri, an Ephraimite warrior, killed Maaseiah the king's son, Azrikam the officer in charge of the palace, and Elkanah, second to the king."
2CH	28	8	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16214	" {8} The Israelites took captive from their kinsmen two hundred thousand wives, sons and daughters. They also took a great deal of plunder, which they carried back to Samaria."
2CH	28	9	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16215	" {9} But a prophet of the Lord named Oded was there, and he went out to meet the army when it returned to Samaria. He said to them,"
2CH	28	9	Prophet: Oded	#06		16216	" << Because the Lord, the God of your fathers, was angry with Judah, he gave them into your hand. But you have slaughtered them in a rage that reaches to heaven."
2CH	28	10	Prophet: Oded	#06		16217	 {10} And now you intend to make the men and women of Judah and Jerusalem your slaves. But aren't you also guilty of sins against the Lord your God?
2CH	28	11	Prophet: Oded	#06		16218	" {11} Now listen to me! Send back your fellow countrymen you have taken as prisoners, for the Lord's fierce anger rests on you.>>"
2CH	28	12	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16219	" {12} Then some of the leaders in Ephraim --Azariah son of Jehohanan, Berekiah son of Meshillemoth,"
2CH	28	12	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16220	" Jehizkiah son of Shallum, and Amasa son of Hadlai --"
2CH	28	12	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16221	 confronted those who were arriving from the war.
2CH	28	13	Leader	#13		16222	" {13} <<You must not bring those prisoners here, or we will be guilty before the Lord."
2CH	28	13	Leader	#13		16223	" Do you intend to add to our sin and guilt? For our guilt is already great, and his fierce anger rests on Israel.>>"
2CH	28	14	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16224	 {14} So the soldiers gave up the prisoners and plunder in the presence of the officials and all the assembly.
2CH	28	15	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16225	" {15} The men designated by name took the prisoners, and from the plunder they clothed all who were naked."
2CH	28	15	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16226	" They provided them with clothes and sandals, food and drink, and healing balm. All those who were weak they put on donkeys."
2CH	28	15	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16227	" So they took them back to their fellow countrymen at Jericho, the City of Palms, and returned to Samaria. {16} At that time King Ahaz sent to the king of Assyria for help."
2CH	28	17	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16228	" {17} The Edomites had again come and attacked Judah and carried away prisoners, {18} while the Philistines had raided towns in the foothills and in the Negev of Judah."
2CH	28	18	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16229	" They captured and occupied Beth Shemesh, Aijalon and Gederoth,"
2CH	28	18	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16230	" as well as Soco, Timnah and Gimzo, with their surrounding villages."
2CH	28	19	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16231	" {19} The Lord had humbled Judah because of Ahaz king of Israel, for he had promoted wickedness in Judah and had been most unfaithful to the Lord."
2CH	28	20	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16232	" {20} Tiglath-Pileser king of Assyria came to him, but he gave him trouble instead of help."
2CH	28	21	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16233	" {21} Ahaz took some of the things from the temple of the Lord and from the royal palace and from the princes and presented them to the king of Assyria, but that did not help him."
2CH	28	22	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16234	" {22} In his time of trouble King Ahaz became even more unfaithful to the Lord. {23} He offered sacrifices to the gods of Damascus, who had defeated him; for he thought,"
2CH	28	23	King Ahaz	#15		16235	" << Since the gods of the kings of Aram have helped them, I will sacrifice to them so they will help me.>>"
2CH	28	23	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16236	 But they were his downfall and the downfall of all Israel.
2CH	28	24	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16237	 {24} Ahaz gathered together the furnishings from the temple of God and took them away. He shut the doors of the Lord's temple and set up altars at every street corner in Jerusalem.
2CH	28	25	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16238	" {25} In every town in Judah he built high places to burn sacrifices to other gods and provoked the Lord, the God of his fathers, to anger."
2CH	28	26	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16239	" {26} The other events of his reign and all his ways, from beginning to end, are written in the book of the kings of Judah and Israel."
2CH	28	27	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16240	" {27} Ahaz rested with his fathers and was buried in the city of Jerusalem, but he was not placed in the tombs of the kings of Israel."
2CH	28	27	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16241	 And Hezekiah his son succeeded him as king.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
2CH	29	<<	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16242	2 CHRONICLES 29
2CH	29	1	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16243	" {1} Hezekiah was twenty-five years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem twenty-nine years. His mother's name was Abijah daughter of Zechariah."
2CH	29	2	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16244	" {2} He did what was right in the eyes of the Lord, just as his father David had done."
2CH	29	3	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16245	" {3} In the first month of the first year of his reign, he opened the doors of the temple of the Lord and repaired them."
2CH	29	4	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16246	" {4} He brought in the priests and the Levites, assembled them in the square on the east side {5} and said:"
2CH	29	5	King Hezekiah	#10		16247	" << Listen to me, Levites! Consecrate yourselves now and consecrate the temple of the Lord, the God of your fathers. Remove all defilement from the sanctuary."
2CH	29	6	King Hezekiah	#10		16248	 {6} Our fathers were unfaithful; they did evil in the eyes of the Lord our God and forsook him. They turned their faces away from the Lord's dwelling place and turned their backs on him.
2CH	29	7	King Hezekiah	#10		16249	 {7} They also shut the doors of the portico and put out the lamps. They did not burn incense or present any burnt offerings at the sanctuary to the God of Israel.
2CH	29	8	King Hezekiah	#10		16250	" {8} Therefore, the anger of the Lord has fallen on Judah and Jerusalem; he has made them an object of dread and horror and scorn, as you can see with your own eyes."
2CH	29	9	King Hezekiah	#10		16251	 {9} This is why our fathers have fallen by the sword and why our sons and daughters and our wives are in captivity.
2CH	29	10	King Hezekiah	#10		16252	" {10} Now I intend to make a covenant with the Lord, the God of Israel, so that his fierce anger will turn away from us."
2CH	29	11	King Hezekiah	#10		16253	" {11} My sons, do not be negligent now, for the Lord has chosen you to stand before him and serve him, to minister before him and to burn incense.>>"
2CH	29	12	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16254	" {12} Then these Levites set to work: from the Kohathites, Mahath son of Amasai and Joel son of Azariah; "
2CH	29	12	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16255	" from the Merarites, Kish son of Abdi and Azariah son of Jehallelel; "
2CH	29	12	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16256	" from the Gershonites, Joah son of Zimmah and Eden son of Joah;"
2CH	29	13	Geneology	#01		16257	" {13} from the descendants of Elizaphan, Shimri and Jeiel; from the descendants of Asaph, Zechariah and Mattaniah;"
2CH	29	14	Geneology	#01		16258	" {14} from the descendants of Heman, Jehiel and Shimei; from the descendants of Jeduthun, Shemaiah and Uzziel."
2CH	29	15	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16259	" {15} When they had assembled their brothers and consecrated themselves, they went in to purify the temple of the Lord, as the king had ordered, following the word of the Lord."
2CH	29	16	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16260	 {16} The priests went into the sanctuary of the Lord to purify it. 
2CH	29	16	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16261	 They brought out to the courtyard of the Lord's temple everything unclean that they found in the temple of the Lord. The Levites took it and carried it out to the Kidron Valley.
2CH	29	17	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16262	" {17} They began the consecration on the first day of the first month, and by the eighth day of the month they reached the portico of the Lord. "
2CH	29	17	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16263	" For eight more days they consecrated the temple of the Lord itself, finishing on the sixteenth day of the first month. {18} Then they went in to King Hezekiah and reported:"
2CH	29	18	Priest	#02		16264	" << We have purified the entire temple of the Lord, the altar of burnt offering with all its utensils, and the table for setting out the consecrated bread, with all its articles."
2CH	29	19	Priest	#02		16265	 {19} We have prepared and consecrated all the articles that King Ahaz removed in his unfaithfulness while he was king. They are now in front of the Lord's altar.>>
2CH	29	20	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16266	 {20} Early the next morning King Hezekiah gathered the city officials together and went up to the temple of the Lord.
2CH	29	21	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16267	" {21} They brought seven bulls, seven rams, seven male lambs and seven male goats as a sin offering for the kingdom, for the sanctuary and for Judah. "
2CH	29	21	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16268	" The king commanded the priests, the descendants of Aaron, to offer these on the altar of the Lord."
2CH	29	22	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16269	" {22} So they slaughtered the bulls, and the priests took the blood and sprinkled it on the altar; "
2CH	29	22	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16270	 next they slaughtered the rams and sprinkled their blood on the altar; then they slaughtered the lambs and sprinkled their blood on the altar.
2CH	29	23	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16271	" {23} The goats for the sin offering were brought before the king and the assembly, and they laid their hands on them."
2CH	29	24	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16272	" {24} The priests then slaughtered the goats and presented their blood on the altar for a sin offering to atone for all Israel, because the king had ordered the burnt offering and the sin offering for all Israel."
2CH	29	25	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16273	" {25} He stationed the Levites in the temple of the Lord with cymbals, harps and lyres in the way prescribed by David and Gad the king's seer and Nathan the prophet;"
2CH	29	25	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16274	 this was commanded by the Lord through his prophets.
2CH	29	26	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16275	" {26} So the Levites stood ready with David's instruments, and the priest s with their trumpets."
2CH	29	27	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16276	" {27} Hezekiah gave the order to sacrifice the burnt offering on the altar. As the offering began, singing to the Lord began also, accompanied by trumpets and the instruments of David king of Israel."
2CH	29	28	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16277	" {28}The whole assembly bowed in worship, while the singers sang and the trumpeters played. All this continued until the sacrifice of the burnt offering was completed."
2CH	29	29	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16278	" {29} When the offerings were finished, the king and everyone present with him knelt down and worshiped."
2CH	29	30	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16279	 {30} King Hezekiah and his officials ordered the Levites to praise the Lord with the words of David and of Asaph the seer. So they sang praises with gladness and bowed their heads and worshiped.
2CH	29	31	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16280	" {31} Then Hezekiah said,"
2CH	29	31	King Hezekiah	#10		16281	 << You have now dedicated yourselves to the Lord. Come and bring sacrifices and thank offerings to the temple of the Lord.>>
2CH	29	31	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16282	" So the assembly brought sacrifices and thank offerings, and all whose hearts were willing brought burnt offerings."
2CH	29	32	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16283	" {32} The number of burnt offerings the assembly brought was seventy bulls, a hundred rams and two hundred male lambs--all of them for burnt offerings to the Lord."
2CH	29	33	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16284	 {33} The animals consecrated as sacrifices amounted to six hundred bulls and three thousand sheep and goats.
2CH	29	34	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16285	" {34} The priests, however, were too few to skin all the burnt offerings; "
2CH	29	34	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16286	" so their kinsmen the Levites helped them until the task was finished and until other priests had been consecrated, "
2CH	29	34	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16287	 for the Levites had been more conscientious in consecrating themselves than the priests had been.
2CH	29	35	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16288	" {35} There were burnt offerings in abundance, together with the fat of the fellowship offerings and the drink offerings that accompanied the burnt offerings. "
2CH	29	35	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16289	 So the service of the temple of the Lord was reestablished.
2CH	29	36	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16290	" {36} Hezekiah and all the people rejoiced at what God had brought about for his people, because it was done so quickly.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
2CH	30	<<	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16291	2 CHRONICLES 30
2CH	30	1	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16292	" {1} Hezekiah sent word to all Israel and Judah and also wrote letters to Ephraim and Manasseh, inviting them to come to the temple of the Lord in Jerusalem and celebrate the Passover to the Lord, the God of Israel."
2CH	30	2	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16293	 {2} The king and his officials and the whole assembly in Jerusalem decided to celebrate the Passover in the second month.
2CH	30	3	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16294	 {3} They had not been able to celebrate it at the regular time because not enough priests had consecrated themselves and the people had not assembled in Jerusalem.
2CH	30	4	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16295	 {4} The plan seemed right both to the king and to the whole assembly.
2CH	30	5	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16296	" {5} They decided to send a proclamation throughout Israel, from Beersheba to Dan, calling the people to come to Jerusalem and celebrate the Passover to the Lord, the God of Israel."
2CH	30	5	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16297	 It had not been celebrated in large numbers according to what was written.
2CH	30	6	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16298	" {6} At the king's command, couriers went throughout Israel and Judah with letters from the king and from his officials, which read:"
2CH	30	6	King Hezekiah	#10		16299	" << People of Israel, return to the Lord, the God of Abraham, Isaac and Israel, that he may return to you who are left, who have escaped from the hand of the kings of Assyria."
2CH	30	7	King Hezekiah	#10		16300	" {7} Do not be like your fathers and brothers, who were unfaithful to the Lord, the God of their fathers, so that he made them an object of horror, as you see."
2CH	30	8	King Hezekiah	#10		16301	" {8} Do not be stiff-necked, as your fathers were; submit to the Lord. Come to the sanctuary, which he has consecrated forever. "
2CH	30	8	King Hezekiah	#10		16302	" Serve the Lord your God, so that his fierce anger will turn away from you."
2CH	30	9	King Hezekiah	#10		16303	" {9} If you return to the Lord, then your brothers and your children will be shown compassion by their captors and will come back to this land, for the Lord your God is gracious and compassionate. "
2CH	30	9	King Hezekiah	#10		16304	 He will not turn his face from you if you return to him.>>
2CH	30	10	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16305	" {10} The couriers went from town to town in Ephraim and Manasseh, as far as Zebulun, but the people scorned and ridiculed them."
2CH	30	11	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16306	" {11} Nevertheless, some men of Asher, Manasseh and Zebulun humbled themselves and went to Jerusalem"
2CH	30	12	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16307	" {12} Also in Judah the hand of God was on the people to give them unity of mind to carry out what the king and his officials had ordered, following the word of the Lord."
2CH	30	13	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16308	 {13} A very large crowd of people assembled in Jerusalem to celebrate the Feast of Unleavened Bread in the second month.
2CH	30	14	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16309	 {14} They removed the altars in Jerusalem and cleared away the incense altars and threw them into the Kidron Valley.
2CH	30	15	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16310	 {15} They slaughtered the Passover lamb on the fourteenth day of the second month. 
2CH	30	15	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16311	 The priests and the Levites were ashamed and consecrated themselves and brought burnt offerings to the temple of the Lord.
2CH	30	16	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16312	 {16} Then they took up their regular positions as prescribed in the Law of Moses the man of God. The priests sprinkled the blood handed to them by the Levites.
2CH	30	17	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16313	" {17} Since many in the crowd had not consecrated themselves, the Levites had to kill the Passover lambs for all those who were not ceremonially clean and could not consecrate their lambs to the Lord."
2CH	30	18	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16314	" {18} Although most of the many people who came from Ephraim, Manasseh, Issachar and Zebulun had not purified themselves, yet they ate the Passover, contrary to what was written. "
2CH	30	18	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16315	" But Hezekiah prayed for them, saying,"
2CH	30	18	King Hezekiah	#10		16316	" << May the Lord, who is good, pardon everyone {19} who sets his heart on seeking God--the Lord, the God of his fathers--even if he is not clean according to the rules of the sanctuary.>>"
2CH	30	20	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16317	 {20} And the Lord heard Hezekiah and healed the people.
2CH	30	21	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16318	" {21} The Israelites who were present in Jerusalem celebrated the Feast of Unleavened Bread for seven days with great rejoicing, while the Levites and priests sang to the Lord every day, accompanied by the Lord's instruments of praise."
2CH	30	22	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16319	" {22} Hezekiah spoke encouragingly to all the Levites, who showed good understanding of the service of the Lord. "
2CH	30	22	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16320	" For the seven days they ate their assigned portion and offered fellowship offerings and praised the Lord, the God of their fathers."
2CH	30	23	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16321	 {23} The whole assembly then agreed to celebrate the festival seven more days; so for another seven days they celebrated joyfully.
2CH	30	24	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16322	" {24} Hezekiah king of Judah provided a thousand bulls and seven thousand sheep and goats for the assembly, "
2CH	30	24	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16323	 and the officials provided them with a thousand bulls and ten thousand sheep and goats. A great number of priests consecrated themselves.
2CH	30	25	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16324	" {25} The entire assembly of Judah rejoiced, along with the priests and Levites and all who had assembled from Israel, including the aliens who had come from Israel and those who lived in Judah."
2CH	30	26	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16325	" {26} There was great joy in Jerusalem, for since the days of Solomon son of David king of Israel there had been nothing like this in Jerusalem."
2CH	30	27	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16326	" {27} The priests and the Levites stood to bless the people, and God heard them, for their prayer reached heaven, his holy dwelling place.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"

2CH	31	21	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16358	" {21} In everything that he undertook in the service of God's temple and in obedience to the law and the commands, he sought his God and worked wholeheartedly. And so he prospered.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
2CH	32	<<	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16359	2 CHRONICLES 32
2CH	32	1	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16360	" {1} After all that Hezekiah had so faithfully done, Sennacherib king of Assyria came and invaded Judah. He laid siege to the fortified cities, thinking to conquer them for himself."
2CH	32	2	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16361	" {2} When Hezekiah saw that Sennacherib had come and that he intended to make war on Jerusalem,"
2CH	32	3	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16362	" {3} he consulted with his officials and military staff about blocking off the water from the springs outside the city, and they helped him."
2CH	32	4	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16363	" {4} A large force of men assembled, and they blocked all the springs and the stream that flowed through the land. They said,"
2CH	32	4	Man	#12		16364	 << Why should the kings of Assyria come and find plenty of water?>>
2CH	32	5	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16365	 {5} Then he worked hard repairing all the broken sections of the wall and building towers on it. 
2CH	32	5	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16366	 He built another wall outside that one and reinforced the supporting terraces of the City of David. He also made large numbers of weapons and shields.
2CH	32	6	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16367	 {6} He appointed military officers over the people and assembled them before him in the square at the city gate and encouraged them with these words:
2CH	32	7	King Hezekiah	#10		16368	" {7} << Be strong and courageous. Do not be afraid or discouraged because of the king of Assyria and the vast army with him, for there is a greater power with us than with him."
2CH	32	8	King Hezekiah	#10		16369	" {8} With him is only the arm of flesh, but with us is the Lord our God to help us and to fight our battles.>>"
2CH	32	8	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16370	 And the people gained confidence from what Hezekiah the king of Judah said.
2CH	32	9	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16371	" {9} Later, when Sennacherib king of Assyria and all his forces were laying siege to Lachish, "
2CH	32	9	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16372	 he sent his officers to Jerusalem with this message for Hezekiah king of Judah and for all the people of Judah who were there:
2CH	32	10	Commander	#13		16373	" {10} << This is what Sennacherib king of Assyria says: On what are you basing your confidence, that you remain in Jerusalem under siege?"
2CH	32	11	Commander	#13		16374	" {11} When Hezekiah says, 'The Lord our God will save us from the hand of the king of Assyria,' he is misleading you, to let you die of hunger and thirst."
2CH	32	12	Commander	#13		16375	" {12} Did not Hezekiah himself remove this god's high places and altars, saying to Judah and Jerusalem, 'You must worship before one altar and burn sacrifices on it'?"
2CH	32	13	Commander	#13		16376	 {13} << Do you not know what I and my fathers have done to all the peoples of the other lands? Were the gods of those nations ever able to deliver their land from my hand?
2CH	32	14	Commander	#13		16377	 {14} Who of all the gods of these nations that my fathers destroyed has been able to save his people from me? How then can your god deliver you from my hand?
2CH	32	15	Commander	#13		16378	 {15} Now do not let Hezekiah deceive you and mislead you like this. 
2CH	32	15	Commander	#13		16379	" Do not believe him, for no god of any nation or kingdom has been able to deliver his people from my hand or the hand of my fathers. "
2CH	32	15	Commander	#13		16380	 How much less will your god deliver you from my hand!>>
2CH	32	16	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16381	 {16} Sennacherib's officers spoke further against the Lord God and against his servant Hezekiah.
2CH	32	17	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16382	" {17} The king also wrote letters insulting the Lord, the God of Israel, and saying this against him:"
2CH	32	17	Commander	#13		16383	" <<J ust as the gods of the peoples of the other lands did not rescue their people from my hand, so the god of Hezekiah will not rescue his people from my hand.>>"
2CH	32	18	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16384	" {18} Then they called out in Hebrew to the people of Jerusalem who were on the wall, to terrify them and make them afraid in order to capture the city."
2CH	32	19	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16385	 {19} They spoke about the God of Jerusalem as they did about the gods of the other peoples of the world--the work of men's hands.
2CH	32	20	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16386	 {20} King Hezekiah and the prophet Isaiah son of Amoz cried out in prayer to heaven about this.
2CH	32	21	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16387	" {21} And the Lord sent an angel, who annihilated all the fighting men and the leaders and officers in the camp of the Assyrian king. "
2CH	32	21	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16388	" So he withdrew to his own land in disgrace. And when he went into the temple of his god, some of his sons cut him down with the sword."
2CH	32	22	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16389	 {22} So the Lord saved Hezekiah and the people of Jerusalem from the hand of Sennacherib king of Assyria and from the hand of all others. He took care of them on every side.
2CH	32	23	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16390	 {23} Many brought offerings to Jerusalem for the Lord and valuable gifts for Hezekiah king of Judah. From then on he was highly regarded by all the nations.
2CH	32	24	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16391	" {24} In those days Hezekiah became ill and was at the point of death. He prayed to the Lord, who answered him and gave him a miraculous sign."
2CH	32	25	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16392	 {25} But Hezekiah's heart was proud and he did not respond to the kindness shown him; therefore the Lord's wrath was on him and on Judah and Jerusalem.
2CH	32	26	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16393	" {26} Then Hezekiah repented of the pride of his heart, as did the people of Jerusalem; therefore the Lord's wrath did not come upon them during the days of Hezekiah."
2CH	32	27	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16394	" {27} Hezekiah had very great riches and honor, and he made treasuries for his silver and gold and for his precious stones, spices, shields and all kinds of valuables."
2CH	32	28	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16395	" {28} He also made buildings to store the harvest of grain, new wine and oil; and he made stalls for various kinds of cattle, and pens for the flocks."
2CH	32	29	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16396	" {29} He built villages and acquired great numbers of flocks and herds, for God had given him very great riches."
2CH	32	30	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16397	 {30} It was Hezekiah who blocked the upper outlet of the Gihon spring and channeled the water down to the west side of the City of David. He succeeded in everything he undertook.
2CH	32	31	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16398	" {31} But when envoys were sent by the rulers of Babylon to ask him about the miraculous sign that had occurred in the land, God left him to test him and to know everything that was in his heart."
2CH	32	32	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16399	 {32} The other events of Hezekiah's reign and his acts of devotion are written in the vision of the prophet Isaiah son of Amoz in the book of the kings of Judah and Israel.
2CH	32	33	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16400	 {33} Hezekiah rested with his fathers and was buried on the hill where the tombs of David's descendants are. 
2CH	32	33	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16401	 All Judah and the people of Jerusalem honored him when he died. And Manasseh his son succeeded him as king.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
2CH	33	<<	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16402	2 CHRONICLES 33
2CH	33	1	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16403	" {1} Manasseh was twelve years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem fifty-five years."
2CH	33	2	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16404	" {2} He did evil in the eyes of the Lord, following the detestable practices of the nations the Lord had driven out before the Israelites."
2CH	33	3	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16405	 {3} He rebuilt the high places his father Hezekiah had demolished; he also erected altars to the Baals and made Asherah poles. He bowed down to all the starry hosts and worshiped them.
2CH	33	4	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16406	" {4} He built altars in the temple of the Lord, of which the Lord had said,"
2CH	33	4	God-FX1	#20		16407	 << My Name will remain in Jerusalem forever.>>
2CH	33	5	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16408	" {5} In both courts of the temple of the Lord, he built altars to all the starry hosts."
2CH	33	6	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16409	" {6} He sacrificed his sons in the fire in the Valley of Ben Hinnom, practiced sorcery, divination and witchcraft, and consulted mediums and spiritists. "
2CH	33	6	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16410	" He did much evil in the eyes of the Lord, provoking him to anger."
2CH	33	7	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16411	" {7} He took the carved image he had made and put it in God's temple, of which God had said to David and to his son Solomon,"
2CH	33	7	God-FX1	#20		16412	" << In this temple and in Jerusalem, which I have chosen out of all the tribes of Israel, I will put my Name forever."
2CH	33	8	God-FX1	#20		16413	" {8} I will not again make the feet of the Israelites leave the land I assigned to your forefathers, if only they will be careful to do everything I commanded them concerning all the laws, decrees and ordinances given through Moses.>>"
2CH	33	9	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16414	" {9} But Manasseh led Judah and the people of Jerusalem astray, so that they did more evil than the nations the Lord had destroyed before the Israelites."
2CH	33	10	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16415	" {10} The Lord spoke to Manasseh and his people, but they paid no attention."
2CH	33	11	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16416	" {11} So the Lord brought against them the army commanders of the king of Assyria, who took Manasseh prisoner, put a hook in his nose, bound him with bronze shackles and took him to Babylon."
2CH	33	12	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16417	 {12} In his distress he sought the favor of the Lord his God and humbled himself greatly before the God of his fathers.
2CH	33	13	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16418	" {13} And when he prayed to him, the Lord was moved by his entreaty and listened to his plea; so he brought him back to Jerusalem and to his kingdom. Then Manasseh knew that the Lord is God."
2CH	33	14	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16419	" {14} Afterward he rebuilt the outer wall of the City of David, west of the Gihon spring in the valley, as far as the entrance of the Fish Gate and encircling the hill of Ophel;"
2CH	33	14	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16420	 he also made it much higher.  He stationed military commanders in all the fortified cities in Judah.
2CH	33	15	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16421	" {15} He got rid of the foreign gods and removed the image from the temple of the Lord, as well as all the altars he had built on the temple hill and in Jerusalem; and he threw them out of the city."
2CH	33	16	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16422	" {16} Then he restored the altar of the Lord and sacrificed fellowship offerings and thank offerings on it, and told Judah to serve the Lord, the God of Israel."
2CH	33	17	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16423	" {17} The people, however, continued to sacrifice at the high places, but only to the Lord their God."
2CH	33	18	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16424	" {18} The other events of Manasseh's reign, including his prayer to his God and the words the seers spoke to him in the name of the Lord, the God of Israel, are written in the annals of the kings of Israel."
2CH	33	19	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16425	" {19} His prayer and how God was moved by his entreaty, as well as all his sins and unfaithfulness, and the sites where he built high places and set up Asherah poles and idols before he humbled himself--"
2CH	33	19	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16426	 all are written in the records of the seers.
2CH	33	20	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16427	 {20} Manasseh rested with his fathers and was buried in his palace. And Amon his son succeeded him as king.
2CH	33	21	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16428	" {21} Amon was twenty-two years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem two years."
2CH	33	22	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16429	" {22} He did evil in the eyes of the Lord, as his father Manasseh had done. Amon worshiped and offered sacrifices to all the idols Manasseh had made."
2CH	33	23	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16430	" {23} But unlike his father Manasseh, he did not humble himself before the Lord; Amon increased his guilt."
2CH	33	24	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16431	 {24} Amon's officials conspired against him and assassinated him in his palace.
2CH	33	25	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16432	" {25} Then the people of the land killed all who had plotted against King Amon, and they made Josiah his son king in his place.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
2CH	34	<<	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16433	2 CHRONICLES 34
2CH	34	1	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16434	" {1} Josiah was eight years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem thirty-one years."
2CH	34	2	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16435	" {2} He did what was right in the eyes of the Lord and walked in the ways of his father David, not turning aside to the right or to the left."
2CH	34	3	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16436	" {3} In the eighth year of his reign, while he was still young, he began to seek the God of his father David."
2CH	34	3	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16437	" In his twelfth year he began to purge Judah and Jerusalem of high places, Asherah poles, carved idols and cast images."
2CH	34	4	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16438	" {4} Under his direction the altars of the Baals were torn down; he cut to pieces the incense altars that were above them, and smashed the Asherah poles, the idols and the images. "
2CH	34	4	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16439	 These he broke to pieces and scattered over the graves of those who had sacrificed to them.
2CH	34	5	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16440	" {5} He burned the bones of the priests on their altars, and so he purged Judah and Jerusalem."
2CH	34	6	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16441	" {6} In the towns of Manasseh, Ephraim and Simeon, as far as Naphtali, and in the ruins around them,"
2CH	34	7	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16442	 {7} he tore down the altars and the Asherah poles and crushed the idols to powder and cut to pieces all the incense altars throughout Israel. Then he went back to Jerusalem.
2CH	34	8	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16443	" {8} In the eighteenth year of Josiah's reign, to purify the land and the temple, he sent Shaphan son of Azaliah and Maaseiah the ruler of the city, "
2CH	34	8	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16444	" with Joah son of Joahaz, the recorder, to repair the temple of the Lord his God."
2CH	34	9	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16445	" {9} They went to Hilkiah the high priest and gave him the money that had been brought into the temple of God, "
2CH	34	9	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16446	" which the Levites who were the doorkeepers had collected from the people of Manasseh, Ephraim and the entire remnant of Israel and from all the people of Judah and Benjamin and the inhabitants of Jerusalem."
2CH	34	10	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16447	 {10} Then they entrusted it to the men appointed to supervise the work on the Lord's temple. These men paid the workers who repaired and restored the temple.
2CH	34	11	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16448	" {11} They also gave money to the carpenters and builders to purchase dressed stone, and timber for joists and beams for the buildings that the kings of Judah had allowed to fall into ruin."
2CH	34	12	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16449	" {12} The men did the work faithfully. Over them to direct them were Jahath and Obadiah, Levites descended from Merari, "
2CH	34	12	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16450	" and Zechariah and Meshullam, descended from Kohath. "
2CH	34	12	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16451	 The Levites--all who were skilled in playing musical instruments--
2CH	34	13	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16452	" {13} had charge of the laborers and supervised all the workers from job to job. Some of the Levites were secretaries, scribes and doorkeepers."
2CH	34	14	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16453	" {14} While they were bringing out the money that had been taken into the temple of the Lord, Hilkiah the priest found the Book of the Law of the Lord that had been given through Moses."
2CH	34	15	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16454	" {15} Hilkiah said to Shaphan the secretary,"
2CH	34	15	Priest: Hilkiah	#02		16455	 << I have found the Book of the Law in the temple of the Lord.>>
2CH	34	15	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16456	 He gave it to Shaphan.
2CH	34	16	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16457	 {16} Then Shaphan took the book to the king and reported to him:
2CH	34	16	Shaphan	#03		16458	 << Your officials are doing everything that has been committed to them.
2CH	34	17	Shaphan	#03		16459	 {17} They have paid out the money that was in the temple of the Lord and have entrusted it to the supervisors and workers.>>
2CH	34	18	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16460	" {18} Then Shaphan the secretary informed the king,"
2CH	34	18	Shaphan	#03		16461	 << Hilkiah the priest has given me a book.>>
2CH	34	18	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16462	 And Shaphan read from it in the presence of the king.
2CH	34	19	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16463	" {19} When the king heard the words of the Law, he tore his robes."
2CH	34	20	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16464	" {20} He gave these orders to Hilkiah, Ahikam son of Shaphan, Abdon son of Micah, Shaphan the secretary and Asaiah the king's attendant:"
2CH	34	21	King Josiah	#09		16465	 {21} << Go and inquire of the Lord for me and for the remnant in Israel and Judah about what is written in this book that has been found. 
2CH	34	21	King Josiah	#09		16466	 Great is the Lord's anger that is poured out on us because our fathers have not kept the word of the Lord; 
2CH	34	21	King Josiah	#09		16467	 they have not acted in accordance with all that is written in this book.>>
2CH	34	22	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16468	" {22} Hilkiah and those the king had sent with him went to speak to the prophetess Huldah, who was the wife of Shallum son of Tokhath, the son of Hasrah, keeper of the wardrobe. "
2CH	34	22	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16469	" She lived in Jerusalem, in the Second District. {23} She said to them,"
2CH	34	23	Prophetess: Huldah (female)	#22		16470	" << This is what the Lord, the God of Israel, says: Tell the man who sent you to me,"
2CH	34	24	Prophetess: Huldah (female)	#22		16471	 {24} 'This is what the Lord says: I am going to bring disaster disaster on this place and its people--all the curses written in the book that has been read in the presence of the king of Judah.
2CH	34	25	Prophetess: Huldah (female)	#22		16472	" {25} Because they have forsaken me and burned incense to other gods and provoked me to anger by all that their hands have made, my anger will be poured out on this place and will not be quenched.'"
2CH	34	26	Prophetess: Huldah (female)	#22		16473	" {26} Tell the king of Judah, who sent you to inquire of the Lord, 'This is what the Lord, the God of Israel, says concerning the words you heard:"
2CH	34	27	Prophetess: Huldah (female)	#22		16474	" {27} Because your heart was responsive and you humbled yourself before God when you heard what he spoke against this place and its people, "
2CH	34	27	Prophetess: Huldah (female)	#22		16475	" and because you humbled yourself before me and tore your robes and wept in my presence, I have heard you, declares the Lord."
2CH	34	28	Prophetess: Huldah (female)	#22		16476	" {28} Now I will gather you to your fathers, and you will be buried in peace. Your eyes will not see all the disaster I am going to bring on this place and on those who live here.'"
2CH	34	28	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16477	 So they took her answer back to the king.
2CH	34	29	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16478	 {29} Then the king called together all the elders of Judah and Jerusalem.
2CH	34	30	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16479	" {30} He went up to the temple of the Lord with the men of Judah, the people of Jerusalem, the priests and the Levites--all the people from the least to the greatest. "
2CH	34	30	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16480	" He read in their hearing all the words of the Book of the Covenant, which had been found in the temple of the Lord."
2CH	34	31	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16481	 {31} The king stood by his pillar and renewed the covenant in the presence of the Lord--
2CH	34	31	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16482	" to follow the Lord and keep his commands, regulations and decrees with all his heart and all his soul, and to obey the words of the covenant written in this book."
2CH	34	32	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16483	" {32} Then he had everyone in Jerusalem and Benjamin pledge themselves to it; the people of Jerusalem did this in accordance with the covenant of God, the God of their fathers."
2CH	34	33	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16484	" {33} Josiah removed all the detestable idols from all the territory belonging to the Israelites, and he had all who were present in Israel serve the Lord their God. "
2CH	34	33	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16485	" As long as he lived, they did not fail to follow follow the Lord, the God of their fathers.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
2CH	35	<<	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16486	2 CHRONICLES 35
2CH	35	1	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16487	" {1} Josiah celebrated the Passover to the Lord in Jerusalem, and the Passover lamb was slaughtered on the fourteenth day of the first month."
2CH	35	2	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16488	 {2} He appointed the priests to their duties and encouraged them in the service of the Lord's temple.
2CH	35	3	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16489	" {3} He said to the Levites, who instructed all Israel and who had been consecrated to the Lord:"
2CH	35	3	King Josiah	#09		16490	 << Put the sacred ark in the temple that Solomon son of David king of Israel built. It is not to be carried about on your shoulders. Now serve the Lord your God and his people Israel.
2CH	35	4	King Josiah	#09		16491	" {4} Prepare yourselves by families in your divisions, according to the directions written by David king of Israel and by his son Solomon."
2CH	35	5	King Josiah	#09		16492	" {5} Stand in the holy place with a group of Levites for each subdivision of the families of your fellow countrymen, the lay people."
2CH	35	6	King Josiah	#09		16493	" {6} Slaughter the Passover lambs, consecrate yourselves and prepare the lambs for your fellow countrymen, doing what the Lord commanded through Moses.>>"
2CH	35	7	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16494	" {7} Josiah provided for all the lay people who were there a total of thirty thousand sheep and goats for the Passover offerings, and also three thousand cattle--all from the king's own possessions."
2CH	35	8	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16495	 {8} His officials also contributed voluntarily to the people and the priests and Levites.
2CH	35	8	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16496	" Hilkiah, Zechariah and Jehiel, the administrators of God's temple, gave the priests twenty-six hundred Passover offerings and three hundred cattle."
2CH	35	9	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16497	" {9} Also Conaniah along with Shemaiah and Nethanel, his brothers, "
2CH	35	9	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16498	" and Hashabiah, Jeiel and Jozabad, the leaders of the Levites, provided five thousand Passover offerings and five hundred head of cattle for the Levites."
2CH	35	10	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16499	 {10} The service was arranged and the priests stood in their places with the Levites in their divisions as the king had ordered.
2CH	35	11	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16500	" {11} The Passover lambs were slaughtered, and the priests sprinkled the blood handed to them, while the Levites skinned the animals."
2CH	35	12	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16501	" {12} They set aside the burnt offerings to give them to the subdivisions of the families of the people to offer to the Lord, as is written in the Book of Moses. They did the same with the cattle."
2CH	35	13	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16502	" {13} They roasted the Passover animals over the fire as prescribed, and boiled the holy offerings in pots, caldrons and pans and served them quickly to all the people."
2CH	35	14	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16503	" {14} After this, they made preparations for themselves and for the priests, because the priests, the descendants of Aaron, were sacrificing the burnt offerings and the fat portions until nightfall. "
2CH	35	14	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16504	 So the Levites made preparations for themselves and for the Aaronic priests.
2CH	35	15	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16505	" {15} The musicians, the descendants of Asaph, were in the places prescribed by David, Asaph, Heman and Jeduthun the king's seer. "
2CH	35	15	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16506	" The gatekeepers at each gate did not need to leave their posts, because their fellow Levites made the preparations for them."
2CH	35	16	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16507	" {16} So at that time the entire service of the Lord was carried out for the celebration of the Passover and the offering of burnt offerings on the altar of the Lord, as King Josiah had ordered."
2CH	35	17	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16508	 {17} The Israelites who were present celebrated the Passover at that time and observed the Feast of Unleavened Bread for seven days.
2CH	35	18	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16509	 {18} The Passover had not been observed like this in Israel since the days of the prophet Samuel; 
2CH	35	18	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16510	" and none of the kings of Israel had ever celebrated such a Passover as did Josiah, with the priests, the Levites and all Judah and Israel who were there with the people of Jerusalem."
2CH	35	19	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16511	 {19} This Passover was celebrated in the eighteenth year of Josiah's reign.
2CH	35	20	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16512	" {20} After all this, when Josiah had set the temple in order, Neco king of Egypt went up to fight at Carchemish on the Euphrates, and Josiah marched out to meet him in battle."
2CH	35	21	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16513	" {21} But Neco sent messengers to him, saying,"
2CH	35	21	Messenger	#16		16514	" << What quarrel is there between you and me, O king of Judah?"
2CH	35	21	Messenger	#16		16515	" It is not you I am attacking at this time, but the house with which I am at war."
2CH	35	21	Messenger	#16		16516	" God has told me to hurry; so stop opposing God, who is with me, or he will destroy you.>>"
2CH	35	22	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16517	" {22} Josiah, however, would not turn away from him, but disguised himself to engage him in battle. "
2CH	35	22	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16518	 He would not listen to what Neco had said at God's command but went to fight him on the plain of Megiddo.
2CH	35	23	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16519	" {23} Archers shot King Josiah, and he told his officers,"
2CH	35	23	King Josiah	#09		16520	 << Take me away; I am badly wounded.>>
2CH	35	24	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16521	" {24} So they took him out of his chariot, put him in the other chariot he had and brought him to Jerusalem, where he died. "
2CH	35	24	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16522	" He was buried in the tombs of his fathers, and all Judah and Jerusalem mourned for him."
2CH	35	25	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16523	" {25} Jeremiah composed laments for Josiah, and to this day all the men and women singers commemorate Josiah in the laments. These became a tradition in Israel and are written in the Laments."
2CH	35	26	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16524	" {26} The other events of Josiah's reign and his acts of devotion, according to what is written in the Law of the Lord--"
2CH	35	27	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16525	" {27} all the events, from beginning to end, are written in the book of the kings of Israel and Judah.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
2CH	36	<<	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16526	2 CHRONICLES 36
2CH	36	1	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16527	 {1} And the people of the land took Jehoahaz son of Josiah and made him king in Jerusalem in place of his father.
2CH	36	2	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16528	" {2} Jehoahaz was twenty-three years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem three months."
2CH	36	3	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16529	 {3} The king of Egypt dethroned him in Jerusalem and imposed on Judah a levy of a hundred talents of silver and a talent of gold.
2CH	36	4	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16530	" {4} The king of Egypt made Eliakim, a brother of Jehoahaz, king over Judah and Jerusalem and changed Eliakim's name to Jehoiakim."
2CH	36	4	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16531	 But Neco took Eliakim's brother Jehoahaz and carried him off to Egypt.
2CH	36	5	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16532	" {5} Jehoiakim was twenty-five years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem eleven years. He did evil in the eyes of the Lord his God."
2CH	36	6	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16533	 {6} Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon attacked him and bound him with bronze shackles to take him to Babylon.
2CH	36	7	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16534	 {7} Nebuchadnezzar also took to Babylon articles from the temple of the Lord and put them in his temple there.
2CH	36	8	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16535	" {8} The other events of Jehoiakim's reign, the detestable things he did and all that was found against him, are written in the book of the kings of Israel and Judah. "
2CH	36	8	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16536	 And Jehoiachin his son succeeded him as king.
2CH	36	9	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16537	" {9} Jehoiachin was eighteen years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem three months and ten days. He did evil in the eyes of the Lord."
2CH	36	10	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16538	" {10} In the spring, King Nebuchadnezzar sent for him and brought him to Babylon, together with articles of value from the temple of the Lord, "
2CH	36	10	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16539	" and he made Jehoiachin's uncle, Zedekiah, king over Judah and Jerusalem."
2CH	36	11	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16540	" {11} Zedekiah was twenty-one years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem eleven years."
2CH	36	12	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16541	" {12} He did evil in the eyes of the Lord his God and did not humble himself before Jeremiah the prophet, who spoke the word of the Lord."
2CH	36	13	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16542	" {13} He also rebelled against King Nebuchadnezzar, who had made him take an oath in God's name. He became stiff-necked and hardened his heart and would not turn to the Lord, the God of Israel."
2CH	36	14	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16543	" {14} Furthermore, all the leaders of the priests and the people became more and more unfaithful, following all the detestable practices of the nations and defiling the temple of the Lord, which he had consecrated in Jerusalem."
2CH	36	15	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16544	" {15} The Lord, the God of their fathers, sent word to them through his messengers again and again, because he had pity on his people and on his dwelling place."
2CH	36	16	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16545	" {16} But they mocked God's messengers, despised his words and scoffed at his prophets until the wrath of the Lord was aroused against his people and there was no remedy."
2CH	36	17	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16546	" {17} He brought up against them the king of the Babylonians, who killed their young men with the sword in the sanctuary, and spared neither young man nor young woman, old man or aged. "
2CH	36	17	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16547	 God handed all of them over to Nebuchadnezzar.
2CH	36	18	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16548	" {18} He carried to Babylon all the articles from the temple of God, both large and small, and the treasures of the Lord's temple and the treasures of the king and his officials."
2CH	36	19	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16549	 {19} They set fire to God's temple and broke down the wall of Jerusalem; they burned all the palaces and destroyed everything of value there.
2CH	36	20	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16550	" {20} He carried into exile to Babylon the remnant, who escaped from the sword, and they became servants to him and his sons until the kingdom of Persia came to power."
2CH	36	21	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16551	" {21} The land enjoyed its sabbath rests; all the time of its desolation it rested, until the seventy years were completed in fulfillment of the word of the Lord spoken by Jeremiah."
2CH	36	22	Narr_14: 2_Chronicles	#05		16552	" {22} In the first year of Cyrus king of Persia, in order to fulfill the word of the Lord spoken by Jeremiah, the Lord moved the heart of Cyrus king of Persia to make a proclamation throughout his realm and to put it in writing:"
2CH	36	23	King Cyrus	#11		16553	" {23} << This is what Cyrus king of Persia says: << 'The Lord, the God of heaven, has given me all the kingdoms of the earth and he has appointed me to build a temple for him at Jerusalem in Judah. "
2CH	36	23	King Cyrus	#11		16554	" Anyone of his people among you--may the Lord his God be with him, and let him go up.'>>*~**~*||||| + 5 SECs |||||*~*"

EZR	3	<<	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16623	EZRA 3
EZR	3	1	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16624	" {1} When the seventh month came and the Israelites had settled in their towns, the people assembled as one man in Jerusalem."
EZR	3	2	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16625	" {2} Then Jeshua son of Jozadak and his fellow priests,"
EZR	3	2	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16626	" and Zerubbabel son of Shealtiel and his associates began to build the altar of the God of Israel to sacrifice burnt offerings on it, in accordance with what is written in the Law of Moses the man of God."
EZR	3	3	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16627	" {3} Despite their fear of the peoples around them, they built the altar on its foundation and sacrificed burnt offerings on it to the Lord, both the morning and evening sacrifices."
EZR	3	4	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16628	" {4} Then in accordance with what is written, they celebrated the Feast of Tabernacles with the required number of burnt offerings prescribed for each day."
EZR	3	5	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16629	" {5} After that, they presented the regular burnt offerings, the New Moon sacrifices and the sacrifices for all the appointed sacred feasts of the Lord, as well as those brought as freewill offerings to the Lord."
EZR	3	6	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16630	" {6} On the first day of the seventh month they began to offer burnt offerings to the Lord, though the foundation of the Lord's temple had not yet been laid."
EZR	3	7	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16631	" {7} Then they gave money to the masons and carpenters, "
EZR	3	7	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16632	" and gave food and drink and oil to the people of Sidon and Tyre, so that they would bring cedar logs by sea from Lebanon to Joppa, as authorized by Cyrus king of Persia."
EZR	3	8	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16633	" {8} In the second month of the second year after their arrival at the house of God in Jerusalem, "
EZR	3	8	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16634	" Zerubbabel son of Shealtiel, Jeshua son of Jozadak and the rest of their brothers (the priests and the Levites and all who had returned from the captivity to Jerusalem ) began the work, "
EZR	3	8	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16635	 appointing Levites twenty years of age and older to supervise the building of the house of the Lord.
EZR	3	9	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16636	 {9} Jeshua and his sons and brothers and Kadmiel and his sons (descendants of Hodaviah ) and the sons of Henadad and 
EZR	3	9	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16637	 their sons and brothers--all Levites--joined together in supervising those working on the house of God.
EZR	3	10	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16638	" {10} When the builders laid the foundation of the temple of the Lord, the priests in their vestments and with trumpets, and the Levites (the sons of Asaph ) with cymbals, took their places to praise the Lord, as prescribed by David king of Israel."
EZR	3	11	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16639	 {11} With praise and thanksgiving they sang to the Lord:
EZR	3	11	Man in Crowd	#18		16640	 << He is good; his love to Israel endures forever.>>
EZR	3	11	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16641	" And all the people gave a great shout of praise to the Lord, because the foundation of the house of the Lord was laid."
EZR	3	12	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16642	" {12} But many of the older priests and Levites and family heads, who had seen the former temple, wept aloud when they saw the foundation of this temple being laid, while many others shouted for joy."
EZR	3	13	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16643	" {13} No one could distinguish the sound of the shouts of joy from the sound of weeping, because the people made so much noise. And the sound was heard far away.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
EZR	4	<<	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16644	EZRA 4
EZR	4	1	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16645	" {1} When the enemies of Judah and Benjamin heard that the exiles were building a temple for the Lord, the God of Israel,"
EZR	4	2	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16646	" {2} they came to Zerubbabel and to the heads of the families and said,"
EZR	4	2	Man	#13		16647	" << Let us help you build because, like you, we seek your God and have been sacrificing to him since the time of Esarhaddon king of Assyria, who brought us here.>>"
EZR	4	3	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16648	" {3} But Zerubbabel, Jeshua and the rest of the heads of the families of Israel answered,"
EZR	4	3	Zerubbabel	#07		16649	" << You have no part with us in building a temple to our God. We alone will build it for the Lord, the God of Israel, as King Cyrus, the king of Persia, commanded us.>>"
EZR	4	4	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16650	 {4} Then the peoples around them set out to discourage the people of Judah and make them afraid to go on building.
EZR	4	5	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16651	 {5} They hired counselors to work against them and frustrate their plans during the entire reign of Cyrus king of Persia and down to the reign of Darius king of Persia.
EZR	4	6	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16652	" {6} At the beginning of the reign of Xerxes, they lodged an accusation against the people of Judah and Jerusalem."
EZR	4	7	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16653	" {7} And in the days of Artaxerxes king of Persia, Bishlam, Mithredath, Tabeel and the rest of his associates wrote a letter to Artaxerxes. "
EZR	4	7	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16654	 The letter was written in Aramaic script and in the Aramaic language.
EZR	4	8	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16655	 {8} Rehum the commanding officer and Shimshai the secretary wrote a letter against Jerusalem to Artaxerxes the king as follows:
EZR	4	9	Enemy	#08		16656	" {9} Rehum the commanding officer and Shimshai the secretary, "
EZR	4	9	Enemy	#08		16657	" together with the rest of their associates--the judges and officials over the men from Tripolis, Persia, "
EZR	4	9	Enemy	#08		16658	" Erech and Babylon, "
EZR	4	9	Enemy	#08		16659	" the Elamites of Susa,"
EZR	4	10	Enemy	#08		16660	 {10} and the other people whom the great and honorable Ashurbanipal deported and settled in the city of Samaria and elsewhere in Trans-Euphrates.
EZR	4	11	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16661	 {11} (This is a copy of the letter they sent him.)
EZR	4	11	Enemy	#08		16662	" To King Artaxerxes, From your servants, the men of Trans-Euphrates:"
EZR	4	12	Enemy	#08		16663	 {12} The king should know that the Jews who came up to us from you have gone to Jerusalem and are rebuilding that rebellious and wicked city. 
EZR	4	12	Enemy	#08		16664	 They are restoring the walls and repairing the foundations.
EZR	4	13	Enemy	#08		16665	" {13} Furthermore, the king should know that if this city is built and its walls are restored, no more taxes, tribute or duty will be paid, and the royal revenues will suffer."
EZR	4	14	Enemy	#08		16666	" {14} Now since we are under obligation to the palace and it is not proper for us to see the king dishonored, we are sending this message to inform the king,"
EZR	4	15	Enemy	#08		16667	 {15} so that a search may be made in the archives of your predecessors. 
EZR	4	15	Enemy	#08		16668	" In these records you will find that this city is a rebellious city, troublesome to kings and provinces, a place of rebellion from ancient times. "
EZR	4	15	Enemy	#08		16669	 That is why this city was destroyed.
EZR	4	16	Enemy	#08		16670	" {16} We inform the king that if this city is built and its walls are restored, you will be left with nothing in Trans-Euphrates."
EZR	4	17	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16671	 {17} The king sent this reply:
EZR	4	17	Artaxerxes	#17		16672	" To Rehum the commanding officer, Shimshai the secretary and the rest of their associates living in Samaria and elsewhere in Trans-Euphrates: Greetings."
EZR	4	18	Artaxerxes	#17		16673	 {18} The letter you sent us has been read and translated in my presence.
EZR	4	19	Artaxerxes	#17		16674	" {19} I issued an order and a search was made, and it was found that this city has a long history of revolt against kings and has been a place of rebellion and sedition."
EZR	4	20	Artaxerxes	#17		16675	" {20} Jerusalem has had powerful kings ruling over the whole of Trans-Euphrates, and taxes, tribute and duty were paid to them."
EZR	4	21	Artaxerxes	#17		16676	" {21} Now issue an order to these men to stop work, so that this city will not be rebuilt until I so order."
EZR	4	22	Artaxerxes	#17		16677	" {22} Be careful not to neglect this matter. Why let this threat grow, to the detriment of the royal interests?"
EZR	4	23	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16678	" {23} As soon as the copy of the letter of King Artaxerxes was read to Rehum and Shimshai the secretary and their associates, they went immediately to the Jews in Jerusalem and compelled them by force to stop."
EZR	4	24	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16679	 {24} Thus the work on the house of God in Jerusalem came to a standstill until the second year of the reign of Darius king of Persia.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
EZR	5	<<	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16680	EZRA 5
EZR	5	1	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16681	" {1} Now Haggai the prophet and Zechariah the prophet, a descendant of Iddo, prophesied to the Jews in Judah and Jerusalem in the name of the God of Israel, who was over them."
EZR	5	2	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16682	" {2} Then Zerubbabel son of Shealtiel and Jeshua son of Jozadak set to work to rebuild the house of God in Jerusalem. And the prophets of God were with them, helping them."
EZR	5	3	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16683	" {3} At that time Tattenai, governor of Trans-Euphrates, and Shethar-Bozenai and their associates went to them and asked,"
EZR	5	3	Tattenai	#03		16684	 << Who authorized you to rebuild this temple and restore this structure?
EZR	5	4	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16685	" {4} They also asked,"
EZR	5	4	Tattenai	#03		16686	 << What are the names of the men constructing this building?>>
EZR	5	5	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16687	" {5} But the eye of their God was watching over the elders of the Jews, and they were not stopped until a report could go to Darius and his written reply be received."
EZR	5	6	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16688	" {6} This is a copy of the letter that Tattenai, governor of Trans-Euphrates, and Shethar-Bozenai and their associates, the officials of Trans-Euphrates, sent to King Darius."
EZR	5	7	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16689	 {7} The report they sent him read as follows:
EZR	5	7	Tattenai	#03		16690	 To King Darius: Cordial greetings.
EZR	5	8	Tattenai	#03		16691	" {8} The king should know that we went to the district of Judah, to the temple of the great God. "
EZR	5	8	Tattenai	#03		16692	 The people are building it with large stones and placing the timbers in the walls. 
EZR	5	8	Tattenai	#03		16693	 The work is being carried on with diligence and is making rapid progress under their direction.
EZR	5	9	Tattenai	#03		16694	" {9} We questioned the elders and asked them, << Who authorized you to rebuild this temple and restore this structure?>>"
EZR	5	10	Tattenai	#03		16695	" {10} We also asked them their names, so that we could write down the names of their leaders for your information."
EZR	5	11	Tattenai	#03		16696	 {11} This is the answer they gave us:
EZR	5	11	Elder	#15		16697	" << We are the servants of the God of heaven and earth, and we are rebuilding the temple that was built many years ago, one that a great king of Israel built and finished."
EZR	5	12	Elder	#15		16698	" {12} But because our fathers angered the God of heaven, he handed them over to Nebuchadnezzar the Chaldean, king of Babylon, who destroyed this temple and deported the people to Babylon."
EZR	5	13	Elder	#15		16699	" {13} << However, in the first year of Cyrus king of Babylon, King Cyrus issued a decree to rebuild this house of God."
EZR	5	14	Elder	#15		16700	" {14} He even removed from the temple of Babylon the gold and silver articles of the house of God, which Nebuchadnezzar had taken from the temple in Jerusalem and brought to the temple in Babylon. "
EZR	5	14	Elder	#15		16701	" << Then King Cyrus gave them to a man named Sheshbazzar, whom he had appointed governor,"
EZR	5	15	Elder	#15		16702	" {15} and he told him, 'Take these articles and go and deposit them in the temple in Jerusalem. And rebuild the house of God on its site.'"
EZR	5	16	Elder	#15		16703	 {16} So this Sheshbazzar came and laid the foundations of the house of God in Jerusalem.
EZR	5	16	Elder	#15		16704	 From that day to the present it has been under construction but is not yet finished.>>
EZR	5	17	Tattenai	#03		16705	" {17} Now if it pleases the king,"
EZR	5	17	Tattenai	#03		16706	 let a search be made in the royal archives of Babylon to see if King Cyrus did in fact issue a decree to rebuild this house of God in Jerusalem. 
EZR	5	17	Tattenai	#03		16707	 Then let the king send us his decision in this matter.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
EZR	6	<<	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16708	EZRA 6
EZR	6	1	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16709	" {1} King Darius then issued an order, and they searched in the archives stored in the treasury at Babylon."
EZR	6	2	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16710	" {2} A scroll was found in the citadel of Ecbatana in the province of Media, and this was written on it:"
EZR	6	2	Scribe	#16		16711	" Memorandum: {3} In the first year of King Cyrus, the king issued a decree concerning the temple of God in Jerusalem:"
EZR	6	3	Darius	#01		16712	" Let the temple be rebuilt as a place to present sacrifices, and let its foundations be laid. It is to be ninety feet high and ninety feet wide,"
EZR	6	4	Darius	#01		16713	 {4} with three courses of large stones and one of timbers. The costs are to be paid by the royal treasury.
EZR	6	5	Darius	#01		16714	" {5} Also, the gold and silver articles of the house of God, which Nebuchadnezzar took from the temple in Jerusalem and brought to Babylon, are to be returned to their places in the temple in Jerusalem;"
EZR	6	5	Darius	#01		16715	 they are to be deposited in the house of God.
EZR	6	6	Darius	#01		16716	" {6} Now then, Tattenai, governor of Trans-Euphrates, and Shethar-Bozenai and you, their fellow officials of that province, stay away from there."
EZR	6	7	Darius	#01		16717	 {7} Do not interfere with the work on this temple of God. Let the governor of the Jews and the Jewish elders rebuild this house of God on its site.
EZR	6	8	Darius	#01		16718	" {8} Moreover, I hereby decree what you are to do for these elders of the Jews in the construction of this house of God: "
EZR	6	8	Darius	#01		16719	" The expenses of these men are to be fully paid out of the royal treasury, from the revenues of Trans-Euphrates, so that the work will not stop."
EZR	6	9	Darius	#01		16720	" {9} Whatever is needed--young bulls, rams, male lambs for burnt offerings to the God of heaven, and wheat, salt, wine and oil, as requested by the priests in Jerusalem --must be given them daily without fail,"
EZR	6	10	Darius	#01		16721	 {10} so that they may offer sacrifices pleasing to the God of heaven and pray for the well-being of the king and his sons.
EZR	6	11	Darius	#01		16722	" {11} Furthermore, I decree that if anyone changes this edict, a beam is to be pulled from his house and he is to be lifted up and impaled on it. "
EZR	6	11	Darius	#01		16723	 And for this crime his house is to be made a pile of rubble.
EZR	6	12	Darius	#01		16724	" {12} May God, who has caused his Name to dwell there, overthrow any king or people who lifts a hand to change this decree or to destroy this temple in Jerusalem. "
EZR	6	12	Darius	#01		16725	 I Darius have decreed it. Let it be carried out with diligence.
EZR	6	13	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16726	" {13} Then, because of the decree King Darius had sent, Tattenai, governor of Trans-Euphrates, and Shethar-Bozenai and their associates carried it out with diligence."
EZR	6	14	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16727	" {14} So the elders of the Jews continued to build and prosper under the preaching of Haggai the prophet and Zechariah, a descendant of Iddo. "
EZR	6	14	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16728	" They finished building the temple according to the command of the God of Israel and the decrees of Cyrus, Darius and Artaxerxes, kings of Persia."
EZR	6	15	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16729	" {15} The temple was completed on the third day of the month Adar, in the sixth year of the reign of King Darius."
EZR	6	16	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16730	" {16} Then the people of Israel --the priests, the Levites and the rest of the exiles--celebrated the dedication of the house of God with joy."
EZR	6	17	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16731	" {17} For the dedication of this house of God they offered a hundred bulls, two hundred rams, four hundred male lambs and, as a sin offering for all Israel, twelve male goats, one for each of the tribes of Israel."
EZR	6	18	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16732	" {18} And they installed the priests in their divisions and the Levites in their groups for the service of God at Jerusalem, according to what is written in the Book of Moses."
EZR	6	19	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16733	" {19} On the fourteenth day of the first month, the exiles celebrated the Passover."
EZR	6	20	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16734	" {20} The priests and Levites had purified themselves and were all ceremonially clean. The Levites slaughtered the Passover lamb for all the exiles, for their brothers the priests and for themselves."
EZR	6	21	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16735	" {21} So the Israelites who had returned from the exile ate it, together with all who had separated themselves from the unclean practices of their Gentile neighbors in order to seek the Lord, the God of Israel."
EZR	6	22	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16736	" {22} For seven days they celebrated with joy the Feast of Unleavened Bread, because the Lord had filled them with joy by changing the attitude of the king of Assyria, "
EZR	6	22	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16737	" so that he assisted them in the work on the house of God, the God of Israel.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
EZR	7	<<	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16738	EZRA 7
EZR	7	1	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16739	" {1} After these things, during the reign of Artaxerxes king of Persia, Ezra son of Seraiah, the son of Azariah, the son of Hilkiah,"
EZR	7	2	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16740	" {2} the son of Shallum, the son of Zadok, the son of Ahitub,"
EZR	7	3	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16741	" {3} the son of Amariah, the son of Azariah, the son of Meraioth,"
EZR	7	4	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16742	" {4} the son of Zerahiah, the son of Uzzi, the son of Bukki,"
EZR	7	5	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16743	" {5} the son of Abishua, the son of Phinehas, the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron the chief priest--"
EZR	7	6	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16744	" {6} this Ezra came up from Babylon. He was a teacher well versed in the Law of Moses, which the Lord, the God of Israel, had given. "
EZR	7	6	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16745	" The king had granted him everything he asked, for the hand of the Lord his God was on him."
EZR	7	7	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16746	" {7} Some of the Israelites, including priests, Levites, singers, gatekeepers and temple servants, also came up to Jerusalem in the seventh year of King Artaxerxes."
EZR	7	8	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16747	 {8} Ezra arrived in Jerusalem in the fifth month of the seventh year of the king.
EZR	7	9	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16748	" {9} He had begun his journey from Babylon on the first day of the first month, and he arrived in Jerusalem on the first day of the fifth month, for the gracious hand of his God was on him."
EZR	7	10	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16749	" {10} For Ezra had devoted himself to the study and observance of the Law of the Lord, and to teaching its decrees and laws in Israel."
EZR	7	11	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16750	" {11} This is a copy of the letter King Artaxerxes had given to Ezra the priest and teacher, a man learned in matters concerning the commands and decrees of the Lord for Israel:"
EZR	7	12	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16751	" {12} Artaxerxes, king of kings,"
EZR	7	12	Artaxerxes	#17		16752	" To Ezra the priest, a teacher of the Law of the God of heaven: Greetings."
EZR	7	13	Artaxerxes	#17		16753	" {13} Now I decree that any of the Israelites in my kingdom, including priests and Levites, who wish to go to Jerusalem with you, may go."
EZR	7	14	Artaxerxes	#17		16754	" {14} You are sent by the king and his seven advisers to inquire about Judah and Jerusalem with regard to the Law of your God, which is in your hand."
EZR	7	15	Artaxerxes	#17		16755	" {15} Moreover, you are to take with you the silver and gold that the king and his advisers have freely given to the God of Israel, whose dwelling is in Jerusalem,"
EZR	7	16	Artaxerxes	#17		16756	" {16} together with all the silver and gold you may obtain from the province of Babylon, as well as the freewill offerings of the people and priests for the temple of their God in Jerusalem."
EZR	7	17	Artaxerxes	#17		16757	" {17} With this money be sure to buy bulls, rams and male lambs, together with their grain offerings and drink offerings, and sacrifice them on the altar of the temple of your God in Jerusalem."
EZR	7	18	Artaxerxes	#17		16758	" {18} You and your brother Jews may then do whatever seems best with the rest of the silver and gold, in accordance with the will of your God."
EZR	7	19	Artaxerxes	#17		16759	 {19} Deliver to the God of Jerusalem all the articles entrusted to you for worship in the temple of your God.
EZR	7	20	Artaxerxes	#17		16760	" {20} And anything else needed for the temple of your God that you may have occasion to supply, you may provide from the royal treasury."
EZR	7	21	Artaxerxes	#17		16761	" {21} Now I, King Artaxerxes, order all the treasurers of Trans-Euphrates to provide with diligence whatever Ezra the priest, a teacher of the Law of the God of heaven, may ask of you--"
EZR	7	22	Artaxerxes	#17		16762	" {22} up to a hundred talents of silver, a hundred cors of wheat, a hundred baths of wine, a hundred baths of olive oil, and salt without limit."
EZR	7	23	Artaxerxes	#17		16763	" {23} Whatever the God of heaven has prescribed, let it be done with diligence for the temple of the God of heaven. Why should there be wrath against the realm of the king and of his sons?"
EZR	7	24	Artaxerxes	#17		16764	" {24} You are also to know that you have no authority to impose taxes, tribute or duty on any of the priests, Levites, singers, gatekeepers, "
EZR	7	24	Artaxerxes	#17		16765	 temple servants or other workers at this house of God.
EZR	7	25	Artaxerxes	#17		16766	" {25} And you, Ezra, in accordance with the wisdom of your God, which you possess, "
EZR	7	25	Artaxerxes	#17		16767	 appoint magistrates and judges to administer justice to all the people of Trans-Euphrates -- all who know the laws of your God. 
EZR	7	25	Artaxerxes	#17		16768	 And you are to teach any who do not know them.
EZR	7	26	Artaxerxes	#17		16769	" {26} Whoever does not obey the law of your God and the law of the king must surely be punished by death, banishment, confiscation of property, or imprisonment."
EZR	7	27	Ezra	#05		16770	" {27} Praise be to the Lord, the God of our fathers, who has put it into the king's heart to bring honor to the house of the Lord in Jerusalem in this way"
EZR	7	28	Ezra	#05		16771	 {28} and who has extended his good favor to me before the king and his advisers and all the king's powerful officials. 
EZR	7	28	Ezra	#05		16772	" Because the hand of the Lord my God was on me, I took courage and gathered leading men from Israel to go up with me.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
EZR	8	<<	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16773	EZRA 8
EZR	8	1	Ezra	#05		16774	 {1} These are the family heads and those registered with them who came up with me from Babylon during the reign of King Artaxerxes:
EZR	8	2	Ezra	#05		16775	" {2} of the descendants of Phinehas, Gershom; of the descendants of Ithamar, Daniel; of the descendants of David, Hattush"
EZR	8	3	Ezra	#05		16776	" {3} of the descendants of Shecaniah; of the descendants of Parosh, Zechariah, and with him were registered 150 men;"

EZR	8	6	Ezra	#05		16779	" {6} of the descendants of Adin, Ebed son of Jonathan, and with him 50 men;"

EZR	8	8	Ezra	#05		16781	" {8} of the descendants of Shephatiah, Zebadiah son of Michael, and with him 80 men;"
