EZR	8	11	Ezra	#05		16784	" {11} of the descendants of Bebai, Zechariah son of Bebai, and with him 28 men;"
EZR	8	12	Ezra	#05		16785	" {12} of the descendants of Azgad, Johanan son of Hakkatan, and with him 110 men;"
EZR	8	13	Ezra	#05		16786	" {13} of the descendants of Adonikam, the last ones, whose names were Eliphelet, Jeuel and Shemaiah, and with them 60 men;"
EZR	8	14	Ezra	#05		16787	" {14} of the descendants of Bigvai, Uthai and Zaccur, and with them 70 men."
EZR	8	15	Ezra	#05		16788	" {15} I assembled them at the canal that flows toward Ahava, and we camped there three days. When I checked among the people and the priests, I found no Levites there."
EZR	8	16	Ezra	#05		16789	" {16} So I summoned Eliezer, Ariel, Shemaiah, Elnathan, Jarib, Elnathan, Nathan, Zechariah and Meshullam, who were leaders, and Joiarib and Elnathan, who were men of learning,"
EZR	8	17	Ezra	#05		16790	" {17} and I sent them to Iddo, the leader in Casiphia. "
EZR	8	17	Ezra	#05		16791	" I told them what to say to Iddo and his kinsmen, the temple servants in Casiphia, so that they might bring attendants to us for the house of our God."
EZR	8	18	Ezra	#05		16792	" {18} Because the gracious hand of our God was on us, "
EZR	8	18	Ezra	#05		16793	" they brought us Sherebiah, a capable man, from the descendants of Mahli son of Levi, the son of Israel, and Sherebiah's sons and brothers, 18 men;"
EZR	8	19	Ezra	#05		16794	" {19} and Hashabiah, together with Jeshaiah from the descendants of Merari, and his brothers and nephews, 20 men."
EZR	8	20	Ezra	#05		16795	 {20} They also brought 220 of the temple servants--a body that David and the officials had established to assist the Levites. All were registered by name.
EZR	8	21	Ezra	#05		16796	" {21} There, by the Ahava Canal, I proclaimed a fast, so that we might humble ourselves before our God and ask him for a safe journey for us and our children, with all our possessions."
EZR	8	22	Ezra	#05		16797	" {22} I was ashamed to ask the king for soldiers and horsemen to protect us from enemies on the road, because we had told the king,"
EZR	8	22	Leader	#02		16798	" << The gracious hand of our God is on everyone who looks to him, but his great anger is against all who forsake him.>>"
EZR	8	23	Ezra	#05		16799	" {23} So we fasted and petitioned our God about this, and he answered our prayer."
EZR	8	24	Ezra	#05		16800	" {24} Then I set apart twelve of the leading priests, together with Sherebiah, Hashabiah and ten of their brothers,"
EZR	8	25	Ezra	#05		16801	" {25} and I weighed out to them the offering of silver and gold and the articles that the king, his advisers, his officials and all Israel present there had donated for the house of our God."
EZR	8	26	Ezra	#05		16802	" {26} I weighed out to them 650 talents of silver, silver articles weighing 100 talents, 100 talents of gold,"
EZR	8	27	Ezra	#05		16803	" {27} 20 bowls of gold valued at 1,000 darics, and two fine articles of polished bronze, as precious as gold."
EZR	8	28	Ezra	#05		16804	" {28} I said to them, << You as well as these articles are consecrated to the Lord. The silver and gold are a freewill offering to the Lord, the God of your fathers."
EZR	8	29	Ezra	#05		16805	 {29} Guard them carefully until you weigh them out in the chambers of the house of the Lord in Jerusalem before the leading priests and the Levites and the family heads of Israel.>>
EZR	8	30	Ezra	#05		16806	 {30} Then the priests and Levites received the silver and gold and sacred articles that had been weighed out to be taken to the house of our God in Jerusalem.
EZR	8	31	Ezra	#05		16807	" {31} On the twelfth day of the first month we set out from the Ahava Canal to go to Jerusalem. The hand of our God was on us, and he protected us from enemies and bandits along the way."
EZR	8	32	Ezra	#05		16808	" {32} So we arrived in Jerusalem, where we rested three days."
EZR	8	33	Ezra	#05		16809	" {33} On the fourth day, in the house of our God, we weighed out the silver and gold and the sacred articles into the hands of Meremoth son of Uriah, the priest. "
EZR	8	33	Ezra	#05		16810	" Eleazar son of Phinehas was with him, and so were the Levites Jozabad son of Jeshua and Noadiah son of Binnui."
EZR	8	34	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16811	" {34} Everything was accounted for by number and weight, and the entire weight was recorded at that time."
EZR	8	35	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16812	 {35} Then the exiles who had returned from captivity sacrificed burnt offerings to the God of Israel: 
EZR	8	35	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16813	" twelve bulls for all Israel, ninety-six rams, seventy-seven male lambs and, as a sin offering, twelve male goats. All this was a burnt offering to the Lord."
EZR	8	36	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16814	" {36} They also delivered the king's orders to the royal satraps and to the governors of Trans-Euphrates, who then gave assistance to the people and to the house of God.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
EZR	9	<<	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16815	EZRA 9
EZR	9	1	Ezra	#05		16816	" {1} After these things had been done, the leaders came to me and said,"
EZR	9	1	Leader	#02		16817	" << The people of Israel, including the priests and the Levites, have not kept themselves separate from the neighboring peoples with their detestable practices,"
EZR	9	1	Leader	#02		16818	" like those of the Canaanites, Hittites, Perizzites, Jebusites, "
EZR	9	1	Leader	#02		16819	" Ammonites, Moabites, Egyptians and Amorites."
EZR	9	2	Leader	#02		16820	" {2} They have taken some of their daughters as wives for themselves and their sons, and have mingled the holy race with the peoples around them. "
EZR	9	2	Leader	#02		16821	 And the leaders and officials have led the way in this unfaithfulness.>>
EZR	9	3	Ezra	#05		16822	" {3} When I heard this, I tore my tunic and cloak, pulled hair from my head and beard and sat down appalled."
EZR	9	4	Ezra	#05		16823	 {4} Then everyone who trembled at the words of the God of Israel gathered around me because of this unfaithfulness of the exiles. And I sat there appalled until the evening sacrifice.
EZR	9	5	Ezra	#05		16824	" {5} Then, at the evening sacrifice, I rose from my self-abasement, with my tunic and cloak torn, and fell on my knees with my hands spread out to the Lord my God"
EZR	9	6	Ezra	#05		16825	" {6}and prayed: << O my God, I am too ashamed and disgraced to lift up my face to you, my God, because our sins are higher than our heads and our guilt has reached to the heavens."
EZR	9	7	Ezra	#05		16826	" {7} From the days of our forefathers until now, our guilt has been great. "
EZR	9	7	Ezra	#05		16827	" Because of our sins, we and our kings and our priests have been subjected to the sword and captivity, to pillage and humiliation at the hand of foreign kings, as it is today."
EZR	9	8	Ezra	#05		16828	" {8} << But now, for a brief moment, the Lord our God has been gracious in leaving us a remnant and giving us a firm place in his sanctuary, "
EZR	9	8	Ezra	#05		16829	 and so our God gives light to our eyes and a little relief in our bondage.
EZR	9	9	Ezra	#05		16830	" {9} Though we are slaves, our God has not deserted us in our bondage. He has shown us kindness in the sight of the kings of Persia: "
EZR	9	9	Ezra	#05		16831	" He has granted us new life to rebuild the house of our God and repair its ruins, and he has given us a wall of protection in Judah and Jerusalem."
EZR	9	10	Ezra	#05		16832	" {10} << But now, O our God, what can we say after this? "
EZR	9	10	Ezra	#05		16833	 For we have disregarded the commands {11} you gave through your servants the prophets when you said: 
EZR	9	11	Ezra	#05		16834	 The land you are entering to possess is a land polluted by the corruption of its peoples.
EZR	9	11	Ezra	#05		16835	 By their detestable practices they have filled it with their impurity from one end to the other.
EZR	9	12	Ezra	#05		16836	" {12} Therefore, do not give your daughters in marriage to their sons or take their daughters for your sons."
EZR	9	12	Ezra	#05		16837	" Do not seek a treaty of friendship with them at any time, that you may be strong and eat the good things of the land and leave it to your children as an everlasting inheritance.'"
EZR	9	13	Ezra	#05		16838	" {13} << What has happened to us is a result of our evil deeds and our great guilt, and yet, our God, you have punished us less than our sins have deserved and have given us a remnant like this."
EZR	9	14	Ezra	#05		16839	 {14} Shall we again break your commands and intermarry with the peoples who commit such detestable practices?
EZR	9	14	Ezra	#05		16840	" Would you not be angry enough with us to destroy us, leaving us no remnant or survivor?"
EZR	9	15	Ezra	#05		16841	" {15} O Lord, God of Israel, you are righteous! We are left this day as a remnant. "
EZR	9	15	Ezra	#05		16842	" Here we are before you in our guilt, though because of it not one of us can stand in your presence.>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
EZR	10	<<	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16843	EZRA 10
EZR	10	1	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16844	" {1} While Ezra was praying and confessing, weeping and throwing himself down before the house of God, a large crowd of Israelites--men, women and children--gathered around him. "
EZR	10	1	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16845	" They too wept bitterly. {2} Then Shecaniah son of Jehiel, one of the descendants of Elam, said to Ezra,"
EZR	10	2	Shecaniah	#10		16846	" << We have been unfaithful to our God by marrying foreign women from the peoples around us. But in spite of this, there is still hope for Israel."
EZR	10	3	Shecaniah	#10		16847	" {3} Now let us make a covenant before our God to send away all these women and their children,"
EZR	10	3	Shecaniah	#10		16848	 in accordance with the counsel of my lord and of those who fear the commands of our God.
EZR	10	3	Shecaniah	#10		16849	 Let it be done according to the Law.
EZR	10	4	Shecaniah	#10		16850	" {4} Rise up; this matter is in your hands. We will support you, so take courage and do it.>>"
EZR	10	5	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16851	 {5} So Ezra rose up and put the leading priests and Levites and all Israel under oath to do what had been suggested. And they took the oath.
EZR	10	6	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16852	 {6} Then Ezra withdrew from before the house of God and went to the room of Jehohanan son of Eliashib. 
EZR	10	6	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16853	" While he was there, he ate no food and drank no water, because he continued to mourn over the unfaithfulness of the exiles."
EZR	10	7	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16854	 {7} A proclamation was then issued throughout Judah and Jerusalem for all the exiles to assemble in Jerusalem.
EZR	10	8	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16855	" {8} Anyone who failed to appear within three days would forfeit all his property, in accordance with the decision of the officials and elders, "
EZR	10	8	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16856	 and would himself be expelled from the assembly of the exiles.
EZR	10	9	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16857	" {9} Within the three days, all the men of Judah and Benjamin had gathered in Jerusalem. "
EZR	10	9	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16858	" And on the twentieth day of the ninth month, all the people were sitting in the square before the house of God, greatly distressed by the occasion and because of the rain."
EZR	10	10	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16859	" {10} Then Ezra the priest stood up and said to them,"
EZR	10	10	Ezra	#05		16860	" << You have been unfaithful; you have married foreign women, adding to Israel's guilt."
EZR	10	11	Ezra	#05		16861	" {11} Now make confession to the Lord, the God of your fathers, and do his will. Separate yourselves from the peoples around you and from your foreign wives.>>"
EZR	10	12	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16862	 {12} The whole assembly responded with a loud voice:
EZR	10	12	Leader	#06		16863	 << You are right! We must do as you say.
EZR	10	13	Leader	#06		16864	 {13} But there are many people here and it is the rainy season; so we cannot stand outside. 
EZR	10	13	Leader	#06		16865	" Besides, this matter cannot be taken care of in a day or two, because we have sinned greatly in this thing."
EZR	10	14	Leader	#06		16866	 {14} Let our officials act for the whole assembly. 
EZR	10	14	Leader	#06		16867	" Then let everyone in our towns who has married a foreign woman come at a set time, along with the elders and judges of each town,"
EZR	10	14	Leader	#06		16868	 until the fierce anger of our God in this matter is turned away from us.>>
EZR	10	15	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16869	" {15} Only Jonathan son of Asahel and Jahzeiah son of Tikvah, supported by Meshullam and Shabbethai the Levite, opposed this."
EZR	10	16	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16870	" {16} So the exiles did as was proposed. Ezra the priest selected men who were family heads, one from each family division, and all of them designated by name. "
EZR	10	16	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16871	" On the first day of the tenth month they sat down to investigate the cases, {17} and by the first day of the first month they finished dealing with all the men who had married foreign women."
EZR	10	18	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16872	" {18} Among the descendants of the priests, the following had married foreign women: From the descendants of Jeshua son of Jozadak, and his brothers: Maaseiah, Eliezer, Jarib and Gedaliah."
EZR	10	19	Narr_15: Ezra	#09		16873	" {19} (They all gave their hands in pledge to put away their wives, and for their guilt they each presented a ram from the flock as a guilt offering.)"

NEH	1	<<	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		16895	NEHEMIAH*~*NEHEMIAH 1
NEH	1	1	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		16896	 {1} The words of Nehemiah son of Hacaliah:
NEH	1	1	Nehemiah	#15		16897	" In the month of Kislev in the twentieth year, while I was in the citadel of Susa,"
NEH	1	2	Nehemiah	#15		16898	" {2} Hanani, one of my brothers, came from Judah with some other men, and I questioned them about the Jewish remnant that survived the exile, and also about Jerusalem."
NEH	1	3	Nehemiah	#15		16899	" {3} They said to me,"
NEH	1	3	Man	#07		16900	" << Those who survived the exile and are back in the province are in great trouble and disgrace. The wall of Jerusalem is broken down, and its gates have been burned with fire.>>"
NEH	1	4	Nehemiah	#15		16901	" {4} When I heard these things, I sat down and wept. For some days I mourned and fasted and prayed before the God of heaven."
NEH	1	5	Nehemiah	#15		16902	" {5} Then I said: << O Lord, God of heaven, the great and awesome God, who keeps his covenant of love with those who love him and obey his commands,"
NEH	1	6	Nehemiah	#15		16903	" {6} let your ear be attentive and your eyes open to hear the prayer your servant is praying before you day and night for your servants, the people of Israel."
NEH	1	6	Nehemiah	#15		16904	" I confess the sins we Israelites, including myself and my father's house, have committed against you."
NEH	1	7	Nehemiah	#15		16905	" {7} We have acted very wickedly toward you. We have not obeyed the commands, decrees and laws you gave your servant Moses."
NEH	1	8	Nehemiah	#15		16906	" {8} << Remember the instruction you gave your servant Moses, saying, 'If you are unfaithful, I will scatter you among the nations,"
NEH	1	9	Nehemiah	#15		16907	" {9} but if you return to me and obey my commands, then even if your exiled people are at the farthest horizon, "
NEH	1	9	Nehemiah	#15		16908	 I will gather them from there and bring them to the place I have chosen as a dwelling for my Name.'
NEH	1	10	Nehemiah	#15		16909	" {10} << They are your servants and your people, whom you redeemed by your great strength and your mighty hand."
NEH	1	11	Nehemiah	#15		16910	" {11} O Lord, let your ear be attentive to the prayer of this your servant and to the prayer of your servants who delight in revering your name. "
NEH	1	11	Nehemiah	#15		16911	 Give your servant success today by granting him favor in the presence of this man.>> I was cupbearer to the king.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
NEH	2	<<	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		16912	NEHEMIAH 2
NEH	2	1	Nehemiah	#15		16913	" {1} In the month of Nisan in the twentieth year of King Artaxerxes, when wine was brought for him, I took the wine and gave it to the king."
NEH	2	1	Nehemiah	#15		16914	" I had not been sad in his presence before; {2} so the king asked me,"
NEH	2	2	Artaxerxes	#17		16915	 << Why does your face look so sad when you are not ill? This can be nothing but sadness of heart.>>
NEH	2	2	Nehemiah	#15		16916	" I was very much afraid, {3} but I said to the king, "
NEH	2	3	Nehemiah	#15		16917	" << May the king live forever! Why should my face not look sad when the city where my fathers are buried lies in ruins, and its gates have been destroyed by fire?>>"
NEH	2	4	Nehemiah	#15		16918	" {4} The king said to me,"
NEH	2	4	Artaxerxes	#17		16919	 << What is it you want?>>
NEH	2	4	Nehemiah	#15		16920	" Then I prayed to the God of heaven, {5} and I answered the king, "
NEH	2	5	Nehemiah	#15		16921	" << If it pleases the king and if your servant has found favor in his sight, let him send me to the city in Judah where my fathers are buried so that I can rebuild it.>>"
NEH	2	6	Nehemiah	#15		16922	" {6} Then the king, with the queen sitting beside him, asked me,"
NEH	2	6	Artaxerxes	#17		16923	" << How long will your journey take, and when will you get back?>>"
NEH	2	6	Nehemiah	#15		16924	 It pleased the king to send me; so I set a time.
NEH	2	7	Nehemiah	#15		16925	" {7} I also said to him, << If it pleases the king, may I have letters to the governors of Trans-Euphrates, so that they will provide me safe-conduct until I arrive in Judah?"
NEH	2	8	Nehemiah	#15		16926	" {8} And may I have a letter to Asaph, keeper of the king's forest, so he will give me timber to make beams for the gates of the citadel by the temple and for the city wall and for the residence I will occupy?>>"
NEH	2	8	Nehemiah	#15		16927	" And because the gracious hand of my God was upon me, the king granted my requests."
NEH	2	9	Nehemiah	#15		16928	 {9} So I went to the governors of Trans-Euphrates and gave them the king's letters. The king had also sent army officers and cavalry with me.
NEH	2	10	Nehemiah	#15		16929	" {10} When Sanballat the Horonite and Tobiah the Ammonite official heard about this, they were very much disturbed that someone had come to promote the welfare of the Israelites."
NEH	2	11	Nehemiah	#15		16930	" {11} I went to Jerusalem, and after staying there three days"
NEH	2	12	Nehemiah	#15		16931	 {12} I set out during the night with a few men. I had not told anyone what my God had put in my heart to do for Jerusalem. There were no mounts with me except the one I was riding on.
NEH	2	13	Nehemiah	#15		16932	" {13} By night I went out through the Valley Gate toward the Jackal Well and the Dung Gate, examining the walls of Jerusalem, which had been broken down, and its gates, which had been destroyed by fire."
NEH	2	14	Nehemiah	#15		16933	" {14} Then I moved on toward the Fountain Gate and the King's Pool, but there was not enough room for my mount to get through;"
NEH	2	15	Nehemiah	#15		16934	" {15} so I went up the valley by night, examining the wall. Finally, I turned back and reentered through the Valley Gate."
NEH	2	16	Nehemiah	#15		16935	" {16} The officials did not know where I had gone or what I was doing, because as yet I had said nothing to the Jews or the priests or nobles or officials or any others who would be doing the work."
NEH	2	17	Nehemiah	#15		16936	" {17} Then I said to them, << You see the trouble we are in: Jerusalem lies in ruins, and its gates have been burned with fire. "
NEH	2	17	Nehemiah	#15		16937	" Come, let us rebuild the wall of Jerusalem, and we will no longer be in disgrace.>>"
NEH	2	18	Nehemiah	#15		16938	" {18} I also told them about the gracious hand of my God upon me and what the king had said to me. They replied,"
NEH	2	18	Official	#02		16939	 << Let us start rebuilding.>>
NEH	2	18	Nehemiah	#15		16940	 So they began this good work.
NEH	2	19	Nehemiah	#15		16941	" {19} But when Sanballat the Horonite, Tobiah the Ammonite official and Geshem the Arab heard about it, they mocked and ridiculed us."
NEH	2	19	Enemy	#04		16942	 << What is this you are doing? Are you rebelling against the king?>>
NEH	2	20	Nehemiah	#15		16943	" {20} I answered them by saying, << The God of heaven will give us success. "
NEH	2	20	Nehemiah	#15		16944	" We his servants will start rebuilding, but as for you, you have no share in Jerusalem or any claim or historic right to it.>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
NEH	3	<<	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		16945	NEHEMIAH 3
NEH	3	1	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		16946	 {1} Eliashib the high priest and his fellow priests went to work and rebuilt the Sheep Gate. 
NEH	3	1	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		16947	" They dedicated it and set its doors in place, building as far as the Tower of the Hundred, which they dedicated, and as far as the Tower of Hananel."
NEH	3	2	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		16948	" {2} The men of Jericho built the adjoining section, and Zaccur son of Imri built next to them."
NEH	3	3	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		16949	 {3} The Fish Gate was rebuilt by the sons of Hassenaah. They laid its beams and put its doors and bolts and bars in place.
NEH	3	4	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		16950	" {4} Meremoth son of Uriah, the son of Hakkoz, repaired the next section. "
NEH	3	4	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		16951	" Next to him Meshullam son of Berekiah, the son of Meshezabel, made repairs, and next to him Zadok son of Baana also made repairs."
NEH	3	5	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		16952	" {5} The next section was repaired by the men of Tekoa, but their nobles would not put their shoulders to the work under their supervisors."
NEH	3	6	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		16953	 {6} The Jeshanah Gate was repaired by Joiada son of Paseah and Meshullam son of Besodeiah. They laid its beams and put its doors and bolts and bars in place.
NEH	3	7	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		16954	" {7} Next to them, repairs were made by men from Gibeon and Mizpah --Melatiah of Gibeon and Jadon of Meronoth --places under the authority of the governor of Trans-Euphrates."
NEH	3	8	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		16955	" {8} Uzziel son of Harhaiah, one of the goldsmiths, repaired the next section; and Hananiah, one of the perfume-makers, made repairs next to that. They restored Jerusalem as far as the Broad Wall."
NEH	3	9	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		16956	" {9} Rephaiah son of Hur, ruler of a half-district of Jerusalem, repaired the next section."
NEH	3	10	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		16957	" {10} Adjoining this, Jedaiah son of Harumaph made repairs opposite his house, and Hattush son of Hashabneiah made repairs next to him."
NEH	3	11	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		16958	 {11} Malkijah son of Harim and Hasshub son of Pahath-Moab repaired another section and the Tower of the Ovens.
NEH	3	12	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		16959	" {12} Shallum son of Hallohesh, ruler of a half-district of Jerusalem, repaired the next section with the help of his daughters."
NEH	3	13	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		16960	 {13} The Valley Gate was repaired by Hanun and the residents of Zanoah. 
NEH	3	13	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		16961	 They rebuilt it and put its doors and bolts and bars in place. They also repaired five hundred yards of the wall as far as the Dung Gate.
NEH	3	14	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		16962	" {14} The Dung Gate was repaired by Malkijah son of Recab, ruler of the district of Beth Hakkerem. He rebuilt it and put its doors and bolts and bars in place."
NEH	3	15	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		16963	" {15} The Fountain Gate was repaired by Shallun son of Col-Hozeh, ruler of the district of Mizpah."
NEH	3	15	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		16964	" He rebuilt it, roofing it over and putting its doors and bolts and bars in place."
NEH	3	15	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		16965	" He also repaired the wall of the Pool of Siloam, by the King's Garden, as far as the steps going down from the City of David."
NEH	3	16	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		16966	" {16} Beyond him, Nehemiah son of Azbuk, ruler of a half-district of Beth Zur, made repairs up to a point opposite the tombs of David, as far as the artificial pool and the House of the Heroes."
NEH	3	17	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		16967	" {17} Next to him, the repairs were made by the Levites under Rehum son of Bani. Beside him, Hashabiah, ruler of half the district of Keilah, carried out repairs for his district."
NEH	3	18	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		16968	" {18} Next to him, the repairs were made by their countrymen under Binnui son of Henadad, ruler of the other half-district of Keilah."
NEH	3	19	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		16969	" {19} Next to him, Ezer son of Jeshua, ruler of Mizpah, repaired another section, from a point facing the ascent to the armory as far as the angle."
NEH	3	20	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		16970	" {20} Next to him, Baruch son of Zabbai zealously repaired another section, from the angle to the entrance of the house of Eliashib the high priest."
NEH	3	21	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		16971	" {21} Next to him, Meremoth son of Uriah, the son of Hakkoz, repaired another section, from the entrance of Eliashib's house to the end of it."
NEH	3	22	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		16972	 {22} The repairs next to him were made by the priests from the surrounding region.
NEH	3	23	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		16973	" {23} Beyond them, Benjamin and Hasshub made repairs in front of their house; and next to them, Azariah son of Maaseiah, the son of Ananiah, made repairs beside his house."
NEH	3	24	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		16974	" {24} Next to him, Binnui son of Henadad repaired another section, from Azariah's house to the angle and the corner,"
NEH	3	25	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		16975	" {25} and Palal son of Uzai worked opposite the angle and the tower projecting from the upper palace near the court of the guard. Next to him, Pedaiah son of Parosh"
NEH	3	26	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		16976	 {26} and the temple servants living on the hill of Ophel made repairs up to a point opposite the Water Gate toward the east and the projecting tower.
NEH	3	27	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		16977	" {27} Next to them, the men of Tekoa repaired another section, from the great projecting tower to the wall of Ophel."
NEH	3	28	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		16978	" {28} Above the Horse Gate, the priests made repairs, each in front of his own house."
NEH	3	29	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		16979	" {29} Next to them, Zadok son of Immer made repairs opposite his house. Next to him, Shemaiah son of Shecaniah, the guard at the East Gate, made repairs."
NEH	3	30	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		16980	" {30} Next to him, Hananiah son of Shelemiah, and Hanun, the sixth son of Zalaph, repaired another section. Next to them, Meshullam son of Berekiah made repairs opposite his living quarters."
NEH	3	31	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		16981	" {31} Next to him, Malkijah, one of the goldsmiths, made repairs as far as the house of the temple servants and the merchants, opposite the Inspection Gate, and as far as the room above the corner;"
NEH	3	32	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		16982	 {32} and between the room above the corner and the Sheep Gate the goldsmiths and merchants made repairs.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
NEH	4	<<	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		16983	NEHEMIAH 4
NEH	4	1	Nehemiah	#15		16984	" {1} When Sanballat heard that we were rebuilding the wall, he became angry and was greatly incensed. He ridiculed the Jews,"
NEH	4	2	Nehemiah	#15		16985	" {2} and in the presence of his associates and the army of Samaria, he said,"
NEH	4	2	Sanballat	#13		16986	 << What are those feeble Jews doing? Will they restore their wall? Will they offer sacrifices? Will they finish in a day? 
NEH	4	2	Sanballat	#13		16987	 Can they bring the stones back to life from those heaps of rubble--burned as they are?>>
NEH	4	3	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		16988	" {3} Tobiah the Ammonite, who was at his side, said,"
NEH	4	3	Tobiah	#14		16989	" << What they are building--if even a fox climbed up on it, he would break down their wall of stones!>>"
NEH	4	4	Nehemiah	#15		16990	" {4} Hear us, O our God, for we are despised. Turn their insults back on their own heads. Give them over as plunder in a land of captivity."
NEH	4	5	Nehemiah	#15		16991	" {5} Do not cover up their guilt or blot out their sins from your sight, for they have thrown insults in the face of the builders."
NEH	4	6	Nehemiah	#15		16992	" {6} So we rebuilt the wall till all of it reached half its height, for the people worked with all their heart."
NEH	4	7	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		16993	" {7} But when Sanballat, Tobiah, the Arabs, the Ammonites and the men of Ashdod heard that the repairs to Jerusalem's walls had gone ahead and that the gaps were being closed, they were very angry."
NEH	4	8	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		16994	 {8} They all plotted together to come and fight against Jerusalem and stir up trouble against it.
NEH	4	9	Nehemiah	#15		16995	" {9} But we prayed to our God and posted a guard day and night to meet this threat. {10} Meanwhile, the people in Judah said,"
NEH	4	10	Man	#06		16996	" << The strength of the laborers is giving out, and there is so much rubble that we cannot rebuild the wall.>>"
NEH	4	11	Nehemiah	#15		16997	" {11} Also our enemies said,"
NEH	4	11	Enemy	#08		16998	" << Before they know it or see us, we will be right there among them and will kill them and put an end to the work.>>"
NEH	4	12	Nehemiah	#15		16999	" {12} Then the Jews who lived near them came and told us ten times over,"
NEH	4	12	Man in Crowd	#18		17000	" << Wherever you turn, they will attack us.>>"
NEH	4	13	Nehemiah	#15		17001	" {13} Therefore I stationed some of the people behind the lowest points of the wall at the exposed places, posting them by families, with their swords, spears and bows."
NEH	4	14	Nehemiah	#15		17002	" {14} After I looked things over, I stood up and said to the nobles, the officials and the rest of the people, "
NEH	4	14	Nehemiah	#15		17003	" << Don't be afraid of them. Remember the Lord, who is great and awesome, and fight for your brothers, your sons and your daughters, your wives and your homes.>>"
NEH	4	15	Nehemiah	#15		17004	" {15} When our enemies heard that we were aware of their plot and that God had frustrated it, we all returned to the wall, each to his own work."
NEH	4	16	Nehemiah	#15		17005	" {16} From that day on, half of my men did the work, while the other half were equipped with spears, shields, bows and armor. "
NEH	4	16	Nehemiah	#15		17006	 The officers posted themselves behind all the people of Judah {17} who were building the wall. 
NEH	4	17	Nehemiah	#15		17007	" Those who carried materials did their work with one hand and held a weapon in the other, {18} and each of the builders wore his sword at his side as he worked. "
NEH	4	18	Nehemiah	#15		17008	" But the man who sounded the trumpet stayed with me. {19} Then I said to the nobles, the officials and the rest of the people, "
NEH	4	19	Nehemiah	#15		17009	" << The work is extensive and spread out, and we are widely separated from each other along the wall."
NEH	4	20	Nehemiah	#15		17010	" {20} Wherever you hear the sound of the trumpet, join us there. Our God will fight for us!>>"
NEH	4	21	Nehemiah	#15		17011	" {21} So we continued the work with half the men holding spears, from the first light of dawn till the stars came out."
NEH	4	22	Nehemiah	#15		17012	" {22} At that time I also said to the people, << Have every man and his helper stay inside Jerusalem at night, so they can serve us as guards by night and workmen by day.>>"
NEH	4	23	Nehemiah	#15		17013	" {23} Neither I nor my brothers nor my men nor the guards with me took off our clothes; each had his weapon, even when he went for water.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
NEH	5	<<	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17014	NEHEMIAH 5
NEH	5	1	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17015	" {1} Now the men and their wives raised a great outcry against their Jewish brothers. {2} Some were saying,"
NEH	5	2	Man	#05		17016	" << We and our sons and daughters are numerous; in order for us to eat and stay alive, we must get grain.>>"
NEH	5	3	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17017	" {3} Others were saying,"
NEH	5	3	Man	#16		17018	" We are mortgaging our fields, our vineyards and our homes to get grain during the famine.>>"
NEH	5	4	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17019	" {4} Still others were saying,"
NEH	5	4	Man	#03		17020	 << We have had to borrow money to pay the king's tax on our fields and vineyards.
NEH	5	5	Man	#03		17021	" {5} Although we are of the same flesh and blood as our countrymen and though our sons are as good as theirs, yet we have to subject our sons and daughters to slavery."
NEH	5	5	Man	#03		17022	" Some of our daughters have already been enslaved, but we are powerless, because our fields and our vineyards belong to others.>>"
NEH	5	6	Nehemiah	#15		17023	" {6} When I heard their outcry and these charges, I was very angry. {7} I pondered them in my mind and then accused the nobles and officials. I told them, "
NEH	5	7	Nehemiah	#15		17024	 << You are exacting usury from your own countrymen!>> 
NEH	5	7	Nehemiah	#15		17025	 So I called together a large meeting to deal with them {8} and said: 
NEH	5	8	Nehemiah	#15		17026	" << As far as possible, we have bought back our Jewish brothers who were sold to the Gentiles.  Now you are selling your brothers, only for them to be sold back to us!>> "
NEH	5	8	Nehemiah	#15		17027	" They kept quiet, because they could find nothing to say. {9} So I continued, "
NEH	5	9	Nehemiah	#15		17028	 << What you are doing is not right. Shouldn't you walk in the fear of our God to avoid the reproach of our Gentile enemies?
NEH	5	10	Nehemiah	#15		17029	 {10} I and my brothers and my men are also lending the people money and grain. But let the exacting of usury stop!
NEH	5	11	Nehemiah	#15		17030	" {11} Give back to them immediately their fields, vineyards, olive groves and houses, and also the usury you are charging them--the hundredth part of the money, grain, new wine and oil.>>"
NEH	5	12	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17031	" {12} They said,"
NEH	5	12	Official	#10		17032	 << We will give it back. We will not demand anything more from them. We will do as you say.>>
NEH	5	12	Nehemiah	#15		17033	 Then I summoned the priests and made the nobles and officials take an oath to do what they had promised.
NEH	5	13	Nehemiah	#15		17034	" {13} I also shook out the folds of my robe and said, "
NEH	5	13	Nehemiah	#15		17035	 << In this way may God shake out of his house and possessions every man who does not keep this promise. So may such a man be shaken out and emptied!>>
NEH	5	13	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17036	" At this the whole assembly said, Amen and praised the Lord. And the people did as they had promised."
NEH	5	14	Nehemiah	#15		17037	" {14} Moreover, from the twentieth year of King Artaxerxes, when I was appointed to be their governor in the land of Judah, until his thirty-second year--twelve years--"
NEH	5	14	Nehemiah	#15		17038	 neither I nor my brothers ate the food allotted to the governor.
NEH	5	15	Nehemiah	#15		17039	 {15} But the earlier governors--those preceding me--placed a heavy burden on the people and took forty shekels of silver from them in addition to food and wine. 
NEH	5	15	Nehemiah	#15		17040	 Their assistants also lorded it over the people. But out of reverence for God I did not act like that.
NEH	5	16	Nehemiah	#15		17041	" {16} Instead, I devoted myself to the work on this wall. All my men were assembled there for the work; we did not acquire any land."
NEH	5	17	Nehemiah	#15		17042	" {17} Furthermore, a hundred and fifty Jews and officials ate at my table, as well as those who came to us from the surrounding nations."
NEH	5	18	Nehemiah	#15		17043	" {18} Each day one ox, six choice sheep and some poultry were prepared for me, and every ten days an abundant supply of wine of all kinds."
NEH	5	18	Nehemiah	#15		17044	" In spite of all this, I never demanded the food allotted to the governor, because the demands were heavy on these people."
NEH	5	19	Nehemiah	#15		17045	" {19} Remember me with favor, O my God, for all I have done for these people.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
NEH	6	<<	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17046	NEHEMIAH 6
NEH	6	1	Nehemiah	#15		17047	" {1} When word came to Sanballat, Tobiah, Geshem the Arab and the rest of our enemies that I had rebuilt the wall and not a gap was left in it--"
NEH	6	1	Nehemiah	#15		17048	 though up to that time I had not set the doors in the gates-- {2} Sanballat and Geshem sent me this message:
NEH	6	2	Sanballat	#13		17049	" << Come, let us meet together in one of the villages on the plain of Ono.>>"
NEH	6	2	Nehemiah	#15		17050	 But they were scheming to harm me; {3} so I sent messengers to them with this reply: 
NEH	6	3	Nehemiah	#15		17051	 I am carring on a great project and cannot go down. Why should the work stop while I leave it and go down to you?
NEH	6	4	Nehemiah	#15		17052	" {4} Four times they sent me the same message, and each time I gave them the same answer."
NEH	6	5	Nehemiah	#15		17053	" {5} Then, the fifth time, Sanballat sent his aide to me with the same message, and in his hand was an unsealed letter {6} in which was written:"
NEH	6	6	Enemy	#14		17054	" << It is reported among the nations--and Geshem says it is true--that you and the Jews are plotting to revolt, and therefore you are building the wall. "
NEH	6	6	Enemy	#14		17055	" Moreover, according to these reports you are about to become their king"
NEH	6	7	Enemy	#14		17056	 {7} and have even appointed prophets to make this proclamation about you in Jerusalem: 'There is a king in Judah!' 
NEH	6	7	Enemy	#14		17057	" Now this report will get back to the king; so come, let us confer together.>>"
NEH	6	8	Nehemiah	#15		17058	 {8} I sent him this reply: << Nothing like what you are saying is happening; you are just making it up out of your head.>>
NEH	6	9	Nehemiah	#15		17059	" {9} They were all trying to frighten us, thinking, << Their hands will get too weak for the work, and it will not be completed.>> But I prayed, << Now strengthen my hands.>>"
NEH	6	10	Nehemiah	#15		17060	" {10} One day I went to the house of Shemaiah son of Delaiah, the son of Mehetabel, who was shut in at his home. He said,"
NEH	6	10	Shemaiah (bad)	#04		17061	" << Let us meet in the house of God, inside the temple, and let us close the temple doors, because men are coming to kill you--by night they are coming to kill you.>>"
NEH	6	11	Nehemiah	#15		17062	" {11} But I said, << Should a man like me run away? Or should one like me go into the temple to save his life? I will not go!>>"
NEH	6	12	Nehemiah	#15		17063	" {12} I realized that God had not sent him, but that he had prophesied against me because Tobiah and Sanballat had hired him."
NEH	6	13	Nehemiah	#15		17064	" {13} He had been hired to intimidate me so that I would commit a sin by doing this, and then they would give me a bad name to discredit me."
NEH	6	14	Nehemiah	#15		17065	" {14} Remember Tobiah and Sanballat, O my God, because of what they have done; remember also the prophetess Noadiah and the rest of the prophets who have been trying to intimidate me."
NEH	6	15	Nehemiah	#15		17066	" {15} So the wall was completed on the twenty-fifth of Elul, in fifty-two days."
NEH	6	16	Nehemiah	#15		17067	" {16} When all our enemies heard about this, all the surrounding nations were afraid and lost their self-confidence, because they realized that this work had been done with the help of our God."
NEH	6	17	Nehemiah	#15		17068	" {17} Also, in those days the nobles of Judah were sending many letters to Tobiah, and replies from Tobiah kept coming to them."
NEH	6	18	Nehemiah	#15		17069	" {18} For many in Judah were under oath to him, since he was son-in-law to Shecaniah son of Arah, and his son Jehohanan had married the daughter of Meshullam son of Berekiah."
NEH	6	19	Nehemiah	#15		17070	" {19} Moreover, they kept reporting to me his good deeds and then telling him what I said. And Tobiah sent letters to intimidate me.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"

NEH	7	4	Nehemiah	#15		17076	" {4} Now the city was large and spacious, but there were few people in it, and the houses had not yet been rebuilt."

NEH	8	<<	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17133	NEHEMIAH 8
NEH	8	1	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17134	" {1} All the people assembled as one man in the square before the Water Gate. They told Ezra the scribe to bring out the Book of the Law of Moses, which the Lord had commanded for Israel."
NEH	8	2	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17135	" {2} So on the first day of the seventh month Ezra the priest brought the Law before the assembly, which was made up of men and women and all who were able to understand."
NEH	8	3	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17136	" {3} He read it aloud from daybreak till noon as he faced the square before the Water Gate in the presence of the men, women and others who could understand. "
NEH	8	3	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17137	 And all the people listened attentively to the Book of the Law.
NEH	8	4	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17138	 {4} Ezra the scribe stood on a high wooden platform built for the occasion.

NEH	8	6	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17144	" {6} Ezra praised the Lord, the great God; and all the people lifted their hands and responded,"
NEH	8	6	Man in Crowd	#16		17145	 << Amen! Amen!>>
NEH	8	6	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17146	 Then they bowed down and worshiped the Lord with their faces to the ground.
NEH	8	7	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17147	" {7} The Levites--Jeshua, Bani, Sherebiah, "
NEH	8	7	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17148	" Jamin, Akkub, Shabbethai, Hodiah, Maaseiah, Kelita, Azariah, "

NEH	8	7	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17150	 instructed the people in the Law while the people were standing there.
NEH	8	8	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17151	" {8} They read from the Book of the Law of God, making it clear and giving the meaning so that the people could understand what was being read."
NEH	8	9	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17152	" {9} Then Nehemiah the governor, Ezra the priest and scribe, and the Levites who were instructing the people said to them all,"
NEH	8	9	Ezra	#05		17153	 This day is sacred to the Lord your God. Do not mourn or weep.>>
NEH	8	9	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17154	" For all the people had been weeping as they listened to the words of the Law. {10} Nehemiah said,"
NEH	8	10	Nehemiah	#15		17155	" << Go and enjoy choice food and sweet drinks, and send some to those who have nothing prepared. This day is sacred to our Lord. Do not grieve, for the joy of the Lord is your strength.>>"
NEH	8	11	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17156	" {11} The Levites calmed all the people, saying,"
NEH	8	11	Levite #2	#02		17157	" << Be still, for this is a sacred day. Do not grieve.>>"
NEH	8	12	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17158	" {12} Then all the people went away to eat and drink, to send portions of food and to celebrate with great joy, because they now understood the words that had been made known to them."
NEH	8	13	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17159	" {13} On the second day of the month, the heads of all the families, along with the priests and the Levites, gathered around Ezra the scribe to give attention to the words of the Law."
NEH	8	14	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17160	" {14} They found written in the Law, which the Lord had commanded through Moses, that the Israelites were to live in booths during the feast of the seventh month"
NEH	8	15	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17161	 {15} and that they should proclaim this word and spread it throughout their towns and in Jerusalem:
NEH	8	15	Israelite	#06		17162	" << Go out into the hill country and bring back branches from olive and wild olive trees, and from myrtles, palms and shade trees, to make booths--as it is written.>>"
NEH	8	16	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17163	" {16} So the people went out and brought back branches and built themselves booths on their own roofs, in their courtyards, in the courts of the house of God and in the square by the Water Gate and the one by the Gate of Ephraim."
NEH	8	17	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17164	 {17} The whole company that had returned from exile built booths and lived in them.
NEH	8	17	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17165	" From the days of Joshua son of Nun until that day, the Israelites had not celebrated it like this. And their joy was very great."
NEH	8	18	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17166	" {18} Day after day, from the first day to the last, Ezra read from the Book of the Law of God. "
NEH	8	18	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17167	" They celebrated the feast for seven days, and on the eighth day, in accordance with the regulation, there was an assembly.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
NEH	9	<<	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17168	NEHEMIAH 9
NEH	9	1	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17169	" {1} On the twenty-fourth day of the same month, the Israelites gathered together, fasting and wearing sackcloth and having dust on their heads."
NEH	9	2	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17170	 {2} Those of Israelite descent had separated themselves from all foreigners. They stood in their places and confessed their sins and the wickedness of their fathers.
NEH	9	3	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17171	" {3} They stood where they were and read from the Book of the Law of the Lord their God for a quarter of the day, and spent another quarter in confession and in worshiping the Lord their God."
NEH	9	4	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17172	" {4} Standing on the stairs were the Levites--Jeshua, Bani, Kadmiel, Shebaniah, Bunni, Sherebiah, Bani and Kenani --who called with loud voices to the Lord their God."
NEH	9	5	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17173	" {5} And the Levites--Jeshua, Kadmiel, Bani, Hashabneiah, Sherebiah, Hodiah, Shebaniah and Pethahiah --said:"
NEH	9	5	Levite #1	#16		17174	" << Stand up and praise the Lord your God, who is from everlasting to everlasting.>>"
NEH	9	5	Levite #2	#02		17175	" << Blessed be your glorious name, and may it be exalted above all blessing and praise."
NEH	9	6	Levite #2	#02		17176	 {6} You alone are the Lord. 
NEH	9	6	Levite #2	#02		17177	" You made the heavens, even the highest heavens, and all their starry host, the earth and all that is on it, the seas and all that is in them. "
NEH	9	6	Levite #2	#02		17178	" You give life to everything, and the multitudes of heaven worship you."
NEH	9	7	Levite #3	#09		17179	 {7} << You are the Lord God who chose Abram and brought him out of Ur of the Chaldeans and named him Abraham.
NEH	9	8	Levite #3	#09		17180	" {8} You found his heart faithful to you, and you made a covenant with him to give to his descendants the land of the Canaanites, Hittites, Amorites, "
NEH	9	8	Levite #3	#09		17181	" Perizzites, Jebusites and Girgashites. "
NEH	9	8	Levite #3	#09		17182	 You have kept your promise because you are righteous.
NEH	9	9	Levite #3	#09		17183	 {9} << You saw the suffering of our forefathers in Egypt; you heard their cry at the Red Sea.
NEH	9	10	Levite #3	#09		17184	" {10} You sent miraculous signs and wonders against Pharaoh, against all his officials and all the people of his land, for you knew how arrogantly the Egyptians treated them. "
NEH	9	10	Levite #3	#09		17185	" You made a name for yourself, which remains to this day."
NEH	9	11	Levite #3	#09		17186	" {11} You divided the sea before them, so that they passed through it on dry ground, but you hurled their pursuers into the depths, like a stone into mighty waters."
NEH	9	12	Levite #3	#09		17187	" {12} By day you led them with a pillar of cloud, and by night with a pillar of fire to give them light on the way they were to take."
NEH	9	13	Levite #3	#09		17188	 {13} << You came down on Mount Sinai; you spoke to them from heaven. 
NEH	9	13	Levite #3	#09		17189	" You gave them regulations and laws that are just and right, and decrees and commands that are good."
NEH	9	14	Levite #3	#09		17190	" {14} You made known to them your holy Sabbath and gave them commands, decrees and laws through your servant Moses."
NEH	9	15	Levite #3	#09		17191	 {15} In their hunger you gave them bread from heaven and in their thirst you brought them water from the rock; 
NEH	9	15	Levite #3	#09		17192	 you told them to go in and take possession of the land you had sworn with uplifted hand to give them.>>
NEH	9	16	Levite #2	#02		17193	" {16} << But they, our forefathers, became arrogant and stiff-necked, and did not obey your commands."
NEH	9	17	Levite #2	#02		17194	 {17} They refused to listen and failed to remember the miracles you performed among them.
NEH	9	17	Levite #2	#02		17195	 They became stiff-necked and in their rebellion appointed a leader in order to return to their slavery.>> 
NEH	9	17	Levite #2	#02		17196	" << But you are a forgiving God, gracious and compassionate, slow to anger and abounding in love."
NEH	9	17	Levite #3	#09		17197	" Therefore you did not desert them, {18} even when they cast for themselves an image of a calf and said, "
NEH	9	18	Levite #3	#09		17198	" This is your god, who brought you up out of Egypt,' or when they committed awful blasphemies."
NEH	9	19	Levite #3	#09		17199	 {19} << Because of your great compassion you did not abandon them in the desert. 
NEH	9	19	Levite #3	#09		17200	" By day the pillar of cloud did not cease to guide them on their path, nor the pillar of fire by night to shine on the way they were to take."
NEH	9	20	Levite #3	#09		17201	" {20} You gave your good Spirit to instruct them. You did not withhold your manna from their mouths, and you gave them water for their thirst."
NEH	9	21	Levite #2	#02		17202	" {21} For forty years you sustained them in the desert; they lacked nothing, their clothes did not wear out nor did their feet become swollen."
NEH	9	22	Levite #2	#02		17203	" {22} << You gave them kingdoms and nations, allotting to them even the remotest frontiers. "
NEH	9	22	Levite #2	#02		17204	 They took over the country of Sihon king of Heshbon and the country of Og king of Bashan.
NEH	9	23	Levite #2	#02		17205	" {23} You made their sons as numerous as the stars in the sky, and you brought them into the land that you told their fathers to enter and possess."
NEH	9	24	Levite #1	#16		17206	" {24} Their sons went in and took possession of the land. You subdued before them the Canaanites, who lived in the land; "
NEH	9	24	Levite #1	#16		17207	" you handed the Canaanites over to them, along with their kings and the peoples of the land, to deal with them as they pleased."
NEH	9	25	Levite #1	#16		17208	" {25} They captured fortified cities and fertile land; they took possession of houses filled with all kinds of good things, wells already dug, vineyards, olive groves and fruit trees in abundance."
NEH	9	25	Levite #1	#16		17209	 They ate to the full and were well-nourished; they reveled in your great goodness.>>
NEH	9	26	Levite #2	#02		17210	 {26} << But they were disobedient and rebelled against you; they put your law behind their backs. 
NEH	9	26	Levite #2	#02		17211	" They killed your prophets, who had admonished them in order to turn them back to you; they committed awful blasphemies."
NEH	9	27	Levite #2	#02		17212	" {27} So you handed them over to their enemies, who oppressed them. But when they were oppressed they cried out to you. "
NEH	9	27	Levite #2	#02		17213	" From heaven you heard them, and in your great compassion you gave them deliverers, who rescued them from the hand of their enemies."
NEH	9	28	Levite #2	#02		17214	" {28} << But as soon as they were at rest, they again did what was evil in your sight. "
NEH	9	28	Levite #2	#02		17215	 Then you abandoned them to the hand of their enemies so that they ruled over them. 
NEH	9	28	Levite #2	#02		17216	" And when they cried out to you again, you heard from heaven, and in your compassion you delivered them time after time."
NEH	9	29	Levite #3	#09		17217	" {29} << You warned them to return to your law, but they became arrogant and disobeyed your commands. "
NEH	9	29	Levite #3	#09		17218	" They sinned against your ordinances, by which a man will live if he obeys them. "
NEH	9	29	Levite #3	#09		17219	" Stubbornly they turned their backs on you, became stiff-necked and refused to listen."
NEH	9	30	Levite #3	#09		17220	 {30} For many years you were patient with them. By your Spirit you admonished them through your prophets.
NEH	9	30	Levite #3	#09		17221	" Yet they paid paid no attention, so you handed them over to the neighboring peoples."
NEH	9	31	Levite #3	#09		17222	" {31} But in your great mercy you did not put an end to them or abandon them, for you are a gracious and merciful God."
NEH	9	32	Levite #2	#02		17223	" {32} << Now therefore, O our God, the great, mighty and awesome God, who keeps his covenant of love, do not let all this hardship seem trifling in your eyes--"
NEH	9	32	Levite #2	#02		17224	" the hardship that has come upon us, upon our kings and leaders, upon our priests and prophets, upon our fathers and all your people, from the days of the kings of Assyria until today."
NEH	9	33	Levite #2	#02		17225	" {33} In all that has happened to us, you have been just; you have acted faithfully, while we did wrong."
NEH	9	34	Levite #2	#02		17226	" {34} Our kings, our leaders, our priests and our fathers did not follow your law; they did not pay attention to your commands or the warnings you gave them."
NEH	9	35	Levite #2	#02		17227	" {35} Even while they were in their kingdom, enjoying your great goodness to them in the spacious and fertile land you gave them, they did not serve you or turn from their evil ways.>>"
NEH	9	36	Levite #1	#16		17228	" {36} << But see, we are slaves today, slaves in the land you gave our forefathers so they could eat its fruit and the other good things it produces."
NEH	9	37	Levite #1	#16		17229	" {37} Because of our sins, its abundant harvest goes to the kings you have placed over us. They rule over our bodies and our cattle as they please. We are in great distress."
NEH	9	38	Nehemiah	#15		17230	" {38} << In view of all this, we are making a binding agreement, putting it in writing, and our leaders, our Levites and our priests are affixing their seals to it.>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"

NEH	10	28	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17247	" {28} << The rest of the people--priests, Levites, gatekeepers, singers, temple servants and all who separated themselves from the neighboring peoples for the sake of the Law of God, "

NEH	10	29	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17249	" and bind themselves with a curse and an oath to follow the Law of God given through Moses the servant of God and to obey carefully all the commands, regulations and decrees of the Lord our Lord."
NEH	10	30	Levite #3	#09		17250	 {30} << We promise not to give our daughters in marriage to the peoples around us or take their daughters for our sons.
NEH	10	31	Levite #3	#09		17251	" {31} << When the neighboring peoples bring merchandise or grain to sell on the Sabbath, we will not buy from them on the Sabbath or on any holy day. "
NEH	10	31	Levite #3	#09		17252	 Every seventh year we will forgo working the land and will cancel all debts.
NEH	10	32	Levite #3	#09		17253	 {32} << We assume the responsibility for carrying out the commands to give a third of a shekel each year for the service of the house of our God:
NEH	10	33	Levite #3	#09		17254	" {33} for the bread set out on the table; for the regular grain offerings and burnt offerings; for the offerings on the Sabbaths, New Moon festivals and appointed feasts; "
NEH	10	33	Levite #3	#09		17255	 for the holy offerings; for sin offerings to make atonement for Israel; and for all the duties of the house of our God.
NEH	10	34	Levite #2	#02		17256	" {34} << We--the priests, the Levites and the people--have cast lots to determine when each of our families is to bring to the house of our God at set times each year a contribution of wood to burn on the altar of the Lord our God, as it is written in the"
NEH	10	35	Levite #2	#02		17257	 {35} << We also assume responsibility for bringing to the house of the Lord each year the firstfruits of our crops and of every fruit tree.
NEH	10	36	Levite #2	#02		17258	" {36} << As it is also written in the Law, we will bring the firstborn of our sons and of our cattle, of our herds and of our flocks to the house of our God, to the priests ministering there."
NEH	10	37	Levite #3	#09		17259	" {37} << Moreover, we will bring to the storerooms of the house of our God, to the priests, the first of our ground meal, of our grain offerings, of the fruit of all our trees and of our new wine and oil. "
NEH	10	37	Levite #3	#09		17260	" And we will bring a tithe of our crops to the Levites, for it is the Levites who collect the tithes in all the towns where we work."
NEH	10	38	Levite #3	#09		17261	" {38} A priest descended from Aaron is to accompany the Levites when they receive the tithes, and the Levites are to bring a tenth of the tithes up to the house of our God, to the storerooms of the treasury."
NEH	10	39	Levite #3	#09		17262	" {39} The people of Israel, including the Levites, are to bring their contributions of grain, new wine and oil to the storerooms where the articles for the sanctuary are kept and where the ministering priests, the gatekeepers and the singers stay. "
NEH	10	39	Levite #3	#09		17263	 << We will not neglect the house of our God.>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*

NEH	11	2	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17266	 {2} The people commended all the men who volunteered to live in Jerusalem.

NEH	11	23	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17292	" {23} The singers were under the king's orders, which regulated their daily activity."
NEH	11	24	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17293	" {24} Pethahiah son of Meshezabel, one of the descendants of Zerah son of Judah, was the king's agent in all affairs relating to the people."

NEH	11	30	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17301	 So they were living all the way from Beersheba to the Valley of Hinnom.

NEH	12	<<	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17306	NEHEMIAH 12

NEH	12	8	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17312	" {8} The Levites were Jeshua, Binnui, Kadmiel, Sherebiah, Judah, and also Mattaniah, who, together with his associates, was in charge of the songs of thanksgiving."
NEH	12	9	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17313	" {9} Bakbukiah and Unni, their associates, stood opposite them in the services."
NEH	12	10	Geneology	#19		17314	" {10} Jeshua was the father of Joiakim, Joiakim the father of Eliashib, Eliashib the father of Joiada,"
NEH	12	11	Geneology	#19		17315	" {11} Joiada the father of Jonathan, and Jonathan the father of Jaddua."
NEH	12	12	Geneology	#19		17316	" {12} In the days of Joiakim, these were the heads of the priestly families: of Seraiah's family, Meraiah; of Jeremiah's, Hananiah;"
NEH	12	13	Geneology	#19		17317	" {13} of Ezra's, Meshullam; of Amariah's, Jehohanan;"
NEH	12	14	Geneology	#19		17318	" {14} of Malluch's, Jonathan; of Shecaniah's, Joseph;"
NEH	12	15	Geneology	#19		17319	" {15} of Harim's, Adna; of Meremoth's, Helkai;"
NEH	12	16	Geneology	#19		17320	" {16} of Iddo's, Zechariah; of Ginnethon's, Meshullam;"
NEH	12	17	Geneology	#19		17321	" {17} of Abijah's, Zicri; of Miniamin's and of Moadiah's, Piltai;"
NEH	12	18	Geneology	#19		17322	" {18} of Bilgah's, Shammua; of Shemaiah's, Jehonathan;"
NEH	12	19	Geneology	#19		17323	" {19} of Joiarib's, Mattenai; of Jedaiah's, Uzzi;"
NEH	12	20	Geneology	#19		17324	" {20} of Sallu's, Kallai; of Amok's, Eber;"
NEH	12	21	Geneology	#19		17325	" {21} of Hilkiah's, Hashabiah; of Jedaiah's, Nethanel."
NEH	12	22	Geneology	#19		17326	" {22} The family heads of the Levites in the days of Eliashib, Joiada, Johanan and Jaddua, as well as those of the priests, were recorded in the reign of Darius the Persian."
NEH	12	23	Geneology	#19		17327	 {23} The family heads among the descendants of Levi up to the time of Johanan son of Eliashib were recorded in the book of the annals.
NEH	12	24	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17328	" {24} And the leaders of the Levites were Hashabiah, Sherebiah, Jeshua son of Kadmiel, and their associates, who stood opposite them to give praise and thanksgiving, "
NEH	12	24	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17329	" one section responding to the other, as prescribed by David the man of God."
NEH	12	25	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17330	" {25} Mattaniah, Bakbukiah, Obadiah, "
NEH	12	25	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17331	" Meshullam, Talmon and Akkub were gatekeepers who guarded the storerooms at the gates."
NEH	12	26	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17332	" {26} They served in the days of Joiakim son of Jeshua, the son of Jozadak, and in the days of Nehemiah the governor and of Ezra the priest and scribe."
NEH	12	27	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17333	" {27} At the dedication of the wall of Jerusalem, the Levites were sought out from where they lived and were brought to Jerusalem to celebrate joyfully the dedication with songs of thanksgiving and with the music of cymbals, harps and lyres."
NEH	12	28	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17334	" {28} The singers also were brought together from the region around Jerusalem --from the villages of the Netophathites,"
NEH	12	29	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17335	" {29} from Beth Gilgal, and from the area of Geba and Azmaveth, for the singers had built villages for themselves around Jerusalem."
NEH	12	30	Nehemiah	#15		17336	" {30} When the priests and Levites had purified themselves ceremonially, they purified the people, the gates and the wall."
NEH	12	31	Nehemiah	#15		17337	" {31} I had the leaders of Judah go up on top of the wall. I also assigned two large choirs to give thanks. One was to proceed on top of the wall to the right, toward the Dung Gate."
NEH	12	32	Nehemiah	#15		17338	" {32} Hoshaiah and half the leaders of Judah followed them,"
NEH	12	33	Nehemiah	#15		17339	" {33} along with Azariah, Ezra, Meshullam, "
NEH	12	34	Nehemiah	#15		17340	" {34} Judah, Benjamin, Shemaiah, Jeremiah,"
NEH	12	35	Nehemiah	#15		17341	" {35} as well as some priests with trumpets, and also Zechariah son of Jonathan, the son of Shemaiah, the son of Mattaniah, "
NEH	12	35	Nehemiah	#15		17342	" the son of Micaiah, the son of Zaccur, the son of Asaph,"
NEH	12	36	Nehemiah	#15		17343	" {36} and his associates--Shemaiah, Azarel, Milalai, Gilalai, "
NEH	12	36	Nehemiah	#15		17344	" Maai, Nethanel, Judah and Hanani --"
NEH	12	36	Nehemiah	#15		17345	 with musical instruments prescribed by David the man of God. Ezra the scribe led the procession.
NEH	12	37	Nehemiah	#15		17346	 {37} At the Fountain Gate they continued directly up the steps of the City of David on the ascent to the wall and passed above the house of David to the Water Gate on the east.
NEH	12	38	Nehemiah	#15		17347	" {38} The second choir proceeded in the opposite direction. I followed them on top of the wall, together with half the people--past the Tower of the Ovens to the Broad Wall,"
NEH	12	39	Nehemiah	#15		17348	" {39} over the Gate of Ephraim, the Jeshanah Gate, the Fish Gate, the Tower of Hananel and the Tower of the Hundred, as far as the Sheep Gate. At the Gate of the Guard they stopped."
NEH	12	40	Nehemiah	#15		17349	" {40} The two choirs that gave thanks then took their places in the house of God; so did I, together with half the officials,"
NEH	12	41	Nehemiah	#15		17350	" {41} as well as the priests--Eliakim, Maaseiah, Miniamin, Micaiah, Elioenai, Zechariah and Hananiah with their trumpets--"
NEH	12	42	Nehemiah	#15		17351	" {42} and also Maaseiah, Shemaiah, Eleazar, Uzzi, Jehohanan, Malkijah, Elam and Ezer. The choirs sang under the direction of Jezrahiah."
NEH	12	43	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17352	" {43} And on that day they offered great sacrifices, rejoicing because God had given them great joy. The women and children also rejoiced. The sound of rejoicing in Jerusalem could be heard far away."
NEH	12	44	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17353	" {44} At that time men were appointed to be in charge of the storerooms for the contributions, firstfruits and tithes. "
NEH	12	44	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17354	" From the fields around the towns they were to bring into the storerooms the portions required by the Law for the priests and the Levites, "
NEH	12	44	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17355	 for Judah was pleased with the ministering priests and Levites.
NEH	12	45	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17356	" {45} They performed the service of their God and the service of purification, as did also the singers and gatekeepers, according to the commands of David and his son Solomon."
NEH	12	46	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17357	" {46} For long ago, in the days of David and Asaph, there had been directors for the singers and for the songs of praise and thanksgiving to God."
NEH	12	47	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17358	" {47} So in the days of Zerubbabel and of Nehemiah, all Israel contributed the daily portions for the singers and gatekeepers. "
NEH	12	47	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17359	" They also set aside the portion for the other Levites, and the Levites set aside the portion for the descendants of Aaron.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
NEH	13	<<	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17360	NEHEMIAH 13
NEH	13	1	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17361	" {1} On that day the Book of Moses was read aloud in the hearing of the people and there it was found written that no Ammonite or Moabite should ever be admitted into the assembly of God,"
NEH	13	2	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17362	" {2} because they had not met the Israelites with food and water but had hired Balaam to call a curse down on them. (Our God, however, turned the curse into a blessing.)"
NEH	13	3	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17363	" {3} When the people heard this law, they excluded from Israel all who were of foreign descent."
NEH	13	4	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17364	" {4} Before this, Eliashib the priest had been put in charge of the storerooms of the house of our God. He was closely associated with Tobiah,"
NEH	13	5	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17365	" {5} and he had provided him with a large room formerly used to store the grain offerings and incense and temple articles, "
NEH	13	5	Narr_16: Nehemiah	#01		17366	" and also the tithes of grain, new wine and oil prescribed for the Levites, singers and gatekeepers, as well as the contributions for the priests."
NEH	13	6	Nehemiah	#15		17367	" {6} But while all this was going on, I was not in Jerusalem, for in the thirty-second year of Artaxerxes king of Babylon I had returned to the king. "
NEH	13	6	Nehemiah	#15		17368	 Some time later I asked his permission {7} and came back to Jerusalem. Here I learned about the evil thing Eliashib had done in providing Tobiah a room in the courts of the house of God.
NEH	13	8	Nehemiah	#15		17369	 {8} I was greatly displeased and threw all Tobiah's household goods out of the room.
NEH	13	9	Nehemiah	#15		17370	" {9} I gave orders to purify the rooms, and then I put back into them the equipment of the house of God, with the grain offerings and the incense."
NEH	13	10	Nehemiah	#15		17371	" {10} I also learned that the portions assigned to the Levites had not been given to them, and that all the Levites and singers responsible for the service had gone back to their own fields."
NEH	13	11	Nehemiah	#15		17372	" {11} So I rebuked the officials and asked them, << Why is the house of God neglected?>> Then I called them together and stationed them at their posts."
NEH	13	12	Nehemiah	#15		17373	" {12} All Judah brought the tithes of grain, new wine and oil into the storerooms."
NEH	13	13	Nehemiah	#15		17374	" {13} I put Shelemiah the priest, Zadok the scribe, and a Levite named Pedaiah in charge of the storerooms and made Hanan son of Zaccur, the son of Mattaniah, their assistant, because these men were considered trustworthy. "
NEH	13	13	Nehemiah	#15		17375	 They were made responsible for distributing the supplies to their brothers.
NEH	13	14	Nehemiah	#15		17376	" {14} Remember me for this, O my God, and do not blot out what I have so faithfully done for the house of my God and its services."
NEH	13	15	Nehemiah	#15		17377	" {15} In those days I saw men in Judah treading winepresses on the Sabbath and bringing in grain and loading it on donkeys, together with wine, grapes, figs and all other kinds of loads. "
NEH	13	15	Nehemiah	#15		17378	 And they were bringing all this into Jerusalem on the Sabbath. Therefore I warned them against selling food on that day.
NEH	13	16	Nehemiah	#15		17379	 {16} Men from Tyre who lived in Jerusalem were bringing in fish and all kinds of merchandise and selling them in Jerusalem on the Sabbath to the people of Judah.
NEH	13	17	Nehemiah	#15		17380	" {17} I rebuked the nobles of Judah and said to them, << What is this wicked thing you are doing--desecrating the Sabbath day?"
NEH	13	18	Nehemiah	#15		17381	" {18} Didn't your forefathers do the same things, so that our God brought all this calamity upon us and upon this city? "
NEH	13	18	Nehemiah	#15		17382	 Now you are stirring up more wrath against Israel by desecrating the Sabbath.>>
NEH	13	19	Nehemiah	#15		17383	" {19} When evening shadows fell on the gates of Jerusalem before the Sabbath, I ordered the doors to be shut and not opened until the Sabbath was over. "
NEH	13	19	Nehemiah	#15		17384	 I stationed some of my own men at the gates so that no load could be brought in on the Sabbath day.
NEH	13	20	Nehemiah	#15		17385	 {20} Once or twice the merchants and sellers of all kinds of goods spent the night outside Jerusalem.
NEH	13	21	Nehemiah	#15		17386	" {21} But I warned them and said, << Why do you spend the night by the wall? If you do this again, I will lay hands on you.>> From that time on they no longer came on the Sabbath."
NEH	13	22	Nehemiah	#15		17387	 {22} Then I commanded the Levites to purify themselves and go and guard the gates in order to keep the Sabbath day holy. 
NEH	13	22	Nehemiah	#15		17388	" Remember me for this also, O my God, and show mercy to me according to your great love."
NEH	13	23	Nehemiah	#15		17389	" {23} Moreover, in those days I saw men of Judah who had married women from Ashdod, Ammon and Moab."
NEH	13	24	Nehemiah	#15		17390	" {24} Half of their children spoke the language of Ashdod or the language of one of the other peoples, and did not know how to speak the language of Judah."
NEH	13	25	Nehemiah	#15		17391	 {25} I rebuked them and called curses down on them. I beat some of the men and pulled out their hair. 
NEH	13	25	Nehemiah	#15		17392	" I made them take an oath in God's name and said: << You are not to give your daughters in marriage to their sons, nor are you to take their daughters in marriage for your sons or for yourselves."
NEH	13	26	Nehemiah	#15		17393	 {26} Was it not because of marriages like these that Solomon king of Israel sinned? Among the many nations there was no king like him. 
NEH	13	26	Nehemiah	#15		17394	" He was loved by his God, and God made him king over all Israel, but even he was led into sin by foreign women."
NEH	13	27	Nehemiah	#15		17395	 {27} Must we hear now that you too are doing all this terrible wickedness and are being unfaithful to our God by marrying foreign women?>>
NEH	13	28	Nehemiah	#15		17396	 {28} One of the sons of Joiada son of Eliashib the high priest was son-in-law to Sanballat the Horonite. And I drove him away from me.
NEH	13	29	Nehemiah	#15		17397	" {29} Remember them, O my God, because they defiled the priestly office and the covenant of the priesthood and of the Levites."
NEH	13	30	Nehemiah	#15		17398	" {30} So I purified the priests and the Levites of everything foreign, and assigned them duties, each to his own task."
NEH	13	31	Nehemiah	#15		17399	" {31} I also made provision for contributions of wood at designated times, and for the firstfruits. Remember me with favor, O my God.*~**~*||||| + 5 SECs |||||*~*"
EST	1	<<	Narr_17: Esther	#25		17400	ESTHER*~*ESTHER 1
EST	1	1	Narr_17: Esther	#25		17401	" {1} This is what happened during the time of Xerxes, the Xerxes who ruled over 127 provinces stretching from India to Cush:"
EST	1	2	Narr_17: Esther	#25		17402	" {2} At that time King Xerxes reigned from his royal throne in the citadel of Susa, {3} and in the third year of his reign he gave a banquet for all his nobles and officials. "
EST	1	3	Narr_17: Esther	#25		17403	" The military leaders of Persia and Media, the princes, and the nobles of the provinces were present."
EST	1	4	Narr_17: Esther	#25		17404	 {4} For a full 180 days he displayed the vast wealth of his kingdom and the splendor and glory of his majesty.
EST	1	5	Narr_17: Esther	#25		17405	" {5} When these days were over, the king gave a banquet, lasting seven days, in the enclosed garden of the king's palace, for all the people from the least to the greatest, who were in the citadel of Susa."
EST	1	6	Narr_17: Esther	#25		17406	" {6} The garden had hangings of white and blue linen, fastened with cords of white linen and purple material to silver rings on marble pillars. "
EST	1	6	Narr_17: Esther	#25		17407	" There were couches of gold and silver on a mosaic pavement of porphyry, marble, mother-of-pearl and other costly stones."
EST	1	7	Narr_17: Esther	#25		17408	" {7} Wine was served in goblets of gold, each one different from the other, and the royal wine was abundant, in keeping with the king's liberality."
EST	1	8	Narr_17: Esther	#25		17409	" {8} By the king's command each guest was allowed to drink in his own way, for the king instructed all the wine stewards to serve each man what he wished."
EST	1	9	Narr_17: Esther	#25		17410	 {9} Queen Vashti also gave a banquet for the women in the royal palace of King Xerxes.
EST	1	10	Narr_17: Esther	#25		17411	" {10} On the seventh day, when King Xerxes was in high spirits from wine, he commanded the seven eunuchs who served him--Mehuman, Biztha, Harbona, "
EST	1	10	Narr_17: Esther	#25		17412	" Bigtha, Abagtha, Zethar and Carcas --"
EST	1	11	Narr_17: Esther	#25		17413	" {11} to bring before him Queen Vashti, wearing her royal crown, in order to display her beauty to the people and nobles, for she was lovely to look at."
EST	1	12	Narr_17: Esther	#25		17414	" {12} But when the attendants delivered the king's command, Queen Vashti refused to come. Then the king became furious and burned with anger."
EST	1	13	Narr_17: Esther	#25		17415	" {13} Since it was customary for the king to consult experts in matters of law and justice, he spoke with the wise men who understood the times {14} and were closest to the king--"
EST	1	14	Narr_17: Esther	#25		17416	" Carshena, Shethar, Admatha, "
EST	1	14	Narr_17: Esther	#25		17417	" Tarshish, Meres, Marsena and Memucan, "
EST	1	14	Narr_17: Esther	#25		17418	 the seven nobles of Persia and Media who had special access to the king and were highest in the kingdom.
EST	1	15	Xerxes	#17		17419	" {15} <<According to law, what must be done to Queen Vashti? She has not obeyed the command of King Xerxes that the eunuchs have taken to her.>>"
EST	1	16	Narr_17: Esther	#25		17420	" {16} Then Memucan replied in the presence of the king and the nobles,"
EST	1	16	Memucan	#02		17421	" << Queen Vashti has done wrong, not only against the king but also against all the nobles and the peoples of all the provinces of King Xerxes."
EST	1	17	Memucan	#02		17422	" {17} For the queen's conduct will become known to all the women, and so they will despise their husbands and say, 'King Xerxes commanded Queen Vashti to be brought before him, but she would not come.'"
EST	1	18	Memucan	#02		17423	 {18} This very day the Persian and Median women of the nobility who have heard about the queen's conduct will respond to all the king's nobles in the same way. 
EST	1	18	Memucan	#02		17424	 There will be no end of disrespect and discord.
EST	1	19	Memucan	#02		17425	" {19} << Therefore, if it pleases the king, "
EST	1	19	Memucan	#02		17426	" let him issue a royal decree and let it be written in the laws of Persia and Media, which cannot be repealed, that Vashti is never again to enter the presence of King Xerxes. "
EST	1	19	Memucan	#02		17427	 Also let the king give her royal position to someone else who is better than she.
EST	1	20	Memucan	#02		17428	" {20} Then when the king's edict is proclaimed throughout all his vast realm, all the women will respect their husbands, from the least to the greatest.>>"
EST	1	21	Narr_17: Esther	#25		17429	" {21} The king and his nobles were pleased with this advice, so the king did as Memucan proposed."
EST	1	22	Narr_17: Esther	#25		17430	" {22} He sent dispatches to all parts of the kingdom, to each province in its own script and to each people in its own language, "
EST	1	22	Narr_17: Esther	#25		17431	 proclaiming in each people's tongue that every man should be ruler over his own household.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
EST	2	<<	Narr_17: Esther	#25		17432	ESTHER 2
EST	2	1	Narr_17: Esther	#25		17433	" {1} Later when the anger of King Xerxes had subsided, he remembered Vashti and what she had done and what he had decreed about her."
EST	2	2	Narr_17: Esther	#25		17434	" {2} Then the king's personal attendants proposed,"
EST	2	2	Servant	#03		17435	 << Let a search be made for beautiful young virgins for the king.
EST	2	3	Servant	#03		17436	 {3} Let the king appoint commissioners in every province of his realm to bring all these beautiful girls into the harem at the citadel of Susa. 
EST	2	3	Servant	#03		17437	" Let them be placed under the care of Hegai, the king's eunuch, who is in charge of the women; and let beauty treatments be given to them."
EST	2	4	Servant	#03		17438	 {4} Then let the girl who pleases the king be queen instead of Vashti.>>
EST	2	4	Narr_17: Esther	#25		17439	" This advice appealed to the king, and he followed it."
EST	2	5	Narr_17: Esther	#25		17440	" {5} Now there was in the citadel of Susa a Jew of the tribe of Benjamin, named Mordecai son of Jair, the son of Shimei, the son of Kish,"
EST	2	6	Narr_17: Esther	#25		17441	" {6} who had been carried into exile from Jerusalem by Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, among those taken captive with Jehoiachin king of Judah."
EST	2	7	Narr_17: Esther	#25		17442	" {7} Mordecai had a cousin named Hadassah, whom he had brought up because she had neither father nor mother. "
EST	2	7	Narr_17: Esther	#25		17443	" This girl, who was also known as Esther, was lovely in form and features, and Mordecai had taken her as his own daughter when her father and mother died."
EST	2	8	Narr_17: Esther	#25		17444	" {8} When the king's order and edict had been proclaimed, many girls were brought to the citadel of Susa and put under the care of Hegai. "
EST	2	8	Narr_17: Esther	#25		17445	" Esther also was taken to the king's palace and entrusted to Hegai, who had charge of the harem."
EST	2	9	Narr_17: Esther	#25		17446	 {9} The girl pleased him and won his favor. Immediately he provided her with her beauty treatments and special food. 
EST	2	9	Narr_17: Esther	#25		17447	 He assigned to her seven maids selected from the king's palace and moved her and her maids into the best place in the harem.
EST	2	10	Narr_17: Esther	#25		17448	" {10} Esther had not revealed her nationality and family background, because Mordecai had forbidden her to do so."
EST	2	11	Narr_17: Esther	#25		17449	 {11} Every day he walked back and forth near the courtyard of the harem to find out how Esther was and what was happening to her.
EST	2	12	Narr_17: Esther	#25		17450	" {12} Before a girl's turn came to go in to King Xerxes, she had to complete twelve months of beauty treatments prescribed for the women, six months with oil of myrrh and six with perfumes and cosmetics."
EST	2	13	Narr_17: Esther	#25		17451	 {13} And this is how she would go to the king: Anything she wanted was given her to take with her from the harem to the king's palace.
EST	2	14	Narr_17: Esther	#25		17452	" {14} In the evening she would go there and in the morning return to another part of the harem to the care of Shaashgaz, the king's eunuch who was in charge of the concubines. "
EST	2	14	Narr_17: Esther	#25		17453	 She would not return to the king unless he was pleased with her and summoned her by name.
EST	2	15	Narr_17: Esther	#25		17454	" {15} When the turn came for Esther (the girl Mordecai had adopted, the daughter of his uncle Abihail ) to go to the king, "
EST	2	15	Narr_17: Esther	#25		17455	" she asked for nothing other than what Hegai, the king's eunuch who was in charge of the harem, suggested.  And Esther won the favor of everyone who saw her."
EST	2	16	Narr_17: Esther	#25		17456	" {16} She was taken to King Xerxes in the royal residence in the tenth month, the month of Tebeth, in the seventh year of his reign."
EST	2	17	Narr_17: Esther	#25		17457	" {17} Now the king was attracted to Esther more than to any of the other women, and she won his favor and approval more than any of the other virgins. "
EST	2	17	Narr_17: Esther	#25		17458	 So he set a royal crown on her head and made her queen instead of Vashti.
EST	2	18	Narr_17: Esther	#25		17459	" {18} And the king gave a great banquet, Esther's banquet, for all his nobles and officials. He proclaimed a holiday throughout the provinces and distributed gifts with royal liberality."
