JOB	18	21	Bildad	#02		18073	 {21} Surely such is the dwelling of an evil man; such is the place of one who knows not God.>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
JOB	19	<<	Narr_18: Job	#13		18074	JOB 19
JOB	19	1	Narr_18: Job	#13		18075	" {1} Then Job replied,"
JOB	19	2	Job	#01		18076	 {2} << How long will you torment me and crush me with words?
JOB	19	3	Job	#01		18077	 {3} Ten times now you have reproached me; shamelessly you attack me.
JOB	19	4	Job	#01		18078	" {4} If it is true that I have gone astray, my error remains my concern alone."
JOB	19	5	Job	#01		18079	 {5} If indeed you would exalt yourselves above me and use my humiliation against me {6} then know that God has wronged me and drawn his net around me.
JOB	19	7	Job	#01		18080	" {7} << Though I cry, 'I've been wronged!' I get no response; though I call for help, there is no justice."
JOB	19	8	Job	#01		18081	 {8} He has blocked my way so I cannot pass; he has shrouded my paths in darkness.
JOB	19	9	Job	#01		18082	 {9} He has stripped me of my honor and removed the crown from my head.
JOB	19	10	Job	#01		18083	 {10} He tears me down on every side till I am gone; he uproots my hope like a tree. {11} His anger burns against me; he counts me among his enemies.
JOB	19	12	Job	#01		18084	 {12} His troops advance in force; they build a siege ramp against me and encamp around my tent.
JOB	19	13	Job	#01		18085	 {13} << He has alienated my brothers from me; my acquaintances are completely estranged from me.
JOB	19	14	Job	#01		18086	 {14} My kinsmen have gone away; my friends have forgotten me. {15} My guests and my maidservants count me a stranger; they look upon me as an alien.
JOB	19	16	Job	#01		18087	" {16} I summon my servant, but he does not answer, though I beg him with my own mouth."
JOB	19	17	Job	#01		18088	" {17} My breath is offensive to my wife; I am loathsome to my own brothers. {18} Even the little boys scorn me; when I appear, they ridicule me."
JOB	19	19	Job	#01		18089	 {19} All my intimate friends detest me; those I love have turned against me.
JOB	19	20	Job	#01		18090	 {20} I am nothing but skin and bones; I have escaped with only the skin of my teeth.
JOB	19	21	Job	#01		18091	" {21} << Have pity on me, my friends, have pity, for the hand of God has struck me."
JOB	19	22	Job	#01		18092	 {22} Why do you pursue me as God does? Will you never get enough of my flesh? <<
JOB	19	23	Job	#01		18093	" {23} Oh, that my words were recorded, that they were written on a scroll, {24} that they were inscribed with an iron tool on lead, or engraved in rock forever!"
JOB	19	25	Job	#01		18094	" {25} I know that my Redeemer lives, and that in the end he will stand upon the earth."
JOB	19	26	Job	#01		18095	" {26} And after my skin has been destroyed, yet in my flesh I will see God;"
JOB	19	27	Job	#01		18096	" {27} I myself will see him with my own eyes--I, and not another. How my heart yearns within me!"
JOB	19	28	Job	#01		18097	" {28} << If you say, 'How we will hound him, since the root of the trouble lies in him,'"
JOB	19	29	Job	#01		18098	" {29} you should fear the sword yourselves; for wrath will bring punishment by the sword, and then you will know that there is judgment.>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
JOB	20	<<	Narr_18: Job	#13		18099	JOB 20
JOB	20	1	Narr_18: Job	#13		18100	 {1} Then Zophar the Naamathite replied:
JOB	20	2	Zophar	#15		18101	 {2} << My troubled thoughts prompt me to answer because I am greatly disturbed.
JOB	20	3	Zophar	#15		18102	" {3} I hear a rebuke that dishonors me, and my understanding inspires me to reply."
JOB	20	4	Zophar	#15		18103	" {4} << Surely you know how it has been from of old, ever since man was placed on the earth,"
JOB	20	5	Zophar	#15		18104	" {5} that the mirth of the wicked is brief, the joy of the godless lasts but a moment."
JOB	20	6	Zophar	#15		18105	" {6} Though his pride reaches to the heavens and his head touches the clouds, {7} he will perish forever, like his own dung;"
JOB	20	7	Zophar	#15		18106	" those who have seen him will say, 'Where is he?' {8} Like a dream he flies away, no more to be found, banished like a vision of the night."
JOB	20	9	Zophar	#15		18107	 {9} The eye that saw him will not see him again; his place will look on him no more.
JOB	20	10	Zophar	#15		18108	 {10} His children must make amends to the poor; his own hands must give back his wealth.
JOB	20	11	Zophar	#15		18109	 {11} The youthful vigor that fills his bones will lie with him in the dust. <<
JOB	20	12	Zophar	#15		18110	" {12} Though evil is sweet in his mouth and he hides it under his tongue,"
JOB	20	13	Zophar	#15		18111	" {13} though he cannot bear to let it go and keeps it in his mouth,"
JOB	20	14	Zophar	#15		18112	 {14} yet his food will turn sour in his stomach; it will become the venom of serpents within him.
JOB	20	15	Zophar	#15		18113	 {15} He will spit out the riches he swallowed; God will make his stomach vomit them up.
JOB	20	16	Zophar	#15		18114	 {16} He will suck the poison of serpents; the fangs of an adder will kill him.
JOB	20	17	Zophar	#15		18115	" {17} He will not enjoy the streams, the rivers flowing with honey and cream."
JOB	20	18	Zophar	#15		18116	 {18} What he toiled for he must give back uneaten; he will not enjoy the profit from his trading.
JOB	20	19	Zophar	#15		18117	 {19} For he has oppressed the poor and left them destitute; he has seized houses he did not build.
JOB	20	20	Zophar	#15		18118	 {20} << Surely he will have no respite from his craving; he cannot save himself by his treasure.
JOB	20	21	Zophar	#15		18119	 {21} Nothing is left for him to devour; his prosperity will not endure.
JOB	20	22	Zophar	#15		18120	" {22} In the midst of his plenty, distress will overtake him; the full force of misery will come upon him."
JOB	20	23	Zophar	#15		18121	" {23} When he has filled his belly, God will vent his burning anger against him and rain down his blows upon him."
JOB	20	24	Zophar	#15		18122	" {24} Though he flees from an iron weapon, a bronze-tipped arrow pierces him."
JOB	20	25	Zophar	#15		18123	" {25} He pulls it out of his back, the gleaming point out of his liver. Terrors will come over him;"
JOB	20	26	Zophar	#15		18124	 {26} total darkness lies in wait for his treasures. A fire unfanned will consume him and devour what is left in his tent.
JOB	20	27	Zophar	#15		18125	 {27} The heavens will expose his guilt; the earth will rise up against him.
JOB	20	28	Zophar	#15		18126	" {28} A flood will carry off his house, rushing waters on the day of God's wrath."
JOB	20	29	Zophar	#15		18127	" {29} Such is the fate God allots the wicked, the heritage appointed for them by God.>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
JOB	21	<<	Narr_18: Job	#13		18128	JOB 21
JOB	21	1	Narr_18: Job	#13		18129	" {1} Then Job replied,"
JOB	21	2	Job	#01		18130	" {2} << Listen carefully to my words; let this be the consolation you give me. {3} Bear with me while I speak, and after I have spoken, mock on."
JOB	21	4	Job	#01		18131	 {4} << Is my complaint directed to man? Why should I not be impatient? {5} Look at me and be astonished; clap your hand over your mouth.
JOB	21	6	Job	#01		18132	" {6} When I think about this, I am terrified; trembling seizes my body."
JOB	21	7	Job	#01		18133	" {7} Why do the wicked live on, growing old and increasing in power? {8} They see their children established around them, their offspring before their eyes."
JOB	21	9	Job	#01		18134	 {9} Their homes are safe and free from fear; the rod of God is not upon them. {10} Their bulls never fail to breed; their cows calve and do not miscarry.
JOB	21	11	Job	#01		18135	 {11} They send forth their children as a flock; their little ones dance about.
JOB	21	12	Job	#01		18136	 {12} They sing to the music of tambourine and harp; they make merry to the sound of the flute.
JOB	21	13	Job	#01		18137	 {13} They spend their years in prosperity and go down to the grave in peace.
JOB	21	14	Job	#01		18138	" {14} Yet they say to God, 'Leave us alone! We have no desire to know your ways."
JOB	21	15	Job	#01		18139	" {15} Who is the Almighty, that we should serve him? What would we gain by praying to him?'"
JOB	21	16	Job	#01		18140	" {16} But their prosperity is not in their own hands, so I stand aloof from the counsel of the wicked."
JOB	21	17	Job	#01		18141	 {17} << Yet how often is the lamp of the wicked snuffed out?
JOB	21	18	Job	#01		18142	" {18} How often does calamity come upon them, the fate God allots in his anger? How often are they like straw before the wind, like chaff swept away by a gale?"
JOB	21	19	Job	#01		18143	" {19} It is said, 'God stores up a man's punishment for his sons.' Let him repay the man himself, so that he will know it!"
JOB	21	20	Job	#01		18144	 {20} Let his own eyes see his destruction; let him drink of the wrath of the Almighty.
JOB	21	21	Job	#01		18145	 {21} For what does he care about the family he leaves behind when his allotted months come to an end?
JOB	21	22	Job	#01		18146	" {22} << Can anyone teach knowledge to God, since he judges even the highest?"
JOB	21	23	Job	#01		18147	" {23} One man dies in full vigor, completely secure and at ease, {24} his body well nourished, his bones rich with marrow."
JOB	21	25	Job	#01		18148	" {25} Another man dies in bitterness of soul, never having enjoyed anything good."
JOB	21	26	Job	#01		18149	" {26} Side by side they lie in the dust, and worms cover them both."
JOB	21	27	Job	#01		18150	" {27} << I know full well what you are thinking, the schemes by which you would wrong me."
JOB	21	28	Job	#01		18151	" {28} You say, 'Where now is the great man's house, the tents where wicked men lived?'"
JOB	21	29	Job	#01		18152	 {29} Have you never questioned those who travel? Have you paid no regard to their accounts--
JOB	21	30	Job	#01		18153	" {30} that the evil man is spared from the day of calamity, that he is delivered from the day of wrath?"
JOB	21	31	Job	#01		18154	" {31} Who denounces his conduct to his face? Who repays him for what he has done? {32} He is carried to the grave, and watch is kept over his tomb."
JOB	21	33	Job	#01		18155	" {33} The soil in the valley is sweet to him; all men follow after him, and a countless throng goes before him."
JOB	21	34	Job	#01		18156	 {34} << So how can you console me with your nonsense? Nothing is left of your answers but falsehood!>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
JOB	22	<<	Narr_18: Job	#13		18157	JOB 22
JOB	22	1	Narr_18: Job	#13		18158	 {1} Then Eliphaz the Temanite replied:
JOB	22	2	Eliphaz	#11		18159	 {2} << Can a man be of benefit to God? Can even a wise man benefit him?
JOB	22	3	Eliphaz	#11		18160	 {3} What pleasure would it give the Almighty if you were righteous? What would he gain if your ways were blameless?
JOB	22	4	Eliphaz	#11		18161	 {4} << Is it for your piety that he rebukes you and brings charges against you? {5} Is not your wickedness great? Are not your sins endless?
JOB	22	6	Eliphaz	#11		18162	" {6} You demanded security from your brothers for no reason; you stripped men of their clothing, leaving them naked."
JOB	22	7	Eliphaz	#11		18163	" {7} You gave no water to the weary and you withheld food from the hungry, {8} though you were a powerful man, owning land-- an honored man, living on it."
JOB	22	9	Eliphaz	#11		18164	 {9} And you sent widows away empty-handed and broke the strength of the fatherless.
JOB	22	10	Eliphaz	#11		18165	" {10} That is why snares are all around you, why sudden peril terrifies you, {11} why it is so dark you cannot see, and why a flood of water covers you."
JOB	22	12	Eliphaz	#11		18166	 {12} << Is not God in the heights of heaven? And see how lofty are the highest stars!
JOB	22	13	Eliphaz	#11		18167	" {13} Yet you say, 'What does God know? Does he judge through such darkness?"
JOB	22	14	Eliphaz	#11		18168	" {14} Thick clouds veil him, so he does not see us as he goes about in the vaulted heavens.'"
JOB	22	15	Eliphaz	#11		18169	" {15} Will you keep to the old path that evil men have trod? {16} They were carried off before their time, their foundations washed away by a flood."
JOB	22	17	Eliphaz	#11		18170	" {17} They said to God, 'Leave us alone! What can the Almighty do to us?'"
JOB	22	18	Eliphaz	#11		18171	" {18} Yet it was he who filled their houses with good things, so I stand aloof from the counsel of the wicked."
JOB	22	19	Eliphaz	#11		18172	" {19} << The righteous see their ruin and rejoice; the innocent mock them, saying, {20} 'Surely our foes are destroyed, and fire devours their wealth.'"
JOB	22	21	Eliphaz	#11		18173	 {21} << Submit to God and be at peace with him; in this way prosperity will come to you.
JOB	22	22	Eliphaz	#11		18174	" {22} Accept instruction from his mouth and lay up his words in your heart. {23} If you return to the Almighty, you will be restored: "
JOB	22	23	Eliphaz	#11		18175	" If you remove wickedness far from your tent {24} and assign your nuggets to the dust, your gold of Ophir to the rocks in the ravines, {25} then the Almighty will be your gold, the choicest silver for you."
JOB	22	26	Eliphaz	#11		18176	 {26} Surely then you will find delight in the Almighty and will lift up your face to God.
JOB	22	27	Eliphaz	#11		18177	" {27} You will pray to him, and he will hear you, and you will fulfill your vows. {28} What you decide on will be done, and light will shine on your ways."
JOB	22	29	Eliphaz	#11		18178	" {29} When men are brought low and you say, 'Lift them up!' then he will save the downcast."
JOB	22	30	Eliphaz	#11		18179	" {30} He will deliver even one who is not innocent, who will be delivered through the cleanness of your hands.>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
JOB	23	<<	Narr_18: Job	#13		18180	JOB 23
JOB	23	1	Narr_18: Job	#13		18181	" {1} Then Job replied,"
JOB	23	2	Job	#01		18182	 {2} << Even today my complaint is bitter; his hand is heavy in spite of my groaning.
JOB	23	3	Job	#01		18183	 {3} If only I knew where to find him; if only I could go to his dwelling! {4} I would state my case before him and fill my mouth with arguments.
JOB	23	5	Job	#01		18184	" {5} I would find out what he would answer me, and consider what he would say."
JOB	23	6	Job	#01		18185	" {6} Would he oppose me with great power? No, he would not press charges against me."
JOB	23	7	Job	#01		18186	" {7} There an upright man could present his case before him, and I would be delivered forever from my judge."
JOB	23	8	Job	#01		18187	" {8} << But if I go to the east, he is not there; if I go to the west, I do not find him."
JOB	23	9	Job	#01		18188	" {9} When he is at work in the north, I do not see him; when he turns to the south, I catch no glimpse of him."
JOB	23	10	Job	#01		18189	" {10} But he knows the way that I take; when he has tested me, I will come forth as gold."
JOB	23	11	Job	#01		18190	 {11} My feet have closely followed his steps; I have kept to his way without turning aside.
JOB	23	12	Job	#01		18191	 {12} I have not departed from the commands of his lips; I have treasured the words of his mouth more than my daily bread.
JOB	23	13	Job	#01		18192	" {13} << But he stands alone, and who can oppose him? He does whatever he pleases."
JOB	23	14	Job	#01		18193	" {14} He carries out his decree against me, and many such plans he still has in store."
JOB	23	15	Job	#01		18194	" {15} That is why I am terrified before him; when I think of all this, I fear him. {16} God has made my heart faint; the Almighty has terrified me."
JOB	23	17	Job	#01		18195	" {17} Yet I am not silenced by the darkness, by the thick darkness that covers my face.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
JOB	24	<<	Narr_18: Job	#13		18196	JOB 24
JOB	24	1	Job	#01		18197	 {1} << Why does the Almighty not set times for judgment? Why must those who know him look in vain for such days?
JOB	24	2	Job	#01		18198	 {2} Men move boundary stones; they pasture flocks they have stolen. {3} They drive away the orphan's donkey and take the widow's ox in pledge.
JOB	24	4	Job	#01		18199	 {4} They thrust the needy from the path and force all the poor of the land into hiding.
JOB	24	5	Job	#01		18200	" {5} Like wild donkeys in the desert, the poor go about their labor of foraging food; the wasteland provides food for their children."
JOB	24	6	Job	#01		18201	 {6} They gather fodder in the fields and glean in the vineyards of the wicked.
JOB	24	7	Job	#01		18202	" {7} Lacking clothes, they spend the night naked; they have nothing to cover themselves in the cold."
JOB	24	8	Job	#01		18203	 {8} They are drenched by mountain rains and hug the rocks for lack of shelter.
JOB	24	9	Job	#01		18204	 {9} The fatherless child is snatched from the breast; the infant of the poor is seized for a debt.
JOB	24	10	Job	#01		18205	" {10} Lacking clothes, they go about naked; they carry the sheaves, but still go hungry."
JOB	24	11	Job	#01		18206	" {11} They crush olives among the terraces; they tread the winepresses, yet suffer thirst."
JOB	24	12	Job	#01		18207	" {12} The groans of the dying rise from the city, and the souls of the wounded cry out for help. But God charges no one with wrongdoing."
JOB	24	13	Job	#01		18208	" {13} << There are those who rebel against the light, who do not know its ways or stay in its paths."
JOB	24	14	Job	#01		18209	" {14} When daylight is gone, the murderer rises up and kills the poor and needy; in the night he steals forth like a thief."
JOB	24	15	Job	#01		18210	" {15} The eye of the adulterer watches for dusk; he thinks, 'No eye will see me,' and he keeps his face concealed."
JOB	24	16	Job	#01		18211	" {16} In the dark, men break into houses, but by day they shut themselves in; they want nothing to do with the light."
JOB	24	17	Job	#01		18212	" {17} For all of them, deep darkness is their morning; they make friends with the terrors of darkness."
JOB	24	18	Job	#01		18213	" {18} << Yet they are foam on the surface of the water; their portion of the land is cursed, so that no one goes to the vineyards."
JOB	24	19	Job	#01		18214	" {19} As heat and drought snatch away the melted snow, so the grave snatches away those who have sinned."
JOB	24	20	Job	#01		18215	" {20} The womb forgets them, the worm feasts on them; evil men are no longer remembered but are broken like a tree."
JOB	24	21	Job	#01		18216	" {21} They prey on the barren and childless woman, and to the widow show no kindness."
JOB	24	22	Job	#01		18217	" {22} But God drags away the mighty by his power; though they become established, they have no assurance of life."
JOB	24	23	Job	#01		18218	" {23} He may let them rest in a feeling of security, but his eyes are on their ways."
JOB	24	24	Job	#01		18219	" {24} For a little while they are exalted, and then they are gone; they are brought low and gathered up like all others; they are cut off like heads of grain."
JOB	24	25	Job	#01		18220	" {25} << If this is not so, who can prove me false and reduce my words to nothing?>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
JOB	25	<<	Narr_18: Job	#13		18221	JOB 25
JOB	25	1	Narr_18: Job	#13		18222	 {1} Then Bildad the Shuhite replied:
JOB	25	2	Bildad	#02		18223	 {2} << Dominion and awe belong to God; he establishes order in the heights of heaven.
JOB	25	3	Bildad	#02		18224	 {3} Can his forces be numbered? Upon whom does his light not rise?
JOB	25	4	Bildad	#02		18225	 {4} How then can a man be righteous before God? How can one born of woman be pure?
JOB	25	5	Bildad	#02		18226	" {5} If even the moon is not bright and the stars are not pure in his eyes, {6} how much less man, who is but a maggot-- a son of man, who is only a worm!>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
JOB	26	<<	Narr_18: Job	#13		18227	JOB 26
JOB	26	1	Narr_18: Job	#13		18228	" {1} Then Job replied,"
JOB	26	2	Job	#01		18229	 {2} << How you have helped the powerless! How you have saved the arm that is feeble!
JOB	26	3	Job	#01		18230	 {3} What advice you have offered to one without wisdom! And what great insight you have displayed!
JOB	26	4	Job	#01		18231	 {4} Who has helped you utter these words? And whose spirit spoke from your mouth?
JOB	26	5	Job	#01		18232	" {5} << The dead are in deep anguish, those beneath the waters and all that live in them."
JOB	26	6	Job	#01		18233	 {6} Death is naked before God; Destruction lies uncovered. {7} He spreads out the northern skies over empty space; he suspends the earth over nothing.
JOB	26	8	Job	#01		18234	" {8} He wraps up the waters in his clouds, yet the clouds do not burst under their weight. {9} He covers the face of the full moon, spreading his clouds over it."
JOB	26	10	Job	#01		18235	 {10} He marks out the horizon on the face of the waters for a boundary between light and darkness.
JOB	26	11	Job	#01		18236	" {11} The pillars of the heavens quake, aghast at his rebuke. {12} By his power he churned up the sea; by his wisdom he cut Rahab to pieces."
JOB	26	13	Job	#01		18237	 {13} By his breath the skies became fair; his hand pierced the gliding serpent.
JOB	26	14	Job	#01		18238	 {14} And these are but the outer fringe of his works; how faint the whisper we hear of him! Who then can understand the thunder of his power?>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
JOB	27	<<	Narr_18: Job	#13		18239	JOB 27
JOB	27	1	Narr_18: Job	#13		18240	 {1} And Job continued his discourse:
JOB	27	2	Job	#01		18241	" {2} << As surely as God lives, who has denied me justice, the Almighty, who has made me taste bitterness of soul,"
JOB	27	3	Job	#01		18242	" {3} as long as I have life within me, the breath of God in my nostrils, {4} my lips will not speak wickedness, and my tongue will utter no deceit."
JOB	27	5	Job	#01		18243	" {5} I will never admit you are in the right; till I die, I will not deny my integrity."
JOB	27	6	Job	#01		18244	 {6} I will maintain my righteousness and never let go of it; my conscience will not reproach me as long as I live.
JOB	27	7	Job	#01		18245	" {7} << May my enemies be like the wicked, my adversaries like the unjust! {8} For what hope has the godless when he is cut off, when God takes away his life?"
JOB	27	9	Job	#01		18246	 {9} Does God listen to his cry when distress comes upon him? {10} Will he find delight in the Almighty? Will he call upon God at all times?
JOB	27	11	Job	#01		18247	 {11} << I will teach you about the power of God; the ways of the Almighty I will not conceal.
JOB	27	12	Job	#01		18248	 {12} You have all seen this yourselves. Why then this meaningless talk?
JOB	27	13	Job	#01		18249	" {13} << Here is the fate God allots to the wicked, the heritage a ruthless man receives from the Almighty:"
JOB	27	14	Job	#01		18250	" {14} However many his children, their fate is the sword; his offspring will never have enough to eat."
JOB	27	15	Job	#01		18251	" {15} The plague will bury those who survive him, and their widows will not weep for them."
JOB	27	16	Job	#01		18252	" {16} Though he heaps up silver like dust and clothes like piles of clay, {17} what he lays up the righteous will wear, and the innocent will divide his silver."
JOB	27	18	Job	#01		18253	" {18} The house he builds is like a moth's cocoon, like a hut made by a watchman."
JOB	27	19	Job	#01		18254	" {19} He lies down wealthy, but will do so no more; when he opens his eyes, all is gone."
JOB	27	20	Job	#01		18255	 {20} Terrors overtake him like a flood; a tempest snatches him away in the night.
JOB	27	21	Job	#01		18256	" {21} The east wind carries him off, and he is gone; it sweeps him out of his place. {22} It hurls itself against him without mercy as he flees headlong from its power."
JOB	27	23	Job	#01		18257	 {23} It claps its hands in derision and hisses him out of his place.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
JOB	28	<<	Narr_18: Job	#13		18258	JOB 28
JOB	28	1	Job	#01		18259	" {1} << There is a mine for silver and a place where gold is refined. {2} Iron is taken from the earth, and copper is smelted from ore."
JOB	28	3	Job	#01		18260	 {3} Man puts an end to the darkness; he searches the farthest recesses for ore in the blackest darkness.
JOB	28	4	Job	#01		18261	" {4} Far from where people dwell he cuts a shaft, in places forgotten by the foot of man; far from men he dangles and sways."
JOB	28	5	Job	#01		18262	" {5} The earth, from which food comes, is transformed below as by fire; {6} sapphires come from its rocks, and its dust contains nuggets of gold."
JOB	28	7	Job	#01		18263	" {7} No bird of prey knows that hidden path, no falcon's eye has seen it. {8} Proud beasts do not set foot on it, and no lion prowls there."
JOB	28	9	Job	#01		18264	 {9} Man's hand assaults the flinty rock and lays bare the roots of the mountains. {10} He tunnels through the rock; his eyes see all its treasures.
JOB	28	11	Job	#01		18265	 {11} He searches the sources of the rivers and brings hidden things to light.
JOB	28	12	Job	#01		18266	 {12} << But where can wisdom be found? Where does understanding dwell?
JOB	28	13	Job	#01		18267	 {13} Man does not comprehend its worth; it cannot be found in the land of the living.
JOB	28	14	Job	#01		18268	" {14} The deep says, 'It is not in me'; the sea says, 'It is not with me.' {15} It cannot be bought with the finest gold, nor can its price be weighed in silver."
JOB	28	16	Job	#01		18269	" {16} It cannot be bought with the gold of Ophir, with precious onyx or sapphires."
JOB	28	17	Job	#01		18270	" {17} Neither gold nor crystal can compare with it, nor can it be had for jewels of gold."
JOB	28	18	Job	#01		18271	 {18} Coral and jasper are not worthy of mention; the price of wisdom is beyond rubies.
JOB	28	19	Job	#01		18272	 {19} The topaz of Cush cannot compare with it; it cannot be bought with pure gold.
JOB	28	20	Job	#01		18273	 {20} << Where then does wisdom come from? Where does understanding dwell?
JOB	28	21	Job	#01		18274	" {21} It is hidden from the eyes of every living thing, concealed even from the birds of the air."
JOB	28	22	Job	#01		18275	" {22} Destruction and Death say, 'Only a rumor of it has reached our ears.' "
JOB	28	23	Job	#01		18276	" {23} God understands the way to it and he alone knows where it dwells, {24} for he views the ends of the earth and sees everything under the heavens."
JOB	28	25	Job	#01		18277	" {25} When he established the force of the wind and measured out the waters, {26} when he made a decree for the rain and a path for the thunderstorm,"
JOB	28	27	Job	#01		18278	 {27} then he looked at wisdom and appraised it; he confirmed it and tested it.
JOB	28	28	Job	#01		18279	" {28} And he said to man, 'The fear of the Lord--that is wisdom, and to shun evil is understanding.'>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
JOB	29	<<	Narr_18: Job	#13		18280	JOB 29
JOB	29	1	Narr_18: Job	#13		18281	 {1} Job continued his discourse:
JOB	29	2	Job	#01		18282	" {2} << How I long for the months gone by, for the days when God watched over me, {3} when his lamp shone upon my head and by his light I walked through darkness!"
JOB	29	4	Job	#01		18283	" {4} Oh, for the days when I was in my prime, when God's intimate friendship blessed my house, "
JOB	29	5	Job	#01		18284	" {5} when the Almighty was still with me and my children were around me,"
JOB	29	6	Job	#01		18285	 {6} when my path was drenched with cream and the rock poured out for me streams of olive oil.
JOB	29	7	Job	#01		18286	" {7} << When I went to the gate of the city and took my seat in the public square,"
JOB	29	8	Job	#01		18287	 {8} the young men saw me and stepped aside and the old men rose to their feet;
JOB	29	9	Job	#01		18288	 {9} the chief men refrained from speaking and covered their mouths with their hands;
JOB	29	10	Job	#01		18289	" {10} the voices of the nobles were hushed, and their tongues stuck to the roof of their mouths."
JOB	29	11	Job	#01		18290	" {11} Whoever heard me spoke well of me, and those who saw me commended me, {12} because I rescued the poor who cried for help, and the fatherless who had none to assist him."
JOB	29	13	Job	#01		18291	 {13} The man who was dying blessed me; I made the widow's heart sing.
JOB	29	14	Job	#01		18292	 {14} I put on righteousness as my clothing; justice was my robe and my turban. {15} I was eyes to the blind and feet to the lame.
JOB	29	16	Job	#01		18293	 {16} I was a father to the needy; I took up the case of the stranger. {17} I broke the fangs of the wicked and snatched the victims from their teeth.
JOB	29	18	Job	#01		18294	" {18} << I thought, 'I will die in my own house, my days as numerous as the grains of sand."
JOB	29	19	Job	#01		18295	" {19} My roots will reach to the water, and the dew will lie all night on my branches."
JOB	29	20	Job	#01		18296	" {20} My glory will remain fresh in me, the bow ever new in my hand.'"
JOB	29	21	Job	#01		18297	" {21} << Men listened to me expectantly, waiting in silence for my counsel."
JOB	29	22	Job	#01		18298	" {22} After I had spoken, they spoke no more; my words fell gently on their ears."
JOB	29	23	Job	#01		18299	 {23} They waited for me as for showers and drank in my words as the spring rain.
JOB	29	24	Job	#01		18300	" {24} When I smiled at them, they scarcely believed it; the light of my face was precious to them."
JOB	29	25	Job	#01		18301	 {25} I chose the way for them and sat as their chief; I dwelt as a king among his troops; I was like one who comforts mourners.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
JOB	30	<<	Narr_18: Job	#13		18302	JOB 30
JOB	30	1	Job	#01		18303	" {1} << But now they mock me, men younger than I, whose fathers I would have disdained to put with my sheep dogs."
JOB	30	2	Job	#01		18304	" {2} Of what use was the strength of their hands to me, since their vigor had gone from them?"
JOB	30	3	Job	#01		18305	" {3} Haggard from want and hunger, they roamed the parched land in desolate wastelands at night."
JOB	30	4	Job	#01		18306	" {4} In the brush they gathered salt herbs, and their food was the root of the broom tree."
JOB	30	5	Job	#01		18307	" {5} They were banished from their fellow men, shouted at as if they were thieves."
JOB	30	6	Job	#01		18308	" {6} They were forced to live in the dry stream beds, among the rocks and in holes in the ground."
JOB	30	7	Job	#01		18309	" {7} They brayed among the bushes and huddled in the undergrowth. {8} A base and nameless brood, they were driven out of the land."
JOB	30	9	Job	#01		18310	 {9} << And now their sons mock me in song; I have become a byword among them.
JOB	30	10	Job	#01		18311	 {10} They detest me and keep their distance; they do not hesitate to spit in my face.
JOB	30	11	Job	#01		18312	" {11} Now that God has unstrung my bow and afflicted me, they throw off restraint in my presence."
JOB	30	12	Job	#01		18313	" {12} On my right the tribe attacks; they lay snares for my feet, they build their siege ramps against me."
JOB	30	13	Job	#01		18314	 {13} They break up my road; they succeed in destroying me-- without anyone's helping them.
JOB	30	14	Job	#01		18315	 {14} They advance as through a gaping breach; amid the ruins they come rolling in.
JOB	30	15	Job	#01		18316	" {15} Terrors overwhelm me; my dignity is driven away as by the wind, my safety vanishes like a cloud."
JOB	30	16	Job	#01		18317	 {16} << And now my life ebbs away; days of suffering grip me. {17} Night pierces my bones; my gnawing pains never rest.
JOB	30	18	Job	#01		18318	 {18} In his great power God becomes like clothing to me; he binds me like the neck of my garment.
JOB	30	19	Job	#01		18319	" {19} He throws me into the mud, and I am reduced to dust and ashes."
JOB	30	20	Job	#01		18320	" {20} << I cry out to you, O God, but you do not answer; I stand up, but you merely look at me."
JOB	30	21	Job	#01		18321	 {21} You turn on me ruthlessly; with the might of your hand you attack me.
JOB	30	22	Job	#01		18322	 {22} You snatch me up and drive me before the wind; you toss me about in the storm.
JOB	30	23	Job	#01		18323	" {23} I know you will bring me down to death, to the place appointed for all the living."
JOB	30	24	Job	#01		18324	 {24} << Surely no one lays a hand on a broken man when he cries for help in his distress.
JOB	30	25	Job	#01		18325	 {25} Have I not wept for those in trouble? Has not my soul grieved for the poor?
JOB	30	26	Job	#01		18326	" {26} Yet when I hoped for good, evil came; when I looked for light, then came darkness."
JOB	30	27	Job	#01		18327	 {27} The churning inside me never stops; days of suffering confront me.
JOB	30	28	Job	#01		18328	" {28} I go about blackened, but not by the sun; I stand up in the assembly and cry for help."
JOB	30	29	Job	#01		18329	" {29} I have become a brother of jackals, a companion of owls. {30} My skin grows black and peels; my body burns with fever."
JOB	30	31	Job	#01		18330	" {31} My harp is tuned to mourning, and my flute to the sound of wailing.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
JOB	31	<<	Narr_18: Job	#13		18331	JOB 31
JOB	31	1	Job	#01		18332	" {1} << I made a covenant with my eyes not to look lustfully at a girl. {2} For what is man's lot from God above, his heritage from the Almighty on high?"
JOB	31	3	Job	#01		18333	" {3} Is it not ruin for the wicked, disaster for those who do wrong? {4} Does he not see my ways and count my every step?"
JOB	31	5	Job	#01		18334	 {5} << If I have walked in falsehood or my foot has hurried after deceit-- {6} let God weigh me in honest scales and he will know that I am blameless--
JOB	31	7	Job	#01		18335	" {7} if my steps have turned from the path, if my heart has been led by my eyes, or if my hands have been defiled, {8} then may others eat what I have sown, and may my crops be uprooted."
JOB	31	9	Job	#01		18336	" {9} << If my heart has been enticed by a woman, or if I have lurked at my neighbor's door, {10} then may my wife grind another man's grain, and may other men sleep with her."
JOB	31	11	Job	#01		18337	" {11} For that would have been shameful, a sin to be judged. {12} It is a fire that burns to Destruction; it would have uprooted my harvest."
JOB	31	13	Job	#01		18338	" {13} << If I have denied justice to my menservants and maidservants when they had a grievance against me, {14} what will I do when God confronts me? What will I answer when called to account?"
JOB	31	15	Job	#01		18339	 {15} Did not he who made me in the womb make them? Did not the same one form us both within our mothers?
JOB	31	16	Job	#01		18340	" {16} << If I have denied the desires of the poor or let the eyes of the widow grow weary,"
JOB	31	17	Job	#01		18341	" {17} if I have kept my bread to myself, not sharing it with the fatherless--"
JOB	31	18	Job	#01		18342	" {18} but from my youth I reared him as would a father, and from my birth I guided the widow--"
JOB	31	19	Job	#01		18343	" {19} if I have seen anyone perishing for lack of clothing, or a needy man without a garment,"
JOB	31	20	Job	#01		18344	" {20} and his heart did not bless me for warming him with the fleece from my sheep,"
JOB	31	21	Job	#01		18345	" {21} if I have raised my hand against the fatherless, knowing that I had influence in court,"
JOB	31	22	Job	#01		18346	" {22} then let my arm fall from the shoulder, let it be broken off at the joint."
JOB	31	23	Job	#01		18347	" {23} For I dreaded destruction from God, and for fear of his splendor I could not do such things."
JOB	31	24	Job	#01		18348	" {24} << If I have put my trust in gold or said to pure gold, 'You are my security,'"
JOB	31	25	Job	#01		18349	" {25} if I have rejoiced over my great wealth, the fortune my hands had gained,"
JOB	31	26	Job	#01		18350	" {26} if I have regarded the sun in its radiance or the moon moving in splendor,"
JOB	31	27	Job	#01		18351	" {27} so that my heart was secretly enticed and my hand offered them a kiss of homage,"
JOB	31	28	Job	#01		18352	" {28} then these also would be sins to be judged, for I would have been unfaithful to God on high."
JOB	31	29	Job	#01		18353	 {29} << If I have rejoiced at my enemy's misfortune or gloated over the trouble that came to him--
JOB	31	30	Job	#01		18354	 {30} I have not allowed my mouth to sin by invoking a curse against his life--
JOB	31	31	Job	#01		18355	" {31} if the men of my household have never said, 'Who has not had his fill of Job's meat?'--"
JOB	31	32	Job	#01		18356	" {32} but no stranger had to spend the night in the street, for my door was always open to the traveler--"
JOB	31	33	Job	#01		18357	" {33} if I have concealed my sin as men do, by hiding my guilt in my heart {34} because I so feared the crowd and so dreaded the contempt of the clans that I kept silent and would not go outside--"
JOB	31	35	Job	#01		18358	" {35} (<< Oh, that I had someone to hear me! I sign now my defense--let the Almighty answer me; let my accuser put his indictment in writing."
JOB	31	36	Job	#01		18359	" {36} Surely I would wear it on my shoulder, I would put it on like a crown."
JOB	31	37	Job	#01		18360	 {37} I would give him an account of my every step; like a prince I would approach him.)--
JOB	31	38	Job	#01		18361	" {38} << if my land cries out against me and all its furrows are wet with tears,"
JOB	31	39	Job	#01		18362	" {39} if I have devoured its yield without payment or broken the spirit of its tenants,"
JOB	31	40	Job	#01		18363	 {40} then let briers come up instead of wheat and weeds instead of barley.>>
JOB	31	40	Narr_18: Job	#13		18364	 The words of Job are ended.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
JOB	32	<<	Narr_18: Job	#13		18365	JOB 32
JOB	32	1	Narr_18: Job	#13		18366	" {1} So these three men stopped answering Job, because he was righteous in his own eyes."
JOB	32	2	Narr_18: Job	#13		18367	" {2} But Elihu son of Barakel the Buzite, of the family of Ram, became very angry with Job for justifying himself rather than God."
JOB	32	3	Narr_18: Job	#13		18368	" {3} He was also angry with the three friends, because they had found no way to refute Job, and yet had condemned him."
JOB	32	4	Narr_18: Job	#13		18369	 {4} Now Elihu had waited before speaking to Job because they were older than he.
JOB	32	5	Narr_18: Job	#13		18370	" {5} But when he saw that the three men had nothing more to say, his anger was aroused. {6} So Elihu son of Barakel the Buzite said:"
JOB	32	6	Elihu	#09		18371	" << I am young in years, and you are old; that is why I was fearful, not daring to tell you what I know."
JOB	32	7	Elihu	#09		18372	" {7} I thought, 'Age should speak; advanced years should teach wisdom.'"
JOB	32	8	Elihu	#09		18373	" {8} But it is the spirit in a man, the breath of the Almighty, that gives him understanding."
JOB	32	9	Elihu	#09		18374	" {9} It is not only the old who are wise, not only the aged who understand what is right."
JOB	32	10	Elihu	#09		18375	 {10} << Therefore I say: Listen to me; I too will tell you what I know.
JOB	32	11	Elihu	#09		18376	" {11} I waited while you spoke, I listened to your reasoning; while you were searching for words,"
JOB	32	12	Elihu	#09		18377	 {12} I gave you my full attention. But not one of you has proved Job wrong; none of you has answered his arguments.
JOB	32	13	Elihu	#09		18378	" {13} Do not say, 'We have found wisdom; let God refute him, not man.'"
JOB	32	14	Elihu	#09		18379	" {14} But Job has not marshaled his words against me, and I will not answer him with your arguments."
JOB	32	15	Elihu	#09		18380	 {15} << They are dismayed and have no more to say; words have failed them.
JOB	32	16	Elihu	#09		18381	" {16} Must I wait, now that they are silent, now that they stand there with no reply?"
JOB	32	17	Elihu	#09		18382	 {17} I too will have my say; I too will tell what I know.
JOB	32	18	Elihu	#09		18383	" {18} For I am full of words, and the spirit within me compels me; {19} inside I am like bottled-up wine, like new wineskins ready to burst."
JOB	32	20	Elihu	#09		18384	 {20} I must speak and find relief; I must open my lips and reply.
JOB	32	21	Elihu	#09		18385	" {21} I will show partiality to no one, nor will I flatter any man;"
JOB	32	22	Elihu	#09		18386	" {22} for if I were skilled in flattery, my Maker would soon take me away.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
JOB	33	<<	Narr_18: Job	#13		18387	JOB 33
JOB	33	1	Elihu	#09		18388	" {1} << But now, Job, listen to my words; pay attention to everything I say."
JOB	33	2	Elihu	#09		18389	 {2} I am about to open my mouth; my words are on the tip of my tongue.
JOB	33	3	Elihu	#09		18390	 {3} My words come from an upright heart; my lips sincerely speak what I know.
JOB	33	4	Elihu	#09		18391	 {4} The Spirit of God has made me; the breath of the Almighty gives me life.
JOB	33	5	Elihu	#09		18392	" {5} Answer me then, if you can; prepare yourself and confront me. {6} I am just like you before God; I too have been taken from clay."
JOB	33	7	Elihu	#09		18393	" {7} No fear of me should alarm you, nor should my hand be heavy upon you."
JOB	33	8	Elihu	#09		18394	 {8} << But you have said in my hearing-- I heard the very words-- {9} 'I am pure and without sin; I am clean and free from guilt.
JOB	33	10	Elihu	#09		18395	 {10} Yet God has found fault with me; he considers me his enemy.
JOB	33	11	Elihu	#09		18396	 {11} He fastens my feet in shackles; he keeps close watch on all my paths.'
JOB	33	12	Elihu	#09		18397	" {12} << But I tell you, in this you are not right, for God is greater than man."
JOB	33	13	Elihu	#09		18398	 {13} Why do you complain to him that he answers none of man's words?
JOB	33	14	Elihu	#09		18399	" {14} For God does speak--now one way, now another-- though man may not perceive it."
JOB	33	15	Elihu	#09		18400	" {15} In a dream, in a vision of the night, when deep sleep falls on men as they slumber in their beds,"
JOB	33	16	Elihu	#09		18401	" {16} he may speak in their ears and terrify them with warnings, {17} to turn man from wrongdoing and keep him from pride,"
JOB	33	18	Elihu	#09		18402	" {18} to preserve his soul from the pit, his life from perishing by the sword."
JOB	33	19	Elihu	#09		18403	" {19} Or a man may be chastened on a bed of pain with constant distress in his bones, {20} so that his very being finds food repulsive and his soul loathes the choicest meal."
JOB	33	21	Elihu	#09		18404	" {21} His flesh wastes away to nothing, and his bones, once hidden, now stick out."
JOB	33	22	Elihu	#09		18405	" {22} His soul draws near to the pit, and his life to the messengers of death."
JOB	33	23	Elihu	#09		18406	" {23} << Yet if there is an angel on his side as a mediator, one out of a thousand, to tell a man what is right for him,"
JOB	33	24	Elihu	#09		18407	" {24} to be gracious to him and say, 'Spare him from going down to the pit; I have found a ransom for him'--"
JOB	33	25	Elihu	#09		18408	 {25} then his flesh is renewed like a child's; it is restored as in the days of his youth.
JOB	33	26	Elihu	#09		18409	" {26} He prays to God and finds favor with him, he sees God's face and shouts for joy; he is restored by God to his righteous state."
JOB	33	27	Elihu	#09		18410	" {27} Then he comes to men and says, 'I sinned, and perverted what was right, but I did not get what I deserved."
JOB	33	28	Elihu	#09		18411	" {28} He redeemed my soul from going down to the pit, and I will live to enjoy the light.'"
JOB	33	29	Elihu	#09		18412	" {29} << God does all these things to a man-- twice, even three times-- {30} to turn back his soul from the pit, that the light of life may shine on him."
JOB	33	31	Elihu	#09		18413	" {31} << Pay attention, Job, and listen to me; be silent, and I will speak."
JOB	33	32	Elihu	#09		18414	" {32} If you have anything to say, answer me; speak up, for I want you to be cleared."
JOB	33	33	Elihu	#09		18415	" {33} But if not, then listen to me; be silent, and I will teach you wisdom.>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
JOB	34	<<	Narr_18: Job	#13		18416	JOB 34
JOB	34	1	Narr_18: Job	#13		18417	 {1} Then Elihu said:
JOB	34	2	Elihu	#09		18418	" {2} << Hear my words, you wise men; listen to me, you men of learning. {3} For the ear tests words as the tongue tastes food."
JOB	34	4	Elihu	#09		18419	 {4} Let us discern for ourselves what is right; let us learn together what is good.
JOB	34	5	Elihu	#09		18420	" {5} << Job says, 'I am innocent, but God denies me justice."
JOB	34	6	Elihu	#09		18421	" {6} Although I am right, I am considered a liar; although I am guiltless, his arrow inflicts an incurable wound.'"
JOB	34	7	Elihu	#09		18422	" {7} What man is like Job, who drinks scorn like water? {8} He keeps company with evildoers; he associates with wicked men."
JOB	34	9	Elihu	#09		18423	" {9} For he says, 'It profits a man nothing when he tries to please God.'"
JOB	34	10	Elihu	#09		18424	" {10} << So listen to me, you men of understanding. Far be it from God to do evil, from the Almighty to do wrong."
JOB	34	11	Elihu	#09		18425	 {11} He repays a man for what he has done; he brings upon him what his conduct deserves.
JOB	34	12	Elihu	#09		18426	" {12} It is unthinkable that God would do wrong, that the Almighty would pervert justice."
JOB	34	13	Elihu	#09		18427	 {13} Who appointed him over the earth? Who put him in charge of the whole world?
JOB	34	14	Elihu	#09		18428	" {14} If it were his intention and he withdrew his spirit and breath, {15} all mankind would perish together and man would return to the dust."
JOB	34	16	Elihu	#09		18429	" {16} << If you have understanding, hear this; listen to what I say."
JOB	34	17	Elihu	#09		18430	 {17} Can he who hates justice govern? Will you condemn the just and mighty One?
JOB	34	18	Elihu	#09		18431	" {18} Is he not the One who says to kings, 'You are worthless,' and to nobles, 'You are wicked,'"
JOB	34	19	Elihu	#09		18432	" {19} who shows no partiality to princes and does not favor the rich over the poor, for they are all the work of his hands?"
JOB	34	20	Elihu	#09		18433	" {20} They die in an instant, in the middle of the night; the people are shaken and they pass away; the mighty are removed without human hand."
JOB	34	21	Elihu	#09		18434	" {21} << His eyes are on the ways of men; he sees their every step. {22} There is no dark place, no deep shadow, where evildoers can hide."
JOB	34	23	Elihu	#09		18435	" {23} God has no need to examine men further, that they should come before him for judgment."
JOB	34	24	Elihu	#09		18436	 {24} Without inquiry he shatters the mighty and sets up others in their place.
JOB	34	25	Elihu	#09		18437	" {25} Because he takes note of their deeds, he overthrows them in the night and they are crushed."
JOB	34	26	Elihu	#09		18438	" {26} He punishes them for their wickedness where everyone can see them, {27} because they turned from following him and had no regard for any of his ways."
JOB	34	28	Elihu	#09		18439	" {28} They caused the cry of the poor to come before him, so that he heard the cry of the needy."
JOB	34	29	Elihu	#09		18440	" {29} But if he remains silent, who can condemn him? If he hides his face, who can see him?"
JOB	34	29	Elihu	#09		18441	" Yet he is over man and nation alike, {30} to keep a godless man from ruling, from laying snares for the people."
JOB	34	31	Elihu	#09		18442	" {31} << Suppose a man says to God, 'I am guilty but will offend no more. {32} Teach me what I cannot see; if I have done wrong, I will not do so again.'"
JOB	34	33	Elihu	#09		18443	" {33} Should God then reward you on your terms, when you refuse to repent? You must decide, not I; so tell me what you know."
JOB	34	34	Elihu	#09		18444	" {34} << Men of understanding declare, wise men who hear me say to me, {35} 'Job speaks without knowledge; his words lack insight.'"
JOB	34	36	Elihu	#09		18445	" {36} Oh, that Job might be tested to the utmost for answering like a wicked man!"
JOB	34	37	Elihu	#09		18446	 {37} To his sin he adds rebellion; scornfully he claps his hands among us and multiplies his words against God.>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
JOB	35	<<	Narr_18: Job	#13		18447	JOB 35
JOB	35	1	Narr_18: Job	#13		18448	 {1} Then Elihu said:
JOB	35	2	Elihu	#09		18449	" {2} << Do you think this is just? You say, 'I will be cleared by God.' {3} Yet you ask him, 'What profit is it to me, and what do I gain by not sinning?'"
JOB	35	4	Elihu	#09		18450	 {4} << I would like to reply to you and to your friends with you. {5} Look up at the heavens and see; gaze at the clouds so high above you.
JOB	35	6	Elihu	#09		18451	" {6} If you sin, how does that affect him? If your sins are many, what does that do to him?"
JOB	35	7	Elihu	#09		18452	" {7} If you are righteous, what do you give to him, or what does he receive from your hand?"
JOB	35	8	Elihu	#09		18453	" {8} Your wickedness affects only a man like yourself, and your righteousness only the sons of men."
JOB	35	9	Elihu	#09		18454	 {9} << Men cry out under a load of oppression; they plead for relief from the arm of the powerful.
JOB	35	10	Elihu	#09		18455	" {10} But no one says, 'Where is God my Maker, who gives songs in the night,"
JOB	35	11	Elihu	#09		18456	 {11} who teaches more to us than to the beasts of the earth and makes us wiser than the birds of the air?'
JOB	35	12	Elihu	#09		18457	 {12} He does not answer when men cry out because of the arrogance of the wicked.
JOB	35	13	Elihu	#09		18458	" {13} Indeed, God does not listen to their empty plea; the Almighty pays no attention to it."
JOB	35	14	Elihu	#09		18459	" {14} How much less, then, will he listen when you say that you do not see him, that your case is before him and you must wait for him,"
JOB	35	15	Elihu	#09		18460	" {15} and further, that his anger never punishes and he does not take the least notice of wickedness."
JOB	35	16	Elihu	#09		18461	 {16} So Job opens his mouth with empty talk; without knowledge he multiplies words.>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
JOB	36	<<	Narr_18: Job	#13		18462	JOB 36
JOB	36	1	Narr_18: Job	#13		18463	 {1} Elihu continued:
JOB	36	2	Elihu	#09		18464	 {2} << Bear with me a little longer and I will show you that there is more to be said in God's behalf.
JOB	36	3	Elihu	#09		18465	 {3} I get my knowledge from afar; I will ascribe justice to my Maker.
JOB	36	4	Elihu	#09		18466	 {4} Be assured that my words are not false; one perfect in knowledge is with you.
JOB	36	5	Elihu	#09		18467	" {5} << God is mighty, but does not despise men; he is mighty, and firm in his purpose."
JOB	36	6	Elihu	#09		18468	 {6} He does not keep the wicked alive but gives the afflicted their rights.
JOB	36	7	Elihu	#09		18469	 {7} He does not take his eyes off the righteous; he enthrones them with kings and exalts them forever.
JOB	36	8	Elihu	#09		18470	" {8} But if men are bound in chains, held fast by cords of affliction, {9} he tells them what they have done-- that they have sinned arrogantly."
JOB	36	10	Elihu	#09		18471	 {10} He makes them listen to correction and commands them to repent of their evil.
JOB	36	11	Elihu	#09		18472	" {11} If they obey and serve him, they will spend the rest of their days in prosperity and their years in contentment."
JOB	36	12	Elihu	#09		18473	" {12} But if they do not listen, they will perish by the sword and die without knowledge."
JOB	36	13	Elihu	#09		18474	" {13} << The godless in heart harbor resentment; even when he fetters them, they do not cry for help."
JOB	36	14	Elihu	#09		18475	" {14} They die in their youth, among male prostitutes of the shrines."
JOB	36	15	Elihu	#09		18476	 {15} But those who suffer he delivers in their suffering; he speaks to them in their affliction.
JOB	36	16	Elihu	#09		18477	" {16} << He is wooing you from the jaws of distress to a spacious place free from restriction, to the comfort of your table laden with choice food."
JOB	36	17	Elihu	#09		18478	 {17} But now you are laden with the judgment due the wicked; judgment and justice have taken hold of you.
JOB	36	18	Elihu	#09		18479	 {18} Be careful that no one entices you by riches; do not let a large bribe turn you aside.
JOB	36	19	Elihu	#09		18480	 {19} Would your wealth or even all your mighty efforts sustain you so you would not be in distress?
JOB	36	20	Elihu	#09		18481	" {20} Do not long for the night, to drag people away from their homes. {21} Beware of turning to evil, which you seem to prefer to affliction."
JOB	36	22	Elihu	#09		18482	" {22} << God is exalted in his power. Who is a teacher like him? {23} Who has prescribed his ways for him, or said to him, 'You have done wrong'?"
JOB	36	24	Elihu	#09		18483	" {24} Remember to extol his work, which men have praised in song. {25} All mankind has seen it; men gaze on it from afar."
JOB	36	26	Elihu	#09		18484	 {26} How great is God--beyond our understanding! The number of his years is past finding out.
JOB	36	27	Elihu	#09		18485	" {27} << He draws up the drops of water, which distill as rain to the streams;"
JOB	36	28	Elihu	#09		18486	 {28} the clouds pour down their moisture and abundant showers fall on mankind.
JOB	36	29	Elihu	#09		18487	" {29} Who can understand how he spreads out the clouds, how he thunders from his pavilion?"
JOB	36	30	Elihu	#09		18488	" {30} See how he scatters his lightning about him, bathing the depths of the sea."
JOB	36	31	Elihu	#09		18489	 {31} This is the way he governs the nations and provides food in abundance. {32} He fills his hands with lightning and commands it to strike its mark.
JOB	36	33	Elihu	#09		18490	 {33} His thunder announces the coming storm; even the cattle make known its approach.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
JOB	37	<<	Narr_18: Job	#13		18491	JOB 37
JOB	37	1	Elihu	#09		18492	" {1} << At this my heart pounds and leaps from its place. {2} Listen! Listen to the roar of his voice, to the rumbling that comes from his mouth."
JOB	37	3	Elihu	#09		18493	 {3} He unleashes his lightning beneath the whole heaven and sends it to the ends of the earth.
JOB	37	4	Elihu	#09		18494	" {4} After that comes the sound of his roar; he thunders with his majestic voice. When his voice resounds, he holds nothing back."
JOB	37	5	Elihu	#09		18495	 {5} God's voice thunders in marvelous ways; he does great things beyond our understanding.
JOB	37	6	Elihu	#09		18496	" {6} He says to the snow, 'Fall on the earth,' and to the rain shower, 'Be a mighty downpour.'"
JOB	37	7	Elihu	#09		18497	" {7} So that all men he has made may know his work, he stops every man from his labor."
JOB	37	8	Elihu	#09		18498	" {8} The animals take cover; they remain in their dens. {9} The tempest comes out from its chamber, the cold from the driving winds."
JOB	37	10	Elihu	#09		18499	" {10} The breath of God produces ice, and the broad waters become frozen. {11} He loads the clouds with moisture; he scatters his lightning through them."
JOB	37	12	Elihu	#09		18500	 {12} At his direction they swirl around over the face of the whole earth to do whatever he commands them.
JOB	37	13	Elihu	#09		18501	" {13} He brings the clouds to punish men, or to water his earth and show his love."
JOB	37	14	Elihu	#09		18502	" {14} << Listen to this, Job; stop and consider God's wonders. {15} Do you know how God controls the clouds and makes his lightning flash?"
JOB	37	16	Elihu	#09		18503	" {16} Do you know how the clouds hang poised, those wonders of him who is perfect in knowledge?"
JOB	37	17	Elihu	#09		18504	" {17} You who swelter in your clothes when the land lies hushed under the south wind, {18} can you join him in spreading out the skies, hard as a mirror of cast bronze?"
JOB	37	19	Elihu	#09		18505	 {19} << Tell us what we should say to him; we cannot draw up our case because of our darkness.
JOB	37	20	Elihu	#09		18506	 {20} Should he be told that I want to speak? Would any man ask to be swallowed up?
JOB	37	21	Elihu	#09		18507	" {21} Now no one can look at the sun, bright as it is in the skies after the wind has swept them clean."
JOB	37	22	Elihu	#09		18508	 {22} Out of the north he comes in golden splendor; God comes in awesome majesty.
JOB	37	23	Elihu	#09		18509	" {23} The Almighty is beyond our reach and exalted in power; in his justice and great righteousness, he does not oppress."
JOB	37	24	Elihu	#09		18510	" {24} Therefore, men revere him, for does he not have regard for all the wise in heart?>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
JOB	38	<<	Narr_18: Job	#13		18511	JOB 38
JOB	38	1	Narr_18: Job	#13		18512	 {1} Then the Lord answered Job out of the storm. He said:
JOB	38	2	God-FX1	#20		18513	" {2} << Who is this that darkens my counsel with words without knowledge? {3} Brace yourself like a man; I will question you, and you shall answer me."
JOB	38	4	God-FX1	#20		18514	" {4} << Where were you when I laid the earth's foundation? Tell me, if you understand."
JOB	38	5	God-FX1	#20		18515	 {5} Who marked off its dimensions? Surely you know! Who stretched a measuring line across it?
JOB	38	6	God-FX1	#20		18516	" {6} On what were its footings set, or who laid its cornerstone-- {7} while the morning stars sang together and all the angels shouted for joy?"
JOB	38	8	God-FX1	#20		18517	" {8} << Who shut up the sea behind doors when it burst forth from the womb, {9} when I made the clouds its garment and wrapped it in thick darkness,"
JOB	38	10	God-FX1	#20		18518	" {10} when I fixed limits for it and set its doors and bars in place, {11} when I said, 'This far you may come and no farther; here is where your proud waves halt'?"
JOB	38	12	God-FX1	#20		18519	" {12} << Have you ever given orders to the morning, or shown the dawn its place, {13} that it might take the earth by the edges and shake the wicked out of it?"
JOB	38	14	God-FX1	#20		18520	" {14} The earth takes shape like clay under a seal; its features stand out like those of a garment. {15} The wicked are denied their light, and their upraised arm is broken."
JOB	38	16	God-FX1	#20		18521	 {16} << Have you journeyed to the springs of the sea or walked in the recesses of the deep?
JOB	38	17	God-FX1	#20		18522	 {17} Have the gates of death been shown to you? Have you seen the gates of the shadow of death?
JOB	38	18	God-FX1	#20		18523	" {18} Have you comprehended the vast expanses of the earth? Tell me, if you know all this."
JOB	38	19	God-FX1	#20		18524	 {19} << What is the way to the abode of light? And where does darkness reside? {20} Can you take them to their places? Do you know the paths to their dwellings?
JOB	38	21	God-FX1	#20		18525	" {21} Surely you know, for you were already born! You have lived so many years!"
JOB	38	22	God-FX1	#20		18526	" {22} << Have you entered the storehouses of the snow or seen the storehouses of the hail, {23} which I reserve for times of trouble, for days of war and battle?"
JOB	38	24	God-FX1	#20		18527	" {24} What is the way to the place where the lightning is dispersed, or the place where the east winds are scattered over the earth?"
JOB	38	25	God-FX1	#20		18528	" {25} Who cuts a channel for the torrents of rain, and a path for the thunderstorm, {26} to water a land where no man lives, a desert with no one in it, {27} to satisfy a desolate wasteland and make it sprout with grass?"
JOB	38	28	God-FX1	#20		18529	 {28} Does the rain have a father? Who fathers the drops of dew?
JOB	38	29	God-FX1	#20		18530	" {29} From whose womb comes the ice? Who gives birth to the frost from the heavens {30} when the waters become hard as stone, when the surface of the deep is frozen?"
JOB	38	31	God-FX1	#20		18531	 {31} << Can you bind the beautiful Pleiades? Can you loose the cords of Orion? {32} Can you bring forth the constellations in their seasons or lead out the Bear with its cubs?
JOB	38	33	God-FX1	#20		18532	 {33} Do you know the laws of the heavens? Can you set up God's dominion over the earth?
JOB	38	34	God-FX1	#20		18533	" {34} << Can you raise your voice to the clouds and cover yourself with a flood of water? {35} Do you send the lightning bolts on their way? Do they report to you, 'Here we are'?"
JOB	38	36	God-FX1	#20		18534	 {36} Who endowed the heart with wisdom or gave understanding to the mind?
JOB	38	37	God-FX1	#20		18535	 {37} Who has the wisdom to count the clouds? Who can tip over the water jars of the heavens {38} when the dust becomes hard and the clods of earth stick together?
JOB	38	39	God-FX1	#20		18536	 {39} << Do you hunt the prey for the lioness and satisfy the hunger of the lions {40} when they crouch in their dens or lie in wait in a thicket?
JOB	38	41	God-FX1	#20		18537	 {41} Who provides food for the raven when its young cry out to God and wander about for lack of food?*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
JOB	39	<<	Narr_18: Job	#13		18538	JOB 39
JOB	39	1	God-FX1	#20		18539	 {1} << Do you know when the mountain goats give birth? Do you watch when the doe bears her fawn?
JOB	39	2	God-FX1	#20		18540	 {2} Do you count the months till they bear? Do you know the time they give birth? {3} They crouch down and bring forth their young; their labor pains are ended.
JOB	39	4	God-FX1	#20		18541	 {4} Their young thrive and grow strong in the wilds; they leave and do not return.
JOB	39	5	God-FX1	#20		18542	" {5} << Who let the wild donkey go free? Who untied his ropes? {6} I gave him the wasteland as his home, the salt flats as his habitat."
JOB	39	7	God-FX1	#20		18543	 {7} He laughs at the commotion in the town; he does not hear a driver's shout. {8} He ranges the hills for his pasture and searches for any green thing.
JOB	39	9	God-FX1	#20		18544	 {9} << Will the wild ox consent to serve you? Will he stay by your manger at night? {10} Can you hold him to the furrow with a harness? Will he till the valleys behind you?
JOB	39	11	God-FX1	#20		18545	 {11} Will you rely on him for his great strength? Will you leave your heavy work to him? {12} Can you trust him to bring in your grain and gather it to your threshing floor?
JOB	39	13	God-FX1	#20		18546	" {13} << The wings of the ostrich flap joyfully, but they cannot compare with the pinions and feathers of the stork."
JOB	39	14	God-FX1	#20		18547	" {14} She lays her eggs on the ground and lets them warm in the sand, {15} unmindful that a foot may crush them, that some wild animal may trample them."
JOB	39	16	God-FX1	#20		18548	" {16} She treats her young harshly, as if they were not hers; she cares not that her labor was in vain, {17} for God did not endow her with wisdom or give her a share of good sense."
JOB	39	18	God-FX1	#20		18549	" {18} Yet when she spreads her feathers to run, she laughs at horse and rider."
JOB	39	19	God-FX1	#20		18550	" {19} << Do you give the horse his strength or clothe his neck with a flowing mane? {20} Do you make him leap like a locust, striking terror with his proud snorting?"
JOB	39	21	God-FX1	#20		18551	" {21} He paws fiercely, rejoicing in his strength, and charges into the fray. {22} He laughs at fear, afraid of nothing; he does not shy away from the sword."
JOB	39	23	God-FX1	#20		18552	" {23} The quiver rattles against his side, along with the flashing spear and lance. {24} In frenzied excitement he eats up the ground; he cannot stand still when the trumpet sounds."
JOB	39	25	God-FX1	#20		18553	" {25} At the blast of the trumpet he snorts, 'Aha!' He catches the scent of battle from afar, the shout of commanders and the battle cry."
JOB	39	26	God-FX1	#20		18554	 {26} << Does the hawk take flight by your wisdom and spread his wings toward the south?
JOB	39	27	God-FX1	#20		18555	 {27} Does the eagle soar at your command and build his nest on high? {28} He dwells on a cliff and stays there at night; a rocky crag is his stronghold.
JOB	39	29	God-FX1	#20		18556	 {29} From there he seeks out his food; his eyes detect it from afar.
JOB	39	30	God-FX1	#20		18557	" {30} His young ones feast on blood, and where the slain are, there is he.>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
JOB	40	<<	Narr_18: Job	#13		18558	JOB 40
JOB	40	1	Narr_18: Job	#13		18559	 {1} The Lord said to Job:
JOB	40	2	God-FX1	#20		18560	 {2} << Will the one who contends with the Almighty correct him? Let him who accuses God answer him!>>
JOB	40	3	Narr_18: Job	#13		18561	 {3} Then Job answered the Lord:
JOB	40	4	Job	#01		18562	" {4} << I am unworthy--how can I reply to you? I put my hand over my mouth. {5} I spoke once, but I have no answer-- twice, but I will say no more.>>"
JOB	40	6	Narr_18: Job	#13		18563	 {6} Then the Lord spoke to Job out of the storm:
JOB	40	7	God-FX1	#20		18564	" {7} << Brace yourself like a man; I will question you, and you shall answer me. {8} << Would you discredit my justice? Would you condemn me to justify yourself?"
JOB	40	9	God-FX1	#20		18565	" {9} Do you have an arm like God's, and can your voice thunder like his? {10} Then adorn yourself with glory and splendor, and clothe yourself in honor and majesty."
JOB	40	11	God-FX1	#20		18566	" {11} Unleash the fury of your wrath, look at every proud man and bring him low, {12} look at every proud man and humble him, crush the wicked where they stand."
JOB	40	13	God-FX1	#20		18567	 {13} Bury them all in the dust together; shroud their faces in the grave. {14} Then I myself will admit to you that your own right hand can save you.
JOB	40	15	God-FX1	#20		18568	" {15} << Look at the behemoth, which I made along with you and which feeds on grass like an ox."
JOB	40	16	God-FX1	#20		18569	" {16} What strength he has in his loins, what power in the muscles of his belly! {17} His tail sways like a cedar; the sinews of his thighs are close-knit."
JOB	40	18	God-FX1	#20		18570	" {18} His bones are tubes of bronze, his limbs like rods of iron. {19} He ranks first among the works of God, yet his Maker can approach him with his sword."
JOB	40	20	God-FX1	#20		18571	" {20} The hills bring him their produce, and all the wild animals play nearby."
JOB	40	21	God-FX1	#20		18572	" {21} Under the lotus plants he lies, hidden among the reeds in the marsh. {22} The lotuses conceal him in their shadow; the poplars by the stream surround him."
JOB	40	23	God-FX1	#20		18573	" {23} When the river rages, he is not alarmed; he is secure, though the Jordan should surge against his mouth."
JOB	40	24	God-FX1	#20		18574	" {24} Can anyone capture him by the eyes, or trap him and pierce his nose?*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
JOB	41	<<	Narr_18: Job	#13		18575	JOB 41
JOB	41	1	God-FX1	#20		18576	 {1} << Can you pull in the leviathan with a fishhook or tie down his tongue with a rope? {2} Can you put a cord through his nose or pierce his jaw with a hook?
JOB	41	3	God-FX1	#20		18577	 {3} Will he keep begging you for mercy? Will he speak to you with gentle words? {4} Will he make an agreement with you for you to take him as your slave for life?
JOB	41	5	God-FX1	#20		18578	 {5} Can you make a pet of him like a bird or put him on a leash for your girls? {6} Will traders barter for him? Will they divide him up among the merchants?
JOB	41	7	God-FX1	#20		18579	" {7} Can you fill his hide with harpoons or his head with fishing spears? {8} If you lay a hand on him, you will remember the struggle and never do it again!"
JOB	41	9	God-FX1	#20		18580	 {9} Any hope of subduing him is false; the mere sight of him is overpowering. {10} No one is fierce enough to rouse him. Who then is able to stand against me?
JOB	41	11	God-FX1	#20		18581	 {11} Who has a claim against me that I must pay? Everything under heaven belongs to me.
JOB	41	12	God-FX1	#20		18582	" {12} << I will not fail to speak of his limbs, his strength and his graceful form. {13} Who can strip off his outer coat? Who would approach him with a bridle?"
JOB	41	14	God-FX1	#20		18583	" {14} Who dares open the doors of his mouth, ringed about with his fearsome teeth?"
JOB	41	15	God-FX1	#20		18584	 {15} His back has rows of shields tightly sealed together; {16} each is so close to the next that no air can pass between.
JOB	41	17	God-FX1	#20		18585	 {17} They are joined fast to one another; they cling together and cannot be parted. {18} His snorting throws out flashes of light; his eyes are like the rays of dawn.
JOB	41	19	God-FX1	#20		18586	 {19} Firebrands stream from his mouth; sparks of fire shoot out. {20} Smoke pours from his nostrils as from a boiling pot over a fire of reeds.
JOB	41	21	God-FX1	#20		18587	" {21} His breath sets coals ablaze, and flames dart from his mouth. {22} Strength resides in his neck; dismay goes before him."
JOB	41	23	God-FX1	#20		18588	" {23} The folds of his flesh are tightly joined; they are firm and immovable. {24} His chest is hard as rock, hard as a lower millstone."
JOB	41	25	God-FX1	#20		18589	" {25} When he rises up, the mighty are terrified; they retreat before his thrashing."
JOB	41	26	God-FX1	#20		18590	" {26} The sword that reaches him has no effect, nor does the spear or the dart or the javelin. {27} Iron he treats like straw and bronze like rotten wood."
JOB	41	28	God-FX1	#20		18591	 {28} Arrows do not make him flee; slingstones are like chaff to him. {29} A club seems to him but a piece of straw; he laughs at the rattling of the lance.
JOB	41	30	God-FX1	#20		18592	" {30} His undersides are jagged potsherds, leaving a trail in the mud like a threshing sledge."
JOB	41	31	God-FX1	#20		18593	 {31} He makes the depths churn like a boiling caldron and stirs up the sea like a pot of ointment.
JOB	41	32	God-FX1	#20		18594	 {32} Behind him he leaves a glistening wake; one would think the deep had white hair.
JOB	41	33	God-FX1	#20		18595	 {33} Nothing on earth is his equal-- a creature without fear.
JOB	41	34	God-FX1	#20		18596	 {34} He looks down on all that are haughty; he is king over all that are proud.>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
JOB	42	<<	Narr_18: Job	#13		18597	JOB 42
JOB	42	1	Narr_18: Job	#13		18598	 {1} Then Job replied to the Lord:
JOB	42	2	Job	#01		18599	 {2} << I know that you can do all things; no plan of yours can be thwarted.
JOB	42	3	Job	#01		18600	" {3} You asked, 'Who is this that obscures my counsel without knowledge?' Surely I spoke of things I did not understand, things too wonderful for me to know."
JOB	42	4	Job	#01		18601	" {4} << You said, 'Listen now, and I will speak; I will question you, and you shall answer me.'"
JOB	42	5	Job	#01		18602	 {5} My ears had heard of you but now my eyes have seen you. {6} Therefore I despise myself and repent in dust and ashes.>>
JOB	42	7	Narr_18: Job	#13		18603	" {7} After the Lord had said these things to Job, he said to Eliphaz the Temanite,"
JOB	42	7	God-FX1	#20		18604	" << I am angry with you and your two friends, because you have not spoken of me what is right, as my servant Job has."
JOB	42	8	God-FX1	#20		18605	 {8} So now take seven bulls and seven rams and go to my servant Job and sacrifice a burnt offering for yourselves. 
JOB	42	8	God-FX1	#20		18606	" My servant Job will pray for you, and I will accept his prayer and not deal with you according to your folly. You have not spoken of me what is right, as my servant Job has.>>"
JOB	42	9	Narr_18: Job	#13		18607	" {9} So Eliphaz the Temanite, Bildad the Shuhite and Zophar the Naamathite did what the Lord told them; and the Lord accepted Job's prayer."
JOB	42	10	Narr_18: Job	#13		18608	" {10} After Job had prayed for his friends, the Lord made him prosperous again and gave him twice as much as he had before."
JOB	42	11	Narr_18: Job	#13		18609	 {11} All his brothers and sisters and everyone who had known him before came and ate with him in his house. 
JOB	42	11	Narr_18: Job	#13		18610	" They comforted and consoled him over all the trouble the Lord had brought upon him, and each one gave him a piece of silver and a gold ring."
JOB	42	12	Narr_18: Job	#13		18611	" {12} The Lord blessed the latter part of Job's life more than the first. He had fourteen thousand sheep, six thousand camels, a thousand yoke of oxen and a thousand donkeys."
JOB	42	13	Narr_18: Job	#13		18612	 {13} And he also had seven sons and three daughters.
JOB	42	14	Narr_18: Job	#13		18613	" {14} The first daughter he named Jemimah, the second Keziah and the third Keren-Happuch."
JOB	42	15	Narr_18: Job	#13		18614	" {15} Nowhere in all the land were there found women as beautiful as Job's daughters, and their father granted them an inheritance along with their brothers."
JOB	42	16	Narr_18: Job	#13		18615	" {16} After this, Job lived a hundred and forty years; he saw his children and their children to the fourth generation."
JOB	42	17	Narr_18: Job	#13		18616	" {17} And so he died, old and full of years.*~**~*||||| + 5 SECs |||||*~*"
PSM	1	<<	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		18617	PSALMS*~*PSALM 1
PSM	1	1	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		18618	 {1} Blessed is the man who does not walk in the counsel of the wicked or stand in the way of sinners or sit in the seat of mockers.
PSM	1	2	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		18619	" {2} But his delight is in the law of the Lord, and on his law he meditates day and night."
PSM	1	3	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		18620	" {3} He is like a tree planted by streams of water, which yields its fruit in season and whose leaf does not wither. Whatever he does prospers."
PSM	1	4	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		18621	 {4} Not so the wicked! They are like chaff that the wind blows away.
PSM	1	5	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		18622	" {5} Therefore the wicked will not stand in the judgment, nor sinners in the assembly of the righteous."
PSM	1	6	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		18623	" {6} For the Lord watches over the way of the righteous, but the way of the wicked will perish.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"

PSM	2	6	God-FX1	#20		18629	" {6} << I have installed my King on Zion, my holy hill.>>"

PSM	2	10	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		18634	" {10} Therefore, you kings, be wise; be warned, you rulers of the earth. {11} Serve the Lord with fear and rejoice with trembling."
PSM	2	12	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		18635	" {12} Kiss the Son, lest he be angry and you be destroyed in your way, for his wrath can flare up in a moment. Blessed are all who take refuge in him.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"

PSM	3	2	Man	#03		18639	 << God will not deliver him.>>
PSM	3	2	David	#07		18640	" Selah. {3} But you are a shield around me, O Lord; you bestow glory on me and lift up my head."
PSM	3	4	David	#07		18641	" {4} To the Lord I cry aloud, and he answers me from his holy hill. Selah. {5} I lie down and sleep; I wake again, because the Lord sustains me."
PSM	3	6	David	#07		18642	 {6} I will not fear the tens of thousands drawn up against me on every side.

PSM	3	8	David	#07		18644	 {8} From the Lord comes deliverance. May your blessing be on your people.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
PSM	4	<<	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		18645	PSALM 4

PSM	4	1	David	#07		18647	" {1} Answer me when I call to you, O my righteous God. Give me relief from my distress; be merciful to me and hear my prayer."
PSM	4	2	David	#07		18648	" {2} How long, O men, will you turn my glory into shame? How long will you love delusions and seek false gods? Selah"
PSM	4	3	David	#07		18649	 {3} Know that the Lord has set apart the godly for himself; the Lord will hear when I call to him.
PSM	4	4	David	#07		18650	" {4} In your anger do not sin; when you are on your beds, search your hearts and be silent. SELAH"
PSM	4	5	David	#07		18651	" {5} Offer right sacrifices and trust in the Lord. {6} Many are saying,"
PSM	4	6	Man	#04		18652	" << Who can show us any good?>> Let the light of your face shine upon us, O Lord."
PSM	4	7	David	#07		18653	 {7} You have filled my heart with greater joy than when their grain and new wine abound.
PSM	4	8	David	#07		18654	" {8} I will lie down and sleep in peace, for you alone, O Lord, make me dwell in safety.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
PSM	5	<<	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		18655	PSALM 5
PSM	5	0	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		18656	 For the director of music. For flutes. A psalm of David.
PSM	5	1	David	#07		18657	" {1} Give ear to my words, O Lord, consider my sighing. {2} Listen to my cry for help, my King and my God, for to you I pray."
PSM	5	3	David	#07		18658	" {3} In the morning, O Lord, you hear my voice; in the morning I lay my requests before you and wait in expectation."
PSM	5	4	David	#07		18659	 {4} You are not a God who takes pleasure in evil; with you the wicked cannot dwell. {5} The arrogant cannot stand in your presence; you hate all who do wrong.
PSM	5	6	David	#07		18660	 {6} You destroy those who tell lies; bloodthirsty and deceitful men the Lord abhors.
PSM	5	7	David	#07		18661	" {7} But I, by your great mercy, will come into your house; in reverence will I bow down toward your holy temple."
PSM	5	8	David	#07		18662	" {8} Lead me, O Lord, in your righteousness because of my enemies-- make straight your way before me."
PSM	5	9	David	#07		18663	 {9} Not a word from their mouth can be trusted; their heart is filled with destruction. Their throat is an open grave; with their tongue they speak deceit.
PSM	5	10	David	#07		18664	" {10} Declare them guilty, O God! Let their intrigues be their downfall. Banish them for their many sins, for they have rebelled against you."
PSM	5	11	David	#07		18665	" {11} But let all who take refuge in you be glad; let them ever sing for joy. Spread your protection over them, that those who love your name may rejoice in you."
PSM	5	12	David	#07		18666	" {12} For surely, O Lord, you bless the righteous; you surround them with your favor as with a shield.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
PSM	6	<<	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		18667	PSALM 6

PSM	6	1	David	#07		18669	" {1} O Lord, do not rebuke me in your anger or discipline me in your wrath."
PSM	6	2	David	#07		18670	" {2} Be merciful to me, Lord, for I am faint; O Lord, heal me, for my bones are in agony. {3} My soul is in anguish. How long, O Lord, how long?"
PSM	6	4	David	#07		18671	" {4} Turn, O Lord, and deliver me; save me because of your unfailing love. {5} No one remembers you when he is dead. Who praises you from the grave?"
PSM	6	6	David	#07		18672	 {6} I am worn out from groaning; all night long I flood my bed with weeping and drench my couch with tears.
PSM	6	7	David	#07		18673	 {7} My eyes grow weak with sorrow; they fail because of all my foes.
PSM	6	8	David	#07		18674	" {8} Away from me, all you who do evil, for the Lord has heard my weeping. {9} The Lord has heard my cry for mercy; the Lord accepts my prayer."
PSM	6	10	David	#07		18675	 {10} All my enemies will be ashamed and dismayed; they will turn back in sudden disgrace.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
PSM	7	<<	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		18676	PSALM 7
PSM	7	0	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		18677	" A shiggalon of David, which he sang to the Lord concerning Cush, a Benjamite."
PSM	7	1	David	#07		18678	" {1} O Lord my God, I take refuge in you; save and deliver me from all who pursue me, {2} or they will tear me like a lion and rip me to pieces with no one to rescue me."
PSM	7	3	David	#07		18679	" {3} O Lord my God, if I have done this and there is guilt on my hands--"
PSM	7	4	David	#07		18680	 {4} if I have done evil to him who is at peace with me or without cause have robbed my foe--
PSM	7	5	David	#07		18681	 {5} then let my enemy pursue and overtake me; let him trample my life to the ground and make me sleep in the dust. Selah
PSM	7	6	David	#07		18682	" {6} Arise, O Lord, in your anger; rise up against the rage of my enemies. Awake, my God; decree justice."
PSM	7	7	David	#07		18683	 {7} Let the assembled peoples gather around you. Rule over them from on high;
PSM	7	8	David	#07		18684	" {8} let the Lord judge the peoples. Judge me, O Lord, according to my righteousness, according to my integrity, O Most High."
PSM	7	9	David	#07		18685	" {9} O righteous God, who searches minds and hearts, bring to an end the violence of the wicked and make the righteous secure."
PSM	7	10	David	#07		18686	" {10} My shield is God Most High, who saves the upright in heart. {11} God is a righteous judge, a God who expresses his wrath every day."
PSM	7	12	David	#07		18687	" {12} If he does not relent, he will sharpen his sword; he will bend and string his bow. {13} He has prepared his deadly weapons; he makes ready his flaming arrows."
PSM	7	14	David	#07		18688	 {14} He who is pregnant with evil and conceives trouble gives birth to disillusionment. {15} He who digs a hole and scoops it out falls into the pit he has made.
PSM	7	16	David	#07		18689	 {16} The trouble he causes recoils on himself; his violence comes down on his own head.
PSM	7	17	David	#07		18690	 {17} I will give thanks to the Lord because of his righteousness and will sing praise to the name of the Lord Most High.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
