PSM	17	<<	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		18791	PSALM 17
PSM	17	0	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		18792	 A prayer of David.
PSM	17	1	David	#07		18793	" {1} Hear, O Lord, my righteous plea; listen to my cry. Give ear to my prayer-- it does not rise from deceitful lips."
PSM	17	2	David	#07		18794	 {2} May my vindication come from you; may your eyes see what is right.
PSM	17	3	David	#07		18795	" {3} Though you probe my heart and examine me at night, though you test me, you will find nothing; I have resolved that my mouth will not sin."
PSM	17	4	David	#07		18796	 {4} As for the deeds of men-- by the word of your lips I have kept myself from the ways of the violent.
PSM	17	5	David	#07		18797	" {5} My steps have held to your paths; my feet have not slipped. {6} I call on you, O God, for you will answer me; give ear to me and hear my prayer."
PSM	17	7	David	#07		18798	" {7} Show the wonder of your great love, you who save by your right hand those who take refuge in you from their foes."
PSM	17	8	David	#07		18799	" {8} Keep me as the apple of your eye; hide me in the shadow of your wings {9} from the wicked who assail me, from my mortal enemies who surround me."
PSM	17	10	David	#07		18800	" {10} They close up their callous hearts, and their mouths speak with arrogance. {11} They have tracked me down, they now surround me, with eyes alert, to throw me to the ground."
PSM	17	12	David	#07		18801	" {12} They are like a lion hungry for prey, like a great lion crouching in cover."
PSM	17	13	David	#07		18802	" {13} Rise up, O Lord, confront them, bring them down; rescue me from the wicked by your sword."
PSM	17	14	David	#07		18803	" {14} O Lord, by your hand save me from such men, from men of this world whose reward is in this life. "
PSM	17	14	David	#07		18804	" You still the hunger of those you cherish; their sons have plenty, and they store up wealth for their children."
PSM	17	15	David	#07		18805	" {15} And I--in righteousness I will see your face; when I awake, I will be satisfied with seeing your likeness.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
PSM	18	<<	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		18806	PSALM 18
PSM	18	0	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		18807	For the director of music. Of David the servant of the Lord. 
PSM	18	0	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		18808	 He sang to the Lord the words of this song when the Lord delievered him from the hand of all his enemies and from the hand of Saul.  {1} He said:
PSM	18	1	David	#07		18809	" I love you, O Lord, my strength. {2} The Lord is my rock, my fortress and my deliverer; my God is my rock, in whom I take refuge. He is my shield and the horn of my salvation, my stronghold."
PSM	18	3	David	#07		18810	" {3} I call to the Lord, who is worthy of praise, and I am saved from my enemies."
PSM	18	4	David	#07		18811	 {4} The cords of death entangled me; the torrents of destruction overwhelmed me. {5} The cords of the grave coiled around me; the snares of death confronted me.
PSM	18	6	David	#07		18812	" {6} In my distress I called to the Lord; I cried to my God for help. From his temple he heard my voice; my cry came before him, into his ears."
PSM	18	7	David	#07		18813	" {7} The earth trembled and quaked, and the foundations of the mountains shook; they trembled because he was angry."
PSM	18	8	David	#07		18814	" {8} Smoke rose from his nostrils; consuming fire came from his mouth, burning coals blazed out of it."
PSM	18	9	David	#07		18815	 {9} He parted the heavens and came down; dark clouds were under his feet. {10} He mounted the cherubim and flew; he soared on the wings of the wind.
PSM	18	11	David	#07		18816	" {11} He made darkness his covering, his canopy around him-- the dark rain clouds of the sky."
PSM	18	12	David	#07		18817	" {12} Out of the brightness of his presence clouds advanced, with hailstones and bolts of lightning."
PSM	18	13	David	#07		18818	" {13} The Lord thundered from heaven; the voice of the Most High resounded. {14} He shot his arrows and scattered the enemies, great bolts of lightning and routed them."
PSM	18	15	David	#07		18819	" {15} The valleys of the sea were exposed and the foundations of the earth laid bare at your rebuke, O Lord, at the blast of breath from your nostrils."
PSM	18	16	David	#07		18820	" {16} He reached down from on high and took hold of me; he drew me out of deep waters. {17} He rescued me from my powerful enemy, from my foes, who were too strong for me."
PSM	18	18	David	#07		18821	" {18} They confronted me in the day of my disaster, but the Lord was my support. {19} He brought me out into a spacious place; he rescued me because he delighted in me."
PSM	18	20	David	#07		18822	 {20} The Lord has dealt with me according to my righteousness; according to the cleanness of my hands he has rewarded me.
PSM	18	21	David	#07		18823	 {21} For I have kept the ways of the Lord; I have not done evil by turning from my God. {22} All his laws are before me; I have not turned away from his decrees.
PSM	18	23	David	#07		18824	" {23} I have been blameless before him and have kept myself from sin. {24} The Lord has rewarded me according to my righteousness, according to the cleanness of my hands in his sight."
PSM	18	25	David	#07		18825	" {25} To the faithful you show yourself faithful, to the blameless you show yourself blameless, {26} to the pure you show yourself pure, but to the crooked you show yourself shrewd."
PSM	18	27	David	#07		18826	" {27} You save the humble but bring low those whose eyes are haughty. {28} You, O Lord, keep my lamp burning; my God turns my darkness into light."
PSM	18	29	David	#07		18827	 {29} With your help I can advance against a troop; with my God I can scale a wall.
PSM	18	30	David	#07		18828	" {30} As for God, his way is perfect; the word of the Lord is flawless. He is a shield for all who take refuge in him."
PSM	18	31	David	#07		18829	 {31} For who is God besides the Lord? And who is the Rock except our God?
PSM	18	32	David	#07		18830	 {32} It is God who arms me with strength and makes my way perfect. {33} He makes my feet like the feet of a deer; he enables me to stand on the heights.
PSM	18	34	David	#07		18831	 {34} He trains my hands for battle; my arms can bend a bow of bronze. 
PSM	18	35	David	#07		18832	" {35} You give me your shield of victory, and your right hand sustains me; you stoop down to make me great. {36} You broaden the path beneath me, so that my ankles do not turn."
PSM	18	37	David	#07		18833	 {37} I pursued my enemies and overtook them; I did not turn back till they were destroyed. {38} I crushed them so that they could not rise; they fell beneath my feet.
PSM	18	39	David	#07		18834	" {39} You armed me with strength for battle; you made my adversaries bow at my feet. {40} You made my enemies turn their backs in flight, and I destroyed my foes."
PSM	18	41	David	#07		18835	" {41} They cried for help, but there was no one to save them-- to the Lord, but he did not answer."
PSM	18	42	David	#07		18836	 {42} I beat them as fine as dust borne on the wind; I poured them out like mud in the streets.
PSM	18	43	David	#07		18837	 {43} You have delivered me from the attacks of the people; you have made me the head of nations; people I did not know are subject to me.
PSM	18	44	David	#07		18838	" {44} As soon as they hear me, they obey me; foreigners cringe before me. {45} They all lose heart; they come trembling from their strongholds."
PSM	18	46	David	#07		18839	 {46} The Lord lives! Praise be to my Rock! Exalted be God my Savior!
PSM	18	47	David	#07		18840	" {47} He is the God who avenges me, who subdues nations under me, {48} who saves me from my enemies. You exalted me above my foes; from violent men you rescued me."
PSM	18	49	David	#07		18841	" {49} Therefore I will praise you among the nations, O Lord; I will sing praises to your name."
PSM	18	50	David	#07		18842	" {50} He gives his king great victories; he shows unfailing kindness to his anointed, to David and his descendants forever.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
PSM	19	<<	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		18843	PSALM 19
PSM	19	0	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		18844	 For the director of music. A Psalm of David.
PSM	19	1	David	#07		18845	 {1} The heavens declare the glory of God; the skies proclaim the work of his hands.
PSM	19	2	David	#07		18846	 {2} Day after day they pour forth speech; night after night they display knowledge. {3} There is no speech or language where their voice is not heard.
PSM	19	4	David	#07		18847	" {4} Their voice goes out into all the earth, their words to the ends of the world. "
PSM	19	4	David	#07		18848	" In the heavens he has pitched a tent for the sun, {5} which is like a bridegroom coming forth from his pavilion, like a champion rejoicing to run his course."
PSM	19	6	David	#07		18849	 {6} It rises at one end of the heavens and makes its circuit to the other; nothing is hidden from its heat.
PSM	19	7	David	#07		18850	" {7} The law of the Lord is perfect, reviving the soul. The statutes of the Lord are trustworthy, making wise the simple."
PSM	19	8	David	#07		18851	" {8} The precepts of the Lord are right, giving joy to the heart. The commands of the Lord are radiant, giving light to the eyes."
PSM	19	9	David	#07		18852	" {9} The fear of the Lord is pure, enduring forever. The ordinances of the Lord are sure and altogether righteous."
PSM	19	10	David	#07		18853	" {10} They are more precious than gold, than much pure gold; they are sweeter than honey, than honey from the comb."
PSM	19	11	David	#07		18854	 {11} By them is your servant warned; in keeping them there is great reward. {12} Who can discern his errors? Forgive my hidden faults.
PSM	19	13	David	#07		18855	" {13} Keep your servant also from willful sins; may they not rule over me. Then will I be blameless, innocent of great transgression."
PSM	19	14	David	#07		18856	" {14} May the words of my mouth and the meditation of my heart be pleasing in your sight, O Lord, my Rock and my Redeemer.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
PSM	20	<<	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		18857	PSALM 20
PSM	20	0	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		18858	 For the director of music. A psalm of David.
PSM	20	1	David	#07		18859	 {1} May the Lord answer you when you are in distress; may the name of the God of Jacob protect you.
PSM	20	2	David	#07		18860	 {2} May he send you help from the sanctuary and grant you support from Zion. {3} May he remember all your sacrifices and accept your burnt offerings. Selah
PSM	20	4	David	#07		18861	 {4} May he give you the desire of your heart and make all your plans succeed.
PSM	20	5	David	#07		18862	 {5} We will shout for joy when you are victorious and will lift up our banners in the name of our God. May the Lord grant all your requests.
PSM	20	6	David	#07		18863	 {6} Now I know that the Lord saves his anointed; he answers him from his holy heaven with the saving power of his right hand.
PSM	20	7	David	#07		18864	" {7} Some trust in chariots and some in horses, but we trust in the name of the Lord our God."
PSM	20	8	David	#07		18865	" {8} They are brought to their knees and fall, but we rise up and stand firm."
PSM	20	9	David	#07		18866	" {9} O Lord, save the king! Answer us when we call!*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
PSM	21	<<	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		18867	PSALM 21
PSM	21	0	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		18868	 For the director of music. A psalm of David.
PSM	21	1	David	#07		18869	" {1} O Lord, the king rejoices in your strength. How great is his joy in the victories you give!"
PSM	21	2	David	#07		18870	 {2} You have granted him the desire of his heart and have not withheld the request of his lips. Selah
PSM	21	3	David	#07		18871	" {3} You welcomed him with rich blessings and placed a crown of pure gold on his head. {4} He asked you for life, and you gave it to him-- length of days, for ever and ever."
PSM	21	5	David	#07		18872	" {5} Through the victories you gave, his glory is great; you have bestowed on him splendor and majesty."
PSM	21	6	David	#07		18873	 {6} Surely you have granted him eternal blessings and made him glad with the joy of your presence.
PSM	21	7	David	#07		18874	 {7} For the king trusts in the Lord; through the unfailing love of the Most High he will not be shaken.
PSM	21	8	David	#07		18875	 {8} Your hand will lay hold on all your enemies; your right hand will seize your foes.
PSM	21	9	David	#07		18876	" {9} At the time of your appearing you will make them like a fiery furnace. In his wrath the Lord will swallow them up, and his fire will consume them."
PSM	21	10	David	#07		18877	" {10} You will destroy their descendants from the earth, their posterity from mankind."
PSM	21	11	David	#07		18878	" {11} Though they plot evil against you and devise wicked schemes, they cannot succeed; {12} for you will make them turn their backs when you aim at them with drawn bow."
PSM	21	13	David	#07		18879	" {13} Be exalted, O Lord, in your strength; we will sing and praise your might.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
PSM	22	<<	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		18880	PSALM 22
PSM	22	0	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		18881	 For the director of music. To the tune of ôThe Doe of the Morning.ö A Psalm of David.
PSM	22	1	David	#07		18882	" {1} My God, my God, why have you forsaken me? Why are you so far from saving me, so far from the words of my groaning?"
PSM	22	2	David	#07		18883	" {2} O my God, I cry out by day, but you do not answer, by night, and am not silent."
PSM	22	3	David	#07		18884	 {3} Yet you are enthroned as the Holy One; you are the praise of Israel. {4} In you our fathers put their trust; they trusted and you delivered them.
PSM	22	5	David	#07		18885	 {5} They cried to you and were saved; in you they trusted and were not disappointed.
PSM	22	6	David	#07		18886	" {6} But I am a worm and not a man, scorned by men and despised by the people. {7} All who see me mock me; they hurl insults, shaking their heads:"
PSM	22	8	Man	#14		18887	" {8} << He trusts in the Lord; let the Lord rescue him. Let him deliver him, since he delights in him.>>"
PSM	22	9	David	#07		18888	 {9} Yet you brought me out of the womb; you made me trust in you even at my mother's breast. {10} From birth I was cast upon you; from my mother's womb you have been my God.
PSM	22	11	David	#07		18889	" {11} Do not be far from me, for trouble is near and there is no one to help."
PSM	22	12	David	#07		18890	 {12} Many bulls surround me; strong bulls of Bashan encircle me. {13} Roaring lions tearing their prey open their mouths wide against me.
PSM	22	14	David	#07		18891	" {14} I am poured out like water, and all my bones are out of joint. My heart has turned to wax; it has melted away within me."
PSM	22	15	David	#07		18892	" {15} My strength is dried up like a potsherd, and my tongue sticks to the roof of my mouth; you lay me in the dust of death."
PSM	22	16	David	#07		18893	" {16} Dogs have surrounded me; a band of evil men has encircled me, they have pierced my hands and my feet."
PSM	22	17	David	#07		18894	 {17} I can count all my bones; people stare and gloat over me. {18} They divide my garments among them and cast lots for my clothing.
PSM	22	19	David	#07		18895	" {19} But you, O Lord, be not far off; O my Strength, come quickly to help me. {20} Deliver my life from the sword, my precious life from the power of the dogs."
PSM	22	21	David	#07		18896	 {21} Rescue me from the mouth of the lions; save me from the horns of the wild oxen.
PSM	22	22	David	#07		18897	 {22} I will declare your name to my brothers; in the congregation I will praise you.
PSM	22	23	David	#07		18898	" {23} You who fear the Lord, praise him! All you descendants of Jacob, honor him! Revere him, all you descendants of Israel!"
PSM	22	24	David	#07		18899	 {24} For he has not despised or disdained the suffering of the afflicted one; he has not hidden his face from him but has listened to his cry for help.
PSM	22	25	David	#07		18900	 {25} From you comes the theme of my praise in the great assembly; before those who fear you will I fulfill my vows.
PSM	22	26	David	#07		18901	 {26} The poor will eat and be satisfied; they who seek the Lord will praise him-- may your hearts live forever!
PSM	22	27	David	#07		18902	" {27} All the ends of the earth will remember and turn to the Lord, and all the families of the nations will bow down before him, {28} for dominion belongs to the Lord and he rules over the nations."
PSM	22	29	David	#07		18903	 {29} All the rich of the earth will feast and worship; all who go down to the dust will kneel before him-- those who cannot keep themselves alive.
PSM	22	30	David	#07		18904	 {30} Posterity will serve him; future generations will be told about the Lord. {31} They will proclaim his righteousness to a people yet unborn-- for he has done it.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*

PSM	23	2	David	#07		18908	" {2} He makes me lie down in green pastures, he leads me beside quiet waters, {3} he restores my soul. He guides me in paths of righteousness for his name's sake."
PSM	23	4	David	#07		18909	" {4} Even though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil, for you are with me; your rod and your staff, they comfort me."

PSM	25	1	David	#07		18924	" {1} To you, O Lord, I lift up my soul; {2} in you I trust, O my God. Do not let me be put to shame, nor let my enemies triumph over me."
PSM	25	3	David	#07		18925	" {3} No one whose hope is in you will ever be put to shame, but they will be put to shame who are treacherous without excuse."
PSM	25	4	David	#07		18926	" {4} Show me your ways, O Lord, teach me your paths; {5} guide me in your truth and teach me, for you are God my Savior, and my hope is in you all day long."
PSM	25	6	David	#07		18927	" {6} Remember, O Lord, your great mercy and love, for they are from of old."
PSM	25	7	David	#07		18928	" {7} Remember not the sins of my youth and my rebellious ways; according to your love remember me, for you are good, O Lord."
PSM	25	8	David	#07		18929	 {8} Good and upright is the Lord; therefore he instructs sinners in his ways. {9} He guides the humble in what is right and teaches them his way.
PSM	25	10	David	#07		18930	 {10} All the ways of the Lord are loving and faithful for those who keep the demands of his covenant.
PSM	25	11	David	#07		18931	" {11} For the sake of your name, O Lord, forgive my iniquity, though it is great."
PSM	25	12	David	#07		18932	" {12} Who, then, is the man that fears the Lord? He will instruct him in the way chosen for him. {13} He will spend his days in prosperity, and his descendants will inherit the land."
PSM	25	14	David	#07		18933	" {14} The Lord confides in those who fear him; he makes his covenant known to them. {15} My eyes are ever on the Lord, for only he will release my feet from the snare."
PSM	25	16	David	#07		18934	" {16} Turn to me and be gracious to me, for I am lonely and afflicted. {17} The troubles of my heart have multiplied; free me from my anguish."
PSM	25	18	David	#07		18935	 {18} Look upon my affliction and my distress and take away all my sins.
PSM	25	19	David	#07		18936	" {19} See how my enemies have increased and how fiercely they hate me! {20} Guard my life and rescue me; let me not be put to shame, for I take refuge in you."
PSM	25	21	David	#07		18937	" {21} May integrity and uprightness protect me, because my hope is in you."
PSM	25	22	David	#07		18938	" {22} Redeem Israel, O God, from all their troubles!*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"

PSM	26	1	David	#07		18941	" {1} Vindicate me, O Lord, for I have led a blameless life; I have trusted in the Lord without wavering."
PSM	26	2	David	#07		18942	" {2} Test me, O Lord, and try me, examine my heart and my mind; {3} for your love is ever before me, and I walk continually in your truth."
PSM	26	4	David	#07		18943	" {4} I do not sit with deceitful men, nor do I consort with hypocrites; {5} I abhor the assembly of evildoers and refuse to sit with the wicked."
PSM	26	6	David	#07		18944	" {6} I wash my hands in innocence, and go about your altar, O Lord, {7} proclaiming aloud your praise and telling of all your wonderful deeds."
PSM	26	8	David	#07		18945	" {8} I love the house where you live, O Lord, the place where your glory dwells."

PSM	26	11	David	#07		18947	 {11} But I lead a blameless life; redeem me and be merciful to me.

PSM	27	<<	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		18949	PSALM 27
PSM	27	0	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		18950	 Of David.
PSM	27	1	David	#07		18951	 {1} The Lord is my light and my salvation-- whom shall I fear? The Lord is the stronghold of my life-- of whom shall I be afraid?
PSM	27	2	David	#07		18952	" {2} When evil men advance against me to devour my flesh, when my enemies and my foes attack me, they will stumble and fall."
PSM	27	3	David	#07		18953	" {3} Though an army besiege me, my heart will not fear; though war break out against me, even then will I be confident."
PSM	27	4	David	#07		18954	" {4} One thing I ask of the Lord, this is what I seek: that I may dwell in the house of the Lord all the days of my life, to gaze upon the beauty of the Lord and to seek him in his temple."
PSM	27	5	David	#07		18955	 {5} For in the day of trouble he will keep me safe in his dwelling; he will hide me in the shelter of his tabernacle and set me high upon a rock.
PSM	27	6	David	#07		18956	 {6} Then my head will be exalted above the enemies who surround me; at his tabernacle will I sacrifice with shouts of joy; I will sing and make music to the Lord.
PSM	27	7	David	#07		18957	" {7} Hear my voice when I call, O Lord; be merciful to me and answer me."
PSM	27	8	David	#07		18958	" {8} My heart says of you, << Seek his face! >> Your face, Lord, I will seek."
PSM	27	9	David	#07		18959	" {9} Do not hide your face from me, do not turn your servant away in anger; you have been my helper. Do not reject me or forsake me, O God my Savior."
PSM	27	10	David	#07		18960	" {10} Though my father and mother forsake me, the Lord will receive me."
PSM	27	11	David	#07		18961	" {11} Teach me your way, O Lord; lead me in a straight path because of my oppressors."
PSM	27	12	David	#07		18962	" {12} Do not turn me over to the desire of my foes, for false witnesses rise up against me, breathing out violence."
PSM	27	13	David	#07		18963	 {13} I am still confident of this: I will see the goodness of the Lord in the land of the living.
PSM	27	14	David	#07		18964	 {14} Wait for the Lord; be strong and take heart and wait for the Lord.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*

PSM	28	0	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		18966	 Of David.
PSM	28	1	David	#07		18967	" {1} To you I call, O Lord my Rock; do not turn a deaf ear to me. For if you remain silent, I will be like those who have gone down to the pit."
PSM	28	2	David	#07		18968	" {2} Hear my cry for mercy as I call to you for help, as I lift up my hands toward your Most Holy Place."
PSM	28	3	David	#07		18969	" {3} Do not drag me away with the wicked, with those who do evil, who speak cordially with their neighbors but harbor malice in their hearts."
PSM	28	4	David	#07		18970	 {4} Repay them for their deeds and for their evil work; repay them for what their hands have done and bring back upon them what they deserve.
PSM	28	5	David	#07		18971	" {5} Since they show no regard for the works of the Lord and what his hands have done, he will tear them down and never build them up again."
PSM	28	6	David	#07		18972	" {6} Praise be to the Lord, for he has heard my cry for mercy."
PSM	28	7	David	#07		18973	" {7} The Lord is my strength and my shield; my heart trusts in him, and I am helped. My heart leaps for joy and I will give thanks to him in song."

PSM	29	4	David	#07		18980	 {4} The voice of the Lord is powerful; the voice of the Lord is majestic. 
PSM	29	5	David	#07		18981	" {5} The voice of the Lord breaks the cedars; the Lord breaks in pieces the cedars of Lebanon. {6} He makes Lebanon skip like a calf, Sirion like a young wild ox."
PSM	29	7	David	#07		18982	 {7} The voice of the Lord strikes with flashes of lightning. {8} The voice of the Lord shakes the desert; the Lord shakes the Desert of Kadesh.
PSM	29	9	David	#07		18983	" {9} The voice of the Lord twists the oaks and strips the forests bare. And in his temple all cry, Glory!"

PSM	30	<<	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		18986	PSALM 30
PSM	30	0	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		18987	 A psalm. A song. For the dedication of the temple. Of David.
PSM	30	1	David	#07		18988	" {1} I will exalt you, O Lord, for you lifted me out of the depths and did not let my enemies gloat over me."
PSM	30	2	David	#07		18989	" {2} O Lord my God, I called to you for help and you healed me. {3} O Lord, you brought me up from the grave; you spared me from going down into the pit."
PSM	30	4	David	#07		18990	" {4} Sing to the Lord, you saints of his; praise his holy name."
PSM	30	5	David	#07		18991	" {5} For his anger lasts only a moment, but his favor lasts a lifetime; weeping may remain for a night, but rejoicing comes in the morning."
PSM	30	6	David	#07		18992	" {6} When I felt secure, I said, << I will never be shaken.>>"
PSM	30	7	David	#07		18993	" {7} O Lord, when you favored me, you made my mountain stand firm; but when you hid your face, I was dismayed."
PSM	30	8	David	#07		18994	" {8} To you, O Lord, I called; to the Lord I cried for mercy:"
PSM	30	9	David	#07		18995	" {9} << What gain is there in my destruction, in my going down into the pit? Will the dust praise you? Will it proclaim your faithfulness?"
PSM	30	10	David	#07		18996	" {10} Hear, O Lord, and be merciful to me; O Lord, be my help.>>"
PSM	30	11	David	#07		18997	" {11} You turned my wailing into dancing; you removed my sackcloth and clothed me with joy, {12} that my heart may sing to you and not be silent. "
PSM	30	12	David	#07		18998	" O Lord my God, I will give you thanks forever.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
PSM	31	<<	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		18999	PSALM 31
PSM	31	0	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		19000	 For the director of music. A psalm of David.
PSM	31	1	David	#07		19001	" {1} In you, O Lord, I have taken refuge; let me never be put to shame; deliver me in your righteousness."
PSM	31	2	David	#07		19002	" {2} Turn your ear to me, come quickly to my rescue; be my rock of refuge, a strong fortress to save me."
PSM	31	3	David	#07		19003	" {3} Since you are my rock and my fortress, for the sake of your name lead and guide me. {4} Free me from the trap that is set for me, for you are my refuge."
PSM	31	5	David	#07		19004	" {5} Into your hands I commit my spirit; redeem me, O Lord, the God of truth."
PSM	31	6	David	#07		19005	 {6} I hate those who cling to worthless idols; I trust in the Lord.
PSM	31	7	David	#07		19006	" {7} I will be glad and rejoice in your love, for you saw my affliction and knew the anguish of my soul."
PSM	31	8	David	#07		19007	 {8} You have not handed me over to the enemy but have set my feet in a spacious place.
PSM	31	9	David	#07		19008	" {9} Be merciful to me, O Lord, for I am in distress; my eyes grow weak with sorrow, my soul and my body with grief."
PSM	31	10	David	#07		19009	" {10} My life is consumed by anguish and my years by groaning; my strength fails because of my affliction, and my bones grow weak."
PSM	31	11	David	#07		19010	" {11} Because of all my enemies, I am the utter contempt of my neighbors; I am a dread to my friends-- those who see me on the street flee from me."
PSM	31	12	David	#07		19011	 {12} I am forgotten by them as though I were dead; I have become like broken pottery.
PSM	31	13	David	#07		19012	 {13} For I hear the slander of many; there is terror on every side; they conspire against me and plot to take my life.
PSM	31	14	David	#07		19013	" {14} But I trust in you, O Lord; I say, << You are my God.>> {15} My times are in your hands; deliver me from my enemies and from those who pursue me."
PSM	31	16	David	#07		19014	 {16} Let your face shine on your servant; save me in your unfailing love.
PSM	31	17	David	#07		19015	" {17} Let me not be put to shame, O Lord, for I have cried out to you; but let the wicked be put to shame and lie silent in the grave."
PSM	31	18	David	#07		19016	" {18} Let their lying lips be silenced, for with pride and contempt they speak arrogantly against the righteous."
PSM	31	19	David	#07		19017	" {19} How great is your goodness, which you have stored up for those who fear you, which you bestow in the sight of men on those who take refuge in you."
PSM	31	20	David	#07		19018	 {20} In the shelter of your presence you hide them from the intrigues of men; in your dwelling you keep them safe from accusing tongues.
PSM	31	21	David	#07		19019	" {21} Praise be to the Lord, for he showed his wonderful love to me when I was in a besieged city."
PSM	31	22	David	#07		19020	" {22} In my alarm I said, << I am cut off from your sight! >> Yet you heard my cry for mercy when I called to you for help."
PSM	31	23	David	#07		19021	" {23} Love the Lord, all his saints! The Lord preserves the faithful, but the proud he pays back in full."
PSM	31	24	David	#07		19022	" {24} Be strong and take heart, all you who hope in the Lord.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
PSM	32	<<	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		19023	PSALM 32
PSM	32	0	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		19024	 Of David. A maskil.
PSM	32	1	David	#07		19025	" {1} Blessed is he whose transgressions are forgiven, whose sins are covered. {2} Blessed is the man whose sin the Lord does not count against him and in whose spirit is no deceit."
PSM	32	3	David	#07		19026	" {3} When I kept silent, my bones wasted away through my groaning all day long. {4} For day and night your hand was heavy upon me; my strength was sapped as in the heat of summer. Selah"
PSM	32	5	David	#07		19027	" {5} Then I acknowledged my sin to you and did not cover up my iniquity. I said, << I will confess my transgressions to the Lord>> -- and you forgave the guilt of my sin. Selah"
PSM	32	6	David	#07		19028	" {6} Therefore let everyone who is godly pray to you while you may be found; surely when the mighty waters rise, they will not reach him."
PSM	32	7	David	#07		19029	 {7} You are my hiding place; you will protect me from trouble and surround me with songs of deliverance. Selah
PSM	32	8	David	#07		19030	 {8} I will instruct you and teach you in the way you should go; I will counsel you and watch over you.
PSM	32	9	David	#07		19031	" {9} Do not be like the horse or the mule, which have no understanding but must be controlled by bit and bridle or they will not come to you."
PSM	32	10	David	#07		19032	" {10} Many are the woes of the wicked, but the Lord's unfailing love surrounds the man who trusts in him."
PSM	32	11	David	#07		19033	" {11} Rejoice in the Lord and be glad, you righteous; sing, all you who are upright in heart!*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
PSM	33	<<	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		19034	PSALM 33
PSM	33	1	Psalmist	#09		19035	" {1} Sing joyfully to the Lord, you righteous; it is fitting for the upright to praise him."
PSM	33	2	Psalmist	#09		19036	 {2} Praise the Lord with the harp; make music to him on the ten-stringed lyre.
PSM	33	3	Psalmist	#09		19037	" {3} Sing to him a new song; play skillfully, and shout for joy."
PSM	33	4	Psalmist	#09		19038	 {4} For the word of the Lord is right and true; he is faithful in all he does.
PSM	33	5	Psalmist	#09		19039	 {5} The Lord loves righteousness and justice; the earth is full of his unfailing love.
PSM	33	6	Psalmist	#09		19040	" {6} By the word of the Lord were the heavens made, their starry host by the breath of his mouth."
PSM	33	7	Psalmist	#09		19041	 {7} He gathers the waters of the sea into jars; he puts the deep into storehouses.
PSM	33	8	Psalmist	#09		19042	 {8} Let all the earth fear the Lord; let all the people of the world revere him.
PSM	33	9	Psalmist	#09		19043	" {9} For he spoke, and it came to be; he commanded, and it stood firm."
PSM	33	10	Psalmist	#09		19044	 {10} The Lord foils the plans of the nations; he thwarts the purposes of the peoples.
PSM	33	11	Psalmist	#09		19045	" {11} But the plans of the Lord stand firm forever, the purposes of his heart through all generations."
PSM	33	12	Psalmist	#09		19046	" {12} Blessed is the nation whose God is the Lord, the people he chose for his inheritance."
PSM	33	13	Psalmist	#09		19047	 {13} From heaven the Lord looks down and sees all mankind;
PSM	33	14	Psalmist	#09		19048	" {14} from his dwelling place he watches all who live on earth-- {15} he who forms the hearts of all, who considers everything they do."
PSM	33	16	Psalmist	#09		19049	 {16} No king is saved by the size of his army; no warrior escapes by his great strength.
PSM	33	17	Psalmist	#09		19050	 {17} A horse is a vain hope for deliverance; despite all its great strength it cannot save.
PSM	33	18	Psalmist	#09		19051	" {18} But the eyes of the Lord are on those who fear him, on those whose hope is in his unfailing love, {19} to deliver them from death and keep them alive in famine."
PSM	33	20	Psalmist	#09		19052	 {20} We wait in hope for the Lord; he is our help and our shield.
PSM	33	21	Psalmist	#09		19053	" {21} In him our hearts rejoice, for we trust in his holy name."
PSM	33	22	Psalmist	#09		19054	" {22} May your unfailing love rest upon us, O Lord, even as we put our hope in you.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
PSM	34	<<	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		19055	PSALM 34
PSM	34	0	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		19056	" Of David. When he pretended to be insane before Abimelech, who drove him away, and he left."
PSM	34	1	David	#07		19057	 {1} I will extol the Lord at all times; his praise will always be on my lips. {2} My soul will boast in the Lord; let the afflicted hear and rejoice.
PSM	34	3	David	#07		19058	 {3} Glorify the Lord with me; let us exalt his name together.
PSM	34	4	David	#07		19059	" {4} I sought the Lord, and he answered me; he delivered me from all my fears. {5} Those who look to him are radiant; their faces are never covered with shame."
PSM	34	6	David	#07		19060	" {6} This poor man called, and the Lord heard him; he saved him out of all his troubles. {7} The angel of the Lord encamps around those who fear him, and he delivers them."
PSM	34	8	David	#07		19061	" {8} Taste and see that the Lord is good; blessed is the man who takes refuge in him. {9} Fear the Lord, you his saints, for those who fear him lack nothing."
PSM	34	10	David	#07		19062	" {10} The lions may grow weak and hungry, but those who seek the Lord lack no good thing."
PSM	34	11	David	#07		19063	" {11} Come, my children, listen to me; I will teach you the fear of the Lord."
PSM	34	12	David	#07		19064	" {12} Whoever of you loves life and desires to see many good days, {13} keep your tongue from evil and your lips from speaking lies. {14} Turn from evil and do good; seek peace and pursue it."
PSM	34	15	David	#07		19065	" {15} The eyes of the Lord are on the righteous and his ears are attentive to their cry; {16} the face of the Lord is against those who do evil, to cut off the memory of them from the earth."
PSM	34	17	David	#07		19066	" {17} The righteous cry out, and the Lord hears them; he delivers them from all their troubles. {18} The Lord is close to the brokenhearted and saves those who are crushed in spirit."
PSM	34	19	David	#07		19067	" {19} A righteous man may have many troubles, but the Lord delivers him from them all; {20} he protects all his bones, not one of them will be broken."
PSM	34	21	David	#07		19068	 {21} Evil will slay the wicked; the foes of the righteous will be condemned.
PSM	34	22	David	#07		19069	 {22} The Lord redeems his servants; no one will be condemned who takes refuge in him.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
PSM	35	<<	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		19070	PSALM 35
PSM	35	0	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		19071	 Of David.
PSM	35	1	David	#07		19072	" {1} Contend, O Lord, with those who contend with me; fight against those who fight against me."
PSM	35	2	David	#07		19073	" {2} Take up shield and buckler; arise and come to my aid. {3} Brandish spear and javelin against those who pursue me. Say to my soul, << I am your salvation.>>"
PSM	35	4	David	#07		19074	 {4} May those who seek my life be disgraced and put to shame; may those who plot my ruin be turned back in dismay.
PSM	35	5	David	#07		19075	" {5} May they be like chaff before the wind, with the angel of the Lord driving them away; {6} may their path be dark and slippery, with the angel of the Lord pursuing them."
PSM	35	7	David	#07		19076	" {7} Since they hid their net for me without cause and without cause dug a pit for me, {8} may ruin overtake them by surprise-- "
PSM	35	8	David	#07		19077	" may the net they hid entangle them, may they fall into the pit, to their ruin."
PSM	35	9	David	#07		19078	 {9} Then my soul will rejoice in the Lord and delight in his salvation.
PSM	35	10	David	#07		19079	" {10} My whole being will exclaim, << Who is like you, O Lord? You rescue the poor from those too strong for them, the poor and needy from those who rob them.>>"
PSM	35	11	David	#07		19080	 {11} Ruthless witnesses come forward; they question me on things I know nothing about. {12} They repay me evil for good and leave my soul forlorn.
PSM	35	13	David	#07		19081	" {13} Yet when they were ill, I put on sackcloth and humbled myself with fasting. "
PSM	35	13	David	#07		19082	" When my prayers returned to me unanswered, {14} I went about mourning as though for my friend or brother. I bowed my head in grief as though weeping for my mother."
PSM	35	15	David	#07		19083	" {15} But when I stumbled, they gathered in glee; attackers gathered against me when I was unaware. They slandered me without ceasing."
PSM	35	16	David	#07		19084	 {16} Like the ungodly they maliciously mocked; they gnashed their teeth at me.
PSM	35	17	David	#07		19085	" {17} O Lord, how long will you look on? Rescue my life from their ravages, my precious life from these lions."
PSM	35	18	David	#07		19086	 {18} I will give you thanks in the great assembly; among throngs of people I will praise you.
PSM	35	19	David	#07		19087	 {19} Let not those gloat over me who are my enemies without cause; let not those who hate me without reason maliciously wink the eye.
PSM	35	20	David	#07		19088	" {20} They do not speak peaceably, but devise false accusations against those who live quietly in the land. {21} They gape at me and say,"
PSM	35	21	Man	#15		19089	 << Aha! Aha! With our own eyes we have seen it.>>
PSM	35	22	David	#07		19090	" {22} O Lord, you have seen this; be not silent. Do not be far from me, O Lord. {23} Awake, and rise to my defense! Contend for me, my God and Lord."
PSM	35	24	David	#07		19091	" {24} Vindicate me in your righteousness, O Lord my God; do not let them gloat over me. {25} Do not let them think,"
PSM	35	25	Man	#04		19092	" << Aha, just what we wanted! >>"
PSM	35	25	David	#07		19093	" or say,"
PSM	35	25	Man	#04		19094	 << We have swallowed him up.>>
PSM	35	26	David	#07		19095	 {26} May all who gloat over my distress be put to shame and confusion; may all who exalt themselves over me be clothed with shame and disgrace.
PSM	35	27	David	#07		19096	" {27} May those who delight in my vindication shout for joy and gladness; may they always say,"
PSM	35	27	Man	#03		19097	" << The Lord be exalted, who delights in the well-being of his servant.>>"
PSM	35	28	David	#07		19098	 {28} My tongue will speak of your righteousness and of your praises all day long.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
PSM	36	<<	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		19099	PSALM 36
PSM	36	0	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		19100	 For the director of music. Of David the servant of the Lord.
PSM	36	1	David	#07		19101	 {1} An oracle is within my heart concerning the sinfulness of the wicked: There is no fear of God before his eyes.
PSM	36	2	David	#07		19102	 {2} For in his own eyes he flatters himself too much to detect or hate his sin. {3} The words of his mouth are wicked and deceitful; he has ceased to be wise and to do good.
PSM	36	4	David	#07		19103	 {4} Even on his bed he plots evil; he commits himself to a sinful course and does not reject what is wrong.
PSM	36	5	David	#07		19104	" {5} Your love, O Lord, reaches to the heavens, your faithfulness to the skies."
PSM	36	6	David	#07		19105	" {6} Your righteousness is like the mighty mountains, your justice like the great deep. O Lord, you preserve both man and beast."
PSM	36	7	David	#07		19106	 {7} How priceless is your unfailing love! Both high and low among men find refuge in the shadow of your wings.
PSM	36	8	David	#07		19107	 {8} They feast on the abundance of your house; you give them drink from your river of delights. {9} For with you is the fountain of life; in your light we see light.
PSM	36	10	David	#07		19108	" {10} Continue your love to those who know you, your righteousness to the upright in heart."
PSM	36	11	David	#07		19109	" {11} May the foot of the proud not come against me, nor the hand of the wicked drive me away."
PSM	36	12	David	#07		19110	" {12} See how the evildoers lie fallen-- thrown down, not able to rise!*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
PSM	37	<<	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		19111	PSALM 37
PSM	37	0	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		19112	 Of David.
PSM	37	1	David	#07		19113	" {1} Do not fret because of evil men or be envious of those who do wrong; {2} for like the grass they will soon wither, like green plants they will soon die away."
PSM	37	3	David	#07		19114	 {3} Trust in the Lord and do good; dwell in the land and enjoy safe pasture. {4} Delight yourself in the Lord and he will give you the desires of your heart.
PSM	37	5	David	#07		19115	" {5} Commit your way to the Lord; trust in him and he will do this: {6} He will make your righteousness shine like the dawn, the justice of your cause like the noonday sun."
PSM	37	7	David	#07		19116	" {7} Be still before the Lord and wait patiently for him; do not fret when men succeed in their ways, when they carry out their wicked schemes."
PSM	37	8	David	#07		19117	" {8} Refrain from anger and turn from wrath; do not fret--it leads only to evil. {9} For evil men will be cut off, but those who hope in the Lord will inherit the land."
PSM	37	10	David	#07		19118	" {10} A little while, and the wicked will be no more; though you look for them, they will not be found. {11} But the meek will inherit the land and enjoy great peace."
PSM	37	12	David	#07		19119	" {12} The wicked plot against the righteous and gnash their teeth at them; {13} but the Lord laughs at the wicked, for he knows their day is coming."
PSM	37	14	David	#07		19120	" {14} The wicked draw the sword and bend the bow to bring down the poor and needy, to slay those whose ways are upright."
PSM	37	15	David	#07		19121	" {15} But their swords will pierce their own hearts, and their bows will be broken. "
PSM	37	16	David	#07		19122	" {16} Better the little that the righteous have than the wealth of many wicked; {17} for the power of the wicked will be broken, but the Lord upholds the righteous."
PSM	37	18	David	#07		19123	" {18} The days of the blameless are known to the Lord, and their inheritance will endure forever."
PSM	37	19	David	#07		19124	 {19} In times of disaster they will not wither; in days of famine they will enjoy plenty.
PSM	37	20	David	#07		19125	" {20} But the wicked will perish: The Lord's enemies will be like the beauty of the fields, they will vanish--vanish like smoke."
PSM	37	21	David	#07		19126	" {21} The wicked borrow and do not repay, but the righteous give generously; {22} those the Lord blesses will inherit the land, but those he curses will be cut off."
PSM	37	23	David	#07		19127	" {23} If the Lord delights in a man's way, he makes his steps firm; {24} though he stumble, he will not fall, for the Lord upholds him with his hand."
PSM	37	25	David	#07		19128	" {25} I was young and now I am old, yet I have never seen the righteous forsaken or their children begging bread."
PSM	37	26	David	#07		19129	 {26} They are always generous and lend freely; their children will be blessed.
PSM	37	27	David	#07		19130	 {27} Turn from evil and do good; then you will dwell in the land forever.
PSM	37	28	David	#07		19131	" {28} For the Lord loves the just and will not forsake his faithful ones. They will be protected forever, but the offspring of the wicked will be cut off;"
PSM	37	29	David	#07		19132	 {29} the righteous will inherit the land and dwell in it forever.
PSM	37	30	David	#07		19133	" {30} The mouth of the righteous man utters wisdom, and his tongue speaks what is just. {31} The law of his God is in his heart; his feet do not slip."
PSM	37	32	David	#07		19134	" {32} The wicked lie in wait for the righteous, seeking their very lives; {33} but the Lord will not leave them in their power or let them be condemned when brought to trial."
PSM	37	34	David	#07		19135	" {34} Wait for the Lord and keep his way. He will exalt you to inherit the land; when the wicked are cut off, you will see it."
PSM	37	35	David	#07		19136	" {35} I have seen a wicked and ruthless man flourishing like a green tree in its native soil, {36} but he soon passed away and was no more; though I looked for him, he could not be found."
PSM	37	37	David	#07		19137	" {37} Consider the blameless, observe the upright; there is a future for the man of peace. {38} But all sinners will be destroyed; the future of the wicked will be cut off."
PSM	37	39	David	#07		19138	 {39} The salvation of the righteous comes from the Lord; he is their stronghold in time of trouble.
PSM	37	40	David	#07		19139	" {40} The Lord helps them and delivers them; he delivers them from the wicked and saves them, because they take refuge in him.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
PSM	38	<<	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		19140	PSALM 38
PSM	38	0	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		19141	 A psalm of David. A petition.
PSM	38	1	David	#07		19142	" {1} O Lord, do not rebuke me in your anger or discipline me in your wrath. {2} For your arrows have pierced me, and your hand has come down upon me."
PSM	38	3	David	#07		19143	 {3} Because of your wrath there is no health in my body; my bones have no soundness because of my sin.
PSM	38	4	David	#07		19144	 {4} My guilt has overwhelmed me like a burden too heavy to bear. {5} My wounds fester and are loathsome because of my sinful folly.
PSM	38	6	David	#07		19145	 {6} I am bowed down and brought very low; all day long I go about mourning. {7} My back is filled with searing pain; there is no health in my body.
PSM	38	8	David	#07		19146	" {8} I am feeble and utterly crushed; I groan in anguish of heart. {9} All my longings lie open before you, O Lord; my sighing is not hidden from you."
PSM	38	10	David	#07		19147	" {10} My heart pounds, my strength fails me; even the light has gone from my eyes. {11} My friends and companions avoid me because of my wounds; my neighbors stay far away."
PSM	38	12	David	#07		19148	" {12} Those who seek my life set their traps, those who would harm me talk of my ruin; all day long they plot deception."
PSM	38	13	David	#07		19149	" {13} I am like a deaf man, who cannot hear, like a mute, who cannot open his mouth; {14} I have become like a man who does not hear, whose mouth can offer no reply."
PSM	38	15	David	#07		19150	" {15} I wait for you, O Lord; you will answer, O Lord my God. {16} For I said, << Do not let them gloat or exalt themselves over me when my foot slips.>>"
PSM	38	17	David	#07		19151	" {17} For I am about to fall, and my pain is ever with me. {18} I confess my iniquity; I am troubled by my sin."
PSM	38	19	David	#07		19152	 {19} Many are those who are my vigorous enemies; those who hate me without reason are numerous.
PSM	38	20	David	#07		19153	 {20} Those who repay my good with evil slander me when I pursue what is good.
PSM	38	21	David	#07		19154	" {21} O Lord, do not forsake me; be not far from me, O my God. {22} Come quickly to help me, O Lord my Savior.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
PSM	39	<<	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		19155	PSALM 39
PSM	39	0	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		19156	 For the director of music. For Jeduthun. A psalm of David.
PSM	39	1	David	#07		19157	" {1} I said, << I will watch my ways and keep my tongue from sin; I will put a muzzle on my mouth as long as the wicked are in my presence.>>"
PSM	39	2	David	#07		19158	" {2} But when I was silent and still, not even saying anything good, my anguish increased."
PSM	39	3	David	#07		19159	" {3} My heart grew hot within me, and as I meditated, the fire burned; then I spoke with my tongue:"
PSM	39	4	David	#07		19160	" {4} << Show me, O Lord, my life's end and the number of my days; let me know how fleeting is my life."
PSM	39	5	David	#07		19161	 {5} You have made my days a mere handbreadth; the span of my years is as nothing before you. Each man's life is but a breath. Selah
PSM	39	6	David	#07		19162	" {6} Man is a mere phantom as he goes to and fro: He bustles about, but only in vain; he heaps up wealth, not knowing who will get it."
PSM	39	7	David	#07		19163	" {7} << But now, Lord, what do I look for? My hope is in you. {8} Save me from all my transgressions; do not make me the scorn of fools."
PSM	39	9	David	#07		19164	" {9} I was silent; I would not open my mouth, for you are the one who has done this. {10} Remove your scourge from me; I am overcome by the blow of your hand."
PSM	39	11	David	#07		19165	 {11} You rebuke and discipline men for their sin; you consume their wealth like a moth-- each man is but a breath. Selah
PSM	39	12	David	#07		19166	" {12} << Hear my prayer, O Lord, listen to my cry for help; be not deaf to my weeping. For I dwell with you as an alien, a stranger, as all my fathers were."
PSM	39	13	David	#07		19167	" {13} Look away from me, that I may rejoice again before I depart and am no more.>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
PSM	40	<<	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		19168	PSALM 40
PSM	40	0	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		19169	 For the director of music. Of David. A psalm.
PSM	40	1	David	#07		19170	 {1} I waited patiently for the Lord; he turned to me and heard my cry.
PSM	40	2	David	#07		19171	" {2} He lifted me out of the slimy pit, out of the mud and mire; he set my feet on a rock and gave me a firm place to stand."
PSM	40	3	David	#07		19172	" {3} He put a new song in my mouth, a hymn of praise to our God. Many will see and fear and put their trust in the Lord."
PSM	40	4	David	#07		19173	" {4} Blessed is the man who makes the Lord his trust, who does not look to the proud, to those who turn aside to false gods."
PSM	40	5	David	#07		19174	" {5} Many, O Lord my God, are the wonders you have done. The things you planned for us no one can recount to you; were I to speak and tell of them, they would be too many to declare."
PSM	40	6	David	#07		19175	" {6} Sacrifice and offering you did not desire, but my ears you have pierced; burnt offerings and sin offerings you did not require."
PSM	40	7	David	#07		19176	" {7} Then I said, << Here I am, I have come-- it is written about me in the scroll. {8} I desire to do your will, O my God; your law is within my heart.>>"
PSM	40	9	David	#07		19177	" {9} I proclaim righteousness in the great assembly; I do not seal my lips, as you know, O Lord."
PSM	40	10	David	#07		19178	 {10} I do not hide your righteousness in my heart; I speak of your faithfulness and salvation. I do not conceal your love and your truth from the great assembly.
PSM	40	11	David	#07		19179	" {11} Do not withhold your mercy from me, O Lord; may your love and your truth always protect me."
PSM	40	12	David	#07		19180	" {12} For troubles without number surround me; my sins have overtaken me, and I cannot see. They are more than the hairs of my head, and my heart fails within me."
PSM	40	13	David	#07		19181	" {13} Be pleased, O Lord, to save me; O Lord, come quickly to help me."
PSM	40	14	David	#07		19182	 {14} May all who seek to take my life be put to shame and confusion; may all who desire my ruin be turned back in disgrace.
PSM	40	15	David	#07		19183	" {15} May those who say to me, << Aha! Aha! >> be appalled at their own shame. {16} But may all who seek you rejoice and be glad in you; may those who love your salvation always say,"
PSM	40	16	Man	#03		19184	 << The Lord be exalted!>>
PSM	40	17	David	#07		19185	" {17} Yet I am poor and needy; may the Lord think of me. You are my help and my deliverer; O my God, do not delay.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
PSM	41	<<	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		19186	PSALM 41
PSM	41	0	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		19187	 For the director of music. A psalm of David.
PSM	41	1	David	#07		19188	 {1} Blessed is he who has regard for the weak; the Lord delivers him in times of trouble.
PSM	41	2	David	#07		19189	 {2} The Lord will protect him and preserve his life; he will bless him in the land and not surrender him to the desire of his foes.
PSM	41	3	David	#07		19190	 {3} The Lord will sustain him on his sickbed and restore him from his bed of illness.
PSM	41	4	David	#07		19191	" {4} I said, << O Lord, have mercy on me; heal me, for I have sinned against you.>> {5} My enemies say of me in malice,"
PSM	41	5	Enemy	#12		19192	 << When will he die and his name perish?>>
PSM	41	6	David	#07		19193	" {6} Whenever one comes to see me, he speaks falsely, while his heart gathers slander; then he goes out and spreads it abroad."
PSM	41	7	David	#07		19194	" {7} All my enemies whisper together against me; they imagine the worst for me, saying,"
PSM	41	8	Enemy	#15		19195	 {8} << A vile disease has beset him; he will never get up from the place where he lies.>>
PSM	41	9	David	#07		19196	" {9} Even my close friend, whom I trusted, he who shared my bread, has lifted up his heel against me. {10} But you, O Lord, have mercy on me; raise me up, that I may repay them."
PSM	41	11	David	#07		19197	" {11} I know that you are pleased with me, for my enemy does not triumph over me. {12} In my integrity you uphold me and set me in your presence forever."
PSM	41	13	David	#07		19198	" {13} Praise be to the Lord, the God of Israel, from everlasting to everlasting. Amen and Amen.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"

PSM	42	1	Son of Korah	#11		19201	" {1} As the deer pants for streams of water, so my soul pants for you, O God."
PSM	42	2	Son of Korah	#11		19202	" {2} My soul thirsts for God, for the living God. When can I go and meet with God?"
PSM	42	3	Son of Korah	#11		19203	" {3} My tears have been my food day and night, while men say to me all day long,"

PSM	42	4	Son of Korah	#11		19205	" {4} These things I remember as I pour out my soul: how I used to go with the multitude, leading the procession to the house of God, with shouts of joy and thanksgiving among the festive throng."
PSM	42	5	Son of Korah	#11		19206	" {5} Why are you downcast, O my soul? Why so disturbed within me? Put your hope in God, for I will yet praise him, my Savior and {6} my God. "

PSM	44	<<	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		19220	PSALM 44
PSM	44	0	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		19221	 For the director of music. Of the Sons of Korah. A maskil.
PSM	44	1	Son of Korah	#11		19222	" {1} We have heard with our ears, O God; our fathers have told us what you did in their days, in days long ago."
PSM	44	2	Son of Korah	#11		19223	 {2} With your hand you drove out the nations and planted our fathers; you crushed the peoples and made our fathers flourish.
PSM	44	3	Son of Korah	#11		19224	" {3} It was not by their sword that they won the land, nor did their arm bring them victory; it was your right hand, your arm, and the light of your face, for you loved them."
PSM	44	4	Son of Korah	#11		19225	" {4} You are my King and my God, who decrees victories for Jacob."
PSM	44	5	Son of Korah	#11		19226	 {5} Through you we push back our enemies; through your name we trample our foes.
PSM	44	6	Son of Korah	#11		19227	" {6} I do not trust in my bow, my sword does not bring me victory; {7} but you give us victory over our enemies, you put our adversaries to shame."
PSM	44	8	Son of Korah	#11		19228	" {8} In God we make our boast all day long, and we will praise your name forever. Selah"
PSM	44	9	Son of Korah	#11		19229	 {9} But now you have rejected and humbled us; you no longer go out with our armies.
PSM	44	10	Son of Korah	#11		19230	" {10} You made us retreat before the enemy, and our adversaries have plundered us."
PSM	44	11	Son of Korah	#11		19231	 {11} You gave us up to be devoured like sheep and have scattered us among the nations.
PSM	44	12	Son of Korah	#11		19232	" {12} You sold your people for a pittance, gaining nothing from their sale."
PSM	44	13	Son of Korah	#11		19233	" {13} You have made us a reproach to our neighbors, the scorn and derision of those around us."
PSM	44	14	Son of Korah	#11		19234	 {14} You have made us a byword among the nations; the peoples shake their heads at us.
PSM	44	15	Son of Korah	#11		19235	" {15} My disgrace is before me all day long, and my face is covered with shame {16} at the taunts of those who reproach and revile me, because of the enemy, who is bent on revenge."
PSM	44	17	Son of Korah	#11		19236	" {17} All this happened to us, though we had not forgotten you or been false to your covenant."
PSM	44	18	Son of Korah	#11		19237	 {18} Our hearts had not turned back; our feet had not strayed from your path.
PSM	44	19	Son of Korah	#11		19238	 {19} But you crushed us and made us a haunt for jackals and covered us over with deep darkness.
PSM	44	20	Son of Korah	#11		19239	" {20} If we had forgotten the name of our God or spread out our hands to a foreign god, {21} would not God have discovered it, since he knows the secrets of the heart?"
PSM	44	22	Son of Korah	#11		19240	 {22} Yet for your sake we face death all day long; we are considered as sheep to be slaughtered.
PSM	44	23	Son of Korah	#11		19241	" {23} Awake, O Lord! Why do you sleep? Rouse yourself! Do not reject us forever."
PSM	44	24	Son of Korah	#11		19242	 {24} Why do you hide your face and forget our misery and oppression?
PSM	44	25	Son of Korah	#11		19243	 {25} We are brought down to the dust; our bodies cling to the ground.
PSM	44	26	Son of Korah	#11		19244	 {26} Rise up and help us; redeem us because of your unfailing love.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*

PSM	45	1	Son of Korah	#11		19247	 {1} My heart is stirred by a noble theme as I recite my verses for the king; my tongue is the pen of a skillful writer.
PSM	45	2	Son of Korah	#11		19248	" {2} You are the most excellent of men and your lips have been anointed with grace, since God has blessed you forever."
PSM	45	3	Son of Korah	#11		19249	" {3} Gird your sword upon your side, O mighty one; clothe yourself with splendor and majesty."
PSM	45	4	Son of Korah	#11		19250	" {4} In your majesty ride forth victoriously in behalf of truth, humility and righteousness; let your right hand display awesome deeds."
PSM	45	5	Son of Korah	#11		19251	 {5} Let your sharp arrows pierce the hearts of the king's enemies; let the nations fall beneath your feet.
PSM	45	6	Son of Korah	#11		19252	" {6} Your throne, O God, will last for ever and ever; a scepter of justice will be the scepter of your kingdom."
PSM	45	7	Son of Korah	#11		19253	" {7} You love righteousness and hate wickedness; therefore God, your God, has set you above your companions by anointing you with the oil of joy."
PSM	45	8	Son of Korah	#11		19254	 {8} All your robes are fragrant with myrrh and aloes and cassia; from palaces adorned with ivory the music of the strings makes you glad.
PSM	45	9	Son of Korah	#11		19255	 {9} Daughters of kings are among your honored women; at your right hand is the royal bride in gold of Ophir.
PSM	45	10	Son of Korah	#11		19256	" {10} Listen, O daughter, consider and give ear: Forget your people and your father's house."
PSM	45	11	Son of Korah	#11		19257	" {11} The king is enthralled by your beauty; honor him, for he is your lord."
PSM	45	12	Son of Korah	#11		19258	" {12} The Daughter of Tyre will come with a gift, men of wealth will seek your favor."
PSM	45	13	Son of Korah	#11		19259	 {13} All glorious is the princess within her chamber; her gown is interwoven with gold.
PSM	45	14	Son of Korah	#11		19260	 {14} In embroidered garments she is led to the king; her virgin companions follow her and are brought to you.
PSM	45	15	Son of Korah	#11		19261	 {15} They are led in with joy and gladness; they enter the palace of the king.
PSM	45	16	Son of Korah	#11		19262	 {16} Your sons will take the place of your fathers; you will make them princes throughout the land.
PSM	45	17	Son of Korah	#11		19263	 {17} I will perpetuate your memory through all generations; therefore the nations will praise you for ever and ever.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*

PSM	48	7	Son of Korah	#11		19295	 {7} You destroyed them like ships of Tarshish shattered by an east wind.
PSM	48	8	Son of Korah	#11		19296	" {8} As we have heard, so have we seen in the city of the Lord Almighty, in the city of our God: God makes her secure forever. Selah"

PSM	48	12	Son of Korah	#11		19300	" {12} Walk about Zion, go around her, count her towers, {13} consider well her ramparts, view her citadels, that you may tell of them to the next generation."

PSM	49	<<	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		19302	PSALM 49
PSM	49	0	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		19303	 For the director of music. Of the Sons of Korah. A psalm.
PSM	49	1	Son of Korah	#11		19304	" {1} Hear this, all you peoples; listen, all who live in this world, {2} both low and high, rich and poor alike:"
PSM	49	3	Son of Korah	#11		19305	 {3} My mouth will speak words of wisdom; the utterance from my heart will give understanding.
PSM	49	4	Son of Korah	#11		19306	 {4} I will turn my ear to a proverb; with the harp I will expound my riddle:
PSM	49	5	Son of Korah	#11		19307	" {5} Why should I fear when evil days come, when wicked deceivers surround meù {6} they that trust in their wealth and boast of their great riches?"
PSM	49	7	Son of Korah	#11		19308	 {7} No man can redeem the life of another or give to God a ransom for him--
PSM	49	8	Son of Korah	#11		19309	" {8} the ransom for a life is costly, no payment is ever enough-- {9} that he should live on forever and not see decay."
PSM	49	10	Son of Korah	#11		19310	 {10} For all can see that wise men die; the foolish and the senseless alike perish and leave their wealth to others.
PSM	49	11	Son of Korah	#11		19311	" {11} Their tombs will remain their houses forever, their dwellings for endless generations, though they had named lands after themselves."
PSM	49	12	Son of Korah	#11		19312	" {12} But man, despite his riches, does not endure; he is like the beasts that perish."
PSM	49	13	Son of Korah	#11		19313	" {13} This is the fate of those who trust in themselves, and of their followers, who approve their sayings. Selah"
PSM	49	14	Son of Korah	#11		19314	" {14} Like sheep they are destined for the grave, and death will feed on them. "
PSM	49	14	Son of Korah	#11		19315	" The upright will rule over them in the morning; their forms will decay in the grave, far from their princely mansions."
PSM	49	15	Son of Korah	#11		19316	 {15} But God will redeem my life from the grave; he will surely take me to himself. Selah
PSM	49	16	Son of Korah	#11		19317	" {16} Do not be overawed when a man grows rich, when the splendor of his house increases; {17} for he will take nothing with him when he dies, his splendor will not descend with him."
PSM	49	18	Son of Korah	#11		19318	" {18} Though while he lived he counted himself blessed-- and men praise you when you prosper-- {19} he will join the generation of his fathers, who will never see the light of life."
PSM	49	20	Son of Korah	#11		19319	 {20} A man who has riches without understanding is like the beasts that perish.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
PSM	50	<<	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		19320	PSALM 50
PSM	50	0	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		19321	 A psalm of Asaph.
PSM	50	1	Asaph	#01		19322	" {1} The Mighty One, God, the Lord, speaks and summons the earth from the rising of the sun to the place where it sets."
PSM	50	2	Asaph	#01		19323	" {2} From Zion, perfect in beauty, God shines forth. {3} Our God comes and will not be silent; a fire devours before him, and around him a tempest rages."
PSM	50	4	Asaph	#01		19324	" {4} He summons the heavens above, and the earth, that he may judge his people:"
PSM	50	5	God-FX1	#20		19325	" {5} << Gather to me my consecrated ones, who made a covenant with me by sacrifice.>>"
PSM	50	6	Asaph	#01		19326	" {6} And the heavens proclaim his righteousness, for God himself is judge. Selah"
PSM	50	7	God-FX1	#20		19327	" {7} << Hear, O my people, and I will speak, O Israel, and I will testify against you: I am God, your God."
PSM	50	8	God-FX1	#20		19328	" {8} I do not rebuke you for your sacrifices or your burnt offerings, which are ever before me."
PSM	50	9	God-FX1	#20		19329	" {9} I have no need of a bull from your stall or of goats from your pens, {10} for every animal of the forest is mine, and the cattle on a thousand hills."
PSM	50	11	God-FX1	#20		19330	" {11} I know every bird in the mountains, and the creatures of the field are mine. "
PSM	50	12	God-FX1	#20		19331	" {12} If I were hungry I would not tell you, for the world is mine, and all that is in it. {13} Do I eat the flesh of bulls or drink the blood of goats?"
PSM	50	14	God-FX1	#20		19332	" {14} Sacrifice thank offerings to God, fulfill your vows to the Most High, {15} and call upon me in the day of trouble; I will deliver you, and you will honor me.>>"
PSM	50	16	Asaph	#01		19333	" {16} But to the wicked, God says:"
PSM	50	16	God-FX1	#20		19334	 << What right have you to recite my laws or take my covenant on your lips? {17} You hate my instruction and cast my words behind you.
PSM	50	18	God-FX1	#20		19335	" {18} When you see a thief, you join with him; you throw in your lot with adulterers. {19} You use your mouth for evil and harness your tongue to deceit."
PSM	50	20	God-FX1	#20		19336	 {20} You speak continually against your brother and slander your own mother's son.
PSM	50	21	God-FX1	#20		19337	 {21} These things you have done and I kept silent; you thought I was altogether like you. But I will rebuke you and accuse you to your face.
PSM	50	22	God-FX1	#20		19338	" {22} << Consider this, you who forget God, or I will tear you to pieces, with none to rescue:"
PSM	50	23	God-FX1	#20		19339	" {23} He who sacrifices thank offerings honors me, and he prepares the way so that I may show him the salvation of God.>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
PSM	51	<<	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		19340	PSALM 51
PSM	51	0	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		19341	 For the director of music. A psalm of David. When the prophet Nathan came to him after David had committed adultery with Bathsheba.
PSM	51	1	David	#07		19342	" {1} Have mercy on me, O God, according to your unfailing love; according to your great compassion blot out my transgressions."
PSM	51	2	David	#07		19343	" {2} Wash away all my iniquity and cleanse me from my sin. {3} For I know my transgressions, and my sin is always before me."
PSM	51	4	David	#07		19344	" {4} Against you, you only, have I sinned and done what is evil in your sight, so that you are proved right when you speak and justified when you judge."
PSM	51	5	David	#07		19345	" {5} Surely I was sinful at birth, sinful from the time my mother conceived me."
PSM	51	6	David	#07		19346	 {6} Surely you desire truth in the inner parts; you teach me wisdom in the inmost place.
PSM	51	7	David	#07		19347	" {7} Cleanse me with hyssop, and I will be clean; wash me, and I will be whiter than snow. {8} Let me hear joy and gladness; let the bones you have crushed rejoice."
PSM	51	9	David	#07		19348	 {9} Hide your face from my sins and blot out all my iniquity.
PSM	51	10	David	#07		19349	" {10} Create in me a pure heart, O God, and renew a steadfast spirit within me. {11} Do not cast me from your presence or take your Holy Spirit from me."
PSM	51	12	David	#07		19350	" {12} Restore to me the joy of your salvation and grant me a willing spirit, to sustain me. {13} Then I will teach transgressors your ways, and sinners will turn back to you."
PSM	51	14	David	#07		19351	" {14} Save me from bloodguilt, O God, the God who saves me, and my tongue will sing of your righteousness."
PSM	51	15	David	#07		19352	" {15} O Lord, open my lips, and my mouth will declare your praise. {16} You do not delight in sacrifice, or I would bring it; you do not take pleasure in burnt offerings."
PSM	51	17	David	#07		19353	" {17} The sacrifices of God are a broken spirit; a broken and contrite heart, O God, you will not despise."
PSM	51	18	David	#07		19354	 {18} In your good pleasure make Zion prosper; build up the walls of Jerusalem.
PSM	51	19	David	#07		19355	" {19} Then there will be righteous sacrifices, whole burnt offerings to delight you; then bulls will be offered on your altar.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
PSM	52	<<	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		19356	PSALM 52
PSM	52	0	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		19357	 For the director of music. A maskil of David. When Doeg the Edomite had gone to Saul and told him: ôDavid has gone to the house of Ahimelech.ö
PSM	52	1	David	#07		19358	" {1} Why do you boast of evil, you mighty man? Why do you boast all day long, you who are a disgrace in the eyes of God?"
PSM	52	2	David	#07		19359	" {2} Your tongue plots destruction; it is like a sharpened razor, you who practice deceit."
PSM	52	3	David	#07		19360	" {3} You love evil rather than good, falsehood rather than speaking the truth. Selah {4} You love every harmful word, O you deceitful tongue!"
PSM	52	5	David	#07		19361	 {5} Surely God will bring you down to everlasting ruin: He will snatch you up and tear you from your tent; he will uproot you from the land of the living. Selah
PSM	52	6	David	#07		19362	" {6} The righteous will see and fear; they will laugh at him, saying,"
PSM	52	7	Man	#10		19363	 {7} << Here now is the man who did not make God his stronghold but trusted in his great wealth and grew strong by destroying others! >>
PSM	52	8	David	#07		19364	 {8} But I am like an olive tree flourishing in the house of God; I trust in God's unfailing love for ever and ever.
PSM	52	9	David	#07		19365	" {9} I will praise you forever for what you have done; in your name I will hope, for your name is good. I will praise you in the presence of your saints.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"

PSM	53	1	Fool	#12		19369	 << There is no God.>>
PSM	53	1	David	#07		19370	" They are corrupt, and their ways are vile; there is no one who does good."
PSM	53	2	David	#07		19371	" {2} God looks down from heaven on the sons of men to see if there are any who understand, any who seek God."
PSM	53	3	David	#07		19372	" {3} Everyone has turned away, they have together become corrupt; there is no one who does good, not even one."
PSM	53	4	David	#07		19373	 {4} Will the evildoers never learn-- those who devour my people as men eat bread and who do not call on God?
PSM	53	5	David	#07		19374	" {5} There they were, overwhelmed with dread, where there was nothing to dread. God scattered the bones of those who attacked you; you put them to shame, for God despised them."

PSM	55	<<	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		19383	PSALM 55
PSM	55	0	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		19384	 For the director of music. With stringed instruments. A maskil of David.
PSM	55	1	David	#07		19385	" {1} Listen to my prayer, O God, do not ignore my plea;"
PSM	55	2	David	#07		19386	" {2} hear me and answer me. My thoughts trouble me and I am distraught {3} at the voice of the enemy, at the stares of the wicked; for they bring down suffering upon me and revile me in their anger."
PSM	55	4	David	#07		19387	 {4} My heart is in anguish within me; the terrors of death assail me. {5} Fear and trembling have beset me; horror has overwhelmed me.
PSM	55	6	David	#07		19388	" {6} I said, << Oh, that I had the wings of a dove! I would fly away and be at rest-- {7} I would flee far away and stay in the desert; Selah"
PSM	55	8	David	#07		19389	" {8} I would hurry to my place of shelter, far from the tempest and storm.>>"
PSM	55	9	David	#07		19390	" {9} Confuse the wicked, O Lord, confound their speech, for I see violence and strife in the city."
PSM	55	10	David	#07		19391	 {10} Day and night they prowl about on its walls; malice and abuse are within it. {11} Destructive forces are at work in the city; threats and lies never leave its streets.
PSM	55	12	David	#07		19392	" {12} If an enemy were insulting me, I could endure it; if a foe were raising himself against me, I could hide from him."
PSM	55	13	David	#07		19393	" {13} But it is you, a man like myself, my companion, my close friend, {14} with whom I once enjoyed sweet fellowship as we walked with the throng at the house of God."
PSM	55	15	David	#07		19394	" {15} Let death take my enemies by surprise; let them go down alive to the grave, for evil finds lodging among them."
PSM	55	16	David	#07		19395	" {16} But I call to God, and the Lord saves me. {17} Evening, morning and noon I cry out in distress, and he hears my voice."
PSM	55	18	David	#07		19396	" {18} He ransoms me unharmed from the battle waged against me, even though many oppose me."
PSM	55	19	David	#07		19397	" {19} God, who is enthroned forever, will hear them and afflict them-- Selah men who never change their ways and have no fear of God."
PSM	55	20	David	#07		19398	 {20} My companion attacks his friends; he violates his covenant.
PSM	55	21	David	#07		19399	" {21} His speech is smooth as butter, yet war is in his heart; his words are more soothing than oil, yet they are drawn swords."
PSM	55	22	David	#07		19400	 {22} Cast your cares on the Lord and he will sustain you; he will never let the righteous fall.
PSM	55	23	David	#07		19401	" {23} But you, O God, will bring down the wicked into the pit of corruption; bloodthirsty and deceitful men will not live out half their days. But as for me, I trust in you.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"

PSM	56	0	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		19403	" For the director of music. To the tune of, ôA Dove on Distant Oaks.ö Of David. A miktam. When the Philistines had seized him in Gath."
PSM	56	1	David	#07		19404	" {1} Be merciful to me, O God, for men hotly pursue me; all day long they press their attack."
PSM	56	2	David	#07		19405	 {2} My slanderers pursue me all day long; many are attacking me in their pride.
PSM	56	3	David	#07		19406	" {3} When I am afraid, I will trust in you. {4} In God, whose word I praise, in God I trust; I will not be afraid. "
PSM	56	4	David	#07		19407	" What can mortal man do to me? {5} All day long they twist my words; they are always plotting to harm me. {6} They conspire, they lurk, they watch my steps, eager to take my life."
PSM	56	7	David	#07		19408	" {7} On no account let them escape; in your anger, O God, bring down the nations. {8} Record my lament; list my tears on your scroll-- are they not in your record?"
PSM	56	9	David	#07		19409	 {9} Then my enemies will turn back when I call for help. By this I will know that God is for me.
PSM	56	10	David	#07		19410	" {10} In God, whose word I praise, in the Lord, whose word I praise-- {11} in God I trust; I will not be afraid. What can man do to me?"
PSM	56	12	David	#07		19411	" {12} I am under vows to you, O God; I will present my thank offerings to you."
PSM	56	13	David	#07		19412	" {13} For you have delivered me from death and my feet from stumbling, that I may walk before God in the light of life.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"

PSM	57	4	David	#07		19418	" {4} I am in the midst of lions; I lie among ravenous beasts-- men whose teeth are spears and arrows, whose tongues are sharp swords."

PSM	58	0	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		19426	 For the director of music. To the tune of ôDo Not Destroy.ö Of David. A miktam.
PSM	58	1	David	#07		19427	" {1} Do you rulers indeed speak justly? Do you judge uprightly among men? {2} No, in your heart you devise injustice, and your hands mete out violence on the earth."
PSM	58	3	David	#07		19428	 {3} Even from birth the wicked go astray; from the womb they are wayward and speak lies.
PSM	58	4	David	#07		19429	" {4} Their venom is like the venom of a snake, like that of a cobra that has stopped its ears, {5} that will not heed the tune of the charmer, however skillful the enchanter may be."
PSM	58	6	David	#07		19430	" {6} Break the teeth in their mouths, O God; tear out, O Lord, the fangs of the lions! {7} Let them vanish like water that flows away; when they draw the bow, let their arrows be blunted."
PSM	58	8	David	#07		19431	" {8} Like a slug melting away as it moves along, like a stillborn child, may they not see the sun."
PSM	58	9	David	#07		19432	 {9} Before your pots can feel the heat of the thorns-- whether they be green or dry--the wicked will be swept away.
PSM	58	10	David	#07		19433	" {10} The righteous will be glad when they are avenged, when they bathe their feet in the blood of the wicked. {11} Then men will say,"
PSM	58	11	Man	#05		19434	 << Surely the righteous still are rewarded; surely there is a God who judges the earth.>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*

PSM	59	1	David	#07		19437	" {1} Deliver me from my enemies, O God; protect me from those who rise up against me. {2} Deliver me from evildoers and save me from bloodthirsty men."
PSM	59	3	David	#07		19438	" {3} See how they lie in wait for me! Fierce men conspire against me for no offense or sin of mine, O Lord."
PSM	59	4	David	#07		19439	" {4} I have done no wrong, yet they are ready to attack me. Arise to help me; look on my plight!"
PSM	59	5	David	#07		19440	" {5} O Lord God Almighty, the God of Israel, rouse yourself to punish all the nations; show no mercy to wicked traitors. Selah"
PSM	59	6	David	#07		19441	" {6} They return at evening, snarling like dogs, and prowl about the city."
PSM	59	7	David	#07		19442	" {7} See what they spew from their mouths-- they spew out swords from their lips, and they say, .<<Who can hear us?>>"
PSM	59	8	David	#07		19443	" {8} But you, O Lord, laugh at them; you scoff at all those nations."
PSM	59	9	David	#07		19444	" {9} O my Strength, I watch for you; you, O God, are my fortress, {10} my loving God. God will go before me and will let me gloat over those who slander me."
PSM	59	11	David	#07		19445	" {11} But do not kill them, O Lord our shield, or my people will forget. In your might make them wander about, and bring them down."
PSM	59	12	David	#07		19446	" {12} For the sins of their mouths, for the words of their lips, let them be caught in their pride."
PSM	59	12	David	#07		19447	" For the curses and lies they utter, {13} consume them in wrath, consume them till they are no more. Then it will be known to the ends of the earth that God rules over Jacob. Selah"
PSM	59	14	David	#07		19448	" {14} They return at evening, snarling like dogs, and prowl about the city. {15} They wander about for food and howl if not satisfied."
PSM	59	16	David	#07		19449	" {16} But I will sing of your strength, in the morning I will sing of your love; for you are my fortress, my refuge in times of trouble."
PSM	59	17	David	#07		19450	" {17} O my Strength, I sing praise to you; you, O God, are my fortress, my loving God.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"

PSM	63	1	David	#07		19483	" {1} O God, you are my God, earnestly I seek you; my soul thirsts for you, my body longs for you, in a dry and weary land where there is no water."
PSM	63	2	David	#07		19484	" {2} I have seen you in the sanctuary and beheld your power and your glory. {3} Because your love is better than life, my lips will glorify you."
PSM	63	4	David	#07		19485	" {4} I will praise you as long as I live, and in your name I will lift up my hands."
PSM	63	5	David	#07		19486	 {5} My soul will be satisfied as with the richest of foods; with singing lips my mouth will praise you.
PSM	63	6	David	#07		19487	 {6} On my bed I remember you; I think of you through the watches of the night.
PSM	63	7	David	#07		19488	" {7} Because you are my help, I sing in the shadow of your wings. {8} My soul clings to you; your right hand upholds me."
PSM	63	9	David	#07		19489	 {9} They who seek my life will be destroyed; they will go down to the depths of the earth. {10} They will be given over to the sword and become food for jackals.
PSM	63	11	David	#07		19490	" {11} But the king will rejoice in God; all who swear by God's name will praise him, while the mouths of liars will be silenced.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"

PSM	64	3	David	#07		19494	" {3} They sharpen their tongues like swords and aim their words like deadly arrows. {4} They shoot from ambush at the innocent man; they shoot at him suddenly, without fear."
PSM	64	5	David	#07		19495	" {5} They encourage each other in evil plans, they talk about hiding their snares; they say,"
