PSM	64	6	Man	#04		19498	 << We have devised a perfect plan! >>
PSM	64	6	David	#07		19499	 Surely the mind and heart of man are cunning. {7} But God will shoot them with arrows; suddenly they will be struck down.
PSM	64	8	David	#07		19500	 {8} He will turn their own tongues against them and bring them to ruin; all who see them will shake their heads in scorn.
PSM	64	9	David	#07		19501	 {9} All mankind will fear; they will proclaim the works of God and ponder what he has done.

PSM	65	<<	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		19503	PSALM 65
PSM	65	0	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		19504	 For the director of music. A psalm of David. A song.
PSM	65	1	David	#07		19505	" {1} Praise awaits you, O God, in Zion; to you our vows will be fulfilled. {2} O you who hear prayer, to you all men will come."
PSM	65	3	David	#07		19506	" {3} When we were overwhelmed by sins, you forgave our transgressions."
PSM	65	4	David	#07		19507	" {4} Blessed are those you choose and bring near to live in your courts! We are filled with the good things of your house, of your holy temple."
PSM	65	5	David	#07		19508	" {5} You answer us with awesome deeds of righteousness, O God our Savior, the hope of all the ends of the earth and of the farthest seas,"
PSM	65	6	David	#07		19509	" {6} who formed the mountains by your power, having armed yourself with strength, {7} who stilled the roaring of the seas, the roaring of their waves, and the turmoil of the nations."
PSM	65	8	David	#07		19510	 {8} Those living far away fear your wonders; where morning dawns and evening fades you call forth songs of joy.
PSM	65	9	David	#07		19511	" {9} You care for the land and water it; you enrich it abundantly. The streams of God are filled with water to provide the people with grain, for so you have ordained it."
PSM	65	10	David	#07		19512	 {10} You drench its furrows and level its ridges; you soften it with showers and bless its crops.
PSM	65	11	David	#07		19513	" {11} You crown the year with your bounty, and your carts overflow with abundance. {12} The grasslands of the desert overflow; the hills are clothed with gladness."
PSM	65	13	David	#07		19514	 {13} The meadows are covered with flocks and the valleys are mantled with grain; they shout for joy and sing.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
PSM	66	<<	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		19515	PSALM 66
PSM	66	0	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		19516	 For the director of music. A song. A psalm.
PSM	66	1	Psalmist	#09		19517	" {1} Shout with joy to God, all the earth! {2} Sing the glory of his name; make his praise glorious!"
PSM	66	3	Psalmist	#09		19518	" {3} Say to God, << How awesome are your deeds! So great is your power that your enemies cringe before you."
PSM	66	4	Psalmist	#09		19519	" {4} All the earth bows down to you; they sing praise to you, they sing praise to your name.>> Selah"
PSM	66	5	Psalmist	#09		19520	" {5} Come and see what God has done, how awesome his works in man's behalf!"
PSM	66	6	Psalmist	#09		19521	" {6} He turned the sea into dry land, they passed through the waters on foot-- come, let us rejoice in him."
PSM	66	7	Psalmist	#09		19522	" {7} He rules forever by his power, his eyes watch the nations-- let not the rebellious rise up against him. Selah"
PSM	66	8	Psalmist	#09		19523	" {8} Praise our God, O peoples, let the sound of his praise be heard; {9} he has preserved our lives and kept our feet from slipping."
PSM	66	10	Psalmist	#09		19524	" {10} For you, O God, tested us; you refined us like silver. {11} You brought us into prison and laid burdens on our backs."
PSM	66	12	Psalmist	#09		19525	" {12} You let men ride over our heads; we went through fire and water, but you brought us to a place of abundance."
PSM	66	13	Psalmist	#09		19526	 {13} I will come to your temple with burnt offerings and fulfill my vows to you-- {14} vows my lips promised and my mouth spoke when I was in trouble.
PSM	66	15	Psalmist	#09		19527	 {15} I will sacrifice fat animals to you and an offering of rams; I will offer bulls and goats. Selah
PSM	66	16	Psalmist	#09		19528	" {16} Come and listen, all you who fear God; let me tell you what he has done for me."
PSM	66	17	Psalmist	#09		19529	 {17} I cried out to him with my mouth; his praise was on my tongue.
PSM	66	18	Psalmist	#09		19530	" {18} If I had cherished sin in my heart, the Lord would not have listened; {19} but God has surely listened and heard my voice in prayer."
PSM	66	20	Psalmist	#09		19531	" {20} Praise be to God, who has not rejected my prayer or withheld his love from me!*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"

PSM	68	3	David	#07		19544	 {3} But may the righteous be glad and rejoice before God; may they be happy and joyful.

PSM	68	16	David	#07		19556	" {16} Why gaze in envy, O rugged mountains, at the mountain where God chooses to reign, where the Lord himself will dwell forever?"
PSM	68	17	David	#07		19557	 {17} The chariots of God are tens of thousands and thousands of thousands; the Lord has come from Sinai into his sanctuary.
PSM	68	18	David	#07		19558	" {18} When you ascended on high, you led captives in your train; you received gifts from men, even from the rebellious-- that you, O Lord God, might dwell there."

PSM	68	21	David	#07		19561	" {21} Surely God will crush the heads of his enemies, the hairy crowns of those who go on in their sins. {22} The Lord says,"
PSM	68	22	God-FX1	#20		19562	" << I will bring them from Bashan; I will bring them from the depths of the sea, {23} that you may plunge your feet in the blood of your foes, while the tongues of your dogs have their share.>>"
PSM	68	24	David	#07		19563	" {24} Your procession has come into view, O God, the procession of my God and King into the sanctuary."
PSM	68	25	David	#07		19564	" {25} In front are the singers, after them the musicians; with them are the maidens playing tambourines."
PSM	68	26	David	#07		19565	 {26} Praise God in the great congregation; praise the Lord in the assembly of Israel.
PSM	68	27	David	#07		19566	" {27} There is the little tribe of Benjamin, leading them, there the great throng of Judah's princes, and there the princes of Zebulun and of Naphtali."

PSM	68	30	David	#07		19569	" {30} Rebuke the beast among the reeds, the herd of bulls among the calves of the nations. Humbled, may it bring bars of silver. Scatter the nations who delight in war."
PSM	68	31	David	#07		19570	 {31} Envoys will come from Egypt; Cush will submit herself to God.

PSM	69	<<	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		19574	PSALM 69
PSM	69	0	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		19575	 For the director of music. To the tune of ôLilies.ö Of David.
PSM	69	1	David	#07		19576	" {1} Save me, O God, for the waters have come up to my neck. {2} I sink in the miry depths, where there is no foothold. I have come into the deep waters; the floods engulf me."
PSM	69	3	David	#07		19577	" {3} I am worn out calling for help; my throat is parched. My eyes fail, looking for my God."
PSM	69	4	David	#07		19578	" {4} Those who hate me without reason outnumber the hairs of my head; many are my enemies without cause, those who seek to destroy me. I am forced to restore what I did not steal."
PSM	69	5	David	#07		19579	" {5} You know my folly, O God; my guilt is not hidden from you."
PSM	69	6	David	#07		19580	" {6} May those who hope in you not be disgraced because of me, O Lord, the Lord Almighty; may those who seek you not be put to shame because of me, O God of Israel."
PSM	69	7	David	#07		19581	" {7} For I endure scorn for your sake, and shame covers my face."
PSM	69	8	David	#07		19582	" {8} I am a stranger to my brothers, an alien to my own mother's sons; {9} for zeal for your house consumes me, and the insults of those who insult you fall on me."
PSM	69	10	David	#07		19583	" {10} When I weep and fast, I must endure scorn; {11} when I put on sackcloth, people make sport of me. {12} Those who sit at the gate mock me, and I am the song of the drunkards."
PSM	69	13	David	#07		19584	" {13} But I pray to you, O Lord, in the time of your favor; in your great love, O God, answer me with your sure salvation."
PSM	69	14	David	#07		19585	" {14} Rescue me from the mire, do not let me sink; deliver me from those who hate me, from the deep waters."
PSM	69	15	David	#07		19586	 {15} Do not let the floodwaters engulf me or the depths swallow me up or the pit close its mouth over me.
PSM	69	16	David	#07		19587	" {16} Answer me, O Lord, out of the goodness of your love; in your great mercy turn to me."
PSM	69	17	David	#07		19588	" {17} Do not hide your face from your servant; answer me quickly, for I am in trouble. {18} Come near and rescue me; redeem me because of my foes."
PSM	69	19	David	#07		19589	" {19} You know how I am scorned, disgraced and shamed; all my enemies are before you."
PSM	69	20	David	#07		19590	" {20} Scorn has broken my heart and has left me helpless; I looked for sympathy, but there was none, for comforters, but I found none."
PSM	69	21	David	#07		19591	 {21} They put gall in my food and gave me vinegar for my thirst. {22} May the table set before them become a snare; may it become retribution and a trap.
PSM	69	23	David	#07		19592	" {23} May their eyes be darkened so they cannot see, and their backs be bent forever. {24} Pour out your wrath on them; let your fierce anger overtake them."
PSM	69	25	David	#07		19593	 {25} May their place be deserted; let there be no one to dwell in their tents. {26} For they persecute those you wound and talk about the pain of those you hurt.
PSM	69	27	David	#07		19594	 {27} Charge them with crime upon crime; do not let them share in your salvation. {28} May they be blotted out of the book of life and not be listed with the righteous.
PSM	69	29	David	#07		19595	" {29} I am in pain and distress; may your salvation, O God, protect me."
PSM	69	30	David	#07		19596	" {30} I will praise God's name in song and glorify him with thanksgiving. {31} This will please the Lord more than an ox, more than a bull with its horns and hoofs."
PSM	69	32	David	#07		19597	" {32} The poor will see and be glad-- you who seek God, may your hearts live! {33} The Lord hears the needy and does not despise his captive people."
PSM	69	34	David	#07		19598	" {34} Let heaven and earth praise him, the seas and all that move in them, {35} for God will save Zion and rebuild the cities of Judah. "
PSM	69	35	David	#07		19599	" Then people will settle there and possess it; {36} the children of his servants will inherit it, and those who love his name will dwell there.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"

PSM	72	7	Solomon	#10		19639	 {7} In his days the righteous will flourish; prosperity will abound till the moon is no more. {8} He will rule from sea to sea and from the River to the ends of the earth.

PSM	72	14	Solomon	#10		19644	" {14} He will rescue them from oppression and violence, for precious is their blood in his sight."
PSM	72	15	Solomon	#10		19645	 {15} Long may he live! May gold from Sheba be given him. May people ever pray for him and bless him all day long.
PSM	72	16	Solomon	#10		19646	 {16} Let grain abound throughout the land; on the tops of the hills may it sway. Let its fruit flourish like Lebanon; let it thrive like the grass of the field.
PSM	72	17	Solomon	#10		19647	" {17} May his name endure forever; may it continue as long as the sun. All nations will be blessed through him, and they will call him blessed."
PSM	72	18	Solomon	#10		19648	" {18} Praise be to the Lord God, the God of Israel, who alone does marvelous deeds."
PSM	72	19	Solomon	#10		19649	 {19} Praise be to his glorious name forever; may the whole earth be filled with his glory. Amen and Amen.

PSM	73	<<	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		19651	PSALM 73
PSM	73	0	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		19652	 A psalm of Asaph.
PSM	73	1	Asaph	#01		19653	" {1} Surely God is good to Israel, to those who are pure in heart. {2} But as for me, my feet had almost slipped; I had nearly lost my foothold."
PSM	73	3	Asaph	#01		19654	 {3} For I envied the arrogant when I saw the prosperity of the wicked. {4} They have no struggles; their bodies are healthy and strong.
PSM	73	5	Asaph	#01		19655	 {5} They are free from the burdens common to man; they are not plagued by human ills.
PSM	73	6	Asaph	#01		19656	 {6} Therefore pride is their necklace; they clothe themselves with violence.
PSM	73	7	Asaph	#01		19657	 {7} From their callous hearts comes iniquity; the evil conceits of their minds know no limits.
PSM	73	8	Asaph	#01		19658	" {8} They scoff, and speak with malice; in their arrogance they threaten oppression."
PSM	73	9	Asaph	#01		19659	" {9} Their mouths lay claim to heaven, and their tongues take possession of the earth."
PSM	73	10	Asaph	#01		19660	" {10} Therefore their people turn to them and drink up waters in abundance. {11} They say,"
PSM	73	11	Man	#03		19661	 << How can God know? Does the Most High have knowledge?>>
PSM	73	12	Asaph	#01		19662	" {12} This is what the wicked are like-- always carefree, they increase in wealth."
PSM	73	13	Asaph	#01		19663	 {13} Surely in vain have I kept my heart pure; in vain have I washed my hands in innocence.
PSM	73	14	Asaph	#01		19664	" {14} All day long I have been plagued; I have been punished every morning. {15} If I had said, << I will speak thus,>> I would have betrayed your children."
PSM	73	16	Asaph	#01		19665	" {16} When I tried to understand all this, it was oppressive to me {17} till I entered the sanctuary of God; then I understood their final destiny."
PSM	73	18	Asaph	#01		19666	" {18} Surely you place them on slippery ground; you cast them down to ruin. {19} How suddenly are they destroyed, completely swept away by terrors!"
PSM	73	20	Asaph	#01		19667	" {20} Like a dream when one awakes, so when you arise, O Lord, you will despise them as fantasies."
PSM	73	21	Asaph	#01		19668	" {21} When my heart was grieved and my spirit embittered, {22} I was senseless and ignorant; I was a brute beast before you."
PSM	73	23	Asaph	#01		19669	" {23} Yet I am always with you; you hold me by my right hand. {24} You guide me with your counsel, and afterward you will take me into glory."
PSM	73	25	Asaph	#01		19670	 {25} Whom have I in heaven but you? And earth has nothing I desire besides you.
PSM	73	26	Asaph	#01		19671	" {26} My flesh and my heart may fail, but God is the strength of my heart and my portion forever."
PSM	73	27	Asaph	#01		19672	 {27} Those who are far from you will perish; you destroy all who are unfaithful to you.
PSM	73	28	Asaph	#01		19673	" {28} But as for me, it is good to be near God. I have made the Sovereign Lord my refuge; I will tell of all your deeds.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
PSM	74	<<	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		19674	PSALM 74
PSM	74	0	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		19675	 A maskil of Asaph.
PSM	74	1	Asaph	#01		19676	" {1} Why have you rejected us forever, O God? Why does your anger smolder against the sheep of your pasture?"
PSM	74	2	Asaph	#01		19677	" {2} Remember the people you purchased of old, the tribe of your inheritance, whom you redeemed-- Mount Zion, where you dwelt."
PSM	74	3	Asaph	#01		19678	" {3} Turn your steps toward these everlasting ruins, all this destruction the enemy has brought on the sanctuary."
PSM	74	4	Asaph	#01		19679	 {4} Your foes roared in the place where you met with us; they set up their standards as signs.
PSM	74	5	Asaph	#01		19680	 {5} They behaved like men wielding axes to cut through a thicket of trees. {6} They smashed all the carved paneling with their axes and hatchets.
PSM	74	7	Asaph	#01		19681	" {7} They burned your sanctuary to the ground; they defiled the dwelling place of your Name. {8} They said in their hearts,"
PSM	74	8	Man	#17		19682	 << We will crush them completely! >>
PSM	74	8	Asaph	#01		19683	 They burned every place where God was worshiped in the land.
PSM	74	9	Asaph	#01		19684	" {9} We are given no miraculous signs; no prophets are left, and none of us knows how long this will be."
PSM	74	10	Asaph	#01		19685	" {10} How long will the enemy mock you, O God? Will the foe revile your name forever?"
PSM	74	11	Asaph	#01		19686	" {11} Why do you hold back your hand, your right hand? Take it from the folds of your garment and destroy them!"
PSM	74	12	Asaph	#01		19687	" {12} But you, O God, are my king from of old; you bring salvation upon the earth."
PSM	74	13	Asaph	#01		19688	 {13} It was you who split open the sea by your power; you broke the heads of the monster in the waters.
PSM	74	14	Asaph	#01		19689	 {14} It was you who crushed the heads of Leviathan and gave him as food to the creatures of the desert.
PSM	74	15	Asaph	#01		19690	 {15} It was you who opened up springs and streams; you dried up the ever flowing rivers.
PSM	74	16	Asaph	#01		19691	" {16} The day is yours, and yours also the night; you established the sun and moon."
PSM	74	17	Asaph	#01		19692	 {17} It was you who set all the boundaries of the earth; you made both summer and winter.
PSM	74	18	Asaph	#01		19693	" {18} Remember how the enemy has mocked you, O Lord, how foolish people have reviled your name."
PSM	74	19	Asaph	#01		19694	 {19} Do not hand over the life of your dove to wild beasts; do not forget the lives of your afflicted people forever.
PSM	74	20	Asaph	#01		19695	" {20} Have regard for your covenant, because haunts of violence fill the dark places of the land."
PSM	74	21	Asaph	#01		19696	 {21} Do not let the oppressed retreat in disgrace; may the poor and needy praise your name.
PSM	74	22	Asaph	#01		19697	" {22} Rise up, O God, and defend your cause; remember how fools mock you all day long."
PSM	74	23	Asaph	#01		19698	" {23} Do not ignore the clamor of your adversaries, the uproar of your enemies, which rises continually.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
PSM	75	<<	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		19699	PSALM 75

PSM	75	6	Asaph	#01		19704	" {6} No one from the east or the west or from the desert can exalt a man. {7} But it is God who judges: He brings one down, he exalts another."

PSM	76	3	Asaph	#01		19711	" {3} There he broke the flashing arrows, the shields and the swords, the weapons of war."
PSM	76	4	Asaph	#01		19712	" {4} You are resplendent with light, more majestic than mountains rich with game."
PSM	76	5	Asaph	#01		19713	" {5} Valiant men lie plundered, they sleep their last sleep; not one of the warriors can lift his hands. {6} At your rebuke, O God of Jacob, both horse and chariot lie still."
PSM	76	7	Asaph	#01		19714	 {7} You alone are to be feared. Who can stand before you when you are angry?

PSM	77	<<	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		19719	PSALM 77
PSM	77	0	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		19720	 For the director of music. For Jeduthun. Of Asaph. A psalm.
PSM	77	1	Asaph	#01		19721	 {1} I cried out to God for help; I cried out to God to hear me.
PSM	77	2	Asaph	#01		19722	" {2} When I was in distress, I sought the Lord; at night I stretched out untiring hands and my soul refused to be comforted."
PSM	77	3	Asaph	#01		19723	" {3} I remembered you, O God, and I groaned; I mused, and my spirit grew faint. {4} You kept my eyes from closing; I was too troubled to speak."
PSM	77	5	Asaph	#01		19724	" {5} I thought about the former days, the years of long ago;"
PSM	77	6	Asaph	#01		19725	 {6} I remembered my songs in the night. My heart mused and my spirit inquired: {7} << Will the Lord reject forever? Will he never show his favor again?
PSM	77	8	Asaph	#01		19726	 {8} Has his unfailing love vanished forever? Has his promise failed for all time? {9} Has God forgotten to be merciful? Has he in anger withheld his compassion?>>
PSM	77	10	Asaph	#01		19727	" {10} Then I thought, << To this I will appeal: the years of the right hand of the Most High.>>"
PSM	77	11	Asaph	#01		19728	" {11} I will remember the deeds of the Lord; yes, I will remember your miracles of long ago. {12} I will meditate on all your works and consider all your mighty deeds."
PSM	77	13	Asaph	#01		19729	" {13} Your ways, O God, are holy. What god is so great as our God? {14} You are the God who performs miracles; you display your power among the peoples."
PSM	77	15	Asaph	#01		19730	" {15} With your mighty arm you redeemed your people, the descendants of Jacob and Joseph. Selah"
PSM	77	16	Asaph	#01		19731	" {16} The waters saw you, O God, the waters saw you and writhed; the very depths were convulsed."
PSM	77	17	Asaph	#01		19732	" {17} The clouds poured down water, the skies resounded with thunder; your arrows flashed back and forth."
PSM	77	18	Asaph	#01		19733	" {18} Your thunder was heard in the whirlwind, your lightning lit up the world; the earth trembled and quaked."
PSM	77	19	Asaph	#01		19734	" {19} Your path led through the sea, your way through the mighty waters, though your footprints were not seen."
PSM	77	20	Asaph	#01		19735	 {20} You led your people like a flock by the hand of Moses and Aaron.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
PSM	78	<<	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		19736	PSALM 78
PSM	78	0	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		19737	 A maskil of Asaph.
PSM	78	1	Asaph	#01		19738	" {1} Oh my people, hear my teaching; listen to the words of my mouth."
PSM	78	2	Asaph	#01		19739	" {2} I will open my mouth in parables, I will utter hidden things, things from of old-- {3} what we have heard and known, what our fathers have told us."
PSM	78	4	Asaph	#01		19740	" {4} We will not hide them from their children; we will tell the next generation the praiseworthy deeds of the Lord, his power, and the wonders he has done."
PSM	78	5	Asaph	#01		19741	" {5} He decreed statutes for Jacob and established the law in Israel, which he commanded our forefathers to teach their children,"
PSM	78	6	Asaph	#01		19742	" {6} so the next generation would know them, even the children yet to be born, and they in turn would tell their children."
PSM	78	7	Asaph	#01		19743	 {7} Then they would put their trust in God and would not forget his deeds but would keep his commands.
PSM	78	8	Asaph	#01		19744	" {8} They would not be like their forefathers-- a stubborn and rebellious generation, whose hearts were not loyal to God, whose spirits were not faithful to him."
PSM	78	9	Asaph	#01		19745	" {9} The men of Ephraim, though armed with bows, turned back on the day of battle; {10} they did not keep God's covenant and refused to live by his law."
PSM	78	11	Asaph	#01		19746	" {11} They forgot what he had done, the wonders he had shown them. {12} He did miracles in the sight of their fathers in the land of Egypt, in the region of Zoan."
PSM	78	13	Asaph	#01		19747	 {13} He divided the sea and led them through; he made the water stand firm like a wall. {14} He guided them with the cloud by day and with light from the fire all night.
PSM	78	15	Asaph	#01		19748	 {15} He split the rocks in the desert and gave them water as abundant as the seas; {16} he brought streams out of a rocky crag and made water flow down like rivers.
PSM	78	17	Asaph	#01		19749	" {17} But they continued to sin against him, rebelling in the desert against the Most High."
PSM	78	18	Asaph	#01		19750	" {18} They willfully put God to the test by demanding the food they craved. {19} They spoke against God, saying,"
PSM	78	19	Man	#04		19751	 << Can God spread a table in the desert?
PSM	78	20	Man	#04		19752	" {20} When he struck the rock, water gushed out, and streams flowed abundantly. But can he also give us food? Can he supply meat for his people?>>"
PSM	78	21	Asaph	#01		19753	" {21} When the Lord heard them, he was very angry; his fire broke out against Jacob, and his wrath rose against Israel, {22} for they did not believe in God or trust in his deliverance."
PSM	78	23	Asaph	#01		19754	" {23} Yet he gave a command to the skies above and opened the doors of the heavens; {24} he rained down manna for the people to eat, he gave them the grain of heaven."
PSM	78	25	Asaph	#01		19755	 {25} Men ate the bread of angels; he sent them all the food they could eat. {26} He let loose the east wind from the heavens and led forth the south wind by his power.
PSM	78	27	Asaph	#01		19756	" {27} He rained meat down on them like dust, flying birds like sand on the seashore. {28} He made them come down inside their camp, all around their tents."
PSM	78	29	Asaph	#01		19757	" {29} They ate till they had more than enough, for he had given them what they craved."
PSM	78	30	Asaph	#01		19758	" {30} But before they turned from the food they craved, even while it was still in their mouths,"
PSM	78	31	Asaph	#01		19759	" {31} God's anger rose against them; he put to death the sturdiest among them, cutting down the young men of Israel."
PSM	78	32	Asaph	#01		19760	" {32} In spite of all this, they kept on sinning; in spite of his wonders, they did not believe. {33} So he ended their days in futility and their years in terror."
PSM	78	34	Asaph	#01		19761	" {34} Whenever God slew them, they would seek him; they eagerly turned to him again."
PSM	78	35	Asaph	#01		19762	" {35} They remembered that God was their Rock, that God Most High was their Redeemer."
PSM	78	36	Asaph	#01		19763	" {36} But then they would flatter him with their mouths, lying to him with their tongues; {37} their hearts were not loyal to him, they were not faithful to his covenant."
PSM	78	38	Asaph	#01		19764	 {38} Yet he was merciful; he forgave their iniquities and did not destroy them. Time after time he restrained his anger and did not stir up his full wrath.
PSM	78	39	Asaph	#01		19765	" {39} He remembered that they were but flesh, a passing breeze that does not return."
PSM	78	40	Asaph	#01		19766	 {40} How often they rebelled against him in the desert and grieved him in the wasteland! {41} Again and again they put God to the test; they vexed the Holy One of Israel.
PSM	78	42	Asaph	#01		19767	" {42} They did not remember his power-- the day he redeemed them from the oppressor,"
PSM	78	43	Asaph	#01		19768	" {43} the day he displayed his miraculous signs in Egypt, his wonders in the region of Zoan."
PSM	78	44	Asaph	#01		19769	 {44} He turned their rivers to blood; they could not drink from their streams.
PSM	78	45	Asaph	#01		19770	" {45} He sent swarms of flies that devoured them, and frogs that devastated them."
PSM	78	46	Asaph	#01		19771	" {46} He gave their crops to the grasshopper, their produce to the locust. {47} He destroyed their vines with hail and their sycamore-figs with sleet."
PSM	78	48	Asaph	#01		19772	" {48} He gave over their cattle to the hail, their livestock to bolts of lightning."
PSM	78	49	Asaph	#01		19773	" {49} He unleashed against them his hot anger, his wrath, indignation and hostility-- a band of destroying angels."
PSM	78	50	Asaph	#01		19774	 {50} He prepared a path for his anger; he did not spare them from death but gave them over to the plague.
PSM	78	51	Asaph	#01		19775	" {51} He struck down all the firstborn of Egypt, the firstfruits of manhood in the tents of Ham."
PSM	78	52	Asaph	#01		19776	 {52} But he brought his people out like a flock; he led them like sheep through the desert.
PSM	78	53	Asaph	#01		19777	" {53} He guided them safely, so they were unafraid; but the sea engulfed their enemies."
PSM	78	54	Asaph	#01		19778	" {54} Thus he brought them to the border of his holy land, to the hill country his right hand had taken."
PSM	78	55	Asaph	#01		19779	 {55} He drove out nations before them and allotted their lands to them as an inheritance; he settled the tribes of Israel in their homes.
PSM	78	56	Asaph	#01		19780	 {56} But they put God to the test and rebelled against the Most High; they did not keep his statutes.
PSM	78	57	Asaph	#01		19781	" {57} Like their fathers they were disloyal and faithless, as unreliable as a faulty bow."
PSM	78	58	Asaph	#01		19782	 {58} They angered him with their high places; they aroused his jealousy with their idols.
PSM	78	59	Asaph	#01		19783	" {59} When God heard them, he was very angry; he rejected Israel completely. {60} He abandoned the tabernacle of Shiloh, the tent he had set up among men."
PSM	78	61	Asaph	#01		19784	" {61} He sent the ark of his might into captivity, his splendor into the hands of the enemy."
PSM	78	62	Asaph	#01		19785	 {62} He gave his people over to the sword; he was very angry with his inheritance.
PSM	78	63	Asaph	#01		19786	" {63} Fire consumed their young men, and their maidens had no wedding songs; {64} their priests were put to the sword, and their widows could not weep."
PSM	78	65	Asaph	#01		19787	" {65} Then the Lord awoke as from sleep, as a man wakes from the stupor of wine. {66} He beat back his enemies; he put them to everlasting shame."
PSM	78	67	Asaph	#01		19788	" {67} Then he rejected the tents of Joseph, he did not choose the tribe of Ephraim; {68} but he chose the tribe of Judah, Mount Zion, which he loved."
PSM	78	69	Asaph	#01		19789	" {69} He built his sanctuary like the heights, like the earth that he established forever."
PSM	78	70	Asaph	#01		19790	" {70} He chose David his servant and took him from the sheep pens; {71} from tending the sheep he brought him to be the shepherd of his people Jacob, of Israel his inheritance."
PSM	78	72	Asaph	#01		19791	 {72} And David shepherded them with integrity of heart; with skillful hands he led them.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*

PSM	83	<<	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		19846	PSALM 83
PSM	83	0	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		19847	 A song. A psalm of Asaph.
PSM	83	1	Asaph	#01		19848	" {1} O God, do not keep silent; be not quiet, O God, be not still. {2} See how your enemies are astir, how your foes rear their heads."
PSM	83	3	Asaph	#01		19849	 {3} With cunning they conspire against your people; they plot against those you cherish. {4} They say:
PSM	83	4	Enemy	#14		19850	" << Come, let us destroy them as a nation, that the name of Israel be remembered no more.>>"
PSM	83	5	Asaph	#01		19851	 {5} With one mind they plot together; they form an alliance against youù

PSM	83	11	Asaph	#01		19857	" {11} Make their nobles like Oreb and Zeeb, all their princes like Zebah and Zalmunna, {12} who said,"
PSM	83	12	Man	#08		19858	 << Let us take possession of the pasturelands of God.>>
PSM	83	13	Asaph	#01		19859	" {13} Make them like tumbleweed, O my God, like chaff before the wind."
PSM	83	14	Asaph	#01		19860	" {14} As fire consumes the forest or a flame sets the mountains ablaze, {15} so pursue them with your tempest and terrify them with your storm."
PSM	83	16	Asaph	#01		19861	" {16} Cover their faces with shame so that men will seek your name, O Lord. {17} May they ever be ashamed and dismayed; may they perish in disgrace."
PSM	83	18	Asaph	#01		19862	" {18} Let them know that you, whose name is the Lord-- that you alone are the Most High over all the earth.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"

PSM	88	<<	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		19912	PSALM 88
PSM	88	0	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		19913	 A song. A psalm of the Sons of Korah. For the director of music. According to mahalath leannoth. A maskil of Heman the Ezrahite.
PSM	88	1	Son of Korah	#11		19914	" {1} O Lord, the God who saves me, day and night I cry out before you. {2} May my prayer come before you; turn your ear to my cry."
PSM	88	3	Son of Korah	#11		19915	 {3} For my soul is full of trouble and my life draws near the grave. {4} I am counted among those who go down to the pit; I am like a man without strength.
PSM	88	5	Son of Korah	#11		19916	" {5} I am set apart with the dead, like the slain who lie in the grave, whom you remember no more, who are cut off from your care."
PSM	88	6	Son of Korah	#11		19917	" {6} You have put me in the lowest pit, in the darkest depths. {7} Your wrath lies heavily upon me; you have overwhelmed me with all your waves. Selah"
PSM	88	8	Son of Korah	#11		19918	 {8} You have taken from me my closest friends and have made me repulsive to them. I am confined and cannot escape; {9} my eyes are dim with grief. 
PSM	88	9	Son of Korah	#11		19919	" I call to you, O Lord, every day; I spread out my hands to you. {10} Do you show your wonders to the dead? Do those who are dead rise up and praise you? Selah"
PSM	88	11	Son of Korah	#11		19920	" {11} Is your love declared in the grave, your faithfulness in Destruction?"
PSM	88	12	Son of Korah	#11		19921	" {12} Are your wonders known in the place of darkness, or your righteous deeds in the land of oblivion?"
PSM	88	13	Son of Korah	#11		19922	" {13} But I cry to you for help, O Lord; in the morning my prayer comes before you. {14} Why, O Lord, do you reject me and hide your face from me?"
PSM	88	15	Son of Korah	#11		19923	 {15} From my youth I have been afflicted and close to death; I have suffered your terrors and am in despair.
PSM	88	16	Son of Korah	#11		19924	 {16} Your wrath has swept over me; your terrors have destroyed me. {17} All day long they surround me like a flood; they have completely engulfed me.
PSM	88	18	Son of Korah	#11		19925	 {18} You have taken my companions and loved ones from me; the darkness is my closest friend.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*

PSM	89	21	God-FX1	#20		19948	 {21} My hand will sustain him; surely my arm will strengthen him. 
PSM	89	22	God-FX1	#20		19949	 {22} No enemy will subject him to tribute; no wicked man will oppress him. {23} I will crush his foes before him and strike down his adversaries.
PSM	89	24	God-FX1	#20		19950	" {24} My faithful love will be with him, and through my name his horn will be exalted. {25} I will set his hand over the sea, his right hand over the rivers."

PSM	89	32	God-FX1	#20		19955	" {32} I will punish their sin with the rod, their iniquity with flogging; {33} but I will not take my love from him, nor will I ever betray my faithfulness."
PSM	89	34	God-FX1	#20		19956	 {34} I will not violate my covenant or alter what my lips have uttered.
PSM	89	35	God-FX1	#20		19957	" {35} Once for all, I have sworn by my holiness-- and I will not lie to David-- {36} that his line will continue forever and his throne endure before me like the sun;"

PSM	89	37	Ethan	#02		19959	" Selah {38} But you have rejected, you have spurned, you have been very angry with your anointed one."
PSM	89	39	Ethan	#02		19960	 {39} You have renounced the covenant with your servant and have defiled his crown in the dust.
PSM	89	40	Ethan	#02		19961	 {40} You have broken through all his walls and reduced his strongholds to ruins.
PSM	89	41	Ethan	#02		19962	 {41} All who pass by have plundered him; he has become the scorn of his neighbors.
PSM	89	42	Ethan	#02		19963	 {42} You have exalted the right hand of his foes; you have made all his enemies rejoice.
PSM	89	43	Ethan	#02		19964	 {43} You have turned back the edge of his sword and have not supported him in battle.
PSM	89	44	Ethan	#02		19965	 {44} You have put an end to his splendor and cast his throne to the ground.
PSM	89	45	Ethan	#02		19966	 {45} You have cut short the days of his youth; you have covered him with a mantle of shame. Selah
PSM	89	46	Ethan	#02		19967	" {46} How long, O Lord? Will you hide yourself forever? How long will your wrath burn like fire?"
PSM	89	47	Ethan	#02		19968	 {47} Remember how fleeting is my life. For what futility you have created all men!
PSM	89	48	Ethan	#02		19969	" {48} What man can live and not see death, or save himself from the power of the grave? Selah"
PSM	89	49	Ethan	#02		19970	" {49} O Lord, where is your former great love, which in your faithfulness you swore to David?"
PSM	89	50	Ethan	#02		19971	" {50} Remember, Lord, how your servant has been mocked, "
PSM	89	50	Ethan	#02		19972	" how I bear in my heart {51} the taunts of all the nations, "

PSM	94	1	Psalmist	#06		20025	" {1} O Lord, the God who avenges, O God who avenges, shine forth. {2} Rise up, O Judge of the earth; pay back to the proud what they deserve."
PSM	94	3	Psalmist	#06		20026	" {3} How long will the wicked, O Lord, how long will the wicked be jubilant? {4} They pour out arrogant words; all the evildoers are full of boasting."
PSM	94	5	Psalmist	#06		20027	" {5} They crush your people, O Lord; they oppress your inheritance. {6} They slay the widow and the alien; they murder the fatherless. {7} They say,"
PSM	94	7	Man (wicked)	#14		20028	 << The Lord does not see; the God of Jacob pays no heed.>>
PSM	94	8	Psalmist	#15		20029	" {8} Take heed, you senseless ones among the people; you fools, when will you become wise?"
PSM	94	9	Psalmist	#15		20030	 {9} Does he who implanted the ear not hear? Does he who formed the eye not see?
PSM	94	10	Psalmist	#15		20031	 {10} Does he who disciplines nations not punish? Does he who teaches man lack knowledge?
PSM	94	11	Psalmist	#15		20032	 {11} The Lord knows the thoughts of man; he knows that they are futile.
PSM	94	12	Psalmist	#15		20033	" {12} Blessed is the man you discipline, O Lord, the man you teach from your law; {13} you grant him relief from days of trouble, till a pit is dug for the wicked."
PSM	94	14	Psalmist	#15		20034	 {14} For the Lord will not reject his people; he will never forsake his inheritance.
PSM	94	15	Psalmist	#15		20035	" {15} Judgment will again be founded on righteousness, and all the upright in heart will follow it."
PSM	94	16	Psalmist	#17		20036	 {16} Who will rise up for me against the wicked? Who will take a stand for me against evildoers?
PSM	94	17	Psalmist	#17		20037	" {17} Unless the Lord had given me help, I would soon have dwelt in the silence of death."
PSM	94	18	Psalmist	#17		20038	" {18} When I said, << My foot is slipping,>> your love, O Lord, supported me."
PSM	94	19	Psalmist	#17		20039	" {19} When anxiety was great within me, your consolation brought joy to my soul."
PSM	94	20	Psalmist	#17		20040	 {20} Can a corrupt throne be allied with you-- one that brings on misery by its decrees?
PSM	94	21	Psalmist	#17		20041	 {21} They band together against the righteous and condemn the innocent to death.
PSM	94	22	Psalmist	#17		20042	" {22} But the Lord has become my fortress, and my God the rock in whom I take refuge."
PSM	94	23	Psalmist	#17		20043	 {23} He will repay them for their sins and destroy them for their wickedness; the Lord our God will destroy them.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*

PSM	102	2	Man	#02		20119	 {2} Do not hide your face from me when I am in distress. 
PSM	102	2	Man	#02		20120	" Turn your ear to me; when I call, answer me quickly."
PSM	102	3	Man	#02		20121	 {3} For my days vanish like smoke; my bones burn like glowing embers.
PSM	102	4	Man	#02		20122	 {4} My heart is blighted and withered like grass; I forget to eat my food.
PSM	102	5	Man	#02		20123	 {5} Because of my loud groaning I am reduced to skin and bones.
PSM	102	6	Man	#02		20124	" {6} I am like a desert owl, like an owl among the ruins."
PSM	102	7	Man	#02		20125	 {7} I lie awake; I have become like a bird alone on a roof.

PSM	102	9	Man	#02		20127	" {9} For I eat ashes as my food and mingle my drink with tears {10} because of your great wrath, for you have taken me up and thrown me aside."
PSM	102	11	Man	#02		20128	 {11} My days are like the evening shadow; I wither away like grass.
PSM	102	12	Man	#02		20129	" {12} But you, O Lord, sit enthroned forever; your renown endures through all generations."
PSM	102	13	Man	#02		20130	" {13} You will arise and have compassion on Zion, for it is time to show favor to her; the appointed time has come."
PSM	102	14	Man	#02		20131	 {14} For her stones are dear to your servants; her very dust moves them to pity.
PSM	102	15	Man	#02		20132	" {15} The nations will fear the name of the Lord, all the kings of the earth will revere your glory."
PSM	102	16	Man	#02		20133	 {16} For the Lord will rebuild Zion and appear in his glory.

PSM	102	25	Man	#02		20141	" {25} In the beginning you laid the foundations of the earth, and the heavens are the work of your hands."
PSM	102	26	Man	#02		20142	" {26} They will perish, but you remain; they will all wear out like a garment. Like clothing you will change them and they will be discarded."
PSM	102	27	Man	#02		20143	" {27} But you remain the same, and your years will never end."

PSM	103	5	David	#07		20149	 {5} who satisfies your desires with good things so that your youth is renewed like the eagle's.

PSM	103	9	David	#07		20153	" {9} He will not always accuse, nor will he harbor his anger forever; {10} he does not treat us as our sins deserve or repay us according to our iniquities."
PSM	103	11	David	#07		20154	" {11} For as high as the heavens are above the earth, so great is his love for those who fear him;"
PSM	103	12	David	#07		20155	" {12} as far as the east is from the west, so far has he removed our transgressions from us."
PSM	103	13	David	#07		20156	" {13} As a father has compassion on his children, so the Lord has compassion on those who fear him; {14} for he knows how we are formed, he remembers that we are dust."
PSM	103	15	David	#07		20157	" {15} As for man, his days are like grass, he flourishes like a flower of the field; {16} the wind blows over it and it is gone, and its place remembers it no more."
PSM	103	17	David	#07		20158	" {17} But from everlasting to everlasting the Lord's love is with those who fear him, and his righteousness with their children's children--"
PSM	103	18	David	#07		20159	 {18} with those who keep his covenant and remember to obey his precepts.

PSM	104	<<	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		20164	PSALM 104

PSM	104	2	Psalmist	#06		20166	 {2} He wraps himself in light as with a garment; 
PSM	104	2	Psalmist	#06		20167	 he stretches out the heavens like a tent {3} and lays the beams of his upper chambers on their waters. 
PSM	104	3	Psalmist	#06		20168	 He makes the clouds his chariot and rides on the wings of the wind.
PSM	104	4	Psalmist	#06		20169	" {4} He makes winds his messengers, flames of fire his servants."
PSM	104	5	Psalmist	#06		20170	 {5} He set the earth on its foundations; it can never be moved.
PSM	104	6	Psalmist	#06		20171	 {6} You covered it with the deep as with a garment; the waters stood above the mountains.
PSM	104	7	Psalmist	#06		20172	" {7} But at your rebuke the waters fled, at the sound of your thunder they took to flight;"
PSM	104	8	Psalmist	#06		20173	" {8} they flowed over the mountains, they went down into the valleys, to the place you assigned for them."
PSM	104	9	Psalmist	#06		20174	 {9} You set a boundary they cannot cross; never again will they cover the earth.
PSM	104	10	Psalmist	#06		20175	 {10} He makes springs pour water into the ravines; it flows between the mountains.
PSM	104	11	Psalmist	#06		20176	 {11} They give water to all the beasts of the field; the wild donkeys quench their thirst.
PSM	104	12	Psalmist	#06		20177	 {12} The birds of the air nest by the waters; they sing among the branches.
PSM	104	13	Psalmist	#06		20178	 {13} He waters the mountains from his upper chambers; the earth is satisfied by the fruit of his work.
PSM	104	14	Psalmist	#06		20179	" {14} He makes grass grow for the cattle, and plants for man to cultivate-- bringing forth food from the earth:"
PSM	104	15	Psalmist	#06		20180	" {15} wine that gladdens the heart of man, oil to make his face shine, and bread that sustains his heart."
PSM	104	16	Psalmist	#06		20181	" {16} The trees of the Lord are well watered, the cedars of Lebanon that he planted."
PSM	104	17	Psalmist	#06		20182	 {17} There the birds make their nests; the stork has its home in the pine trees.
PSM	104	18	Psalmist	#06		20183	 {18} The high mountains belong to the wild goats; the crags are a refuge for the coneys.
PSM	104	19	Psalmist	#06		20184	" {19} The moon marks off the seasons, and the sun knows when to go down."
PSM	104	20	Psalmist	#06		20185	" {20} You bring darkness, it becomes night, and all the beasts of the forest prowl."
PSM	104	21	Psalmist	#06		20186	 {21} The lions roar for their prey and seek their food from God.
PSM	104	22	Psalmist	#06		20187	" {22} The sun rises, and they steal away; they return and lie down in their dens."
PSM	104	23	Psalmist	#06		20188	" {23} Then man goes out to his work, to his labor until evening."
PSM	104	24	Psalmist	#06		20189	" {24} How many are your works, O Lord! In wisdom you made them all; the earth is full of your creatures."
PSM	104	25	Psalmist	#06		20190	" {25} There is the sea, vast and spacious, teeming with creatures beyond number-- living things both large and small."
PSM	104	26	Psalmist	#06		20191	" {26} There the ships go to and fro, and the leviathan, which you formed to frolic there."
PSM	104	27	Psalmist	#06		20192	 {27} These all look to you to give them their food at the proper time.
PSM	104	28	Psalmist	#06		20193	" {28} When you give it to them, they gather it up; when you open your hand, they are satisfied with good things."
PSM	104	29	Psalmist	#06		20194	" {29} When you hide your face, they are terrified; when you take away their breath, they die and return to the dust."
PSM	104	30	Psalmist	#06		20195	" {30} When you send your Spirit, they are created, and you renew the face of the earth."
PSM	104	31	Psalmist	#06		20196	 {31} May the glory of the Lord endure forever; 
PSM	104	31	Psalmist	#06		20197	" may the Lord rejoice in his works-- {32} he who looks at the earth, and it trembles, who touches the mountains, and they smoke."
PSM	104	33	Psalmist	#06		20198	 {33} I will sing to the Lord all my life; I will sing praise to my God as long as I live.
PSM	104	34	Psalmist	#06		20199	" {34} May my meditation be pleasing to him, as I rejoice in the Lord."
PSM	104	35	Psalmist	#06		20200	" {35} But may sinners vanish from the earth and the wicked be no more. Praise the Lord, O my soul. Praise the Lord.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
PSM	105	<<	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		20201	PSALM 105
PSM	105	1	Psalmist	#04		20202	" {1} Give thanks to the Lord, call on his name; make known among the nations what he has done."
PSM	105	2	Psalmist	#04		20203	" {2} Sing to him, sing praise to him; tell of all his wonderful acts."
PSM	105	3	Psalmist	#04		20204	 {3} Glory in his holy name; let the hearts of those who seek the Lord rejoice.
PSM	105	4	Psalmist	#04		20205	 {4} Look to the Lord and his strength; seek his face always.
PSM	105	5	Psalmist	#04		20206	" {5} Remember the wonders he has done, his miracles, and the judgments he pronounced, {6} O descendants of Abraham his servant, O sons of Jacob, his chosen ones."
PSM	105	7	Psalmist	#04		20207	 {7} He is the Lord our God; his judgments are in all the earth.
PSM	105	8	Psalmist	#04		20208	" {8} He remembers his covenant forever, the word he commanded, for a thousand generations, {9} the covenant he made with Abraham, the oath he swore to Isaac."
PSM	105	10	Psalmist	#04		20209	" {10} He confirmed it to Jacob as a decree, to Israel as an everlasting covenant:"
PSM	105	11	God-FX1	#20		20210	 {11} <<To you I will give the land of Canaan as the portion you will inherit.>>
PSM	105	12	Psalmist	#04		20211	" {12} When they were but few in number, few indeed, and strangers in it, {13} they wandered from nation to nation, from one kingdom to another."
PSM	105	14	Psalmist	#04		20212	 {14} He allowed no one to oppress them; for their sake he rebuked kings:
PSM	105	15	God-FX1	#20		20213	 {15} << Do not touch my anointed ones; do my prophets no harm.>>
PSM	105	16	Psalmist	#04		20214	" {16} He called down famine on the land and destroyed all their supplies of food; {17} and he sent a man before them-- Joseph, sold as a slave."
PSM	105	18	Psalmist	#04		20215	" {18} They bruised his feet with shackles, his neck was put in irons, {19} till what he foretold came to pass, till the word of the Lord proved him true."
PSM	105	20	Psalmist	#04		20216	" {20} The king sent and released him, the ruler of peoples set him free."
PSM	105	21	Psalmist	#04		20217	" {21} He made him master of his household, ruler over all he possessed, {22} to instruct his princes as he pleased and teach his elders wisdom."
PSM	105	23	Psalmist	#04		20218	 {23} Then Israel entered Egypt; Jacob lived as an alien in the land of Ham.
PSM	105	24	Psalmist	#04		20219	 {24} The Lord made his people very fruitful; 
PSM	105	24	Psalmist	#04		20220	" he made them too numerous for their foes, {25} whose hearts he turned to hate his people, to conspire against his servants."
PSM	105	26	Psalmist	#04		20221	" {26} He sent Moses his servant, and Aaron, whom he had chosen."
PSM	105	27	Psalmist	#04		20222	" {27} They performed his miraculous signs among them, his wonders in the land of Ham."
PSM	105	28	Psalmist	#04		20223	 {28} He sent darkness and made the land dark-- for had they not rebelled against his words?
PSM	105	29	Psalmist	#04		20224	" {29} He turned their waters into blood, causing their fish to die."
PSM	105	30	Psalmist	#04		20225	" {30} Their land teemed with frogs, which went up into the bedrooms of their rulers."
PSM	105	31	Psalmist	#04		20226	" {31} He spoke, and there came swarms of flies, and gnats throughout their country."
PSM	105	32	Psalmist	#04		20227	" {32} He turned their rain into hail, with lightning throughout their land;"
PSM	105	33	Psalmist	#04		20228	 {33} he struck down their vines and fig trees and shattered the trees of their country.
PSM	105	34	Psalmist	#04		20229	" {34} He spoke, and the locusts came, grasshoppers without number;"
PSM	105	35	Psalmist	#04		20230	" {35} they ate up every green thing in their land, ate up the produce of their soil."
PSM	105	36	Psalmist	#04		20231	" {36} Then he struck down all the firstborn in their land, the firstfruits of all their manhood."
PSM	105	37	Psalmist	#04		20232	" {37} He brought out Israel, laden with silver and gold, and from among their tribes no one faltered."
PSM	105	38	Psalmist	#04		20233	" {38} Egypt was glad when they left, because dread of Israel had fallen on them."
PSM	105	39	Psalmist	#04		20234	" {39} He spread out a cloud as a covering, and a fire to give light at night."
PSM	105	40	Psalmist	#04		20235	" {40} They asked, and he brought them quail and satisfied them with the bread of heaven."
PSM	105	41	Psalmist	#04		20236	" {41} He opened the rock, and water gushed out; like a river it flowed in the desert."
PSM	105	42	Psalmist	#04		20237	 {42} For he remembered his holy promise given to his servant Abraham.
PSM	105	43	Psalmist	#04		20238	" {43} He brought out his people with rejoicing, his chosen ones with shouts of joy;"
PSM	105	44	Psalmist	#04		20239	" {44} he gave them the lands of the nations, and they fell heir to what others had toiled for-- {45} that they might keep his precepts and observe his laws. Praise the Lord.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"

PSM	106	16	Psalmist	#05		20256	" {16} In the camp they grew envious of Moses and of Aaron, who was consecrated to the Lord."
PSM	106	17	Psalmist	#05		20257	 {17} The earth opened up and swallowed Dathan; it buried the company of Abiram.
PSM	106	18	Psalmist	#05		20258	 {18} Fire blazed among their followers; a flame consumed the wicked.
PSM	106	19	Psalmist	#05		20259	" {19} At Horeb they made a calf and worshiped an idol cast from metal. {20} They exchanged their Glory for an image of a bull, which eats grass."
PSM	106	21	Psalmist	#05		20260	" {21} They forgot the God who saved them, who had done great things in Egypt, {22} miracles in the land of Ham and awesome deeds by the Red Sea."
PSM	106	23	Psalmist	#05		20261	" {23} So he said he would destroy them-- had not Moses, his chosen one, stood in the breach before him to keep his wrath from destroying them."
PSM	106	24	Psalmist	#05		20262	 {24} Then they despised the pleasant land; they did not believe his promise.
PSM	106	25	Psalmist	#05		20263	 {25} They grumbled in their tents and did not obey the Lord.
PSM	106	26	Psalmist	#05		20264	" {26} So he swore to them with uplifted hand that he would make them fall in the desert, {27} make their descendants fall among the nations and scatter them throughout the lands."
PSM	106	28	Psalmist	#05		20265	 {28} They yoked themselves to the Baal of Peor and ate sacrifices offered to lifeless gods;
PSM	106	29	Psalmist	#05		20266	" {29} they provoked the Lord to anger by their wicked deeds, and a plague broke out among them."
PSM	106	30	Psalmist	#05		20267	" {30} But Phinehas stood up and intervened, and the plague was checked."
PSM	106	31	Psalmist	#05		20268	 {31} This was credited to him as righteousness for endless generations to come.
PSM	106	32	Psalmist	#05		20269	" {32} By the waters of Meribah they angered the Lord, and trouble came to Moses because of them;"
PSM	106	33	Psalmist	#05		20270	" {33} for they rebelled against the Spirit of God, and rash words came from Moses' lips."
PSM	106	34	Psalmist	#05		20271	" {34} They did not destroy the peoples as the Lord had commanded them, {35} but they mingled with the nations and adopted their customs."
PSM	106	36	Psalmist	#05		20272	" {36} They worshiped their idols, which became a snare to them. {37} They sacrificed their sons and their daughters to demons."
PSM	106	38	Psalmist	#05		20273	" {38} They shed innocent blood, the blood of their sons and daughters, whom they sacrificed to the idols of Canaan, and the land was desecrated by their blood."
PSM	106	39	Psalmist	#05		20274	 {39} They defiled themselves by what they did; by their deeds they prostituted themselves.
PSM	106	40	Psalmist	#05		20275	 {40} Therefore the Lord was angry with his people and abhorred his inheritance.
PSM	106	41	Psalmist	#05		20276	" {41} He handed them over to the nations, and their foes ruled over them."
PSM	106	42	Psalmist	#05		20277	 {42} Their enemies oppressed them and subjected them to their power.
PSM	106	43	Psalmist	#05		20278	" {43} Many times he delivered them, but they were bent on rebellion and they wasted away in their sin."
PSM	106	44	Psalmist	#05		20279	 {44} But he took note of their distress when he heard their cry;
PSM	106	45	Psalmist	#05		20280	 {45} for their sake he remembered his covenant and out of his great love he relented.
PSM	106	46	Psalmist	#05		20281	 {46} He caused them to be pitied by all who held them captive.
PSM	106	47	Psalmist	#05		20282	" {47} Save us, O Lord our God, and gather us from the nations, that we may give thanks to your holy name and glory in your praise."

PSM	107	28	Psalmist	#09		20309	" {28} Then they cried out to the Lord in their trouble, and he brought them out of their distress."

PSM	107	30	Psalmist	#09		20311	" {30} They were glad when it grew calm, and he guided them to their desired haven."

PSM	109	<<	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		20335	PSALM 109
PSM	109	0	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		20336	 For the director of music. Of David. A psalm.
PSM	109	1	David	#07		20337	" {1} O God, whom I praise, do not remain silent, {2} for wicked and deceitful men have opened their mouths against me; they have spoken against me with lying tongues."
PSM	109	3	David	#07		20338	" {3} With words of hatred they surround me; they attack me without cause. {4} In return for my friendship they accuse me, but I am a man of prayer."
PSM	109	5	David	#07		20339	" {5} They repay me evil for good, and hatred for my friendship."
PSM	109	6	David	#07		20340	" {6} Appoint an evil man to oppose him; let an accuser stand at his right hand. {7} When he is tried, let him be found guilty, and may his prayers condemn him."
PSM	109	8	David	#07		20341	 {8} May his days be few; may another take his place of leadership. {9} May his children be fatherless and his wife a widow.
PSM	109	10	David	#07		20342	 {10} May his children be wandering beggars; may they be driven from their ruined homes. {11} May a creditor seize all he has; may strangers plunder the fruits of his labor.
PSM	109	12	David	#07		20343	" {12} May no one extend kindness to him or take pity on his fatherless children. {13} May his descendants be cut off, their names blotted out from the next generation."
PSM	109	14	David	#07		20344	 {14} May the iniquity of his fathers be remembered before the Lord; may the sin of his mother never be blotted out.
PSM	109	15	David	#07		20345	" {15} May their sins always remain before the Lord, that he may cut off the memory of them from the earth."
PSM	109	16	David	#07		20346	" {16} For he never thought of doing a kindness, but hounded to death the poor and the needy and the brokenhearted."
PSM	109	17	David	#07		20347	 {17} He loved to pronounce a curse-- may it come on him; he found no pleasure in blessing-- may it be far from him.
PSM	109	18	David	#07		20348	" {18} He wore cursing as his garment; it entered into his body like water, into his bones like oil. {19} May it be like a cloak wrapped about him, like a belt tied forever around him."
PSM	109	20	David	#07		20349	" {20} May this be the Lord's payment to my accusers, to those who speak evil of me."
PSM	109	21	David	#07		20350	" {21} But you, O Sovereign Lord, deal well with me for your name's sake; out of the goodness of your love, deliver me."
PSM	109	22	David	#07		20351	" {22} For I am poor and needy, and my heart is wounded within me. {23} I fade away like an evening shadow; I am shaken off like a locust."
PSM	109	24	David	#07		20352	" {24} My knees give way from fasting; my body is thin and gaunt. {25} I am an object of scorn to my accusers; when they see me, they shake their heads."
PSM	109	26	David	#07		20353	" {26} Help me, O Lord my God; save me in accordance with your love. {27} Let them know that it is your hand, that you, O Lord, have done it."
PSM	109	28	David	#07		20354	" {28} They may curse, but you will bless; when they attack they will be put to shame, but your servant will rejoice."
PSM	109	29	David	#07		20355	 {29} My accusers will be clothed with disgrace and wrapped in shame as in a cloak.
PSM	109	30	David	#07		20356	 {30} With my mouth I will greatly extol the Lord; in the great throng I will praise him.
PSM	109	31	David	#07		20357	" {31} For he stands at the right hand of the needy one, to save his life from those who condemn him.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"

PSM	112	<<	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		20380	PSALM 112

PSM	112	2	Psalmist	#09		20382	 {2} His children will be mighty in the land; the generation of the upright will be blessed.
PSM	112	3	Psalmist	#09		20383	" {3} Wealth and riches are in his house, and his righteousness endures forever."
PSM	112	4	Psalmist	#09		20384	" {4} Even in darkness light dawns for the upright, for the gracious and compassionate and righteous man."
PSM	112	5	Psalmist	#09		20385	" {5} Good will come to him who is generous and lends freely, who conducts his affairs with justice."
PSM	112	6	Psalmist	#09		20386	 {6} Surely he will never be shaken; a righteous man will be remembered forever.
PSM	112	7	Psalmist	#09		20387	" {7} He will have no fear of bad news; his heart is steadfast, trusting in the Lord."

PSM	119	113	Psalmist	#19		20560	" {113} I hate double-minded men, but I love your law. {114} You are my refuge and my shield; I have put my hope in your word."
PSM	119	115	Psalmist	#19		20561	" {115} Away from me, you evildoers, that I may keep the commands of my God!"
PSM	119	116	Psalmist	#19		20562	" {116} Sustain me according to your promise, and I will live; do not let my hopes be dashed."
PSM	119	117	Psalmist	#19		20563	" {117} Uphold me, and I will be delivered; I will always have regard for your decrees."
PSM	119	118	Psalmist	#19		20564	" {118} You reject all who stray from your decrees, for their deceitfulness is in vain."
PSM	119	119	Psalmist	#19		20565	 {119} All the wicked of the earth you discard like dross; therefore I love your statutes. {120} My flesh trembles in fear of you; I stand in awe of your laws.
PSM	119	121	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		20566	 Ayin
PSM	119	121	Psalmist	#01		20567	 {121} I have done what is righteous and just; do not leave me to my oppressors. {122} Ensure your servant's well-being; let not the arrogant oppress me.
PSM	119	123	Psalmist	#01		20568	" {123} My eyes fail, looking for your salvation, looking for your righteous promise."
PSM	119	124	Psalmist	#01		20569	 {124} Deal with your servant according to your love and teach me your decrees.
PSM	119	125	Psalmist	#01		20570	 {125} I am your servant; give me discernment that I may understand your statutes.
PSM	119	126	Psalmist	#01		20571	" {126} It is time for you to act, O Lord; your law is being broken."
PSM	119	127	Psalmist	#01		20572	" {127} Because I love your commands more than gold, more than pure gold, {128} and because I consider all your precepts right, I hate every wrong path."
PSM	119	129	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		20573	 Pe
PSM	119	129	Psalmist	#09		20574	 {129} Your statutes are wonderful; therefore I obey them. {130} The unfolding of your words gives light; it gives understanding to the simple.

PSM	119	144	Psalmist	#08		20586	 {144} Your statutes are forever right; give me understanding that I may live.

PSM	135	15	Psalmist	#11		20741	" {15} The idols of the nations are silver and gold, made by the hands of men."
PSM	135	16	Psalmist	#11		20742	" {16} They have mouths, but cannot speak, eyes, but they cannot see; {17} they have ears, but cannot hear, nor is there breath in their mouths."
PSM	135	18	Psalmist	#11		20743	" {18} Those who make them will be like them, and so will all who trust in them."
PSM	135	19	Psalmist	#11		20744	" {19} O house of Israel, praise the Lord; O house of Aaron, praise the Lord;"
PSM	135	20	Psalmist	#11		20745	" {20} O house of Levi, praise the Lord; you who fear him, praise the Lord."
PSM	135	21	Psalmist	#11		20746	" {21} Praise be to the Lord from Zion, to him who dwells in Jerusalem. Praise the Lord.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"

PSM	139	<<	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		20786	PSALM 139
PSM	139	0	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		20787	 For the director of music. Of David. A psalm.
PSM	139	1	David	#07		20788	" {1} O Lord, you have searched me and you know me. {2} You know when I sit and when I rise; you perceive my thoughts from afar."
PSM	139	3	David	#07		20789	" {3} You discern my going out and my lying down; you are familiar with all my ways. {4} Before a word is on my tongue you know it completely, O Lord."
PSM	139	5	David	#07		20790	 {5} You hem me in--behind and before; you have laid your hand upon me.
PSM	139	6	David	#07		20791	" {6} Such knowledge is too wonderful for me, too lofty for me to attain. {7} Where can I go from your Spirit? Where can I flee from your presence?"
PSM	139	8	David	#07		20792	" {8} If I go up to the heavens, you are there; if I make my bed in the depths, you are there."
PSM	139	9	David	#07		20793	" {9} If I rise on the wings of the dawn, if I settle on the far side of the sea, {10} even there your hand will guide me, your right hand will hold me fast."
PSM	139	11	David	#07		20794	" {11} If I say, << Surely the darkness will hide me and the light become night around me,>>"
PSM	139	12	David	#07		20795	" {12} even the darkness will not be dark to you; the night will shine like the day, for darkness is as light to you."
PSM	139	13	David	#07		20796	 {13} For you created my inmost being; you knit me together in my mother's womb.
PSM	139	14	David	#07		20797	" {14} I praise you because I am fearfully and wonderfully made; your works are wonderful, I know that full well."
PSM	139	15	David	#07		20798	 {15} My frame was not hidden from you when I was made in the secret place. 
PSM	139	15	David	#07		20799	" When I was woven together in the depths of the earth, {16} your eyes saw my unformed body. All the days ordained for me were written in your book before one of them came to be."
PSM	139	17	David	#07		20800	" {17} How precious to me are your thoughts, O God! How vast is the sum of them!"
PSM	139	18	David	#07		20801	" {18} Were I to count them, they would outnumber the grains of sand. When I awake, I am still with you."
PSM	139	19	David	#07		20802	" {19} If only you would slay the wicked, O God! Away from me, you bloodthirsty men! {20} They speak of you with evil intent; your adversaries misuse your name."
PSM	139	21	David	#07		20803	" {21} Do I not hate those who hate you, O Lord, and abhor those who rise up against you? {22} I have nothing but hatred for them; I count them my enemies."
PSM	139	23	David	#07		20804	" {23} Search me, O God, and know my heart; test me and know my anxious thoughts. {24} See if there is any offensive way in me, and lead me in the way everlasting.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"

PSM	140	5	David	#07		20810	 {5} Proud men have hidden a snare for me; they have spread out the cords of their net and have set traps for me along my path. Selah

PSM	140	7	David	#07		20812	" {7} O Sovereign Lord, my strong deliverer, who shields my head in the day of battle--"
PSM	140	8	David	#07		20813	" {8} do not grant the wicked their desires, O Lord; do not let their plans succeed, or they will become proud. Selah"
PSM	140	9	David	#07		20814	 {9} Let the heads of those who surround me be covered with the trouble their lips have caused.

PSM	140	12	David	#07		20817	 {12} I know that the Lord secures justice for the poor and upholds the cause of the needy.
PSM	140	13	David	#07		20818	 {13} Surely the righteous will praise your name and the upright will live before you.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*

PSM	141	5	David	#07		20825	 {5} Let a righteous man strike me--it is a kindness; let him rebuke me--it is oil on my head. My head will not refuse it. Yet my prayer is ever against the deeds of evildoers;
PSM	141	6	David	#07		20826	" {6} their rulers will be thrown down from the cliffs, and the wicked will learn that my words were well spoken."

PSM	148	1	Psalmist	#05		20917	" {1} Praise the Lord. Praise the Lord from the heavens, praise him in the heights above."
PSM	148	2	Psalmist	#05		20918	" {2} Praise him, all his angels, praise him, all his heavenly hosts."
PSM	148	3	Psalmist	#05		20919	" {3} Praise him, sun and moon, praise him, all you shining stars. {4} Praise him, you highest heavens and you waters above the skies."
PSM	148	5	Psalmist	#05		20920	" {5} Let them praise the name of the Lord, for he commanded and they were created."
PSM	148	6	Psalmist	#05		20921	 {6} He set them in place for ever and ever; he gave a decree that will never pass away.
PSM	148	7	Psalmist	#05		20922	" {7} Praise the Lord from the earth, you great sea creatures and all ocean depths,"
PSM	148	8	Psalmist	#05		20923	" {8} lightning and hail, snow and clouds, stormy winds that do his bidding,"
PSM	148	9	Psalmist	#05		20924	" {9} you mountains and all hills, fruit trees and all cedars, {10} wild animals and all cattle, small creatures and flying birds,"
PSM	148	11	Psalmist	#05		20925	" {11} kings of the earth and all nations, you princes and all rulers on earth, {12} young men and maidens, old men and children."
PSM	148	13	Psalmist	#05		20926	" {13} Let them praise the name of the Lord, for his name alone is exalted; his splendor is above the earth and the heavens."
PSM	148	14	Psalmist	#05		20927	" {14} He has raised up for his people a horn, the praise of all his saints, of Israel, the people close to his heart. Praise the Lord.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
PSM	149	<<	Narr_19: Psalms	#13		20928	PSALM 149
PSM	149	1	Psalmist	#11		20929	" {1} Praise the Lord. Sing to the Lord a new song, his praise in the assembly of the saints."
PSM	149	2	Psalmist	#11		20930	 {2} Let Israel rejoice in their Maker; let the people of Zion be glad in their King.
PSM	149	3	Psalmist	#11		20931	 {3} Let them praise his name with dancing and make music to him with tambourine and harp.
PSM	149	4	Psalmist	#11		20932	 {4} For the Lord takes delight in his people; he crowns the humble with salvation.
PSM	149	5	Psalmist	#11		20933	 {5} Let the saints rejoice in this honor and sing for joy on their beds.
PSM	149	6	Psalmist	#11		20934	" {6} May the praise of God be in their mouths and a double-edged sword in their hands,"
PSM	149	7	Psalmist	#11		20935	" {7} to inflict vengeance on the nations and punishment on the peoples,"
PSM	149	8	Psalmist	#11		20936	" {8} to bind their kings with fetters, their nobles with shackles of iron,"
PSM	149	9	Psalmist	#11		20937	 {9} to carry out the sentence written against them. This is the glory of all his saints. Praise the Lord.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*

PSM	150	2	Psalmist	#15		20940	 {2} Praise him for his acts of power; praise him for his surpassing greatness.
PSM	150	3	Psalmist	#15		20941	" {3} Praise him with the sounding of the trumpet, praise him with the harp and lyre,"
