PRV	1	<<	Narr_20: Proverbs	#13		20945	PROVERBS*~*PROVERBS 1
PRV	1	1	Narr_20: Proverbs	#13		20946	" {1} The proverbs of Solomon son of David, king of Israel: for attaining wisdom and discipline; {2} for understanding words of insight;"
PRV	1	3	Narr_20: Proverbs	#13		20947	" {3} for acquiring a disciplined and prudent life, doing what is right and just and fair;"
PRV	1	4	Narr_20: Proverbs	#13		20948	" {4} for giving prudence to the simple, knowledge and discretion to the young--"
PRV	1	5	Narr_20: Proverbs	#13		20949	" {5} let the wise listen and add to their learning, and let the discerning get guidance-- {6} for understanding proverbs and parables, the sayings and riddles of the wise."
PRV	1	7	Narr_20: Proverbs	#13		20950	" {7} The fear of the Lord is the beginning of knowledge, but fools despise wisdom and discipline."
PRV	1	8	Solomon	#10		20951	" {8} Listen, my son, to your father's instruction and do not forsake your mother's teaching."
PRV	1	9	Solomon	#10		20952	 {9} They will be a garland to grace your head and a chain to adorn your neck.
PRV	1	10	Solomon	#10		20953	" {10} My son, if sinners entice you, do not give in to them. {11} If they say,"
PRV	1	11	Man	#03		20954	" << Come along with us; let's lie in wait for someone's blood, let's waylay some harmless soul;"
PRV	1	12	Man	#03		20955	" {12} let's swallow them alive, like the grave, and whole, like those who go down to the pit;"
PRV	1	13	Man	#03		20956	 {13} we will get all sorts of valuable things and fill our houses with plunder;
PRV	1	14	Man	#03		20957	" {14} throw in your lot with us, and we will share a common purse>> --"
PRV	1	15	Solomon	#10		20958	" {15} my son, do not go along with them, do not set foot on their paths; {16} for their feet rush into sin, they are swift to shed blood."
PRV	1	17	Solomon	#10		20959	 {17} How useless to spread a net in full view of all the birds! {18} These men lie in wait for their own blood; they waylay only themselves!
PRV	1	19	Solomon	#10		20960	 {19} Such is the end of all who go after ill-gotten gain; it takes away the lives of those who get it.
PRV	1	20	Narr_20: Proverbs	#13		20961	" {20} Wisdom calls aloud in the street, she raises her voice in the public squares;"
PRV	1	21	Narr_20: Proverbs	#13		20962	" {21} at the head of the noisy streets she cries out, in the gateways of the city she makes her speech:"
PRV	1	22	Wisdom (female)	#24		20963	 {22} << How long will you simple ones love your simple ways? How long will mockers delight in mockery and fools hate knowledge?
PRV	1	23	Wisdom (female)	#24		20964	" {23} If you had responded to my rebuke, I would have poured out my heart to you and made my thoughts known to you."
PRV	1	24	Wisdom (female)	#24		20965	" {24} But since you rejected me when I called and no one gave heed when I stretched out my hand,"
PRV	1	25	Wisdom (female)	#24		20966	" {25} since you ignored all my advice and would not accept my rebuke,"
PRV	1	26	Wisdom (female)	#24		20967	 {26} I in turn will laugh at your disaster; I will mock when calamity overtakes you--
PRV	1	27	Wisdom (female)	#24		20968	" {27} when calamity overtakes you like a storm, when disaster sweeps over you like a whirlwind, when distress and trouble overwhelm you."
PRV	1	28	Wisdom (female)	#24		20969	 {28} << Then they will call to me but I will not answer; they will look for me but will not find me.
PRV	1	29	Wisdom (female)	#24		20970	" {29} Since they hated knowledge and did not choose to fear the Lord,"
PRV	1	30	Wisdom (female)	#24		20971	" {30} since they would not accept my advice and spurned my rebuke,"
PRV	1	31	Wisdom (female)	#24		20972	 {31} they will eat the fruit of their ways and be filled with the fruit of their schemes.
PRV	1	32	Wisdom (female)	#24		20973	" {32} For the waywardness of the simple will kill them, and the complacency of fools will destroy them;"
PRV	1	33	Wisdom (female)	#24		20974	" {33} but whoever listens to me will live in safety and be at ease, without fear of harm. >>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
PRV	2	<<	Narr_20: Proverbs	#13		20975	PROVERBS 2
PRV	2	1	Solomon	#10		20976	" {1} My son, if you accept my words and store up my commands within you, {2} turning your ear to wisdom and applying your heart to understanding,"
PRV	2	3	Solomon	#10		20977	" {3} and if you call out for insight and cry aloud for understanding, {4} and if you look for it as for silver and search for it as for hidden treasure,"
PRV	2	5	Solomon	#10		20978	 {5} then you will understand the fear of the Lord and find the knowledge of God.
PRV	2	6	Solomon	#10		20979	" {6} For the Lord gives wisdom, and from his mouth come knowledge and understanding."
PRV	2	7	Solomon	#10		20980	" {7} He holds victory in store for the upright, he is a shield to those whose walk is blameless,"
PRV	2	8	Solomon	#10		20981	 {8} for he guards the course of the just and protects the way of his faithful ones.
PRV	2	9	Solomon	#10		20982	 {9} Then you will understand what is right and just and fair--every good path.
PRV	2	10	Solomon	#10		20983	" {10} For wisdom will enter your heart, and knowledge will be pleasant to your soul. "
PRV	2	11	Solomon	#10		20984	" {11} Discretion will protect you, and understanding will guard you."
PRV	2	12	Solomon	#10		20985	" {12} Wisdom will save you from the ways of wicked men, from men whose words are perverse,"
PRV	2	13	Solomon	#10		20986	" {13} who leave the straight paths to walk in dark ways,"
PRV	2	14	Solomon	#10		20987	" {14} who delight in doing wrong and rejoice in the perverseness of evil,"
PRV	2	15	Solomon	#10		20988	 {15} whose paths are crooked and who are devious in their ways.
PRV	2	16	Solomon	#10		20989	" {16} It will save you also from the adulteress, from the wayward wife with her seductive words,"
PRV	2	17	Solomon	#10		20990	 {17} who has left the partner of her youth and ignored the covenant she made before God.
PRV	2	18	Solomon	#10		20991	 {18} For her house leads down to death and her paths to the spirits of the dead.
PRV	2	19	Solomon	#10		20992	 {19} None who go to her return or attain the paths of life.
PRV	2	20	Solomon	#10		20993	 {20} Thus you will walk in the ways of good men and keep to the paths of the righteous.
PRV	2	21	Solomon	#10		20994	" {21} For the upright will live in the land, and the blameless will remain in it;"
PRV	2	22	Solomon	#10		20995	" {22} but the wicked will be cut off from the land, and the unfaithful will be torn from it.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
PRV	3	<<	Narr_20: Proverbs	#13		20996	PROVERBS 3
PRV	3	1	Solomon	#10		20997	" {1} My son, do not forget my teaching, but keep my commands in your heart, {2} for they will prolong your life many years and bring you prosperity."
PRV	3	3	Solomon	#10		20998	" {3} Let love and faithfulness never leave you; bind them around your neck, write them on the tablet of your heart."
PRV	3	4	Solomon	#10		20999	 {4} Then you will win favor and a good name in the sight of God and man.
PRV	3	5	Solomon	#10		21000	" {5} Trust in the Lord with all your heart and lean not on your own understanding; {6} in all your ways acknowledge him, and he will make your paths straight."
PRV	3	7	Solomon	#10		21001	 {7} Do not be wise in your own eyes; fear the Lord and shun evil. {8} This will bring health to your body and nourishment to your bones.
PRV	3	9	Solomon	#10		21002	" {9} Honor the Lord with your wealth, with the firstfruits of all your crops; {10} then your barns will be filled to overflowing, and your vats will brim over with new wine."
PRV	3	11	Solomon	#10		21003	" {11} My son, do not despise the Lord's discipline and do not resent his rebuke, {12} because the Lord disciplines those he loves, as a father the son he delights in."
PRV	3	13	Solomon	#10		21004	" {13} Blessed is the man who finds wisdom, the man who gains understanding, {14} for she is more profitable than silver and yields better returns than gold."
PRV	3	15	Solomon	#10		21005	 {15} She is more precious than rubies; nothing you desire can compare with her.
PRV	3	16	Solomon	#10		21006	" {16} Long life is in her right hand; in her left hand are riches and honor. {17} Her ways are pleasant ways, and all her paths are peace."
PRV	3	18	Solomon	#10		21007	 {18} She is a tree of life to those who embrace her; those who lay hold of her will be blessed.
PRV	3	19	Solomon	#10		21008	" {19} By wisdom the Lord laid the earth's foundations, by understanding he set the heavens in place;"
PRV	3	20	Solomon	#10		21009	" {20} by his knowledge the deeps were divided, and the clouds let drop the dew."
PRV	3	21	Solomon	#10		21010	" {21} My son, preserve sound judgment and discernment, do not let them out of your sight; {22} they will be life for you, an ornament to grace your neck."
PRV	3	23	Solomon	#10		21011	" {23} Then you will go on your way in safety, and your foot will not stumble; {24} when you lie down, you will not be afraid; when you lie down, your sleep will be sweet."
PRV	3	25	Solomon	#10		21012	" {25} Have no fear of sudden disaster or of the ruin that overtakes the wicked, {26} for the Lord will be your confidence and will keep your foot from being snared."
PRV	3	27	Solomon	#10		21013	" {27} Do not withhold good from those who deserve it, when it is in your power to act."
PRV	3	28	Solomon	#10		21014	" {28} Do not say to your neighbor, << Come back later; I'll give it tomorrow<< -- when you now have it with you."
PRV	3	29	Solomon	#10		21015	" {29} Do not plot harm against your neighbor, who lives trustfully near you. {30} Do not accuse a man for no reason-- when he has done you no harm."
PRV	3	31	Solomon	#10		21016	" {31} Do not envy a violent man or choose any of his ways, {32} for the Lord detests a perverse man but takes the upright into his confidence."
PRV	3	33	Solomon	#10		21017	" {33} The Lord's curse is on the house of the wicked, but he blesses the home of the righteous. {34} He mocks proud mockers but gives grace to the humble."
PRV	3	35	Solomon	#10		21018	" {35} The wise inherit honor, but fools he holds up to shame.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
PRV	4	<<	Narr_20: Proverbs	#13		21019	PROVERBS 4
PRV	4	1	Solomon	#10		21020	" {1} Listen, my sons, to a father's instruction; pay attention and gain understanding. {2} I give you sound learning, so do not forsake my teaching."
PRV	4	3	Solomon	#10		21021	" {3} When I was a boy in my father's house, still tender, and an only child of my mother, {4} he taught me and said,"
PRV	4	4	David	#07		21022	 << Lay hold of my words with all your heart; keep my commands and you will live.
PRV	4	5	David	#07		21023	" {5} Get wisdom, get understanding; do not forget my words or swerve from them. {6} Do not forsake wisdom, and she will protect you; love her, and she will watch over you."
PRV	4	7	David	#07		21024	" {7} Wisdom is supreme; therefore get wisdom. Though it cost all you have, get understanding. "
PRV	4	8	David	#07		21025	" {8} Esteem her, and she will exalt you; embrace her, and she will honor you. {9} She will set a garland of grace on your head and present you with a crown of splendor. >>"
PRV	4	10	Solomon	#10		21026	" {10} Listen, my son, accept what I say, and the years of your life will be many. "
PRV	4	11	Solomon	#10		21027	" {11} I guide you in the way of wisdom and lead you along straight paths. {12} When you walk, your steps will not be hampered; when you run, you will not stumble."
PRV	4	13	Solomon	#10		21028	" {13} Hold on to instruction, do not let it go; guard it well, for it is your life."
PRV	4	14	Solomon	#10		21029	" {14} Do not set foot on the path of the wicked or walk in the way of evil men. {15} Avoid it, do not travel on it; turn from it and go on your way."
PRV	4	16	Solomon	#10		21030	 {16} For they cannot sleep till they do evil; they are robbed of slumber till they make someone fall. {17} They eat the bread of wickedness and drink the wine of violence.
PRV	4	18	Solomon	#10		21031	" {18} The path of the righteous is like the first gleam of dawn, shining ever brighter till the full light of day."
PRV	4	19	Solomon	#10		21032	 {19} But the way of the wicked is like deep darkness; they do not know what makes them stumble.
PRV	4	20	Solomon	#10		21033	" {20} My son, pay attention to what I say; listen closely to my words."
PRV	4	21	Solomon	#10		21034	" {21} Do not let them out of your sight, keep them within your heart; {22} for they are life to those who find them and health to a man's whole body."
PRV	4	23	Solomon	#10		21035	" {23} Above all else, guard your heart, for it is the wellspring of life. {24} Put away perversity from your mouth; keep corrupt talk far from your lips."
PRV	4	25	Solomon	#10		21036	" {25} Let your eyes look straight ahead, fix your gaze directly before you. {26} Make level paths for your feet and take only ways that are firm."
PRV	4	27	Solomon	#10		21037	 {27} Do not swerve to the right or the left; keep your foot from evil.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
PRV	5	<<	Narr_20: Proverbs	#13		21038	PROVERBS 5
PRV	5	1	Solomon	#10		21039	" {1} My son, pay attention to my wisdom, listen well to my words of insight, {2} that you may maintain discretion and your lips may preserve knowledge."
PRV	5	3	Solomon	#10		21040	" {3} For the lips of an adulteress drip honey, and her speech is smoother than oil; {4} but in the end she is bitter as gall, sharp as a double-edged sword."
PRV	5	5	Solomon	#10		21041	" {5} Her feet go down to death; her steps lead straight to the grave. {6} She gives no thought to the way of life; her paths are crooked, but she knows it not."
PRV	5	7	Solomon	#10		21042	" {7} Now then, my sons, listen to me; do not turn aside from what I say."
PRV	5	8	Solomon	#10		21043	" {8} Keep to a path far from her, do not go near the door of her house, {9} lest you give your best strength to others and your years to one who is cruel,"
PRV	5	10	Solomon	#10		21044	 {10} lest strangers feast on your wealth and your toil enrich another man's house.
PRV	5	11	Solomon	#10		21045	" {11} At the end of your life you will groan, when your flesh and body are spent. {12} You will say,"
PRV	5	12	Man	#12		21046	 << How I hated discipline! How my heart spurned correction!
PRV	5	13	Man	#12		21047	 {13} I would not obey my teachers or listen to my instructors.
PRV	5	14	Man	#12		21048	 {14} I have come to the brink of utter ruin in the midst of the whole assembly. >>
PRV	5	15	Solomon	#10		21049	" {15} Drink water from your own cistern, running water from your own well."
PRV	5	16	Solomon	#10		21050	" {16} Should your springs overflow in the streets, your streams of water in the public squares? {17} Let them be yours alone, never to be shared with strangers."
PRV	5	18	Solomon	#10		21051	" {18} May your fountain be blessed, and may you rejoice in the wife of your youth."
PRV	5	19	Solomon	#10		21052	" {19} A loving doe, a graceful deer-- may her breasts satisfy you always, may you ever be captivated by her love."
PRV	5	20	Solomon	#10		21053	" {20} Why be captivated, my son, by an adulteress? Why embrace the bosom of another man's wife?"
PRV	5	21	Solomon	#10		21054	" {21} For a man's ways are in full view of the Lord, and he examines all his paths."
PRV	5	22	Solomon	#10		21055	 {22} The evil deeds of a wicked man ensnare him; the cords of his sin hold him fast.
PRV	5	23	Solomon	#10		21056	" {23} He will die for lack of discipline, led astray by his own great folly.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
PRV	6	<<	Narr_20: Proverbs	#13		21057	PROVERBS 6
PRV	6	1	Solomon	#10		21058	" {1} My son, if you have put up security for your neighbor, if you have struck hands in pledge for another,"
PRV	6	2	Solomon	#10		21059	" {2} if you have been trapped by what you said, ensnared by the words of your mouth,"
PRV	6	3	Solomon	#10		21060	" {3} then do this, my son, to free yourself, since you have fallen into your neighbor's hands: Go and humble yourself; press your plea with your neighbor!"
PRV	6	4	Solomon	#10		21061	" {4} Allow no sleep to your eyes, no slumber to your eyelids. {5} Free yourself, like a gazelle from the hand of the hunter, like a bird from the snare of the fowler."
PRV	6	6	Solomon	#10		21062	" {6} Go to the ant, you sluggard; consider its ways and be wise! {7} It has no commander, no overseer or ruler, {8} yet it stores its provisions in summer and gathers its food at harvest."
PRV	6	9	Solomon	#10		21063	" {9} How long will you lie there, you sluggard? When will you get up from your sleep?"
PRV	6	10	Solomon	#10		21064	" {10} A little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to rest-- {11} and poverty will come on you like a bandit and scarcity like an armed man."
PRV	6	12	Solomon	#10		21065	" {12} A scoundrel and villain, who goes about with a corrupt mouth,"
PRV	6	13	Solomon	#10		21066	" {13} who winks with his eye, signals with his feet and motions with his fingers, {14} who plots evil with deceit in his heart-- he always stirs up dissension."
PRV	6	15	Solomon	#10		21067	 {15} Therefore disaster will overtake him in an instant; he will suddenly be destroyed--without remedy.
PRV	6	16	Solomon	#10		21068	" {16} There are six things the Lord hates, seven that are detestable to him:"
PRV	6	17	Solomon	#10		21069	" {17} haughty eyes, a lying tongue, hands that shed innocent blood, {18} a heart that devises wicked schemes, feet that are quick to rush into evil,"
PRV	6	19	Solomon	#10		21070	 {19} a false witness who pours out lies and a man who stirs up dissension among brothers.
PRV	6	20	Solomon	#10		21071	" {20} My son, keep your father's commands and do not forsake your mother's teaching. {21} Bind them upon your heart forever; fasten them around your neck."
PRV	6	22	Solomon	#10		21072	" {22} When you walk, they will guide you; when you sleep, they will watch over you; when you awake, they will speak to you."
PRV	6	23	Solomon	#10		21073	" {23} For these commands are a lamp, this teaching is a light, and the corrections of discipline are the way to life,"
PRV	6	24	Solomon	#10		21074	" {24} keeping you from the immoral woman, from the smooth tongue of the wayward wife."
PRV	6	25	Solomon	#10		21075	" {25} Do not lust in your heart after her beauty or let her captivate you with her eyes,"
PRV	6	26	Solomon	#10		21076	" {26} for the prostitute reduces you to a loaf of bread, and the adulteress preys upon your very life."
PRV	6	27	Solomon	#10		21077	 {27} Can a man scoop fire into his lap without his clothes being burned? {28} Can a man walk on hot coals without his feet being scorched?
PRV	6	29	Solomon	#10		21078	 {29} So is he who sleeps with another man's wife; no one who touches her will go unpunished.
PRV	6	30	Solomon	#10		21079	" {30} Men do not despise a thief if he steals to satisfy his hunger when he is starving. {31} Yet if he is caught, he must pay sevenfold, though it costs him all the wealth of his house."
PRV	6	32	Solomon	#10		21080	 {32} But a man who commits adultery lacks judgment; whoever does so destroys himself.
PRV	6	33	Solomon	#10		21081	" {33} Blows and disgrace are his lot, and his shame will never be wiped away; {34} for jealousy arouses a husband's fury, and he will show no mercy when he takes revenge."
PRV	6	35	Solomon	#10		21082	" {35} He will not accept any compensation; he will refuse the bribe, however great it is.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
PRV	7	<<	Narr_20: Proverbs	#13		21083	PROVERBS 7
PRV	7	1	Solomon	#10		21084	" {1} My son, keep my words and store up my commands within you. {2} Keep my commands and you will live; guard my teachings as the apple of your eye."
PRV	7	3	Solomon	#10		21085	" {3} Bind them on your fingers; write them on the tablet of your heart. {4} Say to wisdom, << You are my sister,>> and call understanding your kinsman;"
PRV	7	5	Solomon	#10		21086	" {5} they will keep you from the adulteress, from the wayward wife with her seductive words."
PRV	7	6	Solomon	#10		21087	" {6} At the window of my house I looked out through the lattice. {7} I saw among the simple, I noticed among the young men, a youth who lacked judgment."
PRV	7	8	Solomon	#10		21088	" {8} He was going down the street near her corner, walking along in the direction of her house {9} at twilight, as the day was fading, as the dark of night set in."
PRV	7	10	Solomon	#10		21089	" {10} Then out came a woman to meet him, dressed like a prostitute and with crafty intent."
PRV	7	11	Solomon	#10		21090	" {11} (She is loud and defiant, her feet never stay at home; {12} now in the street, now in the squares, at every corner she lurks. )"
PRV	7	13	Solomon	#10		21091	 {13} She took hold of him and kissed him and with a brazen face she said:
PRV	7	14	Woman	#23		21092	 {14} << I have fellowship offerings at home; today I fulfilled my vows.
PRV	7	15	Woman	#23		21093	 {15} So I came out to meet you; I looked for you and have found you!
PRV	7	16	Woman	#23		21094	 {16} I have covered my bed with colored linens from Egypt.
PRV	7	17	Woman	#23		21095	" {17} I have perfumed my bed with myrrh, aloes and cinnamon."
PRV	7	18	Woman	#23		21096	" {18} Come, let's drink deep of love till morning; let's enjoy ourselves with love!"
PRV	7	19	Woman	#23		21097	 {19} My husband is not at home; he has gone on a long journey.
PRV	7	20	Woman	#23		21098	 {20} He took his purse filled with money and will not be home till full moon. >>
PRV	7	21	Solomon	#10		21099	 {21} With persuasive words she led him astray; she seduced him with her smooth talk.
PRV	7	22	Solomon	#10		21100	" {22} All at once he followed her like an ox going to the slaughter, "
PRV	7	22	Solomon	#10		21101	" like a deer stepping into a noose {23} till an arrow pierces his liver, like a bird darting into a snare, little knowing it will cost him his life."
PRV	7	24	Solomon	#10		21102	" {24} Now then, my sons, listen to me; pay attention to what I say. {25} Do not let your heart turn to her ways or stray into her paths."
PRV	7	26	Solomon	#10		21103	 {26} Many are the victims she has brought down; her slain are a mighty throng.
PRV	7	27	Solomon	#10		21104	" {27} Her house is a highway to the grave, leading down to the chambers of death.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
PRV	8	<<	Narr_20: Proverbs	#13		21105	PROVERBS 8
PRV	8	1	Solomon	#10		21106	 {1} Does not wisdom call out? Does not understanding raise her voice?
PRV	8	2	Solomon	#10		21107	" {2} On the heights along the way, where the paths meet, she takes her stand; {3} beside the gates leading into the city, at the entrances, she cries aloud:"
PRV	8	4	Wisdom (female)	#24		21108	" {4} << To you, O men, I call out; I raise my voice to all mankind."
PRV	8	5	Wisdom (female)	#24		21109	" {5} You who are simple, gain prudence; you who are foolish, gain understanding."
PRV	8	6	Wisdom (female)	#24		21110	" {6} Listen, for I have worthy things to say; I open my lips to speak what is right."
PRV	8	7	Wisdom (female)	#24		21111	" {7} My mouth speaks what is true, for my lips detest wickedness."
PRV	8	8	Wisdom (female)	#24		21112	 {8} All the words of my mouth are just; none of them is crooked or perverse.
PRV	8	9	Wisdom (female)	#24		21113	 {9} To the discerning all of them are right; they are faultless to those who have knowledge.
PRV	8	10	Wisdom (female)	#24		21114	" {10} Choose my instruction instead of silver, knowledge rather than choice gold,"
PRV	8	11	Wisdom (female)	#24		21115	" {11} for wisdom is more precious than rubies, and nothing you desire can compare with her."
PRV	8	12	Wisdom (female)	#24		21116	" {12} << I, wisdom, dwell together with prudence; I possess knowledge and discretion."
PRV	8	13	Wisdom (female)	#24		21117	" {13} To fear the Lord is to hate evil; I hate pride and arrogance, evil behavior and perverse speech."
PRV	8	14	Wisdom (female)	#24		21118	 {14} Counsel and sound judgment are mine; I have understanding and power.
PRV	8	15	Wisdom (female)	#24		21119	 {15} By me kings reign and rulers make laws that are just;
PRV	8	16	Wisdom (female)	#24		21120	" {16} by me princes govern, and all nobles who rule on earth."
PRV	8	17	Wisdom (female)	#24		21121	" {17} I love those who love me, and those who seek me find me."
PRV	8	18	Wisdom (female)	#24		21122	" {18} With me are riches and honor, enduring wealth and prosperity."
PRV	8	19	Wisdom (female)	#24		21123	 {19} My fruit is better than fine gold; what I yield surpasses choice silver.
PRV	8	20	Wisdom (female)	#24		21124	" {20} I walk in the way of righteousness, along the paths of justice, {21} bestowing wealth on those who love me and making their treasuries full."
PRV	8	22	Wisdom (female)	#24		21125	" {22} << The Lord brought me forth as the first of his works, before his deeds of old;"
PRV	8	23	Wisdom (female)	#24		21126	" {23} I was appointed from eternity, from the beginning, before the world began."
PRV	8	24	Wisdom (female)	#24		21127	" {24} When there were no oceans, I was given birth, when there were no springs abounding with water;"
PRV	8	25	Wisdom (female)	#24		21128	" {25} before the mountains were settled in place, before the hills, I was given birth, {26} before he made the earth or its fields or any of the dust of the world."
PRV	8	27	Wisdom (female)	#24		21129	" {27} I was there when he set the heavens in place, when he marked out the horizon on the face of the deep,"
PRV	8	28	Wisdom (female)	#24		21130	" {28} when he established the clouds above and fixed securely the fountains of the deep,"
PRV	8	29	Wisdom (female)	#24		21131	" {29} when he gave the sea its boundary so the waters would not overstep his command, and when he marked out the foundations of the earth."
PRV	8	30	Wisdom (female)	#24		21132	" {30} Then I was the craftsman at his side. I was filled with delight day after day, rejoicing always in his presence,"
PRV	8	31	Wisdom (female)	#24		21133	 {31} rejoicing in his whole world and delighting in mankind.
PRV	8	32	Wisdom (female)	#24		21134	" {32} << Now then, my sons, listen to me; blessed are those who keep my ways."
PRV	8	33	Wisdom (female)	#24		21135	 {33} Listen to my instruction and be wise; do not ignore it.
PRV	8	34	Wisdom (female)	#24		21136	" {34} Blessed is the man who listens to me, watching daily at my doors, waiting at my doorway."
PRV	8	35	Wisdom (female)	#24		21137	 {35} For whoever finds me finds life and receives favor from the Lord.
PRV	8	36	Wisdom (female)	#24		21138	 {36} But whoever fails to find me harms himself; all who hate me love death. >>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
PRV	9	<<	Narr_20: Proverbs	#13		21139	PROVERBS 9
PRV	9	1	Solomon	#10		21140	 {1} Wisdom has built her house; she has hewn out its seven pillars.
PRV	9	2	Solomon	#10		21141	 {2} She has prepared her meat and mixed her wine; she has also set her table.
PRV	9	3	Solomon	#10		21142	" {3} She has sent out her maids, and she calls from the highest point of the city."
PRV	9	4	Wisdom (female)	#24		21143	 {4} << Let all who are simple come in here! >>
PRV	9	4	Solomon	#10		21144	 she says to those who lack judgment.
PRV	9	5	Wisdom (female)	#24		21145	" {5} << Come, eat my food and drink the wine I have mixed."
PRV	9	6	Wisdom (female)	#24		21146	 {6} Leave your simple ways and you will live; walk in the way of understanding.
PRV	9	7	Wisdom (female)	#24		21147	 {7} << Whoever corrects a mocker invites insult; whoever rebukes a wicked man incurs abuse.
PRV	9	8	Wisdom (female)	#24		21148	 {8} Do not rebuke a mocker or he will hate you; rebuke a wise man and he will love you.
PRV	9	9	Wisdom (female)	#24		21149	 {9} Instruct a wise man and he will be wiser still; teach a righteous man and he will add to his learning.
PRV	9	10	Wisdom (female)	#24		21150	" {10} << The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom, and knowledge of the Holy One is understanding."
PRV	9	11	Wisdom (female)	#24		21151	" {11} For through me your days will be many, and years will be added to your life."
PRV	9	12	Wisdom (female)	#24		21152	" {12} If you are wise, your wisdom will reward you; if you are a mocker, you alone will suffer. >>"
PRV	9	13	Solomon	#10		21153	 {13} The woman Folly is loud; she is undisciplined and without knowledge.
PRV	9	14	Solomon	#10		21154	" {14} She sits at the door of her house, on a seat at the highest point of the city,"
PRV	9	15	Solomon	#10		21155	" {15} calling out to those who pass by, who go straight on their way."
PRV	9	16	Folly (female)	#22		21156	 {16} << Let all who are simple come in here! >>
PRV	9	16	Solomon	#10		21157	 she says to those who lack judgment.
PRV	9	17	Folly (female)	#22		21158	 {17} << Stolen water is sweet; food eaten in secret is delicious! >>
PRV	9	18	Solomon	#10		21159	" {18} But little do they know that the dead are there, that her guests are in the depths of the grave.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
PRV	10	<<	Narr_20: Proverbs	#13		21160	PROVERBS 10
PRV	10	1	Narr_20: Proverbs	#13		21161	 {1} The proverbs of Solomon:
PRV	10	1	Solomon	#10		21162	" A wise son brings joy to his father, but a foolish son grief to his mother. "
PRV	10	2	Solomon	#10		21163	" {2} Ill-gotten treasures are of no value, but righteousness delivers from death."
PRV	10	3	Solomon	#10		21164	 {3} The Lord does not let the righteous go hungry but he thwarts the craving of the wicked. 
PRV	10	4	Solomon	#10		21165	" {4} Lazy hands make a man poor, but diligent hands bring wealth."
PRV	10	5	Solomon	#10		21166	" {5} He who gathers crops in summer is a wise son, but he who sleeps during harvest is a disgraceful son."
PRV	10	6	Solomon	#10		21167	" {6} Blessings crown the head of the righteous, but violence overwhelms the mouth of the wicked."
PRV	10	7	Solomon	#10		21168	" {7} The memory of the righteous will be a blessing, but the name of the wicked will rot."
PRV	10	8	Solomon	#10		21169	" {8} The wise in heart accept commands, but a chattering fool comes to ruin."
PRV	10	9	Solomon	#10		21170	" {9} The man of integrity walks securely, but he who takes crooked paths will be found out."
PRV	10	10	Solomon	#10		21171	" {10} He who winks maliciously causes grief, and a chattering fool comes to ruin."
PRV	10	11	Solomon	#10		21172	" {11} The mouth of the righteous is a fountain of life, but violence overwhelms the mouth of the wicked."
PRV	10	12	Solomon	#10		21173	" {12} Hatred stirs up dissension, but love covers over all wrongs."
PRV	10	13	Solomon	#10		21174	" {13} Wisdom is found on the lips of the discerning, but a rod is for the back of him who lacks judgment."
PRV	10	14	Solomon	#10		21175	" {14} Wise men store up knowledge, but the mouth of a fool invites ruin. "
PRV	10	15	Solomon	#10		21176	" {15} The wealth of the rich is their fortified city, but poverty is the ruin of the poor."
PRV	10	16	Solomon	#10		21177	" {16} The wages of the righteous bring them life, but the income of the wicked brings them punishment."
PRV	10	17	Solomon	#10		21178	" {17} He who heeds discipline shows the way to life, but whoever ignores correction leads others astray."
PRV	10	18	Solomon	#10		21179	" {18} He who conceals his hatred has lying lips, and whoever spreads slander is a fool. "
PRV	10	19	Solomon	#10		21180	" {19} When words are many, sin is not absent, but he who holds his tongue is wise."
PRV	10	20	Solomon	#10		21181	" {20} The tongue of the righteous is choice silver, but the heart of the wicked is of little value."
PRV	10	21	Solomon	#10		21182	" {21} The lips of the righteous nourish many, but fools die for lack of judgment. "
PRV	10	22	Solomon	#10		21183	" {22} The blessing of the Lord brings wealth, and he adds no trouble to it."
PRV	10	23	Solomon	#10		21184	" {23} A fool finds pleasure in evil conduct, but a man of understanding delights in wisdom."
PRV	10	24	Solomon	#10		21185	 {24} What the wicked dreads will overtake him; what the righteous desire will be granted.
PRV	10	25	Solomon	#10		21186	" {25} When the storm has swept by, the wicked are gone, but the righteous stand firm forever."
PRV	10	26	Solomon	#10		21187	" {26} As vinegar vinegar to the teeth and smoke to the eyes, so is a sluggard to those who send him."
PRV	10	27	Solomon	#10		21188	" {27} The fear of the Lord adds length to life, but the years of the wicked are cut short."
PRV	10	28	Solomon	#10		21189	" {28} The prospect of the righteous is joy, but the hopes of the wicked come to nothing."
PRV	10	29	Solomon	#10		21190	" {29} The way of the Lord is a refuge for the righteous, but it is the ruin of those who do evil."
PRV	10	30	Solomon	#10		21191	" {30} The righteous will never be uprooted, but the wicked will not remain in the land."
PRV	10	31	Solomon	#10		21192	" {31} The mouth of the righteous brings forth wisdom, but a perverse tongue will be cut out."
PRV	10	32	Solomon	#10		21193	" {32} The lips of the righteous know what is fitting, but the mouth of the wicked only what is perverse.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
PRV	11	<<	Narr_20: Proverbs	#13		21194	PROVERBS 11
PRV	11	1	Solomon	#10		21195	" {1} The Lord abhors dishonest scales, but accurate weights are his delight."
PRV	11	2	Solomon	#10		21196	" {2} When pride comes, then comes disgrace, but with humility comes wisdom."
PRV	11	3	Solomon	#10		21197	" {3} The integrity of the upright guides them, but the unfaithful are destroyed by their duplicity."
PRV	11	4	Solomon	#10		21198	" {4} Wealth is worthless in the day of wrath, but righteousness delivers from death."
PRV	11	5	Solomon	#10		21199	" {5} The righteousness of the blameless makes a straight way for them, but the wicked are brought down by their own wickedness."
PRV	11	6	Solomon	#10		21200	" {6} The righteousness of the upright delivers them, but the unfaithful are trapped by evil desires."
PRV	11	7	Solomon	#10		21201	" {7} When a wicked man dies, his hope perishes; all he expected from his power comes to nothing."
PRV	11	8	Solomon	#10		21202	" {8} The righteous man is rescued from trouble, and it comes on the wicked instead."
PRV	11	9	Solomon	#10		21203	" {9} With his mouth the godless destroys his neighbor, but through knowledge the righteous escape."
PRV	11	10	Solomon	#10		21204	" {10} When the righteous prosper, the city rejoices; when the wicked perish, there are shouts of joy."
PRV	11	11	Solomon	#10		21205	" {11} Through the blessing of the upright a city is exalted, but by the mouth of the wicked it is destroyed."
PRV	11	12	Solomon	#10		21206	" {12} A man who lacks judgment derides his neighbor, but a man of understanding holds his tongue."
PRV	11	13	Solomon	#10		21207	" {13} A gossip betrays a confidence, but a trustworthy man keeps a secret."
PRV	11	14	Solomon	#10		21208	" {14} For lack of guidance a nation falls, but many advisers make victory sure."
PRV	11	15	Solomon	#10		21209	" {15} He who puts up security for another will surely suffer, but whoever refuses to strike hands in pledge is safe."
PRV	11	16	Solomon	#10		21210	" {16} A kindhearted woman gains respect, but ruthless men gain only wealth."
PRV	11	17	Solomon	#10		21211	" {17} A kind man benefits himself, but a cruel man brings trouble on himself."
PRV	11	18	Solomon	#10		21212	" {18} The wicked man earns deceptive wages, but he who sows righteousness reaps a sure reward."
PRV	11	19	Solomon	#10		21213	" {19} The truly righteous man attains life, but he who pursues evil goes to his death."
PRV	11	20	Solomon	#10		21214	 {20} The Lord detests men of perverse heart but he delights in those whose ways are blameless.
PRV	11	21	Solomon	#10		21215	" {21} Be sure of this: The wicked will will not go unpunished, but those who are righteous will go free."
PRV	11	22	Solomon	#10		21216	 {22} Like a gold ring in a pig's snout is a beautiful woman who shows no discretion.
PRV	11	23	Solomon	#10		21217	" {23} The desire of the righteous ends only in good, but the hope of the wicked only in wrath."
PRV	11	24	Solomon	#10		21218	" {24} One man gives freely, yet gains even more; another withholds unduly, but comes to poverty."
PRV	11	25	Solomon	#10		21219	 {25} A generous man will prosper; he who refreshes others will himself be refreshed.
PRV	11	26	Solomon	#10		21220	" {26} People curse the man who hoards grain, but blessing crowns him who is willing to sell."
PRV	11	27	Solomon	#10		21221	" {27} He who seeks good finds goodwill, but evil comes to him who searches for it."
PRV	11	28	Solomon	#10		21222	" {28} Whoever trusts in his riches will fall, but the righteous will thrive like a green leaf."
PRV	11	29	Solomon	#10		21223	" {29} He who brings trouble on his family will inherit only wind, and the fool will be servant to the wise."
PRV	11	30	Solomon	#10		21224	" {30} The fruit of the righteous is a tree of life, and he who wins souls is wise."
PRV	11	31	Solomon	#10		21225	" {31} If the righteous receive their due on earth, how much more the ungodly and the sinner!*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
PRV	12	<<	Narr_20: Proverbs	#13		21226	PROVERBS 12
PRV	12	1	Solomon	#10		21227	" {1} Whoever loves discipline loves knowledge, but he who hates correction is stupid."
PRV	12	2	Solomon	#10		21228	" {2} A good man obtains favor from the Lord, but the Lord condemns a crafty man."
PRV	12	3	Solomon	#10		21229	" {3} A man cannot be established through wickedness, but the righteous cannot be uprooted."
PRV	12	4	Solomon	#10		21230	" {4} A wife of noble character is her husband's crown, but a disgraceful wife is like decay in his bones."
PRV	12	5	Solomon	#10		21231	" {5} The plans of the righteous are just, but the advice of the wicked is deceitful."
PRV	12	6	Solomon	#10		21232	" {6} The words of the wicked lie in wait for blood, but the speech of the upright rescues them."
PRV	12	7	Solomon	#10		21233	" {7} Wicked men are overthrown and are no more, but the house of the righteous stands firm."
PRV	12	8	Solomon	#10		21234	" {8} A man is praised according to his wisdom, but men with warped minds are despised."
PRV	12	9	Solomon	#10		21235	 {9} Better to be a nobody and yet have a servant than pretend to be somebody and have no food.
PRV	12	10	Solomon	#10		21236	" {10} A righteous man cares for the needs of his animal, but the kindest acts of the wicked are cruel."
PRV	12	11	Solomon	#10		21237	" {11} He who works his land will have abundant food, but he who chases fantasies lacks judgment."
PRV	12	12	Solomon	#10		21238	" {12} The wicked desire the plunder of evil men, but the root of the righteous flourishes."
PRV	12	13	Solomon	#10		21239	" {13} An evil man is trapped by his sinful talk, but a righteous man escapes trouble."
PRV	12	14	Solomon	#10		21240	 {14} From the fruit of his lips a man is filled with good things as surely as the work of his hands rewards him.
PRV	12	15	Solomon	#10		21241	" {15} The way of a fool seems right to him, but a wise man listens to advice."
PRV	12	16	Solomon	#10		21242	" {16} A fool shows his annoyance at once, but a prudent man overlooks an insult."
PRV	12	17	Solomon	#10		21243	" {17} A truthful witness gives honest testimony, but a false witness tells lies."
PRV	12	18	Solomon	#10		21244	" {18} Reckless words pierce like a sword, but the tongue of the wise brings healing."
PRV	12	19	Solomon	#10		21245	" {19} Truthful lips endure forever, but a lying tongue lasts only a moment."
PRV	12	20	Solomon	#10		21246	" {20} There is deceit in the hearts of those who plot evil, but joy for those who promote peace."
PRV	12	21	Solomon	#10		21247	" {21} No harm befalls the righteous, but the wicked have their fill of trouble."
PRV	12	22	Solomon	#10		21248	" {22} The Lord detests lying lips, but he delights in men who are truthful."
PRV	12	23	Solomon	#10		21249	" {23} A prudent man keeps his knowledge to himself, but the heart of fools blurts out folly."
PRV	12	24	Solomon	#10		21250	" {24} Diligent hands will rule, but laziness ends in slave labor."
PRV	12	25	Solomon	#10		21251	" {25} An anxious heart weighs a man down, but a kind word cheers him up."
PRV	12	26	Solomon	#10		21252	" {26} A righteous man is cautious in friendship, but the way of the wicked leads them astray."
PRV	12	27	Solomon	#10		21253	" {27} The lazy man does not roast his game, the diligent man prizes his possessions."
PRV	12	28	Solomon	#10		21254	 {28} In the way of righteousness there is life; along that path is immortality.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
PRV	13	<<	Narr_20: Proverbs	#13		21255	PROVERBS 13
PRV	13	1	Solomon	#10		21256	" {1} A wise son heeds his father's instruction, but a mocker does not listen to rebuke."
PRV	13	2	Solomon	#10		21257	" {2} From the fruit of his lips a man enjoys good things, but the unfaithful have a craving for violence."
PRV	13	3	Solomon	#10		21258	" {3} He who guards his lips guards his life, but he who speaks rashly will come to ruin."
PRV	13	4	Solomon	#10		21259	" {4} The sluggard craves and gets nothing, but the desires of the diligent are fully satisfied."
PRV	13	5	Solomon	#10		21260	" {5} The righteous hate what is false, but the wicked bring shame and disgrace."
PRV	13	6	Solomon	#10		21261	" {6} Righteousness guards the man of integrity, but wickedness overthrows the sinner."
PRV	13	7	Solomon	#10		21262	" {7} One man pretends to be rich, yet has nothing; another pretends to be poor, yet has great wealth."
PRV	13	8	Solomon	#10		21263	" {8} A man's riches may ransom his life, but a poor man hears no threat."
PRV	13	9	Solomon	#10		21264	" {9} The light of the righteous shines brightly, but the lamp of the wicked is snuffed out."
PRV	13	10	Solomon	#10		21265	" {10} Pride only breeds quarrels, but wisdom is found in those who take advice."
PRV	13	11	Solomon	#10		21266	" {11} Dishonest money dwindles away, but he who gathers money little by little makes it grow."
PRV	13	12	Solomon	#10		21267	" {12} Hope deferred makes the heart sick, but a longing fulfilled is a tree of life."
PRV	13	13	Solomon	#10		21268	" {13} He who scorns instruction will pay for it, but he who respects a command is rewarded."
PRV	13	14	Solomon	#10		21269	" {14} The teaching of the wise is a fountain of life, turning a man from the snares of death."
PRV	13	15	Solomon	#10		21270	" {15} Good understanding wins favor, but the way of the unfaithful is hard."
PRV	13	16	Solomon	#10		21271	" {16} Every prudent man acts out of knowledge, but a fool exposes his folly."
PRV	13	17	Solomon	#10		21272	" {17} A wicked messenger falls into trouble, but a trustworthy envoy brings healing."
PRV	13	18	Solomon	#10		21273	" {18} He who ignores discipline comes to poverty and shame, but whoever heeds correction is honored."
PRV	13	19	Solomon	#10		21274	" {19} A longing fulfilled is sweet to the soul, but fools detest turning from evil."
PRV	13	20	Solomon	#10		21275	" {20} He who walks with the wise grows wise, but a companion of fools suffers harm."
PRV	13	21	Solomon	#10		21276	" {21} Misfortune pursues the sinner, but prosperity is the reward of the righteous."
PRV	13	22	Solomon	#10		21277	" {22} A good man leaves an inheritance for his children's children, but a sinner's wealth is stored up for the righteous."
PRV	13	23	Solomon	#10		21278	" {23} A poor man's field may produce abundant food, but injustice sweeps it away."
PRV	13	24	Solomon	#10		21279	" {24} He who spares the rod hates his son, but he who loves him is careful to discipline him."
PRV	13	25	Solomon	#10		21280	" {25} The righteous eat to their hearts' content, but the stomach of the wicked goes hungry.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
PRV	14	<<	Narr_20: Proverbs	#13		21281	PROVERBS 14
PRV	14	1	Solomon	#10		21282	" {1} The wise woman builds her house, but with her own hands the foolish one tears hers down."
PRV	14	2	Solomon	#10		21283	" {2} He whose walk is upright fears the Lord, but he whose ways are devious despises him."
PRV	14	3	Solomon	#10		21284	" {3} A fool's talk brings a rod to his back, but the lips of the wise protect them."
PRV	14	4	Solomon	#10		21285	" {4} Where there are no oxen, the manger is empty, but from the strength of an ox comes an abundant harvest."
PRV	14	5	Solomon	#10		21286	" {5} A truthful witness does not deceive, but a false witness pours out lies."
PRV	14	6	Solomon	#10		21287	" {6} The mocker seeks wisdom and finds none, but knowledge comes easily to the discerning."
PRV	14	7	Solomon	#10		21288	" {7} Stay away from a foolish man, for you will not find knowledge on his lips."
PRV	14	8	Solomon	#10		21289	" {8} The wisdom of the prudent is to give thought to their ways, but the folly of fools is deception."
PRV	14	9	Solomon	#10		21290	" {9} Fools mock at making amends for sin, but goodwill is found among the upright."
PRV	14	10	Solomon	#10		21291	" {10} Each heart knows its own bitterness, and no one else can share its joy."
PRV	14	11	Solomon	#10		21292	" {11} The house of the wicked will be destroyed, but the tent of the upright will flourish."
PRV	14	12	Solomon	#10		21293	" {12} There is a way that seems right to a man, but in the end it leads to death."
PRV	14	13	Solomon	#10		21294	" {13} Even in laughter the heart may ache, and joy may end in grief."
PRV	14	14	Solomon	#10		21295	" {14} The faithless will be fully repaid for their ways, and the good man rewarded for his."
PRV	14	15	Solomon	#10		21296	" {15} A simple man believes anything, but a prudent man gives thought to his steps."
PRV	14	16	Solomon	#10		21297	" {16} A wise man fears the Lord and shuns evil, but a fool is hotheaded and reckless."
PRV	14	17	Solomon	#10		21298	" {17} A quick-tempered man does foolish things, and a crafty man is hated."
PRV	14	18	Solomon	#10		21299	" {18} The simple inherit folly, but the prudent are crowned with knowledge."
PRV	14	19	Solomon	#10		21300	" {19} Evil men will bow down in the presence of the good, and the wicked at the gates of the righteous."
PRV	14	20	Solomon	#10		21301	" {20} The poor are shunned even by their neighbors, but the rich have many friends."
PRV	14	21	Solomon	#10		21302	" {21} He who despises his neighbor sins, but blessed is he who is kind to the needy."
PRV	14	22	Solomon	#10		21303	 {22} Do not those who plot evil go astray? But those who plan what is good find love and faithfulness.
PRV	14	23	Solomon	#10		21304	" {23} All hard work brings a profit, but mere talk leads only to poverty."
PRV	14	24	Solomon	#10		21305	" {24} The wealth of the wise is their crown, but the folly of fools yields folly."
PRV	14	25	Solomon	#10		21306	" {25} A truthful witness saves lives, but a false witness is deceitful."
PRV	14	26	Solomon	#10		21307	" {26} He who fears the Lord has a secure fortress, and for his children it will be a refuge."
PRV	14	27	Solomon	#10		21308	" {27} The fear of the Lord is a fountain of life, turning a man from the snares of death."
PRV	14	28	Solomon	#10		21309	" {28} A large population is a king's glory, but without subjects a prince is ruined."
PRV	14	29	Solomon	#10		21310	" {29} A patient man has great understanding, but a quick-tempered man displays folly."
PRV	14	30	Solomon	#10		21311	" {30} A heart at peace gives life to the body, but envy rots the bones."
PRV	14	31	Solomon	#10		21312	" {31} He who oppresses the poor shows contempt for their Maker, but whoever is kind to the needy honors God."
PRV	14	32	Solomon	#10		21313	" {32} When calamity comes, the wicked are brought down, but even in death the righteous have a refuge."
PRV	14	33	Solomon	#10		21314	 {33} Wisdom reposes in the heart of the discerning and even among fools she lets herself be known.
PRV	14	34	Solomon	#10		21315	" {34} Righteousness exalts a nation, but sin is a disgrace to any people."
PRV	14	35	Solomon	#10		21316	" {35} A king delights in a wise servant, but a shameful servant incurs his wrath.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"

PRV	15	1	Solomon	#10		21318	" {1} A gentle answer turns away wrath, but a harsh word stirs up anger."
PRV	15	2	Solomon	#10		21319	" {2} The tongue of the wise commends knowledge, but the mouth of the fool gushes folly."
PRV	15	3	Solomon	#10		21320	" {3} The eyes of the Lord are everywhere, keeping watch on the wicked and the good."
PRV	15	4	Solomon	#10		21321	" {4} The tongue that brings healing is a tree of life, but a deceitful tongue crushes the spirit."
PRV	15	5	Solomon	#10		21322	" {5} A fool spurns his father's discipline, but whoever heeds correction shows prudence."

PRV	15	7	Solomon	#10		21324	 {7} The lips of the wise spread knowledge; not so the hearts of fools.

PRV	15	11	Solomon	#10		21328	 {11} Death and destruction lie open before the Lord -- how much more the hearts of men!
PRV	15	12	Solomon	#10		21329	 {12} A mocker resents correction; he will not consult the wise.
PRV	15	13	Solomon	#10		21330	" {13} A happy heart makes the face cheerful, but heartache crushes the spirit."

PRV	15	15	Solomon	#10		21332	" {15} All the days of the oppressed are wretched, but the cheerful heart has a continual feast."
PRV	15	16	Solomon	#10		21333	 {16} Better a little with the fear of the Lord than great wealth with turmoil.
PRV	15	17	Solomon	#10		21334	 {17} Better a meal of vegetables where there is love than a fattened calf with hatred.
PRV	15	18	Solomon	#10		21335	" {18} A hot-tempered man stirs up dissension, but a patient man calms a quarrel."
PRV	15	19	Solomon	#10		21336	" {19} The way of the sluggard is blocked with thorns, but the path of the upright is a highway."
PRV	15	20	Solomon	#10		21337	" {20} A wise son brings joy to his father, but a foolish man despises his mother."
PRV	15	21	Solomon	#10		21338	" {21} Folly delights a man who lacks judgment, but a man of understanding keeps a straight course."
PRV	15	22	Solomon	#10		21339	" {22} Plans fail for lack of counsel, but with many advisers they succeed."
PRV	15	23	Solomon	#10		21340	 {23} A man finds joy in giving an apt reply-- and how good is a timely word!
PRV	15	24	Solomon	#10		21341	 {24} The path of life leads upward for the wise to keep him from going down to the grave.
PRV	15	25	Solomon	#10		21342	 {25} The Lord tears down the proud man's house but he keeps the widow's boundaries intact.
PRV	15	26	Solomon	#10		21343	" {26} The Lord detests the thoughts of the wicked, but those of the pure are pleasing to him."
PRV	15	27	Solomon	#10		21344	" {27} A greedy man brings trouble to his family, but he who hates bribes will live."
PRV	15	28	Solomon	#10		21345	" {28} The heart of the righteous weighs its answers, but the mouth of the wicked gushes evil."
PRV	15	29	Solomon	#10		21346	 {29} The Lord is far from the wicked but he hears the prayer of the righteous.
PRV	15	30	Solomon	#10		21347	" {30} A cheerful look brings joy to the heart, and good news gives health to the bones."
PRV	15	31	Solomon	#10		21348	 {31} He who listens to a life-giving rebuke will be at home among the wise.
PRV	15	32	Solomon	#10		21349	" {32} He who ignores discipline despises himself, but whoever whoever heeds correction gains understanding."

PRV	16	1	Solomon	#10		21352	" {1} To man belong the plans of the heart, but from the Lord comes the reply of the tongue."
PRV	16	2	Solomon	#10		21353	" {2} All a man's ways seem innocent to him, but motives are weighed by the Lord."
PRV	16	3	Solomon	#10		21354	" {3} Commit to the Lord whatever you do, and your plans will succeed."
PRV	16	4	Solomon	#10		21355	 {4} The Lord works out everything for his own ends-- even the wicked for a day of disaster.
PRV	16	5	Solomon	#10		21356	 {5} The Lord detests all the proud of heart. Be sure of this: They will not go unpunished.
PRV	16	6	Solomon	#10		21357	 {6} Through love and faithfulness sin is atoned for; through the fear of the Lord a man avoids evil.
PRV	16	7	Solomon	#10		21358	" {7} When a man's ways are pleasing to the Lord, he makes even his enemies live at peace with him."
PRV	16	8	Solomon	#10		21359	 {8} Better a little with righteousness than much gain with injustice.
PRV	16	9	Solomon	#10		21360	" {9} In his heart a man plans his course, but the Lord determines his steps."
PRV	16	10	Solomon	#10		21361	" {10} The lips of a king speak as an oracle, and his mouth should not betray justice."
PRV	16	11	Solomon	#10		21362	 {11} Honest scales and balances are from the Lord; all the weights in the bag are of his making.
PRV	16	12	Solomon	#10		21363	" {12} Kings detest wrongdoing, for a throne is established through righteousness."
PRV	16	13	Solomon	#10		21364	 {13} Kings take pleasure in honest lips; they value a man who speaks the truth.
PRV	16	14	Solomon	#10		21365	" {14} A king's wrath is a messenger of death, but a wise man will appease it."
PRV	16	15	Solomon	#10		21366	" {15} When a king's face brightens, it means life; his favor is like a rain cloud in spring."
PRV	16	16	Solomon	#10		21367	" {16} How much better to get wisdom than gold, to choose understanding rather than silver!"
PRV	16	17	Solomon	#10		21368	 {17} The highway of the upright avoids evil; he who guards his way guards his life.
PRV	16	18	Solomon	#10		21369	" {18} Pride goes before destruction, a haughty spirit before a fall."
PRV	16	19	Solomon	#10		21370	 {19} Better to be lowly in spirit and among the oppressed than to share plunder with the proud.
PRV	16	20	Solomon	#10		21371	" {20} Whoever gives heed to instruction prospers, and blessed is he who trusts in the Lord."
PRV	16	21	Solomon	#10		21372	" {21} The wise in heart are called discerning, and pleasant words promote instruction."
PRV	16	22	Solomon	#10		21373	" {22} Understanding is a fountain of life to those who have it, but folly brings punishment to fools."
PRV	16	23	Solomon	#10		21374	" {23} A wise man's heart guides his mouth, and his lips promote instruction."
PRV	16	24	Solomon	#10		21375	" {24} Pleasant words are a honeycomb, sweet to the soul and healing to the bones."
PRV	16	25	Solomon	#10		21376	" {25} There is a way that seems right to a man, but in the end it leads to death."
PRV	16	26	Solomon	#10		21377	 {26} The laborer's appetite works for him; his hunger drives him on.
PRV	16	27	Solomon	#10		21378	" {27} A scoundrel plots evil, and his speech is like a scorching fire."
PRV	16	28	Solomon	#10		21379	" {28} A perverse man stirs up dissension, and a gossip separates close friends."
PRV	16	29	Solomon	#10		21380	 {29} A violent man entices his neighbor and leads him down a path that is not good.
PRV	16	30	Solomon	#10		21381	 {30} He who winks with his eye is plotting perversity; he who purses his lips is bent on evil.
PRV	16	31	Solomon	#10		21382	 {31} Gray hair is a crown of splendor; it is attained by a righteous life.
PRV	16	32	Solomon	#10		21383	" {32} Better a patient man than a warrior, a man who controls his temper than one who takes a city."
PRV	16	33	Solomon	#10		21384	" {33} The lot is cast into the lap, but its every decision is from the Lord.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"

PRV	17	1	Solomon	#10		21386	" {1} Better a dry crust with peace and quiet than a house full of feasting, with strife."
PRV	17	2	Solomon	#10		21387	" {2} A wise servant will rule over a disgraceful son, and will share the inheritance as one of the brothers."
PRV	17	3	Solomon	#10		21388	" {3} The crucible for silver and the furnace for gold, but the Lord tests the heart."
PRV	17	4	Solomon	#10		21389	 {4} A wicked man listens to evil lips; a liar pays attention to a malicious tongue.
PRV	17	5	Solomon	#10		21390	 {5} He who mocks the poor shows contempt for their Maker; whoever gloats over disaster will not go unpunished.
PRV	17	6	Solomon	#10		21391	" {6} Children's children are a crown to the aged, and parents are the pride of their children."
PRV	17	7	Solomon	#10		21392	 {7} Arrogant lips are unsuited to a fool-- how much worse lying lips to a ruler!
PRV	17	8	Solomon	#10		21393	" {8} A bribe is a charm to the one who gives it; wherever he turns, he succeeds."
PRV	17	9	Solomon	#10		21394	" {9} He who covers over an offense promotes love, but whoever repeats the matter separates close friends."
PRV	17	10	Solomon	#10		21395	 {10} A rebuke impresses a man of discernment more than a hundred lashes a fool.
PRV	17	11	Solomon	#10		21396	 {11} An evil man is bent only on rebellion; a merciless official will be sent against him.
PRV	17	12	Solomon	#10		21397	 {12} Better to meet a bear robbed of her cubs than a fool in his folly.
PRV	17	13	Solomon	#10		21398	" {13} If a man pays back evil for good, evil will never leave his house."
PRV	17	14	Solomon	#10		21399	 {14} Starting a quarrel is like breaching a dam; so drop the matter before a dispute breaks out.
PRV	17	15	Solomon	#10		21400	 {15} Acquitting the guilty and condemning the innocent-- the Lord detests them both.
PRV	17	16	Solomon	#10		21401	" {16} Of what use is money in the hand of a fool, since he has no desire to get wisdom?"
PRV	17	17	Solomon	#10		21402	" {17} A friend loves at all times, and a brother is born for adversity."
PRV	17	18	Solomon	#10		21403	 {18} A man lacking in judgment strikes hands in pledge and puts up security for his neighbor.
PRV	17	19	Solomon	#10		21404	 {19} He who loves a quarrel loves sin; he who builds a high gate invites destruction.
PRV	17	20	Solomon	#10		21405	 {20} A man of perverse heart does not prosper; he whose tongue is deceitful falls into trouble.
PRV	17	21	Solomon	#10		21406	 {21} To have a fool for a son brings grief; there is no joy for the father of a fool.
PRV	17	22	Solomon	#10		21407	" {22} A cheerful heart is good medicine, but a crushed spirit dries up the bones."
PRV	17	23	Solomon	#10		21408	 {23} A wicked man accepts a bribe in secret to pervert the course of justice.
PRV	17	24	Solomon	#10		21409	" {24} A discerning man keeps wisdom in view, but a fool's eyes wander to the ends of the earth."
PRV	17	25	Solomon	#10		21410	 {25} A foolish son brings grief to his father and bitterness to the one who bore him.
PRV	17	26	Solomon	#10		21411	" {26} It is not good to punish an innocent man, or to flog officials for their integrity."
PRV	17	27	Solomon	#10		21412	" {27} A man of knowledge uses words with restraint, and a man of understanding is even-tempered."
PRV	17	28	Solomon	#10		21413	" {28} Even a fool is thought wise if he keeps silent, and discerning if he holds his tongue.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
PRV	18	<<	Narr_20: Proverbs	#13		21414	PROVERBS 18
PRV	18	1	Solomon	#10		21415	 {1} An unfriendly man pursues selfish ends; he defies all sound judgment.
PRV	18	2	Solomon	#10		21416	 {2} A fool finds no pleasure in understanding but delights in airing his own opinions.
PRV	18	3	Solomon	#10		21417	" {3} When wickedness comes, so does contempt, and with shame comes disgrace."
PRV	18	4	Solomon	#10		21418	" {4} The words of a man's mouth are deep waters, but the fountain of wisdom is a bubbling brook."
PRV	18	5	Solomon	#10		21419	 {5} It is not good to be partial to the wicked or to deprive the innocent of justice.
PRV	18	6	Solomon	#10		21420	" {6} A fool's lips bring him strife, and his mouth invites a beating."
PRV	18	7	Solomon	#10		21421	" {7} A fool's mouth is his undoing, and his lips are a snare to his soul."
PRV	18	8	Solomon	#10		21422	 {8} The words of a gossip are like choice morsels; they go down to a man's inmost parts.
PRV	18	9	Solomon	#10		21423	 {9} ne who is slack in his work is brother to one who destroys.
PRV	18	10	Solomon	#10		21424	 {10} The name of the Lord is a strong tower; the righteous run to it and are safe.
PRV	18	11	Solomon	#10		21425	 {11} The wealth of the rich is their fortified city; they imagine it an unscalable wall.
PRV	18	12	Solomon	#10		21426	" {12} Before his downfall a man's heart is proud, but humility comes before honor."
PRV	18	13	Solomon	#10		21427	 {13} He who answers before listening-- that is his folly and his shame.
PRV	18	14	Solomon	#10		21428	" {14} A man's spirit sustains him in sickness, but a crushed spirit who can bear?"
PRV	18	15	Solomon	#10		21429	 {15} The heart of the discerning acquires knowledge; the ears of the wise seek it out.
PRV	18	16	Solomon	#10		21430	 {16} A gift opens the way for the giver and ushers him into the presence of the great.
PRV	18	17	Solomon	#10		21431	" {17} The first to present his case seems right, till another comes forward and questions him."
PRV	18	18	Solomon	#10		21432	 {18} Casting the lot settles disputes and keeps strong opponents apart.
PRV	18	19	Solomon	#10		21433	" {19} An offended brother is more unyielding than a fortified city, and disputes are like the barred gates of a citadel."
PRV	18	20	Solomon	#10		21434	 {20} From the fruit of his mouth a man's stomach is filled; with the harvest from his lips he is satisfied.
PRV	18	21	Solomon	#10		21435	" {21} The tongue has the power of life and death, and those who love it will eat its fruit."
PRV	18	22	Solomon	#10		21436	 {22} He who finds a wife finds what is good and receives favor from the Lord.
PRV	18	23	Solomon	#10		21437	" {23} A poor man pleads for mercy, but a rich man answers harshly."
PRV	18	24	Solomon	#10		21438	" {24} A man of many companions may come to ruin, but there is a friend who sticks closer than a brother.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
PRV	19	<<	Narr_20: Proverbs	#13		21439	PROVERBS 19
PRV	19	1	Solomon	#10		21440	 {1} Better a poor man whose walk is blameless than a fool whose lips are perverse.
PRV	19	2	Solomon	#10		21441	" {2} It is not good to have zeal without knowledge, nor to be hasty and miss the way."
PRV	19	3	Solomon	#10		21442	" {3} A man's own folly ruins his life, yet his heart rages against the Lord."
PRV	19	4	Solomon	#10		21443	" {4} Wealth brings many friends, but a poor man's friend deserts him."
PRV	19	5	Solomon	#10		21444	" {5} A false witness will not go unpunished, and he who pours out lies will not go free."
PRV	19	6	Solomon	#10		21445	" {6} Many curry favor with a ruler, and everyone is the friend of a man who gives gifts."
PRV	19	7	Solomon	#10		21446	" {7} A poor man is shunned by all his relatives-- how much more do his friends avoid him! Though he pursues them with pleading, they are nowhere to be found."
PRV	19	8	Solomon	#10		21447	 {8} He who gets wisdom loves his own soul; he who cherishes understanding prospers.
PRV	19	9	Solomon	#10		21448	" {9} A false witness will not go unpunished, and he who pours out lies will perish."
PRV	19	10	Solomon	#10		21449	 {10} It is not fitting for a fool to live in luxury-- how much worse for a slave to rule over princes!
PRV	19	11	Solomon	#10		21450	 {11} A man's wisdom gives him patience; it is to his glory to overlook an offense.
PRV	19	12	Solomon	#10		21451	" {12} A king's rage is like the roar of a lion, but his favor is like dew on the grass."
PRV	19	13	Solomon	#10		21452	" {13} A foolish son is his father's ruin, and a quarrelsome wife is like a constant dripping."
PRV	19	14	Solomon	#10		21453	" {14} Houses and wealth are inherited from parents, but a prudent wife is from the Lord."
PRV	19	15	Solomon	#10		21454	" {15} Laziness brings on deep sleep, and the shiftless man goes hungry."
PRV	19	16	Solomon	#10		21455	" {16} He who obeys instructions guards his life, but he who is contemptuous of his ways will die."
PRV	19	17	Solomon	#10		21456	" {17} He who is kind to the poor lends to the Lord, and he will reward him for what he has done."
PRV	19	18	Solomon	#10		21457	" {18} Discipline your son, for in that there is hope; do not be a willing party to his death."
PRV	19	19	Solomon	#10		21458	" {19} A hot-tempered man must pay the penalty; if you rescue him, you will have to do it again."
PRV	19	20	Solomon	#10		21459	" {20} Listen to advice and accept instruction, and in the end you will be wise."
PRV	19	21	Solomon	#10		21460	" {21} Many are the plans in a man's heart, but it is the Lord's purpose that prevails."
PRV	19	22	Solomon	#10		21461	 {22} What a man desires is unfailing love; better to be poor than a liar.
PRV	19	23	Solomon	#10		21462	" {23} The fear of the Lord leads to life: Then one rests content, untouched by trouble."
PRV	19	24	Solomon	#10		21463	 {24} The sluggard buries his hand in the dish; he will not even bring it back to his mouth!
PRV	19	25	Solomon	#10		21464	" {25} Flog a mocker, and the simple will learn prudence; rebuke a discerning man, and he will gain knowledge."
PRV	19	26	Solomon	#10		21465	 {26} He who robs his father and drives out his mother is a son who brings shame and disgrace.
PRV	19	27	Solomon	#10		21466	" {27} Stop listening to instruction, my son, and you will stray from the words of knowledge."
PRV	19	28	Solomon	#10		21467	" {28} A corrupt witness mocks at justice, and the mouth of the wicked gulps down evil."
PRV	19	29	Solomon	#10		21468	" {29} Penalties are prepared for mockers, and beatings for the backs of fools.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
PRV	20	<<	Narr_20: Proverbs	#13		21469	PROVERBS 20
PRV	20	1	Solomon	#10		21470	 {1} Wine is a mocker and beer a brawler; whoever is led astray by them is not wise.
PRV	20	2	Solomon	#10		21471	 {2} A king's wrath is like the roar of a lion; he who angers him forfeits his life.
PRV	20	3	Solomon	#10		21472	" {3} It is to a man's honor to avoid strife, but every fool is quick to quarrel."
PRV	20	4	Solomon	#10		21473	 {4} A sluggard does not plow in season; so at harvest time he looks but finds nothing.
PRV	20	5	Solomon	#10		21474	" {5} The purposes of a man's heart are deep waters, but a man of understanding draws them out."
PRV	20	6	Solomon	#10		21475	" {6} Many a man claims to have unfailing love, but a faithful man who can find?"
PRV	20	7	Solomon	#10		21476	 {7} The righteous man leads a blameless life; blessed are his children after him.
PRV	20	8	Solomon	#10		21477	" {8} When a king sits on his throne to judge, he winnows out all evil with his eyes."
PRV	20	9	Solomon	#10		21478	" {9} Who can say, << I have kept my heart pure; I am clean and without sin>>?"
PRV	20	10	Solomon	#10		21479	 {10} Differing weights and differing measures-- the Lord detests them both.
PRV	20	11	Solomon	#10		21480	" {11} Even a child is known by his actions, by whether his conduct is pure and right."
PRV	20	12	Solomon	#10		21481	 {12} Ears that hear and eyes that see-- the Lord has made them both.
PRV	20	13	Solomon	#10		21482	 {13} Do not love sleep or you will grow poor; stay awake and you will have food to spare.
PRV	20	14	Solomon	#10		21483	" {14} << It's no good, it's no good! >> says the buyer; then off he goes and boasts about his purchase."
PRV	20	15	Solomon	#10		21484	" {15} Gold there is, and rubies in abundance, but lips that speak knowledge are a rare jewel."
PRV	20	16	Solomon	#10		21485	 {16} Take the garment of one who puts up security for a stranger; hold it in pledge if he does it for a wayward woman.
PRV	20	17	Solomon	#10		21486	" {17} Food gained by fraud tastes sweet to a man, but he ends up with a mouth full of gravel."
PRV	20	18	Solomon	#10		21487	" {18} Make plans by seeking advice; if you wage war, obtain guidance."
PRV	20	19	Solomon	#10		21488	 {19} A gossip betrays a confidence; so avoid a man who talks too much.
PRV	20	20	Solomon	#10		21489	" {20} If a man curses his father or mother, his lamp will be snuffed out in pitch darkness."
PRV	20	21	Solomon	#10		21490	 {21} An inheritance quickly gained at the beginning will not be blessed at the end.
PRV	20	22	Solomon	#10		21491	" {22} Do not say, << I'll pay you back for this wrong! >> Wait for the Lord, and he will deliver you."
PRV	20	23	Solomon	#10		21492	" {23} The Lord detests differing weights, and dishonest scales do not please him."
PRV	20	24	Solomon	#10		21493	 {24} A man's steps are directed by the Lord. How then can anyone understand his own way?
PRV	20	25	Solomon	#10		21494	 {25} It is a trap for a man to dedicate something rashly and only later to consider his vows.
PRV	20	26	Solomon	#10		21495	 {26} A wise king winnows out the wicked; he drives the threshing wheel over them.
PRV	20	27	Solomon	#10		21496	 {27} The lamp of the Lord searches the spirit of a man; it searches out his inmost being.
PRV	20	28	Solomon	#10		21497	 {28} Love and faithfulness keep a king safe; through love his throne is made secure.
PRV	20	29	Solomon	#10		21498	" {29} The glory of young men is their strength, gray hair the splendor of the old."
PRV	20	30	Solomon	#10		21499	" {30} Blows and wounds cleanse away evil, and beatings purge the inmost being.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
PRV	21	<<	Narr_20: Proverbs	#13		21500	PROVERBS 21
PRV	21	1	Solomon	#10		21501	 {1} The king's heart is in the hand of the Lord; he directs it like a watercourse wherever he pleases.
PRV	21	2	Solomon	#10		21502	" {2} All a man's ways seem right to him, but the Lord weighs the heart."
PRV	21	3	Solomon	#10		21503	 {3} To do what is right and just is more acceptable to the Lord than sacrifice.
PRV	21	4	Solomon	#10		21504	" {4} Haughty eyes and a proud heart, the lamp of the wicked, are sin!"
PRV	21	5	Solomon	#10		21505	 {5} The plans of the diligent lead to profit as surely as haste leads to poverty.
PRV	21	6	Solomon	#10		21506	 {6} A fortune made by a lying tongue is a fleeting vapor and a deadly snare.
PRV	21	7	Solomon	#10		21507	" {7} The violence of the wicked will drag them away, for they refuse to do what is right."
PRV	21	8	Solomon	#10		21508	" {8} The way of the guilty is devious, but the conduct of the innocent is upright."
PRV	21	9	Solomon	#10		21509	 {9} Better to live on a corner of the roof than share a house with a quarrelsome wife.
PRV	21	10	Solomon	#10		21510	 {10} The wicked man craves evil; his neighbor gets no mercy from him.
PRV	21	11	Solomon	#10		21511	" {11} When a mocker is punished, the simple gain wisdom; when a wise man is instructed, he gets knowledge."
PRV	21	12	Solomon	#10		21512	 {12} The Righteous One takes note of the house of the wicked and brings the wicked to ruin.
PRV	21	13	Solomon	#10		21513	" {13} If a man shuts his ears to the cry of the poor, he too will cry out and not be answered."
PRV	21	14	Solomon	#10		21514	" {14} A gift given in secret soothes anger, and a bribe concealed in the cloak pacifies great wrath."
PRV	21	15	Solomon	#10		21515	" {15} When justice is done, it brings joy to the righteous but terror to evildoers."
PRV	21	16	Solomon	#10		21516	 {16} A man who strays from the path of understanding comes to rest in the company of the dead.
PRV	21	17	Solomon	#10		21517	 {17} He who loves pleasure will become poor; whoever loves wine and oil will never be rich.
PRV	21	18	Solomon	#10		21518	" {18} The wicked become a ransom for the righteous, and the unfaithful for the upright."
PRV	21	19	Solomon	#10		21519	 {19} Better to live in a desert than with a quarrelsome and ill-tempered wife.
PRV	21	20	Solomon	#10		21520	" {20} In the house of the wise are stores of choice food and oil, but a foolish man devours all he has."
PRV	21	21	Solomon	#10		21521	" {21} He who pursues righteousness and love finds life, prosperity and honor."
PRV	21	22	Solomon	#10		21522	 {22} A wise man attacks the city of the mighty and pulls down the stronghold in which they trust.
PRV	21	23	Solomon	#10		21523	 {23} He who guards his mouth and his tongue keeps himself from calamity.
PRV	21	24	Solomon	#10		21524	 {24} The proud and arrogant man--<<Mocker>> is his name; he behaves with overweening pride.
PRV	21	25	Solomon	#10		21525	" {25} The sluggard's craving will be the death of him, because his hands refuse to work."
PRV	21	26	Solomon	#10		21526	" {26} All day long he craves for more, but the righteous give without sparing."
PRV	21	27	Solomon	#10		21527	 {27} The sacrifice of the wicked is detestable-- how much more so when brought with evil intent!
PRV	21	28	Solomon	#10		21528	" {28} A false witness will perish, and whoever listens to him will be destroyed forever."
PRV	21	29	Solomon	#10		21529	" {29} A wicked man puts up a bold front, but an upright man gives thought to his ways."
PRV	21	30	Solomon	#10		21530	" {30} There is no wisdom, no insight, no plan that can succeed against the Lord."
PRV	21	31	Solomon	#10		21531	" {31} The horse is made ready for the day of battle, but victory rests with the Lord.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
PRV	22	<<	Narr_20: Proverbs	#13		21532	PROVERBS 22
PRV	22	1	Solomon	#10		21533	 {1} A good name is more desirable than great riches; to be esteemed is better than silver or gold.
PRV	22	2	Solomon	#10		21534	 {2} Rich and poor have this in common: The Lord is the Maker of them all.
PRV	22	3	Solomon	#10		21535	" {3} A prudent man sees danger and takes refuge, but the simple keep going and suffer for it."
PRV	22	4	Solomon	#10		21536	 {4} Humility and the fear of the Lord bring wealth and honor and life.
PRV	22	5	Solomon	#10		21537	" {5} In the paths of the wicked lie thorns and snares, but he who guards his soul stays far from them."
PRV	22	6	Solomon	#10		21538	" {6} Train a child in the way he should go, and when he is old he will not turn from it."
PRV	22	7	Solomon	#10		21539	" {7} The rich rule over the poor, and the borrower is servant to the lender."
PRV	22	8	Solomon	#10		21540	" {8} He who sows wickedness reaps trouble, and the rod of his fury will be destroyed."
PRV	22	9	Solomon	#10		21541	" {9} A generous man will himself be blessed, for he shares his food with the poor."
PRV	22	10	Solomon	#10		21542	" {10} Drive out the mocker, and out goes strife; quarrels and insults are ended."
PRV	22	11	Solomon	#10		21543	 {11} He who loves a pure heart and whose speech is gracious will have the king for his friend.
PRV	22	12	Solomon	#10		21544	" {12} The eyes of the Lord keep watch over knowledge, but he frustrates the words of the unfaithful."
PRV	22	13	Solomon	#10		21545	" {13} The sluggard says, << There is a lion outside! >> or, << I will be murdered in the streets! >>"
PRV	22	14	Solomon	#10		21546	 {14} The mouth of an adulteress is a deep pit; he who is under the Lord's wrath will fall into it.
PRV	22	15	Solomon	#10		21547	" {15} Folly is bound up in the heart of a child, but the rod of discipline will drive it far from him."
PRV	22	16	Solomon	#10		21548	 {16} He who oppresses the poor to increase his wealth and he who gives gifts to the rich--both come to poverty.
PRV	22	17	Solomon	#10		21549	" {17} Pay attention and listen to the sayings of the wise; apply your heart to what I teach,"
PRV	22	18	Solomon	#10		21550	 {18} for it is pleasing when you keep them in your heart and have all of them ready on your lips.
PRV	22	19	Solomon	#10		21551	" {19} So that your trust may be in the Lord, I teach you today, even you."
PRV	22	20	Solomon	#10		21552	" {20} Have I not written thirty sayings for you, sayings of counsel and knowledge, {21} teaching you true and reliable words, so that you can give sound answers to him who sent you?"
PRV	22	22	Solomon	#10		21553	" {22} Do not exploit the poor because they are poor and do not crush the needy in court, {23} for the Lord will take up their case and will plunder those who plunder them."
PRV	22	24	Solomon	#10		21554	" {24} Do not make friends with a hot-tempered man, do not associate with one easily angered, {25} or you may learn his ways and get yourself ensnared."
PRV	22	26	Solomon	#10		21555	" {26} Do not be a man who strikes hands in pledge or puts up security for debts; {27} if you lack the means to pay, your very bed will be snatched from under you."
PRV	22	28	Solomon	#10		21556	 {28} Do not move an ancient boundary stone set up by your forefathers.
PRV	22	29	Solomon	#10		21557	 {29} Do you see a man skilled in his work? He will serve before kings; he will not serve before obscure men.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
PRV	23	<<	Narr_20: Proverbs	#13		21558	PROVERBS 23
PRV	23	1	Solomon	#10		21559	" {1} When you sit to dine with a ruler, note well what is before you, {2} and put a knife to your throat if you are given to gluttony."
PRV	23	3	Solomon	#10		21560	" {3} Do not crave his delicacies, for that food is deceptive."
PRV	23	4	Solomon	#10		21561	 {4} Do not wear yourself out to get rich; have the wisdom to show restraint.
PRV	23	5	Solomon	#10		21562	" {5} Cast but a glance at riches, and they are gone, for they will surely sprout wings and fly off to the sky like an eagle."
PRV	23	6	Solomon	#10		21563	" {6} Do not eat the food of a stingy man, do not crave his delicacies;"
PRV	23	7	Solomon	#10		21564	" {7} for he is the kind of man who is always thinking about the cost. << Eat and drink,>> he says to you, but his heart is not with you."
PRV	23	8	Solomon	#10		21565	 {8} You will vomit up the little you have eaten and will have wasted your compliments.
PRV	23	9	Solomon	#10		21566	" {9} Do not speak to a fool, for he will scorn the wisdom of your words."
PRV	23	10	Solomon	#10		21567	" {10} Do not move an ancient boundary stone or encroach on the fields of the fatherless, {11} for their Defender is strong; he will take up their case against you."
PRV	23	12	Solomon	#10		21568	 {12} Apply your heart to instruction and your ears to words of knowledge.
PRV	23	13	Solomon	#10		21569	" {13} Do not withhold discipline from a child; if you punish him with the rod, he will not die. {14} Punish him with the rod and save his soul from death."
PRV	23	15	Solomon	#10		21570	" {15} My son, if your heart is wise, then my heart will be glad; {16} my inmost being will rejoice when your lips speak what is right."
PRV	23	17	Solomon	#10		21571	" {17} Do not let your heart envy sinners, but always be zealous for the fear of the Lord."
PRV	23	18	Solomon	#10		21572	" {18} There is surely a future hope for you, and your hope will not be cut off."
PRV	23	19	Solomon	#10		21573	" {19} Listen, my son, and be wise, and keep your heart on the right path."
PRV	23	20	Solomon	#10		21574	" {20} Do not join those who drink too much wine or gorge themselves on meat, {21} for drunkards and gluttons become poor, and drowsiness clothes them in rags."
PRV	23	22	Solomon	#10		21575	" {22} Listen to your father, who gave you life, and do not despise your mother when she is old."
PRV	23	23	Solomon	#10		21576	" {23} Buy the truth and do not sell it; get wisdom, discipline and understanding."
PRV	23	24	Solomon	#10		21577	 {24} The father of a righteous man has great joy; he who has a wise son delights in him.
PRV	23	25	Solomon	#10		21578	 {25} May your father and mother be glad; may she who gave you birth rejoice!
PRV	23	26	Solomon	#10		21579	" {26} My son, give me your heart and let your eyes keep to my ways, {27} for a prostitute is a deep pit and a wayward wife is a narrow well."
PRV	23	28	Solomon	#10		21580	" {28} Like a bandit she lies in wait, and multiplies the unfaithful among men."
PRV	23	29	Solomon	#10		21581	" {29} Who has woe? Who has sorrow? Who has strife? Who has complaints? Who has needless bruises? Who has bloodshot eyes? {30} Those who linger over wine, who go to sample bowls of mixed wine."
PRV	23	31	Solomon	#10		21582	" {31} Do not gaze at wine when it is red, when it sparkles in the cup, when it goes down smoothly! {32} In the end it bites like a snake and poisons like a viper."
PRV	23	33	Solomon	#10		21583	" {33} Your eyes will see strange sights and your mind imagine confusing things. {34} You will be like one sleeping on the high seas, lying on top of the rigging."
PRV	23	35	Solomon	#10		21584	" {35} << They hit me,>> you will say, << but I'm not hurt! They beat me, but I don't feel it! When will I wake up so I can find another drink? >>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
PRV	24	<<	Narr_20: Proverbs	#13		21585	PROVERBS 24
PRV	24	1	Solomon	#10		21586	" {1} Do not envy wicked men, do not desire their company; {2} for their hearts plot violence, and their lips talk about making trouble."
PRV	24	3	Solomon	#10		21587	" {3} By wisdom a house is built, and through understanding it is established; {4} through knowledge its rooms are filled with rare and beautiful treasures."
PRV	24	5	Solomon	#10		21588	" {5} A wise man has great power, and a man of knowledge increases strength; {6} for waging war you need guidance, and for victory many advisers."
PRV	24	7	Solomon	#10		21589	 {7} Wisdom is too high for a fool; in the assembly at the gate he has nothing to say.
PRV	24	8	Solomon	#10		21590	" {8} He who plots evil will be known as a schemer. {9} The schemes of folly are sin, and men detest a mocker."
PRV	24	10	Solomon	#10		21591	" {10} If you falter in times of trouble, how small is your strength!"
PRV	24	11	Solomon	#10		21592	 {11} Rescue those being led away to death; hold back those staggering toward slaughter.
PRV	24	12	Solomon	#10		21593	" {12} If you say, << But we knew nothing about this,>> does not he who weighs the heart perceive it? "
PRV	24	12	Solomon	#10		21594	 Does not he who guards your life know it? Will he not repay each person according to what he has done?
PRV	24	13	Solomon	#10		21595	" {13} Eat honey, my son, for it is good; honey from the comb is sweet to your taste."
PRV	24	14	Solomon	#10		21596	" {14} Know also that wisdom is sweet to your soul; if you find it, there is a future hope for you, and your hope will not be cut off."
PRV	24	15	Solomon	#10		21597	" {15} Do not lie in wait like an outlaw against a righteous man's house, do not raid his dwelling place;"
