PRV	24	16	Solomon	#10		21598	" {16} for though a righteous man falls seven times, he rises again, but the wicked are brought down by calamity."
PRV	24	17	Solomon	#10		21599	" {17} Do not gloat when your enemy falls; when he stumbles, do not let your heart rejoice, {18} or the Lord will see and disapprove and turn his wrath away from him."
PRV	24	19	Solomon	#10		21600	" {19} Do not fret because of evil men or be envious of the wicked, {20} for the evil man has no future hope, and the lamp of the wicked will be snuffed out."
PRV	24	21	Solomon	#10		21601	" {21} Fear the Lord and the king, my son, and do not join with the rebellious, {22} for those two will send sudden destruction upon them, and who knows what calamities they can bring?"
PRV	24	23	Solomon	#10		21602	 {23} These also are sayings of the wise: To show partiality in judging is not good:
PRV	24	24	Solomon	#10		21603	" {24} Whoever says to the guilty, << You are innocent<< -- peoples will curse him and nations denounce him."
PRV	24	25	Solomon	#10		21604	" {25} But it will go well with those who convict the guilty, and rich blessing will come upon them. {26} An honest answer is like a kiss on the lips."
PRV	24	27	Solomon	#10		21605	" {27} Finish your outdoor work and get your fields ready; after that, build your house."
PRV	24	28	Solomon	#10		21606	" {28} Do not testify against your neighbor without cause, or use your lips to deceive. {29} Do not say, << I'll do to him as he has done to me; I'll pay that man back for what he did. >>"
PRV	24	30	Solomon	#10		21607	" {30} I went past the field of the sluggard, past the vineyard of the man who lacks judgment;"
PRV	24	31	Solomon	#10		21608	" {31} thorns had come up everywhere, the ground was covered with weeds, and the stone wall was in ruins."
PRV	24	32	Solomon	#10		21609	 {32} I applied my heart to what I observed and learned a lesson from what I saw:
PRV	24	33	Solomon	#10		21610	" {33} A little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to rest-- {34} and poverty will come on you like a bandit and scarcity like an armed man.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
PRV	25	<<	Narr_20: Proverbs	#13		21611	PROVERBS 25
PRV	25	1	Narr_20: Proverbs	#13		21612	" {1} These are more proverbs of Solomon, copied by the men of Hezekiah king of Judah:"
PRV	25	2	Solomon	#10		21613	 {2} It is the glory of God to conceal a matter; to search out a matter is the glory of kings.
PRV	25	3	Solomon	#10		21614	" {3} As the heavens are high and the earth is deep, so the hearts of kings are unsearchable."
PRV	25	4	Solomon	#10		21615	" {4} Remove the dross from the silver, and out comes material for the silversmith;"
PRV	25	5	Solomon	#10		21616	" {5} remove the wicked from the king's presence, and his throne will be established through righteousness."
PRV	25	6	Solomon	#10		21617	" {6} Do not exalt yourself in the king's presence, and do not claim a place among great men;"
PRV	25	7	Solomon	#10		21618	" {7} it is better for him to say to you, << Come up here,>> than for him to humiliate you before a nobleman. "
PRV	25	7	Solomon	#10		21619	" What you have seen with your eyes {8} do not bring hastily to court, for what will you do in the end if your neighbor puts you to shame?"
PRV	25	9	Solomon	#10		21620	" {9} If you argue your case with a neighbor, do not betray another man's confidence, {10} or he who hears it may shame you and you will never lose your bad reputation."
PRV	25	11	Solomon	#10		21621	 {11} A word aptly spoken is like apples of gold in settings of silver. {12} Like an earring of gold or an ornament of fine gold is a wise man's rebuke to a listening ear.
PRV	25	13	Solomon	#10		21622	 {13} Like the coolness of snow at harvest time is a trustworthy messenger to those who send him; he refreshes the spirit of his masters.
PRV	25	14	Solomon	#10		21623	 {14} Like clouds and wind without rain is a man who boasts of gifts he does not give.
PRV	25	15	Solomon	#10		21624	" {15} Through patience a ruler can be persuaded, and a gentle tongue can break a bone."
PRV	25	16	Solomon	#10		21625	" {16} If you find honey, eat just enough-- too much of it, and you will vomit."
PRV	25	17	Solomon	#10		21626	" {17} Seldom set foot in your neighbor's house-- too much of you, and he will hate you."
PRV	25	18	Solomon	#10		21627	 {18} Like a club or a sword or a sharp arrow is the man who gives false testimony against his neighbor.
PRV	25	19	Solomon	#10		21628	 {19} Like a bad tooth or a lame foot is reliance on the unfaithful in times of trouble.
PRV	25	20	Solomon	#10		21629	" {20} Like one who takes away a garment on a cold day, or like vinegar poured on soda, is one who sings songs to a heavy heart."
PRV	25	21	Solomon	#10		21630	" {21} If your enemy is hungry, give him food to eat; if he is thirsty, give him water to drink."
PRV	25	22	Solomon	#10		21631	" {22} In doing this, you will heap burning coals on his head, and the Lord will reward you."
PRV	25	23	Solomon	#10		21632	" {23} As a north wind brings rain, so a sly tongue brings angry looks."
PRV	25	24	Solomon	#10		21633	 {24} Better to live on a corner of the roof than share a house with a quarrelsome wife.
PRV	25	25	Solomon	#10		21634	 {25} Like cold water to a weary soul is good news from a distant land.
PRV	25	26	Solomon	#10		21635	 {26} Like a muddied spring or a polluted well is a righteous man who gives way to the wicked.
PRV	25	27	Solomon	#10		21636	" {27} It is not good to eat too much honey, nor is it honorable to seek one's own honor."
PRV	25	28	Solomon	#10		21637	 {28} Like a city whose walls are broken down is a man who lacks self-control.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
PRV	26	<<	Narr_20: Proverbs	#13		21638	PROVERBS 26
PRV	26	1	Solomon	#10		21639	" {1} Like snow in summer or rain in harvest, honor is not fitting for a fool."
PRV	26	2	Solomon	#10		21640	" {2} Like a fluttering sparrow or a darting swallow, an undeserved curse does not come to rest."
PRV	26	3	Solomon	#10		21641	" {3} A whip for the horse, a halter for the donkey, and a rod for the backs of fools!"
PRV	26	4	Solomon	#10		21642	" {4} Do not answer a fool by his folly, or you will be like him yourself."
PRV	26	5	Solomon	#10		21643	" {5} Answer a fool in the way he has earned by his folly, or he will be wise in his own eyes."
PRV	26	6	Solomon	#10		21644	 {6} Like cutting off one's feet or drinking violence is the sending of a message by the hand of a fool.
PRV	26	7	Solomon	#10		21645	 {7} Like a lame man's legs that hang limp is a proverb in the mouth of a fool.
PRV	26	8	Solomon	#10		21646	 {8} Like tying a stone in a sling is the giving of honor to a fool.
PRV	26	9	Solomon	#10		21647	 {9} Like a thornbush in a drunkard's hand is a proverb in the mouth of a fool.
PRV	26	10	Solomon	#10		21648	 {10} Like an archer who wounds at random is he who hires a fool or any passer-by.
PRV	26	11	Solomon	#10		21649	" {11} As a dog returns to its vomit, so a fool repeats his folly."
PRV	26	12	Solomon	#10		21650	 {12} Do you see a man wise in his own eyes? There is more hope for a fool than for him.
PRV	26	13	Solomon	#10		21651	" {13} The sluggard says, << There is a lion in the road, a fierce lion roaming the streets! >>"
PRV	26	14	Solomon	#10		21652	" {14} As a door turns on its hinges, so a sluggard turns on his bed."
PRV	26	15	Solomon	#10		21653	 {15} The sluggard buries his hand in the dish; he is too lazy to bring it back to his mouth.
PRV	26	16	Solomon	#10		21654	 {16} The sluggard is wiser in his own eyes than seven men who answer discreetly.
PRV	26	17	Solomon	#10		21655	 {17} Like one who seizes a dog by the ears is a passer-by who meddles in a quarrel not his own.
PRV	26	18	Solomon	#10		21656	" {18} Like a madman shooting firebrands or deadly arrows {19} is a man who deceives his neighbor and says, << I was only joking! >>"
PRV	26	20	Solomon	#10		21657	" {20} Without wood a fire goes out; without gossip a quarrel dies down. {21} As charcoal to embers and as wood to fire, so is a quarrelsome man for kindling strife."
PRV	26	22	Solomon	#10		21658	 {22} The words of a gossip are like choice morsels; they go down to a man's inmost parts.
PRV	26	23	Solomon	#10		21659	 {23} Like a coating of glaze over earthenware are fervent lips with an evil heart.
PRV	26	24	Solomon	#10		21660	" {24} A malicious man disguises himself with his lips, but in his heart he harbors deceit."
PRV	26	25	Solomon	#10		21661	" {25} Though his speech is charming, do not believe him, for seven abominations fill his heart."
PRV	26	26	Solomon	#10		21662	" {26} His malice may be concealed by deception, but his wickedness will be exposed in the assembly."
PRV	26	27	Solomon	#10		21663	" {27} If a man digs a pit, he will fall into it; if a man rolls a stone, it will roll back on him."
PRV	26	28	Solomon	#10		21664	" {28} A lying tongue hates those it hurts, and a flattering mouth works ruin.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
PRV	27	<<	Narr_20: Proverbs	#13		21665	PROVERBS 27
PRV	27	1	Solomon	#10		21666	" {1} Do not boast about tomorrow, for you do not know what a day may bring forth."
PRV	27	2	Solomon	#10		21667	" {2} Let another praise you, and not your own mouth; someone else, and not your own lips."
PRV	27	3	Solomon	#10		21668	" {3} Stone is heavy and sand a burden, but provocation by a fool is heavier than both."
PRV	27	4	Solomon	#10		21669	" {4} Anger is cruel and fury overwhelming, but who can stand before jealousy?"
PRV	27	5	Solomon	#10		21670	 {5} Better is open rebuke than hidden love.
PRV	27	6	Solomon	#10		21671	" {6} Wounds from a friend can be trusted, but the kisses of one who hates you are false."
PRV	27	7	Solomon	#10		21672	" {7} He who is full loathes honey, but to the hungry even what is bitter tastes sweet."
PRV	27	8	Solomon	#10		21673	 {8} Like a bird that strays from its nest is a man who strays from his home.
PRV	27	9	Solomon	#10		21674	" {9} Perfume and incense bring joy to the heart, and the pleasantness of one's friend springs from his earnest counsel."
PRV	27	10	Solomon	#10		21675	" {10} Do not forsake your friend and the friend of your father, and do not go to your brother's house when disaster strikes you-- better a neighbor nearby than a brother far away."
PRV	27	11	Solomon	#10		21676	" {11} Be wise, my son, and bring joy to my heart; then I can answer anyone who treats me with contempt."
PRV	27	12	Solomon	#10		21677	" {12} The prudent see danger and take refuge, but the simple keep going and suffer for it."
PRV	27	13	Solomon	#10		21678	 {13} Take the garment of one who puts up security for for a stranger; hold it in pledge if he does it for a wayward woman.
PRV	27	14	Solomon	#10		21679	" {14} If a man loudly blesses his neighbor early in the morning, it will be taken as a curse."
PRV	27	15	Solomon	#10		21680	 {15} A quarrelsome wife is like a constant dripping on a rainy day; {16} restraining her is like restraining the wind or grasping oil with the hand.
PRV	27	17	Solomon	#10		21681	" {17} As iron sharpens iron, so one man sharpens another."
PRV	27	18	Solomon	#10		21682	" {18} He who tends a fig tree will eat its fruit, and he who looks after his master will be honored."
PRV	27	19	Solomon	#10		21683	" {19} As water reflects a face, so a man's heart reflects the man."
PRV	27	20	Solomon	#10		21684	" {20} Death and Destruction are never satisfied, and neither are the eyes of man."
PRV	27	21	Solomon	#10		21685	" {21} The crucible for silver and the furnace for gold, but man is tested by the praise he receives."
PRV	27	22	Solomon	#10		21686	" {22} Though you grind a fool in a mortar, grinding him like grain with a pestle, you will not remove his folly from him."
PRV	27	23	Solomon	#10		21687	" {23} Be sure you know the condition of your flocks, give careful attention to your herds; {24} for riches do not endure forever, and a crown is not secure for all generations."
PRV	27	25	Solomon	#10		21688	" {25} When the hay is removed and new growth appears and the grass from the hills is gathered in, {26} the lambs will provide you with clothing, and the goats with the price of a field."
PRV	27	27	Solomon	#10		21689	 {27} You will have plenty of goats' milk to feed you and your family and to nourish your servant girls.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
PRV	28	<<	Narr_20: Proverbs	#13		21690	PROVERBS 28
PRV	28	1	Solomon	#10		21691	" {1} The wicked man flees though no one pursues, but the righteous are as bold as a lion."
PRV	28	2	Solomon	#10		21692	" {2} When a country is rebellious, it has many rulers, but a man of understanding and knowledge maintains order."
PRV	28	3	Solomon	#10		21693	 {3} A ruler who oppresses the poor is like a driving rain that leaves no crops.
PRV	28	4	Solomon	#10		21694	" {4} Those who forsake the law praise the wicked, but those who keep the law resist them."
PRV	28	5	Solomon	#10		21695	" {5} Evil men do not understand justice, but those who seek the Lord understand it fully."
PRV	28	6	Solomon	#10		21696	 {6} Better a poor man whose walk is blameless than a rich man whose ways are perverse.
PRV	28	7	Solomon	#10		21697	" {7} He who keeps the law is a discerning son, but a companion of gluttons disgraces his father."
PRV	28	8	Solomon	#10		21698	" {8} He who increases his wealth by exorbitant interest amasses it for another, who will be kind to the poor."
PRV	28	9	Solomon	#10		21699	" {9} If anyone turns a deaf ear to the law, even his prayers are detestable."
PRV	28	10	Solomon	#10		21700	" {10} He who leads the upright along an evil path will fall into his own trap, but the blameless will receive a good inheritance."
PRV	28	11	Solomon	#10		21701	" {11} A rich man may be wise in his own eyes, but a poor man who has discernment sees through him."
PRV	28	12	Solomon	#10		21702	" {12} When the righteous triumph, there is great elation; but when the wicked rise to power, men go into hiding."
PRV	28	13	Solomon	#10		21703	" {13} He who conceals his sins does not prosper, but whoever confesses and renounces them finds mercy."
PRV	28	14	Solomon	#10		21704	" {14} Blessed is the man who always fears the Lord, but he who hardens his heart falls into trouble."
PRV	28	15	Solomon	#10		21705	 {15} Like a roaring lion or a charging bear is a wicked man ruling over a helpless people.
PRV	28	16	Solomon	#10		21706	" {16} A tyrannical ruler lacks judgment, but he who hates ill-gotten gain will enjoy a long life."
PRV	28	17	Solomon	#10		21707	 {17} A man tormented by the guilt of murder will be a fugitive till death; let no one support him. But he who hardens his heart falls into trouble.
PRV	28	18	Solomon	#10		21708	" {18} He whose walk is blameless is kept safe, but he whose ways are perverse will suddenly fall."
PRV	28	19	Solomon	#10		21709	" {19} He who works his land will have abundant food, but the one who chases fantasies will have his fill of poverty."
PRV	28	20	Solomon	#10		21710	" {20} A faithful man will be richly blessed, but one eager to get rich will not go unpunished."
PRV	28	21	Solomon	#10		21711	 {21} To show partiality is not good-- yet a man will do wrong for a piece of bread.
PRV	28	22	Solomon	#10		21712	 {22} A stingy man is eager to get rich and is unaware that poverty awaits him.
PRV	28	23	Solomon	#10		21713	 {23} He who rebukes a man will in the end gain more favor than he who has a flattering tongue.
PRV	28	24	Solomon	#10		21714	" {24} He who robs his father or mother and says, << It's not wrong>> -- he is partner to him who destroys."
PRV	28	25	Solomon	#10		21715	" {25} A greedy man stirs up dissension, but he who trusts in the Lord will prosper."
PRV	28	26	Solomon	#10		21716	" {26} He who trusts in himself is a fool, but he who walks in wisdom is kept safe."
PRV	28	27	Solomon	#10		21717	" {27} He who gives to the poor will lack nothing, but he who closes his eyes to them receives many curses."
PRV	28	28	Solomon	#10		21718	" {28} When the wicked rise to power, people go into hiding; but when the wicked perish, the righteous thrive.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
PRV	29	<<	Narr_20: Proverbs	#13		21719	PROVERBS 29
PRV	29	1	Solomon	#10		21720	 {1} A man who remains stiff-necked after many rebukes will suddenly be destroyed--without remedy.
PRV	29	2	Solomon	#10		21721	" {2} When the righteous thrive, the people rejoice; when the wicked rule, the people groan."
PRV	29	3	Solomon	#10		21722	" {3} A man who loves wisdom brings joy to his father, but a companion of prostitutes squanders his wealth."
PRV	29	4	Solomon	#10		21723	" {4} By justice a king gives a country stability, but one who is greedy for bribes tears it down."
PRV	29	5	Solomon	#10		21724	 {5} Whoever flatters his neighbor is spreading a net for his feet.
PRV	29	6	Solomon	#10		21725	" {6} An evil man is snared by his own sin, but a righteous one can sing and be glad."
PRV	29	7	Solomon	#10		21726	" {7} The righteous care about justice for the poor, but the wicked have no such concern."
PRV	29	8	Solomon	#10		21727	" {8} Mockers stir up a city, but wise men turn away anger."
PRV	29	9	Solomon	#10		21728	" {9} If a wise man goes to court with a fool, the fool rages and scoffs, and there is no peace."
PRV	29	10	Solomon	#10		21729	 {10} Bloodthirsty men hate a man of integrity and seek to kill the upright.
PRV	29	11	Solomon	#10		21730	" {11} A fool gives full vent to his anger, but a wise man keeps himself under control."
PRV	29	12	Solomon	#10		21731	" {12} If a ruler listens to lies, all his officials become wicked."
PRV	29	13	Solomon	#10		21732	 {13} The poor man and the oppressor have this in common: The Lord gives sight to the eyes of both.
PRV	29	14	Solomon	#10		21733	" {14} If a king judges the poor with fairness, his throne will always be secure."
PRV	29	15	Solomon	#10		21734	" {15} The rod of correction imparts wisdom, but a child left to himself disgraces his mother."
PRV	29	16	Solomon	#10		21735	" {16} When the wicked thrive, so does sin, but the righteous will see their downfall."
PRV	29	17	Solomon	#10		21736	" {17} Discipline your son, and he will give you peace; he will bring delight to your soul."
PRV	29	18	Solomon	#10		21737	" {18} Where there is no revelation, the people cast off restraint; but blessed is he who keeps the law."
PRV	29	19	Solomon	#10		21738	" {19} A servant cannot be corrected by mere words; though he understands, he will not respond."
PRV	29	20	Solomon	#10		21739	 {20} Do you see a man who speaks in haste? There is more hope for a fool than for him.
PRV	29	21	Solomon	#10		21740	" {21} If a man pampers his servant from youth, he will bring grief in the end."
PRV	29	22	Solomon	#10		21741	" {22} An angry man stirs up dissension, and a hot-tempered one commits many sins."
PRV	29	23	Solomon	#10		21742	" {23} A man's pride brings him low, but a man of lowly spirit gains honor."
PRV	29	24	Solomon	#10		21743	 {24} The accomplice of a thief is his own enemy; he is put under oath and dare not testify.
PRV	29	25	Solomon	#10		21744	" {25} Fear of man will prove to be a snare, but whoever trusts in the Lord is kept safe."
PRV	29	26	Solomon	#10		21745	" {26} Many seek an audience with a ruler, but it is from the Lord that man gets justice."
PRV	29	27	Solomon	#10		21746	 {27} The righteous detest the dishonest; the the wicked detest the upright.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
PRV	30	<<	Narr_20: Proverbs	#13		21747	PROVERBS 30
PRV	30	1	Narr_20: Proverbs	#13		21748	" {1} The sayings of Agur son of Jakeh --an oracle: This man declared to Ithiel, to Ithiel and to Ucal:"
PRV	30	2	Agur	#15		21749	 {2} << I am the most ignorant of men; I do not have a man's understanding.
PRV	30	3	Agur	#15		21750	" {3} I have not learned wisdom, nor have I knowledge of the Holy One."
PRV	30	4	Agur	#15		21751	 {4} Who has gone up to heaven and come down? Who has gathered up the wind in the hollow of his hands? 
PRV	30	4	Agur	#15		21752	 Who has wrapped up the waters in his cloak? Who has established all the ends of the earth? 
PRV	30	4	Agur	#15		21753	" What is his name, and the name of his son? Tell me if you know!"
PRV	30	5	Agur	#15		21754	 {5} << Every word of God is flawless; he is a shield to those who take refuge in him.
PRV	30	6	Agur	#15		21755	" {6} Do not add to his words, or he will rebuke you and prove you a liar."
PRV	30	7	Agur	#15		21756	" {7} << Two things I ask of you, O Lord; do not refuse me before I die:"
PRV	30	8	Agur	#15		21757	" {8} Keep falsehood and lies far from me; give me neither poverty nor riches, but give me only my daily bread."
PRV	30	9	Agur	#15		21758	" {9} Otherwise, I may have too much and disown you and say, 'Who is the Lord? ' Or I may become poor and steal, and so dishonor the name of my God."
PRV	30	10	Agur	#15		21759	" {10} << Do not slander a servant to his master, or he will curse you, and you will pay for it."
PRV	30	11	Agur	#15		21760	 {11} << There are those who curse their fathers and do not bless their mothers;
PRV	30	12	Agur	#15		21761	 {12} those who are pure in their own eyes and yet are not cleansed of their filth;
PRV	30	13	Agur	#15		21762	" {13} those whose eyes are ever so haughty, whose glances are so disdainful;"
PRV	30	14	Agur	#15		21763	" {14} those whose teeth are swords and whose jaws are set with knives to devour the poor from the earth, the needy from among mankind."
PRV	30	15	Agur	#15		21764	 {15} << The leech has two daughters. 'Give! Give! ' they cry.
PRV	30	15	Agur	#15		21765	" << There are three things that are never satisfied, four that never say, 'Enough! ': "
PRV	30	16	Agur	#15		21766	" {16} the grave, the barren womb, land, which is never satisfied with water, and fire, which never says, 'Enough! '"
PRV	30	17	Agur	#15		21767	" {17} << The eye that mocks a father, that scorns obedience to a mother, will be pecked out by the ravens of the valley, will be eaten by the vultures."
PRV	30	18	Agur	#15		21768	" {18} << There are three things that are too amazing for me, four that I do not understand:"
PRV	30	19	Agur	#15		21769	" {19} the way of an eagle in the sky, the way of a snake on a rock, the way of a ship on the high seas, and the way of a man with a maiden."
PRV	30	20	Agur	#15		21770	" {20} << This is the way of an adulteress: She eats and wipes her mouth and says, 'I've done nothing wrong. '"
PRV	30	21	Agur	#15		21771	" {21} << Under three things the earth trembles, under four it cannot bear up:"
PRV	30	22	Agur	#15		21772	" {22} a servant who becomes king, a fool who is full of food,"
PRV	30	23	Agur	#15		21773	" {23} an unloved woman who is married, and a maidservant who displaces her mistress."
PRV	30	24	Agur	#15		21774	" {24} << Four things on earth are small, yet they are extremely wise:"
PRV	30	25	Agur	#15		21775	" {25} Ants are creatures of little strength, yet they store up their food in the summer;"
PRV	30	26	Agur	#15		21776	" {26} coneys are creatures of little power, yet they make their home in the crags;"
PRV	30	27	Agur	#15		21777	" {27} locusts have no king, yet they advance together in ranks;"
PRV	30	28	Agur	#15		21778	" {28} a lizard can be caught with the hand, yet it is found in kings' palaces."
PRV	30	29	Agur	#15		21779	" {29} << There are three things that are stately in their stride, four that move with stately bearing:"
PRV	30	30	Agur	#15		21780	" {30} a lion, mighty among beasts, who retreats before nothing;"
PRV	30	31	Agur	#15		21781	" {31} a strutting rooster, a he-goat, and a king with his army around him."
PRV	30	32	Agur	#15		21782	" {32} << If you have played the fool and exalted yourself, or if you have planned evil, clap your hand over your mouth!"
PRV	30	33	Agur	#15		21783	" {33} For as churning the milk produces butter, and as twisting the nose produces blood, so stirring up anger produces strife.>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
PRV	31	<<	Narr_20: Proverbs	#13		21784	PROVERBS 31
PRV	31	1	Narr_20: Proverbs	#13		21785	 {1} The sayings of King Lemuel --an oracle his mother taught him:
PRV	31	2	Mother of King Lemuel	#22		21786	" {2} O my son, O son of my womb, O son of my vows, {3} do not spend your strength on women, your vigor on those who ruin kings."
PRV	31	4	Mother of King Lemuel	#22		21787	" {4} << It is not for kings, O Lemuel -- not for kings to drink wine, not for rulers to crave beer,"
PRV	31	5	Mother of King Lemuel	#22		21788	" {5} lest they drink and forget what the law decrees, and deprive all the oppressed of their rights."
PRV	31	6	Mother of King Lemuel	#22		21789	" {6} Give beer to those who are perishing, wine to those who are in anguish;"
PRV	31	7	Mother of King Lemuel	#22		21790	 {7} let them drink and forget their poverty and remember their misery no more.
PRV	31	8	Mother of King Lemuel	#22		21791	" {8} << Speak up for those who cannot speak for themselves, for the rights of all who are destitute."
PRV	31	9	Mother of King Lemuel	#22		21792	 {9} Speak up and judge fairly; defend the rights of the poor and needy. >>
PRV	31	10	Mother of King Lemuel	#22		21793	 {10} A wife of noble character who can find? She is worth far more than rubies.
PRV	31	11	Mother of King Lemuel	#22		21794	 {11} Her husband has full confidence in her and lacks nothing of value.
PRV	31	12	Mother of King Lemuel	#22		21795	" {12} She brings him good, not harm, all the days of her life."
PRV	31	13	Mother of King Lemuel	#22		21796	 {13} She selects wool and flax and works with eager hands.
PRV	31	14	Mother of King Lemuel	#22		21797	" {14} She is like the merchant ships, bringing her food from afar."
PRV	31	15	Mother of King Lemuel	#22		21798	 {15} She gets up while it is still dark; she provides food for her family and portions for her servant girls.
PRV	31	16	Mother of King Lemuel	#22		21799	 {16} She considers a field and buys it; out of her earnings she plants a vineyard.
PRV	31	17	Mother of King Lemuel	#22		21800	 {17} She sets about her work vigorously; her arms are strong for her tasks.
PRV	31	18	Mother of King Lemuel	#22		21801	" {18} She sees that her trading is profitable, and her lamp does not go out at night."
PRV	31	19	Mother of King Lemuel	#22		21802	 {19} In her hand she holds the distaff and grasps the spindle with her fingers.
PRV	31	20	Mother of King Lemuel	#22		21803	 {20} She opens her arms to the poor and extends her hands to the needy.
PRV	31	21	Mother of King Lemuel	#22		21804	" {21} When it snows, she has no fear for her household; for all of them are clothed in scarlet."
PRV	31	22	Mother of King Lemuel	#22		21805	 {22} She makes coverings for her bed; she is clothed in fine linen and purple.
PRV	31	23	Mother of King Lemuel	#22		21806	" {23} Her husband is respected at the city gate, where he takes his seat among the elders of the land."
PRV	31	24	Mother of King Lemuel	#22		21807	" {24} She makes linen garments and sells them, and supplies the merchants with sashes."
PRV	31	25	Mother of King Lemuel	#22		21808	 {25} She is clothed with strength and dignity; she can laugh at the days to come.
PRV	31	26	Mother of King Lemuel	#22		21809	" {26} She speaks with wisdom, and faithful instruction is on her tongue."
PRV	31	27	Mother of King Lemuel	#22		21810	 {27} She watches over the affairs of her household and does not eat the bread of idleness.
PRV	31	28	Mother of King Lemuel	#22		21811	" {28} Her children arise and call her blessed; her husband also, and he praises her:"
PRV	31	29	Mother of King Lemuel	#22		21812	" {29} << Many women do noble things, but you surpass them all. >>"
PRV	31	30	Mother of King Lemuel	#22		21813	" {30} Charm is deceptive, and beauty is fleeting; but a woman who fears the Lord is to be praised."
PRV	31	31	Mother of King Lemuel	#22		21814	" {31} Give her the reward she has earned, and let her works bring her praise at the city gate.*~**~*||||| + 5 SECs |||||*~*"
ECC	1	<<	Narr_21: Ecclesiastes	#13		21815	ECCLESIASTES*~*ECCLESIASTES 1
ECC	1	1	Narr_21: Ecclesiastes	#13		21816	" {1} The words of the Teacher, son of David, king in Jerusalem:"
ECC	1	2	Solomon	#10		21817	 {2} << Meaningless! Meaningless! Utterly meaningless! Everything is meaningless! . >>
ECC	1	3	Solomon	#10		21818	 {3} What does man gain from all his labor at which he toils under the sun?
ECC	1	4	Solomon	#10		21819	" {4} Generations come and generations go, but the earth remains forever. {5} The sun rises and the sun sets, and hurries back to where it rises."
ECC	1	6	Solomon	#10		21820	" {6} The wind blows to the south and turns to the north; round and round it goes, ever returning on its course."
ECC	1	7	Solomon	#10		21821	" {7} All streams flow into the sea, yet the sea is never full. To the place the streams come from, there they return again."
ECC	1	8	Solomon	#10		21822	" {8} All things are wearisome, more than one can say. The eye never has enough of seeing, nor the ear its fill of hearing."
ECC	1	9	Solomon	#10		21823	" {9} What has been will be again, what has been done will be done again; there is nothing new under the sun."
ECC	1	10	Solomon	#10		21824	" {10} Is there anything of which one can say, << Look! This is something new>>? It was here already, long ago; it was here before our time."
ECC	1	11	Solomon	#10		21825	" {11} There is no remembrance of men of old, and even those who are yet to come will not be remembered by those who follow."
ECC	1	12	Solomon	#10		21826	" {12} I, the Teacher, was king over Israel in Jerusalem."
ECC	1	13	Solomon	#10		21827	 {13} I devoted myself to study and to explore by wisdom all that is done under heaven. What a heavy burden God has laid on men!
ECC	1	14	Solomon	#10		21828	" {14} I have seen all the things that are done under the sun; all of them are meaningless, a chasing after the wind."
ECC	1	15	Solomon	#10		21829	 {15} What is twisted cannot be straightened; what is lacking cannot be counted.
ECC	1	16	Solomon	#10		21830	" {16} I thought to myself, << Look, I have grown and increased in wisdom more than anyone who has ruled over Jerusalem before me; I have experienced much of wisdom and knowledge. >>"
ECC	1	17	Solomon	#10		21831	" {17} Then I applied myself to the understanding of wisdom, and also of madness and folly, but I learned that this, too, is a chasing after the wind."
ECC	1	18	Solomon	#10		21832	" {18} For with much wisdom comes much sorrow; the more knowledge, the more grief.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
ECC	2	<<	Narr_21: Ecclesiastes	#13		21833	ECCLESIASTES 2
ECC	2	1	Solomon	#10		21834	" {1} I thought in my heart, << Come now, I will test you with pleasure to find out what is good. >> But that also proved to be meaningless."
ECC	2	2	Solomon	#10		21835	" {2} << Laughter,>> I said, << is foolish. And what does pleasure accomplish? >>"
ECC	2	3	Solomon	#10		21836	" {3} I tried cheering myself with wine, and embracing folly--my mind still guiding me with wisdom. I wanted to see what was worthwhile for men to do under heaven during the few days of their lives."
ECC	2	4	Solomon	#10		21837	 {4} I undertook great projects: I built houses for myself and planted vineyards. {5} I made gardens and parks and planted all kinds of fruit trees in them.
ECC	2	6	Solomon	#10		21838	 {6} I made reservoirs to water groves of flourishing trees.
ECC	2	7	Solomon	#10		21839	 {7} I bought male and female slaves and had other slaves who were born in my house. I also owned more herds and flocks than anyone in Jerusalem before me.
ECC	2	8	Solomon	#10		21840	" {8} I amassed silver and gold for myself, and the treasure of kings and provinces. I acquired men and women singers, and a harem as well--the delights of the heart of man."
ECC	2	9	Solomon	#10		21841	 {9} I became greater by far than anyone in Jerusalem before me. In all this my wisdom stayed with me.
ECC	2	10	Solomon	#10		21842	" {10} I denied myself nothing my eyes desired; I refused my heart no pleasure. My heart took delight in all my work, and this was the reward for all my labor."
ECC	2	11	Solomon	#10		21843	" {11} Yet when I surveyed all that my hands had done and what I had toiled to achieve, everything was meaningless, a chasing after the wind; nothing was gained under the sun."
ECC	2	12	Solomon	#10		21844	" {12} Then I turned my thoughts to consider wisdom, and also madness and folly. What more can the king's successor do than what has already been done?"
ECC	2	13	Solomon	#10		21845	" {13} I saw that wisdom is better than folly, just as light is better than darkness."
ECC	2	14	Solomon	#10		21846	" {14} The wise man has eyes in his head, while the fool walks in the darkness; but I came to realize that the same fate overtakes them both."
ECC	2	15	Solomon	#10		21847	" {15} Then I thought in my heart, << The fate of the fool will overtake me also. What then do I gain by being wise? I said in my heart, This too is meaningless."
ECC	2	16	Solomon	#10		21848	" {16} For the wise man, like the fool, will not be long remembered; in days to come both will be forgotten. Like the fool, the wise man too must die! >>"
ECC	2	17	Solomon	#10		21849	" {17} So I hated life, because the work that is done under the sun was grievous to me. All of it is meaningless, a chasing after the wind."
ECC	2	18	Solomon	#10		21850	" {18} I hated all the things I had toiled for under the sun, because I must leave them to the one who comes after me."
ECC	2	19	Solomon	#10		21851	 {19} And who knows whether he will be a wise man or a fool? Yet he will have control over all the work into which I have poured my effort and skill under the sun. This too is meaningless.
ECC	2	20	Solomon	#10		21852	 {20} So my heart began to despair over all my toilsome labor under the sun.
ECC	2	21	Solomon	#10		21853	" {21} For a man may do his work with wisdom, knowledge and skill, and then he must leave all he owns to someone who has not worked for it. This too is meaningless and a great misfortune."
ECC	2	22	Solomon	#10		21854	 {22} What does a man get for all the toil and anxious striving with which he labors under the sun?
ECC	2	23	Solomon	#10		21855	 {23} All his days his work is pain and grief; even at night his mind does not rest. This too is meaningless.
ECC	2	24	Solomon	#10		21856	" {24} A man can do nothing better than to eat and drink and find satisfaction in his work. This too, I see, is from the hand of God, {25} for without him, who can eat or find enjoyment?"
ECC	2	26	Solomon	#10		21857	" {26} To the man who pleases him, God gives wisdom, knowledge and happiness, but to the sinner he gives the task of gathering and storing up wealth to hand it over to the one who pleases God. "
ECC	2	26	Solomon	#10		21858	" This too is meaningless, a chasing after the wind.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
ECC	3	<<	Narr_21: Ecclesiastes	#13		21859	ECCLESIASTES 3
ECC	3	1	Solomon	#10		21860	" {1} There is a time for everything, and a season for every activity under heaven:"
ECC	3	2	Solomon	#10		21861	" {2} a time to be born and a time to die, a time to plant and a time to uproot,"
ECC	3	3	Solomon	#10		21862	" {3} a time to kill and a time to heal, a time to tear down and a time to build,"
ECC	3	4	Solomon	#10		21863	" {4} a time to weep and a time to laugh, a time to mourn and a time to dance,"
ECC	3	5	Solomon	#10		21864	" {5} a time to scatter stones and a time to gather them, a time to embrace and a time to refrain,"
ECC	3	6	Solomon	#10		21865	" {6} a time to search and a time to give up, a time to keep and a time to throw away,"
ECC	3	7	Solomon	#10		21866	" {7} a time to tear and a time to mend, a time to be silent and a time to speak,"
ECC	3	8	Solomon	#10		21867	" {8} a time to love and a time to hate, a time for war and a time for peace."
ECC	3	9	Solomon	#10		21868	 {9} What does the worker gain from his toil? {10} I have seen the burden God has laid on men.
ECC	3	11	Solomon	#10		21869	 {11} He has made everything beautiful in its time. He has also set eternity in the hearts of men; yet they cannot fathom what God has done from beginning to end.
ECC	3	12	Solomon	#10		21870	 {12} I know that there is nothing better for men than to be happy and do good while they live.
ECC	3	13	Solomon	#10		21871	" {13} That everyone may eat and drink, and find satisfaction in all his toil--this is the gift of God."
ECC	3	14	Solomon	#10		21872	 {14} I know that everything God does will endure forever; nothing can be added to it and nothing taken from it. God does it so that men will revere him.
ECC	3	15	Solomon	#10		21873	" {15} Whatever is has already been, and what will be has been before; and God will call the past to account."
ECC	3	16	Solomon	#10		21874	" {16} And I saw something else under the sun: In the place of judgment--wickedness was there, in the place of justice--wickedness was there."
ECC	3	17	Solomon	#10		21875	" {17} I thought in my heart, << God will bring to judgment both the righteous and the wicked, for there will be a time for every activity, a time for every deed. >>"
ECC	3	18	Solomon	#10		21876	" {18} I also thought, << As for men, God tests them so that they may see that they are like the animals."
ECC	3	19	Solomon	#10		21877	" {19} Man's fate is like that of the animals; the same fate awaits them both: As one dies, so dies the other. "
ECC	3	19	Solomon	#10		21878	 All have the same breath; man has no advantage over the animal. Everything is meaningless.
ECC	3	20	Solomon	#10		21879	" {20} All go to the same place; all come from dust, and to dust all return."
ECC	3	21	Solomon	#10		21880	 {21} Who knows if the spirit of man rises upward and if the spirit of the animal goes down into the earth? >>
ECC	3	22	Solomon	#10		21881	" {22} So I saw that there is nothing better for a man than to enjoy his work, because that is his lot. For who can bring him to see what will happen after him?*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
ECC	4	<<	Narr_21: Ecclesiastes	#13		21882	ECCLESIASTES 4
ECC	4	1	Solomon	#10		21883	 {1} Again I looked and saw all the oppression that was taking place under the sun: 
ECC	4	1	Solomon	#10		21884	 I saw the tears of the oppressed-- and they have no comforter; power was on the side of their oppressors-- and they have no comforter.
ECC	4	2	Solomon	#10		21885	" {2} And I declared that the dead, who had already died, are happier than the living, who are still alive."
ECC	4	3	Solomon	#10		21886	" {3} But better than both is he who has not yet been, who has not seen the evil that is done under the sun."
ECC	4	4	Solomon	#10		21887	" {4} And I saw that all labor and all achievement spring from man's envy of his neighbor. This too is meaningless, a chasing after the wind."
ECC	4	5	Solomon	#10		21888	 {5} The fool folds his hands and ruins himself.
ECC	4	6	Solomon	#10		21889	 {6} Better one handful with tranquillity than two handfuls with toil and chasing after the wind.
ECC	4	7	Solomon	#10		21890	 {7} Again I saw something meaningless under the sun:
ECC	4	8	Solomon	#10		21891	" {8} There was a man all alone; he had neither son nor brother. There was no end to his toil, yet his eyes were not content with his wealth."
ECC	4	8	Man	#08		21892	" << For whom am I toiling, and why am I depriving myself of enjoyment? >>"
ECC	4	8	Solomon	#10		21893	 This too is meaningless-- a miserable business! 
ECC	4	9	Solomon	#10		21894	" {9} Two are better than one, because they have a good return for their work:"
ECC	4	10	Solomon	#10		21895	" {10} If one falls down, his friend can help him up. But pity the man who falls and has no one to help him up!"
ECC	4	11	Solomon	#10		21896	" {11} Also, if two lie down together, they will keep warm. But how can one keep warm alone?"
ECC	4	12	Solomon	#10		21897	" {12} Though one may be overpowered, two can defend themselves. A cord of three strands is not quickly broken."
ECC	4	13	Solomon	#10		21898	 {13} Better a poor but wise youth than an old but foolish king who no longer knows how to take warning.
ECC	4	14	Solomon	#10		21899	" {14} The youth may have come from prison to the kingship, or he may have been born in poverty within his kingdom."
ECC	4	15	Solomon	#10		21900	" {15} I saw that all who lived and walked under the sun followed the youth, the king's successor."
ECC	4	16	Solomon	#10		21901	" {16} There was no end to all the people who were before them. But those who came later were not pleased with the successor. This too is meaningless, a chasing after the wind.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
ECC	5	<<	Narr_21: Ecclesiastes	#13		21902	ECCLESIASTES 5
ECC	5	1	Solomon	#10		21903	" {1} Guard your steps when you go to the house of God. Go near to listen rather than to offer the sacrifice of fools, who do not know that they do wrong."
ECC	5	2	Solomon	#10		21904	" {2} Do not be quick with your mouth, do not be hasty in your heart to utter anything before God. God is in heaven and you are on earth, so let your words be few."
ECC	5	3	Solomon	#10		21905	" {3} As a dream comes when there are many cares, so the speech of a fool when there are many words."
ECC	5	4	Solomon	#10		21906	" {4} When you make a vow to God, do not delay in fulfilling it. He has no pleasure in fools; fulfill your vow. {5} It is better not to vow than to make a vow and not fulfill it."
ECC	5	6	Solomon	#10		21907	" {6} Do not let your mouth lead you into sin. And do not protest to the temple messenger, << My vow was a mistake. >> Why should God be angry at what you say and destroy the work of your hands?"
ECC	5	7	Solomon	#10		21908	 {7} Much dreaming and many words are meaningless. Therefore stand in awe of God.
ECC	5	8	Solomon	#10		21909	" {8} If you see the poor oppressed in a district, and justice and rights denied, do not be surprised at such things; "
ECC	5	8	Solomon	#10		21910	" for one official is eyed by a higher one, and over them both are others higher still."
ECC	5	9	Solomon	#10		21911	 {9} The increase from the land is taken by all; the king himself profits from the fields.
ECC	5	10	Solomon	#10		21912	 {10} Whoever loves money never has money enough; whoever loves wealth is never satisfied with his income. This too is meaningless.
ECC	5	11	Solomon	#10		21913	" {11} As goods increase, so do those who consume them. And what benefit are they to the owner except to feast his eyes on them?"
ECC	5	12	Solomon	#10		21914	" {12} The sleep of a laborer is sweet, whether he eats little or much, but the abundance of a rich man permits him no sleep."
ECC	5	13	Solomon	#10		21915	 {13} I have seen a grievous evil under the sun: 
ECC	5	13	Solomon	#10		21916	" wealth hoarded to the harm of its owner, {14} or wealth lost through some misfortune, so that when he has a son there is nothing left for him."
ECC	5	15	Solomon	#10		21917	" {15} Naked a man comes from his mother's womb, and as he comes, so he departs. He takes nothing from his labor that he can carry in his hand."
ECC	5	16	Solomon	#10		21918	" {16} This too is a grievous evil: As a man comes, so he departs, and what does he gain, since he toils for the wind?"
ECC	5	17	Solomon	#10		21919	" {17} All his days he eats in darkness, with great frustration, affliction and anger."
ECC	5	18	Solomon	#10		21920	" {18} Then I realized that it is good and proper for a man to eat and drink, and to find satisfaction in his toilsome labor under the sun during the few days of life God has given him--for this is his lot."
ECC	5	19	Solomon	#10		21921	" {19} Moreover, when God gives any man wealth and possessions, and enables him to enjoy them, to accept his lot and be happy in his work--this is a gift of God."
ECC	5	20	Solomon	#10		21922	" {20} He seldom reflects on the days of his life, because God keeps him occupied with gladness of heart.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
ECC	6	<<	Narr_21: Ecclesiastes	#13		21923	ECCLESIASTES 6
ECC	6	1	Solomon	#10		21924	" {1} I have seen another evil under the sun, and it weighs heavily on men:"
ECC	6	2	Solomon	#10		21925	" {2} God gives a man wealth, possessions and honor, so that he lacks nothing his heart desires, but God does not enable him to enjoy them, and a stranger enjoys them instead. "
ECC	6	2	Solomon	#10		21926	" This is meaningless, a grievous evil."
ECC	6	3	Solomon	#10		21927	 {3} A man may have a hundred children and live many years; 
ECC	6	3	Solomon	#10		21928	" yet no matter how long he lives, if he cannot enjoy his prosperity and does not receive proper burial, I say that a stillborn child is better off than he."
ECC	6	4	Solomon	#10		21929	" {4} It comes without meaning, it departs in darkness, and in darkness its name is shrouded."
ECC	6	5	Solomon	#10		21930	" {5} Though it never saw the sun or knew anything, it has more rest than does that manù"
ECC	6	6	Solomon	#10		21931	 {6} even if he lives a thousand years twice over but fails to enjoy his prosperity. Do not all go to the same place?
ECC	6	7	Solomon	#10		21932	" {7} All man's efforts are for his mouth, yet his appetite is never satisfied."
ECC	6	8	Solomon	#10		21933	 {8} What advantage has a wise man over a fool? What does a poor man gain by knowing how to conduct himself before others?
ECC	6	9	Solomon	#10		21934	" {9} Better what the eye sees than the roving of the appetite. This too is meaningless, a chasing after the wind."
ECC	6	10	Solomon	#10		21935	" {10} Whatever exists has already been named, and what man is has been known; no man can contend with one who is stronger than he."
ECC	6	11	Solomon	#10		21936	" {11} The more the words, the less the meaning, and how does that profit anyone?"
ECC	6	12	Solomon	#10		21937	" {12} For who knows what is good for a man in life, during the few and meaningless days he passes through like a shadow?"
ECC	6	12	Solomon	#10		21938	 Who can tell him what will happen under the sun after he is gone?*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
ECC	7	<<	Narr_21: Ecclesiastes	#13		21939	ECCLESIASTES 7
ECC	7	1	Solomon	#10		21940	" {1} A good name is better than fine perfume, and the day of death better than the day of birth."
ECC	7	2	Solomon	#10		21941	" {2} It is better to go to a house of mourning than to go to a house of feasting, for death is the destiny of every man; the living should take this to heart."
ECC	7	3	Solomon	#10		21942	" {3} Sorrow is better than laughter, because a sad face is good for the heart."
ECC	7	4	Solomon	#10		21943	" {4} The heart of the wise is in the house of mourning, but the heart of fools is in the house of pleasure."
ECC	7	5	Solomon	#10		21944	 {5} It is better to heed a wise man's rebuke than to listen to the song of fools.
ECC	7	6	Solomon	#10		21945	" {6} Like the crackling of thorns under the pot, so is the laughter of fools. This too is meaningless."
ECC	7	7	Solomon	#10		21946	" {7} Extortion turns a wise man into a fool, and a bribe corrupts the heart."
ECC	7	8	Solomon	#10		21947	" {8} The end of a matter is better than its beginning, and patience is better than pride."
ECC	7	9	Solomon	#10		21948	" {9} Do not be quickly provoked in your spirit, for anger resides in the lap of fools."
ECC	7	10	Solomon	#10		21949	" {10} Do not say, << Why were the old days better than these? >> For it is not wise to ask such questions."
ECC	7	11	Solomon	#10		21950	" {11} Wisdom, like an inheritance, is a good thing and benefits those who see the sun."
ECC	7	12	Solomon	#10		21951	" {12} Wisdom is a shelter as money is a shelter, but the advantage of knowledge is this: that wisdom preserves the life of its possessor."
ECC	7	13	Solomon	#10		21952	 {13} Consider what God has done: Who can straighten what he has made crooked?
ECC	7	14	Solomon	#10		21953	" {14} When times are good, be happy; but when times are bad, consider: God has made the one as well as the other. Therefore, a man cannot discover anything about his future."
ECC	7	15	Solomon	#10		21954	" {15} In this meaningless life of mine I have seen both of these: a righteous man perishing in his righteousness, and a wicked man living long in his wickedness."
ECC	7	16	Solomon	#10		21955	" {16} Do not be overrighteous, neither be overwise-- why destroy yourself?"
ECC	7	17	Solomon	#10		21956	" {17} Do not be overwicked, and do not be a fool-- why die before your time?"
ECC	7	18	Solomon	#10		21957	 {18} It is good to grasp the one and not let go of the other. The man who fears God will avoid all extremes.
ECC	7	19	Solomon	#10		21958	 {19} Wisdom makes one wise man more powerful than ten rulers in a city.
ECC	7	20	Solomon	#10		21959	 {20} There is not a righteous man on earth who does what is right and never sins.
ECC	7	21	Solomon	#10		21960	" {21} Do not pay attention to every word people say, or you may hear your servant cursing you-- {22} for you know in your heart that many times you yourself have cursed others."
ECC	7	23	Solomon	#10		21961	" {23} All this I tested by wisdom and I said, << I am determined to be wise << -- but this was beyond me."
ECC	7	24	Solomon	#10		21962	" {24} Whatever wisdom may be, it is far off and most profound-- who can discover it?"
ECC	7	25	Solomon	#10		21963	" {25} So I turned my mind to understand, to investigate and to search out wisdom and the scheme of things and to understand the stupidity of wickedness and the madness of folly."
ECC	7	26	Solomon	#10		21964	" {26} I find more bitter than death the woman who is a snare, whose heart is a trap and whose hands are chains. The man who pleases God will escape her, but the sinner she will ensnare."
ECC	7	27	Solomon	#10		21965	" {27} << Look,>> says the Teacher, << this is what I have discovered: <<Adding one thing to another to discover the scheme of things--"
ECC	7	28	Solomon	#10		21966	" {28} while I was still searching but not finding-- I found one upright man among a thousand, but not one upright woman among them all."
ECC	7	29	Solomon	#10		21967	" {29} This only have I found: God made mankind upright, but men have gone in search of many schemes. >>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
ECC	8	<<	Narr_21: Ecclesiastes	#13		21968	ECCLESIASTES 8
ECC	8	1	Solomon	#10		21969	 {1} Who is like the wise man? Who knows the explanation of things? Wisdom brightens a man's face and changes its hard appearance.
ECC	8	2	Solomon	#10		21970	" {2} Obey the king's command, I say, because you took an oath before God."
ECC	8	3	Solomon	#10		21971	" {3} Do not be in a hurry to leave the king's presence. Do not stand up for a bad cause, for he will do whatever he pleases."
ECC	8	4	Solomon	#10		21972	" {4} Since a king's word is supreme, who can say to him, << What are you doing? >>"
ECC	8	5	Solomon	#10		21973	" {5} Whoever obeys his command will come to no harm, and the wise heart will know the proper time and procedure."
ECC	8	6	Solomon	#10		21974	" {6} For there is a proper time and procedure for every matter, though a man's misery weighs heavily upon him."
ECC	8	7	Solomon	#10		21975	" {7} Since no man knows the future, who can tell him what is to come?"
ECC	8	8	Solomon	#10		21976	 {8} No man has power over the wind to contain it; so no one has power over the day of his death. 
ECC	8	8	Solomon	#10		21977	" As no one is discharged in time of war, so wickedness will not release those who practice it."
ECC	8	9	Solomon	#10		21978	" {9} All this I saw, as I applied my mind to everything done under the sun. There is a time when a man lords it over others to his own hurt."
ECC	8	10	Solomon	#10		21979	" {10} Then too, I saw the wicked buried--those who used to come and go from the holy place and receive praise in the city where they did this. This too is meaningless."
ECC	8	11	Solomon	#10		21980	" {11} When the sentence for a crime is not quickly carried out, the hearts of the people are filled with schemes to do wrong."
ECC	8	12	Solomon	#10		21981	" {12} Although a wicked man commits a hundred crimes and still lives a long time, I know that it will go better with God-fearing men, who are reverent before God."
ECC	8	13	Solomon	#10		21982	" {13} Yet because the wicked do not fear God, it will not go well with them, and their days will not lengthen like a shadow."
ECC	8	14	Solomon	#10		21983	 {14} There is something else meaningless that occurs on earth: 
ECC	8	14	Solomon	#10		21984	" righteous men who get what the wicked deserve, and wicked men who get what the righteous deserve. This too, I say, is meaningless."
ECC	8	15	Solomon	#10		21985	" {15} So I commend the enjoyment of life, because nothing is better for a man under the sun than to eat and drink and be glad. "
ECC	8	15	Solomon	#10		21986	 Then joy will accompany him in his work all the days of the life God has given him under the sun.
ECC	8	16	Solomon	#10		21987	 {16} When I applied my mind to know wisdom and to observe man's labor on earth--his eyes not seeing sleep day or night-- {17} then I saw all that God has done. 
ECC	8	17	Solomon	#10		21988	 No one can comprehend what goes on under the sun. 
ECC	8	17	Solomon	#10		21989	" Despite all his efforts to search it out, man cannot discover its meaning. Even if a wise man claims he knows, he cannot really comprehend it.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
ECC	9	<<	Narr_21: Ecclesiastes	#13		21990	ECCLESIASTES 9
ECC	9	1	Solomon	#10		21991	" {1} So I reflected on all this and concluded that the righteous and the wise and what they do are in God's hands, but no man knows whether love or hate awaits him."
ECC	9	2	Solomon	#10		21992	" {2} All share a common destiny--the righteous and the wicked, the good and the bad, the clean and the unclean, those who offer sacrifices and those who do not. "
ECC	9	2	Solomon	#10		21993	" As it is with the good man, so with the sinner; as it is with those who take oaths, so with those who are afraid to take them."
ECC	9	3	Solomon	#10		21994	 {3} This is the evil in everything that happens under the sun: The same destiny overtakes all. 
ECC	9	3	Solomon	#10		21995	" The hearts of men, moreover, are full of evil and there is madness in their hearts while they live, and afterward they join the dead."
ECC	9	4	Solomon	#10		21996	 {4} Anyone who is among the living has hope--even a live dog is better off than a dead lion! >>
ECC	9	5	Solomon	#10		21997	" {5} For the living know that they will die, but the dead know nothing; they have no further reward, and even the memory of them is forgotten."
ECC	9	6	Solomon	#10		21998	" {6} Their love, their hate and their jealousy have long since vanished; never again will they have a part in anything that happens under the sun."
ECC	9	7	Solomon	#10		21999	" {7} Go, eat your food with gladness, and drink your wine with a joyful heart, for it is now that God favors what you do."
ECC	9	8	Solomon	#10		22000	" {8} Always be clothed in white, and always anoint your head with oil."
ECC	9	9	Solomon	#10		22001	" {9} Enjoy life with your wife, whom you love, all the days of this meaningless life that God has given you under the sun-- all your meaningless days. "
ECC	9	9	Solomon	#10		22002	 For this is your lot in life and in your toilsome labor under the sun.
ECC	9	10	Solomon	#10		22003	" {10} Whatever your hand finds to do, do it with all your might, for in the grave, where you are going, there is neither working nor planning nor knowledge nor wisdom."
ECC	9	11	Solomon	#10		22004	 {11} I have seen something else under the sun: 
ECC	9	11	Solomon	#10		22005	" The race is not to the swift or the battle to the strong, nor does food come to the wise or wealth to the brilliant or favor to the learned; but time and chance happen to them all."
ECC	9	12	Solomon	#10		22006	" {12} Moreover, no man knows when his hour will come: As fish are caught in a cruel net, or birds are taken in a snare, so men are trapped by evil times that fall unexpectedly upon them."
ECC	9	13	Solomon	#10		22007	 {13} I also saw under the sun this example of wisdom that greatly impressed me:
ECC	9	14	Solomon	#10		22008	" {14} There was once a small city with only a few people in it. And a powerful king came against it, surrounded it and built huge siegeworks against it."
ECC	9	15	Solomon	#10		22009	" {15} Now there lived in that city a man poor but wise, and he saved the city by his wisdom. But nobody remembered that poor man."
ECC	9	16	Solomon	#10		22010	" {16} So I said, << Wisdom is better than strength. >> But the poor man's wisdom is despised, and his words are no longer heeded."
ECC	9	17	Solomon	#10		22011	 {17} The quiet words of the wise are more to be heeded than the shouts of a ruler of fools.
ECC	9	18	Solomon	#10		22012	" {18} Wisdom is better than weapons of war, but one sinner destroys much good.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
ECC	10	<<	Narr_21: Ecclesiastes	#13		22013	ECCLESIASTES 10
ECC	10	1	Solomon	#10		22014	" {1} As dead flies give perfume a bad smell, so a little folly outweighs wisdom and honor."
ECC	10	2	Solomon	#10		22015	" {2} The heart of the wise inclines to the right, but the heart of the fool to the left."
ECC	10	3	Solomon	#10		22016	" {3} Even as he walks along the road, the fool lacks sense and shows everyone how stupid he is."
ECC	10	4	Solomon	#10		22017	" {4} If a ruler's anger rises against you, do not leave your post; calmness can lay great errors to rest."
ECC	10	5	Solomon	#10		22018	" {5} There is an evil I have seen under the sun, the sort of error that arises from a ruler:"
ECC	10	6	Solomon	#10		22019	" {6} Fools are put in many high positions, while the rich occupy the low ones. {7} I have seen slaves on horseback, while princes go on foot like slaves."
ECC	10	8	Solomon	#10		22020	 {8} Whoever digs a pit may fall into it; whoever breaks through a wall may be bitten by a snake.
ECC	10	9	Solomon	#10		22021	 {9} Whoever quarries stones may be injured by them; whoever splits logs may be endangered by them.
ECC	10	10	Solomon	#10		22022	" {10} If the ax is dull and its edge unsharpened, more strength is needed but skill will bring success."
ECC	10	11	Solomon	#10		22023	" {11} If a snake bites before it is charmed, there is no profit for the charmer."
ECC	10	12	Solomon	#10		22024	" {12} Words from a wise man's mouth are gracious, but a fool is consumed by his own lips."
ECC	10	13	Solomon	#10		22025	 {13} At the beginning his words are folly; at the end they are wicked madness-- {14} and the fool multiplies words. 
ECC	10	14	Solomon	#10		22026	 No one knows what is coming-- who can tell him what will happen after him?
ECC	10	15	Solomon	#10		22027	 {15} A fool's work wearies him; he does not know the way to town.
ECC	10	16	Solomon	#10		22028	" {16} Woe to you, O land whose king was a servant and whose princes feast in the morning."
ECC	10	17	Solomon	#10		22029	" {17} Blessed are you, O land whose king is of noble birth and whose princes eat at a proper time-- for strength and not for drunkenness."
ECC	10	18	Solomon	#10		22030	" {18} If a man is lazy, the rafters sag; if his hands are idle, the house leaks."
ECC	10	19	Solomon	#10		22031	" {19} A feast is made for laughter, and wine makes life merry, but money is the answer for everything."
ECC	10	20	Solomon	#10		22032	" {20} Do not revile the king even in your thoughts, or curse the rich in your bedroom, because a bird of the air may carry your words, and a bird on the wing may report what you say.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
ECC	11	<<	Narr_21: Ecclesiastes	#13		22033	ECCLESIASTES 11
ECC	11	1	Solomon	#10		22034	" {1} Cast your bread upon the waters, for after many days you will find it again."
ECC	11	2	Solomon	#10		22035	" {2} Give portions to seven, yes to eight, for you do not know what disaster may come upon the land."
ECC	11	3	Solomon	#10		22036	" {3} If clouds are full of water, they pour rain upon the earth. Whether a tree falls to the south or to the north, in the place where it falls, there will it lie."
ECC	11	4	Solomon	#10		22037	 {4} Whoever watches the wind will not plant; whoever looks at the clouds will not reap.
ECC	11	5	Solomon	#10		22038	" {5} As you do not know the path of the wind, or how the body is formed in a mother's womb, so you cannot understand the work of God, the Maker of all things."
ECC	11	6	Solomon	#10		22039	" {6} Sow your seed in the morning, and at evening let not your hands be idle, for you do not know which will succeed, whether this or that, or whether both will do equally well."
ECC	11	7	Solomon	#10		22040	" {7} Light is sweet, and it pleases the eyes to see the sun."
ECC	11	8	Solomon	#10		22041	" {8} However many years a man may live, let him enjoy them all. But let him remember the days of darkness, for they will be many. Everything to come is meaningless."
ECC	11	9	Solomon	#10		22042	" {9} Be happy, young man, while you are young, and let your heart give you joy in the days of your youth. "
ECC	11	9	Solomon	#10		22043	" Follow the ways of your heart and whatever your eyes see, but know that for all these things God will bring you to judgment."
ECC	11	10	Solomon	#10		22044	" {10} So then, banish anxiety from your heart and cast off the troubles of your body, for youth and vigor are meaningless.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
ECC	12	<<	Narr_21: Ecclesiastes	#13		22045	ECCLESIASTES 12
ECC	12	1	Solomon	#10		22046	" {1} Remember your Creator in the days of your youth, before the days of trouble come and the years approach when you will say, << I find no pleasure in them>> --"
ECC	12	2	Solomon	#10		22047	" {2} before the sun and the light and the moon and the stars grow dark, and the clouds return after the rain;"
ECC	12	3	Solomon	#10		22048	" {3} when the keepers of the house tremble, and the strong men stoop, when the grinders cease because they are few, and those looking through the windows grow dim;"
ECC	12	4	Solomon	#10		22049	" {4} when the doors to the street are closed and the sound of grinding fades; when men rise up at the sound of birds, but all their songs grow faint;"
ECC	12	5	Solomon	#10		22050	 {5} when men are afraid of heights and of dangers in the streets; when the almond tree blossoms and the grasshopper drags himself along and desire no longer is stirred. 
ECC	12	5	Solomon	#10		22051	 Then man goes to his eternal home and mourners go about the streets.
ECC	12	6	Solomon	#10		22052	" {6} Remember him--before the silver cord is severed, or the golden bowl is broken; before the pitcher is shattered at the spring, or the wheel broken at the well,"
ECC	12	7	Solomon	#10		22053	" {7} and the dust returns to the ground it came from, and the spirit returns to God who gave it."
ECC	12	8	Solomon	#10		22054	 {8} << Meaningless! >> Meaningless! >><< says the Teacher. << Everything is meaningless! >>
ECC	12	9	Solomon	#10		22055	" {9} << Not only was the Teacher wise, but also he imparted knowledge to the people. He pondered and searched out and set in order many proverbs."
ECC	12	10	Solomon	#10		22056	" {10} The Teacher searched to find just the right words, and what he wrote was upright and true."
ECC	12	11	Solomon	#10		22057	" {11} The words of the wise are like goads, their collected sayings like firmly embedded nails--given by one Shepherd."
ECC	12	12	Solomon	#10		22058	" {12} Be warned, my son, of anything in addition to them. Of making many books there is no end, and much study wearies the body."
ECC	12	13	Solomon	#10		22059	" {13} Now all has been heard; here is the conclusion of the matter: Fear God and keep his commandments, for this is the whole duty of man."
ECC	12	14	Solomon	#10		22060	" {14} For God will bring every deed into judgment, including every hidden thing, whether it is good or evil.*~**~*||||| + 5 SECs |||||*~*"
SOS	1	<<	Narr_22: Song of Solomon	#13		22061	SONG OF SONGS*~*SONG OF SONGS 1
SOS	1	1	Narr_22: Song of Solomon	#13		22062	 {1} Solomon's Song of Songs.
SOS	1	2	Wife of Solomon	#23		22063	 {2} Let him kiss me with the kisses of his mouth-- for your love is more delightful than wine.
SOS	1	3	Wife of Solomon	#23		22064	 {3} Pleasing is the fragrance of your perfumes; your name is like perfume poured out. No wonder the maidens love you!
SOS	1	4	Wife of Solomon	#23		22065	 {4} Take me away with you--let us hurry! Let the king bring me into his chambers. 
SOS	1	4	Wife of Solomon	#23		22066	 We rejoice and delight in you; we will praise your love more than wine. How right they are to adore you!
SOS	1	5	Wife of Solomon	#23		22067	" {5} Dark am I, yet lovely, O daughters of Jerusalem, dark like the tents of Kedar, like the tent curtains of Solomon."
SOS	1	6	Wife of Solomon	#23		22068	" {6} Do not stare at me because I am dark, because I am darkened by the sun. "
SOS	1	6	Wife of Solomon	#23		22069	 My mother's sons were angry with me and made me take care of the vineyards; my own vineyard I have neglected.
SOS	1	7	Wife of Solomon	#23		22070	" {7} Tell me, you whom I love, where you graze your flock and where you rest your sheep at midday. "
SOS	1	7	Wife of Solomon	#23		22071	 Why should I be like a veiled woman beside the flocks of your friends?
SOS	1	8	Solomon	#10		22072	" {8} If you do not know, most beautiful of women, follow the tracks of the sheep and graze your young goats by the tents of the shepherds."
SOS	1	9	Solomon	#10		22073	" {9} I liken you, my darling, to a mare harnessed to one of the chariots of Pharaoh."
SOS	1	10	Solomon	#10		22074	" {10} Your cheeks are beautiful with earrings, your neck with strings of jewels."
SOS	1	11	Solomon	#10		22075	" {11} We will make you earrings of gold, studded with silver."
SOS	1	12	Wife of Solomon	#23		22076	" {12} While the king was at his table, my perfume spread its fragrance."
SOS	1	13	Wife of Solomon	#23		22077	 {13} My lover is to me a sachet of myrrh resting between my breasts.
SOS	1	14	Wife of Solomon	#23		22078	 {14} My lover is to me a cluster of henna blossoms from the vineyards of En Gedi.
SOS	1	15	Solomon	#10		22079	" {15} How beautiful you are, my darling! Oh, how beautiful! Your eyes are doves."
SOS	1	16	Wife of Solomon	#23		22080	" {16} How handsome you are, my lover! Oh, how charming! And our bed is verdant."
SOS	1	17	Solomon	#10		22081	 {17} The beams of our house are cedars; our rafters are firs.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
SOS	2	<<	Narr_22: Song of Solomon	#13		22082	SONG OF SONGS 2
SOS	2	1	Wife of Solomon	#23		22083	" {1} I am a rose of Sharon, a lily of the valleys."
SOS	2	2	Solomon	#10		22084	 {2} Like a lily among thorns is my darling among the maidens.
SOS	2	3	Wife of Solomon	#23		22085	 {3} Like an apple tree among the trees of the forest is my lover among the young men. 
SOS	2	3	Wife of Solomon	#23		22086	" I delight to sit in his shade, and his fruit is sweet to my taste."
SOS	2	4	Wife of Solomon	#23		22087	" {4} He has taken me to the banquet hall, and his banner over me is love."
SOS	2	5	Wife of Solomon	#23		22088	" {5} Strengthen me with raisins, refresh me with apples, for I am faint with love."
SOS	2	6	Wife of Solomon	#23		22089	" {6} His left arm is under my head, and his right arm embraces me."
SOS	2	7	Wife of Solomon	#23		22090	" {7} Daughters of Jerusalem, I charge you by the gazelles and by the does of the field: "
SOS	2	7	Wife of Solomon	#23		22091	 Do not arouse or awaken love until it so desires.
SOS	2	8	Wife of Solomon	#23		22092	" {8} Listen! My lover! Look! Here he comes, leaping across the mountains, bounding over the hills."
SOS	2	9	Wife of Solomon	#23		22093	 {9} My lover is like a gazelle or a young stag. Look! 
SOS	2	9	Wife of Solomon	#23		22094	" There he stands behind our wall, gazing through the windows, peering through the lattice. {10} My lover spoke and said to me,"
SOS	2	10	Solomon	#10		22095	" << Arise, my darling, my beautiful one, and come with me. {11} See! The winter is past; the rains are over and gone."
SOS	2	12	Solomon	#10		22096	" {12} Flowers appear on the earth; the season of singing has come, the cooing of doves is heard in our land."
SOS	2	13	Solomon	#10		22097	" {13} The fig tree forms its early fruit; the blossoming vines spread their fragrance. Arise, come, my darling; my beautiful one, come with me. >>"
SOS	2	14	Solomon	#10		22098	" {14} My dove in the clefts of the rock, in the hiding places on the mountainside, show me your face, let me hear your voice; for your voice is sweet, and your face is lovely."
SOS	2	15	Solomon	#10		22099	" {15} Catch for us the foxes, the little foxes that ruin the vineyards, our vineyards that are in bloom."
SOS	2	16	Wife of Solomon	#23		22100	 {16} My lover is mine and I am his; he browses among the lilies.
SOS	2	17	Wife of Solomon	#23		22101	" {17} Until the day breaks and the shadows flee, turn, my lover, and be like a gazelle or like a young stag on the rugged hills.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
SOS	3	<<	Narr_22: Song of Solomon	#13		22102	SONG OF SONGS 3
SOS	3	1	Wife of Solomon	#23		22103	 {1} All night long on my bed I looked for the one my heart loves; I looked for him but did not find him.
SOS	3	2	Wife of Solomon	#23		22104	" {2} I will get up now and go about the city, through its streets and squares; "
SOS	3	2	Wife of Solomon	#23		22105	 I will search for the one my heart loves. So I looked for him but did not find him.
SOS	3	3	Wife of Solomon	#23		22106	 {3} The watchmen found me as they made their rounds in the city. << Have you seen the one my heart loves? >>
SOS	3	4	Wife of Solomon	#23		22107	 {4} Scarcely had I passed them when I found the one my heart loves. 
SOS	3	4	Wife of Solomon	#23		22108	" I held him and would not let him go till I had brought him to my mother's house, to the room of the one who conceived me."
SOS	3	5	Wife of Solomon	#23		22109	" {5} Daughters of Jerusalem, I charge you by the gazelles and by the does of the field: Do not arouse or awaken love until it so desires."
SOS	3	6	Wife of Solomon	#23		22110	" {6} Who is this coming up from the desert like a column of smoke, perfumed with myrrh and incense made from all the spices of the merchant?"
SOS	3	7	Wife of Solomon	#23		22111	" {7} Look! It is Solomon's carriage, escorted by sixty warriors, the noblest of Israel,"
SOS	3	8	Wife of Solomon	#23		22112	" {8} all of them wearing the sword, all experienced in battle, each with his sword at his side, prepared for the terrors of the night."
SOS	3	9	Wife of Solomon	#23		22113	 {9} King Solomon made for himself the carriage; he made it of wood from Lebanon.
SOS	3	10	Wife of Solomon	#23		22114	" {10} Its posts he made of silver, its base of gold. Its seat was upholstered with purple, its interior lovingly inlaid by the daughters of Jerusalem."
SOS	3	11	Wife of Solomon	#23		22115	" {11} Come out, you daughters of Zion, and look at King Solomon wearing the crown, the crown with which his mother crowned him on the day of his wedding, the day his heart rejoiced.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
SOS	4	<<	Narr_22: Song of Solomon	#13		22116	SONG OF SONGS 4
SOS	4	1	Solomon	#10		22117	" {1} How beautiful you are, my darling! Oh, how beautiful! Your eyes behind your veil are doves. Your hair is like a flock of goats descending from Mount Gilead."
SOS	4	2	Solomon	#10		22118	" {2} Your teeth are like a flock of sheep just shorn, coming up from the washing. Each has its twin; not one of them is alone."
SOS	4	3	Solomon	#10		22119	 {3} Your lips are like a scarlet ribbon; your mouth is lovely. Your temples behind your veil are like the halves of a pomegranate.
SOS	4	4	Solomon	#10		22120	" {4} Your neck is like the tower of David, built with elegance; on it hang a thousand shields, all of them shields of warriors."
SOS	4	5	Solomon	#10		22121	" {5} Your two breasts are like two fawns, like twin fawns of a gazelle that browse among the lilies."
SOS	4	6	Solomon	#10		22122	" {6} Until the day breaks and the shadows flee, I will go to the mountain of myrrh and to the hill of incense."
SOS	4	7	Solomon	#10		22123	" {7} All beautiful you are, my darling; there is no flaw in you."
SOS	4	8	Solomon	#10		22124	" {8} Come with me from Lebanon, my bride, come with me from Lebanon. "
SOS	4	8	Solomon	#10		22125	" Descend from the crest of Amana, from the top of Senir, the summit of Hermon, from the lions' dens and the mountain haunts of the leopards."
SOS	4	9	Solomon	#10		22126	" {9} You have stolen my heart, my sister, my bride; you have stolen my heart with one glance of your eyes, with one jewel of your necklace."
SOS	4	10	Solomon	#10		22127	" {10} How delightful is your love, my sister, my bride! How much more pleasing is your love than wine, and the fragrance of your perfume than any spice!"
SOS	4	11	Solomon	#10		22128	" {11} Your lips drop sweetness as the honeycomb, my bride; milk and honey are under your tongue. The fragrance of your garments is like that of Lebanon."
SOS	4	12	Solomon	#10		22129	" {12} You are a garden locked up, my sister, my bride; you are a spring enclosed, a sealed fountain."
SOS	4	13	Solomon	#10		22130	" {13} Your plants are an orchard of pomegranates with choice fruits, with henna and nard,"
SOS	4	14	Solomon	#10		22131	" {14} nard and saffron, calamus and cinnamon, with every kind of incense tree, with myrrh and aloes and all the finest spices."
SOS	4	15	Solomon	#10		22132	" {15} You are a garden fountain, a well of flowing water streaming down from Lebanon."
SOS	4	16	Wife of Solomon	#23		22133	" {16} Awake, north wind, and come, south wind! Blow on my garden, that its fragrance may spread abroad."
SOS	4	16	Wife of Solomon	#23		22134	 Let my lover come into his garden and taste its choice fruits.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
SOS	5	<<	Narr_22: Song of Solomon	#13		22135	SONG OF SONGS 5
SOS	5	1	Solomon	#10		22136	" {1} I have come into my garden, my sister, my bride; I have gathered my myrrh with my spice. "
SOS	5	1	Solomon	#10		22137	" I have eaten my honeycomb and my honey; I have drunk my wine and my milk. Eat, O friends, and drink; drink your fill, O lovers."
SOS	5	2	Wife of Solomon	#23		22138	 {2} I slept but my heart was awake. Listen! My lover is knocking:
SOS	5	2	Solomon	#10		22139	" << Open to me, my sister, my darling, my dove, my flawless one. My head is drenched with dew, my hair with the dampness of the night. >>"
SOS	5	3	Wife of Solomon	#23		22140	 {3} << I have taken off my robe-- must I put it on again? I have washed my feet-- must I soil them again?
SOS	5	4	Wife of Solomon	#23		22141	 {4} My lover thrust his hand through the latch-opening; my heart began to pound for him.
SOS	5	5	Wife of Solomon	#23		22142	" {5} I arose to open for my lover, and my hands dripped with myrrh, my fingers with flowing myrrh, on the handles of the lock."
SOS	5	6	Wife of Solomon	#23		22143	" {6} I opened for my lover, but my lover had left; he was gone. My heart sank at his departure. "
SOS	5	6	Wife of Solomon	#23		22144	 I looked for him but did not find him. I called him but he did not answer.
SOS	5	7	Wife of Solomon	#23		22145	 {7} The watchmen found me as they made their rounds in the city. 
SOS	5	7	Wife of Solomon	#23		22146	" They beat me, they bruised me; they took away my cloak, those watchmen of the walls!"
SOS	5	8	Wife of Solomon	#23		22147	" {8} O daughters of Jerusalem, I charge you-- if you find my lover, what will you tell him? Tell him I am faint with love."
SOS	5	9	Daughter of Jerusalem	#22		22148	" {9} How is your beloved better than others, most beautiful of women?"
SOS	5	9	Daughter of Jerusalem	#22		22149	" How is your beloved better than others, that you charge us so?"
SOS	5	10	Wife of Solomon	#23		22150	" {10} My lover is radiant and ruddy, outstanding among ten thousand."
SOS	5	11	Wife of Solomon	#23		22151	 {11} His head is purest gold; his hair is wavy and black as a raven.
SOS	5	12	Wife of Solomon	#23		22152	" {12} His eyes are like doves by the water streams, washed in milk, mounted like jewels."
SOS	5	13	Wife of Solomon	#23		22153	 {13} His cheeks are like beds of spice yielding perfume. His lips are like lilies dripping with myrrh.
SOS	5	14	Wife of Solomon	#23		22154	 {14} His arms are rods of gold set with chrysolite. His body is like polished ivory decorated with sapphires.
SOS	5	15	Wife of Solomon	#23		22155	" {15} His legs are pillars of marble set on bases of pure gold. His appearance is like Lebanon, choice as its cedars."
SOS	5	16	Wife of Solomon	#23		22156	" {16} His mouth is sweetness itself; he is altogether lovely. This is my lover, this my friend, O daughters of Jerusalem.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
SOS	6	<<	Narr_22: Song of Solomon	#13		22157	SONG OF SONGS 6
SOS	6	1	Daughter of Jerusalem	#22		22158	" {1} Where has your lover gone, most beautiful of women? Which way did your lover turn, that we may look for him with you?"
SOS	6	2	Wife of Solomon	#23		22159	" {2} My lover has gone down to his garden, to the beds of spices, to browse in the gardens and to gather lilies."
SOS	6	3	Wife of Solomon	#23		22160	 {3} I am my lover's and my lover is mine; he browses among the lilies.
SOS	6	4	Solomon	#10		22161	" {4} You are beautiful, my darling, as Tirzah, lovely as Jerusalem, majestic as troops with banners."
SOS	6	5	Solomon	#10		22162	 {5} Turn your eyes from me; they overwhelm me. Your hair is like a flock of goats descending from Gilead.
SOS	6	6	Solomon	#10		22163	" {6} Your teeth are like a flock of sheep coming up from the washing. Each has its twin, not one of them is alone."
SOS	6	7	Solomon	#10		22164	 {7} Your temples behind your veil are like the halves of a pomegranate.
SOS	6	8	Solomon	#10		22165	" {8} Sixty queens there may be, and eighty concubines, and virgins beyond number;"
SOS	6	9	Solomon	#10		22166	" {9} but my dove, my perfect one, is unique, the only daughter of her mother, the favorite of the one who bore her. "
SOS	6	9	Solomon	#10		22167	 The maidens saw her and called her blessed; the queens and concubines praised her.
SOS	6	10	Solomon	#10		22168	" {10} Who is this that appears like the dawn, fair as the moon, bright as the sun, majestic as the stars in procession?"
SOS	6	11	Solomon	#10		22169	" {11} I went down to the grove of nut trees to look at the new growth in the valley, to see if the vines had budded or the pomegranates were in bloom."
SOS	6	12	Solomon	#10		22170	" {12} Before I realized it, my desire set me among the royal chariots of my people."
SOS	6	13	Solomon	#10		22171	" {13} Come back, come back, O Shulammite; come back, come back, that we may gaze on you! Why would you gaze on the Shulammite as on the dance of Mahanaim?*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
SOS	7	<<	Narr_22: Song of Solomon	#13		22172	SONG OF SONGS 7
SOS	7	1	Solomon	#10		22173	" {1} How beautiful your sandaled feet, O prince's daughter! Your graceful legs are like jewels, the work of a craftsman's hands."
SOS	7	2	Solomon	#10		22174	 {2} Your navel is a rounded goblet that never lacks blended wine. Your waist is a mound of wheat encircled by lilies.
SOS	7	3	Solomon	#10		22175	" {3} Your breasts are like two fawns, twins of a gazelle."
SOS	7	4	Solomon	#10		22176	 {4} Your neck is like an ivory tower. Your eyes are the pools of Heshbon by the gate of Bath Rabbim. Your nose is like the tower of Lebanon looking toward Damascus.
SOS	7	5	Solomon	#10		22177	 {5} Your head crowns you like Mount Carmel. Your hair is like royal tapestry; the king is held captive by its tresses.
SOS	7	6	Solomon	#10		22178	" {6} How beautiful you are and how pleasing, O love, with your delights!"
SOS	7	7	Solomon	#10		22179	" {7} Your stature is like that of the palm, and your breasts like clusters of fruit."
SOS	7	8	Solomon	#10		22180	" {8} I said, << I will climb the palm tree; I will take hold of its fruit. >> "
SOS	7	8	Solomon	#10		22181	" May your breasts be like the clusters of the vine, the fragrance of your breath like apples, {9} and your mouth like the best wine. "
SOS	7	9	Solomon	#10		22182	" May the wine go straight to my lover, flowing gently over lips and teeth."
SOS	7	10	Wife of Solomon	#23		22183	" {10} I belong to my lover, and his desire is for me."
SOS	7	11	Wife of Solomon	#23		22184	" {11} Come, my lover, let us go to the countryside, let us spend the night in the villages."
SOS	7	12	Wife of Solomon	#23		22185	" {12} Let us go early to the vineyards to see if the vines have budded, if their blossoms have opened, and if the pomegranates are in bloom-- there I will give you my love."
SOS	7	13	Wife of Solomon	#23		22186	" {13} The mandrakes send out their fragrance, and at our door is every delicacy, both new and old, that I have stored up for you, my lover.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
SOS	8	<<	Narr_22: Song of Solomon	#13		22187	SONG OF SONGS 8
SOS	8	1	Wife of Solomon	#23		22188	" {1} If only you were to me like a brother, who was nursed at my mother's breasts! "
SOS	8	1	Wife of Solomon	#23		22189	" Then, if I found you outside, I would kiss you, and no one would despise me."
SOS	8	2	Wife of Solomon	#23		22190	 {2} I would lead you and bring you to my mother's house-- she who has taught me.
SOS	8	2	Wife of Solomon	#23		22191	" I would give you spiced wine to drink, the nectar of my pomegranates."
SOS	8	3	Wife of Solomon	#23		22192	 {3} His left arm is under my head and his right arm embraces me.
