ISA	27	13	Isaiah	#01		22800	 {13} And in that day a great trumpet will sound. Those who were perishing in Assyria and those who were exiled in Egypt will come and worship the Lord on the holy mountain in Jerusalem.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
ISA	28	<<	Narr_23: Isaiah	#13		22801	ISAIAH 28
ISA	28	1	Isaiah	#01		22802	" {1} Woe to that wreath, the pride of Ephraim's drunkards, to the fading flower, his glorious beauty, set on the head of a fertile valley-- to that city, the pride of those laid low by wine!"
ISA	28	2	Isaiah	#01		22803	" {2} See, the Lord has one who is powerful and strong. Like a hailstorm and a destructive wind, like a driving rain and a flooding downpour, he will throw it forcefully to the ground."
ISA	28	3	Isaiah	#01		22804	" {3} That wreath, the pride of Ephraim's drunkards, will be trampled underfoot."
ISA	28	4	Isaiah	#01		22805	" {4} That fading flower, his glorious beauty, set on the head of a fertile valley, will be like a fig ripe before harvest-- as soon as someone sees it and takes it in his hand, he swallows it."
ISA	28	5	Isaiah	#01		22806	" {5} In that day the Lord Almighty will be a glorious crown, a beautiful wreath for the remnant of his people."
ISA	28	6	Isaiah	#01		22807	" {6} He will be a spirit of justice to him who sits in judgment, a source of strength to those who turn back the battle at the gate."
ISA	28	7	Isaiah	#01		22808	 {7} And these also stagger from wine and reel from beer: 
ISA	28	7	Isaiah	#01		22809	" Priests and prophets stagger from beer and are befuddled with wine; they reel from beer, they stagger when seeing visions, they stumble when rendering decisions."
ISA	28	8	Isaiah	#01		22810	 {8} All the tables are covered with vomit and there is not a spot without filth.
ISA	28	9	Man	#08		22811	" {9} << Who is it he is trying to teach? To whom is he explaining his message? To children weaned from their milk, to those just taken from the breast?"
ISA	28	10	Man	#08		22812	" {10} For it is: Do and do, do and do, rule on rule, rule on rule; a little here, a little there.>>"
ISA	28	11	Isaiah	#01		22813	" {11} Then He said, << Very well then, with foreign lips and strange tongues God will speak to this people,>> {12} to whom he said,"
ISA	28	12	God-FX1	#20		22814	" << This is the resting place, let the weary rest. This is the place of repose>>"
ISA	28	12	Isaiah	#01		22815	" but they would not listen. {13} So then, the word of the Lord to them will become:"
ISA	28	13	God-FX1	#20		22816	" Do and do, do and do, rule on rule, rule on rule; a little here, a little there--"
ISA	28	13	Isaiah	#01		22817	" so that they will go and fall backward, be injured and snared and captured. {14} Therefore hear the word of the Lord, you scoffers who rule this people in Jerusalem. {15} You boast,"
ISA	28	15	Ruler	#14		22818	" << We have entered into a covenant with death, with the grave we have made an agreement. "
ISA	28	15	Ruler	#14		22819	" When an overwhelming scourge sweeps by, it cannot touch us, for we have made a lie our refuge and falsehood our hiding place.>>"
ISA	28	16	Isaiah	#01		22820	 {16} So this is what the Sovereign Lord says:
ISA	28	16	God-FX1	#20		22821	" << See, I lay a stone in Zion, a tested stone, a precious cornerstone for a sure foundation; the one who trusts will never be dismayed."
ISA	28	17	God-FX1	#20		22822	" {17} I will make justice the measuring line and righteousness the plumb line; hail will sweep away your refuge, the lie, and water will overflow your hiding place."
ISA	28	18	Isaiah	#01		22823	" {18} Your covenant with death will be annulled; your agreement with the grave will not stand. When the overwhelming scourge sweeps by, you will be beaten down by it."
ISA	28	19	Isaiah	#01		22824	" {19} As often as it comes it will carry you away; morning after morning, by day and by night, it will sweep through.>> The understanding of this message will bring sheer terror."
ISA	28	20	Isaiah	#01		22825	" {20} The bed is too short to stretch out on, the blanket too narrow to wrap around you."
ISA	28	21	Isaiah	#01		22826	" {21} The Lord will rise up as he did at Mount Perazim, he will rouse himself as in the Valley of Gibeon -- to do his work, his strange work, and perform his task, his alien task."
ISA	28	22	Isaiah	#01		22827	" {22} Now stop your mocking, or your chains will become heavier; the Lord, the Lord Almighty, has told me of the destruction decreed against the whole land."
ISA	28	23	Isaiah	#01		22828	" {23} Listen and hear my voice; pay attention and hear what I say. {24} When a farmer plows for planting, does he plow continually? Does he keep on breaking up and harrowing the soil?"
ISA	28	25	Isaiah	#01		22829	" {25} When he has leveled the surface, does he not sow caraway and scatter cummin? Does he not plant wheat in its place, barley in its plot, and spelt in its field?"
ISA	28	26	Isaiah	#01		22830	 {26} His God instructs him and teaches him the right way.
ISA	28	27	Isaiah	#01		22831	" {27} Caraway is not threshed with a sledge, nor is a cartwheel rolled over cummin; caraway is beaten out with a rod, and cummin with a stick."
ISA	28	28	Isaiah	#01		22832	" {28} Grain must be ground to make bread; so one does not go on threshing it forever. Though he drives the wheels of his threshing cart over it, his horses do not grind it."
ISA	28	29	Isaiah	#01		22833	" {29} All this also comes from the Lord Almighty, wonderful in counsel and magnificent in wisdom.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
ISA	29	<<	Narr_23: Isaiah	#13		22834	ISAIAH 29
ISA	29	1	Isaiah	#01		22835	" {1} Woe to you, Ariel, Ariel, the city where David settled! Add year to year and let your cycle of festivals go on."
ISA	29	2	God-FX1	#20		22836	" {2} Yet I will besiege Ariel; she will mourn and lament, she will be to me like an altar hearth."
ISA	29	3	God-FX1	#20		22837	 {3} I will encamp against you all around; I will encircle you with towers and set up my siege works against you.
ISA	29	4	Isaiah	#01		22838	" {4} Brought low, you will speak from the ground; your speech will mumble out of the dust. Your voice will come ghostlike from the earth; out of the dust your speech will whisper."
ISA	29	5	Isaiah	#01		22839	" {5} But your many enemies will become like fine dust, the ruthless hordes like blown chaff. "
ISA	29	5	Isaiah	#01		22840	" Suddenly, in an instant, {6} the Lord Almighty will come with thunder and earthquake and great noise, with windstorm and tempest and flames of a devouring fire."
ISA	29	7	Isaiah	#01		22841	" {7} Then the hordes of all the nations that fight against Ariel, that attack her and her fortress and besiege her, will be as it is with a dream, with a vision in the nightù"
ISA	29	8	Isaiah	#01		22842	" {8} as when a hungry man dreams that he is eating, but he awakens, and his hunger remains; "
ISA	29	8	Isaiah	#01		22843	" as when a thirsty man dreams that he is drinking, but he awakens faint, with his thirst unquenched. So will it be with the hordes of all the nations that fight against Mount Zion."
ISA	29	9	Isaiah	#01		22844	" {9} Be stunned and amazed, blind yourselves and be sightless; be drunk, but not from wine, stagger, but not from beer."
ISA	29	10	Isaiah	#01		22845	 {10} The Lord has brought over you a deep sleep: He has sealed your eyes (the prophets); he has covered your heads (the seers).
ISA	29	11	Isaiah	#01		22846	 {11} For you this whole vision is nothing but words sealed in a scroll. 
ISA	29	11	Isaiah	#01		22847	" And if you give the scroll to someone who can read, and say to him, << Read this, please,>> he will answer, << I can't; it is sealed.>>"
ISA	29	12	Isaiah	#01		22848	" {12} Or if you give the scroll to someone who cannot read, and say, << Read this, please,>> he will answer, << I don't know how to read.>> {13} The Lord says:"
ISA	29	13	God-FX1	#20		22849	" << These people come near to me with their mouth and honor me with their lips, but their hearts are far from me. Their worship of me is made up only of rules taught by men."
ISA	29	14	God-FX1	#20		22850	" {14} Therefore once more I will astound these people with wonder upon wonder; the wisdom of the wise will perish, the intelligence of the intelligent will vanish.>>"
ISA	29	15	Isaiah	#01		22851	" {15} Woe to those who go to great depths to hide their plans from the Lord, who do their work in darkness and think, << Who sees us? Who will know?>>"
ISA	29	16	Isaiah	#01		22852	" {16} You turn things upside down, as if the potter were thought to be like the clay! "
ISA	29	16	Isaiah	#01		22853	" Shall what is formed say to him who formed it, << He did not make me<<? Can the pot say of the potter, << He knows nothing<<?"
ISA	29	17	Isaiah	#01		22854	" {17} In a very short time, will not Lebanon be turned into a fertile field and the fertile field seem like a forest?"
ISA	29	18	Isaiah	#01		22855	" {18} In that day the deaf will hear the words of the scroll, and out of gloom and darkness the eyes of the blind will see."
ISA	29	19	Isaiah	#01		22856	 {19} Once more the humble will rejoice in the Lord; the needy will rejoice in the Holy One of Israel.
ISA	29	20	Isaiah	#01		22857	" {20} The ruthless will vanish, the mockers will disappear, and all who have an eye for evil will be cut down--"
ISA	29	21	Isaiah	#01		22858	" {21} those who with a word make a man out to be guilty, who ensnare the defender in court and with false testimony deprive the innocent of justice."
ISA	29	22	Isaiah	#01		22859	" {22} Therefore this is what the Lord, who redeemed Abraham, says to the house of Jacob:"
ISA	29	22	God-FX1	#20		22860	 << No longer will Jacob be ashamed; no longer will their faces grow pale.
ISA	29	23	God-FX1	#20		22861	" {23} When they see among them their children, the work of my hands, they will keep my name holy; "
ISA	29	23	God-FX1	#20		22862	" they will acknowledge the holiness of the Holy One of Jacob, and will stand in awe of the God of Israel."
ISA	29	24	God-FX1	#20		22863	 {24} Those who are wayward in spirit will gain understanding; those who complain will accept instruction.>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*

ISA	30	2	God-FX1	#20		22868	" {2} who go down to Egypt without consulting me; who look for help to Pharaoh's protection, to Egypt's shade for refuge."
ISA	30	3	God-FX1	#20		22869	" {3} But Pharaoh's protection will be to your shame, Egypt's shade will bring you disgrace."

ISA	30	5	God-FX1	#20		22871	" {5} everyone will be put to shame because of a people useless to them, who bring neither help nor advantage, but only shame and disgrace.>>"
ISA	30	6	Narr_23: Isaiah	#13		22872	 {6} An oracle concerning the animals of the Negev: 
ISA	30	6	Isaiah	#01		22873	" Through a land of hardship and distress, of lions and lionesses, of adders and darting snakes, "

ISA	30	8	Isaiah	#01		22876	" {8} Go now, write it on a tablet for them, inscribe it on a scroll, that for the days to come it may be an everlasting witness."
ISA	30	9	Isaiah	#01		22877	" {9} These are rebellious people, deceitful children, children unwilling to listen to the Lord's instruction. {10} They say to the seers,"

ISA	30	12	Isaiah	#01		22882	" {12} Therefore, this is what the Holy One of Israel says: << Because you have rejected this message, relied on oppression and depended on deceit,"
ISA	30	13	Isaiah	#01		22883	" {13} this sin will become for you like a high wall, cracked and bulging, that collapses suddenly, in an instant."
ISA	30	14	Isaiah	#01		22884	" {14} It will break in pieces like pottery, shattered so mercilessly that among its pieces not a fragment will be found for taking coals from a hearth or scooping water out of a cistern.>>"
ISA	30	15	Isaiah	#01		22885	" {15} This is what the Sovereign Lord, the Holy One of Israel, says: << In repentance and rest is your salvation, in quietness and trust is your strength, but you would have none of it."
ISA	30	16	Isaiah	#01		22886	" {16} You said, 'No, we will flee on horses.' Therefore you will flee! You said, 'We will ride off on swift horses.' Therefore your pursuers will be swift!"
ISA	30	17	Isaiah	#01		22887	" {17} A thousand will flee at the threat of one; at the threat of five you will all flee away, till you are left like a flagstaff on a mountaintop, like a banner on a hill.>>"
ISA	30	18	Isaiah	#01		22888	 {18} Yet the Lord longs to be gracious to you; he rises to show you compassion. For the Lord is a God of justice. Blessed are all who wait for him!
ISA	30	19	Isaiah	#01		22889	" {19} O people of Zion, who live in Jerusalem, you will weep no more. How gracious he will be when you cry for help! As soon as he hears, he will answer you."
ISA	30	20	Isaiah	#01		22890	" {20} Although the Lord gives you the bread of adversity and the water of affliction, your teachers will be hidden no more; with your own eyes you will see them."
ISA	30	21	Isaiah	#01		22891	" {21} Whether you turn to the right or to the left, your ears will hear a voice behind you, saying,"
ISA	30	21	God-FX1	#20		22892	 << This is the way; walk in it.>>
ISA	30	22	Isaiah	#01		22893	" {22} Then you will defile your idols overlaid with silver and your images covered with gold; you will throw them away like a menstrual cloth and say to them, << Away with you!>>"
ISA	30	23	Isaiah	#01		22894	" {23} He will also send you rain for the seed you sow in the ground, and the food that comes from the land will be rich and plentiful. In that day your cattle will graze in broad meadows."
ISA	30	24	Isaiah	#01		22895	" {24} The oxen and donkeys that work the soil will eat fodder and mash, spread out with fork and shovel."
ISA	30	25	Isaiah	#01		22896	" {25} In the day of great slaughter, when the towers fall, streams of water will flow on every high mountain and every lofty hill."
ISA	30	26	Isaiah	#01		22897	" {26} The moon will shine like the sun, and the sunlight will be seven times brighter, like the light of seven full days, when the Lord binds up the bruises of his people and heals the wounds he inflicted."
ISA	30	27	Isaiah	#01		22898	" {27} See, the Name of the Lord comes from afar, with burning anger and dense clouds of smoke; his lips are full of wrath, and his tongue is a consuming fire."
ISA	30	28	Isaiah	#01		22899	" {28} His breath is like a rushing torrent, rising up to the neck. He shakes the nations in the sieve of destruction; he places in the jaws of the peoples a bit that leads them astray."
ISA	30	29	Isaiah	#01		22900	" {29} And you will sing as on the night you celebrate a holy festival; your hearts will rejoice as when people go up with flutes to the mountain of the Lord, to the Rock of Israel."
ISA	30	30	Isaiah	#01		22901	" {30} The Lord will cause men to hear his majestic voice and will make them see his arm coming down with raging anger and consuming fire, with cloudburst, thunderstorm and hail."
ISA	30	31	Isaiah	#01		22902	 {31} The voice of the Lord will shatter Assyria; with his scepter he will strike them down.
ISA	30	32	Isaiah	#01		22903	" {32} Every stroke the Lord lays on them with his punishing rod will be to the music of tambourines and harps, as he fights them in battle with the blows of his arm."
ISA	30	33	Isaiah	#01		22904	 {33} Topheth has long been prepared; it has been made ready for the king. 
ISA	30	33	Isaiah	#01		22905	" Its fire pit has been made deep and wide, with an abundance of fire and wood; the breath of the Lord, like a stream of burning sulfur, sets it ablaze.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"

ISA	32	<<	Narr_23: Isaiah	#13		22918	ISAIAH 32
ISA	32	1	Isaiah	#01		22919	" {1} See, a king will reign in righteousness and rulers will rule with justice."
ISA	32	2	Isaiah	#01		22920	" {2} Each man will be like a shelter from the wind and a refuge from the storm, like streams of water in the desert and the shadow of a great rock in a thirsty land."
ISA	32	3	Isaiah	#01		22921	" {3} Then the eyes of those who see will no longer be closed, and the ears of those who hear will listen."
ISA	32	4	Isaiah	#01		22922	" {4} The mind of the rash will know and understand, and the stammering tongue will be fluent and clear."
ISA	32	5	Isaiah	#01		22923	 {5} No longer will the fool be called noble nor the scoundrel be highly respected.
ISA	32	6	Isaiah	#01		22924	" {6} For the fool speaks folly, his mind is busy with evil: He practices ungodliness and spreads error concerning the Lord; the hungry he leaves empty and from the thirsty he withholds water."
ISA	32	7	Isaiah	#01		22925	" {7} The scoundrel's methods are wicked, he makes up evil schemes to destroy the poor with lies, even when the plea of the needy is just."
ISA	32	8	Isaiah	#01		22926	" {8} But the noble man makes noble plans, and by noble deeds he stands."
ISA	32	9	Isaiah	#01		22927	" {9} You women who are so complacent, rise up and listen to me; you daughters who feel secure, hear what I have to say!"
ISA	32	10	Isaiah	#01		22928	" {10} In little more than a year you who feel secure will tremble; the grape harvest will fail, and the harvest of fruit will not come."
ISA	32	11	Isaiah	#01		22929	" {11} Tremble, you complacent women; shudder, you daughters who feel secure! Strip off your clothes, put sackcloth around your waists."
ISA	32	12	Isaiah	#01		22930	" {12} Beat your breasts for the pleasant fields, for the fruitful vines {13} and for the land of my people, a land overgrown with thorns and briers-- "

ISA	32	14	Isaiah	#01		22933	" citadel and watchtower will become a wasteland forever, the delight of donkeys, a pasture for flocks, {15} till the Spirit is poured upon us from on high, and the desert becomes a fertile field, and the fertile field seems like a forest."
ISA	32	16	Isaiah	#01		22934	 {16} Justice will dwell in the desert and righteousness live in the fertile field.
ISA	32	17	Isaiah	#01		22935	 {17} The fruit of righteousness will be peace; the effect of righteousness will be quietness and confidence forever.
ISA	32	18	God-FX1	#20		22936	" {18} My people will live in peaceful dwelling places, in secure homes, in undisturbed places of rest."
ISA	32	19	God-FX1	#20		22937	" {19} Though hail flattens the forest and the city is leveled completely, {20} how blessed you will be, sowing your seed by every stream, and letting your cattle and donkeys range free.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
ISA	33	<<	Narr_23: Isaiah	#13		22938	ISAIAH 33
ISA	33	1	Isaiah	#01		22939	" {1} Woe to you, O destroyer, you who have not been destroyed! Woe to you, O traitor, you who have not been betrayed! "
ISA	33	1	Isaiah	#01		22940	" When you stop destroying, you will be destroyed; when you stop betraying, you will be betrayed."
ISA	33	2	Isaiah	#01		22941	" {2} O Lord, be gracious to us; we long for you. Be our strength every morning, our salvation in time of distress."
ISA	33	3	Isaiah	#01		22942	" {3} At the thunder of your voice, the peoples flee; when you rise up, the nations scatter."
ISA	33	4	Isaiah	#01		22943	" {4} Your plunder, O nations, is harvested as by young locusts; like a swarm of locusts men pounce on it."
ISA	33	5	Isaiah	#01		22944	" {5} The Lord is exalted, for he dwells on high; he will fill Zion with justice and righteousness."
ISA	33	6	Isaiah	#01		22945	" {6} He will be the sure foundation for your times, a rich store of salvation and wisdom and knowledge; the fear of the Lord is the key to this treasure."
ISA	33	7	Isaiah	#01		22946	" {7} Look, their brave men cry aloud in the streets; the envoys of peace weep bitterly."
ISA	33	8	Isaiah	#01		22947	" {8} The highways are deserted, no travelers are on the roads. The treaty is broken, its witnesses are despised, no one is respected."
ISA	33	9	Isaiah	#01		22948	" {9} The land mourns and wastes away, Lebanon is ashamed and withers; Sharon is like the Arabah, and Bashan and Carmel drop their leaves."
ISA	33	10	God-FX1	#20		22949	 {10} << Now will I arise.>>
ISA	33	10	Isaiah	#01		22950	 says the Lord.
ISA	33	10	God-FX1	#20		22951	" <<Now will I be exalted; now will I be lifted up. {11} You conceive chaff, you give birth to straw; your breath is a fire that consumes you."
ISA	33	12	God-FX1	#20		22952	" {12} The peoples will be burned as if to lime; like cut thornbushes they will be set ablaze.>> {13} You who are far away, hear what I have done; you who are near, acknowledge my power!"
ISA	33	14	Isaiah	#01		22953	 {14} The sinners in Zion are terrified; trembling grips the godless: << Who of us can dwell with the consuming fire? Who of us can dwell with everlasting burning?>>
ISA	33	15	Isaiah	#01		22954	" {15} He who walks righteously and speaks what is right, who rejects gain from extortion and keeps his hand from accepting bribes, who stops his ears against plots of murder and shuts his eyes against contemplating evil--"
ISA	33	16	Isaiah	#01		22955	" {16} this is the man who will dwell on the heights, whose refuge will be the mountain fortress. His bread will be supplied, and water will not fail him."
ISA	33	17	Isaiah	#01		22956	 {17} Your eyes will see the king in his beauty and view a land that stretches afar.
ISA	33	18	Isaiah	#01		22957	 {18} In your thoughts you will ponder the former terror: << Where is that chief officer? Where is the one who took the revenue? Where is the officer in charge of the towers?>>
ISA	33	19	Isaiah	#01		22958	" {19} You will see those arrogant people no more, those people of an obscure speech, with their strange, incomprehensible tongue."
ISA	33	20	Isaiah	#01		22959	" {20} Look upon Zion, the city of our festivals; your eyes will see Jerusalem, a peaceful abode, a tent that will not be moved; its stakes will never be pulled up, nor any of its ropes broken."
ISA	33	21	Isaiah	#01		22960	" {21} There the Lord will be our Mighty One. It will be like a place of broad rivers and streams. No galley with oars will ride them, no mighty ship will sail them."
ISA	33	22	Isaiah	#01		22961	" {22} For the Lord is our judge, the Lord is our lawgiver, the Lord is our king; it is he who will save us."
ISA	33	23	Isaiah	#01		22962	" {23} Your rigging hangs loose: The mast is not held secure, the sail is not spread. Then an abundance of spoils will be divided and even the lame will carry off plunder."
ISA	33	24	Isaiah	#01		22963	" {24} No one living in Zion will say, << I am ill<<; and the sins of those who dwell there will be forgiven.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
ISA	34	<<	Narr_23: Isaiah	#13		22964	ISAIAH 34
ISA	34	1	Isaiah	#01		22965	" {1} Come near, you nations, and listen; pay attention, you peoples! Let the earth hear, and all that is in it, the world, and all that comes out of it!"
ISA	34	2	Isaiah	#01		22966	" {2} The Lord is angry with all nations; his wrath is upon all their armies. He will totally destroy them, he will give them over to slaughter."
ISA	34	3	Isaiah	#01		22967	" {3} Their slain will be thrown out, their dead bodies will send up a stench; the mountains will be soaked with their blood."
ISA	34	4	Isaiah	#01		22968	" {4} All the stars of the heavens will be dissolved and the sky rolled up like a scroll; all the starry host will fall like withered leaves from the vine, like shriveled figs from the fig tree."
ISA	34	5	Isaiah	#01		22969	" {5} My sword has drunk its fill in the heavens; see, it descends in judgment on Edom, the people I have totally destroyed."
ISA	34	6	Isaiah	#01		22970	" {6} The sword of the Lord is bathed in blood, it is covered with fat-- the blood of lambs and goats, fat from the kidneys of rams. "
ISA	34	6	Isaiah	#01		22971	 For the Lord has a sacrifice in Bozrah and a great slaughter in Edom.
ISA	34	7	Isaiah	#01		22972	" {7} And the wild oxen will fall with them, the bull calves and the great bulls. Their land will be drenched with blood, and the dust will be soaked with fat."
ISA	34	8	Isaiah	#01		22973	" {8} For the Lord has a day of vengeance, a year of retribution, to uphold Zion's cause."
ISA	34	9	Isaiah	#01		22974	" {9} Edom's streams will be turned into pitch, her dust into burning sulfur; her land will become blazing pitch!"
ISA	34	10	Isaiah	#01		22975	 {10} It will not be quenched night and day; its smoke will rise forever. From generation to generation it will lie desolate; no one will ever pass through it again.
ISA	34	11	Isaiah	#01		22976	 {11} The desert owl and screech owl will possess it; the great owl and the raven will nest there. God will stretch out over Edom the measuring line of chaos and the plumb line of desolation.
ISA	34	12	Isaiah	#01		22977	" {12} Her nobles will have nothing there to be called a kingdom, all her princes will vanish away."
ISA	34	13	Isaiah	#01		22978	" {13} Thorns will overrun her citadels, nettles and brambles her strongholds. She will become a haunt for jackals, a home for owls."
ISA	34	14	Isaiah	#01		22979	" {14} Desert creatures will meet with hyenas, and wild goats will bleat to each other; there the night creatures will also repose and find for themselves places of rest."
ISA	34	15	Isaiah	#01		22980	" {15} The owl will nest there and lay eggs, she will hatch them, and care for her young under the shadow of her wings; there also the falcons will gather, each with its mate."
ISA	34	16	Isaiah	#01		22981	" {16} Look in the scroll of the Lord and read: None of these will be missing, not one will lack her mate. For it is his mouth that has given the order, and his Spirit will gather them together."
ISA	34	17	Isaiah	#01		22982	 {17} He allots their portions; his hand distributes them by measure. They will possess it forever and dwell there from generation to generation.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
ISA	35	<<	Narr_23: Isaiah	#13		22983	ISAIAH 35
ISA	35	1	Isaiah	#01		22984	" {1} The desert and the parched land will be glad; the wilderness will rejoice and blossom. Like the crocus,"
ISA	35	2	Isaiah	#01		22985	 {2} it will burst into bloom; it will rejoice greatly and shout for joy. 
ISA	35	2	Isaiah	#01		22986	" The glory of Lebanon will be given to it, the splendor of Carmel and Sharon; they will see the glory of the Lord, the splendor of our God."
ISA	35	3	Isaiah	#01		22987	" {3} Strengthen the feeble hands, steady the knees that give way; {4} say to those with fearful hearts,"
ISA	35	4	Man	#09		22988	" << Be strong, do not fear; your God will come, he will come with vengeance; with divine retribution he will come to save you.>>"
ISA	35	5	Isaiah	#01		22989	 {5} Then will the eyes of the blind be opened and the ears of the deaf unstopped.
ISA	35	6	Isaiah	#01		22990	" {6} Then will the lame leap like a deer, and the mute tongue shout for joy. Water will gush forth in the wilderness and streams in the desert."
ISA	35	7	Isaiah	#01		22991	" {7} The burning sand will become a pool, the thirsty ground bubbling springs. In the haunts where jackals once lay, grass and reeds and papyrus will grow."
ISA	35	8	Isaiah	#01		22992	 {8} And a highway will be there; it will be called the Way of Holiness. The unclean will not journey on it; it will be for those who walk in that Way; wicked fools will not go about on it.
ISA	35	9	Isaiah	#01		22993	" {9} No lion will be there, nor will any ferocious beast get up on it; they will not be found there. But only the redeemed will walk there, {10} and the ransomed of the Lord will return. "
ISA	35	10	Isaiah	#01		22994	" They will enter Zion with singing; everlasting joy will crown their heads. Gladness and joy will overtake them, and sorrow and sighing will flee away.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
ISA	36	<<	Narr_23: Isaiah	#13		22995	ISAIAH 36
ISA	36	1	Narr_23: Isaiah	#13		22996	" {1} In the fourteenth year of King Hezekiah's reign, Sennacherib king of Assyria attacked all the fortified cities of Judah and captured them."
ISA	36	2	Narr_23: Isaiah	#13		22997	 {2} Then the king of Assyria sent his field commander with a large army from Lachish to King Hezekiah at Jerusalem. 
ISA	36	2	Narr_23: Isaiah	#13		22998	" When the commander stopped at the aqueduct of the Upper Pool, on the road to the Washerman's Field,"
ISA	36	3	Narr_23: Isaiah	#13		22999	" {3} Eliakim son of Hilkiah the palace administrator, Shebna the secretary, and Joah son of Asaph the recorder went out to him. {4} The field commander said to them,"
ISA	36	4	Commander	#08		23000	" << Tell Hezekiah, << 'This is what the great king, the king of Assyria, says: On what are you basing this confidence of yours?"
ISA	36	5	Commander	#08		23001	" {5} You say you have strategy and military strength--but you speak only empty words. On whom are you depending, that you rebel against me?"
ISA	36	6	Commander	#08		23002	" {6} Look now, you are depending on Egypt, that splintered reed of a staff, which pierces a man's hand and wounds him if he leans on it! "
ISA	36	6	Commander	#08		23003	 Such is Pharaoh king of Egypt to all who depend on him.
ISA	36	7	Commander	#08		23004	" {7} And if you say to me, << We are depending on the Lord our God>> --isn't he the one whose high places and altars Hezekiah removed, saying to Judah and Jerusalem, << You must worship before this altar>>?"
ISA	36	8	Commander	#08		23005	" {8} << 'Come now, make a bargain with my master, the king of Assyria: I will give you two thousand horses--if you can put riders on them!"
ISA	36	9	Commander	#08		23006	" {9} How then can you repulse one officer of the least of my master's officials, even though you are depending on Egypt for chariots and horsemen?"
ISA	36	10	Commander	#08		23007	" {10} Furthermore, have I come to attack and destroy this land without the Lord? "
ISA	36	10	Commander	#08		23008	 The Lord himself told me to march against this country and destroy it.'>>
ISA	36	11	Narr_23: Isaiah	#13		23009	" {11} Then Eliakim, Shebna and Joah said to the field commander,"
ISA	36	11	Eliakim	#15		23010	" << Please speak to your servants in Aramaic, since we understand it. "
ISA	36	11	Eliakim	#15		23011	 Don't speak to us in Hebrew in the hearing of the people on the wall.>>
ISA	36	12	Narr_23: Isaiah	#13		23012	" {12} But the commander replied,"
ISA	36	12	Commander	#08		23013	" << Was it only to your master and you that my master sent me to say these things, and not to the men sitting on the wall--who, like you, will have to eat their own filth and drink their own urine?>>"
ISA	36	13	Narr_23: Isaiah	#13		23014	" {13} Then the commander stood and called out in Hebrew,"
ISA	36	13	Commander	#08		23015	" << Hear the words of the great king, the king of Assyria!"
ISA	36	14	Commander	#08		23016	 {14} This is what the king says: Do not let Hezekiah deceive you. He cannot deliver you!
ISA	36	15	Commander	#08		23017	" {15} Do not let Hezekiah persuade you to trust in the Lord when he says, 'The Lord will surely deliver us; this city will not be given into the hand of the king of Assyria.'"
ISA	36	16	Commander	#08		23018	 {16} << Do not listen to Hezekiah. This is what the king of Assyria says: Make peace with me and come out to me. 
ISA	36	16	Commander	#08		23019	" Then every one of you will eat from his own vine and fig tree and drink water from his own cistern,"
ISA	36	17	Commander	#08		23020	" {17} until I come and take you to a land like your own--a land of grain and new wine, a land of bread and vineyards."
ISA	36	18	Commander	#08		23021	" {18} << Do not let Hezekiah mislead you when he says, 'The Lord will deliver us.' "
ISA	36	18	Commander	#08		23022	 Has the god of any nation ever delivered his land from the hand of the king of Assyria?
ISA	36	19	Commander	#08		23023	 {19} Where are the gods of Hamath and Arpad? Where are the gods of Sepharvaim? Have they rescued Samaria from my hand?
ISA	36	20	Commander	#08		23024	 {20} Who of all the gods of these countries has been able to save his land from me? 
ISA	36	20	Commander	#08		23025	 How then can the Lord deliver Jerusalem from my hand?>>
ISA	36	21	Narr_23: Isaiah	#13		23026	" {21} But the people remained silent and said nothing in reply, because the king had commanded,"

ISA	36	22	Narr_23: Isaiah	#13		23028	" {22} Then Eliakim son of Hilkiah the palace administrator, Shebna the secretary, and Joah son of Asaph the recorder went to Hezekiah, with their clothes torn, and told him what the field commander had said.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"

ISA	37	12	Commander	#08		23043	" {12} Did the gods of the nations that were destroyed by my forefathers deliver them--the gods of Gozan, Haran, Rezeph and the people of Eden who were in Tel Assar?"

ISA	37	14	Narr_23: Isaiah	#13		23045	 {14} Hezekiah received the letter from the messengers and read it. Then he went up to the temple of the Lord and spread it out before the Lord. {15} And Hezekiah prayed to the Lord:

ISA	37	19	King Hezekiah	#10		23050	" {19} They have thrown their gods into the fire and destroyed them, for they were not gods but only wood and stone, fashioned by human hands."
ISA	37	20	King Hezekiah	#10		23051	" {20} Now, O Lord our God, deliver us from his hand, so that all kingdoms on earth may know that you alone, O Lord, are God.>>"
ISA	37	21	Narr_23: Isaiah	#13		23052	 {21} Then Isaiah son of Amoz sent a message to Hezekiah:
ISA	37	21	Isaiah	#01		23053	" << This is what the Lord, the God of Israel, says: "
ISA	37	21	Isaiah	#01		23054	" Because you have prayed to me concerning Sennacherib king of Assyria, {22} this is the word the Lord has spoken against him: "
ISA	37	22	Isaiah	#01		23055	 << The Virgin Daughter of Zion despises and mocks you. The Daughter of Jerusalem tosses her head as you flee.
ISA	37	23	Isaiah	#01		23056	 {23} Who is it you have insulted and blasphemed? Against whom have you raised your voice and lifted your eyes in pride? Against the Holy One of Israel!
ISA	37	24	Isaiah	#01		23057	" {24} By your messengers you have heaped insults on the Lord. And you have said,"
ISA	37	24	Commander	#08		23058	" With my many chariots I have ascended the heights of the mountains, the utmost heights of Lebanon. "
ISA	37	24	Commander	#08		23059	" I have cut down its tallest cedars, the choicest of its pines. I have reached its remotest heights, the finest of its forests."
ISA	37	25	Commander	#08		23060	 {25} I have dug wells in foreign lands and drunk the water there. With the soles of my feet I have dried up all the streams of Egypt.'
ISA	37	26	Isaiah	#01		23061	" {26} << Have you not heard? Long ago I ordained it. In days of old I planned it; now I have brought it to pass, that you have turned fortified cities into piles of stone."
ISA	37	27	Isaiah	#01		23062	" {27} Their people, drained of power, are dismayed and put to shame. "
ISA	37	27	Isaiah	#01		23063	" They are like plants in the field, like tender green shoots, like grass sprouting on the roof, scorched before it grows up."
ISA	37	28	God-FX1	#20		23064	 {28} << But I know where you stay and when you come and go and how you rage against me.
ISA	37	29	God-FX1	#20		23065	" {29} Because you rage against me and because your insolence has reached my ears, I will put my hook in your nose and my bit in your mouth, and I will make you return by the way you came."
ISA	37	30	Isaiah	#01		23066	" {30} << This will be the sign for you, O Hezekiah: << This year you will eat what grows by itself, and the second year what springs from that. "
ISA	37	30	Isaiah	#01		23067	" But in the third year sow and reap, plant vineyards and eat their fruit."
ISA	37	31	Isaiah	#01		23068	 {31} Once more a remnant of the house of Judah will take root below and bear fruit above.
ISA	37	32	Isaiah	#01		23069	" {32} For out of Jerusalem will come a remnant, and out of Mount Zion a band of survivors. The zeal of the Lord Almighty will accomplish this."
ISA	37	33	Isaiah	#01		23070	 {33} << Therefore this is what the Lord says concerning the king of Assyria:
ISA	37	33	God-FX1	#20		23071	 << He will not enter this city or shoot an arrow here. He will not come before it with shield or build a siege ramp against it.
ISA	37	34	God-FX1	#20		23072	" {34} By the way that he came he will return; he will not enter this city, declares the Lord. {35} I will defend this city and save it, for my sake and for the sake of David my servant!>>"
ISA	37	36	Narr_23: Isaiah	#13		23073	 {36} Then the angel of the Lord went out and put to death a hundred and eighty-five thousand men in the Assyrian camp. When the people got up the next morning--there were all the dead bodies!
ISA	37	37	Narr_23: Isaiah	#13		23074	 {37} So Sennacherib king of Assyria broke camp and withdrew. He returned to Nineveh and stayed there.
ISA	37	38	Narr_23: Isaiah	#13		23075	" {38} One day, while he was worshiping in the temple of his god Nisroch, his sons Adrammelech and Sharezer cut him down with the sword, and they escaped to the land of Ararat."
ISA	37	38	Narr_23: Isaiah	#13		23076	 And Esarhaddon his son succeeded him as king.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
ISA	38	<<	Narr_23: Isaiah	#13		23077	ISAIAH 38

ISA	38	17	King Hezekiah	#10		23099	 {17} Surely it was for my benefit that I suffered such anguish. 
ISA	38	17	King Hezekiah	#10		23100	 In your love you kept me from the pit of destruction; you have put all my sins behind your back.
ISA	38	18	King Hezekiah	#10		23101	" {18} For the grave cannot praise you, death cannot sing your praise; those who go down to the pit cannot hope for your faithfulness."

ISA	38	20	King Hezekiah	#10		23103	" {20} The Lord will save me, and we will sing with stringed instruments all the days of our lives in the temple of the Lord."

ISA	40	<<	Narr_23: Isaiah	#13		23127	ISAIAH 40

ISA	40	8	Voice #2-FX1	#18		23140	" {8} The grass withers and the flowers fall, but the word of our God stands forever.>>"
ISA	40	9	Isaiah	#01		23141	" {9} You who bring good tidings to Zion, go up on a high mountain. "

ISA	40	10	Isaiah	#01		23144	" {10} See, the Sovereign Lord comes with power, and his arm rules for him. See, his reward is with him, and his recompense accompanies him."
ISA	40	11	Isaiah	#01		23145	 {11} He tends his flock like a shepherd: He gathers the lambs in his arms and carries them close to his heart; he gently leads those that have young.
ISA	40	12	Isaiah	#01		23146	" {12} Who has measured the waters in the hollow of his hand, or with the breadth of his hand marked off the heavens? "
ISA	40	12	Isaiah	#01		23147	" Who has held the dust of the earth in a basket, or weighed the mountains on the scales and the hills in a balance?"
ISA	40	13	Isaiah	#01		23148	" {13} Who has understood the mind of the Lord, or instructed him as his counselor?"
ISA	40	14	Isaiah	#01		23149	" {14} Whom did the Lord consult to enlighten him, and who taught him the right way? Who was it that taught him knowledge or showed him the path of understanding?"
ISA	40	15	Isaiah	#01		23150	 {15} Surely the nations are like a drop in a bucket; they are regarded as dust on the scales; he weighs the islands as though they were fine dust.
ISA	40	16	Isaiah	#01		23151	" {16} Lebanon is not sufficient for altar fires, nor its animals enough for burnt offerings."
ISA	40	17	Isaiah	#01		23152	 {17} Before him all the nations are as nothing; they are regarded by him as worthless and less than nothing.
ISA	40	18	Isaiah	#01		23153	" {18} To whom, then, will you compare God? What image will you compare him to?"
ISA	40	19	Isaiah	#01		23154	" {19} As for an idol, a craftsman casts it, and a goldsmith overlays it with gold and fashions silver chains for it."
ISA	40	20	Isaiah	#01		23155	 {20} A man too poor to present such an offering selects wood that will not rot. He looks for a skilled craftsman to set up an idol that will not topple.
ISA	40	21	Isaiah	#01		23156	 {21} Do you not know? Have you not heard? Has it not been told you from the beginning? Have you not understood since the earth was founded?
ISA	40	22	Isaiah	#01		23157	" {22} He sits enthroned above the circle of the earth, and its people are like grasshoppers. He stretches out the heavens like a canopy, and spreads them out like a tent to live in."
ISA	40	23	Isaiah	#01		23158	 {23} He brings princes to naught and reduces the rulers of this world to nothing.
ISA	40	24	Isaiah	#01		23159	" {24} No sooner are they planted, no sooner are they sown, no sooner do they take root in the ground, than he blows on them and they wither, and a whirlwind sweeps them away like chaff."
ISA	40	25	Isaiah	#01		23160	" {25} The Holy one says,"
ISA	40	25	God-FX1	#20		23161	 << To whom will you compare me? Or who is my equal?>>
ISA	40	26	Isaiah	#01		23162	" {26} Lift your eyes and look to the heavens: Who created all these? He who brings out the starry host one by one, and calls them each by name. "
ISA	40	26	Isaiah	#01		23163	" Because of his great power and mighty strength, not one of them is missing."
ISA	40	27	Isaiah	#01		23164	" {27} Why do you say, O Jacob and complain O Israel:"
ISA	40	27	Jacob	#09		23165	 << My way is hidden from the Lord? My cause is disregarded by my God?>>
ISA	40	28	Isaiah	#01		23166	" {28} Do you not know? Have you not heard? The Lord is the everlasting God, the Creator of the ends of the earth. He will not grow tired or weary, and his understanding no one can fathom."
ISA	40	29	Isaiah	#01		23167	" {29} He gives strength to the weary and increases the power of the weak. {30} Even youths grow tired and weary, and young men stumble and fall;"
ISA	40	31	Isaiah	#01		23168	" {31} but those who hope in the Lord will renew their strength. They will soar on wings like eagles; they will run and not grow weary, they will walk and not be faint.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
ISA	41	<<	Narr_23: Isaiah	#13		23169	ISAIAH 41

ISA	41	17	God-FX1	#20		23189	" {17} << The poor and needy search for water, but there is none; their tongues are parched with thirst. But I the Lord will answer them; I, the God of Israel, will not forsake them."
ISA	41	18	God-FX1	#20		23190	" {18} I will make rivers flow on barren heights, and springs within the valleys. I will turn the desert into pools of water, and the parched ground into springs."
ISA	41	19	God-FX1	#20		23191	" {19} I will put in the desert the cedar and the acacia, the myrtle and the olive."
ISA	41	19	God-FX1	#20		23192	" I will set pines in the wasteland, the fir and the cypress together, {20} so that people may see and know, may consider and understand, that the hand of the Lord has done this, that the Holy One of Israel has created it."
ISA	41	21	Isaiah	#01		23193	 {21} The Lord says: << Present your case.>> Jacob's King says: << Set forth your arguments
ISA	41	22	Isaiah	#01		23194	" {22} Bring in your idols to tell us what is going to happen. Tell us what the former things were, so that we may consider them and know their final outcome. Or declare to us the things to come."
ISA	41	23	Isaiah	#01		23195	" {23} Tell us what the future holds, so we may know that you are gods. Do something, whether good or bad, so that we will be dismayed and filled with fear."
ISA	41	24	Isaiah	#01		23196	 {24} But you are less than nothing and your works are utterly worthless; he who chooses you is detestable.
ISA	41	25	Isaiah	#01		23197	" {25} << I have stirred up one from the north, and he comes-- one from the rising sun who calls on my name. He treads on rulers as if they were mortar, as if he were a potter treading the clay."
ISA	41	26	Isaiah	#01		23198	" {26} Who told of this from the beginning, so we could know, or beforehand, so we could say, 'He was right'? No one told of this, no one foretold it, no one heard any words from you."
ISA	41	27	Isaiah	#01		23199	" {27} I was the first to tell Zion, 'Look, here they are!' I gave to Jerusalem a messenger of good tidings."
ISA	41	28	Isaiah	#01		23200	" {28} I look but there is no one-- no one among them to give counsel, no one to give answer when I ask them."

ISA	42	20	Isaiah	#01		23223	" {20} You have seen many things, but have paid no attention; your ears are open, but you hear nothing.>>"
ISA	42	21	Isaiah	#01		23224	 {21} It pleased the Lord for the sake of his righteousness to make his law great and glorious.
ISA	42	22	Isaiah	#01		23225	" {22} But this is a people plundered and looted, all of them trapped in pits or hidden away in prisons. "

ISA	42	23	Isaiah	#01		23227	 {23} Which of you will listen to this or pay close attention in time to come?
ISA	42	24	Isaiah	#01		23228	" {24} Who handed Jacob over to become loot, and Israel to the plunderers? Was it not the Lord, against whom we have sinned? For they would not follow his ways; they did not obey his law."
ISA	42	25	Isaiah	#01		23229	" {25} So he poured out on them his burning anger, the violence of war. It enveloped them in flames, yet they did not understand; it consumed them, but they did not take it to heart.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"

ISA	44	<<	Narr_23: Isaiah	#13		23262	ISAIAH 44

ISA	44	9	Isaiah	#01		23272	" {9} All who make idols are nothing, and the things they treasure are worthless. Those who would speak up for them are blind; they are ignorant, to their own shame."
ISA	44	10	Isaiah	#01		23273	" {10} Who shapes a god and casts an idol, which can profit him nothing?"
ISA	44	11	Isaiah	#01		23274	 {11} He and his kind will be put to shame; craftsmen are nothing but men. Let them all come together and take their stand; they will be brought down to terror and infamy.
ISA	44	12	Isaiah	#01		23275	 {12} The blacksmith takes a tool and works with it in the coals; 
ISA	44	12	Isaiah	#01		23276	" he shapes an idol with hammers, he forges it with the might of his arm. He gets hungry and loses his strength; he drinks no water and grows faint."
ISA	44	13	Isaiah	#01		23277	 {13} The carpenter measures with a line and makes an outline with a marker; he roughs it out with chisels and marks it with compasses. 
ISA	44	13	Isaiah	#01		23278	" He shapes it in the form of man, of man in all his glory, that it may dwell in a shrine."
ISA	44	14	Isaiah	#01		23279	" {14} He cut down cedars, or perhaps took a cypress or oak. He let it grow among the trees of the forest, or planted a pine, and the rain made it grow."
ISA	44	15	Isaiah	#01		23280	" {15} It is man's fuel for burning; some of it he takes and warms himself, he kindles a fire and bakes bread. But he also fashions a god and worships it; he makes an idol and bows down to it."
ISA	44	16	Isaiah	#01		23281	" {16} Half of the wood he burns in the fire; over it he prepares his meal, he roasts his meat and eats his fill. He also warms himself and says,"
ISA	44	16	Man	#03		23282	 << Ah! I am warm; I see the fire.>>
ISA	44	17	Isaiah	#01		23283	" {17} From the rest he makes a god, his idol; he bows down to it and worships. He prays to it and says,"
ISA	44	17	Man	#03		23284	 << Save me; you are my god.>>
ISA	44	18	Isaiah	#01		23285	" {18} They know nothing, they understand nothing; their eyes are plastered over so they cannot see, and their minds closed so they cannot understand."
ISA	44	19	Isaiah	#01		23286	" {19} No one stops to think, no one has the knowledge or understanding to say,"
ISA	44	19	Man	#03		23287	" << Half of it I used for fuel; I even baked bread over its coals, I roasted meat and I ate. "
ISA	44	19	Man	#03		23288	 Shall I make a detestable thing from what is left? Shall I bow down to a block of wood?>>
ISA	44	20	Isaiah	#01		23289	" {20} He feeds on ashes, a deluded heart misleads him; he cannot save himself, or say,"
ISA	44	20	Man	#03		23290	 << Is not this thing in my right hand a lie?>>
ISA	44	21	God-FX1	#20		23291	" {21} << Remember these things, O Jacob, for you are my servant, O Israel. I have made you, you are my servant; O Israel, I will not forget you."
ISA	44	22	God-FX1	#20		23292	" {22} I have swept away your offenses like a cloud, your sins like the morning mist. Return to me, for I have redeemed you.>>"
ISA	44	23	Isaiah	#01		23293	" {23} Sing for joy, O heavens, for the Lord has done this; shout aloud, O earth beneath. "

ISA	44	24	God-FX1	#20		23296	" I am the Lord, who has made all things, who alone stretched out the heavens, who spread out the earth by myself,"
ISA	44	25	God-FX1	#20		23297	" {25} who foils the signs of false prophets and makes fools of diviners, who overthrows the learning of the wise and turns it into nonsense,"

ISA	44	27	God-FX1	#20		23299	" {27} who says to the watery deep, 'Be dry, and I will dry up your streams,'"

ISA	45	<<	Narr_23: Isaiah	#13		23301	ISAIAH 45
ISA	45	1	Isaiah	#01		23302	" {1} << This is what the Lord says to his anointed, to Cyrus, whose right hand I take hold of to subdue nations before him and to strip kings of their armor, to open doors before him so that gates will not be shut:"

ISA	45	3	Isaiah	#01		23304	" {3} I will give you the treasures of darkness, riches stored in secret places, so that you may know that I am the Lord, the God of Israel, who summons you by name."
ISA	45	4	Isaiah	#01		23305	" {4} For the sake of Jacob my servant, of Israel my chosen, I summon you by name and bestow on you a title of honor, though you do not acknowledge me."
ISA	45	5	Isaiah	#01		23306	" {5} I am the Lord, and there is no other; apart from me there is no God. "
ISA	45	5	Isaiah	#01		23307	" I will strengthen you, though you have not acknowledged me, {6} so that from the rising of the sun to the place of its setting men may know there is none besides me. "
ISA	45	6	God-FX1	#20		23308	" I am the Lord, and there is no other. {7} I form the light and create darkness, I bring prosperity and create disaster; I, the Lord, do all these things."
ISA	45	8	God-FX1	#20		23309	" {8} << You heavens above, rain down righteousness; let the clouds shower it down. Let the earth open wide, let salvation spring up, let righteousness grow with it; I, the Lord, have created it."
ISA	45	9	Isaiah	#01		23310	" {9} << Woe to him who quarrels with his Maker, to him who is but a potsherd among the potsherds on the the ground. "
ISA	45	9	Isaiah	#01		23311	" Does the clay say to the potter, 'What are you making?' Does your work say, 'He has no hands'?"
ISA	45	10	Isaiah	#01		23312	" {10} Woe to him who says to his father, 'What have you begotten?' or to his mother, 'What have you brought to birth?'"
ISA	45	11	Isaiah	#01		23313	" {11} << This is what the Lord says-- the Holy One of Israel, and its Maker:"
ISA	45	11	God-FX1	#20		23314	" Concerning things to come, do you question me about my children, or give me orders about the work of my hands?"
ISA	45	12	God-FX1	#20		23315	 {12} It is I who made the earth and created mankind upon it. My own hands stretched out the heavens; I marshaled their starry hosts.
ISA	45	13	God-FX1	#20		23316	" {13} I will raise up Cyrus in my righteousness: I will make all his ways straight. He will rebuild my city and set my exiles free, but not for a price or reward,"
ISA	45	13	Isaiah	#01		23317	 says the Lord Almighty.
ISA	45	14	Isaiah	#01		23318	 {14} This is what the Lord says: 
ISA	45	14	God-FX1	#20		23319	" << The products of Egypt and the merchandise of Cush, and those tall Sabeans-- they will come over to you and will be yours; they will trudge behind you, coming over to you in chains. "
ISA	45	14	God-FX1	#20		23320	" They will bow down before you and plead with you, saying,"
ISA	45	14	Nation	#16		23321	" 'Surely God is with you, and there is no other; there is no other god.' >>"
ISA	45	15	Isaiah	#01		23322	" {15} Truly you are a God who hides himself, O God and Savior of Israel. {16} All the makers of idols will be put to shame and disgraced; they will go off into disgrace together."
ISA	45	17	Isaiah	#01		23323	" {17} But Israel will be saved by the Lord with an everlasting salvation; you will never be put to shame or disgraced, to ages everlasting."
ISA	45	18	Isaiah	#01		23324	" {18} For this is what the Lord says-- he who created the heavens, he is God; he who fashioned and made the earth, he founded it; "
ISA	45	18	Isaiah	#01		23325	" he did not create it to be empty, but formed it to be inhabited-- he says:"
ISA	45	18	God-FX1	#20		23326	" << I am the Lord, and there is no other. {19} I have not spoken in secret, from somewhere in a land of darkness; "
ISA	45	19	God-FX1	#20		23327	" I have not said to Jacob's descendants, 'Seek me in vain.' I, the Lord, speak the truth; I declare what is right."
ISA	45	20	Isaiah	#01		23328	" {20} << Gather together and come; assemble, you fugitives from the nations. Ignorant are those who carry about idols of wood, who pray to gods that cannot save."
ISA	45	21	Isaiah	#01		23329	" {21} Declare what is to be, present it-- let them take counsel together. Who foretold this long ago, who declared it from the distant past? "
ISA	45	21	Isaiah	#01		23330	" Was it not I, the Lord? And there is no God apart from me, a righteous God and a Savior; there is none but me."
ISA	45	22	God-FX1	#20		23331	" {22} << Turn to me and be saved, all you ends of the earth; for I am God, and there is no other."
ISA	45	23	God-FX1	#20		23332	" {23} By myself I have sworn, my mouth has uttered in all integrity a word that will not be revoked: Before me every knee will bow; by me every tongue will swear."

ISA	45	24	Man	#17		23334	 ' In the Lord alone are righteousness and strength.'>>

ISA	45	25	God-FX1	#20		23336	 {25} But in the Lord all the descendants of Israel will be found righteous and will exult.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*

ISA	47	7	Isaiah	#01		23360	" But you did not consider these things or reflect on what might happen. {8} << Now then, listen, you wanton creature, lounging in your security and saying to yourself,"

ISA	47	9	Isaiah	#01		23363	" They will come upon you in full measure, in spite of your many sorceries and all your potent spells. {10} You have trusted in your wickedness and have said,"

ISA	47	11	Isaiah	#01		23367	" {11} Disaster will come upon you, and you will not know how to conjure it away."

ISA	47	12	Isaiah	#01		23369	" {12} << Keep on, then, with your magic spells and with your many sorceries, which you have labored at since childhood. Perhaps you will succeed, perhaps you will cause terror."
ISA	47	13	Isaiah	#01		23370	 {13} All the counsel you have received has only worn you out! 
ISA	47	13	Isaiah	#01		23371	" Let your astrologers come forward, those stargazers who make predictions month by month, let them save you from what is coming upon you."
ISA	47	14	Isaiah	#01		23372	 {14} Surely they are like stubble; the fire will burn them up. They cannot even save themselves from the power of the flame. Here are no coals to warm anyone; here is no fire to sit by.
ISA	47	15	Isaiah	#01		23373	 {15} That is all they can do for you-- these you have labored with and trafficked with since childhood. Each of them goes on in his error; there is not one that can save you.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
ISA	48	<<	Narr_23: Isaiah	#13		23374	ISAIAH 48
ISA	48	1	Isaiah	#01		23375	" {1} << Listen to this, O house of Jacob, you who are called by the name of Israel and come from the line of Judah, you who take oaths in the name of the Lord and invoke the God of Israel -- but not in truth or righteousness--"
ISA	48	2	Isaiah	#01		23376	 {2} you who call yourselves citizens of the holy city and rely on the God of Israel -- the Lord Almighty is his name:
ISA	48	3	God-FX1	#20		23377	" {3} I foretold the former things long ago, my mouth announced them and I made them known; then suddenly I acted, and they came to pass."
ISA	48	4	God-FX1	#20		23378	" {4} For I knew how stubborn you were; the sinews of your neck were iron, your forehead was bronze."
ISA	48	5	God-FX1	#20		23379	" {5} Therefore I told you these things long ago; before they happened I announced them to you so that you could not say, 'My idols did them; my wooden image and metal god ordained them.'"

ISA	48	7	God-FX1	#20		23381	" {7} They are created now, and not long ago; you have not heard of them before today. So you cannot say, 'Yes, I knew of them.'"
ISA	48	8	God-FX1	#20		23382	 {8} You have neither heard nor understood; from of old your ear has not been open. Well do I know how treacherous you are; you were called a rebel from birth.
ISA	48	9	God-FX1	#20		23383	" {9} For my own name's sake I delay my wrath; for the sake of my praise I hold it back from you, so as not to cut you off."

ISA	48	11	God-FX1	#20		23385	" {11} For my own sake, for my own sake, I do this. How can I let myself be defamed? I will not yield my glory to another."
ISA	48	12	God-FX1	#20		23386	" {12} << Listen to me, O Jacob, Israel, whom I have called: I am he; I am the first and I am the last."

ISA	48	18	God-FX1	#20		23394	" {18} If only you had paid attention to my commands, your peace would have been like a river, your righteousness like the waves of the sea."
ISA	48	19	God-FX1	#20		23395	" {19} Your descendants would have been like the sand, your children like its numberless grains; their name would never be cut off nor destroyed from before me.>>"

ISA	50	7	Isaiah	#01		23445	" {7} Because the Sovereign Lord helps me, I will not be disgraced. Therefore have I set my face like flint, and I know I will not be put to shame."

ISA	50	10	Isaiah	#01		23448	" {10} Who among you fears the Lord and obeys the word of his servant? Let him who walks in the dark, who has no light, trust in the name of the Lord and rely on his God."

ISA	51	<<	Narr_23: Isaiah	#13		23451	ISAIAH 51
ISA	51	1	Isaiah	#01		23452	" {1} << Listen to me, you who pursue righteousness and who seek the Lord: Look to the rock from which you were cut and to the quarry from which you were hewn;"
ISA	51	2	Isaiah	#01		23453	" {2} look to Abraham, your father, and to Sarah, who gave you birth. When I called him he was but one, and I blessed him and made him many."
ISA	51	3	Isaiah	#01		23454	" {3} The Lord will surely comfort Zion and will look with compassion on all her ruins; he will make her deserts like Eden, her wastelands like the garden of the Lord. "
ISA	51	3	Isaiah	#01		23455	" Joy and gladness will be found in her, thanksgiving and the sound of singing."
ISA	51	4	God-FX1	#20		23456	" {4} << Listen to me, my people; hear me, my nation: The law will go out from me; my justice will become a light to the nations."
ISA	51	5	God-FX1	#20		23457	" {5} My righteousness draws near speedily, my salvation is on the way, and my arm will bring justice to the nations. The islands will look to me and wait in hope for my arm."
ISA	51	6	God-FX1	#20		23458	" {6} Lift up your eyes to the heavens, look at the earth beneath; the heavens will vanish like smoke, the earth will wear out like a garment and its inhabitants die like flies. "
ISA	51	6	God-FX1	#20		23459	" But my salvation will last forever, my righteousness will never fail."
ISA	51	7	God-FX1	#20		23460	" {7} << Hear me, you who know what is right, you people who have my law in your hearts: Do not fear the reproach of men or be terrified by their insults."
ISA	51	8	God-FX1	#20		23461	" {8} For the moth will eat them up like a garment; the worm will devour them like wool. But my righteousness will last forever, my salvation through all generations.>>"
ISA	51	9	Isaiah	#01		23462	" {9} Awake, awake! Clothe yourself with strength, O arm of the Lord; awake, as in days gone by, as in generations of old. "
ISA	51	9	Isaiah	#01		23463	" Was it not you who cut Rahab to pieces, who pierced that monster through?"
ISA	51	10	Isaiah	#01		23464	" {10} Was it not you who dried up the sea, the waters of the great deep, who made a road in the depths of the sea so that the redeemed might cross over?"
ISA	51	11	Isaiah	#01		23465	 {11} The ransomed of the Lord will return. They will enter Zion with singing; everlasting joy will crown their heads. 
ISA	51	11	Isaiah	#01		23466	" Gladness and joy will overtake them, and sorrow and sighing will flee away."
ISA	51	12	God-FX1	#20		23467	" {12} << I, even I, am he who comforts you. Who are you that you fear mortal men, the sons of men, who are but grass,"
ISA	51	13	God-FX1	#20		23468	" {13} that you forget the Lord your Maker, who stretched out the heavens and laid the foundations of the earth, that you live in constant terror every day because of the wrath of the oppressor, who is bent on destruction? "
ISA	51	13	God-FX1	#20		23469	" For where is the wrath of the oppressor? {14} The cowering prisoners will soon be set free; they will not die in their dungeon, nor will they lack bread."
ISA	51	15	God-FX1	#20		23470	" {15} For I am the Lord your God, who churns up the sea so that its waves roar-- the Lord Almighty is his name."
ISA	51	16	God-FX1	#20		23471	" {16} I have put my words in your mouth and covered you with the shadow of my hand-- I who set the heavens in place, who laid the foundations of the earth, and who say to Zion, 'You are my people.'>>"
ISA	51	17	Isaiah	#01		23472	" {17} Awake, awake! Rise up, O Jerusalem, you who have drunk from the hand of the Lord the cup of his wrath, you who have drained to its dregs the goblet that makes men stagger."
ISA	51	18	Isaiah	#01		23473	 {18} Of all the sons she bore there was none to guide her; of all the sons she reared there was none to take her by the hand.
ISA	51	19	Isaiah	#01		23474	" {19} These double calamities have come upon you-- who can comfort you?-- ruin and destruction, famine and sword-- who can console you?"
ISA	51	20	Isaiah	#01		23475	" {20} Your sons have fainted; they lie at the head of every street, like antelope caught in a net. They are filled with the wrath of the Lord and the rebuke of your God."
ISA	51	21	Isaiah	#01		23476	" {21} Therefore hear this, you afflicted one, made drunk, but not with wine. {22} This is what your Sovereign Lord says, your God, who defends his people:"
ISA	51	22	God-FX1	#20		23477	" << See, I have taken out of your hand the cup that made you stagger; from that cup, the goblet of my wrath, you will never drink again."
ISA	51	23	God-FX1	#20		23478	" {23} I will put it into the hands of your tormentors, who said to you, 'Fall prostrate that we may walk over you.' And you made your back like the ground, like a street to be walked over.>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"

ISA	53	<<	Narr_23: Isaiah	#13		23494	ISAIAH 53
ISA	53	1	Isaiah	#01		23495	 {1} Who has believed our message and to whom has the arm of the Lord been revealed?
ISA	53	2	Isaiah	#01		23496	" {2} He grew up before him like a tender shoot, and like a root out of dry ground. He had no beauty or majesty to attract us to him, nothing in his appearance that we should desire him."
ISA	53	3	Isaiah	#01		23497	" {3} He was despised and rejected by men, a man of sorrows, and familiar with suffering. Like one from whom men hide their faces he was despised, and we esteemed him not."
ISA	53	4	Isaiah	#01		23498	" {4} Surely he took up our infirmities and carried our sorrows, yet we considered him stricken by God, smitten by him, and afflicted."
ISA	53	5	Isaiah	#01		23499	" {5} But he was pierced for our transgressions, he was crushed for our iniquities; the punishment that brought us peace was upon him, and by his wounds we are healed."
ISA	53	6	Isaiah	#01		23500	" {6} We all, like sheep, have gone astray, each of us has turned to his own way; and the Lord has laid on him the iniquity of us all."
ISA	53	7	Isaiah	#01		23501	" {7} He was oppressed and afflicted, yet he did not open his mouth; he was led like a lamb to the slaughter, and as a sheep before her shearers is silent, so he did not open his mouth."
ISA	53	8	Isaiah	#01		23502	 {8} By oppression and judgment he was taken away. And who can speak of his descendants? For he was cut off from the land of the living; for the transgression of my people he was stricken.
ISA	53	9	Isaiah	#01		23503	" {9} He was assigned a grave with the wicked, and with the rich in his death, though he had done no violence, nor was any deceit in his mouth."
ISA	53	10	Isaiah	#01		23504	" {10} Yet it was the Lord's will to crush him and cause him to suffer, and though the Lord makes his life a guilt offering, he will see his offspring and prolong his days, and the will of the Lord will prosper in his hand."
ISA	53	11	Isaiah	#01		23505	" {11} After the suffering of his soul, he will see the light of life and be satisfied; by his knowledge my righteous servant will justify many, and he will bear their iniquities."
ISA	53	12	Isaiah	#01		23506	" {12} Therefore I will give him a portion among the great, and he will divide the spoils with the strong, because he poured out his life unto death, and was numbered with the transgressors. "

ISA	57	10	Isaiah	#01		23578	" {10} You were wearied by all your ways, but you would not say, 'It is hopeless.' You found renewal of your strength, and so you did not faint."

ISA	57	16	God-FX1	#20		23586	" {16} I will not accuse forever, nor will I always be angry, for then the spirit of man would grow faint before me-- the breath of man that I have created."

ISA	58	<<	Narr_23: Isaiah	#13		23592	ISAIAH 58
ISA	58	1	God-FX1	#20		23593	" {1} << Shout it aloud, do not hold back. Raise your voice like a trumpet. Declare to my people their rebellion and to the house of Jacob their sins."
ISA	58	2	God-FX1	#20		23594	" {2} For day after day they seek me out; they seem eager to know my ways, as if they were a nation that does what is right and has not forsaken the commands of its God. "
ISA	58	2	God-FX1	#20		23595	" They ask me for just decisions and seem eager for God to come near them. They say,"
ISA	58	3	Man	#14		23596	" {3} ' Why have we fasted,' they say, 'and you have not seen it? Why have we humbled ourselves, and you have not noticed?'"
ISA	58	3	Isaiah	#01		23597	" << Yet on the day of your fasting, you do as you please and exploit all your workers."
ISA	58	4	Isaiah	#01		23598	" {4} Your fasting ends in quarreling and strife, and in striking each other with wicked fists. You cannot fast as you do today and expect your voice to be heard on high."
ISA	58	5	Isaiah	#01		23599	" {5} Is this the kind of fast I have chosen, only a day for a man to humble himself? Is it only for bowing one's head like a reed and for lying on sackcloth and ashes? "
ISA	58	5	Isaiah	#01		23600	" Is that what you call a fast, a day acceptable to the Lord?"
ISA	58	6	Isaiah	#01		23601	" {6} << Is not this the kind of fasting I have chosen: to loose the chains of injustice and untie the cords of the yoke, to set the oppressed free and break every yoke?"
ISA	58	7	Isaiah	#01		23602	" {7} Is it not to share your food with the hungry and to provide the poor wanderer with shelter-- when you see the naked, to clothe him, and not to turn away from your own flesh and blood?"
ISA	58	8	Isaiah	#01		23603	" {8} Then your light will break forth like the dawn, and your healing will quickly appear; then your righteousness will go before you, and the glory of the Lord will be your rear guard."
ISA	58	9	Isaiah	#01		23604	" {9} Then you will call, and the Lord will answer; you will cry for help, and he will say: Here am I. << If you do away with the yoke of oppression, with the pointing finger and malicious talk,"
ISA	58	10	Isaiah	#01		23605	" {10} and if you spend yourselves in behalf of the hungry and satisfy the needs of the oppressed, then your light will rise in the darkness, and your night will become like the noonday."
ISA	58	11	Isaiah	#01		23606	" {11} The Lord will guide you always; he will satisfy your needs in a sun-scorched land and will strengthen your frame. You will be like a well-watered garden, like a spring whose waters never fail."
ISA	58	12	Isaiah	#01		23607	" {12} Your people will rebuild the ancient ruins and will raise up the age-old foundations; you will be called Repairer of Broken Walls, Restorer of Streets with Dwellings."
ISA	58	13	Isaiah	#01		23608	" {13} << If you keep your feet from breaking the Sabbath and from doing as you please on my holy day, if you call the Sabbath a delight and the Lord's holy day honorable, "
ISA	58	13	Isaiah	#01		23609	" and if you honor it by not going your own way and not doing as you please or speaking idle words,"
ISA	58	14	Isaiah	#01		23610	" {14} then you will find your joy in the Lord, and I will cause you to ride on the heights of the land and to feast on the inheritance of your father Jacob.>> "
ISA	58	14	Isaiah	#01		23611	 The mouth of the Lord has spoken.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
ISA	59	<<	Narr_23: Isaiah	#13		23612	ISAIAH 59
ISA	59	1	Isaiah	#01		23613	" {1} Surely the arm of the Lord is not too short to save, nor his ear too dull to hear."
ISA	59	2	Isaiah	#01		23614	" {2} But your iniquities have separated you from your God; your sins have hidden his face from you, so that he will not hear."
ISA	59	3	Isaiah	#01		23615	" {3} For your hands are stained with blood, your fingers with guilt. Your lips have spoken lies, and your tongue mutters wicked things."
ISA	59	4	Isaiah	#01		23616	 {4} No one calls for justice; no one pleads his case with integrity. They rely on empty arguments and speak lies; they conceive trouble and give birth to evil.
ISA	59	5	Isaiah	#01		23617	" {5} They hatch the eggs of vipers and spin a spider's web. Whoever eats their eggs will die, and when one is broken, an adder is hatched."
ISA	59	6	Isaiah	#01		23618	" {6} Their cobwebs are useless for clothing; they cannot cover themselves with what they make. Their deeds are evil deeds, and acts of violence are in their hands."
ISA	59	7	Isaiah	#01		23619	 {7} Their feet rush into sin; they are swift to shed innocent blood. Their thoughts are evil thoughts; ruin and destruction mark their ways.
ISA	59	8	Isaiah	#01		23620	 {8} The way of peace they do not know; there is no justice in their paths. They have turned them into crooked roads; no one who walks in them will know peace.
ISA	59	9	Isaiah	#01		23621	" {9} So justice is far from us, and righteousness does not reach us. We look for light, but all is darkness; for brightness, but we walk in deep shadows."
ISA	59	10	Isaiah	#01		23622	" {10} Like the blind we grope along the wall, feeling our way like men without eyes. At midday we stumble as if it were twilight; among the strong, we are like the dead."
ISA	59	11	Isaiah	#01		23623	" {11} We all growl like bears; we moan mournfully like doves. We look for justice, but find none; for deliverance, but it is far away."
ISA	59	12	Isaiah	#01		23624	" {12} For our offenses are many in your sight, and our sins testify against us. Our offenses are ever with us, and we acknowledge our iniquities:"
ISA	59	13	Isaiah	#01		23625	" {13} rebellion and treachery against the Lord, turning our backs on our God, fomenting oppression and revolt, uttering lies our hearts have conceived."
ISA	59	14	Isaiah	#01		23626	" {14} So justice is driven back, and righteousness stands at a distance; truth has stumbled in the streets, honesty cannot enter."
ISA	59	15	Isaiah	#01		23627	" {15} Truth is nowhere to be found, and whoever shuns evil becomes a prey. The Lord looked and was displeased that there was no justice."
ISA	59	16	Isaiah	#01		23628	" {16} He saw that there was no one, he was appalled that there was no one to intervene; so his own arm worked salvation for him, and his own righteousness sustained him."
ISA	59	17	Isaiah	#01		23629	" {17} He put on righteousness as his breastplate, and the helmet of salvation on his head; he put on the garments of vengeance and wrapped himself in zeal as in a cloak."
ISA	59	18	Isaiah	#01		23630	" {18} According to what they have done, so will he repay wrath to his enemies and retribution to his foes; he will repay the islands their due."
ISA	59	19	Isaiah	#01		23631	" {19} From the west, men will fear the name of the Lord, and from the rising of the sun, they will revere his glory. For he will come like a pent-up flood that the breath of the Lord drives along."
ISA	59	20	Isaiah	#01		23632	" {20} << The Redeemer will come to Zion, to those in Jacob who repent of their sins,>>"
ISA	59	21	God-FX1	#20		23633	" {21} << As for me, this is my covenant with them,>>"
ISA	59	21	Isaiah	#01		23634	 says the Lord.
ISA	59	21	God-FX1	#20		23635	" << My Spirit, who is on you, and my words that I have put in your mouth will not depart from your mouth, or from the mouths of your children, or from the mouths of their descendants from this time on and forever.>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
ISA	60	<<	Narr_23: Isaiah	#13		23636	ISAIAH 60
ISA	60	1	Isaiah	#01		23637	" {1} << Arise, shine, for your light has come, and the glory of the Lord rises upon you."
ISA	60	2	Isaiah	#01		23638	" {2} See, darkness covers the earth and thick darkness is over the peoples, but the Lord rises upon you and his glory appears over you."
ISA	60	3	Isaiah	#01		23639	" {3} Nations will come to your light, and kings to the brightness of your dawn."
ISA	60	4	Isaiah	#01		23640	" {4} << Lift up your eyes and look about you: All assemble and come to you; your sons come from afar, and your daughters are carried on the arm."
ISA	60	5	Isaiah	#01		23641	" {5} Then you will look and be radiant, your heart will throb and swell with joy; the wealth on the seas will be brought to you, to you the riches of the nations will come."
ISA	60	6	Isaiah	#01		23642	" {6} Herds of camels will cover your land, young camels of Midian and Ephah. And all from Sheba will come, bearing gold and incense and proclaiming the praise of the Lord."
ISA	60	7	Isaiah	#01		23643	" {7} All Kedar's flocks will be gathered to you, the rams of Nebaioth will serve you; they will be accepted as offerings on my altar, and I will adorn my glorious temple."

ISA	60	11	Isaiah	#01		23647	" {11} Your gates will always stand open, they will never be shut, day or night, so that men may bring you the wealth of the nations-- their kings led in triumphal procession."

ISA	60	13	Isaiah	#01		23649	" {13} << The glory of Lebanon will come to you, the pine, the fir and the cypress together, to adorn the place of my sanctuary; and I will glorify the place of my feet."
ISA	60	14	Isaiah	#01		23650	" {14} The sons of your oppressors will come bowing before you; all who despise you will bow down at your feet and will call you the City of the Lord, Zion of the Holy One of Israel."
ISA	60	15	Isaiah	#01		23651	" {15} << Although you have been forsaken and hated, with no one traveling through, I will make you the everlasting pride and the joy of all generations."
ISA	60	16	Isaiah	#01		23652	" {16} You will drink the milk of nations and be nursed at royal breasts. Then you will know that I, the Lord, am your Savior, your Redeemer, the Mighty One of Jacob."
ISA	60	17	Isaiah	#01		23653	" {17} Instead of bronze I will bring you gold, and silver in place of iron. "
ISA	60	17	Isaiah	#01		23654	" Instead of wood I will bring you bronze, and iron in place of stones. I will make peace your governor and righteousness your ruler."
ISA	60	18	Isaiah	#01		23655	" {18} No longer will violence be heard in your land, nor ruin or destruction within your borders, but you will call your walls Salvation and your gates Praise."
ISA	60	19	Isaiah	#01		23656	" {19} The sun will no more be your light by day, nor will the brightness of the moon shine on you, for the Lord will be your everlasting light, and your God will be your glory."
ISA	60	20	Isaiah	#01		23657	" {20} Your sun will never set again, and your moon will wane no more; the Lord will be your everlasting light, and your days of sorrow will end."
ISA	60	21	Isaiah	#01		23658	" {21} Then will all your people be righteous and they will possess the land forever. They are the shoot I have planted, the work of my hands, for the display of my splendor."
ISA	60	22	God-FX1	#20		23659	" {22} The least of you will become a thousand, the smallest a mighty nation. I am the Lord; in its time I will do this swiftly.>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"

ISA	63	15	Isaiah	#01		23712	" {15} Look down from heaven and see from your lofty throne, holy and glorious. Where are your zeal and your might? Your tenderness and compassion are withheld from us."

ISA	63	17	Isaiah	#01		23714	" {17} Why, O Lord, do you make us wander from your ways and harden our hearts so we do not revere you? Return for the sake of your servants, the tribes that are your inheritance."
