JER	13	13	God-FX1	#20		24192	" I am going to fill with drunkenness all who live in this land, including the kings who sit on David's throne, the priests, the prophets and all those living in Jerusalem."
JER	13	14	God-FX1	#20		24193	" {14} I will smash them one against the other, fathers and sons alike, declares the Lord. I will allow no pity or mercy or compassion to keep me from destroying them."
JER	13	15	Jeremiah	#09		24194	" {15} Hear and pay attention, do not be arrogant, for the Lord has spoken."
JER	13	16	Jeremiah	#09		24195	" {16} Give glory to the Lord your God before he brings the darkness, before your feet stumble on the darkening hills. "
JER	13	16	Jeremiah	#09		24196	" You hope for light, but he will turn it to thick darkness and change it to deep gloom."
JER	13	17	Jeremiah	#09		24197	" {17} But if you do not listen, I will weep in secret because of your pride; my eyes will weep bitterly, overflowing with tears, because the Lord's flock will be taken captive."
JER	13	18	Jeremiah	#09		24198	" {18} Say to the king and to the queen mother, << Come down from your thrones, for your glorious crowns will fall from your heads.>>"
JER	13	19	Jeremiah	#09		24199	" {19} The cities in the Negev will be shut up, and there will be no one to open them. All Judah will be carried into exile, carried completely away."
JER	13	20	Jeremiah	#09		24200	" {20} Lift up your eyes and see those who are coming from the north. Where is the flock that was entrusted to you, the sheep of which you boasted?"
JER	13	21	Jeremiah	#09		24201	 {21} What will you say when the Lord sets over you those you cultivated as your special allies? Will not pain grip you like that of a woman in labor?
JER	13	22	Jeremiah	#09		24202	" {22} And if you ask yourself, << Why has this happened to me?>>-- it is because of your many sins that your skirts have been torn off and your body mistreated."
JER	13	23	Jeremiah	#09		24203	 {23} Can the Ethiopian change his skin or the leopard its spots? Neither can you do good who are accustomed to doing evil.
JER	13	24	God-FX1	#20		24204	" {24} << I will scatter you like chaff driven by the desert wind. {25} This is your lot, the portion I have decreed for you, because you have forgotten me and trusted in false gods."
JER	13	26	God-FX1	#20		24205	" {26} I will pull up your skirts over your face that your shame may be seen-- {27} your adulteries and lustful neighings, your shameless prostitution! "
JER	13	27	God-FX1	#20		24206	" I have seen your detestable acts on the hills and in the fields. Woe to you, O Jerusalem! How long will you be unclean?>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
JER	14	<<	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24207	JEREMIAH 14
JER	14	1	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24208	 {1} This is the word of the Lord to Jeremiah concerning the drought:
JER	14	2	Jeremiah	#09		24209	" {2} << Judah mourns, her cities languish; they wail for the land, and a cry goes up from Jerusalem."
JER	14	3	Jeremiah	#09		24210	" {3} The nobles send their servants for water; they go to the cisterns but find no water. They return with their jars unfilled; dismayed and despairing, they cover their heads."
JER	14	4	Jeremiah	#09		24211	 {4} The ground is cracked because there is no rain in the land; the farmers are dismayed and cover their heads.
JER	14	5	Jeremiah	#09		24212	 {5} Even the doe in the field deserts her newborn fawn because there is no grass.
JER	14	6	Jeremiah	#09		24213	 {6} Wild donkeys stand on the barren heights and pant like jackals; their eyesight fails for lack of pasture.>>
JER	14	7	Man	#17		24214	" {7} Although our sins testify against us, O Lord, do something for the sake of your name. "
JER	14	7	Man	#17		24215	 For our backsliding is great; we have sinned against you.
JER	14	8	Man	#17		24216	" {8} O Hope of Israel, its Savior in times of distress, why are you like a stranger in the land, like a traveler who stays only a night?"
JER	14	9	Man	#17		24217	" {9} Why are you like a man taken by surprise, like a warrior powerless to save? "
JER	14	9	Man	#17		24218	" You are among us, O Lord, and we bear your name; do not forsake us!"
JER	14	10	Jeremiah	#09		24219	 {10} This is what the Lord says about this people:
JER	14	10	God-FX1	#20		24220	 << They greatly love to wander; they do not restrain their feet. So the Lord does not accept them; he will now remember their wickedness and punish them for their sins.>>
JER	14	11	Jeremiah	#09		24221	" {11} Then the Lord said to me,"
JER	14	11	God-FX1	#20		24222	 << Do not pray for the well-being of this people.
JER	14	12	God-FX1	#20		24223	" {12} Although they fast, I will not listen to their cry; though they offer burnt offerings and grain offerings, I will not accept them. Instead, I will destroy them with the sword, famine and plague.>>"
JER	14	13	Jeremiah	#09		24224	" {13} But I said, << Ah, Sovereign Lord, the prophets keep telling them, 'You will not see the sword or suffer famine. Indeed, I will give you lasting peace in this place.'"
JER	14	14	Jeremiah	#09		24225	" {14} << Then the Lord said to me,"
JER	14	14	God-FX1	#20		24226	 << The prophets are prophesying lies in my name. I have not sent them or appointed them or spoken to them. 
JER	14	14	God-FX1	#20		24227	" They are prophesying to you false visions, divinations, idolatries and the delusions of their own minds."
JER	14	15	Jeremiah	#09		24228	" {15} Therefore, this is what the Lord says about the prophets who are prophesying in my name: "
JER	14	15	Jeremiah	#09		24229	" I did not send them, yet they are saying, 'No sword or famine will touch this land.' Those same prophets will perish by sword and famine."
JER	14	16	Jeremiah	#09		24230	 {16} And the people they are prophesying to will be thrown out into the streets of Jerusalem because of the famine and sword. 
JER	14	16	Jeremiah	#09		24231	" There will be no one to bury them or their wives, their sons or their daughters. I will pour out on them the calamity they deserve."
JER	14	17	Jeremiah	#09		24232	" {17} << Speak this word to them: 'Let my eyes overflow with tears night and day without ceasing; for my virgin daughter--my people-- has suffered a grievous wound, a crushing blow."
JER	14	18	Jeremiah	#09		24233	" {18} If I go into the country, I see those slain by the sword; if I go into the city, I see the ravages of famine. Both prophet and priest have gone to a land they know not.'>>"
JER	14	19	Man #1	#03		24234	 {19} Have you rejected Judah completely? Do you despise Zion? 
JER	14	19	Man #1	#03		24235	 Why have you afflicted us so that we cannot be healed? 
JER	14	19	Man #1	#03		24236	" We hoped for peace but no good has come, for a time of healing but there is only terror."
JER	14	20	Man #2	#11		24237	" {20} O Lord, we acknowledge our wickedness and the guilt of our fathers; we have indeed sinned against you."
JER	14	21	Man #2	#11		24238	 {21} For the sake of your name do not despise us; do not dishonor your glorious throne.
JER	14	21	Man #2	#11		24239	 Remember your covenant with us and do not break it.
JER	14	22	Man #2	#11		24240	 {22} Do any of the worthless idols of the nations bring rain? 
JER	14	22	Man #2	#11		24241	 Do the skies themselves send down showers? 
JER	14	22	Man #2	#11		24242	" No, it is you, O Lord our God. "
JER	14	22	Man #2	#11		24243	" Therefore our hope is in you, for you are the one who does all this.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
JER	15	<<	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24244	JEREMIAH 15
JER	15	1	Jeremiah	#09		24245	 {1} Then the Lord said to me:
JER	15	1	God-FX1	#20		24246	" << Even if Moses and Samuel were to stand before me, my heart would not go out to this people. Send them away from my presence! Let them go!"
JER	15	2	God-FX1	#20		24247	" {2} And if they ask you, 'Where shall we go?' tell them, 'This is what the Lord says: 'Those destined for death, to death; those for the sword, to the sword; those for starvation, to starvation; those for captivity, to captivity.'"
JER	15	3	Jeremiah	#09		24248	" {3} << I will send four kinds of destroyers against them, the sword to kill and the dogs to drag away and the birds of the air and the beasts of the earth to devour and destroy."
JER	15	4	Jeremiah	#09		24249	 {4} I will make them abhorrent to all the kingdoms of the earth because of what Manasseh son of Hezekiah king of Judah did in Jerusalem.
JER	15	5	Jeremiah	#09		24250	" {5} << Who will have pity on you, O Jerusalem? Who will mourn for you? Who will stop to ask how you are?"
JER	15	6	Jeremiah	#09		24251	 {6} You have rejected me. You keep on backsliding. So I will lay hands on you and destroy you; I can no longer show compassion.
JER	15	7	Jeremiah	#09		24252	" {7} I will winnow them with a winnowing fork at the city gates of the land. I will bring bereavement and destruction on my people, for they have not changed their ways."
JER	15	8	Jeremiah	#09		24253	 {8} I will make their widows more numerous than the sand of the sea. 
JER	15	8	Jeremiah	#09		24254	 At midday I will bring a destroyer against the mothers of their young men; suddenly I will bring down on them anguish and terror.
JER	15	9	Jeremiah	#09		24255	 {9} The mother of seven will grow faint and breathe her last. Her sun will set while it is still day; she will be disgraced and humiliated. 
JER	15	9	Jeremiah	#09		24256	" I will put the survivors to the sword before their enemies,>>"
JER	15	10	Jeremiah	#09		24257	" {10} Alas, my mother, that you gave me birth, a man with whom the whole land strives and contends! I have neither lent nor borrowed, yet everyone curses me. {11} The Lord said,"
JER	15	11	God-FX1	#20		24258	 << Surely I will deliver you for a good purpose; surely I will make your enemies plead with you in times of disaster and times of distress.
JER	15	12	God-FX1	#20		24259	" {12} << Can a man break iron-- iron from the north--or bronze? {13} Your wealth and your treasures I will give as plunder, without charge, because of all your sins throughout your country."
JER	15	14	God-FX1	#20		24260	" {14} I will enslave you to your enemies in a land you do not know, for my anger will kindle a fire that will burn against you.>>"
JER	15	15	Jeremiah	#09		24261	" {15} You understand, O Lord; remember me and care for me. Avenge me on my persecutors. You are long-suffering--do not take me away; think of how I suffer reproach for your sake."
JER	15	16	Jeremiah	#09		24262	" {16} When your words came, I ate them; they were my joy and my heart's delight, for I bear your name, O Lord God Almighty."
JER	15	17	Jeremiah	#09		24263	" {17} I never sat in the company of revelers, never made merry with them; I sat alone because your hand was on me and you had filled me with indignation."
JER	15	18	Jeremiah	#09		24264	" {18} Why is my pain unending and my wound grievous and incurable? Will you be to me like a deceptive brook, like a spring that fails? {19} Therefore this is what the Lord says:"
JER	15	19	God-FX1	#20		24265	" << If you repent, I will restore you that you may serve me; if you utter worthy, not worthless, words, you will be my spokesman. Let this people turn to you, but you must not turn to them."
JER	15	20	God-FX1	#20		24266	" {20} I will make you a wall to this people, a fortified wall of bronze; they will fight against you but will not overcome you, for I am with you to rescue and save you, >>"
JER	15	20	Jeremiah	#09		24267	 declares the Lord.
JER	15	21	God-FX1	#20		24268	 {21} << I will save you from the hands of the wicked and redeem you from the grasp of the cruel. >>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
JER	16	<<	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24269	JEREMIAH 16
JER	16	1	Jeremiah	#09		24270	 {1} Then the word of the Lord came to me:
JER	16	2	God-FX1	#20		24271	 {2} << You must not marry and have sons or daughters in this place.>>
JER	16	3	Jeremiah	#09		24272	 {3} For this is what the Lord says about the sons and daughters born in this land and about the women who are their mothers and the men who are their fathers:
JER	16	4	Jeremiah	#09		24273	 {4} >>They will die of deadly diseases. They will not be mourned or buried but will be like refuse lying on the ground. 
JER	16	4	Jeremiah	#09		24274	" They will perish by sword and famine, and their dead bodies will become food for the birds of the air and the beasts of the earth. For this is what the Lord says:"
JER	16	5	God-FX1	#20		24275	" {5} << Do not enter a house where there is a funeral meal; do not go to mourn or show sympathy, because I have withdrawn my blessing, my love and my pity from this people,>>"
JER	16	6	Jeremiah	#09		24276	" {6} Both high and low will die in this land. They will not be buried or mourned, and no one will cut himself or shave his head for them."
JER	16	7	Jeremiah	#09		24277	 {7} No one will offer food to comfort those who mourn for the dead--not even for a father or a mother--nor will anyone give them a drink to console them.
JER	16	8	Jeremiah	#09		24278	 {8} << And do not enter a house where there is feasting and sit down to eat and drink.
JER	16	9	God-FX1	#20		24279	 {9} Before your eyes and in your days I will bring an end to the sounds of joy and gladness and to the voices of bride and bridegroom in this place. <<
JER	16	10	God-FX1	#20		24280	" {10} When you tell these people all this and they ask you, 'Why has the Lord decreed such a great disaster against us? What wrong have we done? What sin have we committed against the Lord our God?'"
JER	16	11	God-FX1	#20		24281	" {11} then say to them,"
JER	16	11	Jeremiah	#09		24282	" It is because your fathers forsook me, and followed other gods and served and worshiped them. They forsook me and did not keep my law."
JER	16	12	Jeremiah	#09		24283	 {12} But you have behaved more wickedly than your fathers. See how each of you is following the stubbornness of his evil heart instead of obeying me.
JER	16	13	Jeremiah	#09		24284	" {13} So I will throw you out of this land into a land neither you nor your fathers have known, and there you will serve other gods day and night, for I will show you no favor.'"
JER	16	14	Jeremiah	#09		24285	" {14} << However, the days are coming,>> declares the Lord, << when men will no longer say, 'As surely as the Lord lives, who brought the Israelites up out of Egypt,'"
JER	16	15	Jeremiah	#09		24286	" {15} but they will say, 'As surely as the Lord lives, who brought the Israelites up out of the land of the north and out of all the countries where he had banished them.'"
JER	16	15	God-FX1	#20		24287	 For I will restore them to the land I gave their forefathers.
JER	16	16	God-FX1	#20		24288	" {16} << But now I will send for many fishermen, and they will catch them. "
JER	16	16	God-FX1	#20		24289	" After that I will send for many hunters, and they will hunt them down on every mountain and hill and from the crevices of the rocks."
JER	16	17	God-FX1	#20		24290	" {17} My eyes are on all their ways; they are not hidden from me, nor is their sin concealed from my eyes."
JER	16	18	God-FX1	#20		24291	" {18} I will repay them double for their wickedness and their sin, because they have defiled my land with the lifeless forms of their vile images and have filled my inheritance with their detestable idols.>>"
JER	16	19	Jeremiah	#09		24292	" {19} O Lord, my strength and my fortress, my refuge in time of distress, to you the nations will come from the ends of the earth and say,"
JER	16	19	Nation	#16		24293	" << Our fathers possessed nothing but false gods, worthless idols that did them no good."
JER	16	20	Nation	#16		24294	" {20} Do men make their own gods? Yes, but they are not gods!>>"
JER	16	21	God-FX1	#20		24295	 {21} << Therefore I will teach them-- this time I will teach them my power and might. Then they will know that my name is the Lord*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
JER	17	<<	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24296	JEREMIAH 17
JER	17	1	Jeremiah	#09		24297	" {1} <<Judah's sin is engraved with an iron tool, inscribed with a flint point, on the tablets of their hearts and on the horns of their altars."
JER	17	2	Jeremiah	#09		24298	 {2} Even their children remember their altars and Asherah poles beside the spreading trees and on the high hills.
JER	17	3	God-FX1	#20		24299	" {3} My mountain in the land and your wealth and all your treasures I will give away as plunder, together with your high places, because of sin throughout your country."
JER	17	4	God-FX1	#20		24300	" {4} Through your own fault you will lose the inheritance I gave you. I will enslave you to your enemies in a land you do not know, for you have kindled my anger, and it will burn forever.>>"
JER	17	5	Jeremiah	#09		24301	" {5} This is what the Lord says: << Cursed is the one who trusts in man, who depends on flesh for his strength and whose heart turns away from the Lord."
JER	17	6	Jeremiah	#09		24302	" {6} He will be like a bush in the wastelands; he will not see prosperity when it comes. He will dwell in the parched places of the desert, in a salt land where no one lives."
JER	17	7	Jeremiah	#09		24303	" {7} << But blessed is the man who trusts in the Lord, whose confidence is in him."
JER	17	8	Jeremiah	#09		24304	 {8} He will be like a tree planted by the water that sends out its roots by the stream.
JER	17	8	Jeremiah	#09		24305	 It does not fear when heat comes; its leaves are always green. It has no worries in a year of drought and never fails to bear fruit.
JER	17	9	Voice	#05		24306	 {9} The heart is deceitful above all things and beyond cure. Who can understand it?
JER	17	10	God-FX1	#20		24307	" {10} << I the Lord search the heart and examine the mind, to reward a man according to his conduct, according to what his deeds deserve.>>"
JER	17	11	Jeremiah	#09		24308	" {11} Like a partridge that hatches eggs it did not lay is the man who gains riches by unjust means. When his life is half gone, they will desert him, and in the end he will prove to be a fool."
JER	17	12	Jeremiah	#09		24309	" {12} A glorious throne, exalted from the beginning, is the place of our sanctuary."
JER	17	13	Jeremiah	#09		24310	" {13} O Lord, the hope of Israel, all who forsake you will be put to shame. Those who turn away from you will be written in the dust because they have forsaken the Lord, the spring of living water."
JER	17	14	Jeremiah	#09		24311	" {14} Heal me, O Lord, and I will be healed; save me and I will be saved, for you are the one I praise. {15} They keep saying to me,"
JER	17	15	Man	#06		24312	 << Where is the word of the Lord? Let it now be fulfilled!>>
JER	17	16	Jeremiah	#09		24313	 {16} I have not run away from being your shepherd; you know I have not desired the day of despair. What passes my lips is open before you.
JER	17	17	Jeremiah	#09		24314	 {17} Do not be a terror to me; you are my refuge in the day of disaster.
JER	17	18	Jeremiah	#09		24315	" {18} Let my persecutors be put to shame, but keep me from shame; let them be terrified, but keep me from terror. Bring on them the day of disaster; destroy them with double destruction."
JER	17	19	Jeremiah	#09		24316	 {19} This is what the Lord said to me:
JER	17	19	God-FX1	#20		24317	" << Go and stand at the gate of the people, through which the kings of Judah go in and out; stand also at all the other gates of Jerusalem."
JER	17	20	God-FX1	#20		24318	" {20} Say to them, 'Hear the word of the Lord, O kings of Judah and all people of Judah and everyone living in Jerusalem who come through these gates."
JER	17	21	Jeremiah	#09		24319	 {21} This is what the Lord says: Be careful not to carry a load on the Sabbath day or bring it through the gates of Jerusalem.
JER	17	22	Jeremiah	#09		24320	" {22} Do not bring a load out of your houses or do any work on the Sabbath, but keep the Sabbath day holy, as I commanded your forefathers."
JER	17	23	Jeremiah	#09		24321	 {23} Yet they did not listen or pay attention; they were stiff-necked and would not listen or respond to discipline.
JER	17	24	Jeremiah	#09		24322	" {24} But if you are careful to obey me, declares the Lord, and bring no load through the gates of this city on the Sabbath, but keep the Sabbath day holy by not doing any work on it,"
JER	17	25	Jeremiah	#09		24323	 {25} then kings who sit on David's throne will come through the gates of this city with their officials. 
JER	17	25	Jeremiah	#09		24324	" They and their officials will come riding in chariots and on horses, accompanied by the men of Judah and those living in Jerusalem, and this city will be inhabited forever."
JER	17	26	Jeremiah	#09		24325	" {26} People will come from the towns of Judah and the villages around Jerusalem, from the territory of Benjamin and the western foothills, "
JER	17	26	Jeremiah	#09		24326	" from the hill country and the Negev, bringing burnt offerings and sacrifices, grain offerings, incense and thank offerings to the house of the Lord."
JER	17	27	Jeremiah	#09		24327	" {27} But if you do not obey me to keep the Sabbath day holy by not carrying any load as you come through the gates of Jerusalem on the Sabbath day, "
JER	17	27	Jeremiah	#09		24328	 then I will kindle an unquenchable fire in the gates of Jerusalem that will consume her fortresses.'>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
JER	18	<<	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24329	JEREMIAH 18
JER	18	1	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24330	 {1} This is the word that came to Jeremiah from the Lord:
JER	18	2	God-FX1	#20		24331	" {2} << Go down to the potter's house, and there I will give you my message.>>"
JER	18	3	Jeremiah	#09		24332	" {3} So I went down to the potter's house, and I saw him working at the wheel."
JER	18	4	Jeremiah	#09		24333	" {4} But the pot he was shaping from the clay was marred in his hands; so the potter formed it into another pot, shaping it as seemed best to him. {5} Then the word of the Lord came to me:"
JER	18	6	God-FX1	#20		24334	" {6} <<O house of Israel, can I not do with you as this potter does?>> << Like clay in the hand of the potter, so are you in my hand, O house of Israel."
JER	18	7	God-FX1	#20		24335	" {7} If at any time I announce that a nation or kingdom is to be uprooted, torn down and destroyed,"
JER	18	8	God-FX1	#20		24336	" {8} and if that nation I warned repents of its evil, then I will relent and not inflict on it the disaster I had planned."
JER	18	9	God-FX1	#20		24337	" {9} And if at another time I announce that a nation or kingdom is to be built up and planted,"
JER	18	10	God-FX1	#20		24338	" {10} and if it does evil in my sight and does not obey me, then I will reconsider the good I had intended to do for it."
JER	18	11	God-FX1	#20		24339	" {11} << Now therefore say to the people of Judah and those living in Jerusalem,"
JER	18	11	Jeremiah	#09		24340	" ' This is what the Lord says: Look! I am preparing a disaster for you and devising a plan against you. So turn from your evil ways, each one of you, and reform your ways and your actions.'"
JER	18	12	Jeremiah	#09		24341	" {12} But they will reply, 'It's no use. We will continue with our own plans; each of us will follow the stubbornness of his evil heart."
JER	18	13	Jeremiah	#09		24342	 {13} Therefore this is what the Lord says: << Inquire among the nations: Who has ever heard anything like this? A most horrible thing has been done by Virgin Israel
JER	18	14	Jeremiah	#09		24343	 {14} Does the snow of Lebanon ever vanish from its rocky slopes? Do its cool waters from distant sources ever cease to flow?
JER	18	15	Jeremiah	#09		24344	" {15} Yet my people have forgotten me; they burn incense to worthless idols, which made them stumble in their ways and in the ancient paths. They made them walk in bypaths and on roads not built up."
JER	18	16	Jeremiah	#09		24345	" {16} Their land will be laid waste, an object of lasting scorn; all who pass by will be appalled and will shake their heads."
JER	18	17	Jeremiah	#09		24346	" {17} Like a wind from the east, I will scatter them before their enemies; I will show them my back and not my face in the day of their disaster.>>"
JER	18	18	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24347	" {18} They said,"
JER	18	18	Man	#12		24348	" << Come, let's make plans against Jeremiah; "
JER	18	18	Man	#12		24349	" for the teaching of the law by the priest will not be lost, nor will counsel from the wise, nor the word from the prophets. "
JER	18	18	Man	#12		24350	" So come, let's attack him with our tongues and pay no attention to anything he says.>>"
JER	18	19	Jeremiah	#09		24351	" {19} Listen to me, O Lord; hear what my accusers are saying!"
JER	18	20	Jeremiah	#09		24352	 {20} Should good be repaid with evil? Yet they have dug a pit for me. Remember that I stood before you and spoke in their behalf to turn your wrath away from them.
JER	18	21	Jeremiah	#09		24353	 {21} So give their children over to famine; hand them over to the power of the sword.
JER	18	21	Jeremiah	#09		24354	" Let their wives be made childless and widows; let their men be put to death, their young men slain by the sword in battle."
JER	18	22	Jeremiah	#09		24355	" {22} Let a cry be heard from their houses when you suddenly bring invaders against them, for they have dug a pit to capture me and have hidden snares for my feet."
JER	18	23	Jeremiah	#09		24356	" {23} But you know, O Lord, all their plots to kill me. Do not forgive their crimes or blot out their sins from your sight. "
JER	18	23	Jeremiah	#09		24357	 Let them be overthrown before you; deal with them in the time of your anger.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*

JER	19	3	Jeremiah	#09		24363	 Listen! I am going to bring a disaster on this place that will make the ears of everyone who hears of it tingle.
JER	19	4	Jeremiah	#09		24364	 {4} For they have forsaken me and made this a place of foreign gods; 
JER	19	4	Jeremiah	#09		24365	" they have burned sacrifices in it to gods that neither they nor their fathers nor the kings of Judah ever knew, and they have filled this place with the blood of the innocent."
JER	19	5	Jeremiah	#09		24366	" {5} They have built the high places of Baal to burn their sons in the fire as offerings to Baal --something I did not command or mention, nor did it enter my mind."
JER	19	6	Jeremiah	#09		24367	" {6} So beware, the days are coming, declares the Lord, when people will no longer call this place Topheth or the Valley of Ben Hinnom, but the Valley of Slaughter."
JER	19	7	Jeremiah	#09		24368	 {7} << 'In this place I will ruin the plans of Judah and Jerusalem. 
JER	19	7	Jeremiah	#09		24369	" I will make them fall by the sword before their enemies, at the hands of those who seek their lives, and I will give their carcasses as food to the birds of the air and the beasts of the earth."
JER	19	8	Jeremiah	#09		24370	 {8} I will devastate this city and make it an object of scorn; all who pass by will be appalled and will scoff because of all its wounds.
JER	19	9	Jeremiah	#09		24371	" {9} I will make them eat the flesh of their sons and daughters, and they will eat one another's flesh during the stress of the siege imposed on them by the enemies who seek their lives.'"
JER	19	10	God-FX1	#20		24372	" {10} <<Then break the jar while those who go with you are watching, {11} and say to them,"

JER	19	11	Jeremiah	#09		24374	 They will bury the dead in Topheth until there is no more room.
JER	19	12	Jeremiah	#09		24375	" {12} This is what I will do to this place and to those who live here, declares the Lord. I will make this city like Topheth."
JER	19	13	Jeremiah	#09		24376	" {13} The houses in Jerusalem and those of the kings of Judah will be defiled like this place, Topheth --all the houses where they burned incense on the roofs to all the starry hosts and poured out drink offerings to other gods.'>>"
