JER	20	<<	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24380	JEREMIAH 20
JER	20	1	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24381	" {1} When the priest Pashhur son of Immer, the chief officer in the temple of the Lord, heard Jeremiah prophesying these things,"
JER	20	2	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24382	 {2} he had Jeremiah the prophet beaten and put in the stocks at the Upper Gate of Benjamin at the Lord's temple.
JER	20	3	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24383	" {3} The next day, when Pashhur released him from the stocks, Jeremiah said to him,"
JER	20	3	Jeremiah	#09		24384	" << The Lord's name for you is not Pashhur, but Magor-Missabib. {4} For this is what the Lord says:"
JER	20	4	Jeremiah	#09		24385	 'I will make you a terror to yourself and to all your friends; with your own eyes you will see them fall by the sword of their enemies.
JER	20	4	Jeremiah	#09		24386	" I will hand all Judah over to the king of Babylon, who will carry them away to Babylon or put them to the sword."
JER	20	5	Jeremiah	#09		24387	" {5} I will hand over to their enemies all the wealth of this city--all its products, all its valuables and all the treasures of the kings of Judah. "
JER	20	5	Jeremiah	#09		24388	 They will take it away as plunder and carry it off to Babylon.
JER	20	6	Jeremiah	#09		24389	" {6} And you, Pashhur, and all who live in your house will go into exile to Babylon. There you will die and be buried, you and all your friends to whom you have prophesied lies.'"
JER	20	7	Jeremiah	#09		24390	" {7} << O Lord, you deceived me, and I was deceived; you overpowered me and prevailed. I am ridiculed all day long; everyone mocks me."
JER	20	8	Jeremiah	#09		24391	" {8} Whenever I speak, I cry out proclaiming violence and destruction. So the word of the Lord has brought me insult and reproach all day long."
JER	20	9	Jeremiah	#09		24392	" {9} But if I say, << I will not mention him or speak any more in his name,>> his word is in my heart like a fire, a fire shut up in my bones. I am weary of holding it in; indeed, I cannot."
JER	20	10	Jeremiah	#09		24393	" {10} I hear many whispering, Terror on every side! Report him! Let's report him! All my friends are waiting for me to slip, saying,"
JER	20	10	Friend (bad)	#04		24394	 << Perhaps he will be deceived; then we will prevail over him and take our revenge on him.>>
JER	20	11	Jeremiah	#09		24395	 {11} But the Lord is with me like a mighty warrior; so my persecutors will stumble and not prevail. They will fail and be thoroughly disgraced; their dishonor will never be forgotten.
JER	20	12	Jeremiah	#09		24396	" {12} O Lord Almighty, you who examine the righteous and probe the heart and mind, let me see your vengeance upon them, for to you I have committed my cause."
JER	20	13	Jeremiah	#09		24397	 {13} Sing to the Lord! Give praise to the Lord! He rescues the life of the needy from the hands of the wicked.
JER	20	14	Jeremiah	#09		24398	" {14} Cursed be the day I was born! May the day my mother bore me not be blessed! {15} Cursed be the man who brought my father the news, who made him very glad, saying,"
JER	20	15	Man	#03		24399	 << A child is born to you--a son!>>
JER	20	16	Jeremiah	#09		24400	" {16} May that man be like the towns the Lord overthrew without pity. May he hear wailing in the morning, a battle cry at noon."
JER	20	17	Jeremiah	#09		24401	" {17} For he did not kill me in the womb, with my mother as my grave, her womb enlarged forever."
JER	20	18	Jeremiah	#09		24402	 {18} Why did I ever come out of the womb to see trouble and sorrow and to end my days in shame?*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
JER	21	<<	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24403	JEREMIAH 21
JER	21	1	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24404	 {1} The word came to Jeremiah from the Lord when King Zedekiah sent to him Pashhur son of Malkijah and the priest Zephaniah son of Maaseiah. They said:
JER	21	2	Pashhur	#14		24405	 {2} << Inquire now of the Lord for us because Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon is attacking us.
JER	21	2	Pashhur	#14		24406	 Perhaps the Lord will perform wonders for us as in times past so that he will withdraw from us.>>
JER	21	3	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24407	" {3} But Jeremiah answered them,"
JER	21	4	Jeremiah	#09		24408	" {4} << Tell Zedekiah, 'This is what the Lord, the God of Israel, says: "
JER	21	4	Jeremiah	#09		24409	" I am about to turn against you the weapons of war that are in your hands, which you are using to fight the king of Babylon and the Babylonians who are outside the wall besieging you. "
JER	21	4	Jeremiah	#09		24410	 And I will gather them inside this city. {5} I myself will fight against you with an outstretched hand and a mighty arm in anger and fury and great wrath.
JER	21	6	Jeremiah	#09		24411	 {6} I will strike down those who live in this city--both men and animals--and they will die of a terrible plague.
JER	21	7	Jeremiah	#09		24412	" {7} After that, declares the Lord, I will hand over Zedekiah king of Judah, his officials and the people in this city who survive the plague, sword and famine, "
JER	21	7	Jeremiah	#09		24413	 to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon and to their enemies who seek their lives. He will put them to the sword; he will show them no mercy or pity or compassion.'
JER	21	8	Jeremiah	#09		24414	" {8} << Furthermore, tell the people, 'This is what the Lord says: See, I am setting before you the way of life and the way of death."
JER	21	9	Jeremiah	#09		24415	" {9} Whoever stays in this city will die by the sword, famine or plague. But whoever goes out and surrenders to the Babylonians who are besieging you will live; he will escape with his life."
JER	21	10	Jeremiah	#09		24416	" {10} I have determined to do this city harm and not good, declares the Lord. It will be given into the hands of the king of Babylon, and he will destroy it with fire.'"
JER	21	11	Jeremiah	#09		24417	" {11} << Moreover, say to the royal house of Judah, 'Hear the word of the Lord;"
JER	21	12	God-FX1	#20		24418	 {12} << 'Administer justice every morning; 
JER	21	12	God-FX1	#20		24419	" rescue from the hand of his oppressor the one who has been robbed, or my wrath will break out and burn like fire because of the evil you have done-- burn with no one to quench it."
JER	21	13	God-FX1	#20		24420	" {13} I am against you, Jerusalem, you who live above this valley on the rocky plateau,"
JER	21	13	Jeremiah	#09		24421	 declares the Lord--
JER	21	13	God-FX1	#20		24422	" you who say, << Who can come against us? Who can enter our refuge?>>"
JER	21	14	Jeremiah	#09		24423	" {14} I will punish you as your deeds deserve, declares the Lord. I will kindle a fire in your forests that will consume everything around you.'*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
JER	22	<<	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24424	JEREMIAH 22
JER	22	1	Jeremiah	#09		24425	 {1} This is what the Lord says:
JER	22	1	God-FX1	#20		24426	 << Go down to the palace of the king of Judah and proclaim this message there:
JER	22	2	Jeremiah	#09		24427	" {2} 'Hear the word of the Lord, O king of Judah, you who sit on David's throne--you, your officials and your people who come through these gates."
JER	22	3	Jeremiah	#09		24428	 {3} This is what the Lord says: Do what is just and right. Rescue from the hand of his oppressor the one who has been robbed. 
JER	22	3	Jeremiah	#09		24429	" Do no wrong or violence to the alien, the fatherless or the widow, and do not shed innocent blood in this place."
JER	22	4	Jeremiah	#09		24430	" {4} For if you are careful to carry out these commands, then kings who sit on David's throne will come through the gates of this palace, riding in chariots and on horses, accompanied by their officials and their people."
JER	22	5	Jeremiah	#09		24431	" {5} But if you do not obey these commands, declares the Lord, I swear by myself that this palace will become a ruin.'>> {6} For this is what the Lord says about the palace of the king of Judah:"
JER	22	6	God-FX1	#20		24432	" << Though you are like Gilead to me, like the summit of Lebanon, I will surely make you like a desert, like towns not inhabited."
JER	22	7	God-FX1	#20		24433	" {7} I will send destroyers against you, each man with his weapons, and they will cut up your fine cedar beams and throw them into the fire."
JER	22	8	God-FX1	#20		24434	" {8} << People from many nations will pass by this city and will ask one another, 'Why has the Lord done such a thing to this great city?'"
JER	22	9	God-FX1	#20		24435	 {9} And the answer will be: 'Because they have forsaken the covenant of the Lord their God and have worshiped and served other gods.'>>
JER	22	10	God-FX1	#20		24436	" {10} Do not weep for the dead king or mourn his loss; rather, weep bitterly for him who is exiled, because he will never return nor see his native land again."
JER	22	11	Jeremiah	#09		24437	" {11} For this is what the Lord says about Shallum son of Josiah, who succeeded his father as king of Judah but has gone from this place:"
JER	22	11	God-FX1	#20		24438	 << He will never return. {12} He will die in the place where they have led him captive; he will not see this land again.>>
JER	22	13	God-FX1	#20		24439	" {13} Woe to him who builds his palace by unrighteousness, his upper rooms by injustice, making his countrymen work for nothing, not paying them for their labor."
JER	22	14	God-FX1	#20		24440	" {14} He says, 'I will build myself a great palace with spacious upper rooms.' So he makes large windows in it, panels it with cedar and decorates it in red."
JER	22	15	God-FX1	#20		24441	" {15} << Does it make you a king to have more and more cedar? Did not your father have food and drink? He did what was right and just, so all went well with him."
JER	22	16	God-FX1	#20		24442	" {16} He defended the cause of the poor and needy, and so all went well. Is that not what it means to know me?"
JER	22	16	Jeremiah	#09		24443	 Declares the Lord
JER	22	17	God-FX1	#20		24444	" {17} <<But your eyes and your heart are set only on dishonest gain, on shedding innocent blood and on oppression and extortion.>>"
JER	22	18	Jeremiah	#09		24445	 {18} Therefore this is what the Lord says about Jehoiakim son of Josiah king of Judah:
JER	22	18	God-FX1	#20		24446	" <<They will not mourn for him: 'Alas, my brother! Alas, my sister!' They will not mourn for him: 'Alas, my master! Alas, his splendor!'"
JER	22	19	God-FX1	#20		24447	 {19} He will have the burial of a donkey-- dragged away and thrown outside the gates of Jerusalem.>>
JER	22	20	God-FX1	#20		24448	" {20} << Go up to Lebanon and cry out, let your voice be heard in Bashan, cry out from Abarim, for all your allies are crushed."
JER	22	21	God-FX1	#20		24449	" {21} I warned you when you felt secure, but you said, 'I will not listen!' This has been your way from your youth; you have not obeyed me."
JER	22	22	God-FX1	#20		24450	" {22} The wind will drive all your shepherds away, and your allies will go into exile. Then you will be ashamed and disgraced because of all your wickedness."
JER	22	23	God-FX1	#20		24451	" {23} You who live in 'Lebanon,' who are nestled in cedar buildings, how you will groan when pangs come upon you, pain like that of a woman in labor!"
JER	22	24	Jeremiah	#09		24452	" {24} The Lord declares,"
JER	22	24	God-FX1	#20		24453	" As surely as I live, even if you, Jehoiachin son of Jehoiakim king of Judah, were a signet ring on my right hand, I would still pull you off."
JER	22	25	God-FX1	#20		24454	" {25} I will hand you over to those who seek your life, those you fear--to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon and to the Babylonians."
JER	22	26	God-FX1	#20		24455	" {26} I will hurl you and the mother who gave you birth into another country, where neither of you was born, and there you both will die."
JER	22	27	God-FX1	#20		24456	 {27} You will never come back to the land you long to return to.>>
JER	22	28	God-FX1	#20		24457	" {28} Is this man Jehoiachin a despised, broken pot, an object no one wants? Why will he and his children be hurled out, cast into a land they do not know?"
JER	22	29	God-FX1	#20		24458	" {29} O land, land, land, hear the word of the Lord! "
JER	22	30	Jeremiah	#09		24459	 {30} This is what the Lord says: 
JER	22	30	God-FX1	#20		24460	" << Record this man as if childless, a man who will not prosper in his lifetime, for none of his offspring will prosper, none will sit on the throne of David or rule anymore in Judah.>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
JER	23	<<	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24461	JEREMIAH 23
JER	23	1	Jeremiah	#09		24462	" {1} The Lord declares,"
JER	23	1	God-FX1	#20		24463	 << Woe to the shepherds who are destroying and scattering the sheep of my pasture!>>
JER	23	2	Jeremiah	#09		24464	" {2} Therefore this is what the Lord, the God of Israel says to the shepherds who tend my people:"
JER	23	2	God-FX1	#20		24465	" << Because you have scattered my flock and driven them away and have not bestowed care on them, I will bestow punishment on you for the evil you have done,>>"
JER	23	2	Jeremiah	#09		24466	 declares the Lord.
JER	23	3	God-FX1	#20		24467	" {3} << I myself will gather the remnant of my flock out of all the countries where I have driven them and will bring them back to their pasture, where they will be fruitful and increase in number."
JER	23	4	God-FX1	#20		24468	" {4} I will place shepherds over them who will tend them, and they will no longer be afraid or terrified, nor will any be missing."
JER	23	5	Jeremiah	#09		24469	" {5} The Lord declares,"
JER	23	5	God-FX1	#20		24470	" The days are coming when I will raise up to David a righteous Branch, a King who will reign wisely and do what is just and right in the land."
JER	23	6	God-FX1	#20		24471	 {6} In his days Judah will be saved and Israel will live in safety. This is the name by which he will be called: The Lord Our Righteousness.
JER	23	7	Jeremiah	#09		24472	" {7} The Lord declares,"
JER	23	7	God-FX1	#20		24473	" So then, the days are coming when people will no longer say, 'As surely as the Lord lives, who brought the Israelites up out of Egypt,'"
JER	23	8	God-FX1	#20		24474	" {8} but they will say, 'As surely as the Lord lives, who brought the descendants of Israel up out of the land of the north and out of all the countries where he had banished them.' "
JER	23	8	God-FX1	#20		24475	 Then they will live in their own land.>>
JER	23	9	Jeremiah	#09		24476	" {9} Concerning the prophets: My heart is broken within me; all my bones tremble. I am like a drunken man, like a man overcome by wine, because of the Lord and his holy words."
JER	23	10	Jeremiah	#09		24477	 {10} The land is full of adulterers; because of the curse the land lies parched and the pastures in the desert are withered. The prophets follow an evil course and use their power unjustly.
JER	23	11	God-FX1	#20		24478	" {11} << Both prophet and priest are godless; even in my temple I find their wickedness,>>"
JER	23	11	Jeremiah	#09		24479	 declares the Lord.
JER	23	12	God-FX1	#20		24480	" {12} << Therefore their path will become slippery; they will be banished to darkness and there they will fall. I will bring disaster on them in the year they are punished,"
JER	23	12	Jeremiah	#09		24481	 declares the Lord.
JER	23	13	God-FX1	#20		24482	 {13} Among the prophets of Samaria I saw this repulsive thing: They prophesied by Baal and led my people Israel astray.
JER	23	14	God-FX1	#20		24483	 {14} And among the prophets of Jerusalem. I have seen something horrible: They commit adultery and live a lie. 
JER	23	14	God-FX1	#20		24484	" They strengthen the hands of evildoers, so that no one turns from his wickedness. They are all like Sodom to me; the people of Jerusalem are like Gomorrah.>>"
JER	23	15	Jeremiah	#09		24485	" {15} Therefore, this is what the Lord Almighty says concerning the prophets:"
JER	23	15	God-FX1	#20		24486	" << I will make them eat bitter food and drink poisoned water, because from the prophets of Jerusalem ungodliness has spread throughout the land.>>"
JER	23	16	Jeremiah	#09		24487	 {16} This is what the Lord Almighty says:
JER	23	16	God-FX1	#20		24488	" << Do not listen to what the prophets are prophesying to you; they fill you with false hopes. They speak visions from their own minds, not from the mouth of the Lord."
JER	23	17	God-FX1	#20		24489	" {17} They keep saying to those who despise me, 'The Lord says: You will have peace.' And to all who follow the stubbornness of their hearts they say, 'No harm will come to you.'"
JER	23	18	Jeremiah	#09		24490	 {18} But which of them has stood in the council of the Lord to see or to hear his word? Who has listened and heard his word?
JER	23	19	Jeremiah	#09		24491	" {19} See, the storm of the Lord will burst out in wrath, a whirlwind swirling down on the heads of the wicked."
JER	23	20	Jeremiah	#09		24492	 {20} The anger of the Lord will not turn back until he fully accomplishes the purposes of his heart. In days to come you will understand it clearly.
JER	23	21	God-FX1	#20		24493	" {21} I did not send these prophets, yet they have run with their message; I did not speak to them, yet they have prophesied."
JER	23	22	God-FX1	#20		24494	" {22} But if they had stood in my council, they would have proclaimed my words to my people and would have turned them from their evil ways and from their evil deeds."
JER	23	23	Jeremiah	#09		24495	" {23} The Lord declares,"
JER	23	23	God-FX1	#20		24496	" << Am I only a God nearby, and not a God far away?"
JER	23	24	Jeremiah	#09		24497	" {24} The Lord declares,"
JER	23	24	God-FX1	#20		24498	 <<Can anyone hide in secret places so that I cannot see him? Do not I fill Heaven and earth?>>
JER	23	24	Jeremiah	#09		24499	 declares the Lord.
JER	23	25	God-FX1	#20		24500	" {25} I have heard what the prophets say who prophesy lies in my name. They say, 'I had a dream! I had a dream!'"
JER	23	26	God-FX1	#20		24501	" {26} How long will this continue in the hearts of these lying prophets, who prophesy the delusions of their own minds?"
JER	23	27	God-FX1	#20		24502	" {27} They think the dreams they tell one another will make my people forget my name, just as their fathers forgot my name through Baal worship."
JER	23	28	God-FX1	#20		24503	" {28} Let the prophet who has a dream tell his dream, but let the one who has my word speak it faithfully. For what has straw to do with grain? declares the Lord."
JER	23	29	Jeremiah	#09		24504	" declares the Lord. {29} He says,"
JER	23	29	God-FX1	#20		24505	" Is not my word like fire, and like a hammer that breaks a rock in pieces?"
JER	23	30	Jeremiah	#09		24506	" {30} The Lord declares,"
JER	23	30	God-FX1	#20		24507	" << Therefore, I am against the prophets who steal from one another words supposedly from me."
JER	23	31	Jeremiah	#09		24508	" {31} The Lord declares,"
JER	23	31	God-FX1	#20		24509	" Yes, I am against the prophets who wag their own tongues and yet declare, 'The Lord declares.' {32} Indeed, I am against those who prophesy false dreams"
JER	23	32	Jeremiah	#09		24510	 declares the Lord.
JER	23	32	God-FX1	#20		24511	" They tell them and lead my people astray with their reckless lies, yet I did not send or appoint them. They do not benefit these people in the least,"
JER	23	32	Jeremiah	#09		24512	 declares the Lord.
JER	23	33	God-FX1	#20		24513	" {33} When these people, or a prophet or a priest, ask you, 'What is the oracle of the Lord?' say to them,"
JER	23	33	Jeremiah	#09		24514	" ' What oracle? I will forsake you, declares the Lord.'"
JER	23	34	God-FX1	#20		24515	" {34} If a prophet or a priest or anyone else claims, 'This is the oracle of the Lord,' I will punish that man and his household."
JER	23	35	God-FX1	#20		24516	 {35} This is what each of you keeps on saying to his friend or relative: 'What is the Lord's answer?' or 'What has the Lord spoken?'
JER	23	36	God-FX1	#20		24517	" {36} But you must not mention 'the oracle of the Lord' again, because every man's own word becomes his oracle and so you distort the words of the living God, the Lord Almighty, our God."
JER	23	37	God-FX1	#20		24518	 {37} This is what you keep saying to a prophet: 'What is the Lord's answer to you?' or 'What has the Lord spoken?'
JER	23	38	God-FX1	#20		24519	" {38} Although you claim, 'This is the oracle of the Lord,' this is what the Lord says: "
JER	23	38	God-FX1	#20		24520	" You used the words, 'This is the oracle of the Lord,' even though I told you that you must not claim, 'This is the oracle of the Lord.'"
JER	23	39	God-FX1	#20		24521	" {39} Therefore, I will surely forget you and cast you out of my presence along with the city I gave to you and your fathers."
JER	23	40	God-FX1	#20		24522	 {40} I will bring upon you everlasting disgrace--everlasting shame that will not be forgotten.>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
JER	24	<<	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24523	JEREMIAH 24
JER	24	1	Jeremiah	#09		24524	" {1} After Jehoiachin son of Jehoiakim king of Judah and the officials, the craftsmen and the artisans of Judah were carried into exile from Jerusalem to Babylon by Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, "
JER	24	1	Jeremiah	#09		24525	 the Lord showed me two baskets of figs placed in front of the temple of the Lord.
JER	24	2	Jeremiah	#09		24526	" {2} One basket had very good figs, like those that ripen early; the other basket had very poor figs, so bad they could not be eaten. {3} Then the Lord asked me,"
JER	24	3	God-FX1	#20		24527	" << What do you see, Jeremiah?>>"
JER	24	3	Jeremiah	#09		24528	" << Figs,>> I answered. << The good ones are very good, but the poor ones are so bad they cannot be eaten.>> {4} Then the word of the Lord came to me:"
JER	24	5	God-FX1	#20		24529	" {5} This is what the lord, the God of Israel says: Like these good figs, I regard as good the exiles from Judah, whom I sent away from this place to the land of the Babylonians."
JER	24	6	God-FX1	#20		24530	" {6} My eyes will watch over them for their good, and I will bring them back to this land. I will build them up and not tear them down; I will plant them and not uproot them."
JER	24	7	God-FX1	#20		24531	" {7} I will give them a heart to know me, that I am the Lord. They will be my people, and I will be their God, for they will return to me with all their heart."
JER	24	8	God-FX1	#20		24532	" {8} << 'But like the poor figs, which are so bad they cannot be eaten, so will I deal with Zedekiah king of Judah, his officials and the survivors from Jerusalem, whether they remain in this land or live in Egypt."
JER	24	9	God-FX1	#20		24533	" {9} I will make them abhorrent and an offense to all the kingdoms of the earth, a reproach and a byword, an object of ridicule and cursing, wherever I banish them."
JER	24	10	God-FX1	#20		24534	" {10} I will send the sword, famine and plague against them until they are destroyed from the land I gave to them and their fathers.'>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
JER	25	<<	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24535	JEREMIAH 25
JER	25	1	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24536	" {1} The word came to Jeremiah concerning all the people of Judah in the fourth year of Jehoiakim son of Josiah king of Judah, which was the first year of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon."
JER	25	2	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24537	 {2} So Jeremiah the prophet said to all the people of Judah and to all those living in Jerusalem:
JER	25	3	Jeremiah	#09		24538	" {3} For twenty-three years--from the thirteenth year of Josiah son of Amon king of Judah until this very day--the word of the Lord has come to me and I have spoken to you again and again, but you have not listened."
JER	25	4	Jeremiah	#09		24539	" {4} And though the Lord has sent all his servants the prophets to you again and again, you have not listened or paid any attention. {5} They said,"
JER	25	5	Prophet	#07		24540	" << Turn now, each of you, from your evil ways and your evil practices, and you can stay in the land the Lord gave to you and your fathers for ever and ever."
JER	25	6	Prophet	#07		24541	 {6} Do not follow other gods to serve and worship them; do not provoke me to anger with what your hands have made. Then I will not harm you.>>
JER	25	7	Jeremiah	#09		24542	" {7} The Lord declares,"
JER	25	7	God-FX1	#20		24543	" <<But you did not listen to me, and you have provoked me with what your hands have made, and you have brought harm to yourselves.>>"
JER	25	8	Jeremiah	#09		24544	 {8} Therefore the Lord Almighty says this:
JER	25	8	God-FX1	#20		24545	" << Because you have not listened to my words,"
JER	25	9	Jeremiah	#09		24546	" {9} declares the Lord,"
JER	25	9	God-FX1	#20		24547	" I will summon all the peoples of the north and my servant Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and I will bring them against this land and its inhabitants and against all the surrounding nations. "
JER	25	9	God-FX1	#20		24548	" I will completely destroy them and make them an object of horror and scorn, and an everlasting ruin."
JER	25	10	God-FX1	#20		24549	" {10} I will banish from them the sounds of joy and gladness, the voices of bride and bridegroom, the sound of millstones and the light of the lamp."
JER	25	11	God-FX1	#20		24550	" {11} This whole country will become a desolate wasteland, and these nations will serve the king of Babylon seventy years."
JER	25	12	Jeremiah	#09		24551	" {12} The Lord declares,"
JER	25	12	God-FX1	#20		24552	" << But when the seventy years are fulfilled, I will punish the king of Babylon and his nation, the land of the Babylonians, for their guilt, and will make it desolate forever."
JER	25	13	God-FX1	#20		24553	" {13} I will bring upon that land all the things I have spoken against it, all that are written in this book and prophesied by Jeremiah against all the nations."
JER	25	14	God-FX1	#20		24554	 {14} They themselves will be enslaved by many nations and great kings; I will repay them according to their deeds and the work of their hands.>>
JER	25	15	Jeremiah	#09		24555	" {15} This is what the Lord, the God of Israel, said to me:"
JER	25	15	God-FX1	#20		24556	 << Take from my hand this cup filled with the wine of my wrath and make all the nations to whom I send you drink it.
JER	25	16	God-FX1	#20		24557	" {16} When they drink it, they will stagger and go mad because of the sword I will send among them.>>"
JER	25	17	Jeremiah	#09		24558	 {17} So I took the cup from the Lord's hand and made all the nations to whom he sent me drink it:
JER	25	18	Jeremiah	#09		24559	" {18} Jerusalem and the towns of Judah, its kings and officials, to make them a ruin and an object of horror and scorn and cursing, as they are today;"
JER	25	19	Jeremiah	#09		24560	" {19} Pharaoh king of Egypt, his attendants, his officials and all his people, {20} and all the foreign people there; "
JER	25	20	Jeremiah	#09		24561	" all the kings of Uz; all the kings of the Philistines (those of Ashkelon, Gaza, Ekron, and the people left at Ashdod);"
JER	25	21	Jeremiah	#09		24562	" {21} Edom, Moab and Ammon;"
JER	25	22	Jeremiah	#09		24563	 {22} all the kings of Tyre and Sidon; the kings of the coastlands across the sea;
JER	25	23	Jeremiah	#09		24564	" {23} Dedan, Tema, Buz and all who are in distant places;"
JER	25	24	Jeremiah	#09		24565	 {24} all the kings of Arabia and all the kings of the foreign people who live in the desert;
JER	25	25	Jeremiah	#09		24566	" {25} all the kings of Zimri, Elam and Media;"
JER	25	26	Jeremiah	#09		24567	" {26} and all the kings of the north, near and far, one after the other--all the kingdoms on the face of the earth. And after all of them, the king of Sheshach will drink it too."
JER	25	27	God-FX1	#20		24568	" {27} << Then tell them, 'This is what the Lord Almighty, the God of Israel, says: Drink, get drunk and vomit, and fall to rise no more because of the sword I will send among you.'"
JER	25	28	God-FX1	#20		24569	" {28} But if they refuse to take the cup from your hand and drink, tell them,"
JER	25	28	Jeremiah	#09		24570	 'This is what the Lord Almighty says: You must drink it!
JER	25	29	Jeremiah	#09		24571	" {29} See, I am beginning to bring disaster on the city that bears my Name, and will you indeed go unpunished? "
JER	25	29	Jeremiah	#09		24572	" You will not go unpunished, for I am calling down a sword upon all who live on the earth, declares the Lord Almighty.'"
JER	25	30	God-FX1	#20		24573	 {30} << Now prophesy all these words against them and say to them:
JER	25	30	Jeremiah	#09		24574	" The Lord will roar from on high; he will thunder from his holy dwelling and roar mightily against his land. He will shout like those who tread the grapes, shout against all who live on the earth."
JER	25	31	Jeremiah	#09		24575	" {31} The tumult will resound to the ends of the earth, for the Lord will bring charges against the nations; "
JER	25	31	Jeremiah	#09		24576	" he will bring judgment on all mankind and put the wicked to the sword,'<< declares the Lord. {32} This is what the Lord Almighty says:"
JER	25	32	God-FX1	#20		24577	 << Look! Disaster is spreading from nation to nation; a mighty storm is rising from the ends of the earth.>>
JER	25	33	Jeremiah	#09		24578	" {33} At that time those slain by the Lord will be everywhere--from one end of the earth to the other. They will not be mourned or gathered up or buried, but will be like refuse lying on the ground."
JER	25	34	Jeremiah	#09		24579	" {34} Weep and wail, you shepherds; roll in the dust, you leaders of the flock. For your time to be slaughtered has come; you will fall and be shattered like fine pottery."
JER	25	35	Jeremiah	#09		24580	" {35} The shepherds will have nowhere to flee, the leaders of the flock no place to escape."
JER	25	36	Jeremiah	#09		24581	" {36} Hear the cry of the shepherds, the wailing of the leaders of the flock, for the Lord is destroying their pasture."
JER	25	37	Jeremiah	#09		24582	 {37} The peaceful meadows will be laid waste because of the fierce anger of the Lord.
JER	25	38	Jeremiah	#09		24583	" {38} Like a lion he will leave his lair, and their land will become desolate because of the sword of the oppressor and because of the Lord's fierce anger.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
JER	26	<<	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24584	JEREMIAH 26
JER	26	1	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24585	" {1} Early in the reign of Jehoiakim son of Josiah king of Judah, this word came from the Lord:"
JER	26	2	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24586	 {2} This is what the Lord says:
JER	26	2	God-FX1	#20		24587	 Stand in the courtyard of the Lord's house and speak to all the people of the towns of Judah who come to worship in the house of the Lord. Tell them everything I command you; do not omit a word.
JER	26	3	God-FX1	#20		24588	 {3} Perhaps they will listen and each will turn from his evil way. Then I will relent and not bring on them the disaster I was planning because of the evil they have done.
JER	26	4	God-FX1	#20		24589	" {4} Say to them, This is what the Lord says: If you do not listen to me and follow my law, which I have set before you,"
JER	26	5	God-FX1	#20		24590	" {5} and if you do not listen to the words of my servants the prophets, whom I have sent to you again and again (though you have not listened),"
JER	26	6	God-FX1	#20		24591	 {6} then I will make this house like Shiloh and this city an object of cursing among all the nations of the earth.'>>
JER	26	7	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24592	" {7} The priests, the prophets and all the people heard Jeremiah speak these words in the house of the Lord."
JER	26	8	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24593	" {8} But as soon as Jeremiah finished telling all the people everything the Lord had commanded him to say, the priests, the prophets and all the people seized him and said,"
JER	26	8	Priest	#05		24594	 << You must die!
JER	26	9	Priest	#05		24595	 {9} Why do you prophesy in the Lord's name that this house will be like Shiloh and this city will be desolate and deserted?>>
JER	26	9	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24596	 And all the people crowded around Jeremiah in the house of the Lord.
JER	26	10	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24597	" {10} When the officials of Judah heard about these things, they went up from the royal palace to the house of the Lord and took their places at the entrance of the New Gate of the Lord's house."
JER	26	11	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24598	" {11} Then the priests and the prophets said to the officials and all the people,"
JER	26	11	Priest	#02		24599	 << This man should be sentenced to death because he has prophesied against this city. 
JER	26	11	Priest	#02		24600	 You have heard it with your own ears!>>
JER	26	12	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24601	 {12} Then Jeremiah said to all the officials and all the people:
JER	26	12	Jeremiah	#09		24602	 << The Lord sent me to prophesy against this house and this city all the things you have heard.
JER	26	13	Jeremiah	#09		24603	 {13} Now reform your ways and your actions and obey the Lord your God. Then the Lord will relent and not bring the disaster he has pronounced against you.
JER	26	14	Jeremiah	#09		24604	" {14} As for me, I am in your hands; do with me whatever you think is good and right."
JER	26	15	Jeremiah	#09		24605	" {15} Be assured, however, that if you put me to death, you will bring the guilt of innocent blood on yourselves and on this city and on those who live in it, "
JER	26	15	Jeremiah	#09		24606	 for in truth the Lord has sent me to you to speak all these words in your hearing.>>
JER	26	16	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24607	" {16} Then the officials and all the people said to the priests and the prophets,"
JER	26	16	Official	#17		24608	 << This man should not be sentenced to death! He has spoken to us in the name of the Lord our God.>>
JER	26	17	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24609	" {17} Some of the elders of the land stepped forward and said to the entire assembly of people,"
JER	26	18	Elder	#15		24610	" {18} << Micah of Moresheth prophesied in the days of Hezekiah king of Judah. He told all the people of Judah,"
JER	26	18	Micah	#10		24611	 This is what the Lord Almighty says: 
JER	26	18	Micah	#10		24612	" << Zion will be plowed like a field, Jerusalem will become a heap of rubble, the temple hill a mound overgrown with thickets.>>"
JER	26	19	Elder	#15		24613	 {19} << Did Hezekiah king of Judah or anyone else in Judah put him to death? Did not Hezekiah fear the Lord and seek his favor? 
JER	26	19	Elder	#15		24614	" And did not the Lord relent, so that he did not bring the disaster he pronounced against them? "
JER	26	19	Elder	#15		24615	 We are about to bring a terrible disaster on ourselves!>>
JER	26	20	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24616	 {20} (Now Uriah son of Shemaiah from Kiriath Jearim was another man who prophesied in the name of the Lord; he prophesied the same things against this city and this land as Jeremiah did.
JER	26	21	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24617	" {21} When King Jehoiakim and all his officers and officials heard his words, the king sought to put him to death. But Uriah heard of it and fled in fear to Egypt."
JER	26	22	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24618	" {22} King Jehoiakim, however, sent Elnathan son of Acbor to Egypt, along with some other men."
JER	26	23	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24619	" {23} They brought Uriah out of Egypt and took him to King Jehoiakim, who had him struck down with a sword and his body thrown into the burial place of the common people.)"
JER	26	24	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24620	" {24} Furthermore, Ahikam son of Shaphan supported Jeremiah, and so he was not handed over to the people to be put to death.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
JER	27	<<	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24621	JEREMIAH 27
JER	27	1	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24622	" {1} Early in the reign of Zedekiah son of Josiah king of Judah, this word came to Jeremiah from the Lord:"
JER	27	2	Jeremiah	#09		24623	 {2} This is what the Lord said to me:
JER	27	2	God-FX1	#20		24624	 << Make a yoke out of straps and crossbars and put it on your neck.
JER	27	3	God-FX1	#20		24625	" {3} Then send word to the kings of Edom, Moab, Ammon, Tyre and Sidon through the envoys who have come to Jerusalem to Zedekiah king of Judah."
JER	27	4	God-FX1	#20		24626	" {4} Give them a message for their masters and say,"
JER	27	4	Jeremiah	#09		24627	" ' This is what the Lord Almighty, the God of Israel says: Tell this to your masters:"
JER	27	5	Jeremiah	#09		24628	" {5} With my great power and outstretched arm I made the earth and its people and the animals that are on it, and I give it to anyone I please."
JER	27	6	Jeremiah	#09		24629	 {6} Now I will hand all your countries over to my servant Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon; I will make even the wild animals subject to him.
JER	27	7	Jeremiah	#09		24630	 {7} All nations will serve him and his son and his grandson until the time for his land comes; then many nations and great kings will subjugate him.>>'
JER	27	8	Jeremiah	#09		24631	" {8} << If, however, any nation or kingdom will not serve Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon or bow its neck under his yoke, I will punish that nation with the sword, famine and plague, declares the Lord, until I destroy it by his hand."
JER	27	9	Jeremiah	#09		24632	" {9} So do not listen to your prophets, your diviners, your interpreters of dreams, your mediums or your sorcerers who tell you, 'You will not serve the king of Babylon.'"
JER	27	10	Jeremiah	#09		24633	 {10} They prophesy lies to you that will only serve to remove you far from your lands; I will banish you and you will perish.
JER	27	11	Jeremiah	#09		24634	" {11} But if any nation will bow its neck under the yoke of the king of Babylon and serve him, I will let that nation remain in its own land to till it and to live there, declares the Lord."
JER	27	12	Jeremiah	#09		24635	" {12} <<I gave the same message to Zedekiah king of Judah. I said, << Bow your neck under the yoke of the king of Babylon; serve him and his people, and you will live."
JER	27	13	Jeremiah	#09		24636	" {13} Why will you and your people die by the sword, famine and plague with which the Lord has threatened any nation that will not serve the king of Babylon?"
JER	27	14	Jeremiah	#09		24637	" {14} Do not listen to the words of the prophets who say to you, 'You will not serve the king of Babylon,' for they are prophesying lies to you."
JER	27	15	Jeremiah	#09		24638	" {15} 'I have not sent them, declares the Lord. They are prophesying lies in my name. Therefore, I will banish you and you will perish, both you and the prophets who prophesy to you.'>>"
JER	27	16	Jeremiah	#09		24639	" {16} Then I said to the priests and all these people, << This is what the Lord says: "
JER	27	16	Jeremiah	#09		24640	" Do not listen to the prophets who say, 'Very soon now the articles from the Lord's house will be brought back from Babylon.' They are prophesying lies to you."
JER	27	17	Jeremiah	#09		24641	" {17} Do not listen to them. Serve the king of Babylon, and you will live. Why should this city become a ruin?"
JER	27	18	Jeremiah	#09		24642	" {18} If they are prophets and have the word of the Lord, let them plead with the Lord Almighty that the furnishings remaining in the house of the Lord and in the palace of the king of Judah and in Jerusalem not be taken to Babylon."
JER	27	19	Jeremiah	#09		24643	" {19} For this is what the Lord Almighty says about the pillars, the Sea, the movable stands and the other furnishings that are left in this city,"
JER	27	20	Jeremiah	#09		24644	" {20} which Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon did not take away when he carried Jehoiachin son of Jehoiakim king of Judah into exile from Jerusalem to Babylon, along with all the nobles of Judah and Jerusalem --"
JER	27	21	Jeremiah	#09		24645	" {21} yes, this is what the Lord Almighty, the God of Israel, says about the things that are left in the house of the Lord and in the palace of the king of Judah and in Jerusalem:"
JER	27	22	Jeremiah	#09		24646	" {22} 'They will be taken to Babylon and there they will remain until the day I come for them,' declares the Lord. 'Then I will bring them back and restore them to this place.'>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
JER	28	<<	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24647	JEREMIAH 28
JER	28	1	Jeremiah	#09		24648	" {1} In the fifth month of that same year, the fourth year, early in the reign of Zedekiah king of Judah, the prophet Hananiah son of Azzur, who was from Gibeon, said to me in the house of the Lord in the presence of the priests and all the people:"
JER	28	2	Hananiah	#11		24649	" {2} << This is what the Lord Almighty, the God of Israel, says: 'I will break the yoke of the king of Babylon."
JER	28	3	Hananiah	#11		24650	 {3} Within two years I will bring back to this place all the articles of the Lord's house that Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon removed from here and took to Babylon.
JER	28	4	Hananiah	#11		24651	" {4} I will also bring back to this place Jehoiachin son of Jehoiakim king of Judah and all the other exiles from Judah who went to Babylon,' declares the Lord,"
JER	28	4	Hananiah	#11		24652	 'for I will break the yoke of the king of Babylon.'<<
JER	28	5	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24653	" {5} Then the prophet Jeremiah replied to the prophet Hananiah before the priests and all the people who were standing in the house of the Lord. {6} He said,"
JER	28	6	Jeremiah	#09		24654	 << Amen! May the Lord do so! May the Lord fulfill the words you have prophesied by bringing the articles of the Lord's house and all the exiles back to this place from Babylon.
JER	28	7	Jeremiah	#09		24655	" {7} Nevertheless, listen to what I have to say in your hearing and in the hearing of all the people:"
JER	28	8	Jeremiah	#09		24656	" {8} From early times the prophets who preceded you and me have prophesied war, disaster and plague against many countries and great kingdoms."
JER	28	9	Jeremiah	#09		24657	 {9} But the prophet who prophesies peace will be recognized as one truly sent by the Lord only if his prediction comes true.>>
JER	28	10	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24658	" {10} Then the prophet Hananiah took the yoke off the neck of the prophet Jeremiah and broke it, {11} and he said before all the people,"
JER	28	11	Hananiah	#11		24659	 << This is what the Lord says:
JER	28	11	Hananiah	#11		24660	 'In the same way will I break the yoke of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon off the neck of all the nations within two years.'>>
JER	28	11	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24661	" At this, the prophet Jeremiah went on his way. "
JER	28	12	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24662	" {12} Shortly after the prophet Hananiah had broken the yoke off the neck of the prophet Jeremiah, the word of the Lord came to Jeremiah:"
JER	28	13	God-FX1	#20		24663	" {13} << Go and tell Hananiah, 'This is what the Lord says: You have broken a wooden yoke, but in its place you will get a yoke of iron."
JER	28	14	God-FX1	#20		24664	" {14} This is what the Lord Almighty, the God of Israel, says:"
JER	28	14	God-FX1	#20		24665	" I will put an iron yoke on the necks of all these nations to make them serve Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and they will serve him. I will even give him control over the wild animals.'>>"
JER	28	15	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24666	" {15} Then the prophet Jeremiah said to Hananiah the prophet,"
JER	28	15	Jeremiah	#09		24667	" << Listen, Hananiah! The Lord has not sent you, yet you have persuaded this nation to trust in lies."
JER	28	16	Jeremiah	#09		24668	" {16} Therefore, this is what the Lord says: 'I am about to remove you from the face of the earth. This very year you are going to die, because you have preached rebellion against the Lord.'>>"
JER	28	17	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24669	" {17} In the seventh month of that same year, Hananiah the prophet died.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
JER	29	<<	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24670	JEREMIAH 29
JER	29	1	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24671	" {1} This is the text of the letter that the prophet Jeremiah sent from Jerusalem to the surviving elders among the exiles and to the priests, the prophets and all the other people Nebuchadnezzar had carried into exile from Jerusalem to Babylon."
JER	29	2	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24672	" {2} (This was after King Jehoiachin and the queen mother, the court officials and the leaders of Judah and Jerusalem, the craftsmen and the artisans had gone into exile from Jerusalem.)"
JER	29	3	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24673	" {3} He entrusted the letter to Elasah son of Shaphan and to Gemariah son of Hilkiah, "
JER	29	3	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24674	 whom Zedekiah king of Judah sent to King Nebuchadnezzar in Babylon. It said:
JER	29	4	Jeremiah	#09		24675	" {4} This is what the Lord Almighty, the God of Israel, says to all those I carried into exile from Jerusalem to Babylon:"
JER	29	5	Jeremiah	#09		24676	 {5} << Build houses and settle down; plant gardens and eat what they produce.
JER	29	6	Jeremiah	#09		24677	" {6} Marry and have sons and daughters; find wives for your sons and give your daughters in marriage, so that they too may have sons and daughters. Increase in number there; do not decrease."
JER	29	7	Jeremiah	#09		24678	" {7} Also, seek the peace and prosperity of the city to which I have carried you into exile. Pray to the Lord for it, because if it prospers, you too will prosper.>>"
JER	29	8	Jeremiah	#09		24679	" {8} Yes, this is what the Lord Almighty, the God of Israel, says: << Do not let the prophets and diviners among you deceive you. Do not listen to the dreams you encourage them to have."
JER	29	9	Jeremiah	#09		24680	" {9} They are prophesying lies to you in my name. I have not sent them,>> declares the Lord."
JER	29	10	Jeremiah	#09		24681	" {10} This is what the Lord says: << When seventy years are completed for Babylon, I will come to you and fulfill my gracious promise to bring you back to this place."
JER	29	11	Jeremiah	#09		24682	" {11} For I know the plans I have for you, declares the Lord, plans to prosper you and not to harm you, plans to give you hope and a future."
JER	29	12	Jeremiah	#09		24683	" {12} Then you will call upon me and come and pray to me, and I will listen to you. {13} You will seek me and find me when you seek me with all your heart."
JER	29	14	Jeremiah	#09		24684	" {14} I will be found by you,>> declares the Lord, << and will bring you back from captivity."
JER	29	14	Jeremiah	#09		24685	" I will gather you from all the nations and places where I have banished you,>> declares the Lord, << and will bring you back to the place from which I carried you into exile.>>"
JER	29	15	Jeremiah	#09		24686	" {15} You may say, << The Lord has raised up prophets for us in Babylon,>>"
JER	29	16	Jeremiah	#09		24687	" {16} but this is what the Lord says about the king who sits on David's throne and all the people who remain in this city, your countrymen who did not go with you into exile--"
JER	29	17	Jeremiah	#09		24688	" {17} yes, this is what the Lord Almighty says:"
JER	29	17	God-FX1	#20		24689	" << I will send the sword, famine and plague against them and I will make them like poor figs that are so bad they cannot be eaten."
JER	29	18	God-FX1	#20		24690	" {18} I will pursue them with the sword, famine and plague and will make them abhorrent to all the kingdoms of the earth and an object of cursing and horror, of scorn and reproach, among all the nations where I drive them."
JER	29	19	Jeremiah	#09		24691	" {19} The Lord declares,"
JER	29	19	God-FX1	#20		24692	" For they have not listened to my words, words that I sent to them again and again by my servants the prophets. And you exiles have not listened either,>>"
JER	29	19	Jeremiah	#09		24693	" declares the Lord. {20} Therefore, hear the word of the Lord, all you exiles whom I have sent away from Jerusalem to Babylon."
JER	29	21	God-FX1	#20		24694	" {21} This is what the Lord Almighty, the God of Israel, says about Ahab son of Kolaiah and Zedekiah son of Maaseiah, who are prophesying lies to you in my name: "
JER	29	21	God-FX1	#20		24695	" << I will hand them over to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and he will put them to death before your very eyes."
JER	29	22	God-FX1	#20		24696	" {22} Because of them, all the exiles from Judah who are in Babylon will use this curse: 'The Lord treat you like Zedekiah and Ahab, whom the king of Babylon burned in the fire.'"
JER	29	23	God-FX1	#20		24697	" {23} For they have done outrageous things in Israel; they have committed adultery with their neighbors' wives and in my name have spoken lies, which I did not tell them to do. I know it and am a witness to it,>>"
JER	29	23	Jeremiah	#09		24698	 declares the Lord.
JER	29	24	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24699	" {24} Tell Shemaiah the Nehelamite, {25} << This is what the Lord Almighty, the God of Israel, says: "
JER	29	25	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24700	" You sent letters in your own name to all the people in Jerusalem, to Zephaniah son of Maaseiah the priest, and to all the other priests. You said to Zephaniah,"
JER	29	26	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24701	 {26} 'The Lord has appointed you priest in place of Jehoiada to be in charge of the house of the Lord; you should put any madman who acts like a prophet into the stocks and neck-irons.
JER	29	27	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24702	" {27} So why have you not reprimanded Jeremiah from Anathoth, who poses as a prophet among you?"
JER	29	28	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24703	 {28} He has sent this message to us in Babylon: It will be a long time. Therefore build houses and settle down; plant gardens and eat what they produce.
JER	29	29	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24704	" {29} Zephaniah the priest, however, read the letter to Jeremiah the prophet. {30} Then the word of the Lord came to Jeremiah:"
JER	29	31	Jeremiah	#09		24705	 {31} << Send this message to all the exiles: 'This is what the Lord says about Shemaiah the Nehelamite: 
JER	29	31	Jeremiah	#09		24706	" Because Shemaiah has prophesied to you, even though I did not send him, and has led you to believe a lie, {32} this is what the Lord says: "
JER	29	32	Jeremiah	#09		24707	 I will surely punish Shemaiah the Nehelamite and his descendants. 
JER	29	32	Jeremiah	#09		24708	" He will have no one left among this people, nor will he see the good things I will do for my people, declares the Lord, because he has preached rebellion against me.'>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
JER	30	<<	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24709	JEREMIAH 30
JER	30	1	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24710	 {1} This is the word that came to Jeremiah from the Lord:
JER	30	2	God-FX1	#20		24711	" {2} This is what the Lord, the God of Israel says: Write in a book all the words I have spoken to you."
JER	30	3	God-FX1	#20		24712	" {3} The days are coming, when I will bring my people Israel and Judah back from captivity and restore them to the land I gave their forefathers to possess,."
JER	30	4	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24713	 {4} These are the words the Lord spoke concerning Israel and Judah:
JER	30	5	God-FX1	#20		24714	" {5} << This is what the Lord says: <<'Cries of fear are heard-- terror, not peace."
JER	30	6	God-FX1	#20		24715	" {6} Ask and see: Can a man bear children? Then why do I see every strong man with his hands on his stomach like a woman in labor, every face turned deathly pale?"
JER	30	7	God-FX1	#20		24716	" {7} How awful that day will be! None will be like it. It will be a time of trouble for Jacob, but he will be saved out of it.>>"
JER	30	8	Jeremiah	#09		24717	" {8} 'In that day,' declares the Lord Almighty, 'I will break the yoke off their necks and will tear off their bonds; no longer will foreigners enslave them."
JER	30	9	Jeremiah	#09		24718	" {9} Instead, they will serve the Lord their God and David their king, whom I will raise up for them."
JER	30	10	Jeremiah	#09		24719	" {10} << 'So do not fear, O Jacob my servant; do not be dismayed, O Israel,' declares the Lord."
JER	30	10	Jeremiah	#09		24720	" 'I will surely save you out of a distant place, your descendants from the land of their exile. Jacob will again have peace and security, and no one will make him afraid."
JER	30	11	God-FX1	#20		24721	" {11} I am with you and will save you,' declares the Lord. 'Though I completely destroy all the nations among which I scatter you, I will not completely destroy you. "
JER	30	11	God-FX1	#20		24722	 I will discipline you but only with justice; I will not let you go entirely unpunished.'
JER	30	12	God-FX1	#20		24723	" {12} << This is what the Lord says: << 'Your wound is incurable, your injury beyond healing."
JER	30	13	God-FX1	#20		24724	" {13} There is no one to plead your cause, no remedy for your sore, no healing for you."
JER	30	14	God-FX1	#20		24725	" {14} All your allies have forgotten you; they care nothing for you. I have struck you as an enemy would and punished you as would the cruel, because your guilt is so great and your sins so many."
JER	30	15	God-FX1	#20		24726	" {15} Why do you cry out over your wound, your pain that has no cure? Because of your great guilt and many sins I have done these things to you."
JER	30	16	God-FX1	#20		24727	 {16} But all who devour you will be devoured; all your enemies will go into exile. Those who plunder you will be plundered; all who make spoil of you I will despoil.
JER	30	17	God-FX1	#20		24728	" {17} But I will restore you to health and heal your wounds, declares the Lord, because you are called an outcast, Zion for whom no one cares.>>"
JER	30	18	Jeremiah	#09		24729	" {18} This is what the Lord says: I will restore the fortunes of Jacob's tents and have compassion on his dwellings; the city will be rebuilt on her ruins, and the palace will stand in its proper place."
JER	30	19	Jeremiah	#09		24730	" {19} From them will come songs of thanksgiving and the sound of rejoicing. I will add to their numbers, and they will not be decreased; I will bring them honor, and they will not be disdained."
JER	30	20	Jeremiah	#09		24731	" {20} Their children will be as in days of old, and their community will be established before me; I will punish all who oppress them."
JER	30	21	Jeremiah	#09		24732	 {21} Their leader will be one of their own; their ruler will arise from among them. 
JER	30	21	Jeremiah	#09		24733	" I will bring him near and he will come close to me, for who is he who will devote himself to be close to me? declares the Lord."
JER	30	22	Jeremiah	#09		24734	" {22} So you will be my people, and I will be your God.'>>"
JER	30	23	Jeremiah	#09		24735	" {23} See, the storm of the Lord will burst out in wrath, a driving wind swirling down on the heads of the wicked."
JER	30	24	Jeremiah	#09		24736	 {24} The fierce anger of the Lord will not turn back until he fully accomplishes the purposes of his heart. In days to come you will understand this.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
JER	31	<<	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24737	JEREMIAH 31

JER	31	9	Jeremiah	#09		24750	" I will lead them beside streams of water on a level path where they will not stumble, because I am Israel's father, and Ephraim is my firstborn son."
JER	31	10	Jeremiah	#09		24751	" {10} << Hear the word of the Lord, O nations; proclaim it in distant coastlands: 'He who scattered Israel will gather them and will watch over his flock like a shepherd.'"

JER	31	12	Jeremiah	#09		24753	" {12} They will come and shout for joy on the heights of Zion; they will rejoice in the bounty of the Lord-- the grain, the new wine and the oil, the young of the flocks and herds. "
JER	31	12	Jeremiah	#09		24754	" They will be like a well-watered garden, and they will sorrow no more."
JER	31	13	God-FX1	#20		24755	" {13} Then maidens will dance and be glad, young men and old as well. I will turn their mourning into gladness; I will give them comfort and joy instead of sorrow."
JER	31	14	God-FX1	#20		24756	" {14} I will satisfy the priests with abundance, and my people will be filled with my bounty,>>"
JER	31	15	Jeremiah	#09		24757	 {15} This is what the Lord says:

JER	31	16	Jeremiah	#09		24759	 {16} This is what the Lord says:
JER	31	16	God-FX1	#20		24760	" << Restrain your voice from weeping and your eyes from tears, for your work will be rewarded. They will return from the land of the enemy.>>"
JER	31	16	Jeremiah	#09		24761	" {17} The Lord declares,"
JER	31	17	God-FX1	#20		24762	 So there is hope for your future. Your children will return to their own land.
JER	31	18	Jeremiah	#09		24763	" {18} << I have surely heard Ephraim's moaning: 'You disciplined me like an unruly calf, and I have been disciplined. Restore me, and I will return, because you are the Lord my God."
JER	31	19	Jeremiah	#09		24764	" {19} After I strayed, I repented; after I came to understand, I beat my breast. I was ashamed and humiliated because I bore the disgrace of my youth.'"
JER	31	20	God-FX1	#20		24765	" {20} Is not Ephraim my dear son, the child in whom I delight? Though I often speak against him, I still remember him. Therefore my heart yearns for him; I have great compassion for him,>>"

JER	31	22	Jeremiah	#09		24767	" {22} How long will you wander, O unfaithful daughter? The Lord will create a new thing on earth-- a woman will surround a man.>>"

JER	31	23	God-FX1	#20		24769	" <<When I bring them back from captivity, the people in the land of Judah and in its towns will once again use these words: 'The Lord bless you, O righteous dwelling, O sacred mountain.'"
JER	31	24	God-FX1	#20		24770	 {24} People will live together in Judah and all its towns--farmers and those who move about with their flocks. {25} I will refresh the weary and satisfy the faint.>>
JER	31	26	Jeremiah	#09		24771	" {26} At this I awoke and looked around. My sleep had been pleasant to me. {27} The Lord declares,"

JER	31	28	God-FX1	#20		24773	" {28} Just as I watched over them to uproot and tear down, and to overthrow, destroy and bring disaster, so I will watch over them to build and to plant,>>"
JER	31	28	Jeremiah	#09		24774	" declares the Lord. {29} In those days people will no longer say, 'The fathers have eaten sour grapes, and the children's teeth are set on edge.'"
JER	31	30	Jeremiah	#09		24775	" {30} Instead, everyone will die for his own sin; whoever eats sour grapes--his own teeth will be set on edge. {31} The Lord declares,"

JER	31	32	God-FX1	#20		24777	" {32} It will not be like the covenant I made with their forefathers when I took them by the hand to lead them out of Egypt, because they broke my covenant, though I was a husband to them,"

JER	31	34	God-FX1	#20		24782	" {34} No longer will a man teach his neighbor, or a man his brother, saying, 'Know the Lord,' because they will all know me, from the least of them to the greatest,>>"
JER	31	34	Jeremiah	#09		24783	 declares the Lord.
JER	31	34	God-FX1	#20		24784	 << For I will forgive their wickedness and will remember their sins no more.>>
JER	31	35	Jeremiah	#09		24785	" {35} This is what the Lord says, he who appoints the sun to shine by day, who decrees the moon and stars to shine by night, who stirs up the sea so that its waves roar-- the Lord Almighty is his name:"

JER	31	38	God-FX1	#20		24791	 The days are coming when this city will be rebuilt for me from the Tower of Hananel to the Corner Gate.
