JER	31	40	God-FX1	#20		24794	 The city will never again be uprooted or demolished.>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
JER	32	<<	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24795	JEREMIAH 32
JER	32	1	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24796	" {1} This is the word that came to Jeremiah from the Lord in the tenth year of Zedekiah king of Judah, which was the eighteenth year of Nebuchadnezzar."
JER	32	2	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24797	" {2} The army of the king of Babylon was then besieging Jerusalem, and Jeremiah the prophet was confined in the courtyard of the guard in the royal palace of Judah."
JER	32	3	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24798	" {3} Now Zedekiah king of Judah had imprisoned him there, saying,"
JER	32	3	Zedekiah	#12		24799	" << Why do you prophesy as you do? You say, 'This is what the Lord says: I am about to hand this city over to the king of Babylon, and he will capture it."
JER	32	4	Zedekiah	#12		24800	" {4} Zedekiah king of Judah will not escape out of the hands of the Babylonians but will certainly be handed over to the king of Babylon, and will speak with him face to face and see him with his own eyes."
JER	32	5	Zedekiah	#12		24801	" {5} He will take Zedekiah to Babylon, where he will remain until I deal with him, declares the Lord. If you fight against the Babylonians, you will not succeed.'>>"
JER	32	6	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24802	" {6} Jeremiah said,"
JER	32	6	Jeremiah	#09		24803	 << The word of the Lord came to me:
JER	32	7	Jeremiah	#09		24804	" {7} Hanamel son of Shallum your uncle is going to come to you and say, 'Buy my field at Anathoth, because as nearest relative it is your right and duty to buy it.'"
JER	32	8	Jeremiah	#09		24805	" {8} << Then, just as the Lord had said, my cousin Hanamel came to me in the courtyard of the guard and said, 'Buy my field at Anathoth in the territory of Benjamin. "
JER	32	8	Jeremiah	#09		24806	" Since it is your right to redeem it and possess it, buy it for yourself.' << I knew that this was the word of the Lord;"
JER	32	9	Jeremiah	#09		24807	 {9} so I bought the field at Anathoth from my cousin Hanamel and weighed out for him seventeen shekels of silver.
JER	32	10	Jeremiah	#09		24808	" {10} I signed and sealed the deed, had it witnessed, and weighed out the silver on the scales."
JER	32	11	Jeremiah	#09		24809	" {11} I took the deed of purchase--the sealed copy containing the terms and conditions, as well as the unsealed copy--"
JER	32	12	Jeremiah	#09		24810	" {12} and I gave this deed to Baruch son of Neriah, the son of Mahseiah, in the presence of my cousin Hanamel and of the witnesses who had signed the deed and of all the Jews sitting in the courtyard of the guard."
JER	32	13	Jeremiah	#09		24811	 {13} << In their presence I gave Baruch these instructions:
JER	32	14	Jeremiah	#09		24812	" {14} 'This is what the Lord Almighty, the God of Israel, says: "
JER	32	14	Jeremiah	#09		24813	" Take these documents, both the sealed and unsealed copies of the deed of purchase, and put them in a clay jar so they will last a long time."
JER	32	15	Jeremiah	#09		24814	" {15} For this is what the Lord Almighty, the God of Israel, says: Houses, fields and vineyards will again be bought in this land.'"
JER	32	16	Jeremiah	#09		24815	" {16} << After I had given the deed of purchase to Baruch son of Neriah, I prayed to the Lord:"
JER	32	17	Jeremiah	#09		24816	" {17} << Ah, Sovereign Lord, you have made the heavens and the earth by your great power and outstretched arm. Nothing is too hard for you."
JER	32	18	Jeremiah	#09		24817	 {18} You show love to thousands but bring the punishment for the fathers' sins into the laps of their children after them. 
JER	32	18	Jeremiah	#09		24818	" O great and powerful God, whose name is the Lord Almighty, {19} great are your purposes and mighty are your deeds. "
JER	32	19	Jeremiah	#09		24819	 Your eyes are open to all the ways of men; you reward everyone according to his conduct and as his deeds deserve.
JER	32	20	Jeremiah	#09		24820	" {20} You performed miraculous signs and wonders in Egypt and have continued them to this day, both in Israel and among all mankind, and have gained the renown that is still yours."
JER	32	21	Jeremiah	#09		24821	" {21} You brought your people Israel out of Egypt with signs and wonders, by a mighty hand and an outstretched arm and with great terror."
JER	32	22	Jeremiah	#09		24822	" {22} You gave them this land you had sworn to give their forefathers, a land flowing with milk and honey."
JER	32	23	Jeremiah	#09		24823	" {23} They came in and took possession of it, but they did not obey you or follow your law; they did not do what you commanded them to do. So you brought all this disaster upon them."
JER	32	24	Jeremiah	#09		24824	 {24} << See how the siege ramps are built up to take the city. 
JER	32	24	Jeremiah	#09		24825	" Because of the sword, famine and plague, the city will be handed over to the Babylonians who are attacking it. What you said has happened, as you now see."
JER	32	25	Jeremiah	#09		24826	" {25} And though the city will be handed over to the Babylonians, you, O Sovereign Lord, say to me, 'Buy the field with silver and have the transaction witnessed.'<<"
JER	32	26	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24827	 {26} Then the word of the Lord came to Jeremiah:
JER	32	27	God-FX1	#20		24828	" {27} << I am the Lord, the God of all mankind. Is anything too hard for me? {28} Therefore, this is what the Lord says:"
JER	32	28	God-FX1	#20		24829	" I am about to hand this city over to the Babylonians and to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, who will capture it."
JER	32	29	Jeremiah	#09		24830	 {29} The Babylonians who are attacking this city will come in and set it on fire;
JER	32	29	Jeremiah	#09		24831	" they will burn it down, along with the houses where the people provoked me to anger by burning incense on the roofs to Baal and by pouring out drink offerings to other gods."
JER	32	30	Jeremiah	#09		24832	 {30} << The people of Israel and Judah have done nothing but evil in my sight from their youth;
JER	32	30	Jeremiah	#09		24833	" indeed, the people of Israel have done nothing but provoke me with what their hands have made, declares the Lord."
JER	32	31	Jeremiah	#09		24834	" {31} From the day it was built until now, this city has so aroused my anger and wrath that I must remove it from my sight."
JER	32	32	Jeremiah	#09		24835	" {32} The people of Israel and Judah have provoked me by all the evil they have done--they, their kings and officials, their priests and prophets, the men of Judah and the people of Jerusalem."
JER	32	33	Jeremiah	#09		24836	" {33} They turned their backs to me and not their faces; though I taught them again and again, they would not listen or respond to discipline."
JER	32	34	Jeremiah	#09		24837	 {34} They set up their abominable idols in the house that bears my Name and defiled it.
JER	32	35	Jeremiah	#09		24838	" {35} They built high places for Baal in the Valley of Ben Hinnom to sacrifice their sons and daughters to Molech, "
JER	32	35	Jeremiah	#09		24839	" though I never commanded, nor did it enter my mind, that they should do such a detestable thing and so make Judah sin."
JER	32	36	Jeremiah	#09		24840	" {36} <<You are saying about this city, 'By the sword, famine and plague it will be handed over to the king of Babylon '; but this is what the Lord, the God of Israel, says:"
JER	32	37	God-FX1	#20		24841	 {37} I will surely gather them from all the lands where I banish them in my furious anger and great wrath; I will bring them back to this place and let them live in safety.
JER	32	38	God-FX1	#20		24842	" {38} They will be my people, and I will be their God."
JER	32	39	God-FX1	#20		24843	" {39} I will give them singleness of heart and action, so that they will always fear me for their own good and the good of their children after them."
JER	32	40	God-FX1	#20		24844	" {40} I will make an everlasting covenant with them: I will never stop doing good to them, and I will inspire them to fear me, so that they will never turn away from me."
JER	32	41	God-FX1	#20		24845	 {41} I will rejoice in doing them good and will assuredly plant them in this land with all my heart and soul.
JER	32	42	Jeremiah	#09		24846	" {42} This is what the lord says: As I have brought all this great calamity on this people, so I will give them all the prosperity I have promised them."
JER	32	43	Jeremiah	#09		24847	" {43} Once more fields will be bought in this land of which you say, 'It is a desolate waste, without men or animals, for it has been handed over to the Babylonians."
JER	32	44	Jeremiah	#09		24848	" {44} Fields will be bought for silver, and deeds will be signed, sealed and witnessed in the territory of Benjamin,"
JER	32	44	Jeremiah	#09		24849	" in the villages around Jerusalem, in the towns of Judah and in the towns of the hill country, of the western foothills and of the Negev, "
JER	32	44	Jeremiah	#09		24850	" because I will restore their fortunes, declares the Lord.>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
JER	33	<<	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24851	JEREMIAH 33
JER	33	1	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24852	" {1} While Jeremiah was still confined in the courtyard of the guard, the word of the Lord came to him a second time:"
JER	33	2	Jeremiah	#09		24853	" {2} << This is what the Lord says, he who made the earth, the Lord who formed it and established it--the Lord is his name:"
JER	33	3	God-FX1	#20		24854	 {3} 'Call to me and I will answer you and tell you great and unsearchable things you do not know.'
JER	33	4	Jeremiah	#09		24855	" {4} For this is what the Lord, the God of Israel, says about the houses in this city and the royal palaces of Judah that have been torn down to be used against the siege ramps and the sword {5} in the fight with the Babylonians: "
JER	33	5	Jeremiah	#09		24856	 They will be filled with the dead bodies of the men I will slay in my anger and wrath. I will hide my face from this city because of all its wickedness.
JER	33	6	God-FX1	#20		24857	" {6} << 'Nevertheless, I will bring health and healing to it; I will heal my people and will let them enjoy abundant peace and security."
JER	33	7	God-FX1	#20		24858	 {7} I will bring Judah and Israel back from captivity and will rebuild them as they were before.
JER	33	8	God-FX1	#20		24859	 {8} I will cleanse them from all the sin they have committed against me and will forgive all their sins of rebellion against me.
JER	33	9	God-FX1	#20		24860	" {9} Then this city will bring me renown, joy, praise and honor before all nations on earth that hear of all the good things I do for it; "
JER	33	9	God-FX1	#20		24861	 and they will be in awe and will tremble at the abundant prosperity and peace I provide for it.'
JER	33	10	Jeremiah	#09		24862	" {10} << This is what the Lord says: 'You say about this place, << It is a desolate waste, without men or animals.>> "
JER	33	10	Jeremiah	#09		24863	" Yet in the towns of Judah and the streets of Jerusalem that are deserted, inhabited by neither men nor animals, "
JER	33	10	Jeremiah	#09		24864	" there will be heard once more {11} the sounds of joy and gladness, the voices of bride and bridegroom, and the voices of those who bring thank offerings to the house of the Lord, saying,"
JER	33	11	Voice	#18		24865	" << Give thanks to the Lord Almighty, for the Lord is good; his love endures forever.>>"
JER	33	11	Jeremiah	#09		24866	" For I will restore the fortunes of the land as they were before,' says the Lord."
JER	33	12	Jeremiah	#09		24867	" {12} << This is what the Lord Almighty says; In this place, desolate and without men or animals-in all its towns there will again be pastures for shepherds to rest their flocks."
JER	33	13	Jeremiah	#09		24868	" {13} In the towns of the hill country, of the western foothills and of the Negev, in the territory of Benjamin,"
JER	33	13	Jeremiah	#09		24869	" in the villages around Jerusalem and in the towns of Judah, flocks will again pass under the hand of the one who counts them, says the Lord."
JER	33	14	Jeremiah	#09		24870	" {14} The days are coming, declares the Lord, when I will fulfill the gracious promise I made to the house of Israel and to the house of Judah."
JER	33	15	God-FX1	#20		24871	 {15} In those days and at that time I will make a righteous Branch sprout from David's line; he will do what is just and right in the land.
JER	33	16	God-FX1	#20		24872	 {16} In those days Judah will be saved and Jerusalem will live in safety. This is the name by which it will be called: The Lord Our Righteousness.'
JER	33	17	Jeremiah	#09		24873	" {17} For this is what the Lord says: 'David will never fail to have a man to sit on the throne of the house of Israel,"
JER	33	18	Jeremiah	#09		24874	" {18} nor will the priests, who are Levites, ever fail to have a man to stand before me continually to offer burnt offerings, to burn grain offerings and to present sacrifices.'>>"
JER	33	19	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24875	 {19} The word of the Lord came to Jeremiah:
JER	33	20	Jeremiah	#09		24876	" {20} << This is what the Lord says: 'If you can break my covenant with the day and my covenant with the night, so that day and night no longer come at their appointed time,"
JER	33	21	Jeremiah	#09		24877	 {21} then my covenant with David my servant--and my covenant with the Levites who are priests ministering before me--can be broken and David will no longer have a descendant to reign on his throne.
JER	33	22	Jeremiah	#09		24878	 {22} I will make the descendants of David my servant and the Levites who minister before me as countless as the stars of the sky and as measureless as the sand on the seashore.'>>
JER	33	23	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24879	 {23} The word of the Lord came to Jeremiah:
JER	33	24	God-FX1	#20		24880	" {24} << Have you not noticed that these people are saying, 'The Lord has rejected the two kingdoms he chose'? So they despise my people and no longer regard them as a nation."
JER	33	25	Jeremiah	#09		24881	" {25} This is what the Lord says: 'If I have not established my covenant with day and night and the fixed laws of heaven and earth,"
JER	33	26	Jeremiah	#09		24882	" {26} then I will reject the descendants of Jacob and David my servant and will not choose one of his sons to rule over the descendants of Abraham, Isaac and Jacob."
JER	33	26	Jeremiah	#09		24883	 For I will restore their fortunes and have compassion on them.'>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
JER	34	<<	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24884	JEREMIAH 34
JER	34	1	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24885	" {1} While Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon and all his army and all the kingdoms and peoples in the empire he ruled were fighting against Jerusalem and all its surrounding towns, this word came to Jeremiah from the Lord:"
JER	34	2	Jeremiah	#09		24886	" {2} << This is what the Lord, the God of Israel, says: Go to Zedekiah king of Judah and tell him, 'This is what the Lord says:"
JER	34	2	God-FX1	#20		24887	" I am about to hand this city over to the king of Babylon, and he will burn it down."
JER	34	3	God-FX1	#20		24888	 {3} You will not escape from his grasp but will surely be captured and handed over to him. 
JER	34	3	God-FX1	#20		24889	" You will see the king of Babylon with your own eyes, and he will speak with you face to face. And you will go to Babylon."
JER	34	4	Jeremiah	#09		24890	" {4} << 'Yet hear the promise of the Lord, O Zedekiah king of Judah. This is what the Lord says concerning you: You will not die by the sword; {5} you will die peacefully. "
JER	34	5	Jeremiah	#09		24891	" As people made a funeral fire in honor of your fathers, the former kings who preceded you, so they will make a fire in your honor and lament, << Alas, O master!>>"
JER	34	5	Jeremiah	#09		24892	" I myself make this promise, declares the Lord.'>>"
JER	34	6	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24893	" {6} Then Jeremiah the prophet told all this to Zedekiah king of Judah, in Jerusalem,"
JER	34	7	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24894	 {7} while the army of the king of Babylon was fighting against Jerusalem and the other cities of Judah that were still holding out--Lachish and Azekah.
JER	34	7	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24895	 These were the only fortified cities left in Judah.
JER	34	8	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24896	 {8} The word came to Jeremiah from the Lord after King Zedekiah had made a covenant with all the people in Jerusalem to proclaim freedom for the slaves.
JER	34	9	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24897	" {9} Everyone was to free his Hebrew slaves, both male and female; no one was to hold a fellow Jew in bondage."
JER	34	10	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24898	" {10} So all the officials and people who entered into this covenant agreed that they would free their male and female slaves and no longer hold them in bondage. They agreed, and set them free."
JER	34	11	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24899	 {11} But afterward they changed their minds and took back the slaves they had freed and enslaved them again.
JER	34	12	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24900	 {12} Then the word of the Lord came to Jeremiah:
JER	34	13	Jeremiah	#09		24901	" {13} << This is what the Lord, the God of Israel, says: I made a covenant with your forefathers when I brought them out of Egypt, out of the land of slavery. I said,"
JER	34	14	God-FX1	#20		24902	 {14} 'Every seventh year each of you must free any fellow Hebrew who has sold himself to you. 
JER	34	14	God-FX1	#20		24903	" After he has served you six years, you must let him go free.' Your fathers, however, did not listen to me or pay attention to me."
JER	34	15	Jeremiah	#09		24904	 {15} Recently you repented and did what is right in my sight: Each of you proclaimed freedom to his countrymen. You even made a covenant before me in the house that bears my Name.
JER	34	16	Jeremiah	#09		24905	 {16} But now you have turned around and profaned my name; each of you has taken back the male and female slaves you had set free to go where they wished. You have forced them to become your slaves again.
JER	34	17	Jeremiah	#09		24906	" {17} << Therefore, this is what the Lord says: You have not obeyed me; you have not proclaimed freedom for your fellow countrymen. "
JER	34	17	Jeremiah	#09		24907	" So I now proclaim 'freedom' for you, declares the Lord--'freedom' to fall by the sword, plague and famine. I will make you abhorrent to all the kingdoms of the earth."
JER	34	18	Jeremiah	#09		24908	" {18} The men who have violated my covenant and have not fulfilled the terms of the covenant they made before me, I will treat like the calf they cut in two and then walked between its pieces."
JER	34	19	Jeremiah	#09		24909	" {19} The leaders of Judah and Jerusalem, the court officials, the priests and all the people of the land who walked between the pieces of the calf, {20} I will hand over to their enemies who seek their lives."
JER	34	20	Jeremiah	#09		24910	 Their dead bodies will become food for the birds of the air and the beasts of the earth.
JER	34	21	Jeremiah	#09		24911	" {21} << I will hand Zedekiah king of Judah and his officials over to their enemies who seek their lives, to the army of the king of Babylon, which has withdrawn from you."
JER	34	22	Jeremiah	#09		24912	" {22} I am going to give the order, declares the Lord, and I will bring them back to this city. "
JER	34	22	Jeremiah	#09		24913	" They will fight against it, take it and burn it down. And I will lay waste the towns of Judah so no one can live there.>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
JER	35	<<	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24914	JEREMIAH 35
JER	35	1	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24915	 {1} This is the word that came to Jeremiah from the Lord during the reign of Jehoiakim son of Josiah king of Judah:
JER	35	2	God-FX1	#20		24916	 {2} << Go to the Recabite family and invite them to come to one of the side rooms of the house of the Lord and give them wine to drink.>>
JER	35	3	Jeremiah	#09		24917	" {3} So I went to get Jaazaniah son of Jeremiah, the son of Habazziniah, and his brothers and all his sons--the whole family of the Recabites."
JER	35	4	Jeremiah	#09		24918	" {4} I brought them into the house of the Lord, into the room of the sons of Hanan son of Igdaliah the man of God. "
JER	35	4	Jeremiah	#09		24919	" It was next to the room of the officials, which was over that of Maaseiah son of Shallum the doorkeeper."
JER	35	5	Jeremiah	#09		24920	" {5} Then I set bowls full of wine and some cups before the men of the Recabite family and said to them, << Drink some wine.>> {6} But they replied,"
JER	35	6	Recabite Man	#11		24921	" << We do not drink wine, because our forefather Jonadab son of Recab gave us this command:"
JER	35	6	Recabite Man	#11		24922	 'Neither you nor your descendants must ever drink wine.
JER	35	7	Recabite Man	#11		24923	" {7} Also you must never build houses, sow seed or plant vineyards; "
JER	35	7	Recabite Man	#11		24924	" you must never have any of these things, but must always live in tents. "
JER	35	7	Recabite Man	#11		24925	 Then you will live a long time in the land where you are nomads.'
JER	35	8	Recabite Man	#11		24926	 {8} We have obeyed everything our forefather Jonadab son of Recab commanded us. 
JER	35	8	Recabite Man	#11		24927	" Neither we nor our wives nor our sons and daughters have ever drunk wine {9} or built houses to live in or had vineyards, fields or crops."
JER	35	10	Recabite Man	#11		24928	 {10} We have lived in tents and have fully obeyed everything our forefather Jonadab commanded us.
JER	35	11	Recabite Man	#11		24929	" {11} But when Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon invaded this land, we said, 'Come, we must go to Jerusalem to escape the Babylonian and Aramean armies.' So we have remained in Jerusalem.>>"
JER	35	12	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24930	" {12} Then the word of the Lord came to Jeremiah, saying:"
JER	35	13	Jeremiah	#09		24931	" {13} << This is what the Lord Almighty, the God of Israel, says: Go and tell the men of Judah and the people of Jerusalem, 'Will you not learn a lesson and obey my words?' declares the Lord."
JER	35	14	God-FX1	#20		24932	 {14} 'Jonadab son of Recab ordered his sons not to drink wine and this command has been kept. 
JER	35	14	God-FX1	#20		24933	" To this day they do not drink wine, because they obey their forefather's command. But I have spoken to you again and again, yet you have not obeyed me."
JER	35	15	God-FX1	#20		24934	" {15} Again and again I sent all my servants the prophets to you. They said,"
JER	35	15	Prophet	#02		24935	 << Each of you must turn from your wicked ways and reform your actions; do not follow other gods to serve them. 
JER	35	15	Prophet	#02		24936	 Then you will live in the land I have given to you and your fathers.>>
JER	35	15	God-FX1	#20		24937	" But you have not paid attention or listened to me. {16} The descendants of Jonadab son of Recab have carried out the command their forefather gave them, but these people have not obeyed me.'"
JER	35	17	Jeremiah	#09		24938	" {17} << Therefore, this is what the Lord God Almighty, the God of Israel, says:"
JER	35	17	Jeremiah	#09		24939	 'Listen! I am am going to bring on Judah and on everyone living in Jerusalem every disaster I pronounced against them. 
JER	35	17	Jeremiah	#09		24940	" I spoke to them, but they did not listen; I called to them, but they did not answer.'<<"
JER	35	18	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24941	" {18} Then Jeremiah said to the family of the Recabites,"
JER	35	18	Jeremiah	#09		24942	" << This is what the Lord Almighty, the God of Israel says: 'You have obeyed the command of your forefather Jonadab and have followed all his instructions and have done everything he ordered.'"
JER	35	19	Jeremiah	#09		24943	" {19} Therefore, this is what the Lord Almighty, the God of Israel says: 'Jonadab son of Recab will never fail to have a man to serve me.'>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
JER	36	<<	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24944	JEREMIAH 36
JER	36	1	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24945	" {1} In the fourth year of Jehoiakim son of Josiah king of Judah, this word came to Jeremiah from the Lord:"
JER	36	2	God-FX1	#20		24946	" {2} << Take a scroll and write on it all the words I have spoken to you concerning Israel, Judah and all the other nations from the time I began speaking to you in the reign of Josiah till now."
JER	36	3	God-FX1	#20		24947	" {3} Perhaps when the people of Judah hear about every disaster I plan to inflict on them, each of them will turn from his wicked way; then I will forgive their wickedness and their sin.>>"
JER	36	4	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24948	" {4} So Jeremiah called Baruch son of Neriah, and while Jeremiah dictated all the words the Lord had spoken to him, Baruch wrote them on the scroll."
JER	36	5	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24949	" {5} Then Jeremiah told Baruch,"
JER	36	5	Jeremiah	#09		24950	 << I am restricted; I cannot go to the Lord's temple.
JER	36	6	Jeremiah	#09		24951	 {6} So you go to the house of the Lord on a day of fasting and read to the people from the scroll the words of the Lord that you wrote as I dictated. 
JER	36	6	Jeremiah	#09		24952	 Read them to all the people of Judah who come in from their towns.
JER	36	7	Jeremiah	#09		24953	" {7} Perhaps they will bring their petition before the Lord, and each will turn from his wicked ways, for the anger and wrath pronounced against this people by the Lord are great.>>"
JER	36	8	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24954	 {8} Baruch son of Neriah did everything Jeremiah the prophet told him to do; at the Lord's temple he read the words of the Lord from the scroll.
JER	36	9	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24955	" {9} In the ninth month of the fifth year of Jehoiakim son of Josiah king of Judah, a time of fasting before the Lord was proclaimed for all the people in Jerusalem and those who had come from the towns of Judah."
JER	36	10	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24956	" {10} From the room of Gemariah son of Shaphan the secretary, which was in the upper courtyard at the entrance of the New Gate of the temple, Baruch read to all the people at the Lord's temple the words of Jeremiah from the scroll."
JER	36	11	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24957	" {11} When Micaiah son of Gemariah, the son of Shaphan, heard all the words of the Lord from the scroll, {12} he went down to the secretary's room in the royal palace, where all the officials were sitting: "
JER	36	12	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24958	" Elishama the secretary, Delaiah son of Shemaiah, "
JER	36	12	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24959	" Elnathan son of Acbor, Gemariah son of Shaphan, "
JER	36	12	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24960	" Zedekiah son of Hananiah, and all the other officials."
JER	36	13	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24961	" {13} After Micaiah told them everything he had heard Baruch read to the people from the scroll,"
JER	36	14	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24962	" {14} all the officials sent Jehudi son of Nethaniah, the son of Shelemiah, the son of Cushi, to say to Baruch,"
JER	36	14	Jehudi	#15		24963	 << Bring the scroll from which you have read to the people and come.>>
JER	36	14	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24964	" So Baruch son of Neriah went to them with the scroll in his hand. {15} They said to him,"
JER	36	15	Official	#17		24965	" << Sit down, please, and read it to us.>>"
JER	36	15	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24966	" So Baruch read it to them. {16} When they heard all these words, they looked at each other in fear and said to Baruch,"
JER	36	16	Official	#17		24967	 << We must report all these words to the king.>>
JER	36	17	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24968	" {17} Then they asked Baruch,"
JER	36	17	Official	#17		24969	" << Tell us, how did you come to write all this? Did Jeremiah dictate it?>>"
JER	36	18	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24970	 {18} Baruch replied.
JER	36	18	Baruch	#10		24971	" << Yes, he dictated all these words to me, and I wrote them in ink on the scroll.>>"
JER	36	19	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24972	" {19} Then the officials said to Baruch,"
JER	36	19	Official	#05		24973	" << You and Jeremiah, go and hide. Don't let anyone know where you are.>>"
JER	36	20	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24974	" {20} After they put the scroll in the room of Elishama the secretary, they went to the king in the courtyard and reported everything to him."
JER	36	21	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24975	" {21} The king sent Jehudi to get the scroll, and Jehudi brought it from the room of Elishama the secretary and read it to the king and all the officials standing beside him."
JER	36	22	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24976	" {22} It was the ninth month and the king was sitting in the winter apartment, with a fire burning in the firepot in front of him."
JER	36	23	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24977	" {23} Whenever Jehudi had read three or four columns of the scroll, the king cut them off with a scribe's knife and threw them into the firepot, until the entire scroll was burned in the fire."
JER	36	24	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24978	" {24} The king and all his attendants who heard all these words showed no fear, nor did they tear their clothes."
JER	36	25	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24979	" {25} Even though Elnathan, Delaiah and Gemariah urged the king not to burn the scroll, he would not listen to them."
JER	36	26	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24980	" {26} Instead, the king commanded Jerahmeel, a son of the king, "
JER	36	26	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24981	 Seraiah son of Azriel and Shelemiah son of Abdeel to arrest Baruch the scribe and Jeremiah the prophet. But the Lord had hidden them.
JER	36	27	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24982	" {27} After the king burned the scroll containing the words that Baruch had written at Jeremiah's dictation, the word of the Lord came to Jeremiah:"
JER	36	28	God-FX1	#20		24983	" {28} << Take another scroll and write on it all the words that were on the first scroll, which Jehoiakim king of Judah burned up."
JER	36	29	God-FX1	#20		24984	" {29} Also tell Jehoiakim king of Judah, 'This is what the Lord says:"
JER	36	29	Jeremiah	#09		24985	" You burned that scroll and said, << Why did you write on it that the king of Babylon would certainly come and destroy this land and cut off both men and animals from it."
JER	36	30	Jeremiah	#09		24986	" {30} Therefore, this is what the Lord says about Jehoiakim king of Judah: "
JER	36	30	Jeremiah	#09		24987	 He will have no one to sit on the throne of David; his body will be thrown out and exposed to the heat by day and the frost by night.
JER	36	31	Jeremiah	#09		24988	 {31} I will punish him and his children and his attendants for their wickedness;
JER	36	31	Jeremiah	#09		24989	" I will bring on them and those living in Jerusalem and the people of Judah every disaster I pronounced against them, because they have not listened.'>>"
JER	36	32	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24990	" {32} So Jeremiah took another scroll and gave it to the scribe Baruch son of Neriah, and as Jeremiah dictated, Baruch wrote on it all the words of the scroll that Jehoiakim king of Judah had burned in the fire. "
JER	36	32	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24991	 And many similar words were added to them.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
JER	37	<<	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24992	JEREMIAH 37
JER	37	1	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24993	 {1} Zedekiah son of Josiah was made king of Judah by Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon; he reigned in place of Jehoiachin son of Jehoiakim.
JER	37	2	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24994	 {2} Neither he nor his attendants nor the people of the land paid any attention to the words the Lord had spoken through Jeremiah the prophet.
JER	37	3	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24995	" {3} King Zedekiah, however, sent Jehucal son of Shelemiah with the priest Zephaniah son of Maaseiah to Jeremiah the prophet with this message:"
JER	37	3	Jehucal	#04		24996	 << Please pray to the Lord our God for us.>>
JER	37	4	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24997	" {4} Now Jeremiah was free to come and go among the people, for he had not yet been put in prison."
JER	37	5	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24998	" {5} Pharaoh's army had marched out of Egypt, and when the Babylonians who were besieging Jerusalem heard the report about them, they withdrew from Jerusalem."
JER	37	6	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		24999	 {6} Then the word of the Lord came to Jeremiah the prophet:
JER	37	7	Jeremiah	#09		25000	" {7} << This is what the Lord, the God of Israel, says: Tell the king of Judah, who sent you to inquire of me,"
JER	37	7	God-FX1	#20		25001	" 'Pharaoh's army, which has marched out to support you, will go back to its own land, to Egypt. {8} Then the Babylonians will return and attack this city; they will capture it and burn it down.'"
JER	37	9	Jeremiah	#09		25002	" {9} << This is what the Lord says: Do not deceive yourselves, thinking, 'The Babylonians will surely leave us.' They will not!"
JER	37	10	Jeremiah	#09		25003	" {10} Even if you were to defeat the entire Babylonian army that is attacking you and only wounded men were left in their tents, they would come out and burn this city down.>>"
JER	37	11	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25004	" {11} After the Babylonian army had withdrawn from Jerusalem because of Pharaoh's army,"
JER	37	12	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25005	 {12} Jeremiah started to leave the city to go to the territory of Benjamin to get his share of the property among the people there.
JER	37	13	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25006	" {13} But when he reached the Benjamin Gate, the captain of the guard, whose name was Irijah son of Shelemiah, the son of Hananiah, arrested him and said,"
JER	37	13	Irijah	#14		25007	 << You are deserting to the Babylonians!>>
JER	37	14	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25008	" {14} Jeremiah said,"
JER	37	14	Jeremiah	#09		25009	 << That's not true! I am not deserting to the Babylonians.>>
JER	37	14	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25010	" But Irijah would not listen to him; instead, he arrested Jeremiah and brought him to the officials."
JER	37	15	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25011	" {15} They were angry with Jeremiah and had him beaten and imprisoned in the house of Jonathan the secretary, which they had made into a prison."
JER	37	16	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25012	" {16} Jeremiah was put into a vaulted cell in a dungeon, where he remained a long time. {17} Then King Zedekiah sent for him and had him brought to the palace, where he asked him privately,"
JER	37	17	Zedekiah	#12		25013	 << Is there any word from the Lord?>>
JER	37	17	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25014	 Jeremiah replied.
JER	37	17	Jeremiah	#09		25015	 << Yes! >>
JER	37	17	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25016	" Then he said,"
JER	37	17	Jeremiah	#09		25017	 << You will be handed over to the king of Babylon.>>
JER	37	18	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25018	" {18} Then Jeremiah said to King Zedekiah,"
JER	37	18	Jeremiah	#09		25019	" << What crime have I committed against you or your officials or this people, that you have put me in prison?"
JER	37	19	Jeremiah	#09		25020	" {19} Where are your prophets who prophesied to you, 'The king of Babylon will not attack you or this land'?"
JER	37	20	Jeremiah	#09		25021	" {20} But now, my lord the king, please listen. Let me bring my petition before you: Do not send me back to the house of Jonathan the secretary, or I will die there.>>"
JER	37	21	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25022	 {21} King Zedekiah then gave orders for Jeremiah to be placed in the courtyard of the guard and given bread from the street of the bakers each day until all the bread in the city was gone. 
JER	37	21	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25023	 So Jeremiah remained in the courtyard of the guard.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
JER	38	<<	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25024	JEREMIAH 38
JER	38	1	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25025	" {1} Shephatiah son of Mattan, Gedaliah son of Pashhur, "
JER	38	1	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25026	" Jehucal son of Shelemiah, "
JER	38	1	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25027	" and Pashhur son of Malkijah heard what Jeremiah was telling all the people when he said,"
JER	38	2	Jeremiah	#09		25028	 {2} << This is what the Lord says: 
JER	38	2	Jeremiah	#09		25029	" 'Whoever stays in this city will die by the sword, famine or plague, but whoever goes over to the Babylonians will live. He will escape with his life; he will live.'"
JER	38	3	Jeremiah	#09		25030	" {3} And this is what the Lord says: 'This city will certainly be handed over to the army of the king of Babylon, who will capture it.'>>"
JER	38	4	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25031	" {4} Then the officials said to the king,"
JER	38	4	Official	#17		25032	 << This man should be put to death. 
JER	38	4	Official	#17		25033	" He is discouraging the soldiers who are left in this city, as well as all the people, by the things he is saying to them."
JER	38	4	Official	#17		25034	 This man is not seeking the good of these people but their ruin.>>
JER	38	5	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25035	" {5} Then King Zedekiah answered,"
JER	38	5	Zedekiah	#12		25036	" << He is in your hands, the king can do nothing to oppose you.>>"
JER	38	6	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25037	" {6} So they took Jeremiah and put him into the cistern of Malkijah, the king's son, which was in the courtyard of the guard. "
JER	38	6	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25038	" They lowered Jeremiah by ropes into the cistern; it had no water in it, only mud, and Jeremiah sank down into the mud."
JER	38	7	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25039	" {7} But Ebed-Melech, a Cushite, an official in the royal palace, heard that they had put Jeremiah into the cistern. "
JER	38	7	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25040	" While the king was sitting in the Benjamin Gate, {8} Ebed-Melech went out of the palace and said to him,"
JER	38	9	Ebed-Melech	#16		25041	" {9} << My lord the king, these men have acted wickedly in all they have done to Jeremiah the prophet."
JER	38	9	Ebed-Melech	#16		25042	" They have thrown him into a cistern, where he will starve to death when there is no longer any bread in the city.>>"
JER	38	10	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25043	" {10} Then the king commanded Ebed-Melech the Cushite,"
JER	38	10	Zedekiah	#12		25044	 << Take thirty men from here with you and lift Jeremiah the prophet out of the cistern before he dies.>>
JER	38	11	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25045	 {11} So Ebed-Melech took the men with him and went to a room under the treasury in the palace. 
JER	38	11	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25046	 He took some old rags and worn-out clothes from there and let them down with ropes to Jeremiah in the cistern.
JER	38	12	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25047	" {12} Ebed-Melech the Cushite said to Jeremiah,"
JER	38	12	Ebed-Melech	#16		25048	 << Put these old rags and worn-out clothes under your arms to pad the ropes.>>
JER	38	12	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25049	" Jeremiah did so, {13} and they pulled him up with the ropes and lifted him out of the cistern. And Jeremiah remained in the courtyard of the guard."
JER	38	14	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25050	" {14} Then King Zedekiah sent for Jeremiah the prophet and had him brought to the third entrance to the temple of the Lord. The king said to Jeremiah,"
JER	38	14	Zedekiah	#12		25051	" << I am going to ask you something, do not hide anything from me."
JER	38	15	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25052	" {15} Jeremiah said to Zedekiah,"
JER	38	15	Jeremiah	#09		25053	" << If I give you an answer, will you not kill me? Even if I did give you counsel, you would not listen to me.>>"
JER	38	16	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25054	 {16} But King Zedekiah swore this oath secretly to Jeremiah:
JER	38	16	Zedekiah	#12		25055	" << As surely as the Lord lives, who has given us breath, I will neither kill you nor hand you over to those who are seeking your life.>>"
JER	38	17	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25056	 {17} Then Jeremiah said to Zedekiah
JER	38	17	Jeremiah	#09		25057	" << This is what the Lord God Almighty, the God of Israel, says:"
JER	38	17	Jeremiah	#09		25058	" 'If you surrender to the officers of the king of Babylon, your life will be spared and this city will not be burned down; you and your family will live."
JER	38	18	Jeremiah	#09		25059	" {18} But if you will not surrender to the officers of the king of Babylon, this city will be handed over to the Babylonians and they will burn it down; you yourself will not escape from their hands.'>>"
JER	38	19	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25060	" {19} King Zedekiah said to Jeremiah,"
JER	38	19	Zedekiah	#12		25061	" << I am afraid of the Jews who have gone over to the Babylonians, for the Babylonians may hand me over to them and they will mistreat me.>>"
JER	38	20	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25062	 {20} Jeremiah replied.
JER	38	20	Jeremiah	#09		25063	" << They will will not hand you over. Obey the Lord by doing what I tell you. Then it will go well with you, and your life will be spared."
JER	38	21	Jeremiah	#09		25064	" {21} But if you refuse to surrender, this is what the Lord has revealed to me:"
JER	38	22	Jeremiah	#09		25065	 {22} All the women left in the palace of the king of Judah will be brought out to the officials of the king of Babylon. 
JER	38	22	Jeremiah	#09		25066	 Those women will say to you: << 'They misled you and overcame you-- those trusted friends of yours. Your feet are sunk in the mud; your friends have deserted you.'
JER	38	23	Jeremiah	#09		25067	 {23} << All your wives and children will be brought out to the Babylonians. 
JER	38	23	Jeremiah	#09		25068	 You yourself will not escape from their hands but will be captured by the king of Babylon; and this city will be burned down.>>
JER	38	24	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25069	" {24} Then Zedekiah said to Jeremiah,"

JER	38	26	Zedekiah	#12		25072	" {26} then tell them, 'I was pleading with the king not to send me back to Jonathan's house to die there.'>>"
JER	38	27	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25073	" {27} All the officials did come to Jeremiah and question him, and he told them everything the king had ordered him to say. "
JER	38	27	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25074	" So they said no more to him, for no one had heard his conversation with the king."
JER	38	28	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25075	 {28} And Jeremiah remained in the courtyard of the guard until the day Jerusalem was captured.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*

JER	41	<<	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25138	JEREMIAH 41

JER	41	8	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25149	 So he let them alone and did not kill them with the others.
JER	41	9	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25150	 {9} Now the cistern where he threw all the bodies of the men he had killed along with Gedaliah was the one King Asa had made as part of his defense against Baasha king of Israel.

JER	41	13	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25157	" {13} When all the people Ishmael had with him saw Johanan son of Kareah and the army officers who were with him, they were glad."

JER	42	7	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25174	 {7} Ten days later the word of the Lord came to Jeremiah. 
JER	42	8	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25175	" {8} So he called together Johanan son of Kareah and all the army officers who were with him and all the people from the least to the greatest. {9} He said to them,"

JER	42	10	Jeremiah	#09		25177	" {10} 'If you stay in this land, I will build you up and not tear you down; I will plant you and not uproot you, for I am grieved over the disaster I have inflicted on you."
JER	42	11	Jeremiah	#09		25178	" {11} Do not be afraid of the king of Babylon, whom you now fear. Do not be afraid of him, declares the Lord, for I am with you and will save you and deliver you from his hands."
JER	42	12	Jeremiah	#09		25179	 {12} I will show you compassion so that he will have compassion on you and restore you to your land.'
JER	42	13	Jeremiah	#09		25180	" {13} << However, if you say, 'We will not stay in this land,' and so disobey the Lord your God,"
JER	42	14	Jeremiah	#09		25181	" {14} and if you say, 'No, we will go and live in Egypt, where we will not see war or hear the trumpet or be hungry for bread,'"
JER	42	15	Jeremiah	#09		25182	" {15} then hear the word of the Lord, O remnant of Judah. This is what the Lord Almighty, the God of Israel, says: 'If you are determined to go to Egypt and you do go to settle there,"
JER	42	16	Jeremiah	#09		25183	" {16} then the sword you fear will overtake you there, and the famine you dread will follow you into Egypt, and there you will die."
JER	42	17	Jeremiah	#09		25184	" {17} Indeed, all who are determined to go to Egypt to settle there will die by the sword, famine and plague; not one of them will survive or escape the disaster I will bring on them.'"
JER	42	18	Jeremiah	#09		25185	" {18} This is what the Lord Almighty, the God of Israel, says:"
JER	42	18	Jeremiah	#09		25186	" 'As my anger and wrath have been poured out on those who lived in Jerusalem, so will my wrath be poured out on you when you go to Egypt. "
JER	42	18	Jeremiah	#09		25187	" You will be an object of cursing and horror, of condemnation and reproach; you will never see this place again.'"
JER	42	19	Jeremiah	#09		25188	" {19} << O remnant of Judah, the Lord has told you, 'Do not go to Egypt.' "
JER	42	19	Jeremiah	#09		25189	" Be sure of this: I warn you today {20} that you made a fatal mistake when you sent me to the Lord your God and said, 'Pray to the Lord our God for us; tell us everything he says and we will do it.'"
JER	42	21	Jeremiah	#09		25190	" {21} I have told you today, but you still have not obeyed the Lord your God in all he sent me to tell you."
JER	42	22	Jeremiah	#09		25191	" {22} So now, be sure of this: You will die by the sword, famine and plague in the place where you want to go to settle.>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
JER	43	<<	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25192	JEREMIAH 43
JER	43	1	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25193	 {1} When Jeremiah finished telling the people all the words of the Lord their God--everything the Lord had sent him to tell them--
JER	43	2	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25194	" {2} Azariah son of Hoshaiah and Johanan son of Kareah and all the arrogant men said to Jeremiah,"
JER	43	2	Azariah	#16		25195	" << You are lying! The Lord our God has not sent you to say, 'You must not go to Egypt to settle there.'"
JER	43	3	Azariah	#16		25196	" {3} But Baruch son of Neriah is inciting you against us to hand us over to the Babylonians, so they may kill us or carry us into exile to Babylon.>>"
JER	43	4	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25197	 {4} So Johanan son of Kareah and all the army officers and all the people disobeyed the Lord's command to stay in the land of Judah.
JER	43	5	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25198	" {5} Instead, Johanan son of Kareah and all the army officers led away all the remnant of Judah who had come back to live in the land of Judah from all the nations where they had been scattered."
JER	43	6	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25199	" {6} They also led away all the men, women and children and the king's daughters whom Nebuzaradan commander of the imperial guard had left with Gedaliah son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan, and Jeremiah the prophet and Baruch son of Neriah."
JER	43	7	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25200	 {7} So they entered Egypt in disobedience to the Lord and went as far as Tahpanhes. {8} In Tahpanhes the word of the Lord came to Jeremiah:
JER	43	9	God-FX1	#20		25201	" {9} << While the Jews are watching, take some large stones with you and bury them in clay in the brick pavement at the entrance to Pharaoh's palace in Tahpanhes. {10} Then say to them,"
JER	43	10	Jeremiah	#09		25202	" 'This is what the Lord Almighty, the God of Israel, says:"
JER	43	10	Jeremiah	#09		25203	" I will send for my servant Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and I will set his throne over these stones I have buried here; he will spread his royal canopy above them."
JER	43	11	Jeremiah	#09		25204	" {11} He will come and attack Egypt, bringing death to those destined for death, captivity to those destined for captivity, and the sword to those destined for the sword."
JER	43	12	Jeremiah	#09		25205	 {12} He will set fire to the temples of the gods of Egypt; he will burn their temples and take their gods captive. 
JER	43	12	Jeremiah	#09		25206	" As a shepherd wraps his garment around him, so will he wrap Egypt around himself and depart from there unscathed."
JER	43	13	Jeremiah	#09		25207	 {13} There in the temple of the sun in Egypt he will demolish the sacred pillars and will burn down the temples of the gods of Egypt.'>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
JER	44	<<	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25208	JEREMIAH 44
JER	44	1	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25209	" {1} This word came to Jeremiah concerning all the Jews living in Lower Egypt--in Migdol, Tahpanhes and Memphis--and in Upper Egypt:"
JER	44	2	Jeremiah	#09		25210	" {2} << This is what the Lord Almighty, the God of Israel, says: "
JER	44	2	Jeremiah	#09		25211	 You saw the great disaster I brought on Jerusalem and on all the towns of Judah.  Today they lie deserted and in ruins {3} because of the evil they have done. 
JER	44	3	Jeremiah	#09		25212	 They provoked me to anger by burning incense and by worshiping other gods that neither they nor you nor your fathers ever knew.
JER	44	4	Jeremiah	#09		25213	" {4} Again and again I sent my servants the prophets, who said, 'Do not do this detestable thing that I hate!'"
JER	44	5	Jeremiah	#09		25214	 {5} But they did not listen or pay attention; they did not turn from their wickedness or stop burning incense to other gods.
JER	44	6	Jeremiah	#09		25215	" {6} Therefore, my fierce anger was poured out; it raged against the towns of Judah and the streets of Jerusalem and made them the desolate ruins they are today."
JER	44	7	Jeremiah	#09		25216	" {7} << Now this is what the Lord God Almighty, the God of Israel, says: "
JER	44	7	Jeremiah	#09		25217	" Why bring such great disaster on yourselves by cutting off from Judah the men and women, the children and infants, and so leave yourselves without a remnant?"
JER	44	8	Jeremiah	#09		25218	" {8} Why provoke me to anger with what your hands have made, burning incense to other gods in Egypt, where you have come to live? "
JER	44	8	Jeremiah	#09		25219	 You will destroy yourselves and make yourselves an object of cursing and reproach among all the nations on earth.
JER	44	9	Jeremiah	#09		25220	 {9} Have you forgotten the wickedness committed by your fathers and by the kings and queens of Judah and the wickedness committed by you and your wives in the land of Judah and the streets of Jerusalem?
JER	44	10	Jeremiah	#09		25221	" {10} To this day they have not humbled themselves or shown reverence, nor have they followed my law and the decrees I set before you and your fathers."
JER	44	11	Jeremiah	#09		25222	" {11} << Therefore, this is what the Lord Almighty, the God of Israel, says: I am determined to bring disaster on you and to destroy all Judah."
JER	44	12	Jeremiah	#09		25223	 {12} I will take away the remnant of Judah who were determined to go to Egypt to settle there. 
JER	44	12	Jeremiah	#09		25224	" They will all perish in Egypt; they will fall by the sword or die from famine. From the least to the greatest, they will die by sword or famine. "
JER	44	12	Jeremiah	#09		25225	" They will become an object of cursing and horror, of condemnation and reproach."
JER	44	13	Jeremiah	#09		25226	" {13} I will punish those who live in Egypt with the sword, famine and plague, as I punished Jerusalem."
JER	44	14	Jeremiah	#09		25227	" {14} None of the remnant of Judah who have gone to live in Egypt will escape or survive to return to the land of Judah, to which they long to return and live; none will return except a few fugitives.>>"
JER	44	15	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25228	" {15} Then all the men who knew that their wives were burning incense to other gods, along with all the women who were present--a large assembly--and all the people living in Lower and Upper Egypt, said to Jeremiah,"
JER	44	16	Egyptian	#21		25229	 {16} << We will not listen to the message you have spoken to us in the name of the Lord!
JER	44	17	Egyptian	#21		25230	 {17} We will certainly do everything we said we would: 
JER	44	17	Egyptian	#21		25231	" We will burn incense to the Queen of Heaven and will pour out drink offerings to her just as we and our fathers, our kings and our officials did in the towns of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem. "
JER	44	17	Egyptian	#21		25232	 At that time we had plenty of food and were well off and suffered no harm.
JER	44	18	Egyptian	#21		25233	" {18} But ever since we stopped burning incense to the Queen of Heaven and pouring out drink offerings to her, we have had nothing and have been perishing by sword and famine.>>"
JER	44	19	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25234	" {19} And the women said,"
JER	44	19	Woman	#22		25235	" << When we burned incense to the Queen of Heaven and poured out drink offerings to her, did not our husbands know that we were making cakes like her image and pouring out drink offerings to her?>>"
JER	44	20	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25236	" {20} Then Jeremiah said to all the people, both men and women, who were answering him,"
JER	44	21	Jeremiah	#09		25237	" {21} <<Did not the Lord remember and think about the incense burned in the towns of Judah and the streets of Jerusalem by you and your fathers, your kings and your officials and the people of the land?"
JER	44	22	Jeremiah	#09		25238	" {22} When the Lord could no longer endure your wicked actions and the detestable things you did, your land became an object of cursing and a desolate waste without inhabitants, as it is today."
JER	44	23	Jeremiah	#09		25239	" {23} Because you have burned incense and have sinned against the Lord and have not obeyed him or followed his law or his decrees or his stipulations, this disaster has come upon you, as you now see.>>"
JER	44	24	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25240	" {24} Then Jeremiah said to all the people, including the women,"
JER	44	24	Jeremiah	#09		25241	" << Hear the word of the Lord, all you people of Judah in Egypt."
JER	44	25	Jeremiah	#09		25242	" {25} This is what the Lord Almighty, the God of Israel, says: "
JER	44	25	Jeremiah	#09		25243	" You and your wives have shown by your actions what you promised when you said, 'We will certainly carry out the vows we made to burn incense and pour out drink offerings to the Queen of Heaven.' >> "
JER	44	25	Jeremiah	#09		25244	" Go ahead then, do what you promised! Keep your vows! {26} But hear the word of the Lord, all Jews living in Egypt:"
JER	44	26	Jeremiah	#09		25245	" 'I swear by my great name,' says the Lord, 'that no one from Judah living anywhere in Egypt will ever again invoke my name or swear, << As surely as the Sovereign Lord lives.>>"
JER	44	27	Jeremiah	#09		25246	" {27} For I am watching over them for harm, not for good; the Jews in Egypt will perish by sword and famine until they are all destroyed."
JER	44	28	Jeremiah	#09		25247	 {28} Those who escape the sword and return to the land of Judah from Egypt will be very few. 
JER	44	28	Jeremiah	#09		25248	 Then the whole remnant of Judah who came to live in Egypt will know whose word will stand--mine or theirs.
JER	44	29	Jeremiah	#09		25249	" {29} << 'This will be the sign to you that I will punish you in this place,' declares the Lord, 'so that you will know that my threats of harm against you will surely stand.'"
JER	44	30	Jeremiah	#09		25250	 {30} This is what the Lord says:
JER	44	30	Jeremiah	#09		25251	" 'I am going to hand Pharaoh Hophra king of Egypt over to his enemies who seek his life, just as I handed Zedekiah king of Judah over to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, the enemy who was seeking his life.'>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
JER	45	<<	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25252	JEREMIAH 45

JER	46	<<	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25259	JEREMIAH 46
JER	46	1	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25260	 {1} This is the word of the Lord that came to Jeremiah the prophet concerning the nations:
JER	46	2	Jeremiah	#09		25261	" {2} Concerning Egypt: This is the message against the army of Pharaoh Neco king of Egypt,"
JER	46	2	Jeremiah	#09		25262	 which was defeated at Carchemish on the Euphrates River 
JER	46	2	Jeremiah	#09		25263	 by Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon in the fourth year of Jehoiakim son of Josiah king of Judah:
JER	46	3	Jeremiah	#09		25264	" {3} << Prepare your shields, both large and small, and march out for battle!"
JER	46	4	Jeremiah	#09		25265	" {4} Harness the horses, mount the steeds! Take your positions with helmets on! Polish your spears, put on your armor!"
JER	46	5	Jeremiah	#09		25266	" {5} What do I see? They are terrified, they are retreating, their warriors are defeated. They flee in haste without looking back, and there is terror on every side,>> declares the Lord."
JER	46	6	Jeremiah	#09		25267	 {6} The swift cannot flee nor the strong escape. In the north by the River Euphrates they stumble and fall.
JER	46	7	Jeremiah	#09		25268	" {7} << Who is this that rises like the Nile, like rivers of surging waters?"
JER	46	8	Jeremiah	#09		25269	" {8} Egypt rises like the Nile, like rivers of surging waters. She says, 'I will rise and cover the earth; I will destroy cities and their people.'"
JER	46	9	Jeremiah	#09		25270	" {9} Charge, O horses! Drive furiously, O charioteers! March on, O warriors-- men of Cush and Put who carry shields, men of Lydia who draw the bow."
JER	46	10	Jeremiah	#09		25271	" {10} But that day belongs to the Lord, the Lord Almighty-- a day of vengeance, for vengeance on his foes. "
JER	46	10	Jeremiah	#09		25272	" The sword will devour till it is satisfied, till it has quenched its thirst with blood. "
JER	46	10	Jeremiah	#09		25273	" For the Lord, the Lord Almighty, will offer sacrifice in the land of the north by the River Euphrates."
JER	46	11	Jeremiah	#09		25274	" {11} << Go up to Gilead and get balm, O Virgin Daughter of Egypt. But you multiply remedies in vain; there is no healing for you."
JER	46	12	Jeremiah	#09		25275	 {12} The nations will hear of your shame; your cries will fill the earth. One warrior will stumble over another; both will fall down together.>>
JER	46	13	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25276	 {13} This is the message the Lord spoke to Jeremiah the prophet about the coming of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon to attack Egypt:
JER	46	14	God-FX1	#20		25277	" {14} << Announce this in Egypt, and proclaim it in Migdol; proclaim it also in Memphis and Tahpanhes:"
JER	46	14	Jeremiah	#09		25278	" 'Take your positions and get ready, for the sword devours those around you.' {15} Why will your warriors be laid low? They cannot stand, for the Lord will push them down."
JER	46	16	Jeremiah	#09		25279	" {16} They will stumble repeatedly; they will fall over each other. They will say, 'Get up, let us go back to our own people and our native lands, away from the sword of the oppressor.'"
JER	46	17	Jeremiah	#09		25280	" {17} There they will exclaim, 'Pharaoh king of Egypt is only a loud noise; he has missed his opportunity.'"
JER	46	18	Jeremiah	#09		25281	" {18} << As surely as I live,>> declares the King, whose name is the Lord Almighty, << one will come who is like Tabor among the mountains, like Carmel by the sea."
JER	46	19	Jeremiah	#09		25282	" {19} Pack your belongings for exile, you who live in Egypt, for Memphis will be laid waste and lie in ruins without inhabitant."
JER	46	20	Jeremiah	#09		25283	" {20} << Egypt is a beautiful heifer, but a gadfly is coming against her from the north. {21} Even the mercenaries in her ranks are like fattened calves. "
JER	46	21	Jeremiah	#09		25284	" They too will turn and flee together, they will not stand their ground, for the day of disaster is coming upon them, the time for them to be punished."
JER	46	22	Jeremiah	#09		25285	" {22} Egypt will hiss like a fleeing serpent as the enemy advances in force; force; they will come against her with axes, like men who cut down trees."
JER	46	23	Jeremiah	#09		25286	" {23} They will chop down her forest, declares the Lord. << dense though it be. They are more numerous than locusts, they cannot be counted."
JER	46	24	Jeremiah	#09		25287	" {24} The Daughter of Egypt will be put to shame, handed over to the people of the north.>>"
JER	46	25	Jeremiah	#09		25288	" {25} The Lord Almighty, the God of Israel, says: << I am about to bring punishment on Amon god of Thebes, on Pharaoh, on Egypt and her gods and her kings, and on those who rely on Pharaoh."
JER	46	26	Jeremiah	#09		25289	" {26} I will hand them over to those who seek their lives, to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon and his officers. Later, however, Egypt will be inhabited as in times past,>> declares the Lord."
JER	46	27	God-FX1	#20		25290	" {27} << Do not fear, O Jacob my servant; do not be dismayed, O Israel. I will surely save you out of a distant place, your descendants from the land of their exile. "
JER	46	27	God-FX1	#20		25291	" Jacob will again have peace and security, and no one will make him afraid. {28} Do not fear, O Jacob my servant, for I am with you, declares the Lord. "
JER	46	28	God-FX1	#20		25292	" Though I completely destroy all the nations among which I scatter you, I will not completely destroy you. "
JER	46	28	God-FX1	#20		25293	 I will discipline you but only with justice; I will not let you go entirely unpunished.>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
JER	47	<<	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25294	JEREMIAH 47

JER	47	2	Jeremiah	#09		25296	 {2} This is what the Lord says: 
JER	47	2	Jeremiah	#09		25297	" << See how the waters are rising in the north; they will become an overflowing torrent. They will overflow the land and everything in it, the towns and those who live in them. "
JER	47	2	Jeremiah	#09		25298	" The people will cry out; all who dwell in the land will wail {3} at the sound of the hoofs of galloping steeds, at the noise of enemy chariots and the rumble of their wheels. "
JER	47	3	Jeremiah	#09		25299	 Fathers will not turn to help their children; their hands will hang limp. 
JER	47	4	Jeremiah	#09		25300	 {4} For the day has come to destroy all the Philistines and to cut off all survivors who could help Tyre and Sidon.  
JER	47	4	Jeremiah	#09		25301	" The Lord is about to destroy the Philistines, the remnant from the coasts of Caphtor."

JER	47	7	Jeremiah	#09		25304	" {7} But how can it rest when the Lord has commanded it, when he has ordered it to attack Ashkelon and the coast?>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
JER	48	<<	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25305	JEREMIAH 48
JER	48	1	Jeremiah	#09		25306	" {1} Concerning Moab: This is what the Lord Almighty, the God of Israel, says: << Woe to Nebo, for it will be ruined. "
JER	48	1	Jeremiah	#09		25307	 Kiriathaim will be disgraced and captured; the stronghold will be disgraced and shattered.
JER	48	2	Jeremiah	#09		25308	" {2} Moab will be praised no more; in Heshbon men will plot her downfall: 'Come, let us put an end to that nation.' You too, O Madmen, will be silenced; the sword will pursue you."
JER	48	3	Jeremiah	#09		25309	" {3} Listen to the cries from Horonaim, cries of great havoc and destruction. {4} Moab will be broken; her little ones will cry out."
JER	48	5	Jeremiah	#09		25310	" {5} They go up the way to Luhith, weeping bitterly as they go; on the road down to Horonaim anguished cries over the destruction are heard."
JER	48	6	Jeremiah	#09		25311	 {6} Flee! Run for your lives; become like a bush in the desert.
JER	48	7	Jeremiah	#09		25312	" {7} Since you trust in your deeds and riches, you too will be taken captive, and Chemosh will go into exile, together with his priests and officials."
JER	48	8	Jeremiah	#09		25313	" {8} The destroyer will come against every town, and not a town will escape. The valley will be ruined and the plateau destroyed, because the Lord has spoken."
JER	48	9	Jeremiah	#09		25314	" {9} Put salt on Moab, for she will be laid waste; her towns will become desolate, with no one to live in them. << A curse on him who is lax in doing the Lord's work!"
JER	48	10	Jeremiah	#09		25315	 {10} A curse on him who keeps his sword from bloodshed!
JER	48	11	Jeremiah	#09		25316	" {11} << Moab has been at rest from youth, like wine left on its dregs, not poured from one jar to another-- she has not gone into exile. So she tastes as she did, and her aroma is unchanged."
JER	48	12	Jeremiah	#09		25317	" {12} But days are coming,>> declares the Lord, << when I will send men who pour from jars, and they will pour her out; they will empty her jars and smash her jugs."
JER	48	13	Jeremiah	#09		25318	" {13} Then Moab will be ashamed of Chemosh, as the house of Israel was ashamed when they trusted in Bethel."
JER	48	14	Jeremiah	#09		25319	" {14} << How can you say, 'We are warriors, men valiant in battle'?"
JER	48	15	Jeremiah	#09		25320	" {15} Moab will be destroyed and her towns invaded; her finest young men will go down in the slaughter,>> declares the King, whose name is the Lord Almighty."
JER	48	16	Jeremiah	#09		25321	 {16} << The fall of Moab is at hand; her calamity will come quickly.
JER	48	17	Jeremiah	#09		25322	" {17} Mourn for her, all who live around her, all who know her fame; say, 'How broken is the mighty scepter, how broken the glorious staff!'"
JER	48	18	Jeremiah	#09		25323	" {18} << Come down from your glory and sit on the parched ground, O inhabitants of the Daughter of Dibon, for he who destroys Moab will come up against you and ruin your fortified cities."
JER	48	19	Jeremiah	#09		25324	" {19} Stand by the road and watch, you who live in Aroer. Ask the man fleeing and the woman escaping, ask them, 'What has happened?'"
JER	48	20	Jeremiah	#09		25325	" {20} Moab is disgraced, for she is shattered. Wail and cry out! Announce by the Arnon that Moab is destroyed."
JER	48	21	Jeremiah	#09		25326	" {21} Judgment has come to the plateau-- to Holon, Jahzah and Mephaath,"
JER	48	22	Jeremiah	#09		25327	" {22} to Dibon, Nebo and Beth Diblathaim,"
JER	48	23	Jeremiah	#09		25328	" {23} to Kiriathaim, Beth Gamul and Beth Meon,"
JER	48	24	Jeremiah	#09		25329	" {24} to Kerioth and Bozrah -- to all the towns of Moab, far and near."
JER	48	25	Jeremiah	#09		25330	" {25} Moab's horn is cut off; her arm is broken,>> declares the Lord."
JER	48	26	Jeremiah	#09		25331	" {26} << Make her drunk, for she has defied the Lord. Let Moab wallow in her vomit; let her be an object of ridicule."
JER	48	27	Jeremiah	#09		25332	" {27} Was not Israel the object of your ridicule? Was she caught among thieves, that you shake your head in scorn whenever you speak of her?"
JER	48	28	Jeremiah	#09		25333	" {28} Abandon your towns and dwell among the rocks, you who live in Moab. Be like a dove that makes its nest at the mouth of a cave."
JER	48	29	Jeremiah	#09		25334	" {29} << We have heard of Moab's pride-- her overweening pride and conceit, her pride and arrogance and the haughtiness of her heart."
JER	48	30	Jeremiah	#09		25335	" {30} I know her insolence but it is futile,>> declares the Lord, << and her boasts accomplish nothing."
JER	48	31	Jeremiah	#09		25336	" {31} Therefore I wail over Moab, for all Moab I cry out, I moan for the men of Kir Hareseth."
JER	48	32	Jeremiah	#09		25337	" {32} I weep for you, as Jazer weeps, O vines of Sibmah. Your branches spread as far as the sea; they reached as far as the sea of Jazer. The destroyer has fallen on your ripened fruit and grapes."
JER	48	33	Jeremiah	#09		25338	 {33} Joy and gladness are gone from the orchards and fields of Moab. 
JER	48	33	Jeremiah	#09		25339	" I have stopped the flow of wine from the presses; no one treads them with shouts of joy. Although there are shouts, they are not shouts of joy."
JER	48	34	Jeremiah	#09		25340	" {34} << The sound of their cry rises from Heshbon to Elealeh and Jahaz, "
JER	48	34	Jeremiah	#09		25341	" from Zoar as far as Horonaim and Eglath Shelishiyah, "
JER	48	34	Jeremiah	#09		25342	 for even the waters of Nimrim are dried up.
JER	48	35	Jeremiah	#09		25343	" {35} In Moab I will put an end to those who make offerings on the high places and burn incense to their gods,>> declares the Lord."
JER	48	36	Jeremiah	#09		25344	 {36} << So my heart laments for Moab like a flute; it laments like a flute for the men of Kir Hareseth. The wealth they acquired is gone.
JER	48	37	Jeremiah	#09		25345	 {37} Every head is shaved and every beard cut off; every hand is slashed and every waist is covered with sackcloth.
JER	48	38	Jeremiah	#09		25346	" {38} On all the roofs in Moab and in the public squares there is nothing but mourning, for I have broken Moab like a jar that no one wants,>> declares the Lord."
JER	48	39	Jeremiah	#09		25347	" {39} << How shattered she is! How they wail! How Moab turns her back in shame! Moab has become an object of ridicule, an object of horror to all those around her.>>"
JER	48	40	Jeremiah	#09		25348	" {40} This is what the Lord says: << Look! An eagle is swooping down, spreading its wings over Moab."
JER	48	41	Jeremiah	#09		25349	 {41} Kerioth will be captured and the strongholds taken. In that day the hearts of Moab's warriors will be like the heart of a woman in labor.
JER	48	42	Jeremiah	#09		25350	" {42} Moab will be destroyed as a nation because she defied the Lord. {43} Terror and pit and snare await you, O people of Moab,>> declares the Lord."
JER	48	44	Jeremiah	#09		25351	" {44} << Whoever flees from the terror will fall into a pit, whoever climbs out of the pit will be caught in a snare; for I will bring upon Moab the year of her punishment,>> declares the Lord."
JER	48	45	Jeremiah	#09		25352	" {45} << In the shadow of Heshbon the fugitives stand helpless, for a fire has gone out from Heshbon, a blaze from the midst of Sihon; it burns the foreheads of Moab, the skulls of the noisy boasters."
JER	48	46	Jeremiah	#09		25353	" {46} Woe to you, O Moab! The people of Chemosh are destroyed; your sons are taken into exile and your daughters into captivity."
JER	48	47	Jeremiah	#09		25354	" {47} << Yet I will restore the fortunes of Moab in days to come,>> declares the Lord. Here ends the judgment on Moab.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"

JER	50	7	Jeremiah	#09		25415	" {7} Whoever found them devoured them; their enemies said, 'We are not guilty, for they sinned against the Lord, their true pasture, the Lord, the hope of their fathers.'"

JER	50	10	Jeremiah	#09		25419	" {10} So Babylonia will be plundered; all who plunder her will have their fill,>> declares the Lord."
JER	50	11	Jeremiah	#09		25420	" {11} << Because you rejoice and are glad, you who pillage my inheritance, because you frolic like a heifer threshing grain and neigh like stallions, {12} your mother will be greatly ashamed; "

JER	50	13	Jeremiah	#09		25422	 {13} Because of the Lord's anger she will not be inhabited but will be completely desolate. All who pass Babylon will be horrified and scoff because of all her wounds.
JER	50	14	Jeremiah	#09		25423	" {14} << Take up your positions around Babylon, all you who draw the bow. Shoot at her! Spare no arrows, for she has sinned against the Lord."

JER	50	16	Jeremiah	#09		25426	" {16} Cut off from Babylon the sower, and the reaper with his sickle at harvest. "
JER	50	16	Jeremiah	#09		25427	" Because of the sword of the oppressor let everyone return to his own people, let everyone flee to his own land."

JER	50	17	Jeremiah	#09		25429	 The first to devour him was the king of Assyria; the last to crush his bones was Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon.>>

JER	50	27	Jeremiah	#09		25438	" {27} Kill all her young bulls; let them go down to the slaughter! Woe to them! For their day has come, the time for them to be punished."
JER	50	28	Jeremiah	#09		25439	" {28} Listen to the fugitives and refugees from Babylon declaring in Zion how the Lord our God has taken vengeance, vengeance for his temple."
JER	50	29	Jeremiah	#09		25440	" {29} << Summon archers against Babylon, all those who draw the bow. Encamp all around her; let no one escape. "

JER	50	32	Jeremiah	#09		25444	 {32} The arrogant one will stumble and fall and no one will help her up; I will kindle a fire in her towns that will consume all who are around her.>>

JER	50	34	Jeremiah	#09		25446	" {34} Yet their Redeemer is strong; the Lord Almighty is his name. He will vigorously defend their cause so that he may bring rest to their land, but unrest to those who live in Babylon."

JER	50	36	Jeremiah	#09		25448	 {36} A sword against her false prophets! They will become fools. A sword against her warriors! They will be filled with terror.
JER	50	37	Jeremiah	#09		25449	 {37} A sword against her horses and chariots and all the foreigners in her ranks! They will become women. A sword against her treasures! They will be plundered.
JER	50	38	Jeremiah	#09		25450	" {38} A drought on her waters! They will dry up. For it is a land of idols, idols that will go mad with terror."
JER	50	39	Jeremiah	#09		25451	" {39} << So desert creatures and hyenas will live there, and there the owl will dwell. It will never again be inhabited or lived in from generation to generation."

JER	50	42	Jeremiah	#09		25455	" They sound like the roaring sea as they ride on their horses; they come like men in battle formation to attack you, O Daughter of Babylon."
JER	50	43	Jeremiah	#09		25456	" {43} The king of Babylon has heard reports about them, and his hands hang limp. Anguish has gripped him, pain like that of a woman in labor."
