JER	51	<<	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25462	JEREMIAH 51
JER	51	1	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25463	 {1} This is what the Lord says:
JER	51	1	Jeremiah	#09		25464	" << See, I will stir up the spirit of a destroyer against Babylon and the people of Leb Kamai."
JER	51	2	Jeremiah	#09		25465	 {2} I will send foreigners to Babylon to winnow her and to devastate her land; they will oppose her on every side in the day of her disaster.
JER	51	3	Jeremiah	#09		25466	" {3} Let not the archer string his bow, nor let him put on his armor. Do not spare her young men; completely destroy her army."
JER	51	4	Jeremiah	#09		25467	" {4} They will fall down slain in Babylon, fatally wounded in her streets."
JER	51	5	Jeremiah	#09		25468	" {5} For Israel and Judah have not been forsaken by their God, the Lord Almighty, though their land is full of guilt before the Holy One of Israel."
JER	51	6	Jeremiah	#09		25469	 {6} << Flee from Babylon! Run for your lives! Do not be destroyed because of her sins. It is time for the Lord's vengeance; he will pay her what she deserves.
JER	51	7	Jeremiah	#09		25470	 {7} Babylon was a gold cup in the Lord's hand; she made the whole earth drunk. The nations drank her wine; therefore they have now gone mad.
JER	51	8	Jeremiah	#09		25471	 {8} Babylon will suddenly fall and be broken. Wail over her! Get balm for her pain; perhaps she can be healed.
JER	51	9	Man	#15		25472	" {9} << 'We would have healed Babylon, but she cannot be healed;"
JER	51	9	Man	#15		25473	" let us leave her and each go to his own land, for her judgment reaches to the skies, it rises as high as the clouds.'"
JER	51	10	Jeremiah	#09		25474	" {10} << 'The Lord has vindicated us; come, let us tell in Zion what the Lord our God has done.'"
JER	51	11	Jeremiah	#09		25475	" {11} << Sharpen the arrows, take up the shields!  "
JER	51	11	Jeremiah	#09		25476	" The Lord has stirred up the kings of the Medes, because his purpose is to destroy Babylon. The Lord will take vengeance, vengeance for his temple."
JER	51	12	Jeremiah	#09		25477	" {12} Lift up a banner against the walls of Babylon! Reinforce the guard, station the watchmen, prepare an ambush! "
JER	51	12	Jeremiah	#09		25478	" The Lord will carry out his purpose, his decree against the people of Babylon."
JER	51	13	Jeremiah	#09		25479	" {13} You who live by many waters and are rich in treasures, your end has come, the time for you to be cut off."
JER	51	14	Jeremiah	#09		25480	" {14} The Lord Almighty has sworn by himself: I will surely fill you with men, as with a swarm of locusts, and they will shout in triumph over you."
JER	51	15	Jeremiah	#09		25481	 {15} << He made the earth by his power; he founded the world by his wisdom and stretched out the heavens by his understanding.
JER	51	16	Jeremiah	#09		25482	" {16} When he thunders, the waters in the heavens roar; he makes clouds rise from the ends of the earth. He sends lightning with the rain and brings out the wind from his storehouses."
JER	51	17	Jeremiah	#09		25483	 {17} << Every man is senseless and without knowledge; every goldsmith is shamed by his idols. His images are a fraud; they have no breath in them.
JER	51	18	Jeremiah	#09		25484	" {18} They are worthless, the objects of mockery; when their judgment comes, they will perish."
JER	51	19	Jeremiah	#09		25485	" {19} He who is the Portion of Jacob is not like these, for he is the Maker of all things, including the tribe of his inheritance-- the Lord Almighty is his name."
JER	51	20	Jeremiah	#09		25486	" {20} << You are my war club, my weapon for battle-- with you I shatter nations, with you I destroy kingdoms,"
JER	51	21	Jeremiah	#09		25487	" {21} with you I shatter horse and rider, with you I shatter chariot and driver,"
JER	51	22	Jeremiah	#09		25488	" {22} with you I shatter man and woman, with you I shatter old man and youth, with you I shatter young man and maiden,"
JER	51	23	Jeremiah	#09		25489	" {23} with you I shatter shepherd and flock, with you I shatter farmer and oxen, with you I shatter governors and officials."
JER	51	24	Jeremiah	#09		25490	" {24} << Before your eyes I will repay Babylon and all who live in Babylonia for all the wrong they have done in Zion,>> declares the Lord."
JER	51	25	Jeremiah	#09		25491	" {25} << I am against you, O destroying mountain, you who destroy the whole earth,>> declares the Lord. "
JER	51	25	Jeremiah	#09		25492	" << I will stretch out my hand against you, roll you off the cliffs, and make you a burned-out mountain."
JER	51	26	Jeremiah	#09		25493	" {26} No rock will be taken from you for a cornerstone, nor any stone for a foundation, for you will be desolate forever,>> declares the Lord."
JER	51	27	Jeremiah	#09		25494	 {27} << Lift up a banner in the land! Blow the trumpet among the nations! Prepare the nations for battle against her; summon against her these kingdoms: 
JER	51	27	Jeremiah	#09		25495	" Ararat, Minni and Ashkenaz. "
JER	51	27	Jeremiah	#09		25496	 Appoint a commander against her; send up horses like a swarm of locusts.
JER	51	28	Jeremiah	#09		25497	" {28} Prepare the nations for battle against her-- the kings of the Medes, their governors and all their officials, and all the countries they rule."
JER	51	29	Jeremiah	#09		25498	" {29} The land trembles and writhes, for the Lord's purposes against Babylon stand-- to lay waste the land of Babylon so that no one will live there."
JER	51	30	Jeremiah	#09		25499	 {30} Babylon's warriors have stopped fighting; they remain in their strongholds. 
JER	51	30	Jeremiah	#09		25500	 Their strength is exhausted; they have become like women. Her dwellings are set on fire; the bars of her gates are broken.
JER	51	31	Jeremiah	#09		25501	" {31} One courier follows another and messenger follows messenger to announce to the king of Babylon that his entire city is captured,"
JER	51	32	Jeremiah	#09		25502	" {32} the river crossings seized, the marshes set on fire, and the soldiers terrified.>>"
JER	51	33	Jeremiah	#09		25503	" {33} This is what the Lord Almighty, the God of Israel, says: "
JER	51	33	Jeremiah	#09		25504	 << The Daughter of Babylon is like a threshing floor at the time it is trampled; the time to harvest her will soon come.>>
JER	51	34	Jeremiah	#09		25505	" {34} << Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon has devoured us, he has thrown us into confusion, he has made us an empty jar."
JER	51	34	Jeremiah	#09		25506	" Like a serpent he has swallowed us and filled his stomach with our delicacies, and then has spewed us out."
JER	51	35	Jeremiah	#09		25507	" {35} May the violence done to our flesh be upon Babylon,>> say the inhabitants of Zion. << May our blood be on those who live in Babylonia,>> says Jerusalem."
JER	51	36	Jeremiah	#09		25508	" {36} Therefore, this is what the Lord says: << See, I will defend your cause and avenge you; I will dry up her sea and make her springs dry."
JER	51	37	Jeremiah	#09		25509	" {37} Babylon will be a heap of ruins, a haunt of jackals, an object of horror and scorn, a place where no one lives. {38} Her people all roar like young lions, they growl like lion cubs."
JER	51	39	Jeremiah	#09		25510	" {39} But while they are aroused, I will set out a feast for them and make them drunk, so that they shout with laughter-- then sleep forever and not awake,>> declares the Lord."
JER	51	40	Jeremiah	#09		25511	" {40} << I will bring them down like lambs to the slaughter, like rams and goats."
JER	51	41	Jeremiah	#09		25512	" {41} << How Sheshach will be captured, the boast of the whole earth seized! What a horror Babylon will be among the nations!"
JER	51	42	Jeremiah	#09		25513	" {42} The sea will rise over Babylon; its roaring waves will cover her. {43} Her towns will be desolate, a dry and desert land, a land where no one lives, through which no man travels."
JER	51	44	Jeremiah	#09		25514	 {44} I will punish Bel in Babylon and make him spew out what he has swallowed. The nations will no longer stream to him. And the wall of Babylon will fall.
JER	51	45	Jeremiah	#09		25515	" {45} << Come out of her, my people! Run for your lives! Run from the fierce anger of the Lord."
JER	51	46	Jeremiah	#09		25516	" {46} Do not lose heart or be afraid when rumors are heard in the land; one rumor comes this year, another the next, rumors of violence in the land and of ruler against ruler."
JER	51	47	Jeremiah	#09		25517	 {47} For the time will surely come when I will punish the idols of Babylon; her whole land will be disgraced and her slain will all lie fallen within her.
JER	51	48	Jeremiah	#09		25518	" {48} Then heaven and earth and all that is in them will shout for joy over Babylon, for out of the north destroyers will attack her,>> declares the Lord."
JER	51	49	Jeremiah	#09		25519	" {49} << Babylon must fall because of Israel's slain, just as the slain in all the earth have fallen because of Babylon."
JER	51	50	Jeremiah	#09		25520	" {50} You who have escaped the sword, leave and do not linger! Remember the Lord in a distant land, and think on Jerusalem.>>"
JER	51	51	Man	#05		25521	" {51} << We are disgraced, for we have been insulted and shame covers our faces, because foreigners have entered the holy places of the Lord's house.>>"
JER	51	52	Jeremiah	#09		25522	" {52} << But days are coming,>> declares the Lord, << when I will punish her idols, and throughout her land the wounded will groan."
JER	51	53	Jeremiah	#09		25523	" {53} Even if Babylon reaches the sky and fortifies her lofty stronghold, I will send destroyers against her,>> declares the Lord."
JER	51	54	Jeremiah	#09		25524	" {54} << The sound of a cry comes from Babylon, the sound of great destruction from the land of the Babylonians."
JER	51	55	Jeremiah	#09		25525	 {55} The Lord will destroy Babylon; he will silence her noisy din. Waves of enemies will rage like great waters; the roar of their voices will resound.
JER	51	56	Jeremiah	#09		25526	" {56} A destroyer will come against Babylon; her warriors will be captured, and their bows will be broken. For the Lord is a God of retribution; he will repay in full."
JER	51	57	Jeremiah	#09		25527	" {57} I will make her officials and wise men drunk, her governors, officers and warriors as well; "
JER	51	57	Jeremiah	#09		25528	" they will sleep forever and not awake,>> declares the King, whose name is the Lord Almighty."
JER	51	58	God-FX1	#20		25529	 {58} This is what the Lord Almighty says: 
JER	51	58	God-FX1	#20		25530	" <<Babylon's thick wall will be leveled and her high gates set on fire; the peoples exhaust themselves for nothing, the nations' labor is only fuel for the flames.>>"
JER	51	59	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25531	" {59} This is the message Jeremiah gave to the staff officer Seraiah son of Neriah, the son of Mahseiah, when he went to Babylon with Zedekiah king of Judah in the fourth year of his reign."
JER	51	60	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25532	" {60} Jeremiah had written on a scroll about all the disasters that would come upon Babylon --all that had been recorded concerning Babylon. {61} He said to Seraiah,"
JER	51	61	Jeremiah	#09		25533	" << When you get to Babylon, see that you read all these words aloud."
JER	51	62	Jeremiah	#09		25534	" {62} Then say, 'O Lord, you have said you will destroy this place, so that neither man nor animal will live in it; it will be desolate forever.'"
JER	51	63	Jeremiah	#09		25535	" {63} When you finish reading this scroll, tie a stone to it and throw it into the Euphrates."
JER	51	64	Jeremiah	#09		25536	" {64} Then say, 'So will Babylon sink to rise no more because of the disaster I will bring upon her. And her people will fall.'<<"
JER	51	64	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25537	 The words of Jeremiah end here.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
JER	52	<<	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25538	JEREMIAH 52
JER	52	1	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25539	" {1} Zedekiah was twenty-one years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem eleven years. "
JER	52	1	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25540	 His mother's name was Hamutal daughter of Jeremiah; she was from Libnah.
JER	52	2	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25541	" {2} He did evil in the eyes of the Lord, just as Jehoiakim had done."
JER	52	3	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25542	" {3} It was because of the Lord's anger that all this happened to Jerusalem and Judah, and in the end he thrust them from his presence. Now Zedekiah rebelled against the king of Babylon."
JER	52	4	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25543	" {4} So in the ninth year of Zedekiah's reign, on the tenth day of the tenth month, Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon marched against Jerusalem with his whole army. "
JER	52	4	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25544	 They camped outside the city and built siege works all around it. {5} The city was kept under siege until the eleventh year of King Zedekiah.
JER	52	6	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25545	 {6} By the ninth day of the fourth month the famine in the city had become so severe that there was no food for the people to eat.
JER	52	7	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25546	" {7} Then the city wall was broken through, and the whole army fled. "
JER	52	7	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25547	" They left the city at night through the gate between the two walls near the king's garden, though the Babylonians were surrounding the city. "
JER	52	7	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25548	" They fled toward the Arabah, {8} but the Babylonian army pursued King Zedekiah and overtook him in the plains of Jericho. "
JER	52	8	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25549	" All his soldiers were separated from him and scattered, {9} and he was captured. "
JER	52	9	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25550	" He was taken to the king of Babylon at Riblah in the land of Hamath, where he pronounced sentence on him."
JER	52	10	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25551	 {10} There at Riblah the king of Babylon slaughtered the sons of Zedekiah before his eyes; he also killed all the officials of Judah.
JER	52	11	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25552	" {11} Then he put out Zedekiah's eyes, bound him with bronze shackles and took him to Babylon, where he put him in prison till the day of his death."
JER	52	12	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25553	" {12} On the tenth day of the fifth month, in the nineteenth year of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, "
JER	52	12	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25554	" Nebuzaradan commander of the imperial guard, who served the king of Babylon, came to Jerusalem."
JER	52	13	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25555	" {13} He set fire to the temple of the Lord, the royal palace and all the houses of Jerusalem. Every important building he burned down."
JER	52	14	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25556	 {14} The whole Babylonian army under the commander of the imperial guard broke down all the walls around Jerusalem.
JER	52	15	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25557	" {15} Nebuzaradan the commander of the guard carried into exile some of the poorest people and those who remained in the city, along with the rest of the craftsmen and those who had gone over to the king of Babylon."
JER	52	16	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25558	 {16} But Nebuzaradan left behind the rest of the poorest people of the land to work the vineyards and fields.
JER	52	17	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25559	" {17} The Babylonians broke up the bronze pillars, the movable stands and the bronze Sea that were at the temple of the Lord and they carried all the bronze to Babylon."
JER	52	18	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25560	" {18} They also took away the pots, shovels, wick trimmers, sprinkling bowls, dishes and all the bronze articles used in the temple service."
JER	52	19	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25561	" {19} The commander of the imperial guard took away the basins, censers, sprinkling bowls, pots, lampstands, dishes and bowls used for drink offerings--all that were made of pure gold or silver."
JER	52	20	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25562	" {20} The bronze from the two pillars, the Sea and the twelve bronze bulls under it, and the movable stands, which King Solomon had made for the temple of the Lord, was more than could be weighed."
JER	52	21	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25563	" {21} Each of the pillars was eighteen cubits high and twelve cubits in circumference; each was four fingers thick, and hollow."
JER	52	22	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25564	 {22} The bronze capital on top of the one pillar was five cubits high and was decorated with a network and pomegranates of bronze all around. 
JER	52	22	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25565	" The other pillar, with its pomegranates, was similar. {23} There were ninety-six pomegranates on the sides; the total number of pomegranates above the surrounding network was a hundred."
JER	52	24	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25566	" {24} The commander of the guard took as prisoners Seraiah the chief priest, Zephaniah the priest next in rank and the three doorkeepers."
JER	52	25	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25567	" {25} Of those still in the city, he took the officer in charge of the fighting men, and seven royal advisers. "
JER	52	25	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25568	 He also took the secretary who was chief officer in charge of conscripting the people of the land and sixty of his men who were found in the city.
JER	52	26	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25569	 {26} Nebuzaradan the commander took them all and brought them to the king of Babylon at Riblah.
JER	52	27	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25570	" {27} There at Riblah, in the land of Hamath, the king had them executed. So Judah went into captivity, away from her land."
JER	52	28	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25571	" {28} This is the number of the people Nebuchadnezzar carried into exile: in the seventh year, 3,023 Jews;"
JER	52	29	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25572	" {29} in Nebuchadnezzar's eighteenth year, 832 people from Jerusalem;"
JER	52	30	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25573	" {30} in his twenty-third year, 745 Jews taken into exile by Nebuzaradan the commander of the imperial guard. There were 4,600 people in all."
JER	52	31	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25574	" {31} In the thirty-seventh year of the exile of Jehoiachin king of Judah, in the year Evil-Merodach became king of Babylon, "
JER	52	31	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25575	 he released Jehoiachin king of Judah and freed him from prison on the twenty-fifth day of the twelfth month.
JER	52	32	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25576	 {32} He spoke kindly to him and gave him a seat of honor higher than those of the other kings who were with him in Babylon.
JER	52	33	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25577	 {33} So Jehoiachin put aside his prison clothes and for the rest of his life ate regularly at the king's table.
JER	52	34	Narr_24: Jeremiah	#13		25578	" {34} Day by day the king of Babylon gave Jehoiachin a regular allowance as long as he lived, till the day of his death.*~**~*||||| + 5 SECs |||||*~*"

LAM	2	13	Narr_25: Lamentations	#13		25671	 Mem

LAM	5	7	Jeremiah	#09		25816	" {7} Our fathers sinned and are no more, and we bear their punishment. {8} Slaves rule over us, and there is none to free us from their hands."
LAM	5	9	Jeremiah	#09		25817	" {9} We get our bread at the risk of our lives because of the sword in the desert. {10} Our skin is hot as an oven, feverish from hunger."
LAM	5	11	Jeremiah	#09		25818	" {11} Women have been ravished in Zion, and virgins in the towns of Judah. {12} Princes have been hung up by their hands; elders are shown no respect."
LAM	5	13	Jeremiah	#09		25819	 {13} Young men toil at the millstones; boys stagger under loads of wood. {14} The elders are gone from the city gate; the young men have stopped their music.

LAM	5	17	Jeremiah	#09		25821	" {17} Because of this our hearts are faint, because of these things our eyes grow dim {18} for Mount Zion, which lies desolate, with jackals prowling over it."

LAM	5	21	Jeremiah	#09		25823	" {21} Restore us to yourself, O Lord, that we may return; renew our days as of old {22} unless you have utterly rejected us and are angry with us beyond measure.*~**~*||||| + 5 SECs |||||*~*"
EZE	1	<<	Narr_26: Ezekiel	#13		25824	EZEKIEL*~*EZEKIEL 1
EZE	1	1	Ezekiel	#15		25825	" {1} In the thirtieth year, in the fourth month on the fifth day, while I was among the exiles by the Kebar River, the heavens were opened and I saw visions of God."
EZE	1	2	Narr_26: Ezekiel	#13		25826	 {2} On the fifth of the month--it was the fifth year of the exile of King Jehoiachin --
EZE	1	3	Narr_26: Ezekiel	#13		25827	" {3} the word of the Lord came to Ezekiel the priest, the son of Buzi, by the Kebar River in the land of the Babylonians. "
EZE	1	3	Narr_26: Ezekiel	#13		25828	 There the hand of the Lord was upon him.
EZE	1	4	Ezekiel	#15		25829	" {4} I looked, and I saw a windstorm coming out of the north--an immense cloud with flashing lightning and surrounded by brilliant light. "
EZE	1	4	Ezekiel	#15		25830	" The center of the fire looked like glowing metal, {5} and in the fire was what looked like four living creatures. "
EZE	1	5	Ezekiel	#15		25831	" In appearance their form was that of a man, {6} but each of them had four faces and four wings."
EZE	1	7	Ezekiel	#15		25832	 {7} Their legs were straight; their feet were like those of a calf and gleamed like burnished bronze.
EZE	1	8	Ezekiel	#15		25833	 {8} Under their wings on their four sides they had the hands of a man. 
EZE	1	8	Ezekiel	#15		25834	" All four of them had faces and wings, {9} and their wings touched one another. Each one went straight ahead; they did not turn as they moved."
EZE	1	10	Ezekiel	#15		25835	 {10} Their faces looked like this:
EZE	1	10	Ezekiel	#15		25836	" Each of the four had the face of a man, and on the right side each had the face of a lion, and on the left the face of an ox; each also had the face of an eagle."
EZE	1	11	Ezekiel	#15		25837	" {11} Such were their faces. Their wings were spread out upward; each had two wings, one touching the wing of another creature on either side, and two wings covering its body."
EZE	1	12	Ezekiel	#15		25838	" {12} Each one went straight ahead. Wherever the spirit would go, they would go, without turning as they went."
EZE	1	13	Ezekiel	#15		25839	" {13} The appearance of the living creatures was like burning coals of fire or like torches. Fire moved back and forth among the creatures; it was bright, and lightning flashed out of it."
EZE	1	14	Ezekiel	#15		25840	" {14} The creatures sped back and forth like flashes of lightning. {15} As I looked at the living creatures, I saw a wheel on the ground beside each creature with its four faces."
EZE	1	16	Ezekiel	#15		25841	" {16} This was the appearance and structure of the wheels: They sparkled like chrysolite, and all four looked alike. Each appeared to be made like a wheel intersecting a wheel."
EZE	1	17	Ezekiel	#15		25842	" {17} As they moved, they would go in any one of the four directions the creatures faced; the wheels did not turn about as the creatures went."
EZE	1	18	Ezekiel	#15		25843	" {18} Their rims were high and awesome, and all four rims were full of eyes all around."
EZE	1	19	Ezekiel	#15		25844	" {19} When the living creatures moved, the wheels beside them moved; and when the living creatures rose from the ground, the wheels also rose."
EZE	1	20	Ezekiel	#15		25845	" {20} Wherever the spirit would go, they would go, and the wheels would rise along with them, because the spirit of the living creatures was in the wheels."
EZE	1	21	Ezekiel	#15		25846	" {21} When the creatures moved, they also moved; when the creatures stood still, they also stood still; "
EZE	1	21	Ezekiel	#15		25847	" and when the creatures rose from the ground, the wheels rose along with them, because the spirit of the living creatures was in the wheels."
EZE	1	22	Ezekiel	#15		25848	" {22} Spread out above the heads of the living creatures was what looked like an expanse, sparkling like ice, and awesome."
EZE	1	23	Ezekiel	#15		25849	" {23} Under the expanse their wings were stretched out one toward the other, and each had two wings covering its body."
EZE	1	24	Ezekiel	#15		25850	" {24} When the creatures moved, I heard the sound of their wings, like the roar of rushing waters, like the voice of the Almighty, like the tumult of an army. "
EZE	1	24	Ezekiel	#15		25851	" When they stood still, they lowered their wings."
EZE	1	25	Ezekiel	#15		25852	 {25} Then there came a voice from above the expanse over their heads as they stood with lowered wings.
EZE	1	26	Ezekiel	#15		25853	" {26} Above the expanse over their heads was what looked like a throne of sapphire, and high above on the throne was a figure like that of a man."
EZE	1	27	Ezekiel	#15		25854	" {27} I saw that from what appeared to be his waist up he looked like glowing metal, as if full of fire, and that from there down he looked like fire; and brilliant light surrounded him."
EZE	1	28	Ezekiel	#15		25855	" {28} Like the appearance of a rainbow in the clouds on a rainy day, so was the radiance around him."
EZE	1	28	Ezekiel	#15		25856	" This was the appearance of the likeness of the glory of the Lord. When I saw it, I fell facedown, and I heard the voice of one speaking.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
EZE	2	<<	Narr_26: Ezekiel	#13		25857	EZEKIEL 2

EZE	2	2	Ezekiel	#15		25860	" {2} As he spoke, the Spirit came into me and raised me to my feet, and I heard him speaking to me. {3} He said:"
EZE	2	3	God-FX1	#20		25861	" << Son of man, I am sending you to the Israelites, to a rebellious nation that has rebelled against me; they and their fathers have been in revolt against me to this very day."
EZE	2	4	God-FX1	#20		25862	" {4} The people to whom I am sending you are obstinate and stubborn. Say to them, 'This is what the Sovereign Lord says.'"
EZE	2	5	God-FX1	#20		25863	 {5} And whether they listen or fail to listen--for they are a rebellious house--they will know that a prophet has been among them.
EZE	2	6	God-FX1	#20		25864	" {6} And you, son of man, do not be afraid of them or their words. Do not be afraid, though briers and thorns are all around you and you live among scorpions. "

EZE	2	8	God-FX1	#20		25867	" {8} But you, son of man, listen to what I say to you. Do not rebel like that rebellious house; open your mouth and eat what I give you.>>"
EZE	2	9	Ezekiel	#15		25868	" {9} Then I looked, and I saw a hand stretched out to me. In it was a scroll, {10} which he unrolled before me. "

EZE	3	3	Ezekiel	#15		25875	" So I ate it, and it tasted as sweet as honey in my mouth. {4} He then said to me:"
EZE	3	4	God-FX1	#20		25876	" << Son of man, go now to the house of Israel and speak my words to them."
EZE	3	5	God-FX1	#20		25877	" {5} You are not being sent to a people of obscure speech and difficult language, but to the house of Israel --"
EZE	3	6	God-FX1	#20		25878	" {6} not to many peoples of obscure speech and difficult language, whose words you cannot understand. Surely if I had sent you to them, they would have listened to you."

EZE	3	14	Ezekiel	#15		25888	" {14} The Spirit then lifted me up and took me away, and I went in bitterness and in the anger of my spirit, with the strong hand of the Lord upon me."
EZE	3	15	Ezekiel	#15		25889	" {15} I came to the exiles who lived at Tel Abib near the Kebar River. And there, where they were living, I sat among them for seven days--overwhelmed."

EZE	3	17	God-FX1	#20		25891	" {17} << Son of man, I have made you a watchman for the house of Israel; so hear the word I speak and give them warning from me."
EZE	3	18	God-FX1	#20		25892	" {18} When I say to a wicked man, 'You will surely die,' and you do not warn him or speak out to dissuade him from his evil ways in order to save his life, that wicked man will die for his sin. "
EZE	3	18	God-FX1	#20		25893	 But I will hold you accountable for his blood.
EZE	3	19	God-FX1	#20		25894	" {19} But if you do warn the wicked man and he does not turn from his wickedness or from his evil ways, he will die for his sin; but you will have saved yourself."
EZE	3	20	God-FX1	#20		25895	" {20} << Again, when a righteous man turns from his righteousness and does evil, and I put a stumbling block before him, he will die. "
EZE	3	20	God-FX1	#20		25896	" Since you did not warn him, he will die for his sin. The righteous things he did will not be remembered, and I will hold you accountable for his blood."
EZE	3	21	God-FX1	#20		25897	" {21} But if you do warn the righteous man not to sin and he does not sin, he will surely live because he took warning, and you will have saved yourself.>>"
EZE	3	22	Ezekiel	#15		25898	" {22} The hand of the Lord was upon me there, and he said to me,"

EZE	4	<<	Narr_26: Ezekiel	#13		25906	EZEKIEL 4
EZE	4	1	God-FX1	#20		25907	" {1} << Now, son of man, take a clay tablet, put it in front of you and draw the city of Jerusalem on it."
EZE	4	2	God-FX1	#20		25908	" {2} Then lay siege to it: Erect siege works against it, build a ramp up to it, set up camps against it and put battering rams around it."
EZE	4	3	God-FX1	#20		25909	" {3} Then take an iron pan, place it as an iron wall between you and the city and turn your face toward it. It will be under siege, and you shall besiege it. This will be a sign to the house of Israel."
EZE	4	4	God-FX1	#20		25910	 {4} << Then lie on your left side and put the sin of the house of Israel upon yourself. You are to bear their sin for the number of days you lie on your side.
EZE	4	5	God-FX1	#20		25911	 {5} I have assigned you the same number of days as the years of their sin. So for 390 days you will bear the sin of the house of Israel.
EZE	4	6	God-FX1	#20		25912	" {6} << After you have finished this, lie down again, this time on your right side, and bear the sin of the house of Judah. I have assigned you 40 days, a day for each year."
EZE	4	7	God-FX1	#20		25913	 {7} Turn your face toward the siege of Jerusalem and with bared arm prophesy against her.
EZE	4	8	God-FX1	#20		25914	 {8} I will tie you up with ropes so that you cannot turn from one side to the other until you have finished the days of your siege.
EZE	4	9	God-FX1	#20		25915	" {9} << Take wheat and barley, beans and lentils, millet and spelt; put them in a storage jar and use them to make bread for yourself. You are to eat it during the 390 days you lie on your side."
EZE	4	10	God-FX1	#20		25916	 {10} Weigh out twenty shekels of food to eat each day and eat it at set times. {11} Also measure out a sixth of a hin of water and drink it at set times.
EZE	4	12	God-FX1	#20		25917	" {12} Eat the food as you would a barley cake; bake it in the sight of the people, using human excrement for fuel.>>"
EZE	4	13	Narr_26: Ezekiel	#13		25918	" {13} The Lord said,"
EZE	4	13	God-FX1	#20		25919	 << In this way the people of Israel will eat defiled food among the nations where I will drive them.>>
EZE	4	14	Ezekiel	#15		25920	" {14} Then I said, << Not so, Sovereign Lord! I have never defiled myself. "
EZE	4	14	Ezekiel	#15		25921	 From my youth until now I have never eaten anything found dead or torn by wild animals. No unclean meat has ever entered my mouth.>>
EZE	4	15	Narr_26: Ezekiel	#13		25922	" {15} He said,"
EZE	4	15	God-FX1	#20		25923	" << Very well, I will let you bake your bread over cow manure instead of human excrement.>>"
EZE	4	16	Ezekiel	#15		25924	 {16} He then said to me:
EZE	4	16	God-FX1	#20		25925	" << Son of man, I will cut off the supply of food in Jerusalem. The people will eat rationed food in anxiety and drink rationed water in despair, {17} for food and water will be scarce. "
EZE	4	17	God-FX1	#20		25926	 They will be appalled at the sight of each other and will waste away because of their sin.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
EZE	5	<<	Narr_26: Ezekiel	#13		25927	EZEKIEL 5
EZE	5	1	God-FX1	#20		25928	" {1} << Now, son of man, take a sharp sword and use it as a barber's razor to shave your head and your beard. Then take a set of scales and divide up the hair."
EZE	5	2	God-FX1	#20		25929	" {2} When the days of your siege come to an end, burn a third of the hair with fire inside the city. "
EZE	5	2	God-FX1	#20		25930	 Take a third and strike it with the sword all around the city. And scatter a third to the wind. For I will pursue them with drawn sword.
EZE	5	3	God-FX1	#20		25931	 {3} But take a few strands of hair and tuck them away in the folds of your garment.
EZE	5	4	God-FX1	#20		25932	" {4} Again, take a few of these and throw them into the fire and burn them up. A fire will spread from there to the whole house of Israel."
EZE	5	5	Ezekiel	#15		25933	" {5} << This is what the Sovereign Lord says: This is Jerusalem, which I have set in the center of the nations, with countries all around her."
EZE	5	6	Ezekiel	#15		25934	 {6} Yet in her wickedness she has rebelled against my laws and decrees more than the nations and countries around her. She has rejected my laws and has not followed my decrees.
EZE	5	7	Ezekiel	#15		25935	 {7} Therefore this is what the Sovereign Lord says: You have been more unruly than the nations around you and have not followed my decrees or kept my laws. 
EZE	5	7	Ezekiel	#15		25936	 You have not even conformed to the standards of the nations around you.
EZE	5	8	Ezekiel	#15		25937	" {8} << Therefore this is what the Sovereign Lord says: I myself am against you, Jerusalem, and I will inflict punishment on you in the sight of the nations."
EZE	5	9	Ezekiel	#15		25938	" {9} Because of all your detestable idols, I will do to you what I have never done before and will never do again."
EZE	5	10	Ezekiel	#15		25939	" {10} Therefore in your midst fathers will eat their children, and children will eat their fathers. I will inflict punishment on you and will scatter all your survivors to the winds."
EZE	5	11	Ezekiel	#15		25940	" {11} Therefore as surely as I live, declares the Sovereign Lord, because you have defiled my sanctuary with all your vile images and detestable practices, I myself will withdraw my favor;"
EZE	5	11	Ezekiel	#15		25941	 I will not look on you with pity or spare you.
EZE	5	12	Ezekiel	#15		25942	 {12} A third of your people will die of the plague or perish by famine inside you; 
EZE	5	12	Ezekiel	#15		25943	 a third will fall by the sword outside your walls; and a third I will scatter to the winds and pursue with drawn sword.
EZE	5	13	God-FX1	#20		25944	" {13} << Then my anger will cease and my wrath against them will subside, and I will be avenged. "
EZE	5	13	God-FX1	#20		25945	" And when I have spent my wrath upon them, they will know that I the Lord have spoken in my zeal."
EZE	5	14	God-FX1	#20		25946	" {14} << I will make you a ruin and a reproach among the nations around you, in the sight of all who pass by."
EZE	5	15	God-FX1	#20		25947	" {15} You will be a reproach and a taunt, a warning and an object of horror to the nations around you when I inflict punishment on you in anger and in wrath and with stinging rebuke. I the Lord have spoken."
EZE	5	16	God-FX1	#20		25948	" {16} When I shoot at you with my deadly and destructive arrows of famine, I will shoot to destroy you. I will bring more and more famine upon you and cut off your supply of food."
EZE	5	17	God-FX1	#20		25949	" {17} I will send famine and wild beasts against you, and they will leave you childless. "
EZE	5	17	God-FX1	#20		25950	" Plague and bloodshed will sweep through you, and I will bring the sword against you. I the Lord have spoken.>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"

EZE	6	4	Ezekiel	#15		25956	 {4} Your altars will be demolished and your incense altars will be smashed; and I will slay your people in front of your idols.
EZE	6	5	Ezekiel	#15		25957	" {5} I will lay the dead bodies of the Israelites in front of their idols, and I will scatter your bones around your altars."
EZE	6	6	Ezekiel	#15		25958	" {6} Wherever you live, the towns will be laid waste and the high places demolished, so that your altars will be laid waste and devastated, your idols smashed and ruined, your incense altars broken down, and what you have made wiped out."
EZE	6	7	Ezekiel	#15		25959	" {7} Your people will fall slain among you, and you will know that I am the Lord."
EZE	6	8	God-FX1	#20		25960	" {8} << 'But I will spare some, for some of you will escape the sword when you are scattered among the lands and nations."

EZE	6	9	God-FX1	#20		25962	" how I have been grieved by their adulterous hearts, which have turned away from me, and by their eyes, which have lusted after their idols. "
EZE	6	9	God-FX1	#20		25963	 They will loathe themselves for the evil they have done and for all their detestable practices.
EZE	6	10	God-FX1	#20		25964	 {10} And they will know that I am the Lord; I did not threaten in vain to bring this calamity on them.

EZE	6	11	Ezekiel	#15		25966	" Strike your hands together and stamp your feet and cry out << Alas!>> because of all the wicked and detestable practices of the house of Israel, for they will fall by the sword, famine and plague."
EZE	6	12	Ezekiel	#15		25967	" {12} He that is far away will die of the plague, and he that is near will fall by the sword, and he that survives and is spared will die of famine. So will I spend my wrath upon them."
EZE	6	13	Ezekiel	#15		25968	" {13} And they will know that I am the Lord, when their people lie slain among their idols around their altars, on every high hill and on all the mountaintops, "
EZE	6	13	Ezekiel	#15		25969	 under every spreading tree and every leafy oak--places where they offered fragrant incense to all their idols.
EZE	6	14	Ezekiel	#15		25970	 {14} And I will stretch out my hand against them and make the land a desolate waste from the desert to Diblah --wherever they live. Then they will know that I am the Lord.'<<*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
EZE	7	<<	Narr_26: Ezekiel	#13		25971	EZEKIEL 7
EZE	7	1	Ezekiel	#15		25972	 {1} The word of the Lord came to me:
EZE	7	2	God-FX1	#20		25973	" {2} << Son of man, this is what the Sovereign Lord says to the land of Israel: The end! The end has come upon the four corners of the land."
EZE	7	3	Ezekiel	#15		25974	 {3} The end is now upon you and I will unleash my anger against you. I will judge you according to your conduct and repay you for all your detestable practices.
EZE	7	4	Ezekiel	#15		25975	 {4} I will not look on you with pity or spare you; I will surely repay you for your conduct and the detestable practices among you. Then you will know that I am the Lord.
EZE	7	5	Ezekiel	#15		25976	 {5} << This is what the Sovereign Lord says: Disaster! An unheard-of disaster is coming.
EZE	7	6	Ezekiel	#15		25977	 {6} The end has come! The end has come! It has roused itself against you. It has come!
EZE	7	7	Ezekiel	#15		25978	" {7} Doom has come upon you--you who dwell in the land. The time has come, the day is near; there is panic, not joy, upon the mountains."
EZE	7	8	Ezekiel	#15		25979	 {8} I am about to pour out my wrath on you and spend my anger against you; I will judge you according to your conduct and repay you for all your detestable practices.
EZE	7	9	Ezekiel	#15		25980	 {9} I will not look on you with pity or spare you; I will repay you in accordance with your conduct and the detestable practices among you. 
EZE	7	9	Ezekiel	#15		25981	 Then you will know that it is I the Lord who strikes the blow.
EZE	7	10	Ezekiel	#15		25982	" {10} << The day is here! It has come! Doom has burst forth, the rod has budded, arrogance has blossomed!"
EZE	7	11	Ezekiel	#15		25983	" {11} Violence has grown into a rod to punish wickedness; none of the people will be left, none of that crowd--no wealth, nothing of value."
EZE	7	12	Ezekiel	#15		25984	" {12} The time has come, the day has arrived. Let not the buyer rejoice nor the seller grieve, for wrath is upon the whole crowd."
EZE	7	13	Ezekiel	#15		25985	" {13} The seller will not recover the land he has sold as long as both of them live, for the vision concerning the whole crowd will not be reversed. "
EZE	7	13	Ezekiel	#15		25986	" Because of their sins, not one of them will preserve his life."
EZE	7	14	Ezekiel	#15		25987	" {14} Though they blow the trumpet and get everything ready, no one will go into battle, for my wrath is upon the whole crowd."
EZE	7	15	Ezekiel	#15		25988	" {15} << Outside is the sword, inside are plague and famine; those in the country will die by the sword, and those in the city will be devoured by famine and plague."
EZE	7	16	Ezekiel	#15		25989	" {16} All who survive and escape will be in the mountains, moaning like doves of the valleys, each because of his sins."
EZE	7	17	Ezekiel	#15		25990	" {17} Every hand will go limp, and every knee will become as weak as water."
EZE	7	18	Ezekiel	#15		25991	 {18} They will put on sackcloth and be clothed with terror. Their faces will be covered with shame and their heads will be shaved.
EZE	7	19	Ezekiel	#15		25992	" {19} They will throw their silver into the streets, and their gold will be an unclean thing. Their silver and gold will not be able to save them in the day of the Lord's wrath. "
EZE	7	19	Ezekiel	#15		25993	" They will not satisfy their hunger or fill their stomachs with it, for it has made them stumble into sin."
EZE	7	20	God-FX1	#20		25994	 {20} They were proud of their beautiful jewelry and used it to make their detestable idols and vile images. Therefore I will turn these into an unclean thing for them.
EZE	7	21	God-FX1	#20		25995	" {21} I will hand it all over as plunder to foreigners and as loot to the wicked of the earth, and they will defile it."
EZE	7	22	God-FX1	#20		25996	" {22} I will turn my face away from them, and they will desecrate my treasured place; robbers will enter it and desecrate it."
EZE	7	23	God-FX1	#20		25997	" {23} << Prepare chains, because the land is full of bloodshed and the city is full of violence."
EZE	7	24	God-FX1	#20		25998	" {24} I will bring the most wicked of the nations to take possession of their houses; I will put an end to the pride of the mighty, and their sanctuaries will be desecrated."
EZE	7	25	God-FX1	#20		25999	" {25} When terror comes, they will seek peace, but there will be none."
EZE	7	26	God-FX1	#20		26000	" {26} Calamity upon calamity will come, and rumor upon rumor. They will try to get a vision from the prophet; the teaching of the law by the priest will be lost, as will the counsel of the elders."
EZE	7	27	God-FX1	#20		26001	" {27} The king will mourn, the prince will be clothed with despair, and the hands of the people of the land will tremble."
EZE	7	27	God-FX1	#20		26002	" I will deal with them according to their conduct, and by their own standards I will judge them. Then they will know that I am the Lord.>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
EZE	8	<<	Narr_26: Ezekiel	#13		26003	EZEKIEL 8
EZE	8	1	Ezekiel	#15		26004	" {1} In the sixth year, in the sixth month on the fifth day, while I was sitting in my house and the elders of Judah were sitting before me, the hand of the Sovereign Lord came upon me there."
EZE	8	2	Ezekiel	#15		26005	" {2} I looked, and I saw a figure like that of a man. From what appeared to be his waist down he was like fire, and from there up his appearance was as bright as glowing metal."
EZE	8	3	Ezekiel	#15		26006	 {3} He stretched out what looked like a hand and took me by the hair of my head. 
EZE	8	3	Ezekiel	#15		26007	" The Spirit lifted me up between earth and heaven and in visions of God he took me to Jerusalem, to the entrance to the north gate of the inner court, where the idol that provokes to jealousy stood."
EZE	8	4	Ezekiel	#15		26008	" {4} And there before me was the glory of the God of Israel, as in the vision I had seen in the plain. {5} Then he said to me,"
EZE	8	5	God-FX1	#20		26009	" << Son of man, look toward the north.>>"
EZE	8	5	Ezekiel	#15		26010	" So I looked, and in the entrance north of the gate of the altar I saw this idol of jealousy. {6} And he said to me,"
EZE	8	6	God-FX1	#20		26011	" << Son of man, do you see what they are doing--the utterly detestable things the house of Israel is doing here, things that will drive me far from my sanctuary? "
EZE	8	6	God-FX1	#20		26012	 But you will see things that are even more detestable.>>
EZE	8	7	Ezekiel	#15		26013	" {7} Then he brought me to the entrance to the court. I looked, and I saw a hole in the wall. {8} He said to me,"
EZE	8	8	God-FX1	#20		26014	" << Son of man, now dig into the wall.>>"
EZE	8	8	Ezekiel	#15		26015	" So I dug into the wall and saw a doorway there. {9} And he said to me,"
EZE	8	9	God-FX1	#20		26016	 << Go in and see the wicked and detestable things they are doing here.>>
EZE	8	10	Ezekiel	#15		26017	" {10} So I went in and looked, and I saw portrayed all over the walls all kinds of crawling things and detestable animals and all the idols of the house of Israel."
EZE	8	11	Ezekiel	#15		26018	" {11} In front of them stood seventy elders of the house of Israel, and Jaazaniah son of Shaphan was standing among them. "
EZE	8	11	Ezekiel	#15		26019	" Each had a censer in his hand, and a fragrant cloud of incense was rising. {12} He said to me,"
EZE	8	12	God-FX1	#20		26020	" << Son of man, have you seen what the elders of the house of Israel are doing in the darkness, each at the shrine of his own idol? "
EZE	8	12	God-FX1	#20		26021	" They say, 'The Lord does not see us; the Lord has forsaken the land.'<<"
EZE	8	13	Ezekiel	#15		26022	" {13} Again, he said,"
EZE	8	13	God-FX1	#20		26023	 << You will see them doing things that are even more detestable.>>
EZE	8	14	Ezekiel	#15		26024	" {14} Then he brought me to the entrance to the north gate of the house of the Lord, and I saw women sitting there, mourning for Tammuz. {15} He said to me,"
EZE	8	15	God-FX1	#20		26025	" << Do you see this, son of man? You will see things that are even more detestable than this.>>"
EZE	8	16	Ezekiel	#15		26026	" {16} He then brought me into the inner court of the house of the Lord, and there at the entrance to the temple, between the portico and the altar, were about twenty-five men. "
EZE	8	16	Ezekiel	#15		26027	" With their backs toward the temple of the Lord and their faces toward the east, they were bowing down to the sun in the east. {17} He said to me,"
EZE	8	17	God-FX1	#20		26028	" << Have you seen this, son of man? Is it a trivial matter for the house of Judah to do the detestable things they are doing here? "
EZE	8	17	God-FX1	#20		26029	 Must they also fill the land with violence and continually provoke me to anger? Look at them putting the branch to their nose!
EZE	8	18	God-FX1	#20		26030	" {18} Therefore I will deal with them in anger; I will not look on them with pity or spare them. Although they shout in my ears, I will not listen to them.>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
EZE	9	<<	Narr_26: Ezekiel	#13		26031	EZEKIEL 9

EZE	9	3	Ezekiel	#15		26036	" {3} Now the glory of the God of Israel went up from above the cherubim, where it had been, and moved to the threshold of the temple."

EZE	9	7	Ezekiel	#15		26044	" So they went out and began killing throughout the city. {8} While they were killing and I was left alone, I fell facedown, crying out, "

EZE	10	<<	Narr_26: Ezekiel	#13		26050	EZEKIEL 10
EZE	10	1	Ezekiel	#15		26051	" {1} I looked, and I saw the likeness of a throne of sapphire above the expanse that was over the heads of the cherubim. {2} The Lord said to the man clothed in linen,"
EZE	10	2	God-FX1	#20		26052	 << Go in among the wheels beneath the cherubim. Fill your hands with burning coals from among the cherubim and scatter them over the city.>>
EZE	10	2	Ezekiel	#15		26053	" And as I watched, he went in. {3} Now the cherubim were standing on the south side of the temple when the man went in, and a cloud filled the inner court."
EZE	10	4	Ezekiel	#15		26054	 {4} Then the glory of the Lord rose from above the cherubim and moved to the threshold of the temple. 
EZE	10	4	Ezekiel	#15		26055	" The cloud filled the temple, and the court was full of the radiance of the glory of the Lord."
EZE	10	5	Ezekiel	#15		26056	" {5} The sound of the wings of the cherubim could be heard as far away as the outer court, like the voice of God Almighty when he speaks. {6} When the Lord commanded the man in linen,"
EZE	10	6	God-FX1	#20		26057	" << Take fire from among the wheels, from among the cherubim,>>"
EZE	10	6	Ezekiel	#15		26058	 the man went in and stood beside a wheel.
EZE	10	7	Ezekiel	#15		26059	" {7} Then one of the cherubim reached out his hand to the fire that was among them. He took up some of it and put it into the hands of the man in linen, who took it and went out."
EZE	10	8	Ezekiel	#15		26060	 {8} (Under the wings of the cherubim could be seen what looked like the hands of a man.)
EZE	10	9	Ezekiel	#15		26061	" {9} I looked, and I saw beside the cherubim four wheels, one beside each of the cherubim; the wheels sparkled like chrysolite."
EZE	10	10	Ezekiel	#15		26062	" {10} As for their appearance, the four of them looked alike; each was like a wheel intersecting a wheel."
EZE	10	11	Ezekiel	#15		26063	" {11} As they moved, they would go in any one of the four directions the cherubim faced; the wheels did not turn about as the cherubim went. "
EZE	10	11	Ezekiel	#15		26064	" The cherubim went in whatever direction the head faced, without turning as they went."
EZE	10	12	Ezekiel	#15		26065	" {12} Their entire bodies, including their backs, their hands and their wings, were completely full of eyes, as were their four wheels."
EZE	10	13	Ezekiel	#15		26066	 {13} I heard the wheels being called << the whirling wheels.>>
EZE	10	14	Ezekiel	#15		26067	" {14} Each of the cherubim had four faces: One face was that of a cherub, the second the face of a man, the third the face of a lion, and the fourth the face of an eagle."
EZE	10	15	Ezekiel	#15		26068	 {15} Then the cherubim rose upward. These were the living creatures I had seen by the Kebar River.
EZE	10	16	Ezekiel	#15		26069	" {16} When the cherubim moved, the wheels beside them moved; and when the cherubim spread their wings to rise from the ground, the wheels did not leave their side."
EZE	10	17	Ezekiel	#15		26070	" {17} When the cherubim stood still, they also stood still; and when the cherubim rose, they rose with them, because the spirit of the living creatures was in them."
EZE	10	18	Ezekiel	#15		26071	 {18} Then the glory of the Lord departed from over the threshold of the temple and stopped above the cherubim.
EZE	10	19	Ezekiel	#15		26072	" {19} While I watched, the cherubim spread their wings and rose from the ground, and as they went, the wheels went with them."
EZE	10	19	Ezekiel	#15		26073	" They stopped at the entrance to the east gate of the Lord's house, and the glory of the God of Israel was above them."
EZE	10	20	Ezekiel	#15		26074	" {20} These were the living creatures I had seen beneath the God of Israel by the Kebar River, and I realized that they were cherubim."
EZE	10	21	Ezekiel	#15		26075	" {21} Each had four faces and four wings, and under their wings was what looked like the hands of a man."
EZE	10	22	Ezekiel	#15		26076	 {22} Their faces had the same appearance as those I had seen by the Kebar River. Each one went straight ahead.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*

EZE	12	6	God-FX1	#20		26114	" {6} Put them on your shoulder as they are watching and carry them out at dusk. Cover your face so that you cannot see the land, for I have made you a sign to the house of Israel.>>"

EZE	13	<<	Narr_26: Ezekiel	#13		26141	EZEKIEL 13

EZE	13	3	God-FX1	#20		26144	 {3} This is what the Sovereign Lord says: Woe to the foolish prophets who follow their own spirit and have seen nothing!
EZE	13	4	Ezekiel	#15		26145	" {4} Your prophets, O Israel, are like jackals among ruins."
EZE	13	5	Ezekiel	#15		26146	 {5} You have not gone up to the breaks in the wall to repair it for the house of Israel so that it will stand firm in the battle on the day of the Lord.
EZE	13	6	Ezekiel	#15		26147	" {6} Their visions are false and their divinations a lie. They say, << The Lord declares,>> when the Lord has not sent them; yet they expect their words to be fulfilled."
EZE	13	7	God-FX1	#20		26148	" {7} Have you not seen false visions and uttered lying divinations when you say, << The Lord declares,>> though I have not spoken?"

EZE	13	9	God-FX1	#20		26150	 {9} My hand will be against the prophets who see false visions and utter lying divinations. 
EZE	13	9	God-FX1	#20		26151	" They will not belong to the council of my people or be listed in the records of the house of Israel, nor will they enter the land of Israel. Then you will know that I am the Sovereign Lord."
