EZE	13	11	God-FX1	#20		26153	" {11} therefore tell those who cover it with whitewash that it is going to fall. Rain will come in torrents, and I will send hailstones hurtling down, and violent winds will burst forth."
EZE	13	12	God-FX1	#20		26154	" {12} When the wall collapses, will people not ask you, << Where is the whitewash you covered it with?>>"
EZE	13	13	Ezekiel	#15		26155	" {13} <<'Therefore this is what the Sovereign Lord says: In my wrath I will unleash a violent wind, and in my anger hailstones and torrents of rain will fall with destructive fury."
EZE	13	14	Ezekiel	#15		26156	 {14} I will tear down the wall you have covered with whitewash and will level it to the ground so that its foundation will be laid bare. 
EZE	13	14	Ezekiel	#15		26157	" When it falls, you will be destroyed in it; and you will know that I am the Lord."
EZE	13	15	Ezekiel	#15		26158	" {15} So I will spend my wrath against the wall and against those who covered it with whitewash. I will say to you, << The wall is gone and so are those who whitewashed it,"
EZE	13	16	Ezekiel	#15		26159	" {16} those prophets of Israel who prophesied to Jerusalem and saw visions of peace for her when there was no peace, declares the Sovereign Lord.>> '"
EZE	13	17	God-FX1	#20		26160	" {17} << Now, son of man, set your face against the daughters of your people who prophesy out of their own imagination. Prophesy against them {18} and say, 'This is what the Sovereign Lord says: "
EZE	13	18	God-FX1	#20		26161	 Woe to the women who sew magic charms on all their wrists and make veils of various lengths for their heads in order to ensnare people. 
EZE	13	18	God-FX1	#20		26162	 Will you ensnare the lives of my people but but preserve your own?
EZE	13	19	Ezekiel	#15		26163	 {19} You have profaned me among my people for a few handfuls of barley and scraps of bread. 
EZE	13	19	Ezekiel	#15		26164	" By lying to my people, who listen to lies, you have killed those who should not have died and have spared those who should not live."
EZE	13	20	God-FX1	#20		26165	 {20} << 'Therefore this is what the Sovereign Lord says: 
EZE	13	20	God-FX1	#20		26166	 I am against your magic charms with which you ensnare people like birds and I will tear them from your arms; I will set free the people that you ensnare like birds.
EZE	13	21	God-FX1	#20		26167	" {21} I will tear off your veils and save my people from your hands, and they will no longer fall prey to your power. Then you will know that I am the Lord."
EZE	13	22	God-FX1	#20		26168	" {22} Because you disheartened the righteous with your lies, when I had brought them no grief, and because you encouraged the wicked not to turn from their evil ways and so save their lives,"
EZE	13	23	God-FX1	#20		26169	 {23} therefore you will no longer see false visions or practice divination. I will save my people from your hands. And then you will know that I am the Lord.'>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
EZE	14	<<	Narr_26: Ezekiel	#13		26170	EZEKIEL 14
EZE	14	1	Ezekiel	#15		26171	 {1} Some of the elders of Israel came to me and sat down in front of me. {2} Then the word of the Lord came to me:
EZE	14	3	God-FX1	#20		26172	" {3} << Son of man, these men have set up idols in their hearts and put wicked stumbling blocks before their faces. Should I let them inquire of me at all?"
EZE	14	4	God-FX1	#20		26173	" {4} Therefore speak to them and tell them, 'This is what the Sovereign Lord says: "
EZE	14	4	God-FX1	#20		26174	" When any Israelite sets up idols in his heart and puts a wicked stumbling block before his face and then goes to a prophet, I the Lord will answer him myself in keeping with his great idolatry."
EZE	14	5	Ezekiel	#15		26175	" {5} I will do this to recapture the hearts of the people of Israel, who have all deserted me for their idols.'"
EZE	14	6	Ezekiel	#15		26176	" {6} << Therefore say to the house of Israel, 'This is what the Sovereign Lord says: Repent! Turn from your idols and renounce all your detestable practices!"
EZE	14	7	Ezekiel	#15		26177	" {7} << 'When any Israelite or any alien living in Israel separates himself from me and sets up idols in his heart and puts a wicked stumbling block before his face and then goes to a prophet to inquire of me, I the Lord will answer him myself."
EZE	14	8	Ezekiel	#15		26178	 {8} I will set my face against that man and make him an example and a byword. I will cut him off from my people. Then you will know that I am the Lord.
EZE	14	9	Ezekiel	#15		26179	" {9} << 'And if the prophet is enticed to utter a prophecy, I the Lord have enticed that prophet, and I will stretch out my hand against him and destroy him from among my people Israel."
EZE	14	10	Ezekiel	#15		26180	 {10} They will bear their guilt--the prophet will be as guilty as the one who consults him.
EZE	14	11	Ezekiel	#15		26181	" {11} Then the people of Israel will no longer stray from me, nor will they defile themselves anymore with all their sins. "
EZE	14	11	Ezekiel	#15		26182	" They will be my people, and I will be their God, declares the Sovereign Lord.' "
EZE	14	12	Ezekiel	#15		26183	 {12} << The word of the Lord came to me:
EZE	14	13	God-FX1	#20		26184	" {13} << Son of man, if a country sins against me by being unfaithful and I stretch out my hand against it to cut off its food supply and send famine upon it and kill its men and their animals,"
EZE	14	14	God-FX1	#20		26185	" {14} even if these three men--Noah, Daniel and Job--were in it, they could save only themselves by their righteousness, declares the Sovereign Lord."
EZE	14	15	Ezekiel	#15		26186	" {15} << Or if I send wild beasts through that country and they leave it childless and it becomes desolate so that no one can pass through it because of the beasts,"
EZE	14	16	Ezekiel	#15		26187	" {16} as surely as I live, declares the Sovereign Lord, even if these three men were in it, they could not save their own sons or daughters. They alone would be saved, but the land would be desolate."
EZE	14	17	Ezekiel	#15		26188	" {17} << Or if I bring a sword against that country and say, 'Let the sword pass throughout the land,' and I kill its men and their animals,"
EZE	14	18	Ezekiel	#15		26189	" {18} as surely as I live, declares the Sovereign Lord, even if these three men were in it, they could not save their own sons or daughters. They alone would be saved."
EZE	14	19	Ezekiel	#15		26190	" {19} << Or if I send a plague into that land and pour out my wrath upon it through bloodshed, killing its men and their animals,"
EZE	14	20	Ezekiel	#15		26191	" {20} as surely as I live, declares the Sovereign Lord, even if Noah, Daniel and Job were in it, they could save neither son nor daughter. They would save only themselves by their righteousness."
EZE	14	21	God-FX1	#20		26192	 {21} << For this is what the Sovereign Lord says: How much worse will it be when I send against Jerusalem my four dreadful judgments--sword and famine and wild beasts and plague--to kill its men and their animals!
EZE	14	22	God-FX1	#20		26193	 {22} Yet there will be some survivors--sons and daughters who will be brought out of it. 
EZE	14	22	God-FX1	#20		26194	" They will come to you, and when you see their conduct and their actions, you will be consoled regarding the disaster I have brought upon Jerusalem --every disaster I have brought upon it."
EZE	14	23	God-FX1	#20		26195	" {23} You will be consoled when you see their conduct and their actions, for you will know that I have done nothing in it without cause, >>"
EZE	14	23	Ezekiel	#15		26196	 declares the Sovereign Lord.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
EZE	15	<<	Narr_26: Ezekiel	#13		26197	EZEKIEL 15
EZE	15	1	Ezekiel	#15		26198	 {1} The word of the Lord came to me:
EZE	15	2	God-FX1	#20		26199	" {2} < Son of man, how is the wood of a vine better than that of a branch on any of the trees in the forest?"
EZE	15	3	God-FX1	#20		26200	 {3} Is wood ever taken from it to make anything useful? Do they make pegs from it to hang things on?
EZE	15	4	God-FX1	#20		26201	" {4} And after it is thrown on the fire as fuel and the fire burns both ends and chars the middle, is it then useful for anything?"
EZE	15	5	God-FX1	#20		26202	" {5} If it was not useful for anything when it was whole, how much less can it be made into something useful when the fire has burned it and it is charred?"
EZE	15	6	Ezekiel	#15		26203	" {6} << Therefore this is what the Sovereign Lord says: As I have given the wood of the vine among the trees of the forest as fuel for the fire, so will I treat the people living in Jerusalem."
EZE	15	7	Ezekiel	#15		26204	" {7} I will set my face against them. Although they have come out of the fire, the fire will yet consume them. And when I set my face against them, you will know that I am the Lord."
EZE	15	8	Ezekiel	#15		26205	" {8} I will make the land desolate because they have been unfaithful, declares the Sovereign Lord.>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
EZE	16	<<	Narr_26: Ezekiel	#13		26206	EZEKIEL 16
EZE	16	1	Ezekiel	#15		26207	 {1} The word of the Lord came to me:
EZE	16	2	God-FX1	#20		26208	" {2} << Son of man, confront Jerusalem with her detestable practices {3} and say, 'This is what the Sovereign Lord says to Jerusalem:"
EZE	16	3	God-FX1	#20		26209	 Your ancestry and birth were in the land of the Canaanites; your father was an Amorite and your mother a Hittite.
EZE	16	4	Ezekiel	#15		26210	" {4} On the day you were born your cord was not cut, nor were you washed with water to make you clean, nor were you rubbed with salt or wrapped in cloths."
EZE	16	5	Ezekiel	#15		26211	" {5} No one looked on you with pity or had compassion enough to do any of these things for you. Rather, you were thrown out into the open field, for on the day you were born you were despised."
EZE	16	6	Ezekiel	#15		26212	" {6} << 'Then I passed by and saw you kicking about in your blood, and as you lay there in your blood I said to you, << Live!>>"
EZE	16	7	Ezekiel	#15		26213	" {7} I made you grow like a plant of the field. You grew up and developed and became the most beautiful of jewels. Your breasts were formed and your hair grew, you who were naked and bare."
EZE	16	8	Ezekiel	#15		26214	" {8} << 'Later I passed by, and when I looked at you and saw that you were old enough for love, I spread the corner of my garment over you and covered your nakedness."
EZE	16	8	Ezekiel	#15		26215	" I gave you my solemn oath and entered into a covenant with you, declares the Sovereign Lord, and you became mine."
EZE	16	9	Ezekiel	#15		26216	 {9} << 'I bathed you with water and washed the blood from you and put ointments on you.
EZE	16	10	Ezekiel	#15		26217	 {10} I clothed you with an embroidered dress and put leather sandals on you. I dressed you in fine linen and covered you with costly garments.
EZE	16	11	Ezekiel	#15		26218	" {11} I adorned you with jewelry: I put bracelets on your arms and a necklace around your neck, {12} and I put a ring on your nose, earrings on your ears and a beautiful crown on your head."
EZE	16	13	Ezekiel	#15		26219	 {13} So you were adorned with gold and silver; your clothes were of fine linen and costly fabric and embroidered cloth.
EZE	16	13	Ezekiel	#15		26220	" Your food was fine flour, honey and olive oil. You became very beautiful and rose to be a queen."
EZE	16	14	Ezekiel	#15		26221	" {14} And your fame spread among the nations on account of your beauty, because the splendor I had given you made your beauty perfect, declares the Sovereign Lord."
EZE	16	15	Ezekiel	#15		26222	 {15} << 'But you trusted in your beauty and used your fame to become a prostitute. You lavished your favors on anyone who passed by and your beauty became his.
EZE	16	16	Ezekiel	#15		26223	" {16} You took some of your garments to make gaudy high places, where you carried on your prostitution. Such things should not happen, nor should they ever occur."
EZE	16	17	Ezekiel	#15		26224	" {17} You also took the fine jewelry I gave you, the jewelry made of my gold and silver, and you made for yourself male idols and engaged in prostitution with them."
EZE	16	18	Ezekiel	#15		26225	" {18} And you took your embroidered clothes to put on them, and you offered my oil and incense before them."
EZE	16	19	Ezekiel	#15		26226	" {19} Also the food I provided for you--the fine flour, olive oil and honey I gave you to eat--you offered as fragrant incense before them. That is what happened, declares the Sovereign Lord."
EZE	16	20	Ezekiel	#15		26227	 {20} << 'And you took your sons and daughters whom you bore to me and sacrificed them as food to the idols. Was your prostitution not enough?
EZE	16	21	Ezekiel	#15		26228	 {21} You slaughtered my children and sacrificed them to the idols.
EZE	16	22	Ezekiel	#15		26229	" {22} In all your detestable practices and your prostitution you did not remember the days of your youth, when you were naked and bare, kicking about in your blood."
EZE	16	23	Ezekiel	#15		26230	" {23} << 'Woe! Woe to you, declares the Sovereign Lord. In addition to all your other wickedness, {24} you built a mound for yourself and made a lofty shrine in every public square."
EZE	16	25	Ezekiel	#15		26231	" {25} At the head of every street you built your lofty shrines and degraded your beauty, offering your body with increasing promiscuity to anyone who passed by."
EZE	16	26	Ezekiel	#15		26232	" {26} You engaged in prostitution with the Egyptians, your lustful neighbors, and provoked me to anger with your increasing promiscuity."
EZE	16	27	Ezekiel	#15		26233	" {27} So I stretched out my hand against you and reduced your territory; I gave you over to the greed of your enemies, the daughters of the Philistines, who were shocked by your lewd conduct."
EZE	16	28	Ezekiel	#15		26234	" {28} You engaged in prostitution with the Assyrians too, because you were insatiable; and even after that, you still were not satisfied."
EZE	16	29	Ezekiel	#15		26235	" {29} Then you increased your promiscuity to include Babylonia, a land of merchants, but even with this you were not satisfied."
EZE	16	30	Ezekiel	#15		26236	" {30} << 'How weak-willed you are, declares the Sovereign Lord, when you do all these things, acting like a brazen prostitute!"
EZE	16	31	Ezekiel	#15		26237	" {31} When you built your mounds at the head of every street and made your lofty shrines in every public square, you were unlike a prostitute, because you scorned payment."
EZE	16	32	Ezekiel	#15		26238	 {32} << 'You adulterous wife! You prefer strangers to your own husband!
EZE	16	33	Ezekiel	#15		26239	" {33} Every prostitute receives a fee, but you give gifts to all your lovers, bribing them to come to you from everywhere for your illicit favors."
EZE	16	34	Ezekiel	#15		26240	" {34} So in your prostitution you are the opposite of others; no one runs after you for your favors. You are the very opposite, for you give payment and none is given to you."
EZE	16	35	Ezekiel	#15		26241	" {35} << 'Therefore, you prostitute, hear the word of the Lord! {36} This is what the Sovereign Lord says: "
EZE	16	36	Ezekiel	#15		26242	" Because you poured out your wealth and exposed your nakedness in your promiscuity with your lovers, and because of all your detestable idols, and because you gave them your children's blood,"
EZE	16	37	Ezekiel	#15		26243	" {37} therefore I am going to gather all your lovers, with whom you found pleasure, those you loved as well as those you hated. "
EZE	16	37	Ezekiel	#15		26244	" I will gather them against you from all around and will strip you in front of them, and they will see all your nakedness."
EZE	16	38	Ezekiel	#15		26245	 {38} I will sentence you to the punishment of women who commit adultery and who shed blood; I will bring upon you the blood vengeance of my wrath and jealous anger.
EZE	16	39	Ezekiel	#15		26246	" {39} Then I will hand you over to your lovers, and they will tear down your mounds and destroy your lofty shrines. "
EZE	16	39	Ezekiel	#15		26247	 They will strip you of your clothes and take your fine jewelry and leave you naked and bare.
EZE	16	40	Ezekiel	#15		26248	" {40} They will bring a mob against you, who will stone you and hack you to pieces with their swords."
EZE	16	41	Ezekiel	#15		26249	" {41} They will burn down your houses and inflict punishment on you in the sight of many women. I will put a stop to your prostitution, and you will no longer pay your lovers."
EZE	16	42	Ezekiel	#15		26250	 {42} Then my wrath against you will subside and my jealous anger will turn away from you; I will be calm and no longer angry.
EZE	16	43	Ezekiel	#15		26251	" {43} << 'Because you did not remember the days of your youth but enraged me with all these things, I will surely bring down on your head what you have done, declares the Sovereign Lord. "
EZE	16	43	Ezekiel	#15		26252	 Did you not add lewdness to all your other detestable practices?
EZE	16	44	Ezekiel	#15		26253	" {44} << 'Everyone who quotes proverbs will quote this proverb about you: << Like mother, like daughter.>>"
EZE	16	45	Ezekiel	#15		26254	" {45} You are a true daughter of your mother, who despised her husband and her children; and you are a true sister of your sisters, who despised their husbands and their children. "
EZE	16	45	Ezekiel	#15		26255	 Your mother was a Hittite and your father an Amorite.
EZE	16	46	Ezekiel	#15		26256	" {46} Your older sister was Samaria, who lived to the north of you with her daughters; and your younger sister, who lived to the south of you with her daughters, was Sodom."
EZE	16	47	Ezekiel	#15		26257	" {47} You not only walked in their ways and copied their detestable practices, but in all your ways you soon became more depraved than they."
EZE	16	48	Ezekiel	#15		26258	" {48} As surely as I live, declares the Sovereign Lord, your sister Sodom and her daughters never did what you and your daughters have done."
EZE	16	49	Ezekiel	#15		26259	" {49} << 'Now this was the sin of your sister Sodom: She and her daughters were arrogant, overfed and unconcerned; they did not help the poor and needy."
EZE	16	50	Ezekiel	#15		26260	 {50} They were haughty and did detestable things before me. Therefore I did away with them as you have seen.
EZE	16	51	Ezekiel	#15		26261	" {51} Samaria did not commit half the sins you did. You have done more detestable things than they, and have made your sisters seem righteous by all these things you have done."
EZE	16	52	Ezekiel	#15		26262	" {52} Bear your disgrace, for you have furnished some justification for your sisters. "
EZE	16	52	Ezekiel	#15		26263	" Because your sins were more vile than theirs, they appear more righteous than you. So then, be ashamed and bear your disgrace, for you have made your sisters appear righteous."
EZE	16	53	Ezekiel	#15		26264	" {53} << 'However, I will restore the fortunes of Sodom and her daughters and of Samaria and her daughters, and your fortunes along with them,"
EZE	16	54	Ezekiel	#15		26265	 {54} so that you may bear your disgrace and be ashamed of all you have done in giving them comfort.
EZE	16	55	Ezekiel	#15		26266	" {55} And your sisters, Sodom with her daughters and Samaria with her daughters, will return to what they were before; and you and your daughters will return to what you were before."
EZE	16	56	Ezekiel	#15		26267	" {56} You would not even mention your sister Sodom in the day of your pride, {57} before your wickedness was uncovered. "
EZE	16	57	Ezekiel	#15		26268	" Even so, you are now scorned by the daughters of Edom and all her neighbors and the daughters of the Philistines--all those around you who despise you."
EZE	16	58	Ezekiel	#15		26269	" {58} You will bear the consequences of your lewdness and your detestable practices, declares the Lord."
EZE	16	59	God-FX1	#20		26270	" {59} << 'This is what the Sovereign Lord says: I will deal with you as you deserve, because you have despised my oath by breaking the covenant."
EZE	16	60	God-FX1	#20		26271	" {60} Yet I will remember the covenant I made with you in the days of your youth, and I will establish an everlasting covenant with you."
EZE	16	61	God-FX1	#20		26272	" {61} Then you will remember your ways and be ashamed when you receive your sisters, both those who are older than you and those who are younger. "
EZE	16	61	God-FX1	#20		26273	" I will give them to you as daughters, but not on the basis of my covenant with you."
EZE	16	62	God-FX1	#20		26274	" {62} So I will establish my covenant with you, and you will know that I am the Lord."
EZE	16	63	God-FX1	#20		26275	" {63} Then, when I make atonement for you for all you have done, you will remember and be ashamed and never again open your mouth because of your humiliation,"
EZE	16	63	Ezekiel	#15		26276	 declares the Lord.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
EZE	17	<<	Narr_26: Ezekiel	#13		26277	EZEKIEL 17
EZE	17	1	Ezekiel	#15		26278	 {1} The word of the Lord came to me:
EZE	17	2	God-FX1	#20		26279	" {2} <<Son of man, set forth an allegory and tell the house of Israel a parable."
EZE	17	3	God-FX1	#20		26280	" {3} Say to them, 'This is what the Sovereign Lord says: A great eagle with powerful wings, long feathers and full plumage of varied colors came to Lebanon."
EZE	17	3	God-FX1	#20		26281	" Taking hold of the top of a cedar, {4} he broke off its topmost shoot and carried it away to a land of merchants, where he planted it in a city of traders."
EZE	17	5	Ezekiel	#15		26282	" {5} << 'He took some of the seed of your land and put it in fertile soil. He planted it like a willow by abundant water, {6} and it sprouted and became a low, spreading vine."
EZE	17	6	Ezekiel	#15		26283	" Its branches turned toward him, but its roots remained under it. So it became a vine and produced branches and put out leafy boughs."
EZE	17	7	Ezekiel	#15		26284	 {7} << 'But there was another great eagle with powerful wings and full plumage. 
EZE	17	7	Ezekiel	#15		26285	 The vine now sent out its roots toward him from the plot where it was planted and stretched out its branches to him for water.
EZE	17	8	Ezekiel	#15		26286	" {8} It had been planted in good soil by abundant water so that it would produce branches, bear fruit and become a splendid vine.'"
EZE	17	9	Ezekiel	#15		26287	" {9} << Say to them, 'This is what the Sovereign Lord says: Will it thrive? Will it not be uprooted and stripped of its fruit so that it withers? "
EZE	17	9	Ezekiel	#15		26288	 All its new growth will wither. It will not take a strong arm or many people to pull it up by the roots.
EZE	17	10	Ezekiel	#15		26289	" {10} Even if it is transplanted, will it thrive? Will it not wither completely when the east wind strikes it--wither away in the plot where it grew?'"
EZE	17	11	Ezekiel	#15		26290	 {11} << Then the word of the Lord came to me:
EZE	17	12	God-FX1	#20		26291	" {12} <<Say to this rebellious house, 'Do you not know what these things mean?' "
EZE	17	12	God-FX1	#20		26292	" Say to them: 'The king of Babylon went to Jerusalem and carried off her king and her nobles, bringing them back with him to Babylon."
EZE	17	13	Ezekiel	#15		26293	" {13} Then he took a member of the royal family and made a treaty with him, putting him under oath. "
EZE	17	13	Ezekiel	#15		26294	" He also carried away the leading men of the land, {14} so that the kingdom would be brought low, unable to rise again, surviving only by keeping his treaty."
EZE	17	15	Ezekiel	#15		26295	 {15} But the king rebelled against him by sending his envoys to Egypt to get horses and a large army. Will he succeed? Will he who does such things escape? Will he break the treaty and yet escape?
EZE	17	16	Ezekiel	#15		26296	" {16} << 'As surely as I live, declares the Sovereign Lord, he shall die in Babylon, in the land of the king who put him on the throne, whose oath he despised and whose treaty he broke."
EZE	17	17	Ezekiel	#15		26297	" {17} Pharaoh with his mighty army and great horde will be of no help to him in war, when ramps are built and siege works erected to destroy many lives."
EZE	17	18	Ezekiel	#15		26298	" {18} He despised the oath by breaking the covenant. Because he had given his hand in pledge and yet did all these things, he shall not escape."
EZE	17	19	God-FX1	#20		26299	" {19} << 'Therefore this is what the Sovereign Lord says: As surely as I live, I will bring down on his head my oath that he despised and my covenant that he broke."
EZE	17	20	God-FX1	#20		26300	" {20} I will spread my net for him, and he will be caught in my snare. I will bring him to Babylon and execute judgment upon him there because he was unfaithful to me."
EZE	17	21	God-FX1	#20		26301	" {21} All his fleeing troops will fall by the sword, and the survivors will be scattered to the winds. Then you will know that I the Lord have spoken."
EZE	17	22	Ezekiel	#15		26302	 {22} <<'This is what the Sovereign Lord says:
EZE	17	22	God-FX1	#20		26303	 I myself will take a shoot from the very top of a cedar and plant it; I will break off a tender sprig from its topmost shoots and plant it on a high and lofty mountain.
EZE	17	23	God-FX1	#20		26304	 {23} On the mountain heights of Israel I will plant it; it will produce branches and bear fruit and become a splendid cedar.
EZE	17	23	God-FX1	#20		26305	 Birds of every kind will nest in it; they will find shelter in the shade of its branches.
EZE	17	24	God-FX1	#20		26306	 {24} All the trees of the field will know that I the Lord bring down the tall tree and make the low tree grow tall.
EZE	17	24	God-FX1	#20		26307	" I dry up the green tree and make the dry tree flourish. << 'I the Lord have spoken, and I will do it.'<<*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
EZE	18	<<	Narr_26: Ezekiel	#13		26308	EZEKIEL 18
EZE	18	1	Ezekiel	#15		26309	 {1} The word of the Lord came to me:
EZE	18	2	God-FX1	#20		26310	" {2} << What do you people mean by quoting this proverb about the land of Israel: << 'The fathers eat sour grapes, and the children's teeth are set on edge'?"
EZE	18	3	God-FX1	#20		26311	 {3} << As surely as I live you will no longer quote this proverb in Israel.
EZE	18	4	God-FX1	#20		26312	" {4} For every living soul belongs to me, the father as well as the son--both alike belong to me. The soul who sins is the one who will die."
EZE	18	5	God-FX1	#20		26313	 {5} << Suppose there is a righteous man who does what is just and right.
EZE	18	6	God-FX1	#20		26314	 {6} He does not eat at the mountain shrines or look to the idols of the house of Israel. He does not defile his neighbor's wife or lie with a woman during her period.
EZE	18	7	God-FX1	#20		26315	" {7} He does not oppress anyone, but returns what he took in pledge for a loan. He does not commit robbery but gives his food to the hungry and provides clothing for the naked."
EZE	18	8	God-FX1	#20		26316	 {8} He does not lend at usury or take excessive interest. He withholds his hand from doing wrong and judges fairly between man and man.
EZE	18	9	God-FX1	#20		26317	" {9} He follows my decrees and faithfully keeps my laws. That man is righteous; he will surely live,"
EZE	18	9	Ezekiel	#15		26318	" declares the Sovereign Lord. {10} << Suppose he has a violent son, who sheds blood or does any of these other things"
EZE	18	11	Ezekiel	#15		26319	 {11} (though the father has done none of them): << He eats at the mountain shrines. He defiles his neighbor's wife.
EZE	18	12	Ezekiel	#15		26320	 {12} He oppresses the poor and needy. He commits robbery. He does not return what he took in pledge. He looks to the idols. He does detestable things.
EZE	18	13	Ezekiel	#15		26321	 {13} He lends at usury and takes excessive interest. Will such a man live? 
EZE	18	13	Ezekiel	#15		26322	" He will not! Because he has done all these detestable things, he will surely be put to death and his blood will be on his own head."
EZE	18	14	Ezekiel	#15		26323	" {14} << But suppose this son has a son who sees all the sins his father commits, and though he sees them, he does not do such things:"
EZE	18	15	Ezekiel	#15		26324	 {15} << He does not eat at the mountain shrines or look to the idols of the house of Israel. He does not defile his neighbor's wife.
EZE	18	16	Ezekiel	#15		26325	 {16} He does not oppress anyone or require a pledge for a loan. He does not commit robbery but gives his food to the hungry and provides clothing for the naked.
EZE	18	17	Ezekiel	#15		26326	 {17} He withholds his hand from sin and takes no usury or excessive interest. He keeps my laws and follows my decrees. He will not die for his father's sin; he will surely live.
EZE	18	18	Ezekiel	#15		26327	" {18} But his father will die for his own sin, because he practiced extortion, robbed his brother and did what was wrong among his people."
EZE	18	19	Ezekiel	#15		26328	" {19} << Yet you ask, 'Why does the son not share the guilt of his father?' Since the son has done what is just and right and has been careful to keep all my decrees, he will surely live."
EZE	18	20	Ezekiel	#15		26329	" {20} The soul who sins is the one who will die. The son will not share the guilt of the father, nor will the father share the guilt of the son. "
EZE	18	20	Ezekiel	#15		26330	" The righteousness of the righteous man will be credited to him, and the wickedness of the wicked will be charged against him."
EZE	18	21	Ezekiel	#15		26331	" {21} << But if a wicked man turns away from all the sins he has committed and keeps all my decrees and does what is just and right, he will surely live; he will not die."
EZE	18	22	Ezekiel	#15		26332	" {22} None of the offenses he has committed will be remembered against him. Because of the righteous things he has done, he will live."
EZE	18	23	Ezekiel	#15		26333	" {23} Do I take any pleasure in the death of the wicked? declares the Sovereign Lord. Rather, am I not pleased when they turn from their ways and live?"
EZE	18	24	Ezekiel	#15		26334	" {24} << But if a righteous man turns from his righteousness and commits sin and does the same detestable things the wicked man does, will he live? "
EZE	18	24	Ezekiel	#15		26335	" None of the righteous things he has done will be remembered. Because of the unfaithfulness he is guilty of and because of the sins he has committed, he will die."
EZE	18	25	Ezekiel	#15		26336	" {25} << Yet you say, 'The way of the Lord is not just.' Hear, O house of Israel: Is my way unjust? Is it not your ways that are unjust?"
EZE	18	26	Ezekiel	#15		26337	" {26} If a righteous man turns from his righteousness and commits sin, he will die for it; because of the sin he has committed he will die."
EZE	18	27	Ezekiel	#15		26338	" {27} But if a wicked man turns away from the wickedness he has committed and does what is just and right, he will save his life."
EZE	18	28	Ezekiel	#15		26339	" {28} Because he considers all the offenses he has committed and turns away from them, he will surely live; he will not die."
EZE	18	29	Ezekiel	#15		26340	" {29} Yet the house of Israel says, 'The way of the Lord is not just.' Are my ways unjust, O house of Israel? Is it not your ways that are unjust?"
EZE	18	30	Ezekiel	#15		26341	" {30} << Therefore, O house of Israel, I will judge you, each one according to his ways, declares the Sovereign Lord. Repent! Turn away from all your offenses; then sin will not be your downfall."
EZE	18	31	Ezekiel	#15		26342	" {31} Rid yourselves of all the offenses you have committed, and get a new heart and a new spirit. Why will you die, O house of Israel?"
EZE	18	32	Ezekiel	#15		26343	" {32} For I take no pleasure in the death of anyone, declares the Sovereign Lord. Repent and live!*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
EZE	19	<<	Narr_26: Ezekiel	#13		26344	EZEKIEL 19
EZE	19	1	God-FX1	#20		26345	 {1} <<Take up a lament concerning the princes of Israel and say:
EZE	19	2	Ezekiel	#15		26346	 {2} << 'What a lioness was your mother among the lions! She lay down among the young lions and reared her cubs.
EZE	19	3	Ezekiel	#15		26347	" {3} She brought up one of her cubs, and he became a strong lion. He learned to tear the prey and he devoured men."
EZE	19	4	Ezekiel	#15		26348	" {4} The nations heard about him, and he was trapped in their pit. They led him with hooks to the land of Egypt."
EZE	19	5	Ezekiel	#15		26349	" {5} << 'When she saw her hope unfulfilled, her expectation gone, she took another of her cubs and made him a strong lion."
EZE	19	6	Ezekiel	#15		26350	" {6} He prowled among the lions, for he was now a strong lion. He learned to tear the prey and he devoured men."
EZE	19	7	Ezekiel	#15		26351	 {7} He broke down their strongholds and devastated their towns. The land and all who were in it were terrified by his roaring.
EZE	19	8	Ezekiel	#15		26352	" {8} Then the nations came against him, those from regions round about. They spread their net for him, and he was trapped in their pit."
EZE	19	9	Ezekiel	#15		26353	" {9} With hooks they pulled him into a cage and brought him to the king of Babylon. They put him in prison, so his roar was heard no longer on the mountains of Israel."
EZE	19	10	Ezekiel	#15		26354	 {10} << 'Your mother was like a vine in your vineyard planted by the water; it was fruitful and full of branches because of abundant water.
EZE	19	11	Ezekiel	#15		26355	" {11} Its branches were strong, fit for a ruler's scepter. It towered high above the thick foliage, conspicuous for its height and for its many branches."
EZE	19	12	Ezekiel	#15		26356	" {12} But it was uprooted in fury and thrown to the ground. The east wind made it shrivel, it was stripped of its fruit; its strong branches withered and fire consumed them."
EZE	19	13	Ezekiel	#15		26357	" {13} Now it is planted in the desert, in a dry and thirsty land. {14} Fire spread from one of its main branches and consumed its fruit. No strong branch is left on it fit for a ruler's scepter.' "
EZE	19	14	Ezekiel	#15		26358	 This is a lament and is to be used as a lament.>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*

EZE	20	6	Ezekiel	#15		26366	" {6} On that day I swore to them that I would bring them out of Egypt into a land I had searched out for them, a land flowing with milk and honey, the most beautiful of all lands."
EZE	20	7	Ezekiel	#15		26367	" {7} And I said to them, << Each of you, get rid of the vile images you have set your eyes on, and do not defile yourselves with the idols of Egypt. I am the Lord your God.>>"
EZE	20	8	Ezekiel	#15		26368	" {8} << 'But they rebelled against me and would not listen to me; they did not get rid of the vile images they had set their eyes on, nor did they forsake the idols of Egypt. "

EZE	20	10	Ezekiel	#15		26371	" {10} Therefore I led them out of Egypt and brought them into the desert. {11} I gave them my decrees and made known to them my laws, for the man who obeys them will live by them."

EZE	20	26	God-FX1	#20		26389	 {26} I let them become defiled through their gifts--the sacrifice of every firstborn--that I might fill them with horror so they would know that I am the Lord.'

EZE	21	4	Ezekiel	#15		26423	" {4} Because I am going to cut off the righteous and the wicked, my sword will be unsheathed against everyone from south to north."
EZE	21	5	Ezekiel	#15		26424	 {5} Then all people will know that I the Lord have drawn my sword from its scabbard; it will not return again.'
EZE	21	6	Ezekiel	#15		26425	" {6} << Therefore groan, son of man! Groan before them with broken heart and bitter grief."

EZE	21	7	Ezekiel	#15		26427	" Every heart will melt and every hand go limp; every spirit will become faint and every knee become as weak as water.' It is coming! It will surely take place, declares the Sovereign Lord.>>"

EZE	21	9	God-FX1	#20		26429	" {9} <<Son of man, prophesy and say, 'This is what the Lord says: <<'A sword, a sword, sharpened and polished-- {10} sharpened for the slaughter, polished to flash like lightning! "
EZE	21	10	God-FX1	#20		26430	 << 'Shall we rejoice in the scepter of my son Judah? The sword despises every such stick.

EZE	21	12	God-FX1	#20		26432	" {12} Cry out and wail, son of man, for it is against my people; it is against all the princes of Israel. They are thrown to the sword along with my people. Therefore beat your breast."

EZE	21	16	God-FX1	#20		26437	" {16} O sword, slash to the right, then to the left, wherever your blade is turned. {17} I too will strike my hands together, and my wrath will subside. I the Lord have spoken.>>"

EZE	21	19	God-FX1	#20		26439	" {19} << Son of man, mark out two roads for the sword of the king of Babylon to take, both starting from the same country. Make a signpost where the road branches off to the city."
EZE	21	20	God-FX1	#20		26440	 {20} Mark out one road for the sword to come against Rabbah of the Ammonites and another against Judah and fortified Jerusalem.
EZE	21	21	God-FX1	#20		26441	" {21} For the king of Babylon will stop at the fork in the road, at the junction of the two roads, to seek an omen:"
EZE	21	21	God-FX1	#20		26442	" He will cast lots with arrows, he will consult his idols, he will examine the liver."
EZE	21	22	God-FX1	#20		26443	" {22} Into his right hand will come the lot for Jerusalem, where he is to set up battering rams, to give the command to slaughter, to sound the battle cry, to set battering rams against the gates, to build a ramp and to erect siege works."
EZE	21	23	God-FX1	#20		26444	" {23} It will seem like a false omen to those who have sworn allegiance to him, but he will remind them of their guilt and take them captive."

EZE	21	24	Ezekiel	#15		26446	" Because you people have brought to mind your guilt by your open rebellion, revealing your sins in all that you do--because you have done this, you will be taken captive."
EZE	21	25	Ezekiel	#15		26447	" {25} << 'O profane and wicked prince of Israel, whose day has come, whose time of punishment has reached its climax, {26} this is what the Sovereign Lord says: "
EZE	21	26	Ezekiel	#15		26448	" Take off the turban, remove the crown. It will not be as it was: The lowly will be exalted and the exalted will be brought low."
EZE	21	27	Ezekiel	#15		26449	 {27} A ruin! A ruin! I will make it a ruin! It will not be restored until he comes to whom it rightfully belongs; to him I will give it.'
EZE	21	28	Ezekiel	#15		26450	" {28} << And you, son of man, prophesy and say, 'This is what the Sovereign Lord says about the Ammonites and their insults: "
EZE	21	28	Ezekiel	#15		26451	" << 'A sword, a sword, drawn for the slaughter, polished to consume and to flash like lightning!"
EZE	21	29	Ezekiel	#15		26452	" {29} Despite false visions concerning you and lying divinations about you, it will be laid on the necks of the wicked who are to be slain, whose day has come, whose time of punishment has reached its climax."
EZE	21	30	God-FX1	#20		26453	" {30} Return the sword to its scabbard. In the place where you were created, in the land of your ancestry, I will judge you."
EZE	21	31	God-FX1	#20		26454	" {31} I will pour out my wrath upon you and breathe out my fiery anger against you; I will hand you over to brutal men, men skilled in destruction."
EZE	21	32	God-FX1	#20		26455	" {32} You will be fuel for the fire, your blood will be shed in your land, you will be remembered no more; for I the Lord have spoken.'>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
EZE	22	<<	Narr_26: Ezekiel	#13		26456	EZEKIEL 22
EZE	22	1	Ezekiel	#15		26457	 {1} The word of the Lord came to me:
EZE	22	2	God-FX1	#20		26458	" {2} << Son of man, will you judge her? Will you judge this city of bloodshed? Then confront her with all her detestable practices {3} and say: 'This is what the Sovereign Lord says: "
EZE	22	3	God-FX1	#20		26459	" O city that brings on herself doom by shedding blood in her midst and defiles herself by making idols, {4} you have become guilty because of the blood you have shed and have become defiled by the idols you have made. "
EZE	22	4	God-FX1	#20		26460	" You have brought your days to a close, and the end of your years has come. Therefore I will make you an object of scorn to the nations and a laughingstock to all the countries."
EZE	22	5	Ezekiel	#15		26461	" {5} Those who are near and those who are far away will mock you, O infamous city, full of turmoil."
EZE	22	6	Ezekiel	#15		26462	 {6} << 'See how each of the princes of Israel who are in you uses his power to shed blood.
EZE	22	7	Ezekiel	#15		26463	 {7} In you they have treated father and mother with contempt; in you they have oppressed the alien and mistreated the fatherless and the widow.
EZE	22	8	Ezekiel	#15		26464	 {8} You have despised my holy things and desecrated my Sabbaths.
EZE	22	9	Ezekiel	#15		26465	 {9} In you are slanderous men bent on shedding blood; in you are those who eat at the mountain shrines and commit lewd acts.
EZE	22	10	Ezekiel	#15		26466	" {10} In you are those who dishonor their fathers' bed; in you are those who violate women during their period, when they are ceremonially unclean."
EZE	22	11	Ezekiel	#15		26467	" {11} In you one man commits a detestable offense with his neighbor's wife, another shamefully defiles his daughter-in-law, and another violates his sister, his own father's daughter."
EZE	22	12	Ezekiel	#15		26468	" {12} In you men accept bribes to shed blood; you take usury and excessive interest and make unjust gain from your neighbors by extortion. And you have forgotten me, declares the Sovereign Lord."
EZE	22	13	God-FX1	#20		26469	 {13} << 'I will surely strike my hands together at the unjust gain you have made and at the blood you have shed in your midst.
EZE	22	14	God-FX1	#20		26470	" {14} Will your courage endure or your hands be strong in the day I deal with you? I the Lord have spoken, and I will do it."
EZE	22	15	God-FX1	#20		26471	 {15} I will disperse you among the nations and scatter you through the countries; and I will put an end to your uncleanness.
EZE	22	16	God-FX1	#20		26472	" {16} When you have been defiled in the eyes of the nations, you will know that I am the Lord.'>>"
EZE	22	17	Ezekiel	#15		26473	 {17} Then the word of the Lord came to me:
EZE	22	18	God-FX1	#20		26474	" {18} << Son of man, the house of Israel has become dross to me; all of them are the copper, tin, iron and lead left inside a furnace. They are but the dross of silver."
EZE	22	19	Ezekiel	#15		26475	" {19} Therefore this is what the Sovereign Lord says: 'Because you have all become dross, I will gather you into Jerusalem."
EZE	22	20	Ezekiel	#15		26476	" {20} As men gather silver, copper, iron, lead and tin into a furnace to melt it with a fiery blast, so will I gather you in my anger and my wrath and put you inside the city and melt you."
EZE	22	21	Ezekiel	#15		26477	" {21} I will gather you and I will blow on you with my fiery wrath, and you will be melted inside her."
EZE	22	22	Ezekiel	#15		26478	" {22} As silver is melted in a furnace, so you will be melted inside her, and you will know that I the Lord have poured out my wrath upon you.'"
EZE	22	23	Ezekiel	#15		26479	 {23} << Again the word of the Lord came to me:
EZE	22	24	God-FX1	#20		26480	" {24} <<Son of man, say to the land, 'You are a land that has had no rain or showers in the day of wrath.'"
EZE	22	25	Ezekiel	#15		26481	" {25} There is a conspiracy of her princes within her like a roaring lion tearing its prey; they devour people, take treasures and precious things and make many widows within her."
EZE	22	26	Ezekiel	#15		26482	 {26} Her priests do violence to my law and profane my holy things; they do not distinguish between the holy and the common; 
EZE	22	26	Ezekiel	#15		26483	" they teach that there is no difference between the unclean and the clean; and they shut their eyes to the keeping of my Sabbaths, so that I am profaned among them."
EZE	22	27	Ezekiel	#15		26484	 {27} Her officials within her are like wolves tearing their prey; they shed blood and kill people to make unjust gain.
EZE	22	28	Ezekiel	#15		26485	" {28} Her prophets whitewash these deeds for them by false visions and lying divinations. They say, 'This is what the Sovereign Lord says'--when the Lord has not spoken."
EZE	22	29	Ezekiel	#15		26486	" {29} The people of the land practice extortion and commit robbery; they oppress the poor and needy and mistreat the alien, denying them justice."
EZE	22	30	God-FX1	#20		26487	" {30} <<I looked for a man among them who would build up the wall and stand before me in the gap on behalf of the land so I would not have to destroy it, but I found none."
EZE	22	31	God-FX1	#20		26488	" {31} So I will pour out my wrath on them and consume them with my fiery anger, bringing down on their own heads all they have done.>>"
EZE	22	31	Ezekiel	#15		26489	 declares the Lord.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
EZE	23	<<	Narr_26: Ezekiel	#13		26490	EZEKIEL 23
EZE	23	1	Ezekiel	#15		26491	" {1} The word of the Lord came to me: {2} << Son of man, there were two women, daughters of the same mother."
EZE	23	3	Ezekiel	#15		26492	" {3} They became prostitutes in Egypt, engaging in prostitution from their youth. In that land their breasts were fondled and their virgin bosoms caressed."
EZE	23	4	Ezekiel	#15		26493	" {4} The older was named Oholah, and her sister was Oholibah. They were mine and gave birth to sons and daughters. Oholah is Samaria, and Oholibah is Jerusalem."
EZE	23	5	Ezekiel	#15		26494	 {5} << Oholah engaged in prostitution while she was still mine; 
EZE	23	5	Ezekiel	#15		26495	" and she lusted after her lovers, the Assyrians--warriors {6} clothed in blue, governors and commanders, all of them handsome young men, and mounted horsemen."
EZE	23	7	Ezekiel	#15		26496	 {7} She gave herself as a prostitute to all the elite of the Assyrians and defiled herself with all the idols of everyone she lusted after.
EZE	23	8	Ezekiel	#15		26497	" {8} She did not give up the prostitution she began in Egypt, when during her youth men slept with her, caressed her virgin bosom and poured out their lust upon her."
EZE	23	9	Ezekiel	#15		26498	" {9} << Therefore I handed her over to her lovers, the Assyrians, for whom she lusted."
EZE	23	10	Ezekiel	#15		26499	" {10} They stripped her naked, took away her sons and daughters and killed her with the sword. She became a byword among women, and punishment was inflicted on her."
EZE	23	11	Ezekiel	#15		26500	" {11} << Her sister Oholibah saw this, yet in her lust and prostitution she was more depraved than her sister."
EZE	23	12	Ezekiel	#15		26501	" {12} She too lusted after the Assyrians--governors and commanders, warriors in full dress, mounted horsemen, all handsome young men."
EZE	23	13	Ezekiel	#15		26502	 {13} I saw that she too defiled herself; both of them went the same way.
EZE	23	14	Ezekiel	#15		26503	" {14} << But she carried her prostitution still further. She saw men portrayed on a wall, figures of Chaldeans portrayed in red,"
EZE	23	15	Ezekiel	#15		26504	" {15} with belts around their waists and flowing turbans on their heads; all of them looked like Babylonian chariot officers, natives of Chaldea."
EZE	23	16	Ezekiel	#15		26505	" {16} As soon as she saw them, she lusted after them and sent messengers to them in Chaldea."
EZE	23	17	Ezekiel	#15		26506	" {17} Then the Babylonians came to her, to the bed of love, and in their lust they defiled her. After she had been defiled by them, she turned away from them in disgust."
EZE	23	18	Ezekiel	#15		26507	" {18} When she carried on her prostitution openly and exposed her nakedness, I turned away from her in disgust, just as I had turned away from her sister."
EZE	23	19	Ezekiel	#15		26508	" {19} Yet she became more and more promiscuous as she recalled the days of her youth, when she was a prostitute in Egypt."
EZE	23	20	Ezekiel	#15		26509	" {20} There she lusted after her lovers, whose genitals were like those of donkeys and whose emission was like that of horses."
EZE	23	21	Ezekiel	#15		26510	" {21} So you longed for the lewdness of your youth, when in Egypt your bosom was caressed and your young breasts fondled."
EZE	23	22	Ezekiel	#15		26511	" {22} << Therefore, Oholibah, this is what the Sovereign Lord says: I will stir up your lovers against you, those you turned away from in disgust, and I will bring them against you from every side--"
EZE	23	23	Ezekiel	#15		26512	" {23} the Babylonians and all the Chaldeans, "
EZE	23	23	Ezekiel	#15		26513	" the men of Pekod and Shoa and Koa, "
EZE	23	23	Ezekiel	#15		26514	" and all the Assyrians with them, handsome young men, all of them governors and commanders, chariot officers and men of high rank, all mounted on horses."
EZE	23	24	Ezekiel	#15		26515	" {24} They will come against you with weapons, chariots and wagons and with a throng of people;"
EZE	23	24	Ezekiel	#15		26516	 they will take up positions against you on every side with large and small shields and with helmets. 
EZE	23	24	Ezekiel	#15		26517	" I will turn you over to them for punishment, and they will punish you according to their standards."
EZE	23	25	Ezekiel	#15		26518	" {25} I will direct my jealous anger against you, and they will deal with you in fury. They will cut off your noses and your ears, and those of you who are left will fall by the sword. "
EZE	23	25	Ezekiel	#15		26519	" They will take away your sons and daughters, and those of you who are left will be consumed by fire. {26} They will also strip you of your clothes and take your fine jewelry."
EZE	23	27	Ezekiel	#15		26520	 {27} So I will put a stop to the lewdness and prostitution you began in Egypt. You will not look on these things with longing or remember Egypt anymore.
EZE	23	28	Ezekiel	#15		26521	" {28} << For this is what the Sovereign Lord says: I am about to hand you over to those you hate, to those you turned away from in disgust."
EZE	23	29	Ezekiel	#15		26522	" {29} They will deal with you in hatred and take away everything you have worked for. They will leave you naked and bare, and the shame of your prostitution will be exposed. "
EZE	23	29	Ezekiel	#15		26523	" Your lewdness and promiscuity {30} have brought this upon you, because you lusted after the nations and defiled yourself with their idols."
EZE	23	31	Ezekiel	#15		26524	 {31} You have gone the way of your sister; so I will put her cup into your hand.
EZE	23	32	God-FX1	#20		26525	" {32} << This is what the Sovereign Lord says: << You will drink your sister's cup, a cup large and deep; it will bring scorn and derision, for it holds so much."
EZE	23	33	God-FX1	#20		26526	" {33} You will be filled with drunkenness and sorrow, the cup of ruin and desolation, the cup of your sister Samaria."
EZE	23	34	God-FX1	#20		26527	 {34} You will drink it and drain it dry; you will dash it to pieces and tear your breasts.
EZE	23	34	Ezekiel	#15		26528	" I have spoken, declares the Sovereign Lord. {35} Therefore this is what the Sovereign Lord says:"
EZE	23	35	God-FX1	#20		26529	" Since you have forgotten me and thrust me behind your back, you must bear the consequences of your lewdness and prostitution.>>"
EZE	23	36	Ezekiel	#15		26530	 {36} The Lord said to me:
EZE	23	36	God-FX1	#20		26531	" << Son of man, will you judge Oholah and Oholibah? Then confront them with their detestable practices, {37} for they have committed adultery and blood is on their hands."

EZE	23	38	God-FX1	#20		26533	 {38} They have also done this to me: At that same time they defiled my sanctuary and desecrated my Sabbaths.
EZE	23	39	God-FX1	#20		26534	" {39} On the very day they sacrificed their children to their idols, they entered my sanctuary and desecrated it. That is what they did in my house."
EZE	23	40	God-FX1	#20		26535	" {40} << They even sent messengers for men who came from far away, and when they arrived you bathed yourself for them, painted your eyes and put on your jewelry."
EZE	23	41	God-FX1	#20		26536	" {41} You sat on an elegant couch, with a table spread before it on which you had placed the incense and oil that belonged to me."
EZE	23	42	God-FX1	#20		26537	 {42} << The noise of a carefree crowd was around her; 
EZE	23	42	God-FX1	#20		26538	" Sabeans were brought from the desert along with men from the rabble, and they put bracelets on the arms of the woman and her sister and beautiful crowns on their heads."
EZE	23	43	God-FX1	#20		26539	" {43} Then I said about the one worn out by adultery, 'Now let them use her as a prostitute, for that is all she is.'"
EZE	23	44	God-FX1	#20		26540	" {44} And they slept with her. As men sleep with a prostitute, so they slept with those lewd women, Oholah and Oholibah."
EZE	23	45	God-FX1	#20		26541	" {45} But righteous men will sentence them to the punishment of women who commit adultery and shed blood, because they are adulterous and blood is on their hands."
EZE	23	46	Ezekiel	#15		26542	 {46} << This is what the Sovereign Lord says: Bring a mob against them and give them over to terror and plunder.
EZE	23	47	Ezekiel	#15		26543	 {47} The mob will stone them and cut them down with their swords; they will kill their sons and daughters and burn down their houses.
EZE	23	48	Ezekiel	#15		26544	" {48} << So I will put an end to lewdness in the land, that all women may take warning and not imitate you."
EZE	23	49	Ezekiel	#15		26545	 {49} You will suffer the penalty for your lewdness and bear the consequences of your sins of idolatry. Then you will know that I am the Sovereign Lord.>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
EZE	24	<<	Narr_26: Ezekiel	#13		26546	EZEKIEL 24
EZE	24	1	Ezekiel	#15		26547	" {1} In the ninth year, in the tenth month on the tenth day, the word of the Lord came to me:"
EZE	24	2	God-FX1	#20		26548	" {2} <<Son of man, record this date, this very date, because the king of Babylon has laid siege to Jerusalem this very day."
EZE	24	3	God-FX1	#20		26549	 {3} Tell this rebellious house a parable and say to them: 'This is what the Sovereign Lord says:
EZE	24	4	Ezekiel	#15		26550	" {4} << 'Put on the cooking pot; put it on and pour water into it. Put into it the pieces of meat, all the choice pieces--the leg and the shoulder. Fill it with the best of these bones."
EZE	24	5	Ezekiel	#15		26551	 {5} Take the pick of the flock. Pile wood beneath it for the bones; bring it to a boil and cook the bones in it.
EZE	24	6	Ezekiel	#15		26552	" {6} <<'For this is what the Sovereign Lord says: << 'Woe to the city of bloodshed, to the pot now encrusted, whose deposit will not go away! Empty it piece by piece without casting lots for them."
EZE	24	7	Ezekiel	#15		26553	" {7} << 'For the blood she shed is in her midst: She poured it on the bare rock; she did not pour it on the ground, where the dust would cover it."
EZE	24	8	Ezekiel	#15		26554	" {8} To stir up wrath and take revenge I put her blood on the bare rock, so that it would not be covered."
EZE	24	9	Ezekiel	#15		26555	" {9} << 'Therefore this is what the Sovereign Lord says: << 'Woe to the city of bloodshed! I, too, will pile the wood high."
EZE	24	10	Ezekiel	#15		26556	" {10} So heap on the wood and kindle the fire. Cook the meat well, mixing in the spices; and let the bones be charred."
EZE	24	11	Ezekiel	#15		26557	 {11} Then set the empty pot on the coals till it becomes hot and its copper glows so its impurities may be melted and its deposit burned away.
EZE	24	12	Ezekiel	#15		26558	" {12} It has frustrated all efforts; its heavy deposit has not been removed, not even by fire."
EZE	24	13	Ezekiel	#15		26559	" {13} << 'Now your impurity is lewdness. Because I tried to cleanse you but you would not be cleansed from your impurity, you will not be clean again until my wrath against you has subsided."
EZE	24	14	Ezekiel	#15		26560	" {14} << 'I the Lord have spoken. The time has come for me to act. I will not hold back; I will not have pity, nor will I relent. "
EZE	24	14	Ezekiel	#15		26561	" You will be judged according to your conduct and your actions, declares the Sovereign Lord.'"
EZE	24	15	Ezekiel	#15		26562	 {15} << The word of the Lord came to me:
EZE	24	16	God-FX1	#20		26563	" {16} << Son of man, with one blow I am about to take away from you the delight of your eyes. Yet do not lament or weep or shed any tears."
EZE	24	17	God-FX1	#20		26564	 {17} Groan quietly; do not mourn for the dead. Keep your turban fastened and your sandals on your feet; do not cover the lower part of your face or eat the customary food of mourners.>>
EZE	24	18	Ezekiel	#15		26565	" {18} So I spoke to the people in the morning, and in the evening my wife died. The next morning I did as I had been commanded."
EZE	24	19	Ezekiel	#15		26566	" {19} Then the people asked me,"
EZE	24	19	Israelite	#14		26567	 << Won't you tell us what these things have to do with us?>>
EZE	24	20	Ezekiel	#15		26568	" {20} So I said to them, << The word of the Lord came to me: {21} Say to the house of Israel, 'This is what the Sovereign Lord says:"
EZE	24	21	Ezekiel	#15		26569	" I am about to desecrate my sanctuary--the stronghold in which you take pride, the delight of your eyes, the object of your affection. "
EZE	24	21	Ezekiel	#15		26570	 The sons and daughters you left behind will fall by the sword. {22} And you will do as I have done. You will not cover the lower part of your face or eat the customary food of mourners.
EZE	24	23	Ezekiel	#15		26571	 {23} You will keep your turbans on your heads and your sandals on your feet. You will not mourn or weep but will waste away because of your sins and groan among yourselves.
EZE	24	24	Ezekiel	#15		26572	" {24} Ezekiel will be a sign to you; you will do just as he has done. When this happens, you will know that I am the Sovereign Lord.'"
EZE	24	25	God-FX1	#20		26573	" {25} << And you, son of man, on the day I take away their stronghold, their joy and glory, the delight of their eyes, their heart's desire, and their sons and daughters as well--"
EZE	24	26	God-FX1	#20		26574	 {26} on that day a fugitive will come to tell you the news.
EZE	24	27	God-FX1	#20		26575	" {27} At that time your mouth will be opened; you will speak with him and will no longer be silent. So you will be a sign to them, and they will know that I am the Lord.>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"

EZE	26	<<	Narr_26: Ezekiel	#13		26598	EZEKIEL 26
EZE	26	1	Ezekiel	#15		26599	" {1} In the eleventh year, on the first day of the month, the word of the Lord came to me:"
EZE	26	2	Ezekiel	#15		26600	" {2} << Son of man, because Tyre has said of Jerusalem, 'Aha! The gate to the nations is broken, and its doors have swung open to me; now that she lies in ruins I will prosper,' "
EZE	26	3	Ezekiel	#15		26601	" {3} therefore this is what the Sovereign Lord says:  I am against you, O Tyre, and I will bring many nations against you, like the sea casting up its waves."
EZE	26	4	God-FX1	#20		26602	 {4} They will destroy the walls of Tyre and pull down her towers; I will scrape away her rubble and make her a bare rock.
EZE	26	5	God-FX1	#20		26603	" {5} Out in the sea she will become a place to spread fishnets, for I have spoken, declares the Sovereign Lord. "
EZE	26	5	God-FX1	#20		26604	" She will become plunder for the nations, {6} and her settlements on the mainland will be ravaged by the sword. Then they will know that I am the Lord."
EZE	26	7	Ezekiel	#15		26605	 {7} << For this is what the Sovereign Lord says: 
EZE	26	7	Ezekiel	#15		26606	" From the north I am going to bring against Tyre Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, king of kings, with horses and chariots, with horsemen and a great army."
EZE	26	8	Ezekiel	#15		26607	" {8} He will ravage your settlements on the mainland with the sword; he will set up siege works against you, build a ramp up to your walls and raise his shields against you."
EZE	26	9	Ezekiel	#15		26608	 {9} He will direct the blows of his battering rams against your walls and demolish your towers with his weapons.
EZE	26	10	Ezekiel	#15		26609	 {10} His horses will be so many that they will cover you with dust. 
EZE	26	10	Ezekiel	#15		26610	" Your walls will tremble at the noise of the war horses, wagons and chariots when he enters your gates as men enter a city whose walls have been broken through."
EZE	26	11	Ezekiel	#15		26611	" {11} The hoofs of his horses will trample all your streets; he will kill your people with the sword, and your strong pillars will fall to the ground."
EZE	26	12	Ezekiel	#15		26612	" {12} They will plunder your wealth and loot your merchandise; they will break down your walls and demolish your fine houses and throw your stones, timber and rubble into the sea."
EZE	26	13	Ezekiel	#15		26613	" {13} I will put an end to your noisy songs, and the music of your harps will be heard no more."
EZE	26	14	Ezekiel	#15		26614	" {14} I will make you a bare rock, and you will become a place to spread fishnets. You will never be rebuilt, for I the Lord have spoken, declares the Sovereign Lord."
EZE	26	15	Ezekiel	#15		26615	" {15} << This is what the Sovereign Lord says to Tyre: Will not the coastlands tremble at the sound of your fall, when the wounded groan and the slaughter takes place in you?"
EZE	26	16	Ezekiel	#15		26616	 {16} Then all the princes of the coast will step down from their thrones and lay aside their robes and take off their embroidered garments. 
EZE	26	16	Ezekiel	#15		26617	" Clothed with terror, they will sit on the ground, trembling every moment, appalled at you."
EZE	26	17	Ezekiel	#15		26618	 {17} Then they will take up a lament concerning you and say to you: 
EZE	26	17	Ezekiel	#15		26619	" << 'How you are destroyed, O city of renown, peopled by men of the sea! You were a power on the seas, you and your citizens; you put your terror on all who lived there."
EZE	26	18	Ezekiel	#15		26620	 {18} Now the coastlands tremble on the day of your fall; the islands in the sea are terrified at your collapse.'
EZE	26	19	Ezekiel	#15		26621	 {19} << This is what the Sovereign Lord says: 
EZE	26	19	Ezekiel	#15		26622	" When I make you a desolate city, like cities no longer inhabited, and when I bring the ocean depths over you and its vast waters cover you, {20} then I will bring you down with those who go down to the pit, to the people of long ago."
EZE	26	20	Ezekiel	#15		26623	" I will make you dwell in the earth below, as in ancient ruins, with those who go down to the pit, and you will not return or take your place in the land of the living."
EZE	26	21	Ezekiel	#15		26624	" {21} I will bring you to a horrible end and you will be no more. You will be sought, but you will never again be found, declares the Sovereign Lord.>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
EZE	27	<<	Narr_26: Ezekiel	#13		26625	EZEKIEL 27
EZE	27	1	Ezekiel	#15		26626	 {1} The word of the Lord came to me:
EZE	27	2	God-FX1	#20		26627	" {2} << Son of man, take up a lament concerning Tyre."
EZE	27	3	God-FX1	#20		26628	" {3} Say to Tyre, situated at the gateway to the sea, merchant of peoples on many coasts, 'This is what the Sovereign Lord says: << 'You say, O Tyre, << I am perfect in beauty.>>"
EZE	27	4	Ezekiel	#15		26629	 {4} Your domain was on the high seas; your builders brought your beauty to perfection.
EZE	27	5	Ezekiel	#15		26630	 {5} They made all your timbers of pine trees from Senir; they took a cedar from Lebanon to make a mast for you.
EZE	27	6	Ezekiel	#15		26631	" {6} Of oaks from Bashan they made your oars; of cypress wood from the coasts of Cyprus they made your deck, inlaid with ivory."
EZE	27	7	Ezekiel	#15		26632	 {7} Fine embroidered linen from Egypt was your sail and served as your banner; your awnings were of blue and purple from the coasts of Elishah.
EZE	27	8	Ezekiel	#15		26633	" {8} Men of Sidon and Arvad were your oarsmen; your skilled men, O Tyre, were aboard as your seamen."
EZE	27	9	Ezekiel	#15		26634	 {9} Veteran craftsmen of Gebal were on board as shipwrights to caulk your seams. All the ships of the sea and their sailors came alongside to trade for your wares.
EZE	27	10	Ezekiel	#15		26635	" {10} << 'Men of Persia, Lydia and Put served as soldiers in your army. They hung their shields and helmets on your walls, bringing you splendor."
EZE	27	11	Ezekiel	#15		26636	 {11} Men of Arvad and Helech manned your walls on every side; men of Gammad were in your towers. They hung their shields around your walls; they brought your beauty to perfection.
EZE	27	12	Ezekiel	#15		26637	" {12} << 'Tarshish did business with you because of your great wealth of goods; they exchanged silver, iron, tin and lead for your merchandise."
EZE	27	13	Ezekiel	#15		26638	" {13} << 'Greece, Tubal and Meshech traded with you; they exchanged slaves and articles of bronze for your wares."
EZE	27	14	Ezekiel	#15		26639	" {14} << 'Men of Beth Togarmah exchanged work horses, war horses and mules for your merchandise."
EZE	27	15	Ezekiel	#15		26640	" {15} << 'The men of Rhodes traded with you, and many coastlands were your customers; they paid you with ivory tusks and ebony."
EZE	27	16	Ezekiel	#15		26641	" {16} << 'Aram did business with you because of your many products; they exchanged turquoise, purple fabric, embroidered work, fine linen, coral and rubies for your merchandise."
EZE	27	17	Ezekiel	#15		26642	" {17} << 'Judah and Israel traded with you; they exchanged wheat from Minnith and confections, honey, oil and balm for your wares."
EZE	27	18	Ezekiel	#15		26643	" {18} << 'Damascus, because of your many products and great wealth of goods, did business with you in wine from Helbon and wool from Zahar."
EZE	27	19	Ezekiel	#15		26644	" {19} << 'Danites and Greeks from Uzal bought your merchandise; they exchanged wrought iron, cassia and calamus for your wares."
EZE	27	20	Ezekiel	#15		26645	 {20} << 'Dedan traded in saddle blankets with you.
EZE	27	21	Ezekiel	#15		26646	" {21} << 'Arabia and all the princes of Kedar were your customers; they did business with you in lambs, rams and goats."
EZE	27	22	Ezekiel	#15		26647	" {22} << 'The merchants of Sheba and Raamah traded with you; for your merchandise they exchanged the finest of all kinds of spices and precious stones, and gold."
EZE	27	23	Ezekiel	#15		26648	" {23} << 'Haran, Canneh and Eden and merchants of Sheba, Asshur and Kilmad traded with you."
EZE	27	24	Ezekiel	#15		26649	" {24} In your marketplace they traded with you beautiful garments, blue fabric, embroidered work and multicolored rugs with cords twisted and tightly knotted."
EZE	27	25	Ezekiel	#15		26650	 {25} << 'The ships of Tarshish serve as carriers for your wares. You are filled with heavy cargo in the heart of the sea.
EZE	27	26	Ezekiel	#15		26651	 {26} Your oarsmen take you out to the high seas. But the east wind will break you to pieces in the heart of the sea.
EZE	27	27	Ezekiel	#15		26652	" {27} Your wealth, merchandise and wares, your mariners, seamen and shipwrights, your merchants and all your soldiers, and everyone else on board will sink into the heart of the sea on the day of your shipwreck."
EZE	27	28	Ezekiel	#15		26653	 {28} The shorelands will quake when your seamen cry out. {29} All who handle the oars will abandon their ships; the mariners and all the seamen will stand on the shore.
EZE	27	30	Ezekiel	#15		26654	 {30} They will raise their voice and cry bitterly over you; they will sprinkle dust on their heads and roll in ashes.
EZE	27	31	Ezekiel	#15		26655	 {31} They will shave their heads because of you and will put on sackcloth. They will weep over you with anguish of soul and with bitter mourning.
EZE	27	32	Ezekiel	#15		26656	" {32} As they wail and mourn over you, they will take up a lament concerning you: << Who was ever silenced like Tyre, surrounded by the sea?>>"
EZE	27	33	Ezekiel	#15		26657	" {33} When your merchandise went out on the seas, you satisfied many nations; with your great wealth and your wares you enriched the kings of the earth."
EZE	27	34	Ezekiel	#15		26658	 {34} Now you are shattered by the sea in the depths of the waters; your wares and all your company have gone down with you.
EZE	27	35	Ezekiel	#15		26659	 {35} All who live in the coastlands are appalled at you; their kings shudder with horror and their faces are distorted with fear.
EZE	27	36	Ezekiel	#15		26660	 {36} The merchants among the nations hiss at you; you have come to a horrible end and will be no more.'>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
EZE	28	<<	Narr_26: Ezekiel	#13		26661	EZEKIEL 28
EZE	28	1	Ezekiel	#15		26662	 {1} The word of the Lord came to me:
EZE	28	2	God-FX1	#20		26663	" {2} << Son of man, say to the ruler of Tyre, 'This is what the Sovereign Lord says: "
EZE	28	2	God-FX1	#20		26664	" << 'In the pride of your heart you say, << I am a god; I sit on the throne of a god in the heart of the seas.>> But you are a man and not a god, though you think you are as wise as a god."
EZE	28	3	Ezekiel	#15		26665	 {3} Are you wiser than Daniel? Is no secret hidden from you? 
EZE	28	4	Ezekiel	#15		26666	 {4} By your wisdom and understanding you have gained wealth for yourself and amassed gold and silver in your treasuries.
EZE	28	5	Ezekiel	#15		26667	" {5} By your great skill in trading you have increased your wealth, and because of your wealth your heart has grown proud."
EZE	28	6	God-FX1	#20		26668	" {6} << 'Therefore this is what the Sovereign Lord says: << 'Because you think you are wise, as wise as a god,"
EZE	28	7	God-FX1	#20		26669	" {7} I am going to bring foreigners against you, the most ruthless of nations; they will draw their swords against your beauty and wisdom and pierce your shining splendor."
EZE	28	8	God-FX1	#20		26670	" {8} They will bring you down to the pit, and you will die a violent death in the heart of the seas."
EZE	28	9	God-FX1	#20		26671	" {9} Will you then say, << I am a god,>> in the presence of those who kill you? You will be but a man, not a god, in the hands of those who slay you."
EZE	28	10	God-FX1	#20		26672	" {10} You will die the death of the uncircumcised at the hands of foreigners. I have spoken,>>"
EZE	28	10	Ezekiel	#15		26673	 declares the Sovereign Lord.'
EZE	28	11	Ezekiel	#15		26674	 {11} The word of the Lord came to me:

EZE	28	13	Ezekiel	#15		26676	" {13} You were in Eden, the garden of God; every precious stone adorned you: ruby, topaz and emerald, chrysolite, onyx and jasper, sapphire, turquoise and beryl. "
EZE	28	13	Ezekiel	#15		26677	 Your settings and mountings were made of gold; on the day you were created they were prepared.
EZE	28	14	Ezekiel	#15		26678	" {14} You were anointed as a guardian cherub, for so I ordained you. You were on the holy mount of God; you walked among the fiery stones."
EZE	28	15	Ezekiel	#15		26679	 {15} You were blameless in your ways from the day you were created till wickedness was found in you.
EZE	28	16	Ezekiel	#15		26680	" {16} Through your widespread trade you were filled with violence, and you sinned. "
EZE	28	16	Ezekiel	#15		26681	" So I drove you in disgrace from the mount of God, and I expelled you, O guardian cherub, from among the fiery stones."
EZE	28	17	Ezekiel	#15		26682	" {17} Your heart became proud on account of your beauty, and you corrupted your wisdom because of your splendor. So I threw you to the earth; I made a spectacle of you before kings."
EZE	28	18	Ezekiel	#15		26683	 {18} By your many sins and dishonest trade you have desecrated your sanctuaries. 
EZE	28	18	Ezekiel	#15		26684	" So I made a fire come out from you, and it consumed you, and I reduced you to ashes on the ground in the sight of all who were watching."
EZE	28	19	Ezekiel	#15		26685	 {19} All the nations who knew you are appalled at you; you have come to a horrible end and will be no more.'
EZE	28	20	Ezekiel	#15		26686	 {20} << The word of the Lord came to me:
EZE	28	21	God-FX1	#20		26687	" {21} << Son of man, set your face against Sidon; prophesy against her {22} and say: 'This is what the Sovereign Lord says: "
EZE	28	22	God-FX1	#20		26688	" << 'I am against you, O Sidon, and I will gain glory within you. They will know that I am the Lord, when I inflict punishment on her and show myself holy within her."
EZE	28	23	Ezekiel	#15		26689	" {23} I will send a plague upon her and make blood flow in her streets. The slain will fall within her, with the sword against her on every side. Then they will know that I am the Lord."
EZE	28	24	Ezekiel	#15		26690	 {24} << 'No longer will the people of Israel have malicious neighbors who are painful briers and sharp thorns. Then they will know that I am the Sovereign Lord.
EZE	28	25	Ezekiel	#15		26691	 {25} << 'This is what the Sovereign Lord says:
EZE	28	25	God-FX1	#20		26692	" When I gather the people of Israel from the nations where they have been scattered, I will show myself holy among them in the sight of the nations. "
EZE	28	25	God-FX1	#20		26693	" Then they will live in their own land, which I gave to my servant Jacob."
EZE	28	26	God-FX1	#20		26694	 {26} They will live there in safety and will build houses and plant vineyards; they will live in safety when I inflict punishment on all their neighbors who maligned them.

EZE	29	1	Ezekiel	#15		26697	" {1} In the tenth year, in the tenth month on the twelfth day, the word of the Lord came to me:"
EZE	29	2	God-FX1	#20		26698	" {2} << Son of man, set your face against Pharaoh king of Egypt and prophesy against him and against all Egypt. {3} Speak to him and say: 'This is what the Sovereign Lord says: "
EZE	29	3	God-FX1	#20		26699	" << 'I am against you, Pharaoh king of Egypt, you great monster lying among your streams. You say, << The Nile is mine; I made it for myself.>>"
EZE	29	4	Ezekiel	#15		26700	" {4} But I will put hooks in your jaws and make the fish of your streams stick to your scales. I will pull you out from among your streams, with all the fish sticking to your scales."
EZE	29	5	Ezekiel	#15		26701	" {5} I will leave you in the desert, you and all the fish of your streams. You will fall on the open field and not be gathered or picked up. "
EZE	29	5	Ezekiel	#15		26702	 I will give you as food to the beasts of the earth and the birds of the air.
EZE	29	6	Ezekiel	#15		26703	 {6} Then all who live in Egypt will know that I am the Lord. << 'You have been a staff of reed for the house of Israel.
EZE	29	7	Ezekiel	#15		26704	" {7} When they grasped you with their hands, you splintered and you tore open their shoulders; when they leaned on you, you broke and their backs were wrenched."
EZE	29	8	Ezekiel	#15		26705	 {8} << 'Therefore this is what the Sovereign Lord says: I will bring a sword against you and kill your men and their animals.
EZE	29	9	Ezekiel	#15		26706	" {9} Egypt will become a desolate wasteland. Then they will know that I am the Lord. << 'Because you said, << The Nile is mine; I made it,>>"
EZE	29	10	Ezekiel	#15		26707	" {10} therefore I am against you and against your streams, and I will make the land of Egypt a ruin and a desolate waste from Migdol to Aswan, as far as the border of Cush."
EZE	29	11	Ezekiel	#15		26708	 {11} No foot of man or animal will pass through it; no one will live there for forty years.
EZE	29	12	Ezekiel	#15		26709	" {12} I will make the land of Egypt desolate among devastated lands, and her cities will lie desolate forty years among ruined cities. "
EZE	29	12	Ezekiel	#15		26710	 And I will disperse the Egyptians among the nations and scatter them through the countries.
EZE	29	13	Ezekiel	#15		26711	 {13} << 'Yet this is what the Sovereign Lord says: At the end of forty years I will gather the Egyptians from the nations where they were scattered.
EZE	29	14	Ezekiel	#15		26712	" {14} I will bring them back from captivity and return them to Upper Egypt, the land of their ancestry. There they will be a lowly kingdom."
EZE	29	15	Ezekiel	#15		26713	 {15} It will be the lowliest of kingdoms and will never again exalt itself above the other nations. I will make it so weak that it will never again rule over the nations.
EZE	29	16	Ezekiel	#15		26714	 {16} Egypt will no longer be a source of confidence for the people of Israel but will be a reminder of their sin in turning to her for help. Then they will know that I am the Sovereign Lord.'
EZE	29	17	Ezekiel	#15		26715	" {17} << In the twenty-seventh year, in the first month on the first day, the word of the Lord came to me:"
EZE	29	18	God-FX1	#20		26716	" {18} << Son of man, Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon drove his army in a hard campaign against Tyre; every head was rubbed bare and every shoulder made raw. "
EZE	29	18	God-FX1	#20		26717	 Yet he and his army got no reward from the campaign he led against Tyre.
EZE	29	19	Ezekiel	#15		26718	 {19} Therefore this is what the Sovereign Lord says: 
EZE	29	19	Ezekiel	#15		26719	" I am going to give Egypt to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and he will carry off its wealth. He will loot and plunder the land as pay for his army."
EZE	29	20	Ezekiel	#15		26720	" {20} I have given him Egypt as a reward for his efforts because he and his army did it for me, declares the Sovereign Lord."
EZE	29	21	Ezekiel	#15		26721	" {21} << On that day I will make a horn grow for the house of Israel, and I will open your mouth among them. Then they will know that I am the Lord.>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"

EZE	30	4	Ezekiel	#15		26726	" {4} A sword will come against Egypt, and anguish will come upon Cush. When the slain fall in Egypt, her wealth will be carried away and her foundations torn down."

EZE	30	15	Ezekiel	#15		26737	" {15} I will pour out my wrath on Pelusium, the stronghold of Egypt, and cut off the hordes of Thebes."
EZE	30	16	Ezekiel	#15		26738	 {16} I will set fire to Egypt; Pelusium will writhe in agony. Thebes will be taken by storm; Memphis will be in constant distress.
EZE	30	17	Ezekiel	#15		26739	" {17} The young men of Heliopolis and Bubastis will fall by the sword, and the cities themselves will go into captivity."
EZE	30	18	Ezekiel	#15		26740	" {18} Dark will be the day at Tahpanhes when I break the yoke of Egypt; there her proud strength will come to an end. She will be covered with clouds, and her villages will go into captivity."
EZE	30	19	Ezekiel	#15		26741	" {19} So I will inflict punishment on Egypt, and they will know that I am the Lord.'"
EZE	30	20	Ezekiel	#15		26742	" {20} << In the eleventh year, in the first month on the seventh day, the word of the Lord came to me:"
EZE	30	21	God-FX1	#20		26743	" {21} << Son of man, I have broken the arm of Pharaoh king of Egypt. It has not been bound up for healing or put in a splint so as to become strong enough to hold a sword."
EZE	30	22	Ezekiel	#15		26744	" {22} Therefore this is what the Sovereign Lord says: I am against Pharaoh king of Egypt. I will break both his arms, the good arm as well as the broken one, and make the sword fall from his hand."
EZE	30	23	Ezekiel	#15		26745	 {23} I will disperse the Egyptians among the nations and scatter them through the countries.
EZE	30	24	Ezekiel	#15		26746	" {24} I will strengthen the arms of the king of Babylon and put my sword in his hand, but I will break the arms of Pharaoh, and he will groan before him like a mortally wounded man."
