EZE	30	25	Ezekiel	#15		26748	" Then they will know that I am the Lord, when I put my sword into the hand of the king of Babylon and he brandishes it against Egypt."
EZE	30	26	Ezekiel	#15		26749	 {26} I will disperse the Egyptians among the nations and scatter them through the countries. Then they will know that I am the Lord.>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
EZE	31	<<	Narr_26: Ezekiel	#13		26750	EZEKIEL 31
EZE	31	1	Ezekiel	#15		26751	" {1} In the eleventh year, in the third month on the first day, the word of the Lord came to me:"
EZE	31	2	God-FX1	#20		26752	" {2} << Son of man, say to Pharaoh king of Egypt and to his hordes: << 'Who can be compared with you in majesty?"
EZE	31	3	Ezekiel	#15		26753	" {3} Consider Assyria, once a cedar in Lebanon, with beautiful branches overshadowing the forest; it towered on high, its top above the thick foliage."
EZE	31	4	Ezekiel	#15		26754	" {4} The waters nourished it, deep springs made it grow tall; their streams flowed all around its base and sent their channels to all the trees of the field."
EZE	31	5	Ezekiel	#15		26755	" {5} So it towered higher than all the trees of the field; its boughs increased and its branches grew long, spreading because of abundant waters."
EZE	31	6	Ezekiel	#15		26756	" {6} All the birds of the air nested in its boughs, all the beasts of the field gave birth under its branches; all the great nations lived in its shade."
EZE	31	7	Ezekiel	#15		26757	" {7} It was majestic in beauty, with its spreading boughs, for its roots went down to abundant waters."
EZE	31	8	Ezekiel	#15		26758	" {8} The cedars in the garden of God could not rival it, nor could the pine trees equal its boughs, nor could the plane trees compare with its branches-- "
EZE	31	8	Ezekiel	#15		26759	" no tree in the garden of God could match its beauty. {9} I made it beautiful with abundant branches, the envy of all the trees of Eden in the garden of God."
EZE	31	10	Ezekiel	#15		26760	" {10} << 'Therefore this is what the Sovereign Lord says: Because it towered on high, lifting its top above the thick foliage, and because it was proud of its height,"
EZE	31	11	Ezekiel	#15		26761	" {11} I handed it over to the ruler of the nations, for him to deal with according to its wickedness. "
EZE	31	11	Ezekiel	#15		26762	" I cast it aside, {12} and the most ruthless of foreign nations cut it down and left it. "
EZE	31	12	Ezekiel	#15		26763	 Its boughs fell on the mountains and in all the valleys; its branches lay broken in all the ravines of the land. All the nations of the earth came out from under its shade and left it. 
EZE	31	13	Ezekiel	#15		26764	" {13} All the birds of the air settled on the fallen tree, and all the beasts of the field were among its branches."
EZE	31	14	Ezekiel	#15		26765	" {14} Therefore no other trees by the waters are ever to tower proudly on high, lifting their tops above the thick foliage. "
EZE	31	14	Ezekiel	#15		26766	" No other trees so well-watered are ever to reach such a height; they are all destined for death, for the earth below, among mortal men, with those who go down to the pit."
EZE	31	15	Ezekiel	#15		26767	 {15} << 'This is what the Sovereign Lord says: 
EZE	31	15	Ezekiel	#15		26768	" On the day it was brought down to the grave I covered the deep springs with mourning for it; I held back its streams, and its abundant waters were restrained. "
EZE	31	15	Ezekiel	#15		26769	" Because of it I clothed Lebanon with gloom, and all the trees of the field withered away."
EZE	31	16	Ezekiel	#15		26770	 {16} I made the nations tremble at the sound of its fall when I brought it down to the grave with those who go down to the pit. 
EZE	31	16	Ezekiel	#15		26771	" Then all the trees of Eden, the choicest and best of Lebanon, all the trees that were well-watered, were consoled in the earth below."
EZE	31	17	Ezekiel	#15		26772	" {17} Those who lived in its shade, its allies among the nations, had also gone down to the grave with it, joining those killed by the sword."
EZE	31	18	Ezekiel	#15		26773	 {18} << 'Which of the trees of Eden can be compared with you in splendor and majesty? 
EZE	31	18	Ezekiel	#15		26774	" Yet you, too, will be brought down with the trees of Eden to the earth below; you will lie among the uncircumcised, with those killed by the sword. "
EZE	31	18	Ezekiel	#15		26775	" << 'This is Pharaoh and all his hordes, declares the Sovereign Lord.'>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
EZE	32	<<	Narr_26: Ezekiel	#13		26776	EZEKIEL 32
EZE	32	1	Ezekiel	#15		26777	" {1} In the twelfth year, in the twelfth month on the first day, the word of the Lord came to me:"
EZE	32	2	God-FX1	#20		26778	" {2} << Son of man, take up a lament concerning Pharaoh king of Egypt and say to him: "
EZE	32	2	God-FX1	#20		26779	" << 'You are like a lion among the nations; you are like a monster in the seas thrashing about in your streams, churning the water with your feet and muddying the streams."
EZE	32	3	Ezekiel	#15		26780	" {3} << 'This is what the Sovereign Lord says: << 'With a great throng of people I will cast my net over you, and they will haul you up in my net."
EZE	32	4	Ezekiel	#15		26781	 {4} I will throw you on the land and hurl you on the open field. I will let all the birds of the air settle on you and all the beasts of the earth gorge themselves on you.
EZE	32	5	Ezekiel	#15		26782	 {5} I will spread your flesh on the mountains and fill the valleys with your remains.
EZE	32	6	Ezekiel	#15		26783	" {6} I will drench the land with your flowing blood all the way to the mountains, and the ravines will be filled with your flesh."
EZE	32	7	Ezekiel	#15		26784	" {7} When I snuff you out, I will cover the heavens and darken their stars; I will cover the sun with a cloud, and the moon will not give its light."
EZE	32	8	Ezekiel	#15		26785	" {8} All the shining lights in the heavens I will darken over you; I will bring darkness over your land, declares the Sovereign Lord."
EZE	32	9	Ezekiel	#15		26786	" {9} I will trouble the hearts of many peoples when I bring about your destruction among the nations, among lands you have not known."
EZE	32	10	Ezekiel	#15		26787	" {10} I will cause many peoples to be appalled at you, and their kings will shudder with horror because of you when I brandish my sword before them. "
EZE	32	10	Ezekiel	#15		26788	 On the day of your downfall each of them will tremble every moment for his life.
EZE	32	11	Ezekiel	#15		26789	 {11} << 'For this is what the Sovereign Lord says: << 'The sword of the king of Babylon will come against you.
EZE	32	12	Ezekiel	#15		26790	" {12} I will cause your hordes to fall by the swords of mighty men-- the most ruthless of all nations. They will shatter the pride of Egypt, and all her hordes will be overthrown."
EZE	32	13	Ezekiel	#15		26791	 {13} I will destroy all her cattle from beside abundant waters no longer to be stirred by the foot of man or muddied by the hoofs of cattle.
EZE	32	14	Ezekiel	#15		26792	" {14} Then I will let her waters settle and make her streams flow like oil, declares the Sovereign Lord."
EZE	32	15	Ezekiel	#15		26793	" {15} When I make Egypt desolate and strip the land of everything in it, when I strike down all who live there, then they will know that I am the Lord.'"
EZE	32	16	Ezekiel	#15		26794	" {16} << This is the lament they will chant for her. The daughters of the nations will chant it; for Egypt and all her hordes they will chant it, declares the Sovereign Lord.>>"
EZE	32	17	Ezekiel	#15		26795	" {17} In the twelfth year, on the fifteenth day of the month, the word of the Lord came to me:"
EZE	32	18	Ezekiel	#15		26796	" {18} << Son of man, wail for the hordes of Egypt and consign to the earth below both her and the daughters of mighty nations, with those who go down to the pit."
EZE	32	19	Ezekiel	#15		26797	" {19} Say to them, 'Are you more favored than others? Go down and be laid among the uncircumcised.'"
EZE	32	20	Ezekiel	#15		26798	 {20} They will fall among those killed by the sword. The sword is drawn; let her be dragged off with all her hordes.
EZE	32	21	Ezekiel	#15		26799	" {21} From within the grave the mighty leaders will say of Egypt and her allies, 'They have come down and they lie with the uncircumcised, with those killed by the sword.'"
EZE	32	22	Ezekiel	#15		26800	" {22} << Assyria is there with her whole army; she is surrounded by the graves of all her slain, all who have fallen by the sword."
EZE	32	23	Ezekiel	#15		26801	" {23} Their graves are in the depths of the pit and her army lies around her grave. All who had spread terror in the land of the living are slain, fallen by the sword."
EZE	32	24	Ezekiel	#15		26802	" {24} << Elam is there, with all her hordes around her grave. All of them are slain, fallen by the sword. "
EZE	32	24	Ezekiel	#15		26803	 All who had spread terror in the land of the living went down uncircumcised to the earth below. They bear their shame with those who go down to the pit.
EZE	32	25	Ezekiel	#15		26804	" {25} A bed is made for her among the slain, with all her hordes around her grave. All of them are uncircumcised, killed by the sword. "
EZE	32	25	Ezekiel	#15		26805	" Because their terror had spread in the land of the living, they bear their shame with those who go down to the pit; they are laid among the slain."
EZE	32	26	Ezekiel	#15		26806	" {26} << Meshech and Tubal are there, with all their hordes around their graves. All of them are uncircumcised, killed by the sword because they spread their terror in the land of the living."
EZE	32	27	Ezekiel	#15		26807	" {27} Do they not lie with the other uncircumcised warriors who have fallen, who went down to the grave with their weapons of war, whose swords were placed under their heads? "
EZE	32	27	Ezekiel	#15		26808	" The punishment for their sins rested on their bones, though the terror of these warriors had stalked through the land of the living."
EZE	32	28	Ezekiel	#15		26809	" {28} << You too, O Pharaoh, will be broken and will lie among the uncircumcised, with those killed by the sword."
EZE	32	29	Ezekiel	#15		26810	" {29} << Edom is there, her kings and all her princes; despite their power, they are laid with those killed by the sword. They lie with the uncircumcised, with those who go down to the pit."
EZE	32	30	Ezekiel	#15		26811	 {30} << All the princes of the north and all the Sidonians are there; they went down with the slain in disgrace despite the terror caused by their power.

EZE	32	31	Ezekiel	#15		26813	" {31} << Pharaoh --he and all his army--will see them and he will be consoled for all his hordes that were killed by the sword, declares the Sovereign Lord."

EZE	33	<<	Narr_26: Ezekiel	#13		26815	EZEKIEL 33

EZE	33	2	God-FX1	#20		26817	" {2} << Son of man, speak to your countrymen and say to them:"
EZE	33	2	God-FX1	#20		26818	" 'When I bring the sword against a land, and the people of the land choose one of their men and make him their watchman,"
EZE	33	3	Ezekiel	#15		26819	" {3} and he sees the sword coming against the land and blows the trumpet to warn the people,"
EZE	33	4	Ezekiel	#15		26820	" {4} then if anyone hears the trumpet but does not take warning and the sword comes and takes his life, his blood will be on his own head."
EZE	33	5	Ezekiel	#15		26821	" {5} Since he heard the sound of the trumpet but did not take warning, his blood will be on his own head. If he had taken warning, he would have saved himself."
EZE	33	6	Ezekiel	#15		26822	" {6} But if the watchman sees the sword coming and does not blow the trumpet to warn the people and the sword comes and takes the life of one of them, "
EZE	33	6	Ezekiel	#15		26823	" that man will be taken away because of his sin, but I will hold the watchman accountable for his blood.'"
EZE	33	7	Ezekiel	#15		26824	" {7} << Son of man, I have made you a watchman for the house of Israel; so hear the word I speak and give them warning from me."
EZE	33	8	Ezekiel	#15		26825	" {8} When I say to the wicked, 'O wicked man, you will surely die,' and you do not speak out to dissuade him from his ways, that wicked man will die for his sin, and I will hold you accountable for his blood."
EZE	33	9	Ezekiel	#15		26826	" {9} But if you do warn the wicked man to turn from his ways and he does not do so, he will die for his sin, but you will have saved yourself."

EZE	33	11	Ezekiel	#15		26828	" {11} Say to them, 'As surely as I live, declares the Sovereign Lord, I take no pleasure in the death of the wicked, but rather that they turn from their ways and live. "

EZE	33	12	God-FX1	#20		26830	" {12} << Therefore, son of man, say to your countrymen,"
EZE	33	12	God-FX1	#20		26831	" 'The righteousness of the righteous man will not save him when he disobeys, and the wickedness of the wicked man will not cause him to fall when he turns from it. "
EZE	33	12	God-FX1	#20		26832	" The righteous man, if he sins, will not be allowed to live because of his former righteousness.'"
EZE	33	13	Ezekiel	#15		26833	" {13} If I tell the righteous man that he will surely live, but then he trusts in his righteousness and does evil, none of the righteous things he has done will be remembered; he will die for the evil he has done."
EZE	33	14	Ezekiel	#15		26834	" {14} And if I say to the wicked man, 'You will surely die,' but he then turns away from his sin and does what is just and right--"
EZE	33	15	Ezekiel	#15		26835	" {15} if he gives back what he took in pledge for a loan, returns what he has stolen, follows the decrees that give life, and does no evil, he will surely live; he will not die."
EZE	33	16	Ezekiel	#15		26836	 {16} None of the sins he has committed will be remembered against him. He has done what is just and right; he will surely live.
EZE	33	17	Ezekiel	#15		26837	" {17} << Yet your countrymen say, 'The way of the Lord is not just.' But it is their way that is not just."
EZE	33	18	Ezekiel	#15		26838	" {18} If a righteous man turns from his righteousness and does evil, he will die for it."
EZE	33	19	Ezekiel	#15		26839	" {19} And if a wicked man turns away from his wickedness and does what is just and right, he will live by doing so."
EZE	33	20	Ezekiel	#15		26840	" {20} Yet, O house of Israel, you say, 'The way of the Lord is not just.' But I will judge each of you according to his own ways.>>"

EZE	33	24	God-FX1	#20		26845	" {24} << Son of man, the people living in those ruins in the land of Israel are saying, 'Abraham was only one man, yet he possessed the land. "

EZE	33	28	Ezekiel	#15		26851	" {28} I will make the land a desolate waste, and her proud strength will come to an end, and the mountains of Israel will become desolate so that no one will cross them."

EZE	33	32	God-FX1	#20		26856	" {32} Indeed, to them you are nothing more than one who sings love songs with a beautiful voice and plays an instrument well, for they hear your words but do not put them into practice."

EZE	34	<<	Narr_26: Ezekiel	#13		26858	EZEKIEL 34
EZE	34	1	Ezekiel	#15		26859	 {1} The word of the Lord came to me:

EZE	34	2	God-FX1	#20		26861	 Woe to the shepherds of Israel who only take care of themselves! Should not shepherds take care of the flock?
EZE	34	3	Ezekiel	#15		26862	" {3} You eat the curds, clothe yourselves with the wool and slaughter the choice animals, but you do not take care of the flock."
EZE	34	4	Ezekiel	#15		26863	 {4} You have not strengthened the weak or healed the sick or bound up the injured. You have not brought back the strays or searched for the lost. You have ruled them harshly and brutally.
EZE	34	5	Ezekiel	#15		26864	" {5} So they were scattered because there was no shepherd, and when they were scattered they became food for all the wild animals."
EZE	34	6	Ezekiel	#15		26865	" {6} My sheep wandered over all the mountains and on every high hill. They were scattered over the whole earth, and no one searched or looked for them."
EZE	34	7	Ezekiel	#15		26866	" {7} << 'Therefore, you shepherds, hear the word of the Lord:"

EZE	34	10	God-FX1	#20		26870	 {10} This is what the Sovereign Lord says: I am against the shepherds and will hold them accountable for my flock. 
EZE	34	10	God-FX1	#20		26871	" I will remove them from tending the flock so that the shepherds can no longer feed themselves. I will rescue my flock from their mouths, and it will no longer be food for them."
EZE	34	11	Ezekiel	#15		26872	 {11} 'For this is what the Sovereign Lord says: I myself will search for my sheep and look after them.
EZE	34	12	Ezekiel	#15		26873	" {12} As a shepherd looks after his scattered flock when he is with them, so will I look after my sheep. "
EZE	34	12	Ezekiel	#15		26874	 I will rescue them from all the places where they were scattered on a day of clouds and darkness.
EZE	34	13	Ezekiel	#15		26875	" {13} I will bring them out from the nations and gather them from the countries, and I will bring them into their own land."
EZE	34	13	Ezekiel	#15		26876	" I will pasture them on the mountains of Israel, in the ravines and in all the settlements in the land."
EZE	34	14	Ezekiel	#15		26877	" {14} I will tend them in a good pasture, and the mountain heights of Israel will be their grazing land."
EZE	34	14	Ezekiel	#15		26878	" There they will lie down in good grazing land, and there they will feed in a rich pasture on the mountains of Israel."
EZE	34	15	Ezekiel	#15		26879	" {15} I myself will tend my sheep and have them lie down, declares the Sovereign Lord."
EZE	34	16	Ezekiel	#15		26880	" {16} I will search for the lost and bring back the strays. I will bind up the injured and strengthen the weak, but the sleek and the strong I will destroy. I will shepherd the flock with justice."
EZE	34	17	God-FX1	#20		26881	" {17} << 'As for you, my flock, this is what the Sovereign Lord says: I will judge between one sheep and another, and between rams and goats."
EZE	34	18	God-FX1	#20		26882	 {18} Is it not enough for you to feed on the good pasture? Must you also trample the rest of your pasture with your feet?
EZE	34	18	God-FX1	#20		26883	 Is it not enough for you to drink clear water? Must you also muddy the rest with your feet? {19} Must my flock feed on what you have trampled and drink what you have muddied with your feet?

EZE	34	22	Ezekiel	#15		26886	" I will judge between one sheep and another. {23} I will place over them one shepherd, my servant David, and he will tend them; he will tend them and be their shepherd."
EZE	34	24	Ezekiel	#15		26887	" {24} I the Lord will be their God, and my servant David will be prince among them. I the Lord have spoken."
EZE	34	25	God-FX1	#20		26888	 {25} << 'I will make a covenant of peace with them and rid the land of wild beasts so that they may live in the desert and sleep in the forests in safety.
EZE	34	26	God-FX1	#20		26889	 {26} I will bless them and the places surrounding my hill. I will send down showers in season; there will be showers of blessing.
EZE	34	27	God-FX1	#20		26890	 {27} The trees of the field will yield their fruit and the ground will yield its crops; the people will be secure in their land. 
EZE	34	27	God-FX1	#20		26891	" They will know that I am the Lord, when I break the bars of their yoke and rescue them from the hands of those who enslaved them."
EZE	34	28	God-FX1	#20		26892	" {28} They will no longer be plundered by the nations, nor will wild animals devour them. They will live in safety, and no one will make them afraid."
EZE	34	29	God-FX1	#20		26893	" {29} I will provide for them a land renowned for its crops, and they will no longer be victims of famine in the land or bear the scorn of the nations."

EZE	36	3	God-FX1	#20		26919	" Because they ravaged and hounded you from every side so that you became the possession of the rest of the nations and the object of people's malicious talk and slander,"

EZE	36	4	God-FX1	#20		26921	" This is what the Sovereign Lord says to the mountains and hills, to the ravines and valleys, to the desolate ruins and the deserted towns that have been plundered and ridiculed by the rest of the nations around you--"
EZE	36	5	God-FX1	#20		26922	 {5} this is what the Sovereign Lord says:
EZE	36	5	God-FX1	#20		26923	" In my burning zeal I have spoken against the rest of the nations, and against all Edom, for with glee and with malice in their hearts they made my land their own possession so that they might plunder its pastureland.'"
EZE	36	6	God-FX1	#20		26924	" {6} Therefore prophesy concerning the land of Israel and say to the mountains and hills, to the ravines and valleys: 'This is what the Sovereign Lord says:"
EZE	36	6	God-FX1	#20		26925	 I speak in my jealous wrath because you have suffered the scorn of the nations.
EZE	36	7	Ezekiel	#15		26926	 {7} Therefore this is what the Sovereign Lord says: I swear with uplifted hand that the nations around you will also suffer scorn.
EZE	36	8	Ezekiel	#15		26927	" {8} << 'But you, O mountains of Israel, will produce branches and fruit for my people Israel, for they will soon come home."
EZE	36	9	Ezekiel	#15		26928	" {9} I am concerned for you and will look on you with favor; you will be plowed and sown, {10} and I will multiply the number of people upon you, even the whole house of Israel. "
EZE	36	10	Ezekiel	#15		26929	" The towns will be inhabited and the ruins rebuilt. {11} I will increase the number of men and animals upon you, and they will be fruitful and become numerous. "
EZE	36	11	Ezekiel	#15		26930	 I will settle people on you as in the past and will make you prosper more than before. Then you will know that I am the Lord.
EZE	36	12	Ezekiel	#15		26931	" {12} I will cause people, my people Israel, to walk upon you. They will possess you, and you will be their inheritance; you will never again deprive them of their children."
EZE	36	13	Ezekiel	#15		26932	 {13} << 'This is what the Sovereign Lord says: 
EZE	36	13	Ezekiel	#15		26933	" Because people say to you, << You devour men and deprive your nation of its children,>> {14} therefore you will no longer devour men or make your nation childless, declares the Sovereign Lord."

EZE	36	15	Ezekiel	#15		26935	 declares the Lord.

EZE	36	17	God-FX1	#20		26937	" {17} << Son of man, when the people of Israel were living in their own land, they defiled it by their conduct and their actions. Their conduct was like a woman's monthly uncleanness in my sight."

EZE	36	19	God-FX1	#20		26939	" {19} I dispersed them among the nations, and they were scattered through the countries; I judged them according to their conduct and their actions."
EZE	36	20	God-FX1	#20		26940	" {20} And wherever they went among the nations they profaned my holy name, for it was said of them, 'These are the Lord's people, and yet they had to leave his land.'"
EZE	36	21	God-FX1	#20		26941	" {21} I had concern for my holy name, which the house of Israel profaned among the nations where they had gone."

EZE	36	22	God-FX1	#20		26943	" It is not for your sake, O house of Israel, that I am going to do these things, but for the sake of my holy name, which you have profaned among the nations where you have gone."

EZE	40	<<	Narr_26: Ezekiel	#13		27063	EZEKIEL 40
EZE	40	1	Ezekiel	#15		27064	" {1} In the twenty-fifth year of our exile, at the beginning of the year, on the tenth of the month, in the fourteenth year after the fall of the city--on that very day the hand of the Lord was upon me and he took me there."
EZE	40	2	Ezekiel	#15		27065	" {2} In visions of God he took me to the land of Israel and set me on a very high mountain, on whose south side were some buildings that looked like a city."
EZE	40	3	Ezekiel	#15		27066	" {3} He took me there, and I saw a man whose appearance was like bronze; he was standing in the gateway with a linen cord and a measuring rod in his hand. {4} The man said to me,"
EZE	40	4	Heavenly Man-FX1	#10		27067	" << Son of man, look with your eyes and hear with your ears and pay attention to everything I am going to show you, for that is why you have been brought here. "
EZE	40	4	Heavenly Man-FX1	#10		27068	 Tell the house of Israel everything you see.>>
EZE	40	5	Ezekiel	#15		27069	 {5} I saw a wall completely surrounding the temple area. 
EZE	40	5	Ezekiel	#15		27070	" The length of the measuring rod in the man's hand was six long cubits, each of which was a cubit and a handbreadth. He measured the wall; it was one measuring rod thick and one rod high."
EZE	40	6	Ezekiel	#15		27071	 {6} Then he went to the gate facing east. He climbed its steps and measured the threshold of the gate; it was one rod deep.
EZE	40	7	Ezekiel	#15		27072	" {7} The alcoves for the guards were one rod long and one rod wide, and the projecting walls between the alcoves were five cubits thick. "
EZE	40	7	Ezekiel	#15		27073	 And the threshold of the gate next to the portico facing the temple was one rod deep. 
EZE	40	8	Ezekiel	#15		27074	 {8} Then he measured the portico of the gateway; {9} it was eight cubits deep and its jambs were two cubits thick. The portico of the gateway faced the temple.
EZE	40	10	Ezekiel	#15		27075	" {10} Inside the east gate were three alcoves on each side; the three had the same measurements, and the faces of the projecting walls on each side had the same measurements."
EZE	40	11	Ezekiel	#15		27076	 {11} Then he measured the width of the entrance to the gateway; it was ten cubits and its length was thirteen cubits.
EZE	40	12	Ezekiel	#15		27077	" {12} In front of each alcove was a wall one cubit high, and the alcoves were six cubits square."
EZE	40	13	Ezekiel	#15		27078	 {13} Then he measured the gateway from the top of the rear wall of one alcove to the top of the opposite one; the distance was twenty-five cubits from one parapet opening to the opposite one.
EZE	40	14	Ezekiel	#15		27079	 {14} He measured along the faces of the projecting walls all around the inside of the gateway--sixty cubits. The measurement was up to the portico facing the courtyard.
EZE	40	15	Ezekiel	#15		27080	 {15} The distance from the entrance of the gateway to the far end of its portico was fifty cubits.
EZE	40	16	Ezekiel	#15		27081	" {16} The alcoves and the projecting walls inside the gateway were surmounted by narrow parapet openings all around, as was the portico; the openings all around faced inward. "
EZE	40	16	Ezekiel	#15		27082	 The faces of the projecting walls were decorated with palm trees.
EZE	40	17	Ezekiel	#15		27083	 {17} Then he brought me into the outer court. There I saw some rooms and a pavement that had been constructed all around the court; there were thirty rooms along the pavement.
EZE	40	18	Ezekiel	#15		27084	 {18} It abutted the sides of the gateways and was as wide as they were long; this was the lower pavement.

EZE	44	<<	Narr_26: Ezekiel	#13		27204	EZEKIEL 44
EZE	44	1	Ezekiel	#15		27205	" {1} Then the man brought me back to the outer gate of the sanctuary, the one facing east, and it was shut. {2} The Lord said to me,"
EZE	44	2	God-FX1	#20		27206	" << This gate is to remain shut. It must not be opened; no one may enter through it. It is to remain shut because the Lord, the God of Israel, has entered through it."
EZE	44	3	God-FX1	#20		27207	 {3} The prince himself is the only one who may sit inside the gateway to eat in the presence of the Lord. He is to enter by way of the portico of the gateway and go out the same way.>>
EZE	44	4	Ezekiel	#15		27208	" {4} Then the man brought me by way of the north gate to the front of the temple. I looked and saw the glory of the Lord filling the temple of the Lord, and I fell facedown."
EZE	44	5	Ezekiel	#15		27209	" {5} The Lord said to me,"
EZE	44	5	God-FX1	#20		27210	" << Son of man, look carefully, listen closely and give attention to everything I tell you concerning all the regulations regarding the temple of the Lord. "

EZE	44	6	God-FX1	#20		27212	" {6} Say to the rebellious house of Israel, 'This is what the Sovereign Lord says: Enough of your detestable practices, O house of Israel!"
EZE	44	7	Ezekiel	#15		27213	" {7} In addition to all your other detestable practices, you brought foreigners uncircumcised in heart and flesh into my sanctuary, desecrating my temple while you offered me food, fat and blood, and you broke my covenant."
EZE	44	8	Ezekiel	#15		27214	" {8} Instead of carrying out your duty in regard to my holy things, you put others in charge of my sanctuary."
EZE	44	9	Ezekiel	#15		27215	" {9} This is what the Sovereign Lord says: No foreigner uncircumcised in heart and flesh is to enter my sanctuary, not even the foreigners who live among the Israelites."
EZE	44	10	Ezekiel	#15		27216	 {10} << 'The Levites who went far from me when Israel went astray and who wandered from me after their idols must bear the consequences of their sin.
EZE	44	11	Ezekiel	#15		27217	" {11} They may serve in my sanctuary, having charge of the gates of the temple and serving in it; "
EZE	44	11	Ezekiel	#15		27218	 they may slaughter the burnt offerings and sacrifices for the people and stand before the people and serve them.
EZE	44	12	Ezekiel	#15		27219	" {12} But because they served them in the presence of their idols and made the house of Israel fall into sin, therefore I have sworn with uplifted hand that they must bear the consequences of their sin, declares the Sovereign Lord."
EZE	44	13	Ezekiel	#15		27220	 {13} They are not to come near to serve me as priests or come near any of my holy things or my most holy offerings; they must bear the shame of their detestable practices.
EZE	44	14	Ezekiel	#15		27221	 {14} Yet I will put them in charge of the duties of the temple and all the work that is to be done in it.
EZE	44	15	Ezekiel	#15		27222	" {15} << 'But the priests, who are Levites and descendants of Zadok and who faithfully carried out the duties of my sanctuary when the Israelites went astray from me, are to come near to minister before me; "
EZE	44	15	Ezekiel	#15		27223	" they are to stand before me to offer sacrifices of fat and blood, declares the Sovereign Lord."
EZE	44	16	Ezekiel	#15		27224	 {16} They alone are to enter my sanctuary; they alone are to come near my table to minister before me and perform my service.
EZE	44	17	Ezekiel	#15		27225	" {17} << 'When they enter the gates of the inner court, they are to wear linen clothes; they must not wear any woolen garment while ministering at the gates of the inner court or inside the temple."
EZE	44	18	Ezekiel	#15		27226	 {18} They are to wear linen turbans on their heads and linen undergarments around their waists. They must not wear anything that makes them perspire.
EZE	44	19	Ezekiel	#15		27227	" {19} When they go out into the outer court where the people are, they are to take off the clothes they have been ministering in and are to leave them in the sacred rooms. "
EZE	44	19	Ezekiel	#15		27228	" And they shall put on other clothes, so that they do not consecrate the people by means of their garments."
EZE	44	20	Ezekiel	#15		27229	" {20} << 'They must not shave their heads or let their hair grow long, but they are to keep the hair of their heads trimmed."
EZE	44	21	Ezekiel	#15		27230	 {21} No priest is to drink wine when he enters the inner court. {22} They must not marry widows or divorced women; they may marry only virgins of Israelite descent or widows of priests.
EZE	44	23	Ezekiel	#15		27231	 {23} They are to teach my people the difference between the holy and the common and show them how to distinguish between the unclean and the clean.
EZE	44	24	Ezekiel	#15		27232	" {24} << 'In any dispute, the priests are to serve as judges and decide it according to my ordinances. "
EZE	44	24	Ezekiel	#15		27233	" They are to keep my laws and my decrees for all my appointed feasts, and they are to keep my Sabbaths holy."
EZE	44	25	Ezekiel	#15		27234	 {25} << 'A priest must not defile himself by going near a dead person; 
EZE	44	25	Ezekiel	#15		27235	" however, if the dead person was his father or mother, son or daughter, brother or unmarried sister, then he may defile himself. {26} After he is cleansed, he must wait seven days."
EZE	44	27	Ezekiel	#15		27236	" {27} On the day he goes into the inner court of the sanctuary to minister in the sanctuary, he is to offer a sin offering for himself, declares the Sovereign Lord."

EZE	44	29	Ezekiel	#15		27238	" {29} They will eat the grain offerings, the sin offerings and the guilt offerings; and everything in Israel devoted to the Lord will belong to them."
EZE	44	30	Ezekiel	#15		27239	 {30} The best of all the firstfruits and of all your special gifts will belong to the priests. 
EZE	44	30	Ezekiel	#15		27240	 You are to give them the first portion of your ground meal so that a blessing may rest on your household.

EZE	45	<<	Narr_26: Ezekiel	#13		27242	EZEKIEL 45
EZE	45	1	Ezekiel	#15		27243	" {1}<< 'When you allot the land as an inheritance, you are to present to the Lord a portion of the land as a sacred district, 25,000 cubits long and 20,000 cubits wide; the entire area will be holy."
EZE	45	2	Ezekiel	#15		27244	" {2} Of this, a section 500 cubits square is to be for the sanctuary, with 50 cubits around it for open land."
EZE	45	3	Ezekiel	#15		27245	" {3} In the sacred district, measure off a section 25,000 cubits long and 10,000 cubits wide. In it will be the sanctuary, the Most Holy Place."

EZE	45	7	Ezekiel	#15		27251	" It will extend westward from the west side and eastward from the east side, running lengthwise from the western to the eastern border parallel to one of the tribal portions."
EZE	45	8	Ezekiel	#15		27252	 {8} This land will be his possession in Israel. And my princes will no longer oppress my people but will allow the house of Israel to possess the land according to their tribes.
EZE	45	9	Ezekiel	#15		27253	" {9} << 'This is what the Sovereign Lord says: You have gone far enough, O princes of Israel! Give up your violence and oppression and do what is just and right. "
EZE	45	9	Ezekiel	#15		27254	" Stop dispossessing my people, declares the Sovereign Lord. {10} You are to use accurate scales, an accurate ephah and an accurate bath."
EZE	45	11	Ezekiel	#15		27255	" {11} The ephah and the bath are to be the same size, the bath containing a tenth of a homer and the ephah a tenth of a homer; the homer is to be the standard measure for both."
EZE	45	12	Ezekiel	#15		27256	 {12} The shekel is to consist of twenty gerahs. Twenty shekels plus twenty-five shekels plus fifteen shekels equal one mina.
EZE	45	13	Ezekiel	#15		27257	 {13} << 'This is the special gift you are to offer: a sixth of an ephah from each homer of wheat and a sixth of an ephah from each homer of barley.
EZE	45	14	Ezekiel	#15		27258	" {14} The prescribed portion of oil, measured by the bath, is a tenth of a bath from each cor (which consists of ten baths or one homer, for ten baths are equivalent to a homer )."
EZE	45	15	Ezekiel	#15		27259	 {15} Also one sheep is to be taken from every flock of two hundred from the well-watered pastures of Israel. 
EZE	45	15	Ezekiel	#15		27260	" These will be used for the grain offerings, burnt offerings and fellowship offerings to make atonement for the people, declares the Sovereign Lord."
EZE	45	16	Ezekiel	#15		27261	 {16} All the people of the land will participate in this special gift for the use of the prince in Israel.
EZE	45	17	Ezekiel	#15		27262	" {17} It will be the duty of the prince to provide the burnt offerings, grain offerings and drink offerings at the festivals, the New Moons and the Sabbaths--at all the appointed feasts of the house of Israel. "
EZE	45	17	Ezekiel	#15		27263	" He will provide the sin offerings, grain offerings, burnt offerings and fellowship offerings to make atonement for the house of Israel."
EZE	45	18	Ezekiel	#15		27264	 {18} << 'This is what the Sovereign Lord says: In the first month on the first day you are to take a young bull without defect and purify the sanctuary.

EZE	45	24	Ezekiel	#15		27270	" {24} He is to provide as a grain offering an ephah for each bull and an ephah for each ram, along with a hin of oil for each ephah."

EZE	46	3	Ezekiel	#15		27277	 {3} On the Sabbaths and New Moons the people of the land are to worship in the presence of the Lord at the entrance to that gateway.
EZE	46	4	Ezekiel	#15		27278	" {4} The burnt offering the prince brings to the Lord on the Sabbath day is to be six male lambs and a ram, all without defect."
EZE	46	5	Ezekiel	#15		27279	" {5} The grain offering given with the ram is to be an ephah, and the grain offering with the lambs is to be as much as he pleases, along with a hin of oil for each ephah."

EZE	46	7	Ezekiel	#15		27281	" {7} He is to provide as a grain offering one ephah with the bull, one ephah with the ram, and with the lambs as much as he wants to give, along with a hin of oil with each ephah."
EZE	46	8	Ezekiel	#15		27282	" {8} When the prince enters, he is to go in through the portico of the gateway, and he is to come out the same way."
EZE	46	9	Ezekiel	#15		27283	" {9} << 'When the people of the land come before the Lord at the appointed feasts, whoever enters by the north gate to worship is to go out the south gate; "
EZE	46	9	Ezekiel	#15		27284	" and whoever enters by the south gate is to go out the north gate. No one is to return through the gate by which he entered, but each is to go out the opposite gate."

EZE	46	14	Ezekiel	#15		27290	" {14} You are also to provide with it morning by morning a grain offering, consisting of a sixth of an ephah with a third of a hin of oil to moisten the flour. "
EZE	46	14	Ezekiel	#15		27291	 The presenting of this grain offering to the Lord is a lasting ordinance.
EZE	46	15	Ezekiel	#15		27292	 {15} So the lamb and the grain offering and the oil shall be provided morning by morning for a regular burnt offering.
EZE	46	16	Ezekiel	#15		27293	 {16} << 'This is what the Sovereign Lord says: 
EZE	46	16	Ezekiel	#15		27294	" If the prince makes a gift from his inheritance to one of his sons, it will also belong to his descendants; it is to be their property by inheritance."
EZE	46	17	Ezekiel	#15		27295	" {17} If, however, he makes a gift from his inheritance to one of his servants, the servant may keep it until the year of freedom; then it will revert to the prince. "
EZE	46	17	Ezekiel	#15		27296	" His inheritance belongs to his sons only; it is theirs. {18} The prince must not take any of the inheritance of the people, driving them off their property. "
EZE	46	18	Ezekiel	#15		27297	" He is to give his sons their inheritance out of his own property, so that none of my people will be separated from his property.'"

EZE	47	<<	Narr_26: Ezekiel	#13		27306	EZEKIEL 47
EZE	47	1	Ezekiel	#15		27307	" {1} The man brought me back to the entrance of the temple, and I saw water coming out from under the threshold of the temple toward the east (for the temple faced east). "
EZE	47	1	Ezekiel	#15		27308	" The water was coming down from under the south side of the temple, south of the altar."
EZE	47	2	Ezekiel	#15		27309	" {2} He then brought me out through the north gate and led me around the outside to the outer gate facing east, and the water was flowing from the south side."
EZE	47	3	Ezekiel	#15		27310	" {3} As the man went eastward with a measuring line in his hand, he measured off a thousand cubits and then led me through water that was ankle-deep."
EZE	47	4	Ezekiel	#15		27311	 {4} He measured off another thousand cubits and led me through water that was knee-deep. He measured off another thousand and led me through water that was up to the waist.
EZE	47	5	Ezekiel	#15		27312	" {5} He measured off another thousand, but now it was a river that I could not cross, because the water had risen and was deep enough to swim in--a river that no one could cross. {6} He asked me,"
EZE	47	6	Heavenly Man-FX1	#10		27313	" << Son of man, do you see this?>>"
EZE	47	6	Ezekiel	#15		27314	" Then he led me back to the bank of the river. {7} When I arrived there, I saw a great number of trees on each side of the river. {8} He said to me,"
EZE	47	8	Heavenly Man-FX1	#10		27315	" << This water flows toward the eastern region and goes down into the Arabah, where it enters the Sea. When it empties into the Sea, the water there becomes fresh."
EZE	47	9	Heavenly Man-FX1	#10		27316	 {9} Swarms of living creatures will live wherever the river flows. 
EZE	47	9	Heavenly Man-FX1	#10		27317	" There will be large numbers of fish, because this water flows there and makes the salt water fresh; so where the river flows everything will live."
EZE	47	10	Heavenly Man-FX1	#10		27318	 {10} Fishermen will stand along the shore; from En Gedi to En Eglaim there will be places for spreading nets. The fish will be of many kinds--like the fish of the Great Sea.
EZE	47	11	Heavenly Man-FX1	#10		27319	 {11} But the swamps and marshes will not become fresh; they will be left for salt.
EZE	47	12	Heavenly Man-FX1	#10		27320	" {12} Fruit trees of all kinds will grow on both banks of the river. Their leaves will not wither, nor will their fruit fail. "
EZE	47	12	Heavenly Man-FX1	#10		27321	" Every month they will bear, because the water from the sanctuary flows to them. Their fruit will serve for food and their leaves for healing.>>"

EZE	48	14	Ezekiel	#15		27359	" {14} They must not sell or exchange any of it. This is the best of the land and must not pass into other hands, because it is holy to the Lord."
EZE	48	15	Ezekiel	#15		27360	" {15} << The remaining area, 5,000 cubits wide and 25,000 cubits long, will be for the common use of the city, for houses and for pastureland. "
EZE	48	15	Ezekiel	#15		27361	" The city will be in the center of it {16} and will have these measurements: the north side 4,500 cubits, the south side 4,500 cubits, the east side 4,500 cubits, and the west side 4,500 cubits."
EZE	48	17	Ezekiel	#15		27362	" {17} The pastureland for the city will be 250 cubits on the north, 250 cubits on the south, 250 cubits on the east, and 250 cubits on the west."
EZE	48	18	Ezekiel	#15		27363	" {18} What remains of the area, bordering on the sacred portion and running the length of it, will be 10,000 cubits on the east side and 10,000 cubits on the west side. "

EZE	48	20	Ezekiel	#15		27365	" {20} The entire portion will be a square, 25,000 cubits on each side. As a special gift you will set aside the sacred portion, along with the property of the city."
EZE	48	21	Ezekiel	#15		27366	 {21} << What remains on both sides of the area formed by the sacred portion and the city property will belong to the prince. 
EZE	48	21	Ezekiel	#15		27367	" It will extend eastward from the 25,000 cubits of the sacred portion to the eastern border, and westward from the 25,000 cubits to the western border. "
EZE	48	21	Ezekiel	#15		27368	" Both these areas running the length of the tribal portions will belong to the prince, and the sacred portion with the temple sanctuary will be in the center of them."
EZE	48	22	Ezekiel	#15		27369	 {22} So the property of the Levites and the property of the city will lie in the center of the area that belongs to the prince. 
EZE	48	22	Ezekiel	#15		27370	 The area belonging to the prince will lie between the border of Judah and the border of Benjamin.
EZE	48	23	Ezekiel	#15		27371	 {23} << As for the rest of the tribes: Benjamin will have one portion; it will extend from the east side to the west side.
EZE	48	24	Ezekiel	#15		27372	 {24} << Simeon will have one portion; it will border the territory of Benjamin from east to west.

EZE	48	31	Ezekiel	#15		27379	" {31} the gates of the city will be named after the tribes of Israel. The three gates on the north side will be the gate of Reuben, the gate of Judah and the gate of Levi."

EZE	48	35	Ezekiel	#15		27383	" {35} << The distance all around will be 18,000 cubits. << And the name of the city from that time on will be: THE LORD IS THERE.>>*~**~*||||| + 5 SECs |||||*~*"
DAN	1	<<	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27384	DANIEL*~*DANIEL 1
DAN	1	1	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27385	" {1} In the third year of the reign of Jehoiakim king of Judah, Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon came to Jerusalem and besieged it."
DAN	1	2	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27386	" {2} And the Lord delivered Jehoiakim king of Judah into his hand, along with some of the articles from the temple of God. "
DAN	1	2	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27387	 These he carried off to the temple of his god in Babylonia and put in the treasure house of his god.
DAN	1	3	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27388	" {3} Then the king ordered Ashpenaz, chief of his court officials, to bring in some of the Israelites from the royal family and the nobility--"
DAN	1	4	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27389	" {4} young men without any physical defect, handsome, showing aptitude for every kind of learning, well informed, quick to understand, and qualified to serve in the king's palace. "
DAN	1	4	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27390	 He was to teach them the language and literature of the Babylonians.
DAN	1	5	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27391	" {5} The king assigned them a daily amount of food and wine from the king's table. They were to be trained for three years, and after that they were to enter the king's service."
DAN	1	6	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27392	" {6} Among these were some from Judah: Daniel, Hananiah, Mishael and Azariah."
DAN	1	7	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27393	" {7} The chief official gave them new names: to Daniel, the name Belteshazzar; to Hananiah, Shadrach; to Mishael, Meshach; and to Azariah, Abednego."
DAN	1	8	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27394	" {8} But Daniel resolved not to defile himself with the royal food and wine, and he asked the chief official for permission not to defile himself this way."
DAN	1	9	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27395	" {9} Now God had caused the official to show favor and sympathy to Daniel, {10} but the official told Daniel,"
DAN	1	10	Official	#11		27396	" << I am afraid of my lord the king, who has assigned your food and drink. "
DAN	1	10	Official	#11		27397	 Why should he see you looking worse than the other young men your age? 
DAN	1	10	Official	#11		27398	 The king would then have my head because of you.>>
DAN	1	11	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27399	" {11} Daniel then said to the guard whom the chief official had appointed over Daniel, Hananiah, Mishael and Azariah,"
DAN	1	12	Daniel	#05		27400	 {12} << Please test your servants for ten days: Give us nothing but vegetables to eat and water to drink.
DAN	1	13	Daniel	#05		27401	" {13} Then compare our appearance with that of the young men who eat the royal food, and treat your servants in accordance with what you see.>>"
DAN	1	14	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27402	 {14} So he agreed to this and tested them for ten days. {15} At the end of the ten days they looked healthier and better nourished than any of the young men who ate the royal food.
DAN	1	16	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27403	 {16} So the guard took away their choice food and the wine they were to drink and gave them vegetables instead.
DAN	1	17	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27404	 {17} To these four young men God gave knowledge and understanding of all kinds of literature and learning. And Daniel could understand visions and dreams of all kinds.
DAN	1	18	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27405	" {18} At the end of the time set by the king to bring them in, the chief official presented them to Nebuchadnezzar."
DAN	1	19	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27406	" {19} The king talked with them, and he found none equal to Daniel, Hananiah, Mishael and Azariah; so they entered the king's service."
DAN	1	20	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27407	" {20} In every matter of wisdom and understanding about which the king questioned them, he found them ten times better than all the magicians and enchanters in his whole kingdom."
DAN	1	21	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27408	 {21} And Daniel remained there until the first year of King Cyrus.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
DAN	2	<<	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27409	DANIEL 2
DAN	2	1	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27410	" {1} In the second year of his reign, Nebuchadnezzar had dreams; his mind was troubled and he could not sleep."
DAN	2	2	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27411	" {2} So the king summoned the magicians, enchanters, sorcerers and astrologers to tell him what he had dreamed. When they came in and stood before the king, {3} he said to them,"
DAN	2	3	Nebuchadnezzar	#17		27412	 << I have had a dream that troubles me and I want to know what it means.>>
DAN	2	4	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27413	" {4} Then the astrologers answered the king in Aramaic,"
DAN	2	4	Astrologer	#04		27414	" << O king, live forever! Tell your servants the dream, and we will interpret it.>>"
DAN	2	5	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27415	" {5} The king replied to the astrologers,"
DAN	2	5	Nebuchadnezzar	#17		27416	 << This is what I have firmly decided: 
DAN	2	5	Nebuchadnezzar	#17		27417	" If you do not tell me what my dream was and interpret it, I will have you cut into pieces and your houses turned into piles of rubble."
DAN	2	6	Nebuchadnezzar	#17		27418	" {6} But if you tell me the dream and explain it, you will receive from me gifts and rewards and great honor. "
DAN	2	6	Nebuchadnezzar	#17		27419	 So tell me the dream and interpret it for me.>>
DAN	2	7	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27420	" {7} Once more they replied,"
DAN	2	7	Astrologer	#04		27421	" << Let the king tell his servants the dream, and we will interpret it.>>"
DAN	2	8	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27422	" {8} Then the king answered,"
DAN	2	8	Nebuchadnezzar	#17		27423	" << I am certain that you are trying to gain time, because you realize that this is what I have firmly decided:"
DAN	2	9	Nebuchadnezzar	#17		27424	" {9} If you do not tell me the dream, there is just one penalty for you. "
DAN	2	9	Nebuchadnezzar	#17		27425	" You have conspired to tell me misleading and wicked things, hoping the situation will change. "
DAN	2	9	Nebuchadnezzar	#17		27426	" So then, tell me the dream, and I will know that you can interpret it for me.>>"
DAN	2	10	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27427	" {10} The astrologers answered the king,"
DAN	2	10	Astrologer	#04		27428	 << There is not a man on earth who can do what the king asks! 
DAN	2	10	Astrologer	#04		27429	" No king, however great and mighty, has ever asked such a thing of any magician or enchanter or astrologer."
DAN	2	11	Astrologer	#04		27430	 {11} What the king asks is too difficult. 
DAN	2	11	Astrologer	#04		27431	" No one can reveal it to the king except the gods, and they do not live among men.>>"
DAN	2	12	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27432	 {12} This made the king so angry and furious that he ordered the execution of all the wise men of Babylon.
DAN	2	13	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27433	" {13} So the decree was issued to put the wise men to death, and men were sent to look for Daniel and his friends to put them to death."
DAN	2	14	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27434	" {14} When Arioch, the commander of the king's guard, had gone out to put to death the wise men of Babylon, Daniel spoke to him with wisdom and tact."
DAN	2	15	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27435	" {15} He asked the king's officer,"
DAN	2	15	Daniel	#05		27436	 << Why did the king issue such a harsh decree?>>
DAN	2	15	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27437	" Arioch then explained the matter to Daniel. {16} At this, Daniel went in to the king and asked for time, so that he might interpret the dream for him."
DAN	2	17	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27438	" {17} Then Daniel returned to his house and explained the matter to his friends Hananiah, Mishael and Azariah."
DAN	2	18	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27439	" {18} He urged them to plead for mercy from the God of heaven concerning this mystery, so that he and his friends might not be executed with the rest of the wise men of Babylon."
DAN	2	19	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27440	 {19} During the night the mystery was revealed to Daniel in a vision. Then Daniel praised the God of heaven {20} and said:
DAN	2	20	Daniel	#05		27441	 << Praise be to the name of God for ever and ever; wisdom and power are his.
DAN	2	21	Daniel	#05		27442	 {21} He changes times and seasons; he sets up kings and deposes them. He gives wisdom to the wise and knowledge to the discerning.
DAN	2	22	Daniel	#05		27443	" {22} He reveals deep and hidden things; he knows what lies in darkness, and light dwells with him."
DAN	2	23	Daniel	#05		27444	" {23} I thank and praise you, O God of my fathers: You have given me wisdom and power, you have made known to me what we asked of you, you have made known to us the dream of the king.>>"
DAN	2	24	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27445	" {24} Then Daniel went to Arioch, whom the king had appointed to execute the wise men of Babylon, and said to him,"
DAN	2	24	Daniel	#05		27446	" << Do not execute the wise men of Babylon. Take me to the king, and I will interpret his dream for him.>>"
DAN	2	25	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27447	" {25} Arioch took Daniel to the king at once and said,"
DAN	2	25	Arioch	#21		27448	 << I have found a man among the exiles from Judah who can tell the king what his dream means.>>
DAN	2	26	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27449	" {26} The king asked Daniel (also called Belteshazzar ),"
DAN	2	26	Nebuchadnezzar	#17		27450	 << Are you able to tell me what I saw in my dream and interpret it?>>
DAN	2	27	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27451	" {27} Daniel replied,"
DAN	2	27	Daniel	#05		27452	" << No wise man, enchanter, magician or diviner can explain to the king the mystery he has asked about, {28} but there is a God in heaven who reveals mysteries. "
DAN	2	28	Daniel	#05		27453	 He has shown King Nebuchadnezzar what will happen in days to come. Your dream and the visions that passed through your mind as you lay on your bed are these:
DAN	2	29	Daniel	#05		27454	" {29} << As you were lying there, O king, your mind turned to things to come, and the revealer of mysteries showed you what is going to happen."
DAN	2	30	Daniel	#05		27455	" {30} As for me, this mystery has been revealed to me, not because I have greater wisdom than other living men, but so that you, O king, may know the interpretation and that you may understand what went through your mind."
DAN	2	31	Daniel	#05		27456	" {31} << You looked, O king, and there before you stood a large statue--an enormous, dazzling statue, awesome in appearance."
DAN	2	32	Daniel	#05		27457	" {32} The head of the statue was made of pure gold, its chest and arms of silver, its belly and thighs of bronze, {33} its legs of iron, its feet partly of iron and partly of baked clay."
DAN	2	34	Daniel	#05		27458	" {34} While you were watching, a rock was cut out, but not by human hands. It struck the statue on its feet of iron and clay and smashed them."
DAN	2	35	Daniel	#05		27459	" {35} Then the iron, the clay, the bronze, the silver and the gold were broken to pieces at the same time and became like chaff on a threshing floor in the summer. "
DAN	2	35	Daniel	#05		27460	 The wind swept them away without leaving a trace. But the rock that struck the statue became a huge mountain and filled the whole earth.
DAN	2	36	Daniel	#05		27461	" {36} << This was the dream, and now we will interpret it to the king."
DAN	2	37	Daniel	#05		27462	" {37} You, O king, are the king of kings. The God of heaven has given you dominion and power and might and glory;"
DAN	2	38	Daniel	#05		27463	" {38} in your hands he has placed mankind and the beasts of the field and the birds of the air. Wherever they live, he has made you ruler over them all. You are that head of gold."
DAN	2	39	Daniel	#05		27464	" {39} << After you, another kingdom will rise, inferior to yours. Next, a third kingdom, one of bronze, will rule over the whole earth."
DAN	2	40	Daniel	#05		27465	" {40} Finally, there will be a fourth kingdom, strong as iron--for iron breaks and smashes everything--and as iron breaks things to pieces, so it will crush and break all the others."
DAN	2	41	Daniel	#05		27466	" {41} Just as you saw that the feet and toes were partly of baked clay and partly of iron, so this will be a divided kingdom; "
DAN	2	41	Daniel	#05		27467	" yet it will have some of the strength of iron in it, even as you saw iron mixed with clay."
DAN	2	42	Daniel	#05		27468	" {42} As the toes were partly iron and partly clay, so this kingdom will be partly strong and partly brittle."
DAN	2	43	Daniel	#05		27469	" {43} And just as you saw the iron mixed with baked clay, so the people will be a mixture and will not remain united, any more than iron mixes with clay."
DAN	2	44	Daniel	#05		27470	" {44} << In the time of those kings, the God of heaven will set up a kingdom that will never be destroyed, nor will it be left to another people."
DAN	2	44	Daniel	#05		27471	" It will crush all those kingdoms and bring them to an end, but it will itself endure forever."
DAN	2	45	Daniel	#05		27472	" {45} This is the meaning of the vision of the rock cut out of a mountain, but not by human hands--a rock that broke the iron, the bronze, the clay, the silver and the gold to pieces. "
DAN	2	45	Daniel	#05		27473	 << The great God has shown the king what will take place in the future. The dream is true and the interpretation is trustworthy.>>
DAN	2	46	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27474	" {46} Then King Nebuchadnezzar fell prostrate before Daniel and paid him honor and ordered that an offering and incense be presented to him. {47} The king said to Daniel,"
DAN	2	47	Nebuchadnezzar	#17		27475	" << Surely your God is the God of gods and the Lord of kings and a revealer of mysteries, for you were able to reveal this mystery.>>"
DAN	2	48	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27476	 {48} Then the king placed Daniel in a high position and lavished many gifts on him. He made him ruler over the entire province of Babylon and placed him in charge of all its wise men.
DAN	2	49	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27477	" {49} Moreover, at Daniel's request the king appointed Shadrach, Meshach and Abednego administrators over the province of Babylon, while Daniel himself remained at the royal court.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
DAN	3	<<	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27478	DANIEL 3
DAN	3	1	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27479	" {1} King Nebuchadnezzar made an image of gold, ninety feet high and nine feet wide, and set it up on the plain of Dura in the province of Babylon."
DAN	3	2	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27480	" {2} He then summoned the satraps, prefects, governors, advisers, treasurers, judges, magistrates and all the other provincial officials to come to the dedication of the image he had set up."
DAN	3	3	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27481	" {3} So the satraps, prefects, governors, advisers, treasurers, judges, magistrates and all the other provincial officials assembled for the dedication of the image that King Nebuchadnezzar had set up, and they stood before it."
DAN	3	4	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27482	" {4} Then the herald loudly proclaimed,"
DAN	3	4	Herald	#06		27483	" << This is what you are commanded to do, O peoples, nations and men of every language:"
DAN	3	5	Herald	#06		27484	" {5} As soon as you hear the sound of the horn, flute, zither, lyre, harp, pipes and all kinds of music, you must fall down and worship the image of gold that King Nebuchadnezzar has set up."
DAN	3	6	Herald	#06		27485	 {6} Whoever does not fall down and worship will immediately be thrown into a blazing furnace.>>
DAN	3	7	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27486	" {7} Therefore, as soon as they heard the sound of the horn, flute, zither, lyre, harp and all kinds of music, all the peoples, nations and men of every language fell down and worshiped the image of gold that King Nebuchadnezzar had set up."
DAN	3	8	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27487	" {8} At this time some astrologers came forward and denounced the Jews. {9} They said to King Nebuchadnezzar,"
DAN	3	9	Astrologer	#04		27488	" << O king, live forever!"
DAN	3	10	Astrologer	#04		27489	" {10} You have issued a decree, O king, that everyone who hears the sound of the horn, flute, zither, lyre, harp, pipes and all kinds of music must fall down and worship the image of gold,"
DAN	3	11	Astrologer	#04		27490	 {11} and that whoever does not fall down and worship will be thrown into a blazing furnace.
DAN	3	12	Astrologer	#04		27491	" {12} But there are some Jews whom you have set over the affairs of the province of Babylon --Shadrach, Meshach and Abednego --who pay no attention to you, O king. "
DAN	3	12	Astrologer	#04		27492	 They neither serve your gods nor worship the image of gold you have set up.>>
DAN	3	13	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27493	" {13} Furious with rage, Nebuchadnezzar summoned Shadrach, Meshach and Abednego. "
DAN	3	13	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27494	" So these men were brought before the king, {14} and Nebuchadnezzar said to them,"
DAN	3	14	Nebuchadnezzar	#17		27495	" << Is it true, Shadrach, Meshach and Abednego, that you do not serve my gods or worship the image of gold I have set up?"
DAN	3	15	Nebuchadnezzar	#17		27496	" {15} Now when you hear the sound of the horn, flute, zither, lyre, harp, pipes and all kinds of music, if you are ready to fall down and worship the image I made, very good. "
DAN	3	15	Nebuchadnezzar	#17		27497	" But if you do not worship it, you will be thrown immediately into a blazing furnace. Then what god will be able to rescue you from my hand?>>"
DAN	3	16	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27498	" {16} Shadrach, Meshach and Abednego replied to the king,"
DAN	3	16	Shadrach	#09		27499	" << O Nebuchadnezzar, we do not need to defend ourselves before you in this matter."
DAN	3	17	Shadrach	#09		27500	" {17} If we are thrown into the blazing furnace, the God we serve is able to save us from it, and he will rescue us from your hand, O king."
DAN	3	18	Shadrach	#09		27501	" {18} But even if he does not, we want you to know, O king, that we will not serve your gods or worship the image of gold you have set up.>>"
DAN	3	19	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27502	" {19} Then Nebuchadnezzar was furious with Shadrach, Meshach and Abednego, and his attitude toward them changed. He ordered the furnace heated seven times hotter than usual"
DAN	3	20	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27503	" {20} and commanded some of the strongest soldiers in his army to tie up Shadrach, Meshach and Abednego and throw them into the blazing furnace."
DAN	3	21	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27504	" {21} So these men, wearing their robes, trousers, turbans and other clothes, were bound and thrown into the blazing furnace."
DAN	3	22	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27505	" {22} The king's command was so urgent and the furnace so hot that the flames of the fire killed the soldiers who took up Shadrach, Meshach and Abednego,"
DAN	3	23	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27506	" {23} and these three men, firmly tied, fell into the blazing furnace. {24} Then King Nebuchadnezzar leaped to his feet in amazement and asked his advisers,"
DAN	3	24	Nebuchadnezzar	#17		27507	 << Weren't there three men that we tied up and threw into the fire?>>
DAN	3	24	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27508	" They replied,"
DAN	3	24	Advisor	#16		27509	" << Certainly, O king.>>"
DAN	3	25	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27510	" {25} He said,"
DAN	3	25	Nebuchadnezzar	#17		27511	" << Look! I see four men walking around in the fire, unbound and unharmed, and the fourth looks like a son of the gods.>>"
DAN	3	26	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27512	" {26} Nebuchadnezzar then approached the opening of the blazing furnace and shouted,"
DAN	3	26	Nebuchadnezzar	#17		27513	" << Shadrach, Meshach and Abednego, servants of the Most High God, come out! Come here!>>"
DAN	3	26	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27514	" So Shadrach, Meshach and Abednego came out of the fire, {27} and the satraps, prefects, governors and royal advisers crowded around them."
DAN	3	27	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27515	" They saw that the fire had not harmed their bodies, nor was a hair of their heads singed; their robes were not scorched, and there was no smell of fire on them. "
DAN	3	28	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27516	" {28} Then Nebuchadnezzar said,"
DAN	3	28	Nebuchadnezzar	#17		27517	" << Praise be to the God of Shadrach, Meshach and Abednego, who has sent his angel and rescued his servants! "
DAN	3	28	Nebuchadnezzar	#17		27518	 They trusted in him and defied the king's command and were willing to give up their lives rather than serve or worship any god except their own God.
DAN	3	29	Nebuchadnezzar	#17		27519	" {29} Therefore I decree that the people of any nation or language who say anything against the God of Shadrach, Meshach and Abednego be cut into pieces and their houses be turned into piles of rubble, for no other god can save in this way.>>"
DAN	3	30	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27520	" {30} Then the king promoted Shadrach, Meshach and Abednego in the province of Babylon.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
DAN	4	<<	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27521	DANIEL 4
DAN	4	1	Nebuchadnezzar	#17		27522	" {1} King Nebuchadnezzar, To the peoples, nations and men of every language, who live in all the world: May you prosper greatly!"
DAN	4	2	Nebuchadnezzar	#17		27523	 {2} It is my pleasure to tell you about the miraculous signs and wonders that the Most High God has performed for me.
DAN	4	3	Nebuchadnezzar	#17		27524	" {3} How great are his signs, how mighty his wonders! His kingdom is an eternal kingdom; his dominion endures from generation to generation."
DAN	4	4	Nebuchadnezzar	#17		27525	" {4} I, Nebuchadnezzar, was at home in my palace, contented and prosperous."
DAN	4	5	Nebuchadnezzar	#17		27526	" {5} I had a dream that made me afraid. As I was lying in my bed, the images and visions that passed through my mind terrified me."
DAN	4	6	Nebuchadnezzar	#17		27527	 {6} So I commanded that all the wise men of Babylon be brought before me to interpret the dream for me.
DAN	4	7	Nebuchadnezzar	#17		27528	" {7} When the magicians, enchanters, astrologers and diviners came, I told them the dream, but they could not interpret it for me."
DAN	4	8	Nebuchadnezzar	#17		27529	" {8} Finally, Daniel came into my presence and I told him the dream. "
DAN	4	8	Nebuchadnezzar	#17		27530	" (He is called Belteshazzar, after the name of my god, and the spirit of the holy gods is in him.)"
DAN	4	9	Nebuchadnezzar	#17		27531	" {9} I said, << Belteshazzar, chief of the magicians, I know that the spirit of the holy gods is in you, and no mystery is too difficult for you. Here is my dream; interpret it for me."
DAN	4	10	Nebuchadnezzar	#17		27532	" {10} These are the visions I saw while lying in my bed: I looked, and there before me stood a tree in the middle of the land. Its height was enormous."
DAN	4	11	Nebuchadnezzar	#17		27533	 {11} The tree grew large and strong and its top touched the sky; it was visible to the ends of the earth.
DAN	4	12	Nebuchadnezzar	#17		27534	" {12} Its leaves were beautiful, its fruit abundant, and on it was food for all."
DAN	4	12	Nebuchadnezzar	#17		27535	" Under it the beasts of the field found shelter, and the birds of the air lived in its branches; from it every creature was fed."
DAN	4	13	Nebuchadnezzar	#17		27536	" {13} << In the visions I saw while lying in my bed, I looked, and there before me was a messenger, a holy one, coming down from heaven."
DAN	4	14	Nebuchadnezzar	#17		27537	 {14} He called in a loud voice: 'Cut down the tree and trim off its branches; strip off its leaves and scatter its fruit. 
DAN	4	14	Nebuchadnezzar	#17		27538	 Let the animals flee from under it and the birds from its branches.
DAN	4	15	Nebuchadnezzar	#17		27539	" {15} But let the stump and its roots, bound with iron and bronze, remain in the ground, in the grass of the field. "
DAN	4	15	Nebuchadnezzar	#17		27540	" << 'Let him be drenched with the dew of heaven, and let him live with the animals among the plants of the earth."
DAN	4	16	Nebuchadnezzar	#17		27541	" {16} Let his mind be changed from that of a man and let him be given the mind of an animal, till seven times pass by for him."
DAN	4	17	Nebuchadnezzar	#17		27542	" {17} << 'The decision is announced by messengers, the holy ones declare the verdict, so that the living may know that the Most High is sovereign over the kingdoms of men and gives them to anyone he wishes and sets over them the lowliest of men.'"
DAN	4	18	Nebuchadnezzar	#17		27543	" {18} << This is the dream that I, King Nebuchadnezzar, had. "
DAN	4	18	Nebuchadnezzar	#17		27544	" Now, Belteshazzar, tell me what it means, for none of the wise men in my kingdom can interpret it for me. But you can, because the spirit of the holy gods is in you.>>"
DAN	4	19	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27545	" {19} Then Daniel (also called Belteshazzar ) was greatly perplexed for a time, and his thoughts terrified him. So the king said,"
DAN	4	19	Nebuchadnezzar	#17		27546	" << Belteshazzar, do not let the dream or its meaning alarm you.>>"
DAN	4	19	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27547	" Daniel said,"
DAN	4	19	Daniel	#05		27548	" << My lord, if only the dream applied to your enemies and its meaning to your adversaries!"
DAN	4	20	Daniel	#05		27549	" {20} The tree you saw, which grew large and strong, with its top touching the sky, visible to the whole earth,"
DAN	4	21	Daniel	#05		27550	" {21} with beautiful leaves and abundant fruit, providing food for all, giving shelter to the beasts of the field, and having nesting places in its branches for the birds of the air--"
DAN	4	22	Daniel	#05		27551	" {22} you, O king, are that tree! You have become great and strong; your greatness has grown until it reaches the sky, and your dominion extends to distant parts of the earth."
DAN	4	23	Daniel	#05		27552	" {23} << You, O king, saw a messenger, a holy one, coming down from heaven and saying, 'Cut down the tree and destroy it, but leave the stump, bound with iron and bronze, in the grass of the field, while its roots remain in the ground."
DAN	4	23	Daniel	#05		27553	" Let him be drenched with the dew of heaven; let him live like the wild animals, until seven times pass by for him.'"
DAN	4	24	Daniel	#05		27554	" {24} << This is the interpretation, O king, and this is the decree the Most High has issued against my lord the king:"
DAN	4	25	Daniel	#05		27555	 {25} You will be driven away from people and will live with the wild animals; you will eat grass like cattle and be drenched with the dew of heaven. 
DAN	4	25	Daniel	#05		27556	 Seven times will pass by for you until you acknowledge that the Most High is sovereign over the kingdoms of men and gives them to anyone he wishes.
DAN	4	26	Daniel	#05		27557	 {26} The command to leave the stump of the tree with its roots means that your kingdom will be restored to you when you acknowledge that Heaven rules.
DAN	4	27	Daniel	#05		27558	" {27} Therefore, O king, be pleased to accept my advice: "
DAN	4	27	Daniel	#05		27559	" Renounce your sins by doing what is right, and your wickedness by being kind to the oppressed. It may be that then your prosperity will continue.>>"
DAN	4	28	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27560	" {28} All this happened to King Nebuchadnezzar. {29} Twelve months later, as the king was walking on the roof of the royal palace of Babylon, {30} he said,"
DAN	4	30	Nebuchadnezzar	#17		27561	" << Is not this the great Babylon I have built as the royal residence, by my mighty power and for the glory of my majesty?>>"
DAN	4	31	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27562	" {31} The words were still on his lips when a voice came from heaven,"
DAN	4	31	Angel-FX1	#10		27563	" << This is what is decreed for you, King Nebuchadnezzar: Your royal authority has been taken from you."
DAN	4	32	Angel-FX1	#10		27564	 {32} You will be driven away from people and will live with the wild animals; you will eat grass like cattle. 
DAN	4	32	Angel-FX1	#10		27565	 Seven times will pass by for you until you acknowledge that the Most High is sovereign over the kingdoms of men and gives them to anyone he wishes.>>
DAN	4	33	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27566	 {33} Immediately what had been said about Nebuchadnezzar was fulfilled. He was driven away from people and ate grass like cattle. 
DAN	4	33	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27567	 His body was drenched with the dew of heaven until his hair grew like the feathers of an eagle and his nails like the claws of a bird.
DAN	4	34	Nebuchadnezzar	#17		27568	" {34} At the end of that time, I, Nebuchadnezzar, raised my eyes toward heaven, and my sanity was restored. "
DAN	4	34	Nebuchadnezzar	#17		27569	 Then I praised the Most High; I honored and glorified him who lives forever. 
DAN	4	34	Nebuchadnezzar	#17		27570	 His dominion is an eternal dominion; his kingdom endures from generation to generation.
DAN	4	35	Nebuchadnezzar	#17		27571	 {35} All the peoples of the earth are regarded as nothing. He does as he pleases with the powers of heaven and the peoples of the earth. 
DAN	4	35	Nebuchadnezzar	#17		27572	 No one can hold back his hand or say to him: << What have you done?>>
DAN	4	36	Nebuchadnezzar	#17		27573	" {36} At the same time that my sanity was restored, my honor and splendor were returned to me for the glory of my kingdom. "
DAN	4	36	Nebuchadnezzar	#17		27574	" My advisers and nobles sought me out, and I was restored to my throne and became even greater than before."
DAN	4	37	Nebuchadnezzar	#17		27575	" {37} Now I, Nebuchadnezzar, praise and exalt and glorify the King of heaven, because everything he does is right and all his ways are just. "
DAN	4	37	Nebuchadnezzar	#17		27576	 And those who walk in pride he is able to humble.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
DAN	5	<<	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27577	DANIEL 5
DAN	5	1	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27578	 {1} King Belshazzar gave a great banquet for a thousand of his nobles and drank wine with them.
DAN	5	2	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27579	" {2} While Belshazzar was drinking his wine, he gave orders to bring in the gold and silver goblets that Nebuchadnezzar his father had taken from the temple in Jerusalem, "
DAN	5	2	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27580	" so that the king and his nobles, his wives and his concubines might drink from them."
DAN	5	3	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27581	" {3} So they brought in the gold goblets that had been taken from the temple of God in Jerusalem, and the king and his nobles, his wives and his concubines drank from them."
DAN	5	4	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27582	" {4} As they drank the wine, they praised the gods of gold and silver, of bronze, iron, wood and stone."
DAN	5	5	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27583	" {5} Suddenly the fingers of a human hand appeared and wrote on the plaster of the wall, near the lampstand in the royal palace. The king watched the hand as it wrote."
DAN	5	6	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27584	 {6} His face turned pale and he was so frightened that his knees knocked together and his legs gave way.
DAN	5	7	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27585	" {7} The king called out for the enchanters, astrologers and diviners to be brought and said to these wise men of Babylon,"
DAN	5	7	Belshazzar	#14		27586	" << Whoever reads this writing and tells me what it means, will be clothed in purple and have a gold chain placed around his neck, and he will be made the third highest ruler in the kingdom.>>"
DAN	5	8	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27587	" {8} Then all the king's wise men came in, but they could not read the writing or tell the king what it meant."
DAN	5	9	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27588	 {9} So King Belshazzar became even more terrified and his face grew more pale. His nobles were baffled.
DAN	5	10	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27589	" {10} The queen, hearing the voices of the king and his nobles, came into the banquet hall."
DAN	5	10	Queen	#24		27590	" << O king, live forever! Don't be alarmed! Don't look so pale!"
DAN	5	11	Queen	#24		27591	 {11} There is a man in your kingdom who has the spirit of the holy gods in him.

DAN	5	13	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27596	" {13} So Daniel was brought before the king, and the king said to him,"
DAN	5	13	Belshazzar	#14		27597	" << Are you Daniel, one of the exiles my father the king brought from Judah?"
