DAN	5	16	Belshazzar	#14		27601	" If you can read this writing and tell me what it means, you will be clothed in purple and have a gold chain placed around your neck, and you will be made the third highest ruler in the kingdom.>>"
DAN	5	17	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27602	" {17} Then Daniel answered the king,"
DAN	5	17	Daniel	#05		27603	" << You may keep your gifts for yourself and give your rewards to someone else. Nevertheless, I will read the writing for the king and tell him what it means."
DAN	5	18	Daniel	#05		27604	" {18} << O king, the Most High God gave your father Nebuchadnezzar sovereignty and greatness and glory and splendor."
DAN	5	19	Daniel	#05		27605	" {19} Because of the high position he gave him, all the peoples and nations and men of every language dreaded and feared him. "
DAN	5	19	Daniel	#05		27606	" Those the king wanted to put to death, he put to death; those he wanted to spare, he spared; those he wanted to promote, he promoted; and those he wanted to humble, he humbled."
DAN	5	20	Daniel	#05		27607	" {20} But when his heart became arrogant and hardened with pride, he was deposed from his royal throne and stripped of his glory."
DAN	5	21	Daniel	#05		27608	 {21} He was driven away from people and given the mind of an animal; he lived with the wild donkeys and ate grass like cattle; 
DAN	5	21	Daniel	#05		27609	" and his body was drenched with the dew of heaven, until he acknowledged that the Most High God is sovereign over the kingdoms of men and sets over them anyone he wishes."
DAN	5	22	Daniel	#05		27610	" {22} << But you his son, O Belshazzar, have not humbled yourself, though you knew all this. {23} Instead, you have set yourself up against the Lord of heaven. "
DAN	5	23	Daniel	#05		27611	" You had the goblets from his temple brought to you, and you and your nobles, your wives and your concubines drank wine from them."
DAN	5	23	Daniel	#05		27612	" You praised the gods of silver and gold, of bronze, iron, wood and stone, which cannot see or hear or understand. "
DAN	5	23	Daniel	#05		27613	 But you did not honor the God who holds in his hand your life and all your ways. {24} Therefore he sent the hand that wrote the inscription.
DAN	5	25	Daniel	#05		27614	" {25} << This is the inscription that was written: mene, mene, tekel, parsin"
DAN	5	26	Daniel	#05		27615	 {26} << This is what these words mean: Mene: God has numbered the days of your reign and brought it to an end.
DAN	5	27	Daniel	#05		27616	 {27} Tekel: You have been weighed on the scales and found wanting. {28} Peres: Your kingdom is divided and given to the Medes and Persians.>>
DAN	5	29	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27617	" {29} Then at Belshazzar's command, Daniel was clothed in purple, a gold chain was placed around his neck, and he was proclaimed the third highest ruler in the kingdom."
DAN	5	30	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27618	" {30} That very night Belshazzar, king of the Babylonians, was slain, {31} and Darius the Mede took over the kingdom, at the age of sixty-two.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
DAN	6	<<	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27619	DANIEL 6
DAN	6	1	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27620	" {1} It pleased Darius to appoint 120 satraps to rule throughout the kingdom, {2} with three administrators over them, one of whom was Daniel. "
DAN	6	2	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27621	 The satraps were made accountable to them so that the king might not suffer loss.
DAN	6	3	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27622	 {3} Now Daniel so distinguished himself among the administrators and the satraps by his exceptional qualities that the king planned to set him over the whole kingdom.
DAN	6	4	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27623	" {4} At this, the administrators and the satraps tried to find grounds for charges against Daniel in his conduct of government affairs, but they were unable to do so. "
DAN	6	4	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27624	" They could find no corruption in him, because he was trustworthy and neither corrupt nor negligent. {5} Finally these men said,"
DAN	6	5	Satrap	#15		27625	 << We will never find any basis for charges against this man Daniel unless it has something to do with the law of his God.>>
DAN	6	6	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27626	 {6} So the administrators and the satraps went as a group to the king and said:
DAN	6	6	Satrap	#15		27627	" << O King Darius, live forever! "
DAN	6	7	Satrap	#15		27628	" {7} The royal administrators, prefects, satraps, advisers and governors have all agreed that the king should issue an edict and enforce the decree, "
DAN	6	7	Satrap	#15		27629	" that anyone who prays to any god or man during the next thirty days, except to you, O king, shall be thrown into the lions' den."
DAN	6	8	Satrap	#15		27630	" {8} Now, O king, issue the decree and put it in writing so that it cannot be altered--"
DAN	6	8	Satrap	#15		27631	" in accordance with the laws of the Medes and Persians, which cannot be repealed.>>"
DAN	6	9	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27632	 {9} So King Darius put the decree in writing.
DAN	6	10	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27633	" {10} Now when Daniel learned that the decree had been published, he went home to his upstairs room where the windows opened toward Jerusalem. "
DAN	6	10	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27634	" Three times a day he got down on his knees and prayed, giving thanks to his God, just as he had done before."
DAN	6	11	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27635	 {11} Then these men went as a group and found Daniel praying and asking God for help. {12} So they went to the king and spoke to him about his royal decree:
DAN	6	12	Satrap	#15		27636	" << Did you not publish a decree that during the next thirty days anyone who prays to any god or man except to you, O king, would be thrown into the lions' den?>>"
DAN	6	12	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27637	" The king answered,"
DAN	6	12	Darius	#01		27638	" << The decree stands--in accordance with the laws of the Medes and Persians, which cannot be repealed.>>"
DAN	6	13	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27639	" {13} Then they said to the king,"
DAN	6	13	Satrap	#15		27640	" << Daniel, who is one of the exiles from Judah, pays no attention to you, O king, or to the decree you put in writing. He still prays three times a day.>>"
DAN	6	14	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27641	" {14} When the king heard this, he was greatly distressed; he was determined to rescue Daniel and made every effort until sundown to save him."
DAN	6	15	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27642	" {15} Then the men went as a group to the king and said to him,"
DAN	6	15	Satrap	#15		27643	" << Remember, O king, that according to the law of the Medes and Persians no decree or edict that the king issues can be changed.>>"
DAN	6	16	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27644	" {16} So the king gave the order, and they brought Daniel and threw him into the lions' den. The king said to Daniel,"
DAN	6	16	Darius	#01		27645	" << May your God, whom you serve continually, rescue you!>>"
DAN	6	17	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27646	" {17} A stone was brought and placed over the mouth of the den, and the king sealed it with his own signet ring and with the rings of his nobles, so that Daniel's situation might not be changed."
DAN	6	18	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27647	 {18} Then the king returned to his palace and spent the night without eating and without any entertainment being brought to him. And he could not sleep.
DAN	6	19	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27648	" {19} At the first light of dawn, the king got up and hurried to the lions' den. {20} When he came near the den, he called to Daniel in an anguished voice,"
DAN	6	20	Darius	#01		27649	" << Daniel, servant of the living God, has your God, whom you serve continually, been able to rescue you from the lions?>>"
DAN	6	21	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27650	" {21} Daniel answered,"
DAN	6	21	Daniel	#05		27651	" << O king, live forever! {22} My God sent his angel, and he shut the mouths of the lions. "
DAN	6	22	Daniel	#05		27652	" They have not hurt me, because I was found innocent in his sight. Nor have I ever done any wrong before you, O king.>>"
DAN	6	23	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27653	" {23} The king was overjoyed and gave orders to lift Daniel out of the den. And when Daniel was lifted from the den, no wound was found on him, because he had trusted in his God."
DAN	6	24	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27654	" {24} At the king's command, the men who had falsely accused Daniel were brought in and thrown into the lions' den, along with their wives and children. "
DAN	6	24	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27655	" And before they reached the floor of the den, the lions overpowered them and crushed all their bones."
DAN	6	25	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27656	" {25} Then King Darius wrote to all the peoples, nations and men of every language throughout the land:"
DAN	6	25	Darius	#01		27657	 << May you prosper greatly! {26} << I issue a decree that in every part of my kingdom people must fear and reverence the God of Daniel. 
DAN	6	26	Darius	#01		27658	" << For he is the living God and he endures forever; his kingdom will not be destroyed, his dominion will never end."
DAN	6	27	Darius	#01		27659	 {27} He rescues and he saves; he performs signs and wonders in the heavens and on the earth. 
DAN	6	27	Darius	#01		27660	 He has rescued Daniel from the power of the lions.>>
DAN	6	28	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27661	 {28} So Daniel prospered during the reign of Darius and the reign of Cyrus the Persian.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
DAN	7	<<	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27662	DANIEL 7
DAN	7	1	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27663	" {1} In the first year of Belshazzar king of Babylon, Daniel had a dream, and visions passed through his mind as he was lying on his bed. "
DAN	7	1	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27664	 He wrote down the substance of his dream. {2} Daniel said:
DAN	7	2	Daniel	#05		27665	" << In my vision at night I looked, and there before me were the four winds of heaven churning up the great sea."
DAN	7	3	Daniel	#05		27666	" {3} Four great beasts, each different from the others, came up out of the sea."
DAN	7	4	Daniel	#05		27667	" {4} << The first was like a lion, and it had the wings of an eagle. "
DAN	7	4	Daniel	#05		27668	" I watched until its wings were torn off and it was lifted from the ground so that it stood on two feet like a man, and the heart of a man was given to it."
DAN	7	5	Daniel	#05		27669	" {5} << And there before me was a second beast, which looked like a bear. "
DAN	7	5	Daniel	#05		27670	" It was raised up on one of its sides, and it had three ribs in its mouth between its teeth. It was told, 'Get up and eat your fill of flesh!'"
DAN	7	6	Daniel	#05		27671	" {6} << After that, I looked, and there before me was another beast, one that looked like a leopard. "
DAN	7	6	Daniel	#05		27672	" And on its back it had four wings like those of a bird. This beast had four heads, and it was given authority to rule."
DAN	7	7	Daniel	#05		27673	" {7} << After that, in my vision at night I looked, and there before me was a fourth beast--terrifying and frightening and very powerful."
DAN	7	7	Daniel	#05		27674	" It had large iron teeth; it crushed and devoured its victims and trampled underfoot whatever was left. It was different from all the former beasts, and it had ten horns."
DAN	7	8	Daniel	#05		27675	" {8} << While I was thinking about the horns, there before me was another horn, a little one, which came up among them; "
DAN	7	8	Daniel	#05		27676	 and three of the first horns were uprooted before it. This horn had eyes like the eyes of a man and a mouth that spoke boastfully.
DAN	7	9	Daniel	#05		27677	" {9} << As I looked, << thrones were set in place, and the Ancient of Days took his seat. His clothing was as white as snow; "
DAN	7	9	Daniel	#05		27678	" the hair of his head was white like wool. His throne was flaming with fire, and its wheels were all ablaze."
DAN	7	10	Daniel	#05		27679	" {10} A river of fire was flowing, coming out from before him. "
DAN	7	10	Daniel	#05		27680	" Thousands upon thousands attended him; ten thousand times ten thousand stood before him. The court was seated, and the books were opened."
DAN	7	11	Daniel	#05		27681	 {11} << Then I continued to watch because of the boastful words the horn was speaking. I kept looking until the beast was slain and its body destroyed and thrown into the blazing fire.
DAN	7	12	Daniel	#05		27682	" {12} (The other beasts had been stripped of their authority, but were allowed to live for a period of time.)"
DAN	7	13	Daniel	#05		27683	" {13} << In my vision at night I looked, and there before me was one like a son of man, coming with the clouds of heaven. He approached the Ancient of Days and was led into his presence."
DAN	7	14	Daniel	#05		27684	" {14} He was given authority, glory and sovereign power; all peoples, nations and men of every language worshiped him. "
DAN	7	14	Daniel	#05		27685	" His dominion is an everlasting dominion that will not pass away, and his kingdom is one that will never be destroyed."
DAN	7	15	Daniel	#05		27686	" {15} << I, Daniel, was troubled in spirit, and the visions that passed through my mind disturbed me."
DAN	7	16	Daniel	#05		27687	 {16} I approached one of those standing there and asked him the true meaning of all this. << So he told me and gave me the interpretation of these things:
DAN	7	17	Angel #1-FX1	#10		27688	 {17} 'The four great beasts are four kingdoms that will rise from the earth.
DAN	7	18	Angel #1-FX1	#10		27689	" {18} But the saints of the Most High will receive the kingdom and will possess it forever--yes, for ever and ever.'"
DAN	7	19	Daniel	#05		27690	" {19} <<Then I wanted to know the true meaning of the fourth beast, which was different from all the others and most terrifying, with its iron teeth and bronze claws--"
DAN	7	19	Daniel	#05		27691	 the beast that crushed and devoured its victims and trampled underfoot whatever was left.
DAN	7	20	Daniel	#05		27692	" {20} I also wanted to know about the ten horns on its head and about the other horn that came up, before which three of them fell--"
DAN	7	20	Daniel	#05		27693	 the horn that looked more imposing than the others and that had eyes and a mouth that spoke boastfully.
DAN	7	21	Daniel	#05		27694	" {21} As I watched, this horn was waging war against the saints and defeating them,"
DAN	7	22	Daniel	#05		27695	" {22} until the Ancient of Days came and pronounced judgment in favor of the saints of the Most High, and the time came when they possessed the kingdom."
DAN	7	23	Daniel	#05		27696	 {23} << He gave me this explanation:
DAN	7	23	Angel #1-FX1	#10		27697	" 'The fourth beast is a fourth kingdom that will appear on earth. It will be different from all the other kingdoms and will devour the whole earth, trampling it down and crushing it."
DAN	7	24	Angel #1-FX1	#10		27698	" {24} The ten horns are ten kings who will come from this kingdom. After them another king will arise, different from the earlier ones; he will subdue three kings."
DAN	7	25	Angel #2-FX1	#07		27699	" {25} He will speak against the Most High and oppress his saints and try to change the set times and the laws. The saints will be handed over to him for a time, times and half a time."
DAN	7	26	Angel #2-FX1	#07		27700	" {26} << 'But the court will sit, and his power will be taken away and completely destroyed forever."
DAN	7	27	Angel #2-FX1	#07		27701	" {27} Then the sovereignty, power and greatness of the kingdoms under the whole heaven will be handed over to the saints, the people of the Most High. "
DAN	7	27	Angel #2-FX1	#07		27702	" His kingdom will be an everlasting kingdom, and all rulers will worship and obey him.'"
DAN	7	28	Daniel	#05		27703	" {28} << This is the end of the matter. I, Daniel, was deeply troubled by my thoughts, and my face turned pale, but I kept the matter to myself.>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
DAN	8	<<	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27704	DANIEL 8
DAN	8	1	Daniel	#05		27705	" {1} In the third year of King Belshazzar's reign, I, Daniel, had a vision, after the one that had already appeared to me."
DAN	8	2	Daniel	#05		27706	 {2} In my vision I saw myself in the citadel of Susa in the province of Elam; in the vision I was beside the Ulai Canal.
DAN	8	3	Daniel	#05		27707	" {3} I looked up, and there before me was a ram with two horns, standing beside the canal, and the horns were long. One of the horns was longer than the other but grew up later."
DAN	8	4	Daniel	#05		27708	 {4} I watched the ram as he charged toward the west and the north and the south. 
DAN	8	4	Daniel	#05		27709	" No animal could stand against him, and none could rescue from his power. He did as he pleased and became great."
DAN	8	5	Daniel	#05		27710	" {5} As I was thinking about this, suddenly a goat with a prominent horn between his eyes came from the west, crossing the whole earth without touching the ground."
DAN	8	6	Daniel	#05		27711	 {6} He came toward the two-horned ram I had seen standing beside the canal and charged at him in great rage.
DAN	8	7	Daniel	#05		27712	" {7} I saw him attack the ram furiously, striking the ram and shattering his two horns. "
DAN	8	7	Daniel	#05		27713	" The ram was powerless to stand against him; the goat knocked him to the ground and trampled on him, and none could rescue the ram from his power."
DAN	8	8	Daniel	#05		27714	" {8} The goat became very great, but at the height of his power his large horn was broken off, and in its place four prominent horns grew up toward the four winds of heaven."
DAN	8	9	Daniel	#05		27715	" {9} Out of one of them came another horn, which started small but grew in power to the south and to the east and toward the Beautiful Land."
DAN	8	10	Daniel	#05		27716	" {10} It grew until it reached the host of the heavens, and it threw some of the starry host down to the earth and trampled on them."
DAN	8	11	Daniel	#05		27717	" {11} It set itself up to be as great as the Prince of the host; it took away the daily sacrifice from him, and the place of his sanctuary was brought low."
DAN	8	12	Daniel	#05		27718	" {12} Because of rebellion, the host of the saints and the daily sacrifice were given over to it. It prospered in everything it did, and truth was thrown to the ground."
DAN	8	13	Daniel	#05		27719	" {13} Then I heard a holy one speaking, and another holy one said to him,"
DAN	8	13	Angel #1-FX1	#10		27720	 << How long will it take for the vision to be fulfilled--
DAN	8	13	Angel #1-FX1	#10		27721	" the vision concerning the daily sacrifice, the rebellion that causes desolation, and the surrender of the sanctuary and of the host that will be trampled underfoot?>>"
DAN	8	14	Daniel	#05		27722	" {14} He said to me,"
DAN	8	14	Angel #2-FX1	#07		27723	" << It will take 2,300 evenings and mornings; then the sanctuary will be reconsecrated.>>"
DAN	8	15	Daniel	#05		27724	" {15} While I, Daniel, was watching the vision and trying to understand it, there before me stood one who looked like a man. {16} And I heard a man's voice from the Ulai calling,"
DAN	8	16	Man's Voice	#09		27725	" << Gabriel, tell this man the meaning of the vision.>>"
DAN	8	17	Daniel	#05		27726	" {17} As he came near the place where I was standing, I was terrified and fell prostrate. << Son of man, understand that the vision concerns the time of the end.>>"
DAN	8	18	Daniel	#05		27727	" {18} While he was speaking to me, I was in a deep sleep, with my face to the ground. Then he touched me and raised me to my feet. {19} He said:"
DAN	8	19	Gabriel-FX1	#11		27728	" << I am going to tell you what will happen later in the time of wrath, because the vision concerns the appointed time of the end."
DAN	8	20	Gabriel-FX1	#11		27729	 {20} The two-horned ram that you saw represents the kings of Media and Persia.
DAN	8	21	Gabriel-FX1	#11		27730	" {21} The shaggy goat is the king of Greece, and the large horn between his eyes is the first king."
DAN	8	22	Gabriel-FX1	#11		27731	 {22} The four horns that replaced the one that was broken off represent four kingdoms that will emerge from his nation but will not have the same power.
DAN	8	23	Gabriel-FX1	#11		27732	" {23} << In the latter part of their reign, when rebels have become completely wicked, a stern-faced king, a master of intrigue, will arise."
DAN	8	24	Gabriel-FX1	#11		27733	" {24} He will become very strong, but not by his own power. "
DAN	8	24	Gabriel-FX1	#11		27734	 He will cause astounding devastation and will succeed in whatever he does. He will destroy the mighty men and the holy people.
DAN	8	25	Gabriel-FX1	#11		27735	" {25} He will cause deceit to prosper, and he will consider himself superior. "
DAN	8	25	Gabriel-FX1	#11		27736	" When they feel secure, he will destroy many and take his stand against the Prince of princes. Yet he will be destroyed, but not by human power."
DAN	8	26	Gabriel-FX1	#11		27737	" {26} << The vision of the evenings and mornings that has been given you is true, but seal up the vision, for it concerns the distant future.>>"
DAN	8	27	Daniel	#05		27738	" {27} I, Daniel, was exhausted and lay ill for several days. "
DAN	8	27	Daniel	#05		27739	 Then I got up and went about the king's business. I was appalled by the vision; it was beyond understanding.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
DAN	9	<<	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27740	DANIEL 9
DAN	9	1	Daniel	#05		27741	" {1} In the first year of Darius son of Xerxes (a Mede by descent), who was made ruler over the Babylonian kingdom--"
DAN	9	2	Daniel	#05		27742	" {2} in the first year of his reign, I, Daniel, understood from the Scriptures, according to the word of the Lord given to Jeremiah the prophet, that the desolation of Jerusalem would last seventy years."
DAN	9	3	Daniel	#05		27743	" {3} So I turned to the Lord God and pleaded with him in prayer and petition, in fasting, and in sackcloth and ashes. {4} I prayed to the Lord my God and confessed: "
DAN	9	4	Daniel	#05		27744	" << O Lord, the great and awesome God, who keeps his covenant of love with all who love him and obey his commands, {5} we have sinned and done wrong. "
DAN	9	5	Daniel	#05		27745	 We have been wicked and have rebelled; we have turned away from your commands and laws.
DAN	9	6	Daniel	#05		27746	" {6} We have not listened to your servants the prophets, who spoke in your name to our kings, our princes and our fathers, and to all the people of the land."
DAN	9	7	Daniel	#05		27747	" {7} << Lord, you are righteous, but this day we are covered with shame--"
DAN	9	7	Daniel	#05		27748	" the men of Judah and people of Jerusalem and all Israel, both near and far, in all the countries where you have scattered us because of our unfaithfulness to you."
DAN	9	8	Daniel	#05		27749	" {8} O Lord, we and our kings, our princes and our fathers are covered with shame because we have sinned against you."
DAN	9	9	Daniel	#05		27750	" {9} The Lord our God is merciful and forgiving, even though we have rebelled against him;"
DAN	9	10	Daniel	#05		27751	 {10} we have not obeyed the Lord our God or kept the laws he gave us through his servants the prophets.
DAN	9	11	Daniel	#05		27752	" {11} All Israel has transgressed your law and turned away, refusing to obey you. "
DAN	9	11	Daniel	#05		27753	" << Therefore the curses and sworn judgments written in the Law of Moses, the servant of God, have been poured out on us, because we have sinned against you."
DAN	9	12	Daniel	#05		27754	 {12} You have fulfilled the words spoken against us and against our rulers by bringing upon us great disaster. 
DAN	9	12	Daniel	#05		27755	 Under the whole heaven nothing has ever been done like what has been done to Jerusalem.
DAN	9	13	Daniel	#05		27756	" {13} Just as it is written in the Law of Moses, all this disaster has come upon us, yet we have not sought the favor of the Lord our God by turning from our sins and giving attention to your truth."
DAN	9	14	Daniel	#05		27757	" {14} The Lord did not hesitate to bring the disaster upon us, for the Lord our God is righteous in everything he does; yet we have not obeyed him."
DAN	9	15	Daniel	#05		27758	" {15} << Now, O Lord our God, who brought your people out of Egypt with a mighty hand and who made for yourself a name that endures to this day, we have sinned, we have done wrong."
DAN	9	16	Daniel	#05		27759	" {16} O Lord, in keeping with all your righteous acts, turn away your anger and your wrath from Jerusalem, your city, your holy hill. "
DAN	9	16	Daniel	#05		27760	 Our sins and the iniquities of our fathers have made Jerusalem and your people an object of scorn to all those around us.
DAN	9	17	Daniel	#05		27761	" {17} << Now, our God, hear the prayers and petitions of your servant. For your sake, O Lord, look with favor on your desolate sanctuary."
DAN	9	18	Daniel	#05		27762	" {18} Give ear, O God, and hear; open your eyes and see the desolation of the city that bears your Name. "
DAN	9	18	Daniel	#05		27763	" We do not make requests of you because we are righteous, but because of your great mercy."
DAN	9	19	Daniel	#05		27764	" {19} O Lord, listen! O Lord, forgive! O Lord, hear and act! For your sake, O my God, do not delay, because your city and your people bear your Name.>>"
DAN	9	20	Daniel	#05		27765	" {20} While I was speaking and praying, confessing my sin and the sin of my people Israel and making my request to the Lord my God for his holy hill--"
DAN	9	21	Daniel	#05		27766	" {21} while I was still in prayer, Gabriel, the man I had seen in the earlier vision, came to me in swift flight about the time of the evening sacrifice."
DAN	9	22	Daniel	#05		27767	" {22} He instructed me and said to me,"
DAN	9	22	Gabriel-FX1	#11		27768	" << Daniel, I have now come to give you insight and understanding."
DAN	9	23	Gabriel-FX1	#11		27769	" {23} As soon as you began to pray, an answer was given, which I have come to tell you, for you are highly esteemed. "
DAN	9	23	Gabriel-FX1	#11		27770	" Therefore, consider the message and understand the vision:"
DAN	9	24	Gabriel-FX1	#11		27771	" {24} << Seventy 'sevens' are decreed for your people and your holy city to finish transgression, to put an end to sin, "
DAN	9	24	Gabriel-FX1	#11		27772	" to atone for wickedness, to bring in everlasting righteousness, to seal up vision and prophecy and to anoint the most holy."
DAN	9	25	Gabriel-FX1	#11		27773	" {25} << Know and understand this: From the issuing of the decree to restore and rebuild Jerusalem until the Anointed One, the ruler, comes,"
DAN	9	25	Gabriel-FX1	#11		27774	" there will be seven 'sevens,' and sixty-two 'sevens.' It will be rebuilt with streets and a trench, but in times of trouble."
DAN	9	26	Gabriel-FX1	#11		27775	" {26} After the sixty-two 'sevens,' the Anointed One will be cut off and will have nothing. "
DAN	9	26	Gabriel-FX1	#11		27776	 The people of the ruler who will come will destroy the city and the sanctuary. 
DAN	9	26	Gabriel-FX1	#11		27777	" The end will come like a flood: War will continue until the end, and desolations have been decreed."
DAN	9	27	Gabriel-FX1	#11		27778	 {27} He will confirm a covenant with many for one 'seven.' 
DAN	9	27	Gabriel-FX1	#11		27779	 In the middle of the 'seven' he will put an end to sacrifice and offering. 
DAN	9	27	Gabriel-FX1	#11		27780	" And on a wing of the temple he will set up an abomination that causes desolation, until the end that is decreed is poured out on him.>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
DAN	10	<<	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27781	DANIEL 10
DAN	10	1	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27782	" {1} In the third year of Cyrus king of Persia, a revelation was given to Daniel (who was called Belteshazzar ). "
DAN	10	1	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27783	 Its message was true and it concerned a great war. The understanding of the message came to him in a vision.
DAN	10	2	Daniel	#05		27784	" {2} At that time I, Daniel, mourned for three weeks. {3} I ate no choice food; no meat or wine touched my lips; and I used no lotions at all until the three weeks were over."
DAN	10	4	Daniel	#05		27785	" {4} On the twenty-fourth day of the first month, as I was standing on the bank of the great river, the Tigris,"
DAN	10	5	Daniel	#05		27786	" {5} I looked up and there before me was a man dressed in linen, with a belt of the finest gold around his waist."
DAN	10	6	Daniel	#05		27787	" {6} His body was like chrysolite, his face like lightning, his eyes like flaming torches, his arms and legs like the gleam of burnished bronze, and his voice like the sound of a multitude."
DAN	10	7	Daniel	#05		27788	" {7} I, Daniel, was the only one who saw the vision; the men with me did not see it, but such terror overwhelmed them that they fled and hid themselves."
DAN	10	8	Daniel	#05		27789	" {8} So I was left alone, gazing at this great vision; I had no strength left, my face turned deathly pale and I was helpless."
DAN	10	9	Daniel	#05		27790	" {9} Then I heard him speaking, and as I listened to him, I fell into a deep sleep, my face to the ground. {10} A hand touched me and set me trembling on my hands and knees. {11} He said,"
DAN	10	11	Man in Linen	#08		27791	" << Daniel, you who are highly esteemed, consider carefully the words I am about to speak to you, and stand up, for I have now been sent to you.>>"
DAN	10	11	Daniel	#05		27792	" And when he said this to me, I stood up trembling. {12} Then he continued,"
DAN	10	12	Man in Linen	#08		27793	" << Do not be afraid, Daniel. Since the first day that you set your mind to gain understanding and to humble yourself before your God, your words were heard, and I have come in response to them."
DAN	10	13	Man in Linen	#08		27794	" {13} But the prince of the Persian kingdom resisted me twenty-one days. Then Michael, one of the chief princes, came to help me, because I was detained there with the king of Persia."
DAN	10	14	Man in Linen	#08		27795	" {14} Now I have come to explain to you what will happen to your people in the future, for the vision concerns a time yet to come.>>"
DAN	10	15	Daniel	#05		27796	" {15} While he was saying this to me, I bowed with my face toward the ground and was speechless."
DAN	10	16	Daniel	#05		27797	" {16} Then one who looked like a man touched my lips, and I opened my mouth and began to speak. "
DAN	10	16	Daniel	#05		27798	" I said to the one standing before me, << I am overcome with anguish because of the vision, my lord, and I am helpless."
DAN	10	17	Daniel	#05		27799	" {17} How can I, your servant, talk with you, my lord? My strength is gone and I can hardly breathe.>> "
DAN	10	18	Daniel	#05		27800	" {18} Again the one who looked like a man touched me and gave me strength. {19} He said,"
DAN	10	19	Man in Linen	#08		27801	" << Do not be afraid, O man highly esteemed. Peace! Be strong now; be strong.>>"
DAN	10	19	Daniel	#05		27802	" When he spoke to me, I was strengthened and said, << Speak, my lord, since you have given me strength.>> {20} So he said,"
DAN	10	20	Man in Linen	#08		27803	" << Do you know why I have come to you? Soon I will return to fight against the prince of Persia, and when I go, the prince of Greece will come;"
DAN	10	21	Man in Linen	#08		27804	" {21} but first I will tell you what is written in the Book of Truth. (No one supports me against them except Michael, your prince.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
DAN	11	<<	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27805	DANIEL 11
DAN	11	1	Man in Linen	#08		27806	" {1} And in the first year of Darius the Mede, I took my stand to support and protect him.)"
DAN	11	2	Man in Linen	#08		27807	" {2} << Now then, I tell you the truth: Three more kings will appear in Persia, and then a fourth, who will be far richer than all the others. "
DAN	11	2	Man in Linen	#08		27808	" When he has gained power by his wealth, he will stir up everyone against the kingdom of Greece."
DAN	11	3	Man in Linen	#08		27809	" {3} Then a mighty king will appear, who will rule with great power and do as he pleases."
DAN	11	4	Man in Linen	#08		27810	" {4} After he has appeared, his empire will be broken up and parceled out toward the four winds of heaven. "
DAN	11	4	Man in Linen	#08		27811	" It will not go to his descendants, nor will it have the power he exercised, because his empire will be uprooted and given to others."
DAN	11	5	Man in Linen	#08		27812	" {5} << The king of the South will become strong, but one of his commanders will become even stronger than he and will rule his own kingdom with great power."
DAN	11	6	Man in Linen	#08		27813	" {6} After some years, they will become allies. "
DAN	11	6	Man in Linen	#08		27814	" The daughter of the king of the South will go to the king of the North to make an alliance, but she will not retain her power, and he and his power will not last. "
DAN	11	6	Man in Linen	#08		27815	" In those days she will be handed over, together with her royal escort and her father and the one who supported her."
DAN	11	7	Man in Linen	#08		27816	 {7} << One from her family line will arise to take her place. 
DAN	11	7	Man in Linen	#08		27817	 He will attack the forces of the king of the North and enter his fortress; he will fight against them and be victorious.
DAN	11	8	Man in Linen	#08		27818	" {8} He will also seize their gods, their metal images and their valuable articles of silver and gold and carry them off to Egypt."
DAN	11	8	Man in Linen	#08		27819	 For some years he will leave the king of the North alone.
DAN	11	9	Man in Linen	#08		27820	 {9} Then the king of the North will invade the realm of the king of the South but will retreat to his own country.
DAN	11	10	Man in Linen	#08		27821	" {10} His sons will prepare for war and assemble a great army, which will sweep on like an irresistible flood and carry the battle as far as his fortress."
DAN	11	11	Man in Linen	#08		27822	" {11} << Then the king of the South will march out in a rage and fight against the king of the North, who will raise a large army, but it will be defeated."
DAN	11	12	Man in Linen	#08		27823	" {12} When the army is carried off, the king of the South will be filled with pride and will slaughter many thousands, yet he will not remain triumphant."
DAN	11	13	Man in Linen	#08		27824	" {13} For the king of the North will muster another army, larger than the first; and after several years, he will advance with a huge army fully equipped."
DAN	11	14	Man in Linen	#08		27825	" {14} << In those times many will rise against the king of the South. The violent men among your own people will rebel in fulfillment of the vision, but without success."
DAN	11	15	Man in Linen	#08		27826	 {15} Then the king of the North will come and build up siege ramps and will capture a fortified city.
DAN	11	15	Man in Linen	#08		27827	 The forces of the South will be powerless to resist; even their best troops will not have the strength to stand.
DAN	11	16	Man in Linen	#08		27828	 {16} The invader will do as he pleases; no one will be able to stand against him. He will establish himself in the Beautiful Land and will have the power to destroy it.
DAN	11	17	Man in Linen	#08		27829	 {17} He will determine to come with the might of his entire kingdom and will make an alliance with the king of the South. 
DAN	11	17	Man in Linen	#08		27830	" And he will give him a daughter in marriage in order to overthrow the kingdom, but his plans will not succeed or help him."
DAN	11	18	Man in Linen	#08		27831	" {18} Then he will turn his attention to the coastlands and will take many of them, but a commander will put an end to his insolence and will turn his insolence back upon him."
DAN	11	19	Man in Linen	#08		27832	" {19} After this, he will turn back toward the fortresses of his own country but will stumble and fall, to be seen no more."
DAN	11	20	Man in Linen	#08		27833	" {20} << His successor will send out a tax collector to maintain the royal splendor. In a few years, however, he will be destroyed, yet not in anger or in battle."
DAN	11	21	Man in Linen	#08		27834	 {21} << He will be succeeded by a contemptible person who has not been given the honor of royalty. 
DAN	11	21	Man in Linen	#08		27835	" He will invade the kingdom when its people feel secure, and he will seize it through intrigue."
DAN	11	22	Man in Linen	#08		27836	 {22} Then an overwhelming army will be swept away before him; both it and a prince of the covenant will be destroyed.
DAN	11	23	Man in Linen	#08		27837	" {23} After coming to an agreement with him, he will act deceitfully, and with only a few people he will rise to power."
DAN	11	24	Man in Linen	#08		27838	" {24} When the richest provinces feel secure, he will invade them and will achieve what neither his fathers nor his forefathers did. "
DAN	11	24	Man in Linen	#08		27839	" He will distribute plunder, loot and wealth among his followers. He will plot the overthrow of fortresses--but only for a time."
DAN	11	25	Man in Linen	#08		27840	 {25} << With a large army he will stir up his strength and courage against the king of the South. 
DAN	11	25	Man in Linen	#08		27841	" The king of the South will wage war with a large and very powerful army, but he will not be able to stand because of the plots devised against him."
DAN	11	26	Man in Linen	#08		27842	" {26} Those who eat from the king's provisions will try to destroy him; his army will be swept away, and many will fall in battle."
DAN	11	27	Man in Linen	#08		27843	" {27} The two kings, with their hearts bent on evil, will sit at the same table and lie to each other, but to no avail, because an end will still come at the appointed time."
DAN	11	28	Man in Linen	#08		27844	" {28} The king of the North will return to his own country with great wealth, but his heart will be set against the holy covenant. "
DAN	11	28	Man in Linen	#08		27845	 He will take action against it and then return to his own country.
DAN	11	29	Man in Linen	#08		27846	" {29} << At the appointed time he will invade the South again, but this time the outcome will be different from what it was before."
DAN	11	30	Man in Linen	#08		27847	" {30} Ships of the western coastlands will oppose him, and he will lose heart. Then he will turn back and vent his fury against the holy covenant. "
DAN	11	30	Man in Linen	#08		27848	 He will return and show favor to those who forsake the holy covenant.
DAN	11	31	Man in Linen	#08		27849	 {31} << His armed forces will rise up to desecrate the temple fortress and will abolish the daily sacrifice. 
DAN	11	31	Man in Linen	#08		27850	 Then they will set up the abomination that causes desolation.
DAN	11	32	Man in Linen	#08		27851	" {32} With flattery he will corrupt those who have violated the covenant, but the people who know their God will firmly resist him."
DAN	11	33	Man in Linen	#08		27852	" {33} << Those who are wise will instruct many, though for a time they will fall by the sword or be burned or captured or plundered."
DAN	11	34	Man in Linen	#08		27853	" {34} When they fall, they will receive a little help, and many who are not sincere will join them."
DAN	11	35	Man in Linen	#08		27854	" {35} Some of the wise will stumble, so that they may be refined, purified and made spotless until the time of the end, for it will still come at the appointed time."
DAN	11	36	Man in Linen	#08		27855	 {36} << The king will do as he pleases. He will exalt and magnify himself above every god and will say unheard-of things against the God of gods. 
DAN	11	36	Man in Linen	#08		27856	" He will be successful until the time of wrath is completed, for what has been determined must take place."
DAN	11	37	Man in Linen	#08		27857	" {37} He will show no regard for the gods of his fathers or for the one desired by women, nor will he regard any god, but will exalt himself above them all."
DAN	11	38	Man in Linen	#08		27858	" {38} Instead of them, he will honor a god of fortresses; a god unknown to his fathers he will honor with gold and silver, with precious stones and costly gifts."
DAN	11	39	Man in Linen	#08		27859	 {39} He will attack the mightiest fortresses with the help of a foreign god and will greatly honor those who acknowledge him. 
DAN	11	39	Man in Linen	#08		27860	 He will make them rulers over many people and will distribute the land at a price.
DAN	11	40	Man in Linen	#08		27861	" {40} << At the time of the end the king of the South will engage him in battle, and the king of the North will storm out against him with chariots and cavalry and a great fleet of ships. "
DAN	11	40	Man in Linen	#08		27862	 He will invade many countries and sweep through them like a flood.
DAN	11	41	Man in Linen	#08		27863	" {41} He will also invade the Beautiful Land. Many countries will fall, but Edom, Moab and the leaders of Ammon will be delivered from his hand."
DAN	11	42	Man in Linen	#08		27864	 {42} He will extend his power over many countries; Egypt will not escape.
DAN	11	43	Man in Linen	#08		27865	" {43} He will gain control of the treasures of gold and silver and all the riches of Egypt, with the Libyans and Nubians in submission."
DAN	11	44	Man in Linen	#08		27866	" {44} But reports from the east and the north will alarm him, and he will set out in a great rage to destroy and annihilate many."
DAN	11	45	Man in Linen	#08		27867	" {45} He will pitch his royal tents between the seas at the beautiful holy mountain. Yet he will come to his end, and no one will help him.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
DAN	12	<<	Narr_27: Daniel	#13		27868	DANIEL 12
DAN	12	1	Man in Linen	#08		27869	" {1} << At that time Michael, the great prince who protects your people, will arise."
DAN	12	1	Man in Linen	#08		27870	 There will be a time of distress such as has not happened from the beginning of nations until then.
DAN	12	1	Man in Linen	#08		27871	 But at that time your people--everyone whose name is found written in the book--will be delivered.
DAN	12	2	Man in Linen	#08		27872	" {2} Multitudes who sleep in the dust of the earth will awake: some to everlasting life, others to shame and everlasting contempt."
DAN	12	3	Man in Linen	#08		27873	" {3} Those who are wise will shine like the brightness of the heavens, and those who lead many to righteousness, like the stars for ever and ever."
DAN	12	4	Man in Linen	#08		27874	" {4} But you, Daniel, close up and seal the words of the scroll until the time of the end. Many will go here and there to increase knowledge.>>"
DAN	12	5	Daniel	#05		27875	" {5} Then I, Daniel, looked, and there before me stood two others, one on this bank of the river and one on the opposite bank."
DAN	12	6	Daniel	#05		27876	" {6} One of them said to the man clothed in linen, who was above the waters of the river,"
DAN	12	6	Man	#18		27877	 << How long will it be before these astonishing things are fulfilled?>>
DAN	12	7	Daniel	#05		27878	" {7} The man clothed in linen, who was above the waters of the river, lifted his right hand and his left hand toward heaven, and I heard him swear by him who lives forever, saying, "
DAN	12	7	Daniel	#05		27879	" << It will be for a time, times and half a time. When the power of the holy people has been finally broken, all these things will be completed.>>"
DAN	12	8	Daniel	#05		27880	" {8} I heard, but I did not understand. So I asked, << My lord, what will the outcome of all this be?>> {9} He replied,"
DAN	12	9	Man in Linen	#08		27881	" << Go your way, Daniel, because the words are closed up and sealed until the time of the end."
DAN	12	10	Man in Linen	#08		27882	" {10} Many will be purified, made spotless and refined, but the wicked will continue to be wicked. "
DAN	12	10	Man in Linen	#08		27883	" None of the wicked will understand, but those who are wise will understand."
DAN	12	11	Man in Linen	#08		27884	" {11} << From the time that the daily sacrifice is abolished and the abomination that causes desolation is set up, there will be 1,290 days."
DAN	12	12	Man in Linen	#08		27885	" {12} Blessed is the one who waits for and reaches the end of the 1,335 days."
DAN	12	13	Man in Linen	#08		27886	" {13} << As for you, go your way till the end. You will rest, and then at the end of the days you will rise to receive your allotted inheritance.>>*~**~*||||| + 5 SECs |||||*~*"
HOS	1	<<	Narr_28: Hosea	#13		27887	HOSEA*~*HOSEA 1
HOS	1	1	Narr_28: Hosea	#13		27888	" {1} The word of the Lord that came to Hosea son of Beeri during the reigns of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz and Hezekiah, kings of Judah, and during the reign of Jeroboam son of Jehoash king of Israel:"
HOS	1	2	Narr_28: Hosea	#13		27889	" {2} When the Lord began to speak through Hosea, the Lord said to him,"
HOS	1	2	God-FX1	#20		27890	" << Go, take to yourself an adulterous wife and children of unfaithfulness, because the land is guilty of the vilest adultery in departing from the Lord.>>"
HOS	1	3	Narr_28: Hosea	#13		27891	" {3} So he married Gomer daughter of Diblaim, and she conceived and bore him a son. {4} Then the Lord said to Hosea,"
HOS	1	4	God-FX1	#20		27892	" << Call him Jezreel, because I will soon punish the house of Jehu for the massacre at Jezreel, and I will put an end to the kingdom of Israel."
HOS	1	5	God-FX1	#20		27893	 {5} In that day I will break Israel's bow in the Valley of Jezreel.>>
HOS	1	6	Narr_28: Hosea	#13		27894	" {6} Gomer conceived again and gave birth to a daughter. Then the Lord said to Hosea,"
HOS	1	6	God-FX1	#20		27895	" << Call her Lo-Ruhamah, for I will no longer show love to the house of Israel, that I should at all forgive them."
HOS	1	7	God-FX1	#20		27896	" {7} Yet I will show love to the house of Judah; and I will save them--not by bow, sword or battle, or by horses and horsemen, but by the Lord their God.>>"
HOS	1	8	Narr_28: Hosea	#13		27897	" {8} After she had weaned Lo-Ruhamah, Gomer had another son. {9} Then the Lord said,"
HOS	1	9	God-FX1	#20		27898	" << Call him Lo-Ammi, for you are not my people, and I am not your God."
HOS	1	10	God-FX1	#20		27899	" {10} << Yet the Israelites will be like the sand on the seashore, which cannot be measured or counted."
HOS	1	10	God-FX1	#20		27900	" In the place where it was said to them, 'You are not my people,' they will be called 'sons of the living God.'"
HOS	1	11	God-FX1	#20		27901	" {11} The people of Judah and the people of Israel will be reunited, and they will appoint one leader and will come up out of the land, for great will be the day of Jezreel.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
HOS	2	<<	Narr_28: Hosea	#13		27902	HOSEA 2
HOS	2	1	Hosea	#01		27903	" {1} << Say of your brothers, 'My people,' and of your sisters, 'My loved one.'"
HOS	2	2	Hosea	#01		27904	" {2} << Rebuke your mother, rebuke her, for she is not my wife, and I am not her husband."
HOS	2	2	Hosea	#01		27905	 Let her remove the adulterous look from her face and the unfaithfulness from between her breasts.
HOS	2	3	Hosea	#01		27906	" {3} Otherwise I will strip her naked and make her as bare as on the day she was born; I will make her like a desert, turn her into a parched land, and slay her with thirst."
HOS	2	4	Hosea	#01		27907	" {4} I will not show my love to her children, because they are the children of adultery."
HOS	2	5	Hosea	#01		27908	 {5} Their mother has been unfaithful and has conceived them in disgrace. 
HOS	2	5	Hosea	#01		27909	" She said, 'I will go after my lovers, who give me my food and my water, my wool and my linen, my oil and my drink.'"
HOS	2	6	Hosea	#01		27910	 {6} Therefore I will block her path with thornbushes; I will wall her in so that she cannot find her way.
HOS	2	7	Hosea	#01		27911	 {7} She will chase after her lovers but not catch them; she will look for them but not find them. 
HOS	2	7	Hosea	#01		27912	" Then she will say, 'I will go back to my husband as at first, for then I was better off than now.'"
HOS	2	8	Hosea	#01		27913	" {8} She has not acknowledged that I was the one who gave her the grain, the new wine and oil, who lavished on her the silver and gold-- which they used for Baal."
HOS	2	9	Hosea	#01		27914	" {9} << Therefore I will take away my grain when it ripens, and my new wine when it is ready. I will take back my wool and my linen, intended to cover her nakedness."
HOS	2	10	Hosea	#01		27915	 {10} So now I will expose her lewdness before the eyes of her lovers; no one will take her out of my hands.
HOS	2	11	Hosea	#01		27916	" {11} I will stop all her celebrations: her yearly festivals, her New Moons, her Sabbath days--all her appointed feasts."
HOS	2	12	Hosea	#01		27917	" {12} I will ruin her vines and her fig trees, which she said were her pay from her lovers; I will make them a thicket, and wild animals will devour them."
HOS	2	13	Hosea	#01		27918	" {13} I will punish her for the days she burned incense to the Baals; she decked herself with rings and jewelry, and went after her lovers, but me she forgot,>>"
HOS	2	14	Hosea	#01		27919	 {14} Therefore I am now going to allure her; I will lead her into the desert and speak tenderly to her.
HOS	2	15	Hosea	#01		27920	" {15} There I will give her back her vineyards, and will make the Valley of Achor a door of hope. "
HOS	2	15	Hosea	#01		27921	" There she will sing as in the days of her youth, as in the day she came up out of Egypt."
HOS	2	16	Hosea	#01		27922	" {16} << In that day, the Lord declares, you will call me 'my husband'; you will no longer call me 'my master.'"
HOS	2	17	Hosea	#01		27923	 {17} I will remove the names of the Baals from her lips; no longer will their names be invoked.
HOS	2	18	Hosea	#01		27924	 {18} In that day I will make a covenant for them with the beasts of the field and the birds of the air and the creatures that move along the ground. 
HOS	2	18	Hosea	#01		27925	" Bow and sword and battle I will abolish from the land, so that all may lie down in safety."
HOS	2	19	Hosea	#01		27926	" {19} I will betroth you to me forever; I will betroth you in righteousness and justice, in love and compassion."
HOS	2	20	Hosea	#01		27927	" {20} I will betroth you in faithfulness, and you will acknowledge the Lord."
HOS	2	21	Narr_28: Hosea	#13		27928	" {21} The Lord declares,"
HOS	2	21	God-FX1	#20		27929	" << In that day I will respond, I will respond to the skies, and they will respond to the earth;"
HOS	2	22	God-FX1	#20		27930	" {22} and the earth will respond to the grain, the new wine and oil, and they will respond to Jezreel."
HOS	2	23	God-FX1	#20		27931	 {23} I will plant her for myself in the land; I will show my love to the one I called 'Not my loved one.' 
HOS	2	23	God-FX1	#20		27932	" I will say to those called 'Not my people,' 'You are my people'; and they will say, 'You are my God.'>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"

HOS	3	5	Hosea	#01		27940	 {5} Afterward the Israelites will return and seek the Lord their God and David their king. They will come trembling to the Lord and to his blessings in the last days.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
HOS	4	<<	Narr_28: Hosea	#13		27941	HOSEA 4
HOS	4	1	Hosea	#01		27942	" {1} Hear the word of the Lord, you Israelites, because the Lord has a charge to bring against you who live in the land: "
HOS	4	1	Hosea	#01		27943	" << There is no faithfulness, no love, no acknowledgment of God in the land."
HOS	4	2	Hosea	#01		27944	" {2} There is only cursing, lying and murder, stealing and adultery; they break all bounds, and bloodshed follows bloodshed."
HOS	4	3	Hosea	#01		27945	" {3} Because of this the land mourns, and all who live in it waste away; the beasts of the field and the birds of the air and the fish of the sea are dying."
HOS	4	4	Hosea	#01		27946	" {4} << But let no man bring a charge, let no man accuse another, for your people are like those who bring charges against a priest."
HOS	4	5	God-FX1	#20		27947	" {5} You stumble day and night, and the prophets stumble with you. So I will destroy your mother-- {6} my people are destroyed from lack of knowledge. "
HOS	4	6	God-FX1	#20		27948	" << Because you have rejected knowledge, I also reject you as my priests; because you have ignored the law of your God, I also will ignore your children."
HOS	4	7	God-FX1	#20		27949	" {7} The more the priests increased, the more they sinned against me; they exchanged their Glory for something disgraceful."
HOS	4	8	God-FX1	#20		27950	" {8} They feed on the sins of my people and relish their wickedness. {9} And it will be: Like people, like priests. I will punish both of them for their ways and repay them for their deeds."
HOS	4	10	Hosea	#01		27951	 {10} << They will eat but not have enough; 
HOS	4	10	Hosea	#01		27952	" they will engage in prostitution but not increase, because they have deserted the Lord to give themselves {11} to prostitution, to old wine and new, which take away the understanding."
HOS	4	12	Hosea	#01		27953	 {12} My people consult a wooden idol and are answered by a stick of wood. A spirit of prostitution leads them astray; they are unfaithful to their God.
HOS	4	13	Hosea	#01		27954	" {13} They sacrifice on the mountaintops and burn offerings on the hills, under oak, poplar and terebinth, where the shade is pleasant."
HOS	4	13	Hosea	#01		27955	 Therefore your daughters turn to prostitution and your daughters-in-law to adultery.
HOS	4	14	God-FX1	#20		27956	" {14} << I will not punish your daughters when they turn to prostitution, nor your daughters-in-law when they commit adultery; "
HOS	4	14	God-FX1	#20		27957	 for the men themselves consort with harlots and sacrifice with shrine prostitutes-- a people without understanding will come to ruin!
HOS	4	15	Hosea	#01		27958	" {15} << Though you commit adultery, O Israel, let not Judah become guilty. << Do not go to Gilgal; do not go up to Beth Aven. And do not swear, 'As surely as the Lord lives!'"
HOS	4	16	Hosea	#01		27959	" {16} The Israelites are stubborn, like a stubborn heifer. How then can the Lord pasture them like lambs in a meadow? {17} Ephraim is joined to idols; leave him alone!"
HOS	4	18	Hosea	#01		27960	" {18} Even when their drinks are gone, they continue their prostitution; their rulers dearly love shameful ways."
HOS	4	19	Hosea	#01		27961	" {19} A whirlwind will sweep them away, and their sacrifices will bring them shame.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
HOS	5	<<	Narr_28: Hosea	#13		27962	HOSEA 5
HOS	5	1	Hosea	#01		27963	" {1} << Hear this, you priests! Pay attention, you Israelites! Listen, O royal house! This judgment is against you: You have been a snare at Mizpah, a net spread out on Tabor."
HOS	5	2	God-FX1	#20		27964	 {2} The rebels are deep in slaughter. I will discipline all of them.
HOS	5	3	God-FX1	#20		27965	" {3} I know all about Ephraim; Israel is not hidden from me. Ephraim, you have now turned to prostitution; Israel is corrupt."
HOS	5	4	Hosea	#01		27966	 {4} << Their deeds do not permit them to return to their God. A spirit of prostitution is in their heart; they do not acknowledge the Lord.
HOS	5	5	Hosea	#01		27967	" {5} Israel's arrogance testifies against them; the Israelites, even Ephraim, stumble in their sin; Judah also stumbles with them."
HOS	5	6	Hosea	#01		27968	" {6} When they go with their flocks and herds to seek the Lord, they will not find him; he has withdrawn himself from them."
HOS	5	7	Hosea	#01		27969	 {7} They are unfaithful to the Lord; they give birth to illegitimate children. Now their New Moon festivals will devour them and their fields.
HOS	5	8	Hosea	#01		27970	" {8} << Sound the trumpet in Gibeah, the horn in Ramah. Raise the battle cry in Beth Aven; lead on, O Benjamin."
HOS	5	9	Hosea	#01		27971	 {9} Ephraim will be laid waste on the day of reckoning. Among the tribes of Israel I proclaim what is certain.
HOS	5	10	Hosea	#01		27972	 {10} Judah's leaders are like those who move boundary stones. I will pour out my wrath on them like a flood of water.
HOS	5	11	Hosea	#01		27973	" {11} Ephraim is oppressed, trampled in judgment, intent on pursuing idols. {12} I am like a moth to Ephraim, like rot to the people of Judah."
HOS	5	13	Hosea	#01		27974	" {13} << When Ephraim saw his sickness, and Judah his sores, then Ephraim turned to Assyria, and sent to the great king for help. But he is not able to cure you, not able to heal your sores."
HOS	5	14	God-FX1	#20		27975	" {14} For I will be like a lion to Ephraim, like a great lion to Judah. I will tear them to pieces and go away; I will carry them off, with no one to rescue them."
HOS	5	15	God-FX1	#20		27976	 {15} Then I will go back to my place until they admit their guilt. And they will seek my face; in their misery they will earnestly seek me.>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
HOS	6	<<	Narr_28: Hosea	#13		27977	HOSEA 6
HOS	6	1	Hosea	#01		27978	" {1} << Come, let us return to the Lord. He has torn us to pieces but he will heal us; he has injured us but he will bind up our wounds."
HOS	6	2	Hosea	#01		27979	" {2} After two days he will revive us; on the third day he will restore us, that we may live in his presence. {3} Let us acknowledge the Lord; let us press on to acknowledge him. "
HOS	6	3	Hosea	#01		27980	" As surely as the sun rises, he will appear; he will come to us like the winter rains, like the spring rains that water the earth.>>"
HOS	6	4	God-FX1	#20		27981	" {4} << What can I do with you, Ephraim? What can I do with you, Judah? Your love is like the morning mist, like the early dew that disappears."
HOS	6	5	Hosea	#01		27982	" {5} Therefore I cut you in pieces with my prophets, I killed you with the words of my mouth; my judgments flashed like lightning upon you."
HOS	6	6	Hosea	#01		27983	" {6} For I desire mercy, not sacrifice, and acknowledgment of God rather than burnt offerings."
HOS	6	7	Hosea	#01		27984	" {7} Like Adam, they have broken the covenant-- they were unfaithful to me there. {8} Gilead is a city of wicked men, stained with footprints of blood."
HOS	6	9	Hosea	#01		27985	" {9} As marauders lie in ambush for a man, so do bands of priests; they murder on the road to Shechem, committing shameful crimes."

HOS	6	11	God-FX1	#20		27987	" {11} << Also for you, Judah, a harvest is appointed.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
HOS	7	<<	Narr_28: Hosea	#13		27988	HOSEA 7
HOS	7	1	God-FX1	#20		27989	" {1} << Whenever I would restore the fortunes of my people, whenever I would heal Israel, the sins of Ephraim are exposed and the crimes of Samaria revealed. "
HOS	7	1	God-FX1	#20		27990	" They practice deceit, thieves break into houses, bandits rob in the streets; {2} but they do not realize that I remember all their evil deeds. Their sins engulf them; they are always before me."
HOS	7	3	Hosea	#01		27991	" {3} << They delight the king with their wickedness, the princes with their lies."
HOS	7	4	Hosea	#01		27992	" {4} They are all adulterers, burning like an oven whose fire the baker need not stir from the kneading of the dough till it rises."
HOS	7	5	Hosea	#01		27993	" {5} On the day of the festival of our king the princes become inflamed with wine, and he joins hands with the mockers."
HOS	7	6	Hosea	#01		27994	 {6} Their hearts are like an oven; they approach him with intrigue. Their passion smolders all night; in the morning it blazes like a flaming fire.
HOS	7	7	Hosea	#01		27995	" {7} All of them are hot as an oven; they devour their rulers. All their kings fall, and none of them calls on me."
HOS	7	8	Hosea	#01		27996	 {8} << Ephraim mixes with the nations; Ephraim is a flat cake not turned over.
HOS	7	9	Hosea	#01		27997	" {9} Foreigners sap his strength, but he does not realize it. His hair is sprinkled with gray, but he does not notice."
HOS	7	10	Hosea	#01		27998	" {10} Israel's arrogance testifies against him, but despite all this he does not return to the Lord his God or search for him."
HOS	7	11	Hosea	#01		27999	" {11} << Ephraim is like a dove, easily deceived and senseless-- now calling to Egypt, now turning to Assyria."
HOS	7	12	God-FX1	#20		28000	" {12} When they go, I will throw my net over them; I will pull them down like birds of the air. When I hear them flocking together, I will catch them."
HOS	7	13	God-FX1	#20		28001	" {13} Woe to them, because they have strayed from me! Destruction to them, because they have rebelled against me! I long to redeem them but they speak lies against me."
HOS	7	14	God-FX1	#20		28002	 {14} They do not cry out to me from their hearts but wail upon their beds. They gather together for grain and new wine but turn away from me.
HOS	7	15	God-FX1	#20		28003	" {15} I trained them and strengthened them, but they plot evil against me."
HOS	7	16	Hosea	#01		28004	 {16} They do not turn to the Most High; they are like a faulty bow. Their leaders will fall by the sword because of their insolent words. 
HOS	7	16	Hosea	#01		28005	 For this they will be ridiculed in the land of Egypt.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
HOS	8	<<	Narr_28: Hosea	#13		28006	HOSEA 8
HOS	8	1	God-FX1	#20		28007	 {1} << Put the trumpet to your lips! An eagle is over the house of the Lord because the people have broken my covenant and rebelled against my law.
HOS	8	2	God-FX1	#20		28008	" {2} Israel cries out to me, 'O our God, we acknowledge you!' {3} But Israel has rejected what is good; an enemy will pursue him."
HOS	8	4	God-FX1	#20		28009	 {4} They set up kings without my consent; they choose princes without my approval. With their silver and gold they make idols for themselves to their own destruction.
HOS	8	5	God-FX1	#20		28010	" {5} Throw out your calf-idol, O Samaria! My anger burns against them. How long will they be incapable of purity?"
HOS	8	6	Hosea	#01		28011	" {6} They are from Israel! This calf--a craftsman has made it; it is not God. It will be broken in pieces, that calf of Samaria."
HOS	8	7	Hosea	#01		28012	" {7} They sow the wind and reap the whirlwind. The stalk has no head; it will produce no flour. Were it to yield grain, foreigners would swallow it up."
HOS	8	8	Hosea	#01		28013	 {8} Israel is swallowed up; now she is among the nations like a worthless thing.
HOS	8	9	Hosea	#01		28014	 {9} For they have gone up to Assyria like a wild donkey wandering alone. Ephraim has sold herself to lovers.
HOS	8	10	Hosea	#01		28015	" {10} Although they have sold themselves among the nations, I will now gather them together. They will begin to waste away under the oppression of the mighty king."
HOS	8	11	Hosea	#01		28016	" {11} << Though Ephraim built many altars for sin offerings, these have become altars for sinning."
HOS	8	12	God-FX1	#20		28017	" {12} I wrote for them the many things of my law, but they regarded them as something alien."
HOS	8	13	God-FX1	#20		28018	" {13} They offer sacrifices given to me and they eat the meat, but the Lord is not pleased with them. Now he will remember their wickedness and punish their sins: They will return to Egypt."
HOS	8	14	God-FX1	#20		28019	 {14} Israel has forgotten his Maker and built palaces; Judah has fortified many towns. But I will send fire upon their cities that will consume their fortresses.>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
HOS	9	<<	Narr_28: Hosea	#13		28020	HOSEA 9
HOS	9	1	Hosea	#01		28021	" {1} Do not rejoice, O Israel; do not be jubilant like the other nations. For you have been unfaithful to your God; you love the wages of a prostitute at every threshing floor."
HOS	9	2	Hosea	#01		28022	 {2} Threshing floors and winepresses will not feed the people; the new wine will fail them.
HOS	9	3	Hosea	#01		28023	 {3} They will not remain in the Lord's land; Ephraim will return to Egypt and eat unclean food in Assyria.
HOS	9	4	Hosea	#01		28024	" {4} They will not pour out wine offerings to the Lord, nor will their sacrifices please him. "
HOS	9	4	Hosea	#01		28025	 Such sacrifices will be to them like the bread of mourners; all who eat them will be unclean. This food will be for themselves; it will not come into the temple of the Lord.
HOS	9	5	Hosea	#01		28026	" {5} What will you do on the day of your appointed feasts, on the festival days of the Lord?"
HOS	9	6	Hosea	#01		28027	" {6} Even if they escape from destruction, Egypt will gather them, and Memphis will bury them. Their treasures of silver will be taken over by briers, and thorns will overrun their tents."
HOS	9	7	Hosea	#01		28028	" {7} The days of punishment are coming, the days of reckoning are at hand. "
HOS	9	7	Hosea	#01		28029	" Let Israel know this. Because your sins are so many and your hostility so great, the prophet is considered a fool, the inspired man a maniac."
HOS	9	8	Hosea	#01		28030	" {8} The prophet, along with my God, is the watchman over Ephraim, yet snares await him on all his paths, and hostility in the house of his God."
HOS	9	9	Hosea	#01		28031	" {9} They have sunk deep into corruption, as in the days of Gibeah. God will remember their wickedness and punish them for their sins."
HOS	9	10	God-FX1	#20		28032	" {10} <<When I found Israel, it was like finding grapes in the desert; when I saw your fathers, it was like seeing the early fruit on the fig tree. "
HOS	9	10	God-FX1	#20		28033	" But when they came to Baal Peor, they consecrated themselves to that shameful idol and became as vile as the thing they loved."
HOS	9	11	God-FX1	#20		28034	" {11} Ephraim's glory will fly away like a bird-- no birth, no pregnancy, no conception. {12} Even if they rear children, I will bereave them of every one. Woe to them when I turn away from them!"
HOS	9	13	God-FX1	#20		28035	" {13} I have seen Ephraim, like Tyre, planted in a pleasant place. But Ephraim will bring out their children to the slayer.>>"
HOS	9	14	Hosea	#01		28036	" {14} Give them, O Lord-- what will you give them? Give them wombs that miscarry and breasts that are dry."
HOS	9	15	God-FX1	#20		28037	" {15} << Because of all their wickedness in Gilgal, I hated them there. Because of their sinful deeds, I will drive them out of my house. I will no longer love them; all their leaders are rebellious."
HOS	9	16	God-FX1	#20		28038	" {16} Ephraim is blighted, their root is withered, they yield no fruit. Even if they bear children, I will slay their cherished offspring.>>"
HOS	9	17	Hosea	#01		28039	 {17} My God will reject them because they have not obeyed him; they will be wanderers among the nations.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
HOS	10	<<	Narr_28: Hosea	#13		28040	HOSEA 10

HOS	10	2	Hosea	#01		28042	" {2} Their heart is deceitful, and now they must bear their guilt. The Lord will demolish their altars and destroy their sacred stones. {3} Then they will say,"
HOS	10	3	Israelite	#15		28043	" << We have no king because we did not revere the Lord. But even if we had a king, what could he do for us?>>"
HOS	10	4	Hosea	#01		28044	" {4} They make many promises, take false oaths and make agreements; therefore lawsuits spring up like poisonous weeds in a plowed field."
HOS	10	5	Hosea	#01		28045	 {5} The people who live in Samaria fear for the calf-idol of Beth Aven.
HOS	10	5	Hosea	#01		28046	" Its people will mourn over it, and so will its idolatrous priests, those who had rejoiced over its splendor, because it is taken from them into exile."

HOS	10	12	Hosea	#01		28054	" {12} Sow for yourselves righteousness, reap the fruit of unfailing love, and break up your unplowed ground; for it is time to seek the Lord, until he comes and showers righteousness on you."
HOS	10	13	Hosea	#01		28055	" {13} But you have planted wickedness, you have reaped evil, you have eaten the fruit of deception. "
HOS	10	13	Hosea	#01		28056	" Because you have depended on your own strength and on your many warriors, {14} the roar of battle will rise against your people, so that all your fortresses will be devastated-- "
HOS	10	14	Hosea	#01		28057	" as Shalman devastated Beth Arbel on the day of battle, when mothers were dashed to the ground with their children."
HOS	10	15	Hosea	#01		28058	" {15} Thus will it happen to you, O Bethel, because your wickedness is great. When that day dawns, the king of Israel will be completely destroyed.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
HOS	11	<<	Narr_28: Hosea	#13		28059	HOSEA 11

HOS	11	2	God-FX1	#20		28061	" {2} But the more I called Israel, the further they went from me. They sacrificed to the Baals and they burned incense to images."
HOS	11	3	God-FX1	#20		28062	" {3} It was I who taught Ephraim to walk, taking them by the arms; but they did not realize it was I who healed them."

HOS	13	<<	Narr_28: Hosea	#13		28086	HOSEA 13
