JOEL	1	<<	Narr_29: Joel	#13		28116	JOEL*~*JOEL 1
JOEL	1	1	Narr_29: Joel	#13		28117	 {1} The word of the Lord that came to Joel son of Pethuel.
JOEL	1	2	Joel	#14		28118	" {2} Hear this, you elders; listen, all who live in the land. Has anything like this ever happened in your days or in the days of your forefathers?"
JOEL	1	3	Joel	#14		28119	" {3} Tell it to your children, and let your children tell it to their children, and their children to the next generation."
JOEL	1	4	Joel	#14		28120	 {4} What the locust swarm has left the great locusts have eaten; what the great locusts have left the young locusts have eaten; what the young locusts have left other locusts have eaten.
JOEL	1	5	Joel	#14		28121	" {5} Wake up, you drunkards, and weep! Wail, all you drinkers of wine; wail because of the new wine, for it has been snatched from your lips."
JOEL	1	6	Joel	#14		28122	" {6} A nation has invaded my land, powerful and without number; it has the teeth of a lion, the fangs of a lioness."
JOEL	1	7	Joel	#14		28123	" {7} It has laid waste my vines and ruined my fig trees. It has stripped off their bark and thrown it away, leaving their branches white."
JOEL	1	8	Joel	#14		28124	 {8} Mourn like a virgin in sackcloth grieving for the husband of her youth.
JOEL	1	9	Joel	#14		28125	" {9} Grain offerings and drink offerings are cut off from the house of the Lord. The priests are in mourning, those who minister before the Lord."
JOEL	1	10	Joel	#14		28126	" {10} The fields are ruined, the ground is dried up; the grain is destroyed, the new wine is dried up, the oil fails."
JOEL	1	11	Joel	#14		28127	" {11} Despair, you farmers, wail, you vine growers; grieve for the wheat and the barley, because the harvest of the field is destroyed."
JOEL	1	12	Joel	#14		28128	" {12} The vine is dried up and the fig tree is withered; the pomegranate, the palm and the apple tree-- all the trees of the field--are dried up. Surely the joy of mankind is withered away."
JOEL	1	13	Joel	#14		28129	" {13} Put on sackcloth, O priests, and mourn; wail, you who minister before the altar. "
JOEL	1	13	Joel	#14		28130	" Come, spend the night in sackcloth, you who minister before my God; for the grain offerings and drink offerings are withheld from the house of your God."
JOEL	1	14	Joel	#14		28131	" {14} Declare a holy fast; call a sacred assembly. Summon the elders and all who live in the land to the house of the Lord your God, and cry out to the Lord."
JOEL	1	15	Joel	#14		28132	 {15} Alas for that day! For the day of the Lord is near; it will come like destruction from the Almighty.
JOEL	1	16	Joel	#14		28133	 {16} Has not the food been cut off before our very eyes-- joy and gladness from the house of our God?
JOEL	1	17	Joel	#14		28134	" {17} The seeds are shriveled beneath the clods. The storehouses are in ruins, the granaries have been broken down, for the grain has dried up."
JOEL	1	18	Joel	#14		28135	 {18} How the cattle moan! The herds mill about because they have no pasture; even the flocks of sheep are suffering.
JOEL	1	19	Joel	#14		28136	" {19} To you, O Lord, I call, for fire has devoured the open pastures and flames have burned up all the trees of the field."
JOEL	1	20	Joel	#14		28137	 {20} Even the wild animals pant for you; the streams of water have dried up and fire has devoured the open pastures.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
JOEL	2	<<	Narr_29: Joel	#13		28138	JOEL 2
JOEL	2	1	Joel	#14		28139	" {1} Blow the trumpet in Zion; sound the alarm on my holy hill. Let all who live in the land tremble, for the day of the Lord is coming. "
JOEL	2	1	Joel	#14		28140	" It is close at hand-- {2} a day of darkness and gloom, a day of clouds and blackness. "
JOEL	2	2	Joel	#14		28141	" Like dawn spreading across the mountains a large and mighty army comes, such as never was of old nor ever will be in ages to come."
JOEL	2	3	Joel	#14		28142	" {3} Before them fire devours, behind them a flame blazes. Before them the land is like the garden of Eden, behind them, a desert waste-- nothing escapes them."
JOEL	2	4	Joel	#14		28143	 {4} They have the appearance of horses; they gallop along like cavalry.
JOEL	2	5	Joel	#14		28144	" {5} With a noise like that of chariots they leap over the mountaintops, like a crackling fire consuming stubble, like a mighty army drawn up for battle."
JOEL	2	6	Joel	#14		28145	" {6} At the sight of them, nations are in anguish; every face turns pale."
JOEL	2	7	Joel	#14		28146	" {7} They charge like warriors; they scale walls like soldiers. They all march in line, not swerving from their course."
JOEL	2	8	Joel	#14		28147	 {8} They do not jostle each other; each marches straight ahead. They plunge through defenses without breaking ranks.
JOEL	2	9	Joel	#14		28148	 {9} They rush upon the city; they run along the wall. They climb into the houses; like thieves they enter through the windows.
JOEL	2	10	Joel	#14		28149	" {10} Before them the earth shakes, the sky trembles, the sun and moon are darkened, and the stars no longer shine."
JOEL	2	11	Joel	#14		28150	" {11} The Lord thunders at the head of his army; his forces are beyond number, and mighty are those who obey his command. "
JOEL	2	11	Joel	#14		28151	" The day of the Lord is great; it is dreadful. Who can endure it? {12} The Lord declares,"
JOEL	2	12	God-FX1	#20		28152	" << Even now, return to me with all your heart, with fasting and weeping and mourning.>> {13} Rend your heart and not your garments."
JOEL	2	13	Joel	#14		28153	" Return to the Lord your God, for he is gracious and compassionate, slow to anger and abounding in love, and he relents from sending calamity."
JOEL	2	14	Joel	#14		28154	 {14} Who knows? He may turn and have pity and leave behind a blessing-- grain offerings and drink offerings for the Lord your God.
JOEL	2	15	Joel	#14		28155	" {15} Blow the trumpet in Zion, declare a holy fast, call a sacred assembly."
JOEL	2	16	Joel	#14		28156	" {16} Gather the people, consecrate the assembly; bring together the elders, gather the children, those nursing at the breast."
JOEL	2	16	Joel	#14		28157	 Let the bridegroom leave his room and the bride her chamber.
JOEL	2	17	Joel	#14		28158	" {17} Let the priests, who minister before the Lord, weep between the temple porch and the altar. Let them say,"
JOEL	2	17	Priest	#02		28159	" << Spare your people, O Lord. Do not make your inheritance an object of scorn, a byword among the nations. "
JOEL	2	17	Priest	#02		28160	" Why should they say among the peoples, 'Where is their God?'>>"
JOEL	2	18	Joel	#14		28161	 {18} Then the Lord will be jealous for his land and take pity on his people.
JOEL	2	19	Joel	#14		28162	 {19} The Lord will reply to them:
JOEL	2	19	God-FX1	#20		28163	" << I am sending you grain, new wine and oil, enough to satisfy you fully; never again will I make you an object of scorn to the nations."
JOEL	2	20	God-FX1	#20		28164	" {20} << I will drive the northern army far from you, pushing it into a parched and barren land, with its front columns going into the eastern sea and those in the rear into the western sea. "
JOEL	2	20	God-FX1	#20		28165	 And its stench will go up; its smell will rise.>>
JOEL	2	21	Joel	#14		28166	" Surely he has done great things. {21} Be not afraid, O land; be glad and rejoice. Surely the Lord has done great things."
JOEL	2	22	Joel	#14		28167	" {22} Be not afraid, O wild animals, for the open pastures are becoming green. The trees are bearing their fruit; the fig tree and the vine yield their riches."
JOEL	2	23	Joel	#14		28168	" {23} Be glad, O people of Zion, rejoice in the Lord your God, for he has given you the autumn rains in righteousness. "
JOEL	2	23	Joel	#14		28169	" He sends you abundant showers, both autumn and spring rains, as before."
JOEL	2	24	Joel	#14		28170	 {24} The threshing floors will be filled with grain; the vats will overflow with new wine and oil.
JOEL	2	25	God-FX1	#20		28171	" {25} << I will repay you for the years the locusts have eaten-- the great locust and the young locust, the other locusts and the locust swarm-- my great army that I sent among you."
JOEL	2	26	God-FX1	#20		28172	" {26} You will have plenty to eat, until you are full, and you will praise the name of the Lord your God, who has worked wonders for you; never again will my people be shamed."
JOEL	2	27	God-FX1	#20		28173	" {27} Then you will know that I am in Israel, that I am the Lord your God, and that there is no other; never again will my people be shamed."
JOEL	2	28	God-FX1	#20		28174	" {28} << And afterward, I will pour out my Spirit on all people. Your sons and daughters will prophesy, your old men will dream dreams, your young men will see visions."
JOEL	2	29	God-FX1	#20		28175	" {29} Even on my servants, both men and women, I will pour out my Spirit in those days. {30} I will show wonders in the heavens and on the earth, blood and fire and billows of smoke."
JOEL	2	31	Joel	#14		28176	 {31} The sun will be turned to darkness and the moon to blood before the coming of the great and dreadful day of the Lord.
JOEL	2	32	Joel	#14		28177	 {32} And everyone who calls on the name of the Lord will be saved. 
JOEL	2	32	Joel	#14		28178	" For on Mount Zion and in Jerusalem there will be deliverance, as the Lord has said, among the survivors whom the Lord calls.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
JOEL	3	<<	Narr_29: Joel	#13		28179	JOEL 3
JOEL	3	1	Joel	#14		28180	" {1} << In those days and at that time, when I restore the fortunes of Judah and Jerusalem,"
JOEL	3	2	Joel	#14		28181	 {2} I will gather all nations and bring them down to the Valley of Jehoshaphat. 
JOEL	3	2	Joel	#14		28182	" There I will enter into judgment against them concerning my inheritance, my people Israel, for they scattered my people among the nations and divided up my land."
JOEL	3	3	Joel	#14		28183	 {3} They cast lots for my people and traded boys for prostitutes; they sold girls for wine that they might drink.
JOEL	3	4	Joel	#14		28184	" {4} << Now what have you against me, O Tyre and Sidon and all you regions of Philistia? Are you repaying me for something I have done? "
JOEL	3	4	Joel	#14		28185	" If you are paying me back, I will swiftly and speedily return on your own heads what you have done."
JOEL	3	5	Joel	#14		28186	 {5} For you took my silver and my gold and carried off my finest treasures to your temples.
JOEL	3	6	Joel	#14		28187	" {6} You sold the people of Judah and Jerusalem to the Greeks, that you might send them far from their homeland."
JOEL	3	7	Joel	#14		28188	" {7} << See, I am going to rouse them out of the places to which you sold them, and I will return on your own heads what you have done."
JOEL	3	8	Joel	#14		28189	" {8} I will sell your sons and daughters to the people of Judah, and they will sell them to the Sabeans, a nation far away.>>The Lord has spoken."
JOEL	3	9	Joel	#14		28190	 {9} Proclaim this among the nations: Prepare for war! Rouse the warriors! Let all the fighting men draw near and attack.
JOEL	3	10	Joel	#14		28191	" {10} Beat your plowshares into swords and your pruning hooks into spears. Let the weakling say,"
JOEL	3	10	Man	#12		28192	 << I am strong!>>
JOEL	3	11	Joel	#14		28193	" {11} Come quickly, all you nations from every side, and assemble there. Bring down your warriors, O Lord!"
JOEL	3	12	God-FX1	#20		28194	" {12} << Let the nations be roused; let them advance into the Valley of Jehoshaphat, for there I will sit to judge all the nations on every side."
JOEL	3	13	God-FX1	#20		28195	" {13} Swing the sickle, for the harvest is ripe. Come, trample the grapes, for the winepress is full and the vats overflow-- so great is their wickedness!>>"
JOEL	3	14	Joel	#14		28196	" {14} Multitudes, multitudes in the valley of decision! For the day of the Lord is near in the valley of decision."
JOEL	3	15	Joel	#14		28197	" {15} The sun and moon will be darkened, and the stars no longer shine."
JOEL	3	16	Joel	#14		28198	 {16} The Lord will roar from Zion and thunder from Jerusalem; the earth and the sky will tremble. 
JOEL	3	16	Joel	#14		28199	" But the Lord will be a refuge for his people, a stronghold for the people of Israel."
JOEL	3	17	God-FX1	#20		28200	" {17} << Then you will know that I, the Lord your God, dwell in Zion, my holy hill. Jerusalem will be holy; never again will foreigners invade her."
JOEL	3	18	Joel	#14		28201	" {18} << In that day the mountains will drip new wine, and the hills will flow with milk; all the ravines of Judah will run with water. "
JOEL	3	18	Joel	#14		28202	 A fountain will flow out of the Lord's house and will water the valley of acacias.
JOEL	3	19	Joel	#14		28203	" {19} But Egypt will be desolate, Edom a desert waste, because of violence done to the people of Judah, in whose land they shed innocent blood."
JOEL	3	20	Joel	#14		28204	 {20} Judah will be inhabited forever and Jerusalem through all generations. 
JOEL	3	21	Joel	#14		28205	" {21} Their bloodguilt, which I have not pardoned, I will pardon.>> The Lord dwells in Zion!*~**~*||||| + 5 SECs |||||*~*"

AMO	3	3	Amos	#08		28252	 {3} Do two walk together unless they have agreed to do so? 
AMO	3	4	Amos	#08		28253	 {4} Does a lion roar in the thicket when he has no prey? Does he growl in his den when he has caught nothing?
AMO	3	5	Amos	#08		28254	 {5} Does a bird fall into a trap on the ground where no snare has been set? Does a trap spring up from the earth when there is nothing to catch?
AMO	3	6	Amos	#08		28255	" {6} When a trumpet sounds in a city, do not the people tremble? When disaster comes to a city, has not the Lord caused it?"

AMO	5	3	Amos	#08		28294	 {3} This is what the Sovereign Lord says: 
AMO	5	3	Amos	#08		28295	 The city that marches out a thousand strong for Israel will have only a hundred left; the town that marches out a hundred strong will have only ten left.
AMO	5	4	Amos	#08		28296	 {4} This is what the Lord says to the house of Israel.
AMO	5	4	God-FX1	#20		28297	" << Seek me and live; {5} do not seek Bethel, do not go to Gilgal, do not journey to Beersheba. For Gilgal will surely go into exile, and Bethel will be reduced to nothing.>>"
AMO	5	6	Amos	#08		28298	" {6} Seek the Lord and live, or he will sweep through the house of Joseph like a fire; it will devour, and Bethel will have no one to quench it."
AMO	5	7	Amos	#08		28299	 {7} You who turn justice into bitterness and cast righteousness to the ground
AMO	5	8	Amos	#08		28300	" {8} (he who made the Pleiades and Orion, who turns blackness into dawn and darkens day into night, "
AMO	5	8	Amos	#08		28301	 who calls for the waters of the sea and pours them out over the face of the land-- the Lord is his name--
AMO	5	9	Amos	#08		28302	" {9} he flashes destruction on the stronghold and brings the fortified city to ruin),"
AMO	5	10	Amos	#08		28303	 {10} you hate the one who reproves in court and despise him who tells the truth.
AMO	5	11	Amos	#08		28304	 {11} You trample on the poor and force him to give you grain. 
AMO	5	11	Amos	#08		28305	" Therefore, though you have built stone mansions, you will not live in them; though you have planted lush vineyards, you will not drink their wine."
AMO	5	12	Amos	#08		28306	 {12} For I know how many are your offenses and how great your sins. 
AMO	5	12	Amos	#08		28307	 You oppress the righteous and take bribes and you deprive the poor of justice in the courts.
AMO	5	13	Amos	#08		28308	" {13} Therefore the prudent man keeps quiet in such times, for the times are evil."
AMO	5	14	Amos	#08		28309	" {14} Seek good, not evil, that you may live. Then the Lord God Almighty will be with you, just as you say he is."
AMO	5	15	Amos	#08		28310	" {15} Hate evil, love good; maintain justice in the courts. Perhaps the Lord God Almighty will have mercy on the remnant of Joseph."
AMO	5	16	Amos	#08		28311	" {16} Therefore this is what the Lord, the Lord God Almighty, says:"
AMO	5	16	God-FX1	#20		28312	 << There will be wailing in all the streets and cries of anguish in every public square. The farmers will be summoned to weep and the mourners to wail.
AMO	5	17	God-FX1	#20		28313	" {17} There will be wailing in all the vineyards, for I will pass through your midst,>>"
AMO	5	17	Amos	#08		28314	" says the Lord. {18} Woe to you who long for the day of the Lord! Why do you long for the day of the Lord? That day will be darkness, not light."
AMO	5	19	Amos	#08		28315	" {19} It will be as though a man fled from a lion only to meet a bear, as though he entered his house and rested his hand on the wall only to have a snake bite him."
AMO	5	20	Amos	#08		28316	" {20} Will not the day of the Lord be darkness, not light-- pitch-dark, without a ray of brightness?"
AMO	5	21	God-FX1	#20		28317	" {21} I hate, I despise your religious feasts; I cannot stand your assemblies."
AMO	5	22	God-FX1	#20		28318	" {22} Even though you bring me burnt offerings and grain offerings, I will not accept them. Though you bring choice fellowship offerings, I will have no regard for them."
AMO	5	23	God-FX1	#20		28319	" {23} Away with the noise of your songs! I will not listen to the music of your harps. {24} But let justice roll on like a river, righteousness like a never-failing stream!"
AMO	5	25	God-FX1	#20		28320	" {25} << Did you bring me sacrifices and offerings forty years in the desert, O house of Israel?"
AMO	5	26	God-FX1	#20		28321	" {26} You have lifted up the shrine of your king, the pedestal of your idols, the star of your god-- which you made for yourselves. {27} Therefore I will send you into exile beyond Damascus,>>"
AMO	5	27	Amos	#08		28322	" says the Lord, whose name is God Almighty.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
AMO	6	<<	Narr_30: Amos	#13		28323	AMOS 6
AMO	6	1	Amos	#08		28324	" {1} Woe to you who are complacent in Zion, and to you who feel secure on Mount Samaria, you notable men of the foremost nation, to whom the people of Israel come!"
AMO	6	2	Amos	#08		28325	" {2} Go to Calneh and look at it; go from there to great Hamath, and then go down to Gath in Philistia. "
AMO	6	2	Amos	#08		28326	 Are they better off than your two kingdoms? Is their land larger than yours?
AMO	6	3	Amos	#08		28327	 {3} You put off the evil day and bring near a reign of terror.
AMO	6	4	Amos	#08		28328	 {4} You lie on beds inlaid with ivory and lounge on your couches. You dine on choice lambs and fattened calves.
AMO	6	5	Amos	#08		28329	 {5} You strum away on your harps like David and improvise on musical instruments.
AMO	6	6	Amos	#08		28330	" {6} You drink wine by the bowlful and use the finest lotions, but you do not grieve over the ruin of Joseph."
AMO	6	7	Amos	#08		28331	 {7} Therefore you will be among the first to go into exile; your feasting and lounging will end.
AMO	6	8	Amos	#08		28332	 {8} The Sovereign Lord has sworn by himself--the Lord God Almighty declares:
AMO	6	8	God-FX1	#20		28333	 << I abhor the pride of Jacob and detest his fortresses; I will deliver up the city and everything in it.>>
AMO	6	9	Amos	#08		28334	" {9} If ten men are left in one house, they too will die."
AMO	6	10	Amos	#08		28335	" {10} And if a relative who is to burn the bodies comes to carry them out of the house and asks anyone still hiding there,"
AMO	6	10	Man #1	#03		28336	 << Is anyone with you?>>
AMO	6	10	Amos	#08		28337	" and he says, << No,>> Then he will say,"
AMO	6	10	Man #2	#04		28338	 << Hush! We must not mention the name of the Lord.>>
AMO	6	11	Amos	#08		28339	" {11} For the Lord has given the command, and he will smash the great house into pieces and the small house into bits."
AMO	6	12	Amos	#08		28340	 {12} Do horses run on the rocky crags? Does one plow there with oxen? 
AMO	6	12	Amos	#08		28341	" But you have turned justice into poison and the fruit of righteousness into bitternessù {13} you who rejoice in the conquest of Lo Debar and say,"
AMO	6	13	Man #3	#17		28342	 << Did we not take Karnaim by our own strength?>>
AMO	6	14	Amos	#08		28343	" {14} For the Lord God Almighty declares,"
AMO	6	14	God-FX1	#20		28344	" << I will stir up a nation against you, O house of Israel, that will oppress you all the way from Lebo Hamath to the valley of the Arabah*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
AMO	7	<<	Narr_30: Amos	#13		28345	AMOS 7
AMO	7	1	Amos	#08		28346	 {1} This is what the Sovereign Lord showed me: 
AMO	7	1	Amos	#08		28347	 He was preparing swarms of locusts after the king's share had been harvested and just as the second crop was coming up.
AMO	7	2	Amos	#08		28348	" {2} When they had stripped the land clean, I cried out, << Sovereign Lord, forgive! How can Jacob survive? He is so small!>>"
AMO	7	3	Amos	#08		28349	" {3} So the Lord relented. The Lord said,"
AMO	7	3	God-FX1	#20		28350	" << This will not happen,>>"
AMO	7	4	Amos	#08		28351	 {4} This is what the Sovereign Lord showed me: The Sovereign Lord was calling for judgment by fire; it dried up the great deep and devoured the land.
AMO	7	5	Amos	#08		28352	" {5} Then I cried out, << Sovereign Lord, I beg you, stop! How can Jacob survive? He is so small!>>"
AMO	7	6	Amos	#08		28353	" {6} So the Lord relented. The Sovereign Lord said,"
AMO	7	6	God-FX1	#20		28354	" << This will not happen either,>>"
AMO	7	7	Amos	#08		28355	" {7} This is what he showed me: The Lord was standing by a wall that had been built true to plumb, with a plumb line in his hand. {8} And the Lord asked me,"
AMO	7	8	God-FX1	#20		28356	" << What do you see, Amos?>>"
AMO	7	8	Amos	#08		28357	" << A plumb line,>> I replied. Then the Lord said,"
AMO	7	8	God-FX1	#20		28358	" << Look, I am setting a plumb line among my people Israel; I will spare them no longer."
AMO	7	9	God-FX1	#20		28359	 {9} << The high places of Isaac will be destroyed and the sanctuaries of Israel will be ruined; with my sword I will rise against the house of Jeroboam.>>
AMO	7	10	Narr_30: Amos	#13		28360	 {10} Then Amaziah the priest of Bethel sent a message to Jeroboam king of Israel:
AMO	7	10	Priest of Bethel: Amaziah	#06		28361	 << Amos is raising a conspiracy against you in the very heart of Israel. The land cannot bear all his words.
AMO	7	11	Priest of Bethel: Amaziah	#06		28362	" {11} For this is what Amos is saying: << 'Jeroboam will die by the sword, and Israel will surely go into exile, away from their native land.'<<"
AMO	7	12	Narr_30: Amos	#13		28363	" {12} Then Amaziah said to Amos,"
AMO	7	12	Priest of Bethel: Amaziah	#06		28364	" << Get out, you seer! Go back to the land of Judah. Earn your bread there and do your prophesying there."
AMO	7	13	Priest of Bethel: Amaziah	#06		28365	" {13} Don't prophesy anymore at Bethel, because this is the king's sanctuary and the temple of the kingdom.>>"
AMO	7	14	Narr_30: Amos	#13		28366	" {14} Amos answered Amaziah,"
AMO	7	14	Amos	#08		28367	" << I was neither a prophet nor a prophet's son, but I was a shepherd, and I also took care of sycamore-fig trees."
AMO	7	15	Amos	#08		28368	" {15} But the Lord took me from tending the flock and said to me, 'Go, prophesy to my people Israel.'"
AMO	7	16	Amos	#08		28369	" {16} Now then, hear the word of the Lord. You say, << 'Do not prophesy against Israel, and stop preaching against the house of Isaac.'"
AMO	7	17	Amos	#08		28370	" {17} << Therefore this is what the Lord says: << 'Your wife will become a prostitute in the city, and your sons and daughters will fall by the sword. "
AMO	7	17	Amos	#08		28371	" Your land will be measured and divided up, and you yourself will die in a pagan country.  "
AMO	7	17	Amos	#08		28372	" And Israel will certainly go into exile, away from their native land.'>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
AMO	8	<<	Narr_30: Amos	#13		28373	AMOS 8
AMO	8	1	Amos	#08		28374	" {1} This is what the Sovereign Lord showed me: a basket of ripe fruit. {2} He said,"
AMO	8	2	God-FX1	#20		28375	" << What do you see, Amos?>>"
AMO	8	2	Amos	#08		28376	" << A basket of ripe fruit,>> I answered. Then the Lord said to me,"
AMO	8	2	God-FX1	#20		28377	 <<The time is ripe for my people Israel; I will spare them no longer.
AMO	8	3	Amos	#08		28378	" {3} << In that day, declares the Sovereign Lord, the songs in the temple will turn to wailing. Many, many bodies--flung everywhere! Silence!>>"
AMO	8	4	Amos	#08		28379	" {4} Hear this, you who trample the needy and do away with the poor of the land, {5} saying,"

AMO	8	5	Amos	#08		28381	" skimping the measure, boosting the price and cheating with dishonest scales,"
AMO	8	6	Amos	#08		28382	" {6} buying the poor with silver and the needy for a pair of sandals, selling even the sweepings with the wheat."
AMO	8	7	Amos	#08		28383	 {7} The Lord has sworn by the Pride of Jacob:
AMO	8	7	God-FX1	#20		28384	 << I will never forget anything they have done.

AMO	8	8	Amos	#08		28386	" The whole land will rise like the Nile; it will be stirred up and then sink like the river of Egypt. {9} The Sovereign Lord declares,"
AMO	8	9	God-FX1	#20		28387	" << In that day, I will make the sun go down at noon and darken the earth in broad daylight."
AMO	8	10	God-FX1	#20		28388	 {10} I will turn your religious feasts into mourning and all your singing into weeping. 
AMO	8	10	God-FX1	#20		28389	 I will make all of you wear sackcloth and shave your heads. I will make that time like mourning for an only only son and the end of it like a bitter day.
AMO	8	11	Amos	#08		28390	" {11} << The days are coming, declares the Sovereign Lord, when I will send a famine through the land-- "

AMO	8	12	Amos	#08		28392	" {12} Men will stagger from sea to sea and wander from north to east, searching for the word of the Lord, but they will not find it."
AMO	8	13	Amos	#08		28393	 {13} In that day << the lovely young women and strong young men will faint because of thirst.
AMO	8	14	Amos	#08		28394	" {14} They who swear by the shame of Samaria, or say, 'As surely as your god lives, O Dan,' or, 'As surely as the god of Beersheba lives'-- they will fall, never to rise again.>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
AMO	9	<<	Narr_30: Amos	#13		28395	AMOS 9

OBA	1	<<	Narr_31: Obadiah	#13		28416	OBADIAH

OBA	1	1	Obadiah	#17		28418	" This is what the Sovereign Lord says about Edom -- We have heard a message from the Lord: An envoy was sent to the nations to say,"
OBA	1	1	Envoy	#11		28419	" << Rise, and let us go against her for battle<< --"
OBA	1	2	God-FX1	#20		28420	" {2} << See, I will make you small among the nations; you will be utterly despised."
OBA	1	3	God-FX1	#20		28421	" {3} The pride of your heart has deceived you, you who live in the clefts of the rocks and make your home on the heights, you who say to yourself, 'Who can bring me down to the ground?'"
OBA	1	4	God-FX1	#20		28422	" {4} Though you soar like the eagle and make your nest among the stars, from there I will bring you down,>>"
OBA	1	4	Obadiah	#17		28423	 declares the Lord.
OBA	1	5	Obadiah	#17		28424	" {5} << If thieves came to you, if robbers in the night-- Oh, what a disaster awaits you-- would they not steal only as much as they wanted?"
OBA	1	5	Obadiah	#17		28425	" If grape pickers came to you, would they not leave a few grapes?"
OBA	1	6	Obadiah	#17		28426	" {6} But how Esau will be ransacked, his hidden treasures pillaged!"
OBA	1	7	Obadiah	#17		28427	 {7} All your allies will force you to the border; your friends will deceive and overpower you; 
OBA	1	7	Obadiah	#17		28428	" those who eat your bread will set a trap for you, but you will not detect it."
OBA	1	8	God-FX1	#20		28429	" {8} << In that day, will I not destroy the wise men of Edom, men of understanding in the mountains of Esau?"
OBA	1	9	Obadiah	#17		28430	" declares the Lord. {9} Your warriors, O Teman, will be terrified, and everyone in Esau's mountains will be cut down in the slaughter."
OBA	1	10	Obadiah	#17		28431	" {10} Because of the violence against your brother Jacob, you will be covered with shame; you will be destroyed forever."
OBA	1	11	Obadiah	#17		28432	" {11} On the day you stood aloof while strangers carried off his wealth and foreigners entered his gates and cast lots for Jerusalem, you were like one of them."
OBA	1	12	Obadiah	#17		28433	" {12} You should not look down on your brother in the day of his misfortune, nor rejoice over the people of Judah in the day of their destruction, nor boast so much in the day of their trouble."
OBA	1	13	Obadiah	#17		28434	 {13} You should not march through the gates of my people in the day of their disaster; 
OBA	1	13	Obadiah	#17		28435	 nor look down on them in their calamity in the day of their disaster; nor seize their wealth in the day of their disaster.
OBA	1	14	Obadiah	#17		28436	" {14} You should not wait at the crossroads to cut down their fugitives, nor hand over their survivors in the day of their trouble."
OBA	1	15	God-FX1	#20		28437	" {15} << The day of the Lord is near for all nations. As you have done, it will be done to you; your deeds will return upon your own head."
OBA	1	16	God-FX1	#20		28438	" {16} Just as you drank on my holy hill, so all the nations will drink continually; they will drink and drink and be as if they had never been."
OBA	1	17	Obadiah	#17		28439	" {17} But on Mount Zion will be deliverance; it will be holy, and the house of Jacob will possess its inheritance."
OBA	1	18	Obadiah	#17		28440	" {18} The house of Jacob will be a fire and the house of Joseph a flame; the house of Esau will be stubble, and they will set it on fire and consume it. "
OBA	1	18	Obadiah	#17		28441	 There will be no survivors from the house of Esau.>> The Lord has spoken.
OBA	1	19	Obadiah	#17		28442	" {19} People from the Negev will occupy the mountains of Esau, and people from the foothills will possess the land of the Philistines. "
OBA	1	19	Obadiah	#17		28443	" They will occupy the fields of Ephraim and Samaria, and Benjamin will possess Gilead."
OBA	1	20	Obadiah	#17		28444	 {20} This company of Israelite exiles who are in Canaan will possess the land as far as Zarephath; 
OBA	1	20	Obadiah	#17		28445	 the exiles from Jerusalem who are in Sepharad will possess the towns of the Negev.
OBA	1	21	Obadiah	#17		28446	 {21} Deliverers will go up on Mount Zion to govern the mountains of Esau. And the kingdom will be the Lord's.*~**~*||||| + 5 SECs |||||*~*
JON	1	<<	Narr_32: Jonah	#13		28447	JONAH*~*JONAH 1
JON	1	1	Narr_32: Jonah	#13		28448	 {1} The word of the Lord came to Jonah son of Amittai:
JON	1	2	God-FX1	#20		28449	" {2} << Go to the great city of Nineveh and preach against it, because its wickedness has come up before me.>>"
JON	1	3	Narr_32: Jonah	#13		28450	" {3} But Jonah ran away from the Lord and headed for Tarshish. He went down to Joppa, where he found a ship bound for that port. "
JON	1	3	Narr_32: Jonah	#13		28451	" After paying the fare, he went aboard and sailed for Tarshish to flee from the Lord."
JON	1	4	Narr_32: Jonah	#13		28452	" {4} Then the Lord sent a great wind on the sea, and such a violent storm arose that the ship threatened to break up."
JON	1	5	Narr_32: Jonah	#13		28453	 {5} All the sailors were afraid and each cried out to his own god. And they threw the cargo into the sea to lighten the ship. 
JON	1	5	Narr_32: Jonah	#13		28454	" But Jonah had gone below deck, where he lay down and fell into a deep sleep. {6} The captain went to him and said,"
JON	1	6	Captain	#05		28455	" << How can you sleep? Get up and call on your god! Maybe he will take notice of us, and we will not perish.>>"
JON	1	7	Narr_32: Jonah	#13		28456	" {7} Then the sailors said to each other,"
JON	1	7	Sailor #1	#04		28457	" << Come, let us cast lots to find out who is responsible for this calamity.>>"
JON	1	7	Narr_32: Jonah	#13		28458	" They cast lots and the lot fell on Jonah. {8} So they asked him,"
JON	1	8	Sailor #2	#14		28459	" << Tell us, who is responsible for making all this trouble for us?"
JON	1	8	Sailor #2	#14		28460	 What do you do? Where do you come from? What is your country? From what people are you?>>
JON	1	9	Narr_32: Jonah	#13		28461	" {9} He answered,"

JON	1	10	Narr_32: Jonah	#13		28463	" {10} This terrified them and they asked,"
JON	1	10	Sailor #1	#04		28464	 << What have you done?>>
JON	1	10	Narr_32: Jonah	#13		28465	" (They knew he was running away from the Lord, because he had already told them so.) {11} The sea was getting rougher and rougher."
JON	1	11	Sailor #2	#14		28466	 << What should we do to you to make the sea calm down for us?>>
JON	1	11	Narr_32: Jonah	#13		28467	" they asked him. {12} He said to them,"
JON	1	12	Jonah	#12		28468	" << Pick me up and throw me into the sea, and it will become calm."
JON	1	12	Jonah	#12		28469	 I know that it is my fault that this great storm has come upon you.>>
JON	1	13	Narr_32: Jonah	#13		28470	" {13} Instead, the men did their best to row back to land. But they could not, for the sea grew even wilder than before. {14} Then they cried to the Lord,"
JON	1	14	Sailor #1	#04		28471	" << O Lord, please do not let us die for taking this man's life. "
JON	1	14	Sailor #1	#04		28472	" Do not hold us accountable for killing an innocent man, for you, O Lord, have done as you pleased.>>"
JON	1	15	Narr_32: Jonah	#13		28473	" {15} Then they took Jonah and threw him overboard, and the raging sea grew calm."
JON	1	16	Narr_32: Jonah	#13		28474	" {16} At this the men greatly feared the Lord, and they offered a sacrifice to the Lord and made vows to him."
JON	1	17	Narr_32: Jonah	#13		28475	" {17} But the Lord provided a great fish to swallow Jonah, and Jonah was inside the fish three days and three nights.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
JON	2	<<	Narr_32: Jonah	#13		28476	JONAH 2
JON	2	1	Narr_32: Jonah	#13		28477	" {1} From inside the fish Jonah prayed to the Lord his God. He said,"
JON	2	2	Jonah	#12		28478	" {2} << In my distress I called to the Lord, and he answered me. From the depths of the grave I called for help, and you listened to my cry."
JON	2	3	Jonah	#12		28479	" {3} You hurled me into the deep, into the very heart of the seas, and the currents swirled about me; all your waves and breakers swept over me."
JON	2	4	Jonah	#12		28480	" {4} I said, 'I have been banished from your sight; yet I will look again toward your holy temple.'"
JON	2	5	Jonah	#12		28481	" {5} The engulfing waters threatened me, the deep surrounded me; seaweed was wrapped around my head."
JON	2	6	Jonah	#12		28482	" {6} To the roots of the mountains I sank down; the earth beneath barred me in forever. But you brought my life up from the pit, O Lord my God."
JON	2	7	Jonah	#12		28483	" {7} << When my life was ebbing away, I remembered you, Lord, and my prayer rose to you, to your holy temple."
JON	2	8	Jonah	#12		28484	 {8} << Those who cling to worthless idols forfeit the grace that could be theirs.
JON	2	9	Jonah	#12		28485	" {9} But I, with a song of thanksgiving, will sacrifice to you. What I have vowed I will make good. Salvation comes from the Lord.>>"

JON	3	<<	Narr_32: Jonah	#13		28487	JONAH 3
JON	3	1	Narr_32: Jonah	#13		28488	 {1} Then the word of the Lord came to Jonah a second time:

JON	3	3	Narr_32: Jonah	#13		28490	 {3} Jonah obeyed the word of the Lord and went to Nineveh. Now Nineveh was a very important city--a visit required three days.
JON	3	4	Narr_32: Jonah	#13		28491	" {4} On the first day, Jonah started into the city. He proclaimed:"
JON	3	4	Jonah	#12		28492	 << Forty more days and Nineveh will be overturned.>>
JON	3	5	Narr_32: Jonah	#13		28493	" {5} The Ninevites believed God. They declared a fast, and all of them, from the greatest to the least, put on sackcloth."
JON	3	6	Narr_32: Jonah	#13		28494	" {6} When the news reached the king of Nineveh, he rose from his throne, took off his royal robes, covered himself with sackcloth and sat down in the dust."
JON	3	7	Narr_32: Jonah	#13		28495	 {7} Then he issued a proclamation in Nineveh:
JON	3	7	King of Nineveh	#17		28496	" << By the decree of the king and his nobles: Do not let any man or beast, herd or flock, taste anything; do not let them eat or drink."
JON	3	8	King of Nineveh	#17		28497	 {8} But let man and beast be covered with sackcloth. Let everyone call urgently on God. Let them give up their evil ways and their violence.
JON	3	9	King of Nineveh	#17		28498	 {9} Who knows? God may yet relent and with compassion turn from his fierce anger so that we will not perish.>>
JON	3	10	Narr_32: Jonah	#13		28499	" {10} When God saw what they did and how they turned from their evil ways, he had compassion and did not bring upon them the destruction he had threatened.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
JON	4	<<	Narr_32: Jonah	#13		28500	JONAH 4
JON	4	1	Narr_32: Jonah	#13		28501	" {1} But Jonah was greatly displeased and became angry. {2} He prayed to the Lord,"
JON	4	2	Jonah	#12		28502	" << O Lord, is this not what I said when I was still at home? That is why I was so quick to flee to Tarshish."
JON	4	2	Jonah	#12		28503	" I knew that you are a gracious and compassionate God, slow to anger and abounding in love, a God who relents from sending calamity."
JON	4	3	Jonah	#12		28504	" {3} Now, O Lord, take away my life, for it is better for me to die than to live.>>"
JON	4	4	Narr_32: Jonah	#13		28505	" {4} But the Lord replied,"
JON	4	4	God-FX1	#20		28506	 << Have you any right to be angry?>>
JON	4	5	Narr_32: Jonah	#13		28507	" {5} Jonah went out and sat down at a place east of the city. There he made himself a shelter, sat in its shade and waited to see what would happen to the city."
JON	4	6	Narr_32: Jonah	#13		28508	" {6} Then the Lord God provided a vine and made it grow up over Jonah to give shade for his head to ease his discomfort, and Jonah was very happy about the vine."
JON	4	7	Narr_32: Jonah	#13		28509	" {7} But at dawn the next day God provided a worm, which chewed the vine so that it withered."
JON	4	8	Narr_32: Jonah	#13		28510	" {8} When the sun rose, God provided a scorching east wind, and the sun blazed on Jonah's head so that he grew faint. He wanted to die, and said,"
JON	4	8	Jonah	#12		28511	 << It would be better for me to die than to live.>>
JON	4	9	Narr_32: Jonah	#13		28512	" {9} But God said to Jonah,"
JON	4	9	God-FX1	#20		28513	 << Do you have a right to be angry about the vine?>>
JON	4	9	Narr_32: Jonah	#13		28514	" He said,"
JON	4	9	Jonah	#12		28515	 << I do. I am angry enough to die.>>
JON	4	10	Narr_32: Jonah	#13		28516	" {10} But the Lord said,"
JON	4	10	God-FX1	#20		28517	" << You have been concerned about this vine, though you did not tend it or make it grow. It sprang up overnight and died overnight."
JON	4	11	God-FX1	#20		28518	" {11} But Nineveh has more than a hundred and twenty thousand people who cannot tell their right hand from their left, and many cattle as well. Should I not be concerned about that great city?>>*~**~*||||| + 5 SECs |||||*~*"
MIC	1	<<	Narr_33: Micah	#13		28519	MICAH*~*MICAH 1
MIC	1	1	Narr_33: Micah	#13		28520	" {1} The word of the Lord that came to Micah of Moresheth during the reigns of Jotham, Ahaz and Hezekiah, kings of Judah--"
MIC	1	1	Narr_33: Micah	#13		28521	 the vision he saw concerning Samaria and Jerusalem.
MIC	1	2	Micah	#10		28522	" {2} Hear, O peoples, all of you, listen, O earth and all who are in it, that the Sovereign Lord may witness against you, the Lord from his holy temple."
MIC	1	3	Micah	#10		28523	 {3} Look! The Lord is coming from his dwelling place; he comes down and treads the high places of the earth.
MIC	1	4	Micah	#10		28524	" {4} The mountains melt beneath him and the valleys split apart, like wax before the fire, like water rushing down a slope."
MIC	1	5	Micah	#10		28525	" {5} All this is because of Jacob's transgression, because of the sins of the house of Israel. "
MIC	1	5	Micah	#10		28526	 What is Jacob's transgression? Is it not Samaria? What is Judah's high place? Is it not Jerusalem?
MIC	1	6	God-FX1	#20		28527	" {6} << Therefore I will make Samaria a heap of rubble, a place for planting vineyards. I will pour her stones into the valley and lay bare her foundations."
MIC	1	7	God-FX1	#20		28528	 {7} All her idols will be broken to pieces; all her temple gifts will be burned with fire; I will destroy all her images. 
MIC	1	7	God-FX1	#20		28529	" Since she gathered her gifts from the wages of prostitutes, as the wages of prostitutes they will again be used.>>"
MIC	1	8	Micah	#10		28530	 {8} Because of this I will weep and wail; I will go about barefoot and naked. I will howl like a jackal and moan like an owl.
MIC	1	9	Micah	#10		28531	" {9} For her wound is incurable; it has come to Judah. It has reached the very gate of my people, even to Jerusalem itself."
MIC	1	10	Micah	#10		28532	 {10} Tell it not in Gath; weep not at all. In Beth Ophrah roll in the dust.
MIC	1	11	Micah	#10		28533	" {11} Pass on in nakedness and shame, you who live in Shaphir. Those who live in Zaanan will not come out. "
MIC	1	11	Micah	#10		28534	 Beth Ezel is in mourning; its protection is taken from you.
MIC	1	12	Micah	#10		28535	" {12} Those who live in Maroth writhe in pain, waiting for relief, because disaster has come from the Lord, even to the gate of Jerusalem."
MIC	1	13	Micah	#10		28536	" {13} You who live in Lachish, harness the team to the chariot. "
MIC	1	13	Micah	#10		28537	" You were the beginning of sin to the Daughter of Zion, for the transgressions of Israel were found in you."
MIC	1	14	Micah	#10		28538	 {14} Therefore you will give parting gifts to Moresheth Gath. The town of Aczib will prove deceptive to the kings of Israel.
MIC	1	15	Micah	#10		28539	 {15} I will bring a conqueror against you who live in Mareshah. He who is the glory of Israel will come to Adullam.
MIC	1	16	Micah	#10		28540	 {16} Shave your heads in mourning for the children in whom you delight; 
MIC	1	16	Micah	#10		28541	" make yourselves as bald as the vulture, for they will go from you into exile.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
MIC	2	<<	Narr_33: Micah	#13		28542	MICAH 2

MIC	3	4	Micah	#10		28567	" {4} Then they will cry out to the Lord, but he will not answer them. At that time he will hide his face from them because of the evil they have done."

MIC	3	5	God-FX1	#20		28569	" << As for the prophets who lead my people astray, if one feeds them, they proclaim 'peace'; if he does not, they prepare to wage war against him."
MIC	3	6	God-FX1	#20		28570	" {6} Therefore night will come over you, without visions, and darkness, without divination. The sun will set for the prophets, and the day will go dark for them."

MIC	3	8	Micah	#10		28572	" {8} But as for me, I am filled with power, with the Spirit of the Lord, and with justice and might, to declare to Jacob his transgression, to Israel his sin."

MIC	7	<<	Narr_33: Micah	#13		28635	MICAH 7
MIC	7	1	Micah	#10		28636	 {1} What misery is mine! I am like one who gathers summer fruit at the gleaning of the vineyard;
MIC	7	1	Micah	#10		28637	" there is no cluster of grapes to eat, none of the early figs that I crave."
MIC	7	2	Micah	#10		28638	 {2} The godly have been swept from the land; not one upright man remains. All men lie in wait to shed blood; each hunts his brother with a net.
MIC	7	3	Micah	#10		28639	" {3} Both hands are skilled in doing evil; the ruler demands gifts, the judge accepts bribes, the powerful dictate what they desire-- they all conspire together."
MIC	7	4	Micah	#10		28640	" {4} The best of them is like a brier, the most upright worse than a thorn hedge. "
MIC	7	4	Micah	#10		28641	" The day of your watchmen has come, the day God visits you. Now is the time of their confusion."
MIC	7	5	Micah	#10		28642	 {5} Do not trust a neighbor; put no confidence in a friend. Even with her who lies in your embrace be careful of your words.
MIC	7	6	Micah	#10		28643	" {6} For a son dishonors his father, a daughter rises up against her mother, a daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law-- a man's enemies are the members of his own household."
MIC	7	7	Micah	#10		28644	" {7} But as for me, I watch in hope for the Lord, I wait for God my Savior; my God will hear me."
MIC	7	8	Micah	#10		28645	" {8} Do not gloat over me, my enemy! Though I have fallen, I will rise. Though I sit in darkness, the Lord will be my light."
MIC	7	9	Micah	#10		28646	" {9} Because I have sinned against him, I will bear the Lord's wrath, until he pleads my case and establishes my right."
MIC	7	9	Micah	#10		28647	 He will bring me out into the light; I will see his righteousness.

MIC	7	10	Micah	#10		28650	 My eyes will see her downfall; even now she will be trampled underfoot like mire in the streets.
MIC	7	11	Micah	#10		28651	" {11} The day for building your walls will come, the day for extending your boundaries."
MIC	7	12	Micah	#10		28652	" {12} In that day people will come to you from Assyria and the cities of Egypt, even from Egypt to the Euphrates and from sea to sea and from mountain to mountain."
MIC	7	13	Micah	#10		28653	" {13} The earth will become desolate because of its inhabitants, as the result of their deeds."

MIC	7	14	Micah	#10		28655	 Let them feed in Bashan and Gilead as in days long ago.

MIC	7	16	Micah	#10		28657	" {16} Nations will see and be ashamed, deprived of all their power. They will lay their hands on their mouths and their ears will become deaf."
MIC	7	17	Micah	#10		28658	" {17} They will lick dust like a snake, like creatures that crawl on the ground. "
MIC	7	17	Micah	#10		28659	 They will come trembling out of their dens; they will turn in fear to the Lord our God and will be afraid of you.
MIC	7	18	Micah	#10		28660	" {18} Who is a God like you, who pardons sin and forgives the transgression of the remnant of his inheritance? "
MIC	7	18	Micah	#10		28661	 You do not stay angry forever but delight to show mercy.
MIC	7	19	Micah	#10		28662	 {19} You will again have compassion on us; you will tread our sins underfoot and hurl all our iniquities into the depths of the sea.
MIC	7	20	Micah	#10		28663	" {20} You will be true to Jacob, and show mercy to Abraham, as you pledged on oath to our fathers in days long ago.*~**~*||||| + 5 SECs |||||*~*"
NAH	1	<<	Narr_34: Nahum	#13		28664	NAHUM*~*NAHUM 1
NAH	1	1	Narr_34: Nahum	#13		28665	 {1} An oracle concerning Nineveh. The book of the vision of Nahum the Elkoshite.
NAH	1	2	Nahum	#03		28666	 {2} The Lord is a jealous and avenging God; the Lord takes vengeance and is filled with wrath. 
NAH	1	2	Nahum	#03		28667	 The Lord takes vengeance on his foes and maintains his wrath against his enemies.
NAH	1	3	Nahum	#03		28668	 {3} The Lord is slow to anger and great in power; the Lord will not leave the guilty unpunished.
NAH	1	3	Nahum	#03		28669	" His way is in the whirlwind and the storm, and clouds are the dust of his feet."
NAH	1	4	Nahum	#03		28670	 {4} He rebukes the sea and dries it up; he makes all the rivers run dry. Bashan and Carmel wither and the blossoms of Lebanon fade.
NAH	1	5	Nahum	#03		28671	" {5} The mountains quake before him and the hills melt away. The earth trembles at his presence, the world and all who live in it."
NAH	1	6	Nahum	#03		28672	 {6} Who can withstand his indignation? Who can endure his fierce anger? His wrath is poured out like fire; the rocks are shattered before him.
NAH	1	7	Nahum	#03		28673	" {7} The Lord is good, a refuge in times of trouble. He cares for those who trust in him,"
NAH	1	8	Nahum	#03		28674	 {8} but with an overwhelming flood he will make an end of Nineveh; he will pursue his foes into darkness.
NAH	1	9	Nahum	#03		28675	 {9} Whatever they plot against the Lord he will bring to an end; trouble will not come a second time.
NAH	1	10	Nahum	#03		28676	 {10} They will be entangled among thorns and drunk from their wine; they will be consumed like dry stubble.
NAH	1	11	Nahum	#03		28677	" {11} From you, O Nineveh, has one come forth who plots evil against the Lord and counsels wickedness. {12} This is what the Lord says:"
NAH	1	12	God-FX1	#20		28678	" << Although they have allies and are numerous, they will be cut off and pass away. Although I have afflicted you, O Judah, I will afflict you no more."
NAH	1	13	God-FX1	#20		28679	 {13} Now I will break their yoke from your neck and tear your shackles away.>>
NAH	1	14	Nahum	#03		28680	" {14} The Lord has given a command concerning you, Nineveh: << You will have no descendants to bear your name. "
NAH	1	14	Nahum	#03		28681	" I will destroy the carved images and cast idols that are in the temple of your gods. I will prepare your grave, for you are vile.>>"
NAH	1	15	Nahum	#03		28682	" {15} Look, there on the mountains, the feet of one who brings good news, who proclaims peace! "
NAH	1	15	Nahum	#03		28683	" Celebrate your festivals, O Judah, and fulfill your vows. No more will the wicked invade you; they will be completely destroyed.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
NAH	2	<<	Narr_34: Nahum	#13		28684	NAHUM 2
NAH	2	1	Nahum	#03		28685	" {1} An attacker advances against you, Nineveh. Guard the fortress, watch the road, brace yourselves, marshal all your strength!"
NAH	2	2	Nahum	#03		28686	" {2} The Lord will restore the splendor of Jacob like the splendor of Israel, though destroyers have laid them waste and have ruined their vines."
NAH	2	3	Nahum	#03		28687	 {3} The shields of his soldiers are red; the warriors are clad in scarlet. 
NAH	2	3	Nahum	#03		28688	 The metal on the chariots flashes on the day they are made ready; the spears of pine are brandished.
NAH	2	4	Nahum	#03		28689	" {4} The chariots storm through the streets, rushing back and forth through the squares. "
NAH	2	4	Nahum	#03		28690	 They look like flaming torches; they dart about like lightning.
NAH	2	5	Nahum	#03		28691	" {5} He summons his picked troops, yet they stumble on their way. They dash to the city wall; the protective shield is put in place."
NAH	2	6	Nahum	#03		28692	 {6} The river gates are thrown open and the palace collapses.
NAH	2	7	Nahum	#03		28693	 {7} It is decreed that the city be exiled and carried away. Its slave girls moan like doves and beat upon their breasts.
NAH	2	8	Nahum	#03		28694	" {8} Nineveh is like a pool, and its water is draining away."
NAH	2	8	Slave Girl	#25		28695	 << Stop! Stop!>>
NAH	2	8	Nahum	#03		28696	" they cry, but no one turns back. {9} Plunder the silver! Plunder the gold! The supply is endless, the wealth from all its treasures!"
NAH	2	10	Nahum	#03		28697	" {10} She is pillaged, plundered, stripped! Hearts melt, knees give way, bodies tremble, every face grows pale."
NAH	2	11	Nahum	#03		28698	" {11} Where now is the lions' den, the place where they fed their young, where the lion and lioness went, and the cubs, with nothing to fear?"
NAH	2	12	Nahum	#03		28699	" {12} The lion killed enough for his cubs and strangled the prey for his mate, filling his lairs with the kill and his dens with the prey."
NAH	2	13	God-FX1	#20		28700	" {13} I am against you, declares the Lord Almighty. I will burn up your chariots in smoke and the sword will devour your young lions. "
NAH	2	13	God-FX1	#20		28701	 I will leave you no prey on the earth. The voices of your messengers will no longer be heard.>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
NAH	3	<<	Narr_34: Nahum	#13		28702	NAHUM 3
NAH	3	1	Nahum	#03		28703	" {1} Woe to the city of blood, full of lies, full of plunder, never without victims!"
NAH	3	2	Nahum	#03		28704	" {2} The crack of whips, the clatter of wheels, galloping horses and jolting chariots!"
NAH	3	3	Nahum	#03		28705	" {3} Charging cavalry, flashing swords and glittering spears! Many casualties, piles of dead, bodies without number, people stumbling over the corpsesù"
NAH	3	4	Nahum	#03		28706	" {4} all because of the wanton lust of a harlot, alluring, the mistress of sorceries, who enslaved nations by her prostitution and peoples by her witchcraft."
NAH	3	5	Nahum	#03		28707	" {5} I am against you, declares the Lord Almighty. I will lift your skirts over your face. I will show the nations your nakedness and the kingdoms your shame."
NAH	3	6	Nahum	#03		28708	" {6} I will pelt you with filth, I will treat you with contempt and make you a spectacle."
NAH	3	7	Nahum	#03		28709	" {7} All who see you will flee from you and say, 'Nineveh is in ruins--who will mourn for her?' Where can I find anyone to comfort you?>>"
NAH	3	8	Nahum	#03		28710	" {8} Are you better than Thebes, situated on the Nile, with water around her? The river was her defense, the waters her wall."
NAH	3	9	Nahum	#03		28711	 {9} Cush and Egypt were her boundless strength; Put and Libya were among her allies.
NAH	3	10	Nahum	#03		28712	 {10} Yet she was taken captive and went into exile. Her infants were dashed to pieces at the head of every street.
NAH	3	10	Nahum	#03		28713	" Lots were cast for her nobles, and all her great men were put in chains."
NAH	3	11	Nahum	#03		28714	 {11} You too will become drunk; you will go into hiding and seek refuge from the enemy.
NAH	3	12	Nahum	#03		28715	" {12} All your fortresses are like fig trees with their first ripe fruit; when they are shaken, the figs fall into the mouth of the eater."
NAH	3	13	Nahum	#03		28716	 {13} Look at your troops-- they are all women! The gates of your land are wide open to your enemies; fire has consumed their bars.
NAH	3	14	Nahum	#03		28717	" {14} Draw water for the siege, strengthen your defenses! Work the clay, tread the mortar, repair the brickwork!"
NAH	3	15	Nahum	#03		28718	" {15} There the fire will devour you; the sword will cut you down and, like grasshoppers, consume you. Multiply like grasshoppers, multiply like locusts!"
NAH	3	16	Nahum	#03		28719	" {16} You have increased the number of your merchants till they are more than the stars of the sky, but like locusts they strip the land and then fly away."
NAH	3	17	Nahum	#03		28720	" {17} Your guards are like locusts, your officials like swarms of locusts that settle in the walls on a cold day-- "
NAH	3	17	Nahum	#03		28721	" but when the sun appears they fly away, and no one knows where."
NAH	3	18	Nahum	#03		28722	" {18} O king of Assyria, your shepherds slumber; your nobles lie down to rest. Your people are scattered on the mountains with no one to gather them."
NAH	3	19	Nahum	#03		28723	 {19} Nothing can heal your wound; your injury is fatal. 
NAH	3	19	Nahum	#03		28724	" Everyone who hears the news about you claps his hands at your fall, for who has not felt your endless cruelty?*~**~*||||| + 5 SECs |||||*~*"
HAB	1	<<	Narr_35: Habakkuk	#13		28725	HABAKKUK*~*HABAKKUK 1
HAB	1	1	Narr_35: Habakkuk	#13		28726	 {1} The oracle that Habakkuk the prophet received.
HAB	1	2	Habakkuk	#04		28727	" {2} How long, O Lord, must I call for help, but you do not listen? Or cry out to you, << Violence!>> but you do not save?"
HAB	1	3	Habakkuk	#04		28728	" {3} Why do you make me look at injustice? Why do you tolerate wrong? Destruction and violence are before me; there is strife, and conflict abounds."
HAB	1	4	Habakkuk	#04		28729	" {4} Therefore the law is paralyzed, and justice never prevails. The wicked hem in the righteous, so that justice is perverted."
HAB	1	5	God-FX1	#20		28730	" {5} <<Look at the nations and watch-- and be utterly amazed. For I am going to do something in your days that you would not believe, even if you were told."
HAB	1	6	God-FX1	#20		28731	" {6} I am raising up the Babylonians, that ruthless and impetuous people, who sweep across the whole earth to seize dwelling places not their own."
HAB	1	7	Habakkuk	#04		28732	 {7} They are a feared and dreaded people; they are a law to themselves and promote their own honor.
HAB	1	8	Habakkuk	#04		28733	" {8} Their horses are swifter than leopards, fiercer than wolves at dusk. "
HAB	1	8	Habakkuk	#04		28734	 Their cavalry gallops headlong; their horsemen come from afar. They fly like a vulture swooping to devour; {9} they all come bent on violence. 
HAB	1	9	Habakkuk	#04		28735	 Their hordes advance like a desert wind and gather prisoners like sand.
HAB	1	10	Habakkuk	#04		28736	 {10} They deride kings and scoff at rulers. They laugh at all fortified cities; they build earthen ramps and capture them.
HAB	1	11	Habakkuk	#04		28737	" {11} Then they sweep past like the wind and go on-- guilty men, whose own strength is their god.>>"
HAB	1	12	Habakkuk	#04		28738	" {12} O Lord, are you not from everlasting? My God, my Holy One, we will not die."
HAB	1	12	Habakkuk	#04		28739	" O Lord, you have appointed them to execute judgment; O Rock, you have ordained them to punish."
HAB	1	13	Habakkuk	#04		28740	 {13} Your eyes are too pure to look on evil; you cannot tolerate wrong. Why then do you tolerate the treacherous? 
HAB	1	13	Habakkuk	#04		28741	 Why are you silent while the wicked swallow up those more righteous than themselves?
HAB	1	14	Habakkuk	#04		28742	" {14} You have made men like fish in the sea, like sea creatures that have no ruler."
HAB	1	15	Habakkuk	#04		28743	" {15} The wicked foe pulls all of them up with hooks, he catches them in his net, he gathers them up in his dragnet; and so he rejoices and is glad."
HAB	1	16	Habakkuk	#04		28744	" {16} Therefore he sacrifices to his net and burns incense to his dragnet, for by his net he lives in luxury and enjoys the choicest food."
HAB	1	17	Habakkuk	#04		28745	" {17} Is he to keep on emptying his net, destroying nations without mercy?*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
HAB	2	<<	Narr_35: Habakkuk	#13		28746	HABAKKUK 2
HAB	2	1	Habakkuk	#04		28747	" {1} I will stand at my watch and station myself on the ramparts; I will look to see what he will say to me, and what answer I am to give to this complaint."
HAB	2	2	Habakkuk	#04		28748	 {2} Then the Lord replied:
HAB	2	2	God-FX1	#20		28749	 << Write down the revelation and make it plain on tablets so that a herald may run with it.
HAB	2	3	God-FX1	#20		28750	" {3} For the revelation awaits an appointed time; it speaks of the end and will not prove false. Though it linger, wait for it; it will certainly come and will not delay."
HAB	2	4	Habakkuk	#04		28751	" {4} << See, he is puffed up; his desires are not upright-- but the righteous will live by his faith--"
HAB	2	5	Habakkuk	#04		28752	" {5} indeed, wine betrays him; he is arrogant and never at rest. "
HAB	2	5	Habakkuk	#04		28753	" Because he is as greedy as the grave and like death is never satisfied, he gathers to himself all the nations and takes captive all the peoples."
HAB	2	6	Habakkuk	#04		28754	" {6} << Will not all of them taunt him with ridicule and scorn, saying,"
HAB	2	6	Man	#09		28755	 Woe to him who piles up stolen goods and makes himself wealthy by extortion! How long must this go on?
HAB	2	7	Habakkuk	#04		28756	 {7} Will not your debtors suddenly arise? Will they not wake up and make you tremble? Then you will become their victim.
HAB	2	8	Habakkuk	#04		28757	" {8} Because you have plundered many nations, the peoples who are left will plunder you. "
HAB	2	8	Habakkuk	#04		28758	 For you have shed man's blood; you have destroyed lands and cities and everyone in them.
HAB	2	9	Man	#18		28759	" {9} Woe to him who builds his realm by unjust gain to set his nest on high, to escape the clutches of ruin!"
HAB	2	10	Habakkuk	#04		28760	" {10} You have plotted the ruin of many peoples, shaming your own house and forfeiting your life."
HAB	2	11	Habakkuk	#04		28761	" {11} The stones of the wall will cry out, and the beams of the woodwork will echo it."
HAB	2	12	Man	#18		28762	 {12} Woe to him who builds a city with bloodshed and establishes a town by crime!
HAB	2	13	Habakkuk	#04		28763	" {13} Has not the Lord Almighty determined that the people's labor is only fuel for the fire, that the nations exhaust themselves for nothing?"
HAB	2	14	Habakkuk	#04		28764	" {14} For the earth will be filled with the knowledge of the glory of the Lord, as the waters cover the sea."
HAB	2	15	Man	#08		28765	" {15} Woe to him who gives drink to his neighbors, pouring it from the wineskin till they are drunk, so that he can gaze on their naked bodies."
HAB	2	16	Habakkuk	#04		28766	 {16} You will be filled with shame instead of glory. Now it is your turn! Drink and be exposed! 
HAB	2	16	Habakkuk	#04		28767	" The cup from the Lord's right hand is coming around to you, and disgrace will cover your glory."
HAB	2	17	Habakkuk	#04		28768	" {17} The violence you have done to Lebanon will overwhelm you, and your destruction of animals will terrify you. "
HAB	2	17	Habakkuk	#04		28769	 For you have shed man's blood; you have destroyed lands and cities and everyone in them.
HAB	2	18	Habakkuk	#04		28770	" {18} << Of what value is an idol, since a man has carved it? Or an image that teaches lies?"
HAB	2	18	Habakkuk	#04		28771	 For he who makes it trusts in his own creation; he makes idols that cannot speak.
HAB	2	19	Man	#08		28772	" {19} Woe to him who says to wood, 'Come to life!' Or to lifeless stone, 'Wake up!' Can it give guidance?"
HAB	2	19	Habakkuk	#04		28773	 It is covered with gold and silver; there is no breath in it.
HAB	2	20	Habakkuk	#04		28774	 {20} But the Lord is in his holy temple; let all the earth be silent before him.>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
HAB	3	<<	Narr_35: Habakkuk	#13		28775	HABAKKUK 3
HAB	3	1	Narr_35: Habakkuk	#13		28776	 {1} A prayer of Habakkuk the prophet. On shigionoth.
HAB	3	2	Habakkuk	#04		28777	" {2} Lord, I have heard of your fame; I stand in awe of your deeds, O Lord. Renew them in our day, in our time make them known; in wrath remember mercy."
HAB	3	3	Habakkuk	#04		28778	" {3} God came from Teman, the Holy One from Mount Paran. Selah His glory covered the heavens and his praise filled the earth."
HAB	3	4	Habakkuk	#04		28779	" {4} His splendor was like the sunrise; rays flashed from his hand, where his power was hidden. {5} Plague went before him; pestilence followed his steps."
HAB	3	6	Habakkuk	#04		28780	" {6} He stood, and shook the earth; he looked, and made the nations tremble. "
HAB	3	6	Habakkuk	#04		28781	 The ancient mountains crumbled and the age-old hills collapsed. His ways are eternal.
HAB	3	7	Habakkuk	#04		28782	" {7} I saw the tents of Cushan in distress, the dwellings of Midian in anguish."
HAB	3	8	Habakkuk	#04		28783	" {8} Were you angry with the rivers, O Lord? Was your wrath against the streams? "
HAB	3	8	Habakkuk	#04		28784	 Did you rage against the sea when you rode with your horses and your victorious chariots?
HAB	3	9	Habakkuk	#04		28785	" {9} You uncovered your bow, you called for many arrows. Selah You split the earth with rivers; {10} the mountains saw you and writhed. "
HAB	3	10	Habakkuk	#04		28786	 Torrents of water swept by; the deep roared and lifted its waves on high.
HAB	3	11	Habakkuk	#04		28787	" {11} Sun and moon stood still in the heavens at the glint of your flying arrows, at the lightning of your flashing spear."
HAB	3	12	Habakkuk	#04		28788	 {12} In wrath you strode through the earth and in anger you threshed the nations.
HAB	3	13	Habakkuk	#04		28789	" {13} You came out to deliver your people, to save your anointed one. You crushed the leader of the land of wickedness, you stripped him from head to foot. Selah"
HAB	3	14	Habakkuk	#04		28790	" {14} With his own spear you pierced his head when his warriors stormed out to scatter us, gloating as though about to devour the wretched who were in hiding."
HAB	3	15	Habakkuk	#04		28791	" {15} You trampled the sea with your horses, churning the great waters."
HAB	3	16	Habakkuk	#04		28792	" {16} I heard and my heart pounded, my lips quivered at the sound; decay crept into my bones, and my legs trembled. "
HAB	3	16	Habakkuk	#04		28793	 Yet I will wait patiently for the day of calamity to come on the nation invading us.
HAB	3	17	Habakkuk	#04		28794	" {17} Though the fig tree does not bud and there are no grapes on the vines, though the olive crop fails and the fields produce no food,"
HAB	3	17	Habakkuk	#04		28795	" though there are no sheep in the pen and no cattle in the stalls, {18} yet I will rejoice in the Lord, I will be joyful in God my Savior."
HAB	3	19	Habakkuk	#04		28796	" {19} The Sovereign Lord is my strength; he makes my feet like the feet of a deer, he enables me to go on the heights."
HAB	3	19	Narr_35: Habakkuk	#13		28797	 For the director of music. On my stringed instruments.*~**~*||||| + 5 SECs |||||*~*
ZEP	1	<<	Narr_36: Zephaniah	#13		28798	ZEPHANIAH*~*ZEPHANIAH 1

ZEP	1	1	Narr_36: Zephaniah	#13		28800	" the son of Amariah, the son of Hezekiah,"
ZEP	1	1	Narr_36: Zephaniah	#13		28801	 during the reign of Josiah son of Amon king of Judah:
ZEP	1	2	Zephaniah	#06		28802	" {2} << I will sweep away everything from the face of the earth,>> declares the Lord."
ZEP	1	3	Zephaniah	#06		28803	 {3} << I will sweep away both men and animals; I will sweep away the birds of the air and the fish of the sea. 
ZEP	1	3	Zephaniah	#06		28804	" The wicked will have only heaps of rubble when I cut off man from the face of the earth,>> declares the Lord."
ZEP	1	4	Zephaniah	#06		28805	 {4} << I will stretch out my hand against Judah and against all who live in Jerusalem.

ZEP	1	7	Zephaniah	#06		28809	" {7} Be silent before the Sovereign Lord, for the day of the Lord is near. The Lord has prepared a sacrifice; he has consecrated those he has invited."
ZEP	1	8	Zephaniah	#06		28810	 {8} On the day of the Lord's sacrifice I will punish the princes and the king's sons and all those clad in foreign clothes.
ZEP	1	9	Zephaniah	#06		28811	" {9} On that day I will punish all who avoid stepping on the threshold, who fill the temple of their gods with violence and deceit."
ZEP	1	10	Zephaniah	#06		28812	" {10} << On that day,>> declares the Lord, << a cry will go up from the Fish Gate, wailing from the New Quarter, and a loud crash from the hills."
ZEP	1	11	Zephaniah	#06		28813	" {11} Wail, you who live in the market district; all your merchants will be wiped out, all who trade with silver will be ruined."
ZEP	1	12	Zephaniah	#06		28814	" {12} At that time I will search Jerusalem with lamps and punish those who are complacent, "
ZEP	1	12	Zephaniah	#06		28815	" who are like wine left on its dregs, who think, 'The Lord will do nothing, either good or bad.'"
ZEP	1	13	Zephaniah	#06		28816	" {13} Their wealth will be plundered, their houses demolished."
ZEP	1	13	Zephaniah	#06		28817	 They will build houses but not live in them; they will plant vineyards but not drink the wine.
ZEP	1	14	Zephaniah	#06		28818	 {14} << The great day of the Lord is near-- near and coming quickly.
ZEP	1	14	Zephaniah	#06		28819	" Listen! The cry on the day of the Lord will be bitter, the shouting of the warrior there."
ZEP	1	15	Zephaniah	#06		28820	" {15} That day will be a day of wrath, a day of distress and anguish, a day of trouble and ruin, a day of darkness and gloom, a day of clouds and blackness,"
ZEP	1	16	Zephaniah	#06		28821	 {16} a day of trumpet and battle cry against the fortified cities and against the corner towers.
ZEP	1	17	Zephaniah	#06		28822	" {17} I will bring distress on the people and they will walk like blind men, because they have sinned against the Lord. "
ZEP	1	17	Zephaniah	#06		28823	 Their blood will be poured out like dust and their entrails like filth.
ZEP	1	18	Zephaniah	#06		28824	 {18} Neither their silver nor their gold will be able to save them on the day of the Lord's wrath.
ZEP	1	18	Zephaniah	#06		28825	" In the fire of his jealousy the whole world will be consumed, for he will make a sudden end of all who live in the earth.>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
ZEP	2	<<	Narr_36: Zephaniah	#13		28826	ZEPHANIAH 2

ZEP	2	3	Zephaniah	#06		28829	" {3} Seek the Lord, all you humble of the land, you who do what he commands. "
ZEP	2	3	Zephaniah	#06		28830	" Seek righteousness, seek humility; perhaps you will be sheltered on the day of the Lord's anger."
ZEP	2	4	Zephaniah	#06		28831	 {4} Gaza will be abandoned and Ashkelon left in ruins. At midday Ashdod will be emptied and Ekron uprooted.
ZEP	2	5	Zephaniah	#06		28832	" {5} Woe to you who live by the sea, O Kerethite people;"

ZEP	2	6	Zephaniah	#06		28834	" {6} The land by the sea, where the Kerethites dwell, will be a place for shepherds and sheep pens."

ZEP	2	7	Zephaniah	#06		28836	 In the evening they will lie down in the houses of Ashkelon. The Lord their God will care for them; he will restore their fortunes.
ZEP	2	8	God-FX1	#20		28837	" {8} << I have heard the insults of Moab and the taunts of the Ammonites, who insulted my people and made threats against their land."

ZEP	2	11	Zephaniah	#06		28842	 {11} The Lord will be awesome to them when he destroys all the gods of the land. 
ZEP	2	11	Zephaniah	#06		28843	" The nations on every shore will worship him, every one in its own land."

ZEP	2	13	Zephaniah	#06		28845	" {13} He will stretch out his hand against the north and destroy Assyria, leaving Nineveh utterly desolate and dry as the desert."
ZEP	2	14	Zephaniah	#06		28846	" {14} Flocks and herds will lie down there, creatures of every kind. The desert owl and the screech owl will roost on her columns. "
ZEP	2	14	Zephaniah	#06		28847	" Their calls will echo through the windows, rubble will be in the doorways, the beams of cedar will be exposed."
ZEP	2	15	Zephaniah	#06		28848	" {15} This is the carefree city that lived in safety. She said to herself,"
ZEP	2	15	Nineveh (female)	#24		28849	" << I am, and there is none besides me.>>"
ZEP	2	15	Zephaniah	#06		28850	" What a ruin she has become, a lair for wild beasts! All who pass by her scoff and shake their fists.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
ZEP	3	<<	Narr_36: Zephaniah	#13		28851	ZEPHANIAH 3
ZEP	3	1	Zephaniah	#06		28852	" {1} Woe to the city of oppressors, rebellious and defiled!"
ZEP	3	2	Zephaniah	#06		28853	" {2} She obeys no one, she accepts no correction. She does not trust in the Lord, she does not draw near to her God."
ZEP	3	3	Zephaniah	#06		28854	" {3} Her officials are roaring lions, her rulers are evening wolves, who leave nothing for the morning."
ZEP	3	4	Zephaniah	#06		28855	 {4} Her prophets are arrogant; they are treacherous men. Her priests profane the sanctuary and do violence to the law.
ZEP	3	5	Zephaniah	#06		28856	 {5} The Lord within her is righteous; he does no wrong. 
ZEP	3	5	Zephaniah	#06		28857	" Morning by morning he dispenses his justice, and every new day he does not fail, yet the unrighteous know no shame."
ZEP	3	6	God-FX1	#20		28858	" {6} << I have cut off nations; their strongholds are demolished. I have left their streets deserted, with no one passing through. Their cities are destroyed; no one will be left--no one at all."
ZEP	3	7	God-FX1	#20		28859	" {7} I said to the city, 'Surely you will fear me and accept correction!' Then her dwelling would not be cut off, nor all my punishments come upon her. "
ZEP	3	7	God-FX1	#20		28860	 But they were still eager to act corruptly in all they did.
ZEP	3	8	Zephaniah	#06		28861	" {8} Therefore wait for me, declares the Lord, for the day I will stand up to testify. "
ZEP	3	8	Zephaniah	#06		28862	" I have decided to assemble the nations, to gather the kingdoms and to pour out my wrath on them-- all my fierce anger. "
ZEP	3	8	Zephaniah	#06		28863	 The whole world will be consumed by the fire of my jealous anger.
ZEP	3	9	Zephaniah	#06		28864	" {9} << Then will I purify the lips of the peoples, that all of them may call on the name of the Lord and serve him shoulder to shoulder."
ZEP	3	10	Zephaniah	#06		28865	" {10} From beyond the rivers of Cush my worshipers, my scattered people, will bring me offerings."
ZEP	3	11	Zephaniah	#06		28866	" {11} On that day you will not be put to shame for all the wrongs you have done to me, because I will remove from this city those who rejoice in their pride. "
ZEP	3	11	Zephaniah	#06		28867	 Never again will you be haughty on my holy hill.
ZEP	3	12	Zephaniah	#06		28868	" {12} But I will leave within you the meek and humble, who trust in the name of the Lord."
ZEP	3	13	Zephaniah	#06		28869	" {13} The remnant of Israel will do no wrong; they will speak no lies, nor will deceit be found in their mouths. "
ZEP	3	13	Zephaniah	#06		28870	 They will eat and lie down and no one will make them afraid.
ZEP	3	14	Zephaniah	#06		28871	" {14} Sing, O Daughter of Zion; shout aloud, O Israel! Be glad and rejoice with all your heart, O Daughter of Jerusalem!"
ZEP	3	15	Zephaniah	#06		28872	" {15} The Lord has taken away your punishment, he has turned back your enemy. "
ZEP	3	15	Zephaniah	#06		28873	" The Lord, the King of Israel, is with you; never again will you fear any harm. {16} On that day they will say to Jerusalem,"
ZEP	3	16	Man	#02		28874	" << Do not fear, O Zion; do not let your hands hang limp."
ZEP	3	17	Man	#02		28875	" {17} The Lord your God is with you, he is mighty to save. "
ZEP	3	17	Man	#02		28876	" He will take great delight in you, he will quiet you with his love, he will rejoice over you with singing.>>"
ZEP	3	18	God-FX1	#20		28877	 {18} << The sorrows for the appointed feasts I will remove from you; they are a burden and a reproach to you.
ZEP	3	19	God-FX1	#20		28878	 {19} At that time I will deal with all who oppressed you; I will rescue the lame and gather those who have been scattered. 
ZEP	3	19	God-FX1	#20		28879	 I will give them praise and honor in every land where they were put to shame.
ZEP	3	20	God-FX1	#20		28880	 {20} At that time I will gather you; at that time I will bring you home. I will give you honor and praise among all the peoples of the earth when I restore your fortunes before your very eyes.>>

HAG	2	15	Haggai	#11		28927	" {15} ""'Now give careful thought to this from this day on--consider how things were before one stone was laid on another in the Lord's temple."
HAG	2	16	Haggai	#11		28928	" {16} When anyone came to a heap of twenty measures, there were only ten. When anyone went to a wine vat to draw fifty measures, there were only twenty."
HAG	2	17	Haggai	#11		28929	" {17} I struck all the work of your hands with blight, mildew and hail, yet you did not turn to me,' declares the Lord."
HAG	2	18	Haggai	#11		28930	" {18} 'From this day on, from this twenty-fourth day of the ninth month, give careful thought to the day when the foundation of the Lord's temple was laid. Give careful thought:"

ZEC	5	6	Angel #1-FX1	#10		29030	 << It is a measuring basket. This is the iniquity of the people throughout the land.>>
ZEC	5	7	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29031	" {7} Then the cover of lead was raised, and there in the basket sat a woman! {8} He said,"
ZEC	5	8	Angel #1-FX1	#10		29032	" << This is wickedness,>>"
ZEC	5	8	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29033	 and he pushed her back into the basket and pushed the lead cover down over its mouth.
ZEC	5	9	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29034	" {9} Then I looked up--and there before me were two women, with the wind in their wings! "
ZEC	5	9	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29035	" They had wings like those of a stork, and they lifted up the basket between heaven and earth."
ZEC	5	10	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29036	" {10} << Where are they taking the basket?>> I asked the angel who was speaking to me. {11} He replied,"
ZEC	5	11	Angel #1-FX1	#10		29037	" << To the country of Babylonia to build a house for it. When it is ready, the basket will be set there in its place.>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
ZEC	6	<<	Narr_38: Zechariah	#13		29038	ZECHARIAH 6
ZEC	6	1	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29039	 {1} I looked up again--and there before me were four chariots coming out from between two mountains--mountains of bronze!
ZEC	6	2	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29040	" {2} The first chariot had red horses, the second black, {3} the third white, and the fourth dappled--all of them powerful."

ZEC	9	<<	Narr_38: Zechariah	#13		29102	ZECHARIAH 9

ZEC	9	3	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29105	" {3} Tyre has built herself a stronghold; she has heaped up silver like dust, and gold like the dirt of the streets."
ZEC	9	4	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29106	" {4} But the Lord will take away her possessions and destroy her power on the sea, and she will be consumed by fire."
ZEC	9	5	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29107	" {5} Ashkelon will see it and fear; Gaza will writhe in agony, and Ekron too, for her hope will wither. Gaza will lose her king and Ashkelon will be deserted."

ZEC	9	7	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29110	" Those who are left will belong to our God and become leaders in Judah, and Ekron will be like the Jebusites."
ZEC	9	8	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29111	" {8} But I will defend my house against marauding forces. Never again will an oppressor overrun my people, for now I am keeping watch."

ZEC	9	16	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29122	 {16} The Lord their God will save them on that day as the flock of his people. They will sparkle in his land like jewels in a crown.

ZEC	11	<<	Narr_38: Zechariah	#13		29140	ZECHARIAH 11
