ZEC	11	2	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29142	" {2} Wail, O pine tree, for the cedar has fallen; the stately trees are ruined! Wail, oaks of Bashan; the dense forest has been cut down!"
ZEC	11	3	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29143	 {3} Listen to the wail of the shepherds; their rich pastures are destroyed! Listen to the roar of the lions; the lush thicket of the Jordan is ruined!
ZEC	11	4	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29144	 {4} This is what the Lord my God says: << Pasture the flock marked for slaughter.
ZEC	11	5	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29145	" {5} Their buyers slaughter them and go unpunished. Those who sell them say, 'Praise the Lord, I am rich!' Their own shepherds do not spare them."
ZEC	11	6	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29146	" {6} For I will no longer have pity on the people of the land,>> declares the Lord. << I will hand everyone over to his neighbor and his king. "
ZEC	11	6	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29147	" They will oppress the land, and I will not rescue them from their hands.>>"
ZEC	11	7	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29148	" {7} So I pastured the flock marked for slaughter, particularly the oppressed of the flock. Then I took two staffs and called one Favor and the other Union, and I pastured the flock."
ZEC	11	8	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29149	" {8} In one month I got rid of the three shepherds. The flock detested me, and I grew weary of them {9} and said,"
ZEC	11	9	God-FX1	#20		29150	" << I will not be your shepherd. Let the dying die, and the perishing perish. Let those who are left eat one another's flesh.>>"
ZEC	11	10	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29151	" {10} Then I took my staff called Favor and broke it, revoking the covenant I had made with all the nations."
ZEC	11	11	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29152	" {11} It was revoked on that day, and so the afflicted of the flock who were watching me knew it was the word of the Lord."
ZEC	11	12	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29153	" {12} I told them, << If you think it best, give me my pay; but if not, keep it.>> So they paid me thirty pieces of silver. {13} And the Lord said to me,"
ZEC	11	13	God-FX1	#20		29154	 << Throw it to the potter>>
ZEC	11	13	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29155	 the handsome price at which they priced me! So I took the thirty pieces of silver and threw them into the house of the Lord to the potter.
ZEC	11	14	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29156	" {14} Then I broke my second staff called Union, breaking the brotherhood between Judah and Israel. {15} Then the Lord said to me,"
ZEC	11	15	God-FX1	#20		29157	 << Take again the equipment of a foolish shepherd.
ZEC	11	16	God-FX1	#20		29158	" {16} For I am going to raise up a shepherd over the land who will not care for the lost, or seek the young, or heal the injured, or feed the healthy, but will eat the meat of the choice sheep, tearing off their hoofs."
ZEC	11	17	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29159	" {17} << Woe to the worthless shepherd, who deserts the flock! May the sword strike his arm and his right eye!"
ZEC	11	17	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29160	" May his arm be completely withered, his right eye totally blinded!>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
ZEC	12	<<	Narr_38: Zechariah	#13		29161	ZECHARIAH 12
ZEC	12	1	Narr_38: Zechariah	#13		29162	" {1} This is the word of the Lord concerning Israel. The Lord, who stretches out the heavens, who lays the foundation of the earth, and who forms the spirit of man within him, declares:"
ZEC	12	2	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29163	 {2} << I am going to make Jerusalem a cup that sends all the surrounding peoples reeling. Judah will be besieged as well as Jerusalem.
ZEC	12	3	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29164	" {3} On that day, when all the nations of the earth are gathered against her, I will make Jerusalem an immovable rock for all the nations. All who try to move it will injure themselves."
ZEC	12	4	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29165	" {4} On that day I will strike every horse with panic and its rider with madness, declares the Lord. "
ZEC	12	4	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29166	" << I will keep a watchful eye over the house of Judah, but I will blind all the horses of the nations."
ZEC	12	5	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29167	" {5} Then the leaders of Judah will say in their hearts, 'The people of Jerusalem are strong, because the Lord Almighty is their God.'"
ZEC	12	6	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29168	" {6} << On that day I will make the leaders of Judah like a firepot in a woodpile, like a flaming torch among sheaves. "
ZEC	12	6	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29169	" They will consume right and left all the surrounding peoples, but Jerusalem will remain intact in her place."
ZEC	12	7	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29170	" {7} << The Lord will save the dwellings of Judah first, so that the honor of the house of David and of Jerusalem's inhabitants may not be greater than that of Judah."
ZEC	12	8	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29171	" {8} On that day the Lord will shield those who live in Jerusalem, so that the feeblest among them will be like David, and the house of David will be like God, like the Angel of the Lord going before them."
ZEC	12	9	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29172	 {9} On that day I will set out to destroy all the nations that attack Jerusalem.
ZEC	12	10	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29173	 {10} << And I will pour out on the house of David and the inhabitants of Jerusalem a spirit of grace and supplication. 
ZEC	12	10	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29174	" They will look on me, the one they have pierced, and they will mourn for him as one mourns for an only child, and grieve bitterly for him as one grieves for a firstborn son."
ZEC	12	11	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29175	" {11} On that day the weeping in Jerusalem will be great, like the weeping of Hadad Rimmon in the plain of Megiddo."
ZEC	12	12	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29176	" {12} The land will mourn, each clan by itself, with their wives by themselves: the clan of the house of David and their wives, the clan of the house of Nathan and their wives,"
ZEC	12	13	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29177	" {13} the clan of the house of Levi and their wives, the clan of Shimei and their wives,"
ZEC	12	14	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29178	 {14} and all the rest of the clans and their wives.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
ZEC	13	<<	Narr_38: Zechariah	#13		29179	ZECHARIAH 13

ZEC	13	3	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29183	" {3} And if anyone still prophesies, his father and mother, to whom he was born, will say to him, 'You must die, because you have told lies in the Lord's name.' "
ZEC	13	3	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29184	" When he prophesies, his own parents will stab him."
ZEC	13	4	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29185	 {4} << On that day every prophet will be ashamed of his prophetic vision. He will not put on a prophet's garment of hair in order to deceive.
ZEC	13	5	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29186	" {5} He will say, 'I am not a prophet. I am a farmer; the land has been my livelihood since my youth.'"
ZEC	13	6	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29187	" {6} If someone asks him, 'What are these wounds on your body?' he will answer, 'The wounds I was given at the house of my friends.'"
ZEC	13	7	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29188	" {7} << Awake, O sword, against my shepherd, against the man who is close to me!>> declares the Lord Almighty. "
ZEC	13	7	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29189	" << Strike the shepherd, and the sheep will be scattered, and I will turn my hand against the little ones."
ZEC	13	8	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29190	" {8} In the whole land, declares the Lord, two-thirds will be struck down and perish; yet one-third will be left in it."
ZEC	13	9	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29191	 {9} This third I will bring into the fire; I will refine them like silver and test them like gold. 
ZEC	13	9	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29192	" They will call on my name and I will answer them; I will say, 'They are my people,' and they will say, '"
ZEC	13	9	Man in Crowd	#18		29193	 The Lord is our God.'>>*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
ZEC	14	<<	Narr_38: Zechariah	#13		29194	ZECHARIAH 14
ZEC	14	1	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29195	 {1} A day of the Lord is coming when your plunder will be divided among you.
ZEC	14	2	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29196	" {2} I will gather all the nations to Jerusalem to fight against it; the city will be captured, the houses ransacked, and the women raped. "
ZEC	14	2	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29197	" Half of the city will go into exile, but the rest of the people will not be taken from the city."
ZEC	14	3	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29198	" {3} Then the Lord will go out and fight against those nations, as he fights in the day of battle."
ZEC	14	4	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29199	" {4} On that day his feet will stand on the Mount of Olives, east of Jerusalem, and the Mount of Olives will be split in two from east to west, forming a great valley, "
ZEC	14	4	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29200	 so that half of the mountain shall move northward and the other half southward.
ZEC	14	5	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29201	" {5} You will flee by my mountain valley, for it will extend to Azel. You will flee as you fled from the earthquake in the days of Uzziah king of Judah. "
ZEC	14	5	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29202	" Then the Lord my God will come, and all the holy ones with him. {6} On that day there will be no light, no cold or frost."
ZEC	14	7	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29203	" {7} It will be a unique day, without daytime or nighttime--a day known to the Lord. When evening comes, there will be light."
ZEC	14	8	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29204	" {8} On that day living water will flow out from Jerusalem, half to the eastern sea and half to the western sea, in summer and in winter."
ZEC	14	9	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29205	" {9} The Lord will be king over the whole earth. On that day there will be one Lord, and his name the only name."
ZEC	14	10	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29206	" {10} The whole land, from Geba to Rimmon, south of Jerusalem, will become like the Arabah."
ZEC	14	10	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29207	" But Jerusalem will be raised up and remain in its place, from the Benjamin Gate to the site of the First Gate, to the Corner Gate, and from the Tower of Hananel to the royal winepresses."
ZEC	14	11	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29208	 {11} It will be inhabited; never again will it be destroyed. Jerusalem will be secure.
ZEC	14	12	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29209	 {12} This is the plague with which the Lord will strike all the nations that fought against Jerusalem: 
ZEC	14	12	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29210	" Their flesh will rot while they are still standing on their feet, their eyes will rot in their sockets, and their tongues will rot in their mouths."
ZEC	14	13	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29211	" {13} On that day men will be stricken by the Lord with great panic. Each man will seize the hand of another, and they will attack each other."
ZEC	14	14	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29212	 {14} Judah too will fight at Jerusalem. The wealth of all the surrounding nations will be collected--great quantities of gold and silver and clothing.
ZEC	14	15	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29213	" {15} A similar plague will strike the horses and mules, the camels and donkeys, and all the animals in those camps."
ZEC	14	16	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29214	" {16} Then the survivors from all the nations that have attacked Jerusalem will go up year after year to worship the King, the Lord Almighty, and to celebrate the Feast of Tabernacles."
ZEC	14	17	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29215	" {17} If any of the peoples of the earth do not go up to Jerusalem to worship the King, the Lord Almighty, they will have no rain."
ZEC	14	18	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29216	" {18} If the Egyptian people do not go up and take part, they will have no rain. "
ZEC	14	18	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29217	 The Lord will bring on them the plague he inflicts on the nations that do not go up to celebrate the Feast of Tabernacles.
ZEC	14	19	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29218	 {19} This will be the punishment of Egypt and the punishment of all the nations that do not go up to celebrate the Feast of Tabernacles.
ZEC	14	20	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29219	" {20} On that day holy to the Lord will be inscribed on the bells of the horses, and the cooking pots in the Lord's house will be like the sacred bowls in front of the altar."
ZEC	14	21	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29220	" {21} Every pot in Jerusalem and Judah will be holy to the Lord Almighty, and all who come to sacrifice will take some of the pots and cook in them. "
ZEC	14	21	Zechariah (son of Berekiah)	#01		29221	 And on that day there will no longer be a Canaanite in the house of the Lord Almighty.*~**~*||||| + 5 SECs |||||*~*
MAL	1	<<	Narr_39: Malachi	#13		29222	MALACHI*~*MALACHI 1
MAL	1	1	Narr_39: Malachi	#13		29223	 {1} An oracle: The word of the Lord to Israel through Malachi.
MAL	1	2	Malachi	#05		29224	" {2} << I have loved you,>> says the Lord. But you ask,"
MAL	1	2	Israelite	#14		29225	 How have you loved us?
MAL	1	2	Malachi	#05		29226	" Was not Esau Jacob's brother?>> the Lord says. << Yet I have loved Jacob, {3} but Esau I have hated. "
MAL	1	3	Malachi	#05		29227	 I have turned his mountains into a wasteland and left his inheritance to the desert jackals.>> 
MAL	1	4	Malachi	#05		29228	" {4} Edom may say,"
MAL	1	4	Edom	#06		29229	" << Though we have been crushed, we will rebuild the ruins.>>"
MAL	1	4	Malachi	#05		29230	" But this is what the Lord Almighty says: << They may build, but I will demolish. They will be called the Wicked Land, a people always under the wrath of the Lord."
MAL	1	5	Malachi	#05		29231	" {5} You will see it with your own eyes and say,"
MAL	1	5	Man	#17		29232	 Great is the Lord--even beyond the borders of Israel!'
MAL	1	6	Malachi	#05		29233	" {6} << A son honors his father, and a servant his master. If I am a father, where is the honor due me? If I am a master, where is the respect due me?>> says the Lord Almighty. "
MAL	1	6	Malachi	#05		29234	" << It is you, O priests, who show contempt for my name. << But you ask,"
MAL	1	6	Priest	#15		29235	 How have we shown contempt for your name?
MAL	1	7	Malachi	#05		29236	" {7} You place defiled food on my altar. But you ask,"
MAL	1	7	Priest	#15		29237	 How have we defiled you?
MAL	1	7	Malachi	#05		29238	" By saying that the Lord's table is contemptible. {8} When you bring blind animals for sacrifice, is that not wrong? When you sacrifice crippled or diseased animals, is that not wrong? "
MAL	1	8	Malachi	#05		29239	 Try offering them to your governor! Would he be pleased with you? Would he accept you?>> says the Lord Almighty.
MAL	1	9	Malachi	#05		29240	" {9} << Now implore God to be gracious to us. With such offerings from your hands, will he accept you?>>--says the Lord Almighty."
MAL	1	10	Malachi	#05		29241	" {10} << Oh, that one of you would shut the temple doors, so that you would not light useless fires on my altar!"
MAL	1	10	Malachi	#05		29242	" I am not pleased with you,>> says the Lord Almighty, << and I will accept no offering from your hands."
MAL	1	11	Malachi	#05		29243	" {11} My name will be great among the nations, from the rising to the setting of the sun. "
MAL	1	11	Malachi	#05		29244	" In every place incense and pure offerings will be brought to my name, because my name will be great among the nations,>> says the Lord Almighty."
MAL	1	12	Malachi	#05		29245	" {12} << But you profane it by saying of the Lord's table, It is defiled! and of its food, It is contemptible!"
MAL	1	13	Malachi	#05		29246	" {13} And you say: What a burden!, and you sniff at it contemptuously,>> says the Lord Almighty."
MAL	1	13	Malachi	#05		29247	" << When you bring injured, crippled or diseased animals and offer them as sacrifices, should I accept them from your hands?>> says the Lord."
MAL	1	14	Malachi	#05		29248	" {14} << Cursed is the cheat who has an acceptable male in his flock and vows to give it, but then sacrifices a blemished animal to the Lord. "
MAL	1	14	Malachi	#05		29249	" For I am a great king,>> says the Lord Almighty, << and my name is to be feared among the nations.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
MAL	2	<<	Narr_39: Malachi	#13		29250	MALACHI 2
MAL	2	1	Malachi	#05		29251	" {1} << And now this admonition is for you, O priests."
MAL	2	2	Malachi	#05		29252	" {2} If you do not listen, and if you do not set your heart to honor my name,>> says the Lord Almighty, I will send a curse upon you, and I will curse your blessings. "
MAL	2	2	Malachi	#05		29253	" Yes, I have already cursed them, because you have not set your heart to honor me."
MAL	2	3	Malachi	#05		29254	" {3} << Because of you I will rebuke your descendants; I will spread on your faces the offal from your festival sacrifices, and you will be carried off with it."
MAL	2	4	Malachi	#05		29255	" {4} And you will know that I have sent you this admonition so that my covenant with Levi may continue, says the Lord Almighty."
MAL	2	5	God-FX1	#20		29256	" {5} My covenant was with him, a covenant of life and peace, and I gave them to him; this called for reverence and he revered me and stood in awe of my name."
MAL	2	6	God-FX1	#20		29257	" {6} True instruction was in his mouth and nothing false was found on his lips. He walked with me in peace and uprightness, and turned many from sin."
MAL	2	7	Malachi	#05		29258	" {7} For the lips of a priest ought to preserve knowledge, and from his mouth men should seek instruction--because he is the messenger of the Lord Almighty."
MAL	2	8	Malachi	#05		29259	" {8} But you have turned from the way and by your teaching have caused many to stumble; you have violated the covenant with Levi,>> says the Lord Almighty."
MAL	2	9	God-FX1	#20		29260	" {9} << So I have caused you to be despised and humiliated before all the people, because you have not followed my ways but have shown partiality in matters of the law.>>"
MAL	2	10	Malachi	#05		29261	 {10} Have we not all one Father? Did not one God create us? Why do we profane the covenant of our fathers by breaking faith with one another?
MAL	2	11	Malachi	#05		29262	" {11} Judah has broken faith. A detestable thing has been committed in Israel and in Jerusalem: Judah has desecrated the sanctuary the Lord loves, by marrying the daughter of a foreign god."
MAL	2	12	Malachi	#05		29263	" {12} As for the man who does this, whoever he may be, may the Lord cut him off from the tents of Jacob--even though he brings offerings to the Lord Almighty."
MAL	2	13	Malachi	#05		29264	 {13} Another thing you do: You flood the Lord's altar with tears. 
MAL	2	13	Malachi	#05		29265	 You weep and wail because he no longer pays attention to your offerings or accepts them with pleasure from your hands.
MAL	2	14	Malachi	#05		29266	" {14} You ask, << Why?>> It is because the Lord is acting as the witness between you and the wife of your youth,"
MAL	2	14	Malachi	#05		29267	" because you have broken faith with her, though she is your partner, the wife of your marriage covenant."
MAL	2	15	Malachi	#05		29268	 {15} Has not the Lord made them one? In flesh and spirit they are his. And why one? 
MAL	2	15	Malachi	#05		29269	" Because he was seeking godly offspring. So guard yourself in your spirit, and do not break faith with the wife of your youth. {16} The Lord Almighty says,"
MAL	2	16	God-FX1	#20		29270	" I hate divorce, and I hate the man who does wrong to his wife. So be careful in your spirit and be one who can be trusted."
MAL	2	17	Malachi	#05		29271	 {17} You have wearied the Lord with your words.
MAL	2	17	Man	#06		29272	 How have we wearied him?
MAL	2	17	Malachi	#05		29273	" you ask. By saying,"
MAL	2	17	Man	#08		29274	" All who do evil are good in the eyes of the Lord, and he is pleased with them."
MAL	2	17	Malachi	#05		29275	 ...or...
MAL	2	17	Man	#09		29276	 Where is the God of justice?*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*
MAL	3	<<	Narr_39: Malachi	#13		29277	MALACHI 3
MAL	3	1	Malachi	#05		29278	" {1} The Lord Almighty says, << See, I will send my messenger, who will prepare the way before me. "
MAL	3	1	Malachi	#05		29279	" Then suddenly the Lord you are seeking will come to his temple; the messenger of the covenant, whom you desire, will come,>>"
MAL	3	2	Malachi	#05		29280	 {2} But who can endure the day of his coming? Who can stand when he appears? For he will be like a refiner's fire or a launderer's soap.
MAL	3	3	Malachi	#05		29281	 {3} He will sit as a refiner and purifier of silver; he will purify the Levites and refine them like gold and silver. 
MAL	3	3	Malachi	#05		29282	" Then the Lord will have men who will bring offerings in righteousness, {4} and the offerings of Judah and Jerusalem will be acceptable to the Lord, as in days gone by, as in former years."
MAL	3	5	God-FX1	#20		29283	 {5} << So I will come near to you for judgment.
MAL	3	5	God-FX1	#20		29284	" I will be quick to testify against sorcerers, adulterers and perjurers, against those who defraud laborers of their wages, who oppress the widows and the fatherless, and deprive aliens of justice, but do not fear me, says the Lord Almighty."
MAL	3	6	God-FX1	#20		29285	" {6} I the Lord do not change. So you, O descendants of Jacob, are not destroyed."
MAL	3	7	Malachi	#05		29286	 {7} Ever since the time of your forefathers you have turned away from my decrees and have not kept them.
MAL	3	7	Malachi	#05		29287	" Return to me, and I will return to you,>> says the Lord Almighty. << But you ask,"
MAL	3	7	Israelite	#11		29288	 How are we to return?
MAL	3	8	Malachi	#05		29289	" {8} Will a man rob God? Yet you rob me. But you ask,"
MAL	3	8	Israelite	#14		29290	 How do we rob you?
MAL	3	8	Malachi	#05		29291	 In tithes and offerings. {9} You are under a curse--the whole nation of you--because you are robbing me.
MAL	3	10	Malachi	#05		29292	" {10} Bring the whole tithe into the storehouse, that there may be food in my house. "
MAL	3	10	Malachi	#05		29293	" Test me in this,>> says the Lord Almighty, << and see if I will not throw open the floodgates of heaven and pour out so much blessing that you will not have room enough for it."
MAL	3	11	Malachi	#05		29294	" {11} I will prevent pests from devouring your crops, and the vines in your fields will not cast their fruit,>> says the Lord Almighty."
MAL	3	12	Malachi	#05		29295	" {12} << Then all the nations will call you blessed, for yours will be a delightful land,>> says the Lord Almighty."
MAL	3	13	Malachi	#05		29296	" {13} << You have said harsh things against me,>> says the Lord. Yet you ask,"
MAL	3	13	Israelite	#03		29297	 What have we said against you?
MAL	3	14	Malachi	#05		29298	" {14} You have said,"
MAL	3	14	Israelite	#04		29299	 It is futile to serve God. What did we gain by carrying out his requirements and going about like mourners before the Lord Almighty?
MAL	3	15	Israelite	#04		29300	" {15} But now we call the arrogant blessed. Certainly the evildoers prosper, and even those who challenge God escape!"
MAL	3	16	Malachi	#05		29301	" {16} Then those who feared the Lord talked with each other, and the Lord listened and heard. "
MAL	3	16	Malachi	#05		29302	 A scroll of remembrance was written in his presence concerning those who feared the Lord and honored his name.
MAL	3	17	Malachi	#05		29303	" {17} << They will be mine, says the Lord Almighty, in the day when I make up my treasured possession. I will spare them, just as in compassion a man spares his son who serves him."
MAL	3	18	Malachi	#05		29304	" {18} And you will again see the distinction between the righteous and the wicked, between those who serve God and those who do not.*~**~*||||| + 2 SECs |||||*~*"
MAL	4	<<	Narr_39: Malachi	#13		29305	MALACHI 4
MAL	4	1	Malachi	#05		29306	 {1} << Surely the day is coming; it will burn like a furnace. 
MAL	4	1	Malachi	#05		29307	" All the arrogant and every evildoer will be stubble, and that day that is coming will set them on fire,>> says the Lord Almighty. << Not a root or a branch will be left to them."
MAL	4	2	Malachi	#05		29308	" {2} But for you who revere my name, the sun of righteousness will rise with healing in its wings. And you will go out and leap like calves released from the stall."
MAL	4	3	Malachi	#05		29309	" {3} Then you will trample down the wicked; they will be ashes under the soles of your feet on the day when I do these things,>> says the Lord Almighty."
MAL	4	4	Malachi	#05		29310	" {4} << Remember the law of my servant Moses, the decrees and laws I gave him at Horeb for all Israel."
MAL	4	5	Malachi	#05		29311	" {5} << See, I will send you the prophet Elijah before that great and dreadful day of the Lord comes."
MAL	4	6	Malachi	#05		29312	" {6} He will turn the hearts of the fathers to their children, and the hearts of the children to their fathers; or else I will come and strike the land with a curse.>>*~**~*||||| + 5 SECs |||||*~*"
